Description: The dollar fell and global stock markets edged higher on Wednesday after China retaliated in a trade dispute with the United States, but Wall Street rebounded from a steeply lower opening on the notion a tariff war has not begun and any impact is too early to foresee.

Headlines: Trump wants 'level playing field' on Amazon, taxes: adviser
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is not attacking the business sector with his recent critiques of Amazon.com Inc but wants the online retailer to do more when it comes to taxes, his economic adviser said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Monte dei Paschi's bosses confident about turnaround plan: sources
Description: The top executives of bailed-out Italian bank Monte dei Paschi di Siena told investors in London on Wednesday the bank is making progress with its turnaround plan, two fund managers who attended the meetings said.

Headlines: Chinese ambassador arrives at U.S. State Department
Description: China's ambassador to the United States, Cui Tiankai, arrived at the U.S. State Department on Wednesday for talks with Acting Secretary of State John Sullivan amid a deepening U.S.-China trade dispute.

Headlines: South Korea watching U.S.-China trade issue closely, measures prepared
Description: South Korea's finance minister said on Thursday the trade tussle between the United States and China was being closely watched and that the country had prepared measures for various scenarios.

Headlines: In boost for Britain, Peugeot to build new van at Vauxhall plant
Description: Peugeot-maker PSA has unveiled plans to raise output at its British Vauxhall van plant, in a pre-Brexit show of confidence that will raise pressure on sister brand Opel's German workforce to offer concessions in labor talks.

Headlines: J.M. Smucker to buy Ainsworth Pet Nutrition for $1.9 billion
Description: J. M. Smucker Co said on Wednesday it would buy Rachael Ray Dog food maker Ainsworth Pet Nutrition for about $1.9 billion in cash to strengthen its pet food portfolio, and was exploring options for its U.S. baking business, including a sale.

Headlines: China envoy says prefers to resolve trade dispute by negotiation
Description: The United States and China should avoid a trade war, China's Ambassador to the United States Cui Tiankai said on Wednesday, stressing that Beijing's preference was to resolve the dispute through negotiations.

Headlines: China, holding Treasuries, keeps 'nuclear option' in U.S. trade war
Description: It took China just 11 hours to retaliate against the United States for proposing tariffs on some 1,300 Chinese products, but Chinese officials are holding back on taking aim at their largest American import: government debt.

Headlines: Wall Street closes higher as China tariff fears ease
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes staged a comeback to close around 1 percent higher on Wednesday as investors turned their focus to earnings and away from a trade conflict between the United States and China that wreaked havoc in earlier trading.

Headlines: Peugeot to decide on future of UK Vauxhall car plant in 2020: CEO
Description: Peugeot-maker PSA will decide in 2020 whether to keep its British Vauxhall car plant open with new investment as it improves efficiency and awaits the outcome of Brexit talks, the French automaker's boss said on Wednesday.

Headlines: VW's Skoda unions raise stakes in wage hike demands
Description: Unions at Volkswagen's Skoda Auto have withdrawn from a deal on flexible working shifts, they said on Wednesday, adding pressure on the Czech carmaker as they seek a double-digit pay raise and threaten strikes.

Headlines: China says U.S. has repeatedly missed best opportunities for trade resolution
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday that the United States has repeatedly missed the best opportunities for resolution on trade.

Headlines: China raises anti-dumping tariffs on ethylene glycol, diethylene glycol: commerce ministry
Description: China will raise anti-dumping tariffs on ethylene glycol and diethylene glycol imported from the United States and some European suppliers, the Ministry of Commerce said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade tariff tensions 'very worrisome': OECD
Description: The ratcheting up of trade tensions between the United States and China is "worrisome", the head of the OECD said on Wednesday after the two countries traded blows over $50 billion of import tariffs.

Headlines: VW bets on Brazil rebound with SUV, Honda remains cautious
Description: Volkswagen AG plans to produce its first SUV in Brazil, it said on Wednesday, betting on a rebound in Latin America's market despite signs of caution from rivals such as Honda Motor Co .

Headlines: India's Vistara orders two more A320neo aircraft to start international operations
Description: India's Vistara, a joint venture of Tata Sons [TATAS.UL] and Singapore Airlines , said on Wednesday it had ordered two more A320neo aircraft from Airbus to kick-start its international operations.

Headlines: GM urges 'constructive' U.S.-China dialogue
Description: General Motors Co on Wednesday urged the United States and China to engage in constructive dialogue over trade, after the two countries announced tariffs on $50 billion of each others' imports.

Headlines: GM to drop monthly U.S. vehicle sale reports
Description: (This version of the April 3rd story corrects to delete reference to Brazil in second paragraph)

Headlines: Deutsche Bank nominates U.S. banker Thain to supervisory board
Description: Former Merrill Lynch CEO John Thain is being nominated to the supervisory board of Deutsche Bank , Germany's largest lender said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China says it initiates WTO dispute procedure against U.S. 301 probe
Description: China's commerce ministry said it has initiated a World Trade Organization dispute procedure against the U.S. 301 tariffs investigation on Wednesday, amid an escalating trade dispute between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: China tariff on U.S. soybeans 'regrettable', says U.S. industry body
Description: China's decision to impose tariffs on imports of soybeans from the United States is 'regrettable' and 'won't solve the trade imbalance', the China director of the U.S. Soybean Export Council said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Elliott boosts hopes for change at South Korean auto giant Hyundai
Description: A unit of U.S. activist hedge fund Elliott Management revealed on Wednesday that it holds more than $1 billion worth of shares in key affiliates of South Korea's Hyundai Motor Group and called for more rapid reform of the auto giant's governance.

Headlines: Trump says taking a serious look at policy options on Amazon
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would take a very serious look at policies that might affect online retailer Amazon.com Inc.

Headlines: Trump taking 'serious look' at policy options on Amazon
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would take a serious look at policies to address what he says are the unfair business advantages of online retailer Amazon.com Inc

Headlines: Trade war or not, weak dollar trades here to stay: Reuters poll
Description: Currency market moves as a result of the trade dispute between the United States and China have more or less run their course and only a flare-up in the conflict will change the outlook significantly, a Reuters poll of strategists suggests.

Headlines: USDA looking for ways to protect farmers in China trade dispute: USDA official
Description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) is looking to find ways to shield farmers from the growing trade conflict between the United States and China, a department official said Thursday evening, without providing details of options under review.

Headlines: Pratt & Whitney wins JetBlue engine order
Description: U.S. airline JetBlue Airways Corp said on Thursday it has awarded Pratt & Whitney a contract to supply engines for its total fleet of 85 Airbus A320neo aircraft, more than doubling the carrier's previous contract with the engine maker.

Headlines: Uber to suspend service in Greece after new legislation
Description: Ride-hailing service Uber said on Thursday it would suspend its licensed service in Greece after the approval of local legislation which imposes stricter regulation on the sector.

Headlines: South Korea declares industrial crisis in city where GM factory is closing
Description: South Korea has designated the city of Gunsan an 'industrial crisis zone', expanding its support for the area following plans by General Motors to shut down a plant as well as the closure of a shipyard last year.

Headlines: Trump economic adviser says U.S., China trade deal likely: Fox Business
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Thursday said he expects the United States and China to work out their trade differences over time and that trade barriers likely "will come down on both sides."

Headlines: China says it never backs down in the face of threats after trade salvos with U.S.
Description: China has never surrendered to external pressure and it will win any trade war with the United States, the nation's state media stressed in a series of editorials and columns in the hours after the world's two top economies targeted each other with steep tariffs.

Headlines: Peugeot boss says CO2 fines will create Chinese 'Trojan Horse'
Description: A major European carmaker could be brought "to its knees" by carbon dioxide emissions fines, allowing a Chinese buyer to step in with its own electric vehicle technology, Peugeot maker PSA Group's chief executive said.

Headlines: Monsanto misses profit estimates as corn disappoints
Description: Monsanto Co on Thursday reported weaker-than-expected earnings for a second straight quarter, saying its corn business dropped as U.S. farmers planted fewer acres this spring, while low crop prices continued to drag the sector.

Headlines: China's HNA to sell some or all of $6.3 billion Hilton stake
Description: China's HNA Group Co Ltd, the heavily indebted aviation-to-financials conglomerate, plans to sell some or all of its $6.3 billion stake in Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc , underlining its need to shed assets and tackle a cash crunch.

Headlines: JPMorgan's Dimon praises Trump's deregulatory efforts in annual letter
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon complimented the administration of President Donald Trump in an annual letter to shareholders on Thursday, saying tax cuts and deregulatory efforts were helping his bank make more money.

Headlines: Exclusive: Yellen gets post-Fed payday in private meetings with Wall St. elite
Description: Janet Yellen cashed in with her first paid visit to Wall Street since stepping down as Federal Reserve chair, discussing rate hikes and U.S. President Donald Trump at events on Monday that included a dinner for 40 at a CEO's Manhattan penthouse.

Headlines: Rival banks applauded U.S. watchdog on 2016 Wells Fargo settlement: emails
Description: Rival lenders privately congratulated the top U.S. consumer watchdog on its $100 million settlement with Wells Fargo over the bank's phony accounts scandal, according to internal documents published by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau this week.

Headlines: SoftBank's first lithium deal raises prospects for junior miners
Description: SoftBank Group Corp's entry into the lithium sector, a hot commodity for electric car batteries, is raising hopes that small miners struggling to secure bank funding can tap alternative financing to cash in on booming demand.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco eyes new petrochemical plant in Texas: sources
Description: Saudi Arabia's national oil company Saudi Aramco on Saturday is expected to disclose initial steps toward a multibillion-dollar chemical plant in Texas, according to sources familiar with the company's U.S. operations.

Headlines: China's state media says U.S. tariff action will be defeated
Description: China's state media has rallied against the United States warning its trade protectionism actions would end in defeat and that the only option now was to hit the United States hard enough so it will "remember the pain".

Headlines: Fed's Powell: Too early to say how tariffs would affect U.S. economic outlook
Description: It is too early to say how the prospect of tariffs could impact the U.S. economic outlook, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. job growth seen slowing in March, jobless rate likely fell
Description: U.S. job growth likely slowed in March as the boost from mild temperatures faded, but the gains were probably more than enough to push the unemployment rate down to 4.0 percent, indicating the labor market continues to tighten.

Headlines: Trade dispute escalates as Trump threatens $100 billion more in China tariffs
Description: President Donald Trump on Thursday directed U.S. trade officials to identify tariffs on $100 billion more Chinese imports, upping the ante in an already high-stakes trade confrontation between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: South Korea urges GM, union to reach wage deal swiftly as tension rises
Description: South Korea on Friday urged General Motors Co's local subsidiary and labor union to reach a wage deal swiftly, saying the government will be able to discuss support for the money-losing unit on condition of an agreement.

Headlines: Grab's Uber deal still has some obstacles to navigate
Description: Regulatory scrutiny could complicate ride-hailing company Grab's takeover of Uber Technologies' Southeast Asian business, but there is little the authorities can do to stop Uber from simply exiting the region, lawyers and analysts said.

Headlines: Russia to discuss response to U.S. steel, aluminum tariffs: deputy PM
Description: Russia's government will discuss measures to protect Russian companies from U.S. trade tariffs on steel and aluminum in the coming days, Deputy Prime Minister Arkady Dvorkovich said on Friday.

Headlines: IKEA partners with mall operator SM Prime for first Philippines store
Description: Global furniture retailer IKEA AB [IKEA.UL] will in 2020 open its first store in the Philippines located at one of the world's biggest shopping malls, mall operator SM Prime Holdings Inc said on Friday.

Headlines: Birkin bag maker Hermes expands manufacturing with new French workshop
Description: French luxury handbag maker Hermes said on Friday it had opened a new manufacturing plant in eastern France, as rivals like LVMH's Louis Vuitton also expand leather goods production to keep up with thriving Chinese demand.

Headlines: Trump says 'we've already lost the trade war'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday the United States has already lost any trade war, as he defended his proposed tariffs against Chinese goods, saying the move might cause "a little pain" but the United States will be better off in the long run.

Headlines: Trade war fears already hurting the economy, ECB's Coeure says
Description: A trade war triggered by U.S. tariffs would cause a global recession - and the mere fear of one is already hurting the economy, European Central Bank board member Benoit Coeure said on Friday.

Headlines: Italy Antitrust opens probe into Facebook's collection, use of data
Description: Italy's Antitrust Authority has opened a probe into possible incorrect commercial practices by Facebook in its treatment of user data, the agency said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Instant view: U.S. job gains smallest in six months, wage growth picks up
Description: The U.S. economy created the fewest jobs in six months in March as the boost from mild temperatures faded, but a pickup in wage gains pointed to a tightening labor market, which should allow the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates further this year.

Headlines: Kudlow says U.S.-China trade talks are ongoing: Fox Business
Description: There are ongoing talks on trade between the United States and China, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday but he did not specify at what level the negotiations were occurring.

Headlines: Exclusive: Ukraine's largest airline may sue again in tussle with Ryanair
Description: Ukraine's largest airline may launch new legal action over the entry of Irish low-cost carrier Ryanair into the market if its complaints over airport slots are not addressed, its chief executive told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Court approves procedures for auctioning Weinstein Co
Description: A U.S. bankruptcy judge approved on Friday procedures for auctioning the film studio co-founded by Harvey Weinstein, who was fired by the company last year in the wake of allegations of sexual assault.

Headlines: U.S. job gains smallest in six months, wage growth firming
Description: The U.S. economy created the fewest jobs in six months in March as a boost from milder temperatures faded, but a pickup in wage gains pointed to a tightening labor market, which should allow the Federal Reserve to further raise interest rates this year.

Headlines: Trump administration mulls stiffer rules for imported cars
Description: The Trump administration is considering ways to require imported automobiles to meet stricter environmental standards in order to protect U.S. carmakers, according to two sources familiar with the administration's thinking.

Headlines: Philippines regulator orders pushback in Uber's shutdown amid ongoing review
Description: The Philippines' anti-trust agency said on Saturday it has ordered Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] to continue domestic operations as it reviews the ride hailing firm's deal to sell its money-losing Southeast Asian business to rival Grab.

Headlines: Sberbank to own biggest single stake in Croatia's Agrokor - report
Description: Russia's Sberbank may get around 30 percent of Croatia's indebted food group Agrokor [AGROK.UL] following a debt settlement, a Croatian newspaper reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Air France strike hits flights as French brace for rail stoppages
Description: Air France grounded just under a third of flights on Saturday as staff staged a walkout over pay, and travelers also braced for a fresh wave of train strikes starting later in the day, crippling much of France's transport network.

Headlines: China's state media urges U.S. industry to rally against Trump tariff threat
Description: Chinese state media on Sunday called on industrial and commercial sectors in the United States to rally against President Donald Trump's plans for an additional $100 billion in tariffs against Chinese goods.

Headlines: Kinder Morgan halts most work on disputed Canada pipeline expansion
Description: Kinder Morgan Canada on Sunday suspended most work on a C$7.4 billion ($5.8 billion) oil pipeline expansion that has become the focus of protests, a move underscoring uncertainty over major energy projects in Canada.

Headlines: High stakes, high expectations as earnings season heats up
Description: The rockiest U.S. stock market in two years will meet a major test in the coming weeks as first-quarter earnings pour in, with expectations that tax cuts will help Corporate America show its biggest quarterly profit growth in seven years. Any disappointments could further upset the fragile market.

Headlines: Dubai cryptocurrency firm denies Alibaba trademark infringement
Description: A Dubai-based cryptocurrency company called Alibabacoin Foundation has rebuffed allegations of trademark infringement brought against it by the giant Chinese online retailer Alibaba Group Holding in a U.S. lawsuit last week.

Headlines: Indian special court issues warrants against two accused in PNB bank fraud
Description: A special court of India's Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) issued non-bailable warrants against two Indian jewelers who are central figures in an alleged $2 billion scam at state-run Punjab National Bank (PNB) , according to a source within the investigative agency.

Headlines: ECB needs way of financing banks during wind-down: Constancio
Description: The European Central Bank needs a way to finance failing banks while they are being wound down, ECB vice-president Vitor Constancio said on Monday, citing the British and U.S. models as possible examples.

Headlines: Canada's options on pipeline as Kinder Morgan threatens to quit
Description: Canada's Liberal government is under pressure to push through the expansion of Kinder Morgan Canada Ltd's Trans Mountain pipeline from the Alberta oil sands to the Pacific province of British Columbia.

Headlines: SandRidge says to evaluate buyout offers, including Icahn's
Description: SandRidge Energy Inc said on Monday it would evaluate any offer to buy the company from top shareholder Carl Icahn after the hedge fund manager said he could pay cash to buy the U.S. shale oil producer.

Headlines: Uber agrees to buy electric cycle-sharing startup JUMP Bikes
Description: Ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] said on Monday it has agreed to buy electric bicycle service JUMP Bikes, allowing Uber to offer U.S. passengers an alternative to cars and further consolidating the crowded bike-sharing industry.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank's new CEO faces familiar questions over strategy
Description: Christian Sewing must quickly come up with a coherent strategy for Deutsche Bank after the retail banking veteran was promoted to chief executive of Germany's largest lender.

Headlines: Temasek stake values 'Salt Bae' Turkish restaurant owner at $1.2 billion
Description: Singapore's Temasek and Britain's Metric Capital have bought into Nusr-Et steakhouse owner D.ream in a deal valuing the Turkish firm at $1.2 billion.

Headlines: Telecom Italia vows legal action to stall Elliott's board drive
Description: Telecom Italia (TIM) plans to take legal action to prevent a vote on board candidates proposed by activist fund Elliott on April 24 as top shareholder Vivendi fights to keep its grip on Italy's biggest phone group.

Headlines: Colombia's Nutresa to open 50 new restaurants this year - CEO
Description: Nutresa , Colombia's largest producer of processed foods, will invest about $94 million in the opening of 50 restaurants and ice cream parlors this year, as well as in its distribution, the company's chief executive said on Monday. Investment planned for this year exceeds 2017's by almost 10 percent and Nutresa will also look at possible acquisitions in the 14 countries where operates, Carlos Ignacio Gallego told Reuters in a telephone interview.

Headlines: Stocks and oil up, but US dollar slips amid ongoing geopolitical risk
Description: Stocks across the globe rose on Monday, helping lift oil prices, but shares on Wall Street ended far from their highs after the FBI raided the offices of President Donald Trump's long time lawyer.

Headlines: Tesla to recall 8,898 vehicles in China from June 28: China quality watchdog
Description: China's quality watchdog said on Monday that Tesla Inc will recall a total of 8,898 Model S vehicles in the country starting on June 28, as part of a broader, global recall announced last month.

Headlines: U.S. airline industry boasts overall improvements: study
Description: Despite a steady stream of headlines highlighting U.S. airlines' customer-service failures, carriers have actually improved in several key areas over the last year, including bumping fewer passengers and losing less baggage, according to a study released on Monday.

Headlines: Zuckerberg ditches T-shirt, apologizes for Facebook mistakes
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg swapped his trademark T-shirt and jeans for a dark suit and a purple tie on Monday as he met U.S. lawmakers to apologize for the social network's misuse of its members' data and to head off possible regulation.

Headlines: Viacom asks CBS to raise its bid by $2.8 billion: sources
Description: Viacom Inc has asked CBS Corp to sweeten its merger bid by about $2.8 billion, or almost a quarter more than CBS's offer, three people familiar with the matter said, indicating the wide gap in the U.S. media companies' price expectations.

Headlines: Chinese real estate firms boost apartment rentals in line with Xi demands
Description: Major Chinese real estate companies are renting more of the apartments they develop as they respond to President Xi Jinping's demand that China should produce homes to live in not to speculate on.

Headlines: From silkworms to software, France's LVMH backs luxury startups
Description: France's LVMH is fostering projects by entrepreneurs in the luxury goods sector, including a startup working with silkworms on new materials and another whose software might help detect counterfeits.

Headlines: Alibaba's Jack Ma urges Facebook to fix privacy issues
Description: Jack Ma, founder of Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba, on Monday urged Facebook Inc to resolve its data privacy problems, a day before the social media giant's founder, Mark Zuckerberg, was due to appear at U.S. congressional hearings.

Headlines: Rusal shares plunge over 40 percent on U.S. sanctions
Description: Shares of Russian aluminum giant United Company Rusal Plc plunged as much as 41.8 percent on Monday as investors bailed on the stock after it was included in a new list of U.S. sanctions targeting Russian companies and their owners.

Headlines: Russia's En+ says U.S. sanctions highly likely to hurt business
Description: Russia's En+ Group, which manages the assets of tycoon Oleg Deripaska, said on Monday that new U.S. sanctions were "highly likely" to materially affect its business and prospects in an adverse way.

Headlines: China blames U.S for trade frictions, says negotiations currently impossible
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Monday that the United States was to blame for trade friction and that it was impossible for negotiations to take place under current conditions.

Headlines: China's premier says need to oppose unilateralism, trade protectionism
Description: China's Premier Li Keqiang said a trade war of unilateralism will not only harm bilateral interests but also hurt common interests of the world, according to a statement released by the state council on Monday.

Headlines: GM Korea says it may drop Spark, replace with crossover
Description: General Motors Co's South Korean unit said on Monday it may discontinue its Spark mini car and replace it with a crossover, on falling demand in key U.S. market.

Headlines: Novartis bets big on gene therapy with $8.7 billion AveXis deal
Description: Swiss drugmaker Novartis is moving further into gene therapy by buying AveXis for $8.7 billion, adding a rare-disease treatment that could reap billions in sales.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank picks retail specialist Christian Sewing as CEO
Description: Deutsche Bank named retail specialist Christian Sewing as its new chief executive officer with immediate effect on Sunday, signaling a possible retreat from almost three decades of empowering investment bankers at Germany's largest lender.

Headlines: Spain may step up stake sales in Bankia privatization: chairman
Description: Spain's banking bailout fund FROB could be looking at selling bigger stakes in the future privatization processes of Spain's state-controlled Bankia , Chairman Jose Ignacio Goirigolzarri said on Monday.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco signs deals with French companies worth $10 billion: Al Arabiya
Description: Saudi Aramco will sign eight deals with French companies worth $10 billion, the chief executive of the state-run oil giant told Saudi-run Al Arabiya TV on Monday during an official trip to Paris by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

Headlines: Rio Tinto stands to win from Rusal sanctions; U.S. consumers to lose
Description: Rio Tinto will be among the biggest winners from the U.S. sanctions imposed on Russian aluminum giant United Company Rusal as the penalties further shake up the global metals trade and boost costs for U.S. consumers, industry sources said on Monday.

Headlines: Dubai-based Abraaj hires Houlihan Lokey for health fund advice after dispute
Description: Dubai-based private equity firm Abraaj has hired U.S. investment bank Houlihan Lokey to help it try to stem the fallout from a dispute with investors over its healthcare fund.

Headlines: German government declines comment on new Deutsche Bank CEO
Description: A German government spokesman declined to comment on Monday on Deutsche Bank's decision to appoint Christian Sewing as chief executive, adding that he did not want to pass judgment on the leadership shake-up at Germany's largest lender.

Headlines: Noble Group gets more support for restructuring plan
Description: Commodity trader Noble Group Ltd said on Monday that it is getting growing support for a $3.4 billion restructuring plan after more than 70 percent of creditors holding the majority of its senior debt accepted the initiative.

Headlines: Millionaire bankers on the rise in Europe in decade after crisis
Description: Financiers in Europe earning more than 1 million euros ($1.23 million) rose by a third in the six years to 2016 to 4,597, with investment bankers and London dominant, data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Former Barclays trader Moryoussef to be tried in absentia in London
Description: A French former Barclays trader, charged by British prosecutors over alleged Euribor interest rate manipulation, will be tried in London in absentia, the Serious Fraud Office (SFO) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. wholesale inventories increase solidly in February
Description: Reuters - U.S. wholesale inventories increased a bit less than initially estimated in February, but still suggested that inventory investment would contribute to economic growth in the first quarter after being a drag on output in the prior period.

Headlines: Canada cabinet to discuss troubled Kinder Morgan pipeline
Description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will meet on Tuesday with his cabinet ministers to discuss Kinder Morgan Canada Ltd's threat to walk away from a troubled pipeline expansion as various levels of government signal interest in spending public funds to ensure the project proceeds.

Headlines: Cost-cutter Diess seen driving change as Volkswagen CEO
Description: Loved by investors and prepared to take on trade unions, Volkswagen brand boss Herbert Diess is likely to finally get his chance to lead Germany's biggest carmaker which is expected to change faster under his cost-cutting style.

Headlines: Analyst View: China's Xi promises to open economy, lower tariffs
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Tuesday promised to open the country's economy further and lower import tariffs on products including cars, in a speech that struck a conciliatory tone on the rising trade tensions between China and the United States.

Headlines: Doubts over U.S. bank capital payouts may cloud strong earnings
Description: Quirks in the new U.S. tax code are sowing doubts over how much big banks can boost dividends and stock buybacks this year, threatening to take the shine off what are likely to be strong quarterly profits.

Headlines: Google appeals Indian antitrust watchdog's 'search bias' verdict: sources
Description: Online search giant Google has filed an appeal at the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) against a judgment from India's competition watchdog that found it guilty of "search bias", two sources aware of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: HSBC to expand further in China, cut red tape under new management team
Description: (This version of the April 9 story corrects paragraph 6 to say mainland China retail bank unit made $44 million loss in 2017, removes incorrect year-on-year comparison)

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. watchdog seeks record fine against Wells Fargo for abuses - sources
Description: The top U.S. watchdog for consumer finance is seeking a record fine against Wells Fargo & Co that could exceed several hundred million dollars for auto insurance and mortgage lending abuses, according to three sources with knowledge of the plans.

Headlines: Ford to launch five new, redesigned car models in China in 2018
Description: Ford Motor Co , struggling to revive sales in China, on Tuesday unveiled five new models for the world's biggest auto market, part of a business revitalization effort centered around a plan to launch over 50 new or redesigned vehicles by 2025.

Headlines: China Baowu Steel president: impact of U.S. tariffs on China steel exports to be limited
Description: China Baowu Steel Group President Chen Derong said on Tuesday that tariffs imposed by the United States will have a limited impact on China's steel exports.

Headlines: Indonesia's Lion Air confirms $6.2 billion deal for Boeing 737s, flags 787 jet order
Description: Indonesia's Lion Air Group announced on Tuesday a firm order to buy 50 Boeing Co 737 MAX 10 narrowbody jets worth $6.24 billion and said it plans to place a provisional order for Boeing 787 widebody jets in the next few weeks.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan optimistic very few U.S., China tariffs will take effect
Description: Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said on Tuesday that he is still optimistic that very few if any of the proposed tariffs by the United States and China announced in recent weeks will actually be implemeneted.

Headlines: French competitiveness decline halted but not reversed: Villeroy
Description: France has halted a long decline in its international competitiveness but still needs to do more to claw back lost ground, Bank of France governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg faces Senate hearing but little hope for action
Description: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's No. 1 mission during his appearance before U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday and Wednesday will be to defend against calls to regulate internet-based companies.

Headlines: Healthcare, food boost U.S. producer prices in March
Description: U.S. producer prices increased more than expected in March, boosted by rising healthcare and food costs, pointing to a steady buildup of inflation pressures.

Headlines: Volkswagen to replace HR chief with Gunnar Kilian: Spiegel
Description: Volkswagen , which is working on a management overhaul that sources say could see it replace Chief Executive Matthias Mueller, is also planning to install a new head of human resources, Germany's Spiegel magazine reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler, U.S. Justice Department in diesel emissions settlement talks
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV is in advanced settlement talks with the U.S. Justice Department and California Air Resources Board over accusations that the company illegally used software that led to excess emissions in 104,000 U.S. diesel vehicles sold since 2014, a court-appointed adviser said at a hearing on Tuesday.

Headlines: Rusal non-executive directors exit board after U.S. sanctions
Description: Russian aluminum producer United Company Rusal Plc on Wednesday said two of its non-executive directors resigned after the company's inclusion on a new list of U.S. sanctions targeting Russian companies and their owners.

Headlines: BofA to stop lending to some makers of military firearms: Bloomberg
Description: Bank of America Corp plans to stop lending to companies that make military-style firearms for civilians, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, making it the second major U.S. lender to address gun sales after the Florida high school shooting that left 17 dead in February.

Headlines: Rusal bonds slump, customers review contracts as U.S. sanctions bite
Description: Rusal's dollar bonds slumped to record lows, two major customers said they were reviewing their contracts, and the London Metal Exchange distanced itself from the aluminum giant on Tuesday, in the latest aftershocks from U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: Global stocks up as Xi calms U.S.-China trade fears; oil rallies
Description: Global equity markets rose for the fifth session in six and the Japanese yen fell on Tuesday as Chinese President Xi Jinping's promise to cut import tariffs eased investor concerns about an escalating trade spat between the United States and China.

Headlines: Sanctions expected to prevent Rusal from servicing Eurobond
Description: Rusal , the world's second largest aluminum producer, is unlikely to be able to pay a Eurobond coupon in May as a result of U.S. sanctions imposed on the Russian company last week, investors and analysts said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Rusal triggers Iran-style defense after U.S. sanctions - source
Description: Russian aluminum giant Rusal has activated a contingency plan asking customers to pay in euros instead of dollars to try to skirt round U.S. sanctions, a source close to the matter said.

Headlines: Dubai's Alibabacoin says Alibaba has no monopoly on 'magic' name
Description: The Dubai-based cryptocurrency firm Alibabacoin Foundation on Tuesday said Alibaba Group Holding Ltd cannot monopolize the "magical" Alibaba name, and asked a U.S. judge to dismiss the Chinese e-commerce retailer's trademark lawsuit.

Headlines: Despite trade worries, Fed officials see risks as little changed
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is worried about trade tensions with China, but newly released details on policymakers' views suggest those concerns have not translated into concerns about the overall economy.

Headlines: Toys 'R' Us gets $1 billion bids for 85 percent of Asian business: lawyer
Description: Retailer Toys 'R' Us has received multiple bids of more than $1 billion for an 85 percent stake in its Asian business as the bankrupt company moves ahead with plans to sell some non-U.S. operations, its lawyer Joshua Sussberg said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Instant View: Minutes from March FOMC meeting
Description: All of the Federal Reserve's policymakers felt that the U.S. economy would firm further and that inflation would rise in the coming months, minutes of the central bank's last policy meeting on March 20-21 released on Wednesday showed.

Headlines: Hedge fund Paulson & Co takes stake in Viacom
Description: Paulson & Co, the hedge fund firm led by billionaire investor John Paulson, has taken a stake in Viacom Inc as the U.S. media company has started to turn around its business, Paulson told Reuters in an interview.

Headlines: Federal Reserve policymakers all saw strengthening economy, inflation: minutes
Description: All of the Federal Reserve's policymakers felt that the U.S. economy would firm further and that inflation would rise in the coming months, minutes of the central bank's last policy meeting on March 20-21 released on Wednesday showed.

Headlines: JP Morgan's Dimon says U.S. economy still looks 'pretty good'
Description: JPMorgan Chase Chief Executive Jamie Dimon said on Wednesday the U.S. economy still looked "pretty good" and that there was no law that says growth cannot continue.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank's kingmaker loses his touch
Description: Once one of Germany's chief power brokers in finance, Deutsche Bank Chairman Paul Achleitner's switch of chief executive has triggered criticism that it was rushed through, casting a cloud over his own future.

Headlines: Exclusive: Pentagon stops accepting Lockheed F-35 jets over repair cost dispute
Description: The U.S. Department of Defense has stopped accepting most deliveries of F-35 jets from Lockheed Martin Corp because of a dispute over who will cover costs for fixing a production error, three people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: SoftBank CEO running out of time to clinch Sprint-T-Mobile merger
Description: SoftBank Group Corp CEO Masayoshi Son faces a closing window of opportunity to merge the Japanese company's debt-laden U.S. wireless subsidiary Sprint Corp with Deutsche Telekom's U.S. wireless unit, T-Mobile U.S. Inc.

Headlines: Barnes & Noble must face renewed data breach lawsuit: U.S. appeals court
Description: A federal appeals court revived a lawsuit seeking to hold Barnes & Noble Inc responsible for customer losses from a 2012 data breach, where fraudsters tampered with payment verification machines known as PIN pads at 63 bookstores in nine U.S. states.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices drop, but core inflation firming
Description: U.S. consumer prices fell for the first time in 10 months in March, weighed down by a decline in the cost of gasoline, but underlying inflation continued to firm amid rising prices for healthcare and rental accommodation.

Headlines: Exclusive: Tesla targets November 2019 for start of Model Y production - sources
Description: Tesla Inc is targeting November 2019 as the start of production for its Model Y sport utility vehicle, with production in China to begin two years later, two sources told Reuters this week, shedding some light on the electric vehicle maker's next project that could tax its resources and capacity.

Headlines: U.S. TIPS breakeven rates hold steady after March CPI data
Description: The U.S. bond market's gauges of inflation expectations held steady on Wednesday as domestic consumer prices fell for the first time in 10 months in March due to a drop in gasoline costs, but the trend of inflation accelerating remained intact.

Headlines: U.S. companies found ways to avoid taxes before tax bill: report
Description: Fifteen U.S. corporations including online retailer Amazon.com Inc , power company Duke Energy Corp and insurer Prudential Financial Inc avoided U.S. tax on nearly $25 billion in combined profits last year, a tax watchdog group said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Abu Dhabi's Etihad drops more flights as review continues
Description: Etihad Airways will stop flying to Edinburgh, Scotland and Perth, Australia, from October 1, the latest routes dropped by the Gulf airline, as it continues to review its business strategy.

Headlines: China's Ant ups fundraising target, valuation could hit $150 billion: sources
Description: China's Ant Financial Services Group is in talks with investors to boost its fundraising target to at least $8 billion, which could see its valuation jumping to about $150 billion, people with knowledge of the plan said.

Headlines: VW CEO Mueller's removal has been planned for months: Bild
Description: The replacement of Volkswagen Chief Executive Matthias Mueller has been planned for months and board members Francisco Garcia Sanz and Karlheinz Blessing are also due to be ousted, Germany's Bild newspaper reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Sprint-T-Mobile merger talks back on, control key: sources
Description: Sprint Corp has restarted talks to merge with T-Mobile US Inc , people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday, the latest effort to bring together the fourth and third largest U.S. wireless carriers.

Headlines: China's Xi renews vow to open economy, cut tariffs as U.S. trade row deepens
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping promised on Tuesday to open the country's economy further and lower import tariffs on products like cars, in a speech seen as an attempt to defuse an escalating trade dispute with the United States.

Headlines: Euroclear suspends automated settlement of securities affected by U.S. sanctions
Description: Euroclear, a major international provider of post-trade services, said on Wednesday it had suspended automated processing of deals involving securities hit by the latest U.S. sanctions on Russian companies and individuals.

Headlines: Monsanto loses Indian legal battle over GM cotton patents
Description: A court ruled on Wednesday that Monsanto cannot claim patents on its genetically modified (GM) cotton seeds in India, the Indian company that brought the case said.

Headlines: Bayer to sell digital farming business to clear way for Monsanto deal
Description: Germany's Bayer plans to sell its digital farming business to BASF as part of changes to concessions it has offered to win over antitrust regulators for its proposed takeover of Monsanto .

Headlines: China to remove tariffs on imported cancer drugs from May 1: state media
Description: China will remove import tariffs on cancer drugs from May 1, state media reported on Thursday, citing a meeting of the State Council, or cabinet, chaired by Premier Li Keqiang.

Headlines: Boeing-Embraer proposal brings tie-up closer, not imminent: sources
Description: A new proposal for a tie-up between planemakers Boeing Co and Embraer SA that was submitted to Brazil's government on Tuesday brings the deal closer, but there are still issues to be ironed out, four people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Norway's Wideroe says may increase Embraer jet order
Description: Scandinavia's largest regional airline said on Thursday it aims to increase its order for E2 jets after it received the first of three new-generation aircraft from Brazil's Embraer to become its inaugural operator.

Headlines: Twelve senators seek FCC probe of Sinclair news scripts, pause in Tribune review
Description: Twelve U.S. senators on Thursday asked the Federal Communications Commission to investigate Sinclair Broadcasting Group for "deliberately distorting news" and asked the commission to pause its ongoing review of the company's proposed $3.9 billion acquisition of Tribune Media Co .

Headlines: Exclusive: Chevron, Exxon seek 'small refinery' waivers from U.S. biofuels law
Description: Global energy giants Chevron Corp and Exxon Mobil have asked U.S. regulators for exemptions to the nation's biofuels policy that have historically been reserved for small companies in financial distress, according to sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Myanmar activists welcome Zuckerberg's 24-hour target to block hate speech on Facebook
Description: Myanmar civil society groups welcomed a commitment by Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to tackle hate speech within 24 hours as the social media giant fights messages inciting violence, but urged it to deploy more resources in the country.

Headlines: Zuckerberg resists effort by U.S. senators to commit him to regulation
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on Tuesday navigated through the first of two U.S. congressional hearings without making any further promises to support new legislation or change how the social network does business.

Headlines: Takeda sounds out banks for loans as it moves towards Shire bid: sources
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical has sounded out its major creditors for loans, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said, as it moves closer to a bid for London-listed rare disease specialist Shire that could hit $50 billion.

Headlines: Google poised to emerge unscathed from European antitrust crackdown
Description: The European Union's top antitrust regulator, Margrethe Vestager, has made it her mission to stem alleged anti-competitive abuses by big American tech companies, threatening as recently as last month to break up Alphabet Inc's Google.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce and Boeing back UK minnow's rocket engine technology
Description: British aero-engine maker Rolls-Royce and U.S. planemaker Boeing have both invested in rocket engine company Reaction Engines as the latest blue-chip companies to back the start-up's thermal management technology.

Headlines: Pentagon confirms delivery suspension of Lockheed F-35 jets
Description: The U.S. Department of Defense has stopped accepting deliveries of F-35 jets from Lockheed Martin Corp because of a contractual dispute over fixing a production error, the Pentagon said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg unscathed by congressional grilling, stock rises
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg fielded 10 hours of questions over two days from nearly 100 U.S. lawmakers and emerged largely unscathed and considerably richer.

Headlines: Exclusive: Walmart close to buying majority of India's Flipkart
Description: Walmart Inc is likely to reach a deal to buy a majority stake in Indian e-commerce player Flipkart by the end of June in what could be the U.S. retail giant's biggest acquisition of an online business, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Trump orders review of U.S. Postal Service following criticism of Amazon
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday ordered the creation of a task force to study the U.S. Postal Service and its financial difficulties, after recently claiming without evidence that deliveries for Amazon.com Inc were costing the service money.

Headlines: Dassault eyes lead role in new European fighter jet project: CEO
Description: France's Dassault Aviation aims to take the lead on the development of a new European fighter jet, its chief executive told a German magazine.

Headlines: Wells Fargo CFO says government, not banks, should set gun policy
Description: Wells Fargo & Co believes the U.S. government, rather than banks, should set rules to promote gun safety, its finance chief said on Friday.

Headlines: Wells Fargo faces $1 billion fine from loan abuses
Description: Two U.S. regulators have proposed Wells Fargo & Co pay $1 billion in penalties to resolve probes into auto insurance and mortgage lending abuses at the third largest U.S. bank, overshadowing its first quarter results.

Headlines: U.S. lowers NAFTA key auto content demand: auto executives
Description: U.S. trade negotiators have significantly softened their demands to increase regional automotive content under a reworked NAFTA trade pact in an effort to move more quickly towards a deal in the next few weeks, auto industry executives said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street falls as bank stocks, Syria conflict weigh
Description: Financial stocks led a drop on Wall Street on Friday as results from big banks failed to enthuse and fear of broader conflict in Syria further unnerved investors.

Headlines: Trump says would only join TPP if deal were substantially better than offered to Obama
Description: President Donald Trump said late on Thursday he would only consider joining the landmark Trans-Pacific Partnership trade agreement if it were a "substantially better" deal than the one offered to President Barack Obama.

Headlines: U.S. bank executives see delayed boost from tax overhaul
Description: Banks have not reaped the full benefit of U.S. tax cuts, Wall Street executives said on Friday after a string of quarterly results, with expected business growth and higher consumer spending yet to materialize.

Headlines: U.S. judge says Uber drivers are not company's employees
Description: A U.S. judge in Philadelphia has ruled that limousine drivers for Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] are independent contractors and not the company's employees under federal law, the first ruling of its kind on a crucial issue for the ride-hailing company.

Headlines: More delays in GE power plants a worry for Pakistan's ruling party
Description: A pledge by Pakistan's ruling party to end electricity outages ahead of a general election in mid-2018 is being undermined by the possibility of further delays in new power plants that run on General Electric's flagship gas turbines.

Headlines: Deal-making spike seen as positive sign for U.S. stock market, for now
Description: Investors are optimistic that a pickup in corporate acquisitions stands to support the volatile U.S. stock market, and does not represent a worrisome cyclical sign.

Headlines: U.S. trade war fears ripple through China's 'workshop of the world'
Description: Allan Chau, the general manager of a Chinese factory making precision metal parts for U.S. customers, is still calling it a "proposed" trade war, but that hasn't stopped him from planning for the worst.

Headlines: Goldman's Schwimmer to steer London Stock Exchange through Brexit
Description: The London Stock Exchange named Goldman Sachs' veteran David Schwimmer as chief executive officer on Friday, with an initial challenge of helping the 300-year-old institution to navigate Brexit.

Headlines: Ford's slow China run persists, sales skid again in March
Description: Ford Motor Co's business in China continues to falter amid a dearth of fresh products, even though the American automaker earlier this week said it plans to launch two new models in the world's biggest auto market by the end of the year.

Headlines: Singapore watchdog sets interim measures for Uber-Grab deal
Description: Singapore's competition watchdog on Friday outlined a set of interim measures for ride-hailing firms Grab and Uber Technologies to ensure an open market as it continued its investigation into their merger in the city-state.

Headlines: Regulators eye new measures after Rolls-Royce Trent 1000 glitches: source
Description: U.S. and European regulators are set to order co-ordinated measures following the latest problems with Rolls-Royce Trent 1000 engines, used to power some Boeing 787 jets, said a person familiar with the plans.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to cut output and jobs due to Brexit, diesel slump: source
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover will cut around 1,000 jobs and production at two of its English factories due to a fall in sales caused by uncertainty around Brexit and confusion over diesel policy, a source told Reuters.

Headlines: EU could expand ban to poultry from Brazil's BRF - report
Description: The European Union is likely to expand a ban on poultry imports processed by Brazil's BRF SA , the world's largest chicken exporter, according to a local newspaper report on Saturday.

Headlines: Sulzer gets second license unblocking assets frozen by U.S. sanctions
Description: Swiss pump-maker Sulzer , which was last week freed from U.S. sanctions related to its Russian investor Viktor Vekselberg, said its business was "fully back to normal" after it received a second license fully unblocking its assets.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. will only rejoin Pacific trade pact if terms are improved
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said the United States would only join the Trans Pacific Partnership, a multinational trade deal his administration walked away from last year, if it offered "substantially better" terms than those provided under previous negotiations.

Headlines: Venezuela empowers oil minister Quevedo to reform energy sector
Description: President Nicolas Maduro has decreed extra powers to his oil czar Manuel Quevedo to try and halt sliding crude output in crisis-hit Venezuela, which has sunk to its lowest level since the 1950s.

Headlines: Oil, gold open lower despite Syria strikes; Russian retaliation in focus
Description: Gold and oil traded slightly lower as markets opened for the first time since Western powers launched a missile attack on Syria, but equities are unlikely to experience big losses unless the West strikes again or Russia retaliates.

Headlines: Canada's Trudeau ready to offer aid to ensure pipeline is built
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Sunday moved to end an escalating crisis over a Kinder Morgan Canada Ltd oil pipeline, saying Ottawa was prepared to offer financial aid to ensure the project went ahead.

Headlines: Unions, employers cite progress in German public sector wage talks
Description: Germany's public sector unions and employers said they made progress on Sunday during a third round of wage talks, following warning strikes by than 150,000 union members last week.

Headlines: Israeli unions warn Teva Pharm over plan to close Ashdod plant
Description: Israel's main labor federation intends to take labor or legal action against Teva Pharmaceutical Industries if the drugmaker does not suspend a decision to close a plant in the Israeli port city of Ashdod, it said on Sunday.

Headlines: Ad king Sorrell's abdication leaves WPP at crossroads
Description: Martin Sorrell's sudden exit from WPP marks a shocking end to the career of a chief executive who through sheer force of personality made it the world's biggest advertising firm.

Headlines: Icahn nominates five to replace entire SandRidge board
Description: Billionaire activist investor Carl Icahn on Monday nominated a five-person slate of his employees and business associates to replace the SandRidge Energy Inc board of directors, escalating his fight for control of the U.S. shale oil producer.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says he has no problem with being 'restrictive'
Description: Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan on Monday said he expects the U.S. central bank to raise interest rates three times this year and further next year to levels that could put the brakes on U.S. economic growth, but that he does not want to push short-term rates above long-term borrowing costs.

Headlines: Pentagon revises request for cloud computing services
Description: The U.S. Department of Defense on Monday updated its request for proposals from potential bidders on a $10 billion project for cloud computing services, in a deal that has been closely watched because Amazon.com Inc has been considered to be a top contender.

Headlines: Domino's unveils pizza delivery 'hotspots' as competition rages
Description: Domino's Pizza Inc is ramping up the food delivery wars, adding online ordering for more than 150,000 new delivery "hotspots" at U.S. parks, beaches and other destinations that do not have traditional addresses.

Headlines: Trump to nominate Clarida, Bowman to Fed's Board of Governors
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he would nominate Richard Clarida, an economist who advises fund manager Pimco, and Michelle Bowman, a Kansas banking regulator, for two key positions at the U.S. Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Drug suppliers' shares rise as looming Amazon threat appears to ease
Description: Shares of U.S. drug suppliers rose on Monday after a report that Amazon.com Inc had dropped plans to sell drugs to hospitals, in a boost to a pharmaceutical supply chain rattled by the looming threat of competition from the online retailer.

Headlines: Oil drops as Syria risk seen muted after weekend air strikes
Description: Oil prices dropped on Monday as investor concern waned about escalating tensions in the Middle East following air strikes on Syria over the weekend.

Headlines: U.S. stocks rise as Syria fears ease; yield curve flattens
Description: Wall Street closed higher on Monday as investors appeared less concerned about possible retaliation for U.S.-led missile strikes on Syria, and the yield curve reached its flattest level in over a decade.

Headlines: Hong Kong-listed shares of China's ZTE suspended
Description: The Hong Kong-listed shares of ZTE Corp were suspended on Tuesday after the United States and Britain issued warnings over the Chinese telecom equipment maker.

Headlines: China commerce ministry says hopes U.S. can appropriately deal with issue on ZTE
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Tuesday that it hopes the United States can appropriately deal with the issue involving Chinese telecom equipment maker ZTE Corp in accordance with laws and rules.

Headlines: Toyota to launch 'talking' vehicles in United States in 2021
Description: Toyota Motor Corp plans to start selling U.S. vehicles that can talk to each other using short-range wireless technology in 2021, the Japanese automaker said on Monday, potentially preventing thousands of accidents annually.

Headlines: Australia's AMP misled corporate watchdog for almost a decade: inquiry hears
Description: Australia's largest wealth manager AMP Ltd lied to the country's corporate watchdog for almost a decade to cover its widespread practice of charging customers for services it did not provide, an inquiry heard on Tuesday.

Headlines: IMF sees strong growth for New Zealand, flags medium-term housing risks
Description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) said on Tuesday that it expected New Zealand to show robust economic growth this year, but noted the housing market still posed medium-term risks to the economy.

Headlines: Big activist investors have first-quarter losses while small counterparts thrive
Description: Well known U.S. activist investors including Nelson Peltz and William Ackman took a hit from the first-quarter U.S. stock market slump, with their funds losing money while some smaller players delivered gains.

Headlines: PSA, German union in standoff over Opel's Eisenach plant
Description: The future of Opel's Eisenach factory in Germany hung in the balance on Monday after shop stewards rejected wage concessions demanded by Opel owner PSA Group in exchange for a commitment to invest in a production line for a new model there.

Headlines: UK's NCSC says national security risk from equipment from China's ZTE cannot be mitigated
Description: Britain's main cyber security agency said on Monday it had written to organizations in the UK's telecommunications sector warning them about using services or equipment from Chinese telecom equipment maker ZTE Corp.

Headlines: Qualcomm to refile China antitrust application for $44 billion NXP takeover: sources
Description: U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm will refile as early as Monday an application with the Chinese government to clear its $44 billion takeover of NXP Semiconductors , sources said, giving regulators more time to decide on the deal and averting a collapse.

Headlines: Warburg Pincus in talks to invest in Ant's $8 billion funding round: sources
Description: Warburg Pincus LLC [WP.UL] is in talks to invest in a fundraising round for China's Ant Financial Services Group [ANTFIN.UL] expected to be worth at least $8 billion, people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: VW's trucks division open to buying majority of Navistar
Description: Volkswagen is open to buying a majority stake in U.S. truckmaker Navistar "at some point," it said on Monday, as the German automaker prepares its trucks business for a possible stock market listing that could help raise funds to expand.

Headlines: Britain's WPP, investors adjust to life without Sorrell
Description: WPP entered uncharted territory on Monday after the exit of founder Martin Sorrell left the world's biggest advertising company rudderless at a time of intense industry change.

Headlines: 'Boiled frog syndrome': Germany's China problem
Description: Bauer, a big producer of construction equipment, is better placed than many German companies that invested heavily in China over the past few decades.

Headlines: AirAsia X won't buy 'too expensive' Airbus A350: co-group CEO
Description: Malaysia's AirAsia X Bhd has no plans to buy the Airbus SE A350 widebody jet, the airline's co-group CEO said on Monday, despite the airline having 10 of them on order.

Headlines: UnitedHealth earnings ease investor worries over flu season, stock up
Description: UnitedHealth Group Inc , the largest U.S. health insurer, on Tuesday reassured investors that the pervasive flu season did not crimp first-quarter earnings as had been feared, boosting its shares as well as those of rivals.

Headlines: Who's next? Investors seek to purge 'oligarch risk' from Russia portfolios
Description: "Who's next?" investors in Russia are asking as they scramble to clear their portfolios of "oligarch risk" - holdings in companies that may be next in line for U.S. sanctions after metals company Rusal was targeted last week.

Headlines: Fed's Evans says 2.25 percent inflation would not be a problem
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans said on Tuesday that it could take a year before U.S. inflation gets to 2 percent sustainably, and that if overshoots slightly, he would not be too worried.

Headlines: Fed can keep rate hikes gradual without risking inflation: Evans
Description: The Federal Reserve can stick to a series of gradual U.S. interest-rate increases over the next couple of years without much risk of an unhealthy surge in inflation, Chicago Fed President Charles Evans said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. to announce new weapons export policy on Thursday: sources
Description: A initiative from the administration of U.S. President Donald Trump aimed at boosting arms exports is scheduled to be rolled out on Thursday, two industry sources briefed on the plans said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S., Europe shares climb as dollar recovers on data
Description: U.S. and European shares climbed on Tuesday on quarterly earnings and a renewed appetite for risk, while the dollar rose off a two-week low and 2-year Treasury yields touched a decade high after economic data supported expectations of further rate hikes by the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Wall Street rises on earnings hopes, Netflix soars
Description: U.S. stock indexes rallied on Tuesday on broad-based gains while Netflix and UnitedHealth earnings impressed investors and boosted optimism about the U.S. corporate reporting season.

Headlines: U.S. suppliers to ZTE may find more demand from China firm's rivals
Description: Other customers may make up sales that U.S. suppliers to ZTE Corp lose due to a U.S. government ban on doing business with the Chinese phone and network equipment maker, industry insiders and analysts said on Tuesday, as some of the worst-hit stocks recovered ground.

Headlines: Trade spat to dull expected tax cut boost to U.S. economy: Reuters poll
Description: The ongoing trade spat between the world's two largest economies will restrain the roaring U.S. economy, dulling an expected boost to growth from massive tax cuts passed through Congress just a few months ago, a Reuters poll found.

Headlines: AT&T subsidiary DirecTV asks to be dropped from antitrust case
Description: DirecTV, the biggest U.S. pay TV company and a subsidiary of AT&T, asked a federal court on Tuesday to drop it from the lawsuit that the government filed to stop AT&T from buying movie and TV production company Time Warner.

Headlines: Starbucks to close 8,000 U.S. stores for one afternoon for racial-bias training
Description: Starbucks Corp will close 8,000 company-owned U.S. cafes for the afternoon on May 29 so 175,000 employees can undergo racial tolerance training in response to protests and calls for boycotts after the arrest of two black men waiting in a Philadelphia store.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. bans sales to major Chinese telco equipment vendor ZTE
Description: The United States has banned American firms from selling parts to China's ZTE Corp for seven years, a potentially devastating move for the telecoms equipment maker and exacerbating tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: U.S. ban on sales to China's ZTE opens fresh front as tensions escalate
Description: The United States has banned American firms from selling parts and software to China's ZTE Corp for seven years, potentially devastating for the telecoms equipment maker and exacerbating tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: China's property investment fastest in three-years, land shortage supports values
Description: China posted its fastest property investment growth in three years in the first quarter, driven by a surge in land values and as developers grew more confident about the policy outlook, however, sales slowed as existing curbs hit transactions.

Headlines: China March industrial output up 6.0 percent, misses expectations, January-March investment growth slows
Description: China's industrial output grew 6.0 percent in March from a year earlier, missing expectations, while fixed-asset investment growth slowed to 7.5 percent in the first quarter, also below forecasts, data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trade frictions with U.S. won't change stable development of China’s economy: stats bureau
Description: Trade frictions with the United States will not change the stable development of China's economy, the statistics bureau said on Tuesday, after reporting robust first-quarter growth.

Headlines: U.S. strike on China's ZTE another blow for Qualcomm
Description: A move by the United States to ban American firms selling components to the Chinese telecom equipment maker ZTE Corp will also hit a target closer to home: Qualcomm Inc, a U.S. company that is a major supplier of chips for ZTE's phones.

Headlines: China posts strong growth despite trade concerns
Description: China's economy grew at a slightly faster-than-expected pace of 6.8 percent in the first quarter, buoyed by strong consumer demand and robust property investment.

Headlines: Exclusive: OPEC's new price hawk Saudi Arabia seeks oil as high as $100 - sources
Description: Top oil exporter Saudi Arabia would be happy to see crude rise to $80 or even $100 a barrel, three industry sources said, a sign Riyadh will seek no changes to an OPEC supply-cutting deal even though the agreement's original target is within sight.

Headlines: VW's Electrify America to install EV chargers at Walmart stores
Description: Volkswagen AG unit Electrify America will install electric vehicle charging stations at more than 100 Walmart Inc store locations in 34 U.S. states by mid-2019 as part of Electrify's plans to bolster charging infrastructure across the country, the two companies said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Credit Suisse gets license for wealth management business in Philippines
Description: Credit Suisse Group AG said on Thursday it has received regulatory approval to launch its wealth management business in the Philippines, allowing the Swiss bank to tap the growing onshore wealth in the Southeast Asian country.

Headlines: Starbucks' Schultz steps in as outrage over cafe arrests simmers
Description: Starbucks Corp turned to long-time leader Howard Schultz on Wednesday to make the case that the U.S. coffee chain accused of racial profiling is committed to offering a "safe space" to customers despite the arrest of two black men in one of its Philadelphia cafes.

Headlines: U.S. economic growth on track despite tariff concerns: Fed report
Description: "Robust" business borrowing, rising consumer spending, and tight labor markets indicate the U.S. economy remains on track for continued growth, the Federal Reserve reported on Wednesday, with the risks of a global trade war the one big outlier.

Headlines: Factbox: Tariff talk looms large in Federal Reserve's latest 'Beige Book' business survey
Description: The Federal Reserve's latest "Beige Book", a summary of the state of U.S. business across the central bank's 12 regional districts published on Wednesday, featured an explosion in references to import tariffs as American firms estimated the impact of the Trump administration's newest trade policies.

Headlines: Haley fires back at Kudlow over Russia: 'I don't get confused'
Description: U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley fired back at White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Tuesday over his remarks that she may have been confused over Washington's plans to impose more sanctions on Russia.

Headlines: Corporate earnings boost most stocks, oil surges higher
Description: U.S. stocks ended mixed on Wednesday while most other global shares rose, as investors were drawn to riskier assets because of upbeat earnings from companies in Europe and the United States.

Headlines: SunPower buys U.S. rival SolarWorld to head off Trump tariffs
Description: SunPower Corp on Wednesday said it would buy U.S. solar panel maker SolarWorld Americas, expanding its domestic manufacturing as it seeks to stem the impact of Trump administration tariffs on panel imports.

Headlines: AmEx profit tops estimates as record splurge on rewards woos customers
Description: Credit card issuer American Express Co easily topped Wall Street targets for quarterly profit as record investments in card rewards and a strengthening U.S. economy contributed to higher customer spending.

Headlines: Whiskey sour? China importers fret over U.S. trade battle
Description: When spirits dealer Daniel Taytslin brought his first pallet of American Ragtime Rye whiskey into Shanghai in early April, the 672 bottles faced a 5 percent import tariff at China's customs.

Headlines: Ford expands U.S. medical ride business built around its vans
Description: Ford Motor Co said on Wednesday that it was expanding a medical transport service called GoRide in Southeast Michigan, one of several efforts by the U.S. automaker to build new ride service businesses around its Transit commercial van.

Headlines: China's ZTE may lose Android license as U.S. market woes build
Description: Chinese smartphone maker ZTE Corp's U.S. woes deepened on Tuesday, as regulators proposed new rules that could cut into its sales, while a supply ban means it may not be able to use Android software in its devices, according to a source.

Headlines: Carl Icahn buys stake in software provider VMware: CNBC
Description: Billionaire investor Carl Icahn has acquired a stake in cloud computing platform VMware Inc , CNBC reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Lockheed teams up with more German firms on military helicopter bid
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp's Sikorsky has partnererd with more German firms in its bid to win a 4 billion euro ($5 billion) heavy-lift helicopter contract from Berlin, and will showcase the industrial team at next week's Berlin air show.

Headlines: Shire faces criticism on CEO pay policy as crunch week looms
Description: Shire , the $47 billion rare disease drugmaker being stalked by Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical , faces fresh criticism over its executive pay policy from a leading investor advisory group as a crunch week approaches.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank names institutional client group head in China
Description: Deutsche Bank AG has appointed Beng-Hong Lee as China head of its institutional clients group, a business unit that distributes fixed-income and equities products to institutional investors, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Senior bank regulatory official to be named China Huarong chairman: sources
Description: China Huarong Asset Management Co Ltd is set to be helmed by a senior bank regulatory official, who will replace the current chairman under investigation for alleged corruption, two people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Peugeot boss faces toughest adversary yet in IG Metall
Description: PSA Group boss Carlos Tavares, whose career has seen him thrash out margin-boosting labor deals for two carmakers in several countries, is now taking on Germany's IG Metall union, which has been the undoing of many a cost cutter.

Headlines: Trudeau says recognizes NAFTA timeline, will stick up for Canada
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Thursday he recognized the timelines on seeking a NAFTA trade agreement and was engaging as much as possible to meet an opportunity to make "significant progress".

Headlines: Trump launches effort to boost U.S. weapons sales abroad
Description: The Trump administration rolled out a long-awaited overhaul of U.S. arms export policy on Thursday aimed at expanding sales to allies, saying it will bolster the American defense industry and create jobs at home.

Headlines: The great Russian oil game in Iraqi Kurdistan
Description: Last October, at the height of a political crisis in Iraq's Kurdistan region, a letter arrived at the Iraqi oil ministry in Baghdad from Igor Sechin, head of Kremlin oil major Rosneft .

Headlines: Shire rejects $63 billion Takeda bid as Allergan drops pursuit
Description: Rare disease drug maker Shire Plc said on Thursday it had rejected a $63 billion cash-and-stock acquisition offer by Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd , while Allergan Plc reversed course on pursuing a rival bid.

Headlines: Wells Fargo nears $1 billion settlement for loan abuses: source
Description: Wells Fargo & Co is close to settling a record fine of $1 billion imposed by two U.S. regulators for its risk management business, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles on tobacco and tech, commodities soften after wild ride
Description: Tobacco and tech stocks dragged down Wall Street on Thursday, while oil prices softened and other commodities walked back huge gains after a wild ride.

Headlines: Trade tensions with U.S. testing resolve of Chinese consumers
Description: Guo Qingshan delights in riding his 400,000 yuan ($63,839) Harley-Davidson motorbike around Beijing's suburbs.

Headlines: ZTE woes may boost network rivals Ericsson and Nokia
Description: Investors are warming to beleaguered mobile network makers Ericsson and Nokia as they begin to recover ahead of a once-a-decade uplift from a new business cycle and an unexpected boost from a U.S. ban on exports to low-cost Chinese rival ZTE.

Headlines: Takeda makes $61 billion bid for drugmaker Shire: sources
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical has made a bid for Shire that values the London-listed drugmaker at around $61 billion, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Subaru shares fall after NHK report of mileage cheating
Description: Japan's Subaru Corp falsified mileage and emissions readings on hundreds of vehicles, the country's national broadcaster NHK reported on Thursday, knocking off as much as 3 percent from Subaru's share price.

Headlines: Exxon faces setback in Iraq as oil and water mix
Description: Talks between Exxon Mobil and Iraq on a multi-billion-dollar infrastructure contract have reached an impasse, Iraqi officials and two industry sources said, in a potential setback to the oil major's ambitions to expand in the country.

Headlines: Sky reports strong quarter before bid battle steps up
Description: Sky , the pay-TV group at the center of a takeover battle between Fox, Disney and Comcast, reported a strong third quarter on Thursday, underlining its appeal to rival U.S. entertainment groups who want to expand in Europe.

Headlines: Qualcomm to refile China application to get NXP deal cleared
Description: Qualcomm will refile a regulatory application with the Chinese government to clear its $44 billion takeover of NXP Semiconductors , the U.S. chipmaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Qualcomm concessions insufficient to clinch NXP deal: commerce ministry
Description: U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm will have to do more to complete its proposed takeover of NXP Semiconductors , a commerce ministry spokesman said on Thursday.

Headlines: Daimler open to buying small stake in Volvo cars: Manager Magazin
Description: Daimler is open to supplying Volvo with engines and could even take a small stake in the Swedish carmaker, Manager Magazin said, raising the possibility of increased cooperation between Mercedes-Benz and China's Geely [GEELY.UL].

Headlines: Venture capital firm Fort Ross aims to bring more U.S. startups to Russia
Description: A venture capital firm aiming to bring more U.S. startups to Russia has raised a $200 million fund, hoping to use the fresh pool of money to help Silicon Valley companies deliver their services to Russia's biggest corporations and its millions of internet-connected consumers.

Headlines: Lyft to offset emissions from rides with projects combating climate change
Description: Lyft Inc is launching a program on Thursday to offset emissions from the 1.4 million cars that drive for the U.S. ride-hailing service by investing in projects to reduce other sources of greenhouse gas, the company said.

Headlines: Chips down: China aims to boost semiconductors as trade war looms
Description: China has long pushed the development of top-end semiconductors as a key strategic objective.

Headlines: Boeing, Brazil's Embraer close to tie-up: report
Description: Talks aimed at a tie-up between planemakers Boeing Co and Embraer SA that also involve Brazil's government are at an advanced stage, O Estado de S. Paulo newspaper reported on Friday, citing unnamed sources.
