Headlines: Iraq oil minister says oil prices are not very high
Description: Iraqi Oil Minister Jabar al-Luaibi said on Friday oil prices are "not very high" following a tweet by U.S. President Donald Trump criticizing OPEC over artificially high oil prices.

Headlines: Uber CEO and transport boss had second meeting over London license battle
Description: London's Transport Commissioner Mike Brown met Uber [UBER.UL]boss Dara Khosrowshahi in January, a freedom of information request revealed, as the Silicon Valley app fights to keep its cars on the streets of its most important European market.

Headlines: Japan's Takeda sweetens $62 billion Shire offer
Description: Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical nudged up its offer for Shire to 44.3 billion pounds ($62 billion) on Friday to try to persuade the rare-disease drugs specialist into talks after it rejected three previous proposals.

Headlines: Asian oil demand to hit record, but industry can't take eyes off Middle East
Description: Asian oil demand will hit a record in April just as global crude values are lifted to levels not seen in three years by Middle East supply risks and top exporter Saudi Arabia withholding output and noisily pushing for prices at $80 to $100 per barrel.

Headlines: Facebook's damage limitation drive hits trouble in Germany
Description: Facebook's attempt to limit fallout from a massive data breach hit trouble in Germany on Friday as a privacy watchdog opened a case against the social network and politicians accused its bosses of evasion.

Headlines: Wells Fargo agrees to pay $1 billion to settle customer abuses
Description: Wells Fargo & Co will pay $1 billion to settle with U.S. regulators who say the bank wrongly layered insurance on hundreds of thousands of drivers and routinely hit homebuyers with excessive fees, officials said on Friday.

Headlines: P&G earnings beat as struggling retailers, costs eat into margins
Description: The world's largest consumer goods maker Procter & Gamble Co narrowly beat quarterly earnings expectations on Thursday, saying shrinking retailer inventories and higher commodities and transportation costs squeezed margins.

Headlines: Trump rails against high oil prices, OPEC pushes back
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump accused OPEC on Friday of "artificially" boosting oil prices, drawing rebukes from some of the world's top energy exporters.

Headlines: Oil recovers after sliding on Trump tweet criticizing OPEC
Description: Oil prices edged up on Friday, stabilizing after an earlier slide driven by U.S. President Donald Trump's criticism of OPEC's role in pushing up global oil prices.

Headlines: Wall Street falls on investor nerves about interest rates, tech
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes declined on Friday as investors worried about a jump in U.S. bond yields, with technology stocks leading the decline on nerves about upcoming earnings reports and iPhone demand.

Headlines: U.S. yield hits four-year high; stocks fall on tech sector
Description: A U.S. bond sell-off continued for a second day on Friday, pushing the 10-year Treasury yield to its highest level in more than four years and steepening the yield curve after two weeks of flattening.

Headlines: Trade tensions set for brighter U.S. corporate spotlight
Description: The potential for an intensifying trade dispute to undercut the U.S. stock market could become clearer next week when a host of multinational companies reports quarterly results that may provide a glimpse into the impact of those global tensions.

Headlines: U.S., Europe order emergency checks on engine type in Southwest accident
Description: U.S. and European airline regulators on Friday ordered emergency inspections within 20 days of nearly 700 aircraft engines similar to the one involved in a fatal Southwest Airlines engine blowout earlier this week, citing risks of a similar mishap.

Headlines: U.S. said to investigate AT&T, Verizon over wireless collusion claim: source
Description: The U.S. has opened a probe into alleged coordination by AT&T Inc, Verizon Communications and a telecommunications standards organization to hinder consumers from easily switching wireless carriers, a person briefed on the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: China Huarong confirms chairman departs after probe, shares tumble
Description: China Huarong Asset Management Co confirmed its chairman Lai Xiaomin, who is under investigation for alleged corruption, had stepped down, sparking an 11 percent tumble in shares of the nation's biggest bad debt manager on Friday.

Headlines: China trade body urges tighter corporate compliance after ZTE woes: document
Description: A state-backed Chinese trade body said compliance is now a core risk for Chinese firms and that the government must speed up the implementation of guidelines on corporate oversight following a U.S. ban on sales to ZTE Corp.

Headlines: In Vietnam, a mega casino rises with the help of a Macau junket company
Description: Along a three-kilometer (2-mile) stretch of coastline in central Vietnam, construction cranes are digging up mounds of sand and rubble where the country's biggest casino is set to open next year.

Headlines: World Bank shareholders back $13 billion capital increase
Description: The World Bank's shareholders on Saturday endorsed a $13 billion paid-in capital increase that will boost China's shareholding but bring lending reforms that will raise borrowing costs for higher-middle-income countries, including China.

Headlines: Telecom standards group puts new technology on hold in wake of U.S. probe
Description: A telecommunications standards organization - GSMA - said on Saturday it is delaying implementation of a new cellphone technology due to a U.S. government probe of alleged coordination between the group, AT&T Inc and Verizon Communications Inc to hinder consumers from easily switching wireless carriers.

Headlines: Ford tells WPP it will take bids from other ad agencies
Description: Ford Motor Company said on Saturday it will take bids on some of its advertising managed by WPP , adding to uncertainty around the British ad giant after last week's exit of founder Martin Sorrell.

Headlines: U.S. sanctions on Vekselberg have $1.5-$2 billion assets frozen: sources
Description: ZURICH/MOSCOW - Assets totaling between $1.5 billion and $2 billion have been frozen as a result of sanctions imposed on Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg and his Renova Group conglomerate, two sources close to the matter told Reuters on Saturday.

Headlines: Treasury chief may visit China as trade tensions simmer
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Saturday he may travel to China, a move that could ease tensions between the world's two largest economies, as international policymakers acknowledged Beijing needs to change its trade practices.

Headlines: As chairman investigated over graft, China's Huarong told to control risks
Description: A senior official at China's banking and insurance watchdog said that the new leadership of China Huarong Asset Management Co must effectively control risks and focus on the company's core business of non-performing assets, according to a statement on the company's website on Sunday evening.

Headlines: Michael Bloomberg to write $4.5 million check for Paris climate pact
Description: Former New York mayor and billionaire Michael Bloomberg said on Sunday he will write a $4.5 million check to cover this year's U.S. financial commitment to the Paris Climate Agreement.

Headlines: HNA cuts stake in Deutsche Bank: filing
Description: Chinese conglomerate HNA has cut its stake in Deutsche Bank to 7.9 percent, according to a U.S. regulatory filing.

Headlines: Amazon to double down on groceries; foray deeper into fresh produce in India
Description: Amazon.com Inc expects groceries and household products to account for over half of its business in India in the next five years, as it moves to broaden offerings in the segment and foray into areas such as fresh produce.

Headlines: Fresenius pulls out of Akorn takeover over data integrity
Description: German healthcare group Fresenius SE said it had decided to pull out of its planned acquisition of Akorn after it found data integrity breaches at the U.S. generic drug maker.

Headlines: In Japan, new rules may leave home-sharing industry out in the cold
Description: Japan's new home-sharing law was meant to ease a shortage of hotel rooms, bring order to an unregulated market and offer more lodging options for foreign visitors ahead of next year's Rugby World Cup and the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.

Headlines: China opposes all forms of protectionism, commerce minister says
Description: China opposes all forms of protectionism and will firmly safeguard the world's multilateral trading system, its commerce minister wrote on Monday in the ruling Communist Party's official newspaper.

Headlines: U.S. 'constructive' over allies' concerns on Russian aluminum sanctions: French source
Description: American officials have offered a sympathetic ear to a call from some European capitals for an easing of U.S. sanctions on Russian aluminum producers, a French finance ministry source said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. home sales increase strongly; inventory remains tight
Description: U.S. home sales increased for a second straight month in March amid a rebound in activity in the Northeast and Midwest regions, but a dearth of houses on the market and higher prices remain headwinds as the spring selling season kicks off.

Headlines: Hasbro blames Toys 'R' Us for poor first quarter
Description: Hasbro Inc reported worse than expected results for the first quarter on Monday, blaming the bankruptcy of Toys 'R' Us for a slide in revenue but also promising the worst would be over in the first half of 2018.

Headlines: Nasdaq proposes letting companies decide where their shares trade
Description: Nasdaq Inc on Monday said it will ask regulators to let it give thinly-traded companies that list on its main U.S. stock exchange a choice as to whether their shares can be traded on other exchanges, with the aim of making it easier for investors to buy the stocks.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor Group shares gain after Elliott calls for major change
Description: Shares of three key affiliates of Hyundai Motor Group gained ground on Tuesday after U.S. activist hedge fund Elliott Management stepped up pressure for changes in the South Korean companies.

Headlines: Activist fund Elliott ramps up pressure on South Korean auto giant Hyundai
Description: U.S. activist hedge fund Elliott Management dismissed Hyundai Motor Group's restructuring plan as insufficient on Monday and called on the South Korean conglomerate to adopt a holding company strategy and appoint more independent board members.

Headlines: China's HNA Group to remain a 'major investor' in Deutsche Bank: HNA spokesman
Description: China's HNA Group [HNAIRC.UL] will remain a "major investor" in Deutsche Bank , the aviation-to-financial services conglomerate said in a statement on Monday, citing a company spokesman.

Headlines: Libya examines Total-Marathon purchase, casting doubt on deal: sources
Description: Libya is considering whether to intervene in a $450 million deal that French major Total announced last month to buy a Marathon Oil stake in the country's Waha concessions, several sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: China may backslide on deleveraging if trade war looms
Description: China’s efforts to reduce its reliance on debt and find a more sustainable route to grow its economy may be derailed by the simmering trade dispute with the United States, economists warn.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's Lishen plans first European sales office for electric vehicle batteries - source
Description: Chinese battery maker Tianjin Lishen plans to open a sales office in Germany, its first in Europe, and is in talks to supply local auto makers with batteries used to power electric vehicles, a source at the company told Reuters.

Headlines: Ryanair recognizes German union to represent cabin crew: Verdi
Description: Ryanair made an offer last week to formally recognize labor union Verdi to represent cabin crew in Germany, Verdi said in a statement on Monday.

Headlines: Toys 'R' Us sets up $156 million fund for trade claims: lawyer
Description: Toys 'R' Us will set aside about $156 million to pay vendors for toys and merchandise shipped after the U.S. retailer's Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing last September, a lawyer for the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence, housing data highlight economy's strength
Description: U.S. consumer confidence rebounded in April and new home sales increased more than expected in March, pointing to underlying strength in the economy despite signs that growth slowed in the first quarter.

Headlines: Express Scripts targets Amgen, Lilly migraine drugs in pricing shift
Description: The largest U.S. manager of prescription benefits is telling drugmakers that the current pricing model is broken, and taking aim at Amgen Inc , Eli Lilly and Co and other makers of new migraine medicines to try and fix it.

Headlines: Verizon first-quarter results beat estimates
Description: Verizon Communications Inc reported better-than-expected first-quarter results on Tuesday as the No. 1 U.S. wireless carrier lost fewer monthly phone subscribers than feared, and the company's chief financial officer said it was continuing to explore a new video service.

Headlines: BP has 'very strong' partnership with Rosneft - CEO
Description: BP has a "very strong" partnership with Russian oil giant Rosneft but will steer away from politics, Chief Executive Officer Bob Dudley said on Tuesday, as Moscow could face new western sanctions.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin shares fall as cash flow outlook disappoints
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp , the Pentagon's No. 1 weapons supplier, did not raise its 2018 cash flow projections on Tuesday even as the U.S. government spends more on defense, disappointing investors and pushing its shares lower.

Headlines: Stocks drop on cost worry; U.S. 10-year yields top 3 percent
Description: A gauge of world stocks tumbled on Tuesday, erasing early gains as U.S. bond yields scaled the 3 percent threshold for the first time in four years, while oil prices reversed course after climbing above the $75 per barrel mark.

Headlines: Lockheed lauds U.S. arms sales push, sees foreign sales rising
Description: Top U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin Corp welcomed a push by U.S. President Donald Trump to speed up approvals of arms sales, saying it would reassure allies who had been frustrated by bureaucratic delays in the past.

Headlines: Google-owner Alphabet's shares fall on rise in costs
Description: Shares of Google parent Alphabet Inc lost more than 5 percent on Tuesday as a surge in costs drove what analysts said was its biggest ever contraction in gross margins, overshadowing strong first-quarter ad sales.

Headlines: Wall Street slides as high bond yields fan cost worries
Description: Wall Street dropped sharply on Tuesday as warnings by bellwether companies of higher costs reverberated as the benchmark U.S. 10-year Treasury yield pierced the 3 percent level for the first time in four years.

Headlines: Dutch government memos: Tax cut was 'decisive' for Unilever's headquarters choice
Description: The scrapping of a Dutch tax on dividends was "decisive" for Unilever in deciding whether it would choose the Netherlands or Britain as its base, according to memos released by the Dutch government as part of a domestic political row on Tuesday.

Headlines: Softbank, Google join $1.9 billion investment in China truck-hailing firm
Description: Japan's Softbank Group and Alphabet Inc's venture capital fund CapitalG are among investors pouring $1.9 billion into a truck hailing service platform Manbang, the Chinese company said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump's revenge: U.S. oil floods Europe, hurting OPEC and Russia
Description: As OPEC's efforts to balance the oil market bear fruit, U.S. producers are reaping the benefits - and flooding Europe with a record amount of crude.

Headlines: Whirlpool to sell Embraco compressor business to Japan's Nidec for $1.08 billion
Description: Home appliance maker Whirlpool Corp said on Tuesday it agreed to sell its Embraco compressor business to Japan's Nidec Corp for $1.08 billion in cash as it focuses on its consumer-facing business.

Headlines: China's Didi in talks for IPO as early as this year: WSJ
Description: Chinese ride-hailing company Didi Chuxing is in talks for a multi-billion-dollar initial public offering that could take place as early as this year, The Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Takeda shares slide 5 percent after revised proposal for Shire
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co shares fell more than 5 percent in early trade on Wednesday following news it had sweetened its acquisition offer for London-listed drugmaker Shire Plc to 46 billion pounds ($64 billion).

Headlines: Ryanair agrees to buy 25 more Boeing 737 MAX planes
Description: Ryanair has agreed to buy a further 25 Boeing 737 MAX planes, worth $3 billion at list prices, lifting its order of the U.S. planemaker's flagship short-haul plane model to 135, the two companies said on Tuesday.

Headlines: SAP bullish on outlook as it beats path from back to front office
Description: Germany's SAP announced upbeat results in the seasonally tough first quarter, saying it was gaining ground on competitors Salesforce and Oracle in the cloud and that its margin recovery was firmly on track.

Headlines: Ad sales surge at Google parent Alphabet, but so do costs
Description: Strong growth in ad sales on Google search and YouTube were not enough to offset a surge in costs at parent Alphabet Inc that shrank the first-quarter operating margin, leaving shares flat after hours on Monday.

Headlines: Shire chairwoman says talks with Takeda ongoing
Description: Shire on Tuesday said discussions are ongoing with Takeda Pharmaceutical about the Japanese firm's bid for its Dublin-based rival ahead of a deadline to strike a deal on Wednesday. [L8N1S14PR]

Headlines: Shire receives new bid from Takeda as takeover deadline looms
Description: Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical has sweetened its $62 billion bid for Shire as it races to agree terms with the drugmaker before a deadline to strike a deal expires on Wednesday.

Headlines: Airbus CEO says post-Brexit production shift open for discussion
Description: Airbus will not move its existing activities out of Britain when the country leaves the European Union but could forgo basing new projects there, its chief executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Audi aims to double China production with partner FAW in five years: CEO
Description: German luxury carmaker Audi AG aims to double China production with local partner China FAW Group Corp Ltd [SASACJ.UL] within five years, its chief executive said on Wednesday, as global automakers look to localize in the world's largest vehicle market.

Headlines: Google overhauls Gmail to lure businesses away from Microsoft
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google unveiled on Wednesday its first Gmail redesign since 2013, capping what the company says was an expensive overhaul two years in the making to adopt security and offline functionality and better resemble Microsoft Outlook.

Headlines: Kobe Steel says under investigation over data tampering scandal
Description: Kobe Steel Ltd said on Wednesday that it is under investigation by Japanese authorities over its data tampering, widening a scandal that undermined faith in Japan's industrial sector last year.

Headlines: BMW sees slower growth in China this year; local JV talks ongoing
Description: German luxury carmaker BMW expects the pace of growth of its China sales to almost halve this year, the firm's chief executive said on Wednesday, amid a broader slowdown in the world's largest auto market.

Headlines: Chipotle rallies ahead of debut report from new CEO
Description: Shares of Chipotle Mexican Grill rallied on Wednesday ahead of the company's first quarterly report under a new chief executive hired to turn around the struggling burrito chain.

Headlines: Wall Street ekes out small gain as earnings offset cost worries
Description: Wall Street limped into positive territory on Wednesday on optimism over a spate of upbeat earnings that was nearly offset by jitters over rising U.S. bond yields and corporate costs.

Headlines: AT&T profit misses Wall Street forecasts as pay-TV business lags
Description: AT&T Inc reported lower-than-expected quarterly profit on Wednesday as the No. 2 U.S. wireless carrier lost subscribers from its pay TV business, sending its shares down more than 3 percent after the close of trading.

Headlines: Qualcomm chip sales indicate some smartphone strength
Description: U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc's quarterly profit and revenue topped Wall Street forecasts, suggesting that a slowdown in the global smartphone business might be less severe than feared after a string of weak forecasts from suppliers.

Headlines: Canada sees progress on NAFTA auto rules; steel tariffs loom
Description: Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Wednesday that good progress has been made at the NAFTA trade talks on the key issue of auto rules, though the threat of proposed U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs coming into force next week clouded the mood.

Headlines: Canada sees progress on NAFTA auto rules; steel tariffs loom
Description: Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Wednesday that good progress has been made at the NAFTA trade talks on the key issue of auto rules, though the threat of proposed U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs coming into force next week clouded the mood.

Headlines: Comcast confirms $31 billion bid for Sky, sparking battle with Fox
Description: U.S. media group Comcast submitted a 22 billion pound($30.7 billion) bid for Sky on Wednesday, prompting the European pay TV group to drop its support for a lower offer from Rupert Murdoch's Twenty-First Century Fox .

Headlines: Shire willing to back $64 billion Takeda bid, market signals doubts
Description: Rare disease specialist Shire said on Wednesday it was willing to recommend a sweetened $64 billion offer from Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical Co to shareholders, in what would be the biggest acquisition of a drug company since 2000.

Headlines: Uber suspending Vienna operations after court injunction
Description: The ride-hailing service Uber is suspending operations in Vienna after an Austrian court issued a temporary injunction against it on Wednesday.

Headlines: GM may raise investment plan for South Korean unit: source
Description: General Motors Co and the South Korean government are considering raising the size of their investment in the U.S. automaker's South Korean subsidiary from a previously proposed $2.8 billion, a senior government official with direct knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China banking, insurance regulator warns of risks of online insurance
Description: China's banking and insurance regulator said on Wednesday that it has issued warnings on the risks of online insurance.

Headlines: Global banks fear China will limit JV control through new rules
Description: Western banks are seeking clarification from China's securities watchdog on proposals to allow them to take over their onshore securities ventures, amid concerns about high asset value requirements and limits to ownership by non-financial investors.

Headlines: China invites overseas investors to propel local chip ambitions
Description: China is looking for billions of dollars in funds to propel its domestic ambitions in chips to cut a heavy reliance on imports, and has invited overseas investors to help it get there.

Headlines: Sky withdraws recommendation for Fox bid after higher Comcast offer
Description: The independent directors of pay-TV group Sky said they were withdrawing their recommendation of a takeover bid from Rupert Murdoch's Fox after U.S. cable company Comcast Corp trumped it with a 22 billion pound ($30.68 billion) offer.

Headlines: Credit Suisse fully compliant on sanctions: CEO
Description: Swiss bank Credit Suisse complies with sanctions regimes wherever it does business, Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam said after two U.S. senators demanded big banks disclose any links to rich Russians.

Headlines: Chinese tech giants, government under fire for 'men only' job ads
Description: Top Chinese tech firms and some government departments have been singled out in a report that says discriminatory hiring practices based on gender are widespread in China and are linked to a shrinking proportion of women in the labor force.

Headlines: Credit Suisse delivers best quarter since Thiam's revamp
Description: Credit Suisse delivered its best quarterly results on Wednesday since Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam launched his restructuring plan for Switzerland's second-biggest bank in 2016, driven by its wealth management business.

Headlines: Bud brewer hopeful that aluminum tariffs won't hit U.S. allies
Description: Anheuser-Busch InBev , the world's largest brewer, is hopeful that the United States will grant permanent exemptions to aluminum imported from allies and wants U.S. Congress to look into price spikes that have already set in.

Headlines: 'Small-town kids' shape future of China's consumption
Description: The bright lights of Beijing or Shanghai have never held much allure for Wu Tongxu, a 24-year-old civil servant earning a modest salary in the nondescript city of Xinxiang in China's central Henan province.

Headlines: More parcels, higher prices lift UPS profit but costs soar
Description: United Parcel Service Inc reported higher first-quarter net profit on Thursday, driven by strong package volumes in its core U.S. segment, but higher costs from Saturday delivery and nasty winter weather weighed on the bottom line.

Headlines: GM, South Korea agree $4.35 billion lifeline for GM Korea
Description: General Motors and South Korea have agreed to inject $4.35 billions into the carmaker's loss-making local arm to keep it afloat after it came close to seeking bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: Volatile ruble encourages McDonald's to cook up Russian fries
Description: French fries at McDonald's restaurants from Moscow to Murmansk will be Russian from now on, as the American fast-food chain turns to homegrown potatoes to deal with rouble volatility caused by fluctuating oil prices and Western sanctions.

Headlines: Chipotle restaurant sales beat Street, CEO cites 'recovery story'
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc on Wednesday reported sales at established restaurants and profit for the first quarter that beat expectations, and new Chief Executive Brian Niccol told investors that the beleaguered burrito chain has begun its turnaround.

Headlines: Under U.S. gaze, Latvia votes to dismantle banking bridge to Russia
Description: Latvia's parliament voted on Thursday to scale back domestic banks' ties with risky shell firms under laws aimed at tackling money laundering, but pressure will remain on the Baltic state to do more.

Headlines: China's top court rules for Dior in IP case, raps trademark office
Description: China's top court has ruled in favor of French fashion house Christian Dior , overturning rulings by lower courts and rapping the local trademark office for rejecting an application by the firm to register a perfume bottle trademark.

Headlines: Microsoft tops estimates as Azure, Office products drive gains
Description: Microsoft Corp on Thursday topped Wall Street forecasts for quarterly profit as the technology company signed up more businesses to its Azure cloud computing services and Office 365 productivity suite.

Headlines: South Korea antitrust chief says activist Elliott's Hyundai demand "inappropriate"
Description: South Korea's antitrust chief on Thursday said U.S. activist fund Elliott Management's proposal for Hyundai Motor Group to adopt a holding company structure was "inappropriate" and, if implemented, would be in violation of antitrust law.

Headlines: Starbucks' promotions struggle to attract U.S. customers, shares slip
Description: Starbucks Corp on Thursday reported stagnant store traffic at established U.S. cafes for the second quarter in a row, stirring concerns about intense competition from upscale coffee houses as well as fast-food chains and convenience stores.

Headlines: Exclusive: T-Mobile, Sprint make progress in talks, aim for deal next week - sources
Description: U.S. wireless carriers T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp have made progress in negotiating merger terms and are aiming to successfully complete deal talks as early as next week, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street gains on strong earnings, tech resurgence
Description: U.S. stocks advanced on Thursday with each of Wall Street's major indexes ending the session up 1 percent or higher, boosted by solid earnings results and a rebound in technology stocks as U.S. bond yields pulled back.

Headlines: Toyota to invest $170 million in Mississippi plant, create 400 jobs
Description: Toyota Motor Corp will invest $170 million in an existing plant in Mississippi to build the next generation of its Corolla sedan, the Japanese automaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street seeks rule changes to encourage IPOs, staying public
Description: Wall Street lobby groups urged U.S. policy makers and regulators to revamp rules to encourage more initial public offerings and to reduce the regulatory cost of staying public, in a white paper issued on Thursday.

Headlines: Disney plays up local ties in China amid trade standoff
Description: Shanghai Disneyland should be viewed as a local company in China, Walt Disney said on Thursday, shrugging off concerns that U.S.-China trade tensions could affect visitor numbers or import costs for the $5.5 billion theme park.

Headlines: GM agrees to provide $3.6 billion funding to South Korean unit: South Korea
Description: General Motors has agreed to provide $3.6 billion in fresh funding to its troubled South Korean unit, higher than its previously proposed $2.3 billion as part of a preliminary deal, South Korea said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chip wars - China closing in on second $19 billion semiconductor fund: sources
Description: China's state-backed semiconductor fund is near to closing a 120 billion yuan ($18.98 billion)investment round for a second fund to support the domestic chip sector and help cut reliance on imports amid a bruising trade standoff with the United States.

Headlines: Bayer, Monsanto deal on track for U.S. approval by end of May: source
Description: German drug and crop chemical maker Bayer AG's bid to buy seed and chemical company Monsanto Co is on track to win U.S. antitrust approval by the end of May, unless there is a last-minute complication, a source familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: China considering cutting duty on imported cars by about half: Bloomberg
Description: China is considering cutting the import duty on passenger cars by about half as part of the country's plan to further open up the automobile market, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. considers tightening grip on China ties to corporate America
Description: The U.S. government may start scrutinizing informal partnerships between American and Chinese companies in the field of artificial intelligence, threatening practices that have long been considered garden variety development work for technology companies, sources familiar with the discussions said.

Headlines: Toys "R" Us Canada gets court nod for assets sale
Description: Toys "R" Us (Canada) Ltd on Friday received U.S. and Canadian court approval to sell itself to Prem Watsa's Fairfax Financial Holdings Limited , the bankrupt toy retailer said in a statement.

Headlines: Imperial Oil hikes dividend, buyback after profit jump
Description: Canada's Imperial Oil Ltd on Friday reported a 55 percent jump in quarterly profit, helped by strength in its refining and chemicals businesses, and the company boosted its dividend and repurchase program.

Headlines: Canada stock markets, abruptly shut by technical issue, to resume on Monday
Description: Canada's stock market, the world's sixth-largest, abruptly shut down on Friday after an outage cut market participants off the main exchanges but will resume trading on Monday after resolving "internal technical issues," the exchange operator said.

Headlines: Rising costs, inflation on radar as U.S. earnings season unfolds
Description: Fresh worries about rising costs and inflation face U.S. stock investors looking toward the coming week and the next leg of the first-quarter earnings period.

Headlines: Nasdaq asks regulators to let companies decide where they trade
Description: Nasdaq Inc has asked regulators to allow it to give small companies a choice of trading on a single U.S. stock exchange, rather than all 13 of them, in an effort to make it easier for buyers and sellers of the stocks to find each other.

Headlines: T-Mobile, Sprint finalizing merger terms: sources
Description: U.S. wireless carriers T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp are finalizing terms as they seek to sign a merger by Monday that could value Sprint at around $26 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Alphabet's Sergey Brin says company must assume greater responsibility
Description: Alphabet Inc President Sergey Brin said on Friday that technology companies must take greater responsibility for the social impact of their work, his first comments following a year of heightened global awareness about misuse of digital services.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines orders 40 Boeing 737 MAX jets worth $4.68 billion
Description: U.S. carrier Southwest Airlines has ordered 40 Boeing Co 737 MAX jets worth $4.68 billion at list price to help modernize its fleet, the airline said, making it the planemaker's largest global customer for the updated narrowbody.

Headlines: Weak consumer spending seen restraining U.S. growth in first quarter
Description: The U.S. economy likely slowed in the first quarter as growth in consumer spending braked sharply, but the setback is expected to be temporary against the backdrop of a tightening labor market and large fiscal stimulus.

Headlines: Amazon delivers dazzling profits, as well as $20 Prime hike and NFL games
Description: Amazon.com Inc more than doubled its profit on Thursday and predicted strong spring results as the world's biggest online retailer raised the price for U.S. Prime subscribers, added U.S. football games and touted its cloud services for business.

Headlines: From Disney to Dior, Norway wealth fund challenges CEO pay
Description: Executive pay is firmly in the crosshairs of Norway's $1 trillion sovereign wealth fund as it puts its votes to work at some of the more than 9,000 companies it is invested in.

Headlines: Refiner Phillips 66 profit beats as chemicals unit outperforms
Description: U.S. oil refiner Phillips 66 posted a better-than-expected quarterly profit on Friday, helped by a 28 percent rise in net income from its chemicals unit.

Headlines: Chevron first-quarter profit beats expectations on rising crude prices
Description: U.S. oil producer Chevron Corp posted a better-than-expected first-quarter profit on Friday thanks to rising crude prices and production.

Headlines: U.S. economy slows in first quarter, but wage growth accelerates
Description: The U.S. economy slowed in the first quarter as consumer spending grew at its weakest pace in nearly five years, but a surge in wages amid tightening labor market conditions and lower tax rates suggested the setback is likely temporary.

Headlines: Phillips 66 to run refineries up to mid-90 percent range in second quarter 2018
Description: Independent U.S. refiner Phillips 66 expects its nine refineries to run in the mid-90-percent range of their combined crude oil processing capacity of 1.6 million barrel per day (bpd) in the second quarter of 2018, company Chief Financial Officer Kevin Mitchell said on Friday.

Headlines: Chevron first-quarter profit beats expectations on rising crude prices
Description: U.S. oil producer Chevron Corp posted a better-than-expected first-quarter profit on Friday thanks to rising crude prices and production.

Headlines: Airbus says aims to cut CSeries costs, sell 'big volumes'
Description: Airbus said on Friday it aims to reduce recurring costs of Bombardier's CSeries so that it can sell the jetliner in "big volumes" as soon as a deal to buy the loss-making program from Canada's Bombardier is completed.

Headlines: Canadian exchange operator TMX blames hardware failure for outage
Description: Canada's largest stock exchange operator said on Saturday that the failure of data storage equipment caused an outage that shut down the world's sixth-largest stock market for several hours on Friday afternoon.

Headlines: Emboldened by Trump, banks push to throw off old rule constraints
Description: Emboldened by President Trump's pledge to loosen laws introduced following the 2007-2009 global financial crisis, U.S. banks are pushing to scrap or revise more than a dozen other lesser-known rules they say are outdated, costly and hurt economic growth.

Headlines: China Fosun dials up tourism push with $1.74 billion Atlantis Sanya luxury resort
Description: China's Fosun International Ltd on Saturday launched its Atlantis Sanya luxury resort in a $1.74 billion bet that the sail-shaped development will become an icon in Hainan - China's Hawaii - and a beacon to both domestic and foreign tourists.

Headlines: Russia gives tentative nod to Schlumberger's acquisition of EDC stake
Description: Russia has given preliminary approval to a bid by U.S. oilfield services giant Schlumberger to acquire up to 49 percent of Russia's Eurasia Drilling Co (EDC), an unexpected decision given a chilling in U.S.-Russian relations.

Headlines: Australia banking scandal claims more AMP scalps, chairwoman quits
Description: Australia's largest-listed wealth manager AMP announced the resignations of its chairwoman and legal counsel on Monday, and slashed its directors' fees by a quarter as it races to stem the fallout from damaging revelations of misconduct at the firm.

Headlines: IMF Bentham proposes to fund class action against Australia's AMP
Description: Litigation financier IMF Bentham Ltd said on Monday that it plans to fund a class action against AMP Ltd, Australia's largest listed wealth manager.

Headlines: Canada stock market shutdown pushes investors to explore options
Description: A rare outage at Canada's major stock exchanges could dent the credibility of operator TMX Group Ltd and encourage investors to explore alternative trading channels, fund managers and traders told Reuters.

Headlines: Hong Kong scrambles for talent in battle for Nasdaq's biotech crown
Description: When Hong Kong unveiled plans last year to encourage biotech companies to list in the city by loosening listing rules, the financial industry and investors cheered.

Headlines: Logistics leader Prologis to acquire DCT Industrial for $8.4 billion
Description: Prologis Inc , a logistics company with a global footprint, will acquire smaller U.S. rival DCT Industrial Trust Inc in an $8.4 billion all-stock transaction, including the assumption of debt, the two companies said on Sunday.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco appoints first woman to the board
Description: Saudi Aramco, the world's top oil company which is preparing to go public, said on Sunday it has appointed new members to its board including a female executive, a milestone for Saudi Arabia and the oil industry where there are few women executives.

Headlines: China eases restrictions on foreign ownership of securities ventures
Description: China's securities regulator has released new guidelines for foreign investment in Chinese security joint ventures in which it eased some restrictions and launched an application process for more foreign ownership.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco appoints first woman to the board
Description: Saudi Aramco, the world's top oil company which is preparing to go public, said on Sunday it has appointed new members to its board including a female executive, a milestone for Saudi Arabia and the oil industry where there are few women executives.

Headlines: Regulatory uncertainty overshadows T-Mobile's acquisition of Sprint
Description: Winning U.S. regulatory approval for a $26 billion tie-up of Sprint Corp and rival T-Mobile US Inc is the biggest hurdle to completing the deal, investors and analysts said on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. EPA grants biofuels waiver to billionaire Icahn's oil refinery - sources
Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has granted a financial hardship waiver to an oil refinery owned by billionaire Carl Icahn, a former adviser to President Donald Trump, exempting the Oklahoma facility from requirements under a federal biofuels law, according to two industry sources briefed on the matter.

Headlines: CFTC fines Glencore Agriculture, Glencore Ltd $2 million for trading violations
Description: The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) on Monday said it has levied a fine of $2 million (1.45 million pounds) against Glencore Agriculture B.V. and Glencore Ltd. for multiple violations under the Commodity Exchange Act and CFTC regulations between January 2013 and November 2015.

Headlines: VW's Skoda shifts some SUV production to Germany
Description: Volkswagen AG's Czech division Skoda said it will shift some production of sport-utility vehicles (SUVs) to Germany to meet growing demand for its models.

Headlines: T-Mobile, Sprint say $26 billion deal would give U.S. tech lead over China
Description: T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp said on Sunday they had agreed to a $26 billion all-stock deal and believed they could win over skeptical regulators because the merger would create thousands of jobs and help the United States beat China to creating the next generation mobile network.

Headlines: Chipotle partners with DoorDash for food delivery
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc on Monday announced a national delivery partnership with DoorDash that covers more than 1,500 of the burrito chain's more than 2,400 restaurants in the United States.

Headlines: Marathon to become top U.S. refiner with $23 billion Andeavor buy
Description: Marathon Petroleum Corp agreed to buy rival Andeavor for more than $23 billion in a deal creating one of the largest global refiners that will benefit from access to booming U.S. shale fields and growing U.S. fuel export markets.

Headlines: Sainsbury's Asda buy could make UK tougher grocery market for Amazon
Description: Sainsbury's $10 billion purchase of Walmart's Asda may pressure UK grocery prices and make the British market less attractive for newer players such as Amazon.com .

Headlines: Canada stock market back in business after rare shutdown
Description: Canada's stock exchange, the world's sixth largest, was back in business on Monday after a hardware glitch abruptly ended trading on Friday and the exchange operator TMX Group said it was working to ensure there will be no repeat of the embarrassing market disruption.

Headlines: EU trade chief makes final bid to ward off U.S. tariffs
Description: EU trade chief Cecilia Malmstrom will put Europe's case to be permanently exempted from U.S. tariffs for a final time on Monday, ahead of a pending U.S. decision on whether to impose import duties on steel and aluminium coming from the bloc.

Headlines: Deutsche Telekom bullish on U.S. deal clearing anti-trust scrutiny
Description: Deutsche Telekom CEO Tim Hoettges expressed confidence on Monday that the $26 billion takeover of Sprint Corp by its U.S. unit T-Mobile US would clear anti-trust hurdles.

Headlines: McDonald's serves up quarterly beat on higher global sales, U.S. spending
Description: McDonald's Corp blew past analysts' forecasts for profit and revenue on Monday, helped by higher sales in overseas markets and as U.S. customers spent more at its outlets.

Headlines: Fed faces new challenge: A world without labor 'slack'
Description: Business is coming in so fast and workers are in such high demand at AOW Associates Inc, an Albany, New York-based construction firm, that its chief financial officer hired a guy six weeks ago for a job that didn't exist.

Headlines: U.S. judge blocks Fujifilm, Xerox merger temporarily
Description: Fujifilm Holdings Corp's merger with U.S. firm Xerox Corp was temporarily blocked on Friday following a court ruling, handing its activist investors a win after they sued to stop the deal.

Headlines: TMX says Friday's outage caused by hardware failure: email to clients
Description: Canada's stock market outage on Friday was caused by hardware failure in a communication management component, according an email reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: China's Baidu to sell majority of financial services unit for $1.9 billion
Description: China's Baidu Inc said it will sell a majority stake in its financial services business for about $1.9 billion to a consortium led by TPG Capital Management LP [TPG.UL] and Carlyle Group LP, as it seeks funding to take on established fintech firms in China.

Headlines: Publishers rebuke Google's interpretation of EU privacy law
Description: Google is forcing media firms that generate revenue from its advertising services to accept unreasonable responsibilities under a new European privacy law, four major publisher trade groups told the Alphabet Inc unit late Sunday in a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: OPEC April oil output hits year low on Venezuela slide: Reuters survey
Description: OPEC oil output fell in April to a one-year low due to declining production in Venezuela and lower shipments from African producers, a Reuters survey found, sending compliance with a supply-cutting deal to another record.

Headlines: TMX working with hardware maker to implement permanent fix: CEO
Description: Canada's TMX Group Ltd , which experienced an outage that shut down its exchanges on Friday, is working closely with a hardware maker to implement a permanent fix over the next week, Chief Executive Lou Eccleston told Reuters in an interview on Monday.

Headlines: S&P 500 climbs on trade talk optimism, dollar positive for 2018
Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq rose on Tuesday, helped by optimism over U.S. trade negotiations, while the dollar broke into positive territory for the year.

Headlines: U.S. commerce secretary says 5G priority for Trump administration
Description: The U.S. commerce secretary said on Tuesday that building a next-generation 5G mobile network was a priority for President Donald Trump's administration, boosting the argument behind the proposed merger of wireless carriers Sprint Corp and T-Mobile US Inc .

Headlines: Cold snap for U.S. April auto sales instead of spring thaw
Description: Most major automakers on Tuesday posted lower new U.S. vehicle sales for April as consumer demand continued to weaken and competition intensified following a lengthy boom for the industry.

Headlines: T-Mobile's quarterly revenue beats estimates
Description: U.S. wireless carrier T-Mobile US Inc , which is buying smaller rival Sprint Corp , topped Wall Street estimates for revenue on Tuesday as it added more phone subscribers who pay a monthly bill.

Headlines: Apple plows U.S. tax cuts into record share buybacks
Description: Apple Inc lavished cash on its shareholders like no company in history in the first three months of the year and it intends to keep doing so, making the iPhone maker's investors the clearest winners yet from last year's sweeping U.S. corporate tax cuts.

Headlines: UK trade minister delighted over Trump steel tariff extension
Description: Britain's trade minister Liam Fox said on Tuesday he was delighted that U.S. President Donald Trump had decided to extend a temporary exemption on steel and aluminum tariffs, saying hitting British imports made no sense.

Headlines: BP says still sees oil at $50-$60/bbl in 2018 as shale output surges
Description: BP expects benchmark oil prices to weaken in the second half of the year as U.S. shale production surges by up to 1.5 million barrels per day, Chief Financial Officer Brian Gilvary said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Swiss trader Trafigura bulks up management committee
Description: Trafigura has tripled the size of its management committee, bolstering the position of CEO Jeremy Weir while also giving more responsibility to the next generation of potential leaders, the Swiss commodities trader said on Tuesday.

Headlines: MetLife CFO John Hele retires, treasurer to succeed him
Description: U.S. insurer MetLife Inc said on Tuesday John Hele has retired as chief financial officer and will be succeeded by the company's treasurer John McCallion.

Headlines: China's HNA drops bid to buy Scaramucci's SkyBridge due to regulatory hold-up
Description: Chinese conglomerate HNA Group has dropped its bid for most of SkyBridge Capital, a hedge fund investment firm founded by U.S. President Donald Trump's former aide Anthony Scaramucci, as the deal was still stuck with U.S. regulators after more than a year.

Headlines: Atlanta Fed leaves U.S. second-quarter GDP growth view at 4.1 percent
Description: The U.S. economy is expanding at a 4.1 percent annualized rate in the second quarter as the government said construction spending fell in March and revised up its figure on building activity in February, the Atlanta Federal Reserve's GDPNow forecast model showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Pfizer first-quarter results miss estimates as key drug sales fall short
Description: Pfizer Inc on Tuesday reported lower-than-expected first-quarter revenue as demand for some key drugs and international sales fell short of estimates, sparking a 5.1 percent drop in shares of the largest U.S. drugmaker.

Headlines: EU demands permanent exemption from U.S. steel, aluminum tariffs
Description: The European Union's executive arm demanded a permanent exemption on Tuesday from U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs, saying U.S. President Donald Trump's decision not to impose such barriers for now prolonged business uncertainty.

Headlines: Fed leaves interest rates unchanged, says inflation near goal
Description: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady on Wednesday and expressed confidence that a recent rise in inflation to near the U.S. central bank's target would be sustained, leaving it on track to raise borrowing costs in June.

Headlines: Societe Generale ready to pay up to $1 billion to end U.S. probes: Bloomberg
Description: French bank Societe Generale SA is nearing a deal to pay up to $1 billion to resolve two U.S. investigations, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Fresenius alleges 'blatant fraud' at U.S. drugmaker Akorn
Description: German healthcare group Fresenius alleged it uncovered "blatant fraud at the very top level" of U.S. generic drugmaker Akorn Inc after Fresenius agreed to acquire the company for $4.75 billion, according to a court filing made public late on Tuesday.

Headlines: China won't accept preconditions in U.S. trade talks - Chinese government official
Description: China would welcome a successful outcome from upcoming trade talks with the United States, but is fully prepared for all outcomes and will not negotiate on core interests, a Chinese government official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: MetLife quarterly profit rises 8 percent, helped by tax reform, Asia growth
Description: MetLife Inc reported an 8 percent rise in adjusted first-quarter profit on Wednesday, boosted by U.S. tax reforms, as well as volume growth in Asia and better results in auto and catastrophe businesses.

Headlines: Sprint reports quarterly profit, appoints new CEO
Description: U.S. wireless carrier Sprint Corp on Wednesday posted net annual income for the first time in 11 years and named a new chief executive ahead of its proposed $26 billion merger with bigger rival T-Mobile US Inc .

Headlines: South Korea looking into Elliott over disclosure rules: official
Description: South Korean prosecutors are looking into U.S. activist fund Elliott Management to see if it violated disclosure rules during the fund's 2015 purchase of shares in Samsung C&T Corp , an official with the prosecution said on Thursday.

Headlines: Mnuchin says 'thrilled to be here' as he arrives in Beijing
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin arrived in Beijing on Thursday for trade talks with Chinese officials, telling reporters upon arriving at his hotel he was "thrilled to be here".

Headlines: Cramer Remix: Apple could have just signaled that Trump will make a trade deal with China
Description: Jim Cramer is rethinking trade and China after speaking with Apple CEO Tim Cook.

Headlines: Goldman's Waldron says U.S. tax reform boosts shareholder activism
Description: U.S. companies with more cash on their balance sheets thanks to tax reform are coming under greater scrutiny from activist investors, a top Goldman Sachs Group Inc investment banker said this week.

Headlines: Unilever given investor roasting on pay at London swansong
Description: Unilever Plc's shareholders approved a new executive pay policy on Wednesday, but the Anglo-Dutch consumer goods group faced a bruising backlash at what is expected to be its last annual general meeting in London.

Headlines: Exclusive: UPS weighs strategy to deliver bulky goods to boost growth
Description: United Parcel Service Inc is in talks with at least one U.S. trucking firm to launch an in-home delivery service for large, heavy goods such as couches and treadmills, as the world's largest package deliverer looks to cash in on one the fastest growing segments of online retail.

Headlines: Two U.S. coal miners see growth amid sector's gloom
Description: U.S. electric utilities are expected to shut hundreds more of their coal-fired power generators in the coming years, extending a long trend away from coal and toward natural gas that has cast a pall over the mining industry.

Headlines: China says constructive trade talks are possible as long as U.S. is sincere
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday that as long as the United States is sincere, both sides can have constructive trade talks.

Headlines: HSBC mandated on several privatizations in Saudi Arabia: executive
Description: British bank HSBC has been mandated for several privatizations in Saudi Arabia and will announce them very soon, a senior bank executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Volkswagen in talks to manage Didi fleet, co-develop self-driving cars
Description: (This version of the April 30 story has been changed after Didi Chuxing corrected the number of rides it provides in China each day to 30 million from 3 million as reported in the 7th paragraph)

Headlines: U.S. mortgage applications fall as loan rates hit four and a half year peak: MBA
Description: U.S. mortgage applications fell last week as interest rates on some 30-year fixed-rate home loans reached their highest levels in more than 4-1/2 years, the Mortgage Bankers Association said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ultimate frontier market? Amid thaw, Chinese eye North Korea real estate
Description: Chinese property speculators are starting to bet on a rapid improvement in relations between North Korea and the rest of the world, pushing up prices in the border city of Dandong and even spurring buying interest in the world's most isolated country.

Headlines: EU will not negotiate U.S. tariffs under threat: EU's Juncker
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said on Wednesday the European Union will not accept threats in talks with the United States to secure a permanent exemption from U.S. import tariffs on steel and aluminum.

Headlines: A dark hour for traders as rare outage crippled Canada stock markets
Description: For about an hour and 11 minutes last Friday afternoon, traders in Canada's biggest stock exchanges were left in the dark, as the stock market operator battled with a hardware failure.

Headlines: Exclusive: UTC set to win EU approval for $23 billion Rockwell Collins deal - sources
Description: U.S. aerospace and industrial company United Technologies Corp is set to win EU approval for the largest aerospace deal in history, a $23 billion bid for avionics maker Rockwell Collins , people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trade rows spell gain, and pain, for U.S. grain exporters
Description: Global grain marketers have seized upon trade tensions between the United States and several of its top export markets, including China, to turn around struggling trading units following one of the toughest years ever for the industry.

Headlines: Ping An Healthcare opens up 4.6 percent in Hong Kong debut
Description: Ping An Healthcare and Technology Co Ltd shares opened up 4.6 percent on their market debut in Hong Kong on Friday, as investors jostled for a piece of the fast-growing business.

Headlines: RBC market analyst: Tech is an area of risk in the stock market
Description: "I do think you've got to see some other major sectors take over the leadership," says RBC's head of U.S. equity strategy, Lori Calvasina.

Headlines: Key sticking points in the U.S.-China trade dispute
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin will lead a delegation to Beijing this week to meet with Chinese officials and try to ease the escalating trade dispute between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Sprouts ended Amazon Prime Now delivery partnership on May 1
Description: Sprouts Farmers Market Inc said on Thursday it ended its Prime Now delivery partnership with Amazon.com on May 1 and cut its full-year sales targets, sending shares of the U.S. supermarket chain down almost 12 percent.

Headlines: S&P 500 ends slightly lower on earnings disappointments; yields slip
Description: U.S. stocks cut sharp early losses to end mostly down slightly on Thursday as some disappointing earnings reports offset strong economic data, while bond yields slid after a surprising drop in euro zone inflation data.

Headlines: U.S. lifts Keystone oil pipeline pressure restrictions
Description: Pressure restrictions on TransCanada Corp's Keystone oil pipeline were lifted on Tuesday in a letter issued by U.S. pipeline safety regulators, a spokesman for the agency told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: SoftBank's Son 'not involved' in Sprint, T-Mobile merger approvals
Description: SoftBank Group Corp's Chief Executive Masayoshi Son is not involved in trying to get the proposed merger of U.S. wireless carriers Sprint Corp and T-Mobile US Inc approved, Sprint's outgoing chief executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: UBS CEO says investors may be expecting too much
Description: UBS Group Chief Executive Sergio Ermotti warned on Thursday that investors may be expecting too much too soon from Switzerland's biggest bank, noting heavy spending on technology would weigh on results in the short term.

Headlines: Poorest U.S. consumers seen hit hard by T-Mobile, Sprint merger
Description: The poorest U.S. consumers would lose most from the proposed tie-up of wireless carriers T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp , according to consumer advocates who warned the combined company would raise fees for pre-paid and other low-cost mobile phone plans.

Headlines: Canadian coffee chain Tim Hortons' U.S. franchisees to sue parent
Description: A group of Canadian coffee chain Tim Horton's U.S. franchisees said on Thursday it is suing parent company Restaurant Brands International , escalating growing tensions between the company and owners of its U.S. and Canadian coffee shops.

Headlines: Chances for U.S.-China trade breakthrough seen slim in Beijing talks
Description: The most likely outcome for tense U.S.-China trade talks launching on Thursday is an agreement to keep talking, with U.S. President Donald Trump maintaining his threat to press ahead with punitive tariffs on Chinese goods, trade experts say.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit narrows on exports; jobs market tightening
Description: The U.S. trade deficit narrowed sharply in March as exports increased to a record high amid a surge in deliveries of commercial aircraft and soybeans, bolstering the economy's outlook heading into the second quarter.

Headlines: China says talks with U.S. trade delegation have just begun
Description: China has just begun talks with a trade delegation from the United States, the foreign ministry said on Thursday, soon after the group led by U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin arrived in Beijing, the capital.

Headlines: BNP Paribas first-quarter profit falls on back of trading weakness in Europe
Description: BNP Paribas , France's biggest bank, reported a 17 percent decline in quarterly net profit, in line with expectations, as a weaker dollar and sluggish fixed income trading impacted investment banking revenues.

Headlines: Norway's $1 trillion fund says high return is key objective
Description: Norway's $1 trillion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, continues to seek high returns regardless of its other objectives, its chief executive told an annual hearing in parliament on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. hedge fund Elliott defeats Vivendi in board vote
Description: U.S. hedge fund Elliott pulled off a boardroom coup at Telecom Italia on Friday, wresting control away from French media group Vivendi as the fund embarks on a campaign to shake up slumbering companies across Europe.

Headlines: U.S., China commit to solve trade dispute through dialogue: Xinhua
Description: China and the United States have reached a consensus on some areas of their trade dispute but still have relatively big disagreements on others, China's official Xinhua news agency said in a microblog post on Friday.

Headlines: As Trump's tariffs bite, small U.S. manufacturers begin to tap the brakes
Description: Encouraged by a booming demand for construction equipment, Mike Haberman was planning in early February to hire at least 30 more workers for the manufacturing facility of his Gradall Industries in Ohio.

Headlines: Insurers hit shift button despite Brexit grace period
Description: Lloyd's of London, AIG, Allianz and other insurers are ignoring assurances and establishing new hubs in Britain and the European Union before Brexit in March 2019 to ensure access to customers.

Headlines: China asks U.S. to amend ZTE business ban - sources
Description: China has asked the United States to amend a seven-year ban on American companies selling components and software to Chinese telecom equipment firm ZTE Corp, two sources with knowledge of the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Germany declines to comment on U.S. indictment of ex-VW CEO
Description: A spokesman for Germany's justice ministry on Friday declined to comment on a decision by the U.S. Justice Department to file criminal charges against former Volkswagen AG Chief Executive Martin Winterkorn.

Headlines: Instant View: China media say some progress made with U.S. in trade dispute talks
Description: China and the United States have reached a consensus on some areas of their trade dispute but are still relatively far apart on other issues, China's official Xinhua news agency said on Friday.

Headlines: UTC gains EU antitrust approval to buy Rockwell Collins
Description: U.S. aerospace and industrial company United Technologies Corp secured conditional EU approval on Friday for its $23 billion bid for avionics maker Rockwell Collins , the largest aerospace deal in history.

Headlines: Cramer on trade: China could wait out Trump's presidency to make a deal, and that's bad for stocks
Description: Jim Cramer reveals the market's new thesis on China and predicts what could happen if it comes true.

Headlines: U.S. issues arrest warrant for former Volkswagen CEO but unlikely to face charges
Description: The U.S. Justice Department said on Friday that former Volkswagen Chief Executive Martin Winterkorn, indicted on four felony charges in Detroit in the company's diesel emissions scandal, is a fugitive who faces a U.S. arrest warrant.

Headlines: Wall St. rallies as inflation fears ebb; Apple hits record high
Description: The three major U.S. stock indexes rose more than 1 percent on Friday after weaker-than-expected U.S. wage growth helped to calm investor fears about rising interest rates and inflation, though the S&P 500 and Dow Industrials still posted losses for the week.

Headlines: Alibaba tops revenue forecasts as investments clip margins
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd reported better than expected top line results on Friday, driven by strong sales in its commerce and cloud computing units, even as margins were squeezed by flurry of investments.

Headlines: U.S. stocks gain 1 percent led by tech gains; oil prices jump
Description: U.S. stocks jumped more than 1 percent on Friday, helped by Apple and other technology shares and by weaker-than-expected jobs data that eased interest rate worries, while U.S. oil prices hit their highest in more than three years.

Headlines: U.S. job growth picks up, unemployment rate falls to 3.9 percent
Description: U.S. job growth increased less than expected in April and the unemployment rate dropped to near a 17-1/2-year low of 3.9 percent as some out-of-work Americans left the labor force.

Headlines: Venezuela brings Zerpa, sanctioned by U.S., back to PDVSA
Description: Venezuela's government has named Simon Zerpa, who was sanctioned by the United States last year, as an external director of state oil company PDVSA [PDVSA.UL] while confirming General Manuel Quevedo as the firm's president, the company said in a statement.

Headlines: How a trade row may split the fortunes of two U.S. farm companies
Description: The threat of steep tariffs on soybeans, wheat and corn from an escalating U.S.-China trade dispute may decide the survivor among the two largest real estate funds in the hard-hit U.S. farm sector.

Headlines: Fed's Quarles says paying 'a lot' of attention to spread of machine learning in finance
Description: Federal Reserve vice chair for supervision Randal Quarles said the central bank is in the early stages of studying how the expanding use of machine learning in the financial sector may change its regulatory approach, but that so far it fits within the existing regulatory framework.

Headlines: Australia's ANZ cuts financial planner bonuses as inquiry reshapes an industry
Description: Australia's ANZ said it would quit paying bonuses to financial planners for selling its products, becoming the country's first major lender to change business practices in response to a powerful inquiry that has unmasked widespread misconduct in the sector.

Headlines: ValueAct takes $1.2 billion stake in Citigroup: letter
Description: Activist investing firm ValueAct Capital Partners invested $1.2 billion in Citigroup Inc, citing the U.S. bank's low risk and reliable revenue and not calling for major changes, according to a letter seen by Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: After a year of Macron, start-up hum grows at Paris's Station F
Description: If there's one industry Emmanuel Macron has sought to tie his political fortunes to since storming to victory in France's presidential election last May, it's technology.

Headlines: Walmart likely to announce Flipkart deal before end of week: sources
Description: Walmart is likely to announce its much-anticipated deal to buy a controlling stake in Indian e-commerce player Flipkart before the end of this week, two sources said, in what is likely to be the U.S. retail giant's biggest acquisition of a business.

Headlines: Dollar surge bringing emerging market rate cut cycle to a halt
Description: A resurgent dollar and higher borrowing costs are smashing through Argentina and Turkey's currencies like a wrecking ball and raising the likelihood more broadly that emerging markets' three-year long interest rate cutting cycle is at an end.

Headlines: Nestle and Starbucks strike $7.15 billion coffee licensing deal
Description: Swiss-based Nestle, the world's largest food and beverage company, will pay Starbucks Corp $7.15 billion in cash for exclusive rights to sell the U.S. chain's packaged coffees and teas around the world, tying a premium brand to Nestle's global distribution muscle.

Headlines: Comcast formally notifies Brussels of intention to bid for Sky
Description: U.S. cable operator Comcast has formally notified the European Commission of its intention to bid for Britain's pay-TV group Sky , starting the clock on a review, a regulatory source told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. oil surges past $70, dollar hits fresh 2018 high
Description: The dollar rose to fresh 2018 highs on Monday while oil prices climbed to their highest since late 2014, driven by declining Venezuelan crude production and worries the United States could re-impose sanctions on Iran.

Headlines: Democratic lawmakers express 'serious concerns' about T-Mobile purchase of Sprint
Description: Senators Amy Klobuchar, Elizabeth Warren and other Democratic lawmakers expressed "serious concerns" on Monday about T-Mobile US, Inc's plan to buy rival Sprint Corp , focusing on the planned deal's effect on lower-cost wireless plans, Klobuchar's office said in a press statement.

Headlines: ZTE asks U.S. Commerce Department to suspend business ban
Description: China's ZTE Corp has submitted an application to the U.S. Commerce Department's Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS) for the suspension of a business ban, it said in a filing to the Shenzhen stock exchange on Sunday.

Headlines: Cramer: Warren Buffett's aversion to iPhones might've been what kept him out of Amazon and Alphabet
Description: Jim Cramer wonders if Warren Buffett's reluctance to use Apple iPhones was what stopped his fund from investing in Amazon and Alphabet's stocks.

Headlines: Blackstone to buy Gramercy Property in $7.6 billion deal
Description: U.S. private equity firm Blackstone Group LP will buy commercial real estate manager Gramercy Property Trust in a $7.6 billion all-cash deal, the companies said on Monday.

Headlines: Bank of America's loan to Remington tests its firearms pledge
Description: Bank of America Corp is preparing to provide critical financing to Remington Outdoor Co, which makes assault-type rifles, just weeks after the U.S. bank said it would stop financing "military-style" firearms for civilians.

Headlines: Investor Carl Icahn sells stake in AIG: sources
Description: Billionaire investor Carl Icahn has sold his stake in American International Group Inc , ending a more than two-year association with one of the largest U.S. property and casualty insurers, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Go to Omaha, young man: Chinese investors flock to Buffett
Description: China's growing middle class is becoming a bigger force in global tourism. For a case in point, look no further than Nebraska the week of the Berkshire Hathaway Inc annual shareholders' meeting.

Headlines: 'Facebook effect' turns Swedish steel town into tech hot-spot
Description: Facebook will double the size of its data center in Sweden's northern city of Lulea, raising its total investments in the region to about 8.7 billion crowns ($987 million), the company said on Monday.

Headlines: Oil surges on Venezuela-Conoco dispute, Iran sanction worries
Description: Oil prices rose for the fourth straight day on Monday to hit levels not seen since late 2014, boosted by the latest trouble for Venezuelan oil company PDVSA and the possibility that the United States could re-impose sanctions on Iran.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank denies planning to cut U.S. workforce by 20 percent
Description: Deutsche Bank does not plan to cut its U.S. workforce by about 20 percent, it said on Tuesday, denying a media report.

Headlines: U.S. job openings hit record high, more workers quitting
Description: U.S. job openings surged to a record high in March, suggesting that a recent slowdown in hiring was probably the result of employers having difficulties finding qualified workers.

Headlines: Canadian dollar hits 7-week low as oil falls, greenback climbs
Description: The Canadian dollar weakened to a nearly seven-week low against its U.S. counterpart on Tuesday, with the currency breaking out of its recent holding pattern as oil prices fell and the greenback broadly gained.

Headlines: Trump says may move to count ethanol exports toward biofuels quotas: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump told a group of senators on Tuesday he is considering allowing exported ethanol to count toward the volumes mandated under the nation's biofuels law, a move intended to appease both Big Oil and Big Corn by cutting the refiners' regulatory costs while preserving demand for corn.

Headlines: MetLife to provide pension benefits to 41,000 FedEx retirees through annuity
Description: U.S. insurer MetLife Inc has entered into an agreement to provide pension benefits for about 41,000 FedEx Corp retirees and beneficiaries through an annuity, the two companies said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: China ramps up checks on U.S. pork imports in potentially costly slowdown
Description: China has ramped up inspections of pork shipped from the United States, importers and industry sources said, the latest American product to be hit by a potentially costly slowdown at Chinese ports in the past couple of weeks.

Headlines: AT&T says it hired firm linked to Cohen for advice on Trump
Description: AT&T Inc said on Tuesday it had hired Essential Consultants, a company linked to Donald Trump lawyer Michael Cohen, to advise it on working with the new administration in early 2017, around the time of Trump's inauguration.

Headlines: Weinstein Co sale approved; funds for abuse claims unclear
Description: An affiliate of Lantern Capital received approval from a U.S. bankruptcy judge on Tuesday to buy the assets of the Weinstein Co, but the price may leave little for those who alleged sexual harassment by founder Harvey Weinstein.

Headlines: China accuses US of hostage-taking at the WTO
Description: The United States is threatening the World Trade Organization with "three hard blows", including taking the system of judicial appointments hostage, China's Ambassador to the WTO, Zhang Xiangchen, told its membership on Tuesday.

Headlines: Cramer: Trump's Iran deal announcement showed just how 'stupid' this market is
Description: Jim Cramer explains the stock market's seemingly irrational response to the president's Iran deal announcement.

Headlines: Siemens makes deal with German unions on job cuts
Description: Siemens said it had agreed in principle with trade unions about its plans to cut jobs and restructure its struggling Power and Gas (PG) and Process Industries and Drives businesses in Germany.

Headlines: Exclusive: Qatar Petroleum CEO says pushing ahead with expansion despite Gulf embargo
Description: State energy giant Qatar Petroleum will push ahead with its production expansion and foreign asset acquisition strategy to be on par with oil majors, despite a regional political and economic embargo on Doha, its chief executive said.

Headlines: Siemens strikes deal with German unions over job cuts
Description: Siemens has reached an agreement in principle with trade unions about its plans to cut jobs and restructure its struggling Power and Gas (PG) and Process Industries and Drives (PD) businesses in Germany, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Australia budget sees early return to surplus, cuts personal taxes
Description: Australia's center-right government said in its annual budget on Tuesday that it would return the country's finances to a small surplus in 2019/20, a year earlier than planned and after almost a decade of deficits.

Headlines: VW's Audi finds emissions problem with another 60,000 cars
Description: Audi has discovered emissions-related problems with a further 60,000 cars, it said on Tuesday, dealing a fresh setback to parent Volkswagen more than 2-1/2 years after it first admitted to cheating U.S. diesel exhaust tests.

Headlines: Germany probes Audi for potential new illegal emissions device
Description: German motor vehicle authority KBA has summoned Audi for a formal hearing about whether its diesel-engined A6/A7 models have been fitted with a previously unknown defeat device, Germany's Transport Ministry said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Comcast races to secure regulatory, political approval for Sky deal
Description: U.S. group Comcast stepped up its push to buy European pay-TV group Sky on Tuesday, seeking regulatory and political approval even as it maneuvers for a broader deal with bid rival, Rupert Murdoch's Fox.

Headlines: Exclusive: Comcast prepares all-cash bid to gate-crash Disney-Fox deal - sources
Description: U.S. cable operator Comcast Corp is asking investment banks to increase a bridge financing facility by as much as $60 billion so it can make an all-cash offer for the media assets that Twenty-First Century Fox Inc has agreed to sell to Walt Disney Co for $52 billion, three people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump complains of biased courts, but they often support his policies
Description: In a March speech at a Washington, D.C. law school, U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions slammed "activist" federal judges for blocking some of President Donald Trump’s key initiatives, voicing again a favorite grievance of the administration and Trump himself.

Headlines: Factbox: The court scorebox for Trump and his challengers
Description: Since President Donald Trump took office in January 2017, he and his administration have been swamped with lawsuits attacking his conduct and policies. The administration has lost more frequently in court than its challengers, but it has also had significant wins. And, since separate lawsuits on some issues have been filed in numerous courts, the administration has sometimes won a favorable ruling from one judge, only to have the policy blocked by another. Here are the key issues on

Headlines: U.S. March wholesale inventories revised lower
Description: U.S. wholesale inventories increased less than initially estimated in March amid declines in the stocks of motor vehicles and a range of other goods.

Headlines: SocGen poaches head of equities trading from BofAML
Description: France's Societe Generale has appointed Bank of America Merrill Lynch banker Alexandre Fleury as head of equities after the latest set of results showed the bank underperformed its rivals in trading.

Headlines: Three-quarters Facebook users as active or more since privacy scandal: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Description: Most of Facebook's U.S. users have remained loyal to the social network despite revelations that a political consultancy collected information about millions of accounts without owners' permission, a Reuters/Ipsos poll released on Sunday showed.

Headlines: Vodafone challenges Deutsche Telekom with $21.8 billion Liberty deal
Description: Vodafone has agreed to pay $21.8 billion to buy Liberty Global's assets in Germany and eastern Europe to take the fight to rivals with a broader range of superfast cable TV, broadband and mobile services.

Headlines: Factbox: Walmart notches biggest foreign investment with $16 bln Flipkart deal
