Description: Walmart Inc on Wednesday announced it was paying $16 billion for a roughly 77 percent stake in Indian online marketplace Flipkart, the U.S. retailer's biggest deal as it battles rival Amazon.com Inc in a burgeoning e-commerce market. {nL3N1SG3T3]

Headlines: U.S. producer prices rise slightly on weak hotel costs
Description: U.S. producer prices barely rose in April after strong gains in the first quarter, held back by a moderation in the cost of services such as hotel accommodation and healthcare, which could ease fears that inflation pressures were rapidly building up.

Headlines: Boeing CEO says end of Iran deal won't hurt 737 production
Description: Boeing Co's chief executive said on Wednesday the company will ensure its 737 production will not be hurt after the United States revoked its license to sell jets to IranAir and that none of the 737 aircraft it had expected to sell to Iran were in its backlog of orders.

Headlines: Novartis calls $1.2 million deal with Trump lawyer's firm a 'mistake'
Description: Novartis confirmed it had a $1.2 million contract with the firm of Michael Cohen, U.S. President Donald Trump's personal lawyer, adding it soon realized it had made a mistake but had not been able to stop payments until the deal ended.

Headlines: Walmart to pay $16 billion for control of India's Flipkart, shares slide
Description: Walmart Inc said on Wednesday it will pay $16 billion for a roughly 77 percent stake in Indian e-commerce firm Flipkart, the U.S. retailer's largest-ever deal as it competes with Amazon.com Inc in an important growth market.

Headlines: Japan's Takeda clinches $62 billion Shire deal as pharma M&A rolls on
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical agreed to buy London-listed Shire for 45.3 billion pounds ($62 billion) on Tuesday, the biggest yet in a wave of deals sweeping the drugs industry.

Headlines: Vodafone-Liberty deal would create cable monopoly: Telefonica Deutschland
Description: Telefonica Deutschland , Germany's third-largest mobile operator, said Vodafone's proposed $21.7 billion takeover of Liberty Global's European assets would lead to excessive market concentration.

Headlines: SoftBank to transfer ride-sharing stakes to Vision Fund
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp said on Wednesday it plans to transfer its stakes in ride-sharing firms to the SoftBank Vision Fund, a move which if approved would make the fund one of the world's biggest investors in the fast-changing industry.

Headlines: Japan's Recruit to buy Glassdoor for $1.2 billion in overseas push
Description: HR services provider Recruit Holdings Co has agreed to buy Glassdoor Inc for $1.2 billion, in a deal that will give the Japanese firm access to the U.S. job-website operator's vast database of company reviews and salary data.

Headlines: Google eases tech stress with app controls, table-booking assistant
Description: Google on Tuesday showed how its virtual assistant can now call restaurants and salons to book appointments, navigating complex conversations, as the Alphabet Inc unit acknowledged that a technological onslaught was leaving users frazzled and needing a cure.

Headlines: Walmart buys controlling stake in India's Flipkart for $16 billion
Description: Walmart Inc has agreed to pay $16 billion for a roughly 77 percent stake in Indian online shopping site Flipkart, the U.S. retailer's biggest foreign investment ever as it battles rival Amazon.com Inc in one of the world's biggest emerging markets.

Headlines: South Korea's KAI says paid firm of Trump's lawyer $150,000 for accounting advice
Description: South Korea's Korea Aerospace Industries Ltd (KAI) said on Wednesday it paid $150,000 for consulting services on accounting matters to a firm set up by U.S. President Donald Trump's private lawyer Michael Cohen.

Headlines: U.S. exit from Iran deal puts pressure on European planemakers
Description: America's withdrawal from the Iran nuclear accord signals the collapse of $38 billion in plane deals between Tehran and Western companies and leaves Airbus facing greater risks than arch-rival Boeing, according to people involved in the deals.

Headlines: Senators ask billionaire Icahn for refinery waiver details
Description: Six Democratic U.S. senators have asked billionaire investor Carl Icahn and Environmental Protection Agency Administrator Scott Pruitt to explain how an Icahn-owned refinery secured a valuable EPA exemption from the nation's biofuels law.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies and Apple approaches $1 trillion value
Description: Wall Street jumped on Thursday, and Apple inched closer to a $1 trillion stock market value, as tepid inflation data eased worries of faster U.S. interest rate hikes this year.

Headlines: GM sees custom designs, personal ownership for self-driving cars
Description: General Motors Co , which plans a ride-sharing fleet of robotaxis for next year, is looking at further business opportunities for self-driving cars, such as custom designs that could be almost unrecognizable from those of today, a top executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump drug-pricing speech adds dose of uncertainty for healthcare investors
Description: Investors are bracing for widespread volatility in healthcare stocks on Friday, when U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to give a highly anticipated speech about controlling prescription drug prices.

Headlines: Dollar, yields slide on soft U.S. inflation, stocks rally
Description: The dollar and U.S. government debt yields fell on Thursday while equity markets rallied after a modest rise in consumer prices in April eased concerns the Federal Reserve might raise interest rates more than expected this year.

Headlines: Ford says lost truck production will hit second quarter earnings
Description: Ford Motor Co's quarterly earnings will be affected by shutdowns at three U.S. truck plants caused by a fire at a key parts supplier, the U.S. automaker said on Wednesday, while affirming its full-year earnings estimate.

Headlines: China sentences Anbang's ex-boss to 18 years in jail
Description: The former chairman of China's Anbang Insurance Group Co Ltd has been found guilty of fraud and embezzlement and sentenced to 18 years in prison, three months after the state seized control of an insurer famed for buying New York's Waldorf Astoria hotel.

Headlines: U.S. East Coast refiners look to Texas crude for discounted oil
Description: U.S. East Coast refiners are shipping more shale oil from the Gulf Coast thanks to heavy discounts for West Texas crude and are also looking to bring more via rail, but supply bottlenecks are making it difficult to secure more barrels.

Headlines: Timeline: Xerox's complex relationship with top investors
Description: Xerox Corp's board is battling activist shareholder Carl Icahn and investor Darwin Deason over the company's plan to sell itself to Japan's Fujifilm in a deal the two say dramatically undervalues the photocopying firm.

Headlines: GM's commitment to South Korea is long-term and sincere, says GM executive
Description: General Motors executive Barry Engle said on Thursday that the automaker's commitment to South Korea is long-term and sincere, after South Korea announced details of a new deal with the automaker.

Headlines: Apple scraps $1 billion Irish data center over planning delays
Description: Apple ditched plans to build an 850 million euro ($1 billion) data center in Ireland because of delays in the approval process that have stalled the project for more than three years, the iPhone maker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Bank of America affirms gun pledge, hints at Remington loan exit
Description: Bank of America said on Thursday it was standing by its pledge to stop financing civilian assault weapons and suggested it may be preparing to exit a loan for gun maker Remington Outdoor Corp that sparked criticism of the lender.

Headlines: Balancing act: software giant SAP navigates Russian risks
Description: Most Western technology companies are losing ground in Russia under the weight of restrictive rules and mounting local competition. Germany's SAP is thriving.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices rise slightly; labor market tightening
Description: U.S. consumer prices rose less than expected in April, suggesting that inflation was increasing at a moderate pace, which could allow the Federal Reserve to continue gradually raising interest rates.

Headlines: BT to cut 13,000 jobs as it tackles bloated legacy
Description: BT will cut 13,000 managerial and back-office jobs and move to a smaller London base in the latest attempt by the boss of Britain's biggest telecoms group to rebuild from an accounting scandal and multiple pressures on its business.

Headlines: 'Humbling' U.S. settlement clears crisis-era hangover for RBS
Description: Royal Bank of Scotland's shares rose as much as 6 percent on Thursday after the bank reached a $4.9 billion settlement with U.S. authorities, opening the way for its privatization and return of cash to taxpayers who bailed it out in the financial crisis.

Headlines: Negotiators fail to reach NAFTA deal, Trump launches new attack
Description: Senior American, Canadian and Mexican officials on Friday ended a week of talks without a deal to modernize NAFTA, agreeing instead to resume negotiations soon, ahead of a deadline next week issued by U.S House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan.

Headlines: Takata's defective air bags linked to 278 injuries in U.S.: Senator
Description: Takata Corp's defective air bags have been linked to 278 injuries across the United States, according to updated figures released by U.S. Democratic Senator Bill Nelson of Florida, in advance of a hearing next week on the nomination of Heidi King to head the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

Headlines: Wall Street rises with healthcare rally after Trump's speech
Description: The S&P 500 rose on Friday, helped by healthcare stocks after President Donald Trump blasted high drug prices but avoided taking aggressive measures to cut them.

Headlines: Trump urges automakers to build more vehicles in U.S., blasts NAFTA
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday pressed automakers to build more vehicles in the United States and launched a fresh attack on the North American Free Trade Agreement that has benefited them, while the companies urged him to work with California to keep nationwide U.S. vehicle emissions standards.

Headlines: Foreign investment bill targeting China heads for Senate panel vote
Description: A bill aimed at tightening oversight of foreign investment in the United States because of concern about China's acquisition of critical technology is headed for a vote this month in the U.S. Senate Banking Committee, the panel said on Friday.

Headlines: AT&T CEO: We made 'big mistake' hiring Cohen, chief lobbyist out
Description: AT&T Inc on Friday ousted its top lobbyist, and the No. 2 wireless carrier's chief executive said it was a "big mistake" to hire Michael Cohen, President Donald Trump's personal attorney, for advice on working with the Trump administration.

Headlines: China's ZTE paid over $2.3 billion to U.S. exporters last year, ZTE source says
Description: Chinese technology company ZTE Corp , which this month suspended its main operations after a U.S. Commerce Department ban on American supplies to its business, paid over $2.3 billion to 211 U.S. exporters in 2017, a senior ZTE official said on Friday.

Headlines: Dollar eases, stocks climb amid benign U.S. inflation
Description: The U.S. dollar eased on Friday while an index of global stock performance gained and was poised for its best week since early March, as moderate inflation eased worries about a faster pace of U.S. interest rate hikes and boosted risk appetite.

Headlines: South Korea takes more cautious view on GM Korea turnaround than U.S. automaker
Description: General Motors' South Korean unit is expected to swing to a profit from 2022, state-run Korea Development Bank (KDB) said on Friday, offering a more subdued outlook for the troubled unit compared with the U.S. automaker which sees a profit from 2019.

Headlines: U.S. activist fund Elliott to vote against Hyundai restructuring plan
Description: U.S. activist fund Elliott Management said it will vote against Hyundai Motor Group's restructuring plan and urged other shareholders to reject the proposal to reform South Korea's second-largest conglomerate.

Headlines: Mazda taps Americas head as CEO to raise game in its biggest market
Description: Mazda Motor Corp has named the head of its Americas operations as its next president and CEO after its current chief steps down in June, as Japan's fifth-largest automaker seeks to boost profitability in North America, its biggest market.

Headlines: Iran expects word from Airbus on plane deal soon: Fars
Description: Iran expects to hear from Airbus in the coming days about the fate of an order for 100 planes that looks to have been wrecked by the United States' decision to reinstate sanctions on the Islamic Republic.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard: Trade debate poses risks, but could also hold upside for U.S
Description: Rising trade tensions have introduced uncertainty to a U.S. economy that is otherwise in good shape, but their resolution could also hold upside for the U.S. depending on the policies that end up being enacted, St. Louis Federal Reserve bank president James Bullard said on Friday.

Headlines: China's multi-story hog hotels elevate industrial farms to new levels
Description: On Yaji Mountain in southern China, they are checking in the sows a thousand head per floor in high-rise "hog hotels".

Headlines: Fed to put Wells Fargo remediation plan to public board vote: letter
Description: The Federal Reserve board will hold a public vote on whether to lift growth restrictions on scandal-hit Wells Fargo following pressure from Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren, the Massachusetts lawmaker said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Banks to seek special exemptions for foreign staff after Brexit - sources
Description: Global banks in Britain are calling for a special work visa waiver after Brexit to preserve the City of London's standing as a top global financial center, two industry sources said, a move that would be more generous than the current arrangements.

Headlines: U.S. import prices, surveys point to moderate inflation
Description: U.S. import prices rose less than expected in April as a rebound in the cost of petroleum products was tempered by a drop in food prices, the latest indication that inflation pressures were increasing moderately.

Headlines: BlackRock may keep fees despite executive's U.S. campaign donation: SEC
Description: BlackRock Inc can keep fees from the state of Ohio despite a donation one of its top executives made to Governor John Kasich's U.S. presidential campaign, according to a preliminary ruling late on Friday by a securities regulator.

Headlines: Conoco has seized Venezuela PDVSA products from Isla refinery: Curacao
Description: U.S. oil major ConocoPhillips has seized products belonging to Venezuelan state oil company PDVSA [PDVSA.UL] from the Isla refinery it runs on Curacao, an island official told Reuters on Sunday.

Headlines: Brexit seen threatening UK links in EU supply chain
Description: Mandy Ridyard knew Brexit was going to be a challenge for her aviation components firm, but it was still a shock when she heard a French company bluntly ruling out British suppliers from an international bid for a contract in China.

Headlines: NAFTA math may not add up to more U.S. auto jobs
Description: Trump administration demands in NAFTA trade negotiations meant to push auto jobs back to the United States may not be enough to spark a shift in where automakers build cars and trucks.

Headlines: Russia's Renova gets credit line from Promsvyazbank
Description: Russian billionaire Viktor Vekselberg's Renova Group received a credit line from Promsvyazbank last week to support the business after it was hit by U.S. sanctions, Russia's finance ministry said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. safety agency demands meetings with automakers on Takata recall
Description: The U.S. auto safety agency wants to meet with 12 major automakers that failed to fulfill a December 2017 target deadline for completing repairs on the highest-priority vehicles with dangerous Takata air bag inflators.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce's Ross says exploring alternative remedies for ZTE's actions
Description: The United States will look at whether there are other ways to deal with Chinese telecommunication company ZTE's violations of U.S. sanctions law, Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. small caps near record highs, outperform larger rivals
Description: Wall Street's modestly-sized publicly listed companies are beating out the heavyweights. The Russell 2000 , which tracks U.S. small capitalization companies, on Monday slipped 0.2 percent, but earlier in the session rose to within less than two points of its previous record high of 1,615.5 points.

Headlines: World stocks rise amid U.S.-China trade hopes; oil gains
Description: A gauge of stocks around the world reached its highest point in about two months on Monday amid hopes for improving trade relations between the United States and China, while oil prices climbed further.

Headlines: Oil gains while U.S. crude's discount to Brent deepens
Description: Oil prices rose on Monday as OPEC reported that the global oil glut has been virtually eliminated, while U.S. crude's discount to global benchmark Brent widened to more than $7, its deepest in five months.

Headlines: U.S. to consider expanding Medicare drug price negotiation
Description: The Trump administration is considering expanding Medicare's ability to negotiate the cost of drugs by giving private payers a role in setting the price of medicines administered in hospitals and doctors' offices, Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar said on Monday.

Headlines: Xerox abandons planned deal with Fujifilm in victory for Icahn and Deason
Description: Xerox Corp has scrapped a planned $6.1 billion deal with Fujifilm Holdings Corp in a settlement with activist investors Carl Icahn and Darwin Deason that also hands control of the U.S. photocopier giant to new management.

Headlines: NAFTA 'hot topics' unresolved as deal deadline looms, says U.S. official Ross
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Monday that none of the contentious issues in a new NAFTA trade deal appear to have been resolved, diminishing chances of meeting a Thursday deadline to notify U.S. lawmakers of an agreement.

Headlines: Toys 'R' Us to sell Geoffrey the Giraffe, and sex-toys-r-us.com
Description: Next month, Toys 'R' Us is putting its famous mascot, Geoffrey the Giraffe, on the auction block. Also up for sale: sex-toys-r-us.com.

Headlines: Study finds Uber's growth slows after year of scandal; Lyft benefits
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's growth has slowed as a series of scandals has allowed the ride-hailing company's chief U.S. competitor, Lyft Inc, to grab more market share, digital research firm eMarketer said in a report on Monday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler CEO reprimands colleague for commenting on emissions
Description: Fiat Chrysler Chief Executive Officer Sergio Marchionne reprimanded the company's top U.S. spokesman for issuing press releases about Fiat's vehicle emissions practices days after Volkswagen's disclosure in September 2015 that the German automaker had used illegal software to evade emissions tests, documents released Monday show.

Headlines: New Jersey's long bet on sports wagering finally pays off
Description: For half a decade, New Jersey tried in vain to convince U.S. courts to let it legalize sports betting, dreaming of the billions of dollars it might generate for a struggling state and its cash-strapped casino hub Atlantic City.

Headlines: U.S. says Centra Tech co-founders indicted for cryptocurrency fraud
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Monday announced the indictment of three co-founders of a cryptocurrency start-up once promoted by the boxer Floyd Mayweather, accusing them of fraudulently raising more than $25 million from investors in an initial coin offering.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs securities chiefs to leave firm: memo
Description: Two co-heads of Goldman Sachs' securities division - Isabelle Ealet and Pablo Salame - will retire next month after 20-year stints at the Wall Street bank, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Moscow may provide some support for Deripaska's Rusal, GAZ
Description: Russia is considering providing support to tycoon Oleg Deripaska's Rusal and GAZ , two companies hit by U.S. sanctions, but will not go as far as buying stakes in his firms, Finance Minister Anton Siluanov said on Monday.

Headlines: China's night-owl retail investors leverage up to dominate oil futures trade
Description: As 9 pm approaches every weekday night in China, a small army of individual investors from around the country log onto trading apps on their mobile phones and laptops.

Headlines: Exclusive: Conoco moves to sell North Sea oilfields: sources
Description: U.S. oil major ConocoPhillips is preparing to sell its North Sea fields as the company focuses on shale operations in its home market, industry and banking sources said.

Headlines: Britain's Burberry takes Italian leather goods supplier in-house
Description: Burberry is to take over one of its leather goods suppliers in Italy as the British group seeks to boost its handbag business in a drive to take its brand more upmarket.

Headlines: ZTE employees in China cheer Trump tweet
Description: Employees of ZTE Corp, the Chinese telecom equipment maker, are cheering a tweet by U.S. President Donald Trump that suggested a resolution is in sight for a devastating ban on sales to the Chinese company.

Headlines: Tesla registers Shanghai electric car firm ahead of ownership rule change
Description: Tesla Inc has registered a new electric car firm in Shanghai, as China prepares to scrap rules on capping foreign ownership of new-energy vehicle (NEV) ventures.

Headlines: U.S. optical stocks jump as Trump softens on China's ZTE
Description: Shares of U.S. optical component makers jumped on Monday after President Donald Trump pledged to help ZTE Corp "get back into business, fast" after a U.S. ban hurt the Chinese telecom equipment maker.

Headlines: Beiersdorf to cooperate with Chinese e-commerce business Kaola
Description: Germany's Beiersdorf , the maker of Nivea skin care products, said on Monday it had agreed a strategic cooperation with NetEase Kaola, an unit of Chinese video games publisher NetEase focused on cross-border e-commerce.

Headlines: UPS to create over 500 jobs with new UK delivery center
Description: Delivery firm UPS opened a new package sorting and delivery facility in south east England on Monday, creating hundreds of jobs in one of the U.S. company's largest infrastructure investments outside the United States.

Headlines: Timeline: Xerox's complex relationship with top investors
Description: Xerox Corp's board has scrapped the planned $6.1 billion deal with Japan's Fujifilm Holdings Corp in a settlement with activist investors Carl Icahn and Darwin Deason.

Headlines: Shell, Eni trial on Nigeria corruption re-adjourned to June
Description: The trial of top executives from oil majors Eni and Shell over alleged corruption in Nigeria kicked off on Monday with a brief procedural hearing and a decision to re-adjourn next month.

Headlines: Apple is almost a $1 trillion company, but watch out for Amazon
Description: Apple is on the verge of becoming the first $1 trillion publicly listed U.S. company, but even if it gets there, it could soon be overtaken as Amazon.com surges from behind.

Headlines: Samsung in talks with ZTE, others to supply mobile processor chips: executive
Description: Samsung Electronics is in talks with several smartphone makers including China's ZTE to supply mobile processor chips, a senior executive said, a move that will bring it in more direct competition with larger rival Qualcomm.

Headlines: Facebook says posts with graphic violence rose in early 2018
Description: The number of posts on Facebook showing graphic violence rose in the first three months of the year from a quarter earlier, possibly driven by the war in Syria, the social network said on Tuesday, in its first public release of such data.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending picking up, gasoline prices a threat
Description: U.S. retail sales increased marginally in April as rising gasoline prices cut into discretionary spending, but consumer spending appeared on track to accelerate after slowing sharply in the first quarter.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips shareholders reject executive pay proposal
Description: Shareholders of oil producer ConocoPhillips rejected a proposal at their annual meeting on Tuesday that would have linked executive compensation with U.S. accounting standards.

Headlines: China says will work with U.S. for positive outcome in trade talks
Description: China said on Monday it is willing to work with the United States for a positive outcome in trade negotiations this week.

Headlines: Statoil to become Equinor, dropping 'oil' to attract young talent
Description: Shareholders in Norway's largest company, Statoil , will approve on Tuesday the board's proposal to drop "oil" from its name as its seeks to diversify its business and attract young talent concerned about fossil fuels' impact on climate change.

Headlines: Soft China April investment, retail sales suggest economy losing steam
Description: China reported weaker-than-expected investment and retail sales in April and a drop in home sales, clouding its economic outlook even as policymakers try to navigate debt risks and defuse a heated trade row with the United States.

Headlines: Toshiba upbeat about Chinese review of $18 billion chip unit sale
Description: Toshiba Corp is upbeat about the prospects of clearing China's antimonopoly review of the $18 billion sale of its chip unit, its CEO said, dismissing reports it may pursue alternative plans if the review drags beyond the deal's deadline.

Headlines: Hermes EOS calls for clarity on new Deutsche Boerse chairman by next year
Description: Shareholder adviser Hermes EOS has called for the re-election of Deutsche Boerse's Chairman Joachim Faber for a limited period to allow an orderly succession at the top of the German exchange operator.

Headlines: AirAsia CEO says talks about opening Myanmar airline 'have stopped'
Description: Talks between AirAsia Group Bhd and a partner to open an airline in Myanmar have stopped, the group's chief executive told reporters on Tuesday.

Headlines: China says differences with U.S. should settled through dialogue
Description: Chinese Vice President Wang Qishan said on Tuesday that the United States and China should increase communication and solve differences through negotiations, Chinese state TV reported.

Headlines: Qualcomm-NXP deal still on hold in China, trade talks with U.S. eyed: sources
Description: Qualcomm's proposed $44 billion takeover of rival NXP Semiconductors is yet to see a concrete breakthrough in China, sources said, tempering hopes a lull in trade tensions with the United States had prompted Beijing to speed up its ruling on the deal.

Headlines: BMW targets group pre-tax margins of more than 10 percent: Handelsblatt
Description: Germany's BMW will target a group pre-tax profit of more than 10 billion euros ($11.9 billion) this year, finance chief Nicolas Peter told newspaper Handelsblatt on Tuesday, as the carmaker seeks to achieve double-digit margins in the long run.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips 'not close' to recouping $2 bln from PDVSA: CEO
Description: U.S. oil producer ConocoPhillips is far from collecting the full value of a $2 billion arbitration award against Venezuelan state oil company PDVSA [PDVSA.UL], Conoco's chief executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Russia's Rosneft looks to Vietnam experience to help global expansion
Description: With sanctions barring Russia's largest oil producer from offshore extraction with Western companies, Rosneft is looking to its operations in Vietnam for the experience needed to expand its global reach.

Headlines: Starbucks says aims to triple China revenue by 2022
Description: Starbucks Corp is looking to more than triple its revenue and almost double its store count in China over the next five years, doubling down on the market as traffic growth comes under pressure in the United States.

Headlines: Maduro seizes Kellogg plant after it leaves Venezuela due to crisis
Description: U.S.-based cereal maker Kellogg Co on Tuesday pulled out of Venezuela due to the country's deep economic crisis, and an angry President Nicolas Maduro said its units would be taken over and given to workers.

Headlines: U.S. bond yield hits 7-year high, lifting dollar, hurting stocks
Description: The yield on the benchmark U.S. 10-year Treasury note hit its highest in about seven years on Tuesday on the heels of a report that indicated a pick-up in consumer spending, lifting the dollar to its strongest level this year and weighing on stocks.

Headlines: Factbox: Tesla executive departures since 2016
Description: Electric carmaker Tesla Inc has seen a flurry of senior executive exits in recent months at a time when the company is looking to speed up production of its Model 3 sedan, a mid-market car crucial to its success and future profitability, and developing multiple new vehicles, including a Semi truck.

Headlines: U.S. agencies moving forward with proposing fuel economy revisions
Description: The Trump administration is moving ahead with plans to submit a series of options for softening fuel efficiency standards to the White House for approval in the coming week, two officials briefed on the matter Tuesday said.

Headlines: Germany's ex-foreign minister to join board of Franco-German rail venture
Description: Germany's former foreign minister, Sigmar Gabriel, was nominated on Tuesday as a director of Siemens Alstom , as the Franco-German rail venture finalised its board lineup.

Headlines: Novartis top lawyer exits over Trump attorney deal 'mistake'
Description: Novartis's top lawyer quit on Wednesday over a $1.2 million contract he co-signed with U.S. President Donald Trump's personal attorney, a deal the Swiss drugmaker's ex-CEO also said was a mistake.

Headlines: Frankfurt airport system failure fixed after flights hit
Description: Lufthansa and other airlines canceled flights on Wednesday after a system failure hit the operator of Frankfurt airport, Germany's largest hub.

Headlines: Britain to renationalize rail line sparking new row over ownership
Description: The British government is renationalizing the rail route between London and Edinburgh, taking back the line from a private company after it over-estimated profits, in a step likely to reignite a debate over public ownership of the UK's railways.

Headlines: Canada ready to cover Kinder Morgan loss, sees outside interest
Description: Canada is prepared to cover some losses Kinder Morgan Canada Ltd might suffer if a proposed oil pipeline expansion is delayed and thinks other investors are ready to step in if need be, Finance Minister Bill Morneau said on Wednesday.

Headlines: How Rusal escaped the noose of U.S. sanctions
Description: They were supposed to be the toughest sanctions the United States had ever imposed on a Russian oligarch. Seventeen days later, Washington watered them down.

Headlines: Toys 'R' Us demise could spur merger boom in U.S. toy market
Description: The U.S. toy industry looks set for a flurry of mergers and acquisitions between smaller toy makers in the aftermath of the Toys 'R' Us bankruptcy, as they seek more scope and negotiating power with big box retailers Target and Walmart .

Headlines: Venezuela reactivates Kellogg plant after company pullout
Description: Venezuelan authorities said they were reactivating a Kellogg Co plant under worker control on Wednesday, a day after the U.S. multinational food producer pulled out of the crisis-hit country.

Headlines: Evolus investors frown as FDA declines to approve Botox rival
Description: U.S. health regulators on Wednesday declined to approve Evolus Inc's rival product to Allergan Plc's Botox, citing deficiencies related to the chemistry and manufacturing of its potential treatment for frown lines, sending its shares down as much as 35 percent.

Headlines: India's Infosys sets up blockchain-based trade finance network with seven banks
Description: India's Infosys Ltd has formed a blockchain-based trade finance network with seven private-sector banks, to increase security and efficiency in the banking sector while also broadening its product offering.

Headlines: Fannie Mae sells $1.5 billion bills at higher rates
Description: Fannie Mae , the largest U.S. home funding source, said on Wednesday it sold $1.5 billion of benchmark bills at higher interest rates compared with last week's sale of similar maturities.

Headlines: Novartis ex-CEO says regrets hiring, not firing Trump lawyer
Description: Ex-Novartis Chief Executive Joe Jimenez regrets rushing into a $100,000-per-month consulting contract with U.S. President Donald Trump's personal lawyer but said post-election uncertainty over the administration's healthcare ideas put pressure on the Swiss drugmaker to sign a deal quickly.

Headlines: U.S. pushing for NAFTA deal as Thursday deadline approaches
Description: The United States is still pushing for a deal to revise the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), the White House said on Wednesday, while a top Mexican official held out the possibility of an agreement in the coming weeks.

Headlines: Wall St. gains as small-cap Russell 2000 hits record
Description: Retail and technology stocks led Wall Street higher on Wednesday and the small-cap Russell 2000 hit a record peak, even as a rise in U.S. bond yields to an almost seven-year high suggested more competition for equities and investors fretted over geopolitics.

Headlines: Industrial production rises strongly; homebuilding tumbles
Description: U.S. industrial production increased solidly in April amid an acceleration in manufacturing and mining output, the latest indication that the economy was gathering momentum early in the second quarter.

Headlines: Walgreen, Kroger, Albertsons, HEB sue Allergan over dry-eye drug
Description: Allergan Inc was sued on Wednesday by four large U.S. retailers that accused the drugmaker of antitrust violations for trying to stop rivals from selling generic versions of Restasis, its medication to treat dry-eye disease.

Headlines: Mothercare to close 50 stores, reappoint Newton-Jones as CEO: source
Description: Britain's Mothercare Plc will shutter 50 stores in the UK and bring back Mark Newton-Jones as chief executive as part of a restructuring plan to be unveiled on Thursday, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Xerox names John Visentin as CEO after scrapping Fujifilm deal
Description: Xerox Corp has appointed John Visentin as chief executive officer and set July 31 for its annual shareholders meeting, the U.S. photocopier maker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. gunmaker Remington exits bankruptcy in tough gun climate
Description: U.S. weapons manufacturer Remington Outdoor Co Inc said on Thursday it had emerged from Chapter 11 bankruptcy with less debt and more stable financing that may help it ride out a slowing market for firearms.

Headlines: Exclusive: Vitol, Glencore, Shell in running for Petrobras' Nigerian assets
Description: The world's three largest oil traders are competing to buy the African arm of Brazil's Petrobras that owns stakes in two major Nigerian offshore oil blocks, industry and banking sources with knowledge of the matter said, after submitting bids earlier this month.

Headlines: U.S. labor market tightening; mid-Atlantic factory activity picks up
Description: New applications for U.S. jobless benefits increased more than expected last week, but the number of Americans on unemployment rolls fell to its lowest level since 1973, pointing to diminishing labor market slack.

Headlines: Canada minister eyes pension funds for Kinder Morgan project
Description: Canada's Finance Minister Bill Morneau on Thursday highlighted the country's pension funds as possible investors in Kinder Morgan Inc's pipeline expansion, but industry sources were skeptical about attracting new investors.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade talks to continue on Friday: White House
Description: U.S. and Chinese officials seeking to bridge a divide on trade issues held talks on Thursday, which included a meeting with President Donald Trump, and those discussions will continue on Friday, the White House said in a statement.

Headlines: Brookfield in talks to acquire stake in Kushner-owned Manhattan tower: source
Description: Brookfield Property Partners is in talks to acquire a stake in a Manhattan office tower majority-owned by a company that was previously run by Jared Kushner, son-in-law of U.S. President Donald Trump, a source familiar with a potential deal said on Thursday.

Headlines: Kroger inks Ocado grocery delivery deal to battle Amazon threat
Description: U.S. supermarket chain Kroger Co struck a deal with British online grocer Ocado to ratchet up its delivery business with the construction of robotically operated warehouses, upping the ante in the battle with Amazon.com Inc and sending Ocado shares rocketing.

Headlines: U.S. 10-year bond yield rises higher, oil tops $80
Description: Yields on benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasuries rose on Thursday to their highest level in about seven years, extending this week's bond market selloff and pushing the U.S. dollar to a four-month peak against the yen.

Headlines: As oil rises, warnings emerge from U.S. retailers
Description: Worries about rising oil prices have begun to creep into U.S. retailers' earnings calls, and investors are raising concerns that those costs may slow discretionary spending among Americans and push down the performance of the retailers' shares.

Headlines: Silicon Valley startup peddles 3D-printed bike
Description: After a career that included helping Alphabet Inc's Google build out data centers and speeding packages for Amazon.com Inc to customers, Jim Miller is doing what many Silicon Valley executives do after stints at big companies: finding more time to ride his bike.

Headlines: British government offers $18 billion to Hitachi's UK nuclear project: Kyodo
Description: The British government has offered 2 trillion yen ($18 billion)in financial support to a unit of Japan's Hitachi Ltd to build nuclear reactors in Wales, Kyodo News reported on Thursday.

Headlines: CBS board approves special dividend, decision subject to court approval
Description: CBS Corp said on Thursday its board had approved a special dividend that would dilute controlling shareholder Shari Redstone's stake in the U.S. media company to about 20 percent if the move is approved by a Delaware court.

Headlines: U.S. President Donald Trump meets China's Liu He: CCTV
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He, who is leading a trade delegation in Washington, has met U.S. President Donald Trump, state broadcaster China Central Television said on Friday.

Headlines: North American pipeline operators restructure after tax change
Description: Pipeline operators Enbridge Inc , Williams Cos and Cheniere Energy Inc said on Thursday they would restructure after a U.S. rule change removed a key tax benefit for publicly traded partnerships controlled by those companies.

Headlines: SAP's CEO hints to investors more margin gains on the way
Description: The chief executive of SAP struck a confident note on the German software giant's future on Thursday, hinting that further operating profit margin gains were on the way, while apologizing for corporate governance missteps in South Africa.

Headlines: At Germany's SAP, employee mindfulness leads to higher profits
Description: BERLIN - Peter Bostelmann, an industrial engineer at Europe's technology giant SAP, discovered meditation during a personal crisis a decade ago.

Headlines: Factbox: Bookmakers spell out impact of new UK gambling curbs
Description: The British government on Thursday confirmed it will cut the maximum stake on fixed-odds betting terminals (FOBTs) to two pounds from 100 pounds, in a move designed to tackle problem gambling.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp, Voestalpine subsidiaries seek U.S. tariff exemptions
Description: U.S. subsidiaries of European steelmakers Thyssenkrupp and Voestalpine have applied for exemptions from looming import tariffs in the United States, according to company comments and public filings.

Headlines: Factbox: Vivendi's 5 billion euro bet on Italy
Description: French media group Vivendi has invested over 5 billion euros ($5.9 billion) in Italy over the past three years as part of tycoon Vincent Bollore's stated ambition to build a southern European media powerhouse.

Headlines: Egypt's Banque Misr hires Citi for $500 million loan: sources
Description: Banque Misr, Egypt’s second largest bank, has mandated Citigroup to arrange a $500 million syndicated loan, banking sources said, the latest sign of a pick-up in interest among international banks in lending to Egyptian borrowers.

Headlines: Rosneft says South China Sea drilling is within Vietnam waters
Description: Drilling in the South China Sea by Rosneft is within Vietnamese territorial waters, the Russian state oil firm said in a statement on Thursday, two days after its Vietnamese subsidiary began drilling in Vietnamese waters claimed by China.

Headlines: SAP goal remains to triple market cap, but gives no timeframe
Description: SAP, Germany's most valuable public company, remains committed to tripling its market capitalization, but Chief Executive Bill McDermott declined to specify a timeframe on Thursday.

Headlines: Takeda CEO prescribes surgical R&D cuts after $62 billion Shire deal
Description: For Christophe Weber, the boss of Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical , securing a $62 billion deal last week to buy drugmaker Shire at the fifth time of asking was the easy bit.

Headlines: China says no one can carry out oil, gas activities in Chinese waters without Beijing's permission
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Thursday that no country, organization, company or individual can carry out oil and gas exploration or exploitation in Chinese waters without permission from Beijing.

Headlines: Exclusive: RBS lawyers ask ex-staffer to destroy documents, DOJ informed
Description: Lawyers for Royal Bank of Scotland asked an ex-employee to destroy confidential documents, according to a letter seen by Reuters, in a move which the former staffer's lawyer said put him at risk of legal action by the U.S. government.

Headlines: Exclusive: Intel's Mobileye gets self-driving tech deal for 8 million cars
Description: Mobileye, Intel Corp's Israel-based autonomous driving unit, has signed a contract to supply eight million cars at a European automaker with its self-driving technologies, a company official told Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: As Rosneft's Vietnam unit drills in disputed area of South China Sea, Beijing issues warning
Description: Rosneft Vietnam BV, a unit of Russian state oil firm Rosneft, is concerned that its recent drilling in an area of the South China Sea that is claimed by China could upset Beijing, two sources with direct knowledge of the situation told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ex-Barclays trader tells court being a bank VP is like working at McDonald's
Description: A former Barclays trader on trial in London on charges he conspired to rig Euribor interest rates said on Thursday he was no more senior at the bank than people who served burgers at fast-food chain McDonald's.

Headlines: Maersk latest company to shun Iran as EU scrambles to save nuclear deal
Description: Shipping group A.P. Moller-Maersk on Thursday joined a growing list of companies preparing to call a halt to doing business with Iran, casting doubts on whether European leaders can keep alive a nuclear deal with Tehran.

Headlines: Volkswagen's biggest brand to by-pass Paris auto show
Description: Volkswagen will not display its core brand at the Paris motor show this year, the latest and most prominent carmaker to swerve the biennial industry gathering.

Headlines: In Silicon Valley, Chinese 'accelerators' aim to bring startups home
Description: Beijing's unslakeable thirst for the latest technology has spurred a proliferation of "accelerators" in Silicon Valley that aim to identify promising startups and bring them to China.

Headlines: Vietnam says conducts maritime oil operations under international law
Description: Vietnam's maritime oil and gas operations are in accordance with international law and conducted in waters in which it has total sovereignty, the country's foreign ministry said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: Vivendi under pressure to float music 'jewel' to offset Italian problems
Description: Vivendi investors are eager for an update on plans for a possible listing of its music business on Thursday, hoping that could bolster the French media group's value after several setbacks in Italy.

Headlines: Britain cuts top stake on gambling machines on addiction fears
Description: Britain will cut the maximum stake on fixed-odds betting terminals to just two pounds after the government opted to try to tackle problem gambling and rejected claims that such a big reduction could cost thousands of jobs.

Headlines: China does not want to see escalation in Sino-U.S. trade tension
Description: China does not want to see escalation in Sino-U.S. trade tensions, its commerce ministry said on Thursday, expressing hope that the two sides could minimize conflict during talks being held in the United States.

Headlines: No time frame for UK's cut in gambling machine stakes: minister
Description: The British government has not set an exact timetable for implementing a decision to slash the maximum stake on fixed odds betting terminals to 2 pounds from the current 100 pounds, the minister responsible for the sector said on Thursday.

Headlines: Cramer fears Fed raising rates too quickly will halt a 'red hot' economy
Description: Jim Cramer worries the Fed could raise rates fast than expected after the release of U.S. jobless claims data on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street wobbles as trade concerns loom, U.S. yields retreat
Description: Wall Street's benchmark S&P 500 stock index dipped on Friday on persistent trade concerns, while U.S. 10-year Treasury yields declined from a near seven-year peak after a burst higher this week.

Headlines: U.S. companies seen investing more in business this year after tax cuts
Description: U.S. companies could plow more of the money saved from sweeping tax cuts into business investment later this year, perhaps even surpassing a jump in first-quarter capital expenditure that was the highest in almost seven years, strategists and analysts said.

Headlines: Engie says to end engineering contracts in Iran by November
Description: French gas and power group Engie said on Friday it would end its engineering contracts in Iran by November.

Headlines: Uber files appeal against licence loss in UK city of Brighton
Description: Uber [UBER.UL] submitted an appeal on Friday against the decision by the southern coastal English city of Brighton to strip the taxi app of its licence for not being "fit and proper" over data concerns and the use of drivers from outside the area.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz to make Tesla-rivalling electric compact car
Description: Daimler will invest 500 million euros ($589 million) in Hambach, France, to start producing a small compact electric Mercedes-Benz in addition to its electric cars currently manufactured there for the Smart brand.

Headlines: Engie CEO says will work closely with new chairman
Description: Engie chief executive Isabelle Kocher said she would work closely with new board chairman Jean-Pierre Clamadieu, who formally takes up his position on Friday.

Headlines: Blackstone to end its stay at Hilton after 11 years
Description: After holding an interest in Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc for nearly 11 years, private equity firm Blackstone Group LP has decided to exit the hotel chain operator by selling its about 5.8 percent stake.

Headlines: IKEA pushes into South America with partner Falabella
Description: IKEA [IKEA.UL] will open its first stores in South America under a franchise agreement with Chilean retailer Falabella , as the world's biggest furniture retailer looks for new growth markets to keep challengers at bay.

Headlines: Beijing official says Qualcomm-NXP deal looking more optimistic: WSJ
Description: Qualcomm Inc's $44 billion deal to buy Dutch chipmaker NXP Semiconductors NV is looking "more optimistic now", the Wall Street Journal quoted a Beijing official as saying.

Headlines: Boeing's foldable wingtip for new 777s gets approval
Description: Boeing Co on Friday won approval from the U.S. regulator Federal Aviation Administration for the company's new foldable wingtips for its latest 777 jets.

Headlines: Trump economic adviser Kudlow says China 'meeting many of our demands' on trade
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday that China is "meeting many of our demands" on reducing its trade surplus with the United States but that no deal had emerged yet.

Headlines: Trump urged U.S. Postal Service to double package rates for Amazon: Washington Post
Description: President Donald Trump has personally pushed the postmaster general to double the rates the U.S. Postal Service charges Amazon.com and other companies to ship packages, the Washington Post reported on Friday, citing three unnamed sources.

Headlines: Trump's bonfire of the treaties sweeps towards the WTO
Description: President Donald Trump has the World Trade Organization in a chokehold, and the United States has made clear what he wants: no more judicial rulings that interpret WTO rules to Washington's disadvantage.

Headlines: Paddy Power Betfair welcomes UK decision, says preparing for U.S. expansion
Description: Paddy Power Betfair welcomed the British government’s decision to reduce the maximum stake on fixed odds betting terminals to two pounds as the issue had become a lightning rod for the industry, CEO Peter Jackson said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: BP chief sees shale, OPEC cooling oil markets
Description: BP Chief Executive Bob Dudley expects a flood of U.S. shale and the reopening of OPEC taps to cool the oil market after crude rose above $80 a barrel this week.

Headlines: U.S. bank stock gains may stall after two-year rally
Description: After two years of sharp gains for U.S. bank stocks, investors betting on another big boost for 2018 may be disappointed unless loan growth accelerates or regulations slacken considerably.

Headlines: China says has not offered to cut U.S. trade surplus by $200 billion
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday it was not true that the country had offered to cut its trade surplus with the United States by $200 billion.

Headlines: Berenberg downgrades Telecom Italia, citing 'toxic cocktail'
Description: Telecom Italia (TIM) shares fell on Friday after Berenberg downgraded Italy's biggest phone group to "sell" from "hold", citing pressure from pending new competition, political headwinds and governance issues.

Headlines: Thai snails kept 'happy' and healthy for their cosmetic slime
Description: Giant African snails endemic to Thailand are getting the red carpet treatment to keep them producing top-notch slime, say farmers harvesting the mucus for use in cosmetics.

Headlines: Porsche to recall 60,000 SUVs for emissions problems: German regulator
Description: Volkswagen's sports-car brand Porsche has been asked by Germany's KBA automotive regulator to recall around 60,000 diesel-engined Macan and Cayenne sport-utility vehicles, a KBA spokesman said.

Headlines: Chinese bank staff offered dinner and photos with Trump for $150,000
Description: A Chinese bank said on Friday it was tightening up its management after some staff were caught offering elite clients the chance to attend a dinner with U.S. President Donald Trump, and get their pictures snapped with him, for $150,000.

Headlines: Exclusive: Toyota plans to roll into China's EV market in GAC Motor vehicle
Description: Toyota Motor Corp is taking an unprecedented route to meet China's stringent green car quotas: its showrooms will sell an electric vehicle without the Japanese company's distinctive triple-oval logo.

Headlines: Vietnam launches in-depth probe into Grab-Uber deal in Southeast Asia
Description: Vietnam's Ministry of Industry and Trade said on Friday it had launched an in-depth investigation into ride-hailing company Grab's takeover of Uber Technologies' Southeast Asia business after an initial probe found it might breach antitrust law.

Headlines: Top executive behind Baidu's artificial intelligence drive stepping down
Description: Lu Qi, who oversaw Baidu Inc's shift to artificial intelligence (AI) after a damaging ad scandal in 2016, is stepping down as chief operating officer, China's biggest search engine said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. gun lobby takes aim at 'gun-hating' banks Citi, BofA
Description: The U.S. gun lobby is taking aim at "gun-hating" banks after Citigroup Inc and Bank of America said they would no longer provide certain banking services to gun-makers, according to industry lobbyists.

Headlines: Wall Street's 'Sell in May' could be fading away
Description: "Sell in May and go away," arguably the most well-worn axiom on Wall Street, has proven to be shrewd advice during previous midterm election years.

Headlines: Exclusive: GE nears deal to merge transportation unit with Wabtec - sources
Description: General Electric Co is nearing a deal to merge its transportation business, which manufactures train engines, with Wabtec Corp , a U.S. maker of equipment for the rail industry, two people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Don't neglect to pay the middleman: How Shell and Eni ended up on trial
Description: Seven years ago, two middlemen launched civil lawsuits to seek payment for helping arrange a $1.3 billion oil deal in Nigeria.

Headlines: Australia's Santos gets final sweetened $10.8 billion bid from Harbour Energy
Description: U.S.-based Harbour Energy made a final offer of $10.8 billion for Australia's Santos Ltd on Monday, hiking its bid for a fifth time in nine months after a steep rise in oil prices and potentially deterring any rival bids.

Headlines: Exclusive: BP back on its feet but CEO senses no respite
Description: After the near collapse of his company following the 2010 Gulf of Mexico disaster and a three-year slump in oil prices, BP Chief Executive Officer Bob Dudley is hardly relaxed.

Headlines: Boeing technicians in South Carolina to vote on unionization: WSJ
Description: Some Boeing Co workers at the planemaker' s factory in South Carolina will vote on union representation later this month, the Wall Street Journal reported https://on.wsj.com/2xav6Px on Monday, citing U.S. labor regulators.

Headlines: Exclusive: Ousted MGM CEO explores bid for the U.S. movie studio - sources
Description: Former MGM Holdings Inc Chief Executive Officer Gary Barber, who was ousted earlier this year, is speaking to investment banks about financing an offer to acquire the privately held U.S. movie studio, five people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. and Canadian regulators open probes into cryptocurrency scams
Description: U.S. and Canadian state securities regulators announced Monday they have launched dozens of investigations into cryptocurrency scams.

Headlines: Rising oil prices help ground U.S. airline stocks; could make them cheap
Description: Shares of U.S. airlines have been depressed by rising oil prices this year, but their descent to relatively cheap levels could position them for takeoff.

Headlines: GE to merge transportation unit with Wabtec in $11.1 billion deal
Description: General Electric Co announced a $11.1 billion deal on Monday to merge its transportation business with U.S. rail equipment manufacturer Wabtec Corp , with GE and its shareholders owning just over half of the combined business.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury says updates Trump on Chinese investment concerns
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin has given President Donald Trump an update on Treasury's efforts to address concerns about Chinese investments in the United States, a Treasury spokeswoman said on Monday.

Headlines: Fifth Third Bancorp pays $4.7 billion for MB Financial's Chicago muscle
Description: U.S. regional bank Fifth Third Bancorp has agreed to buy smaller rival MB Financial Inc in a stock-and-cash deal valued at about $4.7 billion, as it looks to expand in Chicago and broaden its middle market customer base.

Headlines: Tesla Model 3 fails to get Consumer Reports nod due to 'big flaws'
Description: Influential U.S. magazine Consumer Reports will not recommend Tesla Inc's Model 3 sedan, saying on Monday it braked slower than a full-sized pickup truck, taking the shine off a day of gains for shares in Elon Musk's electric car company.

Headlines: China says it does not want trade tensions with U.S.
Description: China does not want trade tensions with the United States, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said on Monday after the world's largest economies agreed to drop their tariff threats while they work on a wider trade agreement.

Headlines: PayPal expands retail payments with $2.2 billion Zettle buy
Description: PayPal Holdings Inc has agreed to buy Swedish financial technology startup iZettle for $2.2 billion in the U.S. online payments provider's biggest ever acquisition.

Headlines: Rusal says Deripaska has not formally resigned; reiterates sanctions may hit business
Description: Russia's largest aluminum producer Rusal said on Monday it has not received a formal resignation from director Oleg Deripaska, and reiterated that its business and prospects may be affected by U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: J.C. Penney CEO Ellison jumps ship to Lowe's; shares sink
Description: J.C. Penney's Chief Executive Officer Marvin Ellison is leaving the struggling retailer to join home improvement chain Lowe's Cos Inc , the companies said on Tuesday, sending shares in the U.S. department store chain down as much as 8 percent to an all-time low.

Headlines: Treasury chief says any ZTE penalty changes won't hurt security
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Tuesday that any changes to stiff Commerce Department penalties on Chinese telecommunications equipment maker ZTE Corp will ensure that U.S. national security is maintained and sanctions are enforced.

Headlines: Americans report stronger finances in Trump's first year: Federal Reserve
Description: The share of Americans who report they are doing "at least okay" financially rose in President Donald Trump's first year in office, according to Federal Reserve data published on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: GE seeking to shed troubled insurance business - sources
Description: General Electric Co is working with investment bankers to find ways to shed its insurance business, which has caused it to book hefty charges while sparking shareholder lawsuits and an investigation by U.S. regulators, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: In bipartisan effort, two U.S. lawmakers ask Trump to be tough on ZTE
Description: Two U.S. lawmakers, including the Republican chairman of a powerful House of Representatives committee, asked President Donald Trump on Tuesday not to lift penalties on Chinese telecommunications company ZTE Corp .

Headlines: Civil rights groups warn Amazon about govt use of facial recognition
Description: U.S. civil liberties groups on Tuesday called on Amazon.com Inc to stop offering facial recognition services to governments, warning that the software could be used to target immigrants and people of color unfairly.

Headlines: Wall St. dips on latest U.S.-China comments, European shares rally
Description: Global stock markets tipped downward on Tuesday as Wall Street investors locked in recent gains while taking a cautious view of fresh U.S.-China comments even as European shares approached four-month peaks and China moved to further open up its economy.

Headlines: OPEC may decide to ease oil supply curbs in June: sources
Description: OPEC may decide to raise oil output as soon as June due to worries over Iranian and Venezuelan supply and after Washington raised concerns the oil rally was going too far, OPEC and oil industry sources familiar with the discussions told Reuters.

Headlines: EU doubts if offer can prevent Trump tariffs or steel caps
Description: European Union proposals to open its markets wider to U.S. products, including cars, appear not to have persuaded Washington to lift the threat of import tariffs on EU steel and aluminium, the bloc's trade chief said on Tuesday.

Headlines: EU's Malmstrom says thinks U.S. considers EU trade proposal insufficient
Description: A proposal to get exemption from U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum and promises of closer trade ties may not be sufficient to convince the United States government, EU trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmstrom said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Markets are failing to appreciate how much further earnings have to grow, asset manager says
Description: The U.S. may be close to the peak of its earnings cycle, but earnings still have room to climb, according to asset manager NN Investment Partners

Headlines: 'I am worried about NAFTA,' says CEO of major US railroad serving Mexico and Canada
Description: Jim Cramer gets Union Pacific Chairman and CEO Lance Fritz's take on trade and the Trump administration's NAFTA talks.

Headlines: As Zuckerberg heads to Brussels, British lawmakers ask for answers
Description: British lawmakers want their European counterparts to quiz Facebook FB.O CEO Mark Zuckerberg about a scandal over improper use of millions of Facebook users' data, as he will not give evidence in London himself.

Headlines: Rio Tinto presses Mongolia to shore up copper investment
Description: Rio Tinto on Tuesday called on the Mongolian government to honor the contracts that underpin its Oyu Tolgoi copper project and said the mining world was watching, as anxiety mounts after a series of high-profile arrests.

Headlines: Trump administration weighs new tariffs on imported vehicles: WSJ
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration is weighing a plan that would impose new tariffs on imported vehicles on national security grounds, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: GE cannot guarantee dividend, still fixing some units, CEO says
Description: General Electric Co cannot guarantee its 2019 dividend and is still fixing its power and capital units, Chief Executive John Flannery said on Wednesday, sending the industrial conglomerate's stock down nearly 8 percent.

Headlines: UPS hits customers with new fees for oversized packages
Description: United Parcel Service Inc will begin charging an extra $150 next month to handle oversized packages and pallets, along with a new charge for packages with mislabeled dimensions, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Macron tells global tech CEOs: 'There is no free lunch'
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron told executives from the world's biggest technology firms that he believed in innovation but that he wanted tougher regulations and for them to contribute more to society.

Headlines: Trump mulling probe of auto imports on national security grounds
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is considering launching a trade investigation of auto imports on national security grounds, a senior Trump administration official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. Senate panel to hold hearing on Sprint T-Mobile merger
Description: A U.S. Senate committee plans to hold a hearing on June 27 on the proposed $26.5 billion merger of U.S. wireless carriers T-Mobile US and Sprint Corp .

Headlines: Starbucks calls anti-bias training part of 'long-term journey'
Description: Starbucks Corp on Wednesday revealed details of the employee anti-bias training program that will take place behind closed doors at 8,000 U.S. company-owned cafes on the afternoon of May 29.

Headlines: Wall Street dominance over Europe's struggling banks hits record
Description: Wall Street's dominance over struggling European banks has reached record levels as U.S. firms reap the benefits of booming markets at home, while their transatlantic rivals are trapped in endless restructurings, data showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall St. ends up as Fed seen keeping gradual approach to rate hikes
Description: U.S. stocks ended with small gains on Wednesday after minutes from the Federal Reserve's latest meeting suggested higher inflation may not result in faster interest rate hikes.

Headlines: Facebook users unite! 'Data Labour Union' launches in Netherlands
Description: Activists in Amsterdam on Wednesday launched the 'Datavakbond' or "data labor union", which hopes to elect leaders to negotiate directly with Facebook and Google over what they do with users' data.

Headlines: UK's Vedanta core profit, revenue beat; says working to restart Indian plant
Description: British mining and energy conglomerate Vedanta Resources Plc reported better-than-expected growth in full-year core profit and revenue on Wednesday, driven by stronger commodity prices.

Headlines: India court halts expansion of Vedanta's copper smelter after protest killings
Description: One person died and others were wounded by gunfire in southern India on Wednesday in fresh violence related to protesters' demands that a copper smelter be shut on environmental grounds. The day before at least ten people were killed by police during a mass demonstration against the plant.

Headlines: France's rail unions say workers overwhelmingly vote against reforms
Description: France's hardline CGT union on Wednesday said 95 percent of all rail workers who voted in an internal referendum on President Emmanuel Macron's proposed reform of the SNCF voted against the plan.

Headlines: Staff reject Macron rail reform in 'referendum', unions say
Description: Workers at France's state-owned SNCF rail company on Wednesday resoundingly rejected President Emmanuel Macron's planned overhaul of the railways in an internal ballot organized by labor unions.

Headlines: IBM announces new hiring in France as CEOs meet Macron
Description: IBM announced new recruitment in France before a meeting between President Emmanuel Macron and the bosses of IBM and Microsoft .

Headlines: Uber widens health cover in Europe as new CEO meets France's Macron
Description: Uber plans to offer all its European drivers an upgraded version of the health insurance it already provides in France in a drive to attract independent workers and fend off criticism over their treatment.

Headlines: German cabinet agrees compensation for utilities due to nuclear exit
Description: Chancellor Angela Merkel's cabinet agreed on Wednesday to grant compensation of up to 1 billion euros to utilities for income lost due to Germany's planned phasing out of nuclear power, the environment ministry said.

Headlines: Pompeo says no final decision made yet on China's ZTE
Description: No decision has been made by the Trump administration over removing a ban on Chinese telecoms firm ZTE Corp, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday during congressional testimony.

Headlines: Trump floats management changes instead of sanctions for China's ZTE
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday floated a plan to fine ZTE Corp and shake up its management as his administration considered rolling back more severe penalties that have crippled the Chinese telecommunications company.

Headlines: Alitalia nationalisation would be tricky, sale process must go on: minister
Description: Italy should not push to nationalise insolvent airline Alitalia and the government should not drop the sale process that already attracted interest from other carriers, Industry Minister Carlo Calenda said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Consumer groups ask U.S. agency to probe Tesla 'Autopilot' ads
Description: Two U.S. consumer advocacy groups urged the Federal Trade Commission on Wednesday to investigate what they called Tesla Inc's "deceptive and misleading" use of the name Autopilot for its assisted-driving technology.

Headlines: Tight supply weighs on U.S. home sales; job market strengthening
Description: U.S. home sales tumbled in April as an acute shortage of properties limited choices for potential buyers, the latest sign that the housing market was struggling to regain momentum.

Headlines: U.S. auto import probe fans tariff fears, riles Asia, Europe
Description: A U.S. threat that it may introduce tariffs on foreign auto imports drew strong criticism on Thursday from the country's main business lobbying group, which warned of a "staggering" blow to the industry and the prospect of a global trade war.

Headlines: Sanctions-hit tycoon Deripaska asks Kremlin to buy some of his aluminium: source
Description: Russian aluminium producer Rusal has asked the Russian government to purchase some of its output, a government source said on Thursday, in an effort to alleviate the pain inflicted by U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: German regulator orders recall of Daimler diesel van
Description: Germany's road vehicle authority ordered Daimler on Thursday to recall its Mercedes van model Vito 1.6l Diesel Euro 6, saying engine control features to reduce exhaust emissions were in breach of regulations.

Headlines: Car imports probe gives GM, Ford shares tiny lift
Description: Shares of General Motors and Ford inched only marginally higher before the bell on Thursday after the Trump administration launched a national security probe into car imports which could lead to new tariffs on foreign competitors while also stirring trade tensions.

Headlines: Factbox: Big U.S. auto dealers have significant import exposure
Description: Several U.S. auto dealers derive a significant portion of their revenue from imported vehicles, which could be affected if tariffs are imposed on auto imports.

Headlines: U.S. launches auto import probe, China says will defend interests
Description: The Trump administration has launched a national security investigation into car and truck imports that could lead to new U.S. tariffs similar to those imposed on imported steel and aluminum in March.

Headlines: Nixed U.S.-North Korea meeting, trade fears sink global shares
Description: Shares sank worldwide on Thursday as U.S. President Donald Trump canceled a planned June meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, while tariff fears hit auto stocks and safety buying ramped up.

Headlines: Pfizer to pay $23.85 million to settle U.S. co-payment kickback probe
Description: Pfizer Inc agreed to pay $23.85 million to resolve U.S. charges that it used a purportedly independent charity to pay illegal kickbacks to Medicare patients, covering their out-of-pocket costs for its prescription drugs.

Headlines: Google tries to ease tensions on eve of new EU privacy law
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google sought to ease online publisher concerns on Thursday about the effects European data privacy rules going into effect in just a few hours will have on their ad business.

Headlines: Facebook launches searchable archive of U.S. political ads
Description: Facebook Inc on Thursday launched an archive of U.S. political ads that appear on the world's largest social network, showing who paid for them and other details, after an outcry over Russians' alleged purchase of such ads during the 2016 elections.

Headlines: China says has not promised to cut trade surplus with U.S. by a certain amount
Description: China's Commerce Ministry said on Thursday that it had not pledged to cut the country's trade surplus with the United States by a certain figure, and hopes the United States implements measures promised during trade negotiations as soon as possible.

Headlines: Trump urges a new 'structure' for U.S.-China trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has signaled a new direction in U.S.-China trade talks and said any deal would need "a different structure," fueling uncertainty over current negotiations.

Headlines: Deadly protests land a blow to Indian resources magnate Agarwal's ambitions
Description: Indian billionaire Anil Agarwal often talks about his dream to turn his London-listed company Vedanta Resources into a global resources giant. He has already bought stakes in big mining companies, such as Anglo American Plc, and says he plans to spend at least $1 billion on investments in Africa.

Headlines: EU parliament gets Facebook answers after Zuckerberg meeting
Description: The European Parliament distributed on Thursday what it called a first set of written replies from Facebook to oral questions put by lawmakers to CEO Mark Zuckerberg at a meeting in Brussels on Tuesday.

Headlines: General Electric's power unit fights for growth as wind, solar gain
Description: Vistra Energy Corp and Dominion Energy Inc – which serve about 5.5 million electricity customers in more than a dozen U.S. states – both say they are done building combined-cycle natural gas-fired power plants.

Headlines: U.S. could seek American compliance officers at ZTE: Ross
Description: The United States has not made a final decision on changes to its ban on ZTE Corp , but any alternative remedy could include installing U.S. compliance officers at the Chinese telecoms company, Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Thursday.

Headlines: Procter & Gamble commits to Russia despite rising risks
Description: U.S. consumer goods group Procter & Gamble (P&G) will keep investing in Russian plants in 2018 and beyond, reaffirming its commitment to the market despite political risks.

Headlines: Wall Street dips after Trump cancels North Korea summit; Netflix gains
Description: U.S. stocks ended down slightly on Thursday after President Donald Trump canceled a planned summit with North Korea's Kim Jong Un and threatened to impose tariffs on auto imports, though losses were limited by gains in Netflix and General Electric.

Headlines: LafargeHolcim to close Paris, Zurich head offices, axing 200 jobs
Description: LafargeHolcim , the world's largest cement maker, will close its head offices in Paris and Zurich, eliminating 200 jobs as part of a cost-cutting drive.

Headlines: Siemens backs Northvolt's $5 billion Swedish battery plant
Description: Siemens has become the latest company to contribute to the Northvolt project to build Europe's largest lithium-ion factory in northern Sweden.

Headlines: U.S. reaches deal to keep China's ZTE in business: congressional aide
Description: The Trump administration told lawmakers the U.S. government has reached a deal to put Chinese telecommunications company ZTE Corp back in business after it pays a significant fine and makes management changes, a senior congressional aide said on Friday.

Headlines: Oil prices slump as OPEC and Russia consider output boost
Description: Oil prices fell more than $2 per barrel on Friday as Saudi Arabia and Russia discussed easing production cuts that have helped push crude prices to their highest since 2014.

Headlines: T-Mobile says ex-Trump campaign manager advising on Sprint merger
Description: T-Mobile US said it is getting advice on its proposed $26 billion merger with Sprint Corp from a lobbying firm whose staff includes several members of President Donald Trump's election team such as former campaign manager Corey Lewandowski.

Headlines: Meghan Markle makes gold sales sparkle
Description: The Meghan Markle effect has spread to yellow gold jewelry, helping boost United States sales in the first quarter of 2018 with further gains expected, jewelers said.

Headlines: Oil price fall hits energy shares, dollar rises
Description: Growing expectations of increased oil supply hit crude prices on Friday, lifting the U.S. dollar and weighing on energy shares, while political upheaval in Europe and uncertainty over a U.S.-North Korea summit restrained equity markets.

Headlines: Tesla hires new chief financial officer for China
Description: Tesla Inc on Friday announced a number of key executive hires including former GE and General Motors executive James Zhou as its China CFO and Neeraj Manrao, a former Apple executive, as director of energy manufacturing.

Headlines: U.S. jury awards Apple $539 million in Samsung patent retrial
Description: After nearly five days of deliberations, a U.S. jury on Thursday said Samsung Electronics Co Ltd should pay $539 million to Apple Inc for copying patented smartphone features, according to court documents, bringing a years-long feud between the technology companies into its final stages.

Headlines: Saudi minister Falih says Aramco IPO likely in 2019
Description: Saudi Arabia is most likely to hold the initial public offering (IPO) of oil giant Aramco in 2019, Energy Minister Khalid al-Falih said on Friday, confirming a delay from the initial plan to list the company this year.

Headlines: Bayer cuts Monsanto synergy target by $300 million due to divestments
Description: Bayer said positive synergy effects from the planned takeover of U.S. seeds maker Monsanto would be about $300 million below its previous target because it will sell more businesses than initially expected to get antitrust approval.

Headlines: Tax-dodge strategists probe loopholes in new U.S. law, IRS wary
Description: Tax experts for global corporations are hot on the trail of loopholes in the sweeping tax law approved in December by President Donald Trump and Republicans in the U.S. Congress.

Headlines: Leonardo shares rise on Canada helicopter fleet plans
Description: Shares in Italian aerospace and defense group Leonardo jumped on Friday after Canada said it planned to work with the company to refurbish its fleet of search-and-rescue (SAR) helicopters.

Headlines: Miner Grupo Mexico blames freight train derailments on 'sabotage'
Description: Mexican miner and infrastructure firm Grupo Mexico on Friday said in a statement that seven freight train derailments were due to "sabotage" and would cost the company 312 million pesos ($16 million).

Headlines: Trump metals tariffs make Granite City great again, but at what cost?
Description: After Donald Trump was elected president in 2016 on a pledge to "Make America Great Again" and revive the country's old industrial heartland, Dave Chrusciel hoped someday to return to his previous job at the steel mill here in this southern corner of Illinois.

Headlines: Australia increases Takata air bags recall to just under four million cars
Description: Australia said on Monday it was recalling an additional 1.1 million cars fitted with Takata Corp air bags, increasing the size of the country's biggest ever compulsory recall to just under four million cars.

Headlines: Qualcomm to meet China regulators in push to clear $44 billion NXP deal: sources
Description: Qualcomm Inc is expecting to meet this week in Beijing with China's antitrust regulators in a final push to secure clearance for its proposed $44 billion acquisition of NXP Semiconductors NV , three sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Cyclone shuts Sembcorp Salalah water production plant
