Description: Sembcorp Salalah Water and Power Co , which operates an electricity generation and seawater desalination plant in Oman, said its water production plant had been temporarily shut down because of rough seas as a result of a tropical storm.

Headlines: French industrialist Serge Dassault dies at 93
Description: French billionaire industrialist Serge Dassault, whose group builds the Rafale war planes and owns Le Figaro newspaper, died in Paris on Monday aged 93, a spokesman for Dassault Group said.

Headlines: Germany grills Daimler boss over extent of Vito van emissions fix
Description: Germany's Transport Ministry quizzed Daimler Chief Executive Dieter Zetsche on Monday over how many Mercedes-Benz vans and cars need to be fixed after a regulator said it had found illegal software in one of its models.

Headlines: Italian concerns knock stocks, euro off early highs
Description: European stocks gave up early gains and bond yields recovered from lows as early elections loomed in Italy after the anti-establishment 5-Star and League parties abandoned plans to form a government.

Headlines: China's Anbang says investor selection work under way
Description: China's Anbang Insurance Group [ANBANG.UL] said on Monday that the selection process for a strategic shareholder has begun, reiterating that it has ample cashflow and is operating normally after its state-backed bailout.

Headlines: Blackstone bets big on Australian offices with $2.3 billion Investa bid
Description: U.S. private equity giant Blackstone Group is seeking to deepen its exposure to Australian commercial property with a A$3.08 billion ($2.3 billion) bid for Sydney-focused company Investa Office Fund (IOF) .

Headlines: Singapore Exchange postpones launch of Indian derivatives products
Description: The Singapore Exchange (SGX) has postponed the launch of a set of India derivatives products after an Indian court on Tuesday referred a dispute around the proposed offerings to an arbitrator.

Headlines: Canada pension funds may be long-term buyers of Kinder pipeline
Description: Canada's biggest public pension funds could be long-term buyers of Kinder Morgan Canada Ltd's Trans Mountain pipeline but are unlikely to invest until the C$7.4 billion ($5.7 billion) project has been built, several pension fund sources said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Coca-Cola Co to increase investments in Argentina
Description: Coca-Cola Co said on Tuesday it would increase its investments in Argentina over the next three years, giving embattled President Mauricio Macri's government a boost at a difficult time.

Headlines: Canada to buy Kinder Morgan oil pipeline in bid to save project
Description: Canada will buy Kinder Morgan Canada Ltd's Trans Mountain pipeline for C$4.5 billion ($3.5 billion), the government said on Tuesday, hoping to save a project that faces formidable political and environmental opposition.

Headlines: Worsening Italian crisis batters stock markets
Description: A spiraling Italian political crisis provoked a global stock market sell-off on Tuesday, cut the euro to a 10-month low and spiked borrowing costs for the government in Rome.

Headlines: U.S. sets public hearings on auto import tariff probe
Description: Less than a week after the Trump administration threatened to impose tariffs of up to 25 percent on foreign-built automobiles, the U.S. government on Tuesday said it would hold public hearings on whether the import of vehicles and auto parts represents national security risks.

Headlines: Delays and 'poison pills': team Trump runs out of road in NAFTA talks
Description: President Donald Trump is running out of time to deliver a revamp of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) he promised for this year and people involved in the talks say the crunch is largely of his administration's own making.

Headlines: In Portugal, trust in China is the art of the deal
Description: Utility company EDP may balk at the meager 5 percent premium offered for its shares by China Three Gorges (CT) but the battle for Portugal's biggest business has largely played out already.

Headlines: Swiss watch exports rise in April as Hong Kong booms
Description: Swiss watch exports rose 13.8 percent in April to 1.76 billion Swiss francs ($1.77 billion), powered by a boom in the crucial Hong Kong market, trade data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Not enough time for tech customs solution to Brexit: Aston Martin
Description: The boss of carmaker Aston Martin warned it was probably too late to roll out the kind of technology needed for the post-Brexit customs plan that is favoured by many British eurosceptics.

Headlines: China surprised at White House trade statement -ministry
Description: China expressed surprise on Tuesday at a White House statement that the United States will continue to pursue action on trade with Beijing, saying it was contrary to the consensus both sides reached recently.

Headlines: U.S. May auto sales expected to dip 1 percent: J.D. Power and LMC
Description: U.S. automobile sales are expected to decline 1 percent year-over-year in May, industry consultants J.D. Power and LMC Automotive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Canada likely to buy Trans Mountain pipeline project: Bloomberg
Description: Canada is likely to buy Kinder Morgan Canada Ltd's Trans Mountain oil pipeline and its proposed expansion project in an attempt to ensure that it is built, Bloomberg reported on Monday, citing a person familiar with the talks.

Headlines: U.S. first-quarter growth trimmed on weak consumer spending
Description: U.S. economic growth slowed slightly more than initially thought in the first quarter as consumer spending rose at its weakest pace in nearly five years, but activity is already picking up against the backdrop of a tightening labor market and tax cuts.

Headlines: Global stocks rebound as Italian risk ebbs
Description: Global stocks staged a recovery on Wednesday, buoyed by optimism that Italy may avoid a potentially damaging general election.

Headlines: Blackstone sees scope for Italian deals despite political strife
Description: Alternative asset manager Blackstone Group LP is still open to doing deals in Italy despite political turmoil in the euro zone country, President and Chief Operating Officer Jon Gray said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Consumer Reports recommends Tesla's Model 3 after braking fix
Description: Influential U.S. magazine Consumer Reports said on Wednesday it was recommending Tesla Inc's Model 3 sedan after its latest tests showed that a firmware update improved the car's braking distance by nearly 20 feet.

Headlines: China says reserves right to retaliate to U.S. actions against its investments
Description: The United States' measures against China's investments are against World Trade Organization rules, and China reserves the right to take countermeasures, the commerce ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: PVH CEO on China tariff threats: ‘Cooler heads will prevail’
Description: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer sits down with PVH CEO Manny Chirico to talk tariffs, China and the company's earnings results.

Headlines: Oil climbs over 2 percent, shrugs off API's U.S. crude build
Description: Oil prices surged on Wednesday, shrugging off an unexpected build in U.S. crude stockpiles and rebounding from a four-day slump as Russia's central bank expressed caution on plans to boost oil supply.

Headlines: Moncler aspires to give its puffer jackets a monthly makeover
Description: Italian label Moncler has already turned luxury fashion on its head by transforming casual skiwear into trendy items with its sleek puffer jackets.

Headlines: MSCI drops ZTE, four other companies from MSCI China A Inclusion Index
Description: Telecom equipment and smartphone maker ZTE Corp and four other companies have been dropped from several MSCI indexes including the MSCI China A Inclusion Index as trading in the China-listed A shares of all five companies has been suspended.

Headlines: Singapore Airlines to launch world's longest commercial flight in October
Description: Singapore Airlines Ltd said it would launch the world's longest commercial flight in October, a near-19 hour non-stop journey from Singapore to the New York area.

Headlines: India's e-commerce wars to be reshaped by private label brands
Description: For Lalit Bisht, buying Roadster jeans and T-shirts off Myntra, Flipkart's fashion operation, is a no brainer. It may take a week to deliver clothes to Bisht's small hometown in India's hilly northern Uttarakhand state, but the wait is worth it.

Headlines: Trump's auto tariff plan threatens GM's $7 billion South Korea rescue
Description: Fresh off a $7 billion rescue for its loss-making South Korean operation, General Motors faces a new threat as U.S. President Donald Trump considers higher vehicle import tariffs that could "make or break" its Asian subsidiary.

Headlines: China says does not want trade war but is not scared of one
Description: China's Foreign Ministry on Wednesday urged the United States to meet China halfway and said that it does not want trade war but is not scared of one.

Headlines: IMF official says trade frictions pose risk for China's economy
Description: Trade frictions pose a risk for China's economy, an official from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) said on Wednesday, when asked about the impact of the ongoing tensions with the United States.

Headlines: Bayer wins U.S. nod for Monsanto deal to create agriculture giant
Description: Bayer won U.S. approval for its planned takeover of Monsanto after agreeing to sell about $9 billion in assets, clearing a major hurdle for the $62.5 billion deal that will create by far the largest seeds and pesticides maker.

Headlines: AirAsia shares tumble as India probe threatens IPO plans
Description: AirAsia Group Bhd shares plunged on Wednesday after federal police in India filed a case against the airline accusing it of corruption - a probe that threatens to delay its India unit's IPO plans and international expansion.

Headlines: Trump's "muscle-flexing" with allies will cost US consumer, France says
Description: U.S. trade tariffs on European metals exports are unjustified and will be met with a proportionate and calibrated EU response, the French government said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Russia's Deripaska empire bets on mid-summer plan to escape U.S. sanctions
Description: The aluminium empire of Russian magnate Oleg Deripaska is in close contact with the U.S. Treasury, but needs until mid-summer to come up with a plan to meet U.S. requirements to escape sanctions, the chairman of its holding company told Reuters.

Headlines: The US is the hottest market for trading, analyst says
Description: Bessemer Trust's Rebecca Patterson says the U.S. is the best market for investing.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank's U.S. ops deemed "troubled" by Fed a year ago: WSJ
Description: The United States Federal Reserve last year designated Deutsche Bank AG's U.S. operations to be in "troubled condition", The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: SoftBank joins GM in self-driving car race; GM shares soar
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp will invest $2.25 billion in General Motors Co's autonomous vehicle unit Cruise, the companies said on Thursday, a deal that validates the venerable Detroit automaker's leadership in self-driving cars and sent GM shares up nearly 13 percent.

Headlines: Australian regulator says 'extensive' investigation behind looming charges against ANZ, Deutsche
Description: Australia's competition regulator said the criminal cartel charges it expects to lay against Deutsche Bank and Australia and New Zealand Banking Group over a 2015 ANZ share issue follow an "extensive investigation".

Headlines: Citigroup denies criminal cartel allegations expected in Australia
Description: Citigroup on Friday denied allegations of criminal cartel conduct expected to be laid by Australian prosecutors over its involvement in a $2.3 billion share issue it underwrote for Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd in 2015.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank says it will defend itself against cartel charges in Australia
Description: Deutsche Bank said on Friday it will defend itself against cartel charges expected to be laid in Australia over its involvement in a $2.3 billion share issue it underwrote for Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd in 2015.

Headlines: U.S. crude tumbles, widening Brent's premium to 3-year high
Description: U.S. oil fell nearly 2 percent on Thursday, despite a larger-than-expected decline in U.S. crude inventories, while global benchmark Brent was little changed, pushing the spread between the two to its widest in more than three years.

Headlines: Cramer: Steel producer Nucor the biggest winner on Trump tariffs, a ‘gift’ to investors
Description: US steelmaker Nucor is the biggest single beneficiary of President Donald Trump's tariffs, says "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer.

Headlines: German carmakers hit by report Trump threatens to drive them off U.S. streets
Description: A report that U.S. President Donald Trump has threatened to pursue German carmakers until there are no Mercedes-Benz rolling down New York's Fifth Avenue dented shares in the luxury car manufacturers on Thursday.

Headlines: India receives no bids for Air India stake sale
Description: The Indian government said it did not receive any expressions of interest in its planned Air India stake sale by the Thursday evening deadline, underlining the challenge it faces in fixing the debt-laden state carrier.

Headlines: France's Macron says U.S. tariffs are illegal and a mistake
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said a decision by the United States to impose tariffs on European metals exports is illegal and a mistake which could close the door on discussions about other issues.

Headlines: Exclusive: Late to teapot party, ExxonMobil breaks with tradition in wooing China's oil market
Description: ExxonMobil Corp's global oil marketing team stormed into China this week hoping to elbow aside rivals and gain access to the nation's "teapot" refining market, executives told Reuters.

Headlines: No signs of de-escalation in trade dispute with U.S.: Germany's Scholz
Description: There are no signs of a de-escalation in the trade dispute between Europe and the United States, German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said in a Reuters interview published on Thursday, adding the EU's response to any U.S. tariffs must be strong.

Headlines: Japan Tobacco to cut heated tobacco prices in battle with Philip Morris
Description: Japan Tobacco Inc is set to slash prices on its heated tobacco products early next week after a similar move by bigger rival Philip Morris International Inc , signaling increased competition in Japan's nascent market for alternative cigarettes.

Headlines: Uber, Waymo in talks about self-driving partnership: Uber CEO
Description: Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] is talking with Alphabet Inc's autonomous driving unit Waymo about using its technology on Uber's ride-hailing app, Uber Chief Executive Dara Khosrowshahi said on Wednesday, signaling a possible thaw in relations between the firms.

Headlines: U.S. trade envoy Ross says up to EU whether there is escalation on tariffs: Le Figaro
Description: Washington does not want a trade war with the European Union, but whether there is an escalation or not will depend on the EU, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said in an interview published by daily Le Figaro on Thursday.

Headlines: The rise of the apprentice: a European tradition comes to the U.S
Description: The growing number of apprenticeships in the U.S. has more to do with European companies importing the practice into their American operations than with the long-running NBC television reality show and its former host who now lives in the White House.

Headlines: EU to open WTO case against U.S. tariffs: Malmstrom
Description: The European Union will launch a case at the World Trade Organization against a U.S. move to put new import tariffs on EU steel and aluminum, Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmstrom said in a statement.

Headlines: Cost of insurance against Deutsche Bank default surges after WSJ report
Description: The cost of insuring exposure to credit issued by German lender Deutsche Bank jumped on Thursday after the Wall Street Journal reported the U.S. Federal Reserve last year designated the bank's U.S. operations to be in "troubled condition".

Headlines: French Finance Minister warns Washington against metal tariffs
Description: U.S. tariffs on European metals would be unjustified and dangerous for growth and free trade, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire told U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross on Thursday, hours ahead of Washington's decision on the matter.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce chief: Any reprisals over metals tariffs unlikely to hit U.S. economy
Description: Any retaliation by European nations or any other countries over U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs are unlikely to have much impact on the American economy, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross told CNBC in an interview on Thursday.

Headlines: EU to take action against U.S., China at WTO, Juncker tells German media
Description: The European Commission will lodge complaints with the World Trade Organisation against the United States over metals tariffs and against China over infringements of European firms' patent rights, its chief, Jean-Claude Juncker told German media.

Headlines: Trump orders Energy Department to help ailing coal, nuclear plants
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday directed Energy Secretary Rick Perry to take emergency steps to keep at-risk coal and nuclear plants running, the White House announced.

Headlines: U.S. job growth surges, unemployment rate falls to 3.8 percent
Description: U.S. job growth accelerated in May and the unemployment rate dropped to an 18-year low of 3.8 percent, pointing to rapidly tightening labor market conditions, which could stir concerns about inflation.

Headlines: U.S. May payrolls gains higher than expected
Description: U.S. job growth accelerated in May and the unemployment rate dropped to an 18-year low of 3.8 percent, pointing to rapidly tightening labor market conditions, which could stir concerns about inflation.

Headlines: And the kitchen sink: EU to hit back at U.S. tariffs
Description: The European Union's plans to hit back at new U.S. tariffs on EU steel and aluminum exports include hiking duties on a range of imports from the United States, from blue jeans and rice to the proverbial kitchen sink.

Headlines: Harley warns of hit from EU reprisal against Trump's tariffs
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc on Friday warned of a "significant impact" on its sales after the European Union revealed plans to increase duties on a range of U.S. imports, including big motorcycles, in reprisal for Washington's new tariffs on EU metal exports.

Headlines: COFCO buys U.S. soybeans but new Trump threats make China buyers nervous
Description: China's state grains and agricultural trader COFCO [CNCOF.UL] has bought cargoes of soybeans from the United States, two sources familiar with the matter said, though future purchases may be jeopardized by renewed trade tensions between them.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sorrell tells investor his new venture is not targeting WPP
Description: WPP's former chief executive Martin Sorrell has moved to reassure investors in the advertising giant that the firm he has set up since his abrupt exit will not compete directly with it.

Headlines: EU initiates WTO case against U.S. steel, aluminum tariffs: WTO official
Description: The European Union on Friday submitted a request for consultations with the United States on steel and aluminum tariffs announced by Washington, a first step in the WTO dispute settlement process, a World Trade Organization official said.

Headlines: Tech leads Wall Street's advance after strong jobs data
Description: Wall Street stocks rose on Friday after the latest monthly jobs report pointed to strength in the U.S. economy and geopolitical tensions eased.

Headlines: Trump tweet before U.S. payrolls report raises eyebrows
Description: President Donald Trump set tongues wagging across Wall Street and among economists on Friday when he tweeted what some viewed as a tip about the big monthly U.S. payrolls report due out later in the morning.

Headlines: GM settles lawsuit with motorcyclist hit by self-driving car
Description: General Motors Co agreed to settle a lawsuit filed by a motorcyclist involved in a minor crash with one of its self-driving cars in San Francisco late last year, the U.S. automaker said on Friday.

Headlines: Apple declines invite to EU hearing, cites appeal against EU tax order
Description: IPhone maker Apple has turned down an invitation to an EU lawmakers' hearing, saying it does not want to prejudice its challenge to an EU order to pay up to 13 billion euros ($15 billion) in back taxes to Ireland.

Headlines: Australia threatens ANZ, Deutsche and Citi with criminal charges over share issue
Description: Australia is preparing criminal cartel charges against the country's third-biggest bank and underwriters Deutsche Bank and Citigroup over a $2.3 billion share issue, in an unprecedented move with potential implications for global capital markets.

Headlines: Honda confirms Takata air bag rupture in fatal Malaysia crash
Description: A Takata air bag inflator ruptured in a fatal car crash earlier this week in Malaysia, Honda Motor Co said on Friday, in what appears to be the 23rd death worldwide linked to the faulty part that can emit deadly metal fragments.

Headlines: Volkswagen lowers 2018 car sales outlook in Argentina: executive
Description: Volkswagen expects its car sales in Argentina to grow 5 percent in 2018, down from a previous estimate of 20 percent, regional Chief Executive Pablo Di Si said on Friday, citing the country's high interest rates.

Headlines: Trump throws ailing U.S. coal, nuke plants a lifeline, triggers backlash
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has directed Energy Secretary Rick Perry to take emergency steps to keep coal and nuclear power plants running, the White House said Friday, in what would amount to an unprecedented intervention in U.S. power markets.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. may soon claim up to $1.7 billion penalty from China's ZTE - sources
Description: The Trump administration may soon claim as much as $1.7 billion penalty from ZTE Corp , as it looks to punish and tighten control over the Chinese telecommunications company before allowing it back into business, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank faces another challenge with Fed stress test
Description: Deutsche Bank AG will face another challenge this month when the Federal Reserve publishes the results of a "stress test" on the bulk of its U.S. operations for the first time.

Headlines: Billionaire Bollore says Vivendi will keep its investments in Italy
Description: Billionaire Vincent Bollore said that Vivendi , the media group he controls, will keep its investments in Italy, following several setbacks it had experienced in the country.

Headlines: Airlines take aim at Australia's airport privatization model
Description: As more countries look to privatize airports two conflicting narratives have taken wing: airlines point to Australia's big city airports as a cautionary tale of light regulation, while airports say they've found a winning formula for governments, investors and passengers.

Headlines: Direct impact of U.S. tariffs on EU 'limited': ECB's Weidmann
Description: U.S. tariffs on imports of steel and aluminum from the European Union are likely to have only a limited direct impact on the EU economy, but risk hurting business and consumer confidence, European Central Bank policymaker Jens Weidmann said on Friday.

Headlines: Canada auto sales fall marginally in May
Description: Canada's auto sales recorded a small dip in May as strong sales of light trucks failed to offset slowing demand for passenger cars.

Headlines: Moody's says cartel charges facing ANZ are credit negative
Description: Cartel conduct charges that Australia's consumer watchdog said it expects to file against Australia and New Zealand Banking Group are credit negative for the lender, according to ratings agency Moody's.

Headlines: Germany hopes U.S. will rethink tariffs after clear EU response
Description: German Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Friday he hopes a decisive response from the European Union to new U.S. tariffs will make President Donald Trump rethink his decision to impose levies on steel and aluminum imports.

Headlines: BMW says may source more U.S. steel its auto plant after tariff move
Description: BMW said on Friday it may increase the amount of steel it sources locally for its U.S. plant after Washington imposed tariffs on imports of steel and aluminum from the European Union.

Headlines: Voestalpine says impact of U.S. tariffs manageable
Description: Austrian steelmaker Voestalpine said on Friday the impact of new U.S. tariffs would be manageable but called on the European Union to act quickly to protect its firms from any dumping from other regions that those tariffs might prompt.

Headlines: China hopes Chinese and U.S. consumers benefit from trade ties
Description: China hopes its people and those of the United States, especially consumers, will continue to gain from mutually beneficial U.S.-Sino trade relations, Vice Finance Minister Zhu Guangyao said on Friday.

Headlines: Deere sues Precision Planting, AGCO claiming patent infringement
Description: U.S. farm equipment maker Deere & Co on Friday sued Precision Planting LLC and AGCO Corp , accusing them of infringing on 12 of its patents.

Headlines: G7 finance chiefs kick trade dispute to leaders' summit in Quebec
Description: Finance leaders of the closest U.S. allies vented anger over the Trump administration's metal import tariffs on Saturday, ending a three-day meeting with a stern rebuke of Washington and setting up a heated fight at a G7 summit next week in Quebec.

Headlines: U.S. trade mission seeks structural changes to China's economy: Mnuchin
Description: The United States wants trade talks in Beijing this weekend to result in structural changes to China's economy, in addition to increased Chinese purchases of American goods, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Saturday.

Headlines: Bank of Canada data-dependent amid trade tensions: Poloz
Description: The uncertainty over rising trade tensions and escalating retaliation in response to U.S. import tariffs means the Bank of Canada will be data-dependent as it sets monetary policy, Governor Stephen Poloz said on Saturday.

Headlines: French-German deal on euro zone 'fiscal capacity' in reach: Le Maire
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Saturday he was confident of reaching an agreement with Germany this month about creating a joint "fiscal capacity" within the euro zone.

Headlines: Italy's euroskeptics and their currency ideas take center-stage
Description: If Italy leaves the euro, it will be late on a Friday night.

Headlines: Britain won't sign any U.S. trade deal if it's not in UK interest: minister
Description: Britain won't sign up to any trade deal with the United States if it is not in its own interest, trade minister Liam Fox said on Saturday, after U.S. tariffs on metals imports drew a rebuke from one of Washington's major European allies.

Headlines: U.S. isolated at G7 meeting as tariffs prompt retaliation
Description: The United States' closest allies attacked the Trump administration on Friday for imposing tariffs on steel and aluminum imports and mounted challenges with the world's top trade body, fouling the mood at a G7 finance leaders meeting.

Headlines: Allies in G7 vow to fight U.S. tariffs, see threat to growth
Description: The United States' allies in the G7 vowed on Thursday to push back against Washington's decision to impose tariffs on their steel and aluminum exports, saying as they gathered for a meeting that the move threatens global growth.

Headlines: Uber's 'business is finished' in Turkey, Erdogan says
Description: Turkey's President Tayyip Erdogan has said ride hailing app Uber is finished in Turkey, following pressure from Istanbul taxi drivers who said it was providing an illegal service and called for it to be banned.

Headlines: Bayer set to close Monsanto takeover on Thursday: report
Description: Bayer's planned $62.5 billion takeover of seeds maker Monsanto is set to close on Thursday, Germany's Frankfurter Allgemeine Sonntags Zeitung reported.

Headlines: Arab oil ministers stress need for continued OPEC, non-OPEC cooperation
Description: OPEC and non-OPEC Arab oil ministers stressed the need for continued cooperation between oil producers who are part of a pact for a global supply cut that is due to expire at the end of 2018, Kuwait's state news agency KUNA reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Oil falls 2 percent, U.S. crude hits lowest since early April
Description: Oil prices fell about 2 percent on Monday, with U.S. crude touching its lowest level in nearly two months, breaking below technical support levels as investors kept selling amid growing U.S. production, possible global supply growth and nagging trade tensions.

Headlines: Walmart sells majority of Brazil unit, takes $4.5 billion charge
Description: Walmart Inc said on Monday that it has sold an 80 percent stake in its Brazilian operations to private equity firm Advent International, exiting an underperforming business in its third major international deal since April.

Headlines: CFTC orders French bank Societe Generale to pay $475 million penalty
Description: The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission on Monday ordered French bank Société Générale SA to pay a $475 million penalty to resolve charges it manipulated the London Interbank Offered Rate, or LIBOR, and the Euro Interbank Offered Rate, or Euribor.

Headlines: Qualcomm asks EU court to scrap $1.2 billion antitrust fine
Description: U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm has asked Europe's second-highest court to throw out a 997 million euro ($1.2 billion) fine levied by European Union antitrust regulators, citing numerous errors in the EU decision.

Headlines: Daimler says electric cars on target after report of launch delays
Description: Daimler said planned launches of battery-powered luxury cars were on schedule on Monday following a report in Germany's Handelsblatt that they were facing delays because of battery shortages and other technical problems.

Headlines: SEC fines New York firm deVere $8 million over UK pension advice conflicts
Description: The New York investment adviser deVere USA Inc agreed on Monday to pay an $8 million civil fine to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges it failed to disclose conflicts of interest to hundreds of clients with UK pensions.

Headlines: Microsoft to take on Amazon with $7.5 billion GitHub deal
Description: Microsoft Corp said on Monday it would buy privately held coding website GitHub Inc for $7.5 billion in an all-stock deal to beef up its cloud computing business and challenge market leader Amazon.com Inc .

Headlines: Legg Mason to pay $64 million to resolve U.S. allegations of Libya bribery scheme
Description: Asset management firm Legg Mason Inc has entered into a settlement agreement with the U.S. Justice Department and agreed to pay $64.2 million to resolve allegations it violated anti-bribery laws through one of its subsidiaries in Libya, the department said on Monday.

Headlines: Former State Street executive faces U.S. fraud trial
Description: A former executive at State Street Corp went on trial on Monday on U.S. charges that he participated in a scheme to defraud the bank's clients by charging them secret commissions on billions of dollars in trades.

Headlines: Most Americans oppose businesses refusing to serve gay people: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Description: Nearly three quarters of U.S. adults believe that businesses should not have the right on religious grounds to deny services to customers based on their sexual orientation, a Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll released on Monday showed.

Headlines: Japan's Sharp says to buy Toshiba's PC business
Description: Japan's Sharp Corp said it will acquire Toshiba Corp's personal computer business for $36 million, highlighting its recovery under the control of Foxconn and marking a return to a business it quit eight years ago.

Headlines: Honda's China sales slump for 4th month amid quality issues
Description: Honda Motor Co Ltd's sales in China slumped for a fourth consecutive month in May, due to the lingering impact from a quality issue associated with the automaker's popular CR-V sport-utility vehicle.

Headlines: En+ president Sokov resigns in bid to see U.S. sanctions eased
Description: En+ Group accepted president Maxim Sokov's resignation on Monday as part of a plan to persuade the United States to lift sanctions on the company by filling its board with directors not affiliated with Russian tycoon Oleg Deripaska. Deripaska and the biggest companies in his empire, including aluminum producer Rusal and its parent holding company En+, were included in a U.S. Treasury Department sanctions blacklist in April. Under a plan devised by En+ chairman Greg Barker,

Headlines: Australia's CBA seeks redemption with record settlement
Description: Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA) agreed to pay a record penalty of A$700 million ($529.3 million) to settle explosive money laundering charges brought by Australia's financial intelligence agency.

Headlines: Boeing ties up with Safran to push into aircraft services business
Description: Planemaker Boeing Co will partner with French aerospace firm Safran SA to make and service aircraft auxiliary power units as it uses some its profit from record jet sales to push into other lucrative aerospace segments.

Headlines: KPMG to layoff 400 employees in South Africa in latest shake-up after scandal
Description: Global auditor KPMG said on Monday it will axe up to 400 staff in South Africa in its latest shake-up following a corruption scandal in the country, which saw it lose several major clients.

Headlines: America Movil to launch new U.S. unit for business clients
Description: Mexican telecommunications company America Movil, controlled by the family of Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim, is launching a U.S.-based unit that will offer information technology and communications to business customers, according to a source and a document on the company's website.

Headlines: UBS hires Solon Kentas to lead U.S. consumer and retail M&A
Description: UBS Group AG has appointed Solon Kentas, previously a managing director at Deutsche Bank AG , to lead the Swiss bank's U.S. consumer and retail dealmaking efforts, UBS announced internally in a memo on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wells Fargo pulls back from U.S. Midwest, selling 52 branches to Flagstar
Description: Wells Fargo & Co is pulling back from retail banking in the U.S. Midwest, selling all of its branches in three states, as the bank embarks on a broader review of branch profitability across the country.

Headlines: G7 to call on North Korea to get rid of nuclear weapons: senior EU official
Description: G7 leaders will call on North Korea on Friday to get rid of its nuclear weapons if it wants sanctions against the country to be lifted, a senior European union official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nasdaq ends at record close, S&P edges higher on data
Description: The Nasdaq closed at a record high for the second day in a row with help from the technology and consumer discretionary sectors, while the S&P 500 edged higher as investors eyed solid U.S. economic data.

Headlines: U.S. companies continued stock buyback frenzy in May: report
Description: U.S. companies continued a shopping spree for their own shares in May, making $173.6 billion in buyback announcements, the highest monthly total ever, according to a research report.

Headlines: Britain clears way for Murdoch to battle Comcast for Sky
Description: Rupert Murdoch faces a 22 billion pound ($29.3 billion) fight with U.S. cable company Comcast for European pay-TV company Sky after Britain cleared his bid providing he sells off its TV news business.

Headlines: Nasdaq hits record closing high again; euro recovers
Description: The Nasdaq hit a record closing high for the second day in a row on Tuesday, helped by tech and consumer discretionary shares, while the euro recovered after Italy's new prime minister said the government had never considered leaving the euro zone.

Headlines: Northrop Grumman wins U.S. antitrust approval to buy Orbital ATK
Description: U.S. defense contractor Northrop Grumman won U.S. antitrust approval to buy solid rocket motor supplier Orbital ATK Inc with conditions, the Federal Trade Commission said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Morocco's Centrale Danone workers protest job losses due to boycott
Description: Workers at Morocco's Centrale Danone, a subsidiary of French group Danone , staged a sit-in in Rabat late on Tuesday over losing their jobs as a consumer boycott now in its second month pressures the company.

Headlines: GM China raises new-energy vehicle target to 20 models through 2023
Description: General Motors Co is accelerating the pace of electric vehicle (EV) launches in China as policymakers in the world's biggest auto market continue to promote EVs as an alternative to gasoline cars.

Headlines: Toyota's May China vehicle sales +8.6 Percent year on year
Description: Toyota Motor Corp's vehicle sales in China rose 8.6 percent in May from a year earlier to 122,400 vehicles, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Europe up against Asian juggernaut in electric car battery drive
Description: Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD is looking at launching battery production in Europe, joining Asian rivals aiming to cash in on a green car revolution and threatening attempts by Brussels to nurture a home-grown industry.

Headlines: Japan's Sharp to issue new shares worth about $1.8 billion
Description: Japan's Sharp Corp said on Tuesday it will issue new shares worth about 200 billion yen ($1.8 billion), sending shares of the company tumbling.

Headlines: Sharp to buy Toshiba PC business, issue $1.8 billion in new shares
Description: Japan's Sharp Corp said it will buy Toshiba Corp's personal computer business and issue $1.8 billion in new shares to buy back preferred stock from banks, highlighting a swift recovery under the control of Foxconn.

Headlines: Australia charges investment banks with alleged cartel activity
Description: Australia's anti-cartel laws have come to global attention with the country's competition watchdog lodging criminal charges for alleged cartel behavior against two global investment banks, in a move one expert called "almost unique".

Headlines: China launches DRAM chip price probe into Samsung Elec, SK Hynix and Micron
Description: China has launched a probe into Samsung Electronics Co Ltd , SK Hynix Inc and Micron Technology Inc , the three semiconductor makers who control the market for DRAM memory chips.

Headlines: U.S. services sector activity picks up; job openings at record high
Description: U.S. services sector activity accelerated in May, pointing to robust economic growth in the second quarter, but trade tariffs and a shortage of workers posed a threat to the outlook.

Headlines: Twitter shares jump 5 percent as they win new follower: The S&P 500
Description: Consider it the ultimate "like" for a stock: Twitter Inc is joining the benchmark S&P 500 U.S. index, pushing the social media company's stock price up 5 percent on Tuesday as demand surged from equities investors.

Headlines: U.S. dollar-store shares marked down but specialty discounters thrive
Description: The shares of so-called dollar stores have suffered as U.S. shoppers have started spending more at bargain retailers with focused concepts and big discount chains.

Headlines: Brown-Forman upped Jack Daniel's shipments as trade war loomed
Description: Jack Daniel's maker Brown-Forman Corp warned on Wednesday of trouble ahead from tariffs being slapped on U.S. bourbon and said it had been working in recent months to mitigate the potential impact by shipping more liquor overseas.

Headlines: UBS cuts at least 100 jobs in asset management arm: Bloomberg
Description: Swiss bank UBS Group AG is cutting jobs at its asset management unit while it focuses on growth in China along with passive and sustainable investing, Bloomberg said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook confirms data sharing with Chinese companies
Description: Facebook Inc said Tuesday it has data sharing partnerships with at least four Chinese companies including Huawei, the world's third largest smartphone maker, which has come under scrutiny from U.S. intelligence agencies on security concerns.

Headlines: Alphabet shareholders reject diversity proposal backed by employees
Description: Alphabet Inc's shareholders, including top executives, voted down several proposals on Wednesday, defeating campaigns to tie pay to diversity goals and to get the Google parent to provide more data about efforts to moderate user-generated content.

Headlines: Trump's move to please farmers on biofuels reform draws refinery union ire
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump, in yielding to pressure from farming states and agreeing to suspend changes to U.S. biofuel policy is now being criticized by another important constituency, the main union for oil refinery workers.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers press Facebook over Chinese data sharing
Description: Facebook Inc faced criticism on Wednesday from Republican and Democratic U.S. lawmakers who demanded that the social media company be more forthcoming about data it has shared with four Chinese firms.

Headlines: Macau clamps down on use of UnionPay cards to dodge currency controls
Description: Authorities in Macau, the world's biggest gambling hub, have told financial institutions to tackle the illegal use of UnionPay cards to evade exchange controls, China's latest move to clamp down on illicit capital outflows.

Headlines: Uber jumps into Europe's crowded bike-sharing market
Description: Uber, the ride-hailing company which has been banned from many European cities, is about to launch its JUMP electric bicycle sharing service in Germany as it diversifies and seeks to build bridges with local authorities.

Headlines: China says it does not want U.S. trade frictions to escalate
Description: China's Commerce Ministry said on Thursday that the country does not want an escalation of trade frictions with the United States, and that some specific progress was made in the latest round of talks that concluded over the weekend.

Headlines: Drugmaker Lundbeck to settle U.S. charity probe for $52.6 million
Description: Danish drugmaker Lundbeck said on Wednesday that it will pay $52.6 million to resolve a U.S. probe into its financial support of patient assistance charitable foundations.

Headlines: Germany's E.ON puts fate of Uniper management in Fortum's hands
Description: A vote that could have triggered a probe into whether managers of German energy company Uniper tried to block the sale of a 47 percent stake to Finland's Fortum was postponed on Wednesday in line with a proposal by Uniper's biggest shareholder E.ON .

Headlines: Property investors in Austria give Starwood the cold shoulder
Description: U.S. investment firm Starwood Capital failed on Wednesday in its attempt to take major stakes in Austrian property groups CA Immo and Immofinanz , as shareholders bet a more lucrative deal could be secured.

Headlines: Honda to start selling Hondajet in Japan next year
Description: Honda Motor Co on Wednesday said it would start selling its six-seater business jet in Japan next year, as it seeks to expand global sales by tapping into demand from a growing class of high net-worth individuals.

Headlines: Air Baltic's hurry for Bombardier CSeries deal foreshadows jet selling spree
Description: Latvia-based AirBaltic hastened a deal for Bombardier CSeries planes before Airbus formally takes over the Canadian planemaker because it was worried about securing the right delivery slots, the carrier's chief executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: World's top wealth fund opposed Musk's double role at Tesla
Description: Norway's $1 trillion wealth fund said on Wednesday it had backed an initiative to wrest the role of chairman away from Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk.

Headlines: Siemens signs pacts to deepen ties to China's Belt and Road push
Description: Siemens has signed more than ten cooperation agreements with Chinese companies as it seeks to benefit from deepening involvement with China's "Belt and Road" infrastructure initiative, the German engineering group said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Rising exports push U.S. trade deficit to seven-month low
Description: The U.S. trade deficit fell to a seven-month low in April as exports rose to a record high, lifted by an increase in shipments of industrial materials and soybeans.

Headlines: Swiss prosecutors will not pursue Novartis over Trump lawyer payments
Description: The Swiss attorney general's office (OAG) said on Wednesday it will not bring proceedings against Novartis in connection with $1.2 million in payments the Swiss drugmaker made to U.S. President Donald Trump's personal lawyer.

Headlines: Indian police source says still seeking to quiz AirAsia boss; airline denies summons
Description: India's federal police will again ask AirAsia Group's chief to appear for questioning over allegations the airline broke rules to obtain a flying license in the country, a source said on Wednesday, after he failed to answer a previous request.

Headlines: PetSmart taps advisers to trim $8 billion debt pile: sources
Description: PetSmart Inc, the largest U.S. pet retailer, has hired restructuring advisers to explore ways to trim its debt pile of more than $8 billion as it continues to face falling profits, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Japan PM Abe: no countries benefit from trade protectionism
Description: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said on Wednesday that he wants to send a message at a Group of Seven leaders' summit that no countries benefit from trade protectionism.

Headlines: Billions in U.S. solar projects shelved after Trump panel tariff
Description: President Donald Trump’s tariff on imported solar panels has led U.S. renewable energy companies to cancel or freeze investments of more than $2.5 billion in large installation projects, along with thousands of jobs, the developers told Reuters.

Headlines: Kering's Gucci aims to hit 10 billion euro revenue threshold
Description: Italy's Gucci, the fashion brand fuelling a sales boom at Kering , said on Thursday it aimed to keep growing at twice the pace of the luxury market and aims to eventually reach 10 billion euros ($11.82 billion) in annual revenue.

Headlines: Qualcomm CEO hopes ZTE deal will clear acquisition of NXP in China
Description: Qualcomm Inc CEO Steven Mollenkopf said on Thursday he hoped an announced agreement between the United States and China on the future of ZTE Corp will pave the way for China clearing Qualcomm's acquisition of NXP Semiconductors NV.

Headlines: Honolulu lawmakers pass 'surge pricing' cap for ride-hailing companies
Description: Honolulu could become the first U.S. city to limit fares ride-hailing companies can charge when demand spikes, following a city council vote on Wednesday, the Honolulu Star-Advertiser newspaper reported.

Headlines: Australia's AMP slapped with fourth lawsuit, shares hit six-year low
Description: Australia's biggest wealth manager, AMP Ltd on Thursday said it faced a fourth class-action lawsuit for allegedly charging fees for services not provided, sending the company's shares to their lowest in more than six years.

Headlines: ExxonMobil sees Russian LNG plant's capacity at 6.2 million T/year: Ifax
Description: U.S. major ExxonMobil and Russian energy company Rosneft expect their future joint project to produce more than 6.2 million tonnes of liquefied natural gas per year, Interfax news agency quoted an ExxonMobil manager as saying on Thursday.

Headlines: Top French banks appoint graduate school contemporaries of Macron
Description: France's biggest banks BNP Paribas and Societe Generale have appointed to senior posts former graduate school contemporaries of President Emmanuel Macron, suggesting the institutions want to keep close ties with the political establishment.

Headlines: Euro extends rally on ECB comments, yields fall ahead of G7
Description: The euro climbed to a three-week peak on Thursday as expectations mounted that the European Central Bank will signal an early wind-down of economic stimulus, while oil prices jumped on concern about a drop in exports from Venezuela.

Headlines: Phony bank accounts not a 'systemic' issue: U.S. regulator
Description: A U.S. bank regulator said on Thursday that an industry-wide review prompted by Wells Fargo & Co's sales practices scandal had uncovered some instances of phony accounts at other lenders but little evidence of a "systemic" problem.

Headlines: S&P, Nasdaq fall as tech rally loses steam; Dow rises
Description: The S&P and Nasdaq fell on Thursday as the technology sector snapped a rally while investors turned to safer bets as they kept an eye on global trade tensions and waited for U.S. and European central bank meetings.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers scramble for way to block Trump deal with China's ZTE
Description: Republican and Democratic U.S. senators introduced legislation on Thursday that would roll back an agreement President Donald Trump's administration announced to ease sanctions on Chinese telecommunications company ZTE Corp.

Headlines: Japan's home-sharing offerings evaporate ahead of new regulations
Description: Japan, which just months ago had tens of thousands of Airbnb and home-sharing properties available, has approved only about 150 before a new law kicks in next week, meant to bring order to the market and create more lodging options for foreign tourists.

Headlines: China Huarong to refocus on bad loans amid probes into chairman, investment
Description: China Huarong Asset Management Co Ltd will focus on its core bad debt business, the company said, amid investigations by the official anti-corruption watchdog of its chairman, Lai Xiaomin, and a company it had invested in.

Headlines: Oil gains on Venezuela export cuts, OPEC production levels
Description: Global benchmark Brent crude surged nearly $2 a barrel on Thursday, lifted by concern about a steep drop in exports from Venezuela and worries OPEC may not raise production at its meeting this month.

Headlines: Some fund managers are avoiding Amazon as it leads U.S. market
Description: For most U.S. fund managers, beating the market this year has come down to one decision: whether or not to own shares of Amazon.com Inc .

Headlines: AmTrust agrees to sweetened $2.95 billion buyout offer
Description: U.S. insurer AmTrust Financial Services Inc on Thursday agreed to be acquired by a group of investors for a sweetened $2.95 billion deal that also helped secure the support of dissenting shareholder Carl Icahn.

Headlines: McDonald's plans fresh round of layoffs: WSJ
Description: McDonald's Corp is planning a new round of layoffs to flatten out its management structure further, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing a company email sent to all its U.S. employees, suppliers and franchisees.

Headlines: GM to sell new electric car batteries to Honda in North America
Description: General Motors Co will supply advanced batteries to Japan's Honda Motor Co, the companies said Thursday, a move that could significantly reduce the cost of future electric vehicles at both automakers after 2020.

Headlines: Kering's Gucci aims to steal luxury crown from Louis Vuitton
Description: Italian fashion house Gucci said on Thursday it aims to reach 10 billion euros in annual sales and replace LVMH's Louis Vuitton as the world's biggest luxury label.

Headlines: EU will stand united at G7, Italy included: Tusk
Description: European Union members of the Group of Seven, including Italy's new Prime Minister Guiseppe Conte, will present a united front on all issues to be discussed at a G7 summit in Charlevoix, the chairman of EU leaders Donald Tusk said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street rises, investors eye Fed decision, summit fears ebb
Description: U.S. stock indexes closed higher on Friday as investors shrugged off concerns about global trade tensions but trading volume was relatively light ahead of a busy week of central bank meetings.

Headlines: Verizon names tech chief CEO, prioritizes 5G network over content
Description: Verizon Communications Inc named Chief Technology Officer Hans Vestberg as its new CEO on Friday, surprising analysts and signaling the largest U.S. wireless company's priority is building the next-generation 5G network, not expanding further into media content.

Headlines: EU Commission head offers joint EU-U.S. trade assessment in tariff dispute
Description: The European Union's executive arm offered U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday a joint assessment of EU-U.S. trade to help resolve a dispute over U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs that the EU believes are based on a misreading of trade data.

Headlines: U.S., EU take small step on trade, but no breakthrough at G7 summit
Description: The United States and European Union will establish a dialogue on trade within the next two weeks, a French official said on Friday, signaling a modest step forward for bitterly divided allies at a Group of Seven summit in Canada.

Headlines: Investors focusing on profit margins as rising prices, wages start to bite
Description: For years U.S. inflation has been the dog that did not bark, but rising prices and wages are now showing signs of squeezing profit margins across corporate America, leading investors to punish companies whose results are deteriorating.

Headlines: Mitsubishi Materials finds fresh cases of misconduct, loses certification
Description: Japan's Mitsubishi Materials Corp said on Friday it has found fresh cases of misconduct at its Naoshima copper smelter and refinery in western Japan and the plant's Japanese Industrial Standards (JIS) certification has been revoked.

Headlines: Britain's FCA goes ahead with disputed 'Aramco' listing rule
Description: Britain's markets watchdog will press ahead with a new premium listing next month aimed at attracting companies like state-controlled Saudi Aramco to London, although the rules have been "refined" following investor criticism.

Headlines: G7 communique unlikely due to lack of consensus: officials
Description: Leaders from the Group of Seven countries are highly unlikely to issue a final communique when a two-day summit in Canada ends on Saturday because of a lack of consensus among the group, who are deeply divided over trade issues.

Headlines: Italy's new PM backs Trump on re-admitting Russia into the G7
Description: New Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte threw his weight on Friday behind U.S. President Donald Trump's call for Russia to be included once more into Group of Seven meetings.

Headlines: Kremlin, responding to Trump, says attending G7 not a priority: Sputnik
Description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov, on U.S. President Donald Trump's remark that Russia should be attending a Group of Seven (G7) nations meeting, said: "Russia is focused on other formats, apart from the G7," Sputnik reported.

Headlines: EU's Tusk anticipates tough G7 talks, sees Europe united
Description: Talks at the Group of Seven summit will not be easy as the United States is in conflict with the rest of the group on trade, climate change and the nuclear deal with Iran, the chairman of European Union leaders Donald Tusk said on Friday.

Headlines: UK, U.S. are good friends despite trade row: PM May
Description: Britain and the United States remain good friends who can talk frankly with each other when they disagree, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday ahead of a Group of Seven summit.

Headlines: Exclusive: Malaysia considering seeking return of Goldman Sachs' 1MDB fees
Description: Malaysia is considering asking the U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) to get Goldman Sachs to return nearly $600 million in fees it earned from bonds raised for scandal-tainted 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB), two sources familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Italy's luxury brand Prada paves way for family succession: CEO
Description: Prada Chief Executive Patrizio Bertelli said on Friday his family would not sell its 80 percent stake in Italy's biggest luxury goods group and said his son Lorenzo may one day head the company.

Headlines: Ant Financial raises $14 billion in world's largest-ever single fundraising
Description: Ant Financial Services Group, operator of China's biggest online payment platform, on Friday said it raised around $14 billion in what market watchers called the biggest-ever single fundraising globally by a private company.

Headlines: Comcast to win unconditional EU okay for Sky bid: sources
Description: U.S. cable company Comcast is set to gain unconditional EU antitrust approval for its bid to buy European pay-TV company Sky , two people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: G7 leaders urge Russia to stop undermining democracies
Description: Leaders of the Group of Seven countries urged Russia on Saturday to stop undermining democracies and said they were ready to step up sanctions against Moscow if necessary.

Headlines: UK to force big companies to publish worker to boss pay gap
Description: Britain's biggest companies will from 2020 be legally required to publish the gap between the salary of their chief executive and what they pay their average UK worker, under proposed new government rules.

Headlines: German regulator found defeat devices in Daimler diesel cars: BamS
Description: Germany's road vehicle authority KBA has found five "illegal switch-off devices" in Daimler car engines, newspaper Bild am Sonntag (BamS) reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Italy's Conte wants G8 with Russia, not quick end to sanctions
Description: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said on Saturday he hopes the Group of Seven nations can re-admit Russia as soon as possible but Italy is not seeking an overnight lifting of sanctions against Russia.

Headlines: Heavy security quells scattered protests at Canada G7 summit
Description: A heavy police presence and an isolated summit site thwarted protesters at the Group of Seven meeting in Canada on Saturday, dousing all but a smattering of demonstrations against the powerful world leaders.

Headlines: Trump says United States needs fair access to markets
Description: U.S President Donald Trump said on Saturday he told Group of Seven leaders that the United States required fair access to markets and an end to unfair trade practices.

Headlines: Merkel says differences on trade remain despite joint G7 communique
Description: Leaders of the G7 countries will stress the importance of rules-based trade in a joint communique but there were still differences between Europe and the United States on the issue, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Saturday.

Headlines: France's Macron: G7 statement on trade only first step
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Saturday that a joint statement from Group of Seven nations was just a first step and marked an attempt to "stabilize things" as a trade dispute with the United States threatened to tear the alliance apart.

Headlines: Trump's G7 U-turn destroys trust, Europe must stick together: Germany's Maas
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to back out of a Group of Seven communique through a Twitter message has destroyed trust and Europe's answer must be to stick even closer together, Foreign Minister Heiko Maas said on Sunday.

Headlines: France, Europe stand by G7 statement after Trump U-turn: French official
Description: France and Europe are maintaining their support for the Group of Seven communique and anyone departing from the commitments made at the summit would be showing their "incoherence and inconsistency", a French presidency official told Reuters.

Headlines: KKR to take Envision private for $5.57 billion in healthcare push
Description: KKR & Co said on Monday it will buy Envision Healthcare Corp , one of biggest U.S. providers of physicians to hospitals, in a deal valued at $5.57 billion as it builds up its healthcare portfolio.

Headlines: U.S. stocks rise ahead of North Korea summit, despite Trump's G7 fireworks
Description: U.S. stocks ended slightly higher on Monday as investors shook off the weekend's chaotic G7 summit ahead of a week packed with diplomatic events, and a pair of U.S. Treasury Department auctions met with strong demand.

Headlines: Fed up with rising costs, big U.S. firms dig into healthcare
Description: At its Silicon Valley headquarters, network gear maker Cisco Systems Inc is going to unusual lengths to take control of the relentless increase in its U.S. healthcare costs.

Headlines: Carrefour takes on French rivals in e-commerce with Google tie-up
Description: France's largest food retailer Carrefour is teaming up with Google to boost its online shopping business on its home turf, where rivals are also launching e-commerce offensives.

Headlines: Mitsubishi Materials unveils boardroom shake-up as data tampering scandal deepens
Description: Japan's Mitsubishi Materials Corp on Monday announced a top management reshuffle after the maker of metals and other products for the first time explicitly accepted responsibility over a data tampering scandal dating back to last year.

Headlines: G7 summit 'commotion' has brought EU closer together: German economy minister
Description: Events at the Group of Seven summit have brought the European Union closer together, Germany's economy minister said on Monday.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi books $1 billion quarterly loss ahead of blockbuster IPO
Description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi booked a first-quarter net loss of 7 billion yuan ($1.09 billion) ahead of its blockbuster initial public offering.

Headlines: HSBC to invest $15-17 billion by 2020 in push for growth
Description: HSBC will invest $15-17 billion in the next three years in areas including technology and China as it swings from a strategy of cost-cutting to growth, new CEO John Flint said on Monday, while keeping profitability and dividend targets little changed.

Headlines: Takeda shareholder group aims to block $62 billion Shire deal
Description: A group of Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd shareholders is trying to build support to block the $62 billion acquisition of London-listed Shire Plc at an extraordinary general meeting, a leading member of the group told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Two ex-Penn West executives must face U.S. SEC fraud charges
Description: A U.S. judge has ordered two former finance executives at Penn West Petroleum Ltd, now known as Obsidian Energy Ltd , to face regulatory charges that they helped engineer a multi-year accounting fraud to reduce the Canadian company's operating expenses.

Headlines: Oil mixed as OPEC cites uncertain market outlook for 2018
Description: Oil prices were mixed on Tuesday, with U.S. crude settling higher before falling in post-settlement trading, and Brent slipping as investors prepared for a key meeting of the OPEC producer group next week.

Headlines: JPMorgan is sued over Mexican property transfer
Description: A Mexican real estate developer has filed a $1.2 billion lawsuit accusing JPMorgan Chase & Co of fraudulently inducing it to transfer properties based on a false promise it would sell them.

Headlines: U.S. government posts $147 billion deficit in May
Description: The U.S. government had a $147 billion budget deficit in May, an increase of 66 percent from the same month last year as the ledger took a hit from declining revenue and higher spending, according to Treasury Department data released on Tuesday.

Headlines: As millennials age, more U.S. companies look ahead to Generation Z
Description: After a decade of focusing on the so-called millennial generation, some U.S. companies are starting to look ahead to what’s next.

Headlines: Dissident doyen set to rejoin Fed's rate-setting panel
Description: The U.S. central bank's staunchest advocate for faster interest-rate hikes is set to regain the power to vote at the Federal Reserve's rate-setting meetings starting next month, but the shift is unlikely to mean faster rate hikes under Chair Jerome Powell.

Headlines: With rate hike in the bag, focus turns to Fed's policy language
Description: With the Federal Reserve virtually guaranteed to raise interest rates at its two-day meeting this week, investors are focused on how the U.S. central bank characterizes its monetary policy as borrowing costs return to more normal levels amid an ongoing economic expansion.

Headlines: Global stocks steady after Trump-Kim summit, investors eye Fed
Description: Wall Street made modest gains on Tuesday while the U.S. dollar rose slightly against a basket of major currencies, with only muted impact from the long-awaited U.S.-North Korea summit aimed at denuclearizing the Korean peninsula.

Headlines: AT&T to close Time Warner purchase by June 20: attorney
Description: AT&T plans to close its purchase of Time Warner Inc no later than June 20 after a U.S. court decided it could move ahead with the deal, the company's lead attorney said on Tuesday.

Headlines: L'Oreal to appeal after UK setback in haircare patent row
Description: L'Oreal , maker of brands like Lancome and Maybelline, said on Tuesday it would seek to appeal a British court ruling favoring a U.S. start-up that accuses the French cosmetics giant of infringing its patent on a haircare product.

Headlines: BMW says May sales of BMW, Mini vehicles dip due to China tariffs
Description: BMW said vehicle sales fell 2.1 percent in May, weighed down by China tariffs, the launch of a new model, and a 13.6 percent drop in German deliveries as cities like Hamburg started banning older diesel vehicles from key streets.

Headlines: Malaysia's attorney general says received 1MDB investigation papers from anti-graft agency
Description: Malaysia's attorney general on Tuesday said he has received investigation papers relating to state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) from the country's anti-graft agency.

Headlines: VW's Skoda Auto May deliveries rise 13 percent
Description: Global deliveries by Volkswagen's Czech carmaker Skoda Auto rose 13.4 percent year-on-year in May, posting the best-ever result for the month thanks to double-digit growth in China and Russia.

Headlines: Huawei patent case shows Chinese courts' rising clout
Description: A smartphone patent fight between Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and Samsung Electronics Co could reach a global resolution through a ruling by a Chinese court, a development that reflects the growing attractiveness of China as a quick and effective forum for intellectual property disputes.

Headlines: IMF's Lagarde says global economic outlook darkening by the day
Description: International Monetary Fund chief Christine Lagarde led an attack by global economic organizations on U.S. President Donald Trump's "America First" trade policy on Monday, warning that clouds over the global economy "are getting darker by the day".

Headlines: Trump, in trade feud with allies, say won't let them take advantage of U.S.
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday kept up his feud with America's closest allies over trade, saying he could not allow them to continue taking advantage of the United States.

Headlines: McDonald's to post $80-$90 million charges for restructuring, layoffs
Description: McDonald's Corp plans to take $80 million to $90 million in charges during the second quarter from a restructuring at its U.S. operations that includes layoffs.

Headlines: With assembly team and samosas, IKEA lays ground for India debut
Description: IKEA is set to open its first store in India next month, and the world's biggest furniture retailer is localizing its offering - from the food menu to its "do-it-yourself" (DIY) assembly model - to ensure success in the country.

Headlines: GM has no projects underway with Lyft, CEO Barra says
Description: General Motors Co Chief Executive Officer Mary Barra said on Tuesday the No. 1 U.S. automaker currently has no projects underway with ride-sharing company Lyft, in which it has a 9 percent stake.

Headlines: AT&T, Justice Department await decision that could determine future of media
Description: AT&T Inc , which owns DirecTV, awaits a court ruling on Tuesday that will determine if it can buy Time Warner Inc , a decision that could prompt a cascade of pay TV companies buying television and movie makers and the first big test of the Trump administration's antitrust teams.

Headlines: China's ZTE to resume trading after $1.4 billion U.S. settlement
Description: ZTE Corp said trading in its shares would resume on Wednesday, ending a two-month suspension, after the Chinese telecommunications giant agreed to pay up to $1.4 billion in penalties to the U.S. government and radically overhaul its management.

Headlines: Hurt in past by false dawns, Chinese businessman is wary of bets on North Korea opening up
Description: Property speculators in China may be betting that Tuesday's U.S.-North Korea summit will unlock riches across the border but Chinese construction machinery dealer Wang Chenglin is far from convinced.

Headlines: Instant View: Federal judge OKs AT&T takeover of Time Warner
Description: AT&T Inc won approval from a U.S. court on Tuesday to buy Time Warner Inc for $85 billion, allowing AT&T to compete with internet companies that dominate digital advertising and providing new sources of revenue.

Headlines: Investors wipe $3 billion off China's ZTE as U.S. settlement sinks in
Description: Investors wiped about $3 billion off embattled Chinese telecommunications giant ZTE Corp's market value as it resumed trade on Wednesday after agreeing to pay up to $1.4 billion in penalties to the U.S. government.

Headlines: U.S. accuses Fiat Chrysler, union of conspiring to break labor laws
Description: Top officials of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV and the United Auto Workers (UAW) union conspired to violate U.S. labor laws, federal prosecutors alleged in a court document, saying a former executive at the automaker knew bribes paid to union leaders were designed to "grease the skids" in labor negotiations.

Headlines: U.S. automaker GM names Suryadevara CFO to succeed Stevens
Description: General Motors Co said on Wednesday Dhivya Suryadevara, currently vice president of corporate finance, will succeed Chuck Stevens on Sept. 1 as chief financial officer of the No. 1 U.S. automaker.

Headlines: Linde-Praxair deal gets Brazil antitrust nod
Description: Brazil's antitrust regulator on Wednesday approved the $80 billion merger of gas group Linde AG and Praxair Inc, as long as the companies go ahead with an undisclosed asset sale plan.

Headlines: Wall Street falls as Fed signals two more hikes this year
Description: U.S. stocks ended a choppy session lower on Wednesday after the U.S. Federal Reserve raised interest rates as expected and projected a slightly faster pace of rate hikes this year.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela eyes first-ever refining of foreign oil - documents
Description: Venezuela is considering producing fuels from foreign crude oil for the first time, according to planning documents seen by Reuters, as the country struggles to meet its obligations despite having the world's largest crude reserves.

Headlines: Comcast offers $65 billion to lure Fox from Disney bid
Description: Comcast Corp offered $65 billion on Wednesday to lure Twenty-First Century Fox Inc away from a merger with Walt Disney Co , setting up a bidding war between two of the largest U.S. media companies with its 20 percent higher offer.

Headlines: After nine years of U.S. recovery, Fed sheds anxieties
Description: The Federal Reserve is guiding a U.S. economy that is as close to ideal as it could have dreamed a decade ago, when the darkest days of the recession forced it to take big risks to protect workers, banks and economies around the world from further devastation.

Headlines: Fed lifts rates amid stronger inflation, drops crisis-era guidance
Description: The Federal Reserve raised interest rates on Wednesday, a move that was widely expected but still marked a milestone in the U.S. central bank's shift from policies used to battle the 2007-2009 financial crisis and recession.

Headlines: AT&T wins court approval to buy Time Warner over Trump opposition
Description: AT&T Inc won court approval on Tuesday to buy Time Warner Inc for $85 billion, rebuffing an attempt by U.S. President Donald Trump's administration to block the deal and likely setting off a wave of corporate mergers.

Headlines: Breakingviews - New ZTE regime could climb out of big hole
Description: ZTE is back to life, but faces a tough rehab. The Chinese telecommunications company lost nearly $3 billion in market value after its reprieve from a death sentence imposed by the Trump administration. That suggests concerns about a clean management sweep. If, however, ZTE can find decent leadership and stay out of trouble – big ifs, for sure – a 5G rollout holds real promise.

Headlines: Instant View: Fed raises rates again, sees two more hikes in 2018
Description: The Federal Reserve raised interest rates on Wednesday, a move that was widely expected but still marked a milestone in the U.S. central bank's shift from policies used to battle the 2007-2009 financial crisis and recession.

Headlines: Traders see fourth Fed interest rate hike this year
Description: Traders of U.S. short-term interest-rate futures increased bets the Federal Reserve will raise rates again this year and next after the central bank on Wednesday increased its benchmark lending rate and dropped its longstanding pledge to stimulate the economy "for some time."

Headlines: Oil rises as U.S. inventories fall on strong demand
Description: Oil prices turned positive on Wednesday after a bigger-than-expected decline in U.S. crude inventories along with surprise drawdowns in gasoline and distillates indicated strong demand in the world's top oil consumer.

Headlines: Gasoline leads broad increase in U.S. producer inflation
Description: U.S. producer prices increased more than expected in May, leading to the biggest annual gain in nearly 6-1/2 years, the latest sign of a gradual building up of inflation pressures.

Headlines: Brazil watchdog fines Morgan Stanley, Royal Bank of Canada for forex manipulation
Description: Brazil's antitrust watchdog on Wednesday fined Morgan Stanley and Royal Bank of Canada a total of 42.9 million reais ($11.6 million) for meddling with foreign exchange rates charged to clients.

Headlines: Nissan doubles down on emerging markets as U.S. sales slow
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd said on Wednesday it expects vehicle sales in some markets to beat industry growth, driven by countries including Saudi Arabia - crucial for the Japanese firm that is struggling with slowing sales in the United States.

Headlines: Property agents abandon China's resort island as sales plunge on cooling measures
Description: Tough measures to cool the property market in China's resort island of Hainan have put the brakes on a real estate boom and underscore the policy risks developers and investors face as the government tries to rein in prices.

Headlines: UAW elects new leader to face contract talks, federal probe
Description: The union that represents factory workers at the Detroit Three automakers elected regional director Gary Jones as its new president on Wednesday, ahead of tough 2019 contract talks likely to coincide with declining U.S. sales of new vehicles.

Headlines: Canada says agreed with U.S. to keep NAFTA alive, no talks set
Description: Canada agreed with the United States on Thursday that slow-moving talks to update NAFTA should continue although they did not set a date for the next round, a senior official said in remarks casting further doubt on the chances of a deal this year.

Headlines: Oil mixed as dollar gains and key OPEC meeting looms
Description: Oil prices were mixed on Thursday, with Brent slipping and U.S. crude gaining, as a stronger dollar weighed and a key supply-setting meeting of the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries loomed.

Headlines: Nasdaq hits new closing high, S&P 500 gains after ECB decision, U.S. data
Description: The S&P 500 edged up and the Nasdaq reached another record closing high on Thursday after the European Central Bank said it would avoid raising interest rates until mid-2019, and data showed U.S. economic strength.

Headlines: Dollar soars and Wall Street gains as ECB holds off on rate hikes
Description: The U.S. dollar rose more than a penny against a basket of major currencies as the euro cratered, and U.S. stocks closed higher on Thursday, as the European Central Bank signaled interest rate hikes were a long way off.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending accelerating; labor market robust
Description: U.S. retail sales increased more than expected in May as consumers bought motor vehicles and a range of other goods even as they paid more for gasoline, the latest indication of an acceleration in economic growth in the second quarter.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon to tap Brazil beauty obsession with cosmetics partners
Description: Amazon.com Inc is recruiting major Brazilian cosmetics firms Grupo Boticario and Natura Cosmeticos SA to sell via the logistics platform it is developing in Brazil, three people familiar with talks told Reuters, making an early play for the world's fourth-largest beauty market.

Headlines: How Reuters reported the AT&T-Time Warner ruling first
Description: For U.S. media companies and investors, it was the ruling of the decade.

Headlines: AT&T closes $85 billion deal for Time Warner
Description: AT&T Inc, the No. 2 wireless carrier, on Thursday closed its $85 billion deal to acquire media company Time Warner Inc after U.S. antitrust regulators indicated they would not seek a delay.

Headlines: Atlanta Fed raises U.S. second quarter GDP view to 4.8 percent
Description: The U.S. economy is growing at a 4.8 percent annualized rate in the second quarter, the Atlanta Federal Reserve's GDPNow forecast model showed on Thursday, following data that showed domestic retail sales grew at its strongest pace in six months in May.

Headlines: Malaysia to seek return of 1MDB money from banks, political parties
Description: Malaysia intends to recover all funds illicitly taken from 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB), and determine whether there are grounds for claims against companies, including Goldman Sachs , that profited from dealing with the beleaguered state fund.

Headlines: Cryptocurrency tether used to boost bitcoin prices, study finds
Description: There is evidence that tether, a digital currency pegged to the U.S. dollar, may have been used to manipulate the price of bitcoin <BTC=BTSP> and other cryptocurrencies, according to a research paper released by the University of Texas on Wednesday.

Headlines: EU nations back retaliating against U.S. steel tariffs
