Description: U.S. President Donald Trump, who recently called on OPEC producers to help reduce oil prices, has raised prices through his tweets, Iranian OPEC Governor Hossein Kazempour Ardebili was quoted as saying by news agency SHANA on Thursday.

Headlines: Trade war could hurt these economies far more than U.S., China
Description: Investors watching the trade tit-for-tat between the United States and China may well have reason to fear the havoc a full blown conflict between the world's two biggest economies could wreak on the global economy.

Headlines: Singapore proposes fines on Grab, Uber, says merger harms competition
Description: Singapore's anti-trust body proposed fines on ride-hailing firms Grab and Uber, provisionally finding that their merger had reduced competition and suggesting remedies such as the sale of their car-leasing businesses.

Headlines: EU states back measures to limit steel imports after U.S. tariffs
Description: European Union countries voted on Thursday in favor of provisional measures proposed by the European Commission to curb steel imports into the bloc, following a U.S. decision to slap tariffs on EU steel and aluminum.

Headlines: Trump effort to lift U.S. offshore wind sector sparks interest - from Europe
Description: The Trump administration wants to fire up development of the U.S. offshore wind industry by streamlining permitting and carving out vast areas off the coast for leasing - part of its 'America First' policy to boost domestic energy production and jobs.

Headlines: Exclusive: JPMorgan triggers EU talent transfer as 'dozens' prepare for Brexit move
Description: JPMorgan has asked "several dozen" employees to lead a first wave of relocations from Britain to continental Europe by early 2019, kicking off plans to protect its business post-Brexit, a memo to staff shows.

Headlines: U.S. services sector activity picks up; jobless claims rise
Description: U.S. services sector activity picked up in June amid strong growth in new orders, but trade tariffs and a shortage of workers were starting to strain the supply chain, which could slow momentum in the coming months.

Headlines: EchoStar drops $3.2 billion bid for British rival Inmarsat
Description: U.S. satellite group EchoStar dropped a $3.2 billion takeover approach for Inmarsat on Friday after failing with a late attempt to persuade the British company into talks.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. June payrolls gain more than expected
Description: U.S. job growth increased more than expected in June as manufacturers stepped up hiring, but steady wage gains pointed to moderate inflation pressures that should keep the Federal Reserve on a path of gradual interest rate increases.

Headlines: German government, JPMorgan deny report on Deutsche Bank
Description: The German government dismissed a report that it had privately raised concerns about Deutsche Bank , while JPMorgan denied it was interested in a stake in Germany's biggest lender.

Headlines: Oil mixed as investors short-cover and Saudi boosts output
Description: Oil was mixed on Friday, with short-covering pushing up U.S. crude futures while Brent slipped on global trade tensions and increased Saudi production.

Headlines: Dollar slumps after U.S. nonfarm payrolls data, tariffs kick in
Description: The dollar hit three-week lows on Friday after data showed the U.S. economy created more jobs than expected in June, but a closely watched inflation gauge - wage growth - rose less than forecast and the unemployment rate increased.

Headlines: Ford slides deeper into China rut after worst ever first half vehicle sales
Description: Ford Motor’s China slump intensified, with vehicle sales tumbling 38 percent in June and the automaker recording its worst-ever first half, as buyers shunned its aging models that are awaiting overhauls and flocked to rivals.

Headlines: World stock markets edge higher as U.S.-China trade tariffs kick in
Description: World stock markets rose and the euro climbed to a three-week peak on Friday as the threat of tariffs by the United States and China on billions of dollars of trade became a reality, though concerns about the conflict escalating capped the appetite for risk.

Headlines: Curbs on Chinese investment could hit Detroit and Silicon Valley
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to block Chinese investment in U.S. companies could be trouble for a number of American automotive and technology companies using Chinese funds to develop electric and self-driving cars and related services, from Tesla Inc to dozens of Silicon Valley startups.

Headlines: U.S. jobs growth lifts Wall Street, offsetting tariffs
Description: U.S. stocks climbed on Friday, with the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq hitting their highest levels in two weeks, as strong U.S. jobs growth blunted the impact of an escalating U.S.-China trade dispute.

Headlines: BP in lead to acquire BHP's U.S. onshore shale assets: sources
Description: BP Plc is in the lead to acquire the U.S. onshore shale oil and gas assets of BHP Billiton Ltd after submitting an offer worth well in excess of $10 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Who has Fed Chair Powell's ear? Lawmakers and bankers
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell spends more time with U.S. lawmakers, White House advisers, and bankers than did his predecessor Janet Yellen, who tended to favor meetings with professors, the Treasury secretary and community advocates.

Headlines: U.S. job growth underscores economy's strength, tariffs a threat
Description: The U.S. economy created more jobs than expected in June, but steady wage gains pointed to moderate inflation pressures that should keep the Federal Reserve on a path of gradual interest rate increases this year.

Headlines: Trump's $500 billion trade threat makes China's already battered investors shiver
Description: Six months of wrangling over trade tariffs with the United States has wiped out about a fifth of China's stock market value and driven its currency down sharply. But those moves may have just been a downpayment on what is yet to come.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. tariffs could be applied to Chinese goods worth $500 billion
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday the United States may ultimately impose tariffs on more than a half-trillion dollars' worth of Chinese goods as the world's two largest economies hurtled toward the start of a trade war.

Headlines: Chen to become sole chairman of debt-laden HNA after Wang's death
Description: China's HNA Group said it has made co-founder Chen Feng its sole chairman after fellow chairman Wang Jian died this week, moving to calm concerns about leadership amidst the conglomerate's efforts to slash its massive debt burden.

Headlines: Germany denies Merkel discussed health of Deutsche with UBS boss
Description: The German government denied on Friday that Chancellor Angela Merkel had asked a top banking executive about his views on troubled lender Deutsche Bank.

Headlines: No one gains in a trade war, China's premier says
Description: No one will gain from a trade war, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said on Friday, speaking hours after the United States and China slapped tit-for-tat duties on $34 billion worth of the other's imports.

Headlines: EU says U.S.-China tariff hikes damaging, trade wars 'not easy to win'
Description: European Union Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmstrom said in a tweet on Friday that she was worried about the tit-for-tat tariff hikes between the United States and China, and warned about where the escalation was leading.

Headlines: How trade war with U.S. can hurt growth in China and beyond
Description: The United States is due to impose tariffs on $34 billion of goods it imports from China on Friday. Tariffs on an extra $16 billion may come later.

Headlines: Exclusive: Credit Suisse creates new anti-sexual harassment role
Description: Credit Suisse has carved out a new role to lead its handling of sexual harassment claims and examine group-wide policies, as Switzerland's second-biggest bank seeks to boost equal opportunities and create a fair treatment environment.

Headlines: Cultural mix a hidden weapon in Nestle CEO's activist defense
Description: Growing up in Germany, Mark Schneider was pushed to become fluent in English by his father, who believed it would give him an edge.

Headlines: Dueling tariffs raise fears of long U.S.-China trade battle
Description: The United States and China exchanged the first salvos in what could become a protracted trade war on Friday, slapping tariffs on $34 billion worth of each others’ goods and giving no sign of willingness to start talks aimed at a reaching a truce.

Headlines: Venezuela's domestic airline industry suffers amid economic crisis
Description: Venezuela's domestic airline industry is struggling to maintain operations due to hyperinflation and shortages of spare parts, according to an industry association, making it increasingly hard to obtain tickets and causing chronic flight delays.

Headlines: Paypal to spend $3 billion a year on M&A: CEO to German paper
Description: PayPal Holdings Inc is on the lookout for further acquisitions following its recent takeover of iZettle, the Swedish fintech startup, for $2.2 billion, in the U.S. payments company's biggest ever deal.

Headlines: China's CATL to build its first European EV battery factory in Germany
Description: Chinese battery maker Contemporary Amperex Technology Ltd (CATL) will build its first production site in Europe in Germany, agreeing a major contract with BMW to supply lithium-ion batteries.

Headlines: U.S. mergers help bank fees spike to record highs
Description: NEW YORK (LPC) - A record $1.45 trillion of US syndicated lending to companies for acquisitions, leveraged buyouts, dividends and refinancing in the first half of the year has propelled bank fees from arranging the loans to all-time highs.

Headlines: Sterling slides as foreign minister's resignation heaps pressure on May
Description: Sterling slid on Monday after the resignation of the British foreign minister heaped pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May, but its losses were expected to be contained unless a full-blown leadership challenge materialized.

Headlines: Embraer shareholder files complaint against Boeing deal: paper
Description: A shareholder of planemaker Embraer SA filed a complaint with Brazil's securities regulator against a planned takeover of its commercial aircraft arm by Boeing Co , newspaper Valor Econômico reported on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. states probe fast-food franchise deals not to poach workers
Description: A group of U.S. state attorneys general is investigating whether Five Guys, Panera, Burger King and other big fast food chains are using "no-poach" rules in franchise agreements to hold down wages and limit employee advancement, the officials said on Monday.

Headlines: Dow, S&P 500 post best session in over a month; banks lead gains
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Monday, giving the Dow and S&P 500 their biggest gains in more than a month, as bank shares jumped ahead of earnings reports later this week.

Headlines: HPE could mitigate impact of future U.S. tariffs, CEO says
Description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co can boost manufacturing at its facility in Wisconsin if trade tensions with China escalate, Chief Executive Antonio Neri said on Monday.

Headlines: Uber, Alphabet invest in bike sharing service Lime
Description: Bike sharing service Lime said on Monday it raised $335 million from a group of investors including ride-sharing firm Uber Technologies Inc and Alphabet Inc .

Headlines: Do not blame OPEC, oil producer group says of Trump criticism
Description: The president of OPEC defended the oil producer group on Monday against U.S. President Donald Trump’s recent demands for higher oil output, saying OPEC does not shoulder the blame.

Headlines: Citigroup, with limited options, hopes to lure deposits digitally
Description: Citigroup Inc is facing a unique dilemma among the four largest U.S. banks: it is light on deposits from individuals, an important funding source that costs little and tends to stick around.

Headlines: Nissan admits to more testing misconduct for cars sold in Japan
Description: Nissan Motor said on Monday it had improperly measured exhaust emissions and fuel economy for 19 vehicle models sold in Japan, the second case in less than a year where misconduct has been discovered in its inspection processes.

Headlines: Norway denies holding up Tesla move to improve service
Description: Norway has rejected a suggestion it is holding up Tesla's efforts to improve service in its third-biggest market, saying the electric carmaker has not yet applied to use the mobile service vans it says it needs to solve its problems.

Headlines: The Foxconns of fast beauty propel South Korean cosmetics' success in China
Description: At a factory two hours south of Seoul, women clad in plastic caps and masks put peach-colored eye-shadow into cases, right next to a machine churning out a skin-color face powder.

Headlines: Daimler, Bosch to deploy self-driving taxis in California test program
Description: German automaker Daimler AG and auto supplier Bosch Corp [ROBSCJ.UL] will deploy self-driving taxis in California's Silicon Valley region next year as part of a test program of vehicles designed for city driving, the two companies said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. stocks rise on earnings optimism; dollar gains
Description: The S&P 500 stock index closed at a more than five-month high on Tuesday, boosted by expectations for strong earnings, while the U.S. dollar rose against the safe-haven Japanese yen as waning trade war fears drove a bid for riskier assets.

Headlines: U.S. may list tariffs on $200 billion more Chinese products: official
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is likely to publish this week a list of $200 billion in additional Chinese products to be hit with tariffs, possibly as early as later on Tuesday, an administration official said.

Headlines: Pfizer delays drug price hikes after talking with Trump
Description: Pfizer Inc said on Tuesday it was deferring drug price increases for no more than six months after the company's chief executive officer had an extensive conversation with U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: China commerce ministry official says new U.S. tariff plan harms WTO system, globalization
Description: China's assistant commerce minister said on Wednesday that the latest proposed tariffs from the United States harms the World Trade Organization system and hurts globalization.

Headlines: SoftBank's Son says to carry on with deals despite trade jitters
Description: SoftBank Group Corp CEO Masayoshi Son said on Tuesday he was optimistic that U.S. President Donald Trump's escalation of trade disputes and heightened scrutiny of foreign investments would not affect the Japanese firm's prolific dealmaking.

Headlines: Airbus wins JetBlue order for its newly rebranded A220
Description: Airbus SE scored a key victory on Tuesday, with U.S. airline JetBlue announcing it would buy 60 of its A220-300 narrowbody jets, the first major order for the planemaker's newly rebranded program as its battle with rival Boeing Co intensifies.

Headlines: Old fashion: Vintage boom buoys RealReal and jolts luxury labels
Description: Second-hand fashion, once confined to thrift stores, is outstripping sales growth in the primary luxury goods sector, helping market leader The RealReal expand its business and prompting international labels to look at tie-ups.

Headlines: Former Goldman Sachs banker in 1MDB plea talks with U.S.: WSJ
Description: A former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. banker is in talks with U.S. prosecutors to potentially plead guilty to criminal charges stemming from an alleged scheme to steal billions of dollars from a Malaysian state investment fund, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: China raises tariff rates for some U.S. optical fiber products, from July 11
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Tuesday it is raising "anti-dumping tariff rates" for some optical fiber products originating from the United States, effective on Wednesday, July 11.

Headlines: VW agrees Chinese cooperation on e-mobility, autonomous driving
Description: Volkswagen said it has agreed to cooperate with China's FAW Group and the China Intelligent and Connected Vehicles Research Institute (ICV) on technologies including e-mobility, connectivity and autonomous driving.

Headlines: Air France-KLM CEO hunt signals industry strategy shift under Macron
Description: The hunt for a new chief executive to lead Air France-KLM, a group hobbled by union resistance to cost-cutting at its French brand, is testing President Emmanuel Macron's resolve for a lighter state touch on the economy.

Headlines: Bike-share schemes battle for Paris turf, but it's not all free-wheeling
Description: Grabbing a bicycle from a docking station and riding the streets of Paris used to be one of the city's many charms, but the once-loved Velib system has fallen into disarray and some new dockless bike-share schemes are struggling to survive.

Headlines: Trump told Pfizer CEO price hikes hurt his drug plan: source
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump called Pfizer Chief Executive Ian Read on Tuesday to say the company's July 1 price hikes had complicated the administration's drug pricing plans, prompting the company to defer its planned increases, according to a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Pfizer separates consumer health unit in business rejig
Description: Pfizer Inc announced plans on Wednesday to reorganize into three units, separating its consumer healthcare business that the U.S. drugmaker has been trying to sell since last year.

Headlines: Brazil prosecutors allege jailed GE executive helped company partake in medical cartel
Description: General Electric Co's chief executive for Latin America took part in a medical equipment price-fixing scheme while at the conglomerate, making it a member of an international health-care cartel, according to allegations in a document filed by federal prosecutors.

Headlines: Stocks, oil prices slide on trade war worries
Description: Concerns about an escalating U.S.-China trade war made markets topsy-turvy on Wednesday, with U.S. stocks breaking a four-session winning streak and Brent crude prices seeing their biggest one-day drop in two years.

Headlines: Glencore faces lawsuits over U.S. subpoena, stock drop
Description: Glencore Plc faces at least two lawsuits by U.S. shareholders accusing the big Anglo-Swiss mining company of having made false and misleading disclosures before it received a subpoena in a corruption probe, and its stock tumbled.

Headlines: Dollar hits six-month high against yen on strong inflation
Description: The U.S. dollar strengthened against the Japanese yen on Wednesday as trade tensions mounted and after the Labor Department's expectation-beating inflation report, which increased prospects that the Federal Reserve will raise interest rates another two times this year.

Headlines: Walmex's new e-commerce VP eyes groceries to propel online business
Description: Wal Mart de Mexico's new e-commerce head plans to play to its strengths in grocery deliveries to help the country's largest retailer stand apart from rivals, like Amazon.com Inc and his former employer MercadoLibre Inc, he said in an interview Wednesday.

Headlines: Walmart looks to exit Japan with Seiyu supermarket sale: NIkkei
Description: U.S. retailer Walmart Inc has decided to sell Japanese supermarket chain Seiyu and has already approached major retailers and private equity funds, the Nikkei business daily reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbus faces A330 delivery delays amid HNA Group woes - sources
Description: Airbus faces a logjam of undelivered A330 jets worth well over $1 billion for airlines affiliated to China's debt-laden HNA Group following a stand-off over late payments, according to industry sources and a Reuters examination of parked aircraft.

Headlines: Wall Street snaps four-day rally; latest trade threat weighs
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Wednesday, breaking a four-session streak of gains after Washington's threat to impose tariffs on an additional $200 billion worth of Chinese goods fanned trade war fears, while a sharp drop in oil prices hit energy shares.

Headlines: U.S. producer inflation rises on strong services gains
Description: U.S. producer prices increased more than expected in June amid gains in the cost of services and motor vehicles, leading to the biggest annual increase in 6-1/2 years.

Headlines: Canada's Tim Hortons to enter China as it battles slump at home
Description: Fast-food company Restaurant Brands International said on Wednesday it plans to open 1,500 outlets of its Canadian coffee-and-donut chain Tim Hortons in China over the next decade, capitalizing on a growing cafe culture in the world's second-largest economy.

Headlines: China's CIC sovereign fund says trade war would hurt its investments
Description: The president of China's CIC sovereign wealth fund said on Wednesday that a trade war appeared unavoidable, and that the dispute would have a negative impact on CIC's investments.

Headlines: U.S. House Speaker Ryan: tariffs not the way to go in China trade dispute
Description: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan said on Wednesday tariffs are not the right tool to use in the trade dispute with China, although Beijing engages in unfair trade practices.

Headlines: U.S. House Speaker Ryan: tariffs not the way to go in China trade dispute
Description: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan said on Wednesday tariffs are not the right tool to use in the trade dispute with China, although Beijing engages in unfair trade practices.

Headlines: U.S. May wholesale inventories revised higher
Description: U.S. wholesale inventories were a bit higher than initially estimated in May amid strong increases in the stocks of machinery and a range of other goods.

Headlines: Dollar gains sustained by trade war risk, rising inflation
Description: The U.S. dollar held steady at a six-month high against the Japanese yen and a two-month high against the Swiss franc on Thursday, bolstered by solid inflation data and investor sentiment that the greenback stands to benefit from a trade war.

Headlines: House Speaker casts doubt on Congress acting to stop trade tariffs
Description: U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan said on Thursday that while he does not support President Donald Trump's moves to impose tariffs on major U.S. trading partners' goods, he questioned the wisdom of Congress taking legislative action to stop such sanctions.

Headlines: France's La Poste plans to buy stake in insurer CNP Assurances: source
Description: France's La Poste is planning to buy the stake in insurer CNP Assurances held by state-owned investment fund Caisse des Depots though the details of the deal are not yet finalised, a source close to the mail company told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: China says 'bully' United States started a trade war
Description: The United States has started a trade war and China will defend itself, Chinese Vice Minister of Commerce Wang Shouwen said on Thursday, urging the United States to "take the gun" of tariffs away to smooth the way for talks.

Headlines: A decade on, pre-crisis mortgages linger for big banks, homeowners
Description: A decade on big U.S. banks are still running down and selling off crisis-era mortgages, a process executives point to as weighing on loan growth.

Headlines: P&G says Canada denies tariff exemptions, many products hit
Description: Many Procter & Gamble Co products sold in Canada - from Febreze candles to Gillette shaving foam - will be affected by retaliatory tariffs on U.S.-made goods after Canadian authorities rejected a request for exemptions, a P&G spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. stock futures hit five-month high
Description: U.S. stock futures rose to a five-month high on Friday, extending their recent rally on expectations of solid earnings growth among U.S. firms despite threats from trade wars.

Headlines: Apple launches $300 million green energy fund in China
Description: Apple Inc will launch a $300 million clean energy fund in China, the firm said in a statement on Friday, working with its suppliers to invest in renewable energy projects that could power close to 1 million homes in the country.

Headlines: Wall Street bounces back; technology, industrials lead
Description: U.S. stocks climbed on Thursday as top technology names hit record highs and industrials rebounded from losses driven by trade worries the day before.

Headlines: China says has not been in touch with U.S. about restarting trade talks
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday that China has not been in touch with the United States about restarting trade negotiations and said complaints about forced technology transfers and IP theft are unacceptable.

Headlines: U.S. would re-open trade talks if China makes major changes: Mnuchin
Description: The United States and China could reopen talks on trade but only if Beijing is willing to make significant changes, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday.

Headlines: China does not need U.S. soybeans for state reserves: Sinograin official
Description: China, the world's top soybean buyer, can fully meet the needs of its state soybean reserves without importing from the United States, an official with the state stockpiler told state TV on Thursday.

Headlines: As Trump amps up trade war, China plays nice with foreign investors
Description: Long accused of protectionist tactics that make it a difficult place for foreign firms to operate, China is trying to reverse that narrative amid an escalating trade war with the United States, green-lighting huge investments and portraying itself as a champion of openness.

Headlines: Chipmaker Broadcom inks $19 billion deal to buy software company CA
Description: Broadcom Inc announced a $18.9 billion deal to buy U.S. business software company CA Inc on Wednesday, venturing far beyond its realm of semiconductors and testing investors' confidence in its Chief Executive Hock Tan's dealmaking credentials.

Headlines: Britain finally clears Murdoch's Fox to bid for Sky
Description: Britain finally cleared Rupert Murdoch to buy Sky on Thursday, removing the final obstacle to a head-to-head battle between Murdoch's Twenty-First Century Fox and U.S. rival Comcast for the European pay-TV prize.

Headlines: BMW says developing joint venture with China's Brilliance
Description: German carmaker BMW said it was developing its joint venture with China's Brilliance but did not confirm reports it would raise its stake in BMW Brilliance Automotive (BBA).

Headlines: China says industrial policies mainly serve as guidance, open to all
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday industrial policies including "Made in China 2025" mainly serve as guidance under market conditions and they are open to all foreign firms.

Headlines: Sky shares leap as Comcast and Fox lock horns in bid battle
Description: Sky shares leapt to an 18-year high on Thursday as investors bet a transatlantic battle for the European pay-TV group had further to run, after Comcast's $34 billion bid trumped an offer from Rupert Murdoch made just hours earlier.

Headlines: U.S. inflation steadily firming; labor market strong
Description: U.S. consumer prices recorded their largest increase in nearly 6-1/2 years in the year through June, while the monthly pace continued to suggest a steady buildup of inflation that could keep the Federal Reserve on a path of gradual interest rate increases.

Headlines: Glencore shares under cloud after U.S demands Congo documents in probe
Description: A U.S. demand for documents related to Glencore's assets in Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) as part of a corruption probe has rattled investors and is likely to weigh on the miner's performance until there is more clarity on the case.

Headlines: Main Fiat Chrysler unions dismiss Ronaldo strike call as stunt
Description: Unions representing the majority of workers at Fiat Chrysler in Italy rejected a strike called by an independent labor group in protest against the huge sums of money spent by Italy's Juventus soccer club to sign Cristiano Ronaldo.

Headlines: Rising fares push Delta past profit estimates
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc topped estimates for quarterly profit and operating revenue Thursday as a rise in average fares trumped an almost 40 percent surge in fuel costs, pushing shares higher.

Headlines: China's imports to U.S. ports start peaking early amid tariff threat
Description: Chinese imports to U.S. ports rose more than expected in June, suggesting that some retailers moved up orders to insulate themselves from an intensifying trade war that threatens to send up costs on a growing number of consumer products.

Headlines: Fed emphasizes 'solid' U.S economic growth, repeats gradual approach
Description: The Federal Reserve on Friday pointed to "solid" U.S. economic growth during the first half of the year in its semi-annual report to Congress, where it also reiterated that it expected to continue to raise interest rates gradually.

Headlines: U.S. stocks rise on industrials; dollar flattens
Description: The benchmark S&P 500 index hit a more than five-month high on Friday on gains in industrial stocks and energy companies, while the safe-haven U.S. dollar flattened after touching a two-week high.

Headlines: S&P 500 at five-month high, but banks weigh after results
Description: U.S. stocks rose slightly on Friday, putting the S&P 500 at its highest closing level in more than five months, as gains in industrials and other areas offset a drop in financials after results from three of the big banks mostly disappointed.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter, Alphabet to testify at U.S. House hearing
Description: The U.S. House Judiciary Committee will hold a hearing on Tuesday to take testimony from Facebook Inc, Alphabet Inc's YouTube unit and Twitter Inc on whether social media companies are filtering content for political reasons, the committee chairman said.

Headlines: U.S. banks gain from Washington policy changes but trade worries loom
Description: Second-quarter earnings reports from three of the biggest U.S. banks on Friday showed the sector is benefiting from policy changes in Washington that have lowered their taxes, boosted interest rates and allowed them to buy back more stock.

Headlines: Comcast to pay advisers as much as 243 million pound in fees for Sky takeover
Description: Comcast expects to pay the banks, law firms and other advisers on its 25.9 billion pound ($34.23 billion) bid for Sky as much as 243 million pounds if it wins the battle for the British broadcaster, the U.S. cable giant said on Friday.

Headlines: China's ZTE sees heavy losses in first half due to U.S. penalty
Description: Chinese telecoms equipment group ZTE Corp said on Friday it expected to record a net loss in the first half of the year due to the hefty fine it agreed in order to lift a U.S. ban on component supplies.

Headlines: China says U.S. should not use IP to suppress other countries' development
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday that the United States should not use intellectual property to suppress development in other countries.

Headlines: Late HNA chairman's stake in conglomerate to go to China-based charity: source
Description: Late HNA Group Co Ltd co-chairman Wang Jian's 14.98 percent stake in the conglomerate will be donated to a China-based charity foundation that is already among its top shareholders, said a person with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: JPMorgan profit beats on better-than-expected trading, loan growth
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co's quarterly profit topped Wall Street's expectations on Friday, as trading revenue came in much higher than expected and demand for loans increased on the back of a strengthening U.S. economy.

Headlines: U.S. import prices post biggest drop in over two years
Description: U.S. import prices fell the most in more than two years in June as prices for petroleum products fell and a strong dollar weighed on the costs of other goods.

Headlines: Goldman sees 60 percent chance of more U.S. tariffs on China
Description: Goldman Sachs economists said on Friday they placed a 60 percent chance the Trump administration would impose duties on an additional $200 billion worth of Chinese imports that were recently targeted.

Headlines: Brazil's Embraer sees demand for 10,550 smaller jets in next 20 years
Description: Brazil's Embraer sees demand for 10,550 new aircraft with a capacity of up to 150 seats in the next 20 years, worth around $600 billion, the planemaker said on Sunday.

Headlines: U.S. oil boom delivers surprise for traders - and it's costly
Description: The world's biggest oil traders are counting hefty losses after a surprise doubling in the price discount of U.S. light crude to benchmark Brent in just a month, as surging U.S production upends the market.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce plans for take-off in flying taxi market
Description: British jet engine maker Rolls-Royce has designed a propulsion system for a flying taxi and is starting a search for partners to help develop a project it hopes could take to the skies as soon as early next decade.

Headlines: Strong U.S. retail sales lift second-quarter GDP estimates
Description: U.S. retail sales rose solidly in June as households boosted purchases of automobiles and a range of other goods, cementing expectations for robust economic growth in the second quarter.

Headlines: IMF warns of growing damage from trade fight, says U.S. vulnerable
Description: Escalating and sustained trade conflicts following U.S. tariff actions threaten to derail economic recovery and depress medium-term growth prospects, the International Monetary Fund warned on Monday.

Headlines: Northrop Grumman upbeat on talks for German drone contract
Description: Northrop Grumman Corp is upbeat about the prospects for the sale of its high-altitude Triton MQ-4C unmanned surveillance system to Germany, but says the deal could take several years to complete.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp in leadership turmoil as chairman quits
Description: The chairman of Germany's Thyssenkrupp has resigned, following the company's chief executive under pressure from activist shareholders demanding a radical restructuring of the embattled industrial conglomerate.

Headlines: U.S. arms makers praise new U.S. weapons export policy
Description: U.S. arms makers attending the Farnborough Airshow in Britain on Monday lauded the U.S. government's push to sell more weapons overseas and said they expected European defense spending to increase in the coming years.

Headlines: Lockheed wins $451 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp is being awarded a $451 million contract modification to a previously awarded contract for material and detail design in support of the construction of four Multi Mission Surface Combatant ships, the Pentagon said on Monday.

Headlines: Bank of America profit beats on consumer loan growth, lower expenses
Description: Bank of America Corp reported quarterly profit above analyst expectations on Monday as the second-largest U.S. lender cut expenses and benefited from growth in loans and deposits on the back of a strengthening economy.

Headlines: S&P 500 dips as energy shares fall; Netflix tumbles late after results
Description: The S&P 500 ended slightly lower on Monday following a drop in oil prices that weighed on energy shares and offset a jump in financials as Bank of America's results reinforced expectations of a strong U.S. earnings season.

Headlines: Fast-growing e-cigarette maker Juul to launch in UK
Description: Silicon Valley e-cigarette start-up Juul Labs is bringing its small flash drive-sized vaping device to the United Kingdom this week, aiming to reproduce its break-neck U.S. growth overseas.

Headlines: Jetmakers see brisk start to air show as UK tries to soothe Brexit worries
Description: Planemakers racked up more than $20 billion of deals on the opening day of the Farnborough Airshow on Monday, suggesting demand for new passenger jets remains in rude health despite worries over trade tensions and Brexit.

Headlines: Ford agrees to $299.1 million U.S. Takata air bag settlement
Description: Ford Motor Co agreed to a so-called economic loss settlement of $299.1 million covering at least 6 million U.S. vehicles with potentially faulty Takata air bag inflators, court documents filed in a federal court in Miami on Monday show.

Headlines: IBM seeks $167 million from Groupon in dispute over early internet patents
Description: International Business Machines Corp on Monday asked a U.S. jury to award it $167 million in a lawsuit accusing e-commerce marketplace operator Groupon Inc of using patented technology without authorization.

Headlines: Exclusive: Brazil to delay auction for five of six Eletrobras distributors
Description: Brazil's government will go ahead with the auction of one of state-owned utility Eletrobras' power distributors planned for July 26, while delaying five others to Aug. 30, Planning Minister Esteves Colnago told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: UK looking to Sweden, Japan in search for partners on new fighter jet
Description: Britain is talking to a number of potential partners for its new fighter jet project, Tempest, which it launched on Monday, a senior official in the UK's Royal Air Force told Reuters.

Headlines: Rebates protect Canada's auto industry from retaliatory tariffs
Description: Canadian government customs provisions are expected to soften the blow on the country's powerful automotive industry from retaliatory tariffs on U.S. steel, according to trade lawyers and industry leaders bracing for higher costs.

Headlines: Hong Kong's bourse brushes off Chinese snub over dual-class shares
Description: Hong Kong's exchange described as "temporary" a dispute with its Shanghai and Shenzhen counterparts over plans to bar investor access to dual-class shares, as shares in smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp recovered from the depths of its 10-percent slide on Monday.

Headlines: Boeing, Jackson Square reach firm agreement for 30 737 MAX 8 aircraft
Description: Boeing Co and U.S. aircraft leasing firm Jackson Square Aviation said on Monday they had reached a firm agreement over the purchase of 30 737 MAX 8 aircraft.

Headlines: GE Aviation CEO says changes at GE no constraint for his business
Description: The overhaul at U.S. industrial giant General Electric Co is not a constraint for its aviation arm, "in fact I feel it's the very opposite," the head of GE Aviation said on Monday.

Headlines: Golden Falcon confirms order for 25 A320neos for Wataniya
Description: Golden Falcon Aviation has confirmed an order for 25 Airbus A320neo jets for Kuwait's Wataniya Airways worth around $2.8 billion at list prices, Golden Falcon said on Monday.

Headlines: Qatar Airways finalizes order for five Boeing 777 freighters
Description: Qatar Airways has finalized an order to buy five 777 freighters from U.S. planemaker Boeing , the two companies said on Monday.

Headlines: Air France-KLM creates single joint venture with Chinese partners
Description: Air France, KLM , China Southern Airlines and Xiamen Airlines will merge their existing joint venture agreements, the Franco-Dutch airline group said on Monday.

Headlines: Boeing, United announce order for four 787 dreamliners
Description: United Airlines said on Monday it would buy four new Boeing Co 787-9 widebody jetliners, as the third-largest U.S. air carrier looks to refresh its fleet with more efficient planes.

Headlines: Deutsche surprises market with earnings forecast upgrade
Description: Deutsche Bank expects second-quarter net profits will be more than double analysts' forecasts in a rare piece of good news for Germany's largest bank which is cutting costs to try to revive profitability.

Headlines: Linde sells assets for $3.3 billion to help get Praxair deal cleared
Description: Linde is raising $3.3 billion from selling North and South American assets to a consortium of German gases firm Messer and buyout group CVC as it seeks clearance for a planned $87 billion merger with U.S. group Praxair .

Headlines: Ryanair cancels 1 percent of flights on Friday as strike crisis deepens
Description: Ryanair plans to cancel only 1 percent of its flights during a strike by Ireland-based pilots on Friday, but Europe's largest low-cost airline is bracing for far wider industrial action across five countries next week.

Headlines: UK government wins approval for Brexit trade law in lower house of parliament
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May won approval from the lower of house of parliament on Tuesday for a law needed to let Britain pursue an independent trade policy once it leaves the European Union.

Headlines: Eurofighter buy would help Belgium secure role in future fighter: BAE
Description: Belgium is being offered a possible role in future European combat jet developments if it picks the Eurofighter Typhoon over the U.S.-built F-35, in a fierce contest to rearm the country's air force, a senior official with Britain's BAE Systems said.

Headlines: UK PM May suffers parliament defeat over plans to leave European medicines network
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May suffered an embarrassing defeat on a trade law that means ministers must now seek to secure an agreement that allows Britain to have continued participation in the European medicines regulatory framework.

Headlines: U.S. judge questions scope of indictment against Insys founder
Description: A federal judge on Tuesday expressed concern about the scope of an indictment against several former Insys Therapeutics Inc executives accused of bribing doctors to prescribe an opioid and suggested U.S. prosecutors streamline the case to avoid its dismissal.

Headlines: EU chief to visit Trump on July 25 for trade talks
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker will visit U.S. President Donald Trump in Washington on July 25 to discuss strained trade ties.

Headlines: Boeing CEO says Embraer deal offers thrifty suppliers more volume
Description: Boeing Co sees scope for additional cost savings from suppliers as it expands through the proposed acquisition of the regional jet business of Brazil's Embraer SA , Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Social media companies defend filtering practices before Congress
Description: Facebook Inc , Alphabet Inc and Twitter Inc told a U.S. House panel on Tuesday that the social media companies are not discriminating against content for political reasons.

Headlines: Dollar firms after Fed chair's upbeat remarks, global stocks gain
Description: The U.S. dollar rose on Tuesday against a basket of major currencies following an upbeat economic assessment from the head of the U.S. Federal Reserve, while world stocks climbed as a heavy week of corporate earnings also kicked into gear.

Headlines: U.S. labor board judge rejects McDonald's bid to settle franchisees' case
Description: A judge with a U.S. labor agency on Tuesday rejected McDonald's Corp's proposed settlement of a major case on whether the fast-food company is accountable for alleged labor law violations by franchisees across the country.

Headlines: Fed's Powell: Years of strong jobs, low inflation still ahead
Description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said on Tuesday he sees the United States on track for years more of steady growth, but was challenged in a congressional hearing by senators worried the Trump administration's trade policies were already damaging businesses in their districts.

Headlines: Wall St. climbs on Powell comments, earnings
Description: Wall Street stocks rose on Tuesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average posting its fourth consecutive session of gains after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell expressed an optimistic U.S. economic view and solid earnings bolstered the outlook for a robust reporting period.

Headlines: CSX profit tops Wall St target on cost cuts, pricing power
Description: CSX Corp on Tuesday posted quarterly profit that topped Wall Street's target, as the No. 3 U.S. railroad operator benefited from an ongoing cost-cutting drive and rising prices for carrying freight.

Headlines: Manufacturing, mining power U.S. industrial production
Description: U.S. industrial production increased in June, boosted by a sharp rebound in manufacturing and further gains in mining output, the latest sign of robust economic growth in the second quarter.

Headlines: U.S. ban on China’s ZTE forces telecoms to rethink business: sources
Description: The U.S. trade ban on Chinese telecom equipment maker ZTE wreaked havoc at wireless carriers in Europe and South Asia and forced operators worldwide to consider broadening their supply networks, industry sources told Reuters.

Headlines: ICBC behind 'unidentified' provisional $9 billion order for 80 Airbus A320neo: source
Description: China's ICBC Leasing has emerged as the major financier behind a provisional $8.8 billion order at list prices for 80 Airbus A320neo single-aisle jets, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Air Lease, Boeing strike $9.6 billion deal for 737s and 787s
Description: U.S. airplane leasing firm Air Lease Corp announced on Tuesday a commitment to order as many as 78 Boeing Co single-aisle and wide-body airplanes in a deal valued at $9.6 billion at list prices.

Headlines: IAG's Level airline plans budget long-haul flights from Vienna
Description: British Airways parent IAG plans to expand its long-haul network from Vienna with new budget brand Level, Chief Executive Willie Walsh said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Japan's regional jet not flying so high after air show prang
Description: Japan's efforts to show off its new regional jet, the MRJ, were dealt another setback on Tuesday after a prang forced it to skip a flying display at the Farnborough Airshow.

Headlines: UPS tests 'smart lock' technology in New York apartment buildings
Description: United Parcel Service Inc on Tuesday said it is testing "smart lock" technology that allows its delivery drivers to open doors and drop multiple packages at secure locations inside apartment buildings around New York City.The test includes "hundreds of non-doorman" multi-family buildings in Manhattan and Brooklyn that have installed Latch's "smart access system." The project comes as UPS is working to make "last-mile" e-commerce deliveries to households mo

Headlines: After delays, Japan's regional jet faces dogfight with industry giants
Description: Japan's Mitsubishi Aircraft Corp, trying to keep its new regional jet on track after series of delays, was forced to cancel a demo flight for the world's aerospace industry on Tuesday after the jet was hit by a truck.

Headlines: TUI likely to plump for larger variant of 737 MAX plane
Description: European travel and tourism group TUI is likely to plump for the larger variant of the Boeing 737 MAX plane when it exercises options on an existing order, a board member said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Asda proposes closure of London distribution center, 261 jobs at risk
Description: Asda, the British supermarket arm of Walmart that has agreed to be taken over by rival Sainsbury's , has proposed the closure of an online grocery distribution center in London, putting 261 jobs at risk, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: UnitedHealth second quarter medical costs miss estimates, shares slide
Description: UnitedHealth Group Inc, the largest U.S. health insurer, on Tuesday reported second-quarter medical costs slightly higher than Wall Street expectations, sending its shares down 4 percent and weighing on the rest of the sector.

Headlines: Exclusive: Kenya's Safaricom taking M-Pesa to Ethiopia, sources say
Description: Kenya's Safaricom is in advanced talks with the Ethiopian government to introduce its popular M-Pesa mobile money service, a major step towards establishing a toe-hold in the market of 100 million people, two sources said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Start-up backed by JetBlue founder commits to 60 Airbus A220 jets
Description: European planemaker Airbus said on Tuesday a U.S. airline start-up backed by investors including JetBlue founder David Neeleman had signed a provisional deal to buy 60 Airbus A220-300 aircraft.

Headlines: Europe hits Google with record $5 billion antitrust fine, appeal ahead
Description: European antitrust regulators fined Google a record 4.34 billion euro ($5 billion) on Wednesday and ordered it to stop using its popular Android mobile operating system to block rivals, a ruling which the U.S. tech company said it would appeal.

Headlines: World stocks climb to month peak, U.S. dollar hits three-week high
Description: Stocks on major world markets climbed to a one-month high on Wednesday after a raft of strong corporate earnings, while the U.S. dollar hit a three-week high against major currencies.

Headlines: Airbus inks deal to sell passenger planes to Uganda
Description: Airbus said on Wednesday it had signed an agreement to sell two commercial passenger planes to Uganda as part of the country's plan to revive its national airline which has been defunct for years.

Headlines: U.S. housing starts hit nine-month low; permits drop
Description: U.S. homebuilding fell to a nine-month low in June and permits for future construction declined for a third straight month, dealing a blow to the housing market as it struggles with a dearth of properties available for sale.

Headlines: Fed walks careful line on trade, but downside risks emerging
Description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell's official line on U.S. trade policy is one of careful deference to the Trump administration, acknowledging it is outside the Fed's responsibility and that it might all turn out for the best.

Headlines: Wall Street traders set for best year since aftermath of crisis
Description: Wall Street trading desks may have reached a post-crisis turning point, with revenue on track for the best year since 2011, second-quarter earnings reports from big U.S. banks showed.

Headlines: U.S. tariffs may raise cost of insurance, parts, drive up auto thefts
Description: A threat by the U.S. government to impose tariffs of up to 25 percent on imported auto parts could hit consumers in unexpected ways: higher repair costs, insurance premiums and even the theft of more cars for their parts, the industry said.

Headlines: U.S. regulatory panel gives Zions Bancorp green light to shed Fed oversight
Description: A top U.S. regulatory panel on Wednesday said it had preliminarily approved Zions Bancorp's petition to shed Federal Reserve oversight on the basis it is not systemically important to the U.S. financial system, in a further sign of regulatory easing.

Headlines: Alibaba to buy minority stake in Focus Media to tap digital marketing
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd on Wednesday said it has agreed to acquire a minority stake in China's Focus Media Information Technology Co Ltd to tap into the digital marketing sector.

Headlines: IBM gets boost from new businesses, tops estimates
Description: International Business Machines Corp on Wednesday reported second-quarter profit and revenue that topped analysts' expectations as it benefited from growth in higher-margin businesses including cybersecurity and cloud computing.

Headlines: U.S. tech enforcer says will read 'closely' EU statement on Google
Description: The head of the U.S. Federal Trade Commission, which has investigated Alphabet's Google in the past for abuse of web dominance, said on Wednesday he would take a close look at Europe's recent decision to fine the company 4.34 billion euros ($5 billion).

Headlines: Boeing gets $3.9 billion contract for new Air Force One jets
Description: Boeing Co has received a $3.9 billion contract to build two 747-8 aircraft for use as Air Force One by the U.S. president, due to be delivered by December 2024 and painted red, white and blue, officials said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China clips Air China's wings after descent scare
Description: China's aviation regulator will reduce Air China's Boeing 737 flights by 10 percent and cancel licenses of the pilot and co-pilot involved in an emergency descent last week, in a move analysts say could push the airline to cut some routes.

Headlines: China says U.S.-led trade war has become biggest 'confidence killer' for world economy
Description: The U.S.-driven trade war has become the biggest "confidence killer" for the global economy, China's foreign ministry warned on Wednesday, saying the whole world would fight back if the United States continued to be "wilful".

Headlines: EasyJet has flexibility to convert more of A320 order to larger A321neo: CEO
Description: EasyJet has the flexibility to convert more of an order for Airbus A320 planes into larger A321neos, the chief executive of the British low-cost airline said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Toshiba may face renewed shareholder accounting claims: U.S. appeals court
Description: A U.S. appeals court gave investors in Toshiba Corp's U.S.-listed securities another chance to show they suffered losses because the Japanese industrial conglomerate misled them about its internal controls before a 2015 accounting scandal.

Headlines: Exclusive: Canada housing agency pushes for better income checks to catch fraud
Description: Canada's housing agency has asked the country's tax authority to take a "more direct and formal role" verifying income claimed on mortgage applications, part of a two-year plan to tackle mortgage fraud, documents obtained by Reuters show.

Headlines: In response to Boeing jet plan, Airbus CEO says already in middle of market
Description: Airbus is not planning to respond with a new aircraft should U.S. rival Boeing go ahead with a proposed middle of the market jet, the European aerospace group’s chief executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Airbus says activating Brexit contingency plans as UK strategy 'unraveling'
Description: Airbus is activating its Brexit contingency plans as the British government's strategy for leaving the European Union appears to be "unraveling," the head of Europe's biggest planemaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: After record Google fine, EU's Vestager says she likes the U.S
Description: EU Competition Commissioner Margrethe Vestager said she "very much liked" the United States, countering a reported remark by President Donald Trump that she "hated" the country because of her antitrust actions against U.S. firms.

Headlines: UBS appoints new head of Luxembourg wealth management unit
Description: Swiss bank UBS will swap out leadership at its Luxembourg wealth management (WM) unit in October amid changes in the region, including the Swiss bank's move in January to acquire Nordea's private banking business there.

Headlines: Germany forces 1,050 Tesla owners to forgo electric car bonus
Description: Germany has said 1,050 owners of the Tesla Model S must forgo a 2,000 euro electric car subsidy because the value of their vehicles surpasses an eligibility threshold.

Headlines: British M&A regulator to review level of possible Disney offer for Sky
Description: Britain's takeover regulator said on Wednesday that it would review its ruling that Walt Disney might have to acquire UK broadcaster Sky for at least 14 pounds a share.

Headlines: Goldman sees U.S. two-month bill introduced in November
Description: Goldman Sachs analysts said on Wednesday the U.S. government would likely introduce a two-month bill issue at the November refunding and begin raising the auction size of five-year notes by a greater amount than its recent increase.

Headlines: Boeing in talks with Airbus, others for German helicopter bid
Description: Boeing Co is in talks with Airbus and other companies about joining its bid for a 4 billion euro ($4.7 billion) heavy-lift helicopter contract in Germany, the head of business development for Boeing's defence unit said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Novartis hints at 2018 outlook hike despite drug price freeze
Description: Novartis may ratchet up its 2018 sales outlook, its finance chief said on Wednesday, despite halting planned U.S. drug price hikes amid pressure on the industry from President Donald Trump's administration over the high cost of medicines.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley boss Gorman hits out at Fed stress tests
Description: Morgan Stanley's top executive criticized the Federal Reserve's annual health checks of the biggest U.S. lenders and predicted changes to the tests going forward after his bank reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings on Wednesday.

Headlines: Greece prepares to fly solo on bond markets
Description: Once the outcast of European bond markets, Greece appears firmly on the road to redemption.

Headlines: EU's Juncker 'upbeat and relaxed' ahead of Trump trade meeting
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said he was "upbeat and relaxed" ahead of his trip to Washington next week to discuss strained trade relations between the European Union and the United States.

Headlines: Uber hires former adviser to David Cameron to lead lobbying in northern Europe
Description: Uber Technologies has hired an ex-adviser to former British prime minister David Cameron to lead the ride-hailing firm's lobbying efforts in northern Europe, less than a month after the company won a reprieve to operate in London.

Headlines: Amazon hands goodwill to eBay with move to shut Australians out of overseas sites
Description: Australian home entertainment installer Paul Boon has relied for years on Amazon.com Inc's U.S. website for cheap wall racks and other parts to keep his costs down.

Headlines: Car share operators jump in as Paris Autolib scheme withers
Description: A string of private car-share operators are revving up business in Paris as the pioneering city-run Autolib scheme comes to an end and city authorities promote car sharing over private ownership.

Headlines: Kimberly-Clark weighs sale of European tissues business: sources
Description: Kimberly-Clark Corp is exploring a sale of its European tissue business, as it tries to slash costs and combat slowing sales by exiting less profitable areas, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Trump slams EU over $5 billion fine on Google
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday criticized the European Union over a record $5 billion fine EU antitrust regulators imposed on Google, saying the bloc was taking advantage of the United States.

Headlines: Dollar pares back after Trump comments; world stocks dip
Description: The U.S. dollar pulled back from year-high levels on Thursday after U.S. President Donald Trump expressed concern about a strong currency, while disappointing earnings reports and escalating trade tensions weighed on stocks.

Headlines: U.S. stocks fall on sour earnings, trade fears
Description: U.S. stocks dropped on Thursday after earnings disappointed and trade jitters escalated over worries that the European Union could slap retaliatory tariffs on goods imported from the United States.

Headlines: Microsoft beats Wall Street targets on cloud services revenue
Description: Microsoft Corp on Thursday posted quarterly profit and revenue that beat analysts' estimates, as more businesses signed up for its Azure cloud computing services and Office 365 productivity suite.

Headlines: Boeing sees foreign orders making 40 percent of defense sales in a decade
Description: U.S. aerospace giant Boeing Co could generate more than 40 percent of its defence sales from international customers in a decade, the head of international sales told Reuters.

Headlines: SoftBank's Son says Japan is 'stupid' to disallow ride-sharing
Description: SoftBank Group Corp Chief Executive Masayoshi Son blasted Japan on Thursday for not allowing ride-sharing services, calling it "stupid" and saying the country was lagging overseas rivals in areas such as artificial intelligence (AI).

Headlines: Kobe Steel says Tokyo prosecutors have indicted company over data tampering scandal
Description: Kobe Steel Ltd, Japan's third-biggest steelmaker, said on Thursday it has been indicted by prosecutors over a data tampering scandal that shook the company and faith in Japanese manufacturing prowess last year.

Headlines: Big crude oil margins should boost U.S. refiner earnings
Description: U.S. refiners ran full-tilt in the second quarter, fueled by cheap domestic crude and fat margins that should boost earnings, though their heavy activity could eventually saturate the market with gasoline, sapping profits down the road.

Headlines: AirAsia expands Airbus A330neo order
Description: AirAsia Group expanded an order for A330neo passenger jets, adding 34 aircraft to an existing order to bring the total to 100 long-haul wide-body jets worth $30 billion at list prices.

Headlines: U.S. tariffs could raise auto prices by $83 billion: trade group
Description: A group representing major automakers will tell the U.S. Commerce Department on Thursday that imposing tariffs of 25 percent on imported cars and parts would raise the price of U.S. vehicles by $83 billion annually and cost hundreds of thousands of jobs.

Headlines: EU readies new trade retaliation list before Trump visit
Description: The European Union's trade commissioner said on Thursday she hopes an EU mission to Washington will ease a transatlantic trade dispute but the bloc is preparing a list of U.S. imports to hit if the United States imposes tariffs on EU cars.

Headlines: EU regulators charge Qualcomm with additional violation in pricing case
Description: EU antitrust regulators on Thursday charged Qualcomm with a new violation in a case where the U.S. chipmaker has been accused of selling chipsets below cost to drive out Nvidia Corp unit and British phone software maker Icera.

Headlines: Qualcomm disappointed with continuing EU probe into pricing case
Description: U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm on Thursday expressed disappointment with EU antitrust regulators' decision to continue an investigation in a case where it has been accused of charging below cost prices to stymy British phone software maker Icera.

Headlines: China says U.S. blaming Xi for blocking trade deal is 'bogus'
Description: China said on Thursday comments made by a senior White House official blaming Chinese President Xi Jinping for blocking progress on a deal to avert a trade war were "shocking" and "bogus" accusations.

Headlines: Comcast scraps Fox bid amid takeover battle with Disney
Description: ** Shares of Twenty-First Century Fox and UK's Sky dip after Comcast says abandons bid for Fox assets

Headlines: GE CEO says China tariffs' 'gross cost' could be $400 million
Description: General Electric Co, a major buyer of Chinese goods, estimates new tariffs on its imports from China could raise its costs by $300 million to $400 million overall before steps to lessen the impact, Chief Executive John Flannery said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. carmakers expected to warn of tariff pain when releasing results
Description: When Detroit's automakers report earnings on Wednesday, they are likely to highlight escalating tariffs and use the opportunity to warn investors of far greater pain ahead should U.S. President Donald Trump impose broader tariffs on the industry's vehicles and parts, consultants and analysts said.

Headlines: Microsoft shares at all-time high after bumper results
Description: Microsoft Corp shares rose about 5 percent to an all-time high on Friday, after investors cheered another blockbuster quarter, backed by growth in its legacy software business and Azure cloud computing services.

Headlines: U.S. dollar drops, yields rise after Trump comments on Fed policy and tariffs
Description: The U.S. dollar weakened, long term Treasury yields rose and stocks closed mostly lower on Friday after President Donald Trump complained again about the greenback's strength and about Federal Reserve interest rate rises.

Headlines: Over sorghum salad, U.S. farmers and Chinese buyers chew on trade
Description: Chinese importers of the livestock feed sorghum feasted on tabbouleh salad and chipotle tortillas made with the U.S. grain at a Texas barbecue this week, as farmers try to woo buyers in the middle of an escalating U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Luxembourg police deploy Tesla cars to help nab criminals
Description: Police in Luxembourg have added two Tesla electric cars to their fleet, hoping that their rapid acceleration capacity will help them nab more criminals and speed offenders while also trimming the tiny country's carbon emissions.

Headlines: Factbox: Impact of trade tariffs on European companies
Description: Some European companies are rethinking their strategies to cushion against the impact of trade tensions between the world's two biggest economies, the United States and China.

Headlines: Swiss regulator: Rothschild Bank AG broke anti-moneylaundering rules in 1MDB case
Description: Rothschild Bank AG and one of its subsidiaries committed serious violations of anti-moneylaundering rules in relation to 1MDB, the Malaysian sovereign wealth fund, Switzerland's financial regulator said on Friday.

Headlines: Merkel says ThyssenKrupp structure is a commercial matter
Description: The structure of German submarines-to-lifts conglomerate ThyssenKrupp is a commercial matter, Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S., euro zone growth readings to tell story of divergence
Description: The U.S. and euro zone economies remain a world apart and growth data due in the coming days will only highlight the widening gap, suggesting that monetary policy will continue to move in opposing directions on the two sides of the Atlantic.

Headlines: IT firm Wipro to buy U.S.-based Alight's India ops for $117 million
Description: India's third-biggest software services exporter, Wipro Ltd , said on Friday it would buy U.S.-based Alight Solutions' India operations for $117 million in cash.

Headlines: Amazon, Toyota, Alcoa and others working to counter Trump's tariff plans
Description: Big companies in the United States from Amazon.com Inc to Toyota Motor Corp and Alcoa Corp are working to counter the effect of the Trump administration's trade policies and to head off new tariffs.

Headlines: BHP served with class action over Samarco dam failure
Description: Global miner BHP said on Monday it has been served with a class action proceeding in the Federal Court of Australia regarding the 2015 Samarco dam failure in Brazil.

Headlines: G20 calls for stepped-up trade dialogue; no agreement on path forward
Description: Global finance leaders called on Sunday for stepped-up dialogue to prevent trade and geopolitical tensions from hurting growth, but ended a two-day G20 meeting with little consensus on how to resolve multiple disputes over U.S. tariff actions.

Headlines: EU's Moscovici says trade differences persist after G20 talks
Description: European Commissioner for Economic and Financial Affairs Pierre Moscovici said on Sunday that differences of position on trade tensions remained after talks among G20 finance ministers in Argentina but the meeting was not tense.

Headlines: German industry groups warn U.S. on tariffs before Trump-Juncker meeting
Description: German industry groups warned on Sunday, before European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker meets U.S. President Donald Trump this week, that tariffs the United States has imposed or is threatening to introduce risk harming America itself.

Headlines: U.S. home sales sag as prices race to record high
Description: U.S. home sales unexpectedly fell in June, posting their third straight monthly decline as a persistent shortage of properties on the market drove house prices to a record high.

Headlines: Veolia says Laruelle to become CFO, Brachlianoff COO
Description: French water and waste group Veolia said in a statement executive committee member Claude Laruelle had been appointed new chief financial officer while Veolia UK chief Estelle Brachlianoff will be appointed chief operating officer.

Headlines: Exclusive: General Electric's power unit faces threat in Saudi Arabia
Description: One of General Electric Co's largest and most valuable customers, Saudi Arabia, is lining up competitors to bid against GE for lucrative power plant work, according to five people familiar with the situation. State-controlled Saudi Electricity Co has qualified at least two companies to provide service or parts for some of its more than 50 GE-made F-class turbines, and it is in talks with two others over investments to set up faci

Headlines: Bond yields rise worldwide on stimulus concerns; earnings loom
Description: Fear that U.S. and Japanese policymakers will scale back economic stimulus sent quivers through debt markets on Monday, while U.S. stocks gained ahead of major company earnings reports.

Headlines: Mortgage, Groupon and card debt: how the bottom half bolsters U.S. economy
Description: By almost every measure, the U.S. economy is booming. But a look behind the headlines of roaring job growth and consumer spending reveals how the boom continues in large part by the poorer half of Americans fleecing their savings and piling up debt.

Headlines: S&P 500 index rises as climbing yields boost financial sector stocks
Description: The benchmark U.S. S&P 500 index and the Nasdaq index rose on Monday as a jump in 10-year bond yields boosted financial sector stocks and investors anticipated continued strength in corporate earnings and U.S. economic growth.

Headlines: Honeywell eyes supplier shift to avoid tariff hit
Description: (This version of the July 20 story corrects paragraph 1 to say company will increase the use of supply chain sources from non-China countries, not start sourcing from countries other than China)

Headlines: U.S., European allies map out larger role for F-35 fighter
Description: Lockheed Martin's F-35 fighter jet is arriving in growing numbers in Europe, and is poised to play a much broader role in missile defense and other warfare plans than conventional fighters, according to U.S. and European officials.

Headlines: Storied tabloid N.Y. Daily News slashes half its news staff
Description: The New York Daily News, the city's scrappy, 99-year-old tabloid, is laying off half of its editorial staff, as U.S. newspapers continue to struggle with sharply declining advertising revenue and readership, it said on Monday.

Headlines: PNB fraud defendant Choksi fears 'mob lynching' in India
Description: One of the main defendants in India's largest bank fraud case made a court application on Monday for cancellation of an arrest warrant against him, citing fears for his life because of a growing number of mob lynchings in the country.

Headlines: Marvel sales help Hasbro soothe Toys 'R' Us headache
Description: U.S. toymaker Hasbro Inc beat expectations for quarterly profit and revenue on Monday as a jump in Marvel toy sales helped it recover ground lost in last year's Toys 'R' Us bankruptcy, sending its shares up as much as 14 percent.

Headlines: Exclusive: China Huarong trying to recall some loans as cash crunch bites - sources
Description: China's biggest manager of bad debts is trying to exit early from at least three loans and investments as it wrestles with a liquidity crunch triggered by an anti-corruption probe into its chairman, people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: SABIC deal lets Saudi Arabia delay Aramco IPO, spend on growth: sources
Description: A proposed reshuffle of state assets would allow Saudi Arabia to delay the listing of national oil giant Aramco until 2020 or beyond while still spending on economic development projects, according to three sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Magna-BAIC deal raises prospects for an 'automotive Foxconn' in China
Description: In China, where the future of the car is looking more and more electric, newcomers to the auto industry are looking for partners to help them build their vehicles.

Headlines: Facebook to double office presence in London
Description: Facebook said on Monday it would double its presence in London, acquiring nearly 600,000 square feet (56,000 square meters) of office space across two buildings in King's Cross - enough for more than 6,000 workstations.

Headlines: Blackstone wins EU approval to buy Thomson Reuters unit
Description: U.S. private equity firm Blackstone Group has secured EU antitrust approval to acquire a majority stake in Thomson Reuters' Financial and Risk unit, the European Commission said on Monday.

Headlines: Papa John's adopts rights plan to limit founder's stake
Description: Papa John's International Inc on Sunday adopted a shareholder rights plan, or a "poison pill", with a 15 percent trigger to deter existing stockholders from amassing a controlling stake in the company.

Headlines: Exxon expects more oil from Guyana's offshore block
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp and its partners now expect the large Stabroek oil block offshore Guyana to contain about 25 percent more recoverable resources than estimated, they said on Monday.

Headlines: China probes stainless steel imports from Indonesia, EU, Japan, South Korea
Description: China began an anti-dumping investigation on Monday into stainless steel imports worth $1.3 billion, including from a privately owned Chinese mill with operations offshore, after complaints of damage to the local industry.

Headlines: U.S. to narrow opioid bribe case against Insys founder, others
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Tuesday said they will narrow a case against several former Insys Therapeutics Inc executives accused of bribing doctors to prescribe a potent opioid after a federal judge questioned the scope of the indictment charging them.

Headlines: Citron's Left reiterates belief AbbVie shares will fall sharply
Description: Short-seller Andrew Left's Citron Research expanded on his prediction that U.S. drugmaker AbbVie Inc's stock would fall to $60 a share, arguing that new regulations to speed biosimilar drugs to the market and reform rebates will hurt revenue from the company's top-selling drug, Humira.

Headlines: Scooter companies ride high on hope and hype
Description: Segway-Ninebot Group, a Beijing-based manufacturer of electric scooters, rolled into Los Angeles this week hoping to bolster its position as the main supplier for a new wave of well-funded scooter-rental startups and offer a peek at new battery-powered transit products.

Headlines: Ivanka Trump closes fashion line to focus on helping her father
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump on Tuesday said she was shutting her fashion line to focus on her role as an informal White House adviser, where she is working on advancing working women.

Headlines: China-owned Syngenta plots growth in challenging home market
Description: A year on from Syngenta's $43 billion purchase by ChemChina, the seed and chemical giant is leveraging its new status as a Chinese company to grow its tiny share of the highly fragmented China market.

Headlines: Satellites and blogs: BlackRock to raise game in China stock picking
Description: To gain an investment edge in China, BlackRock Inc , the world's biggest asset manager, will map the country's economic landscape using satellites, parse social media to take the market's pulse and track reports in the ruling Communist Party's newspaper, the People's Daily.

Headlines: S&P reaches highest level since February as Alphabet shares soar
Description: The S&P 500 on Tuesday closed at its highest level since Feb. 1 as Alphabet's blowout results bolstered expectations of a robust earnings season.

Headlines: Trump calls FCC decision on Sinclair-Tribune merger 'unfair'
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday criticized the Federal Communications Commission for not approving Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc's $3.9 billion acquisition of Tribune Media, calling it "disgraceful" compared with the FCC's approval several years ago of a deal involving the NBC television network.

Headlines: Italy government delays, amends reform of small lenders
Description: Italy's government agreed on Tuesday to delay a reform of small banks, slowing an overhaul planned by the former center-left government and backed by the European Central Bank.

Headlines: Four airlines submit complaint against France over strikes
Description: Ryanair , Easyjet , Wizz Air and IAG submitted complaints to the European Commission against France on Tuesday, arguing that its air traffic controllers' strikes were restricting freedom of movement within the EU.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson's profit beats estimates, shares rally
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc's shares rallied on Tuesday after the motorcycle maker forecast a lower-than-expected hit to profit margins from U.S. President Donald Trump's trade tariffs and its quarterly earnings topped Wall Street estimates.

Headlines: UK prosecutor seeks to restore criminal case against Barclays
Description: The UK Serious Fraud Office (SFO) said on Tuesday it was seeking to resurrect a high-profile prosecution of Barclays over undisclosed payments to Qatari investors during the credit crisis two months after a London court dismissed its case.

Headlines: London taxi drivers mull class action suit against Uber
Description: London cab drivers are examining the possibility of bringing a class action suit against Uber, their association said on Tuesday, after the mobile app was granted a temporary licence renewal to operate in the British capital.

Headlines: Factbox: Strong U.S. dollar hurts U.S. firms across multiple industries
Description: A rapid rise in the dollar has hurt second-quarter financial results and some U.S. companies are warning that the pressure could persist in future quarters.

Headlines: Lilly plans Elanco IPO, posts quarterly profit above estimates
Description: Eli Lilly and Co said on Tuesday it would take its Elanco animal health business public and posted a better-than-expected quarterly profit, helped by demand for its diabetes drugs Trulicity and Humalog.

Headlines: Alphabet trounces profit estimates as Google reins in costs
Description: Alphabet Inc on Monday reported that expenses from its Google search business grew more slowly in the second quarter while revenue rose more steeply than analysts had anticipated, boosting profit above Wall Street targets and pushing shares up 3.6 percent after hours.

Headlines: Visa tops profit estimates on higher consumer spending
Description: Visa Inc , the world's largest payments network, topped analysts' estimates for third-quarter profit on Wednesday, as an expanding U.S. economy encouraged more people to spend using their credit and debit cards.

Headlines: Qualcomm reports 4 percent rise in quarterly revenue
Description: Qualcomm Inc reported a 4.2 percent rise in quarterly revenue on Wednesday, helped by demand for its latest Snapdragon chipset from smart phone customers including Samsung Electronics Co Ltd and Xiaomi Corp .

Headlines: FCC chairman stands by Sinclair Tribune merger review decision
