Description: Federal Communications Commission Chairman Ajit Pai said on Wednesday he stands by the decision to refer Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc's $3.9 billion proposed acquisition of Tribune Media Co for review by an administrative law judge despite critical comments from U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Trump secures concessions from EU to avoid trade war: Wall Street Journal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has secured concessions from the European Union to avoid a trade war, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing an EU official who was in the room during talks between Trump and the EU's Jean-Claude Juncker.

Headlines: Trump, Juncker expected to speak at White House following trade meeting: officials
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and the European Union's chief executive, Jean-Claude Juncker, were expected to make statements at a joint event on Wednesday following a meeting on trade, White House officials said.

Headlines: U.S.-EU trade deal pushes stock rally to fourth day
Description: Global stocks extended their rally into a fourth consecutive day on Wednesday after U.S. President Donald Trump and the European Union reached an agreement that investors hope will avert a trade war.

Headlines: Trump says he hopes to strike trade deal with Europe
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he hopes to work out a fair and reciprocal trade deal between the United States and Europe as he welcomed the head of the European Commission to the White House for talks.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce chief says EU trade talks to include all agricultural products
Description: Trade on all agricultural products will be discussed as part of U.S.-European Union talks agreed by President Donald Trump and European Union's chief executive, Jean-Claude Juncker, on Wednesday, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said.

Headlines: Wall St. rises as Trump touts EU trade concessions
Description: Wall Street rose on Wednesday as U.S. President Donald Trump secured concessions from the European Union on trade, while a disappointing quarterly report from Facebook after the bell slammed its stock and threatened to put the brakes on a tech rally.

Headlines: Ford cuts 2018 profit forecast; tariffs, China sales hurt second quarter
Description: Ford Motor Co on Wednesday lowered its full-year earnings forecast due to slumping sales and trade tariffs in China and its struggling business in Europe, and said ongoing plans to revamp its business could lead to pre-tax charges of up to $11 billion over the next three to five years.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler's Marchionne dies, shares dive on profit slide
Description: Former Fiat Chrysler CEO Sergio Marchionne, who rescued the Italian and U.S. companies and built them into the world's seventh-largest carmaker, has died, the news breaking moments before the group reported a heavy fall in profit on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mattel disappoints with second-quarter results, announces job cuts
Description: Mattel Inc's quarterly sales missed analysts' estimates on Wednesday, weighed down by the absence of a big movie tie-in in the quarter, while the liquidation of key customer Toys 'R' Us continued to hurt the U.S. toy maker.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler cuts 2018 outlook, shares tumble
Description: Fiat Chrysler reported second-quarter operating profit below expectations on Wednesday, sending its shares down by as much as 14 percent as the carmaker cut its full-year outlook in response to a weaker performance in China.

Headlines: Biogen easily tops Street estimates on Spinraza sales, raises forecast
Description: Biogen Inc reported far better-than-expected second quarter profit on Tuesday, driven by strong demand of its Spinraza muscle disease treatment, and the U.S. biotech company raised its full-year profit forecast.

Headlines: Daimler and China's Baidu deepen automated driving alliance
Description: German carmaker Daimler said it will deepen a partnership with China's Baidu on automated driving and vehicle connectivity services.

Headlines: EU readying tariffs on $20 billion of U.S. goods, commissioner tells newspaper
Description: The European Union Commission is preparing to introduce tariffs on $20 billion of U.S. goods if Washington imposes trade levies on imported cars, EU trade commissioner Cecilia Malmstrom told the Swedish newspaper Dagens Nyheter on Wednesday.

Headlines: EU commissioner suggests broad cuts to tariffs with U.S.
Description: The European Union's budget commissioner suggested on Wednesday the bloc would be ready to discuss mutual tariff cuts with the United States across a range of products, provided Washington lifts recent punitive tariffs first.

Headlines: Facebook plans innovation hub in China despite tightening censorship
Description: Facebook has set up a subsidiary in China and plans to create an "innovation hub" to support local start-ups and developers, the social media company said on Tuesday, ramping up its presence in the restrictive market where its social media sites remain blocked.

Headlines: Strike-hit Ryanair warns of job losses as cuts Dublin fleet
Description: Ryanair has told more than 300 pilots and cabin crew that they risk losing their jobs as it cuts its Dublin-based fleet by 20 percent for the winter season after strikes hurt bookings in its home market.

Headlines: Waymo self-driving cars to ferry Walmart shoppers in Arizona trial
Description: Alphabet Inc's Waymo is starting trials to ferry shoppers to Walmart Inc's stores in Phoenix, Arizona, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Sinclair, Tribune shares jump after Trump knocks FCC in tweet
Description: Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc and Tribune Media Co shares rose on Wednesday after U.S. President Donald Trump criticized regulators for deferring a decision on their proposed $3.9 billion tie-up and a federal appeals court upheld a change in broadcast ownership rules.

Headlines: 3M to pay $9.1 million over defective military ear plugs
Description: The 3M Co. has agreed to pay $9.1 million to settle allegations it knowingly sold defective combat ear plugs to the U.S. military without disclosing defects that limited the effectiveness of the hearing protection devices, the U.S. Justice Department said on Thursday.

Headlines: Ex-assistant chairman of China's banking regulator sentenced to 16 years in prison: state media
Description: The former assistant chairman of China's banking regulatory commission has been sentenced to 16 years in prison for accepting bribes, state media said on Thursday, as the Chinese government clamps down on corruption.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury chief: 'Disappointed' Qualcomm deal not ok'd: CNBC
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Thursday said he was very disappointed over Qualcomm Inc's failed bid to buy NXP Semiconductors NV after China did not approve the deal, calling it "unfortunate."

Headlines: Retailers set sights on Facebook, Google ad revenue
Description: People with hay fever hate dust. That was the premise of a marketing drive launched by British vacuum cleaner maker Dyson with U.S. retailer Target Corp.

Headlines: Trump relents on EU car tariffs, as U.S.-China fight derails Qualcomm deal
Description: In what the EU chief called a "major concession," U.S. President Donald Trump agreed on Wednesday to refrain from imposing car tariffs while the two sides launch negotiations to cut other trade barriers, easing the threat of a transatlantic trade war.

Headlines: Britain welcomes U.S.-EU pledge to lower trade barriers
Description: Britain welcomed an initiative agreed between U.S. President Donald Trump and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker to cut trade barriers, easing the threat of a transatlantic trade war.

Headlines: Germany's VDA says U.S.-EU trade progress is a 'big step forward'
Description: Germany's VDA automotive association welcomed on Thursday an agreement between the EU and the United States to take steps to ease the threat of a transatlantic trade war, saying it offered a real opportunity to avert further tariffs.

Headlines: China commerce ministry declines to comment on whether Qualcomm deal approved
Description: China's commerce ministry declined on Thursday to comment on whether or not Qualcomm Inc's deal to buy NXP Semiconductors had been approved, after a deadline for approving the deal passed without an announcement, and with Qualcomm having said it would drop its bid for the Dutch firm.

Headlines: German industry warns U.S. auto tariffs not completely off table yet
Description: A top German industry group gave a cautious welcome to solutions proposed by U.S. President Donald Trump and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker to avert a trade war, but warned that U.S. auto tariffs were not completely off the table yet.

Headlines: It started with a kiss: how Juncker wooed Trump
Description: Some personal chemistry with a fellow veteran dealmaker and a quick sense that Donald Trump was ready to bargain helped Jean-Claude Juncker strike a surprise accord to avert a transatlantic trade war, for now.

Headlines: Amazon earnings skyrocket on cloud computing, advertising
Description: Amazon.com Inc forecast strong fall sales and posted a profit that was double Wall Street targets on Thursday thanks to the retailer's younger, higher-earning businesses, including cloud computing and advertising.

Headlines: Starbucks reports cooling quarterly growth and pares outlook
Description: Starbucks Corp forecast slower growth for the current fiscal year on Thursday as boutique coffee chains and fast-food retailers won business in the United States and other established markets and the bloom came off once-booming China.

Headlines: Zuckerberg loses more than $15 billion in record Facebook fall
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's fortune took a more than $15 billion hit on Thursday, as the social media company suffered the biggest one-day wipeout in U.S. stock market history a day after executives forecast years of lower profit margins.

Headlines: Chipotle price hikes, queso cheese boost sales past estimates
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc topped analysts' estimates for same-restaurant sales on Thursday, boosted by higher prices and demand for its queso cheese dip as its new CEO focuses on turning around the once-hot burrito chain.

Headlines: McDonald's U.S. same-store sales miss estimates, shares drop
Description: McDonald's Corp missed quarterly U.S. same-store sales estimates for the first time in at least two years amid fierce competition in a slack restaurant market, sending its shares down as much as 2.3 percent in midday trading.

Headlines: Comcast shares rise on internet customer, profit growth
Description: Comcast Corp on Thursday reported a quarterly profit that beat Wall Street estimates as it added more high-speed internet customers, part of a push to diversify away from the shrinking U.S. pay-TV market.

Headlines: Northrop CEO grilled by U.S. lawmakers over space telescope
Description: Northrop Grumman Corp CEO Wes Bush faced tough questions from U.S. lawmakers about the delays and growing price tag for NASA's James Webb Space Telescope and rebuffed the idea that the company, rather than taxpayers, should pay an $800 million cost overrun.

Headlines: Republican lawmakers remain skeptical after Trump's EU deal
Description: Numerous congressional Republicans worried about jobs for constituents back home remained skeptical of President Donald Trump's trade policies on Thursday, a day after Trump struck a surprise deal with the EU to halt further tariffs and hold talks on opening markets.

Headlines: Exclusive: China eyes infrastructure boost to cushion growth as trade war escalates - sources
Description: China plans to put more money into infrastructure projects and ease borrowing curbs on local governments to help soften the blow to the economy from the Sino-U.S. trade war, policy sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: Trump touts strong economy; facts are more nuanced
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday hailed a report on economic growth as a sign that the economy was mounting a remarkable turnaround under his stewardship. The facts are more nuanced.

Headlines: IBM wins $83 million from Groupon in internet patent fight
Description: A U.S. jury on Friday awarded International Business Machines Corp $83 million in a patent dispute with e-commerce company Groupon Inc .

Headlines: Sanctions blamed as Silicon Valley firms won't ship some kit to Russia
Description: Two Silicon Valley firms have stopped shipping some electronic components to Russian customers even though they are not on the list of firms subject to U.S. sanctions, according to sources who work in the sector and a document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court to reconsider Hyundai-Kia gas mileage settlement
Description: A U.S. appeals court will reconsider its decision to throw out a $210 million nationwide class-action settlement for owners of Hyundai Motor Co and Kia Motors Corp vehicles whose fuel economy was inflated.

Headlines: WeWork's China unit gets $500 million funding from Temasek, Softbank, others
Description: The Chinese unit of U.S. co-working space provider WeWork Cos said it has raised $500 million from investors including Temasek Holdings [TEM.UL] and SoftBank Group Corp as it looks to expand in the market for shared office space in the country.

Headlines: City Council aims to make New York first U.S. city to cap Uber, others
Description: New York City is moving toward becoming the first major U.S. municipality to cap ride-sharing services, sparking a tsunami of protest on Friday from Uber [UBER.UL] and others, which warned that those living in far-flung neighborhoods will suffer most.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp to invest up to $250 million in U.S. elevator site: executive
Description: German industrial conglomerate Thyssenkrupp is planning to invest $150 to $250 million in a new U.S. headquarters for its elevators business, an executive told Reuters.

Headlines: China says it is still open to talks on scrapped Qualcomm-NXP takeover
Description: China's market regulator said it still hoped to find a solution to antitrust concerns that doomed Qualcomm Inc's $44 billion takeover of NXP Semiconductors, after finding that proposals to address the issue had fallen short.

Headlines: Thomson Reuters unit to be renamed Refinitiv after Blackstone deal
Description: Thomson Reuters Corp's Financial and Risk unit, in which U.S. private equity firm Blackstone Group is buying a majority stake, will be renamed Refinitiv once the deal closes, the company said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Sell long-in-the-tooth FAANGs, build up BRICs, say analysts
Description: Investors poured $600 million in to U.S. technology stocks in the week leading up to poor results from Facebook , according to Bank of America Merrill Lynch (BAML) analysts, urging clients to sell the sector on signs inflows have reached bubble territory.

Headlines: Dollar index trims gain after robust U.S. GDP data
Description: The dollar pared its earlier gains against a basket of currencies on Friday as data showed the U.S. economy expanded at its fastest clip in nearly four years but they did not quell worries the pace of growth would slow due to tariffs.

Headlines: Trump to speak about economy after strong report
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump was set to deliver remarks on the economy at the White House at 9:30 a.m. ET (1330 GMT) on Friday after the Commerce Department said the economy grew at its fastest pace in nearly four years during the second quarter.

Headlines: Factbox: Impact of trade tariffs on European companies
Description: Some European companies are rethinking their strategies to cushion the impact of trade tensions between the world's two biggest economies, the United States and China.

Headlines: BP pays $10.5 billion for BHP shale assets to beef up U.S. business
Description: BP Plc has agreed to buy U.S. shale oil and gas assets from global miner BHP Billiton for $10.5 billion, expanding the British oil major's footprint in some of the nation's most productive oil basins in its biggest deal in nearly 20 years.

Headlines: U.S. says has addressed residual seasonality in GDP data
Description: U.S. government statisticians say they have addressed a methodology problem, which analysts had argued tended to understate economic growth in the first quarter.

Headlines: CBS probes misconduct allegations against CEO Moonves amid legal battle
Description: U.S. broadcasting and media company CBS Corp said it was investigating claims of personal misconduct by its chief executive Leslie Moonves made in a New Yorker magazine article that was published on Friday.

Headlines: G20 agriculture ministers had 'frank discussion' about protectionism: Germany
Description: The G20 agriculture ministers gathered in Buenos Aires this weekend had a "frank discussion" about the fact that they do not want unilateral protectionist measures, German Agriculture Minister Julia Klockner told reporters on Saturday.

Headlines: Germany says U.S.-Europe trade tensions ease, questions remain on soy
Description: The trade relationship between the United States and Europe is improving, German Agriculture Minister Julia Kloeckner said on Saturday, but there is no guarantee the bloc will buy the quantity of soybeans that Washington expects.

Headlines: Economy, dollar, trade key to U.S. stocks' global edge
Description: The ability of the U.S. stock market to keep an edge this year over equities elsewhere in the world hinges on the United States maintaining its economic and earnings growth advantage, the strength of the dollar and how global trade tensions resolve, investors said.

Headlines: U.S. stock index futures dip ahead of big earnings week
Description: U.S. stock index futures dipped late on Sunday ahead of a week when more than 140 S&P 500 companies, including Apple Inc , will report earnings.

Headlines: Singapore's offshore industry recovering, but no return to glory days
Description: A big drag on Singapore's growth in recent years, the embattled offshore and marine industry, has broken a three-year losing streak. Yet industry executives aren't betting on a return to the glory days anytime soon.

Headlines: Starbucks and China's Alibaba to partner on delivery: media reports
Description: Starbucks Corp and e-commerce company Alibaba Group Holding Ltd are set to join forces on coffee delivery, according to media reports, as the coffee retailer seeks to rebound from a sales slump in the once-booming China market.

Headlines: U.S. seeks to end criminal fraud case against bond trader Litvak
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Monday moved to dismiss their criminal fraud case accusing former trader Jesse Litvak of lying to customers about bond prices, after two convictions of the former Jefferies managing director were overturned on appeal.

Headlines: Tech stocks pull down equity markets, euro gains
Description: A gauge of global equity markets fell on Monday, pulled down by a sell-off in U.S. technology heavyweights, while the dollar slipped against the euro ahead of several central bank monetary policy meetings later this week.

Headlines: Widespread tech sell-off drags Wall St. down
Description: A broad sell-off of technology stocks pushed the three major U.S. stock indexes lower on Monday, with the Nasdaq Composite posting its third consecutive loss of more than 1 percent for the first time in three years just days after hitting a record high.

Headlines: Uber to stop developing self-driving trucks
Description: Uber [UBER.UL] will stop developing self-driving trucks that have been hauling cargo on U.S. highways, the ride-hailing company said on Monday, seeking to focus its autonomous-vehicle technology solely on cars.

Headlines: Nokia, T-Mobile US agree $3.5 billion deal, world's first big 5G award
Description: T-Mobile US named Nokia to supply it with $3.5 billion in next-generation 5G network gear, the firms said on Monday, marking the world's largest 5G deal so far and concrete evidence of a new wireless upgrade cycle taking root.

Headlines: Chipotle shuts Ohio restaurant after reports of illness
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc has shut a restaurant in Ohio following reports of customers falling sick after eating there, the burrito chain said on Monday.

Headlines: China offers to open discussions on post-Brexit trade deal: UK minister
Description: China has offered to open discussions on a post-Brexit free trade deal with Britain, British Foreign Minister Jeremy Hunt said in Beijing on Monday.

Headlines: German prosecutors investigate VW ex-CEO's financial transfers
Description: German prosecutors said on Monday they are investigating whether former Volkswagen Chief Executive Martin Winterkorn moved some of his assets out of Germany following an inquiry into his role in the manipulation of anti-pollution tests.

Headlines: CBS board to discuss CEO Moonves investigation on Monday: sources
Description: CBS Corp's board will discuss the investigation into allegations of personal misconduct against the U.S. broadcasting and media company's Chief Executive Leslie Moonves on Monday, according to two people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Sanofi has been stockpiling drugs for no-deal Brexit: WSJ
Description: French drugmaker Sanofi has been making drug-shortage contingency plans for more than a year to prepare for Britain and the European Union failing to reach a Brexit transition deal, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing a source.

Headlines: Mexico president-elect Lopez Obrador sees NAFTA deal soon
Description: Mexican presidential winner Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Tuesday that he expected there would be an agreement in the renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) in the coming days.

Headlines: China will strive to hit growth target despite trade tensions with U.S.
Description: China will keep its economic growth within a reasonable range and achieve this year's target despite challenges, the state-run Xinhua news agency said on Tuesday as a trade war with the United States intensifies.

Headlines: Chipotle slumps 9 percent after Ohio outlet linked to food poisoning complaints
Description: More than 100 people said they had fallen sick after eating at a Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc restaurant in Ohio, sending shares of the burrito chain down as much as 9 percent on Tuesday.

Headlines: Third Point seeks allies to put pressure on Campbell Soup: sources
Description: Activist hedge fund Third Point LLC is meeting with some of Campbell Soup Co's largest shareholders to seek support for changes at the U.S. consumer company, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Devon Energy misses profit estimates as costs, oil hedges weigh
Description: U.S. oil producer Devon Energy Corp on Tuesday missed Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit as expenses rose and a misplaced bet on the direction of oil prices offset higher oil output.

Headlines: Dialog Semiconductor ends talks to buy Synaptics
Description: Dialog Semiconductor Plc said on Tuesday it has ended discussions with Synaptics Inc about a potential acquisition of the U.S. touch-pad technology company, without citing a reason.

Headlines: Pfizer CEO expects Trump to eliminate drug rebates
Description: Pfizer Inc Chief Executive Ian Read said on Tuesday he believes the Trump administration intends to stop the practice of allowing rebates on prescription drug purchases, suggesting that U.S. drug pricing reforms may focus on middlemen rather than drugmakers.

Headlines: U.S. insurers grilled on exposure to $4.7 billion J&J talc verdict
Description: Wall Street is trying to figure out whether the U.S. insurance industry will bear any costs from a record $4.69 billion judgment against Johnson & Johnson awarded to customers and their families who claimed that asbestos-contaminated talc caused ovarian cancer.

Headlines: Pfizer CEO believes U.S. will eliminate rebates on prescription drugs
Description: Pfizer Inc Chief Executive Ian Read said on Tuesday that he believes the Trump administration intends to eliminate rebates on prescription drug purchases, but he does not know how quickly such a policy could be implemented.

Headlines: Fed set to hold rates steady, remain on track for more hikes
Description: The Federal Reserve is expected to keep interest rates unchanged on Wednesday, but solid economic growth combined with rising inflation are likely to keep it on track for another two hikes this year even as President Donald Trump has ramped up criticism of its push to raise rates.

Headlines: BOJ adopts forward guidance on rates, makes framework flexible
Description: The Bank of Japan pledged to keep interest rates "very low" for the time being and took measures to make its massive stimulus program more flexible on Tuesday, reflecting its forecast that it would take time for inflation to hit its 2 percent target.[T9N1TD07B]

Headlines: Factbox: Key changes made to BOJ's policy framework on July 31
Description: The Bank of Japan took measures to make its massive stimulus program more flexible and pledged to keep interest rates low for the time being on Tuesday, reflecting its forecast that it would take time for inflation to hit its 2 percent target.

Headlines: How U.S. tariffs on China minerals could hurt industry, consumers
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's proposed tariffs on another $200 billion of Chinese goods threaten a niche trade in minor metals and rare earths used in everything from stomach remedies and jet engines to consumer electronics.

Headlines: Panasonic expects Tesla battery biz to contribute to profit as early as October
Description: Panasonic Corp on Tuesday said it expects its battery business with U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla to contribute to profit from the second half of its business year, as production of mass-market Model 3 cars picks up pace.

Headlines: Honda resists U.S. tariff hit for now, first-quarter profit at 12-year high
Description: Honda Motor said the impact of U.S. steel and aluminum import tariffs on its bottom line had so far been limited, as it posted a surprise jump in quarterly profits to their highest in more than a decade on improving North American sales.

Headlines: Britain's car industry cautions: No-deal Brexit is our nightmare
Description: A no-deal Brexit would seriously damage the car industry in Britain and the European Union by raising costs and sowing chaos for carmakers and consumers alike, the head of Britain's car industry warned on Tuesday.

Headlines: BMW to build 1 billion euro car factory in Hungary
Description: BMW will invest 1 billion euros ($1.17 bln) to build a new plant in Hungary at a time when a rise in protectionism is forcing carmakers to curb inter-continental exports and to refocus production networks to serve regional trading blocs.

Headlines: U.S. labor costs post largest annual gain since 2008
Description: U.S. labor costs increased in the second quarter as employers boosted benefits for workers, leading to the largest annual increase since 2008.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending rises; wage growth slows in second-quarter
Description: U.S. consumer spending increased solidly in June as households spent more at restaurants and on accommodation, building a strong base for the economy heading into the third quarter, while inflation rose moderately.

Headlines: BOJ adopts forward guidance on rates, makes framework flexible
Description: The Bank of Japan pledged to keep interest rates "very low" for the time being and took measures to make its massive stimulus program more flexible on Tuesday, reflecting its forecast that it would take time for inflation to hit its 2 percent target.

Headlines: Trade tensions, labor shortages loom over U.S. factories
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity slowed in July amid signs that a robust economy and import tariffs were putting pressure on the supply chain, which could hurt production in the long term.

Headlines: Scolding from Chinese state media dampens Apple's earnings cheer
Description: Apple Inc may have just notched up its fourth straight quarter of double-digit revenue growth in China, but among some Chinese consumers the glow was overshadowed by Chinese state media’s tirade of criticism against the smartphone giant.

Headlines: Apple's ride to $1 trillion: The magic number that gets it there
Description: Apple Inc updated its latest share count on Wednesday, putting the magic stock price at $207.04 that would make the iPhone maker the first publicly listed U.S. company valued at $1 trillion.

Headlines: T-Mobile adds wireless subscribers; awaits Sprint deal approval
Description: T-Mobile US Inc on Wednesday said it added far more wireless subscribers than Wall Street had expected, as the third-largest U.S. wireless carrier invests in its network while awaiting regulatory approval to buy rival Sprint Corp .

Headlines: Tesla will tap local debt to fund $2 billion Shanghai Gigafactory: Musk
Description: Tesla Inc said on Wednesday that it would raise capital from Asian debt markets to fund the construction of its third "Gigafactory," which will be located in Shanghai and cost an approximate $2 billion.

Headlines: Lawsuit claims Walmart stole technology to keep produce fresh
Description: Walmart Inc was sued on Wednesday by a Silicon Valley company that accused the largest U.S. retailer of stealing its technology to prolong the shelf life of produce and reduce spoilage.

Headlines: Global factory growth slowing; China-U.S. trade war biting
Description: Factory growth stuttered across the world in July, heightening concerns about the global economic outlook as an intensifying trade conflict between the United States and China sent shudders through trading partners.

Headlines: Huawei overtakes Apple as world No. 2 smartphone seller, gains ground in China
Description: China's Huawei Technologies overtook Apple Inc to become the world's second-biggest smartphone seller in the June quarter, data from market research firms showed, as it gained ground in Europe and expanded its lead back home.

Headlines: CEO to take break from running Germany's Uniper for cancer treatment
Description: The chief executive of Germany's Uniper , Klaus Schaefer, will take a break from running the company while he is being treated for cancer, the utility said.

Headlines: Tesla second-quarter report could be an $850 million boon or bane for short-sellers
Description: Tesla Inc - the most heavily shorted U.S. company - is set to report quarterly results on Wednesday, and short-sellers could be dealt a nearly $850 million loss or gain, depending on the direction of the post-earnings stock move.

Headlines: GM taps former Trump aide to head lobbying efforts
Description: General Motors Co said on Wednesday it has tapped a former Trump administration economic and trade adviser to head its public policy efforts.

Headlines: More drugmakers build Brexit stockpiles as EU agency faces exodus
Description: Sanofi and Novartis said on Wednesday they planned to increase stockpiles of medicines in Britain in preparation for potential disruption if the UK crashes out of the European Union without a deal.

Headlines: U.S. new vehicle sales drop in July
Description: Major automakers on Wednesday reported lower U.S. new vehicle sales for July amid steep declines in passenger cars, except Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV (FCA) , which said its sales climbed 6 percent.

Headlines: Iran MPs summon Rouhani as U.S. pressure squeezes economy
Description: Iranian lawmakers have given President Hassan Rouhani one month to appear before parliament to answer questions on his government's handling of Iran's economic struggles, state media reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq rise as Apple hits $1 trillion mark
Description: Technology stocks pushed the S&P 500 and Nasdaq higher on Thursday, driven by Apple shares as the iPhone maker became the first publicly traded U.S. company worth a trillion dollars.

Headlines: China stands its ground after Trump amps up tariff threats
Description: China vowed on Thursday to retaliate if the United States acted on a threat to raise tariffs on the Asian nation's exports, fueling fears in financial markets that the trade war between the world's two biggest economies would escalate.

Headlines: FCC chairman Pai says Trump has not contacted him on Sinclair deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has not contacted the Federal Communications Commission about its lack of approval for Sinclair Broadcast Group's deal to buy Tribune Media Co , which Trump has called "disgraceful" on Twitter, FCC Chairman Ajit Pai said on Thursday.

Headlines: Apple breaches $1 trillion stock market valuation
Description: Apple Inc on Thursday became the first $1 trillion publicly listed U.S. company, crowning a decade-long rise fueled by its ubiquitous iPhone that transformed it from a niche player in personal computers into a global powerhouse spanning entertainment and communications.

Headlines: Apple says it has paid two-thirds of $15 billion Irish tax bill
Description: IPhone maker Apple has to date paid two-thirds of the 13 billion euros ($15.1 billion) which EU antitrust regulators said it owes Ireland in back taxes, the company said in a regulatory filing late on Wednesday.

Headlines: Kellogg margins hurt by cuts to snack prices, higher costs
Description: Kellogg Co reported lower-than-expected quarterly profit margins on Thursday as the cereal maker spent more on marketing and transportation and had to cut prices on snack foods after it stopped distributing directly to U.S. retailers.

Headlines: Hong Kong insurance market lures well-educated mainland Chinese
Description: May Zhang, a 28-year-old from the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen, holds a master's degree in engineering from the University of Oxford, but now makes her living selling insurance in Hong Kong.

Headlines: U.S. utilities balk at expanded carbon-capture subsidy
Description: Few U.S. energy policies can bring together coal miners, oil drillers, environmentalists, Republicans and Democrats.

Headlines: BMW sees 5-10 percent sales growth in China despite tariffs
Description: BMW expects China sales to rise between 5 and 10 percent this year, despite the introduction of 40 percent import tariffs on vehicles imported from the United States since July.

Headlines: Instant view: Apple hits $1 trillion stock market valuation
Description: Apple Inc became the first $1 trillion publicly listed U.S. company on Thursday, crowning a decade-long rise fueled by its ubiquitous iPhone that transformed it from a niche player in personal computers into a global powerhouse spanning entertainment and communications.

Headlines: BMW builds X5 in Thailand to counteract U.S. China tariffs: CEO
Description: BMW's said it is producing between 10,000 and 20,000 X5 sports utility vehicles in Thailand as a way to supply Chinese customers now that imported vehicles from the United States face a 40 percent tariff.

Headlines: China says fully prepared for U.S. threats on escalating trade war
Description: China is fully prepared for the United States' threats to escalate the two countries' trade war and will have to fight back to defend its dignity and the interests of its people, the commerce ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: UK regulator confirms Disney must offer at least 14 pounds per share for Sky
Description: Britain's takeover regulator said on Friday that a review had confirmed its ruling that Walt Disney might have to offer at least 14 pounds a share to buy UK pay-television group Sky.

Headlines: Traders see two more U.S. rate hikes in 2018 after jobs data
Description: U.S. interest rates futures held steady on Friday, suggesting traders were sticking with their view the Federal Reserve would raise key overnight borrowing costs twice more in 2018 following a mixed payrolls report for July.

Headlines: U.S. July payrolls rise less than expected
Description: U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in July, likely due to companies' struggles to find qualified workers, and the unemployment rate declined, pointing to tightening labor market conditions.

Headlines: U.S. June trade deficit posts biggest rise in 1-1/2 years
Description: The U.S. trade deficit recorded its biggest increase in more than 1-1/2 years in June as the boost to exports from soybean shipments faded and higher oil prices lifted the import bill.

Headlines: Heineken toasts $3.1 billion China Resources Beer premium tie-up
Description: Heineken is taking a $3.1 billion stake in the parent of China Resources Beer , China's top brewer, to tap a growing thirst for premium brands in the world's biggest beer market.

Headlines: Atlanta Fed pares U.S. third quarter GDP growth view to 4.4 percent
Description: The U.S. economy is growing at a 4.4 percent annualized rate in the third quarter in the wake of the latest data on payrolls and services activity, the Atlanta Federal Reserve's GDPNow forecast model showed on Friday.

Headlines: GM seeks to exclude China-made Buick SUV from tariff
Description: General Motors Co is seeking an exemption to a 25 percent U.S. tariff on its Chinese-made Buick Envision sport utility, the automaker said on Thursday, in a move to prevent the key model in the brand's U.S. lineup from becoming a victim of the U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Amazon reports 1.7 million pound UK tax bill due to share deductions
Description: The main UK subsidiary of Amazon.com Inc had a tax bill of 1.7 million pounds ($2.21 million) on profits of 72.4 million pounds in 2017 thanks to deductions related to share-based awards to staff, accounts published this week show.

Headlines: U.S. tax cuts prompt rethink by some 'inverted' companies
Description: A few U.S. companies that moved offshore in a wave of inversion deals are considering returning to the United States now that domestic tax rates are lower and tax policing is tougher abroad, attorneys and consultants said.

Headlines: Wells Fargo faces tax credit probes, new problems with mortgage borrowers
Description: Wells Fargo & Co is facing government probes into its use of low-income housing tax credits, and has also set aside $8 million to compensate borrowers who were incorrectly denied mortgage modifications under a federal assistance program, the bank said in a regulatory filing on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. job growth slows in July, unemployment rate drops
Description: U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in July as employment in the transportation and utilities sectors fell, but a drop in the unemployment rate suggested that labor market conditions continued to tighten.

Headlines: Opel to slow production at two German plants: newspaper
Description: Carmaker Opel, a unit of France's PSA Group , plans to slow production at two German sites after the summer to help cut costs in response to declining sales, regional newspaper Allgemeine Zeitung reported on Friday.

Headlines: China's Didi, Ant Financial weigh joint $2 bln Ofo buyout: source
Description: Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing and Alibaba's Ant Financial are in talks with bike-sharing startup Ofo for a joint buyout offer that could value Ofo at up to $2 billion, according to a source with direct knowledge of the discussions.

Headlines: Canada 'very keen' on wrapping up year-old NAFTA talks
Description: Canada is "very keen" on concluding negotiations to renew the North American Free Trade Agreement as soon as possible, Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Saturday, amid signs of progress after months of delays.

Headlines: Exclusive: Russia's Gazprom suspends external borrowing amid spat with Naftogaz - sources
Description: Russia's Gazprom suspended its external borrowing program earlier this year because of a deepening legal dispute with Ukraine's Naftogaz over gas supplies, three banking sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Linde shares drop as Praxair merger hits U.S. antitrust hurdle
Description: Shares in Linde dropped as much as 10 percent on Monday after the German industrial gases group's planned $86 billion merger with U.S. rival Praxair was thrown into doubt by more demands from U.S. antitrust regulators.

Headlines: Rising costs and U.S. settlement crimp HSBC's first-half profit
Description: HSBC Holdings Plc posted a small increase in first-half pretax profit, as rising expenses from investments in a new growth strategy and a $765 million settlement for alleged mis-selling of U.S. mortgage securities ate into higher revenues.

Headlines: Global stocks lift on strong earnings as trade fight caps gains; sterling slumps
Description: Stock markets lifted on Monday after strong corporate earnings helped Wall Street close higher, but a tariff dispute between the United States and China limited gains in equities while boosting the dollar and helping keep Treasury yields lower.

Headlines: Tyson Foods beats profit estimates on strong beef demand
Description: Tyson Foods Inc beat analysts' quarterly profit estimates on Monday as the No. 1 U.S. meat processor reported a record operating income for its beef business due to increased exports and cattle supplies.

Headlines: Oil rises after OPEC sources say Saudi crude output fell
Description: Oil futures gained on Monday after OPEC sources said Saudi crude production unexpectedly fell in July, raising concerns about global oil supplies as the United States prepares to reinstate sanctions against major exporter Iran.

Headlines: Sprint, T-Mobile in early stages of regulatory review, no decisions yet: source
Description: U.S. antitrust enforcers are in the early stages of reviewing T-Mobile US Inc's plan to buy Sprint Corp for $26 billion, and have reached no conclusions on how many wireless carriers the country needs, a source familiar with the situation said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. banks further eased business loan standards in Q2 2018
Description: Loan officers at U.S. banks reported easing lending standards for business loans for firms of all sizes while keeping terms for commercial real estate loans almost unchanged in the second quarter, a Federal Reserve survey showed on Monday.

Headlines: Harley seeks alliance for lightweight bikes to grow India business
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc is scouting for a partner with a manufacturing and distribution footprint to make lightweight motorcycles for use in India and other Asian markets, a top company executive said.

Headlines: Arista to pay $400 million to Cisco to resolve court fight
Description: Arista Networks Inc will pay $400 million to Cisco Systems Inc to resolve a U.S. court fight between the two network equipment makers, Arista said in a regulatory filing on Monday, the day a jury trial in the dispute was scheduled to begin.

Headlines: China fines Alipay for violating payment services regulations
Description: The Shanghai head office of China's central bank has levied a fine of 4.12 million yuan ($601,846) on Alipay, the online payment platform of Ant Financial, for violating regulations on payment services, the regulator said on Monday.

Headlines: Wall Street closes higher as strong earnings cheer investors
Description: The three major U.S. stock indexes closed higher on Monday as investors applauded a strong U.S. earnings season with results from Berkshire Hathaway impressing and Facebook lifting Nasdaq after a report it was planning new services.

Headlines: EU asks WTO to certify it has removed Airbus subsidies
Description: The European Union has asked the World Trade Organization to certify that it has complied with WTO rulings on its subsidies for planemaker Airbus, attempting to forestall billions of dollars of U.S. sanctions, a document published by the WTO showed on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. bond market takes looming Treasuries deluge in stride
Description: U.S. government debt supply will likely continue to boom, but bond market investors seem to be taking it in stride.

Headlines: Vietnam jails former bankers in graft crackdown
Description: A court in Vietnam handed lengthy prison terms on Monday to several former bankers accused of mismanagement, amid a crackdown on corruption in the communist-ruled country.

Headlines: Japan's Universal says former chairman Okada arrested in Hong Kong
Description: Japanese gaming group Universal Entertainment Corp said on Monday its former chairman Kazuo Okada was arrested in Hong Kong by the territory's Independent Commission Against Corruption in relation to multiple corruption-related offences.

Headlines: China's Didi to invest $1 billion in its auto services platform
Description: Didi Chuxing Technology, China's largest ride-hailing service, said on Monday it will invest $1 billion in its auto services business, part of a larger unit rebranding as the company ramps up to a widely anticipated initial public offering (IPO).

Headlines: Linde shares drop as Praxair merger hits U.S. antitrust hurdle
Description: Shares in Linde plunged more than 8 percent on Monday after the industrial gases group's planned $87 billion merger with Praxair was put in doubt by demands from U.S. antitrust regulators.

Headlines: Honda to recall 96,900 SUVs in China, runs checks on two models
Description: Honda Motor Co on Monday said it will recall 96,900 Avancier sport utility vehicles (SUVs) in China, due to a cold-climate engine problem that has already led to hundreds of thousands of its vehicles being recalled earlier this year.

Headlines: U.S. think tank's tiny lab helps Facebook battle fake social media
Description: A day before Facebook announced that it had discovered and disabled a propaganda campaign designed to sow dissension among U.S. voters, it exclusively shared some of the suspicious pages with an online forensics team so busy it hasn't put a nameplate on the door.

Headlines: Tesla starts hiring for new $2 billion Shanghai plant
Description: Tesla Inc has started hiring for a new factory in Shanghai, according to job postings on its website, just a month after the U.S. electric vehicle (EV) maker signed agreements with local authorities for the $2 billion project.

Headlines: Consultation prize: U.S.-China trade war fires bonanza for advisory firms
Description: As U.S. and Chinese firms rush for outside expertise on how to handle fallout from the escalating trade war between the two nations, consultants on everything from management to logistics say they have seen soaring demand for their services.

Headlines: Wendy's North America same-restaurant sales top estimates
Description: U.S. burger chain Wendy's Co on Tuesday topped Wall Street targets for sales at established outlets in North America, led by the popularity of its value-menu offerings.

Headlines: BMW recalls 324,000 cars in Europe after Korean engine fires: FAZ
Description: German luxury carmaker BMW is recalling about 324,000 diesel vehicles in Europe to fix a technical fault that has caused engine fires in South Korea, German newspaper Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung (FAZ) said.

Headlines: U.S. job openings hover at record highs in June
Description: U.S. job openings held near record highs in June amid a modest decline in hiring, pointing to further tightening labor market conditions, which economists hope will soon spur faster wage growth.

Headlines: Fox posts offer document for Sky deal
Description: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc on Tuesday posted an offer document and form of acceptance for its 14 pounds a share offer to buy UK's Sky on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. prosecutors target Goldman Sachs in 1MDB probe: NYT
Description: U.S. prosecutors are investigating whether Goldman Sachs Group Inc has any culpability in a Malaysian fraud involving a government fund that had ties to a former bank employee, the New York Times reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Apple tells lawmakers iPhones are not listening in on consumers
Description: Apple Inc told U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday that its iPhones do not listen to users without their consent and do not allow third-party apps to do so either, after lawmakers asked the company if its devices were invading users' privacy.

Headlines: Superyacht linked to 1MDB probe arrives at Malaysian port
Description: A $250 million superyacht, impounded as part of a hunt for assets linked to the multi-billion dollar investigation into 1Malaysia Development Bhd, arrived at a port in Malaysia on Tuesday about six months after it was seized.

Headlines: U.S. safety regulator probes fires in some Ford pickup trucks
Description: U.S. traffic safety regulator is investigating complaints of fire during crashes in some Ford Motor Co F-150 Supercrew pickup trucks linked to a seat belt component.

Headlines: Alibaba merging China food delivery units to counter Tencent-backed Meituan
Description: Alibaba Group plans to merge its food delivery units and raise funds for the combined business, intensifying a battle with Tencent-backed Meituan Dianping for dominance of China's booming on-demand services market, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Chinese newspaper mocks Trump's claim of winning trade war as 'wishful thinking'
Description: Chinese state media kept up their criticism of U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies, with a newspaper on Tuesday describing as "wishful thinking" Trump's belief that a fall in Chinese stocks was a sign of his winning the trade war.

Headlines: Overseas costs drag on profits at Domino's Pizza; shares slide
Description: Rising overseas costs, particularly in Norway, overshadowed an improvement in sales at Domino's Pizza Group , pushing first-half pre-tax profit down almost 10 percent and sending the company's shares to an 11-month low.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mattress Firm explores U.S. bankruptcy to close stores
Description: Mattress Firm Inc, the largest U.S. mattress retailer, is considering a potential bankruptcy filing as it seeks ways to get out of costly store leases and shut some of its 3,000 locations that are losing money, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: CVS Health beats profit estimates, defends PBM business
Description: CVS Health Corp beat analysts' estimates for quarterly profit on Wednesday and the drugstore operator defended its pharmacy benefits management business in the face of the Trump administration's move to clamp down on escalating drug costs.

Headlines: Impact of trade tariffs on European companies
Description: Some European companies are rethinking their strategies to cushion the impact of trade tensions between the world's two biggest economies, the United States and China.

Headlines: European stocks falter as pharma sector falls
Description: European shares dipped on Wednesday as poor corporate earnings in the pharmaceutical sector weighed on sentiment already soured by trade tensions, with Washington preparing tariffs on another $16 billion of Chinese goods.

Headlines: American Medical Association opposes merger of CVS and Aetna
Description: The American Medical Association, which represents U.S. physicians, urged the U.S. Justice Department on Wednesday to stop CVS Health Corp's plan to buy insurance provider Aetna Inc, saying the deal could result in higher prices for prescription medicines.

Headlines: IKEA strives to keep prices low as it opens first store in India
Description: IKEA will set some prices even lower in India than elsewhere when it opens its first store in the country on Thursday, as it woos cost-conscious shoppers unaccustomed to DIY furniture.

Headlines: Beer drinkers lose U.S. appeal over Anheuser-SABMiller merger
Description: A federal appeals court on Wednesday rejected an antitrust challenge by 23 beer drinkers to Anheuser-Busch InBev SA's $107 billion purchase in 2016 of SABMiller Plc, which they claimed would thwart competition and raise prices in the U.S. beer market.

Headlines: New York City votes to cap Uber, Lyft vehicle licenses
Description: The New York City Council on Wednesday agreed to cap the number of licenses for ride-hailing services such as Uber Technologies Inc for one year, dealing a blow to the companies that have relied on the largest U.S. metro area for a major source of their revenue.

Headlines: Mazda, Suzuki, Yamaha Motor submit reports on improper testing: Japan ministry
Description: Mazda Motor Corp, Suzuki Motor Corp and Yamaha Motor Co have submitted reports to Japan's transport ministry that they conducted improper fuel economy and emissions tests on their vehicles, the ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Rouble slides towards two-year low on U.S. sanctions 'bill from hell'
Description: The rouble slid towards its lowest level in nearly two years on Wednesday and investors sold off bonds and stocks after the Kommersant daily published what it said was the full text of a draft U.S. law detailing possible penalties against Russia.

Headlines: Video of Redstone patriarch to be reviewed in CBS legal battle
Description: A video of 95-year-old Sumner Redstone, the patriarch of the family that owns the voting majority of CBS Corp , can be reviewed in the U.S. broadcast and media company's legal battle against the family, a Delaware judge ruled on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil drops on China import data, weighing on equities
Description: Oil prices slumped on Wednesday after Chinese import data showed a slowdown in demand and weighed on world equity markets, which traded near break-even as U.S. technology shares extended recent gains.

Headlines: SEC examining Musk's tweets on taking Tesla private: WSJ
Description: U.S. regulators are asking Tesla Inc why Chief Executive Elon Musk announced his plan to take the electric carmaker private on Twitter and whether his statement was truthful, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Papa John's growing rift with founder casts doubts on recovery
Description: Shares of Papa John's International Inc slumped as much as 7 percent on Wednesday and hit a near four-year low, a day after the U.S. pizza chain cut its current-quarter forecast blaming its ongoing tussle with the chain's founder.

Headlines: Amazon launches curbside pickup at Whole Foods stores
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Wednesday said it was launching curbside pickup at Whole Foods stores, in its latest tactic to win over U.S. grocery shoppers.

Headlines: China crude imports rise, but capped by weak 'teapot' demand
Description: China's crude oil imports recovered slightly in July after falling for the previous two months, but were still among the lowest this year due to a drop-off in demand from the country's smaller independent, or "teapot", refineries.

Headlines: Chinese media warns against 'wantonly' rising tariffs in U.S. trade war
Description: Certain people who want to wield the "stick of hegemony" on China with tariffs for their own personal ends will only end up hurting themselves, major Chinese state newspapers said on Wednesday in a unified message against the United States.

Headlines: China July coal imports highest in years as heatwave fuels demand
Description: China increased its coal imports in July by 14 percent to their highest in 4-1/2 years, official data showed on Wednesday, as rising temperatures boosted demand for coal-fired power to run air conditioners in the world's top buyer of the fuel.

Headlines: Instant View: China's copper, coal, oil and iron ore imports rise in July
Description: China's imports of copper, iron ore, coal and oil rose in July from the previous month, customs data showed on Wednesday, but soy imports dipped.

Headlines: China's iron ore imports rise in July despite pollution curbs
Description: China's iron ore imports rebounded in July, customs data showed on Wednesday, buoyed by record steel production and strong margins as official measures to cut pollution curb the output of cheaper products from small mills.

Headlines: China Tower joins growing list of subdued Hong Kong IPO debuts
Description: China Tower Corp Ltd's shares closed flat on their debut in Hong Kong on Wednesday, with escalating Sino-U.S. trade tensions dragging on investor sentiment toward the world's biggest initial public offering (IPO) in two years.

Headlines: Dutch court rejects Ryanair attempt to prevent pilots' strike
Description: A Dutch court on Thursday rejected a case from Ryanair seeking to block pilots in the Netherlands from joining a wider European strike scheduled for Friday at the airline to protest slow progress in negotiating a collective labor agreement.

Headlines: Is SpaceX the model for a private Tesla?
Description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk has held up his closely held space transportation company SpaceX as a model for taking his loss-making electric car company private, saying he wants existing Tesla investors to continue to hold stock.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp CEO sees job cuts as part of overhaul: FAZ
Description: Germany's embattled industrial group Thyssenkrupp expects job cuts as part of an overhaul of its operations, daily Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung (FAZ) reported, citing an interview with the top executive.

Headlines: Rite Aid and Albertsons terminate merger amid opposition to deal
Description: Drug store chain Rite Aid Corp and U.S. grocer Albertsons Companies Inc agreed to terminate their merger agreement, the companies said on Wednesday, a little over 10 days after a shareholder advisory firm opposed the deal.

Headlines: American Tower feud 'not positive' for Mexico's TV Azteca, Fitch says
Description: Credit ratings agency Fitch voiced concerns on Thursday that TV Azteca's legal battle with American Tower Corp was "not positive or favorable" for the Mexican broadcaster's credit profile, two days after Reuters reported the lawsuit.

Headlines: Loeb's Third Point calls for Campbell Soup sale: filing
Description: Billionaire investor Daniel Loeb and fellow Campbell Soup Co shareholder George Strawbridge on Thursday called for a sale of the iconic U.S. food company best known for its canned soups, according to a regulatory filing.

Headlines: U.S. built Mercedes-Benz SUV's held up by Chinese customs
Description: Mercedes-Benz sports utility vehicles built in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, are being checked for potential problems by Shanghai customs authorities, Daimler confirmed on Thursday, as a trade dispute between the United States and China heats up.

Headlines: Top auto supplier Magna takes $60 million hit from tariffs, but CEO still sees 'huge' opportunity
Description: Jim Cramer sits down with Magna International CEO Don Walker, who explains the effects of the Trump administration's tariffs on his manufacturing company.

Headlines: Apple's mettle in India tested in squabble over anti-spam app
Description: In India, the world's second-biggest smartphone market, Apple Inc's normally deft management of government relations is being put to a fresh high-stakes test.

Headlines: Chinese state media accuse U.S. of 'mobster mentality', vow to fight tariffs
Description: Chinese state media on Thursday accused the United States of a "mobster mentality" in its move to implement additional tariffs on Chinese goods, and warned Beijing had all the necessary means to fight back.

Headlines: Honda recalls another 69,000 vehicles in China
Description: Honda Motor Co. Ltd will recall 69,090 UR-V sport utility vehicles (SUVs) in China, market regulators said on Thursday, a result of a cold-climate engine problem that has already forced the recall of hundreds of thousands of vehicles.

Headlines: Musk's Tesla buyout plan could test Wall Street's nerves
Description: A leveraged buyout of electric carmaker Tesla could be an ominous sign of market exuberance, but investors may need more justification to run for the exits.

Headlines: Global trade losing momentum in third quarter, WTO indicator shows
Description: Lower export orders and car sales are likely to slow world trade growth in the third quarter, the WTO said, as a global tariff crusade by U.S. President Donald Trump to protect American jobs begins to bite.

Headlines: Energy executives lament Trump tariffs as costs rise on pipeline projects
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's proposal to double tariffs on steel and aluminum from Turkey could push up costs even further for domestic oil and gas pipeline projects, as energy executives said they were already struggling from earlier tariff rises.

Headlines: Emirates expects single-digit U.S. capacity rise in 2018: executive
Description: Emirates airline [EMIRA.UL] expects a single-digit percentage increase in its U.S. capacity in 2018, a company executive said on Friday, as sales rebound after travel restrictions imposed by the Trump administration weakened demand from the Middle East early last year.

Headlines: Turkish currency's freefall rocks world equity markets, euro
Description: A plunge in the Turkish lira rocked global equities and emerging markets on Friday and fear of further fallout sent investors scurrying for safety in assets like the yen and U.S. government bonds.

Headlines: Wall Street ends lower as Turkey woes hit banks
Description: U.S. stocks slid on Friday as a deepening economic crisis in Turkey dragged on bank shares and triggered a move out of riskier assets.

Headlines: Heineken considers closing Brazilian factories due to court dispute
Description: Heineken NV , the world's second-largest beer maker, is considering closing two factories in northeastern Brazil as "an extreme measure" after a court ordered the company to sell beer and soft drinks in the region at a money-losing price, the company said on Friday in a statement.

Headlines: Exclusive: Tesla's board seeking more information on Musk's financing plan - sources
Description: Tesla Inc's board has not yet received a detailed financing plan from CEO Elon Musk, and is seeking more information about how he will take the U.S. electric car maker private in a proposed deal worth $72 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Automakers balk at U.S. request for confidential info for import probe
Description: Two automotive trade groups on Friday raised "significant concerns" over the U.S. government's request for confidential business information as it probes whether automotive imports pose a national security risk, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. inflation pressures rise in July; Fed on track to lift rates
Description: U.S. consumer prices rose in July and the underlying trend continued to strengthen, pointing to a steady increase in inflation pressures that keeps the Federal Reserve on track to gradually raise interest rates.

Headlines: Dish Network CFO to step down, join Brookdale Senior Living
Description: Dish Network Corp's chief financial officer, Steven Swain, is leaving the U.S. satellite TV provider to become the finance chief at Brookdale Senior Living .

Headlines: China paper rebuts trade war criticism, says 'an elephant can't hide'
Description: China's top newspaper rebutted growing criticism in government circles that Beijing should have taken a lower profile to head off its trade war with the United States, saying on Friday that, like an elephant, China cannot hide its size and strength.

Headlines: Qualcomm settles anti-trust case with Taiwan regulator for $93 million
Description: Mobile chipmaker Qualcomm Inc will settle an anti-trust case with Taiwanese regulators for about $93 million, and has also pledged to invest $700 million in Taiwan over the next five years.

Headlines: Trade war threatens reign of luxury stocks
Description: An escalating trade war between the United States and China could abruptly end a glittering stock market run for luxury goods firms, with some investors already put off by lofty valuations in a sector powered by shoppers in the two countries.

Headlines: U.S. tells China's HNA to sell stake in NYC building near Trump Tower: WSJ
Description: The U.S. government has ordered Chinese conglomerate HNA Group Co Ltd [HNAIRC.UL] to sell its majority stake in a Manhattan building whose tenants include a police precinct tasked with protecting Trump Tower, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.

Headlines: Chinese media keep up drumbeat of criticism of U.S.
Description: China's state media continued a barrage of criticism of the United States on Saturday as their tit-for-tat trade war escalated, while seeking to reassure readers the Chinese economy remains in strong shape.

Headlines: Alaska seafood industry braces for China tariff pain
Description: Alaska fishermen are used to coping with fickle weather and wild ocean waves. Now they face a new challenge: the United States' trade war with China, which buys $1 billion in Alaskan fish annually, making it the state’s top seafood export market.

Headlines: Exclusive: Saudi Arabia's PIF has shown no interest in bankrolling Tesla buyout - sources
Description: Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund (PIF) has shown no interest so far in financing Tesla Inc CEO Elon Musk's proposed $72 billion deal to take the U.S. electric car maker private, despite acquiring a minority stake in the company this year, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: NRF lifts 2018 U.S. retail sales forecast on strong job market, tax reform
Description: The National Retail Federation on Monday raised its U.S. retail sales forecast for 2018, citing higher wages, gains in disposable income and a strong job market that have boosted consumer spending.

Headlines: Independent labels urge EU to block Sony's $2.3 billion bid for EMI
Description: Independent music labels group Impala has called on EU antitrust regulators to block Sony Corp's bid to become the world's largest music publisher with its $2.3 billion offer for control of EMI, saying the combination would have too much market power.

Headlines: WPP to quit London headquarters in break with past after Sorrell departure
Description: WPP is set to move out of its central London headquarters after 30 years, in another break with the past following the departure in April of founder and CEO Martin Sorrell from the world's largest advertising company.

Headlines: Turkey must ensure independence of central bank: Merkel
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel urged Turkey on Monday to ensure the independence of its central bank as other senior officials said that Turkey's economic woes were causing great concern.

Headlines: U.S. bank shares fall on Turkey contagion fears
Description: U.S. bank shares fell for a third straight session on Monday as investor appetite for risk weakened on worries that a currency crisis in Turkey would spread to other countries.

Headlines: Roundup cancer verdict sends Bayer shares sliding
Description: Bayer shares plunged as much as 14 percent on Monday, losing about $14 billion in value, after newly acquired Monsanto was ordered to pay $289 million in damages in the first of possibly thousands of U.S. lawsuits over alleged links between a weedkiller and cancer.

Headlines: Beijing struggles to defuse anger over China's P2P lending crisis
Description: Peter Wang was asleep at his home in Beijing last Monday when police officers arrived before dawn to detain him, saying he had helped organize a protest planned for later that day.

Headlines: Barclays shifting ownership of European branches to Irish unit ahead of Brexit: sources
Description: Barclays has begun shifting direct ownership of its French, German and Spanish branches from a British-based entity to its Irish bank, according to sources with direct knowledge of the plans, ahead of Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headlines: White House adviser Hassett: U.S. monitoring Turkey situation 'very closely'
Description: White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett said on Monday the Trump administration is monitoring the financial situation in Turkey "very closely" after the Turkish currency fell to a record low against the U.S. dollar on Monday.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin wins $480 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp has been awarded a $480 million U.S. defense contract for air-launched rapid response weapon critical design review and test and production readiness support, the Pentagon said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump backs boycott of Harley Davidson in steel tariff dispute
Description: President Donald Trump backed boycotting American motorcycle manufacturer Harley Davidson Inc on Sunday, the latest salvo in a dispute between the company and Trump over tariffs on steel.

Headlines: Icahn reverses position on Cigna-Express Scripts deal
Description: Activist investor Carl Icahn said on Monday that he no longer intended to solicit proxies to vote against the $52 billion Cigna-Express Scripts deal, a turn around from his position last week when he urged the health insurer's shareholders to vote against it.

Headlines: Wall Street dragged down by fall out from Turkey's plunging lira
Description: U.S. stocks dropped on Monday as global jitters from Turkey's plummeting currency spread to Wall Street, with the S&P 500 and the Dow falling for the fourth session in a row.

Headlines: U.S. economy seen strong in 2018, to slow in 2019: CBO
Description: U.S. economic growth will probably accelerate this year before slowing in 2019 to well below the Trump administration's 3 percent target as a fiscal stimulus fades, congressional researchers projected on Monday.

Headlines: Venezuela gasoline prices should rise to international levels: Maduro
Description: Venezuela's heavily subsidized domestic gasoline prices should rise to international levels to avoid billions of dollars in annual losses due to fuel smuggling, President Nicolas Maduro said in a televised address on Monday.

Headlines: Citigroup shakes up consumer bank and card chief leaves
Description: Citigroup Inc restructured its consumer bank on Monday, elevating one executive and triggering the departure of another, as the third-biggest U.S. bank moved to improve results.

Headlines: Kroger partners with Alibaba in China grocery sales venture
Description: Kroger Co has partnered with Alibaba Group Holding Ltd to sell nuts, supplements and other products in China, venturing outside the United States for the first time in what is fast becoming a fierce global battle to dominate online grocery sales.

Headlines: Berkshire boosts Goldman, Teva stakes; buys more Apple
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc boosted its investments in Goldman Sachs Group Inc and Israel's Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd during the second quarter and confirmed it has expanded its already huge bet on iPhone maker Apple Inc .

Headlines: Brinks CEO: We’re ‘ready’ for Canadian marijuana legalization
Description: Brinks CEO Douglas Pertz says that the cash management company is ready to benefit from legal cannabis in Canada, starting October 17.

Headlines: Soros Fund Management adds popular tech names, BlackRock in second quarter
Description: Soros Fund Management LLC added Facebook Inc, Apple Inc and Twitter Inc, but trimmed stakes in Alphabet Inc and Amazon.com Inc in the quarter through June, according to a regulatory filing on Tuesday.

Headlines: Musk says Silver Lake, Goldman advising on taking Tesla private
Description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk tweeted on Monday that he was working with buyout firm Silver Lake and investment bank Goldman Sachs Group Inc as financial advisers on his plan to take the U.S. electric car maker private.

Headlines: Sprint partners with LG to launch 5G smartphone in 2019
Description: Sprint Corp said Tuesday it has partnered with phone manufacturer LG Electronics Inc to launch a 5G smartphone in the first half of next year, marking the first 5G device deal for the No. 4 U.S. wireless carrier.

Headlines: DAMAC Properties 'holds its nerve' amid Dubai real estate slump: CFO
Description: Dubai's DAMAC Properties , owner and operator of the only Trump-branded golf club in the Middle East, is confident of its financial position despite registering its worst quarter in terms of booked sales since the company went public five years ago, its chief financial officer said.

Headlines: Novartis recruits new compliance head from Siemens after ethics stumbles
Description: Novartis has recruited a new chief ethics officer from Siemens after costly bribery scandals and a disputed $1.2 million contract with President Donald Trump's former lawyer that the Swiss drugmaker now calls a mistake.

Headlines: Tech still all the rage while bears prowl emerging markets: BAML survey
Description: Global investors remain overwhelmingly bullish on U.S. and Chinese tech shares, while short positions on emerging equities are growing increasingly popular, Bank of America Merrill Lynch's latest monthly fund manager survey showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Amazon to open Colombia service center, employ 600 workers
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Tuesday said it will open its first customer service center in Colombia in October and employ 600 people. The center, intended to prevent and resolve problems, will serve customers worldwide in Spanish, English and Portuguese, the world's largest online retailer said in a statement.

Headlines: Google provides data on U.S. political advertising
Description: Google has added a section to its twice-yearly transparency report to show who buys U.S. election ads on its platform and how much money is spent on political advertising, the search engine giant said on Wednesday.

Headlines: White House condemns Turkey's tariffs on U.S. imports
Description: The White House on Wednesday condemned Turkey's doubling of tariffs on U.S. cars, alcohol and tobacco imports, calling the action "a step in the wrong direction."

Headlines: Turkish finance minister says Turkey-Qatar will improve cooperation
Description: Turkey and Qatar will improve cooperation after Doha pledged to invest $15 billion in Turkey, Turkish Finance Minister Berat Albayrak said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. investor sues AT&T for $224 million over loss of cryptocurrency
Description: U.S. entrepreneur and cryptocurrency investor Michael Terpin filed a $224 million lawsuit on Wednesday against telecommunications company AT&T , accusing it of fraud and gross negligence in connection with the theft of digital currency tokens from his personal account.

Headlines: Trump says his steel tariffs will save the U.S. industry: WSJ
Description: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday his tariffs on foreign steel are saving the U.S. industry and he predicted that in the future American steelmakers will mostly face domestic competition, the Wall Street Journal reported.

Headlines: Cramer: Global sell-off isn't 'as special as it seems'
Description: Jim Cramer explains how the global sell-off is related to Turkey, China and Macy's and why it isn't as big of a deal as investors might think.

Headlines: Corona owner invests another $4 billion in cannabis producer Canopy
Description: Corona beer maker Constellation Brands will infuse another $4 billion into Canada's top cannabis producer Canopy Growth , the biggest investment in the industry, to capitalize on booming demand for marijuana.

Headlines: Royal Bank of Scotland pays $4.9 billion for crisis-era misconduct
Description: Royal Bank of Scotland will pay $4.9 billion to settle U.S. claims that it misled investors on residential mortgage-backed securities between 2005 and 2008, the U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Erdogan spokesman says problems with U.S. will be resolved
Description: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan's spokesman said on Wednesday he expected problems with the United States, which helped drive the lira to record lows, to be resolved but Washington must stop trying to influence Turkey's judiciary.

Headlines: Express Scripts staking out million-dollar gene therapies
Description: Express Scripts Holding Co built a multi-billion enterprise pressuring drug companies to lower their prices for U.S. patients. Now it is quietly building a side business: getting paid to help drug companies dispense a new generation of high-priced drugs.

Headlines: Turkey's doubling tariffs on U.S. products will amount to $533 million, trade minister says
Description: Turkish trade minister Ruhsar Pekcan says the doubling of customs tarrifs on some imported U.S. products would amount to $533 million, the state run Anadolu news agency reported.

Headlines: Brazil may probe Google over its cell phone system: report
Description: Brazil's antitrust watchdog Cade is considering opening an investigation into Google over alleged abuses in its cell phone operating system, the president of the agency said in an interview published on Wednesday in newspaper Valor Economico.

Headlines: Turkey, trade worries hit Wall Street
Description: U.S. stock indexes fell sharply on Wednesday, hurt by concerns over a stronger dollar and Turkey's currency crisis, as well as over the trade tensions with U.S. trading partners that have dominated the first half of 2018.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories edge up in June
Description: U.S. business inventories barely rose in June and the inventory-to-sales ratio fell to more than a 3-1/2-year low, suggesting businesses would need to ramp up the accumulation of stock, which would boost economic growth in the third quarter.

Headlines: Express Scripts staking out million dollar gene therapies
Description: Express Scripts Holding Co built a multi-billion enterprise pressuring drug companies to lower their prices for U.S. patients. Now it is quietly building a side business: getting paid to help drug companies dispense a new generation of high-priced drugs.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales, manufacturing data bolster third-quarter economic outlook
Description: U.S. retail sales rose more than expected in July as households boosted purchases of motor vehicles and clothing, suggesting the economy remained strong early in the third quarter.

Headlines: Wall St. rallies on solid earnings, U.S.-China trade talks
Description: U.S. stocks rebounded on Thursday with the Dow posting its biggest percentage gain in over four months, as positive earnings and waning trade jitters buoyed investor confidence.

Headlines: Whistleblower accuses Tesla of spying on employees at Gigafactory: attorney
Description: An employee fired from Tesla Inc's Nevada battery factory filed a whistleblower complaint with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, accusing the company of spying on employees and failing to act after learning that a Mexican cartel may be dealing drugs inside the plant, his attorney said on Thursday.

Headlines: Cramer: Post Holdings' portfolio gives stock 'room to run'
Description: Jim Cramer says Post Holdings' spin-off of its private label division and smart acquisitions have shown that the company knows how to unlock value.

Headlines: Cramer: Don’t dismiss Sen. Elizabeth Warren’s ideas as bad for companies
Description: While Senator Elizabeth Warren’s economic policies are known to spark divisive reactions, CNBC’s Jim Cramer thinks that investors shouldn’t be too quick to write off her ideas as bad for business.

Headlines: Trump pushes U.S. lawsuit against drug companies over opioids
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday again pressed U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions to sue drug companies over the nation's ongoing opioids crisis.

Headlines: Turkey does not wish to have problems with U.S.: foreign minister
