Headlines: PwC says more tech is solution for higher audit standards
Description: The Big Four accounting firms can invest in technology that will raise standards beyond what could be achieved by smaller rivals, the head of PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) said on Tuesday, defending the top firms against UK calls to be broken up.

Headlines: Ghosn turns to Japanese to deflect Renault-Nissan succession question
Description: Carlos Ghosn, head of the world's largest automotive alliance by sales, gets a lot of questions about who could replace him, and at the Paris auto show on Tuesday he used a fresh way to postpone an answer.

Headlines: Amazon raises minimum wage to $15, urges rivals to follow
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Tuesday it would raise its minimum wage to $15 per hour for U.S. employees from next month, giving in to critics of poor pay and working conditions at the world's second most valuable company.

Headlines: Kroger to test grocery pick-up program at Walgreens stores
Description: U.S. grocer Kroger Co said on Tuesday it is exploring a partnership with Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc to allow its customers order online and pick up groceries at some of the drug retailer's stores.

Headlines: Italy's Enel names Nicola Cotugno chief of Brazil operations
Description: Italian utility Enel SpA on Tuesday named Nicola Cotugno as the country manager for its Brazilian operations, replacing Carlo Zorzoli, who will head global business development at Enel's green power unit in Italy.

Headlines: Senator Bernie Sanders applauds Amazon for wage hike
Description: U.S. Democratic Senator and prominent Amazon critic Bernie Sanders praised the company's move to increase minimum hourly wages to $15 on Tuesday and said other companies should follow its lead.

Headlines: Euro weakens to six-week low as Italian concerns weigh
Description: The euro fell to a six-week low on Tuesday after a senior lawmaker in one of Italy's ruling parties said most of the country's problems would be resolved if it readopted a national currency.

Headlines: Tariffs could lift U.S. prices but no sign yet: Fed's Powell
Description: The array of trade tariffs and counter measures from other countries could raise U.S. inflation but there is so far no indication of that happening, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed regulator says midsize bank relief 'highest priority'
Description: The Federal Reserve's top regulator told U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday that his "highest priority" is enacting simpler rules for banks with between $100 billion and $250 billion in assets, though Republicans pressed for a more drastic easing.

Headlines: Brexit uncertainty weighs on Jaguar's electric car investment decision
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover has yet to make an imminent decision on whether to build electric cars in its home market partly due to uncertainty over the final Brexit terms, its boss told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: LVMH watch brands to attend Baselworld 2019, changes needed for 2020
Description: Luxury goods group LVMH's watch brands will be present at the next edition of the Baselworld watch fair in March, the outgoing head of its watch division told CNN Money Switzerland, adding the world's biggest trade show needs to make changes in 2020.

Headlines: PepsiCo margin slip clouds profit beat, North America beverage rebound
Description: PepsiCo Inc's quarterly profit margins disappointed investors on Tuesday as commodity and transportation costs jumped, overshadowing an earnings beat fueled by growth in emerging markets and a rebound in North American beverage sales.

Headlines: Citigroup plans to grow offshore booking center in UAE: executive
Description: Citigroup plans to boost the United Arab Emirates' role as an offshore booking center and is working towards a full banking license in Saudi Arabia, helping to propel its regional growth, a senior executive told Reuters.

Headlines: BMW would up Dutch production in hard Brexit scenario: CEO
Description: German carmaker BMW sees a 50:50 chance of Britain leaving the European Union without a trade agreement, which would force it to shift more production of Mini vehicles to the Netherlands, Chief Executive Harald Krueger said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Volkswagen not prepared to cover full costs of diesel retrofits: source
Description: Volkswagen is not prepared to cover the full cost of hardware retrofits for older diesel vehicles in Germany, a source at Volkswagen said, contradicting a deal announced by the German coalition parties on Tuesday.

Headlines: Sharp makes long-awaited OLED foray, wary of big spending
Description: Japan's Sharp Corp unveiled its long-awaited move into the organic light-emitting diode (OLED) market on Wednesday as the Apple Inc supplier looks to catch rival Samsung Electronics Co Ltd .

Headlines: Wells Fargo has not done enough to refund cheated drivers: regulator
Description: Wells Fargo & Co has not convinced U.S. regulators it is doing enough to repay 600,000 drivers who were wrongly pushed into buying auto insurance, a leading bank regulator said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hilton to double hotels in Africa in next five years: CEO
Description: Hilton Worldwide Holdings plans to more than double its hotels in Africa in the next five years by mainly striking deals with existing hotels for conversion into its brand, its chief executive said.

Headlines: How Trump's son-in-law helped salvage the North American trade zone
Description: Robert Lighthizer was the public face of arduous, year-long talks to rework NAFTA, but as he savored a successful conclusion in the White House Rose Garden on Monday, the U.S. trade representative singled out another man as the deal's architect.

Headlines: Making cars separately for UK and EU would impact UK production, PSA warns
Description: If Britain's departure from the European Union disrupts trade to the extent PSA Group has to make cars separately for the two markets, there would "necessarily be an impact" on its UK production, the automaker's European boss said on Tuesday.

Headlines: 'A tale of two hurricanes' for September U.S. new car sales
Description: Major automakers on Tuesday posted a hefty drop in U.S. new vehicle sales for September, caused in part by a decline in sales in areas hit by Hurricane Florence and a tough comparison to the previous September when consumers rushed to replace vehicles damaged by Hurricane Harvey.

Headlines: Italy weighs on global stocks, but Dow bucks trend to mark record high close
Description: Stock indexes around the globe weakened on Tuesday, European assets sold off and Italy's bond yields hit multi-year highs after an Italian lawmaker made anti-euro comments, though Wall Street's blue-chip index bucked the trend and set a new record.

Headlines: Tesla worried by China tariffs even as deliveries surge
Description: Tesla Inc announced record quarterly car production on Tuesday but warned of major problems with selling cars in China due to new tariffs that would force it to accelerate investment in its factory in Shanghai.

Headlines: Amazon raises minimum wage rates in Britain
Description: Amazon said on Tuesday it is raising its minimum wage in Britain to 10.50 pounds ($13.59) an hour for all employees in the London area and 9.50 pounds an hour for staff in all other parts of the country, effective from Nov. 1.

Headlines: Canada PM takes Quebec dairy gamble to preserve big trade deal
Description: With his political future at stake, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will mount a charm offensive to placate dairy farmers who say he sold them out in order to win approval of a continental trade deal.

Headlines: Toys 'R' Us lenders cancel auction, plan to revive brand
Description: The top lenders of Toys 'R' Us have decided to cancel the bankruptcy auction of its brand name and other intellectual property assets and instead plan to revive the Toys 'R' Us and Babies 'R' Us brand names, a court filing on Monday showed.

Headlines: Fed's Powell says U.S. outlook 'remarkably positive'
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Tuesday hailed a "remarkably positive outlook" for the U.S. economy that he feels is on the verge of a "historically rare" era of ultra-low unemployment and tame prices for the foreseeable future.

Headlines: Inflation expectations haven't gone up as much as wanted: Fed's Evans
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans said on Wednesday that U.S. inflation expectations in financial markets hadn't gone up as much as he would have liked.

Headlines: Federal Reserve prepares for next crisis, bets it will begin like the last
Description: The Federal Reserve painted a picture of the U.S. economy that was almost too good to be true at its last meeting, with inflation seen contained in the near future despite the lowest unemployment rate in 20 years.

Headlines: Fed's Evans says comfortable with a December rate hike
Description: Federal Reserve policymaker Charles Evans said on Wednesday he was comfortable with expectations in financial markets that the U.S. central bank will raise interest rates again in December.

Headlines: U.S. services sector activity hits 21-year high; hiring accelerates
Description: U.S. services sector activity raced to a 21-year high in September and companies boosted hiring, signs of enduring strength in the economy at the end of the third quarter.

Headlines: North American orders for semi-trucks surge in September
Description: North American orders for Class 8 semi-trucks jumped 92 percent in September as trucking companies continued to struggle with tight capacity in a booming U.S. freight market, FTR, a company that tracks the industry, said on Wednesday.

Headlines: With rates on the rise, Fed must plan for next downturn, Evans says
Description: With the U.S. economy strong, inflation nearly back to the Federal Reserve's 2-percent goal, and the Fed's gradual rate hikes likely to begin mildly restraining growth by late next year, it is time to consider how best to fight the next downturn, a U.S. central banker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fed can hold rates 'relatively indefinitely' when mildly restrictive: Evans
Description: U.S. interest rates could plateau for a while once they have risen to a level we they become mildly restrictive for the economy, Federal Reserve policy maker Charles Evans said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Dollar hits six-week highs on hawkish Fed
Description: The U.S. dollar rose to its highest in six weeks on Wednesday as Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the U.S. economy is “remarkably positive” and spoke of the need to continue raising interest rates.

Headlines: Financials lift Wall Street, but rate worry caps gains
Description: Wall Street advanced on Wednesday and the Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at a record for a second day, after U.S. economic data fueled a rise in Treasury yields, lifting financial stocks.

Headlines: U.S. retailer group sees 2018 holiday sales up more than 4 percent
Description: U.S. holiday sales in 2018 will increase 4.3 percent to 4.8 percent boosted by a strong economy but will be slower than a year ago when consumer spending surged to a 12-year high, according to a forecast from a leading retail industry group.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil eyes multi-billion dollar investment at Singapore refinery: executive
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp is considering a multi-billion dollar investment at its Singapore refinery, the company's largest, ahead of new global shipping fuel regulations starting in 2020, a senior executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Cramer: Beware the bears' warnings on global markets—they could lead you astray
Description: Jim Cramer warns investors not to take market pessimists too seriously when they warn that financial trouble overseas could affect U.S. stocks.

Headlines: Aston Martin shares open flat at 19 pounds per share in London debut
Description: Shares in luxury carmaker Aston Martin opened flat at the offer price of 19 pounds ($24.70) per share in its London debut on Wednesday.

Headlines: Looming large: Shell's LNG Canada seen as tip of megaproject iceberg
Description: The launch of a massive liquefied natural gas (LNG) export project in Canada could fire the starting gun on a wave of other approvals around the world, potentially curbing a supply crunch expected after 2020.

Headlines: Tech giants allied against proposed Australia law seeking encrypted data
Description: Four global tech giants - Facebook, Apple, Alphabet and Amazon - will oppose an Australian law that would require them to provide access to private encrypted data linked to suspected illegal activities, an industry lobby group said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Lilly's diabetes drug data impresses, hurts rival Novo's shares
Description: Eli Lilly and Co said on Thursday its new two-in-one diabetes drug was successful in lowering blood sugar and reducing weight, sending its shares to a record high and weighing on those of arch-rival Novo Nordisk .

Headlines: E-cigarette maker Juul files complaints against 'copycat products'
Description: Juul Labs, the e-cigarette maker at the heart of a U.S. crackdown on youth vaping, has filed patent infringement complaints in the United States and Europe against what it said were copycat rivals.

Headlines: Gucci boss reassures staff over looming era of slower growth
Description: The head of Gucci has reassured shop staff over a looming slowdown in the pace of sales growth after a revenue explosion at the Kering -owned label, according to an internal video message seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Wells Fargo planning its first post-crisis mortgage bond: Bloomberg
Description: Wells Fargo & Co is planning its first post-crisis offering of bonds tied to U.S. home loans without government backing, Bloomberg reported on Thursday citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Chipotle CEO and CFO: 'We're back on our front foot' after food safety scandals
Description: Jim Cramer sits down with Chipotle Mexican Grill CEO Brian Niccol and CFO Jack Hartung to hear about how they're moving on from the chain's past food safety problems.

Headlines: Wealth managers count cost of U.S.-Chinese trade war on Asian business
Description: The performance of big wealth managers may take hit as a trade war between the United States and China hurts business in major growth market Asia, bankers said.

Headlines: Aston Martin skids on market debut
Description: Shares in luxury automaker Aston Martin fell as much as 6.5 percent on their market debut in London on Wednesday as investors and analysts raised concerns over its ability to deliver an ambitious roll-out of new models.

Headlines: Russia's major state banks see forex outflow amid sanctions threats
Description: Russia's largest lenders, state-owned Sberbank and VTB , saw outflows of foreign currency deposits in August amid a rouble depreciation and concerns about new U.S. sanctions, according to an analysis of central bank data.

Headlines: U.S. job growth cools; unemployment rate drops to 3.7 percent
Description: U.S. job growth slowed sharply in September likely as Hurricane Florence depressed restaurant and retail payrolls, but the unemployment rate fell to near a 49-year low of 3.7 percent, pointing to a further tightening in labor market conditions.

Headlines: N.Y. Fed lowers U.S. Q3, Q4 GDP growth view
Description: U.S. gross domestic product is expanding at a 2.27 percent clip in the third quarter, slower than the 2.47 percent pace calculated a week ago, the New York Federal Reserve's Nowcast model showed on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. job growth slows; unemployment rate falls to 3.7 percent
Description: U.S. job growth slowed sharply in September, likely as Hurricane Florence depressed restaurant and retail payrolls, but the unemployment rate fell to near a 49-year low of 3.7 percent, pointing to a further tightening in labor market conditions.

Headlines: Atlanta Fed keeps U.S. third-quarter GDP growth view at 4.1 percent
Description: The U.S. economy is expanding at a 4.1 percent annualized rate in the third quarter, the Atlanta Federal Reserve's GDPNow forecast model showed on Friday, following the release of the latest payrolls and trade data.

Headlines: America First is hurting China's business
Description: The U.S. economy has pulled ahead this year, extending a lengthy expansion with help from President Donald Trump's "America First" agenda and massive tax cuts, but upcoming data could illuminate the impact of his policies on global peers.

Headlines: Are transportation stocks the market's canary in a coal mine?
Description: The U.S. transportation sector, which many see as a proxy indicator of the economy's health, has retreated 3.1 percent from its Sept. 14 record, hinting to some analysts that the longest bull market on record has entered its late stages.

Headlines: A decade of U.S. economic sluggishness may have just snapped back to normal
Description: For a solid decade after the collapse of Lehman Brothers touched off a global financial crisis, there was good reason to think the U.S. economy remained broken, from skepticism about the health of the labor market to tepid economic growth and the moribund rate of interest paid on U.S. Treasury bonds.

Headlines: Wall Street falls as solid jobs report boosts bond yields
Description: U.S. stocks dropped for a second straight day on Friday, weighed down by another rise in Treasury yields in the wake of a solid jobs report that capped off a week of robust data.

Headlines: U.S. plans to rewrite rules that impede self-driving cars
Description: The Trump administration is moving ahead with plans to revise safety rules that bar fully self-driving cars from the roads without equipment such as steering wheels, pedals and mirrors, according to a document made public on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil prices mark weekly gain ahead of Iran sanctions
Description: Crude futures steadied on Friday after climbing to four-year highs earlier this week, and both Brent and U.S. crude marked weekly gains ahead of U.S. sanctions on Iranian oil exports.

Headlines: Stocks fall globally after U.S. jobs data, Treasury yields rise again
Description: Major world stock markets sank for a second straight day on Friday after strong U.S. jobs numbers signaled a continued tightening of the labor market and increased inflation pressures, while Treasury yields rose again to multi-year highs.

Headlines: Tariff deal with U.S. not yet even in 'pre-work' stage: EU trade chief
Description: The European Union has yet to begin even "pre-work" towards a transatlantic trade agreement on industrial goods aimed at averting a tariff war with U.S. President Donald Trump, Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmstrom said on Friday.

Headlines: Abandoned by Unilever, Dutch prime minister forced to reconsider tax plan
Description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said his government would reconsider plans to scrap its dividend tax in a major political climbdown only hours after Unilever dropped plans to move its headquarters to the Netherlands.

Headlines: Era of bank secrecy ends as Swiss start sharing account data
Description: The era of mystery-cloaked numbered Swiss bank accounts has officially come to a close as Switzerland, the world's biggest center for managing offshore wealth, began automatically sharing client data with tax authorities in dozens of other countries.

Headlines: Toyota, sensing an opening, debates building Lexus cars in China
Description: Toyota Motor Corp, long opposed to producing its premium Lexus cars in China because of concerns over quality and profitability, is now considering it to ignite growth and narrow sales gaps with its German rivals, four company insiders told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit jumps to six-month high in August
Description: The U.S. trade deficit increased to a six-month high in August as exports dropped further amid declining soybean shipments and imports hit a record high, suggesting that trade could weigh on economic growth in the third quarter.

Headlines: Italy works on extending Alitalia loan deadline: source
Description: Italy is working on an extension of as much as six months to a Dec. 15 deadline for Alitalia to repay a 900 million euro ($1 billion) loan meant to keep the airline afloat while it searches for a buyer, a government source said on Saturday.

Headlines: Banks back Democrats in bid to rebuild bipartisan support
Description: Banks are going to bat for Democrats in the U.S. November midterm congressional elections as part of an ambitious strategy to rebuild the bipartisan support they enjoyed before the 2007-2009 financial crisis.

Headlines: UK seeks additional reassurances from Comcast on independence of Sky News
Description: Britain has sought additional reassurances from cable company Comcast over the editorial independence of the Sky News television channel following the U.S. group's takeover of broadcaster Sky .

Headlines: Why are investment banks nervous about Australia's cartel case?
Description: Investment bankers are bracing for the start of a landmark legal case about alleged cartel activity in Australia's financial sector, nervous the proceedings could lead to increased scrutiny and tougher measures from regulators worldwide.

Headlines: Italy keen to keep 15 percent stake in Alitalia in rescue plan: paper
Description: Italy is working on an Alitalia rescue plan that would see the state taking a stake of around 15 percent in the carrier along with separate investments by state-owned firms such as Ferrovie dello Stato and a foreign player, Il Sole 24 Ore said on Sunday.

Headlines: Walmart partners with MGM to boost video-on-demand service Vudu
Description: Walmart Inc said on Monday it will partner with U.S. movie studio Metro Goldwyn Mayer to create content for its Vudu video-on-demand service, which the retailer bought eight years ago.

Headlines: Former Tesco executives encouraged profit overstatement, misled stock market, court told
Description: Two former senior executives of Tesco abused their positions to encourage practices that resulted in a 250 million pounds ($327 million) overstatement of expected profits and misled the stock market, a prosecutor told a London court on Monday.

Headlines: EU bank watchdog examining Danish handling of Danske
Description: Denmark's financial watchdog faces an inquiry by the European Union's banking supervisor into how it supervised Danske Bank , which last week said it was being investigated by the U.S. Department of Justice over alleged money laundering.

Headlines: Swiss bank UBS on trial in France over alleged tax fraud
Description: Swiss bank UBS Group AG , its French unit and six executives faced charges of aggravated tax fraud and money laundering on Monday, the first day of a trial into allegations they helped wealthy clients avoid taxes in France.

Headlines: Facebook debuts smart speaker for Messenger video calls
Description: Facebook Inc on Monday released a smart speaker designed to ease video calls, but the company's history of privacy mishaps and the device's price and limited functionality could slow it from taking on market leaders Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google.

Headlines: Exclusive: Microsoft's $7.5 billion GitHub deal set for EU approval - sources
Description: U.S. software giant Microsoft is set to win unconditional EU antitrust approval for its $7.5 billion purchase of privately held coding website GitHub, two people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: UK union calls on its Uber drivers to strike on Tuesday
Description: A British trade union called on Uber [UBER.UL] drivers to strike in London, Birmingham and Nottingham on Tuesday for 24 hours by not signing into the app, in a push for higher fares and more working rights.

Headlines: Starbucks taps Hyatt financial chief to be its new CFO
Description: Starbucks Corp on Monday named Hyatt Hotels Corp's financial chief Patrick Grismer as its new chief financial officer, making another leadership change in the past year as it battles intense competition in a cooling U.S. coffee market.

Headlines: Emerging market stocks' descent to 17 month lows entices U.S. investors
Description: The steep decline in emerging market stocks since early this year are attracting some U.S. fund managers who think they may find long-term bargains amid the sell-off.

Headlines: Exclusive: Codelco in talks to sell copper to China's Minmetals in three-year deals
Description: Codelco is in talks to sell up to 60,000 tonnes of copper a year to China Minmetals from 2019 to 2021, marking a change in sales strategy at Chile's state-owned miner which typically made deals on an annual basis, industry sources said.

Headlines: General Motors China sales go into reverse as market stalls
Description: General Motors Co's quarterly sales in China fell for the first time in over a year, hit by faltering economic growth and a wider slowdown in the world's biggest auto market amid a whipsawing trade war with the United States.

Headlines: U.S. data 'looking good' ahead of December rates meeting, Fed's Bullard says
Description: St. Louis Federal Reserve Bank President James Bullard said on Monday that any further interest rate hike in United States this year should depend on data, but that indicators were "looking good".

Headlines: Comcast's $40 billion Sky takeover becomes unconditional
Description: U.S. cable company Comcast took control of Sky on Tuesday after it acquired the 39 percent of the company owned by Twenty-First Century Fox, the rival it defeated with a $40 billion knock-out bid for the European pay-TV group last month.

Headlines: Unions accuse Chevron of 'massive' tax avoidance via the Netherlands
Description: International and Dutch unions filed a complaint with a global trade body on Tuesday accusing Chevron Corp. of funneling billions of euros through letter box companies in the Netherlands to avoid taxation.

Headlines: Self-driving cars may hit U.S. roads in pilot program: NHTSA
Description: Fully self-driving cars may be on the fast lane to U.S. roads under a pilot program the Trump administration said on Tuesday it was considering, which would allow real-world road testing for a limited number of the vehicles.

Headlines: Google challenges record $5 billion EU antitrust fine
Description: Alphabet unit Google on Tuesday challenged a record 4.34-billion euro ($5 billion) fine imposed by European Union antitrust regulators three months ago for using its popular Android mobile operating system to thwart rivals.

Headlines: EU nations agree to seek 35 percent CO2 cut on cars by 2030
Description: European Union nations, voicing concern over a U.N. report on global warming, agreed on Tuesday to seek a 35 percent cut in car emissions by 2030, as Germany warned that overly challenging targets risked harming industry and jobs.

Headlines: Dollar weakens as bond yields retreat after rapid rise
Description: Stocks on major world markets edged lower on Tuesday, with a decline in the materials sector offsetting rising energy shares, while long-dated U.S. Treasury yields pulled back from multi-year highs and helped weaken the U.S. dollar.

Headlines: P&G gets steel tariff exemption for Gillette, Venus razors
Description: Procter & Gamble Co was informed on Tuesday that it is now exempt from the 25 percent U.S. tariff levied on imported Japanese and Swedish steel that is used in its Gillette and Venus razor blades, a company spokesman told Reuters.

Headlines: Google unveils new Pixel phone, adds tablet in Apple challenge
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Tuesday unveiled the third edition of its Pixel smartphone, a Google Home smart speaker with a display and its first tablet computer as it makes a come-from-behind push into hardware.

Headlines: China slashes U.S. LPG imports amid trade war
Description: China has choked back on imports of liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) from the United States, traders and analysts said, turning to the Middle East for extra supplies amid the two countries' trade dispute.

Headlines: Nigeria's central bank head to meet MTN and banks over $8.1 billion repatriation row -sources
Description: Nigeria's central bank governor is to meet representatives of telecommunications company MTN and banks on Tuesday to discuss a dispute over the repatriation of $8.1 billion, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: PIMCO's Amey says Britain to avoid disorderly Brexit
Description: The pound can strengthen 5 to 10 percent from current levels because Britain and the European Union are likely to reach an agreement to avert a disorderly Brexit, the head of sterling portfolios at fund management giant PIMCO said on Monday.

Headlines: Daimler eyes joint venture with China's Geely: Bloomberg
Description: German vehicle manufacturer Daimler AG is in talks with China's Geely Holding Group Co to set up a joint venture to offer ride-hailing and car-sharing services in China, Bloomberg reported, citing sources.

Headlines: Qualcomm adds two new members to its board
Description: Qualcomm Inc said on Tuesday it named Martin Anstice, chief executive officer of chip gear maker Lam Research Corp, and Irene Rosenfeld, former chairman and CEO of U.S. snack foods company Mondelez International Inc, to its board.

Headlines: Proxy firm Glass Lewis had endorsed Unilever's Dutch move
Description: Proxy advisory firm Glass Lewis had recommended shareholders vote for Unilever's proposed move to the Netherlands before the plan was scrapped last week.

Headlines: Exclusive: EU set to clear start of talks to boost U.S. beef imports
Description: European Union countries are on the verge of agreeing to start negotiations with the United States to allow more U.S. beef into Europe, in what could be a major move to defuse transatlantic trade tensions.

Headlines: Instant View: Wall Street shares slide, tech losses in focus
Description: Wall Street shares slid on Wednesday, with all three major U.S. indexes down more than 2 percent in the afternoon as investors dumped high-growth names such as technology and FAANG stocks, with rising Treasury yields and trade-related worries sapping their risk appetite.

Headlines: Trump briefed on stock market sell-off: CNBC
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has been briefed on Wednesday's stock market sell-off, a senior White House official told CNBC, as the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped more than 3 percent in one day and the S&P 500 marked its biggest daily decline since February.

Headlines: Exclusive: Brazil's Bolsonaro would not sell Petrobras in short term - party chief
Description: The far-right front-runner in Brazil's presidential election, Jair Bolsonaro, has no plans to privatize oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA in the short term if elected, the president of his party told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Citigroup may face fair lending penalty from regulator - sources
Description: A U.S. financial regulator is mulling sanctions against Citigroup Inc for denying minority customers the kinds of mortgage discounts that the bank offered to many other borrowers, three people familiar with the probe told Reuters.

Headlines: Fed policymaker says clarity key to avoiding global disruptions
Description: As the Federal Reserve keeps raising interest rates in a strong U.S. economy, transparency and open communications will be key to avoiding market disruptions and misunderstanding in other countries, an influential Fed policymaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. stock index futures down as trading resumes
Description: U.S. stock index futures were down slightly late Wednesday after they resumed trading for the overnight session.

Headlines: CVS, Aetna win U.S. approval for $69 billion deal
Description: Pharmacy chain CVS Health Corp won U.S. antitrust approval for its $69 billion acquisition of health insurer Aetna Inc , the Justice Department said on Wednesday, paving the way for a combination with potential to cut U.S. healthcare costs for consumers.

Headlines: Fat profits: Asian traders cash in as Europe thirsts for waste oils
Description: Once surreptitiously dumped down drains in the dead of night, Asia's used cooking oil is fast becoming one of the most sought-after commodities in Europe - as a feedstock for biodiesel.

Headlines: Chinese finance ministry official says 'optimistic' on trade war breakthrough
Description: A Chinese finance ministry official said on Wednesday he felt "a little bit more optimistic" on the prospect of breaking an impasse in trade negotiations with Washington, saying both sides are too economically integrated to tolerate a fallout.

Headlines: France's Monoprix says grocery alliance with Amazon Prime tops expectations
Description: Casino's upmarket Monoprix supermarket chain said the start of its partnership with Amazon Prime's delivery service for Paris had been better than expected - an alliance that could prove crucial for debt-ridden Casino's fortunes.

Headlines: GM appoints former CIA official Jami Miscik to its board
Description: General Motors Co named former Central Intelligence Agency official Jami Miscik to its board, the No.1 U.S. automaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Swiss top court knocks down bid to extend banking secrecy
Description: Switzerland's highest court ruled on Wednesday that prosecutors cannot extend Swiss banking secrecy rules to all corners of the globe to pursue whistleblowers and other leakers at foreign subsidiaries.

Headlines: U.S. agency says Tesla safety claim goes beyond its analysis
Description: Tesla Inc claimed its Model 3 electric car has the lowest risk of occupant injury of any vehicle in U.S. government tests, but the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Tuesday said the claim goes beyond the scope of its analysis.

Headlines: U.S. wholesale inventories rise slightly more than initially estimated
Description: U.S. wholesale inventories rose slightly more than initially thought in August.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices rebound, wholesale inventories rise
Description: U.S. producer prices increased 0.2 percent in September, in line with expectations, while a revision to wholesale inventory estimates for August showed the biggest jump in nearly five years, beating forecasts.

Headlines: Exclusive: Shell seeks to sell Venezuela JV stake to France's Maurel & Prom - sources
Description: Royal Dutch Shell Plc is negotiating the sale of its stake in a Venezuelan oil joint venture to Paris-based Maurel & Prom , three sources said this week, a move to scale down its crude business in the ailing OPEC-member country to focus on gas.

Headlines: Canada to impose steel safeguards after U.S. tariffs
Description: Canada will impose new quotas and tariffs on imports of seven categories of steel, the federal government said on Thursday, fresh measures to head off a potential rise in imports as overseas steelmakers shut out of the United States seek new customers.

Headlines: U.S. safety agency OKs advanced headlights for road use
Description: The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Thursday said it was moving to allow advanced headlights known as "adaptive driving beams" to be used in vehicles on U.S. roads that could help prevent nighttime crashes.

Headlines: Lockheed, Rheinmetall to make joint bid to supply German navy helicopters
Description: U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin Corp and German peer Rheinmetall AG said on Thursday they will make a joint bid to supply the German navy with MH-60R Seahawk helicopters built by Lockheed's Sikorsky unit.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sears CEO Lampert explores bidding for assets in bankruptcy - sources
Description: Sears Holdings Corp Chief Executive Officer Eddie Lampert is exploring a bid for some of the cash-strapped U.S. retailer's businesses and real estate once it files for bankruptcy, an alternative to a traditional court-supervised reorganization, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Machines take the blame as U.S. stock market sells off
Description: Investors searching for perpetrators and victims in this week's U.S. stock market selloff pointed to a familiar source: number-crunching fund managers and machines.

Headlines: Australia's ANZ fired senior executives due to bad banking behavior: CEO
Description: Australia and New Zealand Banking Group fired over 200 staff for wrongdoing, including senior executives, due in part to issues raised at a public inquiry into financial sector misconduct, ANZ Chief Executive Shayne Elliott said on Friday.

Headlines: Cramer's sell-off handbook: 4 things need to happen for stocks to recover
Description: Jim Cramer says the stock market's recovery hinges on the Federal Reserve, oil prices, the transportation industry and the trade war with China.

Headlines: Mounting costs add to worries about 2019 US profit growth
Description: Rising costs for companies are worrying investors already concerned about a step down in U.S. corporate profit growth next year as Wall Street's focus turns away from 2018's tax-fueled earnings boost.

Headlines: Call 'em crazy, but Fed officials likely to keep raising rates
Description: A stock sell-off, rising trade tension with China, slower global growth and verbal pressure from the White House are unlikely to dent the U.S. Federal Reserve's rate hike plans in an economy performing in line with the central bank's forecasts.

Headlines: U.S. inflation slows in September, weekly jobless claims increase
Description: U.S. consumer prices rose less than expected in September, held back by a slower increase in the cost of rent and falling energy prices, as underlying inflation pressures appeared to cool slightly.

Headlines: Sears skips payments to vendors amid bankruptcy concerns
Description: Sears Holdings Corp has started to miss payments to vendors, adding to concerns about its future after sources said the U.S. department store operator was preparing to file for bankruptcy in the coming days.

Headlines: Toyota, SoftBank in first-ever alliance, target self-driving car services
Description: (This October 4 story corrects paragraph 17 to show Toyota has partnership, not investment, in Didi Chuxing.)

Headlines: German coalition parties spat over diesel car fines
Description: Ministers from Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservatives attacked on Thursday a proposal by the Social Democrats to fine carmakers who fail to offer diesel hardware retrofits, opening a new battle front in their fragile coalition government.

Headlines: Exclusive: Reverse gear - China car dealers push for tax cut as auto growth stalls
Description: China's top auto dealers' association has asked the government to halve taxes on car purchases to revive faltering sales, sources said, as worries grow the country's auto market could shrink this year for the first time in decades.

Headlines: Trump calls 'loco' Federal Reserve 'too aggressive'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump launched a second day of criticism against the Federal Reserve on Thursday, calling its interest rate increases a "ridiculous" policy that was making it more expensive for his administration to finance its escalating deficits.

Headlines: Foxconn's Sept revenue jumps, buoys hopes for solid sales at Apple
Description: Taiwan's Foxconn, a key Apple Inc supplier, reported a 30 percent jump in September revenue on Thursday, boosting expectations for solid product sales for the American tech giant even as U.S.-China trade war escalates.

Headlines: Mounting costs add to worries about 2019 U.S. profit growth
Description: Rising costs for companies are worrying investors already concerned about a step down in U.S. corporate profit growth next year as Wall Street's focus turns away from 2018's tax-fueled earnings boost.

Headlines: IMF chief defends Powell after Trump slams 'crazy' Fed
Description: The head of the International Monetary Fund on Thursday defended Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell one day after U.S. President Donald Trump criticized the American central bank, which has been raising U.S. interest rates, as "crazy."

Headlines: U.S. jobless claims rise unexpectedly in latest week
Description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits unexpectedly rose last week but remained near a 49-year low, and the increase appeared unlikely to dislodge the view that the U.S. labor market remains strong.

Headlines: At IMF-World Bank meetings, Powell praised as Trump calls Fed 'crazy'
Description: The Bank of England governor and the head of the International Monetary Fund praised the abilities of Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Thursday, after U.S. President Donald Trump said the Fed had "gone crazy" by raising interest rates.

Headlines: Apple gets critical iPhone technology in $600 million Dialog deal
Description: Apple Inc is taking control over the power-management technology at the heart of its iPhones in a $600 million deal with Dialog Semiconductor that also secures the German-listed company's role as a supplier to the U.S. tech giant.

Headlines: SEC in no rush to change quarterly reporting: chairman
Description: The head of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Thursday the agency was in no rush to change quarterly reporting requirements for large public companies, two months after President Donald Trump ordered his agency to study the matter.

Headlines: Puma commemorates 'black power' salute in U.S. market push
Description: Puma is launching a campaign to mark the 50th anniversary of U.S. sprinter Tommie Smith's black-gloved salute at the 1968 Olympics, shortly after rival Nike scored a hit with an ad featuring a modern-day activist for racial equality.

Headlines: U.S. business group says Trump China tariffs cost $1.4 billion/month
Description: A coalition of U.S. business groups fighting President Donald Trump's trade tariffs has launched an advertisement aimed at telling voters ahead of the midterm elections that the measures are costing American businesses and consumers $1.4 billion a month.

Headlines: U.S. banks need more than in-line third quarter to boost shares
Description: Major U.S. banks, beginning on Friday, are expected to report earnings growth that exceeds that of the broader market, but that may not be enough to impress investors, who have been unimpressed by loan growth and are anticipating higher deposit rates and credit costs.

Headlines: Graphic: U.S. banks enjoy benefits of a growing economy, lower taxes
Description: The U.S. banking industry is enjoying the benefits of a growing economy and lower taxes, if the double-digit profit growth posted by three major lenders on Friday is any indication.

Headlines: Wall St. rebounds with technology stocks leading the way
Description: The U.S. benchmark S&P 500 stock index snapped a six-day losing streak on Friday as technology stocks recovered after a week of losses, with investors looking for bargains ahead of the third quarter earnings reporting season.

Headlines: U.S. banks profit from higher rates, more loans and lower costs
Description: Three of the largest U.S. lenders reported double-digit profit increases on Friday, helped by an expanding economy and lower taxes, and forecast more growth ahead as long as current trends continue.

Headlines: Cramer says the Fed could cause a 2019 slowdown with its aggressive rate hike agenda
Description: Jim Cramer warns that U.S. companies could feel the heat of the Fed's lockstep rate hikes in 2019.

Headlines: Cannabis could disrupt a $500 billion market, says CEO of top marijuana maker after deal with DEA
Description: Jim Cramer hears from Canopy Growth chief Bruce Linton about the cannabis producer's recent deal with the Drug Enforcement Administration and what Canada's legalization will mean for the marijuana industry.

Headlines: Most S&P 500 stocks are deep in correction territory
Description: As Wall Street steadied on Friday after its worst two-day slide in eight months, the U.S. stock market remained fragile, with nearly three quarters of the S&P 500's components in correction territory, or worse.

Headlines: China auto sales post biggest drop in 7 years as growth engine stalls
Description: China's car sales fell the most in nearly seven years in September, stoking concerns the world's biggest auto market could contract for the first time in decades this year amid cooling economic growth and a biting trade war.

Headlines: Berlin welcomes carmakers' trade-in offers
Description: The government welcomes German automakers' moves towards making concrete offers of discount trade-ins to owners of older, dirtier diesel vehicles, adding that these latest moves had been precisely what Chancellor Angela Merkel had been expecting.

Headlines: Canada's Air Transat says airline deal with Thomas Cook could expand
Description: Canada's Air Transat could expand a partnership deal with the airline arm of British tourism group Thomas Cook to include codesharing and interlining, the boss of the Canadian carrier said.

Headlines: BMW says trade war could hit 2019 results by up to 500 million euros
Description: German carmaker BMW expects a hit to earnings of up to half a billion euros ($579 million) next year if tariffs between the United States and China remain in place, Chief Financial Officer Nicolas Peter told Automobilwoche magazine.

Headlines: Trump's ethanol plan: Hype now, legal fights later
Description: President Donald Trump's hyping of a plan to boost ethanol demand drew cheers at an Iowa rally on Tuesday, but the oil refining industry has promised a lawsuit to block the move, so victory for Midwest farmers is far from certain.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade talks must cover currency, U.S. Treasury chief says
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday that he told China's central bank chief that currency issues need to be part of any further U.S.-China trade talks and expressed his concerns about the yuan's recent weakness.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sears aims to close up to 150 stores in bankruptcy - sources
Description: Sears Holdings Corp is planning to close up to 150 of its department and discount stores and keep at least another 300 open as part of a plan to restructure under U.S. bankruptcy protection, people familiar with the matter said Friday.

Headlines: U.S. draws China FX into trade dispute as IMF calls for resolution
Description: The United States sought to make currency a central part of any solution to a bruising trade fight with China, keeping the pressure on Beijing to speed up economic reforms at a gathering of world policy makers who pledged to do more to safeguard global growth.

Headlines: StanChart CEO says 'actively working' on Indonesian bank stake
Description: Standard Chartered Plc is "actively working" on options for its stake in Indonesia's PT Bank Permata tbk , the British lender's Chief Executive Bill Winters said on Saturday.

Headlines: Trade war won't trigger Asian credit ratings downgrades, for now: Fitch
Description: Fitch Ratings has maintained its stable credit outlook for all Asian countries, except Pakistan, despite expecting some "dampening effect" in the region due to the U.S.-China trade tensions, senior ratings analysts said on Saturday.

Headlines: China views yuan depreciation not in its interest: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Saturday said Chinese officials told him this week that a further depreciation of China's yuan currency was not in the country's interest.

Headlines: BOJ's Kuroda says Fed rate hikes good for global economy
Description: Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said on Saturday steady interest rate hikes by the Federal Reserve were "basically good" for the world economy, shrugging off concerns that higher U.S. rates could hurt Asian economies by triggering capital outflows.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sears CEO steps in for bankruptcy financing - sources
Description: Sears Holdings Corp CEO Eddie Lampert has stepped in to contribute toward a financing package of between $500 million and $600 million that the U.S. department store operator was close to securing on Sunday to fund operations during bankruptcy proceedings, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Barclays to challenge Goldman in digital-only bank market: FT
Description: Barclays Plc is launching a retail account that will offer U.S. consumers a low-cost, digital-only bank with the backing of a major financial institution, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Apple buys music analytics company Asaii: Axios
Description: Apple Inc has acquired music analytics start-up Asaii, Axios reported on Sunday, citing sources, in a bid to strengthen content recommendations to its music users.

Headlines: 'Retail is the place to be' in cannabis, says MedMen CEO after 'blockbuster' PharmaCann acquisition
Description: Jim Cramer sits down with MedMen co-founder and CEO Adam Bierman, whose cannabis retailer will absorb PharmaCann in the largest marijuana-related acquisition in U.S. history.

Headlines: Bankruptcy judge approves financing to keep Sears open
Description: A bankruptcy judge on Monday approved $300 million in financing to keep department store chain Sears Holdings Corp open through the holiday season, giving the century-old retailer that once dominated U.S. shopping malls a chance to remain in business.

Headlines: Bear or bull? Five reasons to claw or thunder
Description: A sharp pullback in stocks last week, including the S&P 500's biggest single-day drop since a market correction in February, has left investors questioning whether this could signal danger for the longest-ever bull run for U.S. equities.

Headlines: Unwelcome guest: U.S. tariffs loom at China's biggest trade fair
Description: Amid gathering gloom over the state of the Chinese economy, exporters of motorcycles, tractors, photocopiers and Christmas tree lighting will join thousands of other companies peddling their wares at China's largest trade fair Monday.

Headlines: AstraZeneca will keep UK investment freeze if no Brexit clarity
Description: AstraZeneca will keep its freeze on manufacturing investments in Britain if the country's exit from the European Union fails to give enough clarity on future trading relations, the drugmaker's chairman was quoted as saying on Monday.

Headlines: Around 100,000 Opel vehicles to be recalled in diesel probe - ministry
Description: Germany's Transport Ministry said on Monday that roughly 100,000 Opel vehicles were to be recalled shortly after a further manipulation of diesel emissions by exhaust management software was discovered.

Headlines: Credit Suisse downgrades U.S. steel sector citing oversupply
Description: Credit Suisse on Monday downgraded the U.S. steel sector as it expects prices to fall due to oversupply, stemming from the Trump administration's move to slap tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: Labor strife in India's manufacturing hubs may undermine Modi's jobs push
Description: Labor unrest is on the rise at two centers in India where motorcycles and components are manufactured, underlining the problems Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government faces in creating new manufacturing jobs that are sustainable and pay attractive wages.

Headlines: Exclusive: HNA held talks with Ant, others as it weighs options for IT unit Pactera - sources
Description: China's HNA Group is exploring an outright sale and other options for its IT outsourcing unit Pactera and has held talks with investors including Ant Financial [ANTFIN.UL], people with knowledge of the situation said.

Headlines: SoftBank's Saudi ties unnerve investors as shares drop 8 percent
Description: SoftBank Group Corp saw its shares drop on Monday as fallout from the disappearance of a Saudi journalist spread to the Japanese conglomerate, whose nearly $100 billion Vision Fund is almost half financed by Saudi Arabia.

Headlines: Around 100,000 Opel vehicles to be recalled in diesel probe: ministry
Description: Germany's Transport Ministry said on Monday it would order roughly 100,000 Opel vehicles to be recalled as part of an emissions probe, after prosecutors searched the carmaker's offices earlier in the day.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales increase modestly; consumer spending strong
Description: U.S. retail sales barely rose in September as a rebound in motor vehicle purchases was offset by the biggest drop in spending at restaurants and bars in nearly two years.

Headlines: Safe havens rise on West-Saudi tension; world stocks fall
Description: Major stock markets slipped on Monday as rising tensions between Western powers and Saudi Arabia added to concerns over the pace of global economic growth, with investors flocking to traditional safe-havens like the Japanese and Swiss currencies, as well as gold.

Headlines: Tech stocks drag down Wall St. as earnings worries weigh
Description: U.S. stocks ended lower in a choppy trading session on Monday, dragged down by technology stocks amid lingering worries over interest rates and corporate earnings.

Headlines: Airbnb bill may limit short-term rentals in U.S. capital
Description: Short-term rentals of Jackie Howard's two-bedroom home near major tourist attractions in Washington, D.C. have helped her family pay for everything from plumbing emergencies to braces for her daughter.

Headlines: France's Safran improves Silvercrest engine design: executive
Description: France's Safran has improved the design of its Silvercrest engine to prevent a repeat of factory delays and plans further testing in the second quarter of next year to confirm the breakthrough, the head of its engines division told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Big U.S. banks end third quarter on high note
Description: Wall Street's top investment banks enjoyed a strong third quarter as strength in stock trading and equity underwriting added to the benefits from a strong U.S. economy and tax reforms.

Headlines: Railroad operator CSX's quarterly profit tops Wall Street target
Description: CSX Corp on Tuesday reported quarterly profit that topped Wall Street's view and raised its full-year revenue forecast, as the No. 3 U.S. railroad operator benefited from ongoing cost-cutting and higher prices for moving freight.

Headlines: Wall St. rallies over 2 percent with earnings, data boost
Description: U.S. stocks surged more than 2 percent on Tuesday after upbeat earnings reports from major companies including UnitedHealth and Goldman Sachs and solid economic data, as equities rebounded from a recent sharp sell-off.

Headlines: Uber IPO proposals value company at $120 billion: WSJ
Description: Ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] could be valued at $120 billion, when it finally goes public next year according to proposals made by U.S. banks bidding to run the offering, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: United lifts 2018 target as network growth boosts third-quarter profit
Description: United Airlines posted solid third-quarter profit on Tuesday and raised its 2018 outlook for the third time this year, helped by its strategy to add flights at three mid-continent U.S. hubs: Chicago, Denver and Houston.

Headlines: U.S. government posts widest deficit since 2012
Description: The U.S. government closed the 2018 fiscal year $779 billion in the red, its highest deficit in six years, as Republican-led tax cuts pinched revenues and expenses rose on a growing national debt, according to data released on Monday by the Treasury Department.

Headlines: Qualcomm, FTC ask judge to delay ruling to pursue settlement
Description: Qualcomm Inc and the U.S. Federal Trade Commission on Monday asked a federal judge to delay a preliminary ruling in an antitrust case U.S. regulators brought against the mobile chip company in order to pursue settlement talks.

Headlines: Lost in transmission: China's small firms get more loans on paper but not in reality
Description: Beijing is keen to show results after four rounds of policy easing, so China's big banks are playing along, highlighting their efforts to boost lending to cash-starved small firms, offering collateral waivers and setting loan targets.

Headlines: Trade war cost: China's third quarter GDP growth seen hitting lowest since 2009 - Reuters poll
Description: At week's end, global investors and policy makers will likely be given a stark reminder of the costs of a bitter Sino-U.S. trade war, with a Reuters poll predicting that China's third-quarter growth will slow to its weakest pace since the global financial crisis.

Headlines: U.S. job openings hit record high of 7.14 million
Description: U.S. job openings jumped to a record high in August, far outpacing a rise in hiring, suggesting that companies could be increasingly having difficulties finding qualified workers.

Headlines: U.S. judge approves SEC settlement with Tesla, Musk; shares jump
Description: A U.S. judge on Tuesday approved a settlement between a federal regulator, Tesla Inc and its chief executive officer, Elon Musk, over his tweets promising to take the company private, signaling an end to a tumultuous period for investors.

Headlines: U.S. seen likely to relieve Prudential of 'systemic' oversight
Description: A panel of U.S. regulators is seen as likely to relieve Prudential Financial Inc from stricter oversight when it meets on Tuesday, in a move that could reduce the insurance company's regulatory costs.

Headlines: U.S. industrial output rises; job openings at record high
Description: U.S. industrial production increased for a fourth straight month in September, boosted by gains in manufacturing and mining output, but momentum slowed sharply in the third quarter.

Headlines: Nomura to pay $480 million to U.S. over 'fraudulent' mortgage-backed securities
Description: Nomura Holdings Inc has agreed to pay $480 million to resolve civil claims by the U.S. government that it misled investors in marketing residential mortgage-backed securities, U.S. authorities said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Equity trading strength boosts profits at Morgan Stanley, Goldman
Description: Wall Street's top investment banks reported better-than-expected quarterly profits on Tuesday, helped by strength in stock trading and equity underwriting, wrapping up what has been a strong quarter for the big U.S. banks.

Headlines: SoftBank 'anxiously' monitoring Saudi Arabia situation: executive
Description: SoftBank Group Chief Operating Officer Marcelo Claure said on Tuesday it is "business at usual" at companies backed by its nearly $100 billion Vision Fund despite a tense situation with Saudi Arabia, which provided nearly half of the fund's capital.

Headlines: Cramer: Cannabis 'might be the most disruptive force since Amazon' for pharma, beverage industries
Description: Jim Cramer surveys the pot craze as Canada prepares to legalize cannabis nationwide and flags the companies he thinks will be long-term winners.

Headlines: Trade off: China soybean imports set for biggest drop in 12 years amid tariff conflict
Description: China's soybean imports are set to drop by a quarter in the last three months of 2018, their biggest fall in at least 12 years as buyers curb purchases amid the Sino-U.S. trade war and high domestic stockpiles.

Headlines: Pfizer to cut around 2 percent of jobs through early next year
Description: U.S. drugmaker Pfizer Inc plans to reduce its global headcount by around 2 percent through voluntary retirements and layoffs this year and early next year, as it looks to streamline its corporate structure and eliminate some managerial roles and responsibilities.

Headlines: White House's Kudlow says Trump not demanding Fed policy change
Description: White House economic advisor Larry Kudlow said on Wednesday that U.S. President Trump was not demanding a policy change at the Federal Reserve after Trump heaped more criticism on the Fed on Tuesday, calling rising U.S. interest rates his "biggest threat."

Headlines: U.S. regains crown as most competitive economy for first time since 2008: WEF
Description: The U.S. economy sits atop of the World Economic Forum's annual global competitiveness survey for the first time since the 2007-2009 financial crisis, benefiting from a new ranking methodology this year, the Swiss body said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fujifilm wins appeal in battle with Xerox over aborted merger
Description: Japan's Fujifilm Holdings Corp has won an appeal in its legal battles with Xerox Corp, with a New York court overturning preliminary injunctions requested by an activist investor that had blocked their planned merger.

Headlines: U.S. holiday hiring hits highest since 2014 as consumer confidence soars
Description: Holiday hiring of more than 700,000 workers by U.S. retailers would be the largest since 2014, according to a report by a global outplacement firm, underscoring a robust economy that has seen consumer confidence at its highest in nearly two decades.

Headlines: Gulfstream expects market growth in 2019 on new business jets: president
Description: Gulfstream Aerospace expects growth in both sales opportunities and deliveries next year, as the U.S. business jet maker brings two new large-cabin corporate planes to market, company President Mark Burns said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. watchdog threatens retaliation over EU clearing rules
Description: U.S. banks and securities houses could be barred from trading on exchanges in the European Union if the bloc refuses to water down "irresponsible" proposals for regulating foreign clearing houses, a top U.S. regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump administration says to open trade talks with EU, UK, Japan
Description: The U.S. Trade Representative's office told Congress on Tuesday it intends to open trade talks with the European Union, the United Kingdom and Japan.

Headlines: Express Scripts covers Amgen, Lilly migraine drugs, excludes Teva
Description: Express Scripts Holding Co, one of the largest U.S. prescription benefits managers, will cover new migraine drugs from Eli Lilly and Amgen Inc, but exclude a rival medication from Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd after price negotiations with all three manufacturers.

Headlines: Indian regulator asks Fortis Healthcare to recover $55 million from founders, eight firms
Description: India's capital markets regulator has asked Fortis Healthcare to recover 4.03 billion rupees ($55 million) from its founder brothers and firms related to them, pending an investigation into loans made by the company.

Headlines: GE to pay penalty if falls short of French job pledges: ministry
Description: General Electric's new CEO told France's finance minister on Wednesday that it would stick to his predecessor's French job pledges or pay a penalty, the Finance Ministry said.

Headlines: U.S. Senate panel wants to question Hyundai, Kia over engine fire reports
Description: The Senate Commerce Committee's Republican chairman and ranking Democrat said on Wednesday they had asked top U.S. executives at Hyundai Motor Co and Kia Motors Corp to testify at a Nov. 14 hearing on reports of engine fires involving vehicles from the Korean automakers.

Headlines: Story on Zhoushan in talks with Exxon Mobil on ethylene plant withdrawn
Description: The story headlined 'China's Zhoushan city woos Exxon Mobil for a $7 bln ethylene plant' is withdrawn. The provincial government has withdrawn its original statement issued on Wednesday because it was not factually correct, an official told Reuters. There will be no replacement story.

Headlines: China's Geely 'corrects' rumors about presidential family ties
Description: Chinese carmaker Geely Automobile Holdings Ltd , long the subject of speculation about its political ties, has moved to dispel a widely held belief its chairman's wife was related to Chinese President Xi Jinping.

Headlines: Alcoa's profit beat fueled by rising alumina prices, shares rise
Description: Top U.S. aluminum producer Alcoa Corp reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit on Wednesday, as a series of supply hits boosted alumina prices.

Headlines: At Facebook, public funds join push to remove Zuckerberg as chairman
Description: Four major U.S. public funds that hold shares in Facebook Inc on Wednesday proposed removing Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg as chairman following several high-profile scandals and said they hoped to gain backing from larger asset managers.

Headlines: U.S. environmental agency says in talks with Volvo over emissions issue
Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency said on Wednesday it has been in talks with Volvo over the last few weeks about an issue with catalytic converters causing some of its vehicles to exceed nitrogen oxide emission limits.

Headlines: U.S. data drags oil lower; dollar up after Fed minutes
Description: Oil prices fell on Wednesday after U.S. crude inventories rose by much more than expected and exports fell, while the dollar added to gains after minutes showed Federal Reserve policy makers largely united on the need to raise borrowing costs further.

Headlines: Despite Trump criticism, Fed sees need for more rate hikes
Description: Federal Reserve policymakers are largely united on the need to raise borrowing costs further, minutes from their most recent policy meeting show, despite U.S. President Donald Trump's view that interest rate hikes have already gone too far.

Headlines: Exclusive: Don't mention the oil price - U.S. legal threat prompts change at OPEC
Description: OPEC has urged its members not to mention oil prices when discussing policy in a break from the past, as the oil producing group seeks to avoid the risk of U.S. legal action for manipulating the market, sources close to OPEC said.

Headlines: Appeals court to hear U.S. Justice Department objection to AT&T deal on Dec. 6
Description: A U.S. appeals court will hear oral arguments on Dec. 6 in the Justice Department's fight against AT&T Inc's $85.4 billion purchase of Time Warner, the court said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Hurricane Florence, rising mortgage rates hurt U.S. homebuilding
Description: U.S. homebuilding dropped more than expected in September as construction activity in the South fell by the most in nearly three years, likely held down by Hurricane Florence.

Headlines: Fed downplays policy headaches from drop in bank reserves
Description: The Federal Reserve downplayed any disruption to its policy tools from a drop last month in the so-called excess reserves that flow among banks, according to minutes published Wednesday of the U.S. central bank's Sept. 25-26 meeting.

Headlines: Iran calls U.S. efforts to cut its oil exports to zero 'political bluff'
Description: Statements by the United States that it would reduce Iran's oil exports to zero are a "political bluff", the head of state-run National Iranian Oil Company (NIOC) said, according to a report published by Tasnim news agency on Wednesday.

Headlines: Rising rates knock U.S. mortgage activity to lowest since 2014: MBA
Description: U.S. consumers filed the fewest requests for a mortgage since late 2014 last week as most home borrowing costs reached their highest levels in more than seven years, the Mortgage Bankers Association said on Wednesday.

Headlines: SocGen CEO cancels attendance at Saudi Arabia investment conference
Description: The chief executive of French bank Societe Generale has canceled his attendance at a Saudi Arabia investment conference, as leading business executives pull out amid widespread concern about the fate of a Saudi journalist.

Headlines: Boeing signs maintenance deals with El Al Airlines, Lufthansa
Description: Boeing Co signed a two-year maintenance deal with Israel's El Al Airlines on Wednesday, as it looks to boost its high-margin after-sales business that services planes bought by airlines and military customers.

Headlines: Cramer: The Fed may already be winning the war against inflation and needs to pause the rate hikes
Description: Jim Cramer points to "pockets of weakness" in the U.S. economy and questions the Federal Reserve's plans to hike rates three more times in 2019.

Headlines: U.S. oil service firms face tough quarter despite high crude prices
Description: Even as crude prices hover near four-year highs, U.S. oilfield service firms' third-quarter results due out in coming days will reflect a shaky recovery, as their customers face drilling constraints and pressure to hold down spending.

Headlines: Weaker China demand, regulation spell tough quarter for Europe's auto stocks: Goldman Sachs
Description: Goldman Sachs analysts said slowing car demand in China and new fuel consumption regulations were hurting investors' sentiment toward European autos stocks and warned this results season could be challenging, hitting shares in the sector on Wednesday.

Headlines: China asks WTO to set up panel to discuss U.S. steel, aluminum measures
Description: China has filed a request with the World Trade Organisation to establish an expert group to determine the legality of tariffs imposed by the United States on imports of steel and aluminum, the Ministry of Commerce said late on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. asks for WTO panel over metals tariff retaliation
Description: The United States is requesting that a World Trade Organization dispute resolution panel get involved in a clash over international retaliation over U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum, according to a U.S. official familiar with the matter.

Headlines: China third quarter GDP growth slows to 6.5 percent year-on-year, missing forecast
Description: China's economy grew at a slower than expected pace of 6.5 percent in the third quarter from a year earlier, marking the weakest rate since the global financial crisis, official data showed on Friday.

Headlines: China September industrial output weakens; investment, retail sales beat expectations
Description: China's industrial output grew 5.8 percent in September from a year earlier, missing expectations, while fixed-asset investment growth rose to 5.4 percent in the first nine months, above forecasts, data showed on Friday.

Headlines: China able to reach 2018 growth target: stats bureau
Description: China will be able to reach its full-year economic growth target of around 6.5 percent in 2018 even as downward pressure increases, and will be able to maintain steady growth next year, a spokesman of the country's statistics bureau said on Friday.

Headlines: Instant View: China's third quarter GDP rises 6.5 percent year-on-year, slowest since 2009
Description: China's third quarter economic growth slowed to its weakest pace since the global financial crisis, and missed expectations, as a years-long campaign to tackle debt risks and the trade war with the United States began to bite.

Headlines: China September coal output hits nine-month high as new capacity starts up
Description: China's coal output hit its highest in nine months in September, government data showed on Friday, boosted as new mining capacity started up in the country's northwest.

Headlines: VW to offer buyer incentive for scrapping older German diesels
Description: Volkswagen on Thursday said it will offer trade-in incentives and a bonus for scrapping older diesel vehicles in Germany, in a move to stave off driving bans in polluted cities.

Headlines: Factbox: Trade-in incentives in Germany to replace old diesel cars
Description: Carmakers have started offering trade-in incentives in Germany to encourage customers to scrap older diesel vehicles and buy more sustainable engines.

Headlines: Primark sharpens ethical focus in bid for German customers
Description: Primark, the fashion chain owned by Associated British Foods , has emphasized its commitment to environmental standards and safer working conditions as it fights for market share in discount-loving Germany and other countries.

Headlines: Busy as a Jollibee: Asia's fast-food giant expands abroad
Description: Jollibee Foods , a major Asian fast-food operator, hopes to generate half its sales outside its home market of the Philippines within five to seven years, up from 30 percent now, its chief executive told Reuters.

Headlines: AmEx tops profit estimates on higher consumer spending
Description: American Express Co topped Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit on Thursday and lifted its yearly earnings forecast, as a strengthening U.S. economy powered higher credit card spending.

Headlines: De Beers eyes tech markets for synthetic diamonds future
Description: Anglo American unit De Beers is going after lucrative, but elusive high-tech markets in quantum computing, as it aims to expand its lab-grown diamond business beyond drilling and cutting.

Headlines: Ericsson has dismissed 50 employees following U.S. corruption probe
Description: Mobile telecom gear maker Ericsson said on Thursday that it has dismissed 50 people over a U.S. corruption probe it warned could lead to a financial penalty.

Headlines: Indonesia raids home of Lippo Group deputy chairman in bribery probe
Description: Indonesia's anti-graft agency said on Thursday it had raided 10 locations, including the home of Lippo Group Deputy Chairman James Riady, as part of a bribery investigation linked to the conglomerate's $21 billion Meikarta real estate project.

Headlines: UK fashion retailer New Look to exit China, close 120 stores
Description: British fashion group New Look is to exit China and will close its remaining 120 stores there by the end of the year, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Takeda gets Japanese approval for $62 billion Shire purchase
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd said on Thursday Japan's Fair Trade Commission had approved its $62 billion acquisition of Shire Plc , bringing the Japanese firm closer to sealing a deal that will make it a global top 10 drugmaker.

Headlines: Hacked, scammed and on your own: navigating cryptocurrency 'wild west'
Description: When Peggy and Marco Lachmann-Anke learned in January that hackers cracked a 40-character password and cleaned out their cryptocurrency wallet, they did not go to the police or alert the tokens' issuer, the Berlin-based technology group IOTA.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil bets big on China LNG, sidesteps trade war
Description: In the middle of a Sino-U.S. trade war, the world's largest publicly traded oil and gas company is turning toward Beijing for business at a time when most of Corporate America is looking elsewhere to avoid the threat of tariffs.

Headlines: Google to charge smartphone makers for Google Play in Europe
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Tuesday revamped how it distributes its mobile apps in the European Union, introducing a licensing fee for device makers to access its app marketplace in a response to regulators' findings that it had broken antitrust law.

Headlines: U.S. existing home sales fall for sixth straight month
Description: U.S. home sales fell in September by the most in over two years as the housing market continued to struggle despite strength across the broader economy.

Headlines: China moves to lift confidence as economic growth hits weakest pace since 2009
Description: China's economic growth cooled to its weakest quarterly pace since the global financial crisis, with regulators moving quickly to calm nervous investors as a years-long campaign to tackle debt risks and the trade war with the United States began to bite.

Headlines: Clash over Trump tariffs heats up with barrage of WTO litigation
Description: Disputes over U.S. tariffs and retaliatory moves by other states have sparked 12 requests for adjudication at the World Trade Organization, signalling an escalation in global trade tensions.

Headlines: SolarWinds shares rise 3.2 percent in downsized market debut
Description: SolarWinds Corp's shares rose as much as 3.2 percent in their downsized U.S. market debut on Friday, giving the enterprise software maker a market value of about $4.80 billion.

Headlines: Honeywell says China growth slowing, tariffs to squeeze margins
Description: Honeywell said on Friday it was seeing slower growth in China and that trade tariffs would squeeze margins and potentially cost it "hundreds of millions" of dollars in 2019.

Headlines: Canada gives Lockheed Martin first chance to bid on warships design
Description: The Canadian government on Friday said Lockheed Martin Corp would be given first chance to bid on a contract to design 15 warships that will end up costing Canada around C$60 billion ($46 billion).

Headlines: AbbVie CFO Chase to retire by mid-year 2019
Description: AbbVie Inc said on Friday that William Chase stepped down as chief financial officer and will retire from the company in mid-2019, and the U.S. drugmaker promoted controller, Robert Michael, to the CFO role.

Headlines: Trump to meet heads of Boeing, Lockheed, Northrop at Arizona air base
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is scheduled to meet the chief executives of the biggest U.S. defense companies at Luke Air Force Base in Arizona on Friday to discuss how they can source more parts and materials domestically, people familiar with the meeting said on Friday.

Headlines: No room at the inn: Central Europe student housing crunch attracts investors
Description: Wroclaw's hulking Soviet-era public dormitories held little appeal for Odysseas Savvas when he moved to the Polish city from Greece to study business at university. Instead, he opted for his own room and bathroom in a newly built private residence.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan sees two-three more rate hikes to hit 'neutral' level
Description: Another two to three interest rate increases from the Federal Reserve will likely put U.S. borrowing costs in "neutral" territory where it is neither stimulating nor restricting economic growth, Dallas Federal Reserve President Robert Kaplan said on Friday.

Headlines: S&P falls on interest rate, trade concerns; P&G lifts Dow
Description: The U.S. benchmark S&P 500 stock index edged lower on Friday as strong earnings from Procter & Gamble Co were offset by ongoing concerns about rising interest rates and tensions over trade policy denting economic growth.

Headlines: Europe-Asia statement to avoid China subsidies criticism: draft
Description: A final communique for the Europe-Asia leaders summit will not include language calling for an end to trade and market distorting measures by governments at China's request, according to the latest draft and EU diplomats.

Headlines: Frustrated GM investors ask what more CEO Barra can do
Description: General Motors Co Chief Executive Mary Barra has transformed the No. 1 U.S. automaker in her almost five years in charge, but that is still not enough to satisfy investors.

Headlines: Cramer's game plan: Companies tied to China or the Fed are 'guilty until proven innocent'
Description: Jim Cramer prepares for what he thinks may be the "toughest" earnings week yet and issues a warning about companies with links to China trade or the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Euro, pound rally on Brexit concession; global stocks dip
Description: Stocks dipped on Friday, dragging a global index into a fourth consecutive weekly loss, while the euro and sterling rallied against the dollar after a report said Britain is ready to drop a key Brexit demand.

Headlines: China's real estate investment slows in September as caution sinks in
Description: Growth in China's real estate investment eased in September and home sales fell for the first time since April, as developers dialed back expansion plans amid economic uncertainties and as additional curbs on speculative investment kicked in.
