Headlines: SAIC VW starts work on $2.5 billion China plant in Audi pivot
Description: Volkswagen AG's China venture with SAIC Motor Corp Ltd has started building a $2.5 billion new energy vehicle (NEV) plant in Shanghai, which will make VW's luxury Audi AG brand cars, a possible first for the venture.

Headlines: China's regulators rush to rally market confidence, boosting shares
Description: China's regulators lined up to rally market confidence on Friday with new rules, measures and words of comfort as shares brushed near four-year lows for the second straight day before surging.

Headlines: Tesla launches new $45,000 Model 3
Description: Tesla Inc on Thursday introduced a new $45,000 version of its Model 3 sedan on its website, launching the car as U.S. tax breaks for Tesla cars are about to decrease.

Headlines: UBS warns staff over China travel after banker held in Beijing: source
Description: Swiss bank UBS Group AG. has asked its China wealth management staff to reconsider their travel plans to the country after authorities there asked one of its bankers to delay her departure from Beijing to meet with local officials, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: China says must balance stable growth and risk prevention
Description: China must balance the need for stable growth while managing risks and maintain a prudent and neutral monetary policy, the State Council, the country's cabinet, said on Sunday following a meeting of top economic and financial policymakers.

Headlines: MUFG says bank's CEO will not attend Saudi conference
Description: The CEO of Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group's banking arm will not attend the Future Investment Initiative conference in Saudi Arabia, the group said on Sunday, joining a growing list of business executives to withdraw over concern about the death of journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

Headlines: With market on edge, investors look to tech trio
Description: The pressure is on for Amazon, Alphabet and Microsoft as they prepare to report quarterly results at a time when confidence in those market leaders looks increasingly fragile and in danger of derailing Wall Street's rally.

Headlines: Institutional investors turn their backs on Australian banks
Description: Investors are turning against Australia's big banks as earnings tumble, growth plans are abandoned, and fee income cut in the fallout from a powerful financial sector misconduct inquiry and more challenging economic conditions.

Headlines: Exclusive: China Evergrande seeks $1.5 billion via HK tower financing - sources
Description: Highly leveraged property firm China Evergrande Group is in talks with financial institutions to raise about $1.5 billion this month by offering its Hong Kong office tower as collateral, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Ford sees higher metal costs, hopes China and U.S. can settle trade issues
Description: Ford Motor Co has seen higher steel and aluminum costs driven by trade tariffs bite into profit, but is hopeful the United States and China can avoid further tensions that could make things more costly, a top Ford executive said on Monday.

Headlines: Linde-Praxair deal clears final hurdle with U.S. antitrust nod
Description: Industrial gases groups Praxair and Linde won U.S. antitrust approval for their $86 billion merger on Monday, clearing the last hurdle for the deal in the nick of time.

Headlines: Exclusive: Aston Martin considers flying in components, changing ports to handle Brexit
Description: Aston Martin is considering flying in car components and moving more parts through UK ports other than Dover to avoid possible border friction after Britain leaves the European Union, its boss told Reuters.

Headlines: Belgium chooses Lockheed's F-35 over Eurofighter: Belga
Description: Belgium has chosen Lockheed Martin's F-35 stealth jets over the Eurofighter Typhoon to replace its aging F-16s, news agency Belga cited government sources as saying, in a move that would cement the U.S.-made war plane's position in Europe.

Headlines: Global banks curb China travel after UBS banker stopped from leaving
Description: Global banks including Citigroup and Standard Chartered have asked their private banking staff to postpone or reconsider travel to China after authorities there prevented a UBS banker from leaving the country, sources said.

Headlines: Hasbro results dented by lingering Toys 'R' Us woes, shares drop
Description: Toymaker Hasbro Inc missed analysts' expectations for quarterly revenue and profit on Monday, as the demise of major retail partner Toys 'R' Us hurt sales in Europe and the United States, sending its shares down as much as 8 percent.

Headlines: Cramer: We could be facing a cold war with China, and these stocks may be sacrificed
Description: Jim Cramer says the escalation in the United States' trade war with China could end in an outright cold war that debilitates parts of the stock market.

Headlines: SoftBank COO pulls out of Saudi Arabia conference: Bloomberg
Description: SoftBank Group Corp's Chief Operating Officer Marcelo Claure will not be attending the Saudi Arabia investment conference this week, Bloomberg reported on Monday, citing a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Philips CEO says Brexit putting Britain at risk as manufacturing hub
Description: The chief executive of Philips said on Monday he was worried about the lack of progress on a deal over the terms of Britain's exit from the European Union, and warned that a no-deal Brexit would jeopardize the country's position as a manufacturing hub.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs changes Asia investment banking leadership: memo
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc has named veteran banker Todd Leland as its investment banking head for Asia Pacific excluding Japan, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters, adding to leadership changes at the bank with CEO David Solomon taking over this month.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sears chairman Lampert seeks partner for bankruptcy financing - sources
Description: Sears Holdings Corp Chairman Eddie Lampert is in discussions with at least one potential partner to contribute to a $300 million bankruptcy loan the U.S. retailer is seeking, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Bombardier sues Mitsubishi jet program over trade secrets
Description: Canadian airplane maker Bombardier Inc has sued the aircraft unit of Japan's Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd , saying former Bombardier employees passed on trade secrets to help Mitsubishi's oft-delayed regional jet project.

Headlines: Republican U.S. election sweep would boost short sellers: Lamensdorf
Description: U.S. equity short sellers are rooting for a Republican sweep of Congress in U.S. elections on Nov. 6, which are seen as partly a vote on President Donald Trump's pro-business policies, a leading Wall Street short seller said on Monday.

Headlines: Hasbro CEO doesn't expect 'major tariff situation' as toymaker moves production from China
Description: Jim Cramer and Hasbro Chairman and CEO Brian Goldner discuss how the ongoing trade dispute between the United States and China affects the toymaker's business.

Headlines: Arm CEO pulls out of Saudi conference: source
Description: British chip designer Arm Holdings Chief Executive Officer Simon Segars has pulled out of the Saudi Arabia investment conference this week, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Dow, S&P 500 fall as dollar rises, yield curve flat
Description: U.S. stocks closed lower after choppy trade on Monday, as some investors showed signs of earnings season nerves, while political worries in Europe led the dollar to strengthen against the euro and sterling.

Headlines: Oil little changed despite Saudi pledge to boost output
Description: Oil futures were little changed on Monday after paring earlier losses despite Saudi Arabia's pledge to raise crude production to a record high, two weeks before U.S. sanctions potentially choke off Iranian supplies.

Headlines: Exclusive: Corona brewer Constellation seeks to sell U.S. wine brands - sources
Description: Constellation Brands Inc , the U.S. producer of Corona and Modelo beers, is looking to sell some of its U.S.-based wine brands, in a deal that could be worth more than $3 billion, according to four people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: UBS says it allows staff to travel 'freely' to China after banker's departure delayed
Description: UBS allows all its staff to travel "freely in and out" of China and it is business as usual there, the Swiss bank said, after local authorities last week asked one of its bankers to delay her departure from Beijing to meet with officials.

Headlines: Apple's Cook set to back strong privacy laws in Europe, U.S. at Brussels event
Description: Apple Chief Executive Tim Cook is expected to praise new European privacy rules and to voice the company's support for strong laws in Europe and the United States to protect the use of data, according to prepared remarks for delivery at a Brussels event.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson makes $2.1 billion offer to buy out Japan cosmetics firm Ci:z
Description: U.S. healthcare conglomerate Johnson & Johnson said on Tuesday it will buy all outstanding shares of Japanese skincare firm Ci:z Holdings Co Ltd that it does not already own for 230 billion yen ($2.05 billion) in cash.

Headlines: SoftBank's Son cancels Saudi conference speech: sources
Description: SoftBank Group Corp Chief Executive Masayoshi Son, whose $93 billion Vision Fund drew nearly half its money from Saudi Arabia, canceled a speaking engagement at the kingdom's investment conference this week, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Saudi crown prince proclaims investment conference despite boycott
Description: Saudi Arabia's crown prince trumpeted on Tuesday a conference that has drawn investment deals worth $50 billion despite a boycott over the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, declaring the event as "great - more people more money".

Headlines: Caterpillar tries to allay earnings concerns after shares tank
Description: Caterpillar Inc tried on Tuesday to ease mounting concerns about China and global demand after it affirmed its 2018 profit estimate, a move that investors feared signaled a cap in earnings growth and sparked a sell-off in its shares.

Headlines: Target's two-day holiday shipping option beats Amazon, Walmart
Description: Target Corp, aiming to one-up retail rivals during the upcoming U.S. holiday shopping season, said on Tuesday it was adding more delivery and pickup options for online shoppers to have items shipped to their homes or ready for quick pick-up at local stores.

Headlines: Wall St. extends recent fall but ends well off day's lows
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Tuesday after worries about the earnings outlook added to recent selling pressure, though major indexes ended well off the day's lows as investors snapped up beaten-down shares late in the session.

Headlines: Tariffs begin to take bite out of U.S. corporate earnings growth
Description: U.S. company earnings growth is slowing after a bumper start to the year, and the reality of an escalating trade war between two of the world's largest economies is starting to weigh on companies ranging from Caterpillar Inc to Ford Motor Co.

Headlines: Instant View: Wall Street shares resume tumble
Description: Wall Street stocks tumbled more than 2 percent on Tuesday as disappointing forecasts from industrial bellwethers Caterpillar and 3M piled on to concerns over Saudi Arabia's diplomatic isolation, Italy's finances and trade-war fears.

Headlines: Philip Morris aims to revive Japan sales with cheaper heat-not-burn tobacco
Description: Philip Morris International Inc released cheaper versions of its IQOS "heat not burn" products in Japan on Tuesday as it tries to revive sales and ward off competition from other alternatives to conventional cigarettes.

Headlines: SoftBank CEO cancels speaking role at Saudi conference: source
Description: SoftBank Group Corp Chief Executive Masayoshi Son has cancelled a speaking engagement at the Future Investment Initiative conference in Saudi Arabia, said a source close to the matter.

Headlines: U.S. judge affirms Monsanto weed-killer verdict, slashes damages
Description: A U.S. judge on Monday affirmed a verdict against Bayer AG unit Monsanto that found its glyphosate-based weed-killers responsible for a man’s terminal cancer, sending the German company's shares down 8 percent.

Headlines: Total to announce retail network in Saudi Arabia with Aramco: Total CEO
Description: French oil and gas producer Total is set to announce a retail network in Saudi Arabia with Saudi Aramco, Total's chief executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's Huawei opens up to German scrutiny ahead of 5G auctions
Description: Chinese's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] will open a new information security lab in Germany next month that will enable source code reviews, in a step aimed at winning regulators' confidence before the country's 5G mobile spectrum auction.

Headlines: Saudi signs deals worth $50 billion in oil, gas and infrastructure
Description: Saudi Arabia signed deals worth more than $50 billion in oil, gas, infrastructure and other sectors at an investment conference in Riyadh on Tuesday, officials there said.

Headlines: Whirlpool counters tariff hit with price hikes, shares surge
Description: U.S. home appliances maker Whirlpool was able to counter costs arising from trade tariffs by raising prices, helping it beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit and driving its shares 7 percent higher on Wednesday.

Headlines: Analyst View: Nasdaq confirms correction while S&P and Dow erase 2018 gain
Description: U.S. stocks tumbled again on Wednesday, confirming a correction for the Nasdaq and erasing the Dow and S&P 500's gains for the year, as disappointing forecasts from chipmakers and weak home sales data fueled worries about economic and profit growth.

Headlines: Investors flee stocks on global worries, Treasuries rise
Description: Wall Street stock indexes tumbled on Wednesday as spooked investors ran for safety on global economic and political worries while U.S. Treasuries prices climbed and the U.S. dollar surged.

Headlines: Visa tops profit estimates as consumer spending grows
Description: Visa Inc topped Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Wednesday, as the world's largest payments network benefited from higher credit- and debit-card spending in a strengthening U.S. economy.

Headlines: Italian watchdog fines Apple, Samsung over software updates
Description: Italy's anti-trust watchdog said on Wednesday it was fining Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd 5 million euros ($5.7 million) each following complaints they used software updates to slow down their mobile phones.

Headlines: Southeast Asia's Grab inks prepaid card deal with Mastercard
Description: Singapore-based Grab has partnered payments processor Mastercard Inc to issue prepaid cards tailored to Southeast Asian consumers, extending the use of Grab's digital wallet and helping its unbanked users transact online.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales near two-year low as mortgages rates rise
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes fell to a near two-year low in September and data for the prior three months was revised lower, the latest indications that rising mortgage rates and higher prices were sapping demand for housing.

Headlines: Nasdaq confirms correction while S&P 500 and Dow erase 2018 gains
Description: U.S. stocks plunged again on Wednesday, confirming a correction for the Nasdaq and erasing the Dow and the S&P 500's gains for the year, as disappointing forecasts from chipmakers and weak home sales data fueled jitters about economic and profit growth.

Headlines: Microsoft sales and profit beat estimates on cloud growth
Description: Microsoft Corp beat Wall Street estimates for revenue and profit in its first quarter on Wednesday, as more businesses signed up for its Azure cloud computing services and Office 365 software.

Headlines: Trump and the Fed are creating 'a totally destructive tug of war' in the stock market, Cramer warns
Description: Jim Cramer warns that with the Federal Reserve and the president on opposite sides when it comes to the U.S. economy, the real losers are investors.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sinopec, CNPC to skip Iran oil bookings for November as U.S. sanctions near
Description: Sinopec Group and China National Petroleum Corp (CNPC), the country's top state-owned refiners, have not made any nominations to load Iranian oil for November because of concerns they would be violating U.S. sanctions, two persons with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: For Fed, sell-off could point to fading Trump stimulus
Description: A three-week stock market sell-off may signal concerns that the massive stimulus from U.S. tax cuts and government spending will fade sooner than expected, a central issue for the Federal Reserve as it considers when to halt interest rate hikes.

Headlines: Slump persists, China fails to stimulate markets hobbled by pledged shares
Description: China is struggling to restore confidence in its stock markets, which are being weighed down by a massive amount of shares that have been pledged as collateral as credit-starved companies seek to raise funds.

Headlines: Ford hires new China chief to tackle daunting turnaround task
Description: Ford Motor Co has hired a new chief for its troubled China operations, ending a nine-month search after the previous head suddenly quit and tasking him with fixing a deep sales slump in the world's biggest car market.

Headlines: Trump threats, demands spark 'existential crisis' at WTO
Description: The World Trade Organization is scrambling to develop a plan for the biggest reform in its 23-year history after U.S. President Donald Trump brought the world's top trade court to the brink of collapse by blocking appointments of its judges and threatening to pull the United States out of the organization.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia will not penalize banks that boycotted conference: central bank chief
Description: Saudi Arabia's central bank governor said the kingdom will not penalize foreign banks that boycotted an investment conference in Riyadh because of the fallout from the killing of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

Headlines: A banker's woe: Chinese wealth may get harder to snag for global bankers
Description: News of a foreign wealth manager being denied exit from China last week is raising concerns for global private banks, as they seek to tap trillions of dollars of wealth offshore in the face of Beijing's growing curbs on overseas investments and outflows.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court revives Nestle child slavery lawsuit
Description: A U.S. federal appeals court on Tuesday reinstated a lawsuit by a group of former child slaves accusing the U.S. unit of Nestle SA, the world's largest food maker, and Cargill Co [CARG.UL] of perpetuating child slavery at Ivory Coast cocoa farms.

Headlines: Danske Bank whistleblower to testify before European parliament
Description: The whistleblower who helped to reveal a major money laundering scandal at Denmark's largest bank, Danske Bank , will testify before the European Parliament and the Danish Parliament at two events in November.

Headlines: Factbox: Foreign investment in Saudi Arabia
Description: Scandal surrounding the killing of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi has shrunk the attendance of senior executives from multinational companies at this week's Future Investment Initiative conference in Riyadh.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia reassures boycotting banks, prince to address forum
Description: Saudi Arabia said on Wednesday it would not penalize foreign banks boycotting an investment forum in a message of reassurance for a gathering overshadowed by a global outcry over slain journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

Headlines: Europe hit by steel import surge from U.S. tariffs: industry body
Description: Steel imports into Europe have risen sharply as a result of U.S. tariffs, particularly from Turkey, threatening European steelmakers as demand growth in the continent slows, European steel association Eurofer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wall St. rebounds, dollar gains as euro swoons on Draghi
Description: U.S. stocks climbed back on Thursday after a massive sell-off the day previous, with strong earnings encouraging investors to venture into risky bets again, while the dollar gained on the euro.

Headlines: U.S. shale producers eye global pricing as exports surge
Description: Three years after a ban on crude oil exports was lifted, some U.S. shale producers are doing something they have never done before - lock in prices for their barrels that will find a home overseas.

Headlines: Vivendi's Canal+ backs African TV dramas as European sales suffer
Description: On a muddy side-street in Abidjan, Alex Ogou directs his cast of young locals in a TV drama about gangsters in Ivory Coast that French media giant Vivendi hopes will help revive its fortunes.

Headlines: Mattel reports surprise rise in North America sales, shares jump
Description: Mattel Inc reported a surprise rise in North American sales, allaying concerns about the effects of retailer Toys 'R' Us' liquidation on the toy industry and driving its shares up 8 percent on Thursday.

Headlines: Few see Trump-friendly U.S. stock recovery before elections
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's favorite report card on his presidency may be failing him at a critical moment.

Headlines: U.S. business spending on equipment cooling; goods trade deficit rises
Description: U.S. business spending on equipment appeared to have remained slow in September and the goods trade deficit widened further as rising imports outpaced a rebound in exports, suggesting economic growth moderated in the third quarter.

Headlines: Five things to know about Trump's war (of words) on the Fed
Description: With U.S. stocks well down from their record highs in September and key elections less than two weeks away, President Donald Trump has stepped up his criticism of the Federal Reserve's interest rate increases and of Jerome Powell, the man he picked to lead the central bank.

Headlines: Wall St. rebounds after upbeat earnings, bargain hunting
Description: U.S. stocks jumped on Thursday, giving the Nasdaq its biggest daily gain since March, as Microsoft's upbeat earnings spurred a rebound in technology names and investors snapped up oversold shares.

Headlines: Republican senator decries USDA aid for Smithfield unit of China's WH Group
Description: A prominent Republican on the U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee complained on Thursday about Chinese-owned Smithfield Foods Inc receiving aid from the U.S. Department of Agriculture meant to help American farmers hurt by China's trade tariffs.

Headlines: Alphabet misses Wall Street revenue estimates; shares fall
Description: Google parent Alphabet Inc on Thursday missed analysts' quarterly revenue estimates for the first time in at least two years and reported continuing erosion of its operating margin, sending shares down almost 7 percent after hours.

Headlines: Oil settles higher as stock markets gain, Saudi signals intervention
Description: Oil prices rose 1 percent on Thursday, following the U.S. stock market higher a day after Wall Street's biggest drop since 2011 and as Saudi Arabia's energy minister signaled major producers may have to intervene in crude markets to support prices.

Headlines: Tech stocks battered after disappointing Amazon and Alphabet results
Description: So-called FANG stocks and other tech shares sank in extended trade on Thursday following disappointing quarterly reports from Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc .

Headlines: Cramer breaks down why Trump's tariffs aren't working for steelmakers like Nucor
Description: Jim Cramer points to three reasons for Nucor's muted performance as the Trump administration's tariffs on steel imports kick in.

Headlines: Daimler hit by Germany slump, CEO forecasts high fourth quarter demand
Description: Daimler Chief Executive Dieter Zetsche on Thursday said customer demand remains strong even as a regulatory crackdown on diesel cars and a 13 percent sales slowdown for Mercedes-Benz cars in Germany weighed on third-quarter earnings.

Headlines: Chipotle tops profit estimates as turnaround takes shape
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc topped Wall Street profit estimates on Thursday, as newer menu items and a marketing blitz helped the burrito chain recover from a series of food-safety lapses that had kept diners away.

Headlines: Trian calls for PPG Industries CEO ouster, wants to split company
Description: Activist hedge fund Trian Fund Management said on Thursday that it wants to replace PPG Industries' chief executive with his predecessor and suggested that the U.S. paints and coatings company be broken up.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia still moving ahead with three major development projects
Description: Saudi Arabia is still moving ahead with three major development projects, NEOM, the Red Sea tourism project, and an entertainment development that will include a Six Flags theme park.

Headlines: Saudi says it will offer series of privatization deals by March
Description: Saudi Arabia will offer international investors the chance to invest in a raft of privatization deals from grains to healthcare and water desalination over the next six months, Economy Minister Mohammed al-Tuwaijri said on Thursday.

Headlines: Saudi hopes to attract $427 billion in investments by 2030
Description: Saudi Arabia expects to attract investments of more than 1.6 trillion riyals ($427 billion) by 2030 in its push to boost industry, Energy Minister Khalid Al-Falih said on Thursday, according to state TV al-Ekhbariya.

Headlines: Daimler says is reviewing production footprint amid global tariffs
Description: Daimler Chief Financial Officer Bodo Uebber on Thursday said the company is reviewing ways to counter tariffs between China and the United States that have caused a price hike of Mercedes-Benz sports utility vehicles sold in China.

Headlines: Jaguar launches Slovak plant, sees output hitting 100,000 by 2020
Description: British carmaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) expects to hit annual production of 100,000 cars at its plant in Slovakia by 2020, the chief executive of the newly opened factory, Alexander Wortberg, said on Thursday.

Headlines: One trillion yuan: China state carmaker FAW gains huge credit line
Description: China's state-owned automaker FAW Group said it signed a deal with 16 banks for a credit line worth more than 1 trillion yuan ($144 billion), an eye-catching amount analysts said was mostly symbolic, albeit an important signal of government support.

Headlines: China says 'hard to understand' U.S. skipping import fair
Description: China finds it "hard to understand" why the United States is not sending senior government officials to a major import expo in Shanghai next month, the foreign ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Saudi says companies 'apologized' for missing investment conference
Description: Energy Minister Khalid Al-Falih said on Thursday that companies that pulled out of the Future Investment Initiative conference in Riyadh had apologized for missing the event.

Headlines: Chevron settles claims it violated Clean Air Act: U.S. Justice Department
Description: Chevron Corp will spend about $163 million to settle claims by the U.S. government and the state of Mississippi that it violated provisions of the Clean Air Act when its refineries accidentally released hazardous chemicals, the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Saudis trumpet $56 billion deals as conference ends amid partial boycott
Description: Saudi Arabia said it signed $56 billion of deals at an investment conference this week and expected the United States to remain a key business partner despite a partial boycott of the event over the killing of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

Headlines: KKR preps for dealmaking in wake of stock market sell-off
Description: Private equity firm KKR & Co Inc sees the chance to take advantage of the recent U.S. stock market plunge to make acquisitions, co-President and co-Chief Operating Officer Scott Nuttall said on Thursday.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor posts big profit miss on U.S. recalls; shares dive
Description: Hyundai Motor Co's third-quarter net profit plunged by a shocking two-thirds, hit by a $440 million one-off charge related to U.S. recalls and sending its shares tumbling to near nine-year-lows on Thursday.

Headlines: AB InBev told Indian authorities about cartel, triggering anti-trust probe
Description: An Indian anti-trust probe into beer price-fixing allegations was initiated after the world's largest brewer Anheuser-Busch InBev told the authorities last year it had detected an industry cartel, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Microsoft overtakes Amazon as second most valuable U.S. company
Description: Microsoft Corp regained its spot as the second most valuable U.S. company on Friday after a disappointing quarterly report from Amazon.com wiped $65 billion off the online retailer's market capitalization.

Headlines: GM wants Trump administration to back national electric vehicle program
Description: General Motors Co said on Friday it wants the Trump administration to back a nationwide program to boost sales of zero emission vehicles like electric cars, even as the government has proposed ending California's ability to require more clean vehicles.

Headlines: S&P 500 ends at lowest since May as tech, internet stocks tumble
Description: The S&P 500 ended at its lowest level since early May on Friday and flirted with correction territory after technology and internet shares sold off further, capping another volatile week for U.S. stocks.

Headlines: U.S. economic growth slows slightly in third quarter; outlook less upbeat
Description: The U.S. economy slowed less than expected in the third quarter as a tariff-related drop in soybean exports was partially offset by the strongest consumer spending in nearly four years, keeping growth on track to hit the Trump administration's 3 percent target this year.

Headlines: Global oil pricing worries hit U.S. energy shares as earnings loom
Description: Worries over global oil pricing and pipeline constraints are hanging over the energy sector as U.S. companies begin to report quarterly results, with many producers' shares trading lower on the year.

Headlines: Danske Bank drops to last place in private banking survey: Prospera
Description: Danske Bank , which is embroiled in a major money laundering scandal, is now the least preferred of the five large banks in Denmark amongst wealthy private banking customers, a survey from Swedish consultancy firm Prospera showed on Friday.

Headlines: China's Wanda Group says stake sales report 'inconsistent with the facts'
Description: China's Dalian Wanda Group said on Friday news it was considering the sale of a stake in Legendary Entertainment and divesting from its sports assets was "seriously inconsistent with the facts."

Headlines: Volkswagen has held kick-off meeting for 2019 Traton IPO: sources
Description: Volkswagen has held an initial meeting to discuss plans for the flotation of its trucks unit Traton, set to be Germany's biggest of 2019, after hiring a quartet of banks to manage the potential 6 billion euro ($6.8 billion) IPO, people close to the matter said.

Headlines: Asked about Green knighthood, UK PM's spokeswoman says committee constantly reviews evidence
Description: Britain's honors committee constantly reviews evidence, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Friday when asked whether businessman Philip Green should be stripped of his knighthood.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's Wanda Group explores Legendary Entertainment stake sale - sources
Description: China's Dalian Wanda Group is exploring a partial sale of its Hollywood film studio and the full sale of its sports assets in its latest push to reduce offshore holdings under pressure from Beijing, sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Guarding stability, China likely to slow yuan's slide to 7 per dollar - sources
Description: China is likely to use its vast currency reserves to stop any precipitous fall through the psychologically important level of 7 yuan per dollar as it could risk triggering speculation and heavy capital outflows, policy insiders said.

Headlines: Unilever adjourns meetings where Dutch move would've sought approval
Description: Unilever on Friday said meetings where it had planned to seek court and shareholder approval to move its headquarters to the Netherlands have been adjourned indefinitely after its decision to scrap the move in the face of a shareholder revolt.

Headlines: Belgium picks Lockheed's F-35 over Eurofighter on price
Description: Belgium said on Thursday it had chosen Lockheed Martin's F-35 stealth jets over the Eurofighter Typhoon to replace its aging F-16s in a 4 billion euro ($4.55 billion) deal, saying the decision came down to price.

Headlines: Long-term care policies loom over U.S. life insurance results
Description: Big U.S. life insurers are bracing for elevated payouts to owners of long-term care policies, which cover expenses like assisted living for infirmed and elderly customers.

Headlines: Euro zone to discuss Italy budget, despite Rome's objection - sources
Description: Euro zone finance ministers will discuss Italy's 2019 draft budget at their next meeting, on Nov. 5, despite Italian requests to postpone the talks, a European Union official told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Sears directors tap Evercore to examine former CEO Lampert's deals -sources
Description: Two Sears Holdings Corp board directors have hired investment bank Evercore Inc to scrutinize deals that were led by former Sears Chief Executive Eddie Lampert with the U.S. retailer before it filed for bankruptcy protection, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Brazil will leave fate of Boeing-Embraer deal to next president
Description: Brazil will leave a decision on whether to approve the sale of a controlling stake in planemaker Embraer SA's commercial jet business to Boeing Co to the next government, Defense Minister Joaquim Silva e Luna told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Tesla says has not received subpoena on Model 3 production
Description: Tesla Inc has not received a U.S. subpoena related to its Model 3 production forecasts, the electric carmaker said on Friday, following a report that it faced a deepening criminal probe about the projections.

Headlines: U.S. equity index futures start weekly trading little changed
Description: U.S. equity index futures were little changed at the start of weekly trading on Sunday, leaving it unclear whether Wall Street would rebound from last week's steep sell-off or extend the slide.

Headlines: IBM to acquire software company Red Hat for $34 billion
Description: IBM Corp said on Sunday it had agreed to acquire U.S. software company Red Hat Inc for $34 billion, including debt, as it seeks to diversify its technology hardware and consulting business into higher-margin products and services.

Headlines: France will ask auto makers to fund new car trade-in payments
Description: France will ask carmakers on Monday to help fund an expanded trade-in program to get older, polluting cars off the road with incentives for new ones, the French finance minister told daily Le Parisien on Sunday.

Headlines: After years of global success, India's Reliance Industries faces oil shock at home
Description: Reliance Industries , currently India's second most valuable listed company, got rich by trading fuel across Asia, Africa and Europe while effectively ignoring its home market.

Headlines: Daimler doesn't rule out future cooperation with Tesla: report
Description: Daimler AG does not rule out cooperating with Tesla Inc in future even though the German luxury car producer sold its stake in the U.S. electric vehicles company, Daimler's chief executive told a Polish newspaper.

Headlines: U.S. October auto sales seen down slightly: consultants
Description: U.S. auto sales likely fell slightly in October from a year earlier, when replacement demand following hurricanes Harvey and Irma boosted business, industry consultants J.D. Power and LMC Automotive said on Monday.

Headlines: Hitachi agrees to buy Elliott's stake in Italy's Ansaldo STS, ending feud
Description: Hitachi has wrapped up a bitter feud with U.S. activist investor Elliott over Ansaldo STS , agreeing to buy the fund's stake in the Italian rail signaling group as part of a move to take full control.

Headlines: Intel's Mobileye, Volkswagen plan Israel's first autonomous ride-hailing service
Description: Volkswagen and Intel Corp's Mobileye are planning to roll out Israel's first ride-hailing service using self-driving cars starting early next year.

Headlines: GM says it favors fuel-efficiency rules based on historic rates
Description: General Motors Co backs an annual increase in fuel-efficiency standards based on "historic rates" rather than tough Obama era rules or a Trump administration proposal that would freeze requirements, according to a federal filing made public on Monday.

Headlines: Google seeks to grant $25 million to AI for 'good' projects
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google announced on Monday that it would grant about $25 million globally next year to humanitarian and environmental projects seeking to use artificial intelligence (AI) to speed up and grow their efforts.

Headlines: China's OnePlus, backed by Qualcomm and T-Mobile, launches smartphone in U.S
Description: A Chinese smartphone company whose high-end products are little known outside a tech-savvy niche entered the U.S. market on Monday with the backing of two key local allies - chipmaking giant Qualcomm and mobile operator T-Mobile US Inc - and no questions from U.S. regulators.

Headlines: Intel says more women, African-Americans in workforce after diversity push
Description: Intel Corp has increased the ratio of women and African-Americans in its workforce after three years of a high-profile effort to improve diversity, the U.S. microchip maker said in a report released on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending solid; income gain smallest in 15 months
Description: U.S. consumer spending rose for a seventh straight month in September, but income recorded its smallest gain in more than a year on moderate wage growth, suggesting the current pace of spending was unlikely to be sustained.

Headlines: Israel, Boeing sign reciprocal spending deal: ministry
Description: Boeing has agreed to spend billions of dollars in Israel over the coming decade if it wins major defense contracts, Israel's Economy Ministry said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Higher revenues, restrained spending boost U.S. states' credit quality - Conning
Description: The credit quality of U.S. states is improving, with revenue growth and spending moderation helping to halt a downward trend, according to a report to be released later on Tuesday.

Headlines: Baker Hughes to halt buybacks, awaits GE plans
Description: GE's Baker Hughes has halted its share buyback program as it awaits more clarity from parent General Electric about its plans as the U.S. conglomerate embarks on more organizational and financial changes.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence at 18-year high; house price gains slow
Description: U.S. consumer confidence rose to an 18-year high in October, driven largely by a robust labor market, bolstering expectations that strong economic growth would continue through early 2019.

Headlines: Wall Street drops on trade worries, S&P 500 nears correction
Description: U.S. stocks fell in a volatile session on Monday, with the benchmark S&P 500 index ending close to confirming its second correction of 2018, hurt by fresh worries about U.S.-China trade policy tensions and a sharp drop in the big technology and internet shares.

Headlines: Wall St. rebounds as chip, transport shares surge
Description: Major U.S. stock indexes jumped more than 1 percent on Tuesday, helped by strong gains for chip and transport stocks as investors took advantage of cheaper prices following a steep recent pullback for equities.

Headlines: U.S. restricts exports to Chinese semiconductor firm Fujian Jinhua
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration took action on Monday to cut off a Chinese state-backed chipmaker from U.S. suppliers amid allegations the firm stole intellectual property from U.S. semiconductor company Micron Technology Inc .

Headlines: U.S. go-go growth stock days are gone, value back in play
Description: One undeniable fact has underpinned the latest leg of the long-running U.S. bull market: Paying up for growth stocks at any price paid off, hugely.

Headlines: Julius Baer expects ex-banker's sentence to have no bearing on its U.S. legal issues
Description: Swiss private bank Julius Baer does not expect the U.S. sentencing of one of its former Latin America executives to have any bearing on the bank's U.S. legal issues, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Bentley warns worst case no deal Brexit would hit profitability, investment
Description: The boss of carmaker Bentley said failure to reach a Brexit deal would be "quite damaging" to annual profit in the worst case scenario, limit the company's ability to invest and could lead to its plant closing for an additional few days.

Headlines: Kroger set to place warehouse order with partner Ocado
Description: U.S. supermarket chain Kroger Co is expected to order the first three of 20 high-tech warehouses from online grocer Ocado by the end of the year under the terms of a breakthrough deal agreed in May.

Headlines: Citi granted license to set up Citibank branch in Abu Dhabi
Description: Citigroup has been granted a license to set up a branch of Citibank at Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGAM), a financial center in Abu Dhabi, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Insurer AIG's quarterly loss narrows on reinsurance benefit
Description: American International Group Inc reported a smaller quarterly loss on Wednesday as reinsurance pacts helped offset steep catastrophe losses in Japan and North America.

Headlines: How the U.S. midterm elections could ripple through markets
Description: Gridlock, Blue Sweep or Red Repeat? Wall Street is closely watching the U.S. midterm Congressional elections next week, as policy decisions that could sway the economy, corporate decision-making and consumer spending hinge on the results.

Headlines: Sprint beats revenue and profit forecasts, shares rise
Description: Sprint Corp beat Wall Street's estimates for quarterly revenue, profit and overall net subscriber additions on Wednesday, driving shares in the No. 4 U.S. wireless carrier 9 percent higher in morning trading.

Headlines: Siemens goes back to its roots with 600 million euro Berlin investment
Description: Siemens went back to its Berlin roots on Wednesday as it announced plans to invest up to 600 million euros ($681 million) to create an industrial and technology hub in the German capital.

Headlines: Wall St. ends last day of haunted October in the black
Description: U.S. stocks rebounded for a second day on Wednesday as investors snapped up beaten-down technology and internet favorites and strong company results lifted spirits, even as the S&P 500 closed out its worst month in seven years.

Headlines: Federal Reserve unveils proposal to ease regulations for larger banks
Description: The Federal Reserve said on Wednesday it wants to ease regulations for U.S. lenders with less than $700 billion in assets, a way to lessen the burden on big commercial lenders that do not have volatile Wall Street businesses.

Headlines: Private payrolls rise in October; wages surge in third quarter
Description: U.S. private sector payrolls increased by the most in eight months in October, suggesting overall job growth accelerated this month after Hurricane Florence weighed on restaurant and retail employment in September.

Headlines: Airbus in talks to unjam some HNA, Emirates deliveries: sources
Description: Airbus faces new headaches delivering A330s to airlines tied to China's cash-strapped HNA Group and is in separate talks with Emirates over the timing of undelivered A380 superjumbos.

Headlines: Barrick, Randgold sweeten dividend ahead of takeover deal vote
Description: Canada's Barrick Gold and takeover target Randgold Resources are boosting their dividend payouts ahead of shareholder votes next week on their $6.1 billion deal, the miners said Wednesday.

Headlines: Countering global protectionism, Pacific trade pact nears takeoff
Description: A landmark 11-country deal that will slash tariffs across much of the Asia-Pacific region will come into force at the end of December, New Zealand said on Wednesday, a rare bright spot for global commerce as the U.S.-China trade war intensifies.

Headlines: Early bitcoin investors count winnings after volatile decade
Description: Seven years ago, Marshall Hayner gave his grandfather one bitcoin, worth about $30. On the paper wallet he fashioned to commemorate the gift, the U.S. entrepreneur and software developer wrote: "Do not open until $100,000."

Headlines: 'It's a mistake' to write off FANG even as the stocks could still go lower, Cramer says
Description: Jim Cramer maintains that even when Facebook, Amazon, Netflix and Alphabet "screw up," they're still great companies.

Headlines: Honda and GAC Group to build $430 million Chinese plant for new-energy cars
Description: Honda Motor Co's joint venture with GAC Group will invest 3.27 billion yuan ($469 million) in new-energy vehicle production in China, GAC said in a stock exchange filing on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ex-JPMorgan CFO's activist fund takes stake in Deutsche Bank
Description: An activist hedge fund led by the former finance chief of JP Morgan Chase has taken a 3.1 percent stake in Deutsche Bank , saying it backed new Chief Executive Christian Sewing's efforts to turn around Germany's biggest bank, but there was more to do.

Headlines: Apple held talks to take stake in iHeartMedia: FT
Description: Apple Inc has held talks with iHeartMedia Inc to take a stake in the U.S. radio company, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Volvo Cars taps Baidu tech to develop robotaxi for China
Description: Volvo Cars has teamed up with Chinese search engine operator Baidu to develop a self-driving taxi for China, it said on Thursday, opening another frontier to secure its place in the robotaxi market while its Uber supply deal remains in limbo.

Headlines: Failing? No, says New York Times after online boost
Description: The New York Times Co , assailed by a U.S. president who brands it as "failing," signed up more than 200,000 paying online subscribers in the third quarter, helping it top Wall Street estimates for both profit and revenue.

Headlines: Rising interest rates pinch U.S. auto sales, consumer confidence
Description: U.S. auto sales rose slightly in October, hit by rising interest rates and higher vehicle prices, and No.2 carmaker Ford Motor Co. warned of slipping consumer confidence, indicating sales volumes would continue to moderate in 2018.

Headlines: Global stocks begin November stronger, lifted by results, trade war progress
Description: World equity markets began November with a broad rally on Thursday after a brutal October, boosted by strong corporate earnings and signs that a trade war between economic giants, China and the United States, could be contained.

Headlines: Canada October auto sales slide 1.9 percent
Description: Canada's auto sales slid for the seventh straight month in October as demand for new cars waned with rising interest rates.

Headlines: Starbucks same-store sales boosted by U.S., China rebound; shares soar
Description: Starbucks Corp on Thursday reported a better-than-expected rise in quarterly sales at established stores as it benefited from higher prices in the United States and a rebound in China, sending its shares up nearly 9 percent.

Headlines: U.S. judge shreds main claim in Parmesan cheese labeling lawsuits
Description: A federal judge on Thursday dismissed the central claim in lawsuits accusing five food producers and retailers of deceiving consumers by using "100% Grated Parmesan Cheese" labels to describe products that contained cellulose, an anti-clumping agent made from wood pulp.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to open technical engineering office in Hungary
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) will create 100 jobs with a new technical engineering office in Hungary to allow for close collaboration with suppliers in central and Eastern Europe, the firm said on Friday.

Headlines: BMW expands car-sharing service DriveNow in London
Description: BMW is expanding its car-sharing service DriveNow into five more London boroughs as the carmaker overcomes some of the barriers to operating across the city where firms need to strike agreements with separate local authorities.

Headlines: JP Morgan CEO says has no interest in buying Deutsche Bank: Handelsblatt
Description: JP Morgan has no interest in buying Deutsche Bank the U.S. bank's chief executive told German daily Handelsblatt.

Headlines: BlackRock's Fink says U.S., China on path to full-fledged trade war
Description: BlackRock Inc Chief Executive Larry Fink said on Thursday the United States is on a path to a full-fledged trade war against China as the world's two largest economies engage in tit-for-tat tariffs.

Headlines: Japanese carmakers' weapon of choice in Trump trade war: Flexible factories
Description: At points along the assembly line at Nissan Motor Co Ltd's 7201.T largest U.S. factory, workers wheel trolleys past shelves selecting parts wherever they see a green or blue light.

Headlines: Testy talks, tangled taxes: Amazon's slow push into Brazil's retail jungle
Description: Amazon.com Inc is struggling to ramp up its operations in Brazil, a promising market that so far has proven difficult for the world's largest online retailer to crack, according to nearly twenty people with knowledge of the situation.

Headlines: Vietjet to finalize $6.5 billion Airbus order: sources
Description: Fast-growing budget carrier Vietjet Aviation is set to finalize a $6.5 billion jet order with Europe's Airbus during a visit to Hanoi by French Prime Minister Edouard Philippe on Friday, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Cigna boosts 2018 forecast after third quarter earnings beat
Description: U.S. health insurer Cigna Corp , which is in the process of acquiring Express Scripts Holding Co , significantly bumped up its 2018 adjusted profit forecast, and its shares rose more than 3 percent on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. labor market tightening; manufacturing slowing
Description: New applications for U.S. unemployment aid fell last week and the number of Americans receiving benefits was the lowest in more than 45 years as labor market conditions tightened further.

Headlines: U.S. online spending set to rise 14.8 percent in 2018 holiday season
Description: U.S. online spending during the holiday shopping season is likely to grow 14.8 percent this year to $124.1 billion, far outpacing the 2.7 percent growth predicted for brick-and-mortar locations and highlighting the ongoing switch from stores to web shopping.

Headlines: Signs of relief emerge for battered U.S. homebuilding stocks
Description: U.S. homebuilders' earnings have been hit by rising mortgage rates in the latest quarter, but their shares are showing signs of recovering.

Headlines: From pharma to prisons, election-sensitive stocks that could swing
Description: Tuesday's midterm U.S. congressional elections stand to have broad effects on federal government policies that could ripple through industries from healthcare and tech to gunmakers and prisons.

Headlines: AirAsia X names new CEO to take over from co-founders
Description: Malaysia's long-haul budget carrier AirAsia X on Thursday appointed Nadda Buranasiri as its new group chief executive officer to take over from its co-founders.

Headlines: Chevron profit doubles as U.S. oil production jumps, shares rise
Description: U.S. oil and natural gas producer Chevron Corp on Friday reported that its quarterly profit doubled on record oil and gas production, sending its shares up as much as 5 percent.

Headlines: Economy glides, but fading 'Trump bump' may cast shadow over 2020 race
Description: President Donald Trump's bet that tax cuts and a gush of government spending would smooth the path to a second term may falter as cracks begin to appear in a decade-old recovery.

Headlines: AbbVie sees hit to Humira sales from European competition
Description: U.S. drugmaker AbbVie Inc on Friday lowered its forecast for overseas sales of its top-selling medicine, Humira, due to larger-than-expected pricing cuts because of new competition in Europe.

Headlines: U.S. job growth soars; annual wage gain largest since 2009
Description: U.S. job growth rebounded sharply in October and wages recorded their largest annual gain in 9-1/2 years, pointing to further labor market tightening that could encourage the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates again in December.

Headlines: Deutsche edges up in EU stress tests, still among worst 10 banks in Europe
Description: Deutsche Bank on Friday scored among the ten worst banks in the latest round of European stress tests, yet another sign of weakness at Germany's largest lender.

Headlines: Italy's Banco BPM says one-off costs weighed on stress test outcome
Description: Italy's Banco BPM , one of the banks that fared the worst in Europe-wide stress tests of the sector, said on Friday one-off costs had weighed on the outcome of the health check.

Headlines: Broadcom makes $1 billion patent claim against Volkswagen: Der Spiegel
Description: U.S. semiconductor supplier Broadcom has made a patent claim for more than $1 billion against Volkswagen and is threatening to seek a judicial ban on the production of several car models, German magazine Der Spiegel said on Friday.

Headlines: Austrian banking supervisors call on lenders to bolster capital after stress test
Description: Austria's banking supervisors on Friday renewed their calls to the country's biggest lenders to bolster their capital reserves after Erste Group was ranked among the 10 worst performers in a Europe-wide stress test.

Headlines: Exclusive: Twitter deletes over 10,000 accounts that sought to discourage U.S. voting
Description: Twitter Inc deleted more than 10,000 automated accounts posting messages that discouraged people from voting in Tuesday's U.S. election and wrongly appeared to be from Democrats, after the party flagged the misleading tweets to the social media company.

Headlines: As China soy demand wavers, U.S. farmers turn back to grains
Description: Since the mid-2000s, North Dakota farmer Paul Thomas has planted more of his land with soybeans as China's demand for the oilseed grew. The shift culminated this year when Thomas planted 1,600 of his 5,000 acres with soybeans, the most ever.

Headlines: Cramer's game plan: Stay on your toes as market-moving news flow continues
Description: Jim Cramer tells investors not to be too positive or too negative in a week with major earnings reports, a potential trade deal with China and the midterm elections.

Headlines: After tragedies and big losses, Hyundai looks to reverse North Korea fortunes
Description: For Hyundai, the South Korean conglomerate, North Korea has been a story of lost opportunities – and tragedy.

Headlines: Trump's latest tariffs undercut his first trade salvo in solar
Description: In January, President Donald Trump fired the opening shot of his trade war, slapping tariffs on solar panel imports to boost U.S. manufacturing of a product long dominated by cheap foreign competition.

Headlines: Alibaba cuts sales forecast on economic uncertainty, trade fears
Description: China's Alibaba Group Holding Ltd lowered its full-year sales forecast on Friday due to concerns about the economic impact of a U.S.-China trade spat, which the company expects will dent revenue ahead of its top sale season.

Headlines: Wall Street snaps three-day rally as Apple falls, trade optimism fades
Description: U.S. stocks snapped a three-day rally on Friday as Apple shares dropped following a disappointing forecast and the White House dampened optimism over U.S.-China trade talks.

Headlines: Consumer companies try price hikes as U.S. wages climb
Description: Consumer goods companies, emboldened by a strong U.S. economy, are rolling out price increases on everyday products and groceries after several years of haggling with big retailers that needed cheaper products to attract customers.

Headlines: China says willing to meet U.S. over trade issues on equal footing
Description: China is willing to resolve trade issues with the United States through mutually respectful talks and on an equal footing, said one of the country's vice commerce ministers Wang Bingnan on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. charges financier, former Goldman bankers for 1MDB
Description: U.S. prosecutors unveiled criminal charges on Thursday against two former Goldman Sachs Group Inc bankers and Malaysian financier Low Taek Jho tied to the alleged theft of billions of dollars from Malaysian sovereign wealth fund 1MDB.

Headlines: U.S. allows eight importers to keep buying Iran oil for now
Description: The United States said on Friday it will temporarily allow eight importers to keep buying Iranian oil when it re-imposes sanctions on Monday to try to force Iran to curb its nuclear, missile and regional activities.

Headlines: Business figures call for vote on Brexit terms: Sunday Times
Description: More than 70 business figures are calling for a public vote on the final terms of Britain's exit from the European Union, warning that the country faces "either a blindfold or a destructive hard Brexit", the Sunday Times reported.

Headlines: Europe focuses on growth, Fed to follow mid-terms
Description: New economic forecasts from the European Commission and services PMIs will help clarify the outlook for the euro zone economy after third-quarter growth disappointed, while mid-term elections and a Federal Reserve meeting top the U.S. agenda.

Headlines: India iPhone sales to fall for first time in four years: researcher
Description: Apple's iPhone sales are set to dip by around a quarter in India's holiday season fourth quarter, putting them on course for the first full-year fall in four years, industry research firm Counterpoint said on Saturday.

Headlines: Trade war, spy claims cloud horizon for China airshow
Description: Trade frictions with the United States and accusations of industrial espionage are set to cast a cloud over China's largest aerospace meeting this week, as suppliers consider what the country's slowing economy could mean for booming jet demand.

Headlines: All-UK customs Brexit deal report is 'speculation': PM May's office
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's office has dismissed as "speculation" a newspaper report that suggests an all-UK customs deal will be written into the legally binding agreement governing Britain's withdrawal from the EU

Headlines: Oil mixed as U.S. imposes sanctions on Iran, Tehran defiant
Description: Oil prices were mixed on Monday after a steep five-day fall, as the United States formally imposed punitive sanctions on Iran but granted eight countries temporary waivers allowing them to keep buying oil from the Islamic Republic.

Headlines: Evelyn Davis, known as corporate gadfly, dies at 89
Description: Evelyn Davis, who became known as a corporate gadfly for her attendance and relentless questioning of top executives at scores of U.S. annual shareholder meetings over a period of decades, has died at age 89.

Headlines: U.S. will allow three Iranian civil nuclear projects to continue
Description: The United States will allow non-proliferation civil nuclear projects at Arak, Bushehr and Fordow in Iran "under the strictest scrutiny," the State Department said on Monday, as the country began reimposing strict sanctions on Iran.

Headlines: Iran says actions taken to continue trade after U.S. sanctions
Description: Iran said on Monday it has taken necessary banking measures to continue trade with its partners after the United States reimposed sanctions on Tehran's energy and financial sectors, Iranian state TV quoted the head of the country's Central Bank Abdolnassr Hemmati as saying.

Headlines: Marriott cuts current-quarter forecast on weak North America demand
Description: U.S. hotel chain Marriott International Inc on Monday cut its fourth-quarter forecast for a key measure of hotel health, blaming uncertainty related to weak demand in North America, its biggest market.

Headlines: U.S. stocks edge higher ahead of midterms, Fed; dollar falls
Description: Energy and financial stocks pushed U.S. equities higher on Monday, on the eve of U.S. midterm elections to determine whether President Donald Trump's Republican Party retains control of the U.S. Congress and ahead of a meeting of Federal Reserve policy makers.

Headlines: Toymaker Lego wins court case against Chinese copycats
Description: Lego has won another case against imitators in China where copies of its colorful plastic toy bricks and figures have been a recurrent problem, the Danish toymaker said on Monday.

Headlines: Third-quarter U.S. profit growth on track to be highest since 2010
Description: U.S. earnings growth for S&P 500 companies in the third quarter is on track to be the highest since 2010, eclipsing the strong results from earlier this year, according to IBES data from Refinitiv.

Headlines: GE dismisses talk that it may owe billions of dollars in taxes
Description: General Electric Co on Monday downplayed concerns that its U.S. tax liabilities could increase by billions of dollars and that a decision by British tax authorities could saddle the company with an additional $1 billion tax bill.

Headlines: Vying for Vuitton: China's e-commerce rivals seek luxury stranglehold
Description: China's online giants Alibaba and JD.com are taking their battle for relevance in the lucrative luxury goods market to a new level, as they aim to crack e-commerce tie-ups with top brands that usually shun selling through third parties.

Headlines: U.S. reimposes Iran sanctions, Tehran decries 'bullying'
Description: The United States on Monday restored sanctions targeting Iran's oil, banking and transportation sectors and threatened more action to stop its "outlaw" policies, steps the Islamic Republic called economic warfare and vowed to defy.

Headlines: Wall Street boosted by financials, energy, defensive sectors
Description: The S&P 500 rose on Monday with boosts from financial, energy and defensive sectors as investors showed some caution on the eve of U.S. congressional elections.

Headlines: Lowe's shuts 51 stores in U.S. and Canada
Description: Home improvement chain Lowe's Companies Inc announced the closure of another 51 underperforming stores in the United States and Canada on Monday as it strives to compete with rival Home Depot Inc in a slowing housing market.

Headlines: Iran tells U.N. chief: U.S. should be held accountable over sanctions
Description: The United Nations should hold the United States accountable for re-imposing sanctions on Monday to choke off Iran's oil and shipping industry, measures that defy a U.N. Security Council resolution, Iran's U.N. ambassador wrote in a letter to Secretary-General Antonio Guterres.

Headlines: Iran's Zarif says sanctions 'backfiring', isolating U.S.
Description: Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif said on Monday that new U.S. sanctions were "backfiring", making Washington more isolated, not the Islamic Republic.

Headlines: Rouhani says Iran to sell oil, defy U.S. sanctions: TV
Description: Iran will sell its oil and break sanctions reimposed by the United States on its vital energy and banking sectors, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said on Monday.

Headlines: Iran in contact with other signatories of nuclear deal as U.S. reinforces sanctions
Description: Iran is in constant contact with other signatories of a 2015 nuclear deal reached between Tehran and powers as the United States reinforces lifted sanctions under the pact, Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Bahram Qasemi said on Monday.

Headlines: EU opposed to U.S. resumption of sanctions on Iran: Moscovici
Description: The European Union is opposed to the United States' decision to reimpose oil and financial sanctions against Iran, European Economic Affairs Commissioner Pierre Moscovici said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. ratchets up pressure on Iran with resumption of sanctions
Description: The United States reimposes oil and financial sanctions against Iran on Monday, significantly turning up the pressure on Tehran in order to curb its missile and nuclear programs and counter its growing military and political influence in the Middle East.

Headlines: Softbank's Son says to carry out responsibility to Saudi people
Description: SoftBank Group Corp CEO Masayoshi Son condemned the killing of a journalist by Saudi security forces, but defended the firm's financial ties with Saudi Arabia, saying SoftBank will continue carrying out its responsibility to that country's citizens.

Headlines: Japan's Subaru recalls more cars, slashes guidance as cheating issue widens
Description: Japan's Subaru Corp said it would recall more vehicles sold in the domestic market on new cases of inspection cheating, and cautioned that rising recall costs would lop off about a quarter from its annual profit forecast.

Headlines: Forget gridlock, Republican win may be better for stocks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has warned that his favorite measure of success, the stock market, is imperiled if voters favor Democrats in next week's congressional elections.

Headlines: Turkey told it will receive waiver from U.S. sanctions on Iran: finance minister
Description: Turkey has been told it will receive a waiver from the U.S. sanctions on exports of Iranian oil, Finance Minister Berat Albayrak said on Monday, as Washington re-introduced the sanctions.

Headlines: Goldman downgrade overshadows Italian bank Intesa's strong stress test
Description: Italian banking shares fell on Monday, with a Goldman Sachs downgrade on Italy's top retail bank Intesa SanPaolo outweighing its strong performance in European regulatory tests.

Headlines: SWIFT says suspending some Iranian banks' access to messaging system
Description: The Belgium-based SWIFT financial messaging service said on Monday it is suspending some unspecified Iranian banks’ access to its messaging system in the interest of the stability and integrity of the global financial system.

Headlines: Citigroup appoints Philip Drury head of EMEA investment banking: memo
Description: Citigroup Inc named Philip Drury to run its London-based banking, capital markets and advisory business across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, according to a memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Stocks gain, dollar flat as U.S. elections prompt investor caution
Description: U.S. shares rose on Tuesday while the dollar held steady as Americans went to the polls in elections that could shift the balance of power in Congress.

Headlines: Wells Fargo says internal error caused more home foreclosures than expected
Description: Wells Fargo & Co said on Tuesday an internal underwriting error had caused it to reject home loan modifications, resulting in the bank foreclosing more homes than expected.

Headlines: Wendy's surprise same-restaurant sales drop burn shares
Description: Wendy's Co on Tuesday reported quarterly sales at established outlets in North America below analyst estimates and lowered its same-store sales forecast for the year, as the burger chain struggles to lure customers in a fiercely competitive U.S. fast-food industry.

Headlines: Hyundai raises Southeast Asia bet with second investment in Grab
Description: Hyundai Motor Co has raised its stakes in growing Southeast Asian markets with a $250 million investment in Singapore's Grab, its second in the ride-hailing firm, as it chases rivals in the race for new-age transportation.

Headlines: S&P 500 futures drop as U.S. election results trickle in
Description: S&P 500 e-mini futures fell 0.3 percent on Tuesday as U.S. election results began to trickle in, with Democrats picking up a House of Representatives seat in Virginia, according to projections from media outlets and data provider DDHQ.

Headlines: Cramer: Despite his criticisms, President Trump is good for The New York Times
Description: "This is one of those situations where all publicity is good publicity," says CNBC's Jim Cramer on President Trump's frequent criticisms of The New York Times.

Headlines: China says ready for U.S. talks, sees no winners in trade war
Description: China is ready to hold discussions and work with the United States to resolve trade disputes because the world's two largest economies stand to lose from confrontation, Vice President Wang Qishan said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chinese upstart Luckin Coffee seeks funds to double valuation to $2 billion - sources
Description: Luckin Coffee, an up-and-coming coffee chain with ambitions to challenge Starbucks Corp in China, is targeting a valuation of $1.5 billion to $2 billion as it launches a new round of funding, people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Germany says EU should revise, delay digital tax plan
Description: Germany's Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Tuesday the European Commission should revise its plan for a EU-wide tax on large digital companies and stressed the new levy should be applied only if there is no global deal by the summer of 2020.

Headlines: Two years in, Trump holds stock market bragging rights
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has taken credit for the stock market's gains during his nearly two years in the White House, and those claims are reasonable given the impact of tax cuts and pro-business policies on investor sentiment.

Headlines: Trulicity leads mixed third quarter for Lilly; shares sink
Description: Eli Lilly and Co's diabetes drug Trulicity helped power higher-than-expected third-quarter profit on Tuesday, while sales of some other newer treatments fell short of Wall Street estimates.

Headlines: Caution grips European stocks ahead of U.S. mid-term results
Description: European shares ended a choppy session in negative territory on Tuesday as investors punished companies like Zalando that missed expectations and remained cautious while waiting for the results of U.S. mid-term elections.

Headlines: Strong car sales lift spirits at Brazil auto show
Description: Automakers in Brazil last month notched their strongest sales in nearly four years, a leading trade group said on Wednesday, adding to optimism as the auto industry kicked off the biannual Sao Paulo International Motor Show.

Headlines: Cannabis shares light up as U.S. voter support for industry grows
Description: Shares of cannabis companies rose on Wednesday as results from the previous day's U.S. elections pointed to more favorable political conditions for the cannabis industry.

Headlines: Global stocks rise after U.S. vote splits power; dollar slips
Description: Most major stock markets rose on Wednesday, led by a strong rally on Wall Street, after the outcome of the U.S. midterm congressional elections drove expectations of political gridlock in Washington, boosting risk assets and weighing on the dollar.

Headlines: Google plans to expand office space in New York City: WSJ
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google is nearing a deal to buy or lease an office building in New York City that could add space for more than 12,000 new workers, The Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing sources.

Headlines: UBS expects to be sued by U.S. Justice Department over crisis-era mortgage securities
Description: UBS Group AG, Switzerland's largest bank, said it expects to be sued by the U.S. Department of Justice as early as Thursday on civil charges related to the sale of mortgage-backed securities in the run-up to the 2008 global financial crisis, according to a company statement.

Headlines: China's Sinopec signs purchase agreements worth $45.6 billion at Shanghai Expo
Description: China's state-owned Sinopec signed purchase agreements worth $45.6 billion on Thursday, covering supplies of crude oil, chemicals, coal and equipment.

Headlines: Starbucks partners with UberEats in Japan
Description: Starbucks Corp said on Wednesday it was partnering with UberEats to deliver coffee and food in Tokyo starting Friday, as the world's largest coffee chain looks to boost sales in Japan, one of its major Asia-Pacific markets.

Headlines: Michigan vote to legalize pot fires up investor momentum behind cannabis
Description: Michigan's vote Tuesday to become the 10th U.S. state where the recreational use of cannabis is legal is adding more momentum to a trend that some investors now say is inevitable: that marijuana will become legal nationwide within the next 5 years.

Headlines: Dish beats profit estimates, expects more subscriber losses
Description: Dish Network Corp beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Wednesday, as the U.S. satellite TV provider benefited from lower programming costs due to a blackout of Univision channels.

Headlines: Italy's antitrust opens probe into Ryanair's, Wizz Air's hand luggage policies
Description: Italy's antitrust said on Wednesday it was opening a probe against Ryanair and Wizz Air over their new hand luggage policies.

Headlines: Telecom network maker Nokia wins $2.3 billion frame deals in China
Description: Finnish mobile telecom network maker Nokia announced on Wednesday that it had signed frame deals with China Mobile, China Telecom and China Unicom worth more than 2 billion euros ($2.3 billion).

Headlines: Ahold Delhaize CEO says robots to speed up U.S. deliveries
Description: Ahold Delhaize's chief executive on Wednesday confirmed the Dutch retailer will partner with start-up Takeoff to build small, automated warehouses to speed order picking and cut delivery times from its U.S. stores.

Headlines: Firepower for U.S. stocks may lose spark as Democrats gain clout
Description: The U.S. stock market may be facing the remainder of Donald Trump's presidential term with the prospect of less juice to supercharge it.

Headlines: U.S. companies team up with hospitals to reduce employee maternity costs
Description: General Electric Co and other large companies are trying to chip away at rising childbirth costs for U.S. employees, working directly with hospitals to reduce cesarean sections and related complications.

Headlines: German prosecutors search BlackRock in sham trades inquiry
Description: German state prosecutors confirmed they searched the Munich offices of investor BlackRock as part of a probe into an illicit tax trading scheme but exonerated the company's local chairman, who is vying to succeed Chancellor Angela Merkel.

Headlines: No blockbuster from Fox results before Disney sale
Description: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc fell short of estimates for quarterly revenue on Wednesday, hit by the absence of a major movie hit at the end of the U.S. summer as it prepares to sell the bulk of its business to Walt Disney Co .

Headlines: Norwegian Air: all our 737 MAX 8 operate as normal after Boeing statement
Description: Norwegian Air said on Wednesday all fourteen of its 737 MAX 8 Boeing planes were operating as normal after receiving a safety bulletin from the U.S. plane manufacturer.

Headlines: EU's Vestager says probe into Google AdSense case nearing end
Description: EU regulators are close to wrapping up their third case against Alphabet unit Google involving its AdSense advertising service, Europe's antitrust chief said on Wednesday, suggesting the company may soon be hit with another hefty fine.

Headlines: Health stocks up on U.S. vote; insurers hit records
Description: Shares in drugmakers and U.S. health insurers rallied on Wednesday, after election results delivered a split Congress that is unlikely to significantly cut government healthcare programs or reduce drug prices in the world's biggest and most profitable market.

Headlines: China, Russia unveil life-size model of planned widebody jet at Zhuhai airshow
Description: China and Russia on Tuesday unveiled a life-size model of a proposed wide-body long-haul jet at the opening of China's largest airshow, giving public shape to their joint efforts to break into a market dominated by Boeing and Airbus .

Headlines: D.R. Horton forecasts weak home sales, shares fall 10 percent
Description: D.R. Horton shares fell more than 10 percent after the largest U.S. homebuilder forecast first-quarter home sales below analysts' estimates on Thursday, the latest sign that rising mortgage rates and higher home prices are weighing on the housing market.

Headlines: French prosecutors call for 3.7 billion euro fine against UBS
Description: French prosecutors argued in a Paris court on Thursday for Swiss bank UBS AG to be fined 3.7 billion euros for helping wealthy French people evade taxes.

Headlines: Traders keep bets on U.S. Fed's 2019 interest rate rises
Description: Traders of U.S. short-term interest-rate futures on Wednesday stuck with bets the Federal Reserve will raise rates once more this year and twice next year after the U.S. central bank ended a two-day meeting, as expected, with no change to interest rates.

Headlines: D.R. Horton forecasts first-quarter 2019 home deliveries below estimates
Description: Top U.S. homebuilder D.R. Horton forecast first-quarter deliveries below analysts' estimates on Thursday, as rising interest rates push buyers to delay purchases of expensive homes.

Headlines: Equities fall after Fed keeps rates on hold, dollar up
Description: World equity markets declined on Thursday, snapping a seven-session winning streak, with U.S. stocks on the defensive and the dollar strengthening after the Federal Reserve kept interest rates unchanged.

Headlines: Google hears protesters, changes sexual harassment policies
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Thursday it would change the way it handles sexual harassment claims, a week after 20,000 of its workers around the world walked off their jobs to protest its response to such issues.

Headlines: Wall Street falls after Fed statement, energy shares tumble
Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed slightly lower on Thursday after a Federal Reserve statement, and energy stocks were the biggest drag on the S&P as U.S. crude oil prices fell.

Headlines: Japanese firms see U.S. trade talks boosting exports despite Trump rhetoric
Description: Half of Japanese companies expect new trade talks with Washington to boost their U.S.-bound exports, a Reuters poll found, despite President Donald Trump's intensifying drive to cut the trade gap between the two major economies.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims fall slightly in latest week
Description: New applications for U.S. unemployment fell slightly last week and the number of Americans receiving benefits remained at a 45-year low as strong labor market conditions continued.
