Headlines: Huawei seeks clarification after New Zealand intelligence agency rejects 5G bid
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd said it was seeking clarification from New Zealand after the country's intelligence agency rejected the telecommunication industry's first request to use the Chinese firm's equipment in its planned 5G mobile network.

Headlines: Indonesia's Go-Jek starts trial launch in Singapore, challenges Grab
Description: Indonesian ride-hailing firm Go-Jek kicked off a trial launch in parts of Singapore on Thursday and plans to roll out an array of services through its app in early 2019, challenging dominant player Grab in the small city-state.

Headlines: Tokyo prosecutors plan to seek extension of Ghosn's detention: Kyodo
Description: Tokyo prosecutors plan to seek an extension of Carlos Ghosn's detention, after the ousted chairman of Nissan Motor Co was arrested last week for alleged financial misconduct, Kyodo News reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Cramer flags four stocks to buy if US-China trade talks go south
Description: Jim Cramer says the stocks of Dollar Tree, CVS, McDonald's and Constellation Brands are all buys if the United States and China can't agree on trade.

Headlines: Unilever CEO change not connected to HQ climbdown: chairman
Description: The replacement of Unilever's CEO Paul Polman was not connected to a shareholder row earlier this year over a proposed move of the headquarters of the Anglo-Dutch consumer goods company from Britain to the Netherlands, said the group's chairman.

Headlines: South Korea indicts group for leaking Samsung display tech to Chinese firm
Description: South Korean prosecutors on Thursday said they have indicted nine people on suspicion of leaking Samsung Electronics Co Ltd flexible display technology to a Chinese company.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to spend 5 billion euros in Italy to fill plants, keep jobs
Description: Fiat Chrysler plans to spend more than 5 billion euros ($5.7 billion) on new models and engines in Italy over the next three years to try to make better use of factories and boost jobs and margins.

Headlines: Trump studying new auto tariffs after GM restructuring
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that new auto tariffs were "being studied now," asserting they could prevent job cuts such as the U.S. layoffs and plant closures that General Motors Co announced this week.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank offices raided in money laundering probe
Description: Police raided six Deutsche Bank offices in and around Frankfurt on Thursday over money laundering allegations linked to the "Panama Papers", the public prosecutor's office in Germany's financial capital said.

Headlines: Amazon picks New York City, Washington D.C. area for new offices
Description: Amazon.com Inc picked America's financial and political capitals for massive new offices on Tuesday, branching out from its home base in Seattle with plans to create more than 25,000 jobs in both New York City and an area just outside Washington, D.C.

Headlines: Honeywell to shift global headquarters to Charlotte
Description: Honeywell International Inc said on Friday it is relocating its global corporate headquarters to Charlotte, North Carolina, which is closer to several of the U.S. industrial conglomerate's businesses in the Southeast of the United States.

Headlines: Does Google harm local search rivals? EU antitrust regulators ask
Description: EU antitrust regulators have asked Google's rivals if the internet search giant unfairly demotes local search competitors, according to a questionnaire seen by Reuters, a move which could lead to a fourth case against the Alphabet unit.

Headlines: Russian and Saudi energy ministers to meet at G20: RIA
Description: Russia's energy minister Alexander Novak will meet his Saudi counterpart at the G20 summit in Argentina and discuss an oil output reduction in 2019, RIA news agency cited Novak as saying on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Vodafone, Liberty Global deal faces full EU antitrust scrutiny - source
Description: Vodafone's $21.8 billion proposed acquisition of Liberty Global's assets in Germany and eastern Europe is likely to face a full EU antitrust investigation, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Eni in talks to grow presence in the Gulf: source
Description: Italian major Eni is in talks to grow its footprint in Oman and the United Arab Emirates as part of plans to build its asset base in the oil-rich Gulf and offset its reliance on Africa, a source close to the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. judge gives preliminary OK to $48 million Volkswagen investor settlement
Description: A U.S. judge in California has granted preliminary approval to a $48 million settlement for investors who said Volkswagen AG made false and misleading statements over its excess diesel emissions.

Headlines: Fed's grades slip in Wall Street's latest report card
Description: Wall Street last month gave the Federal Reserve its worst grade since Jerome Powell took the helm of the U.S. central bank earlier this year, docking points for a communications misstep early in October that sent U.S. stocks tumbling.

Headlines: U.S. to conduct additional Keystone XL pipeline review
Description: The U.S. State Department will conduct another environmental review of TransCanada Corp's long-pending Keystone XL oil pipeline, a U.S. official said on Friday, a move that could lead to additional delays of the project.

Headlines: Saudi Crown Prince sidelined in G20 family photo
Description: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman was sidelined during the official "family photo" of world leaders and other dignitaries at the Group of 20 summit in Buenos Aires on Friday, standing at the far edge of the group portrait and ignored.

Headlines: Buenos Aires locked down for G20 summit, protest tightly controlled
Description: Thousands of demonstrators marched in Buenos Aires on Friday to protest the G20's economic policies as the world's leading industrialized nations opened their annual summit in the Argentine capital.

Headlines: Microsoft's market value overtakes Apple's to close out week
Description: Microsoft Corp's stock market value closed above Apple Inc's for the first time in eight years on Friday as the Windows maker benefited from growth in cloud computing while Apple was hit by investor concern about iPhone demand.

Headlines: China hopes U.S. shows sincerity at G20 trade talks
Description: China hopes the United States can show sincerity and promote proposals both countries can accept when their two leaders meet at this week's G20 summit, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said on Friday ahead of the key trade talks.

Headlines: Tokyo authorities extend Ghosn's detention by 10 days - media
Description: Tokyo authorities on Friday extended for another 10 days the detention of ousted Nissan Motor Co chairman Carlos Ghosn, who is being held in Tokyo's main detention center after allegations against him of financial misconduct, Japanese media said.

Headlines: China says it hopes U.S. can show sincerity on trade
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Friday it hoped the United States could show sincerity and meet it halfway on trade, ahead of a meeting this weekend between the two countries' leaders that could be key to resolving their trade war.

Headlines: Toyota to buy out PSA stake in joint Czech factory
Description: Toyota has agreed to buy out PSA Group's stake in a jointly-managed Czech Republic factory specializing in the production of small cars, the companies said on Friday.

Headlines: Cramer's game plan: A week defined by trade talks and employment
Description: Jim Cramer flags key stocks and events in the week ahead, which will see the aftereffects of a critical meeting between the presidents of the United States and China.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: This company's earnings could signal a weakening economy
Description: Jim Cramer explains how Toll Brothers' earnings could highlight the slowing housing market and confirm that the U.S. economy is weakening.

Headlines: Tesco, Volkswagen to develop UK electric vehicle charging network
Description: Britain's biggest retailer Tesco and German car maker Volkswagen have teamed up to develop an electric vehicle charging network in the UK, they said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court upholds Sprint patent verdict against Time Warner Cable
Description: A U.S. appeals court on Friday upheld a roughly $140 million jury verdict in favor of Sprint Corp in its lawsuit accusing Time Warner Cable Inc, part of Charter Communications Inc, of using patented technology without authorization.

Headlines: Gucci to add sparkle with high-end jewels, Kering's Pinault says
Description: Gucci, the Italian fashion label driving revenue growth at French luxury group Kering , will branch into high end jewelry with a collection in June or July, Kering boss Francois-Henri Pinault said in a newspaper interview on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Boeing eyes Lion Air crash software upgrade in 6-8 weeks
Description: Boeing Co is weighing plans to launch a software upgrade for its 737 MAX in six to eight weeks that would help address a scenario faced by the Lion Air crew during last month's deadly crash in Indonesia, two people briefed on the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: SoftBank becomes first Japan firm to forgo IPO price range, keeps view at 1,500 yen
Description: SoftBank chalked up another first in Japan on Friday, setting a single indicative price of 1,500 yen for its telco IPO rather than a price range as usual, pegging the deal at 2.4 trillion yen ($21.16 billion) in the country's biggest-ever listing.

Headlines: New G20 chair Japan wants trade imbalances, aging population on 2019 agenda
Description: Japan will put issues ranging from global trade imbalances to the impact of aging populations on the agenda when it chairs next year's meetings of leaders from the Group of 20 major economies, government officials said.

Headlines: Saudi Crown Prince meets U.N. chief, other leaders, on G20 sidelines
Description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman has met United Nations Secretary General Antonio Guterres on the sidelines of the G20 summit in Argentina, Saudi state TV reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Trump-Xi trade armistice clears way for more market gains
Description: One of the darkest clouds hanging over Wall Street somewhat dissipated on the weekend when China and the United States agreed to shelve any new tariffs and reset discussions, at least temporarily halting an increase in their tensions over trade.

Headlines: China, U.S. declare 90-day halt to new tariffs: White House
Description: China and the United States agreed to halt additional tariffs in a deal that keeps their trade war from escalating as the two sides try again to bridge their differences with fresh talks aimed at reaching an agreement within 90 days.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nexstar clinches $4.1 billion deal to acquire Tribune Media - sources
Description: Nexstar Media Group Inc has reached an agreement to acquire Tribune Media Co for about $4.1 billion, a deal which would make it the largest local U.S. TV station operator, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: U.S. November car sales surprise on upside
Description: Holiday season deals propped up U.S. auto sales in November, limiting the scale of annual falls at some carmakers and putting overall figures on course to top analysts' expectations, numbers from several top producers showed on Monday.

Headlines: China vowed to move immediately on new trade commitments: U.S. official
Description: China vowed over the weekend to move immediately on new commitments it made to improve trade relations with the United States, a top White House official said on Monday.

Headlines: GSK slides after buying cancer firm Tesaro for hefty $5.1 billion
Description: GlaxoSmithKline has agreed to buy U.S. cancer specialist Tesaro for $5.1 billion, a costly investment to rebuild the pharmaceuticals business by new Chief Executive Emma Walmsley that unnerved investors.

Headlines: White House adviser expects China's tariffs on U.S. autos to fall to zero
Description: White House Economic Adviser Larry Kudlow on Monday said that China could immediately slash its vehicle tariffs, as the country enters a 90-day truce in the current trade war with the United States to negotiate a trade deal, as he reiterated China's pledge to begin lifting barriers immediately.

Headlines: U.S. construction spending slows, factory growth readings mixed
Description: U.S. construction spending fell for a third straight month, government data showed on Monday, while private-sector figures showed an uptick in manufacturing order growth but offered a mixed view on overall factory activity.

Headlines: Brazil antitrust body raises concerns over Disney-Fox deal
Description: Brazil's antitrust regulator Cade said on Monday that a deal by Walt Disney Co to buy Twenty-First Century Fox's entertainment assets raised concerns about undermining competition in the cable television market.

Headlines: Relief rally boosts Wall Street on U.S.-China trade truce
Description: Wall Street's major indexes rallied on Monday following a truce between the United States and China in their trade dispute, which has clouded the outlook for the stock market for much of the year.

Headlines: White House seeks to end subsidies for electric cars, renewables
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Monday the Trump administration wants to end subsidies for electric cars and other items, including renewable energy sources.

Headlines: Senators, union press GM CEO on plant closings, job cuts
Description: General Motors Chief Executive Mary Barra, facing growing criticism, will meet with Ohio's two U.S. senators on Wednesday about the Detroit automaker's plans to idle five North American plants and cut up to 15,000 jobs.

Headlines: Trump to notify Congress in 'near future' he will terminate NAFTA
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he will give formal notice to the U.S. Congress in the near future to terminate the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), giving six months for lawmakers to approve a new trade deal signed on Friday.

Headlines: Dealmaker Albert Frere, Belgium's richest man, dies aged 92
Description: Albert Frere, a veteran dealmaker whose impeccable business timing made him Belgium's richest man, died on Monday at the age of 92, the firm he built, Groupe Bruxelles Lambert (GBL), said.

Headlines: Macron to call on U.S. funds to build French start-ups, not steal them
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron will urge a visiting group of top Silicon Valley venture capitalists this week to invest in the nation's start-ups while calling on them not to "steal" the best creations, four sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Tencent Music presses play on $1.2 billion U.S. IPO
Description: Tencent Music Entertainment launched its hotly-anticipated U.S. initial public offering (IPO) of up to $1.2 billion on Monday after global stock markets were boosted by a truce brokered by U.S. and Chinese leaders in their trade conflict.

Headlines: Jet Airways to stop free meals for most domestic economy passengers
Description: Jet Airways Ltd , India's biggest full-service carrier, will stop providing free meals to most domestic economy class passengers from January, in the debt-laden airline's latest move to cut costs and boost revenues.

Headlines: Uber hires former U.S. safety official for self-driving effort
Description: Uber Technologies Inc on Monday confirmed it hired a senior U.S. auto safety official involved in the federal government's handling of self-driving cars for its autonomous vehicle efforts.

Headlines: Unilever swallows GSK's Indian Horlicks business for $3.8 billion
Description: Unilever is to buy GlaxoSmithKline's Horlicks nutrition business for $3.8 billion, boosting the Anglo-Dutch group's position in India by adding the popular malted drink.

Headlines: UAE says Qatar's decision to leave OPEC admission of decline of Doha's role
Description: The United Arab Emirates said on Monday Doha's decision to leave OPEC was a reflection of the decline of its influence.

Headlines: German government welcomes U.S.-China truce halting new tariffs for 90 days
Description: The German Economy Ministry on Monday welcomed a deal between the United States and China to halt additional tariffs and hold fresh talks to try to reach an agreement within 90 days.

Headlines: Verizon, Samsung to release 5G smartphones in U.S. in 2019
Description: Verizon Communications Inc and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd on Monday confirmed long-held industry expectations they would seek to steal a march on Apple Inc by launching U.S. 5G smartphones in the first half of 2019.

Headlines: BMW says faces currency, tariff and raw material headwinds in 2019
Description: BMW expects headwinds from rising currency and commodities prices to reach a mid to high triple-digit million euro amount in 2019, Chief Financial Officer Nicolas Peter said in a statement on Monday.

Headlines: Canada's construction steel buyers face tariff 'roulette'
Description: Canadian steel buyers are racing to get construction steel into the country to claim first-come, first-serve exemptions from tariffs that were meant to stabilize the country's market in the wake of U.S. President Donald Trump's metals tariffs.

Headlines: U.S. broadcaster Nexstar to buy Tribune Media for $4.1 billion
Description: Nexstar Media Group Inc said on Monday it had agreed to buy Chicago-based peer Tribune Media Company for about $4.1 billion in cash, a deal that would make it the largest regional U.S. TV station operator.

Headlines: Ireland still concerned about EU digital tax despite new proposal: minister
Description: Ireland's finance minister poured cold water Tuesday on a new Franco-German proposal for a European tax on companies' digital revenues, saying it failed to address his concerns.

Headlines: Global stocks dive on growth concerns, doubts over trade truce
Description: Global stocks tumbled on Tuesday as a flattening Treasury yield curve sparked recession warnings, while optimism sharply waned that the United States and China would quickly resolve their trade dispute.

Headlines: Instant View: Stocks slammed, yield curve flattens on trade doubts, growth worries
Description: U.S. stocks plunged on Tuesday and more points along the Treasury yield curve inverted as doubts arose over a speedy resolution to the U.S.-China trade dispute and over the health of the global economy.

Headlines: U.S. judge concerned over government nod for CVS-Aetna deal
Description: A federal judge who has been asked to sign off on the U.S. government's decision to approve CVS Health Corp's acquisition of insurer Aetna Inc said Tuesday he was "less convinced" than the government that the companies had struck a deal that ensured the merger was legal under antitrust law.

Headlines: If Iran can't export oil from Gulf, no other country can, Iran's president says
Description: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani made an apparent threat on Tuesday to disrupt other countries' oil shipments through the Gulf if Washington presses ahead with efforts to halt Iranian oil exports.

Headlines: Oil curbs gains amid trade, output cut uncertainty
Description: Oil prices pared gains in a volatile trade on Tuesday amid fears that demand would stall due to a trade war between the United States and China, and concerns that Russia remains a stumbling block to a deal to cut global crude supply.

Headlines: WTO warns of trade crisis as German car bosses face U.S. tariff talks
Description: The global system of international trade is in crisis, the World Trade Organization (WTO) warned on Tuesday, as German car bosses gathered in Washington hoping to stave off potential tariffs on U.S. imports of luxury cars.

Headlines: White House presses German automakers to expand U.S. investments
Description: President Donald Trump pressed senior executives of leading German automakers to expand their investments in the United States as the White House considers imposing new tariffs on European-made vehicles.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles, spooked by growth and trade worries
Description: Wall Street tumbled more than 3 percent on Tuesday, led lower by bank and industrial shares, as the U.S. bond market sent unsettling signs about economic growth and investors worried anew about global trade.

Headlines: SoftBank's Vision Fund to hire China team, set up mainland office: sources
Description: The SoftBank-led Vision Fund is hiring an investment team to be based in China as the $100 billion investment giant expands in one of the world's most vibrant tech markets, two people with direct knowledge of the move told Reuters.

Headlines: Volkswagen may use Ford's U.S. plants to build cars, deepening alliance
Description: Volkswagen AG's chief executive said on Tuesday after a meeting at the White House that the German automaker was building an alliance with Ford Motor Co and might use the U.S. automaker's plants to build cars.

Headlines: Two key Canada-to-U.S. oil pipelines hit by disruptions
Description: Two major pipelines carrying oil from Canada to the United States were hit by weather-related disruptions on Tuesday, the latest hit to Canada's oil industry just days after the Alberta government announced forced cuts in crude production.

Headlines: As markets turn, Fed says it is not fazed
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve officials convinced the massive U.S. bond market has fundamentally changed in the last decade are about to test their commitment to that idea against investors who have begun betting against the U.S. central bank's ability to continue raising interest rates.

Headlines: Thomson Reuters to cut 3,200 jobs in next two years
Description: Thomson Reuters Corp said on Tuesday that it will cut its workforce by 12 percent in the next two years, axing 3,200 jobs, as part of a plan to streamline the business and reduce costs.

Headlines: GM moves to challenge Ford in U.S. commercial fleet sales
Description: General Motors Co is intensifying its attack on rival Ford Motor Co's lead in sales to U.S. commercial fleets to prop up profit margins amid weakening consumer demand, according to executives at the No. 1 U.S. automaker.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lion Air ponders cancelling Boeing jets in row over crash - sources
Description: Indonesia's Lion Air is reviewing airplane purchases from Boeing Co and has not ruled out cancelling orders as relations worsen in a spat over responsibility for a 737 jetliner crash that killed 189 people in late October, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Sharp contractors axe 3,000 staff as iPhone sensor output shifts: union
Description: Nearly 3,000 foreign workers subcontracted to Sharp Corp have been laid off in central Japan, a labor union said, as the firm moves production of some sensors for Apple iPhones to a Chinese plant owned by its parent Foxconn.

Headlines: Money managers are realizing that Trump isn't 'dependable enough' for the market: Cramer
Description: Jim Cramer attributes part of Tuesday's marketwide collapse to political uncertainty brought about by the Trump administration.

Headlines: Nissan premium brand Infiniti's global sales rise 6 percent on firm China growth
Description: Global sales of Nissan Motor Co Ltd's Infiniti rose 6 percent in November from a year earlier, as the premium brand weathered a deepening market slowdown in China to post strong growth, showed an Infiniti statement seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Toll Brothers orders slump for first time in more than four years
Description: U.S. luxury home builder Toll Brothers Inc on Tuesday reported its first fall in quarterly orders in more than four years as rising mortgage rates and higher home prices hit demand, sending its shares down as much as 10 percent.

Headlines: New UPS navigation tool aims to save time and money with each turn
Description: United Parcel Service Inc on Tuesday said it is rolling out a new navigation tool designed to reduce costs for the company and headaches for its roughly 60,000 U.S. package delivery drivers.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce chief says timing of auto tariffs depends on talks
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Tuesday that possible tariffs on automakers are aimed at pushing companies to make more cars and other vehicles in the United States and the timing of any duties would depend on the success of ongoing negotiations.

Headlines: Mercedes Benz to hire 600 contractors in Brazil as economy recovers
Description: Mercedes Benz's Brazil operation will hire some 600 contractors in 2019 on year-long contracts to work on commercial vehicles, adding to a workforce of 10,000, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Daimler raises prospect of boosting stake in Chinese partner: Bloomberg
Description: Germany's Daimler AG has raised the prospect of increasing its stake in a joint venture with Chinese partner BAIC Motor Corp , Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: New Yorkers overwhelmingly support Amazon campus in Queens: poll
Description: New Yorkers by a wide margin approve of plans for Amazon.com Inc to build a massive new campus in the city, although they are divided over terms of a multibillion-dollar incentive package used to lure the largest U.S. online retailer, according to poll results released on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela's refinery woes send fuel imports soaring - internal documents
Description: Venezuela this month plans to import over 300,000 barrels per day (bpd) of refined products to ease domestic fuel shortages caused by hobbled refineries and need to prioritize exports, according to internal documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Sanofi plans 670 job cuts in France by end 2020
Description: French drugmaker Sanofi told unions on Wednesday it was planning to cut 670 jobs in France, a union representative told Reuters.

Headlines: Ahead of OPEC meeting, Trump urges producers to keep oil flowing
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday called on the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies not to cut oil production next year, saying it would trigger higher oil prices worldwide.

Headlines: Petrobras unveils plan to boost asset sales, deepwater investment
Description: Brazilian state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA plans to raise some $26.9 billion via asset sales and partnerships by 2023 while boosting investments on the front edge of an anticipated production boom in Brazil.

Headlines: Exclusive: Blackstone plans IPO of U.S. benefits manager Alight - sources
Description: Private equity firm Blackstone Group LP is readying an initial public offering (IPO) of Alight Solutions LLC, a U.S. provider of healthcare and retirement benefits services that could be valued at more than $7 billion, including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Nissan finds more improper testing, considers recall: Nikkei
Description: Nissan Motor Co has found more cases of improper testing of vehicles in Japan and is considering recalling affected cars, the Nikkei reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Tariff effects broaden across U.S., wage growth higher: Fed
Description: Tariff-driven price increases have spread more broadly through the U.S. economy, though on balance inflation has risen at a modest pace in most parts of the country, the Federal Reserve said on Wednesday in its latest report on the economy.

Headlines: Barclays to keep Swiss private banking growth momentum in 2019
Description: Britain's Barclays expects to have grown its Swiss private banking business by more than 10 percent this year and is looking to expand further in Switzerland in 2019.

Headlines: Takeda clears key hurdle as investors back $59 billion Shire deal
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical has won shareholder approval for its $59 billion takeover of London-listed Shire , creating a global powerhouse that has a stronger drugs pipeline but is also saddled with massive debt.

Headlines: Unilever's Polman calls for trust in farewell message
Description: Unilever boss Paul Polman, quitting months after shareholders scuppered his plan to base company headquarters in the Netherlands, signed off with a typical mixture of advice and philosophy in his last message to investors.

Headlines: China's Didi announces reorganization plan to address safety
Description: Chinese ride-hailing firm Didi Chuxing on Wednesday announced a reorganization plan aimed at improving safety on its platform, as it works to address public and government concerns raised after the murders of two of its users.

Headlines: Iran won't discuss its OPEC quota while under sanctions: agency
Description: Iran will not discuss its OPEC quota as long as it is under sanctions, Iranian Oil Minister Bijan Zanganeh was quoted by the state news agency IRNA as saying on Wednesday.

Headlines: German auto bosses did not discuss trade issues with Trump: VDA
Description: Talks between German auto bosses and U.S. President Donald Trump in Washington focused on the companies' plans for the United States and were not about trade issues, German car association VDA said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Berlin: German automakers' meeting with Trump separate to U.S.-EU trade talks
Description: Discussions between German car executives and President Donald Trump in Washington on Tuesday should be seen as separate from the trade talks between the European Union and the United States, a German government spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Lower drug sales potential at Bayer underscores need for deals
Description: Germany's Bayer , which acquired seed company Monsanto this year, reduced its combined sales estimate for its most promising experimental drugs, acknowledging it needs to do more to replenish the development pipeline.

Headlines: Thomas Cook shares climb 45 percent but bonds hit record low
Description: Thomas Cook's shares climbed 45 percent on hopes that it would not need to issue new equity, although its bond prices extended their losses to record lows on Wednesday, amid deepening worries about the UK travel group's debt.

Headlines: China's BAIC stock sinks on report Daimler may raise joint venture stake
Description: BAIC Motor Corp Ltd's shares slumped as much as 13.5 percent on Wednesday following a media report saying Germany's Daimler AG was considering increasing its stake in its joint venture with the Chinese automaker.

Headlines: BT to strip China's Huawei from core networks, limit 5G access
Description: Britain's BT Group said on Wednesday it was removing Huawei Technologies' equipment from the core of its existing 3G and 4G mobile operations and would not use the Chinese company in central parts of the next network.

Headlines: Danske investors bank on Maersk clan to chart course through crisis
Description: Danske Bank's top investors are looking to Denmark's Maersk family to steer the country's largest lender through the turmoil of a 200 billion euro ($227 billion) money laundering scandal.

Headlines: U.S. third-quarter unit labor costs revised lower
Description: U.S. unit labor costs rebounded less than initially thought in the third quarter and the decline in the prior period was sharper than previously estimated, suggesting moderate growth in wage inflation.

Headlines: Auto supplier Bosch sees car market stagnating in 2019
Description: German auto supplier Bosch expects global car production in 2019 to languish at this year's level, the head of its core auto parts unit said on Thursday, citing a cool-down in China and lower demand for diesel cars in Europe.

Headlines: France will tax digital giants from 2019 even if no EU-wide agreement: FinMin
Description: Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire on Thursday said France will tax digital giants at a national level from 2019 if European Union states cannot reach an agreement on a tax on digital revenues for the bloc.

Headlines: Kroger quarterly same-store sales fall short of estimates
Description: U.S. supermarket chain Kroger Co reported quarterly same-store sales that fell just short of analysts' estimates on Thursday, hit by disruptions caused by the company revamping stores to give more shelf space to its best-selling products.

Headlines: SoftBank mobile services disrupted ahead of bumper IPO, shares drop
Description: SoftBank Group Corp's mobile phone services were disrupted in some parts of Japan on Thursday, ahead of an initial public offering (IPO) of its domestic telecoms unit later this month that will potentially raise $21 billion.

Headlines: Exclusive: Albemarle pushes Chile to reverse lithium quota decision - filings
Description: Albemarle Corp has launched an aggressive lobbying campaign after Chilean regulators denied its request to boost lithium output, stressing the company's importance to Chile's economy and workers, according to records reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: East European energy firms charge into EV market
Description: For trips near their village in western Poland, Jacek Balcer and his wife zip around in their electric cars. But when they want to travel further afield they know it's time to bring out their diesel van or risk being stranded.

Headlines: OPEC, Russia move closer to cutting oil output
Description: OPEC and Russia moved closer on Wednesday to agreeing cuts in oil production from next year despite pressure from U.S. President Donald Trump to reduce the price of crude.

Headlines: France fines washing machine makers $214 million for price rigging
Description: France's competition authority on Thursday fined six home appliance makers a total of 189 million euros ($214 million) for price-rigging in 2006 and 2009, the largest penalty it has handed out so far this year.

Headlines: Lion Air CEO says possible will cancel Boeing 737 MAX orders
Description: Indonesia's Lion Air is considering cancelling orders for Boeing Co 737 MAX jets following a crash that killed 189 people in October but has not yet made a decision, the airline's CEO Edward Sirait said on Thursday.

Headlines: Embraer-Boeing aviation deal blocked by Brazilian court
Description: A Brazilian federal court on Thursday granted an injunction blocking the proposed tie-up between U.S. planemaker Boeing Co and Embraer SA , a deal the Brazilian company says is crucial to its survival.

Headlines: J&J unit to pay $360 million to U.S. to resolve charity kickback probe
Description: A Johnson & Johnson unit will pay the U.S. government $360 million to resolve an investigation into its financial support of a charity that helped Medicare patients cover out-of-pocket drug costs, the Justice Department said on Thursday.

Headlines: Chevron sets first capital spending budget increase in 4 years
Description: Chevron Corp plans to spend $20 billion next year on oil and natural gas projects, the second-largest U.S. oil producer said on Thursday in a statement, its first increase in four years.

Headlines: Carlos Ghosn, Nissan Motor to be indicted Monday: Nikkei
Description: Tokyo prosecutors plan to indict former Nissan Motor Co Ltd Chairman Carlos Ghosn on Monday for financial misconduct, the Nikkei business daily reported, ratcheting up their case against the auto tycoon.

Headlines: US Concrete CEO sees path to infrastructure bill 'in the next two years'
Description: Jim Cramer and U.S. Concrete chief Bill Sandbrook break down the concrete producer's outlook on U.S. infrastructure and address the recent weakness in its stock.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit hits 10-year high; job growth slowing
Description: The U.S. trade deficit jumped to a 10-year high in October as soybean exports dropped further and imports of consumer goods rose to a record high, suggesting the Trump administration's tariff-related measures to shrink the trade gap likely have been ineffective.

Headlines: Sears Chairman Lampert makes $4.6 billion bid for bankrupt retailer
Description: Sears Holdings Corp Chairman Eddie Lampert's ESL Investments Inc has made an offer valued at $4.6 billion to buy the bankrupt U.S. retailer, one of the only options that would prevent the department store chain from shutting its doors for good.

Headlines: Top Huawei executive arrested on U.S. request, clouding China trade truce
Description: The daughter of Huawei's founder, a top executive at the Chinese technology giant, was arrested in Canada and faces extradition to the United States, stirring up fears it could reignite a Sino-U.S. trade row and roiling global stock markets.

Headlines: Canada PM says government played no role in Huawei executive's arrest
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Thursday said his government had no involvement in the arrest of a top executive from Chinese technology giant Huawei, who was detained at Vancouver airport.

Headlines: Former Tesco directors cleared of fraud over 2014 accounting scandal
Description: Two former directors of Tesco have been acquitted of fraud and false accounting at Britain's biggest retailer after a 2014 scandal, dealing a major blow to the UK Serious Fraud Office.

Headlines: U.S. securities regulator should demand more voting disclosure from fund managers: official
Description: The U.S. securities regulator should consider imposing stricter disclosure requirements on institutional fund managers relating to how they vote in corporate elections, a Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) official said on Thursday.

Headlines: In major shift, U.S. now exports more oil than it ships in
Description: The United States last week exported more crude oil and fuel than it imported for the first time on record, according to data released on Thursday, the same day OPEC ended a meeting without a decision to curb global output to balance out the historic surge in U.S. supply.

Headlines: U.S. crude oil exports surge to record 3.2 million bpd last week: EIA
Description: U.S. crude oil exports surged to 3.2 million barrels per day (bpd) last week, the highest on record, based on data going back to 1991, U.S. Energy Information Administration data showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Madison Square Garden CEO to settle U.S. securities charges
Description: The chief executive of the Madison Square Garden Co , owner of the New York Knicks and New York Rangers sports teams, has agreed to pay nearly $610,000 to resolve U.S. securities violations that he said stemmed from a law firm error.

Headlines: Oil's sharp price drop fuels questions for stock market
Description: U.S. stock investors are wary that a 30 percent slump in oil prices will pressure corporate profits while also presenting a sign of weakness in global growth at a time they are already weighing when the long economic expansion will end.

Headlines: Trump aide Bolton says he knew in advance about Huawei arrest: NPR reporter
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's national security adviser, John Bolton, said in an interview with National Public Radio that he knew in advance about the arrest of a top executive of the Chinese technology giant Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], according to an NPR reporter on Thursday.

Headlines: Fed policymakers signal turning point on U.S. rate-hike path
Description: The U.S. central bank is flagging a turning point in monetary policy, as a Federal Reserve policymaker on Friday backed interest rate hikes in the "near term" but nodded to increasingly less certainty ahead.

Headlines: Bullard: U.S. monetary policy at a 'crossroads,' rates appropriate
Description: U.S. monetary policy is at a "turning point," St. Louis Federal Reserve bank president James Bullard said on Friday, as the Fed balances the behavior of inflation, the economy, and the rate hikes it has approved so far.

Headlines: Exclusive: Activist investor Elliott has stake in Germany's Bayer - sources
Description: Activist investor Elliott has taken a position in Germany's Bayer , adding to the slew of investments the fund has made in German companies, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: White House adviser: U.S.-China trade talks, Huawei arrest are separate
Description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro on Friday said that the U.S. -China trade truce and the recent arrest of a top Huawei Technologies Co Ltd executive "are two separate events," calling the timing of events a coincidence.

Headlines: Oil prices climb on OPEC-led cuts, but off session highs
Description: Oil prices jumped more than 2 percent on Friday as Saudi Arabia and other producers in OPEC, as well as allies like Russia, agreed to reduce output to drain global fuel inventories and support the market.

Headlines: Canadian court bail hearing for Huawei CFO adjourned until Monday
Description: A bail hearing for the chief financial officer of China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd was adjourned until Monday, after

Headlines: Explainer: How does extradition to the U.S. work?
Description: The arrest in Canada of a top Chinese technology executive for possible extradition to the United States has roiled markets and cast doubt on a recent U.S.-China trade truce.

Headlines: OPEC, Russia agree to slash oil output despite Trump pressure
Description: OPEC and its Russia-led allies agreed on Friday to slash oil production by more than the market had expected despite pressure from U.S. President Donald Trump to reduce the price of crude.

Headlines: U.S. job growth slows in November, monthly wage gains modest
Description: U.S. job growth slowed in November and monthly wages increased less than forecast, suggesting some moderation in economic activity that could support expectations of fewer interest rate increases from the Federal Reserve in 2019.

Headlines: Analyst View: OPEC, allied exporters to cut crude output by 1.2 million bpd
Description: OPEC and its Russia-led allies moved closer on Friday to clinching a deal that would cut oil production by more than the market had expected despite pressure from U.S. President Donald Trump to reduce the price of crude.

Headlines: Tesla hires Washington trial lawyer as new general counsel
Description: Tesla Inc has hired Dane Butswinkas, a Washington, D.C. trial lawyer, as its general counsel, the electric car manufacturer said late on Thursday.

Headlines: White House huddles with tech executives on future of jobs
Description: The Trump administration, which has had strained relations with technology companies, met on Thursday with top tech executives to discuss ways to "ensure American dominance" of innovation and the future of high tech jobs.

Headlines: Nissan to recall 150,000 more vehicles in Japan after improper inspections
Description: Nissan Motor Co said on Friday it will recall 150,000 more vehicles in Japan due to improper final inspections before they were shipped from two Japanese manufacturing plants.

Headlines: Brazil's government joins Embraer in challenging injunction of tie-up with Boeing
Description: Brazil's government said on Friday that it would appeal an injunction issued Thursday blocking a proposed tie-up between planemakers Embraer and Boeing , joining Embraer, which has also said it will challenge the decision.

Headlines: Kudlow says does not see Huawei issue spilling into trade talks with China: CNBC
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow told CNBC on Friday that he does not see the recent controversy surrounding China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd spilling into the trade talks between the United States and China.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. November payrolls lower than expected
Description: U.S. job growth slowed in November and monthly wages increased less than expected, suggesting some moderation in economic activity that could support expectations of fewer interest rate increases from the Federal Reserve in 2019.

Headlines: OPEC gets Iran green light to cut oil output by 0.8 million barrels per day: source
Description: Iran gave OPEC the green light on Friday to cut oil output by around 0.8 million barrels per day from 2019, an OPEC source said.

Headlines: Once mighty Noble Group faces insolvency protection after re-listing ban
Description: Noble Group said on Friday it will seek changes to its original debt restructuring plan, with the spotlight now moving toward what the once mighty commodity merchant has called the alternative: insolvency protection.

Headlines: Huawei welcome in France, sensitive investments can be blocked: French minister
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Friday Chinese tech giant Huawei [HWT.UL] was welcome in France, though the government could block certain investments.

Headlines: BMW names Vukotich as new head of autonomous driving development
Description: Germany luxury carmaker BMW said on Saturday Alejandro Vukotich will be the new head of its driver assistance and autonomous driving development department from January 2019.

Headlines: China's November export, import growth shrinks, showing weak demand
Description: China reported far weaker than expected November exports and imports, showing slower global and domestic demand and raising the possibility authorities will take more measures to keep the country's growth rate from slipping too much.

Headlines: Julius Baer in talks with Santander over Venezuela business: sources
Description: Swiss private bank Julius Baer is in talks about transferring its Venezuelan book of business to Spain's Banco Santander as Baer reorganizes operations in Latin America, sources close to the situation have told Reuters.

Headlines: Volkswagen denies allegations chairman knew early about emissions cheating: report
Description: Volkswagen has denied allegations that Chairman Hans Dieter Poetsch knew about the carmaker's emissions test cheating almost three months before U.S. authorities made it public in September 2015.

Headlines: Alibaba takes control of film group in $160 million share purchase
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd said on Monday it will increase its stake in Hong Kong-listed Alibaba Pictures to 51 percent, taking control of the film unit's board.

Headlines: Hong Kong on track for global IPO crown but many new listings sag
Description: Hong Kong is on course to take the global IPO crown this year for the most money raised in stock market flotations, narrowly ahead of arch-rival New York, but its new listings have posted the worst performance among leading bourses, data show.

Headlines: Volkswagen denies allegations chairman knew early about emissions cheating: report
Description: Volkswagen has denied allegations that Chairman Hans Dieter Poetsch knew about the carmaker's emissions test cheating almost three months before U.S. authorities made it public in September 2015.

Headlines: U.S. says March 1 'hard deadline' for trade deal with China
Description: Unless U.S.-China trade talks wrap up successfully by March 1, new tariffs will be imposed, U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said on Sunday, clarifying there is a "hard deadline" after a week of seeming confusion among President Donald Trump and his advisers.

Headlines: Global stock decline on growth, Brexit worries; Wall St. gains
Description: A gauge of global equities stumbled on Monday, as losses in Europe and Asia extended to Wall Street on new signs world economic growth was being curbed by the U.S.-China trade spat, but was off early lows as U.S. stocks turned positive.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin names Kenneth Possenriede chief financial officer
Description: U.S. defense contractor Lockheed Martin Corp on Monday named Kenneth Possenriede chief financial officer, replacing Bruce Tanner.

Headlines: Wall St. ends choppy day higher; tech helps, Brexit weighs
Description: Wall Street ended Monday's volatile session slightly higher with help from technology stocks although bank stocks tumbled and uncertainty over Britain's exit from the European Union kept investors on edge about global growth.

Headlines: Chinese province pledges billions to drive tech, innovation
Description: China's coastal province of Zhejiang, home to e-commerce giant Alibaba , has pledged more than $17 billion to drive the tech industry and innovation in the coming five years, the state news agency Xinhua reported.

Headlines: GoPro to move U.S.-bound camera production out of China
Description: GoPro Inc on Monday took the first steps to move most of its U.S.-bound camera production out of China by the summer of 2019 to counter the potential impact from any new tariffs.

Headlines: Google+ shutdown speeds up, new privacy bug affected 52.5 million users
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Monday it would shut down its Google+ social media service in April, four months ahead of schedule, after finding a software flaw for the second time this year that allowed partner apps to access its users' private data.

Headlines: SoftBank's record IPO reaches $23.5 billion after extra share sale
Description: SoftBank Group Corp is set to raise 2.65 trillion yen ($23.5 billion) in Japan's biggest-ever IPO - a share sale widely regarded as finalizing the group's transition from domestic telco to a monolithic global tech investor.

Headlines: Ghosn, Nissan formally charged in financial misconduct scandal
Description: Tokyo prosecutors indicted Carlos Ghosn, the ousted chairman of Nissan , for under-reporting his income, and officially charged the automaker for its role in the financial misconduct scandal that has shocked the industry.

Headlines: Hitachi shares rise after report it is considering scrapping Britain nuclear project
Description: Hitachi Ltd shares rose as much as 2.9 percent on Monday after Japan's TV Asahi reported the firm is considering scrapping its 3 trillion yen ($26.61 billion) nuclear project in Britain due to projections of further increases in construction costs.

Headlines: Onset of recession may take longer than expected after yield curve inverts
Description: The onset of a U.S. recession could take longer than usually thought after key points of the Treasury yield curve invert, as a surge in U.S. short-dated debt issuance has altered the dynamics of the Treasury market and other indicators show an economic downturn is farther off.

Headlines: Verizon says to shed 10,400 jobs by mid next year
Description: Verizon Communications Inc said on Monday that about 10,400 employees will be leaving the U.S. wireless carrier by mid next year as part of the company's voluntary separation program.

Headlines: NJ Transit to decide on Bombardier order worth up to $3.6 billion
Description: New Jersey Transit's board will decide on Wednesday whether to award the first part of an order for up to 999 cars worth as much as $3.6 billion to Canada-based Bombardier Inc , a copy of the agency's Dec. 12 agenda shows.

Headlines: SoftBank plans Nvidia stake sale soon, could make about $3 billion: Bloomberg
Description: SoftBank Group Corp is planning to sell its stake in Nvidia Corp early next year as the U.S. chipmaker's shares slide, Bloomberg reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Avianca Brasil files for bankruptcy, citing jet repossession threat
Description: Brazil's fourth-largest airline, Avianca Brasil, filed for bankruptcy protection on Monday, saying its operations had been threatened by potential repossession of aircraft, which could prevent the carrier from continuing to operate.

Headlines: Colombia's Grupo Aval says will cooperate with U.S. investigation
Description: Grupo Aval , Colombia's largest financial conglomerate, said on Tuesday it had received an inquiry from the United States Justice Department related to an investigation into a highway project where one of its subsidiaries partnered with Brazilian construction firm Odebrecht.

Headlines: Cramer: Pick individual stocks with long-term growth stories in this 'treacherous' market
Description: Jim Cramer recommends steering clear of stocks and exchange-traded funds with China exposure as the stock market endures drastic swings.

Headlines: U.S. fund Castlelake to buy planes from AirAsia in $800 million deal: sources
Description: U.S. private investment firm Castlelake LP has struck a deal to buy a portfolio of about 30 narrowbody planes from AirAsia Group Bhd for a total price of roughly $800 million, people familiar with the transaction said.

Headlines: Court rejects Nissan ex-chairman Ghosn's appeal to end detention
Description: A Tokyo court on Tuesday rejected ousted Nissan Motor chairman Carlos Ghosn's appeal to end his detention following his arrest last month on allegations of financial misconduct.

Headlines: China court bans sales of older iPhone models in Apple-Qualcomm global battle
Description: A Chinese court has ordered a sales ban of some older Apple Inc iPhone models in China for violating two patents of chipmaker Qualcomm Inc, though intellectual property lawyers said enforcement of the ban was likely still a distant threat.

Headlines: Three broker-dealers settle SEC charges over incomplete data
Description: Broker-dealers Citadel Securities, Natixis Securities Americas LLC and MUFG Securities Americas Inc agreed to pay total penalties of more than $6 million to settle charges of providing incomplete trading data, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said on Monday.

Headlines: Two lawmakers want GM to commit to producing all U.S. EVs domestically
Description: Two U.S. senators from Ohio on Tuesday asked General Motors chief executive Mary Barra to commit to building all future electric vehicles for U.S. buyers at home and to provide more details of plans to cut back on car production in North America.

Headlines: Venezuela's deals to shield Citgo from creditors now in doubt
Description: Venezuela is facing the possible unraveling of a pair of billion-dollar settlements aimed at protecting the cash-strapped country's U.S.-based Citgo Petroleum Corp from seizure by creditors.

Headlines: EU opens $22 billion Vodafone, Liberty Global deal inquiry
Description: Vodafone's purchase of Liberty Global's assets in Germany and east Europe may damage competition in Germany and the Czech Republic, EU antitrust regulators said on Tuesday, as they opened a full-scale probe into the $21.8 billion deal.

Headlines: Global stocks choppy on political sparring, oil climbs
Description: A gauge of global stock markets edged higher in volatile trade on Tuesday as investors waded through a chunk of geopolitical headlines, including threats by U.S. President Donald Trump to shut down the government over a funding fight and signs of a thaw in the U.S.-China trade battle.

Headlines: After Trump comment on Huawei, official says Justice Dept. sticks to law enforcement
Description: A top U.S. Justice Department official pushed back on Wednesday against President Donald Trump's comment that he might intervene in a legal case involving an executive from the Chinese telecommunications firm Huawei Technologies Co [HWT.UL] if it would help secure a trade deal.

Headlines: Trading Trump: Wall Street stresses over White House comments
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co's trading desk was not buying what U.S. President Donald Trump was selling this week.

Headlines: Japan rules out asking private firms to avoid telecoms gear that could be malicious
Description: Japan's government has no plan to ask private companies to avoid buying telecommunications equipment that could have malicious functions, such as information leakage, its top spokesman, Yoshihide Suga, said on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street closes up, investors optimistic on China trade
Description: U.S. stocks closed up on Wednesday afternoon, though well below their session highs as investors pulled back in the last few minutes of trading despite optimism about U.S.-China trade relations and some reassuring signs in British politics.

Headlines: Canada frees CFO of China's Huawei on bail; Trump might intervene
Description: A top executive of Chinese telecoms giant Huawei Technologies Co Ltd was granted bail by a Canadian court on Tuesday, 10 days after her arrest in Vancouver at the request of U.S. authorities sparked a diplomatic dispute.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump says Fed shouldn't hike rates, but calls Powell 'a good man'
Description: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday it would be a mistake if the Federal Reserve raises interest rates when it meets next week, as it is expected to do, continuing his criticism of the U.S. central bank.

Headlines: Samsung to shut mobile phone plant in China's Tianjin
Description: Samsung Electronics will cease operations at one of its mobile phone manufacturing plants in China, the company said, as its sales in the world's biggest smartphone market slumps amid rising competition from lower-cost local rivals.

Headlines: Washington takes center stage in bank branch battles
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co has made a splash this year in Washington, D.C. opening branches for the first time in the nation's capital.

Headlines: Highlights: Key quotes from the Reuters interview with Trump
Description: Here are highlights from the Reuters interview with U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday.

Headlines: Germany seeks to assist potential bank merger: Bloomberg
Description: Germany is holding high-level talks to facilitate a possible merger of the nation's two largest private banks - Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank - Bloomberg reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: FCC considers ending merger ban among broadcast networks
Description: The Federal Communications Commission on Wednesday voted to open a new review of U.S. media ownership rules and seek comments on whether the government should end a prohibition on mergers among the four largest broadcast networks.

Headlines: Intel plans 'stacked' circuits in bid to regain its chipmaking lead
Description: Intel Corp said on Wednesday that it has developed a way to stack its computing circuits on top of one another in a bid to regain the lead in chip manufacturing technology that it has lost to rivals like Taiwan Semiconductor Co Ltd in recent years.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbus staff error led to fatal Mali copter crash - German official
Description: The fatal crash of a German armed forces helicopter in Mali last year was caused by the failure of mechanics from manufacturer Airbus to correctly set the aircraft's rotor controls after repairs, a defense official told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices flat; underlying inflation firm
Description: U.S. consumer prices were unchanged in November, held back by a sharp decline in the price of gasoline, but underlying inflation pressures remained firm amid rising rents and healthcare costs.

Headlines: U.S. not swayed by WTO reform proposals
Description: Proposals for reforming the World Trade Organization fail to deal with problems raised by the United States, the U.S. envoy to the WTO told its General Council on Wednesday.

Headlines: China preparing plan to increase access for foreign companies: WSJ
Description: China is planning to replace an industrial policy with a new program that promises greater access for foreign companies, the Wall Street Journal reported https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-is-preparing-to-increase-access-for-foreign-companies-11544622331?mod=breakingnews on Wednesday, in a move to resolve trade tensions with the United States.

Headlines: Japan Post to invest $2.6 billion in U.S. insurer Aflac: source
Description: Japan Post Holdings Co is planning to invest about $2.6 billion in Aflac Inc , aiming to become the largest shareholder in the U.S. insurer, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Renault finds no irregularities in Ghosn pay audit
Description: Renault said on Thursday an audit launched in the wake of Chairman and CEO Carlos Ghosn's arrest in Japan had so far found no irregularities with his pay at the French carmaker.

Headlines: Trump says GM shift to electric vehicles is 'not going to work'
Description: President Donald Trump on Thursday said General Motors Co's decision to shift much of its focus to electric vehicles will not succeed, and he asserted a new trade deal will make it harder for the company to move work to other countries.

Headlines: Apple plans new $1 billion campus for Austin, Texas
Description: Apple Inc said on Thursday it would spend $1 billion to build a second campus in Austin, Texas, that will house up to 15,000 workers as part of a broader push by U.S. companies to create more domestic jobs.

Headlines: UK's Nissan Brexit letter still too confidential to release two years on: FOI
Description: A British government letter to Nissan two years ago offering reassurances about Brexit, which helped secure a major investment from the Japanese carmaker, is still considered too sensitive to release, a Reuters freedom of information request revealed.

Headlines: China's auto sales in 2019 to roughly match 2018: industry association
Description: China, the world's biggest car market, expects to sell 28 million vehicles in 2019, roughly level with 2018, its Association of Automobile Manufacturers said on Thursday.

Headlines: IEA sees global oil supply tightening more quickly in 2019
Description: The global oil market could move into deficit sooner than expected thanks to OPEC's output agreement with Russia and to Canada's decision to cut supply, the International Energy Agency said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. solar takes hit from Trump tariffs but is cheaper than ever: report
Description: U.S. solar installations fell 15 percent in the third quarter as the Trump administration's tariffs on overseas-made panels forced developers to put off large projects, according to a report commissioned by the industry's primary trade group.

Headlines: OPEC exit frees Qatar from U.S. legal concerns
Description: Even before taking over Qatar's energy policy in a government reshuffle last month, Qatar Petroleum (QP) CEO Saad al-Kaabi had long wanted the Gulf state to leave OPEC.

Headlines: Japan's SoftBank to shun Huawei in favor of Ericsson, Nokia equipment: Nikkei
Description: SoftBank Group Corp plans to replace 4G network equipment from China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd with hardware from Nokia and Ericsson, Nikkei reported on Thursday, without citing sources.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler may review $5.7 billion plan if Italy taxes diesel, petrol cars
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) could review its 5 billion euro ($5.7 billion) Italian investment plan, which includes a shift to cleaner engines, if Rome raises taxes on petrol and diesel cars.

Headlines: Bombardier's venture in China gets $453 million state rail contract
Description: Canadian manufacturer Bombardier Inc's Chinese joint venture said on Thursday it had won a $453 million contract to supply 168 high-speed train cars to state-owned China Railway Corp (CRC), making it the second order win this year for China's growing high-speed network.

Headlines: Enel-BYD say Chile electric bus roll-out heralds more for region
Description: Europe's biggest utility Enel and Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD on Thursday marked the arrival of 100 electric buses in Chile and said they would work together on similar plans for three other Latin American nations.

Headlines: YouTube, under pressure for problem content, takes down 58 million videos in quarter
Description: YouTube took down more than 58 million videos and 224 million comments during the third quarter based on violations of its policies, the unit of Alphabet Inc's Google said on Thursday in an effort to demonstrate progress in suppressing problem content.

Headlines: Qualcomm to file suits in Chinese courts to ban iPhone XS, XR sales
Description: Chipmaker Qualcomm Inc is asking courts in China to ban sales of Apple Inc's latest iPhone models XS and XR after winning a preliminary injunction against older models, the company confirmed on Thursday.

Headlines: Standard Chartered axes over 200 jobs in India: source
Description: Standard Chartered Plc has laid off over 200 employees in India in its retail banking division, as more customers move to digital services, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: The trading firms under investigation in Brazil graft probe
Description: Last week, Brazilian investigators accused four of the world's largest oil-trading firms of participating in a corruption scheme focused on Brazil's state-controlled oil company Petrobras.

Headlines: Delta Air Lines shares drop on weak revenue outlook
Description: Shares in U.S. carrier Delta Air Lines Inc dropped 4 percent in Thursday morning trading on concerns that slowing global economies would limit the No. 2 U.S. airline's revenue growth in 2019 despite strong travel demand.

Headlines: Ford set to end production at Blanquefort in France, jobs at risk
Description: Ford will end production at its Blanquefort plant in France by late August next year after rejecting a rescue deal for the factory, in a move which drew the ire of France's finance minister due to the risk of large-scale job losses.

Headlines: Vitol, rival oil traders in spotlight of Brazil bribery probe
Description: Brazil's epic "Car Wash" corruption investigation has taken down presidents and elite businessmen, and led to the largest corporate leniency deal ever signed.

Headlines: Tesla cuts China prices after tariff drop on U.S.-made cars
Description: Tesla Inc has cut prices on its Model S and Model X vehicles in China after Beijing suspended additional tariffs on U.S.-made cars.

Headlines: Anti-harassment groups share $20 million CBS handout after Moonves exit
Description: CBS Corp on Friday named the Time's Up anti-sexual harassment group and 17 other organizations that will share a $20 million donation stemming from the exit of its chief executive Les Moonves following allegations of sexual misconduct.

Headlines: U.S. sets new March 2 date for China tariff increases amid talks
Description: The U.S. Trade Representative's office on Friday officially changed the scheduled date of a tariff rate increase on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods to 12:01 a.m. EST (0501 GMT) on March 2, 2019 as the United States and China pursue talks on trade and intellectual property.

Headlines: Global growth worry hits stocks, but U.S. data lifts dollar
Description: A gauge of global stocks tumbled on Friday after weak economic data from China and Europe intensified global growth worries as investors weighed the broader impact of the trade dispute between the United States and China.

Headlines: China to halt added tariffs on U.S.-made cars in easing of trade tensions
Description: China will temporarily suspend additional 25 percent tariffs on U.S.-made vehicles and auto parts starting Jan. 1, 2019, the finance ministry said on Friday, following a truce in a trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Wall St. tumbles on global growth worries, J&J decline
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes tumbled on Friday and the Dow confirmed a correction as weak data from China and Europe stoked fears of a global economic slowdown, while Johnson & Johnson shares were the biggest drag after Reuters reported the company knew for decades that its Baby Powder contained asbestos.

Headlines: N.Y. Fed's U.S. fourth-quarter GDP growth holds near 2.4 percent
Description: The U.S. economy is growing at a 2.42 percent pace in the fourth quarter as stronger-than-expected November data on industrial output offset the steepest drop in import prices in over three years last month, the New York Federal Reserve's Nowcast model showed on Friday.

Headlines: Atlanta Fed raises U.S. fourth-quarter GDP growth view to 3 percent
Description: The U.S. economy is expanding at a 3.0 percent annualized rate in the fourth quarter based on steady retail sales growth and stronger-than-forecast industrial output in November, the Atlanta Federal Reserve's GDPNow forecast model showed on Friday.

Headlines: Macron calls Ford's decision over Bordeaux plant 'hostile'
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday that Ford's decision to end production at its plant in Blanquefort, southern France next year was "hostile" and said his government was actively seeking a buyer for the site.

Headlines: Scale of theft at Shell's Singapore refinery much greater, court documents show
Description: Around $150 millions' worth of oil was stolen from Shell's biggest global refinery over several years, Singapore court documents reviewed by Reuters show, far more than reported when police first revealed the heist earlier this year.

Headlines: GM to begin U.S. layoff notices as it offers job transfers
Description: General Motors Co on Friday said it is beginning to send formal notices to U.S. government agencies of its plan to end production at auto plants and cut thousands of jobs as it shrinks passenger car production in North America.

Headlines: U.S. industrial output up 0.6 percent in November, manufacturing flat
Description: U.S. industrial output rose in November as a jump in mining and utilities production was offset by drops in other sectors including business equipment and construction.

Headlines: Apple to push software update in China as Qualcomm case threatens sales ban
Description: Apple Inc, facing a court ban in China on some of its iPhone models over alleged infringement of Qualcomm Inc patents, said on Friday it will push software updates to users in a bid to resolve potential issues.

Headlines: Exclusive: France plans Renault CEO hunt as board frays over Ghosn - sources
Description: The French government is seeking candidates to replace Renault's embattled boss Carlos Ghosn, as some board members began to voice doubts about keeping him in office after his indictment in Japan for suspected misconduct, several sources told Reuters.

Headlines: SoftBank telco IPO sees strong demand despite Huawei, network disruption
Description: Domestic investors have sought nearly double the number of shares offered by SoftBank Group Corp's soon-to-list wireless unit, two sources from a lead IPO underwriter said, underscoring strong demand for Japan's third-largest telco.

Headlines: Jet Airways' survival may rest on founder Goyal leaving the cockpit
Description: Jet Airways Ltd's 69-year-old founder Naresh Goyal, who started out as an assistant in a travel agency, wove together charm, persistence and consummate dealmaking to build India's biggest full-service carrier.

Headlines: U.S. recession risks jump, Fed rate hike expectations slump - Reuters poll
Description: The risk of a U.S. recession in the next two years has risen to 40 percent, according to a Reuters poll of economists who also found a significant shift in expectations toward fewer Federal Reserve interest rate rises next year.

Headlines: Ahead of China anniversary, trade war fans calls for faster market reforms
Description: China's trade war with the United States is spurring some Chinese entrepreneurs, government advisers and think-tanks to call for faster reforms in the world's second-largest economy and the freeing of a private sector stifled by state controls.

Headlines: Small-cap S&P 600 index confirms bear market
Description: As U.S. stocks have been rocked by trade tensions and monetary policy worries, shares of small-cap companies, by one measure, have now confirmed that they are in their first bear market in three years.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories increase strongly in October
Description: - U.S. business inventories rose solidly in October as stocks at retailers increased by the most in more than a year, suggesting inventory investment could contribute to economic growth in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: Air Berlin's administrator sues Etihad for up to 2 billion euros
Description: German airline Air Berlin's insolvency administrator is suing Abu Dhabi's Etihad, its former owner, for damages of up 2 billion euros ($2.26 billion), a Berlin court said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending strengthening in boost to economy
Description: U.S. consumer spending gathered momentum in November as households bought furniture, electronics and a range of other goods, which could further allay fears of a significant slowdown in the American economy even as the outlook overseas continued to darken.

Headlines: Motiva preliminarily picked to run Curacao refinery: report
Description: Motiva Enterprises has preliminarily been chosen by the government of Curacao to operate the 335,000-barrel-per-day Isla refinery, replacing Venezuela's state-run PDVSA, local media said on Saturday.

Headlines: Pemex aims for splash in shallow waters, retreats from the deeps
Description: Mexican state-run oil giant Petroleos Mexicanos will focus on existing shallow water assets and refining next year at the expense of riskier, deepwater projects under a new government that has vowed to turn around the ailing company.

Headlines: Germany plans to lower threshold for probes of foreign takeovers: Handelsblatt
Description: Berlin plans to cut to 10 percent the threshold at which it can launch national security probes of stake purchases by non-European companies in German firms, business newspaper Handelsblatt reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Qatar considering increasing its stake in Deutsche Bank: Handelsblatt
Description: Qatar is considering increasing its stake in Deutsche Bank , newspaper Handelsblatt reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Qatar Petroleum to invest $20 billion in U.S. in major expansion
Description: Qatar Petroleum (QP) is looking to invest at least $20 billion in the United States over the coming few years, its chief executive told Reuters, after the Gulf Arab state unexpectedly quit OPEC this month.

Headlines: Indonesia, EFTA sign long delayed free trade deal
Description: Indonesia on Sunday signed an economic agreement with the European Free Trade Association (EFTA) aimed at increasing trade and investment, concluding almost eight years of negotiations.

Headlines: 2018: The year volatility came home to roost
Description: U.S. stocks are down only slightly for 2018, but that masks a volatile year for investors.

Headlines: South Korea to provide $3 billion in financial support for troubled auto suppliers
Description: South Korea unveiled a policy package to support its embattled car parts makers industry that includes providing financial support worth over 3.5 trillion won ($3.10 billion) and encouraging the use of electric cars.

Headlines: S&P 500 hits 14-month low on economic jitters ahead of Fed meeting
Description: Wall Street's major indexes all slid more than 2 percent on Monday, with the benchmark S&P 500 closing at its lowest in 14 months, on concerns about slowing economic growth ahead of a highly anticipated decision from the Federal Reserve this week on the course of U.S. interest-rate hikes.

Headlines: U.S. healthcare stocks drop after judge rules Obamacare unconstitutional
Description: Shares of U.S. health insurers, hospitals and healthcare companies fell on Monday in the aftermath of a ruling by a federal judge in Texas that the Affordable Care Act (ACA), commonly called Obamacare, was unconstitutional.

Headlines: U.S. ethanol producers seek pricing reform as markets plunge, ADM sells
Description: U.S. ethanol producers stung by collapsing prices are seeking changes to the way benchmark values for the biofuel are established, arguing the current system used by exchanges is vulnerable to manipulation, according to sources.

Headlines: BNY Mellon to pay more than $54 million for improper handling of ADRs: SEC
Description: The top U.S. securities regulator on Monday said that Bank of New York Mellon will pay more than $54 million to settle charges of improper handling of "pre-released" American Depositary Receipts, U.S. securities representing foreign shares of a foreign company.

Headlines: China, EU lambast United States for miring WTO in crisis
Description: The United States came under fire from China and the European Union on Monday, accused by both major trading partners of taking protectionist measures and bringing the World Trade Organization (WTO) to its knees.

Headlines: ABB to sell Power Grids to Hitachi, revamp business structure
Description: ABB reached a deal with Japan's Hitachi to sell its Power Grids division, with the Swiss engineering group adding it plans to return net cash proceeds of $7.6-7.8 billion from selling the 80.1 percent stake in the unit to shareholders.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz cuts China prices after tariff on U.S.-made cars suspended
Description: German luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz on Monday said it would offer discounts on cars imported into China from the United States until March 31 after Beijing suspended additional tariffs on U.S.-made cars.

Headlines: Nestle to cut about 380 jobs at four locations in Germany
Description: Swiss food giant Nestle is cutting around 380 jobs in Germany by closing two locations and reducing the workforce at two others as it reacts to lower demand and shifts some production elsewhere, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: ABB relents to activist shareholder and unloads Power Grids unit
Description: ABB will sell a majority stake in its Power Grids division to Japan's Hitachi and return the proceeds to shareholders, bowing to pressure from an activist investor to sell the business that makes transformers and converters.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs fires back after Malaysia charges bank in 1MDB probe
Description: Malaysia on Monday filed criminal charges against Goldman Sachs Group Inc related to its dealings with the sovereign wealth fund 1MDB, and Goldman Sachs fired back that the previous Malaysian government had lied to the investment bank.

Headlines: Google to spend $1 billion on new campus in New York
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google is investing more than $1 billion on a new campus in New York, becoming the second major technology company after Amazon to pick America's financial capital to expand and create thousands of jobs.

Headlines: Oil falls, U.S. crude dips below $50 on oversupply fears
Description: Oil prices fell more than 2 percent on Monday, with U.S. crude tumbling below $50 a barrel, on signs of oversupply in the United States and as investor concern over global economic growth and fuel demand grows.

Headlines: DoubleLine's Gundlach says U.S. equities are in long-term bear market
Description: Jeffrey Gundlach, chief executive of DoubleLine Capital, on Monday said the S&P 500 stock index is headed to new lows and that U.S. equities are in a long-term bear market.

Headlines: Cash-strapped South African Airways expands Emirates code sharing
Description: South African Airways (SAA) said on Tuesday that it had signed a deal with Emirates [EMIRA.UL] to expand an existing codeshare agreement, in a rare bright spot for the cash-strapped airline.

Headlines: Malaysia says Goldman Sachs failed to disclose key facts in 1MDB bond sales
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc made untrue statements and omitted key facts in offering circulars for the bonds it sold for Malaysian state fund 1MDB, the Malaysian government said in criminal charges against the U.S. bank.

Headlines: Indian regulator says Reuters report on J&J baby powder 'under consideration'
Description: India's federal drug regulator said on Tuesday a Reuters report that Johnson & Johnson knew for decades that cancer-causing asbestos lurked in its baby powder was "under consideration".

Headlines: Kroger starts use of unmanned vehicles for delivery in Arizona
