Description: U.S. supermarket chain Kroger Co said on Tuesday it has started using unmanned autonomous vehicles to deliver groceries Scottsdale, Arizona in partnership with Silicon Valley startup Nuro.

Headlines: Italy's UniCredit settles dispute with Caius
Description: British hedge fund Caius has made a payment to UniCredit to settle a dispute over complex financial instruments which Italy's biggest bank counts toward its core capital, the two companies said.

Headlines: GM cutting 50 jobs at U.S. battery plant tied to Chevy Volt
Description: General Motors Co said on Tuesday it plans to cut 50 jobs at a suburban Detroit lithium-ion battery assembly plant after the largest U.S. automaker announced last month it will end production of its plug-in hybrid Chevrolet Volt in 2019.

Headlines: U.S. agency to speed reviews of automaker self-driving petitions
Description: The U.S. auto safety regulator said on Tuesday it is speeding up the process for reviewing whether automakers can deploy self-driving vehicles without devices such as brakes and steering wheels.

Headlines: Treasury's Mnuchin says expects January trade talks with China: Bloomberg
Description: The United States and China are planning to hold meetings in January to "document an agreement" on trade, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told Bloomberg in an interview on Tuesday.

Headlines: Kinder Morgan faces proposed class action lawsuit on pipeline
Description: Kinder Morgan is facing a proposed class action lawsuit, claiming that a division of the pipeline operator has emitted chemicals and toxic gas that caused damage to property and killed animals.

Headlines: China embarks on second round of soy buying post Trump-Xi truce
Description: Chinese importers returned to the U.S. soy market on Tuesday for their second round of purchases since the two countries agreed to a truce in their trade war, four traders with knowledge of the deals and the U.S. Soybean Export Council said.

Headlines: Trump pressures Fed before meeting, warns against 'another mistake'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday further sought to pressure the Federal Reserve as the central bank prepared to start its two-day policy meeting, warning the Fed's board not to "make yet another mistake" ahead of an expected interest rate hike.

Headlines: S&P flat as government shutdown threat, Fed decision loom
Description: The benchmark S&P 500 stock index ended little changed in a choppy trading session on Tuesday as the possibility of a partial U.S. government shutdown raised investor jitters ahead of a highly anticipated meeting of the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Micron sales, profit miss estimates as chip glut hurts prices
Description: U.S. chipmaker Micron Technology Inc gave on Tuesday quarterly sales and profit forecasts well below Wall Street estimates, citing a market glut of memory chips as consumer and business demand for phones and computers is weakening.

Headlines: Sears to take $443 million in charges arising from store closures
Description: Bankrupt U.S. retailer Sears Holdings Corp will take a charge of about $443 million arising from store closures, a regulatory filing showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: High taxes could hasten bank moves from Britain after Brexit
Description: Britain risks driving banks overseas if current high levels of taxation on the industry are maintained after Brexit, a bank lobby group said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Investors revolt against executive pay plans at tarnished Australian banks
Description: Shareholders voted against the executive remuneration plans of two of Australia's biggest banks on Wednesday following misconduct revelations that have swept through the country's financial sector.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin wins $585 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp has been awarded a $585 million U.S. defense contract for a Homeland Defense Radar in Hawaii, the Pentagon said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall St. tumbles as investors fret over Fed policy update
Description: U.S. stocks declined sharply on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve's forecast of fewer interest-rate increases in 2019 fell short of investors' hopes of a more dovish monetary policy.

Headlines: After Fed selloff, is a U.S. bear market next?
Description: U.S. stocks took another body blow on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates again and the central bank chairman did not soften his tone about the outlook for further financial tightening to the degree investors had hoped.

Headlines: U.S. imposes fresh Russia sanctions for election meddling
Description: The United States imposed fresh Russia-related sanctions on Wednesday, expanding a blacklist of individuals allegedly involved in a Kremlin-backed campaign to meddle with the 2016 U.S. presidential election, among other misdeeds.

Headlines: U.S. Congress will not pass self-driving car bill in 2018: senators
Description: The U.S. Congress will not vote on a bill to speed the introduction of self-driving cars before it adjourns for the year, a blow to companies like General Motors Co and Alphabet Inc's Waymo unit, key senators said on Wednesday.

Headlines: LME to remove suspension on Rusal metal if sanctions lifted
Description: The London Metal Exchange (LME) said on Wednesday it proposed to lift its suspension on aluminum produced by Russia's Rusal if U.S. sanctions are lifted.

Headlines: China's Sinograin confirms U.S. soybean purchases
Description: China's Sinograin said it had recently bought a few batches of soybeans from the United States, amid a truce in a trade war between the two nations.

Headlines: Japan's Nidec to expand electric-car motor production outside China: Nikkei
Description: Nidec Corp will add locations outside China to build motors for electric vehicles as the Japanese motor maker rethinks its supply strategy, the Nikkei business daily reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil rebounds from rout on signs of strong product demand
Description: Oil prices rose on Wednesday, recovering somewhat from a sharp selloff during the previous session, after U.S. data showed strong demand for refined products.

Headlines: Fed raises interest rates, signals more hikes ahead
Description: After weeks of market volatility and calls by President Donald Trump for the Federal Reserve to stop raising interest rates, the U.S. central bank instead did it again, and stuck by a plan to keep withdrawing support from an economy it views as strong.

Headlines: Nissan, Renault bosses met one-on-one in Amsterdam, Nissan says
Description: Nissan Motor Co CEO Hiroto Saikawa held a one-on-one meeting with the acting boss of automaker partner Renault in Amsterdam this week that led to "positive" and "productive" talks, the Japanese automaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Noble Group completes $3.5 billion restructuring to emerge as smaller, unlisted firm
Description: Noble Group , the once mighty commodity trader, on Thursday completed its drawn out $3.5 billion debt restructuring to emerge as a smaller, unlisted Asia-focused coal-trading business.

Headlines: Nissan says CEO had one-on-one meeting with Renault's acting boss
Description: Nissan Motor Co on Thursday said CEO Hiroto Saikawa had held a one-on-one meeting with the acting boss of its automaking partner Renault SA during talks between the alliance in Amsterdam this week.

Headlines: El Sharara oilfield to reopen, Libyan government says
Description: Libya's biggest oilfield, El Sharara, will reopen, the country's internationally recognized government said on Wednesday after Prime Minister Fayez al-Sarraj flew there to persuade protesters to end a blockage.

Headlines: Estonia arrests ten in Danske Bank money laundering inquiry
Description: Estonia has arrested 10 former employees of the local branch of Danske Bank as part of an international investigation into alleged money laundering.

Headlines: Instant View: Stocks sink after Fed raises rates, Powell comments on balance sheet
Description: U.S. stock markets tumbled on Wednesday, reversing a morning rally after the U.S. Federal Reserve delivered an expected interest rate hike but signaled its tightening cycle is nearing an end in the face of financial market volatility and slowing global growth.

Headlines: BP launches $3 billion sale of U.S. onshore assets to fund BHP deal: sources
Description: Britain's BP has launched the sale of U.S. oil and gas onshore assets that could raise more than $3 billion to help pay for other fields in the United States it bought in October from BHP , industry and banking sources said.

Headlines: Asian business confidence wallows near three-year low on trade worries: Thomson Reuters/INSEAD
Description: A very cautious optimism remains among Asian companies in the fourth quarter as they wait to see whether there will be any breakthrough in a trade dispute between the United States and China, a Thomson Reuters/INSEAD survey showed.

Headlines: Italy's transport minister says he would like to revoke Autostrade concession
Description: Italy's Transport Minister Danilo Toninelli said on Wednesday that he would like to revoke motorway concessions held by Autostrade per l'Italia after the collapse of a bridge in Genoa last August.

Headlines: Indian regulator to test samples of Johnson & Johnson baby powder: media
Description: India's federal drug regulator will on Wednesday seize samples of Johnson & Johnson's baby powder for testing, local media said, following a Reuters report that the company knew for decades that cancer-causing asbestos lurked in the product.

Headlines: German auto supplier to plead guilty, pay $35 million fine in VW emissions case
Description: German auto supplier IAV Gmbh has agreed to plead guilty and pay a $35 million fine for conspiring to assist Volkswagen AG in its effort to evade U.S. diesel emissions standards, the U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Exxon Mobil secured U.S. hardship waiver from biofuels laws - sources
Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency granted oil major Exxon Mobil Corp a financial hardship waiver this year temporarily freeing its Montana refinery from U.S. biofuel laws, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Payments company Square to re-apply for a bank license
Description: Square Inc , the payments company led by Twitter Inc chief executive Jack Dorsey, is refiling its application with U.S. state and federal regulators for a bank license, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Uber loses latest UK legal bid to block worker rights for drivers
Description: Uber has lost its latest court bid to stop its British drivers being classified as workers, entitling them to rights such as the minimum wage, in a decision which jeopardizes the taxi app's business model.

Headlines: U.S. existing home sales rise, trend weak
Description: U.S. home sales unexpectedly rose in November, but recorded their biggest annual decline in 7-1/2 years as the housing market remained mired in weakness amid higher mortgage rates which have made home purchases more expensive.

Headlines: Malaysia charges another ex-Goldman Sachs banker over 1MDB
Description: Malaysia on Wednesday charged a second former banker at Goldman Sachs Group Inc in connection with a suspected money-laundering scheme at state fund 1MDB and said it had issued a summons to the bank.

Headlines: Data problems complicate U.S. regulator's watch over ratings firms
Description: A decade since the global financial crisis, the U.S. securities regulator is still struggling to get a grip on the country's rating agencies because it lacks the tools and expertise needed to crunch growing reams of ratings data, people familiar with the effort say.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin wins $997 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp has been awarded a $997 million U.S. defense contract for the upgrade of 84 F-16 aircraft to the V-configuration, the Pentagon said on Thursday.

Headlines: Boeing, Sikorsky wins $1.1 billion U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Boeing Co and Sikorsky Aircraft, a unit of Lockheed Martin Corp , have been awarded a $1.1 billion U.S. defense contract for contractor support for MH-6, MH-47, and MH-60 aircraft, the Pentagon said on Thursday.

Headlines: Campbell Soup names industry veteran Mark Clouse as new CEO
Description: Campbell Soup Co named Mark Clouse, the former CEO of Pinnacle Foods, as its new chief executive on Thursday, a key step in the U.S. company's efforts to regain market share and boost profits.

Headlines: Asia M&A clocks second best on record, strength to persist despite trade troubles
Description: Asia Pacific M&A volumes clocked their second-highest level on record this year and dealmakers are optimistic the momentum will persist into 2019, with inbound deals into China emerging as a strong theme amid political and macroeconomic headwinds.

Headlines: Exclusive: China hacked HPE, IBM and then attacked clients - sources
Description: Hackers working on behalf of China's Ministry of State Security breached the networks of Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co and IBM, then used the access to hack into their clients' computers, according to five sources familiar with the attacks.

Headlines: Hyundai to open car plant in Indonesia, to build EVs: minister
Description: Hyundai Motor Co plans to start producing electric vehicles (EVs) in Indonesia as part of an around $880 million auto investment in the country, the deputy minister for industry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Mitsubishi seeks dismissal of Bombardier trade secrets case
Description: A trade secrets lawsuit brought by Canada's Bombardier Inc against the aircraft unit of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd should be dismissed because the allegations are baseless and designed to "disrupt development" of a rival jet, a spokesman for the Japanese company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Hong Kong takes global IPO crown, looks to a quieter 2019
Description: A flurry of initial public offerings (IPOs) in Hong Kong propelled the financial center to first place for IPO volumes globally, but next year is unlikely to see as many big-ticket listings.

Headlines: China says more trade talks with U.S. planned for January
Description: China and the United States will hold more talks on trade in January, China said on Thursday, following detailed discussions about the issues to be tacked in the negotiations.

Headlines: U.S. bank regulators sign off on 'living wills' for foreign banks
Description: U.S. banking regulators announced on Thursday they had signed off on "living wills" for four foreign banks - Barclays , Credit Suisse , Deutsche Bank and UBS - detailing how they could safely be dissolved in a crisis.

Headlines: Tokyo court rejects prosecutors' appeal against decision not to extend Ghosn's detention: media
Description: A Tokyo court upheld a decision not to extend the detention of former Nissan Motor Chairman Carlos Ghosn and former Representative Director Greg Kelly, public broadcaster NHK said on Thursday, a move that brings them closer to a release on bail.

Headlines: Investors association asks for tender offer in Boeing-Embraer deal
Description: Brazilian investors' association Abradin has filed a motion with a São Paulo court questioning the legality of a tie-up between U.S. planemaker Boeing Co and Embraer SA .

Headlines: GM to respond by January 7 to Canada union efforts to save plant
Description: General Motors Co will respond by Jan. 7 to a Canadian union's proposals for keeping an Ontario auto assembly plant open, the head of Canada's largest private sector union said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. aims to present figures on impact of tariffs in mid-January: report
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department plans to present new calculations on the impact that tariffs on foreign cars would have on the U.S. market in four weeks' time, a German magazine reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Big Pharma returning to U.S. price hikes in January after pause
Description: Novartis AG and Bayer AG are among nearly 30 drugmakers that have taken steps to raise the U.S. prices of their medicines in January, ending a self-declared halt to increases made by a pharma industry under pressure from the Trump administration, according to documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Asia's central banks have almost no reasons to hike rates in 2019
Description: Weaker economic growth and tepid price pressures in Asia will leave central banks in the region with few reasons to tighten policy next year -- especially as U.S. rate hikes slow -- unless a new bout of currency weakness forces them to do so.

Headlines: Aluminum plunges, Rusal shares soar as U.S. to lift sanctions
Description: The U.S. Treasury said it will lift sanctions on the core empire of Russian businessman Oleg Deripaska, including aluminum giant Rusal and its parent En+, watering down the toughest penalties imposed since Moscow's 2014 annexation of Crimea.

Headlines: Amazon error allowed Alexa user to eavesdrop on another home
Description: A user of Amazon's Alexa voice assistant in Germany got access to more than a thousand recordings from another user because of "a human error" by the company.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims rise less than expected
Description: WASHINGTON (Reuters - The number of Americans filing applications for jobless benefits rose marginally from near a 49-year low last week, suggesting underlying strength in the labor market and broader economy.

Headlines: Russian tycoon in GAZ sanctions talks; investors get more time
Description: Oleg Deripaska's team, which secured the lifting of U.S. sanctions on the Russian tycoon's aluminum and energy businesses, is also working to get them removed from his automaker GAZ , five sources close to the talks said.

Headlines: U.S. senators write to regulators on Robinhood's botched checking plans
Description: A bipartisan group of U.S. senators sent a letter to regulators on Thursday expressing concern that financial technology startup Robinhood may not be offering full transparency to its customers over the botched launch of its new cash management service.

Headlines: Oil prices tumble to lowest in more than a year as equities sell off
Description: Oil prices fell about 5 percent on Thursday, hitting their lowest level in more than a year on worries about oversupply and the outlook for energy demand as a U.S. interest rate rise knocked stock markets.

Headlines: Tokyo court's ruling clears way for possible release of ex-Nissan boss Ghosn
Description: A Tokyo court unexpectedly ruled not to extend the detention of Nissan's ex-chairman Carlos Ghosn on Thursday, meaning he may soon be released from jail where he has been since last month facing allegations of financial misconduct.

Headlines: Signs of trouble so far just noise to a Fed that sees growth continuing
Description: Late fall brought a dust cloud of bad news for the U.S. economy, with shippers like Fedex cutting their global outlook for next year, chipmaker Micron Technology missing its revenue target as demand slides worldwide, and GM trimming 14,000 jobs as sales slow, not to mention a stock market limping into year end.

Headlines: Airbus shares fall after report of U.S. joining corruption probe
Description: Shares in Europe's Airbus fell sharply on Thursday after Le Monde newspaper reported the United States had opened an investigation into allegations of corruption, raising the stakes of probes already under way in Britain and France.

Headlines: Dollar rallies from post-Fed losses as U.S. shutdown likely
Description: The dollar gained on Friday as investors sought the currency's safety amid persistent equity market volatility and a possible U.S. government shutdown.

Headlines: Boeing heads for expected 2018 plane order victory over Airbus
Description: Boeing Co looked poised to beat European arch-rival Airbus for aircraft orders in 2018 by a wide margin after clinching billions of dollars in new business from Nigeria's Green Africa Airways and Saudi Arabia's flyadeal.

Headlines: Nasdaq in bear market, first of the three major U.S. indexes
Description: The Nasdaq Composite Index confirmed on Friday it is in a bear market for the first time since 2008, underscoring fears that the longest bull run in history for U.S. stocks could soon be over.

Headlines: CEO of Boehner-backed cannabis company sees bill paving way for legalization being passed in 2019
Description: Jim Cramer discusses the prospect of U.S. marijuana legalization with Acreage Holdings founder and CEO Kevin Murphy.

Headlines: Futures extend slide on growth fears, government shutdown threat
Description: S&P 500 e-minis logged their biggest losing streak in seven years on Friday, dropping about 0.6 percent on growing worries of slowing global growth and the threat of a U.S. government shutdown.

Headlines: Foxconn to build $9 billion chip plant in China with local govt: Nikkei
Description: Taiwan's Foxconn , Apple Inc's iPhone assembler, is in the final stages of talks with the local government of the Chinese city of Zhuhai to build a chip plant there with a total investment of about $9 billion, the Nikkei business daily reported on Friday.

Headlines: Crude refusal: China shuns U.S. oil despite trade war truce
Description: China, the world's top oil importer, is set to start 2019 buying little or no crude from the United States despite a three-month truce in a trade scrap between the two nations, with relatively high freight costs and political uncertainty choking demand.

Headlines: Exclusive: Bangladesh says to collect, test samples of Johnson & Johnson Baby Powder
Description: Bangladesh will collect and test samples of Johnson & Johnson's Baby Powder for asbestos in a couple of days, its main testing authority said on Friday, after a Reuters report last Friday that the firm knew for decades that cancer-causing asbestos could be found in the product.

Headlines: Indian regulator orders J&J to stop using raw material to make Baby Powder in India
Description: India's drugs regulator has ordered Johnson & Johnson to stop manufacturing its Baby Powder using raw materials in two of its Indian factories until test results prove they are free of asbestos, a senior official said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. third-quarter growth trimmed; business spending slowing
Description: The U.S. economy slowed slightly more than previously estimated in the third quarter and momentum appears to have moderated further in the fourth quarter, with new orders and shipments of manufactured capital goods falling in November.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mitsui, Saudi Aramco, Russia's RDIF in talks to buy Arctic LNG 2 stakes - sources
Description: Japan's Mitsui & Co Ltd , Russian sovereign wealth fund RDIF and Saudi Aramco are in talks to buy stakes in Novatek's Arctic LNG 2 project, with the size of the investments still to be decided, sources familiar with the talks told Reuters.

Headlines: French court fines oil group Total in Iran bribery case
Description: A Paris court fined French oil and gas group Total 500,000 euros ($570,000) on Friday for bribing foreign public officials in a case related to Iranian contracts in 1997.

Headlines: U.S. auto sales seen falling 1 percent in Dec - J.D. Power, LMC
Description: The pace of U.S. vehicle sales is set to slow for the sixth straight month in December despite aggressive discounts from manufacturers, according to industry consultants J.D. Power and LMC Automotive.

Headlines: U.S. third-quarter economic growth revised down to 3.4 percent
Description: The U.S. economy slowed in the third quarter a bit more than previously estimated, but the pace was likely strong enough to keep growth on track to hit the Trump administration's 3 percent target this year, even as momentum appears to have moderated further early in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: Political stumbles, savvy activists knock Canada's oil sector to its knees
Description: A decade ago, Canada's oil sector was growing so fast it was predicted to become a global energy superpower, but a series of political missteps and formidable environmental activism has created a dysfunctional system requiring OPEC-style government intervention to move its oil to market.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nigerian energy sector's crippling debts delay next power plant
Description: Plans to build another privately-financed power station in Nigeria to help end decades of chronic blackouts have been delayed because of concerns about persistent shortfalls in payments for electricity across the sector.

Headlines: Volkswagen to write off Gett investment - Spiegel
Description: German carmaker Volkswagen will write off its investment in Gett after the Israel-based ride hailing app failed to gain ground on bigger rivals Uber [UBER.UL], Lyft and Didi, weekly Der Spiegel reported on Friday.

Headlines: Online clothing retailers hunt for better fit to cut costly returns
Description: Models testing fashion brands like Adidas , Benetton and Gap are finding that almost a third of the shoes and clothes they try on are bigger or smaller than the size on the label indicates, explaining why many clothes bought online are sent back.

Headlines: Trump has discussed firing Fed Chairman Powell: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has privately discussed the possibility of firing Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell, a move that could roil already volatile financial markets, two sources familiar with situation said on Saturday.

Headlines: Mnuchin says Trump told him he 'never suggested firing' Fed chairman
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Saturday that President Donald Trump told him he had "never suggested firing" the chairman of the U.S. Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Judge accepts CVS offer on Aetna while reviewing consent decree
Description: A U.S. federal judge reviewing an agreement between the government and CVS Health Corp allowing it to buy health insurer Aetna has indicated that he will not halt most integration between the two companies.

Headlines: Malaysia seeks $7.5 billion in reparations from Goldman Sachs: FT
Description: Malaysia is seeking $7.5 billion in reparations from Goldman Sachs Group Inc over its dealings with scandal-linked state fund 1MDB, the Financial Times (FT) reported on Friday, citing the finance minister.

Headlines: Index futures little changed ahead of holiday-shortened week
Description: U.S. equity index futures were little changed late on Sunday as electronic trading resumed to kick off a holiday-shortened week following reports over the weekend that President Donald Trump has privately discussed firing the head of the U.S. Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Trump advisers have discussed arranging meeting with Fed's Powell: WSJ
Description: The advisers of President Donald Trump have discussed in recent days arranging a meeting between him and Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell in the coming weeks, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing a source.

Headlines: Australia's MYOB recommends KKR's lower buyout offer
Description: MYOB Group Ltd said on Monday it would recommend U.S. private equity giant KKR & Co's buyout offer for the Australian accounting software maker.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz, Mondelez make the cut in Campbell Soup's international business auction: sources
Description: U.S. food companies Kraft Heinz Co and Mondelez International Inc have been short-listed to participate in the second round of Campbell Soup Co's auction of its international business, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Tesla cuts Model 3 prices in China
Description: Tesla Inc has slashed prices on its Model 3 electric car in China.

Headlines: U.S. financial regulators tell Treasury nothing out of ordinary in markets
Description: U.S. financial regulators told the Treasury Department on Monday they were not seeing anything out of ordinary in financial markets during the recent sell-off, according to a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Trump says: 'The only problem our economy has is the Fed'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump blasted America's independent central bank on Monday, describing the Federal Reserve as the only problem had by the country's economy.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury was not concerned on liquidity ahead of call with bankers: CNBC
Description: U.S. Treasury officials were not concerned with liquidity in the banking system when Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin reached out to top U.S. bank CEOs in phone calls on Sunday, CNBC reported on Monday, citing a senior Treasury official.

Headlines: Explainer: 'Plunge Protection Team' to convene amid Wall Street rout
Description: The Trump administration is arranging a phone call on Monday with top regulators to discuss financial markets amid a rout on Wall Street.

Headlines: Markets not merry as stock losses extend into eighth day
Description: A gauge of stocks worldwide posted an eighth straight decline on Monday as investors ignored Trump administration attempts to reinforce confidence and the U.S. president called the Federal Reserve the "only problem our economy has."

Headlines: Rate futures market says Fed is all but done with hikes
Description: The Federal Reserve is finished raising U.S. interest rates.

Headlines: Wall Street selloff worsens on Mnuchin move, Washington drama
Description: The S&P 500 tumbled to the brink of a bear market on Monday as U.S. stocks extended their steep sell-off in a pre-holiday shortened session, with investors rattled by the U.S. Treasury secretary's convening of a crisis group and by other political developments.

Headlines: Trump calls Fed 'only problem' in U.S. economy; markets slump
Description: President Donald Trump blasted the Federal Reserve on Monday, describing it as the "only problem" for the U.S. economy, as top officials convened to discuss the growing rout in stock markets caused in part by the president's attacks on the central bank.

Headlines: Hyundai sees Russia auto market growth slowing in 2019
Description: South Korea-based carmaker Hyundai Motor Co. expects growth in the Russian auto market to slow sharply next year, the head of its Russian branch said on Monday.

Headlines: Bike-sharing firm Ofo's dramatic fall a warning to China's tech investors
Description: On the sidewalks of Shanghai and Beijing, once bright-yellow Ofo bicycles lie in varying states of disrepair - chains unhooked, wheels buckled and paint starting to fade - reflecting the quick rise and sharp fall of the Chinese bike-sharing startup.

Headlines: Top Trump official calls bankers, will convene 'Plunge Protection Team'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's Treasury secretary called top U.S. bankers on Sunday amid an ongoing rout on Wall Street and made plans to convene a group of officials known as the "Plunge Protection Team."

Headlines: Talks to get Russian automaker GAZ off U.S. sanctions list ongoing: Siluanov
Description: Talks aimed at lifting U.S. sanctions on Russian automaker GAZ are ongoing with the U.S. Treasury Department, and the company is implementing internal measures to encourage the process, Russian Finance Minister Anton Siluanov said.

Headlines: Nissan's Kelly examined at Japanese hospital after securing bail
Description: Nissan director Greg Kelly was being examined in a hospital on Wednesday, a source said, a day after he was released on bail from a Tokyo jail where his former boss Carlos Ghosn is still being detained.

Headlines: Nissan's Kelly released on bail as Tokyo court rejects prosecutors' plea
Description: Former Nissan Motor Co Representative Director Greg Kelly has been released on bail after more than a month in detention on financial-misconduct charges, as a Tokyo court rejected prosecutors' request to keep the American executive in custody.

Headlines: Tokyo court OKs release of Nissan's Kelly, rejecting prosecutors' appeal
Description: Former Nissan Motor Co Representative Director Greg Kelly was set to be released after more than a month in detention after a Tokyo court late on Tuesday rejected prosecutors' request to hold the American executive.

Headlines: Intel to get 700 million shekel grant for Israel expansion
Description: Israel will give Intel Corp a 700 million shekel ($185 million) grant in return for a planned $5 billion expansion of its production operations in Israel.

Headlines: Ex-Insys CEO to plead guilty to opioid kickback scheme
Description: The former chief executive of Insys Therapeutics Inc has agreed to plead guilty to participating in a scheme to bribe doctors to prescribe a powerful opioid medication in order to boost its sales, U.S. prosecutors said on Wednesday.

Headlines: In Japan, a scramble for new workers disrupts traditional hiring
Description: It's a rite of spring in Japan: Major corporations hire fresh university graduates en masse every April, starting them all at the same salary with assurances of rising pay and lifetime employment.

Headlines: Global stocks and oil rebound after pre-holiday thumping
Description: Stocks and oil prices rebounded on Wednesday as the Trump administration attempted to shore up investor confidence and markets welcomed a report on strong U.S. holiday spending.

Headlines: India tightens e-commerce rules, likely to hit Amazon, Flipkart
Description: India will ban e-commerce companies such as Amazon.com and Walmart -owned Flipkart Group from selling products from companies in which they have an equity interest.

Headlines: U.S. holiday shopping season best in six years: report
Description: Sales in the 2018 U.S. holiday shopping season rose 5.1 percent to over $850 billion, the strongest in six years, according to a Mastercard report on Wednesday, as shoppers were encouraged by a robust economy and early discounts.

Headlines: Lawsuit against Boeing over Lion Air crash demands Chicago jury trial
Description: The family of a man who was killed when a Lion Air flight crashed in October has sued Boeing Co, alleging the 737 MAX 8 aircraft was "unreasonably dangerous" and demanding a jury trial in Chicago, where the U.S. manufacturer is based.

Headlines: Rusal board chairman quits as part of U.S. sanctions waiver deal
Description: Russian aluminum company Rusal said on Wednesday that board chairman Matthias Warnig resigned as part of a restructuring it agreed to implement in exchange for a waiver from U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: Trump praises Treasury Secretary Mnuchin but hits Fed again on rate rises
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday expressed confidence in Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin amid worries over a weakening economy and a stock market slump, but repeated his criticism of the U.S. Federal Reserve, saying it has raised interest rates too quickly.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley unit to pay $10 million fine for anti-money laundering violations
Description: Wall Street's industry funded watchdog fined the U.S. brokerage unit of Morgan Stanley $10 million on Wednesday for compliance failures in the firm's anti-money laundering program, the regulator said.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin wins $712 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp has been awarded a $712 million U.S. defense contract for the development of advanced hardware in support of the F-35 Lightning II aircraft, the Pentagon said on Thursday.

Headlines: Green Growth to launch hostile bid for pot producer Aphria
Description: U.S. cannabis retailer Green Growth Brands Ltd said on Thursday it would make a hostile takeover bid for Aphria Inc in an all-stock deal valuing the Canadian pot producer at C$2.8 billion ($2.06 billion).

Headlines: Japan's Nomura aims for increased deal-related business in U.S. push: CEO
Description: Nomura Holdings Inc aims to increase its share of business arranging foreign exchange hedging, acquisition finance and other deal-related services for corporate clients in the United States, the CEO of Japan's biggest investment bank said.

Headlines: China's draft foreign investment law bans forced tech transfer, emphasizes reciprocity
Description: China has proposed a ban on forced technology transfer and illegal government "interference" in foreign business operations, practices that have come under the spotlight in a trade dispute with the United States.

Headlines: China says direct trade talks with U.S. in January, pledges more opening
Description: China and the United States have made plans for face-to-face consultations over trade in January, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Thursday, as the world's two biggest economies advanced efforts to resolve a months-long trade war.

Headlines: U.S. government advises workers on staving off creditors amid shutdown
Description: As a partial shutdown of the U.S. government stretched into its sixth day, the agency that oversees the federal workforce offered advice on staving off creditors to the estimated 800,000 employees who could be affected by a lapse in pay.

Headlines: Drop in U.S. consumer confidence stokes fears of economic slowdown
Description: A measure of U.S. consumer confidence posted its sharpest decline in more than three years in December, rattling investors already nervous about the prospect that a global economic slowdown was spilling over into the United States.

Headlines: Renault union calls for more transparency over Dutch holding
Description: France's CGT union has called for more transparency at Renault and its Dutch holding company and asked the French government, one of the carmaker's shareholders, to try to shed light on its workings, a CGT representative said on Thursday.

Headlines: Venezuela cocoa growers fear new pest: the government
Description: Venezuela cocoa trader Freddy Galindo has battled highway robberies, kidnappings of family members and declining quality in his 19 years exporting the nation's legendary beans.

Headlines: Exclusive: Foxconn to begin assembling top-end Apple iPhones in India in 2019 - source
Description: Apple Inc will begin assembling its top-end iPhones in India through the local unit of Foxconn as early as 2019, the first time the Taiwanese contract manufacturer will have made the product in the country, according to a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chile to delay arbitration with top lithium producer Albemarle
Description: Chile will delay a previously announced arbitration with Albemarle Corp , the world's top lithium producer, in anticipation that the U.S.-based miner will make a new offer to bring it into compliance with a 2016 contract, a source close to the negotiations told Reuters.

Headlines: Wall Street roars back late to keep rally going
Description: U.S. stocks roared back to end in positive territory on Thursday following steep losses for much of the session, as equities rebounded for a second day.

Headlines: Exclusive: New allegations against Ghosn concern payments to Saudi businessman - sources
Description: Fresh misconduct allegations brought by Tokyo prosecutors against ousted Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn center on the use of company funds to pay a Saudi businessman who is believed to have helped him out of financial difficulties, two company sources with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Fed survey points to a scaling back of bets on emerging market gains
Description: Most financial market credit officers surveyed by the Federal Reserve in November said their big clients were exposed to emerging markets but were scaling back bets emerging market assets would rise in value, the U.S. central bank said on Thursday.

Headlines: Sears Chair Lampert makes $4.4 billion bid to keep retailer alive
Description: Sears Holdings Corp Chairman Eddie Lampert submitted a $4.4 billion takeover bid for the bankrupt U.S. retailer, representing its only chance of escaping liquidation and laying off tens of thousands of workers, a spokesman for the billionaire's hedge fund said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. retirees try to keep cool as stocks tumble
Description: Nancy Farrington, a retiree who turns 75 next month, admits to being in a constant state of anxiety over the biggest December stock market rout since Herbert Hoover was president.

Headlines: Tesla names close Musk friend Larry Ellison to board
Description: Tesla Inc on Friday named Oracle Corp co-founder Larry Ellison, a shareholder and self-described close friend of Chief Executive Elon Musk, to its board to provide the independent oversight demanded by U.S. regulators after Musk tweeted about taking the electric carmaker private.

Headlines: Wells Fargo to pay $575 million in settlement with U.S. states
Description: Wells Fargo & Co will pay $575 million to settle claims made by U.S. states, the latest settlement as the bank works to resolve lingering investigations and legal battles stemming from its sales-practices scandal and to remove a punitive asset cap.

Headlines: Oil prices steady near year-and-a-half lows ahead of New Year
Description: Oil prices steadied on Friday after a week of volatile trading ahead of the New Year holiday, supported by a rise in U.S. equity markets but pressured by worries about a global glut of crude.

Headlines: HKMA fines JPMorgan Hong Kong branch over anti-money laundering lapses
Description: The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) said on Friday that it had fined the Hong Kong branch of JPMorgan Chase & Co HK$12.5 million ($1.60 million) and reprimanded it for breaching anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing rules.

Headlines: U.S. pending home sales fall unexpectedly in November
Description: Contracts to buy previously owned homes fell unexpectedly in November, the National Association of Realtors said on Friday, the latest sign of weakness in the U.S. housing market.

Headlines: Nissan to make fewer cars in China in months ahead as demand slows: source
Description: Nissan Motor Co will produce 30,000 fewer vehicles in the coming months in China than what it had planned, a person briefed on the matter told Reuters, as global automakers grapple with falling demand in the world's biggest car market.

Headlines: Germany paves way for upgrading exhaust systems on older diesel cars
Description: Germany on Friday cleared away legal hurdles for carmakers to upgrade exhaust emissions filtering systems on older diesel cars as a way to avoid vehicle bans, but failed to quell doubts among manufacturers and suppliers over the effectiveness of retrofits.

Headlines: Tough to stop Nord Stream 2 now it's being built - EU's Oettinger
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's criticism of the Russian-backed Nord Stream 2 pipeline is no reason to stop the project and any attempt to do so would be difficult now that it is being built, European Commissioner Guenther Oettinger said.

Headlines: Third prototype of China's C919 jet completes first test flight
Description: A third prototype of China's home-built C919 narrowbody passenger jet completed its first test flight on Friday, its manufacturer said, in another step forward in the nation's push to become a global civil aerospace player.

Headlines: Rusal appoints independent director as new board chairman
Description: Russian aluminum company Rusal said on Friday it has appointed independent non-executive director Jean-Pierre Thomas as its new chairman as part of an agreed restructuring in exchange for the lifting of U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: Wall Street rises, limps across the finish line of a turbulent year
Description: Wall Street advanced in low-volume trading on Monday as revelers gathered to ring in 2019, marking the end of the worst year for U.S. stocks since 2008, the height of the financial crisis.

Headlines: Trade optimism lifts stocks, but 2018 ends in red
Description: Equities around the world rose on Monday as possible progress in resolving the trade dispute between the United States and China engendered some investor optimism in what has been a punishing end of year for markets.

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell's unscripted approach sets up for rocky 2019
Description: Jerome Powell had a bumpy first year as Federal Reserve chairman when it came to talking policy, by turns spooking and comforting investors even as economic data offered increasingly mixed signals and President Donald Trump stepped up his attacks on the U.S. central bank.

Headlines: U.S. companies repatriate over half a trillion dollars in 2018, but pace slows
Description: U.S. companies have sent home over half a trillion dollars of cash they held overseas in 2018 to take advantage of tax changes, but data suggest the pace is slowing, potentially removing a key source of support for Wall Street.

Headlines: China's services activity picks up in December: official PMI
Description: Growth in China's services industry picked up in December after a two-month slowdown, an official survey showed, offering some respite for the slowing economy though the outlook remains gloomy as domestic and external risks to growth rise.

Headlines: China December factory activity shrinks for first time in 19 months: Caixin PMI
Description: China's factory activity contracted for the first time in 19 months in December as domestic and export orders continued to weaken, a private survey showed, pointing to a rocky start for the world's second-largest economy in 2019.

Headlines: Global growth worries, higher oil flatten yield curve
Description: Yields on long-dated U.S. Treasury securities fell to their lowest in nearly a year on Wednesday on concerns about the health of the global economy, a worry exacerbated late in the day when Apple Inc cut its sales outlook and sent U.S. equity index futures tumbling.

Headlines: U.S. fund investors yank most cash from stocks since February: ICI
Description: U.S. fund investors anguished over economic growth and policies pulled the most cash from stocks in any weekly period since last February, Investment Company Institute data showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: South Koreans seek Nippon Steel asset seizure in 'forced labor' case
Description: South Korean plaintiffs in a World War Two forced labor court case against Japan's Nippon Steel & Sumitomo Metal Corp have applied to seize some of Nippon Steel's Korean assets, their lawyers said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Hyundai flags tough 2019 as U.S., China demand stays slow
Description: South Korea's Hyundai Motor Group flagged another year of tepid car sales growth on the back of a slow 2018, saying trade protectionism adds uncertainty and major markets such as the United States and China remained sluggish.

Headlines: UK minister defends giving Brexit ferry contract to company with no ships
Description: Britain's transport minister has defended awarding a 14 million-pound ($18 million) contract for shipping goods after Brexit to a new ferry company that owns no ships.

Headlines: China's Didi launches credit, crowdfunding services in diversification push
Description: China's Didi Chuxing has launched a suite of financial products, including crowdfunding and lending, as it continues to diversify outside the ride-hailing business following a year of safety scandals.

Headlines: Nestle welcomes Indian court ruling in Maggi case
Description: Food group Nestle said on Thursday a ruling by India's Supreme Court marked a partial victory in its row with the government over Maggi noodles.

Headlines: Father and son advised on opposite sides of Bristol-Celgene deal
Description: For most U.S. families, the holidays are all about gathering around the fireplace, overeating at festive dinners, and playing the occasional board game. But this year, a father and son were also working on the biggest pharmaceutical acquisition of all time.

Headlines: Petrobras, Brazil government expect to resolve dispute within 100 days: minister
Description: Brazil's government and state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA expect to resolve a dispute over the oil producing zone known as the 'transfer-of-rights' area within 100 days, a minister said on Thursday.

Headlines: Apple shares dive; rare revenue warning drags global markets
Description: Apple Inc shares plunged 10 percent on Thursday after the iPhone maker blamed weak China demand for a holiday-quarter revenue shortfall, with many investors worried the rare stumble was a harbinger for slowing global growth.

Headlines: Oil rises in choppy trade as OPEC supply cuts vie with demand worry
Description: Oil prices rose more than 1 percent on Thursday in volatile trade, drawing support from signs that Saudi Arabia is cutting crude output but pressured by concerns that slowing global economic growth could dent demand.

Headlines: At Brazil's Petrobras, a 'Chicago Boy' takes the reins
Description: Depending on who you ask, Roberto Castello Branco, the new chief executive of Brazil's Petroleo Brasileiro SA , will either save the indebted oil major - or strip it to the bone.

Headlines: Delta shares fall 10 percent on lowered outlook; drags down rivals
Description: Shares of Delta Air Lines Inc fell about 9 percent on Thursday, after the U.S. carrier warned fourth-quarter unit revenue would be slightly below its prior forecast due to the lower-than-expected improvement in last-minute fares booked by travelers.

Headlines: Instant view: Stocks slammed, Treasury yields fall, yen surges
Description: U.S. stocks plunged on Thursday and 2-year U.S. Treasury yields dropped below the Federal Reserve's policy rate for the first time in more than a decade, delivering a signal the U.S. central bank could begin reversing its tightening regime before long.

Headlines: Reuss, 35-year GM veteran, to succeed Ammann as president
Description: General Motors Co said on Thursday that Mark Reuss would succeed Dan Ammann as president, effective immediately, as part of the automaker's ongoing shift to electric and self-driving vehicles in North America and China.

Headlines: Wall Street plunges as factory data, Apple warning fuel slowdown fears
Description: Wall Street plunged on Thursday after slowing U.S. factory activity on the heels of a dire revenue warning from Apple Inc fueled fears of a global economic slowdown.

Headlines: U.S. retail vacancies rise marginally in fourth quarter: Reis
Description: U.S. retail vacancies inched higher in the fourth quarter, underscoring how the retail sector has withstood many store closures across the country, real estate research firm Reis Inc said in a report.

Headlines: FDIC chair says no concerns about U.S. bank health amid market turmoil
Description: A top U.S. bank regulator said on Thursday she had no concerns that volatility in the equities and futures markets posed a threat to the banking system, telling Reuters the country's lenders have plenty of capital to weather further market swings.

Headlines: Cost to insure Bristol-Myers debt jumps as leverage balloons
Description: The cost to insure Bristol-Myers Squibb debt hit its highest point since May 2010 on Thursday, following the announcement that the U.S. pharmaceutical company would acquire rival Celgene Corp in a deal worth about $74 billion.

Headlines: Apple cuts sales forecast as China sales weaken; iPhone pricing in focus
Description: Apple Inc on Wednesday took the rare step of cutting its quarterly sales forecast, with Chief Executive Tim Cook blaming slowing iPhone sales in China, whose economy has been dragged down by uncertainty around U.S.-China trade relations.

Headlines: Tesla cuts U.S. prices on all vehicles, shares drop
Description: Tesla Inc on Wednesday cut U.S. prices for all its vehicles to offset lower green tax credits, and fell short on quarterly deliveries of its mass-market Model 3 sedan, sending shares of the electric vehicle maker down nearly 7 percent on worries of future profitability.

Headlines: Cargill net drops 20 percent, revenues fall as trade fight bites
Description: Grains trader Cargill Inc on Thursday reported a 20 percent drop in its fiscal second-quarter 2019 net earnings, as global trade tensions hit the bottom line along with challenges in the Chinese hog sector and a struggling U.S. dairy business.

Headlines: Airbus bags new orders as delivery target doubts grow
Description: Airbus narrowed a sales gap against U.S. rival Boeing by finalising orders for 120 of the former Bombardier CSeries jet, but shares in Europe's top planemaker fell as doubts surfaced over a target for overall 2018 deliveries.

Headlines: Major automakers bullish on U.S. market despite rising interest rates
Description: Major automakers on Thursday shrugged off declines in U.S. new vehicle sales in December and said they were bullish about 2019 even as economists warned that rising interest rates will discourage consumers from buying cars in the year ahead.

Headlines: UAW sues GM over temporary workers, escalating fight over job cuts
Description: The United Auto Workers said on Thursday it was suing General Motors Co over labor contract violations stemming from its alleged use of temporary workers at an Indiana assembly plant, escalating the union's fight against GM's plans to possibly close U.S. factories.

Headlines: Upbeat employment report underscores U.S. economic strength
Description: U.S. employers hired the most workers in 10 months in December while boosting wages, pointing to sustained strength in the economy that could ease fears of a sharp slowdown in growth.

Headlines: U.S. jobs data, dovish Fed comments boost equities
Description: Equities around the globe rallied on Friday while bond yields rose after sharply declining earlier in the week as U.S. employment data pointed to economic strength and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the U.S. central bank would be patient with monetary policy.

Headlines: China warnings signal Trump's trade war finally hitting home
Description: Weak sales at Apple and Cargill, U.S. giants of technology and agriculture, may be the clearest sign yet that President Donald Trump's quest to reset world trade carries costs at home and could isolate the United States as the increasingly fragile engine for global economic growth.

Headlines: The Fed may have just set the Trump rally back on its course, says Jim Cramer
Description: Jim Cramer sees more upside in the stock market as he looks back on its performance under President Donald Trump's administration.

Headlines: Wall St. rebounds on robust jobs report, dovish Powell remarks
Description: Wall Street rebounded on Friday to close at its highest in two weeks after a strong jobs report and assurances from Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell that the central bank would be patient and flexible in steering the course of interest rates.

Headlines: Cramer's lightning round: 'Do some trimming' in Qualcomm if the stock rallies
Description: Jim Cramer rattles off his responses to callers' stock questions, including one on a technology company with ties to China.

Headlines: Instant View: Powell pledges patience; says won't quit if Trump asks
Description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Friday moved to mollify financial markets concerned about a U.S. economic slowdown, saying that while momentum is solid, the U.S. central bank will be sensitive to the downside risks the market is pricing in.

Headlines: Tesla urges tariff exemption for Chinese-made car computer 'brain'
Description: Tesla Inc has asked the Trump administration to exempt the Chinese-made car computer "brain" of its new Model 3 sedan from 25 percent tariffs imposed in August, saying they threaten the electric carmaker's bottom line.

Headlines: Court battle, trade war and 5G spell tough 2019 for Apple in China
Description: Apple Inc's chief executive Tim Cook has his work cut out in China this year: the iPhone maker faces the looming threat of a court-ordered sales ban, the uncertain outcome of trade war talks and the roll-out of a new 5G network, where it finds itself behind rivals like Huawei and Samsung.

Headlines: German Apple reseller Gravis says still selling iPhones 7, 8
Description: German Apple retailer Gravis said it was still selling iPhone 7 and 8 models at its stores and online after Qualcomm posted security bonds to enforce a court order that will ban sales of some Apple iPhones in Germany.

Headlines: UK consumer lending growth slows to near four-year low as Brexit approaches
Description: Lending to British consumers grew at its slowest pace in nearly four years in November and the number of mortgage approvals fell, Bank of England data showed, adding to signs of a pre-Brexit slowdown in the economy.

Headlines: Pioneering Southwest Airlines co-founder Herb Kelleher dies at 87
Description: Herb Kelleher, who co-founded pioneering low-cost carrier Southwest Airlines Co and built it into an industry powerhouse stamped with his colorful, unconventional personality, died on Thursday at age 87, the U.S. carrier said.

Headlines: Chinese phone maker Huawei punishes employees for iPhone tweet blunder
Description: China's Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] has punished two employees for New Year greetings sent on the smartphone maker's official Twitter account using an iPhone, an internal memo showed.

Headlines: Audits reveal Deutsche Bank's links to tax trade scandal
Description: There are "lots of indications" that some managers discussed "the reputational risks" of Deutsche Bank's involvement in a share-trading scheme that is the subject of Germany's biggest post-war fraud investigation, according to a conclusion in one of five internal audits seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. December payrolls surprise big to the upside
Description: U.S. employers hired the most workers in 10 months in December while boosting wages, which could help to allay a recent upsurge in fears about the economy's health that has roiled financial markets.

Headlines: Brazil's Bolsonaro: worried Boeing could own all of Embraer's commercial division
Description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Friday he is concerned that a proposed sale of 80 percent of Embraer's commercial aviation business to Boeing could lead to the U.S. planemaker taking over all of the division.

Headlines: Nissan's Ghosn to make first public appearance in seven weeks in court on Tuesday
Description: Ousted Nissan Motor Co Ltd chairman Carlos Ghosn is set to make his first public appearance in seven weeks at a Tokyo court on Tuesday after he requested an open hearing to hear the reason for his continued detention.

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell says he would not resign if Trump asked
Description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Friday said he would not resign even if President Donald Trump asked him to do so, a clear assertion of the U.S. central bank's independence in the face of Trump's strident criticism of the Fed's rate hikes.

Headlines: Oil rises on China-U.S. talks, gains capped by U.S. fuel build
Description: Oil rose nearly 2 percent on Friday after proposed trade talks between the United States and China eased some fears about a global economic slowdown, but gains were capped after the United States reported a sharp build in refined product inventories.

Headlines: China slashes banks' reserve requirements again as growth slows
Description: China's central bank said on Friday it was cutting the amount of cash that banks have to hold as reserves for the fifth time in a year, freeing up $116 billion for new lending as it tries to reduce the risk of a sharp economic slowdown.

Headlines: Japanese prosecutors want Ghosn to sign confession, says son: paper
Description: Japanese prosecutors want Carlos Ghosn, the detained auto executive who oversaw an alliance that sold 10 million vehicles a year, to confess to financial misconduct, his son told France's weekly Journal du Dimanche (JDD).

Headlines: South Korea's Celltrion aims to set up China JV within first half of 2019: chairman
Description: South Korean drugmaker Celltrion Inc aims to set up a joint venture in China within the first half of this year, and begin selling products in the country next year, its chairman said on Sunday.

Headlines: Samsung Electronics braces for profit drop as China slowdown chips away at demand
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd is set to post its first drop in quarterly operating profit in two years as slowing economic growth in China, a key market for the South Korean tech giant, erodes demand for its products.

Headlines: Southeast Asia wary of China's Belt and Road project, skeptical of U.S.: survey
Description: Southeast Asian countries should be cautious in negotiating with China on its flagship Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) to avoid being trapped in unsustainable debt, 70 percent of respondents said in a policy survey released on Monday.

Headlines: Canada auto union head to meet with GM on Tuesday
Description: The head of Canada's auto union said on Monday he was set to meet with General Motors Co executives in Detroit on Tuesday to discuss the automaker's Oshawa, Ontario, assembly plant, scheduled to shut down in December 2019.

Headlines: Sears picks liquidator should rescue talks fall through: sources
Description: A long-standing liquidator is now first in line for one of the U.S. retail sector's most daunting assignments: shutting down 126-year-old department store chain Sears Holdings Corp , people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Activist Starboard seeks Dollar Tree board changes, disposal
Description: Activist hedge fund Starboard Value LP on Monday called on Dollar Tree Inc to sell its underperforming Family Dollar business and proposed replacing a majority of the board after revealing a stake in the U.S. discount retailer.

Headlines: Venezuela's PDVSA in oil deal with firm part-owned by Florida Republican
Description: Venezuelan state oil firm PDVSA [PDVSA.UL] has signed a deal with little-known U.S. energy firm Erepla, partly owned by a prominent Florida Republican, to help increase the socialist-run country's plummeting crude oil output, the company said.

Headlines: Nucor to set up plate mill in U.S. Midwest for $1.35 billion
Description: Steel producer Nucor Corp said on Monday it would spend about $1.35 billion to build a plate mill in the U.S. Midwest, taking advantage of federal tax cuts that has resulted in windfall gains for several companies.

Headlines: Huawei launches server chipset as China pushes to cut reliance on imports
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] on Monday launched a new chipset for use in servers, at a time when China is pushing to enhance its chip-making capabilities and reduce its heavy reliance on imports, especially from the United States.

Headlines: Assets worth $1 trillion to shift from UK to EU due to Brexit: EY
Description: Assets worth nearly 800 billion pounds ($1 trillion) are being moved from Britain to new financial hubs in the European Union ahead of Brexit, consultancy EY said on Monday.

Headlines: China's Geely sees sales growth evaporating as car market struggles
Description: China's most globally high-profile and successful carmaker, Geely, is forecasting flat sales this year, a sharp slowdown from 2018 as the country's giant auto market struggles with slowing economic growth and more cautious consumers.

Headlines: Exclusive: Aston Martin triggers contingency plans for no deal Brexit
Description: British carmaker Aston Martin has triggered contingency plans to cope with a potentially disorderly Brexit, including hiring a new supply chain chief and preparing to fly in components as well as use ports other than Dover.

Headlines: Brazil studying if Boeing-Embraer deal is in its 'ideal form'
Description: Brazil national security adviser Augusto Heleno said on Monday that the government is studying whether the deal between planemakers Embraer and Boeing is in its "ideal form" or in need of changes.

Headlines: Statement by ex-Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn in Tokyo court
Description: The following are prepared remarks by Carlos Ghosn, ex-chairman of Nissan Motor Co, for his court appearance in Tokyo on Tuesday regarding allegations against him of aggravated breach of trust. The statement was released by Ghosn's lawyers in the United States.

Headlines: Ghosn's lawyer: Nissan agreed on transfer of currency contracts
Description: Nissan Motor Co had agreed with former chairman Carlos Ghosn to take on his personal foreign exchange contracts, his lawyer said, disputing allegations of financial misconduct.

Headlines: Sears workers demand hardship fund after Toys 'R' Us success
Description: As Sears Holdings Corp teeters on the brink of liquidation, its employees are pushing for a hardship fund they hope can replicate the success of bankrupt retailer Toys 'R' Us, whose workers collected $20 million in severance pay from its former owners.

Headlines: Kroger plans $1.2 billion debt offering
Description: U.S. supermarket chain Kroger Co said on Tuesday it plans to raise $1.2 billion through a debt offering, according to a U.S. regulatory filing https://bit.ly/2QxmZAN.

Headlines: GM did not heed call to keep Oshawa, Ontario plant open: union boss
Description: The head of Canada's auto union blasted General Motors Co on Tuesday for pushing ahead with plans to phase out work at its Oshawa, Ontario, assembly plant despite calls by workers and politicians in Canada to find a new vehicle to build there.

Headlines: Cramer: It's not too late to buy into Facebook, Apple, Amazon or Alphabet
Description: Jim Cramer says the majority of FAANG, his acronym for the stocks of Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix and Alphabet, is still ripe for the picking.

Headlines: On brink of demise, Sears to reconsider billionaire chairman's bid
Description: Sears Holdings Corp agreed on Tuesday to consider a revised takeover bid from billionaire Chairman Edward Lampert, temporarily staving off a liquidation that would have spelled the end of the 126-year-old U.S. department-store chain.

Headlines: Apple, Facebook propel Wall Street to three-week peak
Description: The S&P 500 jumped to a three-week high on Tuesday, led by Apple, Amazon, Facebook and industrial shares on bets that the United States and China would strike a deal to end their trade war.

Headlines: U.S. retail imports level off after China tariff avoidance rush
Description: Imports at major U.S. container ports are leveling off after retailers' months-long rush to bring in Chinese merchandise before higher tariffs hit, according to a retail trade report issued on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nissan's Ghosn claims innocence in first appearance since November arrest
Description: Ousted Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn declared his innocence in his first public appearance since his November arrest, telling a Tokyo court on Tuesday that he had been wrongly accused of financial misconduct.

Headlines: India to issue new safety rules for A320neos with Pratt & Whitney engines
Description: India's civil aviation watchdog will issue an advanced safety management protocol in one week for airlines operating Airbus A320neo aircraft fitted with the troubled Pratt & Whitney engines, the civil aviation secretary told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Union Pacific jumps 8 percent after company picks turnaround expert as COO
Description: Shares of Union Pacific Corp rose 8 percent in early trading on Tuesday after the No.1 U.S. railroad named https://www.up.com/media/releases/190107-jim-vena.htm industry veteran Jim Vena as chief operating officer, prompting upgrades by several brokerages.

Headlines: Scant relief for U.S. aluminum users from removal of Rusal sanctions
Description: U.S. plans to remove sanctions on Russian aluminum giant Rusal will be of limited benefit to consumers in the United States where tariffs on aluminum imports mean producers still need much higher prices to incentivize shipments.

Headlines: Ryanair's Spanish cabin crew unions call off Tuesday strike
Description: Unions representing Ryanair cabin crew in Spain called off plans to strike on Tuesday to allow time for further talks, the SITCPLA and USO unions said in a statement.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's HNA touts assets for sale as funding crunch intensifies
Description: China's indebted HNA Group met bankers on Tuesday to tout the latest assets that the sprawling conglomerate is putting on the block as it looks to raise funds and stave off an intensifying cash crunch.

Headlines: Group close to India's ruling party seeks change in patent act after pro-Monsanto court verdict
Description: A nationalist group close to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party said on Tuesday it would seek a legislative amendment to the rules governing patents, after the country's top court ruled in favor of Monsanto's cotton seed patent.

Headlines: Trump renews dig at Fed, expresses longing for lower interest rates
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday expressed longing for the lower interest rates that the Federal Reserve put in place during the 2007-09 recession, saying he could boost the economy if the central bank brought interest rates to zero.

Headlines: World stocks rise on U.S.-China trade talk hopes
Description: An index of world stocks rose for the third straight session on Tuesday, with investors hopeful that the United States and China would strike a deal to end their months-long trade war that has hurt sentiment in financial markets.

Headlines: U.S. job openings drop, but still at lofty levels
Description: U.S. job openings fell in November, pulled down by sharp declines in construction and other services, but did little to change views that the economy is facing a shortage of workers.

Headlines: Fed may still need to hike rates twice this year: Rosengren
Description: A top Federal Reserve official said on Wednesday the U.S. central bank may still need to raise interest rates a couple times this year, although he said he could not rule out the possibility that the Fed might actually have to ease policy.

Headlines: Traders keep bets against further Fed rate hikes
Description: U.S. short-term interest-rate futures rose slightly on Wednesday just after minutes from the Federal Reserve's most recent meeting showed policymakers want to be patient about further rate hikes.

Headlines: Fed policymakers say U.S. rate hikes can wait, for now
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve policymakers say they will wait to deliver more interest rate hikes until they have a better handle on whether slowing global growth and financial market volatility will undercut an otherwise solid U.S. economic outlook.

Headlines: Lennar sees housing demand rebounding, shares up nearly 10 percent
Description: Lennar Corp said on Wednesday it was seeing an improvement in home sales in its new fiscal year as mortgage rates start to ease and posted earnings ahead of expectations, allaying concerns of a slowdown in the broader U.S. housing market.

Headlines: Wall Street extends rally as chipmakers rebound
Description: Wall Street rallied for a fourth session on Wednesday, propelled by Apple, chipmakers and other trade-sensitive stocks after signs of progress in trade talks between the United States and China.

Headlines: Skydance hires ousted Disney animation head John Lasseter
Description: U.S. film production company Skydance Media on Wednesday named Walt Disney Co's former animation head and co-founder of Pixar, John Lasseter, as head of its animation division.

Headlines: Judge proposes PG&E power restrictions for next California fire season
Description: A U.S. judge on Wednesday issued a proposed order to restrict utility PG&E from using power lines deemed to be unsafe during high winds in the 2019 California fire season, according to a court filing.

Headlines: Watchdog orders Deutsche Bank to re-examine 20,000 risky customers by June
Description: Germany's financial markets watchdog is requiring Deutsche Bank to re-examine the files of about 20,000 risky clients by the end of June as part of its "know your customer" process, a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Judge proposes PG&E power restrictions for next California fire season
Description: A U.S. judge on Wednesday proposed restricting utility PG&E Corp from using power lines deemed to be unsafe during high winds in the 2019 California fire season, adding another complication for the California utility as it faces billions of dollars in wildfire liabilities.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sears chairman submits new roughly $5 billion bid to save retailer - sources
Description: Sears Holdings Corp Chairman Eddie Lampert submitted a revised roughly $5 billion takeover bid for the company on Wednesday, people familiar with the matter said, boosting the chances that the U.S. department store operator will escape liquidation.

Headlines: China pledges to buy 'substantial amount' of U.S. goods: USTR
Description: China has pledged to purchase "a substantial amount" of agricultural, energy and manufactured goods and services from the United States, the U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Wednesday after U.S.-China trade talks wrapped up in Beijing.

Headlines: $100 billion beyond the iPhone: Apple CEO Tim Cook talks giant's move past hardware
Description: Apple CEO Tim Cook and CNBC's Jim Cramer discuss business in China, pessimism on Wall Street, disputes with Qualcomm and what's next for the consumer tech giant.

Headlines: Fed's Evans sees three U.S. rate hikes in 2019
Description: A Federal Reserve official said on Wednesday he expects three interest-rate rises this year assuming the U.S. economy remains reasonably strong, adding it was a "very good time" to watch how political developments play out.

Headlines: Evans still sees U.S. rate hikes but cites risks, says Fed can wait a bit
Description: The Federal Reserve can wait and use the first half of this year to assess growing risks to the otherwise solid U.S. economic outlook, an influential regional Fed president said on Wednesday, even as he stuck by an expectation to eventually raise interest rates a bit into restrictive territory.

Headlines: Exclusive: Fiat Chrysler nearing U.S. diesel emissions settlement - source
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV is nearing a settlement to resolve the U.S. Justice Department's allegations that the Italian-American automaker used illegal software to allow 104,000 U.S. diesel vehicles to pollute beyond legal limits, a person briefed on the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Sears chairman confirms new $5 billion bid to save bankrupt retailer
Description: Sears Holdings Corp Chairman Eddie Lampert confirmed on Thursday he has made a new takeover bid of more than $5 billion for the company, an offer that may significantly increase the likelihood the U.S. department store will be able to stay in business.

Headlines: Carmaker Rolls-Royce urges UK's May to avoid a hard Brexit
Description: Carmaker Rolls-Royce called on the British government to avoid a disorderly Brexit and said it was building up some stock, expanding warehouse capacity and training suppliers for customs changes in case Britain leaves the EU without a deal.

Headlines: Sen. Sanders, Rep. Cummings introduce bill to lower U.S. drug prices
Description: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders and Representative Elijah Cummings introduced legislation on Thursday aimed at lowering the cost of prescription drugs for American consumers, critiquing President Donald Trump administration's efforts to curb medicine prices.

Headlines: Ford, Jaguar slash thousands of jobs across Europe
Description: Ford and Jaguar Land Rover unveiled sweeping job cuts across Europe on Thursday as carmakers struggle with a slump in demand for diesel vehicles, tougher emissions rules and a global economic slowdown led by China.

Headlines: Trump's attorney general nominee to recuse from AT&T-Time Warner appeal
Description: William Barr, nominated by President Donald Trump to become U.S. attorney general, plans to recuse himself from a major antitrust case, according to people who spoke with him on Thursday, as he navigates possible conflicts of interest presented by about $37 million in assets he amassed as a private-sector lawyer.

Headlines: J&J raises U.S. prices on around two dozen drugs
Description: Johnson & Johnson raised U.S. prices on around two dozen prescription drugs on Thursday, including the psoriasis treatment Stelara, prostate cancer drug Zytiga and blood thinner Xarelto, all among its top-selling products.

Headlines: China vice president urges dialogue for stable China-U.S. ties: Xinhua
Description: China's Vice President Wang Qishan urged for dialogue and consultations for healthy and stable bilateral relations between the country and the United States, China's Xinhua news agency reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Stocks rise for fifth straight day as the Fed supports
Description: An index of world stock markets rose on Thursday as worries over the lack of clear signs of a resolution to the U.S.-China trade spat were offset by an assurance by Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell that the U.S. central bank has the ability to be patient on monetary policy.

Headlines: Chinese official 'most likely' to visit in January for trade talks: U.S. Treasury Secretary
Description: U.s. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday that Chinese Vice Premier Liu He will "most likely" visit Washington later in January for trade talks.

Headlines: Ford's ride-share service Chariot to shut operations by March-end
Description: Ford Motor Co's ride-share service Chariot is ceasing its operations in the United States and the UK by the end of March, Chariot said in a blog post http://bit.ly/2D3DKjL on Thursday.

Headlines: Germany's Bosch to pay $131 million to settle U.S. diesel emissions claims
Description: German auto supplier Robert Bosch GmbH [ROBG.UL] will pay around $131 million to settle claims from Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV U.S. diesel owners and resolve all investigations by 47 U.S. state attorneys general into its involvement with diesel vehicles.

Headlines: American Airlines shares fall on dour fourth quarter expectations, weigh on sector
Description: American Airlines shares fell as much as 11 percent on Thursday after the biggest U.S. carrier cut its estimate for a closely watched measure of performance, raising concerns that slowing global economic growth is hurting business travel.

Headlines: U.S. oil export boom sparks a battle to build Texas ports
Description: Booming U.S. oil exports have set off a scramble to build Gulf Coast ports to handle more than 3 million barrels per day in new supplies expected over the next five years.

Headlines: Stocks boosted by U.S.-China trade hope, oil prices soar
Description: Stocks around the world extended recent gains and oil prices jumped on Wednesday on optimism the United States and China may be inching toward a trade deal, soothing fears of an all-out trade war and its possible impact on global growth.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover clear they regard UK as home: PM May's spokesman
Description: Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) has made clear they regard Britain as home and are investing in the future, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headlines: China says trade talks with U.S. made progress on forced tech transfers, IP rights
Description: China and the United States made progress during their recent trade talks over structural issues such as forced technology transfers and intellectual property rights, China's commerce ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Cramer picks his favorites in the race back to a $1 trillion market cap
Description: Jim Cramer revisits the race between Apple, Amazon, Alphabet and Microsoft to reach a $1 trillion market cap.
