Headlines: Starboard building stake in MGM Resorts: sources
Description: Activist hedge fund Starboard Value LP is building a stake in MGM Resorts , two people familiar with the matter said on Thursday, as the U.S. hotel and casino operator comes under investor scrutiny over its profit targets.

Headlines: Exclusive: Saudi private jet industry stalls after corruption crackdown
Description: A crackdown on corruption in Saudi Arabia has severely dented the kingdom's private jet industry in a sign of the impact the campaign has had on private enterprise and the wealthy elite.

Headlines: Exclusive: VW, China spearhead $300 billion global drive to electrify cars
Description: Global automakers are planning a $300 billion surge in spending on electric vehicle technology over the next five to 10 years, with nearly half of the money targeted at China, accelerating the industry's transition from fossil fuels and shifting power to Asian battery and electric vehicle technology suppliers.

Headlines: U.S. buyback market support may wane in 2019
Description: U.S. companies' shopping spree for their own shares helped put a floor on market declines in 2018. Don't look for the same level of support in 2019.

Headlines: Airbus loses to Boeing in annual jet order race
Description: Europe's Airbus lost out to Boeing in 2018, breaking a five-year winning streak against its U.S. rival for the number of jet orders, slumping to its lowest share of the $150 billion jet market in six years, data showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Dutch government says it will cooperate with EU probe into Nike tax status
Description: The Dutch government said on Thursday it will cooperate with an investigation by the EU Commission into Nike Inc.'s tax arrangements in the Netherlands.

Headlines: Exclusive: Modi's 'Make in India' a casualty as steel, auto firms spar over sourcing
Description: India's steel ministry is putting pressure on automakers to use locally made steel by refusing to back down on tougher import rules despite warnings that the new regulations could disrupt the production of cars, government and industry sources said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Glencore loses exclusive rights to major Libyan oil grades
Description: Trading and mining giant Glencore has lost its exclusive marketing rights for two of Libya's main crude oil export grades after holding them since late 2015, trading sources with direct knowledge said.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to cut 4,500 jobs, mainly in Britain
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover said it will cut around 4,500 jobs, mainly in its home market, as it tries to tackle a slowdown in China and a slump in demand for its diesel-powered vehicles.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to cut 4,500 jobs, mainly in Britain
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover said it will cut around 4,500 jobs, mainly in its home market, as it tries to tackle a slowdown in China and a slump in demand for its diesel-powered vehicles.

Headlines: New Petrobras CEO pushes to oust board members: sources
Description: The new chief executive of Brazil's Petroleo Brasileiro SA is pushing for the ouster of two of the state-controlled oil company's board members, three people with knowledge of the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Battered U.S. bank stocks may get a boost this year
Description: After a miserable 2018, big U.S. bank stocks could be in for a lift if upcoming earnings releases show strong fourth-quarter loan growth helps to offset weak trading revenue.

Headlines: U.S. government shutdown may depress January job growth
Description: A partial shutdown of the U.S. government could slash job growth by as much as 500,000 in January and lift the unemployment rate above 4.0 percent unless the impasse in Washington is resolved before next Friday, economists warned.

Headlines: Alphabet board sued on allegations of sexual misconduct cover-up
Description: Two shareholder lawsuits filed this week accused the board of Google parent Alphabet Inc of playing a direct role in covering up sexual misconduct claims against two former executives over the last five years.

Headlines: Apple considered Samsung, MediaTek to supply 5G modems for 2019 iPhones
Description: Apple Inc held talks with Samsung Electronics Co Ltd and MediaTek Inc along with existing vendor Intel Corp to supply 5G modem chips for 2019 iPhones, according to an Apple executive's testimony at a trial between Qualcomm Inc and the U.S. Federal Trade Commission on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. stocks pause after five-day rally; dollar rebounds
Description: Wall Street ended little changed on Friday, taking a breather following a five-day winning streak, while the dollar rebounded against most currencies from earlier losses tied to expectations the U.S. central bank is in no hurry to raise interest rates.

Headlines: Huawei Canada executive leaves post as scrutiny of company grows
Description: One of Huawei Canada's top executives on Friday disclosed he was leaving his post after more than seven years with the Chinese telecommunications equipment maker, which is facing heightened scrutiny over security issues from Canada and its allies.

Headlines: Autostrade to pay 439 million euros for Genoa bridge recostruction: sources
Description: Autostrade per l'Italia (ASPI) has agreed to pay for the reconstruction of the collapsed Genoa bridge, Italy's Transport Minister Danilo Toninelli said on Twitter.

Headlines: Pemex's New York roadshow spooks investors, yields spike
Description: Yields on the debt of Mexican state-run oil company Pemex rose sharply this week after the company failed during presentations in New York to lay out a clear plan to reduce debt and increase output, analysts said.

Headlines: GE unit wins $450 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: GE Medical Systems Information Technologies Inc, a unit of General Electric Co, has been awarded a $450 million U.S. defense contract for patient monitoring systems, accessories and training, the Pentagon said on Friday.

Headlines: After Monsanto patent ruling, Indian farmers hope for next-gen GM seeds
Description: Monsanto's victory this week in a patent case in India regarding genetically modified (GM) cotton seeds has raised hopes among farmers that the company will now launch its next-generation seeds.

Headlines: Cheaper gasoline weighs on U.S. consumer prices in December
Description: U.S. consumer prices fell for the first time in nine months in December amid a plunge in gasoline prices, but underlying inflation pressures remained firm as rental housing and healthcare costs rose steadily.

Headlines: Nissan cancels lease on Ghosn's Tokyo apartment
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd has terminated the lease to ex-Chairman Carlos Ghosn's luxury apartment in Tokyo, Ghosn's legal team said on Friday, as the Japanese automaker cuts ties with the executive following his arrest in November.

Headlines: China and slow growth may keep the punchbowl brimming
Description: It was meant to be the first year in nearly a decade that the world's central banks took more cash out of markets than they pumped in. Instead, China -- and slowing growth elsewhere -- may ensure yet another year of positive liquidity flows.

Headlines: China's Wanda files for U.S. IPO of sports unit to raise up to $500 million: sources
Description: Chinese conglomerate Dalian Wanda Group has filed confidentially for a U.S. initial public offering of its sports unit that could fetch up to $500 million, according to sources with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: China's Geely says it has not sold Daimler shares, denies Bloomberg report
Description: China's Geely Group [GEELY.UL] said it has not sold any shares in Daimler AG , denying a Bloomberg report that the Chinese firm had slashed its 9.7 percent stake in the German carmaker by more than half.

Headlines: Impact of 'Yellow Vests' protests on French and European companies
Description: The "yellow vests" movement - named after the fluorescent jackets French motorists have to carry in their vehicles - started in mid-November as a protest against a fuel tax but has since grown into a broader backlash against President Emmanuel Macron's government.

Headlines: Nissan ex-chief Ghosn seeks bail after indictment on two new charges
Description: Nissan ex-Chairman Carlos Ghosn has requested his release on bail after being indicted in Tokyo on Friday on two new charges, his lawyers said, as the once-feted auto executive awaits a lengthy criminal trial that could be as long as six months away.

Headlines: Timeline: Debt-laden Jet Airways' rocky ride
Description: Jet Airways Ltd , India's biggest full-service carrier, has been under dark clouds for the most part of the past year, and several efforts are on to save the sinking airline.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lessors to India's troubled Jet Airways consider taking back planes -sources
Description: Crisis talks between India's cash-strapped Jet Airways Ltd and aircraft lessors have failed to ease a row over late payments, prompting some lessors to explore taking back aircraft, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: GM's Cadillac will introduce EV in fight against Tesla - sources
Description: Cadillac is expected to become General Motors Co's lead electric vehicle brand as the largest U.S. automaker gears up to introduce a new model under that luxury marquee to challenge Tesla Inc , two people briefed on the matter said Thursday.

Headlines: As world economy stumbles into 2019, eyes turn to China
Description: Ten years after China helped stave off the threat of a global depression with a huge stimulus plan, investors are looking once again toward Beijing as the world economy heads for a slowdown, or worse, in 2019.

Headlines: Ford plans to cut 1,150 jobs in Britain, Unite union says
Description: U.S. carmaker Ford plans to cut 1,150 jobs in Britain, the Unite union said on Friday, with nearly 1,000 job losses at its Bridgend engine plant in Wales.

Headlines: France's 'yellow vest' protests could shake up euro zone bond markets
Description: France's response to "yellow vest" protests could be a turning point for euro zone bond markets if it kicks off an era of increased public borrowing in the bloc and loads additional debt on to a market already nervous over the removal of ECB stimulus.

Headlines: Cramer's game plan: Entering earnings season with more risk 'than I'd like'
Description: Jim Cramer looks ahead to key events in the week ahead as earnings season begins with quarterly reports from the biggest U.S. banks.

Headlines: Nissan expands Ghosn probe to more countries, executive Munoz under scrutiny: sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd has broadened its investigation into ousted chairman Carlos Ghosn to include dealings that took place in the United States, India and Latin America, three people with knowledge of the inquiry said.

Headlines: China's premier says tax cuts support employment, economic stability
Description: China's plans for tax cuts targeting smaller companies will help to support employment and economic stability, and will expand the country's tax base over the long term, Premier Li Keqiang was quoted as saying on Saturday.

Headlines: India's online sellers to appeal against competition commission's Flipkart ruling
Description: A group representing online sellers in India will appeal against the Competition Commision of India's (CCI's) ruling in favour of Walmart-owned Flipkart, the group's lawyer Chanakya Basa said in a release on Saturday.

Headlines: OPEC is not the enemy of the U.S., UAE energy minister says
Description: Oil producer group OPEC is not the enemy of the United States, United Arab Emirates Energy Minister Suhail al-Mazrouei said on Saturday in Abu Dhabi.

Headlines: VW could face recall of more cars over emissions: report
Description: Germany's Federal Motor Transport Authority (KBA) is considering recalling more Volkswagen cars due to its emissions, scandal, the Bild am Sonntag newspaper reported on Sunday.

Headlines: German railway to propose sale of Arriva subsidiary: source
Description: German rail operator Deutsche Bahn wants to sell its Arriva international subsidiary to plug a 4 billion euro ($4.6 billion) financing gap, though Britain's looming exit from the European Union is making it hard to value the business, a source close to the plans told Reuters on Sunday.

Headlines: Israel drone maker Aeronautics gets $232 million buyout offer
Description: Israel's state-owned Rafael Advanced Defense Systems and businessman Avihai Stolero have offered to buy unmanned aerial vehicle maker Aeronautics for 850 million shekels ($232 million).

Headlines: Huawei sacks employee arrested in Poland on spying charges
Description: Chinese telecommunications equipment maker Huawei said on Saturday it had sacked an employee arrested in Poland on spying charges in a case that could intensify Western security concerns about the company.

Headlines: Saudi energy minister says no need for extraordinary OPEC meeting before April
Description: Saudi Energy Minister Khalid al-Falih said on Sunday in Abu Dhabi he saw no need for an extraordinary meeting of the Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries before April.

Headlines: DP World signs acquisition agreement for Chile port operator
Description: Major port operator DP World said on Sunday it had agreed to acquire a 71.3 percent stake in Chile's Puertos y Logistica (Pulogsa) from Minera Valparaiso and other shareholders associated with the Matte Group.

Headlines: U.S. healthcare stocks seen maintaining momentum after strong 2018
Description: One of the rare market bright spots last year, the U.S. healthcare sector remains a Wall Street darling despite a slow start to 2019.

Headlines: U.S. government shutdown holds up FAA approval of aircraft, routes
Description: Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) approval of aircraft such as Boeing's MAX and new routes like Southwest Airline Co's Hawaii launch are on hold due to the U.S. government shutdown, delaying commercial operations.

Headlines: PG&E bond prices fall, spreads widen on bankruptcy plans
Description: Bonds of PG&E Corp , owner of the biggest U.S. power utility by number of customers, plunged on Monday after the company said it is preparing to file for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection as it faces liabilities linked to wildfires in California.

Headlines: VW CEO says hopes U.S. investments help avoid tariffs against EU
Description: Volkswagen's Chief Executive Herbert Diess said an $800 million investment to build a new electric car in Chattanooga, Tennessee should help ease tensions with United States President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Doing a Buffett? Bet on S&P 500 causes flap on options market
Description: An anonymous trader caused a stir in the U.S. equity options market on Monday with a massive bet that recalled Warren Buffett's famous wager on global stocks more than a decade ago.

Headlines: PG&E prepares bankruptcy filing after California wildfires
Description: PG&E Corp , owner of the biggest U.S. power utility by customers, said on Monday it is preparing to file for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection as soon as this month amid pressure from potentially crushing liabilities linked to California's catastrophic wildfires in 2017 and 2018.

Headlines: Alaska officials probing BP oil, gas wells at Prudhoe Bay after spill
Description: Regulators in the U.S. state of Alaska will investigate all of the oil and natural gas wells operated by BP Plc at its Prudhoe Bay oil field after the release of a small amount of crude oil and gas from a well that had earlier been shut.

Headlines: FCA reviewing Italy plan after new taxes for polluting cars
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV is reviewing its investment plan for Italy after the country approved taxes on the purchase of larger gasoline and diesel cars, Chief Executive Officer Mike Manley said on Monday.

Headlines: Wells Fargo settles SEC lawsuit over Curt Schilling's 38 Studios
Description: Wells Fargo & Co agreed to settle a U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission fraud lawsuit related to a $75 million bond offering for 38 Studios Inc, a now-bankrupt video game company founded by former All-Star major league baseball pitcher Curt Schilling.

Headlines: Brazil government nominates three new Petrobras board members amid accusations of meddling
Description: Brazil's government on Monday nominated three new board members for state-owned oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA (Petrobras), amid accusations that new CEO Roberto Castello Branco was pushing to oust board members.

Headlines: China car sales hit reverse for first time since 1990s
Description: Car makers in China will face more fierce competition this year, after a tough 2018 when the world's biggest auto market contracted for the first time in more than two decades, the country's top auto industry association said on Monday.

Headlines: China's 2018 trade surplus with U.S. highest on record going back to 2006
Description: China's trade surplus with the United States rose to $323.32 billion last year, the highest on record going back to 2006, Reuters calculations based on customs data showed on Monday.

Headlines: China says biggest trade worries this year are external uncertainty, protectionism
Description: China's customs said on Monday that the biggest worry in trade this year is external uncertainty and protectionism, forecasting the country's trade growth may slow in 2019.

Headlines: CapitaLand bets on new markets with $4.4 billion Temasek real estate deal
Description: Singapore's CapitaLand is forking out S$6 billion ($4.4 billion) to scoop up logistics and industrial assets from state investor Temasek, in a deal the developer said would create Asia's largest real estate investment manager.

Headlines: China's exports shrink most in two years, raising risks to global economy
Description: China's exports unexpectedly fell the most in two years in December, while imports also contracted, pointing to further weakness in the world's second-largest economy in 2019 and deteriorating global demand.

Headlines: ACWA considers supporting solar panel manufacturing in Saudi
Description: ACWA Power is considering supporting the manufacturing of solar panels in Saudi Arabia, its chief executive said, as the power and water plants developer seeks to facilitate Saudi Arabia's plans to develop its renewable power industry.

Headlines: UnitedHealth profit beats expectations, shares rise
Description: UnitedHealth Group Inc , the largest U.S. health insurer, beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Tuesday, driven largely by growth in its Optum services business, including its pharmacy benefits unit.

Headlines: Apollo Global nears deal to buy Arconic for more than $10 billion: WSJ
Description: Apollo Global Management LLC is nearing a deal to buy U.S. aluminum products maker Arconic Inc for more than $10 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler looking at options to plug hole in its truck lineup: CEO
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV Chief Executive Mike Manley told Reuters on Tuesday he is open to partnerships to develop a new midsize pickup truck the automaker could sell in Latin America and other markets outside the United States to compete with models such as Ford Motor Co's Thailand-built Ranger.

Headlines: U.S. charges hackers, traders with stealing SEC filings
Description: U.S. authorities on Tuesday charged a suspected Ukrainian computer hacker and several traders with scheming to trade on market-moving corporate earnings news stolen from a U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission database.

Headlines: Weak U.S. producer prices support tame inflation picture
Description: U.S. producer prices dropped by the most in more than two years in December as the cost of energy products and trade services fell, adding to signs of tame inflation that may allow the Federal Reserve to be patient about raising interest rates this year.

Headlines: Ex-Barclays trio 'cheated global financial system', Euribor trial told
Description: Three former Barclays bankers cheated the global financial system to gain an unfair edge over counterparties in a five-year plot to rig Euribor interest rates, a London prosecutor alleged on Tuesday.

Headlines: Petrobras board nominee fined in 2016 for insider trading: documents
Description: One of three new board members nominated by Brazil's government to sit on the board of state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA was fined in 2016 by securities regulator CVM for insider trading, according to CVM documents on the ruling seen by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. holiday shoppers spend record $126 billion online: Adobe
Description: U.S. shoppers spent a record $126 billion on online shopping during the 2018 holiday season, taking advantage of early discounts on Amazon.com and other websites and with more people using smartphones to place their orders, Adobe Analytics said on Tuesday.

Headlines: German court throws out Qualcomm's latest patent case against Apple
Description: A patent lawsuit filed by Qualcomm Inc against Apple Inc was thrown out by a German court on Tuesday, in a reversal for the U.S. chipmaker after it won a recent court ban on the sale of some iPhones in the country.

Headlines: China signals more stimulus as economic slowdown deepens
Description: China on Tuesday signaled more stimulus measures in the near term as a tariff war with the United States took a heavy toll on its trade sector and raised the risk of a sharper economic slowdown.

Headlines: Shoe retailer Payless to explore options, including sale: sources
Description: U.S. discount retailer Payless ShoeSource Inc has hired an adviser to help evaluate strategic alternatives, including a sale or restructuring, less than 18 months after it emerged from bankruptcy, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Brighter future for sterling seen if no-deal Brexit is averted
Description: Britain's plans to leave the European Union could be thrown into disarray by a vote in parliament later on Tuesday but bets are mounting that a chaotic no-deal Brexit can be avoided and that sterling will rise from here.

Headlines: Oil rises about 3 percent on economic stability hopes
Description: Oil prices rose about 3 percent on Tuesday, along with world stock markets, supported by China's plan to introduce policies to stabilize a slowing economy, reversing the previous session's losses due to grim data in the world's second-largest economy.

Headlines: Best U.S. fund managers of '18 buying healthcare, pot stocks as market wobbles
Description: The top-performing U.S. growth fund managers of the last year are taking the recent slide in the U.S. stock market to add to their bets in companies they expect will continue to expand regardless of the direction of the overall economy.

Headlines: Sears chairman's takeover proposal faces moment of truth
Description: Negotiations between Sears Holdings Corp Chairman Eddie Lampert and the bankrupt U.S. department store operator approached a resolution late on Tuesday as the billionaire hedge fund manager faced the choice of improving his $5 billion offer for the company or ending his takeover plans, people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Verizon deepens ties with Apple, offers free Apple Music to some U.S. customers
Description: Verizon Communications Inc said on Tuesday it will include free Apple Music subscriptions in some of its top-tier U.S. data plans, deepening its ties with the iPhone maker.

Headlines: United profit beats forecasts as new flights from hubs pay off
Description: United Airlines on Tuesday reported a fourth-quarter profit that easily beat Wall Street forecasts, sending shares higher, as the No. 3 U.S. carrier scheduled more flights out of its hubs and won back customers after a series of public relations disasters.

Headlines: Ralph Winter office to invest $300 million in Medici U.S. shared housing
Description: Medici Living Group said on Tuesday the family office of German real estate investor Ralph Winter has agreed to invest $300 million over three years to develop 1,300 U.S. units of Medici's Quarters brand of shared housing for young professionals.

Headlines: As loans and revenue shrink, Wells Fargo leans on cost cuts
Description: Wells Fargo & Co's loan book shrank and revenue fell across all its major businesses last quarter, as the fourth-largest U.S. lender continued to work through the consequences of wayward sales practices at its consumer bank.

Headlines: Netflix raises prices for U.S. subscribers
Description: Netflix Inc is raising monthly fees for its U.S. subscribers by between 13 percent and 18 percent, the video streaming pioneer's first price increase since 2017 as it spends heavily on original content and international expansion.

Headlines: Global auto leaders urge Trump administration to end trade turmoil
Description: Auto executives gathered in Detroit on Monday called on the Trump administration and Congress to resolve trade disputes, and end the government shutdown, saying political uncertainty is costing the industry.

Headlines: U.S. investigating Huawei for alleged trade secret theft: WSJ
Description: Federal prosecutors are investigating Huawei Technologies[HWT.UL], the world's largest telecommunications equipment maker, for allegedly stealing trade secrets from U.S. businesses and could soon issue an indictment, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump 'inclined' to impose new U.S. auto tariffs: senator
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is likely to move ahead with tariffs on imported vehicles, a move that could prompt the European Union to agree a new trade deal, said Senate Finance Committee Chairman Charles Grassley on Wednesday.

Headlines: Sears chairman prevails in bankruptcy auction for retailer with $5.2 billion bid: sources
Description: Sears Holdings Corp Chairman Eddie Lampert prevailed in a bankruptcy auction for the U.S. department store chain with an improved takeover bid of roughly $5.2 billion, allowing the 126-year-old retailer to keep its doors open, people familiar with the matter said Wednesday.

Headlines: In Papua New Guinea, Exxon's giant LNG project fuels frustration
Description: From her red-roofed home near Papua New Guinea's capital of Port Moresby, Isabelle Dikana Iveiri overlooks a giant plant used by Exxon Mobil Corp to liquefy billions of dollars' worth of natural gas before it is shipped to Asian buyers.

Headlines: Hyundai, Kia issue new U.S. recall of 168,000 vehicles for fire risks
Description: Hyundai Motor Co and affiliate Kia Motors Corp said on Wednesday they will recall about 168,000 U.S. vehicles at risk of fuel leaks, after recalling them in 2017 for engine fire risks, and will offer software upgrades for 3.7 million vehicles.

Headlines: Oil gains with Wall Street, but rising U.S. fuel stocks weigh
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Wednesday, buoyed by a U.S. equity market rally and a supply cut agreement by OPEC+, but gains were limited by data showing growing U.S. refined product inventories and record crude production.

Headlines: Exclusive: ADM CEO says wrong time for 'monster' acquisitions
Description: U.S. grain merchant Archer Daniels Midland Co (ADM) has looked at buying rivals including Bunge Ltd. and dozens of other companies but decided the time is not right for "monster" acquisitions, the company's chief executive told Reuters.

Headlines: On the autofarm: China turns to driverless tractors, combines to overhaul agriculture
Description: A brand new combine harvester buzzes up and down a field in eastern China without a driver on board, chopping golden rice stalks and offering a glimpse of what authorities say is the automated future of the nation's mammoth agricultural sector.

Headlines: China posts scant rise in outbound investment in 2018 amid outflow curbs
Description: China's overseas investment rose only marginally in 2018 as the yuan weakened and regulators cracked down on deals that were suspected to be skirting controls on moving money out of the country.

Headlines: China must prepare for economic difficulties in 2019: premier
Description: China must prepare for difficulties this year as the economy faces increasing pressure, state radio on Wednesday quoted Premier Li Keqiang as saying.

Headlines: China central bank's record $83 billion injection heightens worries over ailing economy
Description: China's central bank injected a record $83 billion into the country's financial system on Wednesday, seeking to avoid a cash crunch that would put further pressure on the weakening economy.

Headlines: EU court paves way for $2 billion UPS claim as annuls TNT bid veto
Description: Europe's top court opened the way to a $2 billion damages claim by U.S. delivery company UPS on Wednesday by annulling a 2013 decision to stop it buying Dutch firm TNT Express.

Headlines: McDonald's loses 'Big Mac' trademark case to Irish chain Supermac's
Description: McDonald's Corp has lost its rights to the trademark "Big Mac" in a European Union case ruling in favor of Ireland-based fast-food chain Supermac's, according to a decision by European regulators.

Headlines: U.S. start-up CommonGrounds raises $100 million, unveils 'hackable' shared office
Description: CommonGrounds, a California start-up trying to carve out a niche in the crowded flexible workspace sector with movable office walls, has raised $100 million from three investors, including the Emirati developer of Dubai's Burj Khalifa, the world's tallest skyscraper.

Headlines: London taxi maker names former Audi executive as new CEO
Description: The London Electric Vehicle Company (LEVC), which makes the city's popular black taxis, named former Audi executive Joerg Hofmann as its new chief executive, succeeding Chris Gubbey who will step down next month.

Headlines: U.S. automakers push for deal on fuel efficiency rules
Description: Executives at the major U.S. automakers are pressing the Trump administration and California to agree on standards for fuel efficiency and carbon emissions through 2025, as risks increase that a deadline for setting national standards will pass without a deal.

Headlines: Ford and IBM among quartet in Congo cobalt blockchain project
Description: Carmaker Ford , technology giant IBM , South Korean cathode maker LG Chem and China's Huayou Cobalt have joined forces in the first blockchain project to monitor cobalt supplies from Democratic Republic of Congo.

Headlines: GM's Washington charm offensive sidelined by Wall Street's push for profit
Description: General Motors code named its November announcement to cut nearly 15,000 jobs in North America and restructure itself "Turbo," suggesting a leaner approach for the largest U.S. automaker would "accelerate its transformation."

Headlines: Better later: FX options signal more pound strength on Brexit delay signs
Description: Hard Brexit, soft Brexit, no Brexit - or maybe just later Brexit?

Headlines: Ford sees weaker-than-expected fourth quarter, uncertainty in 2019
Description: Ford Motor Co forecast a weaker-than-expected fourth quarter profit and provided a cloudier 2019 outlook due to tariff costs and uncertainty over Britain's exit from the European Union, sending shares down more than 3.5 percent on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. import prices fall; year-on-year drop largest since 2016
Description: U.S. import prices fell for a second straight month in December as the cost of petroleum products tumbled and a strong dollar curbed prices of other goods, leading to the largest year-on-year drop in more than two years.

Headlines: Indian air safety watchdog orders extra checks on planes with Pratt & Whitney engines
Description: India's air safety watchdog on Thursday directed airlines to make extra checks on their Airbus A320neo aircraft fitted with Pratt & Whitney engines as part of new safety protocols after temporary grounding orders affected the planes last year.

Headlines: Trump tariffs force tough choices at U.S. auto suppliers
Description: Bob Roth makes no bones about his feelings towards U.S. manufacturing.

Headlines: Hitachi halts UK nuclear project as energy supply crunch looms
Description: Japan's Hitachi Ltd put a $28 billion nuclear power project in Britain on hold on Thursday, dealing a blow to the country's plans for the replacement of aging plants.

Headlines: Exclusive: British Lotus cars to be 'Made in China' at new Geely plant: documents
Description: The Chinese owner of Lotus plans to start producing the British sports car brand in China for the first time with the opening of a new 9 billion yuan ($1.3 billion) factory in Wuhan city, company job advertisements and government documents showed.

Headlines: Walmart partners with four more grocery delivery companies
Description: Walmart Inc said on Thursday it has partnered with another four companies as part of its goal of offering grocery home delivery in more than 100 U.S. cities.

Headlines: U.S. legislation steps up pressure on Huawei and ZTE, China calls it 'hysteria'
Description: A bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers introduced bills on Wednesday that would ban the sale of U.S. chips or other components to Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], ZTE Corp or other Chinese telecommunications companies that violate U.S. sanctions or export control laws.

Headlines: Renault executives, French government officials to meet Nissan CEO: Nikkei
Description: Renault executives and French government officials were planning to meet Nissan CEO Hiroto Saikawa in Japan on Thursday, Japanese media said, as the automakers consider their partnership in the wake of alliance Chairman Carlos Ghosn's arrest.

Headlines: Siemens rules out further concessions to get Alstom deal approval: sources
Description: Siemens will not make further concessions to save a rail merger deal with France's Alstom even after European competition authorities demanded further concessions, sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Nissan to lay off 700 contract workers in Mississippi
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd's U.S. arm said on Thursday it plans to lay off up to 700 contract workers at its Mississippi assembly plant, citing slowing sales of its vans and Titan pickup trucks.

Headlines: U.S. grand jury indicts four Audi managers in VW emissions probe
Description: A federal grand jury in Detroit on Thursday indicted four managers at Volkswagen AG's luxury Audi unit as part of the U.S. government's investigation into the German automaker's diesel emissions cheating scandal, according to court documents.

Headlines: Fossil to sell smartwatch technology worth $40 million to Google, shares rise
Description: Fossil Group Inc said on Thursday it would sell its intellectual property related to a smartwatch technology currently under development to Alphabet Inc's Google for $40 million, sending the watchmaker's shares up as much as 11 percent.

Headlines: American Express misses estimates on slowing customer spending; shares drop
Description: American Express Co missed Wall Street's fourth-quarter profit estimates on Thursday, as the rate of customer spending slowed despite a strong U.S. holiday sales season.

Headlines: Stocks rise on trade optimism, pound strengthens
Description: Global stock indexes rose on Thursday as optimism over a resolution to the trade war between the United States and China lifted sentiment, while sterling strengthened amid hopes of a second referendum on Britain's membership in the European Union.

Headlines: Lampert wins Sears bankruptcy auction with $5.2 billion bid
Description: Sears Holdings Corp Chairman Eddie Lampert won a bankruptcy auction to buy the once iconic U.S. retailer after presenting an improved offer of $5.2 billion, Sears said on Thursday, but creditors quickly moved to oppose the deal.

Headlines: Trading operations stung banks in fourth quarter but dovish Fed fuels hope
Description: Big trading operations were a thorn in the side of the top U.S. banks in the fourth quarter as fears about global growth sent credit markets into a tailspin, but a "dovish" turn from the Federal Reserve may mean the drama is over for now.

Headlines: Hitachi debacle strengthens Franco-Chinese hand in UK nuclear
Description: Hitachi's decision to freeze its $28 billion nuclear power project in Britain strengthens the hand of France's EDF and its Chinese partner in talks with the government on how to finance new reactors.

Headlines: India's Sun Pharma asks regulator to examine media report
Description: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd on Friday asked India's capital markets regulator to look into a media report about an alleged complaint by a whistleblower that led to a sell-off in the company's shares.

Headlines: Avianca Brasil's legal fight with plane leasing firms escalates
Description: Avianca Brasil's battle with its aircraft leasing firms intensified on Friday after Brazil's aviation regulator said it would no longer ground 10 of the struggling carrier's planes and another lessor renewed its effort to repossess 10 others.

Headlines: Luxury online reseller The RealReal in talks with banks for IPO: sources
Description: U.S. online luxury reseller The RealReal Inc is talking to investment banks about the possibility of an initial public offering (IPO) later this year, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: FedEx to take up to $575 million charge as it starts voluntary buyouts
Description: FedEx Corp said on Friday it could take as much as $575 million in charges as it began offering voluntary cash buyouts to certain U.S-based employees in a bid to reduce costs.

Headlines: Fed's Brainard sees mounting negative risks for U.S. economy
Description: Federal Reserve Governor Lael Brainard on Friday became the latest U.S. central banker to worry publicly about rising risks for the U.S. economy, suggesting she could embrace a pause on raising interest rates that has won support among most of her peers.

Headlines: Fed policymakers leave little doubt: Rate hikes can wait
Description: "Patience" is the new mantra at the Federal Reserve, less than two weeks ahead of the U.S. central bank's first policy meeting of the new year, as officials leave little doubt they want to stop raising interest rates - at least for a while.

Headlines: U.S. regulators discuss fining Facebook for privacy violations: report
Description: U.S. regulators have met to discuss imposing a fine against Facebook Inc for violating a legally binding agreement with the government to protect the privacy of personal data, the Washington Post reported on Friday, citing three people familiar with the discussions.

Headlines: PBGC steps in to oversee Sears' two pension plans
Description: Pension Benefit Guaranty Corp (PBGC) is taking steps to assume responsibility for bankrupt retailer Sears Holdings Corp's two pension plans, covering about 90,000 people, the U.S. government agency said on Friday.

Headlines: White House adviser Kudlow says making progress on China trade talks
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday that the United States and China were making progress on trade negotiations but reaching a deal would take time.

Headlines: Three named to En+ voting trust as Deripaska looks to reduce stakes
Description: Russian conglomerate En+ Group on Friday named three Americans who will form a voting trust to help Oleg Deripaska reduce his stake in the company in exchange for a waiver from U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: Exclusive: BlackRock, Goldman to move some fund managers to U.S. if no-deal Brexit - sources
Description: BlackRock and Goldman Sachs Asset Management both plan to temporarily move some British-based fund managers to New York in the event of a no-deal Brexit, two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Facebook sheds gains after report on potential major fine
Description: ** Shares of Facebook paring gains on Friday after a report that U.S. regulators discussed fining the co for privacy violations

Headlines: Shutdown clouds outlook for consumer-driven U.S. economic growth
Description: After tax cuts, rising incomes and buoyant stock markets set off a consumer boom in 2018, signs are emerging that the main engine of U.S. economic growth could sputter, and a record-long government shutdown further muddies the waters.

Headlines: Malaysia open to talks if Goldman pays $7.5 billion, minister says
Description: Malaysia's finance minister said on Friday the government would be ready to discuss dropping criminal charges against Goldman Sachs linked to the 1MDB scandal if the bank pays $7.5 billion in reparations.

Headlines: U.S. crude gains, slowing global economy challenge oil market in 2019: IEA
Description: U.S. oil production growth combined with a slowing global economy will put oil prices under downward pressure in 2019, challenging OPEC's resolve to support the market with output cuts, the International Energy Agency said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump-Deutsche Bank links in sights of U.S. House investigators
Description: Democrats now in control of the U.S. House of Representatives are working out which House panels will take the lead in investigating President Donald Trump's business ties to Deutsche Bank, lawmakers and aides familiar with the plans told Reuters.

Headlines: Murdoch seeks permission to merge UK's Times and Sunday Times
Description: Rupert Murdoch's London-based newspapers The Times and Sunday Times have asked the British government for permission to share resources across both titles, a move that is barred under rules imposed when the media mogul bought both newspapers in 1981.

Headlines: Volkswagen mulls extending diesel incentives across Germany
Description: German carmaker Volkswagen is examining whether to extend trade-in incentives to owners of older vehicles in all of Germany, extending the program beyond the 15 most heavily polluted cities, a spokesman said on Friday.

Headlines: Trian to skip PPG board challenge after new commitments: sources
Description: Trian Fund Management LP will not challenge PPG Industries Inc's board of directors at its 2019 shareholder meeting after the U.S. paints and coatings company met some of the activist hedge fund's demands and announced new financial targets, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Brazil aviation regulator will no longer ground 10 Avianca Brasil planes
Description: Brazil's aviation regulator ANAC said on Friday it would no longer ground 10 planes operated by Avianca Brasil, which represented 20 percent of the struggling carrier's fleet.

Headlines: U.S. consumer sentiment at two-year low, manufacturing rebounds
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment tumbled in early January to its lowest level since President Donald Trump was elected more than two years ago as an ongoing partial shutdown of the federal government and financial market volatility stoked fears of a sharp deceleration in economic growth.

Headlines: Foxconn cuts 50,000 contract jobs in China: Nikkei
Description: Apple Inc's biggest iPhone assembler Foxconn Technology Group has let go around 50,000 contract workers in China since October, months earlier than normal, Nikkei reported on Friday.

Headlines: Paris informs Tokyo it wants Renault and Nissan to integrate: Nikkei
Description: A French government delegation has informed Tokyo that it would seek an integration of Renault and Nissan , most likely under the umbrella of a single holding company, the Nikkei reported on Sunday.

Headlines: GM warns workers in Brazil on losses, tough turnaround plan
Description: General Motors Co has warned employees in Brazil that new investments there depend on a painful plan to return to profit in the country, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Saturday.

Headlines: EU must approve Siemens/Alstom deal, says French finance minister
Description: The European Union must approve the tie-up between Germany's Siemens and French group Alstom , said French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire, who added he would meet a main European regulator to express his support for the deal.

Headlines: Eurotunnel boss says a second referendum would still back Brexit
Description: Britons would back Brexit again if asked to vote in a second referendum, the head of Eurotunnel said on Sunday.

Headlines: China's December property investment slows in sign of fatigue for key GDP driver
Description: Growth in property investment in China cooled to the second slowest pace in 2018 in December, adding to signs of a further slackening in the real estate market in a blow to a key driver economic growth.

Headlines: China December aluminum production surges to record monthly high
Description: China's primary aluminum output defied low prices to rise for a second straight month to a record high in December as falling alumina costs boosted margins, while 2018 annual output was also a record, official data showed on Monday.

Headlines: China should boost banks' active support for economy: central bank official
Description: Encouraging China's banks to actively increase support for the real economy, rather than relying on authorities' orders to boost lending, is the key to improving the supply of credit in the economy, a central bank official said on Monday.

Headlines: China has ample room for macro policy support - statistics bureau chief
Description: China has ample room for macro policy support, Ning Jizhe, head of the National Bureau of Statistics said on Monday, after the world's second-largest economy grew at the slowest pace since the global financial crisis in the fourth quarter of 2018.

Headlines: India's SBI says lenders awaiting SEBI decision on Etihad offer for Jet Airways: paper
Description: The State Bank of India (SBI)-led consortium of lenders is waiting for India’s capital markets regulator to decide on a bailout offer by Etihad Airways for the financially stressed Jet Airways , SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar said, the Business Standard reported on Saturday.

Headlines: China's 2018 oil refinery output, December gas production hit records
Description: Chinese oil refiners raised their output to a record in 2018, led by state-run oil majors which maximized operations on firm profit-margins and private refiners which increased processing after being granted higher crude import quotas.

Headlines: China December coal output rises about 2 percent to highest in over three years
Description: China's December coal output climbed 2.1 percent from the year before, government data showed, hitting the highest level in at least three years as major producers ramped up production amid robust winter demand and after the country started up new mines.

Headlines: ProSieben sees pressure easing as Netflix raises prices
Description: ProSiebenSat.1 Media believes that price increases by U.S. streaming giant Netflix could ease competitive pressures on the German group's core TV business and is bullish on growth at its e-commerce arm, CEO Max Conze said.

Headlines: Berkshire denies media report on accord to extract lithium
Description: A unit of Berkshire Hathaway Inc denied a report on Sunday that it reached an agreement to allow extraction of lithium from its geothermal wells in California, a project that could offer U.S. carmakers and battery producers a secure supply of the metal.

Headlines: China's survey-based jobless rate up to 4.9 percent in December
Description: China's survey-based jobless rate was 4.9 percent at the end of December, the statistics bureau said on Monday, slightly up from 4.8 percent in November.

Headlines: China December daily crude steel output at lowest since March
Description: China's average daily steel output in December hit its lowest level since March, according to Reuters calculations based on official data, as producers cut output amid shrinking profit-margins.

Headlines: Australian economy to be slowed, not sunk, by headwinds: Reuters poll
Description: Analysts have trimmed forecasts for Australian economic growth following some disappointing numbers last year, but still tip solid outcomes ahead even in the face of falling house prices and a slowdown in China.

Headlines: Oil edges up as investors latch on to OPEC cuts, supply outlook
Description: Oil prices edged up on Monday, reversing earlier losses, as investors shrugged off data that confirmed China's economic growth is cooling and instead latched on to positive supply-side drivers for the market.

Headlines: Japan firms wary of boosting investment amid intensifying trade war: Reuters poll
Description: Over a third of Japanese firms aim to raise capital expenditure in the fiscal year starting April, with many others worried about the impact on spending plans of a trade war between major markets China and the United States, a Reuters survey showed.

Headlines: Nissan's Ghosn offers to wear electronic ankle tag to get bail
Description: Ousted Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn has offered to wear an electronic ankle tag and hire guards to monitor him in an unusual bid to secure his release on bail after two months of detention in Japan for alleged financial crimes.

Headlines: Nissan's Ghosn offers to wear electronic ankle tag for bail
Description: Ousted Nissan Motor Co Chairman Carlos Ghosn has offered to wear an electronic ankle tag and hire guards to monitor him in an unusual bid to secure his release on bail after two months of detention in Japan for alleged financial crimes.

Headlines: Western Australia claims BHP owes up to $215 million in underpaid iron ore royalties
Description: The state of Western Australia said on Monday an audit had found global miner BHP Group underpaid royalties on iron ore shipments sold via its Singapore marketing hub stretching back over more than a decade.

Headlines: Nippon Life president says actively exploring M&A in U.S.
Description: Nippon Life Insurance Co is actively seeking mergers and acquisitions overseas, with a focus on the United States and Asia's emerging economies, the president of Japan's largest life insurer said on Monday.

Headlines: Detained ex-Nissan chairman Ghosn offers stock, passports for bail
Description: Ousted Nissan Motor Co chairman Carlos Ghosn has offered to post stock he owns in the automaker as collateral, surrender his passports and submit to electronic tracking as part of a renewed effort to persuade a Tokyo court to grant him bail while he awaits trial on charges of financial misconduct, a spokeswoman for the car executive said.

Headlines: Data dependent? Five questions for the ECB
Description: The European Central Bank holds its first meeting of the year on Thursday as concern grows about weak economic growth at home and risks abroad from global trade tensions and Brexit.

Headlines: German economy minister: Must do everything to support Siemens, Alstom train merger
Description: Germany's Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Monday that he was in favor of a planned train merger between Siemens and Alstom and would do its utmost to support it.

Headlines: Global FDI skids 19 percent on Trump tax reform, may rebound in 2019 - U.N.
Description: Global foreign direct investment (FDI) fell 19 percent last year to an estimated $1.2 trillion, largely caused by U.S. President Donald Trump's tax reforms, the United Nations trade and development agency UNCTAD said on Monday.

Headlines: China's Huawei in unprecedented media blitz as it battles heightened scrutiny
Description: China's Huawei has launched an unprecedented public relations blitz, thrusting its low-key founder in front of international media as the telecoms firm seeks to ease concern among Western nations bent on shutting it out of their markets.

Headlines: Sparkling Australian wine exports lose their fizz as Chinese economy slows
Description: Australian wine shipments to China grew at their slowest pace in four years in 2018, industry data showed on Tuesday, in another indication that Sino-U.S. trade tensions were dragging on consumer spending in the world's second-largest economy.

Headlines: Lockheed sees potential exports of 200 F-16 jets from proposed Indian plant
Description: Lockheed Martin sees a potential export market of more than $20 billion for its F-16 fighter aircraft from an assembly line in India it has offered to set up in order to win a large Indian military order, a top executive said.

Headlines: Xi keeps China on high alert for 'black swan' events: Xinhua
Description: China must be on guard against "black swan" risks while fending off "gray rhino" events, President Xi Jinping said on Monday, adding that the economy faces deep and complicated changes, state news agency Xinhua reported.

Headlines: Explainer: The shareholder puzzle facing airlines after Brexit
Description: Airlines that will no longer be majority owned by EU nationals once Britain leaves the European Union face the threat of losing their right to fly within the bloc after Brexit due to share ownership rules.

Headlines: Exclusive: No-deal Brexit puts Bentley's return to profit at risk
Description: Loss-making carmaker Bentley is on track to be profitable this year but a no-deal Brexit puts that at "fundamental risk", its boss told Reuters, adding that the chance of Britain leaving the EU on March 29 with a deal now seemed "fairly low."

Headlines: Canada has not asked U.S. to drop case of Huawei's Meng: Freeland
Description: Canada has not asked the United States to abandon its bid to have Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou extradited, Canada's Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Tuesday in an interview with Bloomberg TV.

Headlines: U.S. to pursue extradition of Huawei CFO from Canada
Description: The U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday that it will pursue the extradition of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's [HWT.UL] chief financial officer, arrested in Canada in December on allegations that she participated in a conspiracy to defraud banks.

Headlines: PG&E shares surge as company secures $5.5 billion in bankruptcy financing
Description: U.S. power producer PG&E Corp's shares surged as much as 16 percent on Tuesday after it said it had secured $5.5 billion in debtor-in-possession (DIP) financing from four banks as it prepares to file for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: Renault convenes board to turn page on Ghosn era
Description: Renault has called a board meeting to replace Chairman and Chief Executive Carlos Ghosn, in a move that may begin to ease tensions with alliance partner Nissan in the wake of Ghosn's arrest in Japan for alleged financial misconduct.

Headlines: U.S. home sales hit three-year low, prices rise slowly
Description: U.S. home sales tumbled to their lowest level in three years in December and house price increases slowed sharply, suggesting a further loss of momentum in the housing market.

Headlines: Wall Street drops as economic outlook, corporate forecasts sour
Description: U.S. stocks ended lower on Tuesday, snapping a four-session rally, as a gloomy global economic growth outlook, trade concerns and disappointing company forecasts dampened sentiment.

Headlines: BAE Systems wins $474 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: BAE Systems PLC has been awarded a $474 million U.S. defense contract for technical and maintenance support for the M109 family of vehicles, the Pentagon said on Tuesday.

Headlines: BlackRock plans environmentally conscious money market fund
Description: BlackRock Inc is planning a new fund for investors looking to park their cash safely while helping the environment, expanding options for "socially responsible" investments, a filing with U.S. market regulators showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: GM, facing losses in Brazil, seeks tax breaks in Sao Paulo state
Description: General Motors Co's Brazil unit is in advanced talks with Sao Paulo state to receive tax incentives, the company told public officials and union representatives at a meeting on Tuesday, a few days after telling workers in a memo that it was losing money in the country.

Headlines: KPMG subject of second UK investigation over Carillion audit
Description: Britain's Financial Reporting Council (FRC) has opened a second investigation into how accounting firm KPMG audited the books of collapsed UK construction company Carillion, the watchdog said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tokyo court denies latest bail request of Nissan's Ghosn
Description: Carlos Ghosn's latest request for bail was rejected by a Tokyo court on Tuesday, despite the ousted Nissan chairman offering to wear an electronic ankle tag in an unusual bid to win release after two months of detention for alleged financial crimes.

Headlines: China's growth slowed by service, farm sectors, despite construction rebound
Description: Weakness in the service and farm sectors slowed China's economic growth in the fourth quarter, despite a strong pickup in construction activity, official data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: UBS won't take lead in consolidating European bank sector: Weber
Description: Switzerland's UBS Group will not take the lead in consolidating a fragmented European bank sector, Chairman Axel Weber said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Verdi union speaks out against any Deutsche Bank, Commerzbank merger
Description: Germany's Verdi labor union on Tuesday voiced concern over any possible merger between Germany's largest banks – Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank .

Headlines: In Versailles, Macron vows to reform to avoid king's fate
Description: President Emmanuel Macron told dozens of the world's most powerful executives on Monday that he would not follow the path of guillotined French royals and would continue to reform the French economy despite a sometimes violent popular revolt.

Headlines: Brazil investor group to file lawsuit against Boeing-Embraer deal
Description: Brazilian investors’ association Abradin said it would file a lawsuit claiming a proposed tie-up between U.S. planemaker Boeing Co and Embraer SA should come with a public tender offer, escalating its fight against the proposed deal.

Headlines: J&J forecasts disappointing 2019 sales, defends talc safety
Description: Johnson & Johnson on Tuesday forecast 2019 sales that fell short of analysts' estimates and said it expected further pressure on U.S. prescription drug prices, weighing on the broader pharmaceutical sector.

Headlines: Brazil's Bolsonaro uses Davos speech to appeal to big business
Description: Brazil's new right-wing President Jair Bolsonaro threw out the welcome mat for big business and foreign investors on Tuesday, telling a summit of CEOs in Davos that his government would make the country one of the top 50 in which to do business.

Headlines: China's slowing growth improves the chances for an 'advantageous' trade deal: Jim Cramer
Description: Jim Cramer argues that China's economic weakness raises the odds for a U.S.-China trade resolution.

Headlines: Explainer: What happens next in Huawei CFO Meng's case?
Description: The U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday it will pursue the extradition of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's [HWT.UL] Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou, arrested in Canada in December on allegations she participated in a conspiracy to defraud banks.

Headlines: J&J, U.S. states settle hip implant claims for $120 million
Description: Johnson & Johnson and its DePuy Orthopaedics unit have agreed to pay $120 million to resolve deceptive marketing claims by several U.S. states over the company's metal-on-metal hip implants.

Headlines: EnBW open to partnerships in U.S. offshore wind expansion
Description: German utility EnBW could seek more partners in its planned push into the burgeoning U.S. offshore wind sector, its chief executive said.

Headlines: As Google races ahead, German carmakers look to go faster on autonomous driving
Description: Germany's top carmakers including BMW and Volkswagen are looking at ways to speed up development of the next generation of self-driving cars, possibly by even working together, as tech giant Google forges ahead with plans to mass produce such vehicles.

Headlines: U.S. airlines tap army helicopter pilots to ease shortage
Description: U.S. Army pilot Shaun Perez spent ten hours flying an Apache helicopter over Afghanistan, providing gun cover for Special Forces soldiers on the ground as they hunted for high-value targets, guns and weapons.

Headlines: General Electric to cut close to 470 jobs in France: unions
Description: General Electric , which bought Alstom's energy business in 2015, aims to slash close to 470 jobs across the division in France in the face of falling orders worldwide, unions said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Amazon spends company record on U.S. lobbying in 2018: filing
Description: Amazon.com Inc spent $14.19 million on lobbying the U.S. government in 2018, according to a regulatory filing, beating its year-ago record, as large U.S. technology companies pushed back on issues such as privacy, immigration and new tariffs.

Headlines: Blank-check company IPOs moving ahead despite U.S. government shutdown
Description: A corner of the market for initial public offerings is evading the freeze on stock market flotations inflicted by the U.S. government shutdown, putting the spotlight on listings that usually stay under most investors' radar.

Headlines: Lawyers suing Fiat Chrysler in U.S. diesel case seek over $100 million
Description: Lawyers representing owners of Fiat Chrysler diesel vehicles told a U.S. judge they are seeking up to $106.5 million in legal fees and out-of-pocket costs in connection with a settlement over excess vehicle emissions, but they are in talks to finalize the amount, officials said Wednesday.

Headlines: Renault board meets to choose successor to Ghosn
Description: Renault's board will meet on Thursday to replace Chairman and Chief Executive Carlos Ghosn, in a move that could help ease tensions with alliance partner Nissan following Ghosn's arrest in Japan for alleged financial misconduct.

Headlines: Stocks seesaw, dollar off; global, U.S. worries weigh
Description: The MSCI global stock index ended Wednesday's choppy trading session with a small gain as worries over U.S. politics, global economic growth and trade tensions were countered by a boost from quarterly earnings reports.

Headlines: Citadel's Griffin buys New York condo for record $238 million
Description: Ken Griffin, the billionaire founder of hedge fund Citadel, has paid $238 million for a penthouse condominium overlooking Manhattan's Central Park, a spokesman for Griffin said on Wednesday, in a deal that sets a record for a U.S. home sale.

Headlines: Microsoft says Bing inaccessible in China
Description: Microsoft Corp's Bing search engine is currently inaccessible in China and the company is exploring its next steps, a company spokesperson said in a statement.

Headlines: CEOs sour on Trump policies, warn they hurt business, investment
Description: From centre-stage in Davos last year, President Donald Trump told the world's corporate bosses that America is a great place to invest. It hasn't quite turned out that way.

Headlines: Boeing says prolonged government shutdown could hurt business: CNBC
Description: Boeing Co has warned that a prolonged U.S. government shutdown could hurt its business as well as the broader aviation industry, CNBC reported on Wednesday, citing an emailed statement from the plane-maker.

Headlines: Wall Street edges higher as upbeat earnings dampened by trade, shutdown woes
Description: Wall Street ended slightly higher on Wednesday after a spate of upbeat earnings reports, but lingering concerns about trade tensions and the longest U.S. government shutdown ever limited the advance.

Headlines: China says will step up fiscal spending this year to support economy
Description: China will step up fiscal spending this year to support its economy, focusing on further cuts in taxes and fees for small firms, finance ministry officials said on Wednesday.

Headlines: PG&E expects capital spending of about $6.6 billion in 2019
Description: U.S. power company PG&E Corp said http://bit.ly/2T5NcbG on Wednesday it expected capital expenses of about $6.6 billion in 2019 and $6.9 billion in 2020.

Headlines: Volvo recalls over 200,000 cars to fix fuel leak issue
Description: Volvo Cars, which is owned by China's Zhejiang Geely Holding Group [GEELY.UL], is voluntarily recalling about 200,000 cars after it found an engineering issue that could potentially cause fuel leakage in the engine compartment over time.

Headlines: Subaru halts bulk of global car output over part defect
Description: Subaru Corp said its sole car factory in Japan, accounting for roughly 60 percent of global production, could be out of action for almost two weeks after it discovered a suspected defect in a power-steering component.

Headlines: U.S. bank Citi to shrink Russia branch network, but expects to do more business
Description: The Russian arm of U.S. bank Citi said on Wednesday it planned to reduce the number of its offices in the country, but expected to do more business this year.

Headlines: Chip results augur more tech gloom as slowing China weighs
Description: Somber results from chipmakers SK Hynix Inc and Texas Instruments Inc , on the heels of warnings from tech behemoths Samsung and Apple, indicate more gloom for the sector as China's economy slows to its weakest in decades.

Headlines: Saudis to Davos: Move on from Khashoggi, let's do business
Description: If you somehow missed the news about the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi by Saudi agents and the global outcry that ensued, you might think Saudi Arabia is the darling of the World Economic Forum in Davos.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines flags government shutdown impact; profit beats
Description: Southwest Airlines Co said on Thursday the U.S. partial government shutdown had knocked between $10 million and $15 million off its revenue so far in January as it reported a better-than-expected fourth-quarter profit.

Headlines: U.S. copper projects gain steam thanks to electric vehicle trend
Description: Once seen as a laggard in the global mining industry, U.S. copper deposits have quietly drawn more than $1.1 billion in investments from small and large miners alike as Tesla and other electric carmakers scramble for more of the red metal.

Headlines: U.S. shutdown 'extremely negative' for IPO market: Morgan Stanley CEO
Description: Morgan Stanley Chief Executive Officer James Gorman said on Thursday it would be extremely negative for the initial public offering market if the United States government shutdown goes on much longer.

Headlines: American Airlines profit and forecast beat on higher fares
Description: No. 1 U.S. carrier American Airlines posted on Thursday quarterly profit and 2019 guidance that beat Wall Street estimates thanks to higher fares and healthy passenger demand, sending its shares up nearly 6 percent.

Headlines: MGM Resorts forms committee to evaluate real estate portfolio
Description: U.S. casino operator MGM Resorts International said on Thursday it had formed a committee to evaluate its real estate portfolio.

Headlines: 'AI' to hit hardest in U.S. heartland and among less-skilled: study
Description: The Midwestern states hit hardest by job automation in recent decades, places that were pivotal to U.S. President Donald Trump's election, will be under the most pressure again as advances in artificial intelligence reshape the workplace, according to a new study by Brookings Institution researchers.

Headlines: Bombardier to buy Global jet wing-making unit from Triumph
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc said on Thursday it will buy a wing manufacturing unit from aircraft parts supplier Triumph Group to boost its business jets program.

Headlines: China's Huawei unveils 5G modem Balong 5000, 'world's most powerful'
Description: China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd on Thursday unveiled its 5G modem Balong 5000, which it described as the most powerful 5G modem in the world.

Headlines: Microsoft says Bing search engine blocked in China
Description: Microsoft Corp's Bing search engine has been blocked in China, the company said on Wednesday, making it the latest foreign technology service to be shut down behind the country's Great Firewall.

Headlines: Renault to name new leaders as scandal-hit Ghosn bows out
Description: Renault's board was meeting on Thursday to appoint new leadership, after Chairman and Chief Executive Carlos Ghosn resigned in the wake of a financial scandal that has rocked the French carmaker and its alliance with Japan's Nissan .

Headlines: New Zealand PM says country is not discriminating against Huawei
Description: New Zealand's prime minister has assured Chinese telecoms equipment group Huawei Technologies Co Ltd of even-handed treatment after the small U.S. ally blocked the sale of some Huawei equipment citing national security concerns.

Headlines: Poland set to exclude China's Huawei from 5G plans
Description: Poland is set to exclude Huawei from its future 5G network in favour of European players following the arrest of an employee from the Chinese telecoms company on suspicion of spying, officials and industry sources say.

Headlines: Ford CEO tells employees: 'Time to bury' 2018, focus on doubling profit
Description: Ford Motor Co Chief Executive Jim Hackett told employees late on Thursday the No. 2 U.S. automaker would not accept last year's "mediocre" results and said the company was aiming to nearly double its annual operating profit.

Headlines: Google asks U.S. Supreme Court to end Oracle copyright case
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Thursday asked the U.S. Supreme Court to reverse a ruling that resurrected a billion-dollar copyright case brought by Oracle Corp that dates to 2010.

Headlines: Weak Intel outlook stokes fears of a chip slowdown
Description: Intel Corp forecast current-quarter revenue and profit below analysts' estimates and missed fourth-quarter sales estimates on Thursday, hit by a slowdown in China and sluggish demand for its data center and modem chips.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz to ramp up business with China auto suppliers
Description: Daimler AG will deepen partnerships with Chinese auto suppliers since they often lead United States and European rivals in key technologies for electric cars and connected vehicles, Mercedes-Benz executive Wilko Stark said on Thursday.

Headlines: Nasdaq boosted by chip rally, Dow, S&P 500 stall
Description: The S&P 500 edged higher but the Dow closed nominally lower on Thursday as lingering anxieties about slowing global growth and unresolved trade disputes undercut a spate of strong earnings, while chipmakers rallied to give the Nasdaq a solid gain.

Headlines: U.S. universities unplug from China's Huawei under pressure from Trump
Description: Top U.S. universities are ditching telecom equipment made by Huawei Technologies and other Chinese companies to avoid losing federal funding under a new national security law backed by the Trump administration.

Headlines: 'Maddening' U.S. shutdown hangs over airlines even as profits beat
Description: Three major U.S. airlines said on Thursday the U.S. government partial shutdown had not yet had a major financial impact but a tipping point might be near.

Headlines: Union Pacific profit beats, boosted by volume and price gains
Description: Union Pacific Corp, one of the biggest U.S. railroads, on Thursday reported higher-than-expected quarterly profit and said efficiency gains will bolster profits in 2019.

Headlines: ECB's Draghi warns of weaker growth ahead
Description: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi acknowledged on Thursday that economic growth in the euro zone was likely to be weaker than earlier expected due to the fall-out from factors ranging from China's slowdown to Brexit

Headlines: Audi to cut $17 billion from costs by 2022: Manager Magazin
Description: Volkswagen's premium brand Audi wants to cut costs by 15 billion euros ($17 billion) by 2022, Germany's Manager Magazin business monthly reported on Thursday, citing Audi executives.

Headlines: Renault names new leaders as scandal-hit Ghosn bows out
Description: Renault appointed Michelin boss Jean-Dominique Senard as its new chairman on Thursday, after Carlos Ghosn was forced to resign in the wake of a financial scandal that has rocked the French carmaker and its alliance with Japan's Nissan.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank queried by U.S. House panels on Trump ties
Description: Deutsche Bank AG has received an inquiry from two U.S. House of Representatives committees on the lender's ties to President Donald Trump, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Airbus threatens to shift work if Britain leaves EU with no deal
Description: Airbus warned on Thursday it could shift future wing-building out of Britain in the absence of a smooth exit from the European Union, predicting "potentially very harmful decisions" for its British operations in the event of a 'no-deal' Brexit.

Headlines: Harvard, Levi Strauss, U.S. think tank in blockchain tie-up on worker welfare
Description: Harvard University's public health graduate school, U.S. think-tank New America, and American apparel company Levi Strauss & Co announced on Thursday a collaboration to develop a blockhain-based system designed to augment outside auditors of factory health and safety with self-reporting by workers.

Headlines: J.P. Morgan pares U.S. first quarter GDP view to 1.75 percent
Description: J.P. Morgan economists reduced their outlook for U.S. economic growth in the first quarter to 1.75 percent from 2.00 percent as the partial U.S. government shutdown has stretched to a second month for the longest one ever, they said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. government shutdown threatens rollout of new car models: automakers
Description: The partial U.S. government shutdown is threatening to delay the roll-out of new vehicle models in the United States by stalling required certifications from the Environmental Protection Agency, automakers said.

Headlines: Exclusive: NYC Transit stops Bombardier deliveries until problems fixed
Description: New York City Transit will stop taking new train car deliveries from Bombardier Inc until it fixes existing cars, as the Canadian aerospace and transportation company faces pressure to improve performance at its rail unit, its largest division by revenues.

Headlines: Boeing wins $2.46 billion U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: The Boeing Cowon a $2.46 billion U.S. defense contract for the production and delivery of 19 P-8A Poseidon long-range anti-submarine warfare and surveillance aircraft and other equipment, the Pentagon said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Stocks, yields rise after deal announced to end U.S. government shutdown
Description: Wall Street indexes rose and bond yields followed stocks higher on Friday after U.S. President Donald Trump announced an agreement to end the longest ever U.S. government shutdown and as investors reacted to corporate earnings reports.

Headlines: Exclusive: CVS to cover migraine drugs from Teva, Lilly; excludes Amgen
Description: CVS Health Corp, a top U.S. manager of pharmacy benefits, has added new migraine drugs from Teva Pharmaceutical Industries and Eli Lilly and Co to its list of covered drugs, excluding a rival treatment from Amgen Inc, a CVS spokeswoman told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. government shutdown gives banks rare public relations opportunity
Description: The U.S. government shutdown has handed banks a rare opportunity to tout their nicer side as they prepare for rough treatment under a Democrat-controlled House of Representatives.

Headlines: Wall Street advances on Washington temporary shutdown deal
Description: Wall Street gained ground on Friday in a broad-based rally as investors were heartened by news that Washington would move to temporarily end the longest U.S. government shutdown in history.

Headlines: Democrats warn U.S. aviation system is jeopardized by government shutdown
Description: Two U.S. House Democrats who chair panels overseeing aviation issues warned Friday the ongoing partial government shutdown is jeopardizing aviation safety as air traffic controller staffing shortages forced a temporary halt to flights arriving at a New York airport and delayed hundreds of flights in the country's northeast.

Headlines: U.S. economy lost at least $6 billion to government shutdown: S&P
Description: The U.S. economy lost at least $6 billion during the partial shutdown of the federal government due to lost productivity from furloughed workers and economic activity lost to outside business, S&P Global Ratings said on Friday.

Headlines: Wells Fargo CEO defends his stewardship, in response to Sen. Warren: CNBC
Description: Wells Fargo & Co Chief Executive Tim Sloan, in a CNBC interview on Friday, said he is the right person to run the company, in response to Senator Elizabeth Warren's repeated calls for him to be fired after a 2016 scandal.

Headlines: China confident of keeping 2019 growth within 'appropriate range'
Description: China is fully confident that it is capable of keeping its economic growth rate within an appropriate range in 2019 in spite of challenges, state news agency Xinhua reported Chinese Premier Li Keqiang as saying on Friday.

Headlines: Consumer confidence in focus as shutdown fears fade
Description: U.S. fund managers are continuing their retreat from consumer-related stocks and increasing their defensive bets out of concerns that the U.S. economy is slowing even though government leaders had reached agreement to end the longest shutdown ever.

Headlines: Flights snarled at U.S. East Coast airports as controllers call in sick
Description: Hundreds of flights were grounded or delayed at New York-area and Philadelphia airports on Friday as air traffic controllers called in sick hours before President Donald Trump announced an end to the 35-day partial shutdown of the U.S. government.

Headlines: As government shutdown drags on, shares of subprime lenders rally
Description: Payday lenders' stocks have emerged as big winners during the record-long U.S. government shutdown, though the updraft could prove short-lived.

Headlines: Delta postpones Airbus A220 launch due to U.S. government shutdown
Description: Delta Air Lines said on Friday it had decided to postpone the debut of its Airbus A220 due to delays in the Federal Aviation Administration certification process, which has stalled during the partial U.S. government shutdown.

Headlines: Exclusive: Hindu group RSS urges India's Modi to resist U.S. push to ease e-commerce curbs
Description: A Hindu nationalist group close to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party has urged him to resist pressure from the United States and not defer new regulations for the e-commerce sector, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Market rout overshadows business growth for U.S. life insurers
Description: U.S. life insurers are expected to report messy fourth-quarter results starting next week, with their massive investment portfolios getting hit by tumultuous markets.

Headlines: U.S. bank trade group, Accenture and others back fintech startup Finxact
Description: Accenture Plc, SunTrust Banks Inc and the American Bankers Association, a trade group for U.S. banks, said on Friday that they had joined a $30 million investment round in Finxact, a startup that develops the back-end technology used by banks to process some transactions.

Headlines: Global stocks gain on earnings, euro rebounds after dovish ECB
