Headlines: Sodexo's sport and leisure business targets China in growth drive
Description: Sodexo's sport and leisure business, which provides catering at the U.S. Super Bowl, Royal Ascot and the Eiffel Tower, will focus on organic growth as it integrates its 2017 U.S. acquisition Centerplate.

Headlines: Bank of England's Carney spells out no-deal Brexit hit to UK
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney warned on Tuesday of the potential shock to Britain's economy from Brexit which could serve as an "acid test" for countries around the world trying to respond to the challenges of globalization.

Headlines: Red flags emerge as Americans' debt load hits another record
Description: Some red flags emerged for the U.S. economy late last year as credit card inquiries fell, student-loan delinquencies remained high and riskier borrowers drove home automobiles, according to a report that could signal a downturn is on the horizon.

Headlines: U.S. job openings hit record high; workers more scarce
Description: U.S. job openings surged to a record high in December, led by vacancies in the construction and accommodation and food services sectors, strengthening analysts' views that the economy was running out of workers.

Headlines: China, U.S. start high-level trade talks in Beijing: Xinhua
Description: China and the United States began high level trade talks in Beijing on Thursday, state news agency Xinhua said.

Headlines: Ford told UK PM May it is preparing alternative production sites: The Times
Description: Ford Motor Co has told British Prime Minister Theresa May that it is stepping up preparations to move production out of Britain, The Times reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: President Macron to unveil plan to give Europe's electric battery industry a jolt
Description: France will invest 700 million euros ($790 million) over the next five years into projects to boost the European electric car battery industry and reduce its carmakers' reliance on dominant Asian rivals, said French presidency officials.

Headlines: Nissan agrees joint venture to build Algerian car assembly plant
Description: Japan's second-largest automaker Nissan Motor Co has signed a joint venture agreement with an Algerian private partner to build a car assembly plant at a cost of $160 million, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mnuchin says trade talks in China are 'so far, so good'
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Wednesday trade talks with China are progressing well, as the world's two largest economies try to iron out an agreement to resolve their trade dispute.

Headlines: Huawei sees no sales slowdown in Poland: official
Description: Chinese telecoms firm Huawei has not seen a slowdown in sales of end-user equipment so far in Poland, the company's senior standards manager in Europe said on Wednesday.

Headlines: There's a looming threat for the stock market and it has nothing to do with China, Cramer says
Description: Jim Cramer warns investors that an upcoming "deluge of deals" could hurt their portfolios more than China or the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Amazon, GM in talks to invest in electric pickup truck maker Rivian: sources
Description: Amazon.com Inc and General Motors Co are in talks to invest in Rivian Automotive LLC in a deal that would value the U.S. electric pickup truck manufacturer at between $1 billion and $2 billion, people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Dish misses profit estimates on bigger subscriber loss, shares fall
Description: Dish Network Corp on Wednesday missed Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit as the U.S. satellite TV service provider lost more than expected pay-TV subscribers, sending its shares down 4.8 percent.

Headlines: Apple, Walmart, IBM CEOs join White House advisory panel
Description: The chief executives of Apple Inc, Walmart Inc, IBM Corp and other major companies are joining a Trump administration advisory board that hopes to prepare U.S. workers to deal with job training issues and the worforce shift brought by artificial intelligence and automation, the U.S. Commerce Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: EU clinches copyright overhaul deal, tech giants in focus
Description: The European Union is set to rewrite its two-decades-old copyright rules which will force Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc to share revenue with the creative industries and remove copyright-protected content on YouTube or Instagram.

Headlines: Exclusive: Volkswagen, Ford far apart on investment in Ford autonomous unit - sources
Description: Partners Volkswagen AG and Ford Motor Co are at odds over how much the German automaker will invest in the No. 2 U.S. automaker's self-driving vehicle unit, with Ford seeking at least $500 million, people familiar with the negotiations said. Analysts and investors have focused on the potential savings their alliance could generate, so any sign of problems in the negotiations is not welcome news.

Headlines: Optimism over U.S.-China trade deal lifts equity markets
Description: Hopes for a resolution in a prolonged trade spat between the United States and China helped extend a week-long rally in world stock markets on Wednesday, and bond yields also climbed.

Headlines: U.S. posts another budget deficit as tax revenues sag
Description: The U.S. federal government ran a $14 billion budget deficit in December as revenues sagged following last year's tax cuts even as the economy appeared strong, Treasury Department data showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wall Street advances on trade hopes, tame inflation data
Description: Wall Street closed higher on Wednesday as investor optimism was stoked over hopes the United States and China could iron out a trade deal, and benign inflation data suggested the Federal Reserve would hold interest rates steady in the near term.

Headlines: Ackman's hedge fund gains nearly 25 percent in early 2019
Description: Hedge fund manager William Ackman told investors that his publicly traded portfolio has gained 24.7 percent this year, fueled by strong growth in Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac and Chipotle Mexican Grill stocks.

Headlines: Flexport in talks to raise $500 million in SoftBank-led deal: Axios
Description: Freight logistics provider Flexport Inc is in talks to raise around $500 million in a deal led by SoftBank Group Corp, news website Axios reported on Wednesday citing sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Google to spend over $13 billion on U.S. data centers, offices
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it would spend more than $13 billion on data centers and offices in the United States this year.

Headlines: India's IndiGo to cut number of flights in February, March
Description: India's IndiGo Airlines, the country's largest domestic carrier, said on Wednesday it would cut the number of flights it operates by 2 percent in February due to bad weather.

Headlines: Shares of Slim's America Movil hammered after disappointing year
Description: Shares in Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim's America Movil tumbled more than 5 percent a day after it reported slightly better than expected fourth quarter profit that did not impress investors disappointed by weak results all year.

Headlines: Lower gasoline prices restrain U.S. consumer inflation
Description: U.S. consumer prices were unchanged for a third straight month in January, leading to the smallest annual increase in inflation in more than 1-1/2 years, which could allow the Federal Reserve to hold interest rates steady for a while.

Headlines: Barclays, J.P. Morgan cut U.S. fourth-quarter 2018 GDP view after retail sales plunge
Description: Barclays and J.P. Morgan on Thursday reduced their estimates on U.S. economic growth in the final quarter of 2018 following data that showed domestic retail sales took a 1.2 percent spill in December, which was its steepest monthly drop in nine years.

Headlines: Weakest U.S. retail sales since 2009 cast pall over economy
Description: U.S. retail sales recorded their biggest drop in more than nine years in December as receipts fell across the board, suggesting a sharp slowdown in economic activity at the end of 2018.

Headlines: Starbucks launches all-day dining cafe in China
Description: Starbucks Corp said on Friday it would launch a new all-day dining cafe in China which will serve a brunch menu and cocktails, as the world's largest coffee chain seeks to expand its retail offering in the increasingly competitive market.

Headlines: Mexico's Pemex, after downgrade, will make all debt payments: Lopez Obrador
Description: Mexican state oil firm Pemex will make all its debt payments, President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Thursday, promising to shore up its finances after Moody's and Fitch downgraded its credit rating to one notch above junk.

Headlines: Prominent investors stock up on eBay, then activists flex muscle
Description: EBay Inc.'s stock price slumped for most of last year but a number of prominent hedge funds were so convinced that change is on the horizon for the e-commerce company that they established new or added to existing positions in the last months of 2018.

Headlines: Chance of a U.S. recession up, number of Fed rate hikes down: Reuters poll
Description: There is a one-in-four chance of a U.S. recession in the next 12 months, a scenario that should keep the Federal Reserve from raising interest rates next month, according to a Reuters poll of economists who now expect only one rate hike this year.

Headlines: U.S. tax refunds down nearly 9 percent vs year ago: IRS data
Description: The average U.S. tax refund under President Donald Trump's tax overhaul is down nearly 9 percent so far in this year's tax filing season, according to Internal Revenue Service data released on Thursday.

Headlines: Berkshire trims Apple stake, adds Suncor and Red Hat, exits Oracle
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc said it has trimmed its stake in iPhone maker Apple Inc, though none of the selling was Buffett's, and added positions in Canada's Suncor Energy Inc and software company Red Hat Inc.

Headlines: U.S. negotiating multibillion-dollar fine with Facebook: report
Description: The U.S. government and Facebook Inc are negotiating a settlement over the company's privacy lapses that could require the online social network to pay a multibillion-dollar fine, the Washington Post reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump to get U.S. Commerce Department recommendation on auto tariffs
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department is set to meet a Sunday deadline to deliver its recommendations to President Donald Trump on whether imported vehicles and parts pose a national security risk and to outline options on how to address the issue, officials said Thursday.

Headlines: S&P 500 slips as grim retail sales data overshadows trade hopes
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow slipped while the Nasdaq posted a slim gain on Thursday as investors struggled to square grim retail sales data with hopes that high-level talks in Beijing could resolve the ongoing U.S.-China trade dispute.

Headlines: U.S.-owned utility to close two coal plants, in blow to Trump
Description: The Tennessee Valley Authority voted on Thursday to close two aging coal-fired power plants, including one supplied by a company led by a major supporter of President Donald Trump, who had urged the U.S.-owned utility to keep it open.

Headlines: #FedValentines is back; roses, rates and job market slack
Description: In January, the Federal Reserve delivered what investors took as a kind of love letter, a rate-hike pause that sent stock markets soaring. On Valentine's Day, U.S. central bankers offered tender missives of a different sort.

Headlines: U.S. shale executives predict oil production constraints to remain
Description: Drilling curbs by oil producers in the largest U.S. shale field will continue until transport bottlenecks ease and investors stop punishing companies for increasing capital spending, executives at an energy conference said on Thursday.

Headlines: Xcelerate to sell third-party warranties for EVs including Teslas
Description: Auto leasing and financing company Xcelerate said on Thursday it has launched the first U.S. third-party extended warranties for electric vehicles, including those of market leader Tesla Inc, filling a void for used vehicles that have so far lacked such coverage.

Headlines: Renault Chairman: not time to discuss Nissan chairmanship - Jiji
Description: Renault SA Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard, arriving in Japan for a meeting with Nissan Motor, said it was not yet time to discuss whether he would assume the chairmanship of the Japanese automaker, Jiji news agency reported on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. group says Trump trade tariffs cost businesses $2.7 billion in November
Description: U.S. businesses paid an additional $2.7 billion in tariffs in November 2018, according to data from a coalition of U.S. business groups fighting President Donald Trump's trade tariffs.

Headlines: With eyes on China, EU lawmakers back investment screening
Description: EU lawmakers overwhelmingly backed a far-reaching system on Thursday to coordinate scrutiny of foreign investments, notably from China, to protect strategic technologies and infrastructure in Europe.

Headlines: Belgium tax break for BP, others, upheld by EU court
Description: BP, BASF and more than 30 other multinationals stand to benefit after EU judges overturned an order demanding Belgium revoke a tax break.

Headlines: Amazon faces probe into treatment of sellers in Austria
Description: Austria's competition authority has begun investigating whether Amazon is exploiting its market dominance in relation to other retailers that use its website as a marketplace, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices drop for second straight month
Description: U.S. producer prices fell for a second straight month in January, leading to the smallest annual increase in 1-1/2 years, the latest sign of benign inflation that could allow the Federal Reserve to be patient about raising interest rates this year.

Headlines: Nissan, Renault and Mitsubishi executives reaffirmed importance of alliance: Mitsubishi chief
Description: The chief executives of Japan's Nissan and Mitsubishi Motors met with the newly appointed chairman of Renault in Tokyo on Thursday and reaffirmed the importance of their three-way alliance, Mitsubishi CEO Osamu Masuko said.

Headlines: Apple to ship iPhones with only Qualcomm chips to German stores
Description: Apple Inc said Thursday that it will resume selling older iPhone models in its stores in Germany, where they were banned last year due to a patent infringement ruling.

Headlines: Alibaba takes 8 percent stake in Chinese video platform Bilibili - Xinhua
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd has bought an 8 percent stake in Chinese video platform Bilibili Inc, the official Xinhua news agency reported on Thursday.

Headlines: KLM workers petition Air France to keep Dutch executive
Description: Hundreds of workers of Air France's Dutch subsidiary KLM gathered at its office in Amstelveen, Netherlands, on Thursday to deliver a petition voicing support for the subsidiary's CEO Pieter Elbers.

Headlines: 'Robo-adviser' Wealthfront launches cash account
Description: Wealthfront, one of the largest digital wealth management firms known as "robo-advisers", said on Thursday it is expanding its suite of financial products by introducing a cash account with a rate on deposits of 2.24 percent, significantly higher than the average U.S. rate.

Headlines: Bollore to hand over Vivendi to sons as Universal rumors swirl
Description: Billionaire Vincent Bollore will further withdraw from Vivendi's management at a crucial time for the French media giant, which is struggling in Italy and is weighing the sale of Universal Music Group (UMG).

Headlines: As Amazon drops New York City project, progressives claim a major coup
Description: U.S. Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez wasted no time on Thursday in calling Amazon's decision to scrap plans to build a major New York outpost with nearly $3 billion in city and state incentives a big victory for progressive politicians.

Headlines: Amazon places big bet on aspiring Tesla rival Rivian
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Friday it would lead a $700 million investment in U.S. electric pickup truck startup Rivian Automotive LLC, in the e-commerce giant's biggest bet on technologies with potential to reshape the automotive sector.

Headlines: After strong 2019 start for U.S. stocks, trade verdict looms
Description: Optimism about a U.S.-China trade agreement has helped drive U.S. stocks to more than two-month highs, creating a make-or-break moment for Wall Street as a year-long clash between the world's two largest economies comes to a head.

Headlines: Alphabet unit seeks share of property taxes for Toronto smart city
Description: Alphabet Inc's Sidewalk Labs unit is proposing it get a share of property taxes, development fees, and the rising value of Toronto city land as part of a deal to build a smart city, according to the company's slide presentation made public on Friday.

Headlines: Hundreds of Chinese protest against BBVA in Madrid
Description: Hundreds of Chinese citizens waving Spanish and Chinese flags took to the streets of Madrid on Friday to protest against BBVA, saying the bank had blocked their accounts.

Headlines: Visa, Mastercard mull increasing fees for processing transactions: WSJ
Description: Visa Inc and Mastercard Inc, the two biggest U.S. card networks, are preparing to raise certain fees levied on U.S. merchants for processing transactions from this April, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Sputtering auto production sinks U.S. manufacturing output
Description: U.S. manufacturing fell sharply in January, led by the biggest drop in motor vehicle production since the recession, the latest indication that the economy was losing momentum.

Headlines: London bankers will need 'chaperones' for EU clients under no-deal Brexit: sources
Description: Investment banks have warned M&A teams in Britain they cannot pitch business to clients in the European Union if there is a no-deal Brexit without an EU "chaperone" sitting in on their meeting, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. factory output drops, autos fall the most since recession
Description: U.S. manufacturing output fell steeply in January as motor vehicle production posted its biggest fall since 2009, with declines in a broad range of goods likely to fuel fears of a sharp slowdown in factory activity.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies on trade optimism
Description: Wall Street rallied on Friday, with the Dow and the Nasdaq posting their eighth consecutive weekly gains as investors grew hopeful that the United States and China would hammer out an agreement resolving their protracted trade war.

Headlines: Exclusive: China offers to end market-distorting subsidies but won't say how
Description: China has pledged to end market-distorting subsidies for its domestic industries but offered no details on how it would achieve that goal, according to three people familiar with the U.S.-China trade talks in Beijing this week.

Headlines: European shares recover after weak data wobble
Description: European shares recovered on Friday after weak U.S. and Chinese economic data earlier sent global equity markets into a dive.

Headlines: Euronext confident 'dual-listed' trading to continue after Brexit
Description: The trading of dual-listed shares in Britain by European investors is expected to continue after Brexit, a senior official at pan-European exchange Euronext has said.

Headlines: Seizing on Huawei's troubles, Samsung bets big on network gear
Description: Samsung Electronics is pouring resources into its telecom network equipment business, aiming to capitalize on the security fears hobbling China's Huawei, according to company officials and other industry executives.

Headlines: China says reached consensus on some key issues during U.S. trade talks
Description: China and the United States reached a consensus in principle on some key issues during trade talks in Beijing, state news agency Xinhua reported on Friday.

Headlines: China-U.S. trade talks 'making a final sprint': state media
Description: Chinese state media on Saturday expressed cautious optimism over trade talks between the United States and China, a day after President Xi Jinping said a week of discussions had produced "step-by-step" progress.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: This single statement by Nvidia speaks volumes
Description: Jim Cramer seconds Nvidia's call for more computing and explains why investors have reason to believe in the stock's bottom.

Headlines: Automakers brace for U.S. government report on import tariffs
Description: A confidential Commerce Department report due to be sent to Donald Trump on Sunday is widely expected to clear the way for the U.S. president to threaten tariffs on imported autos and auto parts by designating the imports a national security threat, auto industry officials said on Friday.

Headlines: Big U.S. exchanges to sue SEC over 'overreaching' fee experiment
Description: The three largest U.S. stock exchange operators said they will sue the Securities and Exchange Commission for overstepping its authority by ordering a pilot program to test banning lucrative payments exchanges make to brokers for resting stock orders.

Headlines: Starboard gauges Bristol-Myers shareholder support for Celgene deal
Description: Activist hedge fund Starboard Value LP has asked a proxy solicitor to probe the level of support among Bristol-Myers Squibb Co shareholders for the U.S. drug maker's $74 billion deal to buy Celgene Corp, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Analyst View: Investors divided over Mexico's bailout of state oil company
Description: The Mexican government promised on Friday to do what it takes to strengthen the finances of ailing state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos with an injection of at least $3.6 billion to prevent a further credit downgrade.

Headlines: Russian court extends custody of Baring Vostok's Calvey until April
Description: A Russian court on Saturday ordered Michael Calvey, the U.S. founder of one of Russia's biggest private equity firms accused of fraud, to be kept in custody until April 13.

Headlines: Russian court orders Baring Vostok's Calvey to be kept in custody until April 13
Description: A Moscow court has ordered Baring Vostok's founder Michael Calvey to be kept in custody until April 13.

Headlines: Qatar aims to build $20 billion sports sector ahead of World Cup
Description: Qatar wants to attract more sports companies to the Gulf state, aiming to develop a $20 billion sports sector ahead of the 2022 World Cup, a senior official said on Sunday.

Headlines: Russia's Gazprombank freezes accounts of Venezuela's PDVSA: source
Description: Russian lender Gazprombank has decided to freeze the accounts of Venezuelan state oil company PDVSA and halted transactions with the firm to reduce the risk of the bank falling under U.S. sanctions, a Gazprombank source told Reuters on Sunday.

Headlines: New Zealand to target online giants with digital tax
Description: New Zealand said on Monday that it plans to update its laws so it can tax revenue earned by multinational digital firms such as Google, Facebook and Amazon, extending a global effort to bring global tech giants into the tax net.

Headlines: Qatar's real estate market faces reality check ahead of World Cup
Description: Qatar's Doha Tower, a spike-tipped cylinder that glows orange at night, won an award when finished in 2012 amid a Gulf-wide real estate boom, but today about half of its 46 floors are empty.

Headlines: Auto industry lines up against possible U.S. tariffs
Description: The U.S. auto industry urged President Donald Trump's administration on Monday not to saddle imported cars and auto parts with steep tariffs, after the U.S. Commerce Department sent a confidential report to the White House late on Sunday with its recommendations for how to proceed.

Headlines: U.S. agency submits auto tariff probe report to White House
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department sent a report on Sunday to U.S. President Donald Trump that could unleash steep tariffs on imported cars and auto parts, provoking a sharp backlash from the industry even before it is unveiled, the agency confirmed.

Headlines: U.S. tariffs on EU cars could mean EU buying less U.S. soya beans and gas: Juncker
Description: United States tariffs on imports of European cars could mean that Europe would buy less soya beans and liquid gas from the U.S., the head of the European Commission Jean-Claude Juncker said on Monday.

Headlines: Germany bans Wirecard 'shorting' as prosecutors probe FT journalist
Description: Germany's financial watchdog has banned "short" selling of Wirecard shares due to volatility in the payments firm's stock following reports in the Financial Times which are now the subject of an investigation by German authorities.

Headlines: Citi expects privatization to bolster revenue in Brazil
Description: Citigroup Inc expects to boost annual revenue in Brazil over the next years by advising potential public asset sales and through a revival in capital markets, its chief executive officer in Brazil told journalists on Monday.

Headlines: Russia's Rusal is in talks to resume reinsurance with Western companies
Description: Russia's Rusal, the world's second-largest aluminum producer, is in talks to resume reinsuring its risks with Western companies after Washington lifted sanctions on it, officials with Russian National Reinsurance Co (RNRC) said.

Headlines: EU's Juncker expects Trump to refrain from imposing higher tariffs on cars
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has promised European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker that he will not impose additional import tariffs on European cars for the time being, Juncker was quoted in a published interview as saying on Monday.

Headlines: Citi in talks to buy Canary Wharf office building: source
Description: Citigroup is in talks to buy the tower housing its European headquarters in London's Canary Wharf district, which is on the market with a price tag of around 1.2 billion pounds ($1.55 billion), a source familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: SoftBank invests in Mubadala's new $400 million European tech fund: source
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group has provided nearly half of the cash for Abu Dhabi's state investor Mubadala Investment Co's new $400 million fund investing in European start-ups, a source familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. seeking stable yuan pledge in China trade deal: Bloomberg TV
Description: The United States is seeking to secure a pledge from China it will not devalue its yuan as part of an agreement intended to end the countries' trade war, Bloomberg TV reported on Monday.

Headlines: Barclays hoped 2008 cash call would drive international growth, court told
Description: Barclays believed deals with strategic investors during the 2008 financial crisis would help to provide a springboard for its international ambitions, the bank's former chairman told a London criminal trial on Tuesday.

Headlines: Google to buy data migration company Alooma in cloud push
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Tuesday it will buy data migration company Alooma, as part of efforts to catch up with bigger cloud service rivals Amazon.com Inc and Microsoft Corp.

Headlines: Gold hits 10-month peak on growth worries; dollar dips
Description: Gold prices rose to a 10-month high on Tuesday as concerns over a global economic slowdown spurred a safe-haven bid and were also supported by a weaker U.S. dollar, which fell on optimism for a breakthrough in U.S.-China trade talks.

Headlines: Wall Street rises modestly on Walmart bump
Description: U.S. stocks gained ground on Tuesday as upbeat results from Walmart boosted investor sentiment and high-level U.S.-China trade talks resumed in Washington.

Headlines: Kellogg, Mondelez stock up on Pringles, Milka for fear of Brexit
Description: As Brexit looms, Kellogg Co and Mondelez International Inc are taking measures to protect Britons from a potential shortage of Pringles chips, BelVita biscuits and Milka chocolate.

Headlines: Walmart holiday-quarter sales jump, says consumers still spending
Description: Walmart Inc posted its strongest holiday quarter in at least a decade on Tuesday, boosted by higher grocery and e-commerce sales, and said it saw no signs of weakness in U.S. consumer spending despite recent signs of a slowdown.

Headlines: Exclusive: Fed's Williams says new economic outlook necessary for rate hikes
Description: New York Fed President John Williams on Tuesday said he was comfortable with the level U.S. interest rates are at now and that he sees no need to raise them again unless economic growth or inflation shifts to an unexpectedly higher gear.

Headlines: U.S. settles with Teva over keeping generic drugs off market
Description: The U.S. government has reached a settlement with Teva Pharmaceuticals Industries Ltd over charges that its agreements with rivals impeded consumer access to lower-priced generic drugs.

Headlines: South Korean prosecutors raid Hyundai's office in recall probe: Chosun Biz
Description: South Korean prosecutors on Wednesday raided the office of Hyundai Motor Co's quality division in southern Seoul as part of a probe into how the automaker and affiliate Kia Motors Corp handled vehicle recalls over engine defects, online media Chosun Biz reported.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs Asia Pacific CEO to retire: Bloomberg
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc's Chairman and Chief Executive for the Asia-Pacific region excluding Japan, Ken Hitchner, is retiring from the company, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Honda CEO says decision to end production in UK not Brexit related
Description: Honda Motor Co's decision to end production in Britain was not related to Brexit, its chief executive said on Tuesday, after announcing the closure of its only British car plant.

Headlines: Honda UK plant closure not related to Brexit: Europe boss
Description: Honda's decision to close its only British car plant is not related to Brexit and is a product of global changes in the industry, the firm's Europe's boss said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's JD.com to lay off 10 percent of senior executives this year: report
Description: JD.com Inc, one of China's largest e-commerce sites, will lay off 10 percent of its senior executives this year, Chinese online media outlet Sina Tech reported on Tuesday, citing unnamed sources.

Headlines: Payless ShoeSource seeks bankruptcy protection again
Description: U.S. discount retailer Payless ShoeSource Inc on Monday filed for voluntary Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection for the second time, along with its North American subsidiaries, and said it would wind down all North American stores by the end of May.

Headlines: Medtronic quarterly profit beats on strength in surgical products
Description: Medtronic Plc beat analysts' estimates for quarterly profit on Tuesday, boosted by sales of its surgical products, and the largest U.S. standalone medical device maker raised the upper end of its full-year earnings forecast.

Headlines: Nestle says it is now well positioned in confectionery
Description: Nestle's success with its KitKat brand means its does not need to add new businesses after selling its candy unit to Italy's Ferrero last year, the Swiss food group's global head of confectionery said.

Headlines: Get Brexit sorted out, UK business minister says after Honda plant decision
Description: The United Kingdom must urgently end the uncertainty over its exit from the European Union so that businesses can have clarity about the future, business minister Greg Clark said just hours after Honda said it would close its car plant in Britain.

Headlines: UK PM May told Honda president she was disappointed by plant closure: spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May spoke to the president of Honda to express her disappointment after the car manufacturer's decision to shut a plant in England, May's spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: HSBC warns on China, UK slowdowns as 2018 profit disappoints
Description: HSBC warned it may have to delay some investments this year as Europe's biggest bank missed 2018 profit forecasts due to slowing growth in its two home markets of China and Britain.

Headlines: BHP CEO staying around to deal with tailings and transformation
Description: The chief executive of mining group BHP has no plans to quit and will focus on the "nuclear level of safety" needed to avoid any repeat of the Vale dam collapse in Brazil, as well as on transforming his own company.

Headlines: U.S. consumers forecast more spending than a year ago: NY Fed
Description: U.S. consumers expect to spend more money in 2019 than they did a year ago, data from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Aviva, NatWest to join 'Brexodus' of business to EU
Description: England's High Court on Tuesday gave Aviva, Britain’s second largest insurer, approval to transfer around 9 billion pounds ($11.69 billion) in assets to a new Irish company just before the starting gun is fired on Brexit.

Headlines: January FOMC minutes: Little risk in pause
Description: Federal Reserve policymakers thought pausing on U.S. interest rate hikes last month posed little risk and plenty of benefit, minutes from their Jan. 29-30 meeting showed, giving them time to assess the effects of a global slowdown and the Fed's rate hikes to date on U.S. economic momentum.

Headlines: Volvo Cars raises $215 million in bond issue months after failed IPO
Description: Sweden's Volvo Cars has raised some 2 billion Swedish crowns ($215 million) in a bond issue just five months after the Chinese-owned carmaker terminated plans for a stock market flotation, blaming trade tensions and a downturn in the sector.

Headlines: Danske Bank pulls out of Russia, Baltics after money-laundering backlash
Description: Danske Bank will pull out of Russia and the neighboring Baltic states, the Danish lender said after Estonia ordered it to close the branch at the center of one of the largest-ever money laundering scandals.

Headlines: Estonia investigates alleged Swedbank link to money laundering scandal
Description: Estonia is investigating allegations linking Swedbank to suspicious transactions in the country involving Danske Bank, Estonia's state prosecutor said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Bristol-Myers says Starboard nominated five directors, bought shares
Description: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co said on Wednesday that activist hedge fund Starboard Value LP intends to nominate five directors to the U.S. drugmaker's board, one month after it announced a $74 billion deal to acquire peer Celgene Corp.

Headlines: U.S. trade representative to testify on China next week
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer will testify next week at a U.S. House of Representatives hearing on U.S.-China trade issues, a spokesman for the House Ways and Means Committee said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Steve Cohen's venture firm invests in U.S. cybersecurity company
Description: Billionaire investor Steve Cohen's Point72 Ventures has invested in a U.S. cybersecurity firm that will provide a way to detect, alert, and protect against data- and identity-related attacks, according to one of the venture capital company's top officials.

Headlines: Global stocks rise on U.S.-China trade hopes; oil up again
Description: An index of stocks across the globe hit a more than four-month high on Wednesday on hopes for progress in trade talks between the United States and China, and a supportive backdrop from major central banks also helped push risk assets higher.

Headlines: Factbox: Tesla executive departures since 2016
Description: Tesla Inc on Wednesday announced the departure of its general counsel Dane Butswinkas, just two months into the job, the latest in a string of senior level exits from the electric carmaker.

Headlines: India's top court finds Anil Ambani guilty of contempt in RCom-Ericsson case
Description: India's Supreme Court on Wednesday found Anil Ambani, chairman of debt-laden Reliance Communications (RCom), guilty of contempt of court for wilfully failing to pay 5.5 billion rupees ($77.29 million) to telecom equipment maker Ericsson.

Headlines: Ghosn's new lawyer, 'the Razor', takes aim at Nissan and prosecutors
Description: Carlos Ghosn's new lawyer took aim at Nissan, prosecutors and courts on Wednesday, dismissing the charges against the ousted chairman as an internal company matter and saying Japan was out of step with international norms by keeping his client in jail.

Headlines: Lockheed unveils new F-21 fighter jet configured for India
Description: Lockheed Martin offered India on Wednesday a new combat jet to be made locally, the F-21, in an attempt to win a large military order worth more than $15 billion.

Headlines: Caesars says continues to look at options after Icahn urges sale of company
Description: Caesars Entertainment Corp said on Wednesday it will continue to look at options for the company, a day after activist investor Carl Icahn urged the U.S. casino operator to consider selling itself.

Headlines: British PM May says Honda plant closure can't be blamed on Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said Honda's announcement that it would close its factory in England in 2021 was deeply disappointing, but could not be blamed on the country's upcoming departure from the European Union.

Headlines: Fed flags end to balance sheet runoff, patience on rates
Description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday signaled they will soon lay out a plan to stop letting go of $4 trillion in bonds and other assets, but policymakers are still debating how long their newly adopted "patient" stance on U.S. rates policy will last.

Headlines: Wall Street ends up slightly as Fed minutes support cautious stance
Description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Wednesday after minutes from the Federal Reserve's last meeting reaffirmed for investors that the U.S. central bank would be "patient" with respect to further interest rate hikes.

Headlines: Southwest shares drop as mechanics dispute escalates
Description: Southwest Airlines Co's shares fell more than 5 percent on Wednesday after the low-cost U.S. carrier said it was investigating whether a conflict with its mechanics union was leading to a spike in flight cancellations.

Headlines: Former Barclays chairman 'not aware' of Qatar fee document, court told
Description: Barclays' former chairman, giving evidence in a landmark London fraud trial, said he first saw a document detailing agreed fees for Qatari investors in the British bank four years after the payment was agreed.

Headlines: Qualcomm urges U.S. regulators to reverse course and ban some iPhones
Description: Qualcomm Inc is urging U.S. trade regulators to reverse a judge's ruling and ban the import of some Apple Inc iPhones in a long-running patent fight between the two companies.

Headlines: Airbus says A320neo India deliveries back on track
Description: European aircraft maker Airbus deliveries of its A320neo aircraft are back on track in India with fewer problems being seen with the narrowbody jet's Pratt & Whitney engines, a senior company executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Swedish watchdog calls Swedbank money laundering report 'very serious'
Description: Sweden's financial watchdog said allegations in a media report linking Swedbank to a Baltic money laundering scandal, involving Danske Bank were "very serious" as shares in the Swedish bank tumbled on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump urges U.S. telecommunications companies to step up 5G systems
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday called on U.S. telecommunications companies to boost their work to build faster 5G wireless communications networks, saying they were lagging and at risk of being left behind other countries' efforts.

Headlines: U.S. won't partner with countries that use Huawei systems: Pompeo
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Thursday warned that the United States would not be able to partner with or share information with countries that adopt Huawei Technologies Co Ltd systems, citing security concerns.

Headlines: Exclusive: China central bank sees benchmark rate cut as last resort, may use other tools - sources
Description: China's central bank is not yet ready to cut benchmark interest rates to spur the slowing economy, despite cooling inflation and a stronger yuan, which have fanned market expectations of such a move, policy sources told Reuters.

Headlines: China's central bank to keep yuan stable, maintain prudent monetary policy
Description: China's central bank said on Thursday that it will keep its yuan currency stable and maintain its prudent monetary policy to ensure financial stability in the world's second-largest economy.

Headlines: Canadian auto union faces Catch-22 in General Motors fight
Description: Jerry Dias, the leader of Canada's auto union, is unsparing in his rhetorical attacks on General Motors Co's decision to close its Oshawa, Ontario, assembly plant and lay off thousands of union workers by year-end.

Headlines: U.S. leading economic indicators fall in January, some components estimated
Description: The index of U.S. leading economic indicators declined 0.1 percent in January, the Conference Board said on Thursday, but it advised that some of the components of the index were estimated due to the government shutdown.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nigeria hits oil majors with billions in back taxes
Description: Nigeria has ordered foreign oil and gas companies to pay nearly $20 billion in taxes it says are owed to local states, industry and government sources said, in a move that could deter investment in Africa's largest economy.

Headlines: Google fails to disclose microphone in Nest Secure
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it had made an "error" in not disclosing that its Nest Secure home security system had a built-in microphone in its devices.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S., China drafting memorandums for possible trade deal
Description: Top U.S. and Chinese trade officials are working this week to hash out language on six broad agreements that aim to resolve the most contentious issues in their seven-month trade war.

Headlines: Banning Huawei from 5G would cause difficulties: T-Mobile Polska CEO
Description: If Poland excludes Chinese tech giant Huawei from 5G development it would cause difficulties and possibly delay the network rollout, the chief executive of the Polish unit of T-Mobile said on Thursday.

Headlines: Google's new cloud boss has big task to catch rivals, Reuters data show
Description: Google has a new cloud computing boss and big ambitions to someday produce more revenue from that business than from advertising.

Headlines: Sony to beef up chip business with new engineers
Description: Sony Corp said on Thursday it will assign 40 percent of its new engineer hires in Japan over the next two years to the chip business which includes imaging sensors, as it looks for growth from new applications in everything from cars to phones.

Headlines: Credit Suisse loses bid to dismiss lawsuit in U.S. over writedowns
Description: A U.S. judge has rejected Credit Suisse Group AG's bid to dismiss a lawsuit accusing the Swiss bank of defrauding shareholders about its risk appetite and risk management before taking $1 billion of writedowns on souring debt.

Headlines: Consumer Reports yanks recommendation for Tesla's Model 3, citing reliability
Description: Consumer Reports on Thursday pulled a recommendation for Tesla Inc's Model 3, citing reliability problems, and the influential U.S. magazine turned up the pressure on other automakers to include crash-avoiding automatic braking as standard equipment.

Headlines: Trump to meet Chinese Vice Premier Liu He on Friday: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will meet with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He, who is leading trade talks with U.S. officials in Washington, at the White House on Friday, the White House said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: SpaceX, Boeing design risks threaten new delays for U.S. space program
Description: NASA has warned SpaceX and Boeing Co of design and safety concerns for their competing astronaut launch systems, according to industry sources and a new government report, threatening the U.S. bid to revive its human spaceflight program later this year.

Headlines: Wall St. breaks run of gains as economic data disappoints
Description: Weak economic reports pressured U.S. stocks on Thursday after the market's recent run of gains, and a drop in healthcare shares added to the bearish momentum.

Headlines: U.S. stocks sag on poor economic outlook; oil, gold slip
Description: Wall Street stocks fell on Thursday due to a deteriorating economic outlook that was only partially offset by signs of trade progress between China and the United States, while gold and oil prices retreated from their recent peaks.

Headlines: U.S. banks record $59.1 billion in profits in fourth-quarter of 2018
Description: The U.S. banking sector recorded $59.1 billion in profits in the fourth quarter of 2018, down slightly from the third quarter's record level but still up significantly from the prior year, according to data from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S., China sketch outlines of deal to end trade war - sources
Description: The United States and China have started to outline commitments in principle on the stickiest issues in their trade dispute, marking the most significant progress yet toward ending a seven-month trade war, according to sources familiar with the negotiations.

Headlines: Oil off 2019 highs as U.S. crude stocks build, output hits record
Description: Oil prices fell below 2019 highs on Thursday after U.S. government data showed a fifth weekly build in crude inventories and record production, while concerns about slowing global economic growth weighed.

Headlines: Ariane 6 rocket sees first commercial deals in race with SpaceX
Description: Ariane 6, Europe's next-generation space rocket, is expected to win its first two commercial launch orders in coming weeks, company officials said, a key milestone as the European launcher vies for orders against Elon Musk's U.S. competitor SpaceX.

Headlines: Nestle investing $115 million to expand Purina factory in U.S.
Description: Nestle is investing $115 million to expand its Purina factory in Bloomfield, in the U.S. state of Missouri, the Swiss foodmaker said on Thursday, as it seeks to increase production of cat litter.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lyft plans to launch its IPO roadshow week of March 18 - sources
Description: Lyft Inc plans to launch the roadshow for its initial public offering during the week of March 18, making it the first U.S. ride-hailing company to debut in the stock market, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wild cats, boas are obstacles in Mexican president's refinery race
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador's race to build an oil refinery in record time on land that was until recently alive with mangrove, wild cats and boa constrictors, has run into trouble, complicating his effort to revive ailing state-oil company Pemex.

Headlines: AutoNation names new CEO as slowing auto sales hit results
Description: AutoNation Inc said on Friday it has chosen insurance and financial services executive Carl Liebert to succeed longtime Chief Executive Officer Mike Jackson and lead the largest U.S. auto dealership chain at a challenging time, when the domestic vehicle market has been slowing.

Headlines: Equifax says U.S. regulators seek damages related to 2017 breach
Description: Credit reporting company Equifax Inc said it was informed by several U.S. regulators that they intend to seek damages from the company related to the cybersecurity breach of 2017 that exposed personal information of nearly 145 million people.

Headlines: China has agreed to buy up to $1.2 trillion in U.S. goods: CNBC
Description: China has agreed to buy up to $1.2 trillion in goods from the United States as part of the current negotiations to end the trade war between the countries, CNBC reported on Friday, citing sources familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Oil hits 2019 highs on U.S.-China trade hopes, but U.S. output weighs
Description: Oil prices touched their highest since mid-November on Friday and posted weekly gains for the second week in a row, boosted by hopes that U.S.-China trade talks would soon produce a deal, although new record U.S. oil supply limited gains.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade hopes lift stocks; oil hits three-month high
Description: Stocks rose in major markets across the world on Friday on bets of progress in trade talks between China and the United States, while crude futures hit their highest level in more than three months supported by ongoing supply cuts.

Headlines: Trump's economy 'a little under' 3 percent growth goal: Fed
Description: The Trump administration will fall "a little under" its target of 3 percent annual growth of gross domestic product for 2018, the Federal Reserve said Friday in a report that offers an economic scorecard of sorts for the first full year of President Donald Trump's term.

Headlines: S&P 500 posts highest close since November 8 on trade optimism
Description: The S&P 500 posted its highest closing level since Nov. 8 on Friday as investors clung to signs of progress in the ongoing trade talks between the United States and China.

Headlines: Flattening U.S. yield curve in late 2018 'flashing red' on economy: Fed's Williams
Description: A flattening U.S. yield curve in December, which was close to being inverted, was "flashing red" about a deceleration in U.S. economic growth heading into 2019, despite some solid data at the time, New York Federal Reserve President John Williams said on Friday.

Headlines: Fed's policy pause sets stage for broad overhaul
Description: When Federal Reserve policymakers last month put a three-year rate-hike campaign on hold and backed ending a yearlong push to shrink their $4 trillion balance sheet, they cited increased risks to U.S. economic growth and the need for more time to sort through the data.

Headlines: No more MOUs! USTR Lighthizer tweaks trade terminology after dispute with Trump
Description: In trade talks between the United States and China, Memorandums of Understanding - the building blocks of what would be a historic deal - are officially out.

Headlines: France wants agriculture kept out of a EU-U.S. trade deal: Elysee
Description: France opposes including agricultural products in any trade deal between the United States and the European Union, a source at French President Emmanuel Macron's office said on Friday.

Headlines: Alibaba CEO rules out layoffs this year
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd expects to avoid layoffs this year despite China's economic slowdown, CEO Daniel Zhang said on Friday.

Headlines: Tesla rolls out Model 3 in China ahead of schedule in sales push
Description: Tesla Inc has started delivering Model 3 cars in China slightly ahead of schedule, as it looks to revive its sales that have been hit hard by Sino-U.S. trade tensions.

Headlines: VietJet to sign major Boeing deal during Trump-Kim summit: sources
Description: Fast-growing Vietnamese budget airline VietJet Aviation JSC is expected to sign a major jet deal with Boeing Co on the sidelines of next week's Trump-Kim summit, according to sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: AT&T pulls ads from YouTube over videos exploiting children
Description: AT&T Inc pulled all its advertising from Alphabet Inc's YouTube for the second time in two years after a magazine reported the platform displayed ads next to videos that showed the exploitation of children.

Headlines: British fraud office abandons Rolls-Royce, GSK investigations
Description: The UK's Serious Fraud Office (SFO) has abandoned two of its largest and longest investigations, into alleged bribery at aero engine maker Rolls-Royce and drugs maker GlaxoSmithKline, in a move described by one lawyer as "extraordinary".

Headlines: U.S., China haggle over toughest issues in trade war talks
Description: Top U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators haggled on Thursday over the details of a set of agreements aimed at ending their trade war, just one week before a Washington-imposed deadline for a deal expires and triggers higher U.S. tariffs.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs backs U.S. construction finance tech startup Rabbet
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc has backed Rabbet, a U.S. startup that develops software to help make construction finance more efficient, the companies said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exxon, Microsoft strike cloud computing agreement for U.S. shale
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp and Microsoft Corp have agreed to use cloud technology in the U.S. oil producer's shale operations, they said on Friday, helping to boost profitability in the nation's largest shale field.

Headlines: EU drafting retaliatory tariff list hitting Caterpillar, Xerox, Samsonite: Bloomberg
Description: The European Union has drafted a list of retaliatory tariffs that would target Caterpillar Inc, Xerox Corp and Samsonite International if U.S. President Donald Trump imposes duties on European cars, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing an unnamed senior EU official.

Headlines: Roche nearing $5 billion deal to acquire Spark Therapeutics: WSJ
Description: Swiss drugmaker Roche Holding AG is nearing a deal to acquire U.S. biotechnology company Spark Therapeutics Inc, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S., China sprint to seal deal ahead of Trump's deadline
Description: U.S. and Chinese negotiators met for over seven hours on Saturday to resolve their trade dispute and avoid an escalation of the tit-for-tat tariffs that have already disrupted global commerce, slowed the world economy and roiled financial markets.

Headlines: Caesars in talks with Icahn about new CEO as part of settlement: sources
Description: U.S. casino operator Caesars Entertainment Corp is in talks to offer Carl Icahn a role in selecting its new CEO as part of an agreement that would also give the billionaire investor board seats, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: U.S., Chinese negotiators discuss enforcement in Sunday trade talks: source
Description: U.S. and Chinese negotiators on Sunday are discussing tariffs and an enforcement mechanism for a potential trade deal after making good progress on structural issues during talks on Saturday, a source familiar with the situation told Reuters.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi unveils $680 5G smartphone, sees growth in Africa
Description: China's Xiaomi has launched its contribution to a new wave of smartphones that will be able to take advantage of faster 5G mobile networks at a lower price than analysts expect from rivals such as Samsung.

Headlines: Vietnam's Bamboo Airways to buy 10 Boeing planes during Trump-Kim summit
Description: Vietnamese carrier Bamboo Airways will sign a deal with Boeing Co to purchase 10 planes on the sidelines of this week's Trump-Kim summit, an airline executive said on Sunday.

Headlines: UAE's ADNOC seals $4 billion pipeline infrastructure deal with KKR, BlackRock
Description: Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) has sealed a $4 billion midstream pipeline infrastructure deal with U.S. investment firms KKR and BlackRock, the government-owned company said on Sunday.

Headlines: World shares climb after Trump delays tariffs on Chinese imports
Description: World stock markets rose on Monday after U.S. President Donald Trump said he would delay a tariff hike on Chinese imports, buoying hopes of a resolution to a trade war between the world's two biggest economies.

Headlines: Freeport investing to mitigate risk from tailings dams: CEO
Description: Freeport-McMoRan Inc Chief Executive Richard Adkerson said on Monday his company has been investing heavily to mitigate any danger from tailings dams and is "comfortable" with engineering designs in place at existing dams.

Headlines: Brazil oil regulator to investigate Petrobras oil spill
Description: Brazil's oil regulator said on Monday that is has started an investigation into an oil spill at an offshore platform owned by Petroleo Brasileiro SA.

Headlines: Volkswagen could sell smaller trucks stake if markets in a spin: sources
Description: Volkswagen could sell a smaller stake in its Traton trucks division than expected if markets are shaken by Brexit, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. senators press for Huawei to be excluded from solar power market
Description: A bipartisan group of senators on Monday urged the U.S. government to block Huawei Technologies Co Ltd from supplying solar energy generators just as it has acted to keep the Chinese giant out of the U.S. telecommunications network.

Headlines: U.S. auto sales seen falling in February: J.D. Power, LMC Automotive
Description: U.S. auto sales are expected to drop about 1 percent in February from a year earlier partly due to inclement weather, according to industry consultants J.D. Power and LMC Automotive.

Headlines: Sony revitalizes smartphone franchise with movie-style screens
Description: Japan's Sony, which has fallen way behind its South Korean and Chinese rivals in the smartphone sales race, aims to capitalize on its movie pedigree with new devices featuring 21:9 ratio screens, the dimensions used to film blockbusters.

Headlines: Banks losing battle to be no-deal Brexit ready
Description: Major banks are still not ready for a 'no-deal' Brexit as they grapple with delays in licenses for new European Union businesses, staffing problems and snags in redrafting contracts.

Headlines: Newmont CEO says shareholders do not see value in Barrick bid
Description: Newmont Mining Corp Chief Executive Gary Goldberg said on Monday that Barrick Gold Corp's $18 billion hostile bid for his company is perplexing to his shareholders and not in the best interest of both miners.

Headlines: Trump calls on OPEC to 'relax,' says oil prices are too high
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday expressed concern about oil prices and repeated his previous calls on the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) to keep prices steady.

Headlines: Huawei seeks solution to Czech security warning, readies legal means: paper
Description: China's Huawei Technologies is prepared to defend itself in court in the Czech Republic if it is unable to resolve a security warning from the country's cyber watchdog in an open way, its country manager was quoted as saying on Monday.

Headlines: Buffett appears to fault Trump, laments deals dearth in Berkshire letter
Description: Warren Buffett on Saturday appeared to fault U.S. President Donald Trump for taking too much credit for the nation's economic growth, while acknowledging that market conditions are making it tough for his Berkshire Hathaway Inc to find more big companies to buy.

Headlines: China's technology challenge is bigger than just Huawei, British spymaster says
Description: The West needs to understand that the challenge of China's technological revolution runs much deeper than Huawei's row with the United States over intellectual property theft and state espionage, one of Britain's top spies said.

Headlines: Madoff trustee can pursue lawsuits against Koch, banks, others
Description: A U.S. federal appeals court said the trustee liquidating Bernard Madoff's firm may pursue dozens of lawsuits to recoup funds from defendants including Koch Industries Inc, long controlled by the billionaire brothers Charles and David Koch, and major banks.

Headlines: RTL sells Universum Film to U.S. firm KKR
Description: Broadcaster RTL on Monday said it had sold Universum Film, a unit specialized in film rights, to U.S. private equity KKR for an undisclosed sum.

Headlines: Huawei security row overshadows annual telecoms gathering
Description: Leading telecoms companies gather in Barcelona this weekend for their main annual trade fair under the shadow of a bitter clash between the United States and China over network security for the next generation of mobile services.

Headlines: Factbox: Pharma company executives to testify at U.S. Senate drug price hearing
Description: Executives from seven of the world's largest pharmaceutical companies are set to testify about high U.S. prescription drug prices at a U.S. Senate hearing on Tuesday, amid an intensifying focus on the industry's practices by both political parties.

Headlines: U.S. housing outlook stuck in a lull as economy dulls: Reuters poll
Description: U.S. house prices are forecast to rise this year at the slowest pace in more than half a decade, as a dearth of single-family homes and higher mortgage rates restrain activity in an already-expensive market, a Reuters poll of housing analysts found.

Headlines: Fed's Powell heads to Congress amid shifting landscape
Description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell worked hard to strengthen ties with Congress during his first year as head of the U.S. central bank, doubling the pace of meetings with lawmakers over his predecessors and courting Democrats and Republicans alike.

Headlines: U.S. trial tests claims Roundup weed killer caused cancer
Description: Bayer AG on Monday faced a second U.S. jury over allegations that its popular glyphosate-based weed killer Roundup causes cancer, six months after the company's share price was rocked by a $289 million verdict in California state court.

Headlines: Car industry will be big 5G customer down the road, says SEAT
Description: Carmakers will be big customers for next-generation telecoms networks, helping to justify investment in 5G, but need to be more innovative if the technology is to take off, Spain's SEAT said on Monday.

Headlines: Oil falls more than 3 percent as Trump blames OPEC for 'too high' prices
Description: Oil futures tumbled more than 3 percent on Monday in their largest daily percentage drop this year after U.S. President Donald Trump called on OPEC to ease its efforts to boost crude prices, which he said were "getting too high."

Headlines: Wall Street rises after Trump stirs China trade hopes again
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes ended higher on Monday but well below the session's highs after President Donald Trump said he would delay a planned hike in tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: Pharma stocks could see turbulence from U.S. Senate drug-price hearing
Description: U.S. healthcare stocks could face more turbulence on Tuesday, after a bumpy early 2019, as top executives from some of the largest pharmaceutical companies are expected to get grilled in the U.S. Senate on the high cost of prescription drugs.

Headlines: Embraer shareholders OK sale of commercial jet division to Boeing
Description: Shareholders of Brazil's Embraer SA approved a deal on Tuesday to sell 80 percent of the company's commercial plane division to Boeing Co, enabling Boeing to compete with Airbus SE in the market for jets with up to 150 seats.

Headlines: Exclusive: Glencore complains to LME about access to metal in Malaysia
Description: Glencore has lodged a complaint with the London Metal Exchange (LME) about the company's inability to take speedy delivery of aluminum from warehouses owned by ISTIM UK in Port Klang, Malaysia, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Pound leaps on Brexit hopes, shares take breather
Description: Britain's pound vaulted to a 21-month high against the euro on Tuesday on hopes that the worst of all Brexits will be avoided, while world shares took a breather after scaling five-month peaks.

Headlines: Thomson Reuters posts earnings beat, hunts for acquisitions
Description: Thomson Reuters reported better-than-expected earnings on Tuesday, helping push its shares to a record high, and said it is continuing to look for acquisitions to bolster its Legal and Tax & Accounting units, where demand is up in part because of U.S. tax reforms.

Headlines: Hapag-Lloyd says U.S. shipping probe closed, free of obligations
Description: Germany's Hapag-Lloyd is cleared of a U.S. Department of Justice probe into the practices of container shipping companies, with no charges brought, a spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Short seller Andrew Left loses appeal against Hong Kong market ban
Description: U.S. short seller Andrew Left lost his legal bid on Tuesday to overturn a five-year ban from Hong Kong's financial markets and a fine for market manipulation.

Headlines: VW creates entry-level JETTA brand to capture first-time buyers
Description: Volkswagen on Tuesday said it will launch an entry-level JETTA brand in China in the third quarter this year, as a way to capture first-time buyers in the world's largest car market which has started to sputter.

Headlines: 'Loser' vs 'Anemic': Barrick's Newmont bid starts on toxic note
Description: Long-time rivals Barrick Gold Corp and Newmont Mining Corp renewed their animosity on Monday with their chief executives trading insults after Barrick launched an $18 billion hostile bid for the U.S. company, presaging an aggressive battle.

Headlines: Boeing shifting spare parts in preparation for Brexit: executive
Description: Boeing Co has been shifting spare parts between its distribution centers in the United Kingdom and elsewhere in the world in preparation for Brexit, an executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers, industry fret over Trump's China trade deal eagerness
Description: President Donald Trump's decision to delay a steep tariff hike on Chinese goods as he touted progress in weekend trade talks was greeted with a mixture of relief and dread among U.S. industry groups and lawmakers on Monday.

Headlines: UAW sues GM over decision to end production at U.S. plants
Description: The United Auto Workers union on Tuesday filed suit against General Motors Co over its decision to end production and eliminate thousands of jobs at three U.S. auto plants, saying it violated a 2015 collective bargaining agreement.

Headlines: Brazil's CAOA in talks to buy Ford factory: source
Description: Brazilian automaker CAOA, which produces vehicles with Korea's Hyundai Motor Co and China's Chery Automobile Co, is in talks to buy a Ford Motor Co plant in the country that is slated to close by 2019, according to a source with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Papa John's gives upbeat full-year forecast after rocky 2018, shares rise
Description: Papa John's International Inc forecast better-than-feared North American same-store sales on Tuesday, as the U.S. pizza chain's investments on rebranding following its months-long spat with founder John Schnatter pay off.

Headlines: Fed's Powell says 'no rush' to hike rates in 'solid' but slowing economy
Description: The Federal Reserve is in "no rush to make a judgment" about further changes to interest rates, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell told U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday as he spelled out the central bank's approach to an economy that is likely slowing.

Headlines: Boeing unveils unmanned combat jet developed in Australia
Description: Boeing Co on Wednesday unveiled an unmanned, fighter-like jet developed in Australia and designed to fly alongside crewed aircraft in combat for a fraction of the cost.

Headlines: Hyundai rejects Elliott's payout call, shares rise ahead of showdown meeting
Description: Hyundai Motor Group on Tuesday rejected demands by U.S. activist investor Elliott Management for a combined 7 trillion won ($6.3 billion) dividend payout and new board members, complicating efforts to revamp South Korea's second-biggest conglomerate.

Headlines: Exclusive: HSBC probe helped lead to U.S. charges against Huawei CFO
Description: An internal investigation by HSBC Holdings PLC into Huawei Technologies' connections to a suspected front company in Iran found that the Chinese telecommunications equipment maker maintained close financial ties to the firm years after purportedly selling the unit, documents reviewed by Reuters show.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department will not appeal AT&T, Time Warner merger after court loss
Description: AT&T Inc emerged victorious on Tuesday over the Trump administration's drawn-out attempts to block its $85.4 billion purchase of Time Warner as the U.S. Justice Department said it would not fight an appeals court ruling approving the deal.

Headlines: Boeing nominates former U.N. ambassador Haley to join its board
Description: U.S. aerospace manufacturer Boeing Co said on Tuesday it has nominated Nikki Haley, former U.S. ambassador to the United Nations and a close ally of President Donald Trump, to join its board of directors at the company's annual shareholders meeting on April 29.

Headlines: Dutch shell firms used to pay millions in Brazilian bribes: prosecutors
Description: Prosecutors raided locations across the Netherlands on Tuesday as part of an investigation into the alleged use of shell companies to distribute $100 million in bribes on behalf of Brazilian conglomerate Odebrecht SA.

Headlines: U.S. senators tell drug company executives pricing is 'morally repugnant'
Description: U.S. senators called drug pricing practices "morally repugnant" and told drug company executives they do not want to hear them blame others for the high prices, taking an aggressive stance at a Senate hearing on the rising costs of prescription medicines.

Headlines: Wall St. edges lower in choppy session
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes fell slightly after a choppy session on Tuesday as investors eyed mixed U.S. economic data and corporate news and waited for clarity on issues such as the U.S.-China trade talks.

Headlines: Walmart seeks ad business boost in fight with Amazon
Description: Walmart Inc will consolidate advertising sales for its stores and websites, it said on Tuesday, aiming to boost profits from an untapped business as the world's largest retailer competes with marketing titans Amazon.com Inc, Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc.

Headlines: Fed says U.S. economy ended 2018 with solid but weakening growth
Description: The U.S. economy maintained "solid" growth through the second half of 2018, likely expanding "just under" 3 percent for the year, though consumer and business spending had begun to weaken, the Federal Reserve said on Friday in its semi-annual monetary policy report to Congress.

Headlines: Macy's new restructuring to cut 100 senior jobs, save $100 million annually
Description: Macy's Inc, the largest U.S. department store chain, said on Tuesday it would cut 100 senior management positions to reduce costs and improve profitability, and reported holiday same-store sales growth short of Wall Street's expectations.

Headlines: Citgo formally cuts ties with Venezuela-based parent company: sources
Description: U.S. refiner Citgo Petroleum Corp is formally cutting ties with its parent, state-run oil firm Petroleos de Venezuela SA, to meet U.S. sanctions imposed on the OPEC country, two people close to the decision told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: JPMorgan keeps key profit goal, cautious on U.S. recession risks
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co, the biggest U.S. bank by assets, said on Tuesday it expects to face rising costs for deposits, a key part of its business, and slowing global economic growth.

Headlines: Instant View: Powell - Fed remains patient deciding on further hikes
Description: Rising risks and recent soft data shouldn't prevent solid growth for the U.S. economy this year, but the Federal Reserve will remain "patient" in deciding on further interest rate hikes, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell said on Tuesday.

Headlines: With OPEC likely to ignore Trump, oil prices edge up
Description: Oil futures inched up on Tuesday after news that OPEC would continue production cuts despite comments from U.S. President Donald Trump, who criticized the producer group for rising crude prices a day earlier.

Headlines: Why some U.S. fund managers like China regardless of trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to delay raising tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods has helped push global stock markets broadly higher as investors hope for a resolution in the trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: U.S. consumer regulator forms task force to monitor big tech
Description: The Federal Trade Commission, under pressure to keep closer tabs on big tech companies such as Alphabet's Google and Facebook, said on Tuesday it would create a task force to monitor the sector and investigate anticompetitive conduct.

Headlines: Europe calls for facts not fears in Huawei security row
Description: Facts not fears should decide the future of telecoms network security in Europe, industry leaders and policy chiefs said this week, brushing off U.S. calls for a ban on Chinese vendors.

Headlines: Dutch state's Air France-KLM raid shows interventionist mood
Description: When Air France's new Canadian chief executive met Dutch politicians in The Hague on Feb. 15, he unknowingly set in motion a new chapter in European aviation nationalism.

Headlines: U.S. goods trade deficit deteriorates; factory orders edge up
Description: The U.S. goods trade deficit widened sharply in December as slowing global demand and a strong dollar weighed on exports, another sign that economic growth slowed in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: Qatar, China, Japan sought 'extras' after Barclays 2008 fundraising: court
Description: Qatari, Chinese and Japanese investors all sought "extras" from Barclays as the British bank raised billions of pounds at the height of the credit crisis in 2008, a landmark London criminal trial heard on Wednesday.

Headlines: J.C. Penney pulls plug on clothing subscription service
Description: J.C. Penney Co Inc on Friday will end a clothing subscription service venture, the retailer said this week, a move toward sharpening its focus on more-profitable apparel sales and exiting lines like major appliances.

Headlines: Germany's Merck makes $5.9 billion counterbid for Versum
Description: German drugs and lab supplies maker Merck KGaA offered $5.9 billion, including debt, for Versum Materials, in a cash deal that tops an offer from U.S. rival Entegris, as both seek to boost their electrochemicals operations.

Headlines: JPMorgan hires commercial bankers, leaders across Europe, Asia
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co on Wednesday named half a dozen people to a commercial banking team in Europe and new international and Asia-Pacific regional leaders, as the U.S. bank closes in on business clients it hopes to poach from rivals abroad.

Headlines: Global stocks slip after U.S. trade official's comments but energy up
Description: Global stock indexes ended with mostly slight losses on Wednesday after U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said it was too early to predict an outcome in U.S.-China trade talks, although a jump in oil prices lifted shares of energy companies.

Headlines: Wall Street steadies after Lighthizer, Powell, Cohen testimonies
Description: The S&P 500 closed down slightly on Wednesday but well above its session low after testimonies to U.S. Congress from trade and central bank officials as well as President Donald Trump's former lawyer brought few major surprises.

Headlines: Rattled by Vale disaster, mining CEOs move to change industry
Description: After last month's deadly tailings dam disaster at a Vale SA facility in Brazil, Freeport-McMoRan Inc Chief Executive Richard Adkerson sent a memo to his 29,000 employees telling them to immediately report any safety concerns about the scores of dams his company operates.

Headlines: Hot-rolled mess: China's steelmakers hit the skids as car sales slow
Description: China's steel mills may have taken a wrong turn by adding millions of tonnes of new high-end capacity just as the country's car sector, a key steel consumer, undergoes its first contraction in decades, cutting metal demand.

Headlines: China's CDH targets raising $1 billion in venture capital arm: sources
Description: China's CDH Investments is aiming to raise nearly $1 billion in dollar and yuan funds through its venture and growth capital arm to invest in sectors including healthcare and logistics, said people with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Wingardium Leviosa! Harry Potter magic helps Lego lift sales
Description: Harry Potter and Star Wars building sets helped Lego return to growth in 2018, along with strong sales in China, where the privately-owned Danish toymaker plans to open new stores.

Headlines: Elliott pushes for Hyundai shareholder support after dividend proposals rejected
Description: Elliott Management Corp on Wednesday urged shareholders of a Hyundai Motor Group firm to vote for its proposal for higher dividends and new board members, a day after the South Korean conglomerate rejected demands by the U.S. activist investor.

Headlines: Ahold says on course to meet U.S. online sales growth targets
Description: Ahold Delhaize, which operates supermarkets in Europe and the United States, is on track to meet a 20 percent U.S. online sales growth target this year as it opens automated grocery distribution points along the East Coast, its chief executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Bayer reaps profit lift from Monsanto seeds, consumer health
Description: Bayer's $63 billion purchase of U.S. seeds maker Monsanto made its mark on the German company's fourth quarter earnings on Wednesday, lifting profit and boding well for the peak season of its enlarged agriculture business.

Headlines: Lowe's predicts more home renovations this year after strong profit
Description: U.S. home improvement chain Lowe's beat Wall Street earnings forecasts on Wednesday, and predicted that more Americans would renovate their houses this year rather than buy a home in a market where prices are rising.

Headlines: Ford's China JV ends some contracts with job agencies as sales fall
Description: Ford Motor Co's joint venture with China Changan Automobile Group has decided not to renew its contract with some agencies supplying it with workers, as carmakers struggle to cope with slumping sales in China.

Headlines: U.S. goods trade deficit widens sharply in December
Description: The U.S. goods trade deficit widened sharply in December as slowing global demand and a strong dollar weighed on exports, another sign that economic growth slowed in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: Huawei, Samsung agree to settle patent dispute in U.S. court
Description: China's Huawei Technologies and South Korea's Samsung Electronics have agreed to settle a two-year old patent dispute in the United States, court documents show.

Headlines: Disney agrees to sell Fox Sports in Brazil to win antitrust nod
Description: Walt Disney Co accepted a demand by Brazil's antitrust regulator CADE that it sell local rights for the Fox Sports channel to win approval of its takeover of Twenty-First Century Fox Inc, the regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: First Facebook investigation to be completed by summer: regulator
