Description: Facebook's lead regulator in the European Union expects to conclude the first of seven investigations into the company's use of personal data this summer and the remainder by the end of the year, Ireland's Data Protection Commissioner said on Thursday.

Headlines: Future Retail secures deal to open 7-Eleven stores in India
Description: U.S.-based 7-Eleven Inc expects to open its first branded store in India this year, after reaching a deal with Future Retail Ltd to run the chain in the Asian nation.

Headlines: China February factory activity shrinks to three-year low, export orders worst in a decade
Description: Factory activity in China contracted to a three-year low in February as export orders fell at the fastest pace since the global financial crisis, highlighting deepening cracks in an economy facing weak demand at home and abroad.

Headlines: JD.com shares jump on upbeat sales performance
Description: JD.com Inc, China's second largest e-commerce firm, reported a 22.4 percent jump in quarterly sales on Thursday, beating estimates on the back of robust retail sales and sending its U.S.-listed shares up 13.8 percent in pre-market trade.

Headlines: Sunrise hits snag after announcing $6.3 billion deal for Liberty Global's Swiss assets
Description: Sunrise Communications' $6.3 billion deal to buy U.S. cable giant Liberty Global's Swiss assets, announced on Thursday, immediately hit a snag as a key shareholder said it would shun a planned rights issue to finance the acquisition.

Headlines: U.S. working on detailed trade pact with China: Mnuchin
Description: The United States is working to hammer out a detailed trade agreement with China that will include specific structural commitments, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told CNBC on Thursday.

Headlines: Inmarsat jumps on report EchoStar plans new approach
Description: Inmarsat shares spiked on Thursday afternoon after a report by CTFN M&A news website said U.S. satellite group EchoStar was expected to renew its interest in the company "very soon", and no later than the next six months.

Headlines: Russian court denies detained U.S. investor Calvey bail
Description: A Russian court on Thursday ruled that prominent U.S. investor Michael Calvey should remain in custody pending trial, rejecting his appeal to be released on bail or moved to house arrest.

Headlines: Exxon's Cyprus gas discovery adds another giant to East Med collection
Description: ExxonMobil added another giant gas discovery to the east Mediterranean region after finding a gas-bearing reservoir offshore Cyprus but infrastructure bottlenecks and geopolitical disputes mean output from the field could be far off.

Headlines: S&P 500 could go beyond its current record closing level: Investor
Description: David Dietze of Point View Wealth Management says he remains bullish on U.S. markets in part because the fear of higher interest rates has been "tamed."

Headlines: Exclusive: Meeting Maduro - Inside a U.S. businessman's oil deal with Venezuela
Description: In November 2017, Harry Sargeant III, a wealthy American businessman, flew to Venezuela to see about buying some oil.

Headlines: USTR to suspend China tariff hike 'until further notice'
Description: The U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Wednesday it would move to formally suspend a scheduled tariff increase on Chinese goods "until further notice" following President Donald Trump's decision to delay his Friday deadline for a U.S.-China trade deal amid progress in their talks.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank merger with Commerzbank doesn't make sense: advisor
Description: A merger between Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank does not make economic sense at the moment, an advisor to Germany's Finance Ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Starbucks' China rival Luckin Coffee taps three banks for U.S. IPO: sources
Description: Chinese startup Luckin Coffee, which has ambitions to overtake Starbucks at home this year, has tapped three banks including Credit Suisse to work on a U.S. IPO in 2019, said people with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Darkening economic outlook threatens to cap oil price in 2019: Reuters poll
Description: Oil analysts have grown more pessimistic over the prospects for a significant price rally this year, as booming U.S. shale output and a deteriorating global economic backdrop threaten to offset the boost from OPEC's crude supply cuts.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor CEO says China capacity cuts being considered: sources
Description: Hyundai Motor Co, which is reeling from tumbling sales in China, is considering cutting capacity at its factories in its biggest market, Chief Executive Lee Won-hee said, according to two people with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: China P2P lender Dianrong closing 60 stores, laying off 2,000 employees: source
Description: Dianrong, one of China's biggest peer-to-peer (P2P) lenders, is shutting down 60 of its 90 offline stores and laying off an estimated 2,000 employees, a source with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Fed's Powell: 'Muted' inflation gives room for wages to rise
Description: A rise in productivity last year gives more room for wages to grow without the risk of higher inflation, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said on Thursday, offering another reason why the U.S. central bank can hold off on further rate increases.

Headlines: In U.S. charm offensive, China's Huawei launches ad to combat dark image
Description: Huawei Technologies ran a full page ad in major U.S. newspapers on Thursday urging readers not to believe "everything you hear," about the Chinese tech firm, as it defends itself against government accusations its equipment can be used to spy.

Headlines: U.S. stocks edge downward as Wall Street takes a pause
Description: Wall Street's main indexes fell slightly on Thursday as support from better-than-feared U.S. GDP data was countered by concerns about earnings and U.S.-China trade relations.

Headlines: HBO Chief Executive Richard Plepler to resign from company
Description: HBO Chief Executive Richard Plepler will leave the premium television network owned by U.S. wireless carrier AT&T Inc after nearly 28 years at the company, Plepler said in a memo to HBO employees on Thursday.

Headlines: Huawei units plead not guilty to U.S. trade secret theft
Description: Huawei Device Co Ltd and Huawei Device USA Inc pleaded not guilty to U.S. fraud, trade secrets conspiracy and other charges, and a trial date was set for March 2020, the Justice Department said on Thursday.

Headlines: Kia, Hyundai expand U.S. engine fire recalls by 534,000 vehicles
Description: Kia Motors Corp and affiliate Hyundai Motor Co said on Thursday they are recalling around 534,000 additional U.S. vehicles at risk of engine fires.

Headlines: U.S. economic growth in 2018 misses Trump's 3 percent target
Description: The U.S. economy fell short of the Trump administration's 3 percent annual growth target in 2018 despite $1.5 trillion in tax cuts and a government spending blitz, and economists say growth will only slow from here.

Headlines: Global stocks fall on China weakness, tempered trade hopes
Description: Global equities markets fell on Thursday as weak Chinese economic data and mixed messages on the progress of trade talks between China and the United States weighed on investor sentiment.

Headlines: Caesars bows to Icahn demands on board, sale still eyed
Description: U.S. casino operator Caesars Entertainment Corp has struck a deal with investor Carl Icahn that appoints three new directors to its board, although the billionaire hedge fund manager continues to press for a sale of the company.

Headlines: Another Kroger unit to stop accepting Visa credit cards due to high fees
Description: U.S. supermarket chain Kroger Co on Friday said its Smith's Food and Drug Stores division will stop accepting Visa Inc's credit cards, starting April 3, because of excessive transaction fees.

Headlines: Big U.S. pension funds ask electric utilities for decarbonization plans
Description: Top U.S. pension funds are asking electric utilities to accelerate efforts to cut carbon emissions but will not force the issue with proxy resolutions this spring, hoping market shifts and falling prices for renewable energy have already made executives and directors receptive to the goal.

Headlines: JPMorgan keeps Venezuela in emerging bond indexes: fund managers
Description: JPMorgan has retained dollar-denominated debt issued by Venezuela and its state-run oil company PDVSA in a key emerging market bond index as part of its monthly rebalancing, according to two fund managers.

Headlines: Pompeo says world should have eyes wide open about Chinese tech risks
Description: U.S Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Friday that the world should be "eyes wide open" about the risks of using Chinese technology, and that there could be problems for American firms operating in certain places where Huawei equipment was deployed.

Headlines: China's fledgling junk bond market spawns new breed of vulture funds
Description: When the Shanghai-traded bonds of conglomerate China Minsheng Investment Group plunged 40 percent over two days in January after news it had missed a repayment, Beijing-based hedge fund manager Jash Zhang smelled blood.

Headlines: William Hill 2019 outlook in line as U.S. expansion ramps up
Description: British bookmaker William Hill Plc said on Friday that 2019 results would be in line with market expectations while reporting a slight dip in full-year adjusted operating profit, as it booked more costs to expand in the U.S.

Headlines: Canada to allow extradition case against Huawei executive
Description: The Canadian government, as expected, said on Friday it would allow an extradition hearing to proceed against Meng Wanzhou, the chief financial officer of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd who was detained in Canada late last year.

Headlines: Wall St. Week Ahead: U.S. stock reign may not last over other regions
Description: U.S. stock prices are outpacing those in most other regions to start 2019, but the gap is narrow and some investors are eyeing potential catalysts to tip the scales to the rest of the world.

Headlines: Canada approves Huawei extradition proceedings, China seethes
Description: The Canadian government, as expected, on Friday approved extradition proceedings against the chief financial officer of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, prompting a furious reaction from China.

Headlines: U.S. fines American Airlines, Delta for long tarmac delays
Description: American Airlines was fined $1 million and Delta Air Lines Inc $750,000 for violating federal rules barring lengthy tarmac delays at U.S. airports, the U.S. Transportation Department said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. auto sales fall in February on weak SUV demand
Description: Automakers on Friday reported a decline in U.S. light vehicle sales for February as demand for SUVs slows after years of rapid growth, pointing to a drop in overall sales in 2019.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending, factory data point to weak first quarter GDP growth
Description: U.S. personal income fell for the first time in more than three years in January and consumer spending dropped by the most since 2009 in December, putting the economy on a weak growth path early in the first quarter.

Headlines: Global shares rise on trade optimism, tame inflation
Description: World equity markets rose on Friday as optimism around trade and benign U.S. inflation boosted investor sentiment, while crude oil retreated on news of weaker U.S. factory activity.

Headlines: U.S. holds major oil and gas lease sale in sage grouse habitat
Description: The U.S. government kicked off a major sale of oil and gas leases in Wyoming this week after rejecting protests over lands on offer that are considered critical areas for wildlife.

Headlines: Wells Fargo officials enter $240 million settlement over bogus accounts
Description: Wells Fargo & Co executives and directors have reached a $240 million settlement with U.S. shareholders over the creation by bank employees of millions of unauthorized customer accounts.

Headlines: Intellia CEO not involved in Starboard's Bristol-Myers board challenge
Description: Intellia Therapeutics Inc Chief Executive John Leonard, who U.S. drug maker Bristol-Myers Squibb Co said last week was nominated by hedge fund Starboard Value LP to sit on its board, is not affiliated with the effort, an Intellia spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. trade chief courts auto union to back North American trade pact
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and his staff will head to Michigan next week to meet with United Auto Workers union leaders in an effort to win labor backing for a new North American free trade deal, the union said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Huawei plans billions in dividends for staff despite row with U.S. - sources
Description: China's Huawei is set to reward employee shareholders with a 3 percent rise in cash dividends that are worth billions of dollars, according to company sources and Reuters calculations - a move expected to boost morale as it battles a U.S.-led drive against its telecom gear.

Headlines: White House to host CEOs for workforce advisory meeting
Description: The White House on Wednesday is hosting major chief executives who joined a Trump administration advisory board on workforce issues.

Headlines: German carmakers to invest 60 billion euros in electric cars and automation: VDA
Description: Germany's car industry is to invest nearly 60 billion euros ($68 billion) over the next three years on electric cars and automated driving, the head of the VDA car industry association said ahead of the Geneva motor show.

Headlines: Wall Street weekahead: U.S. stock reign may not last over other regions
Description: U.S. stock prices are outpacing those in most other regions to start 2019, but the gap is narrow and some investors are eyeing potential catalysts to tip the scales to the rest of the world.

Headlines: U.S. agency probing two fatal Tesla crashes in Florida since last Sunday
Description: U.S. authorities are investigating a fatal Tesla Inc Model S crash in Florida last Sunday that killed the driver and caused a massive fire, the second fatal Tesla crash in the state this week being probed, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Saturday.

Headlines: Head of French carmaker PSA says Europe's CO2 cuts will threaten jobs: Le Figaro
Description: The EU's plans to slash carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions from vehicles and push carmakers to go electric will threaten 13 million jobs in Europe's auto industry and benefit Asia, the head of French carmaker PSA told Le Figaro.

Headlines: Investors spooked by Brazilian Vale's surprise CEO shake-up
Description: Investors were skeptical on Sunday about the surprise decision by Brazil's Vale SA to remove its high-profile chief executive in the wake of a deadly January accident at one of the world's largest iron ore miner's facilities.

Headlines: China says U.S. trade talks progress 'well received'
Description: The "substantive progress" China and the United States have made in their trade talks has been "well-received" in both countries and around the world, a senior Chinese official said on Monday, maintaining Beijing's previous upbeat assessment of discussions.

Headlines: U.S. construction spending falls, fourth quarter GDP seen revised lower
Description: U.S. construction spending unexpectedly fell in December as investment in both private and public projects dropped, leading economists to expect that the government will trim its economic growth estimate for the fourth quarter.

Headlines: U.S. seeks to cut dialysis costs with more home care versus clinics
Description: The Trump administration is working on a new payment approach for treating kidney disease that favors lower cost care at home and transplants, a change that would upend a dialysis industry that provides care in thousands of clinics nationwide.

Headlines: Dollar nudges up on hopes for U.S.-China trade deal
Description: The dollar rose against a basket of major currencies on Monday on traders' bets that China and the United States are moving closer to a trade deal that would end sparring between the world's two biggest economies.

Headlines: Wall Street drops after weak data, healthcare slump
Description: Wall Street's major indexes fell on Monday, weighed down by a weak U.S. construction spending report and declines in healthcare shares, as an initial rally on optimism over a U.S.-China trade deal faded.

Headlines: Ghosn's family taps U.N. rights working group to show violations in detention
Description: Carlos Ghosn's lawyers have submitted a dossier to a United Nations' working group which showed that the former head of Renault's rights had been violated during detention in Japan, one if his lawyers said on Monday.

Headlines: Vale shares fall after CEO is 'temporarily' ousted after dam disaster
Description: Shares in Brazil's Vale SA, the world's largest iron-ore miner, fell on Monday after its CEO Fabio Schvartsman and three other executives resigned over the weekend following a dam collapse in January that left over 300 dead.

Headlines: Google plans to ban political ads before Canada election
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google will ban political advertising on its platform before the Canadian federal election, after the country introduced stringent transparency rules.

Headlines: Huawei said to be preparing to sue U.S. government: source
Description: Chinese telecoms equipment company Huawei plans to announce a lawsuit against the United States government on Thursday on grounds related to a defense bill, a source with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Honeywell sees slowing demand for civilian helicopters over next five years
Description: Honeywell International Inc expects to deliver 4,000 helicopters for civilian use through 2023, down from 4,200 it forecast last year, on the back of a slowing global economy, the U.S. industrial conglomerate said on Monday.

Headlines: Easier for China to face tariffs than bend to U.S. pressure
Description: China will acknowledge concessions made in any trade deal with the United States for the sake of stabilizing shaky relations, but is unlikely to yield to demands it alter its economic model even if faced with continued tariffs, many trade experts believe.

Headlines: Ghosn lawyer says he's optimistic former Nissan head could soon win bail
Description: The lawyer for former Nissan Motor Co Ltd Chairman Carlos Ghosn on Monday said he was optimistic the ousted executive could win bail in the near future, after being held in custody at a detention center in Japan for over three months.

Headlines: JPMorgan backs away from private prison finance
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co has decided to stop financing private operators of prisons and detention centers, which have become targets of protests over Trump administration immigration policies.

Headlines: Exclusive: Romania's opposition seeks Huawei ban in telecom infrastructure
Description: Romania's biggest opposition party will trigger a public inquiry into Huawei's contribution to critical infrastructure and seek to bar it from 5G network development due to mounting security concerns, its IT expert said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Suits and ties now optional, Goldman Sachs hedges dress code
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc said on Tuesday that it is relaxing the dress code for all its employees, a move once considered unimaginable for the Wall Street firm's leagues of monk-shoed partners and bankers in bespoke suits.

Headlines: China to take steps to boost domestic consumption this year: state planner
Description: China's state planner said on Wednesday that the government will implement measures to further boost domestic consumption this year.

Headlines: China to slash taxes, boost lending to prop up slowing economy
Description: China sought to shore up its slowing economy through billions of dollars in planned tax cuts and infrastructure spending, with economic growth at its weakest in almost 30 years due to softer domestic demand and a trade war with the United States.

Headlines: Belle International taps BAML for sportswear unit IPO after $6.8 billion buyout: sources
Description: Chinese footwear retailer Belle International has hired Bank of America Merill Lynch (BAML) to help prepare for a Hong Kong listing of its sportswear business this year, said people with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales at seven-month high; services sector picks up
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes rose to a seven-month high in December, but November's outsized jump was revised lower, pointing to continued weakness in the housing market.

Headlines: T-Mobile spent $195,000 at Trump Hotel in D.C. since merger announcement
Description: T-Mobile Us Inc's chief executive, John Legere, and other company leaders have spent $195,000 on hotel stays and other expenses at the Trump International Hotel in Washington since the company sought approval for a $26 billion merger with Sprint last April, documents released on Tuesday show.

Headlines: Oil prices flat; focus on OPEC-led output cuts, Libya oilfield
Description: Oil prices hovered near flat on Tuesday as the market balanced OPEC-led efforts to tighten crude supply with the restart of Libya's biggest oilfield and the prospect of weaker demand.

Headlines: BMW could shift some UK engine, Mini output if no orderly Brexit
Description: BMW could move some production of engines and its Mini model out of Britain if the country does not secure an orderly departure from the European Union, the German carmaker said on Tuesday, in the latest Brexit warning from the auto industry.

Headlines: Exclusive: Carlyle in final talks to clinch $3.4 billion deal for Cepsa stake - sources
Description: Private equity firm Carlyle Group is ahead of other contenders to buy a 30 percent stake in Spain's Cepsa for up to 3 billion euros ($3.4 billion), just four months after owner Mubadala shelved a listing of the energy company, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: China agrees on solution to Tesla customs issue: source
Description: China's customs authorities have accepted electric carmaker Tesla Inc's plan to remedy problems with the clearance of imported cars, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Carmaker Rolls-Royce: Short Brexit delay would make things worse
Description: A short delay to Brexit would make things even worse, scuppering some contingency plans organized around a Mar. 29 exit date, the boss of luxury carmaker Rolls-Royce told Reuters.

Headlines: Chevron, Exxon take turns wooing investors with shale boasts
Description: The two biggest U.S. oil companies tried to outdo each other on Tuesday, boasting about their prowess in shale to lure investors to their side.

Headlines: Pompeo says China trade deal has 'got to be right': interview
Description: U.S. President Trump will reject a U.S.-China trade deal that is not perfect, but the United States would still keep working on an agreement, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said in a media interview.

Headlines: China can 'absolutely' reach agreement with U.S. on financial opening, banking regulatory chief says
Description: China can "absolutely" reach an agreement with the United States on opening up its financial sector, China's top banking regulator Guo Shuqing told reporters on Tuesday on the sidelines of the annual parliament meeting.

Headlines: Codelco's lithium push fades in favor of copper
Description: With the global race to secure lithium heating up in 2016, Chile's president Michelle Bachelet wanted to be sure her country seized the moment. Home to half the world's lithium reserves, Chile tapping its state-run miner Codelco to ramp up production seemed a sure bet.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific in talks to buy stake in HNA's HK Express Airways
Description: Hong Kong flagship carrier Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd said on Tuesday it is in "active discussions" about an acquisition involving budget airline Hong Kong Express Airways Ltd, although an agreement has yet to be reached.

Headlines: Investor pushes L Brands to spin off Victoria's Secret
Description: Activist investor Barington Capital on Tuesday urged L Brands to separate its Victoria's Secret and Bath & Body Works businesses, in an effort to turn around the struggling consumer brands owner.

Headlines: U.S. extends time for divestment from sanctioned Russian company GAZ
Description: The U.S. Treasury said on Wednesday it was extending by four months the deadline for investors to divest from Russian automaker GAZ, a company linked to Russian tycoon Oleg Deripaska that Washington sanctioned over Russia's "malign activity."

Headlines: Exclusive: Grab eyes more funding after record $4.5 billion round in Southeast Asia
Description: Grab is considering raising more funds from strategic investors, the president of Southeast Asia's top ride-hailing firm said, after raking in over $4.5 billion in the region's largest private financing round that included SoftBank's Vision Fund. The Singapore-based firm continues to see strong interest from global investors after securing nearly $1.5 billion from the Vision Fund in a year-long round, Ming Maa told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade talks progressing well via video conference: USDA official
Description: Trade negotiations between the United States and China are progressing well via video conference, a senior official at the U.S. Department of Agriculture said on Wednesday.

Headlines: As Trump wages trade war, U.S. goods deficit hits record high in 2018
Description: The U.S. goods trade deficit surged to a record high in 2018 as strong domestic demand fueled by lower taxes pulled in imports, despite the Trump administration's "America First" policies, including tariffs, aimed at shrinking the trade gap.

Headlines: GE explores stake sale in Enel renewables joint venture: sources
Description: General Electric Co is exploring a sale of its 50 percent stake in a renewable energy joint venture with Italy's Enel SpA, the latest deal GE CEO Lawrence Culp is pursuing to pay down debt, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Huawei set to announce lawsuit against U.S. as it seeks to strike back
Description: Huawei Technologies is set to announce a lawsuit on Thursday against the United States, ratcheting up its response to a campaign aimed at closing it out of Western markets for fear its telecoms equipment could be used by Beijing for spying.

Headlines: In Canadian court, Huawei CFO's lawyer raises Trump comments on case
Description: The lawyer for Huawei Technologies' Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou told a Canadian court on Wednesday that he has concerns allegations against her have a political character and raised U.S. President Donald Trump's comments on the case.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil CEO sets plan to boost spending; shares dip
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp plans to boost capital spending for several years, CEO Darren Woods said on Wednesday, and the largest U.S. oil company's shares fell after he laid out a strategy to "lean in" while the rest of the industry cuts back.

Headlines: Nielsen, Headset partner to study U.S. cannabis market
Description: Consumer research services provider Nielsen Holdings Plc said on Wednesday it had teamed up with cannabis analytics company Headset, to help packaged goods companies understand the U.S. cannabis market.

Headlines: Amazon to close U.S. pop-up stores, focus on opening more book stores
Description: Amazon.com Inc will close all of its U.S. pop-up stores and focus instead on opening more book stores, a company spokesperson said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Hyundai may suspend production at one of its Chinese plants as slowdown bites
Description: Hyundai Motor Co is considering plans to suspend production at its oldest plant in China, the South Korean carmaker said on Wednesday, as it reels from tumbling sales and massive overcapacity in its biggest market.

Headlines: Tariffs, government shutdown weigh on still-growing economy: Fed
Description: Slowing global growth and the 35-day partial federal government shutdown weighed on the U.S. economy in the first weeks of 2019, but it continued growing amid still-tight labor markets, the Federal Reserve reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ousted Nissan boss Ghosn leaves Japan jail after $9 million bail
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn walked out of a Tokyo prison on a $9 million bail on Wednesday, slipping past reporters in a face mask and moving closer to mounting a defense against financial misconduct charges that he has called "meritless".

Headlines: Ex-Nissan boss Ghosn pays bail, Tokyo court says, paving way for release on Wednesday
Description: Former Nissan Motor Chairman Carlos Ghosn has paid bail of 1 billion yen ($8.9 million), the Tokyo District Court said on Wednesday, clearing the way for his release from the Tokyo detention center where he has been held for more than 100 days.

Headlines: Geely chairman says China auto industry faces restructuring in next 3-5 years
Description: Zhejiang Geely Holding's Chairman, Li Shufu, said on Wednesday China's automotive industry faces restructuring and bankruptcies in the next three to five years as the industry transforms.

Headlines: Ex-Nissan chief Ghosn case shines harsh light on Japan's 'hostage justice'
Description: The high-profile case of ex-Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn has shone a light in Japan on what critics call "hostage justice", in which suspects can be held for months after arrest, but any reforms will likely be incremental and slow.

Headlines: Volvo Cars warns of pulling electric cars out of United States: FT
Description: Volvo Cars, owned by China's Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co, will not sell its all-electric Polestar models in the United States if the company faces tariffs on exports from China, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ghosn very affected by time in prison, lawyer says
Description: Ousted Renault-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn has been very affected by the 107 days he spent in a Tokyo prison, his French lawyer Francois Zimeray said on RTL radio station on Wednesday.

Headlines: French finance minister welcomes Ghosn's release from jail
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire welcomed on Wednesday the release of former Renault boss Carlos Ghosn from jail in Japan.

Headlines: Unlikely twins and differing fortunes: Malaysia's Petronas & Indonesia's Pertamina
Description: On the southernmost edge of the Asian landmass and on the shores of the busy shipping lanes of the Singapore Strait, Malaysia's Petronas is starting up a state-of-the art petroleum processing hub, called RAPID.

Headlines: Democrats probe whether White House interfered in AT&T Time Warner merger
Description: Two U.S. House Democrats on Thursday asked the White House and Justice Department to turn over documents that could show whether Republican President Donald Trump sought to intervene in the regulatory review of AT&T Inc's $85 billion acquisition of Time Warner Inc.

Headlines: SpaceX CEO Musk's security clearance under review over pot use: official
Description: SpaceX Chief Executive Elon Musk's security clearance is being reviewed by the Pentagon after the billionaire smoked marijuana on a California comedian's podcast in September, a U.S. official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Last Chevrolet Cruze in Ohio built amid GM restructuring
Description: General Motors Co said the last Chevrolet Cruze rolled off the assembly line Wednesday afternoon at its Lordstown, Ohio, assembly plant, the first of five plants in North America to end production this year and ending U.S. production of the Cruze.

Headlines: Tesla enters into agreement with Chinese lenders for Gigafactory
Description: Tesla Inc said on Thursday it signed an agreement with lenders in China for a 12-month facility of up to 3.5 billion yuan ($521 million) for the electric carmaker's Gigafactory in Shanghai, and secured new commitments from banks that could be used for investments in the United States and elsewhere.

Headlines: Huawei fights back against U.S. blackout with Texas lawsuit
Description: Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei Technologies sued the U.S. government on Thursday, saying a law limiting its American business was unconstitutional, ratcheting up its fight back against a government bent on closing it out of global markets.

Headlines: Germany does not want to ban Huawei from 5G networks: minister
Description: Germany does not want to ban Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei Technologies from building its 5G networks, Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Thursday, adding that Berlin would tighten security criteria for all vendors instead.

Headlines: Explainer: Huawei faces slim odds in new U.S. court fight
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd has opened up a new front in its battle with the U.S. government by filing a lawsuit challenging a congressional ban on federal agencies' use of the Chinese technology company's products.

Headlines: ECB move sends stocks lower; dollar climbs
Description: A gauge of global stock markets stumbled on Thursday while the U.S. dollar rose, as the European Central Bank postponed interest rate hikes to 2020 and launched a new round of cheap loans to banks in an effort to spark the euro zone economy.

Headlines: Abercrombie expects redesigned stores to boost 2019 sales, shares surge
Description: (This March 6 story, corrects paragraph 2 to say company will be closing up to 40 stores, not 40 stores; also drops reference to on-trend clothing boosting demand for the Abercrombie brand)

Headlines: U.S. State Department declines comment on Huawei suit
Description: The U.S. State Department declined to comment on Thursday on a lawsuit against the United State by Chinese telecommunications equipment maker Huawei Technologies, and said Washington advocates for secure networks that are free from undue foreign government influence.

Headlines: BMW's China electric car export plans on hold amid tariff uncertainty
Description: BMW's ambitions to establish China as a hub for exporting electric cars are in limbo because of uncertainty over potential trade tariffs between China and the United States, company executives told Reuters.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs further shrinks commodities trading
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc , once one of the most active banks in commodities trading, has cut 10 roles to further downsize its global commodities trading division amid rising costs and shrinking profits.

Headlines: SoftBank extends tech reach with $5 billion LatAm fund
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group is launching a $5 billion fund to invest in technology companies in Latin America, it said on Thursday, ramping up its tech ambitions beyond its huge Vision Fund.

Headlines: U.S. senators offer resolution backing Canada on Huawei CFO
Description: The Republican and Democratic leaders of the U.S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee introduced legislation on Thursday backing Canada's handling of Huawei Technologies Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou, as the United States seeks her extradition.

Headlines: Brazil's Sao Paulo state to offer tax incentives to automakers
Description: Brazil's Sao Paulo state said on Friday it would offer fresh tax incentives to automakers, weeks after Ford Motor Co said it would shut down a plant there with 3,000 employees and General Motors Co hinted it might do the same before backtracking.

Headlines: Canada court dismisses bid by SNC-Lavalin to escape corruption trial
Description: Canada's Federal Court on Friday rejected a bid by SNC-Lavalin Group Inc to challenge prosecutors who insist the construction company must face trial on charges of corruption.

Headlines: Oil drops 1 percent as economic outlook weakens, U.S. supply surges
Description: Oil prices fell about 1 percent on Friday after disappointing U.S. job growth revived concerns about a slowing global economy and weaker demand for oil.

Headlines: Global stocks, dollar fall as global growth worries mount
Description: Global stocks lost ground on Friday and the dollar softened for the first time in eight sessions after a disappointing U.S. payrolls report exacerbated concerns that the world economy was slowing.

Headlines: Wall Street extends losing streak after weak U.S. jobs data
Description: Wall Street's main indexes fell for a fifth straight session on Friday and posted their biggest weekly declines since the market tumbled at the end of 2018, as a weak U.S. jobs report ignited more concerns about the global economy.

Headlines: Exclusive: EDP readies sale of electricity generation assets in Portugal - sources
Description: EDP-Energia de Portugal is working on a plan to sell some of its electricity generation assets in Portugal, three sources close to the matter said, in an effort to free up cash to drive its renewable energy expansion.

Headlines: Wall Street weekahead: Housing shares dependent on economy easing but not falling
Description: The pace of U.S. economic growth may prove to be critical for shares of homebuilders, which have climbed sharply as spring approaches. An easing economy that allows for lower interest rates supports an optimistic outlook for the industry, investors say, but any hints of a sustained downturn could sink shares.

Headlines: Fed's Powell says no immediate policy responses needed to economy
Description: The Federal Reserve does not see problems in the U.S. economy that warrant an immediate change in its policy, and it will be careful not to shock financial markets as it stabilizes its bond portfolio, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said on Friday.

Headlines: China says hopes countries don't abuse rules to limit investment
Description: China hopes other countries do not abuse national security rules to impede normal investment, Vice Commerce Minister Qian Keming said on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. February job growth weakest in nearly one and a half years
Description: U.S. employment growth almost stalled in February, with the economy creating only 20,000 jobs, adding to signs of a sharp slowdown in economic activity in the first quarter.

Headlines: What stood out in the February U.S. jobs report
Description: Headline U.S. job growth hit the brakes in February, registering the smallest gain since September 2017 and the third-smallest during the unprecedented run of 101 consecutive months of payrolls gains.

Headlines: Exclusive: India investigating Philip Morris, Godfrey Phillips: source
Description: India's main financial crime-fighting agency is investigating Philip Morris International Inc and its Indian partner Godfrey Phillips for alleged violation of the country's laws, a senior directorate source told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: China's February crude imports surge 22 percent; gas imports drop from January
Description: China's crude oil imports rose to the third-highest volume on record on a daily basis on increasing purchases by new private refineries, while natural gas imports eased as demand dropped amid warmer temperatures, customs data showed on Friday.

Headlines: China February soybean imports fall to four-year low amid tariffs, flat demand
Description: China's soybean imports in February fell to their lowest monthly level in four years, as buying slowed amid uncertainties over trade relations with the United States and flat demand for soymeal, customs data showed on Friday.

Headlines: China's iron ore imports hit 10-month low in February on holiday break
Description: China's imports of iron ore fell to a 10-month low in February, customs data showed on Friday, curbed by a slowdown in trade during a week-long national holiday and a steep run-up in prices.

Headlines: China's February coal imports tumble on uncertainty over curbs, holiday disruption
Description: China's coal imports in February fell sharply from January after utilities curbed buying citing uncertainty over Beijing's policies on shipments arriving from overseas, while the week-long lunar new year holiday also cut into business.

Headlines: China's February trade surplus with U.S. narrows sharply to $14.72 billion
Description: China's trade surplus with the United States narrowed to $14.72 billion in February, from $27.3 billion in January, customs data showed on Friday.

Headlines: Tokyo prosecutor says Ghosn's bail conditions not sufficient
Description: A Tokyo prosecutor said on Friday he thought the bail conditions imposed on Carlos Ghosn, the former head of Nissan Motor and Renault, would not be sufficient to prevent tampering of evidence.

Headlines: No 'silent lambs': China supports Huawei's bid for U.S. legal redress
Description: The Chinese government's top diplomat, State Councilor Wang Yi, said on Friday that China supports Huawei Technologies' bid for legal redress in the United States, adding that Chinese companies should use "legal weapons" and not be "silent lambs".

Headlines: China February exports tumble the most in three years, spur fears of 'trade recession'
Description: China's exports tumbled the most in three years in February while imports fell for a third straight month, pointing to a further slowdown in the economy and stirring talk of a "trade recession", despite a spate of support measures.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. EPA aims to curb biofuel credit speculation by blocking outsiders
Description: The Environmental Protection Agency will attempt to stamp out speculation in the U.S. biofuel credit market by barring trading by non-industry players, publicizing large positions, and improving price transparency, a source familiar with the agency's proposals told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: 'Short' pound bets fade three weeks before Brexit
Description: With three weeks to go before Britain is due to exit the European Union, interest in selling the pound against the dollar and euro is dwindling as currency traders bet that the worst-case scenario of a no-deal Brexit will be averted.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. February job growth stalls but wage gains strong
Description: U.S. job growth almost stalled in February, with the economy creating only 20,000 jobs amid a contraction in payrolls in construction and several other sectors, which could raise concerns about a sharp slowdown in economic activity.

Headlines: China says working with U.S. day and night to get trade deal
Description: China and the United States are still working day and night to achieve a trade deal that matches the interests of both sides and the hopes of the world, including eliminating tit-for-tat tariffs, a senior Chinese official said on Saturday.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor in talks with investors to develop headquarters project
Description: Hyundai Motor Co is in talks with potential investors to develop its new headquarters planned for the South Korean capital of Seoul to share additional investment costs worth about 3.7 trillion won ($3.27 billion), it said on Sunday.

Headlines: Powell: Fed not in 'any hurry' to change rates amid global risks - tv
Description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said on Sunday the U.S. central bank does "not feel any hurry" to change the level of interest rates again as it watches how a slowing global economy affects local conditions in the United States.

Headlines: Berlin backs Deutsche Bank merger despite risk of shortfall: sources
Description: Berlin is so worried about the health of Deutsche Bank that it pushed for a merger with rival Commerzbank even though it could open up a huge financial shortfall, a German official told Reuters.

Headlines: Kia Motors considers suspending its No.1 plant in China: source
Description: Kia Motors may halt operations at its No.1 plant in China as part of its longer-term efforts to enhance competitiveness, a source familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Renault, Nissan, MMC plan joint board meeting, eye integration: report
Description: Renault SA, Nissan Motor Co and Mitsubishi Motors Corp plan to set up a joint board meeting structure to discuss issues related to their alliance in a step toward integration of operations, TV Tokyo reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Tokyo court denies Ghosn's request to attend Nissan board meeting: NHK
Description: A Tokyo court denied former Nissan Motor boss Carlos Ghosn's request to attend the automaker's board meeting this week, days after he was released from detention on a $9 million bail, national broadcaster NHK reported on Monday.

Headlines: Trump's budget to land with a thud on Monday
Description: When President Donald Trump proposes his 2020 federal budget on Monday, official Washington will likely have a quick look, shrug and move on, marking another stage in the quiet decay of the U.S. government's traditional policy-making processes.

Headlines: UBS, StanChart settle 2009 Hong Kong IPO misconduct case
Description: UBS Group AG and Standard Chartered PLC have agreed to settle a case of alleged misconduct related to a 2009 IPO in Hong Kong, in a move expected to end uncertainty about the Swiss bank's ability to lead stock listings in the city.

Headlines: To lure young talent, banks mimic tech workspaces
Description: Tattooed models in mustard robes replaced the usual gray-suited bankers at Nordea Bank's Copenhagen headquarters recently, as the Danish bank strutted out its latest attempt to woo young talent.

Headlines: China suspends commercial operations of Boeing 737-8 planes
Description: China's civil aviation regulator said on Monday that it has asked domestic airlines to suspend the commercial operations of all Boeing 737-8 planes by 6:00 p.m. local time (5.00 a.m. ET), a day after a deadly crash of a 737 MAX 8 by Ethiopian Airlines.

Headlines: Brexit fallout on UK finance intensifies: think tank
Description: More than 275 financial firms are moving a combined $1.2 trillion in assets and funds and thousands of staff from Britain to the European Union in readiness for Brexit at a cost of up to $4 billion, a report from a think tank said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. senator calls on FAA to ground Boeing 737 MAX 8
Description: Democratic U.S. Senator Dianne Feinstein on Monday urged the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration to ground Boeing's 737 MAX 8 fleet after two fatal crashes since October.

Headlines: Boeing CEO confident in 737 MAX safety after second deadly crash
Description: Boeing Co's top executive told employees on Monday he was confident in the safety of the U.S. manufacturer's fastest-selling 737 MAX aircraft in the wake of two deadly crashes since October.

Headlines: Olympus whistleblower Woodford wins London pensions lawsuit
Description: The former CEO of Olympus, who blew the whistle on a $1.7 billion accounting scandal at the Japanese medical equipment maker in 2011, has won a London court battle over alleged wrongdoing linked to his 64-million-pound ($85-million) pension.

Headlines: Trump budget proposes ending electric vehicle tax credit
Description: The White House proposed on Monday eliminating a tax credit worth up to $7,500 on the purchase of new electric vehicles, a move it says would save the U.S. government $2.5 billion over a decade.

Headlines: DNB sticks with Nasdaq offer for Oslo Bors after rival bidder extends deadline
Description: Oslo Bors' biggest shareholder, Norwegian bank DNB, said on Monday that it continues to support Nasdaq's offer for the Oslo exchange operator after rival bidder Euronext extended its offer.

Headlines: Euronext extends Oslo Bors takeover offer on same terms
Description: European exchange group Euronext on Monday extended its offer for Oslo Bors, while keeping the terms unchanged, as its battle with Nasdaq for control of Norway's stock market operator escalates.

Headlines: Malaysia may have to review Boeing 737 Max orders: Nikkei
Description: Malaysia may have to reconsider the purchase of 25 Boeing Co 737 MAX 8 aircraft, the Nikkei reported on Monday, citing the country's economic affairs minister, after the second fatal crash of the planemaker's newest jet in less than six months.

Headlines: Nvidia outbids Intel to buy Israel's Mellanox in data centre push
Description: U.S. chip supplier Nvidia Corp has agreed to buy Israeli chip designer Mellanox Technologies Ltd for $6.8 billion, beating rival Intel Corp in a deal that would help the firm boost its data centre and artificial intelligence business.

Headlines: Alphabet's Waymo seeks outside investors: The Information
Description: Alphabet Inc's self-driving car division, Waymo, has been seeking financing from outside investors such as European automakers Volkswagen AG, The Information reported on Monday, citing a person with direct knowledge of the situation.

Headlines: Amazon domain battle rages on as internet overseer postpones decision
Description: Brazil on Monday thanked the global body that oversees Internet addresses for extending until April a deadline for Amazon basin nations to reach a deal with Amazon.com Inc in their seven-year battle over the .amazon domain name.

Headlines: Oslo Bors sticks with Nasdaq offer, as rival bidder extends deadline
Description: Norway's Oslo Bors, the subject of a bidding war between exchange operators Euronext and Nasdaq, continues to back Nasdaq's offer, Oslo Bors said on Monday, shortly after Euronext said it was extending its offer.

Headlines: Wells Fargo CEO to tout risk management, remediation to U.S. Congress
Description: Wells Fargo & Co Chief Executive Tim Sloan will tout the scandal-plagued bank's progress in repaying wrongly charged customers and highlight changes to its risk management in testimony to U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday, according to prepared remarks.

Headlines: Big investors look past Khashoggi to opportunities in Saudi Arabia
Description: Big investors in Saudi Arabia are pushing ahead with deals and pouring money back into its stock market as the kingdom tries to move on from the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

Headlines: Ghost workers sap Tunisia's phosphate wealth
Description: METLAOUI, Tunisia - Tunisia's state phosphate firm CPG pays Abdel-Basset Klifhi a salary of $280 a month, even though he spends most days in his favorite cafe in the southern town of Metlaoui.

Headlines: Tesla backtracks on store closures, plans top-end price rise
Description: Electric carmaker Tesla Inc backed off its plan to close all of its U.S. stores in a blog post https://www.tesla.com/en_NZ/blog/update-tesla-stores-and-pricing?redirect=no and instead will raise prices of its high-end vehicles by about 3 percent on average, as it strives for profitability.

Headlines: Japan court blocks ex-Nissan boss Ghosn from attending board meeting
Description: A Tokyo court rejected ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn's request to attend a board meeting this week, denying him a seat at the table even as the carmaker looks set to bolster an alliance he built over two decades.

Headlines: Auto woes drive dip in German industrial output as Brexit nears
Description: Plunging car output drove an unexpected drop in production of German goods in January and an industry body cut its 2019 growth forecast, adding to signs that trade tensions and unease about Brexit are weighing on Europe's largest economy.

Headlines: Exclusive: Occidental emerges as heavy hitter in U.S. oil export boom
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp has emerged as one of the biggest exporters of U.S. shale oil, rivaling large trading firms and oil majors, in a market now worth more than $150 million every day.

Headlines: U.S. inflation forecasts decline, supporting rate-hike holiday
Description: U.S. consumers expect prices to rise more slowly, according to the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, a decline in inflation expectations in February that likely reinforces policymakers' reluctance to hike rates.

Headlines: Exclusive: Citgo, Valero try to return Venezuelan oil following sanctions: document
Description: The top U.S. buyers of Venezuelan oil are in the unusual position of trying to return millions of barrels of crude they need but cannot accept because of U.S. sanctions on the South American nation and its state-run energy firm PDVSA.

Headlines: India's Jet Airways denies report of new $293 mln loan from PNB
Description: India's debt-laden Jet Airways Ltd denied a media report on Monday that it had secured a 20.50 billion rupee ($293 million) loan from state-owned Punjab National Bank (PNB) to help pay overdue plane leasing fees and salaries.

Headlines: Mexico's Aeromexico suspends Boeing 737 MAX planes
Description: Mexican airline Aeromexico said on Monday it had suspended the operation of its six Boeing 737 MAX 8 planes until it had clear information about the investigation into the crash of an Ethiopian Airlines jet on Sunday.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales rebound but not enough to jolt slowing economy
Description: U.S. retail sales rose modestly in January after a December drop that was even larger than originally estimated, but the recovery was not seen strong enough to alter the course of a U.S. economy that was losing momentum in early 2019.

Headlines: Singapore suspends Boeing 737 MAX flights after Ethiopia crash
Description: Singapore will temporarily suspend all Boeing 737 MAX flights from 1400 local time (0600 GMT) on Tuesday, the civil aviation authority said, two days after an Ethiopian Airlines crash that killed all 157 on board.

Headlines: IATA cuts annual air cargo traffic growth forecast citing trade frictions, Brexit
Description: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) on Tuesday nearly halved its annual forecast for traffic growth in the air cargo market to 2 percent citing trade frictions, Brexit and anti-globalization rhetoric.

Headlines: Insurers face large claims after second Boeing 737 MAX crash
Description: Boeing Co's insurers face big claims from families of the victims of the Ethiopian Airlines crash, coming less than six months after the crash of the same type of Boeing aircraft in Indonesia, insurance and aviation sources said.

Headlines: Mueller probe already financed through September: officials
Description: Special Counsel Robert Mueller and the team he assembled to investigate U.S. President Donald Trump and his associates have been funded through the end of September 2019, three U.S. officials said on Monday, an indication that the probe has funding to keep it going for months if need be.

Headlines: Boeing shares take another hit as more countries ground 737 MAX 8 planes
Description: Boeing Co's stock took another beating on Tuesday as a raft of countries grounded its 737 MAX 8 aircraft, responding to a deadly crash in Ethiopia which has so far knocked $25 billion off the market value of the world's largest planemaker.

Headlines: EASA suspends all flight operations of two Boeing 737 models
Description: The European Union's aviation safety agency EASA suspended all flights in the bloc by Boeing's 737-8 and 737-9 airplanes following the Sunday's deadly plane crash in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Shell urges Trump White House to tighten methane leak rules
Description: Royal Dutch Shell urged U.S. President Donald Trump's administration on Tuesday to tighten restrictions on greenhouse gas emissions from oil and gas production, instead of weakening them as planned.

Headlines: Germany grounds Boeing 737 MAX 8 and 9 for three months
Description: Germany's air safety authority DFS said on Tuesday that both Boeing 737 MAX 8 and MAX 9 models will be barred from the country's air space until June 12.

Headlines: Nissan's Infiniti to exit western Europe early next year
Description: Nissan Motor Co's premium brand Infiniti said on Tuesday it will exit western Europe early next year, as it restructures its global operations and turns its attention to sales in the world's top two auto markets.

Headlines: U.S. senator asks American, Southwest, United to ground Boeing MAX jets
Description: Democratic U.S. Senator Richard Blumenthal on Tuesday asked American Airlines, Southwest Airlines and United Airlines to voluntarily ground all Boeing 737 MAX 8 and MAX 9 planes after two deadly crashes in recent months.

Headlines: Wirecard puts accounting manager on leave until probe ends: CEO
Description: Wirecard has suspended an accounting employee in Singapore until an investigation into allegations of fraud and creative accounting is over, the company's chief executive told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers at T-Mobile, Sprint hearing spar over stay at Trump hotel
Description: U.S. lawmakers questioning the chief executives of T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp over their planned merger sparred with each other on Tuesday over T-Mobile's executives staying at President Donald Trump's hotel where they spent $195,000 while in Washington.

Headlines: Bermuda prohibits Boeing 737 MAX from its airspace
Description: Bermuda has prohibited Boeing's 737 MAX 8 and 737 MAX 9 aircraft from its airspace until further notice following Sunday's deadly plane crash in Ethiopia, the British overseas territory's aviation authority said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Rite Aid shakes up top management, to cut about 400 U.S. jobs
Description: Rite Aid Corp said on Tuesday its chief executive officer would exit as part of a revamp of its leadership, and that it would slash about 400 corporate positions.

Headlines: U.S. Senate to hold crash hearing as lawmakers urge grounding Boeing 737 MAX 8
Description: The U.S. Senate Commerce Committee plans to hold a hearing on the fatal crashes of two Boeing Co 737 MAX 8 jets since October as a growing number of lawmakers called on U.S. regulators to ground the airplane.

Headlines: S&P, Nasdaq rise on tame inflation data; Dow felled by Boeing
Description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq rose on Tuesday after tame inflation data underscored the Federal Reserve's dovish stance on interest rate hikes, but the Dow ended lower as Boeing's shares sank for a second day after one of its planes crashed in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Elon Musk's defense of his Tesla tweet will get SEC response
Description: The top U.S. securities regulator received permission from a federal judge on Tuesday to respond to Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk's arguments that his Twitter post about the electric vehicle maker’s production volume did not violate his recent fraud settlement.

Headlines: Oil edges higher on cuts to Saudi exports
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Tuesday, supported by signs of tightening global supply after a Saudi official said the kingdom plans to cut oil exports in April, while the U.S. government reduced its forecast for domestic crude output growth.

Headlines: Stocks rise on tame U.S. inflation, dollar eases
Description: A gauge of world equity markets rose and the dollar eased on Tuesday after a tame reading on U.S. inflation reinforced expectations the Federal Reserve will not raise interest rates anytime soon, while Boeing shares slid for a second day.

Headlines: Germany's Verdi union opposed to Deutsche-Commerzbank merger
Description: Germany's Verdi labor union on Tuesday objected strongly to a possible merger between Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank, arguing that the merged group would be a more attractive target for a hostile foreign takeover.

Headlines: Yum China to open KFC outlets at Chinese gas stations
Description: Yum China Holdings is partnering with China's two biggest state oil giants to open franchise fast-food outlets at gas stations in the country, in a bid to tap new growth areas as the domestic economy slows.

Headlines: Elon Musk shoots down U.S. regulator's complaint about his Tesla tweet
Description: SAN FRANCISCO - Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk shot back against U.S. securities regulators on Monday, arguing in a filing that his recent tweet about the electric vehicle maker's production volume did not violate his fraud settlement and he cannot be held in contempt.

Headlines: Ghosn 'disappointed' at ban from Nissan meeting, wants to fulfill duties
Description: Former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn said he was disappointed that a Tokyo court had rejected his request to attend the car maker's board meeting on Tuesday, and that he was still willing to carry out his duties as a board member.

Headlines: Saudi seals six private sector deals worth $3.5 billion, plans many more
Description: Saudi Arabia has completed six public-private partnership deals in the past two months worth around $3.5 billion, and plans at least 23 more by 2022 despite some delays in its plan to engage the private sector, the head of its privatization body said.

Headlines: Slowing economy keeping U.S. inflation under wraps
Description: U.S. consumer prices rose for the first time in four months in February, but the pace of the increase was modest, resulting in the smallest annual gain in nearly 2-1/2 years.

Headlines: Irish Aviation Authority to temporarily suspend Boeing 737 MAX operations
Description: The Irish Aviation Authority is temporarily suspending the operation of all variants of the Boeing 737 MAX aircraft in Irish airspace with immediate effect following a deadly crash in Ethiopia, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed sanctions former Goldman Sachs bankers over 1MDB money-laundering scandal
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Tuesday it had sanctioned two former Goldman Sachs Group Inc bankers for their roles in a money-laundering scandal involving 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB), Malaysia's state-owned investment fund.

Headlines: Canada sees no reason to ground Boeing 737 MAX 8, ready to act if need be
Description: Canada has no plans to ground Boeing Co 737 MAX 8 aircraft but is ready to "act immediately" to suspend flights if new information emerges indicating there is a problem, Transport Minister Marc Garneau said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Airlines keep calm and carry on after Boeing jet groundings
Description: Groundings of brand-new Boeing 737 MAX 8 jets have sent shockwaves through global aviation after a crash in Ethiopia, but many airlines are managing to keep to schedule with other jets while economic woes mean some may be grateful for a pause.

Headlines: South American nations evaluating shutting airspace to Boeing 737 MAX: Telam news agency
Description: Argentina and other South American nations are evaluating closing their airspace to Boeing 737 MAX airplanes following two fatal crashes in five months involving that type of plane, Argentina's state-run news agency Telam reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Bayer Roundup cancer trial goes to jury after closing arguments
Description: A trial in which a California man alleged his use of Bayer AG's glyphosate-based Roundup weed killer caused his cancer went to a federal U.S. jury after lawyers for both sides delivered their closing arguments on Tuesday.

Headlines: Ethiopia crash black boxes still in Addis Ababa: airline
Description: Two black box recorders recovered from the crash of Ethiopia Airlines flight 302 are still in the capital Addis Ababa as discussions continue about where in Europe to send them, the airline said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Black boxes from Ethiopia crash to go to Europe for analysis
Description: The black boxes from a Boeing 737 MAX 8 plane that crashed in Ethiopia, killing 157 people, will be sent to Europe for analysis, a spokesman for Ethiopia Airlines said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Egypt bars Boeing 737 MAX jets from its airspace: statement
Description: Egypt has barred the passage, takeoff and landing of Boeing 737 MAX aircraft, the civil aviation ministry said in a statement on Wednesday.

Headlines: Talk to 'Green New Deal' backers, BP CEO tells oil industry
Description: The oil industry should engage with proponents of the "Green New Deal," a Democratic initiative seeking to radically reduce U.S. dependence on fossil fuels, BP Chief Executive Officer Bob Dudley said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Black boxes from Ethiopia plane crash could be sent to Europe: airline
Description: The black boxes from Sunday's plane crash in Ethiopia could be sent to a "closer country in Europe" rather than the United States for analysis, the chief executive of Ethiopian Airlines told CNN on Wednesday.

Headlines: Lebanon bans Boeing 737 MAX planes from its airspace: NNA
Description: Lebanon's aviation authority on Wednesday said it had banned all Boeing 737 MAX planes from landing in Beirut or flying in Lebanese airspace, state news agency NNA said.

Headlines: South Korean proxy adviser recommends votes against Elliott's proposals for Hyundai Mobis
Description: South Korea's leading proxy adviser KCGS recommended shareholders vote against U.S. activist investor Elliott Management's proposals for dividends and board members at Hyundai Mobis, according to its report.

Headlines: Germany sees 750 million euro potential risk from scrapping of Airbus A380
Description: The decision by Airbus to scrap its A380 jet risks costing Germany as much as 750 million euros, an economy ministry report seen by Reuters showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Shanghai's hotly-anticipated tech board draws defectors from rivals
Description: A growing number of companies trading on China's main over-the-counter (OTC) equity market are defecting to Shanghai's hotly-anticipated Nasdaq-style technology board, as they follow the money.

Headlines: JPMorgan's Chase to open up to 90 branches in new U.S. markets
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co's consumer banking unit said on Wednesday it will open up to 90 branches in new U.S. markets, in the face of intensifying competition for loans and deposits among the country's three biggest banks.

Headlines: Exclusive: Exxon eyes Israel gas bid in major Middle East shift
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp is considering exploring for oil and gas in Israel, said a person with direct knowledge of the matter, in what would make Exxon the first oil major to operate in the country still technically at war with Gulf Arab states.

Headlines: Stocks rise on tame inflation outlook, dollar eases
Description: World equity markets advanced broadly on Wednesday after U.S. data again showed risk-friendly low inflation, which weakened the dollar, while Boeing shares gained even as the United States said it would ground the company's 737 MAX aircraft.

Headlines: Wall Street rises; Boeing up despite U.S. grounding of 737 MAX jets
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Wednesday, led by gains in healthcare shares, and Boeing edged upward even as the United States joined other nations in grounding the company's 737 MAX jets.

Headlines: U.S. Congress wants to know why the FAA waited so long to ground Boeing 737 jets
Description: Congress plans to scrutinize why the United States waited so many days to ground all Boeing Co 737 MAX jets involved in Sunday's crash in Ethiopia as other countries and airlines acted more quickly.

Headlines: Panama suspends operations of Boeing 737 MAX jets in its airspace
Description: Panama's civil aviation authority on Wednesday temporarily suspended the operations of all Boeing 737 MAX 8 and MAX 9 aircraft in its airspace, following Sunday's deadly crash of an Ethiopian Airlines plane.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler recalling 965,000 U.S., Canadian vehicles over excess emissions
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV will recall about 965,000 gasoline-powered vehicles in the United States and Canada that do not meet emissions standards and will replace their catalytic converters, officials said on Wednesday.

Headlines: VW halts truck unit IPO until market conditions improve
Description: Volkswagen said on Wednesday it would halt preparations for an initial public offering (IPO) of its trucks unit Traton until market conditions improve, stalling what was expected to be Germany's biggest share offering this year.

Headlines: Canada grounds Boeing 737 MAX 8 and 9 jets, citing safety concerns
Description: Canada on Wednesday became the latest nation to ground Boeing 737 MAX aircraft, citing potential safety concerns after an Ethiopian Airlines Boeing MAX crashed on Sunday, killing 157 people.

Headlines: Southwest pilots stand by 737 MAX despite Canada ban
Description: The Southwest Airlines pilots union said on Wednesday that it remained confident in Boeing Co's 737 MAX even after Canada became the latest country to ground the jet.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia has no Boeing 737 MAX in its aircraft registry: civil aviation
Description: Saudi Arabia does not have Boeing 737 MAX planes in its own aircraft registry, an official with the civil aviation authority said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. warnings have prompted further talks on Huawei: German government spokeswoman
Description: The letter of the United States's Ambassador to Germany warning Berlin against using Chinese manufacturer Huawei's equipment to build a next-generation telephone network has stimulated further discussion, a German government spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. House technology panel heads seeks delay in 5G spectrum auction
Description: Leaders of a U.S. House of Representatives committee on Wednesday asked the Federal Communications Commission to delay a radio frequency spectrum auction for next-generation 5G wireless communications, which is scheduled for Thursday.

Headlines: Ford says cutting U.S. salaried jobs, doesn't say how many
Description: Ford Motor Co confirmed on Wednesday it is cutting an unspecified number of U.S. salaried jobs as part of a global reorganization announced last year.

Headlines: Kayak soothes nervous Boeing flyers with airplane search filter
Description: Travel website Kayak is making changes to let customers exclude specific aircraft types from searches, and booking sites are looking to reroute passengers, after an unexplained Boeing jet crash that killed 157 people in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Airlines wrestle with calls, cancellations after Boeing MAX fleet grounded
Description: U.S. and Canadian carriers wrestled with customer calls and flight cancellations on Thursday after the two countries followed other nations in grounding Boeing's 737 MAX planes because of safety concerns.

Headlines: European shares rise on delayed Brexit vote, dollar gains; Wall Street flat
Description: A gauge of global equity markets traded little changed on Thursday as European shares rose ahead of new voting that backed a Brexit delay and bolstered the dollar, while Wall Street meandered on uncertainty over U.S.-China trade talks.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs cuts CEO job in Brazil - statement
Description: Goldman Sachs Group is changing its management in Brazil and getting rid of the post of local chief executive officer, the bank said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers say Boeing 737 MAX 8 grounded for at least 'weeks'
Description: U.S. lawmakers said after a briefing with the acting head of the Federal Aviation Administration on Thursday that Boeing 737 MAX 8 and 9 planes will remain grounded for "weeks" at a minimum, until a software upgrade could be tested and installed in all of the planes.

Headlines: Apple touts data privacy in TV ad campaign
Description: Apple Inc on Thursday launched a television advertising campaign promoting its stance on data privacy, seeking to differentiate itself from tech industry rivals such as Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc that have become the target of regulatory scrutiny over the issue.

Headlines: Exclusive: Retailer Pier 1 taps debt restructuring lawyers - sources
Description: Pier 1 Imports Inc has tapped debt restructuring lawyers to navigate potential negotiations with lenders as it struggles with falling sales, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday, sending shares of the U.S. home furnishing retail chain sharply lower.

Headlines: Factbox: Boeing 737 MAX 8 groundings spread around the world
Description: The United States on Wednesday became the latest to join the long list of countries around the globe to ground Boeing's 737 MAX aircraft following Sunday's deadly plane crash in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Nine banks win dismissal of Canadian rate-rigging lawsuit in U.S.
Description: A federal judge in Manhattan on Thursday dismissed a lawsuit by investors that accused nine large banks, including six from Canada, of conspiring to manipulate a Canadian rate benchmark to improve profits from derivatives trading.

Headlines: Boeing groundings put U.S.-China trade-linked jet order in limbo
Description: China's move to ground Boeing Co's 737 MAX jetliners following the deadly Ethiopian Airlines crash has cast a shadow over the American planemaker's immediate hopes for a major jet order linked to a U.S.-China trade deal, industry sources said.

Headlines: TPG Rise founder leaves firm in wake of U.S. college admissions scandal
Description: TPG Capital senior executive Bill McGlashan on Thursday left the private equity firm after he was charged in connection with a U.S. college fraud scheme that has ensnared Hollywood celebrities and corporate elite.

Headlines: Explainer: How to read an aircraft's black box
Description: France's BEA safety investigators are searching for clues as to what caused an Ethiopian Airlines plane to hurtle to the ground after take-off, as they begin analyzing two black boxes that arrived in Paris on Thursday from the crashed Boeing 737 MAX.

Headlines: S&P 500 eases amid U.S.-China trade uncertainty
Description: The S&P 500 slipped on Thursday, snapping a three-day streak of gains, as uncertainty over when a trade deal between the United States and China would be reached left investors on edge.

Headlines: U.S. judge assessing CVS merger with Aetna orders hearing
Description: A U.S. judge who has been asked to sign off on a government agreement that allowed CVS Health Corp to buy health insurer Aetna ordered a hearing for April 5.

Headlines: Alaska Air says too early to talk about future 737 MAX deliveries
Description: Alaska Air Group Inc said on Thursday it was too early to discuss its future 737 MAX deliveries from Boeing Co, following a deadly crash involving one of the planes in Ethiopia this past Sunday.

Headlines: Families of Ethiopia plane crash victims storm out of meeting with airline
Description: The families of people killed in the Ethiopian Airlines plane crash stormed out of a meeting with the airline in Addis Ababa on Thursday, complaining of a lack of information.

Headlines: Russia suspends Boeing 737 MAX flights: Ifax
Description: Russia's aviation authority on Thursday suspended flights by Boeing 737 MAX planes in the country's airspace following Sunday's deadly plane crash in Ethiopia, Interfax news agency cited the authority's head as saying.

Headlines: China customs says it has lifted suspension on Tesla Model 3 imports
Description: China's customs authority has lifted a warning notice that barred Tesla Model 3 imports into the country last week, an official in the authority's news department told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Japan bans Boeing 737 MAX planes from its airspace
Description: Japan's transport ministry on Thursday said it had banned flights by Boeing Co's 737 MAX 8 and 9 aircraft from its airspace, the latest country to do so following the Ethiopian Airlines plane crash that killed 157 people.

Headlines: Malaysia's securities regulator issues Goldman Sachs with show-cause letter
Description: Malaysia's securities commission said on Thursday that it has issued a show-cause letter to Goldman Sachs, which is embroiled in multi-jurisdictional investigations into Malaysian state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB).

Headlines: U.S. prosecutors probing Facebook's data deals: New York Times
Description: U.S. federal prosecutors are conducting a criminal investigation into data deals Facebook Inc struck with some of the world's largest technology companies, the New York Times reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: China customs lifts suspension on Tesla Model 3 imports
Description: China's customs authority has lifted its suspension on imports of Tesla's Model 3, an official in the authority's news department told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. import prices post largest gain in nine months
Description: U.S. import prices increased by the most in nine months in February, but the trend remained weak, with prices declining for a third straight month on an annual basis.

Headlines: Higher store investments to hit Dollar General profit, shares fall 10 pct
Description: Dollar General Corp will plow back a part of its 2019 profit to revamp its supply chain and add self-checkout lanes at its stores as it competes with online grocers and U.S. chains Walmart Inc and Kroger Co.

Headlines: Junior trader files harassment, discrimination lawsuit against UBS
Description: A former junior trader who accused UBS of mishandling a complaint of rape and sexual assault by senior colleagues against her has filed a claim in the UK for damages against the Swiss lender, legal documents seen by Reuters show.

Headlines: Ethiopian jet's black box seen damaged but intact in photo
Description: France's air accident investigation agency on Thursday released a picture of the doomed Ethiopian Airlines jet's flight data recorder, which appeared to show the crash-proof housing protecting the critical recording chip intact.

Headlines: Toyota investing $749 million in five U.S. plants, adding 586 jobs
Description: Toyota Motor Corp said on Thursday it will invest $749 million in five U.S. plants and add 586 jobs as it boosts engine production capacity and adds new hybrid models to its lineup.

Headlines: Microsoft targets video game developers, in challenge to Amazon's cloud dominance
Description: Microsoft Corp on Thursday said it is combining elements of its video gaming and Azure cloud computing businesses to court game developers, an action designed to use the strength of its Xbox gaming franchise to gain ground on cloud services leader Amazon.com.

Headlines: Analysis of Ethiopian Airways jet's black boxes to start Friday: BEA
Description: Ethiopian investigators have arrived at France's BEA air accident investigation agency and technical analysis of the black boxes recovered from the doomed Ethiopian Airlines plane will begin on Friday, the agency said.

Headlines: Treasury's Mnuchin expects elements of China trade talks to be resolved soon
Description: The Trump administration is discussing a thick tome of ideas with Chinese officials as the two sides seek a trade deal, with Washington expecting some elements to be resolved soon, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday.

Headlines: Top Pentagon official has not spoken to admin about 737's
Description: A former Boeing executive who is now the Acting Secretary of Defense, Patrick Shanahan, told the U.S. Congress he has not spoken to anyone in the U.S. administration about issues with the 737 MAX 8 jet grounded Wednesday by the Federal Aviation Administration following crashes.

Headlines: Russia's top banks plot temporary sanctions workaround: sources
Description: Leading Russian banks are working on plans to help each other retain at least short-term access to the global financial system in the event that they are hit by fresh U.S. sanctions, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Tunisia bars Boeing 737 max jets from its airspace
Description: Tunisia has barred the passage, takeoff and landing of Boeing 737 MAX aircraft on its territory, the transport ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. airlines focus on affected customers after 737 MAX jets grounded
