Description: With a multibillion-dollar settlement looming for Facebook over user privacy violations, Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg met with U.S. lawmakers on Capitol Hill on Tuesday to discuss legislation to protect users of the social network, officials said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Enbridge seeking at least eight-year oil shipping commitments on Canada Mainline, worrying small producers
Description: Canada's Enbridge is asking oil shippers to sign at least eight-year contracts to move crude on its Mainline pipeline network, as it proposes to shift away from a monthly allocation system, people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Australia regulator: Vodafone-TPG merger would cut competition
Description: Australia's competition regulator on Wednesday said it opposed the proposed merger between TPG Telecom Ltd and Vodafone Group's Australian unit because it would reduce competition, particularly in mobile services.

Headlines: China to extend preferential taxes for integrated circuit firms
Description: China will extend preferential taxes for producers of integrated circuits and software companies, the cabinet said on Wednesday.

Headlines: As Uber gears up for IPO, many Indian drivers talk of shattered dreams
Description: In 2016, Rajesh Raut started driving an Uber taxi in Mumbai, hoping he could earn more than the $215 he received each month for making flatbreads at a roadside stall.

Headlines: Tencent pulls blockbuster game PUBG in China, launches patriotic alternative
Description: Tencent Holdings Ltd on Wednesday shut down its test version of global blockbuster "PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds" in China and shifted users to a similar, more patriotic video game which, unlike PUBG, has regulatory approval to generate revenue.

Headlines: SoftBank Corp to buy $4 billion worth of new shares from Yahoo Japan
Description: Japan's SoftBank Corp said on Wednesday it would buy 456.5 billion yen ($4.15 billion) worth of new shares to be issued by Yahoo Japan Corp, boosting its stake to 44.64 percent from 12.08 percent.

Headlines: Explainer: How U.S.-China talks differ from any other trade deal
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He goes to Washington for trade talks on Thursday and Friday, setting up a last-ditch bid for progress toward a deal that would avoid a sharp increase in tariffs on Chinese goods ordered by U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Nestle, rivals vie for big baby formula prize in China's smaller cities
Description: Nestle plans to launch a new line of baby formula in China this year under an existing brand, targeted at smaller cities, as the world's largest packaged food company tries to lengthen its lead in the world's biggest baby milk market.

Headlines: Google plans new browser tools on privacy, ad transparency
Description: Alphabet Inc unit Google in the coming months plans to introduce new internet browser tools to limit how users' web activity is tracked by advertising companies and give them greater insight into why certain ads are shown to them, the company announced in blog posts on Tuesday.

Headlines: In Canada, a little-known drug regulator shows its teeth
Description: A tiny, little-known government agency is ramping up regulation of Canada's pharmaceutical industry, seeking to rein in prices for patented drugs that are among the highest in the world, according to industry sources and a Reuters analysis of government data.

Headlines: Instant view: China's oil, coal, soybean imports rise in April from year before
Description: China's imports of crude oil, coal and soybeans rose in April from the same month last year, while cargoes of iron ore and copper dropped, customs data showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: China April crude oil imports hit monthly record, refiners stocked up ahead of sanctions
Description: China's crude oil imports in April unexpectedly surged to a record despite refinery maintenance outages and tepid domestic fuel demand, customs data showed, as state-run refiners built up stocks of Iranian crude oil anticipating a sanctions clampdown.

Headlines: China's April soybean imports rise as buyers delayed cargoes on tax change
Description: China's soybean imports in April jumped 10.7 percent from the same period a year earlier, customs data showed on Wednesday, as shipments delayed from March reached the world's top oilseed buyer.

Headlines: Under pressure from Trump, GM in talks to sell idled Ohio plant
Description: Under pressure from President Donald Trump, General Motors Co said on Wednesday it was in talks to sell an idled northeast Ohio plant to a cash-strapped electric truck-building company.

Headlines: Wells Fargo creates new unit focused on regulatory compliance
Description: Wells Fargo & Co is creating a new unit tasked with satisfying U.S. regulatory requirements, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Google debuts privacy controls, principles at I/O event
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google business on Tuesday announced new privacy controls for its services, including “Incognito mode” for Google Maps, and published new privacy commitments for its hardware, showing how increased public scrutiny is forcing greater transparency in Silicon Valley.

Headlines: Anti-trust watchdog blocks $11 billion merger of Vodafone's Australian business with TPG Telecom
Description: Australia's anti-trust regulator blocked a A$15 billion ($11 billion) merger between TPG Telecom and Vodafone's Australian joint venture on competition grounds on Wednesday, knocking shares in the firms involved.

Headlines: Jet Airways pilots' union asks India's top court to direct lender to release funds
Description: Jet Airways' pilots' union has appealed to India's top court to direct State Bank Of India (SBI) to release interim funding to try to revive the grounded airline, according to a court filing made on Tuesday which was reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. says no more sanctions waivers for Iran oil purchases
Description: The United States will not grant any more waivers to any countries that would allow them to buy Iranian oil without facing U.S. sanctions, a senior U.S. diplomat said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Walmart raises U.S. tobacco purchase age to 21 starting in July
Description: Walmart Inc said on Wednesday it will raise the minimum age to purchase tobacco products to 21 across its U.S. stores starting July 1, responding to growing regulatory and political pressure to curb a surge in teenage use of e-cigarettes.

Headlines: GM, union reach deal to rescue part of Ontario plant: source
Description: General Motors and the largest union representing Canada's auto workers have reached a deal to partly rescue an auto plant in Ontario slated to close this year by converting it to a parts-stamping facility, a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wirecard eyes share buybacks, sales leads from Softbank alliance
Description: German payments firm Wirecard is considering buying back shares following its partnership with Japan's Softbank Group which it said on Wednesday had already created leads for potential cooperation in digital payments.

Headlines: Slim chance of comprehensive U.S.-China trade deal this week: Nomura
Description: Nomura analysts see a high likelihood further negotiations between the United States and China will be needed before a final trade deal is reached, dragging out a dispute between the world's two biggest economies that has kept investors on edge.

Headlines: These 6 stocks could make or break the S&P 500's run
Description: The index's next move could depend on Microsoft, Amazon, Apple, Alphabet, Facebook and Berkshire Hathaway, chart master Carter Worth says.

Headlines: U.S. March wholesale inventories revised down
Description: U.S. wholesale inventories were a bit weaker than initially thought in March as sales increased by the most in 10 months.

Headlines: Reckitt chairman aims for swift decision on CEO succession
Description: Reckitt Benckiser is working to resolve both its search for a new chief executive and its position relating to U.S. charges of wrongdoing at a former business, its chairman told investors at its annual general meeting on Thursday.

Headlines: OPEC in the dark on oil supply as Russia, Iran cut exports
Description: OPEC is in the dark on the oil supply outlook for the second half of this year, with Iranian and Russian outages looking increasingly significant but Saudi Arabia reluctant to pump more due to fears of a price crash, sources in the organization said.

Headlines: Cramer: How Trump's 'surreal, fanciful vision' can force China to a trade agreement
Description: Trump can attempt to mitigate the damage by floating some good news about trade discussions as he did Thursday, Cramer says.

Headlines: How Total's CEO pounced on Anadarko's African energy assets
Description: It took Total's chief executive and a small group of advisers just days to line up the French energy major's biggest acquisition in almost two decades when it agreed to buy the African assets of U.S. firm Anadarko.

Headlines: Peugeot signals openness to deals after JLR report
Description: PSA Group said on Thursday it was ready to consider potential tie-ups, after the French carmaker's shares briefly rose on a report that it was in advanced talks with Tata Motors to acquire UK-based Jaguar Land Rover (JLR).

Headlines: Occidental seen as a rare victory for hedge funds tracking corporate jets
Description: Hedge funds paying upward of $100,000 per year to track the flights of corporate jets were vindicated when Occidental Petroleum Corp announced two deals last week that matched locations the U.S. oil and gas company's private plane had recently visited.

Headlines: SoftBank Group unveils stock split, rakes in $3.8 billion gain on Uber stake
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp announced a stock split while keeping the per-share dividend unchanged for the year, effectively doubling its shareholder payout, as it also reported a $3.8 billion valuation gain on its stake in Uber.

Headlines: India's incredulous data: Economists create own benchmarks
Description: Economists and investors are increasingly showing that they have little or no confidence in India's official economic data – presenting whoever is elected as the next prime minister with an immediate problem.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz launches sale of baby food unit: sources
Description: U.S. packaged food giant Kraft Heinz has launched the sale of its baby food brand Plasmon with preliminary bids due by the end of next week, two sources close to the matter said.

Headlines: Toyota, Panasonic to set up company for 'connected' homes
Description: Japan's Toyota Motor Corp and Panasonic Corp said they plan to establish a joint company to develop "connected" services to be used in homes and urban development.

Headlines: Chinese tech firms' search for growth seen boosting costs in March quarter
Description: Three of China's biggest tech companies are expected to report that they ramped up or broadly maintained their pace of quarterly spending to develop new technology and push into relatively new markets, as current growth drivers stall.

Headlines: Novartis buys dry eye drug from Takeda for up to $5.3 billion
Description: Novartis is buying dry-eye drug Xiidra from Takeda Pharmaceutical Co for up to $5.3 billion as the Swiss drugmaker refreshes its ophthalmic medicines portfolio with a potential blockbuster.

Headlines: Tencent, Alibaba, Xiaomi units win Hong Kong online banking license
Description: Hong Kong's banking regulator has issued four more online-only banking licenses to units of Alibaba, PingAn and smartphone maker Xiaomi, as well as to a JV involving Tencent, ICBC and Hillhouse Capital.

Headlines: German auto suppliers downbeat as trade dispute simmers
Description: German automotive suppliers Continental and Bosch do not expect a speedy recovery of the global auto market, as an escalating trade conflict between the United States and China threatens to compound already weak car demand.

Headlines: Copa Airlines has 'full confidence' in Boeing 737 MAX planes: CEO
Description: Panama's Copa Airlines said on Thursday it has "full confidence" in its Boeing 737 MAX planes, which have been grounded worldwide since March after two fatal crashes.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade talks to continue on Friday: White House
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin have agreed with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He to continue trade talks on Friday morning, a White House spokesman said on Thursday.

Headlines: Sticker shock from Trump's new trade tariffs months away
Description: It may take three or four months for American shoppers to feel the pinch from President Donald Trump's latest round of tariff increases, but retailers will have little choice but to raise prices on a wide range of goods to cover the rising cost of imports before too long, according to economists and industry consultants.

Headlines: U.S. Customs agency issues tariff increase notice, allows grace period
Description: U.S. Customs and Border Protection said on Thursday it would begin collecting a 25 percent tariff on a $200 billion category of Chinese imports at 12:01 a.m. EDT (0401 GMT) on Friday, the final step toward activation of President Donald Trump's planned tariff increase.

Headlines: Explainer: What would it take for U.S. regulators to break up Facebook?
Description: Facebook Inc co-founder and Mark Zuckerberg's former college roommate Chris Hughes urged U.S. regulators to break up the social media company in a New York Times opinion piece on Thursday.

Headlines: Scaramucci celebrates hedge funds in Vegas at SALT with less glitz
Description: After a one-year pause, the hedge fund industry schmooze fest organized by Anthony Scaramucci, the investment manager who briefly served as President Donald Trump's communications director, returned to the Las Vegas strip this week.

Headlines: Equities, yields close lower before U.S.-China trade crunch time
Description: Stock indexes around the world fell for a fourth day in a row on Thursday, though Wall Street closed above session lows after comments from President Donald Trump about U.S.-China trade talks a day before the United States was due to raise tariffs.

Headlines: Leading investor in Britain's Metro Bank cuts stake by nearly a third
Description: U.S. investment firm Fidelity Management & Research, one of the biggest investors in Britain's Metro Bank, has cut its stake in the lender by almost a third.

Headlines: Krupp Foundation: We supported Thyssenkrupp's Tata JV plans
Description: Alfried Krupp von Bohlen und Halbach Stiftung - Thyssenkrupp's biggest shareholder - said it had supported the company's management in its joint venture plans with India's Tata Steel and the planned split up.

Headlines: UK sees risk of serious damage from U.S.-China trade tensions
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Friday he was hopeful the United States and China would step back from a potential trade war that risked causing very serious damage to Britain and the world economy.

Headlines: Trial date set for Elon Musk's 'pedo guy' tweet
Description: A U.S. judge on Friday said Elon Musk must face a defamation lawsuit by a British diver who said he was falsely branded a pedophile and child rapist by the chief executive of electric car company Tesla Inc.

Headlines: U.S. stocks rise, dollar pares losses on trade talk hopes
Description: A gauge of world equity markets rebounded and the dollar pared losses on Friday after President Donald Trump said U.S.-China trade talks were constructive, easing tensions that pushed stocks on Wall Street toward their biggest weekly loss since December.

Headlines: WeWork's starry valuation dazzles landlords, reaffirms doubters
Description: WeWork's $47 billion valuation as it heads toward what may be the year's largest initial public offering after ride-hailing firm Uber has made the flexible office space start-up the envy of landlords and the target of skeptics at a time when rents have barely kept pace with inflation.

Headlines: U.S. plans more aid for farmers amid China trade spat
Description: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue said on Friday that President Donald Trump had asked him to create a plan to help American farmers cope with the heavy impact of the U.S.-China trade war on agriculture.

Headlines: French prosecutor opens investigation over suspected Monsanto file
Description: The French prosecutor on Friday said it had opened a preliminary investigation into a suspected file assembled by Bayer's seed maker Monsanto to influence various personalities in France.

Headlines: Trade-sensitive stocks on ropes as uncertainty weighs
Description: A week of worsening fears on Wall Street leading up to Washington's increase on tariffs on Chinese goods has taken a toll on stocks that rely heavily on global trade.

Headlines: Bodum sues Starbucks for product disparagement over French press recall
Description: Bodum Holding AG sued Starbucks Corp on Friday for alleged product disparagement in connection with the coffee company's recent U.S. and Canadian recall of 263,200 co-branded French presses made from recycled materials.

Headlines: U.S. CEO group says rising U.S.-China tariffs could hurt economy
Description: Business Roundtable, a group of U.S. corporate chief executive officers, said on Friday it was concerned that rising U.S.-China tariffs will hurt the American economy.

Headlines: Amazon holds talks with workers in Poland as strike threatened
Description: Amazon said on Friday it was in talks with employees in Poland after unions threatened strike action, seeking higher pay in distribution centres.

Headlines: Wirecard sees profit potential of Softbank alliance at up to 273 million euros
Description: Wirecard sees the total five-year profit potential from its alliance with Japan's Softbank Group Corp at between 209 million euros and 273 million euros ($235-$307 million), the German payments company said on Friday.

Headlines: Occidental's victory over Chevron for Anadarko
Description: Before Occidental Petroleum Corp clinched a deal on Thursday to buy Anadarko Petroleum Corp for $38 billion, it pursued its U.S. oil and gas exploration and production rival for nearly two years, culminating in the sector's most high-profile public contest since the 1980s.

Headlines: Following opioid suits, family behind deadly OxyContin squabbles
Description: A united front among members of the billionaire Sackler family behind painkiller OxyContin is showing signs of strain from litigation over who bears responsibility for the deadly U.S. opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Ailing Thyssenkrupp drops split plan in favour of elevators float
Description: Germany's Thyssenkrupp will embark on a fresh restructuring and list elevators, its most successful business, after regulatory opposition sunk plans to hive off its steel division, unravelling its previous break-up proposal.

Headlines: Etihad submits bid for India's Jet, eyes minority stake
Description: Middle Eastern carrier Etihad Airways has submitted a bid for a stake in India's Jet Airways, the unit of State Bank of India (SBI) overseeing the sale of the stricken airline said on Friday.

Headlines: Top Chinese trade negotiator leaves U.S. trade representative's office
Description: China's top trade negotiator Liu He left the U.S. Trade Representative's office on Friday morning, after talks aimed at resolving a trade dispute between the United States and China.

Headlines: Foxconn's Gou to keep board seat as he bids for Taiwan's presidency
Description: Terry Gou, chairman of Apple supplier Foxconn, will retain a seat on the company's proposed board, a company filing showed on Friday, as he plans to run in Taiwan's 2020 presidential election.

Headlines: Tata Steel to explore all options for European unit after ThyssenKrupp JV falls apart
Description: India's Tata Steel Ltd said on Friday it will explore all options for its European steel business after its proposed joint venture with German steel giant ThyssenKrupp AG failed to secure regulatory approval.

Headlines: Volvo Cars is cutting several hundred jobs: Swedish radio
Description: Swedish carmaker Volvo, which is owned by China's Geely, is cutting several hundred jobs, Swedish radio reported on Friday citing sources.

Headlines: Uber starts trading at $42 a share, 6.7% below IPO price
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's stock on Friday opened down 6.7 percent in its first trade on the New York Stock Exchange, in the most high-profile U.S. market debut since Facebook Inc seven years ago.

Headlines: Abraaj founder given more time to raise 15 million pound bail
Description: The Pakistani founder of Abraaj Group, once one of the largest emerging markets private equity investors, has been given more time to raise a 15 million pound ($19.5 million) bail by a London court, a court official said on Friday.

Headlines: LVMH pairs up with Rihanna for new fashion brand
Description: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH is launching a new fashion brand with Barbadian singer Rihanna, in a rare move by the French group to set up a label from scratch as it taps into soaring demand for celebrity collaborations in the luxury world.

Headlines: Cashing out in Uber's IPO: China, Russia and the Middle East
Description: In 2015, Uber Technologies Inc went on a fundraising spree in China, tapping venture capitalists and state-backed corporations for cash and connections to try and navigate the Chinese regulatory environment.

Headlines: China expresses regret over U.S. tariff hike, vows countermeasures
Description: China on Friday said it "deeply regrets" the United States' decision to increase tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods to 25% from 10%, adding without elaborating that it would take necessary countermeasures.

Headlines: Billionaire Bezos unveils moon lander mockup, embraces Trump's lunar timetable
Description: Billionaire entrepreneur Jeff Bezos unveiled on Thursday a mockup of a lunar lander being built by his Blue Origin rocket company and touted his moon goals in a strategy aimed at capitalizing on the Trump administration's renewed push to establish a lunar outpost in just five years.

Headlines: AB InBev files for Hong Kong IPO of Asia business to raise $5 billion
Description: The world's biggest brewer, Anheuser-Busch InBev, filed plans on Friday to spin off its Asian business via a Hong Kong initial public offering, in a deal which two sources with knowledge of the matter said could be worth at least $5 billion.

Headlines: Tata Steel says EU not likely to ok Thyssenkrupp JV
Description: Tata Steel on Friday said that the European Commission does not intend to clear its proposed joint venture with Germany's Thyssenkrupp.

Headlines: From Paris to Omaha: How Occidental CEO out-maneuvered Chevron in Anadarko bid
Description: Occidental Petroleum chief executive Vicki Hollub was caught off guard when U.S. oil giant Chevron swooped in last month with a $33 billion offer to buy Anadarko Petroleum, the oil and gas exploration and production firm she had been wooing for nearly two years.

Headlines: Bayer says won't tolerate unethical behavior as France probes Monsanto file
Description: Bayer said on Saturday it did not accept "unethical behavior" following a French investigation into a suspected file assembled by the German company's seed making unit Monsanto to influence various personalities in France.

Headlines: Germany's Thyssenkrupp agrees restructuring approach with labor leaders
Description: Management and labor leaders at Germany's Thyssenkrupp have agreed on a way forward after the industrial conglomerate announced a fresh restructuring drive that could lead to the loss of 6,000 jobs.

Headlines: U.S. bargaining power won't improve if China trade war intensifies: Global Times editorial
Description: China's nationalist Global Times tabloid said in an editorial on Sunday that the United States would not have more bargaining chips at the negotiation table with China once the trade war intensifies.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's BAIC seeks to buy 5 percent Daimler stake - sources
Description: China's BAIC Group is seeking to buy a stake of up to 5 percent in Daimler as a way to secure its investment in Chinese Mercedes-Benz manufacturing company Beijing Benz Automotive, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. states accuse Teva, other drugmakers, of price-fixing: lawsuit
Description: U.S. states filed a lawsuit accusing Teva Pharmaceuticals USA Inc of orchestrating a sweeping scheme with 19 other drug companies to inflate drug prices - sometimes by more than 1,000% - and stifle competition for generic drugs, state prosecutors said on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. says Huawei lawyer's prior work at Justice Department poses conflicts
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd lawyer James Cole's prior work at the U.S. Department of Justice created conflicts of interest that should disqualify him from defending the Chinese company in a case of alleged bank fraud and sanctions violations, U.S. prosecutors said in a filing on Friday.

Headlines: Insys says it may be forced to file for bankruptcy due to litigation cash crunch
Description: Insys Therapeutics Inc said on Friday that a cash crunch resulting from legal costs related to a U.S. Justice Department probe into sales practices for the company's powerful opioid medication and other litigation may lead the company to file for bankruptcy and prevent it from completing its settlement deal with the Justice Department.

Headlines: SoftBank set to invest in British financing group Greensill
Description: A prospective deal between SoftBank Group Corp's Vision Fund and UK-based financing group Greensill Capital could be announced as early as Monday, a city source told Reuters.

Headlines: Bayer hires law firm to investigate Monsanto stakeholder file issue
Description: Bayer said on Sunday it was hiring an external law firm to investigate French media complaints that Monsanto, the U.S. seed maker it took over last year, had compiled a file of influential personalities.

Headlines: Germany's Thyssenkrupp to seek new steel partners, CEO tells paper
Description: Thyssenkrupp will still seek partners for its steel operations after abandoning a European merger with India's Tata Steel, Chief Executive Guido Kerkhoff said in comments published on Sunday.

Headlines: China's door to talks with U.S. on trade always open: state media
Description: China's door to talks with the United States about their trade dispute is always open, but China will not yield on important issues of principle, state media said on Sunday.

Headlines: Six Chinese entities banned from exporting sensitive U.S. goods
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Monday it banned six Chinese technology entities, one Pakistani firm and five based in the United Arab Emirates from exporting sensitive U.S. technologies and other goods.

Headlines: BlackRock pullout makes state role in Carige rescue more plausible: Moody's
Description: The decision of U.S. asset manager BlackRock to pull out of the rescue of Italian troubled bank Carige makes state intervention more plausible, Moody's Investors Service said on Monday.

Headlines: Italian bank fund won't plug entire Carige capital hole: sources
Description: Italian banks will not step in to plug a capital shortfall at regional lender Banca Carige after U.S. fund manager BlackRock pulled out of a planned rescue bid, sources said, making a state bailout for the bank more likely.

Headlines: Norway paves way for Euronext takeover of Oslo Bors
Description: Norway will allow Euronext to take a majority stake in Oslo Bors VPS, the country's finance ministry said on Monday, confirming an earlier statement by Euronext.

Headlines: Australia's export billions go missing, statisticians suspected
Description: Australia's export earnings are booming as resource prices surge but a statistical quirk means tens of billions of dollars go missing from main measures of growth, making the economy seem weaker than it actually is.

Headlines: Bar rises for shale takeovers as Chevron bows out of Anadarko fight
Description: Chevron Chief Executive Michael Wirth's decision to opt out of a bidding war for Anadarko Petroleum Corp has raised the bar for deals, and dampened expectations that oil majors will drive a new wave of consolidation in U.S. shale.

Headlines: TV networks emerge as obstacles on YouTube's hunt for ads
Description: Three years ago, the beginning of the end of the U.S. television business looked certain when one of the largest ad buying agencies vowed to move a big chunk of its purchases to YouTube from TV budgets.

Headlines: Norway clears way for Euronext to secure Oslo Bors in Nasdaq battle
Description: Euronext won approval from Norway's Ministry of Finance to buy up to 100% of Oslo Bors on Monday, effectively ending a five-month battle with Nasdaq for one of the last independent stock market operators in Europe.

Headlines: EU trade chief sees possible extension to May 18 deadline for U.S. car tariffs: newspaper
Description: European Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmstroem expects U.S. President Donald Trump to delay a May 18 deadline for U.S. tariffs on cars imported from the European union, according to an interview published in the Sueddeutsche newspaper on Monday.

Headlines: Stocks dive, yuan weakens as U.S.-China trade fight intensifies
Description: Global stock markets tumbled on Monday and the Chinese yuan weakened to its lowest level since December as the trade war between the United States and China escalated.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon rolls out machines that pack orders and replace jobs
Description: Amazon.com Inc is rolling out machines to automate a job held by thousands of its workers: boxing up customer orders.

Headlines: Volkswagen to make batteries in Germany, slim down
Description: Volkswagen will invest almost 1 billion euros ($1.1 billion) in battery cell production at a facility in western Germany and is seeking to simplify the group by spinning off or selling units, the automaker said on Monday.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says he's vigilant but patient on U.S.-China tensions
Description: Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan on Monday said he is "extremely vigilant" on the escalating trade tensions between the United States and China, though it could take months before there is more clarity on how the talks are shaping up.

Headlines: Facebook raises minimum wage for U.S. contract workers to $20/hour
Description: Facebook Inc said on Monday it was raising its minimum wage for all U.S. contract workers, reacting to rising costs of living as it faces intense scrutiny over the treatment of ordinary employees and their pay.

Headlines: U.S. drops plan to require vehicle brake-throttle override system
Description: The Trump administration said Monday it will drop rules first proposed in 2012 that would have required automakers to install brake-throttle override systems to prevent runaway vehicles.

Headlines: Exclusive: Truckmaker Scania signs Northvolt battery deal, in talks on equity
Description: Volkswagen truck brand Scania has signed a battery supply deal with Sweden's Northvolt and is in talks about making an equity investment as part of the startup's efforts to raise 1.5 billion euros ($1.68 billion), Scania's head said on Monday.

Headlines: Bayer says Monsanto likely kept files on influential people across Europe
Description: Bayer said on Monday its Monsanto unit, which is being investigated by French prosecutors for compiling files of influential people such as journalists in France, likely did the same across Europe, suggesting a potentially wider problem.

Headlines: Tokyo prosecutors detail Ghosn's alleged cash transfer in revised indictment: Kyodo
Description: Tokyo prosecutors have filed a request to revise the content of their indictment of Carlos Ghosn for aggravated breach of trust, providing further details on alleged cash transfers involving the former Nissan boss and a Saudi friend, Kyodo news reported.

Headlines: Cellphones and laptops on latest USTR China tariff list, drugs excluded
Description: A list of products subject to possible U.S. tariffs on about $300 billion of Chinese imports will include cellphones and laptop computers but not pharmaceuticals and rare earth materials, the U.S. Trade Representative's Office said on Monday.

Headlines: Billionaire Schwartz makes $2.6 billion bet on Canada's WestJet Airlines
Description: Billionaire Gerry Schwartz pounced on Canada's WestJet Airlines on Monday as his private equity firm Onex Corp offered to buy the struggling airline for C$3.5 billion ($2.6 billion), betting it can turn around its recent decline by taking the company private.

Headlines: Amazon extends lead as top retail brand in Kantar/WPP survey
Description: Amazon has almost doubled its brand value to $316 billion as it expands in areas like entertainment and smart speakers, while China's Alibaba is now the world's second most valuable retail brand, a survey showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. exempts water filters, camera parts from China tariffs
Description: The Trump administration on Monday announced that it will exempt a broad range of additional Chinese-made products from 25 percent U.S. tariffs, including industrial equipment, water filtering equipment, small electric motors, remote control devices and stereoscopic microscopes.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco bets on oil supply to Europe, trading expansion
Description: Saudi Aramco aims to boost its oil supply to Europe by 300,000 barrels per day (bpd) within the next two years as it expands its trading operations there with an office opening this summer in London, a senior company executive said.

Headlines: PG&E proposes court order for CEO, board to tour town destroyed by wildfire
Description: PG&E Corp on Monday submitted a proposed order to a U.S. District Court judge that would require the power provider's chief executive and board to visit the California town of Paradise by July 15, to see the destruction caused by a wildfire in November that may be linked to the company's equipment.

Headlines: Exclusive: UniCredit advances toward bid for Germany's Commerzbank – sources
Description: UniCredit has stepped up preparations for a potential bid for Germany's Commerzbank by drafting in investment bankers including a former top German official, three people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Bayer nears seven-year low after $2 billion award in Roundup trial
Description: Bayer shares fell by as much as 5 percent on Tuesday after a California couple were awarded more than $2 billion in the largest U.S. jury penalty over allegations its Roundup weed killer causes cancer.

Headlines: Global stocks bounce back as Trump downplays U.S.-China trade fight
Description: U.S. and European stocks regained ground on Tuesday after President Donald Trump downplayed the U.S.-China trade war as "a little squabble" a day after a spike in tensions between the world's two largest economies rattled financial markets.

Headlines: Stocks bounce back as trade rhetoric cools
Description: U.S. stocks on Tuesday reclaimed some of the ground lost in the prior day's steep sell-off, with tariff-sensitive technology stocks leading the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq higher as investors were heartened by a tonal shift in U.S.-China trade rhetoric.

Headlines: Google to push new ads on its apps to snare shoppers
Description: Whether you are Googling on the couch, fiddling with Maps in the car or swiping through the Discover feed on the toilet, expect Alphabet Inc's Google to put ads in several new spots this year.

Headlines: U.S. growth would have contracted without trillions in government, consumer debt: Gundlach
Description: U.S. growth appears to be based "exclusively" on government, corporate and mortgage debt and the economy would have contracted if the United States had not added trillions in debt, Jeffrey Gundlach, chief executive of DoubleLine Capital, said in an investor webcast on Tuesday.

Headlines: Uber drivers are contractors, not employees, U.S. labor agency says
Description: Drivers for ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc are independent contractors and not employees, the general counsel of a U.S. labor agency has concluded, in an advisory memo that is likely to carry significant weight in a pending case against the company and could prevent drivers from joining a union.

Headlines: Carrefour and TerraCycle launch 'Loop' test in Paris to tackle waste
Description: French retailer Carrefour and U.S. waste recycling company TerraCycle launched on Tuesday the test for their 'Loop' initiative which they hope will tackle the problems of plastic waste threatening to destroy the environment.

Headlines: OPEC sees more 2019 demand for its oil as it keeps cutting output
Description: OPEC said on Tuesday that world demand for its oil would be higher than expected this year as supply growth from rivals including U.S. shale producers slows, pointing to a tighter market if the exporter group refrains from raising output.

Headlines: India delays levying retaliatory tariff on U.S. goods to June 16
Description: India delayed on Tuesday the implementation of higher tariffs on some goods imported from the United States to June 16, according to a government statement.

Headlines: U.S. leaves rare earths, critical minerals off China tariff list
Description: The United States has again decided not to impose tariffs on rare earths and other critical minerals from China, underscoring its reliance on the Asian nation for a group of materials used in everything from consumer electronics to military equipment.

Headlines: Mexico's rising oil nationalism faces debt-rating crisis
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador took office in December vowing to revive state-owned energy company Pemex and put the brakes on foreign investment to give the public a bigger cut of the country's oil wealth.

Headlines: VOI makes European push in crowded electric scooter-sharing market
Description: Sweden's VOI Technology plans to put a new fleet of thousands of electric scooters on European streets this summer to fend off competition in an increasingly crowded market.

Headlines: Britain downplays Huawei threat to U.S. intelligence sharing
Description: Britain would never take a decision on Huawei and 5G that would threaten its intelligence sharing alliance with the United States but it also does not want a new Cold War with China, Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Huawei willing to sign 'no-spy' pacts with governments: chairman
Description: Huawei is willing to sign no-spy agreements with governments, including Britain, the Chinese telco company's chairman said on Tuesday, amid U.S. pressure on European countries to shun the firm over espionage concerns.

Headlines: Fed's Williams says tariffs boost U.S. inflation, weigh on growth
Description: Tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump on Chinese goods in the escalating trade war between the two countries will boost U.S. inflation and could dampen economic growth, a top Federal Reserve policymaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips will not chase expensive Permian deals, CEO says
Description: ConocoPhillips Chief Executive Officer Ryan Lance on Tuesday repeated a pledge to restrain spending, saying the U.S. oil producer would not be drawn into pricey mergers and acquisitions.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: Tariffs could hurt earnings, but for some CEOs, it's worth it
Description: Jim Cramer reveals how some CEOs are willing to take the tariff pain because they're fed up with China's trade practices.

Headlines: Adobe CEO: We're 'optimistic' about our prospects in the wake of tariffs
Description: "Our exposure to China in both [creative and enterprise] is fairly minimal," CEO Shantanu Narayen says.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: What's behind today's huge sell-off
Description: Jim Cramer reveals that the coupling of an escalating trade war with China and Uber's IPO fiasco led to the market's dip.

Headlines: Members only: U.S. retailers revamp loyalty schemes for Amazon era
Description: With private fitting rooms, members-only stores and clever apps, U.S. department stores are reinventing their old and tested loyalty programs to fend off the challenge from e-commerce giant Amazon.com Inc and other online rivals.

Headlines: Huawei is not controlled by China, executive says
Description: Huawei is a private company that is not controlled by the Chinese government and would refuse to hand over information to Beijing although no such request has been made, the firm's Vice President of Western Europe said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs bought Commerzbank's claim in Saudi's biggest debt saga: sources
Description: Goldman Sachs has bought a claim against The International Bank Corporation (TIBC), a Bahraini bank whose default 10 years ago triggered the biggest financial crisis in Saudi Arabia, three sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Kone looks at options for potential Thyssenkrupp elevator deal - sources
Description: Finland's Kone is assessing the viability of a bid for Thyssenkrupp's 14 billion euro ($15.7 billion) elevators division even as the German conglomerate pursues plans to list it, four people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Ford recalling 273,000 vehicles in North America that could roll away
Description: Ford Motor Co is recalling nearly 273,000 Ford Fusion and Ranger pickup trucks in North America that could roll away if the gear is not in "park" mode, the second largest U.S. automaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Beyond Meat surges after coffee chain Tim Hortons adds vegan sausages to menu
Description: Shares of Beyond Meat rose as much as 16% on Wednesday after Canada's Restaurant Brands International Inc's coffee chain Tim Hortons said it will introduce three new sandwiches using the vegan burger marker's plant-based sausages

Headlines: U.S. tariffs against Airbus would harm Delta: airline official
Description: U.S. imposition of tariffs against the European Union over aircraft subsidies would cause "serious harm" to Delta Air Lines since the U.S. carrier is already under contract to buy several billion dollars worth of Airbus aircraft, a senior airline official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mnuchin says China trade talks likely to continue in Beijing
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Wednesday he will likely travel to Beijing soon to continue negotiations with Chinese counterparts as the world's two biggest economies try to salvage talks aimed at ending their months-long trade war.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories unchanged; sales surge
Description: U.S. business inventories were unchanged in March as sales increased by the most in more than two years, which could ease concerns of a broad build-up in inventories in the economy.

Headlines: Ford to build more Lincolns for Chinese market locally: CFO
Description: Ford Motor Co plans to start production of new luxury Lincoln models in China for that market as they are launched, starting with the new Corsair later this year, to benefit from lower costs and avoid the risk of tariffs, a top executive said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. bank regulator will vet next Wells Fargo CEO
Description: A top U.S. bank regulator said on Wednesday it will vet Wells Fargo & Co's pick for its next chief executive, a development that could complicate the scandal-hit lender's efforts to find a permanent replacement for CEO Tim Sloan.

Headlines: Macy's CEO says recent tariffs to impact furniture business
Description: Macy's Inc said on Wednesday the recent hike in U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods will hurt its furniture business of the department store operator.

Headlines: Ubisoft's fourth quarter misses company's expectations
Description: French video game producer Ubisoft on Wednesday reported fourth-quarter net bookings of 676.7 million euros, below company's expectations of approximately 698.0 million euros.

Headlines: WeWork starts $2.9 billion property platform with Canada's CDPQ
Description: The We Company, parent of workspace provider WeWork, said on Wednesday it has created a $2.9 billion real estate investment platform with funding from one of Canada's largest pension funds, building on ties with private equity firm the Rhone Group.

Headlines: Weak U.S. retail sales, industrial output highlight slowing economy
Description: U.S. retail sales unexpectedly fell in April as households cut back on purchases of motor vehicles and a range of other goods, pointing to a slowdown in economic growth after a temporary boost from exports and inventories in the first quarter.

Headlines: Alibaba beats revenue expectations on cloud boost
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd beat fourth-quarter revenue forecasts on Wednesday, thanks to growth in its core business and its diversification into cloud computing and other services.

Headlines: Cisco beats earnings target, says has cushioned supply chain from tariffs
Description: Cisco Systems Inc reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings on Wednesday and gave an upbeat sales forecast for the current period, saying that minimal sales exposure to China and changes to its supply chains have helped cushion the blow of U.S.-China trade dispute.

Headlines: Big U.S. hedge funds regain ardor for FAANGs in first quarter: filings
Description: Some of the biggest, highest-profile U.S. hedge fund investors and money managers fell back in love with FAANGs in the first quarter, according to regulatory filings released on Wednesday.

Headlines: Macy's CEO says tariff escalation could hurt business
Description: Macy's Inc said on Wednesday the latest tariffs on Chinese imports by Washington are hitting its furniture business and warned investors that additional levies would leave its clothing and accessory categories vulnerable as well.

Headlines: Wall St. ends higher as trade worries ease
Description: U.S. stocks closed higher on Wednesday as reports that U.S. President Donald Trump would hold off on imposing tariffs on imported cars and parts eased growth concerns even as economic data disappointed investors.

Headlines: Boeing made mistakes on 737 MAX says Southwest CEO, hopeful planes return in U.S. summer
Description: Boeing Co made mistakes with its 737 MAX planes that need to be addressed, Southwest Airlines Co Chief Executive Officer Gary Kelly told shareholders on Wednesday, but he said he is still hopeful that the jets grounded after two crashes will return to service in the U.S. summer.

Headlines: Fears of flying Boeing’s 737 MAX won’t get in way of price conscious ticket shoppers: Reuters/IPSOS poll
Description: U.S. fliers still consider ticket prices the most important factor when choosing a flight, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll, suggesting two fatal crashes of Boeing Co 737 MAX jets have had little impact on consumer sentiment.

Headlines: Boeing, aerospace group urge limits to U.S. tariffs over EU subsidies
Description: Senior officials from Boeing Co and a U.S. aerospace trade group on Wednesday urged the U.S. government to narrowly tailor any tariffs imposed on the European Union over illegal aircraft subsidies to avoid harming American manufacturers.

Headlines: Global stocks gain after Trump auto-tariff delay, weak data pressures yields
Description: U.S. and European stock indexes gained on Wednesday after news that U.S. President Donald Trump planned to delay tariffs on auto imports, offsetting earlier pressure on equities from weak U.S. and Chinese economic data that helped depress bond yields.

Headlines: Supersonic jets must be no noisier than existing planes: airports group
Description: A new generation of U.S.-produced commercial supersonic jets must be no louder than existing planes or risk exacerbating existing complaints over noise from air traffic, Angela Gittens, director of Airports Council International (ACI) said.

Headlines: WhatsApp informs Irish regulator of 'serious security vulnerability'
Description: Facebook's WhatsApp has informed its lead regulator in the European Union, Ireland's Data Protection Commissioner (DPC), of a serious security vulnerability on its platform, the DPC said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Walmart mulls stock market listing for UK arm Asda
Description: Walmart, the world's biggest retailer, said it is considering a stock market listing for its British supermarket arm Asda, whose attempt to combine with rival Sainsbury's was blocked by the UK regulator last month.

Headlines: China says it will support firms in boosting R&D spending
Description: China will support firms in boosting their spending on research and development, state television cited the cabinet as saying on Wednesday.

Headlines: China says it is only taking actions in self defense in U.S. trade dispute
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday the United States was defining the two countries' dispute over trade as a trade war, and China was only taking action in self-defense.

Headlines: China's retail sales growth slumps to 16-year low as trade war risks rise
Description: China reported surprisingly weaker growth in retail sales and industrial output for April on Wednesday, adding pressure on Beijing to roll out more stimulus as the trade war with the United States escalates.

Headlines: Huawei's $105 billion business at stake after U.S. broadside
Description: The latest U.S. broadside against Huawei that puts the Chinese firm on an exports blacklist threatens to rattle the global tech supply chain, linked closely to the $105 billion business of the world's top supplier of telecoms network equipment.

Headlines: Corning says it expects no impact from U.S. ban sales to Huawei
Description: Corning Inc on Thursday said it does not believe that a U.S. order potentially restricting sales of components to Chinese telecoms gear maker Huawei Technologies Co Ltd will have any material impact on its overall financial performance.

Headlines: Airbus CEO says all planemakers to suffer from 'lose-lose' trade war
Description: Airbus Chief Executive Guillaume Faury warned on Thursday any further escalation of trade tensions would damage aerospace firms globally, including the European planemaker's U.S. rival Boeing.

Headlines: Japanese bank MUFG rethinks policy on coal-fired power projects
Description: Japan's Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group will no longer provide financing for new coal-fired power generation projects after July 1, it said on Wednesday in a revised environmental and social policy framework.

Headlines: Airbus CEO: premature to talk about buying Bombardier Belfast plant
Description: The head of Europe's Airbus said it was too early to talk about acquiring a Belfast factory placed on sale by Canada's Bombardier .

Headlines: Five more U.S. states sue OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma over opioid epidemic
Description: Five U.S. states on Thursday filed lawsuits accusing Purdue Pharma LP of illegally marketing and selling opioids, escalating the wave of litigation over a nationwide abuse epidemic.

Headlines: Bayer bets on 'silver bullet' defense in Roundup litigation; experts see hurdles
Description: Bayer AG plans to argue that a $2 billion jury award and thousands of U.S. lawsuits claiming its glyphosate-based weed killer Roundup causes cancer should be tossed because a U.S. regulatory agency said the herbicide is not a public health risk.

Headlines: Walmart says higher China tariffs will increase prices for U.S. shoppers
Description: Walmart Inc said on Thursday that prices for shoppers will rise due to higher tariffs on goods from China as the world's largest retailer reported its best comparable sales growth for the first quarter in nine years.

Headlines: Delta, United poised for most new slots at Tokyo's Haneda airport
Description: Delta Air Lines and United Airlines are poised to win the most new daytime slots at Tokyo's Haneda International Airport in time for the 2020 Summer Olympics, according to a U.S. Department of Transportation statement on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. commerce secretary says Huawei order effective Friday: interview
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Thursday that an order blacklisting Chinese telecoms giant Huawei Technologies Co Ltd will go into effect on Friday.

Headlines: Global stocks gain after earnings, deal news, data; U.S. yields move up
Description: World stock markets were buoyed by deal-making news and solid earnings from Dow components Cisco and Walmart on Thursday while strong economic data pushed U.S. bond yields higher even as investors struggled to make sense of the latest developments in global trade relations.

Headlines: With inflation elusive, two Fed policymakers lay out a welcome mat
Description: Worried that current low inflation expectations will sap the U.S. central bank's ability to combat a future downturn, two Federal Reserve officials on Thursday made an unusual pitch: if inflation rises unexpectedly, the Fed should lay out the welcome mat.

Headlines: Austrian prosecutors see little basis for case against Airbus: report
Description: Vienna prosecutors believe there is little basis for an investigation into a decade-old $2 billion Eurofighter jet purchase by Austria, two media reported on Thursday, citing an internal report.

Headlines: Fed needs to let inflation rise above 2%, Kashkari says
Description: Low U.S. inflation expectations are sapping the Federal Reserve's ability to respond to a future downturn, Minneapolis Fed President Neel Kashkari said Thursday, calling for the Fed to allow inflation to rise above 2% to bring the economy back to full strength.

Headlines: Brokers brave China's FX market crackdown in hunt for household high rollers
Description: Lured by hopes that China's retail investors could become major players in global currency markets, foreign brokers are brazenly chasing business in a gray area of the country's online trading sector, even as Beijing vows to wipe out such activities.

Headlines: China's Huawei, 70 affiliates placed on U.S. trade blacklist
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Wednesday it is adding Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and 70 affiliates to its so-called “Entity List” - a move that bans the telecom giant from buying parts and components from U.S. companies without U.S. government approval.

Headlines: China says there has to be good faith for meaningful talks with U.S.
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Thursday that there has to be good faith for meaningful talks with the United States, amid an on-going trade war between the two countries.

Headlines: Trade war hurting the U.S. ethanol industry 'badly': U.S. Grains Council
Description: The U.S.-China trade war is hurting the U.S. ethanol industry "badly," Mike Dwyer, chief economist of the U.S. Grains Council, said on Wednesday at an event at New York Sugar week:

Headlines: Opting out: Some of China’s '996' tech tribe quit, seek less stress
Description: For over six years Qi Yaqian was a proud member of China's so-called 996 tech tribe, working nights and weekends at Nuomi, a group deals website.

Headlines: China says will protect rights of its businesses
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Thursday that the country will take necessary measures to safeguard the rights and interests of its businesses, after the United States hit Chinese telecoms giant Huawei Technologies Co Ltd with severe sanctions.

Headlines: Airlines urge regulators not to compete on safety after Boeing crisis
Description: Global airlines urged regulators on Friday not to compete over setting new safety rules, after two crashes led to the grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX and raised questions about the international influence of the U.S. aviation authority.

Headlines: Nestle to boost healthy food products in Brazil, eyes partnerships
Description: Nestle SA will increase its natural and organic products in Brazil, its No. 4 market worldwide, as part of a wider Americas plan to cut sugar, sodium and saturated fats in its food, a spokesman said.

Headlines: Masuko to step down as Mitsubishi Motors CEO, Kato to succeed him
Description: Mitsubishi Motors Corp said on Friday that Osamu Masuko will step down as its chief executive on June 21 and be replaced by Takao Kato, who is president of its operations in Indonesia.

Headlines: Samsung Electronics says undecided on further investment in its China NAND plant
Description: South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Friday that it has not decided on additional investment in a second memory chip production line in the Chinese city of Xian, denying a report by China's official Xinhua news agency.

Headlines: Exclusive: Kazakhstan to seek damages from Transneft for tainted oil loaded in Ust-Luga
Description: Kazakh oil flowing via Russia to be loaded on tankers at the Baltic Sea port of Ust-Luga has been contaminated and Kazakhstan plans to seek compensation from Russian pipeline monopoly Transneft, a senior Kazakh energy official said.

Headlines: Samsung to spend more than $14 billion in second phase of China chip plant: Xinhua
Description: South Korean tech giant Samsung Electronics Co Ltd will spend more than $14 billion in the second phase of investment in its memory chip plant in Xian, China, China's official Xinhua news agency reported on Friday citing a Samsung executive.

Headlines: Exclusive: FBI targets Johnson & Johnson, Siemens, GE, Philips in Brazil graft case - sources
Description: The U.S. FBI is investigating corporate giants Johnson & Johnson, Siemens AG, General Electric Co and Philips for allegedly paying kickbacks as part of a scheme involving medical equipment sales in Brazil, two Brazilian investigators have told Reuters.

Headlines: Corporations, events face boycott threats over U.S. abortion laws
Description: Companies operating in Alabama and Georgia, ranging from Toyota to Netflix, as well as an Alabama music festival faced boycott threats on Friday after the states passed near-total bans on abortion.

Headlines: Trade talks between U.S. and China have stalled: CNBC
Description: The trade talks between the United States and China have stalled, CNBC reported on Friday, citing sources.

Headlines: Starbucks' China challenger Luckin raises $561 million in U.S. IPO
Description: Luckin Coffee Inc, the Chinese challenger to Starbucks Corp, on Thursday priced its U.S. initial public offering at the top end of its targeted range and sold more shares than planned in the biggest U.S. float by a Chinese firm this year.

Headlines: Starbucks' China rival Luckin surges in market debut
Description: Shares of Luckin Coffee Inc surged as much as 52.7% in their market debut on Friday, indicating strong investor demand for the self-declared challenger to Starbucks Corp in China.

Headlines: Tall chip tale? Huawei's backup plans leave experts unconvinced
Description: Chip experts are calling out Huawei for its claims that it could ensure a steady supply chain without U.S. help, saying the technology the Chinese telecoms network gear maker buys from American companies would be "hard to replace".

Headlines: Italy's deputy PM Salvini: would be proud of a UniCredit bid for Commerzbank
Description: Italy's Deputy Prime Minister and League leader Matteo Salvini said he would hail a takeover bid by Italy's UniCredit for German rival Commerzbank.

Headlines: U.S. 'not sincere' about wanting more trade talks with China: media
Description: The United States is not sincere about wanting to resume trade talks with China and has damaged the atmosphere for negotiations with its recent moves, a state media social media account said.

Headlines: China says economic impact of U.S. trade tensions 'controllable'
Description: China's state planner said on Friday trade frictions with the United States has had some impact on China's economy, but it was "controllable" and countermeasures would be rolled-out when needed to "keep economic operations within reasonable range".

Headlines: Huawei's HiSilicon says it has long been preparing for U.S. ban scenario
Description: Huawei Technologies' chip arm HiSilicon said on Friday it has long been prepared for the "extreme scenario" that it could be banned from purchasing U.S. chips and technology, and is able to ensure steady supply of most products.

Headlines: Nissan says Saikawa to remain as CEO, Renault chief to join board
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor Co said on Friday it would keep Hiroto Saikawa as its chief executive, while bringing in the boss of alliance partner Renault to its board.

Headlines: China says always wants to resolve disputes through talks
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday Beijing has always wanted to resolve all disputes through talks amid an escalating trade conflict with the United States.

Headlines: U.S. recession risk rises as U.S.-China trade tensions heat up: Reuters poll
Description: Over the last month the U.S.-China trade war has boosted the risk of a U.S. recession, say a strong majority of economists polled by Reuters, who now put the chances of that happening in the next two years at 40%.

Headlines: New Zealand central bank revokes ANZ's permission to assess operational risk capital
Description: New Zealand's central bank has revoked Australia and New Zealand Banking Group's local license to calculate its own operational risk capital due to "persistent" control failures, adding to the bank's minimum capital requirement in the country.

Headlines: Exxon evacuates foreign staff from Iraqi oilfield
Description: Exxon Mobil has evacuated all of its foreign staff, around 60 people, from Iraq's West Qurna 1 oilfield and is flying them out to Dubai, a senior Iraqi official and three other sources told Reuters on Saturday.

Headlines: Spain's Globalia to launch new air carrier in Brazil: cabinet minister
Description: Spanish tourism and transportation company Grupo Globalia will launch a new air carrier in Brazil, Brazilian Infrastructure Minister Tarcísio Gomes de Freitas said in a message posted on Twitter on Saturday.

Headlines: Huawei founder says growth 'may slow, but only slightly' after U.S. restrictions
Description: Huawei Technologies' founder and chief executive Ren Zhengfei said on Saturday the growth of the Chinese tech giant "may slow, but only slightly" due to recent U.S. restrictions.

Headlines: Canada vows 'full steam ahead' on ratifying trade pact after U.S. lifts metals tariffs
Description: Canada will move quickly to ratify the new North American trade pact, Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Saturday, a day after the United States agreed to lift tariffs on Canadian steel and aluminum.

Headlines: OPEC has two main options for June meeting, both foresee output rise: sources
Description: Saudi Arabia and Russia are discussing two main scenarios for a meeting of OPEC and its oil-producer allies in June and both frameworks propose increased crude output from the second half of 2019, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Lumentum says halting all Huawei shipments, cuts quarterly forecast
Description: Mobile phone parts producer Lumentum Holdings Inc on Monday was the first U.S. company to confirm formally it was halting shipments to Huawei Technologies, following export restrictions put in place by the United States Department of Commerce.

Headlines: Goldman switches to Mazars for European audit
Description: Goldman Sachs International has appointed Mazars to audit its London-based European operations in a major coup for the accounting firm.

Headlines: UK firms likely to scrap planned investment on a no-deal Brexit: BoE's Broadbent
Description: British companies are likely to cancel projects that they have put on hold because of Brexit uncertainty if the country leaves the European Union without a deal to smooth the shock, Bank of England Deputy Governor Ben Broadbent said on Monday.

Headlines: Huawei founder says U.S. government is underestimating company: state media
Description: The U.S. government's temporary easing of trade restrictions on Huawei Technologies bears little meaning on the company as the Chinese firm has made preparations, Huawei's founder Ren Zhengfei told state broadcaster CCTV on Tuesday in an interview.

Headlines: American Airlines asks court to block disruptive 'slowdown' by mechanics unions
Description: American Airlines Group Inc has filed a lawsuit against two unions representing its mechanics, asking the court to halt what it called an illegal slowdown that it said on Monday threatened to disrupt U.S. summer travel.

Headlines: Walmart, Target, Bed Bath must face lawsuit over fake 'Egyptian' cotton: NY judge
Description: A federal judge said Walmart Inc, Target Corp and Bed Bath & Beyond Inc must face a lawsuit claiming they sold linens that were falsely labeled "100% Egyptian Cotton" or "100% Long-Staple Egyptian cotton" despite being suspicious of their origin.

Headlines: Face ID firm Lumentum follows Google with Huawei ban
Description: Apple Face ID parts supplier Lumentum Holdings Inc followed Google on Monday in clamping down on the business it does with Huawei Technologies, after U.S. President Donald Trump imposed a ban on the Chinese firm on national security grounds.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank staff flagged Trump, Kushner transactions for watchdog: NYTimes
Description: Anti-money laundering specialists at Deutsche Bank AG recommended in 2016 and 2017 that multiple transactions involving entities controlled by U.S. President Donald Trump and his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, be reported to a federal financial-crimes watchdog, the New York Times reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank denies report it prevented Trump transactions being flagged
Description: Deutsche Bank denied a report that said some of its executives rejected the advice of the bank's own anti-money laundering specialists and prevented some transactions involving entities controlled by President Donald Trump and his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, being filed with the government.

Headlines: Trump rejects New York Times report on Deutsche Bank transactions
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday rejected a New York Times report that raised questions about multiple Deutsche Bank transactions involving entities controlled by him and his son-in-law Jared Kushner.

Headlines: Chips are down: Huawei U.S. blacklisting knocks semiconductor stocks
Description: U.S. and European chipmakers fell sharply on Monday amid worries the Huawei Technologies suppliers may suspend shipments to the Chinese firm due to a U.S. crackdown.

Headlines: China's tech transfer problem is growing, EU business group says
Description: Cases of European firms forced to transfer technology in China are increasing despite Beijing saying the problem does not exist, a European business lobby said, adding that its outlook on the country's regulatory environment is "bleak".

Headlines: Jim Cramer: 'Your portfolio should have as little exposure to China as possible'
Description: "As long as President [Donald] Trump believes that the Chinese are the ones who pay the price, he's going to keep taking a hard-line approach to these negotiations," Cramer said.

Headlines: Year-old Xinhua alert spreads proclaiming U.S.-China trade row ceasefire
Description: China’s official Xinhua news agency condemned the spreading of "false news" on Monday after some websites published a year-old alert announcing a ceasefire in the Sino-U.S. trade dispute.

Headlines: Trade uncertainty darkens U.S. small caps outlook
Description: Shares of smaller publicly listed U.S. companies have fallen more on recent U.S.-China trade tensions than larger corporations and could face an even rougher road as the year wears on unless the prospects for economic growth improve.

Headlines: Carrefour considers sale of stake in China business: sources
Description: Carrefour, Europe largest retailer, is exploring the sale of a minority stake in its loss-making business in China and has started sounding out potential buyers, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Berlin: We're examining impact of U.S. sanctions against Huawei on German firms
Description: The German Economy Ministry is examining the impact of U.S. sanctions against Huawei Technologies Co Ltd on German firms, a spokeswoman said on Monday.

Headlines: Air New Zealand picks Boeing for wide-body jet order: sources
Description: Air New Zealand Ltd has decided to buy wide-body planes from Boeing Co, people with direct knowledge of the matter said, ending an 18 month battle between the U.S. aircraft maker and European rival Airbus SE.

Headlines: Former Tesla bull makes $10 worst case call on China worries
Description: One of Tesla's former biggest supporters on Wall Street said on Tuesday the electric carmaker's shares could fall to $10 from nearly $200 now, if tensions with China escalate and sap demand for its cars.

Headlines: U.S. senators urge Volkswagen to end delay in Tennessee union vote
Description: Three Democratic U.S. senators on Tuesday questioned a decision by Volkswagen AG's U.S. unit to delay a union election for workers at its Tennessee assembly plant.

Headlines: Exclusive: A delicate balance - Toyota took care to make offering to U.S. before China deals
Description: Toyota Motor Corp last month announced two deals in China that were small in size but large in strategic planning.

Headlines: Fed officials see past misses as trouble for any new inflation approach
Description: The Federal Reserve is discussing whether a better way to get the U.S. economy to hit the central bank's inflation target is to tolerate much higher price increases in some years to counter the weaker ones.

Headlines: Nokia CEO sees possible benefits from Huawei tensions
Description: Nokia Chief Executive Rajeev Suri said on Tuesday the company could benefit from a U.S. clampdown on Chinese rival Huawei as the race to roll out 5G services heats up.

Headlines: J.C. Penney sales fall short, net loss doubles; shares sink
Description: Same-store sales fell more than expected at J.C. Penney Co Inc in the first quarter and its net loss nearly doubled after the retailer exited its appliance and in-store furniture businesses, sending shares down more than 9% on Tuesday.

Headlines: EU regulators to decide on IBM's $34 billion Red Hat bid by June 27
Description: EU antitrust regulators will decide by June 27 whether to clear U.S. tech giant International Business Machines Corp's $34 billion bid for software company Red Hat.

Headlines: Huawei accuses U.S. of bullying, says working with Google to respond to ban
Description: Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei called itself the victim of U.S. "bullying" on Tuesday and said it was working with Google to respond to trade restrictions imposed by Washington last week, a senior Huawei executive said.

Headlines: Brazil lower house votes to allow foreign airlines in domestic market
Description: Brazil's lower house of Congress voted on Tuesday to allow foreign-controlled airlines to operate domestic flights in Latin America's largest economy, opening the door to more competition in an increasingly concentrated market.

Headlines: Merck buys Peloton to expand its kidney cancer treatment portfolio
Description: U.S. drugmaker Merck & Co Inc on Tuesday agreed to buy Peloton Therapeutics Inc for $1.05 billion in cash, gaining access to the privately held company's lead kidney cancer drug candidate.

Headlines: Wall St. rises as Huawei reprieve boosts tech shares
Description: Shares of technology companies helped lift Wall Street on Tuesday after the United States temporarily eased curbs on China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, alleviating investor concerns about pressure on future corporate results in the sector.

Headlines: Global stocks rally as U.S. eases Huawei restrictions
Description: The dollar rose and global equity markets advanced on Tuesday, led by chipmakers and companies exposed to Asia, after the United States temporarily eased trade restrictions on China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headlines: Rare earth firms' stocks soar on U.S.-China trade war speculation
Description: Shares in rare earth-related companies soared on Tuesday, led by jumps in Chinese producers a day after Chinese President Xi Jinping visited a rare earth firm in southern China, sparking speculation the sector could be the next front in the Sino-U.S. trade war.

Headlines: Qorvo stops chip shipments to Huawei
Description: Radio frequency chipmaker Qorvo on Tuesday joined mobile parts maker Lumentum Holdings Inc in halting shipments to Huawei Technologies, following export restrictions by the United States government.

Headlines: Cramer: Health care stocks are rising on hopes Biden will snag the 2020 Democratic nomination
Description: "Unlike Bernie Sanders or Elizabeth Warren or Kamala Harris, Biden's against 'Medicare for All,'" the "Mad Money" host says.

Headlines: U.S. airline group sees record summer travel, despite 737 MAX grounding
Description: U.S. summer air travel will hit a new record this year despite the grounding of Boeing's 737 MAX aircraft after two fatal crashes, a group representing major airlines said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Huawei believes Europe will keep faith in company: executive
Description: China's Huawei believes Europe will not follow the United States in blacklisting the company because it has been a partner of European telecoms firms for many years, a top Huawei executive told an Italian newspaper.

Headlines: U.S., China need to reverse course in trade row to help economy: OECD
Description: Economic growth in China and the United States could be 0.2-0.3% lower on average by 2021 and 2022 if the two countries do not row back on tit-for-tat tariffs in their dispute that has dampened the global economic outlook, the OECD said on Tuesday.

Headlines: J.C.Penney says more tariffs on China imports would hurt business
Description: J.C.Penney Inc on Tuesday warned of a "meaningful impact" on its private and national brands from U.S. President Donald Trump's potential fourth round of tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: Hundreds of foreign companies attend North Korea trade fair despite sanctions
Description: An international trade fair in North Korea this week may be the largest such event on record, analysts said on Tuesday, with hundreds of Chinese and other foreign vendors taking part despite sanctions pressure.

Headlines: Fingerprints and finances: next Wells Fargo CEO will be under regulatory microscope
Description: From submitting their fingerprints to giving up their tax records, Wells Fargo & Co's next chief executive will go through a vetting process that could rival that of top U.S. government officials.

Headlines: Huawei says it is a victim of U.S. bullying
Description: Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei on Tuesday said it was a victim of bullying by the U.S. administration.

Headlines: Italy's Prada to ditch some wholesalers to support full-price sales
Description: Italian luxury goods group Prada said it would shrink its wholesale network in Italy and Europe in a push to have uniform prices for its products across different outlets and reduce markdowns.

Headlines: Factbox: Investments by automakers in the U.S. and China since Trump came to power
Description: Major automakers have announced a slew of investments in the United States since President Donald Trump took office in January 2017 and exerted pressure on the industry to create more U.S. jobs.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says U.S. rates are on the right setting: FOX
Description: The U.S. economy should grow at a solid 2.25-2.50% rate this year, with inflation moving up to the Federal Reserve's target, putting rates in the right place, a top Fed official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says U.S. is 'flirting' with yield curve inversion
Description: U.S. bond markets are "flirting" with a yield curve inversion that could signal slower economic growth ahead, Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: Qualcomm's 'obstinance' needs monitoring - judge
Description: Qualcomm Inc illegally suppressed competition in the market for smartphone chips by threatening to cut off supplies and extracting excessive licensing fees, a U.S. judge ruled, a decision that could force the company to overhaul its business practices.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury's Mnuchin: No discussion with White House on Trump's taxes
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Wednesday said he had not discussed releasing President Donald Trump's tax returns with the White House, and disagreed with an IRS memo that reportedly concluded he should release them to Congress.

Headlines: T-Mobile-Sprint deal would boost prices, hurt poorest U.S. consumers, experts say
Description: Concessions by T-Mobile US Inc to win U.S. government approval to buy Sprint Corp will likely lead to higher prices for the poorest Americans, many of whom use prepaid wireless plans, analysts and activists said.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury's Mnuchin says U.S. to hit debt limit in late summer
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Wednesday urged Congress to raise the U.S. debt ceiling as soon as possible, saying the U.S. government was expected to exhaust its borrowing authority around late summer.

Headlines: U.S. judge says Qualcomm violated antitrust law; appeal planned, shares plunge
Description: Qualcomm Inc illegally suppressed competition in the market for smartphone chips by threatening to cut off supplies and extracting excessive licensing fees, a U.S. judge ruled, a decision that could force the company to overhaul its business practices.

Headlines: Renewed U.S.-China trade tensions push down Wall Street
Description: Wall Street's major indexes dipped on Wednesday as inflamed trade tensions between the United States and China weighed on investor sentiment.

Headlines: GM faces pushback on U.S. self-driving vehicle plan
Description: General Motors Co faces pushback over its request that U.S. regulators waive some automobile safety standards to make it possible to deploy a ride-sharing fleet of driverless cars without steering wheels or other human controls.

Headlines: Natura agrees to buy Avon, creating cosmetics powerhouse
Description: Brazil's Natura SA said on Wednesday it had reached an agreement to buy rival Avon Products Inc via a share swap, creating the world's fourth-largest beauty company with a redoubled focus on direct sales.

Headlines: Uber to open third Latin America support center in Bogota
Description: Ride-hailing app Uber will spend $40 million over five years to open its third support center in Latin America in September in the Colombian capital Bogota, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Gold miners must focus on returns, mergers to attract investment: Barrick CEO
Description: Gold miners must focus on maximizing returns and more mergers to attract investors seeking to diversify after years of under-investing in mines, Barrick Gold's chief executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Shares in China's Hikvision slump after report of U.S. blacklisting
Description: Shenzhen-listed shares in Chinese video surveillance firm Hikvision Digital Technology Co Ltd opened 10% lower on Wednesday after reports that the U.S. may blacklist the firm.
