Description: U.S. stocks rose on Wednesday, with each of the major indexes closing at a record high, as expectations grew that the Federal Reserve would take a more dovish turn as a raft of data provided more evidence of a slowing economy.

Headlines: U.S. judge to slash $80 million Roundup jury verdict: court hearing
Description: A U.S. judge on Tuesday said he would reduce an $80 million damage award against Bayer AG to $50 million or less in the case of a man who blamed his cancer on glyphosate-based weed killer Roundup.

Headlines: EU leaders choose France's Lagarde for ECB after marathon summit
Description: European Union leaders agreed on Tuesday to name France's Christine Lagarde as the new head of the European Central Bank and sealed a deal on filling the EU's other top four jobs after marathon talks that have exposed deep divisions in the bloc.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit surges to five-month high as imports soar
Description: The U.S. trade deficit jumped to a five-month high in May as imports of goods increased, likely as businesses restocked ahead of an increase in tariffs on Chinese merchandise, eclipsing a broad rise in exports.

Headlines: Weed leader Canopy Growth ousts co-CEO Bruce Linton
Description: Canada's Canopy Growth Corp fired founder and co-Chief Executive Officer Bruce Linton, a surprise move that comes just a week after the weed producer's largest shareholder expressed disappointment over its loss-making streak.

Headlines: Samsung Electronics' second-quarter profit likely halved as Huawei woes worsen chip glut
Description: Samsung Electronics is likely to say second-quarter profit more than halved when it reports preliminary earnings on Friday, data showed, as a drop in memory chip shipments to China's embattled Huawei exacerbated a price-squeezing supply glut.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sweden's EQT targets Asia Pacific as IPO decision looms
Description: High above Stockholm's skyline, Sweden's EQT Partners is plotting the next chapter in its rapid rise from a Nordic-focused investor to the world's seventh-biggest buyout firm, with a focus on growth in the Asia Pacific region.

Headlines: Global stock markets, bonds rally in expectation of rate cuts
Description: Record low bond yields in Europe and the expectation of further interest rate cuts by central banks worldwide helped push global stock market indices higher Wednesday as the benchmark U.S. S&P 500 hit another record high.

Headlines: Oil prices climb as U.S. equities rally, rig count drops
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Wednesday ahead of a U.S. holiday, after falling steeply a day earlier as worries about a slowing global economy outweighed a decision by OPEC and allies to extend crude output cuts.

Headlines: Asda boss sees possible stock market listing in two to three years
Description: The timescale for a possible stock market listing of British supermarket group Asda, by its U.S. parent Walmart , is two to three years, Asda's boss said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. judge blocks Qualcomm effort to put antitrust ruling on hold
Description: A U.S. judge on Wednesday ruled against Qualcomm Inc's effort to block the implementation of a sweeping antitrust ruling against it as the mobile chip supplier pursues an appeal that could take more than a year to wind through the courts.

Headlines: William Hill to close British betting shops, cut jobs after curbs
Description: William Hill plans to cut about a third of its betting shops and jobs in Britain after the government slashed the maximum stake permitted on fixed-odds terminals, dubbed the "crack cocaine" of gambling by their critics.

Headlines: Factbox: British bookmakers cut back after fixed-odds machine curbs
Description: Gambling company William Hill plans to close 700 betting shops, putting 4,500 jobs at risk, after Britain in April cut the maximum stake on fixed-odds betting terminals.

Headlines: Superdry moves to fill boardroom seats after Dunkerton's bruising battle
Description: Superdry has appointed former finance heads of M&S and New Look to its board, months after the UK fashion retailer's founder Julian Dunkerton rejoined after a bruising boardroom battle that saw most of its directors leave.

Headlines: U.S. asks federal court to throw out Huawei lawsuit
Description: The U.S. government filed a motion on Wednesday asking for the dismissal of a lawsuit by Chinese telecommunications giant Huawei Technologies Co Ltd that claimed the United States had acted illegally when it blacklisted Huawei's products.

Headlines: Oil prices fall on U.S. inventory data, concerns about demand
Description: Oil prices fell in thin trade on Thursday, weighed down by data showing a smaller-than-expected draw on U.S. crude stockpiles and worries about the global economy.

Headlines: Samsung in hot water over splashy Australian phone ads
Description: Australia's consumer watchdog has sued Samsung Electronics Co Ltd's Australian unit for allegedly misleading consumers by promoting water-resistant Galaxy smartphones as suitable to use in swimming pools and the surf.

Headlines: Buoyant U.S. stocks at odds with downbeat market signals
Description: Even as record highs this week in the major U.S. stock indexes telegraph confidence on Wall Street, caution abounds in other U.S. markets, where falling bond yields and flailing small-cap stocks indicate investors are torn about where to place bets.

Headlines: Wall Street dips as rate cut expectations relax
Description: U.S. stocks dipped on Friday, as the S&P 500 snapped a three-day streak of record closes, following an unexpectedly strong U.S. payrolls report that led investors to reassess how dovish a stance the Federal Reserve may take at its next meeting.

Headlines: Warning light flashing for Slovakia's auto industry
Description: When David landed an assembly line job at Volkswagen's Bratislava factory, his colleagues congratulated him on securing a well-paid position he could ride to retirement.

Headlines: Oil prices rise on Iran tensions, OPEC output cuts
Description: Oil futures rose on Friday as tensions over Iran and an extension to output cuts by OPEC and its allies boosted prices, but mixed economic data limited the rally.

Headlines: China's Anbang to offload health insurance unit as government speeds up asset sales
Description: China's Anbang Insurance Group said it will sell its entire stake in a health insurance unit as Beijing speeds up asset disposals at the troubled government-controlled insurance conglomerate.

Headlines: 'Wolf of Wall Street' producer charged with 1MDB money laundering in Malaysia
Description: Malaysia on Friday charged one of the "Wolf of Wall Street" film producers, and stepson of former prime minister Najib Razak, with money laundering, alleging he misappropriated $248 million linked to state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB).

Headlines: 'Safe like China': In Argentina, ZTE finds eager buyer for surveillance tech
Description: In Argentina's remote northern province of Jujuy, Chinese telecoms giant ZTE is installing a little slice of the Asian nation's vast surveillance state - security cameras that the local government says will help to curb street crime.

Headlines: Wells Fargo fined in Ireland over reporting breaches
Description: Wells Fargo & Co's Irish subsidiary was fined 5.9 million euros on Friday for a prolonged series of regulatory reporting breaches, the second largest fine ever handed down by Ireland's Central Bank.

Headlines: Fed describes labor market as strong, weak inflation as 'transitory'
Description: U.S. economic growth continued "at a solid pace" in the first half of the year though it likely weakened in recent months as higher tariffs depressed global trade and business investment weakened, the Federal Reserve said on Friday in its semi-annual report to Congress.

Headlines: Graphic: America's economy and wages are cooling but not its female workforce
Description: Data released on Friday showed a return to strong job growth in the United States, allaying some fears the U.S. economy is on a short path to recession. But the data also reinforced the view that economic growth is slowing.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. job growth surges, but wage growth remains tepid
Description: U.S. job growth rebounded strongly in June, but moderate wage gains and mounting evidence that the economy was slowing sharply could still encourage the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates this month.

Headlines: Exit of Deutsche Bank's investment bank chief marks end of era
Description: The head of Deutsche Bank's investment bank agreed to step down on Friday in a sign of the division's waning influence as Germany's largest lender prepares a multi-billion dollar restructuring aimed at reversing a decline in its fortunes.

Headlines: U.S. job growth surges, July rate cut expectations intact
Description: U.S. job growth rebounded strongly in June, with government payrolls surging, but persistent moderate wage gains and mounting evidence the economy was losing momentum could still encourage the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates this month.

Headlines: India's PNB says detects 38 billion rupee fraud
Description: India's state-run Punjab National Bank (PNB) on Saturday said it had reported a borrowing fraud of 38.05 billion Indian rupees ($556 million) in Bhushan Power & Steel Ltd's account to the country's central bank.

Headlines: Fed faces tougher task in deciding whether to cut U.S. rates
Description: U.S. employers are hiring workers, but that is only making the Federal Reserve's job harder.

Headlines: Gray Television well placed for U.S. election ad deluge: Barron's
Description: Broadcasting company Gray Television Inc is well placed to profit from an anticipated deluge of political advertising ahead of U.S. elections in 2020, according to Barron's.

Headlines: British Airways faces record $230 million fine over data theft
Description: British Airways-owner IAG is facing a record $230 million fine for the theft of data from 500,000 customers from its website last year under tough new data-protection rules policed by the UK's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO).

Headlines: Huawei outlines investment plans in Poland depending on 5G role
Description: Huawei aims to spend 3 billion zlotys ($793 million) in Poland in the next five years, although whether the Chinese firm has a role in the 5G rollout may affect the scale of investment, an official at the group's Polish unit said.

Headlines: Waymo tests Wi-Fi in driverless taxis hoping perks can route it past rivals
Description: Waymo is rolling out amenities to entice riders to use its self-driving taxis, creating a potential route to profitability in a money-losing industry.

Headlines: Fed easing could prompt first China rate cut in four years - analysts
Description: China's central bank could cut its benchmark policy rate for the first time in four years if the U.S. Federal Reserve delivers a widely expected cut in late July, analysts say, as Chinese policymakers step up support for the slowing economy.

Headlines: SunTrust to stop financing private U.S. prison operators
Description: SunTrust Banks Inc will stop financing operators of private prisons and immigration holding facilities, it said on Monday, becoming the latest lender to distance itself from a sector associated with the Trump administration's policies.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbus, Boeing indicate they may pull out of Canada fighter jet race - sources
Description: Airbus SE and Boeing Co may pull out of a bidding process to supply Canada with new fighter jets because they say the contest is unfairly tilted toward Lockheed Martin Corp, two sources with direct knowledge of the situation said on Monday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank capital-boosting debt dips on restructuring fears
Description: Deutsche Bank's capital-boosting Additional Tier I (AT1) debt issues fell on Monday on worries over future challenges Germany's biggest lender may face in a planned overhaul.

Headlines: Supply-chain pain: South Korea chipmakers and their suppliers seek to bypass Tokyo curbs
Description: South Korean chipmakers and Japanese chemical suppliers caught in the midst of a sudden escalation of a bilateral diplomatic dispute are scrambling to circumvent tightened export controls imposed by Tokyo, industry executives said.

Headlines: Wall St. drops as Apple falls, Fed eyed
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Monday as Apple shares dropped following a broker downgrade and investors continued to weigh chances of an aggressive interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve later this month.

Headlines: Roche, Spark push back takeover deadline in $4.3 billion deal
Description: Roche and Spark Therapeutics agreed to extend the deadline for the Swiss drugmaker's $4.3 billion takeover bid for the U.S. gene therapy specialist, Roche said, adding it remains "fully committed" to a deal it sees closing this year.

Headlines: U.S. consumer inflation outlook rises for first time in three months: NY Fed survey
Description: U.S. consumers in June lifted their inflation expectations for the first time in three months, New York Fed data showed on Monday, reducing pressure on central bankers to cut rates significantly to support economic momentum.

Headlines: Oil steadies as demand worries offset Iran's new nuclear threats
Description: Oil prices steadied on Monday as tensions over Iran's nuclear program countered concerns about whether slowing global economic growth would hit oil demand.

Headlines: Global stocks slide on dimming prospects for sharp U.S. rate cut
Description: Stocks around the world fell on Monday after strong U.S. job gains tempered expectations the Federal Reserve will deliver a large interest rate cut at the end of July.

Headlines: Trade call between U.S., Chinese officials was constructive: White House
Description: U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators held a constructive phone call on Tuesday, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said.

Headlines: Bombardier to lay off 550 workers at Thunder Bay, Ontario, plant: BNN Bloomberg
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc is laying off half the 1,100 workers at its Thunder Bay, Ontario, railway car plant, BNN Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing a federal government source.

Headlines: Doubts over Deutsche Bank turnaround plan dent shaky shares
Description: Deutsche Bank shares extended losses on Tuesday on investor doubts that its chief executive can revive the lender by shrinking the investment bank and returning to its roots as banker to corporate Germany.

Headlines: Appetizing prospects: Uber founder takes aim at South Korea's shared kitchen market
Description: Chef Youm Jung-phil plans to close his restaurant in Seoul's affluent Gangnam district this month, worn down by the rising cost of labor and rent as well as declines in the number of customers eating in.

Headlines: Mexico calls out Louis Vuitton for using traditional pattern
Description: The Mexican government has questioned Louis Vuitton's use of a traditional Mexican pattern in the design of a chair, less than a month after it sent a similar letter to another prominent fashion house.

Headlines: IBM closes $34 billion deal to buy Red Hat to boost cloud business
Description: International Business Machines Corp said on Tuesday it has closed its $34 billion acquisition of software company Red Hat Inc , as it looks to ramp up its cloud computing business.

Headlines: U.S., China to relaunch talks with little changed since deal fell apart
Description: The United States and China are set to relaunch trade talks this week after a two-month hiatus, but a year after their trade war began there is little sign their differences have narrowed.

Headlines: Exclusive: Germany's Bayer seeks animal health merger with Elanco - sources
Description: Bayer has approached U.S. drug firm Elanco Animal Health to discuss a possible combination of their pet-health businesses to create an industry giant, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Apple's services revenue, China to power third quarter: analyst
Description: Apple Inc will likely see a surge in services revenue in the third quarter, charged by app store developer revenue and renewed growth in China, critical areas for the future as the iPhone maker faces a maturing smartphone market, Evercore ISI said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Qualcomm asks appeals court to pause antitrust ruling's impact
Description: Qualcomm Inc on Monday asked a U.S. appeals court to pause an antitrust ruling that could drastically alter its business model while it tries to overturn the ruling.

Headlines: U.S. exempts some medical, electronic devices from China tariffs
Description: The Trump administration will exempt 110 Chinese products, from medical equipment to key capacitors, from hefty tariffs, it said on Tuesday, offering relief to some U.S. firms which have said the taxes harm their bottom lines.

Headlines: Airbus confirms deliveries rose 28% in first half of 2019
Description: Airbus confirmed on Tuesday that its deliveries rose by 28% in the first half of the year, putting it ahead of Boeing for the first time in eight years as the U.S. planemaker sees no immediate end to the grounding of its 737 MAX.

Headlines: U.S., Chinese negotiators resume trade talks on Tuesday: official
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin spoke with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He and Minister Zhong Shan on Tuesday to continue negotiations to resolve outstanding trade issues, a U.S. official said.

Headlines: World stocks rise, dollar drops as Fed chair boosts rate-cut hopes
Description: A broad index of world stock markets edged higher on Wednesday while the U.S. dollar fell as comments from Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell bolstered expectations for an interest rate cut from the U.S. central bank this month.

Headlines: Wall Street touches new highs after comments by Fed's Powell
Description: U.S. stocks ended higher and the S&P 500 index briefly crossed the 3,000-point mark for the first time on Wednesday as remarks by Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell reassured investors about the potential for an interest rate cut later this month.

Headlines: Europe should brace for U.S. tariffs on several fronts: German official
Description: European Union member states should brace for U.S. tariffs on several fronts in the months ahead, a senior German official warned late on Tuesday, just hours before Washington launched a probe of a planned French digital tax that could trigger future tariffs.

Headlines: Nintendo shares jump on imminent launch of Switch Lite
Description: Shares in Japan's Nintendo Co rose more than 4% on Thursday after the company said it would soon launch Nintendo Switch Lite, a cheaper, handheld version of its hugely popular Switch games.

Headlines: Domestic airfares soar in Indonesia despite government price cap
Description: When Resti Novita Sari booked to fly from Jakarta to her hometown of Padang to visit family for the Eid holiday, airfares were 40% to 60% higher than she had paid in previous years.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin to keep Pennsylvania plant open at Trump's request
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp has decided to keep the Sikorsky helicopter plant in Coatesville, Pennsylvania, open after U.S. President Donald Trump pressed its chief executive to continue operations, the company said on Twitter on Wednesday.

Headlines: S&P 500 tops 3,000 less than five years after 2,000
Description: The S&P 500, the benchmark index that investors tend to rely on as a proxy for the U.S. stock market, topped 3,000 for the first time on Wednesday.

Headlines: Instant view: Powell - Fed stands ready to act "as appropriate" to sustain expansion
Description: Concerns about trade policy and a weak global economy "continue to weigh on the U.S. economic outlook" and the Federal Reserve stands ready to "act as appropriate" to sustain a decade-long expansion, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell said on Wednesday in remarks that could bolster expectations of an interest rate cut later this month.

Headlines: Amazon customer helpline not required, says Europe's top court in boost for e-commerce
Description: U.S. online retailer Amazon does not have to provide a helpline phone number to consumers, Europe's top court said on Wednesday in a ruling that could boost e-commerce merchants.

Headlines: Chinese movie-ticketing leader Maoyan says to boost film investment, Tencent partnership
Description: Maoyan Entertainment , China's leading movie-ticketing platform, said it would boost investment in the domestic film industry and deepen its partnership with Tencent Holdings Ltd , as it works to halt a downturn at cinemas.

Headlines: U.S., Chinese negotiators hold 'constructive' phone talks on trade
Description: U.S. and Chinese trade officials held a "constructive" phone conversation on Tuesday, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said, marking a new round of talks after the world's two largest economies agreed to a truce in a year-long trade war.

Headlines: Japan curbs could drag on, hurt global economy: Moon
Description: Japan's export curbs on key materials used by South Korean tech companies could drag on despite diplomatic efforts to end the dispute, South Korea's president said on Wednesday, pledging to help firms to reduce their reliance on Japanese suppliers.

Headlines: Kremlin says Rosneft's dispute with Transneft not a matter for Putin
Description: The dispute between Rosneft and Transneft is not a matter for Russian President Vladimir Putin to intervene in because it is a corporate matter, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fed's Powell bolsters rate cut view on trade, global growth concerns
Description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Wednesday set the stage for the first U.S. interest rate cut in a decade later this month, pledging to 'act as appropriate' to defend an economic expansion threatened by trade disputes and a global slowdown.

Headlines: Aggressive U.S. energy policy tests ties with European allies
Description: For the administration of President Donald Trump, a policy of "energy dominance" means reducing dependence on imported oil and promoting exports to boost the national economy and Washington's political influence overseas.

Headlines: Euro zone growth, inflation outlook cut as risks from U.S. trade grow
Description: The European Commission lowered its estimates on Wednesday for euro zone growth and inflation, saying uncertainty over U.S. trade policy posed a major risk to the bloc.

Headlines: Many Fed officials saw near-term rate cut, not all convinced: minutes
Description: Many U.S. Federal Reserve officials at their last meeting thought more stimulus would be needed soon if risks to the U.S. economy did not let up, and several others leaned in that direction, records from the meeting showed.

Headlines: Workers at Chilean Walmart retailers strike over wages
Description: As many as 17,000 workers at Walmart´s largest union in Chile walked off the job early Wednesday morning, demanding better salaries after negotiations over a new labor contract broke down earlier this week, the union's president said.

Headlines: Major grain traders face one-two punch from U.S. floods, trade war
Description: Severe U.S. weather likely dented earnings for large grain companies including Archer Daniels Midland Co and Bunge Ltd for a second straight quarter, adding to headwinds from a still-unresolved U.S.-China trade war, analysts and economists said.

Headlines: American Airlines raises unit revenue forecast, shares rise
Description: American Airlines Group Inc on Wednesday raised its estimate for second-quarter unit revenue as the grounding of Boeing Co's MAX jets left the No. 1 U.S. carrier with fewer aircraft in service, allowing it to fly fuller planes.

Headlines: British billionaire Dyson snaps up Singapore's priciest penthouse
Description: British billionaire and inventor of the bagless vacuum cleaner James Dyson has bought the most expensive apartment in Singapore, where his company plans to build an electric car.

Headlines: Fed's Powell affirms rate cut view; others see U.S. economy humming
Description: As Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell kept the focus Thursday on global risks that could trigger a Fed rate cut in coming weeks, his colleagues from regional Fed districts painted a rosier picture of continued U.S. economic growth and a solid business outlook.

Headlines: Bostic: Fed's focus is its mandates not market pricing for rate cuts
Description: Strong market expectations of an upcoming Fed rate increase are not a reason for the central bank to make a policy move given a U.S. economy that continues to perform well, Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic said on Thursday.

Headlines: Air China to buy 20 A350-900 wide-body aircraft from Airbus
Description: Air China Ltd , China's flagship carrier, will buy 20 A350-900 jets from Airbus SE , both companies said, bolstering the European planemaker's order book for wide-body jets against Boeing Co amid Sino-U.S. trade tensions.

Headlines: European startups navigate long, winding road to self-driving future
Description: Far from the sunny, wide streets of Phoenix, where Waymo's self-driving taxis ply their trade, a handful of European startups are developing driverless cars to navigate the clogged, chaotic, rain-swept roads of European cities.

Headlines: Boeing reshuffles management of grounded 737: memo
Description: Boeing Co has reassigned the head of its next airplane project to run the troubled 737 program, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Thursday, as the grounding of its 737 MAX in the wake of two accidents commands the U.S. planemaker's full attention.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow climb as health insurers, financials gain
Description: The Dow and S&P 500 rose on Thursday to close at record highs as health insurers gained after the Trump administration scrapped a plan designed to rein in prescription drug prices, while financial shares climbed with bond yields.

Headlines: Apple's India-made top-end iPhones to hit stores next month: source
Description: Apple Inc's top-end iPhones, assembled in India by Foxconn's local unit, are likely to hit Indian stores next month, a source said, potentially helping the tech giant drop prices in the world's second-biggest smartphone market.

Headlines: U.S. underlying inflation stirring; labor market tightening
Description: U.S. underlying consumer prices increased by the most in nearly 1-1/2 years in June amid solid gains in a range of goods and services, but that did not change expectations the Federal Reserve would cut interest rates this month.

Headlines: FCA plans electric Fiat 500 for 2020 as moves on from Renault
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) plans to spend 700 million euros ($788 million) to take the Fiat 500 electric as the carmaker moves on from its failed $35 billion bid to merge with France's Renault , a pioneer in electric vehicles.

Headlines: Brazil cotton farmers sue Bayer over patent on GMO seed
Description: Brazilian cotton producers in the state of Mato Grosso on Thursday sued Bayer AG , seeking to cancel the chemical company's patent protection for its Bollgard II RR Flex genetically modified cotton seed, according to a statement sent to Reuters.

Headlines: Delta Air quarterly profit surges 39% on higher fares
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc reported a 39.3% rise in quarterly profit on Thursday, as the second-largest U.S. carrier benefited from higher fares and flying fuller planes.

Headlines: Vitol faces possible $6 million fine for U.S. power market manipulation
Description: Global energy trader Vitol faces a possible fine of $6 million from a U.S. energy regulator for alleged manipulation in California's power market, an order from the regulator showed.

Headlines: Powell testimony, Fed meeting highlight case for 'insurance'
Description: A confidence shock driven partly by the U.S. trade war is at the center of an increasingly persuasive argument for Federal Reserve policymakers seriously considering cutting rates for the first time in a decade.

Headlines: Colgate to buy skin care business of France's Filorga for $1.69 billion
Description: Colgate-Palmolive Co said on Thursday it would buy the skin care unit of France's Laboratoires Filorga Cosmétiques for 1.50 billion euros ($1.69 billion), as the consumer goods company bolsters its personal care business.

Headlines: Wall Street banks bailing on troubled U.S. farm sector
Description: In the wake of the U.S. housing meltdown of the late 2000s, JPMorgan Chase & Co hunted for new ways to expand its loan business beyond the troubled mortgage sector.

Headlines: U.S. Fed policy-makers debate merit of a repo facility
Description: Federal Reserve officials argued the pros and cons of a possible policy tool that allows banks to borrow from the U.S. central bank using Treasuries and other securities as collateral, minutes of the Fed's June policy meeting released on Wednesday showed.

Headlines: Tropical depression likely to form in Gulf of Mexico: U.S. NHC
Description: A storm system in the Gulf of Mexico could develop into a tropical depression later on Thursday, likely bringing hurricane conditions across the north-central gulf coast over the next couple of days, the U.S. National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.

Headlines: Reckitt to pay $1.4 billion to end U.S. opioid addiction treatment probes
Description: Reckitt Benckiser has agreed to pay up to $1.4 billion to resolve U.S. claims that its former pharmaceuticals business Indivior before it was spun out of the company carried out an illegal scheme to boost sales of an opioid addiction treatment.

Headlines: U.S. to hold hearing on French tax investigation Aug. 19
Description: The U.S. Trade Representative's (USTR) Office will hold a hearing on Aug 19 in its probe of France's new planned tax on big technology companies, calling the proposal "unreasonable."

Headlines: AB InBev pulls Budweiser listing, canceling year's largest IPO
Description: Anheuser-Busch InBev said on Friday it will not proceed with the planned listing in Hong Kong of its Asia Pacific unit, Budweiser Brewing Company APAC Ltd, in what would have been the world's biggest initial public offering (IPO) of 2019.

Headlines: J&J faces U.S. criminal probe related to baby powder - Bloomberg
Description: The U.S. Justice Department is pursuing a criminal probe into whether Johnson & Johnson lied about potential cancer risks of its talcum powder and has convened a grand jury in Washington, Bloomberg reported on Friday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Wall Street stocks climb, dollar drops on rate-cut optimism
Description: Wall Street stocks closed higher and the dollar fell on Friday as investors prepared for a U.S. interest-rate cut, while oil futures were little changed as a forecast for a global crude surplus offset worries about U.S. output declines due to a tropical storm.

Headlines: Exclusive: Pentagon races to track U.S. rare earths output amid China trade dispute
Description: The Pentagon is rapidly assessing the United States' rare earths capability in a race to secure stable supply of the specialized material amid the country's trade conflict with China, which controls the rare earths industry, according to a government document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin plans to expand Milwaukee plant workforce by 15%
Description: Defense contractor Lockheed Martin Corp said on Friday it plans to increase the workforce at its approximately 300-person Milwaukee facility by more than 15% this year.

Headlines: China's June exports, imports fall as trade war takes heavier toll
Description: China's exports fell in June as the United States ramped up trade pressure, while imports shrank more than expected, pointing to further weakness in the world's second-largest economy and slackening global growth.

Headlines: China June rare earth exports rise, snapping two months of declines
Description: China's rare earth exports rose by 9% in June from May, customs data showed on Friday, snapping two months of declines that had stoked worries over supply from the world's top producer of the materials amid the Sino-U.S. trade dispute.

Headlines: China June soybean imports fall on trade war, deadly pig disease
Description: China's soybean imports fell 11.5% in June from May, customs data showed on Friday, as the Sino-U.S. trade war and an outbreak of deadly African swine fever curb demand.

Headlines: China's June coal imports fall as local miners boost output
Description: China's June coal imports fell 1.4% from May to 27.1 million tonnes, official data showed on Friday, as local miners boosted output to ensure adequate supply ahead of summer.

Headlines: China June trade surplus with U.S. rises 11% to $29.92 billion
Description: China's trade surplus with the United States, a major source of friction with its biggest trading partner, rose 11% in June to $29.92 billion from $26.9 billion in May, customs data showed on Friday.

Headlines: China copper imports in June fall 27% from a year earlier
Description: China's unwrought copper imports in June fell 27.2% from a year earlier, official data showed on Friday, as a slowdown in the world's second-biggest economy continues to weigh on demand for the metal.

Headlines: Expectations are low for bank earnings but investors say 'buy'
Description: Low interest rates and weak trading volume have pushed down Wall Street's second-quarter estimates for the biggest U.S. banks, yet investors still say they want in on the sector.

Headlines: China considers limited support for petrol-electric hybrids in boon for Toyota, Honda
Description: China is considering re-classifying petrol-electric hybrid vehicles so they get more favorable treatment than all-petrol or diesel counterparts under clean car rules, making it easier for automakers to meet environment quotas and offer more choice.

Headlines: China's June crude oil imports climb as new refineries spur demand
Description: China's crude oil imports on a daily basis in June rose 15.2% from a year earlier, customs data showed on Friday, as the start up of new large-scale refiners spurred demand for feedstocks.

Headlines: Canada's struggling energy industry takes stock at annual Stampede party
Description: Frustration is palpable among Canadian energy executives who have flocked to the annual Calgary Stampede celebrations in Canada's oil capital this week, even though a recent pipeline approval gives them something to celebrate amid the rodeo competitions, corporate parties and pancake breakfasts.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices rise marginally, suggest tame inflation
Description: U.S. producer prices rose slightly for the second straight month in June as an acceleration in the cost of services was offset by cheaper energy goods, resulting in the smallest annual increase in producer inflation in nearly 2-1/2 years.

Headlines: Partial ECM exit to leave Deutsche Bank focused on Europe
Description: Deutsche Bank is focusing its equity capital markets (ECM) business such as initial public offerings (IPOs) on Germany and Europe, scaling back in the United States and retreating from most of Asia, banking sources said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Barneys New York explores options that include bankruptcy - sources
Description: U.S. luxury department store operator Barneys New York Inc is exploring options that include a bankruptcy filing, as it struggles with high rents and changing consumer tastes, people familiar with the matter said on Saturday.

Headlines: Trump administration freezing fuel efficiency penalties
Description: The Trump administration said late on Friday it was issuing final rules to suspend a 2016 Obama administration regulation that more than doubled penalties for automakers failing to meet fuel efficiency requirements.

Headlines: Huawei plans extensive layoffs at its U.S. operations: WSJ
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd is planning extensive layoffs in the United States as the Chinese telecoms equipment company grapples with its U.S. blacklisting, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: India says Deloitte misreading law in challenging government's call for ban
Description: India has told a tribunal the local auditing affiliate of international accounting group Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu is misreading a key federal law as the firm seeks to avoid a five-year ban on new business, according to legal documents reviewed by Reuters on Sunday.

Headlines: Citigroup profit beats estimates on gains in consumer lending
Description: Citigroup Inc topped expectations for quarterly profit on Monday as a tight lid on costs and strength in consumer lending helped the third-largest U.S. bank counter weakness in its trading business.

Headlines: Pearson goes 'digital first' in U.S. college market
Description: Pearson, the world's biggest education company, will release all its titles for the United States college market in digital form first, in a break from the traditional and more expensive textbook publishing model.

Headlines: PayPal launches international money transfer service Xoom across Europe
Description: U.S. payments company PayPal is expanding further in Europe by launching its international money transfers service Xoom in Britain and 31 other countries across the continent.

Headlines: Amazon rivals ride on Prime Day marketing as protests unfold
Description: Amazon.com Inc's Prime Day is now a major marketing opportunity and shopping event in the annual calendar for other U.S. retail companies, rivaling the Thanksgiving holiday's Black Friday as a driver of sales.

Headlines: Gilead invests $5 billion to deepen ties with biotech Galapagos
Description: U.S. antiviral drugmaker Gilead Sciences will invest $5.1 billion in a major expansion of its partnership with Belgo-Dutch biotech Galapagos NV , news that lifted Galapagos's shares more than 18% to an all-time high on Monday.

Headlines: China data steadies stocks as U.S. earnings get underway
Description: A gauge of global stocks rose modestly on Monday after economic data from China came in as expected, but equities on Wall Street slipped on weakness in financials in the wake of Citigroup's earnings report.

Headlines: China's first-half pork output falls amid disease outbreak
Description: China's pork output fell by less than expected in the first half as the country tackles a devastating disease outbreak, although official data showed conflicting figures on the size of the decline in the hog herd.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. firms may get nod to restart Huawei sales in two-four weeks - official
Description: The U.S. may approve licenses for companies to re-start new sales to Huawei in as little as two weeks, according to a senior U.S. official, in a sign President Donald Trump's recent effort to ease restrictions on the Chinese company could move forward quickly.

Headlines: Factbox: The Galapagos drugs pipeline that has drawn in Gilead
Description: U.S. antiviral drugmaker Gilead Sciences will invest $5.1 billion in a major expansion of its partnership with Belgo-Dutch biotech Galapagos NV .

Headlines: China June industrial output up 6.3% year-on-year, beats forecasts, retail sales up 9.8%
Description: China's industrial output grew 6.3% in June from a year earlier, official data showed on Monday, picking up from May's 17-year low and handily beating market expectations.

Headlines: China home price growth cools in June, but investment quickens
Description: Growth in China's new home prices cooled in June as sales shrank for a second month, but building starts and investment quickened, providing a cushion for the slowing economy while Beijing claims some wins in reducing market froth.

Headlines: Instant View: China second quarter GDP rises 6.2% year-on-year, slowest in at least 27 years
Description: China's second-quarter economic growth slowed to its weakest pace in at least 27 years, in line with expectations, as demand at home and abroad cooled in the face of a bruising trade war with the United States.

Headlines: China June crude oil throughput rises to record on new plants
Description: China's crude oil throughput rose to a record in June, up 7.7% from a year earlier, following the start-up of two new, large refineries, official data showed on Monday.

Headlines: China churns out record daily steel output in June - Reuters calculation
Description: China's daily crude steel output rose to record levels in June, according to Reuters calculations, even as anti-pollution production curbs pushed whole-month production slightly lower, official data showed on Monday.

Headlines: China says first-half growth sets good foundation for hitting 2019 GDP target
Description: China's first-half economic growth of 6.3% was "hard-won" and laid a good foundation for achieving a full-year growth target of between 6% and 6.5%, a spokesman for the country's statistics bureau said on Monday.

Headlines: Amazon workers in Germany strike over pay, Verdi union says
Description: More than 2,000 workers at seven Amazon sites across Germany have gone on strike over pay for at least two days, labor union Verdi said on Monday.

Headlines: China June aluminum output climbs to daily record - Reuters calculations
Description: China's daily aluminum output hit record levels in June, according to Reuters calculations, even as total production for the whole of the month fell slightly according to data released by the National Bureau of Statistics on Monday.

Headlines: Opioid 'kingpin' J&J fueled epidemic, Oklahoma argues at trial's end
Description: Lawyers for the state of Oklahoma on Monday compared Johnson & Johnson to a drug cartel leader as they sought to hold the drugmaker responsible for fueling the U.S. opioid epidemic in the first trial to result from lawsuits over the crisis.

Headlines: China June coal output hits record high as miners ramp up ahead of summer
Description: China's coal output rose in June from the previous month to a record high, official data showed on Monday, as miners ramped up production to ensure supply ahead of peak summer demand for electricity.

Headlines: UAW head wants union to share in profits of U.S. automakers
Description: The head of the labor union representing most hourly workers at the U.S. automakers struck an adversarial tone on Monday, vowing in likely contentious talks for new four-year deals that they want to share in the companies' profits.

Headlines: United Airlines extends suspension of Delhi, Mumbai flights to Oct. 26
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc said on Monday it was extending the suspension of its flights from the United States to Delhi and Mumbai in India until Oct. 26, citing continued restriction of Pakistani airspace.

Headlines: Goldman banker highlights Morgan Stanley's Hong Kong IPO woes
Description: A senior Goldman Sachs banker has highlighted to colleagues the role played by rival Morgan Stanley in failed Hong Kong IPOs following the collapse on Friday of Budweiser APAC's $9.8 billion initial public offering, according to an internal email seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Wall Street slips as bank earnings, Trump trade comments weigh
Description: U.S. stocks edged lower on Tuesday as quarterly results from banks added to concerns about lower interest rates dampening their profits, while comments from U.S. President Donald Trump on trade also dragged down Wall Street's major indexes.

Headlines: Amazon offers $10 to Prime Day shoppers who hand over their data
Description: Amazon.com Inc has a promotion for U.S. shoppers on Prime Day, the 48-hour marketing blitz that started Monday: Earn $10 of credit if you let Amazon track the websites you visit.

Headlines: As steep patent cliff looms, Shionogi moves to develop its own U.S. sales staff
Description: For much of its 141-year history, Japan's Shionogi & Co Ltd has played safe when selling its drugs in the United States and other overseas markets - relying on bigger partners to promote its products and avoiding the cost of maintaining a large sales force.

Headlines: Facebook should not be trusted with 'crazy' cryptocurrency plan: senators
Description: Democratic and Republican lawmakers said on Tuesday that Facebook Inc's track record of what they described as untrustworthiness should stand in the way of it launching a digital currency, labeling the plan "delusional" and "crazy" at a Senate hearing.

Headlines: U.S. SEC chief says he has not met with Facebook since Libra announcement
Description: A top U.S. financial market regulator said on Tuesday he has not discussed with Facebook its Libra currency proposal, nearly a month after the social media giant announced the project.

Headlines: Bitcoin tumbles as U.S. senators grill Facebook on crypto plans
Description: The cryptocurrency market took a beating on Tuesday with bitcoin losing over 10% in value after U.S. lawmakers grilled Facebook on its cryptocurrency plans, as political and regulatory scrutiny of digital coins intensifies.

Headlines: Visa invests in Indonesian ride-hailing firm Go-Jek
Description: Visa Inc said on Wednesday it has invested in Indonesia's Go-Jek as part of the ride-hailing company's ongoing Series F fundraising round.

Headlines: EU goods trade gaps with U.S. and China widen
Description: The European Union's trade surplus in goods with the United States and its deficit with China both increased in the first five months of 2019, figures that could add extra strain to global tensions.

Headlines: Demand for new designer's ranges lift Burberry sales and shares
Description: Strong demand for designer Riccardo Tisci's new fashion ranges helped revenue at British label Burberry grow faster than expected in the first quarter, sending its shares soaring as a high stakes overhaul showed early signs of promise.

Headlines: Australia watchdog says Vodafone misled customers over digital purchases
Description: Australia's competition watchdog said https://www.accc.gov.au/media-release/vodafone-to-compensate-customers-over-direct-carrier-billing-charges on Tuesday Vodafone had admitted that it misled thousands of customers for five years by charging them for digital content they bought unknowingly from the telecom company's third-party billing service.

Headlines: South Korean forced labor victims to seek Japan's Mitsubishi asset sale
Description: South Koreans forced to work for Japanese occupiers will seek a court order to forcibly liquidate Japan's Mitsubishi Heavy Industries' assets to compensate them, their lawyers said on Tuesday, risking more Japanese anger over the issue.

Headlines: Tesla drops cheapest Model X, S variants, cuts prices to simplify lineup
Description: Tesla Inc has dropped the standard-range variants of its Model X and Model S from its product lineup and adjusted prices across its range, in a sales push that comes days after the U.S. electric vehicle maker reported record deliveries.

Headlines: Amazon U.S. rivals get sales boost on Prime Day: Adobe
Description: Several large U.S. retailers recorded higher sales on the first day of Amazon.com Inc's Prime Day shopping event as online shoppers also flocked to their websites, Adobe Analytics said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales ease fears over economy; rate cut still seen
Description: U.S. retail sales increased more than expected in June, pointing to strong consumer spending, which could help to blunt some of the drag on the economy from weak business investment.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi continues chip strategy revamp with investment in semiconductor designer
Description: China's Xiaomi Corp has taken a stake of roughly 6% in compatriot chip designer VeriSilicon Holdings Co Ltd, as the smartphone maker revamps its years-long pursuit of success in semiconductors which it sees as central to driving innovation.

Headlines: Big banks beat profit expectations but warning signs grow
Description: Three big U.S. banks reported strong earnings on Tuesday even as warning signs emerged that the playing field is beginning to tilt against the financial industry.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing output climbs for second month in June
Description: U.S. manufacturing output accelerated in June, climbing for the second straight month, thanks in large part to increased production of motor vehicles and parts.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories rise moderately in May
Description: U.S. business inventories rose moderately in May as sales rebounded, suggesting that inventory accumulation could have been a drag on economic growth in the second quarter.

Headlines: Domino's shares slide as same-store sales disappoint
Description: Domino's Pizza Inc reported its slowest U.S. same-store sales growth in at least three years in the second quarter, driving shares lower and raising doubts about its strategy for fighting off competition from delivery apps.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers challenge Facebook over Libra cryptocurrency plan
Description: U.S. lawmakers bashed Facebook on Wednesday over its planned cryptocurrency, saying the company had not shown it could be trusted to safeguard the world financial system and consumers' data.

Headlines: Japanese official says negotiators working hard on U.S.-Japan trade deal
Description: U.S. and Japanese officials are working hard to reach agreement on a bilateral trade agreement, a senior Japanese official told Reuters on Wednesday, adding he was looking forward to news on the deal in the near future.

Headlines: Renault-Nissan alliance is priority for France ahead of any consolidation: Le Maire
Description: Renault's alliance with Japanese partner Nissan remains the priority for France ahead of any further consolidation such as a merger with Fiat-Chrysler , French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Wednesday.

Headlines: How lithium-rich Chile botched a plan to attract battery makers
Description: In March 2018, the Chilean government unveiled big news: Corporate investors, including South Korean electronics giant Samsung, would build three factories in Chile to produce battery parts for electric vehicles.

Headlines: Budweiser APAC's IPO failure hurt retail investors, say newspaper adverts urging reform
Description: The dramatic failure of brewer Budweiser APAC's $9.8 billion Hong Kong listing left "mom and pop" investors badly out of pocket, a local broker has said in an unusual series of full-page advertisements in newspapers across the city on Wednesday.

Headlines: As Fed nears rate cut, policymakers debate how deep, and even if
Description: With the first U.S. interest rate reduction in a decade expected later this month, two Federal Reserve policymakers sketched out arguments on Tuesday on how deep the cut should be, even as a third said she needs more data before being ready to sign on at all.

Headlines: Bank of America trims net interest income guidance
Description: Bank of America Corp lowered its annual net interest income guidance on Wednesday to reflect a weakened interest rate environment as the second-largest U.S. lender reported higher-than expected earnings fueled by strong consumer trends.

Headlines: Bills targeting China's Huawei introduced in Congress
Description: Members of the U.S. Senate and House of Representatives introduced bills on Tuesday to keep tight restrictions on Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, amid concern about President Donald Trump's easing of curbs on the Chinese firm.

Headlines: Bayer shares up 1.8% trade after U.S. Roundup rule
Description: Shares in German chemicals company Bayer rose 1.8% in early trade on Tuesday after a U.S. judge slashed a damages award Bayer owes a California man who blamed its Roundup weed killer for his cancer.

Headlines: Amazon says it will cooperate with EU antitrust regulator probe
Description: U.S. online retailer Amazon said on Wednesday that it would cooperate fully with EU antitrust regulators investigating its use of merchants' data.

Headlines: Microsoft, AT&T sign cloud deal worth more than $2 billion
Description: Microsoft Corp and AT&T Inc on Wednesday said they reached a deal under which the telecommunications company will tap Microsoft's Azure cloud service for its computing needs and use Microsoft 365, which includes Office productivity software, for much of its 268,000-strong workforce.

Headlines: Amazon appeases German watchdog, but EU opens new probe
Description: Amazon has reached a deal with Germany's anti-trust authority to overhaul its terms of service for third-party merchants, acting to appease regulators as the European Union announced its own investigation of the e-commerce giant.

Headlines: Takeda kicks off sale of Western European drugs: sources
Description: Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical Co has reached out to prospective bidders for a portfolio of drugs for sale in western Europe as it seeks to trim its debt following the $59 billion purchase of Shire, sources close to the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Oil prices fall more than 1% after U.S. fuel inventories build
Description: Oil futures fell more than 1% on Wednesday, extending a more than 3% drop in prices the previous session, after U.S. government data showed large builds in refined product stockpiles.

Headlines: Trade, earnings worry drag on stocks; U.S. Treasury yields fall
Description: A gauge of global equities retreated for a second straight session and U.S. Treasury yields fell as simmering trade concerns gained steam and the pace of the U.S. corporate earnings season picked up.

Headlines: Union Pacific cost cuts sheltered profit amid freight slowdown
Description: Union Pacific Corp on Thursday reported a quarterly profit that beat Wall Street estimates, as the U.S. railroad operator cut costs and raised rates to overcome disruptions from record floods in the Midwest and ongoing U.S.-China trade tensions.

Headlines: U.S. solar sector launches lobbying push to preserve key subsidy
Description: The U.S. solar industry on Wednesday kicked off a lobbying push aimed at convincing Congress to extend a generous tax credit for solar energy systems that is set to begin phasing out next year.

Headlines: Trump wants weaker dollar but it could be a hard sell
Description: President Donald Trump wants a cheaper dollar, saying earlier this month the United States should match what he says are efforts by other countries to weaken their own currencies - giving them an unfair trade advantage.

Headlines: Wall Street rises as Fed's Williams cements rate-cut expectations
Description: U.S. stocks moved higher on Thursday after a slow start as comments from New York Fed President John Williams helped cement expectations for an interest rate cut from the U.S. central bank at the end of the month.

Headlines: Trump's tariffs trip up the all-American RV industry
Description: Carrie Gray points to a stack of unwelcome mail on a conference table at the offices of Renegade RV, one of the leading U.S. manufacturers of high-end recreational vehicles. She’s buried in bad news from most of her about 350 suppliers.

Headlines: Netflix to roll out cheaper mobile-only plan for India
Description: Netflix Inc said on Wednesday it would roll out a lower-priced mobile-only plan in India within the next three months to tap into a price-sensitive market at a time the streaming company is losing customers in its home turf.

Headlines: Boeing to make $50 million in payments to 737 MAX crash victims' families
Description: Boeing Co said on Wednesday it will dedicate half of a $100 million fund it created after two crashes of its 737 MAX planes to provide payments to families of those killed, with veteran U.S. compensation expert Ken Feinberg hired by the world's largest plane maker to oversee the distribution.

Headlines: Truckmaker Volvo lifts market view, picks Samsung for batteries
Description: Sweden's AB Volvo raised its market forecasts for North America and Europe on Thursday, as higher trucks and construction equipment deliveries helped it to top profit estimates.

Headlines: Exclusive: Ping An-backed Lufax to ditch P2P lending on regulatory woes - sources
Description: Lufax, one of China's largest online wealth management platforms that is backed by financial giant Ping An Insurance , plans to exit its once-core peer-to-peer lending (P2P) business, three sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Samsung asks partners to stockpile Japanese components: source
Description: South Korea's Samsung Electronics has sent letters to local partners urging them to stockpile more Japanese components in case Tokyo expands its export restrictions, a source with knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Netflix shares plunge as global growth falls short, U.S. customers shrink
Description: Netflix Inc said on Wednesday it lost U.S. streaming customers for the first time in eight years and missed targets for new subscribers overseas, an announcement that jarred investors ahead of looming competition.

Headlines: Novartis raises full-year targets, aims to settle U.S. lawsuit
Description: Novartis boss Vas Narasimhan raised full-year targets on Thursday and announced that $700 million has been set aside in the hope of settling a decade-old lawsuit alleging that the Swiss drugmaker bribed U.S. doctors.

Headlines: Novartis CEO sets aside $700 million to settle doctor bribery lawsuit
Description: Novartis Chief Executive Vas Narasimhan set aside $700 million to settle a U.S. doctor bribery lawsuit, as the Swiss drugmaker seeks to close the chapter on allegedly aggressive business practices that exposed it to litigation risks.

Headlines: Trump to meet airline executives to discuss 'competition and transparency'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will meet with top executives from a handful of airlines on Thursday to discuss "competition and transparency," a White House official said.

Headlines: Southwest schedules without Boeing 737 MAX until Nov. 2, freezes pilot hiring
Description: Southwest Airlines Co joined U.S. rivals on Thursday in cancelling more flights until early November due to the continued grounding of Boeing Co's 737 MAX, which has also prompted the low-cost carrier to freeze new pilot hiring.

Headlines: Transport app FlixMobility gets Germany's biggest tech funding round to drive growth
Description: Transport app FlixMobility has raised around 500 million euros ($561 million) in Germany's biggest tech funding round to date to back investments in its expansion, sources familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley reports drop in profit, but wealth management gains
Description: Morgan Stanley reported a drop in quarterly profit Thursday, hit by lower market activity amid global trade tensions and expectations for U.S. interest rate cuts.

Headlines: ASOS warns on profit again after botching warehouse revamps
Description: British online fashion retailer ASOS warned on profits for the third time since December, saying problems ramping up warehouses in the United States and Germany had restricted product availability, hitting sales and raising costs.

Headlines: UnitedHealth boosts earnings forecast, set to pass price discounts to patients
Description: UnitedHealth Group Inc will stick with its decision to pass on drug maker discounts to patients to help them beat rising medicine prices despite the U.S. government having withdrawn a similar proposed policy in its health programs, its top executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Ford to lay off around 200 workers at Canadian plant
Description: Ford Motor Co will lay off about approximately 200 employees in September at a Canadian manufacturing plant in Oakville, Ontario, with the possibility of more layoffs in January, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Netflix sinks on subscriber losses, analysts still see growth
Description: Wall Street brokerages stuck to a positive outlook on Netflix Inc on Thursday, betting that a strong content slate for the rest of 2019 would reverse shock second-quarter losses in U.S. subscribers that sank its stock price.

Headlines: Equifax nears deal to pay about $700 million to settle U.S. data breach probes: WSJ
Description: Credit reporting company Equifax Inc is close to a deal to pay around $700 million to settle data breach probes with U.S. regulators and states, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Four Republican lawmakers ask Trump to move forward with $10 billion Pentagon cloud contract
Description: Four Republican members of U.S. Congress, including House Armed Services Committee ranking member Mac Thornberry, sent a letter to President Donald Trump on Thursday urging him to move forward with a $10 billion cloud contract with the Defense Department.

Headlines: Oil climbs as Middle East tensions offset demand worries
Description: Oil prices rose about 1 percent on Friday after steep losses a day earlier, supported by rising tensions between the United States and Iran, even as concerns that slowing economic growth could dent global oil demand cast a cloud.

Headlines: U.S.-China officials discuss trade; Mnuchin eyes possible in-person talks
Description: U.S. and Chinese officials spoke by telephone on Thursday as the world's two largest economies seek to end a year-long trade war, with U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin suggesting in-person talks could follow.

Headlines: AB InBev sells Australian brewer to Asahi, keeps Asia IPO on radar
Description: Anheuser-Busch InBev , the world's largest brewer, is selling its Australian operations to Japan's Asahi for $11 billion and could revive the stalled flotation of its Asian business as it looks to cut debt.

Headlines: GM's mid-engine Corvettes roar onstage to take on Europeans
Description: General Motors Co unveiled on Thursday its newly designed mid-engine 2020 Corvette in a splashy tribute to its emblematic sports car, even as the No. 1 U.S. automaker faces mounting pressures in a sluggish and uncertain global sales environment.

Headlines: Exclusive: J.C. Penney taps debt restructuring advisers - sources
Description: J.C. Penney Co Inc has hired advisers to explore debt restructuring options that would buy more time for the money-losing U.S. retailer to forge a turnaround, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Cummins makes offer for VW's large engines unit: sources
Description: United States-based diesel engines maker Cummins has made an indicative offer for Volkswagen's MAN Energy Solutions unit, people close to the matter said, as the carmaker seeks to slim down its portfolio of disparate assets.

Headlines: Carlos Ghosn sues Nissan-Mitsubishi in the Netherlands: paper
Description: Carlos Ghosn has launched a court case in the Netherlands against Japanese carmakers Nissan Motor and Mitsubishi Motors , who ousted him as chairman of their alliance last year on charges of embezzlement, Dutch newspaper NRC reported on Saturday.

Headlines: AutoNation names new CEO, posts strong quarterly profit
Description: AutoNation Inc , the largest U.S. auto dealership chain, on Monday named a new chief executive four months after picking someone else for the position, while posting a stronger-than-expected quarterly profit.

Headlines: Trump meets with tech CEOs on Huawei
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump met on Monday with the chief executives of seven technology companies and he agreed with their request for timely licensing decisions from the Commerce Department on blacklisted Chinese firm Huawei Technologies, the White House said.

Headlines: Trump agrees to prompt responses to license requests for Huawei sales
Description: President Donald Trump agreed at a meeting with the heads of top technology companies like Google on Monday to make "timely" decisions on requests by U.S. companies to sell to blacklisted Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, the White House said.

Headlines: LG Display to invest $2.6 billion in OLED panel plant in South Korea
Description: LG Display said on Tuesday that it would invest 3 trillion won ($2.6 billion) in its organic light-emitting diode (OLED) panels production line in South Korea.

Headlines: Tech leads U.S. stocks higher; oil gains
Description: U.S. stocks gained ground on Monday at the onset of a heavy earnings week, while European shares inched higher as investors took heart from potential progress in U.S.-China trade talks and increasing geopolitical tensions sent oil prices climbing.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor lays out U.S. recovery plan, places hope on new SUV models
Description: South Korea's Hyundai Motor Co laid out its U.S. sales turnaround plan on Monday with an expanded line-up of sport-utility vehicles (SUV), after posting its biggest quarterly profit jump in seven years.

Headlines: Starbucks' China rival Luckin Coffee plans first foray overseas
Description: Starbucks' Chinese challenger, Luckin Coffee , plans to open coffee shops in the Middle East and India, in its first move overseas.

Headlines: Toshiba Memory sees 'good chance' of M&A in push for data center business
Description: Japan's Toshiba Memory said there was a "good chance" of acquisitions as it pushes to increase its share of the market for advanced storage products used in data centers.

Headlines: Microsoft to invest $1 billion in OpenAI
Description: Microsoft Corp said on Monday it was investing $1 billion in San Francisco-based OpenAI and that the two had formed a multi-year partnership to develop artificial intelligence supercomputing technologies on Microsoft's Azure cloud computing service.

Headlines: Facebook, Amazon and Alphabet take center stage on Wall Street
Description: The so-called FANG stocks take center stage on Wall Street this week, with Amazon , Alphabet and Facebook set to report as the S&P 500 approaches a record high.

Headlines: Huawei executive says 'concerned' about Canadians held in China
Description: The Canadian unit of China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd sought to distance itself from the actions of the Chinese government on Monday, with a top local executive saying the company is worried about two Canadian men being held by Beijing.

Headlines: Shipping companies sue Philadelphia Energy Solutions for $600,000 in unpaid bills
Description: Three Greek shipping companies sued U.S. refiner Philadelphia Energy Solutions Inc (PES) for about $600,000, claiming the company did not pay them for fees incurred by crude oil tankers chartered earlier this year, court documents showed.

Headlines: S&P 500 climbs toward record high, earnings in focus
Description: The S&P 500 climbed toward a record high on Monday, supported by expectations of lower interest rates, while investors awaited quarterly earnings from marquee companies Facebook, Alphabet and Amazon later this week.

Headlines: Trump: 'We will have to find out' about Huawei's relationship with North Korea
Description: Asked about a media report that said Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] had secretly built and maintained North Korea's commercial wireless network, U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday, "We will have to find out."

Headlines: Lloyds and Standard Life Aberdeen to settle 100 billion sterling funds row: Sky News
Description: Lloyds Banking‎ Group PLC will pay about 140 million pounds ($174.72 million) to Standard Life Aberdeen PLC (SLA) to settle a legal fight over the future of a 100 billion pound asset management mandate, Sky news reported on Monday.

Headlines: Oil prices strengthen more than 1% on Iran risk
Description: Oil prices rose more than 1% on Monday, as investors worried about possible supply disruptions in the energy-rich Middle East after Iran's seizure of a British tanker last week.

Headlines: China's credit push to small firms falters in factory heartland
Description: China's campaign to boost loans to small firms was supposed to support the economy during its biggest slowdown in decades, but banks' reluctance to lend has left exporters and manufacturers in its southern industrial belt struggling to pay the bills.

Headlines: China's credit push to small firms falters in factory heartland
Description: China's campaign to boost loans to small firms was supposed to support the economy during its biggest slowdown in decades, but banks' reluctance to lend has left exporters and manufacturers in its southern industrial belt struggling to pay the bills.

Headlines: Big Tech faces broad U.S. Justice Department antitrust probe
Description: The U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday it was opening a broad investigation of major digital technology firms into whether they engage in anticompetitive practices, the strongest sign the Trump administration is stepping up its scrutiny of Big Tech.

Headlines: Chipotle's online shift fuels highest sales growth in two years
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc's aggressive push into online orders, amped up ads around fresh ingredients and the addition of healthier meals helped the burrito chain post its highest sales growth at established restaurants in over two years.

Headlines: China's BAIC buys 5% Daimler stake to cement alliance
Description: China's Beijing Automotive Group Co Ltd (BAIC) has bought a 5% stake in Daimler , cementing their long-standing alliance after China's Geely emerged as a potential rival by also taking a stake in the German automaker.

Headlines: U.S. tech cos asking White House to speed up Huawei exemptions process: Kudlow
Description: U.S. telecommunications companies are pushing the Trump administration to move quickly on applications seeking exemptions to Huawei's blacklisting, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said in a Fox News interview on Tuesday.

Headlines: Power traders tackle renewables puzzle in Danish 'Silicon Valley'
Description: Far from the sprawling financial hubs of London or Frankfurt, high-tech traders in the Danish university city of Aarhus are driving rapid change in European power markets, easing the shift to renewables with technology that also carries some risks.

Headlines: EU has 35 billion-euro list if U.S. hits its cars, trade chief says
Description: The European Union will retaliate with extra duties on 35 billion euros ($39.1 billion) worth of U.S. goods if Washington imposes punitive tariffs on EU cars, the bloc's trade chief said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Huawei first-half revenue up about 30% despite U.S. ban: Bloomberg
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's revenue grew roughly 30% in the first half after select teams secured critical supplies to keep production going despite U.S. technology export restrictions, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Top investors lose $1 billion as China's Nasdaq-style board reverses on day two
Description: The biggest shareholders in China's new Nasdaq-style STAR Market lost a combined $1 billion in the second day of trade on Tuesday, a day after the board's roaring debut created three new billionaires.

Headlines: Alibaba welcomes U.S. small businesses to sell globally on its platform
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holdings Ltd will allow small U.S. businesses to sell on Alibaba.com, the company said on Tuesday, as it seeks to tap into the business-to-business e-commerce market and fend off rivals like Amazon.com Inc .

Headlines: Earnings and trade optimism push Wall St. toward record high
Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq approached record highs on Tuesday, lifted by upbeat quarterly reports from Coca-Cola and United Technologies and on optimism the United States would resolve its trade conflict with China.

Headlines: Equifax consumers face uphill battle for claims
Description: Consumers affected by the massive Equifax Inc data breach in 2017 will not reap any windfalls from the credit reporting company's $700 million U.S. settlement announced on Monday, but may face a cumbersome process to get compensation.

Headlines: Colombia orders Uber to improve data security after 2016 breach
Description: Colombia has given ride-hailing app Uber Technologies Inc four months to improve its data security, the commerce regulator said on Tuesday, after a 2016 data breach affected more than 260,000 of the South American country's residents.

Headlines: U.S. home sales tumble as prices surge to record high
Description: U.S home sales fell more than expected in June as a persistent shortage of properties pushed prices to a record high, indicating the housing market was struggling to regain speed since hitting a soft patch last year.

Headlines: TechnipFMC resolves U.S. and Brazil probes, hopes to settle French case
Description: Oil services company TechnipFMC said it would pay $301.3 million to resolve anti-corruption probes with Brazilian and U.S. authorities, and added it was committed to resolving another probe on its affairs with French authorities.

Headlines: To survive trade war, some U.S. importers embark on major revamps of product lines
Description: When U.S President Donald Trump tweeted in May his intention to raise tariffs on Chinese goods, management at California-based NewAir Appliances knew they needed to do something or their business would be in trouble.

Headlines: Oil falls 1% despite large U.S. stockpile decline
Description: Oil prices fell 1% on Wednesday, failing to draw lasting support from a large decrease in U.S. crude stockpiles as investors worried about global oil demand.

Headlines: Nissan warns of profit plunge, set to unveil 10,000 job cuts
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd warned on Wednesday that first-quarter profit tumbled around 90% percent, a day before it is expected to announce more than 10,000 job cuts as the crisis deepens at Japan's second-largest automaker.

Headlines: Nasdaq beats quarterly profit on strength in non-trading units
Description: U.S. exchange operator Nasdaq Inc beat analysts' estimates for second-quarter profit on Wednesday, as a boost in its non-trading businesses, including information services, overshadowed a softer trading environment.

Headlines: Exclusive: Bearing brunt of trade war, Singapore chipmakers cut jobs
Description: Caught between a Sino-U.S. trade war, political concerns over Chinese telecoms firm Huawei and slowing consumer demand, chipmakers in Singapore have started slowing production and laying off hundreds of jobs, firms told Reuters.

Headlines: Deutsche Telekom sets meeting as T-Mobile, Sprint deal nears approval: report
Description: Deutsche Telekom has called a leadership meeting on Wednesday in expectation of U.S. regulatory approval of the proposed merger of its U.S. T-Mobile unit with rival Sprint , according to business daily Handelsblatt.

Headlines: Huawei's U.S. research arm slashes jobs as trade ban bites
Description: China's Huawei Technologies laid off more than two-thirds of the 850-strong workforce at its Futurewei Technologies research arm in the United States, after being blacklisted by the government.

Headlines: Trump has no position on Boeing's 737 Max, but says it must be fixed to fly: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has no position on Boeing Co's grounded 737 Max aircraft except that the plane's flaws must be fixed if the company wants to win U.S. approval to fly it again, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ryanair Portuguese cabin crew to strike in August: union
Description: Ryanair cabin crew in Portugal are set to strike for five days in August in a dispute over pay and conditions, the SNPVAC union said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Hilton cuts forecast for key revenue measure amid slowing economic growth
Description: Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc cut its full-year outlook for a key revenue measure on Wednesday, citing a slowing global economy which was weighing on spending plans of businesses, sending the U.S. hotel operator's shares down as much as 2.8%.

Headlines: Anthem shares sink as cost concerns overshadow earnings beat
Description: Anthem Inc shares fell as much as 4% on Wednesday after the U.S. health insurer missed Wall Street expectations for a key medical cost gauge as a result of higher costs of selling Medicaid health plans for low-income customers.

Headlines: BMW doubles battery production capacity in the United States
Description: BMW Group said on Wednesday it would double its production capacity for electric vehicle batteries at its U.S. plant in South Carolina as it ramps up manufacturing of plug-in hybrid vehicles to include the X3 vehicle in addition to the X5.

Headlines: Caterpillar earnings disappoint on weak China sales, higher costs
Description: Caterpillar Inc's earnings on Wednesday missed Wall Street's estimates, hurt by a combination of weak sales in China and higher production and restructuring costs, sending its shares lower.

Headlines: U.S. attorney general, state officials discuss big tech firms' effect on competition
Description: Eight state attorneys general met with U.S. Attorney General William Barr on Thursday to discuss the effect of big tech companies on competition, and various antitrust actions are being reviewed, the Texas attorney general's office said in a statement.

Headlines: Starbucks traffic surges, posts best sales growth in three years
Description: Starbucks Corp attracted more customers in the latest quarter on an expanded line up of beverages and food offerings in the United States and China, leading the coffee chain to raise its fiscal 2019 profit forecast.

Headlines: California, four automakers defy Trump, agree to tighten emissions rules
Description: Four major automakers said on Thursday they have reached an agreement with California on fuel efficiency rules, bypassing a Trump administration effort to strip the state of the right to fight climate change by setting its own standards.

Headlines: Unilever second-quarter sales slip as wet weather hits Europe
Description: Consumer goods giant Unilever Plc reported slightly weaker-than-expected quarterly underlying sales growth on Thursday, hit by wet weather in Europe and moderating growth in India, but kept its full-year sales target intact.

Headlines: Salesforce expands footprint into China with Alibaba partnership
Description: Salesforce.com Inc said on Wednesday it will partner with Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba Group Holdings Ltd , as the U.S. cloud-based service provider looks to make inroads into the Chinese software market with its products.

Headlines: Raytheon profit beats, raises full-year outlook
Description: U.S. weapons maker Raytheon Co on Thursday reported a better-than-expected second-quarter profit and raised its full-year profit and sales outlook, helped by higher sales of missiles and guns for naval ships, sending its stock up 3% premarket.

Headlines: J.P. Morgan pares U.S. second quarter GDP view to 1.0%
Description: J.P. Morgan on Thursday trimmed its prior estimate on U.S. economic growth in the second quarter to 1.00% even in the wake of a larger-than-forecast increase in domestic durable goods orders and a shrinkage in trade goods deficit in June.

Headlines: Exclusive: Kenya Airways goes full circle with two-year nationalization plan
Description: Kenya will take at least 21 months to take back full control of its national carrier Kenya Airways , buying out minority shareholders and converting shares held by banks into Treasury bonds, a lawmaker briefed on the transaction said.

Headlines: Autogrill enters exclusive deal with Panera Bread for U.S. market
