Description: Italian caterer Autogrill said on Thursday it had signed an exclusive multi-year agreement with bakery chain Panera Bread to develop outlets in U.S. airports and motorways.

Headlines: Nissan to cut 12,500 jobs as crisis deepens after profit wipe out
Description: Nissan Motor Co unveiled its biggest restructuring plan in a decade, axing nearly a tenth of its workforce and flagging possible plant closures to rein in costs that ballooned when Carlos Ghosn was CEO.

Headlines: Atlanta Fed model lowers U.S. second quarter GDP estimate to 1.3%
Description: The U.S. economy grew at a 1.3% annualized rate in the second quarter based on June data on domestic durable goods orders and advance goods trade, the Atlanta Federal Reserve's GDPNow forecast model showed on Thursday.

Headlines: China auto group cuts 2019 sales forecast to a 5% drop
Description: China's biggest auto industry association has cut its sales forecast for this year due to slowing economic growth, and now expects sales to fall for the second year running.

Headlines: T-Mobile beats estimates for phone subscribers
Description: T-Mobile US Inc on Thursday beat analysts' estimates for second-quarter net new phone subscribers who pay a monthly bill, boosted by the U.S. mobile carrier's competitive wireless plans aimed at fending off its bigger rivals.

Headlines: Equities fall, bond yields rise on Draghi remarks, mixed earnings
Description: U.S. stocks backed off record highs and government bond yields ticked up on Thursday following mixed earnings reports and rosier-than-expected economic sentiment from the European Central Bank.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX groundings plague U.S. airlines, 'frustrated' Southwest exits Newark
Description: Boeing Co's top two U.S. customers warned on Thursday of an increasing financial toll from the prolonged grounding of the 737 MAX jet, which prompted a "frustated" Southwest Airlines Co to announce it was ending operations at Newark Liberty International airport.

Headlines: Trump's ambitious Fannie, Freddie overhaul faces hurdles
Description: President Donald Trump's administration faces a growing list of hurdles that could scuttle its ambitions to remove U.S. mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac from their government lifeline.

Headlines: Factbox: Fannie, Freddie and the government: it's complicated
Description: The Trump administration wants to take Fannie and Freddie out of government conservatorship, but doing so will be complicated due to the central role they play in the housing market and the Treasury's holdings in the two firms. [L2N24J0YC]

Headlines: Sprint, T-Mobile win U.S. antitrust approval for $26 billion merger
Description: T-Mobile US Inc won U.S. antitrust approval for its $26 billion takeover of rival Sprint Corp, the Justice Department said Friday, clearing a major hurdle to a deal that merges the nation's third and fourth largest wireless carriers.

Headlines: Trump says he expects Apple to announce it will build plant in Texas
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he wanted Apple Inc to build its plants in the United States and expects the technology firm to announce it will build one in Texas.

Headlines: U.S. economy slows in second quarter; weak business investment a red flag
Description: U.S. economic growth slowed less than expected in the second quarter as a surge in consumer spending blunted some of the drag from declining exports and a smaller inventory build, which could further allay concerns about the economy's health.

Headlines: N.Y. Fed model raises U.S. third quarter GDP view above 2%
Description: U.S. economy is growing faster in the third quarter than previously thought based on this week's June data on durable goods orders and new home sales, the New York Federal Reserve's Nowcast model showed on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. economy misses Trump's 3% target in 2018
Description: U.S. economic growth in 2018 missed the Trump administration's 3% target by any measure, which could renew criticism of the White House's $1.5 trillion in tax cuts.

Headlines: Dish Network has tough road to become competitive mobile carrier
Description: Dish Network's bid to become a fourth U.S. mobile carrier may cost billions more than it expected and pits it against corporate giants, but the satellite TV provider has an advantage in starting fresh with no legacy technology to maintain and deep-pocketed potential partners.

Headlines: Italy picks Deloitte to set up 500 million-euro real estate fund
Description: Italy has picked the consulting firm Deloitte as its financial adviser in setting up a 500 million-euro real estate fund in an effort to squeeze money out of the property it owns, an official told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Trump says second-quarter economic growth was 'not bad'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump wrote in a tweet on Friday that second-quarter economic growth, which slowed by less than expected, was "Not bad considering we have the very heavy weight of the Federal Reserve anchor wrapped around our neck."

Headlines: Alphabet shares jump 9% on ad rebound, cloud promise
Description: Shares of Alphabet Inc rose nearly 9% in premarket trading on Friday, after the company handily beat Wall Street targets on higher ad sales and touted growth at its cloud unit, a high-margin business it is leaning more on to drive growth.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. second quarter GDP growth slows to 2.1% but tops estimates
Description: U.S. economic growth slowed less than expected in the second quarter as a surge in consumer spending blunted some of the drag from declining exports and a smaller inventory build, which could further allay concerns about the economy's health.

Headlines: Alphabet's revenue rebounds; easing doubts on growth and boosting shares
Description: Alphabet Inc shares rose about 8% after the company reported quarterly results that eased investors' concerns about growth challenges facing its Google advertising business.

Headlines: Huawei rolls out 5G phone and flags first Hongmeng device
Description: Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] on Friday released its first 5G phone in China and said it would soon launch smart TVs equipped with its own Hongmeng operating system.

Headlines: Canada's new cannabis licensing favors richer companies, experts say
Description: A new licensing process for legal cannabis producers in Canada limits the ability of smaller companies to attract investment, which could leave the fledgling industry dominated by companies with deep pockets or those who got a foot in the door prior to regulation changes in May, industry executives said.

Headlines: Alphabet says to continue talks with DoJ in antitrust review
Description: Alphabet Inc on Thursday acknowledged a broader U.S. Department of Justice antitrust review of large technology firms and said it will continue to engage with the regulator.

Headlines: Oil gains on U.S. economic data, Gulf crude tanker dispute
Description: Oil prices inched up on Friday, ending the week higher after stronger-than-expected U.S. economic data brightened the crude demand outlook and concerns over the safety of oil transport around the Strait of Hormuz threatened supply.

Headlines: McDonald's beats sales forecast on new deals, store revamp
Description: McDonald's Corp beat quarterly sales expectations at established U.S. restaurants on Friday, as the world's largest burger chain attracted more diners with upgraded stores and new promotions, such as the 2 for $5 Mix and Match deal.

Headlines: LSE-Refinitiv deal faces long antitrust review: sources
Description: U.S. buyout fund Blackstone Group Inc is expected to announce the merger of its majority-owned financial data firm Refinitiv with the London Stock Exchange Group Plc within a week, but the deal is expected to face a long antitrust review before it can close, four sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Trade jitters running high at U.S. companies ahead of new U.S.-China talks
Description: Worries about the U.S.-China trade war are running high during the current U.S. quarterly reporting season, with companies as diverse as Juniper Networks and O'Reilly Automotive bemoaning the consequences but saying they are finding ways to weather the storm.

Headlines: Sterling slumps on 'no-deal Brexit' worries; stocks dip
Description: The British pound touched its lowest level in over two years against the dollar after Prime Minister Boris Johnson said a hard divorce from the EU was in the cards, while stocks dipped globally with Wall Street backing off record highs.

Headlines: Activist investor Cat Rock calls Just Eat, Takeaway.com deal 'excellent news'
Description: Investment firm Cat Rock on Monday lauded Amsterdam-based Takeaway.com's deal to buy Just Eat in an 8.2 billion pound ($10.05 billion) deal to create one of the world's largest online food delivery firms.

Headlines: Exclusive: First big U.S. offshore wind project hits snag due to fishing-industry concerns
Description: Trump administration infighting is holding up approval of the first major U.S. offshore wind energy project, with agencies sparring over whether the proposal does enough to protect the fishing industry, according to interviews and agency documents.

Headlines: That bad? How the U.S. economy stacks up to past rate cut cycles
Description: Spooked by a global economic slowdown, the U.S. Federal Reserve is seen launching on Wednesday its fifth interest rate-cutting campaign since 1995. It will come despite many signs of strength in the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Amazon plans imminent launch of online food delivery service in India: sources
Description: Amazon.com Inc is planning a foray into the burgeoning online food delivery business in India this year, two sources aware of the development said, in a move that could raise competition in an increasingly crowded market.

Headlines: Exclusive: BlackRock in talks to take over Cofense after U.S. security concerns - sources
Description: BlackRock Inc , an investor in Cofense Inc, is in advanced talks to take over the U.S. cyber security firm, after a U.S. national security panel asked buyout firm Pamplona Capital Management LLP to sell its stake, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Top EU court rejects BMW appeal against limit on car plant aid
Description: The European Union's top court on Monday rejected an appeal by German carmaker BMW against a European Commission decision to limit the state aid it could receive for a car plant in eastern Germany.

Headlines: Wall St. takes a pause in wait for Fed news, trade progress
Description: U.S. stocks stepped back from peak levels on Monday as investors took a breather as they anticipated a U.S. Federal Reserve interest rate cut this week and looked for signs of progress from U.S.-China trade negotiations, currently under way in Shanghai.

Headlines: A Fed interest rate cut is in the bag. What then?
Description: U.S. central bankers are expected to lower borrowing costs this week for the first time since the depths of the financial crisis more than a decade ago. That's the easy part.

Headlines: Capital One is sued over data breach in proposed class action
Description: Capital One Financial Corp was sued on Tuesday after the bank said a hacker who has since been arrested accessed personal information belonging to about 106 million people in the United States and Canada.

Headlines: Apple wants to make high-end computers in U.S., needs tariff relief - Cook
Description: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook on Tuesday said that the desire to keep Mac Pro computer production in United States was behind the company's recent request for tariff exclusions.

Headlines: China's service sector activity grows at slower pace in July: official PMI
Description: China's services sector activity grew at a slower pace in July, an official survey showed on Wednesday, heaping pressure on Beijing which is counting on the sector to help weather a sharp hit to its manufacturers and the economy from the Sino-U.S. trade war.

Headlines: Amazon, Walmart, Ikea targeted in University of California light bulb lawsuits
Description: Five major retailers, including Amazon.com Inc and Walmart Inc, were sued on Tuesday by the University of California over what it called the "existential threat" when foreign manufacturers infringe schools' patents.

Headlines: China probes small bank shareholdings as risk worries persist
Description: China is sharpening its scrutiny of small banks' shareholders amid fears that loans from the lenders to big investors could prove a weak point in the country's financial system, jolted by the state's weekend rescue of one lender and recent takeover of another.

Headlines: China, U.S. officials meet for trade talks in Shanghai
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin shook hands with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He before beginning trade talks in Shanghai on Wednesday in a bid to end a year-long trade war.

Headlines: Ivory Coast, Ghana pricing agreement causing a 'spike in cocoa cost' - Mondelez
Description: A new cocoa pricing mechanism announced by top growers Ivory Coast and Ghana earlier this month is causing cocoa costs to rise, a Mondelez International Inc executive said on an earnings call with analysts on Tuesday.

Headlines: Enterprise Products in deal with Chevron to develop crude oil port
Description: Pipeline operator Enterprise Products Partners LP signed long-term agreements with Chevron Corp that advance its proposed offshore crude project in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico, the companies said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Brazil Embraer's deliveries of commercial jets continue to fall in second quarter
Description: Brazil planemaker Embraer delivered 26 commercial planes in the second quarter of 2019, down from 28 planes in the same period of 2018 and 35 in 2017, the company said in a securities filing on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S., China move trade talks to Shanghai amid deal pessimism
Description: U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators shift to Shanghai this week for their first in-person talks since a G20 truce last month, a change of scenery for two sides struggling to resolve deep differences on how to end a year-long trade war.

Headlines: Brazil oil block auction looks very expensive: BP CEO
Description: Brazil's closely-watched auction of offshore oil blocks looks "very expensive" and BP has yet to decide if it will take part in it, Chief Executive Officer Bob Dudley said on Tuesday.

Headlines: BP has no plans to take its tankers through Hormuz
Description: BP has not taken any of its oil tankers through the Strait of Hormuz since a July 10 attempt by Iran to seize one of its vessels, the British company's Chief Financial Officer Brian Gilvary said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. firms see little clarity on Huawei as U.S.-China talks resume
Description: A month after President Donald Trump said he would allow U.S. companies to resume selling to blacklisted Chinese telecommunications giant Huawei, his administration has done little to clarify what sales will be permitted.

Headlines: Huawei outsells smartphone rivals in China, tightens market grip amid U.S. spat
Description: China's Huawei Technologies cemented its dominance of the domestic smartphone market in the second quarter, with shipments and market share rising, as Chinese customers backed the embattled firm amid its trade fight with the United States.

Headlines: As trade war bites, China's factories set for third month of shrinking activity: Reuters poll
Description: Factory activity in China is expected to have contracted for the third month in a row in July, a Reuters poll showed, underlining the intensifying strains on the world's second-biggest economy from a protracted trade war with the United States.

Headlines: Bayer sees glyphosate settlement only if financially reasonable
Description: Bayer on Tuesday said it would consider settling with U.S. plaintiffs suing over the German group's Roundup herbicide only on reasonable terms, and if such a move wraps up all cases.

Headlines: Huawei warns on U.S. ban after China smartphone sales drive first-half revenue
Description: Chinese tech giant Huawei Technologies warned on Tuesday a U.S. trade blacklisting will impact short-term revenue growth, even as its half-year revenue surged 23% thanks to soaring smartphone sales at home.

Headlines: Sony surprises with record profit as image sensor demand offsets weak gaming
Description: Japan's Sony Corp surprised the market by reporting on Tuesday a record first-quarter operating profit despite the slowing gaming business, as strong demand for multiple-lens camera systems for smartphones boosted sales of image sensors.

Headlines: Moderate U.S. consumer spending, inflation back Fed rate cut
Description: U.S. consumer spending and prices rose moderately in June, pointing to slower economic growth and benign inflation that could see the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates on Wednesday for the first time in a decade.

Headlines: Under fire, Swiss minister dumps Philip Morris as Expo sponsor
Description: Switzerland scrapped a 1.8 million Swiss franc ($1.8 million) sponsorship deal with Philip Morris International for the country's pavilion at Expo 2020 in Dubai after being widely criticized for taking tobacco money to promote its image abroad.

Headlines: D.R. Horton expects lower incentive spending to boost margins
Description: No.1 U.S. homebuilder D.R. Horton Inc on Tuesday said it expects lower incentive spending and strong buyer demand to benefit margins, sending its shares up about 6%.

Headlines: Newer drugs help Eli Lilly top Wall Street quarterly profit estimate
Description: Eli Lilly and Co reported a second-quarter profit that topped Wall Street estimates and raised its 2019 earnings forecast on Tuesday, as higher demand for newer drugs offset increased discounts for the U.S. Medicare program and sales declines of medicines that lost patent protection.

Headlines: Capital One says information of over 100 million individuals in U.S., Canada hacked
Description: Capital One Financial Corp said on Monday that personal information including names and addresses of about 100 million individuals in the United States and 6 million people in Canada were obtained by a hacker who has been arrested.

Headlines: Major U.S. banks lower benchmark interest rates following Fed rate cut
Description: Major U.S. banks lowered their benchmark rates for a wide range of consumer and commercial loans on Wednesday, following a rate cut from the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Is Trump the reason the Fed cut rates?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's repeated calls for easier monetary policy may not be what drove the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates on Wednesday.

Headlines: A look back at the Fed's past rate-cutting cycles
Description: U.S. interest rates have never been as low as they are now at the start of any past Federal Reserve interest rate reduction cycle.

Headlines: U.S. markets gyrate after Fed cuts rates, stocks fall
Description: Wall Street turned negative after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell characterized the U.S. central bank's first rate cut since 2008 as a "mid-cycle adjustment to policy," suggesting the move was not the start of a lengthy series of rate cuts.

Headlines: U.S. prisons lose Wall Street sell-side coverage
Description: Sell-side analysts have stopped covering U.S. private prison operators as Wall Street has distanced itself from publicly traded GEO Group Inc and CoreCivic Inc .

Headlines: Qualcomm outlook clouded by Huawei's smartphone gains in China
Description: Qualcomm Inc's quarterly revenue and profit forecast fell short of Wall Street targets, driven by Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's strong gains in the Chinese smartphone market, the U.S. company said, sending its shares down as much as 6%.

Headlines: U.S., China to keep talking on trade after little progress in Shanghai
Description: U.S. and Chinese negotiators ended a brief round of trade talks on Wednesday with little sign of progress and agreed to meet again in September, prolonging an uneasy truce in a year-long trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Cisco whistleblower gets first False Claims payout over cybersecurity
Description: Cisco Systems Inc has agreed to settle a whistleblower’s claim that it improperly sold video surveillance software with known vulnerabilities to U.S. federal and state governments, marking the first payout on a False Claims Act case brought over failure to meet cybersecurity standards.

Headlines: Dollar rises after Fed cuts rates, signals move is one-off
Description: The U.S. dollar rose to two-year highs on Wednesday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, having made the first cut to interest rates since 2008, signaled the move was not the start of a rate-cutting cycle.

Headlines: China to buy more U.S. farm products, talks to resume in September: White House
Description: China will ramp up purchases of American agricultural exports, a White House spokeswoman said on Wednesday after U.S.-China trade talks concluded in Shanghai, offering no other details.

Headlines: Brexit and subsidy row cloud strong Airbus profits
Description: Airbus urged European governments to step up plans for a "likely" no-deal Brexit and settle a long-running subsidy dispute with the United States to help limit trade risks for Europe's largest planemaker.

Headlines: China says discussed purchase of U.S. agricultural goods in latest talks
Description: Chinese and U.S. trade negotiators discussed the purchase of U.S. agricultural goods during trade talks this week and will meet again in the United States in September, the commerce ministry said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump says Fed's Powell 'let us down' on interest rate decision
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell "let us down" with a quarter-percentage-point interest rate cut on Wednesday, saying the market wanted a signal that a "lengthy and aggressive rate-cutting cycle" was under way.

Headlines: Directors of Australia's Crown Resorts attack 'deceitful campaign' in letter
Description: Casino operator Crown Resorts on Wednesday dismissed media reports that it flouted visa rules to bring Chinese gamblers to Australia after the government ordered an inquiry into immigration officials' dealings with the company.

Headlines: Lloyds Bank plays down Brexit fears as mis-selling charge hits profits again
Description: Lloyds Banking Group played down mounting concerns about Britain's Brexit crisis as it missed first-half profit forecasts due to a much larger than expected charge for mis-selling insurance.

Headlines: Roche, Spark extend $4.3 billion takeover again, this time to September 3
Description: Roche and Spark Therapeutics announced another extension of the Swiss drugmaker's $4.3 billion takeover offer for the U.S. gene therapy specialist as regulatory reviews in the United States and Britain continue.

Headlines: After $6 billion M&A spree, insurer FWD eyes China foray ahead of potential IPO
Description: Fast-growing insurer FWD is seeking to launch operations in China ahead of any public offering and plans to bolster its non-life business in Asia, its chief executive said, as a potential shake-up looms in the region's insurance sector.

Headlines: U.S. wage inflation moderate, Midwest manufacturing slumps
Description: U.S. labor costs rose at their slowest pace in 1-1/2 years in the second quarter, the latest sign of benign inflation that enabled the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates on Wednesday for the first time since 2008.

Headlines: Carlyle to give shareholders a vote in switch to corporation
Description: Carlyle Group LP emulated its peers on Wednesday with plans to convert from a publicly traded partnership into a corporation, and went one step further by announcing it will become the first U.S. private equity firm to hold shareholder votes.

Headlines: Oil rises as U.S. crude stocks fall again, Fed cuts interest rates
Description: Oil prices rose for a fifth day on Wednesday following a larger-than-expected drop in U.S. inventories and after the Federal Reserve cut U.S. interest rates for the first time in more than a decade.

Headlines: Facebook defeats appeal in U.S. claiming it aided Hamas attacks in Israel
Description: Facebook Inc on Wednesday defeated an appeal by American victims of Hamas attacks in Israel, who sought to hold the company liable for providing the group a social media platform to further its terroristic goals.

Headlines: Apple woos investors with China gain, market value nears $1 trillion
Description: Apple Inc shares rose 4.4% on Wednesday, after the company calmed Wall Street nerves with an improvement in sales in China and as several brokerages predicted a boost from its services business and the launch of new iPhones in the second half of 2019.

Headlines: Italy's UniCredit says carrying out own probe in relation to Capital One data breach
Description: Italy's biggest bank by assets UniCredit said on Wednesday it was carrying out its own investigation in relation to a major data breach at capital one Financial Corp.

Headlines: WeWork hosts analysts before IPO; debt, lease obligations in focus
Description: Wall Street banks are set to grill WeWork on its finances on Wednesday as it prepares to publicly sell stock for the first time, possibly in September, a sale that will create a benchmark for the rapidly expanding flexible office industry.

Headlines: Free-spending consumers lift company profits, but Trump tariffs now loom
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's plan to slap new tariffs on Chinese imports comes on the heels of unexpectedly strong second-quarter results for automakers, consumer products companies and restaurant chains, boosted by spending on high-end products

Headlines: PG&E negotiates price cuts on five solar, battery contracts
Description: PG&E Corp on Thursday told a U.S. bankruptcy judge that it had reached agreements to cut prices by at least 10% on five power contracts, according to court papers.

Headlines: Wall Street dragged down by Trump trade tweet
Description: Wall Street fell again on Thursday, abruptly reversing early gains after U.S. President Donald Trump put concerns about the U.S.-China trade war back in the spotlight, tweeting that he would impose an additional 10% tariff on $300 billion in Chinese imports.

Headlines: Stocks, oil tumble as Trump escalates trade war with China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump sent financial markets reeling on Thursday when he announced additional tariffs on Chinese products, as traders worried not only about the escalation of the trade war but also the effect on the independence of the U.S. central bank.

Headlines: Texas joins states suing to stop T-Mobile, Sprint deal as trial delayed
Description: U.S. states suing to stop T-Mobile US Inc's $26 billion merger with Sprint Corp won two victories on Thursday as Texas' Republican attorney general joined 14 Democrats, adding political depth to the group, and a judge agreed to give states until December to make their case.

Headlines: Tariff wars: Duties imposed by Trump and U.S. trading partners
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would impose a 10% tariff on the remaining $300 billion of Chinese imports starting Sept. 1, after negotiators failed to make progress in U.S.-China trade talks.

Headlines: Senior China diplomat says more U.S. tariffs incorrect way to resolve trade dispute
Description: Threatening more tariffs on Chinese goods was not a correct or constructive way to resolve the U.S.-China trade dispute, senior Chinese diplomat Wang Yi said on Friday after U.S. President Donald Trump said he would slap a 10% tariff on the remaining $300 billion of Chinese imports starting Sept. 1.

Headlines: U.S. retailers blast new China tariffs, say move will raise prices further, hurt jobs
Description: President Donald Trump's threat to impose 10% tariffs on the remaining $300 billion of Chinese imports from Sept. 1 will hurt consumer purchases, raise prices further and limit hiring, four large retail trade groups warned on Thursday.

Headlines: Google blocks websites certified by DarkMatter, after Reuters reports
Description: Alphabet's Google has blacklisted websites approved by a United Arab Emirates-based security company after Reuters reports tied the firm to a state hacking operation.

Headlines: Oil slumps 7% as Trump announces additional tariffs on Chinese imports
Description: Oil prices plummeted more than 7% on Thursday, with the U.S. benchmark posting its worst day in more than four years, after President Donald Trump said he would impose additional tariffs Chinese imports starting Sept. 1.

Headlines: Amazon in early talks to buy stake in India's Reliance Retail: ET
Description: Amazon.com Inc is in exploratory talks with Reliance Industries Ltd's retail unit to buy an up to 26% stake in India's biggest brick-and-mortar retailer, the Economic Times (ET) reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Fannie Mae net income falls, seen paying $3.4 billion to U.S. Treasury
Description: Fannie Mae's net income fell in the second quarter from a year-ago due to losses on its derivatives, while it is expected to pay $3.4 billion in dividends to the U.S. Treasury, the No. 1 U.S. mortgage financing agency said on Thursday.

Headlines: Marathon Petroleum tops estimates on refining beat, retail strength
Description: U.S. refiner Marathon Petroleum Corp beat estimates for quarterly profit on Thursday, benefiting from better-than-expected earnings from its refining segment as well as higher sales in its gas stations business.

Headlines: BNP Paribas expects only one more U.S. rate cut in 2019
Description: BNP Paribas analysts said late Wednesday they expect the Federal Reserve to lower key U.S. borrowing costs only one more time in 2019, with a 25 basis-point cut in September as an insurance against mounting risks.

Headlines: Fed cuts interest rates, signals it may not need to do more
Description: The Federal Reserve cut interest rates on Wednesday, but the head of the U.S. central bank said the move might not be the start of a lengthy campaign to shore up the economy against risks including global weakness.

Headlines: U.S. factory activity growth slows to weakest in nearly three years
Description: The U.S. manufacturing sector expanded in July, but the pace of growth decelerated to its weakest in nearly three years stemming from a broad decline in activities from the month before, an industry report released on Thursday showed.

Headlines: ADM profit plunges as floods, U.S.-China trade war batter grain handler
Description: Global grain trader and food processor Archer Daniels Midland Co on Thursday reported a 41.3% drop in second-quarter adjusted profit and missed Wall Street expectations, after being battered by the U.S.-China trade war and severe U.S. weather this spring that disrupted production and transportation.

Headlines: Coffee baron's death fuels India Inc anger over government crackdown on wrongdoing
Description: The apparent suicide of India's coffee baron V.G. Siddhartha, under investigation by tax authorities, has inflamed anger toward the government among business leaders who feel it is going too far in its crackdown on fraud and tax evasion.

Headlines: Retail trade group says plan to impose new tariffs will raise prices, hurt jobs
Description: The National Retail Federation, a top U.S. trade group, said President Donald Trump's threat to impose 10% tariffs on the remaining $300 billion of Chinese imports from Sept. 1, is a flawed strategy that will raise prices and hurt jobs.

Headlines: Trump: U.S. will hit $300 billion worth of Chinese goods with 10% tariff
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would impose an additional 10% tariff on $300 billion worth of Chinese imports starting Sept. 1, as talks aimed at easing tensions between the world's two largest economies continue.

Headlines: Instant View: Trump announces new tariffs on China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday moved to impose a 10% tariff on an additional $300 billion worth of Chinese imports starting Sept. 1, after U.S. and Chinese negotiators failed to kickstart trade talks between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: 'Truck, truck and away': Pickups drive GM's profit beat
Description: General Motors Co posted a better-than-expected net profit on Thursday as high-margin pickup trucks, SUVs and crossovers helped overcome slowing sales in the United States and China, and reiterated its full-year earnings forecast.

Headlines: Atlanta Fed model raises U.S. third-quarter GDP view to 2.2%
Description: The U.S. economy grew at a 2.2% annualized rate in the third quarter based on the latest data on national manufacturing activity and construction spending, the Atlanta Federal Reserve's GDPNow forecast model showed on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. confirms small soybean sale to private Chinese buyer
Description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture on Thursday confirmed a private Chinese company bought 68,000 tonnes of soybeans in the week ended July 25, the first soybean purchase since Beijing offered to exempt five crushers from import tariffs imposed more than a year ago as part of a U.S.-China trade dispute.

Headlines: Verizon beats profit estimates as monthly phone subscribers jump
Description: Verizon Communications Inc on Thursday beat second-quarter profit estimates as the U.S. mobile carrier added more monthly phone subscribers than expected and stepped up efforts to deploy the next-generation 5G network nationwide.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil profit sinks, Chevron rises as both boost output
Description: Weaker second-quarter refining and chemicals profits offset surging U.S. shale production at U.S. oil majors Exxon Mobil Corp and Chevron Corp , the two reported on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. tariff threat may compound Apple's iPhone woes: BofA
Description: Apple Inc could see a hit to its annual earnings from U.S. President Donald Trump's newly proposed 10% tariff on Chinese imports from Sept. 1, analysts from Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Friday.

Headlines: Google to allow rival search engines to compete on Android - at a price
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google will allow rivals to compete to be the default search engines on new Android devices in Europe, but they will have to pay for the privilege.

Headlines: U.S. shale shippers will pay surcharge for Trump steel tariffs
Description: Plains All American Pipeline LP said on Friday it will tack on a fee for users of a new oil pipeline to pay for the cost of the Trump administration's tariffs on imported steel, with analysts and traders calling it the first U.S. energy pipeline operator to do so.

Headlines: Nissan wants Renault to reduce stake to revive Renault-FCA deal talks: WSJ
Description: Carmakers Nissan Motor Co and Renault SA are trying to reach a deal to reshape their global alliance, in hopes of reviving Renault's merger talks with Italy's Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV , the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing emails and people briefed on the talks.

Headlines: Atlanta Fed model lowers U.S. third-quarter GDP growth estimate to 1.9%
Description: The U.S. economy likely will grow at a 1.9% annualized rate in the third quarter, based on the latest data on domestic payrolls, trade and factory orders, the Atlanta Federal Reserve's GDPNow forecast model showed on Friday.

Headlines: Volvo Cars, China in first blockchain project for recycled cobalt
Description: Volvo Cars, owned by China's Geely [GEELY.UL], has produced the first cars containing recycled cobalt mapped using a blockchain, and has joined a separate project to monitor cobalt from Democratic Republic of Congo, Volvo said.

Headlines: Exxon's U.S. refineries suffer greater outages in second quarter over year ago, data shows
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp 's U.S. second-quarter refining profits bounced back from a loss earlier this year but remain below past levels in part because of a wave of production outages, according to an examination of data from Reuters and energy industry intelligence service Genscape.

Headlines: Amazon in talks to buy stake in India's Reliance Retail: sources
Description: Amazon.com Inc is in talks with Reliance Industries Ltd's retail unit to buy a stake in India's biggest brick-and-mortar retailer, two sources with knowledge of the talks told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Levi's slims down China supply chain exposure as trade war rages on
Description: Levi Strauss & Co has been "deliberate and diligent" in moving production out of China because of uncertainty hanging over tariffs on goods imported from China, Chief Executive Officer Chip Bergh said in an interview with Reuters.

Headlines: Sprint loses fewer-than-expected phone subscribers, shares rise
Description: Sprint Corp on Friday reported fewer-than-expected losses in quarterly net phone subscribers who pay a monthly bill, as the U.S. wireless carrier's cheaper plans helped it retain customers amid its pending merger with larger rival T-Mobile US .

Headlines: Fed, trade confusion upending Wall Street investment playbooks
Description: As Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday described why the central bank's interest rate cut should not be seen as the start of a lengthy easing cycle, the U.S. stock market was losing value at a rate of over $25 billion a minute.

Headlines: Exclusive: Novelis must offer concessions or face EU veto to $2.6 billion Aleris deal - sources
Description: U.S. aluminum maker Novelis [NVLXC.UL] must offer concessions to European Union competition authorities by Aug. 9 to gain approval for its $2.6 billion takeover of aluminum processor Aleris [TXPACA.UL], sources close to the matter said.

Headlines: Stronger yen prompts Toyota to trim profit forecast, saps Honda
Description: Toyota Motor Corp lowered its annual profit forecast while Honda Motor Co turned in a double-digit decline in quarterly earnings as a resurgent yen hurt two of Japan's biggest automakers.

Headlines: China says to take countermeasures if U.S. bent on putting tariffs on Chinese goods
Description: China will have to take countermeasures if the United States is bent on putting more tariffs on Chinese goods, the Chinese foreign ministry said on Friday.

Headlines: Campbell confirms sale of Australian snacks unit Arnott's to KKR for $2.2 billion
Description: Campbell Soup Co on Friday confirmed that it signed a deal to sell its Australian snacks unit Arnott's and some of its international operations to KKR & Co Inc for $2.2 billion as the U.S. company works on reducing debt.

Headlines: N.Y. Fed model slashes U.S. third-quarter GDP estimate below 2%
Description: U.S. economy is growing more slowly in the third quarter than previously thought based on this week's data releases on manufacturing and import/export prices, the New York Federal Reserve's Nowcast model showed on Friday.

Headlines: Group of 12 U.S. states challenge Trump fuel economy penalty freeze
Description: A group of 12 states led by California and New York on Friday challenged the Trump administration's decision to suspend a 2016 Obama administration regulation that more than doubled penalties for automakers that fail to meet fuel efficiency requirements.

Headlines: U.S. gives tentative approval for expanded Delta, Air France, Virgin joint venture
Description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao granted tentative approval on Friday for an expanded transatlantic joint venture made up of Delta Air Lines Inc , Air France KLM SA and Virgin Atlantic.

Headlines: Exclusive - India's biggest carmaker Maruti Suzuki cuts temporary jobs as sales plunge
Description: India's biggest automaker, Maruti Suzuki India Ltd , said it had cut the number of its temporary workers to cope with a slowdown in auto sales, adding to the jobless problem in Asia's third largest economy.

Headlines: Apple, Google pause reviewing audio recordings from voice assistants
Description: Apple Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google have globally suspended reviewing recordings from users interacting with their voice assistants, as concerns over data privacy mount.

Headlines: Elon Musk to launch China unit for tunneling company this month
Description: Elon Musk will soon launch a China unit for his underground tunneling enterprise, The Boring Company, the billionaire entrepreneur said on Twitter.

Headlines: Saudi energy minister says he discussed oil markets with Russian counterpart
Description: Saudi energy minister Khalid Al-Falih discussed oil markets with his Russian counterpart and stressed that Saudi Arabia would continue to comply with production cuts until the end of Q1 2020, he said in a tweet on Saturday.

Headlines: South Korea to spend $6.5 billion on R&D to cut reliance on Japanese imports
Description: South Korea on Monday announced plans to invest about 7.8 trillion won ($6.48 billion) in research and development for local materials, parts and equipment over the next seven years in an effort to cut the reliance on Japanese imports.

Headlines: Japan, U.S. target broad bilateral trade deal by September: Nikkei
Description: Japan and the United States have agreed to target a broad deal on bilateral trade by September, seeking to bridge differences of opinion over tariffs on beef and the automobile sector, the Nikkei business daily reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Japan service sector growth eases on tempered optimism, job creation: PMI
Description: - Activity in Japan's services sector expanded again in July, albeit at a fractionally slower pace than the previous month, a revised survey showed on Monday, indicating resilient domestic demand despite signs of a loss of momentum.

Headlines: Japan's FTC investigating Apple over pressure on parts makers: Mainichi
Description: Japan's Fair Trade Commission is investigating Apple Inc over its pressure on Japanese parts makers and whether it abused its power in violation of antimonopoly rules, the Mainichi newspaper reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: Why Microsoft is the best of the large-cap stocks
Description: Jim Cramer explains that Microsoft is the one to buy of the large cap stocks due to its little China exposure and its recent quarter.

Headlines: Murdoch's Fox Corp to buy fintech Credible Labs in $397 million deal
Description: U.S. broadcaster Fox Corp on Monday agreed to buy Credible Labs Inc in a deal valuing the online finance broker at $397 million, as the Murdoch-controlled firm hunts for growth following the sale of its film and TV assets to Disney.

Headlines: Take Five: Trade war whiplash and other market themes for the week ahead
Description: It's been a familiar pattern in the Sino-U.S. trade war since 2018. Combative tweets from Donald Trump, high-level talks between the two sides, a stalemate, more tariffs and counter-tariffs, and then conciliatory messages.

Headlines: Elliott calls for break-up and bigger buyback at Germany's Scout24
Description: U.S. activist investor Elliott [ECAL.UL] has urged German classifieds group Scout24 to sell its car listings business and ramp up a share buyback program to boost returns to investors.

Headlines: Bombardier-led consortium wins $4.5 billion monorail contract in Egypt
Description: A consortium led by Bombardier Inc said on Monday it had won a contract to build and operate two monorail lines in Egypt for more than $4.5 billion.

Headlines: Google pledges carbon-neutral shipping, recycled plastic for all devices
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Monday announced that it would neutralize carbon emissions from delivering consumer hardware by next year and include recycled plastic in each of its products by 2022.

Headlines: HSBC axes CEO Flint in shock shift to speed up strategy
Description: HSBC ousted John Flint as chief executive after just 18 months in a shock move the chairman of Europe's biggest bank said was needed to speed up progress on priority areas such as the turnaround of its U.S. business.

Headlines: Markets brace for volatility surge as currencies enter trade war
Description: China's decision to let its yuan plunge through a previously sacrosanct level means a tit-for-tat trade conflict could morph into a currency war, injecting volatility into long-dormant foreign exchanges and piling pressure on world markets.

Headlines: U.S. services sector slows; orders hit three-year low
Description: U.S. services sector activity slowed in July as new orders dropped to their lowest level in three years, suggesting the economy lost further momentum early in the third quarter.

Headlines: Tyson Foods hits record high after beating estimates, prepares for China profit boost
Description: Tyson Foods Inc reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings on Monday and reaffirmed expectations it will profit from the spread of a fatal hog disease in China, sending shares to a record high.

Headlines: Big U.S. investors use summer sell-off to ramp up bets
Description: The summer sell-off is finally here - and not all U.S. investors are rattled by it.

Headlines: U.S. labor market slowing as job openings, hiring fall
Description: U.S. job openings and hiring fell in June, suggesting that demand for labor was cooling in tandem with a slowing economy, which could provide another reason for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates again next month.

Headlines: U.S. Drug distributors propose $10 billion to end state lawsuits over opioids: Bloomberg
Description: Drug wholesalers AmerisourceBergen Corp , McKesson Corp and Cardinal Health Inc have proposed a $10 billion settlement for claims that they played a part in the U.S. opioid epidemic, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with negotiations.

Headlines: Air China to suspend Beijing-Hawaii flights amid weak travel demand
Description: Air China will suspend its flights on the Beijing-Hawaii route from Aug. 27 after a review of its network, China's flagship carrier said on Tuesday, as travel demand remains weak amid an escalating U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs sees no trade deal before 2020 U.S. election, now expects three rate cuts
Description: Goldman Sachs said it no longer expects the United States and China to agree on a deal to end their prolonged trade dispute before the November 2020 presidential election as policymakers from the world's largest economies are "taking a harder line".

Headlines: Exclusive: India raises cost of refinery project with Aramco by 36% - sources
Description: India has increased the cost estimate of a giant refinery and petrochemical project to be jointly built with Saudi Aramco and Abu Dhabi National Oil Co by more than 36%, after protests by farmers forced the relocation of the plant, four sources said.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's Huawei seeks compensation from Flex over withheld goods
Description: Huawei Technologies said it was seeking compensation from its contract manufacturer Flex Ltd for illegally withholding some 400 million yuan ($57 million) worth of its goods in the wake of a U.S. trade ban on the Chinese firm.

Headlines: Jolted markets mark new 2019 milestones
Description: Global financial markets have been jolted in recent days by yet another escalation in a trade war between the United States and China, with the resulting selloff and bid for safety pushing assets and markers into new territory for the year.

Headlines: German finance minister: U.S.-China trade conflict escalation would hurt economy more
Description: An escalation in a trade conflict between the United States and China will further damage the global economy, German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz warned on Tuesday, urging all sides to negotiate.

Headlines: Sprint to launch Chinese-made OnePlus 5G smartphone in U.S.
Description: Sprint Corp said on Tuesday it would launch a 5G smartphone made by OnePlus, becoming the second U.S. wireless carrier after T-Mobile to offer a cellphone made by the Chinese company.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz offers subsidies to retrofit older diesel cars in Germany
Description: Daimler said on Tuesday Mercedes-Benz customers in Germany could apply for a 3,000 euro ($3,350) subsidy to upgrade the exhaust filters of older, polluting diesel vehicles, the latest effort among German carmakers to avoid inner-city bans.

Headlines: Global stocks climb as currency war fears ease
Description: World stock markets inched higher on Tuesday, propelled by solid gains on Wall Street, after China's central bank stepped in to stabilize the yuan, soothing fears that a protracted trade spat between the United States and China would spill over into a currency war.

Headlines: Walgreens to close about 200 stores in United States
Description: Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc said on Tuesday it plans to close about 200 U.S. stores and expects to record related pre-tax charges of between $1.9 billion and $2.4 billion.

Headlines: Cramer: Action in the bond market does not mean a recession is 'around the corner'
Description: Jim Cramer says that the U.S. economy is not on the verge of a recession, despite the rush for the safety of government bonds.

Headlines: Rush into U.S. bonds curbs global stock markets; gold touches 6-year high
Description: Investors rushed into the safety of U.S. government bonds on Wednesday, muting a broad stocks rally as fears of a global recession grew.

Headlines: Tesla stands by safety claims despite U.S. probes, subpoenas over crashes
Description: Electric carmaker Tesla Inc stood by its Model 3 safety claims on Wednesday in the face of regulatory scrutiny, while documents showed the top U.S. automotive safety watchdog issued at least five subpoenas since last year seeking information about crashes involving the company's vehicles.

Headlines: Medina Mora, powerful Citigroup exec who battled scandals, dies at 69
Description: Manuel Medina Mora, one of the most influential Mexican bankers to work on Wall Street during a long career at Citigroup Inc , has died, the bank's Mexican unit Citibanamex said on Wednesday. He was 69.

Headlines: Dollar will be cut down to size if Fed gives in to market whims - Reuters poll
Description: The U.S. dollar's dominance will come to an end if the Federal Reserve gives in to pressure from financial markets and President Donald Trump and chops interest rates another 50 basis points this year, a Reuters poll of market strategists showed.

Headlines: Subway to test Beyond Meat meatball in North America
Description: Subway Restaurants will test Beyond Meat Inc meatballs in 685 restaurants across the United States and Canada starting next month, the latest chain to jump on the meat alternatives bandwagon.

Headlines: Reliance Industries set to bring Tiffany stores to India
Description: India's Reliance Industries Ltd is partnering with iconic U.S.-based luxury jeweller Tiffany & Co to open a line of stores in the country, adding yet another marquee name to its growing portfolio of brands.

Headlines: Ryanair to shut Faro base in Portugal in 2020: union
Description: Ryanair has decided to close its base at Faro International Airport in southern Portugal from next year with the loss of at least 120 jobs, the SNPVAC cabin crew union, which had called a strike for Aug. 21-25, said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Great Wall warns BMW joint venture faces uncertainties
Description: China's Great Wall Motor on Wednesday said that its joint venture with BMW faced regulatory uncertainties as both companies pledged to proceed with plans for developing a low-cost electric car.

Headlines: GM wins victory in ignition switch defect lawsuits
Description: General Motors Co persuaded the U.S. federal judge who oversees nationwide litigation over defective ignition switches to narrow claims by owners who said their vehicles lost value because of the defect, which has been linked to 124 deaths.

Headlines: AMD lands Google, Twitter as customers with newest server chip
Description: Advanced Micro Devices Inc on Wednesday released the second generation of its processor chip for data centers and said that it had landed Alphabet Inc' Google and Twitter Inc as customers.

Headlines: MMT may be Democrats' economic cure, but only Trump got the memo
Description: From her home overlooking Setauket Harbor on Long Island's North Shore, a motorboat bobbing at the dock, Stephanie Kelton hopes to revolutionize how the U.S. government manages the economy.

Headlines: CVS Health raises 2019 profit forecast after beating profit estimates
Description: CVS Health Corp raised its full-year profit forecast and reported higher-than-expected second-quarter results on Wednesday, as increased U.S. prescription drug prices fueled rebates to its pharmacy benefits business.

Headlines: Stock short-sellers reaped big gains on Aug. 5 selloff: S3 Partners
Description: Short-sellers targeting U.S. stocks logged a one-day paper profit of $24.75 billion on the sell-off on Aug. 5, according to data from financial technology and analytics firm S3 Partners.

Headlines: Former Defense Secretary Mattis rejoins General Dynamics board
Description: Former U.S. Defense Secretary Jim Mattis rejoined the board of General Dynamics Corp on Wednesday, seven months after quitting his job in the Trump administration over disagreements about foreign policy, the defense contractor said.

Headlines: Two U.S. senators raise privacy concerns over Facebook's Messenger Kids
Description: Democratic U.S. senators Edward Markey and Richard Blumenthal have written to Facebook Inc questioning whether there was a "worrying pattern" of poor privacy protection for children using its Messenger Kids app.

Headlines: Diabetes drug maker Novo Nordisk buys pill factory in North Carolina
Description: Novo Nordisk said on Tuesday it had bought a factory in North Carolina that would assist in manufacturing and packaging its new once-daily pill for treating type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: U.S. government contractors get first look at Huawei ban
Description: The U.S. agency responsible for government contracts on Wednesday released an interim rule for a ban on federal purchases of telecommunications equipment from five Chinese companies, including Huawei.

Headlines: Smart home tech makes inroads into China's emerging elderly care market
Description: Charging elderly clients just 1 yuan or about 15 cents a day, little-known Lanchuang Network Technology Corp has embarked on one of the most ambitious undertakings in aged care by a private sector firm in China.

Headlines: U.S. June wholesale inventories revised lower
Description: U.S. wholesale inventories were revised lower to show them unchanged in June, indicating a slowdown in the pace of inventory accumulation that could further weigh on economic growth.

Headlines: Glencore Zambian unit closes two mine shafts; opposition sees 1,400 job cuts
Description: Glencore's Mopani Copper Mines in Zambia has closed two shafts at its Nkana mine, the company said on Thursday, a move that an opposition leader said had led to 1,400 job losses.

Headlines: Nestle starts selling Starbucks-branded coffee in China
Description: Food giant Nestle on Thursday started selling Starbucks-branded coffee in mainland China, seeking to tap growth in a market where it says coffee consumption per capita remains low compared to global standards.

Headlines: Salesforce to buy Israel's ClickSoftware for $1.35 billion
Description: U.S. cloud-based service provider Salesforce agreed to buy U.S.-Israeli software developer ClickSoftware for $1.35 billion in cash and shares, in a bid to accelerate growth of its cloud-based products to manage customer service operations.

Headlines: Exclusive: Denmark's Nord Stream 2 route request could cause eight-month delay, cost 660 million euros - operator
Description: A Russian-led gas pipeline project across the Baltic Sea to Europe could be delayed by up to eight months and cost an extra 660 million euros ($740 million) due to hurdles in securing the necessary permits from Denmark, the pipeline operator has said.

Headlines: Signs of price truce push Lyft, Uber higher
Description: Lyft Inc's hints that its cut-throat rivalry with U.S. ride-hailing rival Uber Inc is easing may prove bad news for customers but it sent shares in both companies sharply higher on Thursday.

Headlines: Equinor's power and gas trading unit expands to the U.S.
Description: Danske Commodities, a power and gas trading firm owned by oil major Equinor , has expanded its operations to the United States, completing its first trade on the PJM wholesale power market, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: SoulCycle, Equinox face boycott calls over investor's Trump fundraiser
Description: Fitness chains SoulCycle and Equinox on Wednesday sought to distance themselves from a fundraiser for U.S. President Donald Trump reportedly in the works by their billionaire owner, real estate executive Stephen Ross.

Headlines: Honda to recall 222,674 Accord vehicles in China
Description: Honda Motor Co Ltd's venture with Guangzhou Automobile Group Co Ltd will recall 222,674 Accord sedans in China, market regulators said on Thursday, after recent complaints on social media about the car engine's quality.

Headlines: Sarepta says adverse event report for DMD gene therapy erroneously submitted
Description: Sarepta Therapeutics Inc said on Thursday it was informed that an adverse event report was erroneously submitted to the U.S. health regulator regarding an ongoing study of the company's gene therapy for Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD).

Headlines: Pork producers win dismissal of price-fixing lawsuits - U.S. judge
Description: A federal judge on Thursday dismissed antitrust lawsuits accusing several U.S. pork companies of conspiring to limit supply in the $20 billion-a-year market, in order to inflate prices and their own profits at the expense of consumers and other purchasers.

Headlines: Amazon's Alexa comes under scrutiny of Luxembourg privacy watchdog
Description: Luxembourg's privacy regulator has asked Amazon for information regarding its Alexa voice assistant, an indication of rising regulatory unease over companies' use of personal data.

Headlines: U.S. small-cap stocks under renewed threat from tariffs
Description: Last week's announcement of more U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods may have undermined the prospects for small-cap stocks to rebound this year, even after a brief respite from the Federal Reserve's recent interest-rate cut. Just a day after the Fed cut interest rates for the first time in more than a decade, President Donald Trump vowed on Aug. 1 to impose 10% tariffs on an additional $300 billion of Chinese goods beginning on Sept. 1.

Headlines: Ryanair Irish pilots back industrial action as unrest spreads
Description: Ryanair's directly employed pilots in Ireland on Friday voted in favor of industrial action unless pay demands are met swiftly, with Spanish pilots also threatening to join growing unrest at the airline.

Headlines: Malaysia files criminal charges against 17 Goldman Sachs executives
Description: Malaysia filed criminal charges on Friday against 17 current and former directors at subsidiaries of Goldman Sachs Group Inc following an investigation into a multi-billion-dollar corruption scandal that led to the demise of state fund 1MDB.

Headlines: Tame U.S. producer inflation supports case for another rate cut
Description: U.S. producer prices increased moderately in July, lifted by a rebound in the cost of energy products, while underlying producer inflation retreated, which could allow the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates again next month.

Headlines: Huawei unveils Harmony operating system, won't ditch Android for smartphones
Description: Huawei Technologies unveiled on Friday its proprietary operating system for smartphones and other devices, as U.S. trade restrictions imposed in May threaten to cut the Chinese firm's access to U.S. technologies such as Android.

Headlines: Trade war escalation nudges U.S. closer to recession: Reuters poll
Description: The recent escalation in the U.S.-China trade war has brought forward the next U.S. recession, according to a majority of economists polled by Reuters who now expect the Federal Reserve to cut rates again in September and once more next year.

Headlines: Daimler faces up to 1 billion euro diesel fine: Der Spiegel
Description: Prosecutors in Stuttgart, Germany are set to fine Mercedes-Benz parent Daimler between 800 million euros ($895 million) and 1 billion euros for diesel-related violations, German magazine Der Spiegel said in its online edition on Friday.

Headlines: No Lyft for Uber shares after results fall short
Description: Shares of Uber Inc fell 10% in early trading on Friday after the ride-hailing service missed most Wall Street targets in its quarterly earnings report, in sharp contrast to upbeat numbers from U.S. rival Lyft Inc a day earlier.

Headlines: Canada sheds 'disappointing' 24,200 jobs in July: analysts
Description: Canada's economy shed a net 24,200 jobs in July, driven by a decline in wholesale and retail trade, official data showed on Friday, as Canada's job market remained in a holding pattern for the third consecutive month.

Headlines: Instant View: Canada sheds 24,200 jobs in July, jobless rate rises to 5.7%
Description: Canada's economy lost a net 24,200 jobs in July, both in full-time and part-time work, Statistics Canada said on Friday. The jobless rate edged up to 5.7%.

Headlines: Bayer has not proposed paying $8 billion to settle U.S. Roundup claims: mediator
Description: Bayer AG has not proposed paying $8 billion to settle all U.S. claims related to the Roundup herbicide, mediator Ken Feinberg said in an email on Friday.

Headlines: Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam says protests have hit business like a 'tsunami'
Description: Embattled Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam said on Friday the business community was very worried about the long-term consequences of protests in the Asian financial hub.

Headlines: Ryanair's Irish pilots back industrial action over pay
Description: Ryanair's directly employed pilots in Ireland on Friday voted overwhelmingly in favor of industrial action unless the airline agrees to union pay proposals by Monday, the Forsa/IALPA trade union said.

Headlines: Wall Street ends down amid more trade woes, high volatility
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Friday following renewed jitters over the U.S.-China trade war, capping a week of trading that saw big swings and high volume.

Headlines: IMF stands by yuan view; says China could need stimulus if trade war worsens
Description: The International Monetary Fund on Friday stood by its assessment that the value of China's yuan was largely in line with economic fundamentals, but an IMF official said the fund was encouraging China to pursue a more flexible exchange rate with less intervention.

Headlines: Investors look for consumer pressure ahead of next tariffs
Description: As President Donald Trump prepares to slap new tariffs on Chinese imports, investors are bracing for signs of pressure on U.S. consumers as top retailers begin reporting quarterly results next week and key consumer sentiment and retail sales data is released.

Headlines: Peru suspends key permit for Southern Copper in U-turn on Tia Maria project
Description: Peru on Friday suspended a recently issued construction permit for Southern Copper's Tia Maria mine, a project that has triggered violent protests by nearby residents.

Headlines: U.S. still evaluating requests from firms to sell to China's Huawei: officials
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department is continuing to evaluate requests by U.S. companies to sell certain equipment to Chinese telecoms company Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, a White House official and Commerce Department spokesman said Friday.

Headlines: Gold gains as trade concerns weigh on global markets
Description: Signs of further escalation of the U.S.-China trade war and weak UK economic data weighed on global markets on Friday, capping a volatile week that has pushed gold to its highest level in six years.

Headlines: Brazil appeals judge lifts temporary arrest of former billionaire Eike Batista
Description: A Brazilian appeals court judge ordered on Saturday the release of Eike Batista, the mining and oil magnate who was once Brazil's richest man, revoking a temporary prison order that would expire on Monday.

Headlines: Fed remains a target as economy falls short of Trump's ambitious goals
Description: It has become a jarring and frequent contradiction. President Donald Trump blames the Federal Reserve for putting the U.S. economy at risk while data shows an economy in "reasonably good" shape, as the head of the central bank recently said.

Headlines: Tesla electric car catches fire after hitting tow truck in Moscow
Description: A Tesla Model 3 electric car caught fire after crashing into a parked tow truck on a Moscow motorway late on Saturday, with the Tesla driver saying he had failed to see the vehicle with which he collided.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs economists say fears rise that U.S.-China trade war leading to recession
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc said on Sunday that fears of the U.S.-China trade war leading to a recession are increasing and that Goldman no longer expects a trade deal between the world's two largest economies before the 2020 U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: Colombia fines Uber more than $629,000 for obstructing regulatory visit
Description: Colombia's commerce regulator said on Monday it would fine ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc more than $629,000 for obstructing a regulatory visit in 2017.

Headlines: AMS sparks bidding war for Osram, shines spotlight on auto business
Description: Osram said on Monday it would consider a takeover by Austrian sensor maker AMS that trumps a competing bid by Bain and Carlyle with a cash offer valuing the German lighting group at 4.3 billion euros ($4.8 billion).

Headlines: Saudi Aramco aims to buy Reliance stake, reports lower earnings
Description: Saudi Aramco is planning a multibillion dollar investment in India's Reliance Industries as the energy giant diversifies its oil business, where weaker prices cut its first-half profit by 12%.

Headlines: Jet Airways sale suffers setback as two potential investors back out
Description: Creditors' hopes of resurrecting India's Jet Airways and salvaging some value from the bankrupt airline were dealt a fresh blow on Monday as two potential investors said they were no longer interested in putting money into the business.

Headlines: Exclusive: PSA, Dongfeng to drop two China auto plants, halve workforce - document
Description: Peugeot maker PSA Group and partner Dongfeng Group have agreed to cut thousands of jobs in China and drop two of their four shared assembly plants, according to a document seen by Reuters, in a last-ditch bid to curb mounting losses as the world's largest auto market loses steam.

Headlines: Take Five: The devil's in the data
Description: Fears of a major downturn in euro zone powerhouse Germany have grown following "scary" industrial output figures for June and reports due this week that will hold those concerns up to the light.

Headlines: Barrick doesn't have 'for-sale' sign on Tongon, Massawa, but open to options: CEO
Description: Barrick Gold Corp is not actively seeking to sell its Tongon mine in Ivory Coast and the Massawa project in Senegal but will consider various options for both, Chief Executive Mark Bristow told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Yen, gold gain on trade war angst; Argentine peso sinks
Description: Investors piled into gold, safe-haven yen and bonds on Monday over nagging concerns about a prolonged U.S.-China trade war and global growth, while Argentina's peso plunged 15% after voters handed its president an election mauling.

Headlines: American Airlines wins permanent court block against alleged disruption by mechanics
Description: A U.S. federal court on Monday issued a permanent injunction against American Airlines Group Inc's mechanics union, which the airline had accused of illegal slowdowns it said had devastated its operations during the peak summer travel season.

Headlines: U.S. senators ask Amazon CEO if 'Amazon's Choice' deceives consumers
Description: Two U.S. senators asked Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Jeff Bezos on Monday how the "Amazon's Choice" badge on certain products is determined and whether the mark deceives consumers into purchasing "products of inferior quality."

Headlines: Oregon joins states' lawsuit to block T-Mobile, Sprint merger
Description: Oregon has joined a multistate lawsuit to block the merger of U.S. wireless carriers T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp, the New York attorney general's office, which is leading the lawsuit along with California, said on Monday.

Headlines: Wall Street falls on geopolitical tensions, recession fears
Description: U.S. stocks dropped in a broad sell-off on Monday as simmering geopolitical tensions spooked equity investors and drove a bond market rally while the protracted U.S.-China trade war stoked fears of impending recession.

Headlines: U.S. transportation chief asks new FAA head to review agency in wake of 737 MAX crashes
Description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao said on Monday she has asked the new head of the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to assess the agency's performance in the wake of two fatal crashes of Boeing Co's 737 MAX planes since October.

Headlines: U.S. details items from China for which new tariff is delayed
Description: The Trump administration on Tuesday released a 21-page list detailing an extensive array of Chinese imports for which it has decided to delay a new 10% tariff from Sept. 1 to Dec. 15, ranging from frozen fish to fireworks, sports equipment and baby gear.

Headlines: Cramer: Trump's tariff delay short squeezed stocks to spark a rally
Description: Trump gave the market a boost when it seemed like "everything is falling apart and the stock market's about to roll over," Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: Predicting the next U.S. recession
Description: A protracted trade war between China and the United States, the world's largest economies, and a deteriorating global growth outlook has left investors apprehensive about the end to the longest expansion in American history.

Headlines: Tyson to rebuild plant after fire, assures weekly pay for full-time workers
Description: U.S. meat processor Tyson Foods Inc said on Monday it will rebuild a Kansas beef plant after a fire heavily damaged the facility last week and that full-time, active employees would be paid weekly until production resumes.

Headlines: Exclusive: Yuan at right level, disorderly capital flows unlikely - China central bank official
Description: China's yuan is at an appropriate level currently and two-way fluctuations in the currency will not necessarily cause disorderly capital flows, a senior official at the People's Bank of China told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Amazon in talks to buy up to 10% stake in India's Future Retail: Bloomberg
Description: Amazon.com Inc is in late-stage talks to buy as much as 10% of India's Future Retail Ltd , Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. inflation picking up; Fed rate cut still expected
Description: U.S. consumer prices increased broadly in July, but the signs of an acceleration in inflation will likely do little to change market expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates again next month amid worsening trade tensions.

Headlines: Shares, dollar rebound on thaw in U.S.-China trade war
Description: U.S. and European stocks jumped, the dollar strengthened and Treasury yields rose on Tuesday after the United States said it would delay tariffs on some Chinese products, easing concerns that a protracted trade war would harm global growth.

Headlines: CBS, Viacom reunite with plans for bigger role in streaming TV wars
Description: CBS Corp and Viacom Inc have reached a deal to reunite media mogul Sumner Redstone's U.S. entertainment empire, betting that a larger company will be able to compete and partner better in a media industry dominated by giants.

Headlines: Trump delays tariffs on Chinese cellphones, laptops, toys; markets jump
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday backed off his Sept. 1 deadline for 10% tariffs on remaining Chinese imports, delaying duties on cellphones, laptops and other consumer goods, in the hopes of blunting their impact on U.S. holiday sales.

Headlines: Factbox: Merged CBS and Viacom aim to join U.S. media big league
Description: CBS Corp and Viacom Inc on Tuesday reached a deal to reunite media mogul Sumner Redstone's U.S. entertainment empire after 13 years apart.

Headlines: African Americans underserved by U.S. banks: study
Description: Many African Americans have difficulty accumulating savings in part because they lack access to mainstream financial services like banking, a new study on the contributing factors to the U.S. racial wealth gap by McKinsey & Co found on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tech leads Wall Street higher as tariff delay sparks rally
Description: U.S. stocks closed higher on Tuesday after an announced delay of planned tariffs on some Chinese imports brought buyers back to the equities market in a broad-based rally.

Headlines: Trump says Christmas shopping was factor in tariff decision
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday his administration decided to delay tariffs on some Chinese imports until mid-December to avoid hurting U.S. shoppers heading into the Christmas holiday.

Headlines: Exclusive: After 50 years in UK North Sea, Exxon eyes the exit - sources
Description: Exxon Mobil is considering a sale of its assets in the British North Sea after more than 50 years in the oil and gas basin as it focuses on U.S. shale production and new projects.

Headlines: Apple's AirPods will not escape Trump's China tariffs
Description: Apple Inc's AirPods, Apple Watch and HomePod, which have helped the company to offset waning sales of its bestselling iPhone this year, are not included in a temporary reprieve on tariffs by the Trump administration and will face a 10% levy on Sept 1.

Headlines: Ryanair's Irish pilots agree to talks as strike looms
Description: Ryanair's directly employed pilots in Ireland agreed to attend mediated talks starting on Wednesday to avert a strike their trade union said would go ahead next week if the airline does not properly address a pay claim.

Headlines: CBS, Viacom agree to merge in all-stock deal
Description: CBS Corp and Viacom Inc agreed to merge on Tuesday, creating a company with more than $28 billion in revenue, as an increasingly competitive media landscape prompted their controlling shareholder to reunify the U.S. entertainment companies 13 years after breaking them up.

Headlines: Colgate warns Venezuelans not to buy fake imported toothpaste brands
Description: Colgate-Palmolive Co is warning Venezuelans not buy fake versions of its toothpaste brands, leading local authorities to issue a health warning, as demand for imported products in Venezuela's dysfunctional economy encourages the spread of knock-off goods.

Headlines: Exclusive: Citgo to appoint new CEO to navigate political, legal turmoil - sources
Description: Citgo Petroleum Corp has selected Carlos Jorda as its next chief executive, according to three people familiar with the matter, turning to a seasoned refinery expert and native Venezuelan to run a company facing legal attacks and working under U.S. sanctions against parent Petroleos de Venezuela (PDVSA).

Headlines: Oil drops 3% on weak global economic data, U.S. crude stocks build
Description: Oil prices shed 3% on Wednesday after fresh Chinese and European economic revived global demand fears and U.S. crude inventories rose unexpectedly for the second week in a row.

Headlines: Novartis replaces top scientists at Avexis after drug data manipulated
Description: Novartis AG said on Wednesday it replaced the two top research and development executives at its Avexis unit after some data was manipulated from early testing of a gene therapy for infants that costs more than $2 million.

Headlines: Exclusive: China curbs gold imports as trade war heats up
Description: China has severely restricted imports of gold since May, bullion industry sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters, in a move that could be aimed at curbing outflows of dollars and bolstering its yuan currency as economic growth slows.

Headlines: U.S. import prices rebound, but trend still subdued
Description: U.S. import prices unexpectedly rose in July, but the underlying trend continued to be weak, pointing to subdued imported inflation pressures.

Headlines: Ryanair Spanish cabin crew unions threaten 10 days of strikes
Description: Unions representing Ryanair cabin crew in Spain on Wednesday announced plans to hold 10 days of strikes in September unless the Irish airline changes its plans to close several bases in the country.

Headlines: China's Tencent cautious after surge in quarterly profit
Description: China's Tencent Holdings , the world's largest gaming company by revenue, warned on Wednesday of a difficult economic environment even as it reported a better-than-expected 35% jump in quarterly profit.

Headlines: Macy's not looking to raise prices if new tariffs imposed: CEO
Description: Macy's Inc Chief Executive Officer Jeff Gennette said on Wednesday that the department store chain would not raise prices on products if the Trump administration goes ahead with its latest 10% tariffs.

Headlines: Novartis names Bulto as new head of U.S. drugs business
Description: Swiss drugmaker Novartis has named company veteran Victor Bulto as head of its U.S. pharmaceuticals business, effective on Sept. 1.

Headlines: Lion Air 'urgently requires' more 737 MAX jets to support growth: co-founder
Description: Indonesia's Lion Air "urgently requires" more Boeing Co 737 MAX jets to support its growth strategy once regulators approve the grounded model's return to service, the airline's co-founder, Rusdi Kirana, told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ford extends warranties on 560,000 Focus, Fiesta models
Description: Ford Motor Co said on Wednesday it was extending warranties on clutch and related hardware in 560,000 Focus and Fiesta cars in the United States and Canada after reports of problems with their six-speed transmission.

Headlines: Vision Fund makes $110 million bet on renewable energy storage
Description: Softbank Group's Vision Fund has made its first foray into energy storage technology with a $110 million investment in Switzerland-based Energy Vault.

Headlines: Ackman bets on idol Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway
Description: Billionaire U.S. investor William Ackman has long described how Warren Buffett, often called the greatest stock picker ever, has influenced his career. Now he's paying the Oracle of Omaha the ultimate homage with a new investment in Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway .

Headlines: Bankruptcy filings by U.S. energy producers pick up speed: law firm analysis
Description: Bankruptcy filings by U.S. energy producers so far this year have already nearly matched the total for the whole of 2018, law firm Haynes & Boone reported on Wednesday, as volatile oil and gas prices drive companies to seek protection from creditors.

Headlines: Democrat wants FCC to open T-Mobile, Sprint settlement for comment
