Description: U.S. Representative David Cicilline urged Federal Communications Commission Chairman Ajit Pai on Thursday to give the public the chance to comment on a draft order that would grant agency approval to the $26 billion merger of T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp.

Headlines: Markets register a shock, but is Trump right to blame the Fed?
Description: It takes a lot to kill an economic expansion, typically requiring a major shock to bring growth to a halt and trigger a U.S. recession.

Headlines: Apple says it supports 2.4 million U.S. jobs
Description: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it was either directly or indirectly responsible for 2.4 million U.S. jobs, up 20% from the 2 million the technology company estimated in 2017.

Headlines: Boeing delays delivery of ultra-long-range version of 777X
Description: Boeing Co has pushed back the entry into service of an ultra-long-range version of its forthcoming 777X widebody, the U.S. planemaker said on Wednesday, as it grapples with fallout from the 737 MAX crisis and engine issues with the 777X.

Headlines: Stocks waver, dollar recovers on renewed growth worries
Description: The dollar recovered from early weakness but a gauge of world equity performance edged lower on Thursday as concerns about global growth offset investor optimism over a surge in U.S. retail sales last month and strong Walmart earnings.

Headlines: Oil deepens slide on recession fears, China's trade threats
Description: Oil prices fell more than 1% on Thursday, extending the previous session's 3% drop, pressured by mounting recession concerns and a surprise boost in U.S. crude inventories.

Headlines: CFTC says Kraft, Mondelez to pay $16 million in wheat price manipulation case
Description: The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) said on Thursday Kraft Heinz Co and Mondelez International Inc will have to pay $16 million in penalty regarding a wheat manipulation case that dates back to 2015.

Headlines: Canopy Growth needs another 3-5 years to turn profit
Description: Canopy Growth Corp said on Thursday it expects another three to five years to turn in a profit as Canada's largest cannabis company invests heavily to diversify and expand.

Headlines: Strong U.S. retail sales ease gloom over economy
Description: U.S. retail sales surged in July as consumers bought a range of goods even as they cut back on motor vehicle purchases, helping to assuage financial market fears that the economy was heading into recession.

Headlines: Trump says China talks 'productive'; Beijing vows tariff retaliation
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that U.S. and Chinese negotiators were holding "productive" trade talks and expected them to meet in September despite U.S. tariffs on over $125 billion worth of Chinese imports taking effect Sept 1.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing output drops in July
Description: U.S. manufacturing output dropped in July, ending a run of two months of growth.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines expands daily service to Hawaii
Description: U.S. budget-friendly carrier Southwest Airlines Co will add another daily flight to Hawaii from January 2020, the company said on Thursday, as it counts on leisure travel from the West Coast to boost its growth.

Headlines: Ryanair expects minimal disruption from planned strikes
Description: Ryanair expects minimal cancellations with affected passengers flying out at different times if pilots in Britain and Ireland go ahead with a two-day strike next week, the airline's chief people officer said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Buyout firms KKR, Blackstone among bidders for Philippine hospitals group - sources
Description: Buyout firms KKR , Blackstone and CVC are among bidders competing for a stake in the hospital unit of Philippines' Metro Pacific Investments Corp , people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Weight of history: Chongqing Steel and China's state sector dilemma
Description: A year and a half ago, Chongqing Iron and Steel Corp (CISC) , China's oldest steelmaker, was rescued from the brink of bankruptcy in a deal hailed as a shining example of how struggling state companies can be revamped.

Headlines: U.S. removes some Chinese furniture, modems from planned 10% tariffs
Description: The Trump administration is sparing some Chinese-made household furniture, baby items and internet modems and routers from its next rounds of 10% tariffs, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Lower rates could boost housing stocks, but risks remain
Description: Lower U.S. interest rates could help support outperforming U.S. homebuilder stocks, even as they raise worries about the economy, while a bonanza of industry data and Federal Reserve speakers next week are likely to help shape the outlook.

Headlines: EQM stops some work on WV-VA Mountain Valley natgas pipe
Description: EQM Midstream Partners LP told U.S. federal regulators the company would stop some work on its long-delayed Mountain Valley natural gas pipeline from West Virginia to Virginia as the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service reviews a couple of permits.

Headlines: Wall Street ends sharply higher on German stimulus optimism
Description: U.S. stocks rebounded on Friday as an ebbing bond rally and news of potential German economic stimulus brought buyers back to the equities market, closing the book on a tumultuous week.

Headlines: Dollar firms, global stocks soar on ECB rate cut expectations
Description: U.S. and European stocks surged on Friday on expectations the European Central Bank will cut interest rates but the dollar pared gains against the euro after a report said the German government was prepared to take on new debt to lift the economy.

Headlines: Canada awards multi-billion contract to General Dynamics as election looms
Description: Canada on Friday announced a multi-billion dollar contract with General Dynamics Corp for equipment that will be manufactured in a region where the ruling Liberals need to do well in an October election.

Headlines: Irish regulator nears end of first privacy probe, ruling to take months
Description: Ireland's data privacy regulator is close to concluding its first probe into a multinational company under the EU's new privacy laws, likely to involve Facebook's WhatsApp subsidiary, although a formal decision could take months.

Headlines: Tyson recalls nearly 40,000 pounds of Weaver chicken patties
Description: Tyson Foods Inc is recalling nearly 40,000 pounds of its Weaver chicken patties after some consumers found pieces of rubber in the product, the no. 1 U.S. meat processor said.

Headlines: U.S. housing market mired in weakness; consumer sentiment ebbs
Description: U.S. homebuilding fell for a third straight month in July amid a steep decline in the construction of multi-family housing units, but a jump in permits to a seven-month high offered hope for the struggling housing market.

Headlines: U.S. drillers add oil rigs for first week since June: Baker Hughes
Description: U.S. energy firms this week increased the number of oil rigs operating for the first time in seven weeks despite plans by most producers to cut spending on new drilling this year.

Headlines: STAR Market tech board offers hope to Chinese venture capitalists
Description: When Chinese venture capital firm New Vision Capital invested in two startups focusing on cloud computing and micro-optics, the plan was to eventually take them public on the Nasdaq exchange.

Headlines: Trump says he is having dinner Friday with Apple CEO Cook
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he was having dinner on Friday with Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook of Apple Inc, a company the president has criticized for not manufacturing more of its products in the United States.

Headlines: Invesco thrives in China as former executive Ross leads Trump's trade war
Description: The former investment company of U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross has been flourishing in China, even as he marshals billions of dollars' worth of punishing tariffs in America's deepening trade war.

Headlines: Court leaves PG&E with sole right to submit bankruptcy plan
Description: A federal judge on Friday allowed PG&E Corp to retain the sole rights to propose a plan to exit bankruptcy, as he rejected efforts by investors to put forward competing plans, according to court documents.

Headlines: U.S. 30-year yields drop to record low; 10-year yields sink
Description: U.S. 30-year Treasury yields fell to a record low below 2% and benchmark 10-year notes dropped to a three-year trough on Thursday amid persistent worries about global trade tensions and economic slowdowns around the world.

Headlines: Amazon.com defeats IRS appeal in U.S. tax dispute
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Friday defeated an appeal by the U.S. Internal Revenue Service in what the online retailer has called a $1.5 billion dispute over its tax treatment of transactions with a Luxembourg subsidiary.

Headlines: Alibaba and the $15 billion question: Amid Hong Kong's protests, when to list?
Description: Hong Kong's political unrest is posing a dilemma for Alibaba Group Holding Ltd on the timing of its planned $15 billion listing in the city, with sources saying China's biggest e-commerce company is now considering several timetables.

Headlines: SoftBank plans to lend up to $20 billion to employees to invest in new fund: WSJ
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp is planning to lend up to $20 billion to its employees, including Chief Executive Masayoshi Son, to buy stakes in its second Vision Fund, the Wall Street Journal reported https://on.wsj.com/307Ljih on Saturday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Novartis to answer U.S. Senate demand for data manipulation details
Description: Novartis plans to answer a U.S. senator who demanded details about data manipulation related to its gene therapy Zolgensma, amid scrutiny of the Swiss drugmaker's decision to delay informing regulators until after the treatment's approval.

Headlines: U.S. whiskey exporters struggle after year of EU tariffs
Description: When Europe's tariffs on U.S. whiskey hit in June 2018, craft distillery Mountain Laurel Spirits LLC lost 10% of its sales overnight as its European distributor simply stopped buying its award-winning Dad's Hat Pennsylvania Rye Whiskey.

Headlines: Apple CEO warns Trump about China tariffs, Samsung competition
Description: President Donald Trump said on Sunday that he had spoken with Apple Inc's Chief Executive Tim Cook about the impact of U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports as well as competition from South Korean company Samsung Electronics Co Ltd.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce secretary: Fed policies boosting U.S. dollar
Description: Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Monday that the Trump administration was not happy with how Federal Reserve monetary policy was helping the U.S. dollar stay strong.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce Secretary Ross downplays fears of recession
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross on Monday added to a chorus of presidential officials downplaying concerns over a looming recession after the U.S. Treasury yield curve temporarily inverted last week for the first time in 12 years.

Headlines: Juul raises $325 million in equity and debt financing for global expansion
Description: U.S. e-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc has raised $325 million in an equity and debt offering to speed up its global reach at a time of intense regulatory scrutiny in its home market.

Headlines: Equinor, Gazprom lose European gas market share as LNG surges
Description: Europe's two biggest suppliers of pipeline gas, Norway's Equinor and Russia's Gazprom, have lost market share for the first time in at least four years amid a tripling in liquefied natural gas (LNG) imports into the region over the past 10 months.

Headlines: Fed's Rosengren says cutting rates could worsen next downturn: Bloomberg
Description: Boston Federal Reserve Bank President Eric Rosengren on Monday signaled no willingness to support further interest rate cuts, saying that U.S. economic conditions are still good and that easing policy could encourage a worrying debt build-up.

Headlines: Oil rises 2% after attack on Saudi field, stimulus expectations
Description: Oil prices gained roughly 2% on Monday after a weekend attack on a Saudi oil facility by Yemen's Houthi forces threatened crude supplies and as traders looked for signs that top economies would take measures to counteract a global slowdown.

Headlines: Who is next in big pharma's merger spree?
Description: Consolidation in the U.S. healthcare industry, which has already witnessed a string of multi-billion dollar deals, is expected to remain a major theme for the rest of 2019.

Headlines: Judge dismisses turnaround guru's racketeering case vs McKinsey
Description: A federal judge dismissed claims on Monday by turnaround pioneer Jay Alix that McKinsey & Co violated racketeering laws when the consulting firm expanded into advising bankrupt U.S. companies.

Headlines: Exclusive: Fearing data privacy issues, Google cuts some Android phone data for wireless carriers
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google has shut down a service it provided to wireless carriers globally that showed them weak spots in their network coverage, people familiar with the matter told Reuters, because of Google's concerns that sharing data from users of its Android phone system might attract the scrutiny of users and regulators.

Headlines: Zalando to deliver orders for Adidas French website
Description: Online fashion retailer Zalando has launched a pilot to deliver orders placed by customers in Paris on the website of Adidas as it extends moves to allow brands to use the logistics network it has built for its own ecommerce business.

Headlines: American Airlines to pay $22.1 million U.S. fine over mail delivery times: Justice Department
Description: American Airlines Group Inc, the largest U.S. airline, will pay $22.1 million to settle claims it falsely reported the times it transferred possession of U.S. mail to foreign postal administrations or other intended recipients, the U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. yield curve: Invert, steepen, repeat
Description: A swift steepening of the U.S. 2-year/10-year yield curve after it inverted last week may have given investors hope that the United States can escape recession. They should probably take a breath.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lotus Midstream mulls reversing West Texas to Cushing pipeline - sources
Description: Pipeline operator Lotus Midstream LLC may reverse flows on a line now sending crude from West Texas to Cushing, Oklahoma, the main hub for pricing U.S. crude futures, three people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday, an unusual move that could lift U.S. benchmark prices by draining supplies.

Headlines: U.S. regulators hand Wall Street a major win with stripped-down 'Volcker Rule'
Description: U.S. banking regulators on Tuesday eased trading regulations for Wall Street banks, giving them one of their biggest wins under the Trump administration but drawing criticism from consumer activists who warned of potential risks to taxpayers.

Headlines: U.S. oil firms challenge pipeline surcharge for steel tariff
Description: Two U.S. shale producers have challenged an energy pipeline operator's proposed surcharge for the Trump administration's 25% tariff on imported steel, raising the stakes for pipeline builders facing higher construction costs.

Headlines: Trump White House seeks to assuage farmer unrest over biofuel policy: sources
Description: President Donald Trump's administration has been scrambling to stem the tide of rising anger in Farm Belt states after its decision this month to allow numerous oil refiners to mix less ethanol into their gasoline, sources told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Walmart sues Tesla for negligence after repeated solar system fires
Description: Walmart Inc on Tuesday sued Tesla Inc, accusing it of "widespread negligence" that led to repeated fires of its solar systems and asking a court to force Tesla to remove solar panels from more than 240 of its U.S. stores.

Headlines: Wall Street rally ends as financial shares slide
Description: Financial shares led U.S. stocks lower on Tuesday to end a three-day rally as investors awaited comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell at the end of the week.

Headlines: U.S. conservatives say Facebook needs 'significant work' to address concerns: former senator
Description: A review by a former Republican U.S. senator concludes that political conservatives believe Facebook Inc needs to do "significant work" to satisfy their concerns that the social media website is biased, describing policies and examples that they found problematic without laying out evidence of systemic partisanship.

Headlines: Kohl's cuts 2019 margin forecast on tariffs, first half promotions cost
Description: Kohl's Corp forecast a steeper decline in full-year profit margin despite better-than-expected quarterly earnings, because of the cost of more aggressive promotions in the first half and potential hit from new tariffs on imports from China.

Headlines: Exclusive: Cigna seeks sale of group benefits insurance business - sources
Description: U.S. health insurer Cigna Corp is exploring a sale of its group benefits insurance business, which could be valued at as much as $6 billion, four people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Japan, U.S. ministers meet for trade talks as hopes for early deal fade
Description: Japan and the United States will seek to narrow gaps on trade when their top negotiators meet this week, but hopes for a deal in September are fading as both sides fail to make concessions on agriculture and automobiles, sources say.

Headlines: Wall Street rises as Target, Lowe's results point to consumer confidence
Description: Wall Street's main indexes rose on Wednesday as upbeat earnings from retailers pointed to strength in U.S. consumer demand, and held gains after minutes from last month's Federal Reserve meeting showed policymakers had debated a more aggressive interest rate cut.

Headlines: U.S. farmers, lawmakers dial up pressure on Trump over biofuel policy
Description: The agriculture and biofuel industries and their U.S. congressional allies ramped up pressure on the Trump administration on Wednesday over the relief he has given oil refiners from rules requiring use of biofuels.

Headlines: Fannie Mae names former FDIC chair Sheila Bair to board
Description: U.S. mortgage financing agency Fannie Mae said on Wednesday it named former Federal Deposit Insurance Corp chair Sheila Bair to its board.

Headlines: Illinois corn yields seen below average but improve as tour scouts go West
Description: Corn farmers in west-central Illinois are facing potentially smaller corn yields this fall in what has been a challenging growing season after extreme weather and heavy rains delayed plantings across much of the U.S. Midwest, scouts on an annual tour said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. home sales rise, boosted by lower mortgage rates
Description: U.S. home sales rose more than expected in July, boosted by lower mortgage rates and a strong labor market, signs the Federal Reserve's shift toward lower interest rates was supporting the economy.

Headlines: Trade woes are slowing U.S. economy, U.S. budget experts say
Description: Higher trade barriers, including President Donald Trump's tariffs, are slowing the U.S. economy and cutting household income, congressional budget experts warned on Wednesday, as Trump heads toward a 2020 election showdown with Democrats.

Headlines: Boeing hiring as it targets 737 MAX flights resuming ‘early 4th quarter’
Description: Boeing Co said on Tuesday it plans to add extra staff and hire "a few hundred" temporary employees at an airport in Washington state where it is storing many grounded 737 MAX jetliners, a key step in its best-case plan for resuming deliveries to airline customers in October.

Headlines: British pilots union prepared to call off Ryanair strike
Description: Ryanair can still avoid a planned strike by British pilots this week if it agrees to a new framework for talks, the chief of UK pilot union BALPA said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump attacks Ford Motor for not backing fuel economy rollback
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump stepped up a series of attacks on automakers on Wednesday for not backing his administration's plan to roll back Obama-era fuel efficiency rules, singling out Ford Motor Co in particular for backing a deal with California for stricter fuel economy standards.

Headlines: Xiaomi growth slows as fewer people buy phones, Huawei competition bites
Description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp posted its slowest revenue growth as a public company, missing analysts' estimates, as it lost market share to Huawei and customers held on to their phones before a 5G refresh.

Headlines: Exclusive: Humbled Noble Group seeks to rebuild LNG, energy businesses: sources
Description: Noble Group Holdings (Noble Holdings) plans to rebuild its liquefied natural gas (LNG) and core energy businesses and develop rare earths as it seeks new life as a niche, Asia-focused commodity trader, sources aware of the matter said.

Headlines: Texas shale towns grapple with growth as oil-bust fears fade
Description: In west Texas, the center of the U.S. oil boom, about 3,800 students at Permian High School are crammed into a campus designed for 2,500, with 20 portable buildings to help with the overflow.

Headlines: Danish regulator prepares report for police on Danske overcharging
Description: Denmark's financial watchdog has prepared a draft report to send to Danish police over Danske Bank's overcharging of customers, a scandal that led to the dismissal of the bank's former interim chief executive.

Headlines: Norway mulls alternatives to sluggish Europe for $1 trillion fund
Description: Norway's $1-trillion-plus sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, may seek to shift the balance of its investments between Europe, the Americas and Asia, a senior official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump heaps pressure on Fed and its chairman Powell to cut rates
Description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday continued to pressure the Federal Reserve and the central bank's chairman to lower interest rates, saying its policies were hampering U.S. growth and reducing the country's ability to compete economically.

Headlines: Exclusive: Philips, under investigation in U.S. and Brazil, fired whistleblower who warned of graft
Description: Healthcare giant Philips was warned of suspicious sales of its medical equipment to the Brazilian government, and failed to halt them, nearly a decade before an alleged bribery racket was exposed in the company's Brazil operations last year, Reuters has learned.

Headlines: Court grants Ryanair injunction to stop Irish pilot strike
Description: The Irish High Court on Wednesday granted Ryanair an injunction to prevent its Dublin-based pilots from going on strike later this week.

Headlines: Exclusive: Daimler to make Mercedes Benz-branded heavy trucks in China - sources
Description: German auto maker Daimler AG plans to build Mercedes Benz-branded heavy trucks in China by revamping truck plants owned by its local joint venture, according to a document seen by Reuters and two sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. home refinancing activity hits three-year high: MBA
Description: U.S. homeowners filed the most applications to refinance their current mortgages in over three years as 30-year borrowing costs slipped to their lowest levels since late 2016, the Mortgage Bankers Association said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump talks up economy, talks down Fed amid mixed data
Description: President Donald Trump said U.S. economic growth could be record-setting if the Federal Reserve would only lower interest rates further, as reports on Thursday painted a decidedly mixed picture of the nation's economy.

Headlines: Fed's Powell, under pressure, likely to stick to 'mid-cycle' message
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell comes to this year's meeting of central bankers in Jackson Hole, Wyoming, caught between discord within the U.S. central bank over appropriate monetary policy and mounting outside pressure for more interest rate cuts.

Headlines: Is the U.S. economy sinking or the strongest ever? For the Fed, no clear answer
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is under pressure from President Donald Trump to cut interest rates. Investors expect the Fed to cut, perhaps by a lot.

Headlines: U.S. factories show signs of trouble; labor market still firm
Description: Activity is contracting in the U.S. manufacturing sector but the number of Americans filing applications for unemployment benefits fell last week, signs that factories are suffering from a global slowdown even as the broader labor market remains healthy.

Headlines: Stocks edge lower as investors eye Fed's Jackson Hole meeting
Description: An index of stock markets worldwide crept lower on Thursday on uncertainty over the outlook for U.S. interest rate cuts and weak U.S. manufacturing data that raised concerns about the health of the world's largest economy.

Headlines: U.S. plans in-person China trade talks next month: White House adviser
Description: The Trump administration is still planning for a round of in-person talks between U.S. and Chinese officials in September after a constructive exchange this week between deputy-level negotiators, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Thursday.

Headlines: For U.S. housing, trade war set to blunt some of Fed stimulus: Reuters poll
Description: The U.S.-China trade war may blunt some of the stimulus on the U.S. housing market from expected further interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve, with only a modest outlook for price rises, a Reuters poll of property market experts found.

Headlines: Facing farmer anger, Trump scrambles Cabinet to brainstorm on biofuel policy: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump, faced with mounting anger in the farm belt over policies that allow oil refineries to use less corn-based ethanol, summoned Cabinet members on Thursday to discuss ways to boost biofuel demand, four sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: News Corp developing 'Knewz.com' service to take on Google News: WSJ
Description: News Corp is developing a news-aggregation service to compete with Alphabet Inc's Google News and could be launched later this year, the Wall Street Journal reported citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: S&P 500 stalls in economic data offset, ahead of Fed chair's speech
Description: The benchmark S&P 500 ended little changed on Thursday as a fall in U.S. jobless claims offset data showing a contraction in U.S. manufacturing activity while investors awaited Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's speech on Friday for clues on the central bank's monetary policy.

Headlines: Exclusive: KKR explores $5 billion sale of Epicor Software - sources
Description: Buyout firm KKR & Co Inc is exploring a sale of Epicor Software Corp that could value the U.S. enterprise resource planning software provider at close to $5 billion, including debt, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: China says hopes U.S. stops wrong tariff action, vows to retaliate if new levies imposed
Description: China said on Thursday it hopes the United States will stop its wrong tariff action, adding that any new tariffs would lead to escalation.

Headlines: Oil eases as Fed's Jackson Hole meeting gets underway
Description: Oil prices weakened on Thursday on worries about the global economy and as equity markets were on edge over the uncertain outlook for U.S. interest rate cuts.

Headlines: Fed was divided on rate cut, wanted to avoid appearing on path for more cuts
Description: Federal Reserve policymakers were deeply divided over whether to cut interest rates last month but were united in wanting to signal they were not on a preset path to more cuts, a message not likely to sit well with U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: India needs to reduce ecommerce restrictions to revive economy: Amazon executive
Description: India needs to encourage ecommerce and reduce red tape to help small businesses sell online and export goods to help revive sagging domestic economic growth, a senior Amazon.com executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Volkswagen says it is not interested in buying a Tesla stake
Description: Volkswagen on Thursday denied a media report which suggested that the German carmaker was interested in buying a stake in United States electric car manufacturer Tesla.

Headlines: Mediaset files complaint against Vivendi with Italy watchdog
Description: Mediaset has filed a complaint with Italy's market watchdog, accusing shareholder Vivendi of leaking information with a view to scuppering its corporate restructuring plans, the Italian broadcaster said on Thursday.

Headlines: Volkswagen not interested in buying Tesla stake
Description: Volkswagen said on Thursday it was not interested in taking a stake in Tesla , denying a media report that CEO Herbert Diess wanted to buy shares in the U.S. company to access its software and batteries technology.

Headlines: Explainer: What are the obstacles to Bayer settling Roundup lawsuits?
Description: Bayer AG is in mediation to potentially settle thousands of U.S. lawsuits claiming that the company's Roundup weed killer causes cancer, but some legal experts said the cases raises novel questions that may prevent an easy settlement.

Headlines: U.S. transport chief names aviation safety advisory panel
Description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao on Thursday named 22 people to a new panel that will advise the department on aviation safety oversight and certification programs as the Federal Aviation Administration continues to grapple with the fallout from two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes.

Headlines: As U.S. watchdog retreats, mortgage firms reprise cozy marketing arrangements
Description: U.S. mortgage firms are getting back into joint marketing and advertising arrangements, reviving a controversial practice that was effectively banned in the aftermath of the 2007-2008 subprime mortgage crisis.

Headlines: Navarro says China talks to continue, trade war won't slow U.S. economy
Description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said on Friday he does not believe the trade war in China will cause higher prices or a slower economy in the United States.

Headlines: Shares in Peppa Pig owner rise past Hasbro offer
Description: Peppa Pig-owner Entertainment One's shares rose more than 30% to a record high on Friday, surpassing the price agreed by the company's board with U.S. toy maker Hasbro Inc in a sign that investors see some chance of a counter offer.

Headlines: White House mulling tax cuts but not to counter short-term weakness: adviser
Description: The Trump administration is studying tax cuts to buttress long-term U.S. economic growth that could be rolled out during the 2020 election campaign but is not looking at action to counter any perceived economic weakness now, the White House economic adviser said on Thursday.

Headlines: Seeking clarity from Fed's Powell? Good luck with that
Description: When Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell speaks in Jackson Hole, Wyoming, on Friday, traders will comb through his remarks for clues on whether the U.S. central bank will deliver more rate cuts this year.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales drop sharply, point to more housing weakness
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes sank more than expected in July, a sign that the housing market continued in low gear despite lower mortgage rates and a strong labor market.

Headlines: Powell: Fed to act as appropriate to keep expansion going
Description: The U.S. economy is in a "favorable place" and the Federal Reserve will "act as appropriate" to keep the current economic expansion on track, Fed chair Jerome Powell said on Friday in remarks that gave few clues about whether the central bank will cut interest rates at its next meeting or not.

Headlines: Boeing spacecraft astronauts see new frontier for commercial space
Description: A crew of veteran U.S. astronauts and aviators are training in Houston for a manned mission to the International Space Station aboard Boeing's new Starliner spacecraft, which could also be used to take tourists into space on future missions.

Headlines: Russia starts sales of 'Putin limousine', eyes Chinese market
Description: Russia opened a showroom on Friday selling its first post-Soviet luxury limousine under the Aurus brand, a type of car used by President Vladimir Putin at his inauguration last year.

Headlines: Powell: Fed to act as appropriate to keep expansion going
Description: The U.S. economy is in a "favorable place" and the Federal Reserve will "act as appropriate" to keep the current economic expansion on track, Fed chair Jerome Powell said on Friday in remarks that gave few clues about whether the central bank will cut interest rates at its next meeting or not.

Headlines: Huawei says U.S. curbs to cut smartphone unit's revenue by over $10 billion
Description: Chinese technology giant Huawei said on Friday the impact of U.S. trade restrictions on its business will be less than what it initially feared, though the curbs could push its smartphone unit's revenue lower by about $10 billion this year.

Headlines: IMF's Gopinath says U.S. monetary policy being accommodative and data driven
Description: International Monetary Fund chief economist Gita Gopinath said on Friday that U.S. monetary policy is being accommodative and data driven.

Headlines: Volkswagen recalls 679,000 U.S. vehicles that could roll away
Description: Volkswagen AG said Friday it is recalling 679,000 U.S. vehicles sold since 2011 that could roll away because of an electrical issue.

Headlines: UBS taps BoE adviser van Steenis for sustainable finance, IR roles
Description: UBS Group has hired Huw van Steenis, a former senior adviser to Bank of England Governor Mark Carney, to head investor relations and a new sustainable finance committee at Switzerland's largest bank, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Tesla in advanced talks with LG Chem on battery supply in China: source
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc is in advanced talks with South Korea's LG Chem Ltd to source batteries for vehicles to be made in its Shanghai plant, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. fines Deutsche Bank $16 million to settle China, Russia corruption charges
Description: Deutsche Bank has agreed to pay more than $16 million to settle charges that it violated U.S. corruption laws by hiring relatives of foreign government officials in order to win or retain business, the U.S. regulator said in a statement.

Headlines: British judge orders confiscation of $1 million in cryptocurrencies from jailed hacker
Description: A London judge ordered on Friday the confiscation of bitcoin and other digital currencies worth nearly $1 million from a prolific computer hacker, in the first case of its kind for Britain's biggest police force.

Headlines: Fed's Powell vs. Trump: who's got a 'feel' for markets now?
Description: Donald Trump once accused the Federal Reserve of not having a "feel" for the market and compared Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell to a golfer who can't putt, but on Friday it was the U.S. president that drove markets into the rough.

Headlines: Factbox: From phone makers to farmers, the toll of Trump's trade wars
Description: The world's two largest economies, China and the United States, on Friday exchanged blows in the latest escalation in their trade war that has roiled supply chains and whipsawed financial markets.

Headlines: Top U.S. publishers sue Amazon's Audible for copyright infringement
Description: Amazon.com Inc's Audible was sued by some of the top U.S. publishers for copyright infringement on Friday, aiming to block a planned rollout of a feature called 'Audible Captions' that shows the text on screen as a book is narrated.

Headlines: Trump administration considers boost to biofuel mandates to ease farmer anger: sources
Description: The Trump administration is considering ramping up biofuel blending quotas in the coming years to assuage anger in the Farm Belt over its recent broad use of waivers for small refineries, but is not planning to rescind any of the exemptions it has granted so far, four sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: China to raise import tariffs on U.S. scrap copper, aluminum from December 15
Description: China will impose an extra 5% tariff on imports of copper scrap and aluminum scrap from the United States from Dec. 15, according to a list of retaliatory tariffs published by the Ministry of Finance late on Friday.

Headlines: For some, currency wars may not be fun or easy to win
Description: It's a maxim for private investors: Don't fight the Fed.

Headlines: U.S. trade group says 'unrealistic' for American retailers to exit China
Description: The U.S. National Retail Federation (NRF) said on Friday it is "unrealistic" for American retailers to move out of China, the world's second-largest economy, as 95% of the world's consumers live outside the United States.

Headlines: Trump heaps another 5% tariff on Chinese goods in latest tit-for-tat escalation
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday lashed back at a new round of Chinese tariffs by heaping an additional 5% duty on some $550 billion in targeted Chinese goods in the latest tit-for-tat trade war escalation by the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: World needs to end risky reliance on U.S. dollar: BoE's Carney
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney took aim at the U.S. dollar's "destabilizing" role in the world economy on Friday and said central banks might need to join together to create their own replacement reserve currency.

Headlines: Fed's commitment to act upstaged by Trump's furor
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the central bank would "act as appropriate" to keep the U.S. economy healthy in a deteriorating global economy, but stopped short of committing to rapid-fire rate cuts and drew fire from President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Fed's Mester sees downside risk from escalating trade war
Description: Cleveland Federal Reserve President Loretta Mester said on Saturday she sees "big downside risk" from rising trade uncertainty, and will be watching how businesses and consumers react ahead of the U.S. central bank's next policy meeting.

Headlines: China willing to resolve trade dispute with U.S. via dialogue: newspaper
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He said on Monday that China is willing to resolve its trade dispute with the United States through calm negotiations and resolutely opposes the escalation of the conflict, a state-backed newspaper reported.

Headlines: Tesla scouting sites for possible factory in Germany's NRW: Rheinische Post
Description: Electric carmaker Tesla is scouting out locations for a possible factory in the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia (NRW), Germany's most populous state, daily Rheinische Post reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: No ready spark seen for lagging U.S. energy shares
Description: There may be little relief on the horizon for investors in U.S. energy companies, whose shares moved from darlings to dismal performers during Wall Street's record bull run and now face a shaky global economy, doubts about fossil fuel investments and general market skepticism.

Headlines: German cartel office to take Facebook case to High Court
Description: The German cartel office will appeal a regional court's decision to suspend restrictions it had imposed on Facebook's data collection practices to the Federal Court of Justice, Germany's highest court.

Headlines: KKR becomes Axel Springer's biggest shareholder
Description: KKR has become the biggest shareholder of German media group Axel Springer , paying 2.9 billion euros ($3.2 billion) for a 43.54% stake, the U.S. private equity firm said on Monday.

Headlines: Japan denies it gave Trump too much in trade talks
Description: Japan's top government spokesman denied on Monday that Tokyo made too many concessions in trade talks with the United States, saying the fact the two countries were able to reach a broad agreement was "very valuable."

Headlines: Macron says France and U.S. reached digital tax deal
Description: France and the United States have reached a deal to end a standoff over a French tax on big internet companies, French President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Third Point builds stake in Ray-Ban maker EssilorLuxottica - sources
Description: Third Point LLC, the U.S. hedge fund that has pushed for changes at companies ranging from Nestle SA to Campbell Soup Co , has amassed a stake in Ray-Ban maker EssilorLuxottica SA , people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: German cartel office to take Facebook case to High Court
Description: Germany's cartel office said on Monday it would appeal a regional court decision to suspend restrictions it had placed on Facebook's data collection practices to the country's highest court.

Headlines: China says it will take 'more steps' to protect interests if U.S. enacts tariffs
Description: China's said it is ready to take more steps to protect its interests if the United States moves ahead in enacting new tariffs.

Headlines: Trump sees possible U.S.-EU trade deal that would avert car tariffs
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said he thinks the United States will be able to reach a fair trade agreement with the European Union without imposing threatened tariffs on car imports, offering a potential lifeline to German carmakers.

Headlines: Exclusive: Brazil's Petrobras refineries sale lures trading companies, PetroChina, Saudi Aramco - sources
Description: Brazil's planned privatization of eight Petroleo Brasileiro SA refineries has lured several of the world's largest trading and oil companies as prospective bidders, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Stocks, dollar rise as U.S.-China trade rhetoric softens
Description: A global gauge of equities edged higher on Monday and the dollar rebounded after U.S. President Donald Trump said Chinese officials had contacted Washington about resuming trade negotiations.

Headlines: Spirit Airlines looking at A321neo and 'larger' Boeing plane for growth: CEO
Description: Spirit Airlines , a fast-growing, low-cost U.S. carrier that flies an all-Airbus SE fleet, is looking at both the Airbus A321neo and a larger Boeing Co aircraft to fuel its growth, Chief Executive and President Ted Christie said on Monday.

Headlines: Starbucks CEO sees no signs of a looming recession - 'We're firing on all cylinders'
Description: "We have not seen signs in the U.S. of anything related to a slowdown, but we do know these things go in cycles," Starbucks CEO Kevin Johnson says.

Headlines: U.S. house prices rise in June, but momentum slowing
Description: U.S. house prices rose solidly in June, but the pace of appreciation is slowing, which together with declining mortgage rates could boost the struggling housing market.

Headlines: Mercedes Benz Brazil to invest 1.4 billion reais for new trucks, but exports still weak
Description: The Brazil unit of Mercedes Benz, the local market leader in trucks and buses, said on Tuesday it will invest 1.4 billion reais ($340 million) to launch of a new line of trucks as it expects the domestic market to grow in 2020, even if exports could fall.

Headlines: Ericsson, Deutsche Telekom team up for industrial 5G services in Germany
Description: Ericsson and Deutsche Telekom will team up to tap rising demand for mobile technology at industrial sites in Germany, as communications providers seek local uses for 5G with national deployment still years away.

Headlines: Britain to make Huawei decision on 5G by the autumn: digital minister
Description: Britain will make a decision on whether to allow China's Huawei equipment to be used in its 5G networks in the autumn, the digital minister Nicky Morgan said.

Headlines: Norway wealth fund should move more investment to North America, central bank says
Description: Norway's $1 trillion sovereign wealth fund should shift billions in investments from European stock markets and instead invest more in the United States and other North American markets to seek higher returns, the fund's manager recommended on Tuesday.

Headlines: BlackRock takes aim at CEOs serving on other companies' boards
Description: BlackRock Inc is stepping up opposition to U.S. CEOs who sit on more than one corporate board beside their own, arguing that working as a director takes increasingly more time, a report from the world's largest asset manager showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: GlobalFoundries sues TSMC, wants U.S. import ban on some products
Description: Contract chipmaker GlobalFoundries sued larger rival and Apple supplier TSMC for patent infringement, seeking to stop imports into the United States and Germany of products made with the allegedly infringed technologies.

Headlines: Uber Eats, Japan convenience store Lawson form delivery tie-up
Description: Uber Eats and Japanese convenience store chain Lawson on Tuesday announced a delivery partnership in central Tokyo, seeking to capitalize on growing demand for quick home delivery of food and everyday items.

Headlines: Three U.S. bond kings wield same strategy, get same result: lag their peers
Description: Three names dominate the U.S. world of bond investing - Jeffrey Gundlach, Dan Ivascyn and Scott Minerd. But funds run by these star investors are lagging their respective benchmarks this year.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence falls but only slightly despite trade fight
Description: U.S. consumer confidence fell less than expected in August, with households still upbeat about the labor market despite an escalation in trade tensions, which has cast a shadow over the longest economic expansion in history.

Headlines: Explainer: Ex-Google engineer faces severe penalties in self-driving trade secrets case
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Tuesday brought a criminal case against a former high-ranking Google engineer, alleging he stole confidential technology from the company's self-driving car unit before joining rival Uber Technologies Inc .

Headlines: Timeline: Autonomous car pioneer Levandowski faces criminal charges of stealing from Alphabet
Description: The U.S. Department of Justice on Tuesday filed criminal charges against Anthony Levandowski, accusing the former high-ranking Alphabet Inc engineer of stealing the company's self-driving car technology before joining rival Uber Technologies Inc .

Headlines: Business group issues wake-up call on China's corporate 'social credit' plan
Description: The rollout of China's controversial corporate "social credit system" is well under way and accelerating, a European business lobby in the country said on Wednesday, warning that foreign governments need to wake up to the plan's potential risks.

Headlines: Navigating the trade war: How to invest during turmoil
Description: The start-and-stop progress of negotiations between the United States and China aimed at ending the trade war between the world's two largest economies is souring Wall Street playbooks and increasing market volatility as investors seek to profit during the uncertainty.

Headlines: Fed rejects call to deny Trump rate cuts; Trump keeps up pressure
Description: The U.S. central bank on Tuesday rejected a call from a former Federal Reserve policymaker to counter President Donald Trump's trade agenda by refusing to "play along" and denying the president the interest rate cuts he has demanded.

Headlines: Fed divided on policy, discount rate votes show
Description: U.S. central bankers may have been more deeply divided than previously understood over the decision last month to cut interest rates for the first time in more than a decade, records from meetings held across the Fed's 12 regional Fed banks suggest.

Headlines: U.S. yield inversion deepens, stokes recession fears
Description: The U.S. yield curve inversion deepened on Tuesday to levels not seen since 2007, rekindling fears of a looming recession that spurred a sell-off on Wall Street and stoked even more safe-haven demand for government bonds.

Headlines: Exclusive: Boeing CEO eyes major aircraft order under any U.S.-China trade deal
Description: Boeing Co said on Tuesday that an aircraft order from China could result from any deal to end a yearlong trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: U.S. 30-year bond yields hit record low, curve inversion grows
Description: U.S. Treasury debt yields fell on Wednesday, with 30-year yields setting all-time lows, as fears about a recession and trade tensions between China and the United States stoked unrelenting demand for low-risk government debt.

Headlines: Boeing wins $500 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Boeing Co has been awarded a $500 million contract for providing F-15QA aircrew and maintenance training to Qatar's air force, the Pentagon said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wall Street climbs on energy, financials boost
Description: U.S. stocks climbed on Wednesday, recovering from early declines on gains in energy and financial shares, but investors remained leery about the potential for another flare-up in the U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Tiffany profit tops estimates, Hong Kong and tourism hit sales
Description: Luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co on Wednesday reported quarterly earnings that beat estimates on a drop in marketing costs even as sales were hurt by lower spending by Chinese tourists in the United States and political unrest in Hong Kong.

Headlines: Trump to announce plan to boost biofuel demand soon: U.S. agriculture secretary
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will announce a plan to boost demand for biofuels within weeks, his secretary of agriculture said on Wednesday, as the administration seeks to assuage farmers angered by its expanded use of oil refinery waivers.

Headlines: Explainer: U.S. dollar intervention: What would it take?
Description: The strength of the U.S. dollar has long been a thorn in President Donald Trump's side. That has put the almost unthinkable scenario of currency intervention up for debate in global foreign exchange circles.

Headlines: Fed's Daly says she's in a 'watch and see' mode on rates
Description: San Francisco Federal Reserve President Mary Daly on Thursday said she is in a "watch and see" mode as she assesses the need for another U.S. interest-rate cut for an economy that has "strong" momentum but faces headwinds from uncertainty and a global growth slowdown.

Headlines: Fed's Daly says her 'bias' is to run hot U.S. economy
Description: San Francisco Federal Reserve President Mary Daly on Thursday signaled support for continued U.S. monetary policy accommodation, saying she believes the benefits of running a "hot" economy currently outweigh the potential costs.

Headlines: BP to quit Alaska after 60 years with $5.6 billion sale to Hilcorp
Description: British oil major BP Plc on Tuesday agreed to sell all its Alaskan properties for $5.6 billion to privately held Hilcorp Energy Co, exiting a region where it operated for 60 years.

Headlines: Facebook tightens rules for U.S. political advertisers ahead of 2020 election
Description: Facebook Inc is tightening its political ad rules in the United States, it said on Wednesday, requiring new disclosures for its site and photo-sharing platform Instagram ahead of the U.S. presidential election in November 2020.

Headlines: U.S. judge rules for Regeneron, Sanofi in Amgen cholesterol drug patent fight
Description: A U.S. judge on Wednesday set aside a jury verdict that found Amgen Inc patents on its cholesterol drug Repatha were valid, handing a victory to Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc and Sanofi SA, which sells a rival drug.

Headlines: USDA to probe beef market after Tyson Foods slaughterhouse fire
Description: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue ordered an investigation into widening prices between cattle and beef on Wednesday after a recent fire at a Tyson Foods Inc slaughterhouse in Holcomb, Kansas, shut the plant.

Headlines: IMF staff analyzing Argentina's new debt plan: spokesman
Description: The International Monetary Fund is analyzing the impact of a new debt plan announced by Argentina's Treasury Ministry on Wednesday, an IMF spokesman said.

Headlines: Retailers howl as U.S. trade agency locks in 15% tariffs on September 1
Description: The Trump administration on Wednesday made official its extra 5% tariff on $300 billion in Chinese imports and set collection dates of Sept. 1 and Dec. 15, prompting hundreds of U.S. retail, footwear, toy and technology companies to warn of price hikes.

Headlines: Privatize Petrobras? Lofty ambition, higher hurdles
Description: Brazil's influential finance minister has convinced President Jair Bolsonaro to consider the once-unthinkable step of privatizing state-owned oil company Petrobras , but stiff political opposition could stifle any effort to sell the country's corporate crown jewel.

Headlines: Exclusive: Aramco Trading sells first U.S. West Texas Light crude to South Korea's Hyundai - sources
Description: Aramco Trading Company (ATC) sold its first-ever cargo of U.S. West Texas Light (WTL) crude, with a South Korean refiner the buyer, as the Saudi Aramco unit expands its U.S. oil dealings to boost trade volumes, four people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank says records sought in Trump congressional probe include tax returns
Description: Financial records related to U.S. President Donald Trump and three of his children that congressional Democrats have requested from Deutsche Bank AG include tax returns, the bank disclosed in a court filing on Tuesday.

Headlines: Burger King's China franchisee hires Citi for stake sale: sources
Description: Tab Food Investments (TFI), the biggest worldwide franchisee of Burger King, has asked Citigroup to help to sell a minority stake in the business in China and Turkey, a deal which could fetch at least $200 million, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. yield curve inverts further, 30-year yields hit new record low
Description: A key part of the U.S. yield curve, a closely-followed recession indicator, inverted further on Wednesday while 30-year Treasury yields fell to a few record low on growing concern about the fallout from a bitter global trade conflict.

Headlines: China's Fosun set to save Thomas Cook as key terms agreed
Description: British travel operator Thomas Cook Group said on Wednesday it had agreed the main terms of a rescue package that will see China's Fosun Tourism take over its tour operations and creditor banks and bondholders acquire its airline.

Headlines: Tiffany says sales could miss estimates if Hong Kong protests continue
Description: Tiffany & Co warned on Wednesday of the impact the ongoing protests in Hong Kong are having on the company's sales, and said any deterioration in the situation may result in the jeweler's full-year sales coming in below its own forecasts.

Headlines: Over 200 U.S. footwear companies urge Trump to scrap proposed tariff hike
Description: More than 200 U.S. footwear companies on Wednesday urged U.S. President Donald Trump to cancel proposed higher tariffs on Chinese imports that take effect beginning next month, calling them hidden taxes that will jack up consumer prices.

Headlines: U.S business groups urge Trump to postpone further China tariff hike
Description: Over 160 business groups on Wednesday appealed to U.S. President Donald Trump in a letter to postpone all tariff hikes on Chinese imports scheduled this year, warning that it could hit shoppers with higher prices during the holiday season.

Headlines: Trump likely to unveil biofuel plan in 'the next couple of weeks': Agriculture Secretary
Description: President Donald Trump is likely to announce a plan that aims to mitigate the impact of waivers granted to oil refineries on biofuel demand in the next couple of weeks, Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Volkswagen discussing Turkish car tax as it seeks deal on plant: sources
Description: German carmaker Volkswagen is holding talks with officials in Ankara over Turkey's vehicle tax regime as it seeks to conclude a 1-billion euro investment to build a production plant in Turkey, two sources said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. economy slowing, but consumers limiting downside
Description: U.S. economic growth slowed in the second quarter, the government confirmed on Thursday, but the strongest consumer spending in 4-1/2 years amid a solid labor market threw cold water on financial market expectations of a recession.

Headlines: Trump promises ethanol-related 'giant package' to please farmers
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday his administration is planning a "giant package" related to ethanol that would please U.S. farmers angry that many more oil refiners have been freed from obligations to use the corn-based fuel.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. retailers comment on latest tariff escalation
Description: Several U.S. retailers, footwear companies and business groups have warned that the long-drawn Sino-U.S. trade war would jack up consumer prices and trigger job losses.

Headlines: Dell beats profit estimates on higher desktop sales; shares rise 9%
Description: Dell Technologies Inc beat Wall Street profit estimates on Thursday, helped by higher demand for desktops, as well as a focus on more profitable contracts within its server unit in China, sending the company's shares up 9% in extended trading.

Headlines: Huawei under probe by U.S. prosecutors over new allegations: WSJ
Description: U.S. prosecutors are investigating new instances of alleged technology theft by Chinese telecommunication equipment maker Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Apple to supply parts to independent repair shops for first time
Description: Apple Inc said on Thursday it will begin selling parts, tools and repair guides to independent shops to fix broken iPhones, a major change after years of lobbying against laws in some U.S. states that would have compelled it to do just that.

Headlines: New products, remodeled stores push U.S. dollar chains to boost profit forecast
Description: The top two U.S. discount store chains raised their full-year profit forecast on Thursday as a push on adding a range of new products - from fresh food to self-owned brands - starts to pay off, cushioning a blow from increased tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: Exclusive: Novelis' $2.6 billion Aleris deal set for EU green light - sources
Description: U.S. aluminum producer Novelis is set to secure EU antitrust approval for its $2.6 billion bid for Aleris, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: UBS hires former Credit Suisse star Khan as part of broader shakeup
Description: Switzerland's biggest bank UBS on Thursday appointed former Credit Suisse manager Iqbal Khan to co-lead its flagship wealth management business, as part of a broader shake-up of its executive board.

Headlines: Argentina says to extend maturities of international bonds, IMF debt
Description: Argentina will negotiate with holders of its sovereign bonds and the International Monetary Fund to extend the maturities of its debt obligations as a way of ensuring the country's ability to pay, Treasury Minister Hernan Lacunza said on Wednesday.

Headlines: S&P calls Argentine's debt maturity extension a 'default'
Description: Ratings agency Standard & Poor's said on Thursday that Argentina's decision to "unilaterally" extend maturities on its short-term debt constituted a "default," and warned that the country's local and foreign currency sovereign credit ratings were now in "selective default."

Headlines: Tencent scraps plan to invest $150 million in Chinese education firm VIPKid: sources
Description: Tencent has shelved plans to invest about $150 million to lead a fresh fundraising round for Chinese education firm VIPKid, two people with knowledge of the matter said, as Beijing tightens oversight of online education platforms.

Headlines: Waymo urges U.S. to 'promptly' remove barriers to self-driving cars
Description: Waymo, the self-driving car unit of Google parent Alphabet Inc, on Thursday urged the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) to "promptly" remove regulatory barriers for cars without steering wheels and brake pedals.

Headlines: S&P slashes Argentina's long-term debt three notches on maturity extension plan
Description: Standard & Poors announced on Thursday that it was slashing Argentina's long-term credit rating another three notches into the deepest area of junk debt, saying the government's plan to "unilaterally" extend maturities had triggered a brief default.

Headlines: Trump says trade meeting with China set for September is still on
Description: President Donald Trump said on Friday a meeting on trade between U.S. and Chinese officials set for September was still scheduled.

Headlines: Trump says euro dropping 'like crazy' against dollar, blames Fed
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday accused the U.S. Federal Reserve Bank of inaction as the euro slid in value against the dollar, something he said gave European countries a big trade advantage.

Headlines: Wall Street Weekahead: Retailers in spotlight as tariffs on consumer products kick in
Description: U.S. retailers will be front and center on Wall Street next week as the United States imposes new tariffs on $300 billion worth of Chinese imports, including clothing, televisions and jewelry.

Headlines: Juul raises over $750 million in expanded funding round
Description: E-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc, which is facing regulatory scrutiny in the domestic U.S market, has raised $785.2 million in an equity and debt offering as it looks to expand globally, a regulatory filing showed.

Headlines: Wall Street stalls to end weak August as China tariffs loom ahead of U.S. holiday
Description: Wall Street ended the week with a lackluster session on Friday as investors were cautious ahead of a holiday weekend in which a fresh round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports were due to be levied.

Headlines: IMF board to meet for informal session about Argentina -spokesperson
Description: The executive board of the International Monetary Fund will meet for an "informal information session" on Friday to discuss recent events in Argentina, an IMF spokesman said.

Headlines: Argentina curbs banks' access to pesos amid growing market turmoil
Description: Argentina's battered bonds and currency were driven still lower on Friday amid downgrades by three credit rating agencies and a new measure the central bank said was designed to "avoid any lack of money" and safeguard the liquidity of the country's financial system.

Headlines: Google to pay up to $200 million to FTC on YouTube probe: source
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google will spend up to $200 million to settle a Federal Trade Commission investigation into YouTube's alleged violation of a children's privacy law, a person briefed on the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Cuba unveils tighter rules on cooperatives in clampdown on non-state sector
Description: Communist-run Cuba unveiled tighter regulations on non-agricultural cooperatives on Friday, including curbs on their prices, in keeping with a broader push to increase control of the growing non-state sector.

Headlines: Oil falls ahead of hurricane but posts weekly gain as U.S.-China trade war eases
Description: Oil futures fell on Friday, with U.S. crude down nearly 3% ahead of a hurricane near the Florida coast that could dampen demand, but prices were still headed for the biggest weekly increase since early July, boosted by an easing of U.S.-China trade rhetoric.

Headlines: Toxic chemical at PES refinery mostly cleared, aiding probe of June blaze
Description: Most of a highly toxic chemical stored at a fire-damaged Philadelphia oil refinery has been rendered inert, clearing the way for closer inspections of the site following a June blaze that led to the plant's closure, officials said on Friday.

Headlines: Hints of factory-driven slowdown in key 2020 U.S. election states
Description: A decline in economic activity in the U.S. Midwest, apparent in a little-noticed report on Friday from the Chicago Federal Reserve Bank, adds to evidence of slowing growth in factory-heavy corners of the country key to next year's U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: China to exempt Tesla cars from 10% purchase tax
Description: China will exempt Tesla Inc's electric vehicles from its purchase tax, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) said on Friday, a concession made amidst trade tensions with the United States.

Headlines: Boeing aims to strengthen engineering oversight after panel review
Description: Boeing Co needs to reorganize its engineering reporting lines company-wide and ensure higher ranking officials, including its CEO, get faster feedback about potential safety concerns from lower levels of the company, according to an internal review at the U.S. planemaker following two recent fatal crashes.

Headlines: Trade war with U.S. won't affect China's pork supply: Chinese ministry
Description: China said its trade dispute with the United States would not affect the Asian nation's pork supply, state-television reported on Friday, citing an official at the agriculture ministry.

Headlines: Airbus pulls out of Canada fighter jet race, boosts Lockheed Martin's chances
Description: Airbus SE on Friday pulled out of a multibillion-dollar competition to supply Canada with 88 new fighter jets, a decision that boosts the chances of rival Lockheed Martin Corp .

Headlines: Danske Bank reported to police for overcharging customers: regulator
Description: Denmark's financial watchdog said on Friday it had reported Danske Bank to the police for overcharging customers, the latest blow to the lender as it tries to restore trust after involvement in a major money laundering scandal.

Headlines: Amazon and Indian trader group in public spat over discounts
Description: Amazon.com defended its business strategies in India as it came under fire from a local trader group on Friday over discounted products on the global e-commerce giant's website.

Headlines: Factbox: Next rounds of Trump's tariffs on Chinese goods to hit consumers
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's next round of tariffs on Chinese imports is scheduled to take effect starting on Sunday, escalating the trade war between the world's two largest economies with a big hit to consumer goods.

Headlines: Delays expected at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport as KLM ground staff strike
Description: Ground staff for the Dutch arm of Air France KLM SA are set to strike on Monday morning at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport, likely causing delays and canceled flights, the Dutch union FNV said Saturday.

Headlines: China's factory activity shrinks for fourth month as trade woes deepen
Description: Factory activity in China shrank in August for the fourth month in a row as the United States ramped up trade pressure and domestic demand remained sluggish, pointing to a further slowdown in the world's second-largest economy.

Headlines: Argentines wait at banks to withdraw cash as currency controls kick in
Description: In the early hours of Monday morning in Buenos Aires, before banks had opened their doors, winding lines of customers waited to withdraw savings after Argentina's government imposed capital controls restricting dollar purchases and transfers.

Headlines: Argentina central bank to keep tight monetary policy despite currency policy changes
Description: Argentina's central bank will maintain a tight monetary policy despite changes to recently implemented currency restrictions, central bank President Guido Sandleris said on Monday.

Headlines: Frankfurt auto show touts green credentials amid climate protests
Description: The Frankfurt Auto Show will champion sustainable driving and electric cars, Germany's auto industry association said on Monday, as it seeks to head off protests from climate activists.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia names head of PIF as Aramco chairman
Description: Saudi Arabia has named Yasir al-Rumayyan, head of the kingdom's sovereign wealth fund, known as the PIF, as chairman of Aramco, replacing Energy Minister Khalid al-Falih, as the state oil giant prepares to go public.

Headlines: Energy ministers of Russia, Iran discuss investment projects
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak and his Iranian counterpart, Reza Ardakanian have discussed the development of joint energy investment projects during their meeting in Moscow on Monday, the Russian ministry said in a statement.

Headlines: Dutch minister: I did not have contact with Uber on tax plan
Description: The top Dutch tax politician has denied meeting representatives of Uber Technologies, in answer to questions from parliament about why the company has been allowed to claim a provisional $6.1 billion tax write-off in the Netherlands.

Headlines: VW retains access to U.S. public sector contracts, agrees to second monitor at HQ
Description: Volkswagen will not be excluded from public sector contracts in the United States following its emissions scandal but will install a second U.S. monitor at its German headquarters, a spokesman for the carmaker said on Monday.

Headlines: Factories fettered by trade wars, faltering demand in August
Description: The bitter trade war between China and the United States kept global factory activity largely in decline in August, business surveys showed, strengthening the case for policymakers to unleash fresh stimulus to fend off recession risks.

Headlines: China aims to rev up shale gas drive, wean itself off imports amid U.S. trade row
Description: China aims to slash its growing dependence on gas imports by boosting domestic projects like shale fields as the security of its energy supply comes under the spotlight amid a festering trade war with the United States.

Headlines: Bankers' exits and zombie accounts: China's Shanghai free trade zone sputters
Description: When China launched the expansion of the Shanghai free trade zone (FTZ) recently and announced six new zones in July, officials touted the efforts to attract foreign investment and deepen trade ties with neighboring countries.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi plans $1.5 billion buyback to arrest stock tumble
Description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp announced a HK$12 billion ($1.53 billion) share buyback plan on Tuesday, in a reversal of its cash-management strategy that is aimed at boosting its floundering stock.

Headlines: Roche, Spark again extend $4.3 billion takeover offer
Description: Roche Holding and Spark Therapeutics announced on Tuesday another extension of the Swiss drugmaker's $4.3 billion takeover offer for the U.S. gene therapy specialist as regulatory reviews continue.

Headlines: Trade war dents Chinese company profits, portfolio inflows
Description: Some Chinese business sectors reported solid first half earnings, though a substantial fall in industrial profits and in tepid overseas investment inflows into China's stock markets show fallout from the protracted trade war with the United States.

Headlines: Kroger asks customers to quit openly carrying guns in stores
Description: U.S. grocer Kroger Co has begun asking customers to stop openly carrying firearms in stores, a change in policy, a spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Factbox: Recent U.S. corporate responses to gun violence
Description: A series of mass shootings in the United States, including one each in Texas and Ohio last month that killed 31 people, once again has revived a national debate on firearms regulation, which in the past has led retailers and other U.S. companies to tighten restrictions on gun sales.

Headlines: Wall Street traders pump up Argentine peso as currency controls hit home
Description: Argentina's peso surged on Tuesday, pumped up by Wall Street traders cheering President Mauricio Macri's capital controls that are aimed at protecting the beleaguered currency.

Headlines: Tyson cuts profit forecast, says slaughterhouse fire among challenges
Description: Tyson Foods Inc lowered its 2019 adjusted earnings forecast on Tuesday, citing a litany of causes including a recent fire at its Holcomb slaughterhouse and volatility in the commodity market.

Headlines: Exclusive: OxyContin maker prepares 'free-fall' bankruptcy as settlement talks stall
Description: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP is preparing to seek bankruptcy protection before the end of the month if it does not reach a settlement with U.S. communities over widespread opioid litigation, three people familiar with the matter said, after some states balked at the company's $10 billion to $12 billion offer in August to end their lawsuits as part of a negotiated Chapter 11 case.

Headlines: 'Flight shaming' threatens air travel demand beyond Europe: IATA chief
Description: This summer, U.S. airlines have enjoyed booming flight demand, immune to a Swedish-born "flight shaming" movement that has hit air travel in Europe, where environmentally conscious travelers are choosing trains over planes.

Headlines: Japanese automakers' sales fall in South Korea amid consumer boycott
Description: Japanese automakers posted sharper sales falls in South Korea in August, industry data showed on Wednesday, hit by a consumer boycott of Japanese vehicles amid a worsening diplomatic row between the countries.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury yields drop, stocks slide as global slowdown fears loom
Description: Benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury yields fell on Tuesday to their lowest since July 2016 and all three major U.S. stock indexes lost ground in a risk-off session driven by heightened trade worries and an unexpected contraction of U.S. factory activity.

Headlines: Oil sinks as manufacturing data feeds global economy worries
Description: Oil prices fell on Tuesday, with U.S. crude futures down 2% after manufacturing data raised concerns about a weakening global economy, while the U.S.-China trade dispute continued to drag on investor sentiment.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing shrinks, 10-year yield hits three-year low
Description: U.S. Treasury yields fell on Tuesday, with the benchmark 10-year yield hitting its lowest since July 2016, after U.S. manufacturing data showed the first contraction since 2016 on worries about a weakening global economy and U.S.-China trade tensions.

Headlines: Barclays, Julius Baer bolster wealth business with ex-Credit Suisse bankers
Description: Britain's Barclays and Switzerland's Julius Baer have targeted Credit Suisse's International Wealth Management business, which in July saw the departure of its head Iqbal Khan, to hire a total of 14 bankers.

Headlines: Executive's flight to PSA highlights Renault-Nissan tensions
Description: A senior Renault-Nissan executive has quit the troubled carmaking alliance to join Peugeot maker PSA Group , blaming Renault boss Thierry Bollore for forcing his exit.

Headlines: Oil industry urges Trump administration to dismiss biofuel industry wish list
Description: The American Petroleum Institute on Tuesday urged the Trump administration to reject proposals floated by U.S. farmers and ethanol producers to boost ethanol demand, the latest development in the clash over biofuel policy.

Headlines: Papua New Guinea to investigate terms of UBS loan
Description: Papua New Guinea will start preliminary hearings on Sept. 19 into the terms of a A$1.2 billion ($810.5 million) loan from Swiss bank UBS used for an ill-fated government investment in the gas sector, the inquiry's chairman said on Monday.

Headlines: Illinois joins lawsuit to stop T-Mobile, Sprint merger
Description: Illinois has joined a multistate lawsuit aimed at stopping the merger of U.S. wireless carriers T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp , the New York attorney general's office, which is leading the effort along with California, said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Netflix applies for license under new Turkish broadcasting rules
Description: U.S. online streaming service Netflix has applied for a license to continue operating in Turkey under new online broadcasting rules that have raised fears over possible censorship in the future.

Headlines: Burger King to launch meatless 'Rebel Whopper' in Brazil
Description: Burger King will launch a plant-based burger imitating meat called the "Rebel Whopper" in Brazil in November, the company said on Tuesday, amid an international rush for mass-market chains to cater to vegetarian and vegan diners.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing contracts as trade war with China bites
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity contracted for the first time in three years in August, with new orders and hiring declining sharply as trade tensions weighed on business confidence, raising financial market fears of a recession.

Headlines: Oil prices rise over 4% on positive economic data from China
Description: Oil prices rose more than 4% on Wednesday, boosted by a wider market pickup on positive news from China, after three days of losses due to fears about a weakening global economy.

Headlines: Equities advance, U.S. Treasury yield curve steepens on easing geopolitical fears
Description: Stocks rebounded worldwide on Wednesday, and the U.S. Treasury yield curve steepened as upbeat geopolitical news and positive economic data from China helped revive risk appetite.

Headlines: U.S. biodiesel industry leaders urge Trump's EPA to lift biodiesel mandate
Description: U.S. biodiesel industry leaders told an Environmental Protection Agency regional administrator in Houston on Wednesday that they want the Trump administration to boost the volume of biodiesel that oil refiners must blend into their fuel each year, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. judge approves CVS purchase of insurer Aetna
Description: A federal judge reviewing a Justice Department decision to allow U.S. pharmacy chain and benefits manager CVS Health Corp to merge with health insurer Aetna said on Wednesday that the agreement was in fact legal under antitrust law.

Headlines: U.S. economy growing modestly as trade war dents activity: Fed
Description: The U.S. economy grew at a modest pace in recent weeks, with manufacturing buffeted by a global slowdown while consumer purchases gave mixed signals on the strength of household spending, the Federal Reserve reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: New York Fed's Williams still sees above-trend growth despite risks
Description: New York Federal Reserve President John Williams said on Wednesday he still expects the U.S. economy to expand at an above-trend pace of 2.0%-2.5% in 2019 despite low business investment and trade uncertainty.

Headlines: Dozen Goldman partners could possibly exit by 2019-end: WSJ
Description: As many as a dozen partners at Goldman Sachs Group Inc are negotiating an exit from the bank and are likely to leave by the end of 2019, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Marks & Spencer to be kicked out of FTSE 100 for first time
