Description: Marks & Spencer will be relegated from London's FTSE 100 index for the first time since the inception of the blue-chip index in 1984, according to Reuters calculations based on Tuesday's closing prices.

Headlines: To cut or not? Dueling Fed views boost pressure on Powell
Description: The Federal Reserve should use its meeting in two weeks to aggressively cut interest rates, one U.S. central banker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: BAT launches more vaping products in Japan to take on Philip Morris
Description: British American Tobacco said it would launch two new tobacco heating products in Japan under its glo brand, as it seeks to close the gap with market leader Philip Morris International Inc in the country's fast-growing vaping industry.

Headlines: Exclusive: In U-turn, Ford ditches plan to unify China sales system after partners push back
Description: Ford Motor Co has scrapped a plan to create a unified national sales company for China that stoked mistrust of the automaker at its joint venture partners and contributed to a spectacular collapse in sales in the world's biggest car market.

Headlines: JLR to launch 30 new vehicles in China over next two years
Description: Luxury carmaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) plans to launch 30 new or revamped vehicles in China in the next two years, it said on Wednesday, seeking to build on a recent recovery in sales in the world's biggest auto market.

Headlines: Effort to disqualify lawyer part of U.S. campaign against Huawei: counsel
Description: The effort to stop a former U.S. Justice Department official from representing Huawei is another step in a broader U.S. government campaign against the Chinese company, a lawyer for Huawei argued on Wednesday.

Headlines: New York City sues T-Mobile over 'rampant' customer sales abuses
Description: New York City sued T-Mobile USA Inc on Wednesday, accusing the fourth-largest U.S. mobile phone company of engaging in "rampant" sales abuses of customers for its lower-priced, prepaid wireless brand, Metro by T-Mobile.

Headlines: T-Mobile US workers worry Sprint deal will mean job losses
Description: T-Mobile US retail employees and technicians delivered a letter late Tuesday for Deutsche Telekom CEO Tim Hoettges, seeking assurances that their jobs and paychecks will be safe if the wireless carrier is allowed to merge with Sprint, its smaller rival.

Headlines: Google's YouTube to pay $170 million penalty for collecting data on kids
Description: Google, which is owned by Alphabet Inc, and its YouTube video service will pay $170 million to settle allegations that it broke federal law by collecting personal information about children, the Federal Trade Commission said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Malaysia aims to recover nearly $1 billion paid out by former 1MDB unit
Description: Malaysia is pursuing civil action to recover about 4 billion ringgit ($954.65 million) of funds disbursed by a former subsidiary of 1MDB, a now-defunct state fund under investigation for money laundering, the finance minister said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Former Nissan boss Ghosn's trial to begin as early as March - Kyodo
Description: The trial of Carlos Ghosn, the former head of Nissan Motor Co who has been charged with financial misconduct in Japan, will begin as early as March, Kyodo News said on Thursday, citing his defense lawyer.

Headlines: Amazon may need to raise prices to offset latest tariff blow: BofA
Description: Amazon.com Inc will need to raise prices in the United States by about 2.1%-2.6% on average to offset the impact of fresh tariffs slapped by the Trump administration on various Chinese goods, Bank of America Merrill Lynch analysts estimated.

Headlines: Stocks rally, Treasury yields rise on easing trade fears
Description: U.S. stocks followed worldwide equities to one-month highs and Treasury yields rose sharply on Thursday as renewed U.S.-China trade optimism and upbeat U.S. economic data stoked risk appetite and lured investors away from safe-haven assets.

Headlines: U.S. services sector suggests economy weathering trade storm
Description: U.S. services sector activity accelerated in August and private employers boosted hiring, suggesting the economy continued to grow at a moderate pace despite trade tensions which have stoked financial market fears of a recession.

Headlines: GM will use Google to power future infotainment systems
Description: General Motors Co will use embedded Google technology to power navigation, voice activated controls and other vehicle infotainment functions starting in 2021, in a win for Alphabet Inc in the race with Amazon.com and other technology companies to control dashboards.

Headlines: Sony appeals to film lovers with slimline Xperia 5 smartphone
Description: Sony launched the Xperia 5, a slimline version of its flagship smartphone, at the IFA consumer electronics fair in Berlin on Thursday as it seeks to strengthen its appeal to its niche audience of video, film and music lovers.

Headlines: Brokerage Charles Schwab closing Singapore office two years after launch
Description: Discount brokerage company Charles Schwab Corp will close its Singapore office by the end of this year, only about two years after opening it in late 2017.

Headlines: Nordea names former Handelsbanken boss as new CEO
Description: Finland's Nordea on Thursday named Frank Vang-Jensen, head of personal banking at the Nordic region's biggest bank, as its new chief executive, who pledged to keep a close eye on costs at the group.

Headlines: Tesla's use of individual driver data for insurance 'state-by-state proposition'
Description: Tesla Inc's use of individual customer data, such as vehicle camera footage and GPS, to price its new insurance products will depend on drivers' authorization and individual U.S. state laws, a senior company executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: GM CEO Barra to meet with Trump Thursday: White House
Description: General Motors Chief Executive Mary Barra will meet with U.S. President Donald Trump and White House officials on Thursday -- just days after GM came under attack from Trump, the White House confirmed late Wednesday.

Headlines: USTR confirms ministerial level China trade talks in 'coming weeks'
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin spoke with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He and agreed to hold ministerial-level trade talks in Washington "in the coming weeks," a USTR spokesman said late on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump to meet with USDA, EPA officials about biofuels plan: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to meet with Department of Agriculture and Environmental Protection Agency officials late Thursday to consider a plan that would include boosting biofuels requirements for 2020 by 1 billion gallons, according to two sources familiar with the discussions.

Headlines: House panel to discuss Big Tech's impact on privacy, antitrust
Description: The House of Representatives' antitrust panel will hold a hearing next week to discuss the effect of consumer data collection by big tech platforms, like Alphabet's Google and Amazon, on online competition.

Headlines: Fannie, Freddie and the government: it's complicated
Description: The Trump administration wants to take Fannie and Freddie out of government conservatorship, but doing so will be complicated due to the central role they play in the housing market and the Treasury's holdings in the two firms.

Headlines: Explainer: U.S., China more divided than ever as new trade talks loom
Description: Senior U.S. and Chinese officials have pledged to meet in October to settle their ongoing trade war but a lasting peace seems more elusive than ever.

Headlines: Paxos gets U.S. regulator nod for gold-backed token, dollar-backed stablecoin
Description: Paxos Trust Company launched the first regulated, gold-backed digital token and later this month will debut a stablecoin pegged to the U.S. dollar, after getting approval from New York regulators on Thursday.

Headlines: GM CEO Barra calls meeting with Trump 'productive and valuable'
Description: General Motors Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Mary Barra said her face-to-face session with U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday was "productive and valuable," but declined to offer specifics.

Headlines: U.S. hiring cools; wages, hours offer silver lining
Description: U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in August, with retail hiring declining for a seventh straight month, but strong wage gains should support consumer spending and keep the economy expanding moderately amid rising threats from trade tensions.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. congressional probe finds possible lapses in Deutsche Bank controls - sources
Description: U.S. congressional investigators have identified possible failures in Deutsche Bank AG's money laundering controls in its dealings with Russian oligarchs, after the lender handed over a trove of transaction records, emails and other documents, three people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Wall Street ticks higher after jobs data, Chinese stimulus plan
Description: U.S. stocks edged higher on Friday as a new Chinese stimulus plan helped ease some concerns around global growth, while investors digested underwhelming jobs data that rounded off a week of mixed economic signals.

Headlines: Merkel says Germany is open for Chinese investment
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Friday that Germany is open for Chinese investment and she welcomes all Chinese companies to invest in the country.

Headlines: No place like home: Chinese firms stung by trade war build up domestic brands
Description: For over a decade, manufacturer Matsutek plied away at building its business with big Western brands, supplying firms such as Philips and Honeywell with products made in its Chinese factories for the U.S. and other overseas markets.

Headlines: U.S. August payrolls rose less than expected
Description: U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in August, with retail hiring declining for a seventh straight month, but strong wage gains should support consumer spending and keep the economy expanding moderately amid rising threats from trade tensions.

Headlines: Spirit Airlines sales to take $25 million hit from Hurricane Dorian
Description: Spirit Airlines on Friday cut its third-quarter outlook for a key revenue measure as it estimates an approximate $25 million hit on its sales, hurt by hundreds of flights cancellations due to Hurricane Dorian.

Headlines: Wall St. week ahead: Another recent inversion could provide support for stocks
Description: A decline in interest rates on long-term U.S. government bonds below the average stock dividend yield has received less attention than an inverted Treasury yield curve, but it could be a reason stocks find support after a bruising August.

Headlines: Oil Search woes in Papua New Guinea throw spotlight on Alaska
Description: With a giant gas project expansion in the tropical highlands of remote Papua New Guinea bogged down by politics, the country's biggest company, Oil Search , is turning for growth to the other side of the world in Alaska's frozen wilderness.

Headlines: Stockpiles of tomatoes? UK retailers bristle at demands of no-deal Brexit
Description: A British demand for supermarkets to prepare for a potentially chaotic no-deal Brexit by stockpiling food is stoking anger in the industry, with bosses saying they should not be blamed if people can't find everything they want on the shelves.

Headlines: U.S. home purchase sentiment edges up in August: Fannie Mae
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment about buying a home ticked up in August as expectations about falling mortgage rates offset reduced optimism about home price appreciation and the timing to buy and sell a home, Fannie Mae said on Monday.

Headlines: Ferrari mixes sport with power in new Spider and GTS models
Description: Italy's Ferrari showed off two new cars on Monday as it pursues an aggressive roll-out of new premium models to sustain turbo-charged core earnings and share price growth.

Headlines: Explainer: Big tech probes could break up firms, result in huge fines, or neither
Description: The potential penalties for several wide-ranging investigations into whether Facebook, Google and other big U.S. tech companies used their market power unfairly include everything from breaking up the companies, to large fines and forcing them to create more competition.

Headlines: Apple may spark upgrade rush with new iPhones, tight pricing
Description: Apple Inc could sell as many as 200 million of its latest iPhones from existing users upgrading their older devices and much of that demand will come from China despite an ongoing trade war, several Wall Street analysts said on Monday.

Headlines: Pompeo looking forward to completed U.S.-Japan trade deal at U.N. General Assembly
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Monday he was looking forward to a completed U.S.-Japan trade agreement at the United Nations General Assembly in New York later this month.

Headlines: Elliott Management calls for AT&T shake-up as Trump piles on
Description: Activist investor Elliott Management Corp on Monday unveiled a $3.2 billion stake in AT&T Inc and urged the sprawling U.S. telecommunications and media conglomerate to end its acquisition spree and focus on improving its business.

Headlines: Wall Street ends flat amid rate hopes, tech declines
Description: U.S. stocks ended flat on Monday as increased expectations of stimulus from central banks around the world were offset by losses in technology and healthcare shares.

Headlines: Telefonica plans to offer voluntary redundancy to up to 20% of Spain staff: source
Description: Telefonica plans to offer voluntary redundancy to up to a fifth of its workforce in Spain, a person with knowledge of the matter said on Monday, as the telecoms company struggles to boost earnings in its home market.

Headlines: Trump calls activist shareholder moves on AT&T 'great news'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday weighed in on activist investor Elliott Management Corp's moves targeting AT&T Inc , calling the hedge fund's actions "great news" and repeating his criticism of the wireless carrier's CNN news division.

Headlines: U.S. charges Chinese professor in latest shot at Huawei
Description: U.S. prosecutors have charged a Chinese professor with fraud for allegedly taking technology from a California company to benefit Huawei, in another shot at the embattled Chinese telecommunications equipment maker.

Headlines: Wall Street opens higher on hopes of monetary stimulus
Description: U.S. stocks opened higher for the fourth straight session on Monday, as mixed global economic data lifted expectations of monetary stimulus from central banks, including the U.S. Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Britain at risk of losing leading edge in maritime services
Description: Britain's position as a top hub for maritime services is being eroded by competition, a loss of shipping finance business and the removal of tycoon-friendly tax breaks, a report said, deepening uncertainty for its financial sector as Brexit nears.

Headlines: Geely to bring air taxis to China in tie-up with Daimler-backed Volocopter
Description: German startup Volocopter said it plans to form a partnership with Zhejiang Geely Holding Group that will bring its air taxis to China and that it has raised 50 million euros ($55.13 million) in fresh funding from the Chinese company and others.

Headlines: Japan downgrades second-quarter GDP as trade war hits business investment
Description: Japan's economy grew at a slower pace than initially estimated in the second quarter as the U.S.-China trade war prompted a downward revision of business spending, intensifying calls for the central bank to deepen stimulus this month.

Headlines: Uber Eats to pull out of South Korea amid tough competition
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's restaurant delivery business will terminate its service in South Korea, Uber Eats said on Monday.

Headlines: Citi's Atiq Rehman appointed head of EMEA emerging markets business
Description: Citigroup Inc has appointed Atiq Rehman, currently Middle East and Africa head at the U.S. bank, as the head of the newly created EMEA Emerging Markets Cluster, according to an internal email sent on Monday and seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Huawei feels no big impact from Czech, Polish security fears
Description: Security concerns in Poland and the Czech Republic over telecoms equipment made by Huawei Technologies have not had a significant business impact despite creating uncertainty, a deputy head of central Europe and the Nordics said.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury chief weighing next steps amid French tax spat
Description: The United States is meeting with technology and other companies as it considers its options following a row with Paris over France's tax on big internet firms, the U.S. Treasury secretary said on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Repsol in advanced talks to buy Exxon assets in Gulf of Mexico - sources
Description: Spanish oil giant Repsol SA is in advanced talks to acquire some deepwater assets in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico from Exxon Mobil Corp for about $1 billion, three people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Bond yields, stock prices supported ahead of central bank meetings
Description: Asian stock markets held firm and bond yields rose on Wednesday as hopes of diminishing U.S.-China tensions and reduced risk of no-deal Brexit prompted investors to take profit in risk-off trade ahead of key central bank policy meetings.

Headlines: Airlines see new government in Venezuela as key to repayment of debt: IATA
Description: International airlines are pinning their hopes on a change of government in Venezuela before some $4 billion owned to the firms by the state might be repaid, a top executive with the International Air Transport Association (IATA) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tearful Ma bids Alibaba farewell with rock star show
Description: A tearful Jack Ma formally left Alibaba on Tuesday, donning a guitar and a rock star wig at an event for thousands of employees of the e-commerce giant he founded 20 years ago in a small shared apartment in Hangzhou city in eastern China.

Headlines: GE to lose majority control of Baker Hughes with up to $3 billion share sale
Description: General Electric is looking to raise up to $3 billion in sale of majority-owned Baker Hughes shares, resulting in a reduction of the U.S industrial conglomerate's stake in the oilfield services provider to less than 50%, Baker Hughes said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China to buy U.S. goods to sweeten trade deal: SCMP
Description: China is expected to buy more agricultural products in hope for a better trade deal with the United States, South China Morning Post reported https://bit.ly/2manJ5q on Tuesday, citing a source.

Headlines: Apple leans on devices business in global battle against Disney, Netflix
Description: Apple Inc , the company that transformed the music, mobile and personal computing industries, is relying on the ubiquity of its iPhones and iPads to take on Disney and Netflix in the battle for streaming TV customers.

Headlines: IBM, Fraunhofer partner on German-backed quantum computing research push
Description: IBM is joining forces with a German research institute to explore the potential of quantum computing, backed by a government plan to invest 650 million euros ($717 million) over two years in wider research in the field.

Headlines: Overhaul Fannie and Freddie or we will act, Trump administration tells Congress
Description: The Trump administration will pursue the reform of mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac , the guarantors of over half the nation's mortgages, if Congress fails to act, officials told Congress on Tuesday.

Headlines: Ahead of election year, more Americans lack health insurance, incomes stall
Description: The share of Americans without health insurance rose for the first time in a decade last year and U.S. household income hardly budged, according to a government report on Tuesday that laid bare issues that could be central to the U.S. presidential election next year.

Headlines: Declining U.S. vacancies point to slowing job growth
Description: U.S. job openings fell for a second straight month in July amid decreases in wholesale trade and the federal government, bolstering economists' views that job growth has peaked.

Headlines: U.S. sets preliminary duties of up to 222% on Chinese ceramic tile
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Tuesday that it found that imports of ceramic tile from China are unfairly subsidized and it imposed preliminary duties on them ranging from about 104% to 222%.

Headlines: Trump rules out for now cutting capital-gains taxes
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has ruled out for now slashing taxes on capital gains after a meeting with his advisers, a White House spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Great Wall may consider building cars in Europe once sales hit 50,000 a year: chairman
Description: China's Great Wall Motor may consider building car manufacturing facilities in the European Union once its sales there hit 50,000 units a year, its chairman said, as part of a push to seek growth in overseas markets.

Headlines: U.S. IPOs hope for stock market volatility reprieve
Description: U.S. companies planning to launch initial public offerings (IPOs) in the coming weeks are hoping that August's bout of stock market volatility will subside this month, according to investment bankers and capital markets lawyers advising them.

Headlines: U.S. judge approves novel framework for opioid settlement talks
Description: A federal judge on Wednesday approved the substance of a proposal by lawyers representing cities and counties suing drug companies over the U.S. opioid epidemic that would bring every state and municipality in the country into their settlement talks.

Headlines: Purdue Pharma reaches tentative opioid settlement with some: sources
Description: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP reached a tentative agreement with some plaintiffs to resolve litigation over its alleged role in fueling the U.S. opioid crisis and plans to tussle with states opposing the settlement offer in bankruptcy proceedings as soon as next week, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific freezes new hiring, to focus on cost cuts: memo
Description: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd has put a freeze on new hiring, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters, as the airline battles a slump in demand from fliers avoiding Hong Kong amid massive anti-government protests in the city.

Headlines: Purdue OxyContin settlement would rank among largest in pharma history
Description: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP has reached a tentative multibillion-dollar agreement with some plaintiffs aimed at settling thousands of lawsuits over its alleged role in the U.S. opioid crisis, Reuters reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Trump's call for negative rates threatens savers
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's push for low interest rates reached a new pitch on Wednesday, when he demanded the Federal Reserve take the extraordinary step of sending them below zero.

Headlines: Note to Trump: Negative rates have delivered few positive results
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted with envy on Wednesday about the ultra-low, even negative interest rates in other parts of the world, berating what he called the "boneheads" at the Federal Reserve for not following suit.

Headlines: Trade hopes buoy Wall Street as China extends olive branch
Description: Wall Street moved higher on Wednesday, led by tariff-sensitive technology and industrial stocks after China extended an olive branch ahead of next month's trade negotiations with the United States.

Headlines: Stocks buoyed by trade hopes, bond yields up with ECB on deck
Description: A gauge of global equity markets climbed on Wednesday on signs of gradual progress in the trade war between the United States and China, while bond yields rose as investors remained unconvinced what stimulus measures the European Central Bank will provide at its meeting on Thursday.

Headlines: Italy's 5-Star Movement says to monitor closely Hong Kong's bid for LSE
Description: Italy's ruling 5-Star Movement will monitor closely a bid by Hong Kong Exchange for the London Stock Exchange to ensure it does not hurt Italian interests, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump reverses course, seeks negative rates from Fed 'boneheads'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday called on the "boneheads" at the Federal Reserve to push interest rates down into negative territory, a move reluctantly used by other world central banks to battle weak economic growth that risks punishing savers and banks' earnings in the process.

Headlines: Trump: U.S. agrees to delay tariff hike on some Chinese goods by two weeks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday the United States has agreed to delay increasing tariffs on $250 billion worth of Chinese imports from Oct. 1 to Oct. 15 "as a gesture of good will."

Headlines: Analyst view: Negative rates? Not so fast, says Wall Street
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's pining for negative rates was widely panned on Wall Street where strategists and traders said such a move would be unjustified and extreme, and not advisable based on the experience in other countries.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices rise; Fed rate cut still expected
Description: U.S. producer prices unexpectedly rose in August, but the overall trend in producer inflation remains tame, cementing financial market expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates again next week to support a slowing economy.

Headlines: Explainer: How does negative rate policy work?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has suggested that the U.S. Federal Reserve drive interest rates into negative territory. He says his motivation was to refinance the U.S. government's $22 trillion in outstanding debt and lengthen the amount of time over which it is repaid. [nL2N26208B]

Headlines: Switzerland warns Facebook's Libra it will face extra scrutiny
Description: Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency suffered another setback on Wednesday when Switzerland said the proposed payments system could face strict rules that typically apply to banks, on top of tough anti-money laundering laws.

Headlines: As trade war pinches China, it opens doors wide for foreign money
Description: As the Sino-U.S. trade war drags on, Beijing is throwing its door wide open to foreign investors as concerns grow over declining exports, capital flight and persistent yuan weakness.

Headlines: GM recalls 3.8 million vehicles in North America due to braking issue
Description: General Motors Co said Wednesday it was recalling 3.46 million U.S. pickup trucks and SUVs to address a vacuum pump issue that could make braking more difficult and that has been linked to 113 accidents and 13 injuries.

Headlines: Exclusive: Ahead of trade talks, China makes biggest U.S. soybean purchases since June - traders
Description: Privately run Chinese firms bought at least 10 boatloads of U.S. soybeans on Thursday, the country's most significant purchases since at least June, traders said, ahead of high-level talks next month aimed at ending a bilateral trade war that has lasted more than a year.

Headlines: Exclusive: Two JPMorgan metals executives put on leave amid U.S. probe - source
Description: Two JPMorgan Chase & Co employees, including a top metals trading executive, have been placed on leave in response to a U.S. criminal investigation into the bank’s metals trading practices, according to a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Brazilian lithium producer Sigma in talks with Tesla, other automakers
Description: Brazil-based lithium startup Sigma Lithium Resources Corp has held talks with Tesla Inc and other automakers about supplying the key battery ingredient in the coming years, the company's chief executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Draghi ties Lagarde's hands with promise of indefinite stimulus
Description: European Central Bank chief Mario Draghi pledged indefinite stimulus on Thursday to revive an ailing euro zone economy, tying the hands of his successor for years to come and sparking an immediate conflict with U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: IMF says it remains engaged in Argentina, focuses on stabilizing economy
Description: The International Monetary Fund is continuing talks with Argentina as authorities there try to stem spiraling economic problems in Latin America's third-largest economy, IMF spokesman Gerry Rice told reporters on Thursday.

Headlines: Mexico's Pemex places $7.5 billion of bonds in record refinancing operation
Description: Mexican state oil company Pemex said on Thursday it had placed $7.5 billion worth of bonds with maturities of seven, 10 and 30 years that will be used for debt refinancing.

Headlines: U.S. corruption probe involving lavish parties, champagne hits another top UAW official
Description: Just two days before the UAW's contracts with Detroit automakers were due to expire, U.S. prosecutors arrested and charged a senior union official on Thursday with embezzlement, releasing a complaint that alleges he spent member dues on lavish parties for union leaders, with liquor, cigars and women to light them.

Headlines: Reuters asks judge to release secret Propecia documents
Description: Reuters asked a U.S. judge on Thursday to unseal documents filed in court regarding potential risks associated with Propecia, Merck & Co's popular baldness drug.

Headlines: Grand jury indicts GE's Baker Hughes for exposing workers to toxic chemicals
Description: A grand jury in Alaska this week indicted General Electric's Baker Hughes, two of its subsidiaries and an employee, for 25 felony charges of assault relating to toxic chemical releases at a construction site, according to authorities.

Headlines: Three U.S. senators urge Amazon's Bezos to check driver abuse
Description: Three U.S. senators on Thursday said Amazon.com Inc should stop working with delivery contractors that violate labor laws by imposing unfair conditions on drivers delivering packages for the e-commerce company.

Headlines: U.S. court upholds ex-HSBC executive's conviction for foreign-exchange scheme
Description: A U.S. appeals court on Thursday upheld the conviction of a former HSBC Holdings Plc executive who was sentenced to two years in prison for defrauding Cairn Energy Plc in a $3.5 billion currency trade.

Headlines: Trump says he will unveil 'middle-income' tax plan in 2020
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday his administration would unveil a tax overhaul plan aimed at middle-income households next year, amid the 2020 presidential election.

Headlines: U.S. core inflation firming, but Fed still seen cutting rates
Description: U.S. underlying consumer prices increased solidly in August, leading to the largest annual gain in a year, but rising inflation is unlikely to deter the Federal Reserve from cutting interest rates again next week to support a slowing economy.

Headlines: U.S. flags Huawei 5G network security concerns to Gulf allies
Description: The United States has raised its concerns with Gulf allies over a possible security risk in using Huawei's technology for their 5G mobile infrastructure, U.S. officials said on Thursday.

Headlines: As trade war deepens, a state-owned insurer in China helps soften the blow
Description: As the U.S.-China trade war intensifies, an insurance company run by the Chinese government is stepping in to support Chinese exporters, providing low cost coverage and chasing down U.S. importers unwilling or unable to pay mounting tariffs.

Headlines: UK says to decide on Huawei soon but China must play by rules
Description: Britain will make a decision soon about whether to allow Huawei equipment to be used in its 5G networks but China must play by the rules if it gets access to Western markets, Defense Secretary Ben Wallace said.

Headlines: Nissan China head, turnaround executive among top candidates for CEO: sources
Description: The head of Nissan Motor Co's China business and an executive tasked with leading its revival have emerged as two of the top candidates to take over as the next CEO of the troubled Japanese automaker, four people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Yahoo Japan bids for control of fashion e-tailer Zozo for $3.7 billion
Description: Yahoo Japan Corp said it will take over Japan's biggest online fashion retailer Zozo Inc for 400 billion yen ($3.7 billion), seeking to breathe fresh life into the business and compete better against the likes of Amazon.com .

Headlines: AB InBev set to revive Budweiser Asia IPO with $5 billion float: sources
Description: Anheuser-Busch InBev is planning to raise about $5 billion from a revived float of its Asian operations after the world's largest beer maker shelved a Hong Kong IPO in July, people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: ECB action, hit by Trump as 'hurting U.S. exports,' ups pressure on Fed
Description: The European Central Bank's move to cut interest rates and restart a larger stimulus program drew fast reaction from the White House on Thursday, with President Donald Trump saying the ECB was undercutting the value of its currency and "hurting U.S. exports."

Headlines: Trump is prepared to keep, raise tariffs on Chinese goods, Mnuchin says
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is prepared to keep or even raise tariffs on Chinese imports amid ongoing trade talks, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday, after both sides granted concessions ahead of the next round of negotiations.

Headlines: Exclusive: Germany eyes massive windfall from plunging borrowing costs
Description: Germany could enjoy a windfall of 5 billion euros or more this year as record-low bond yields slash its borrowing costs, three people familiar with Berlin's budget planning told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: ECB Draghi: Weaker forecasts don't account for risk of hard Brexit
Description: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi said on Thursday the bank's weaker economic forecasts did not take into account the possibility of Britain leaving the European Union without an exit deal, even though the chances of a hard Brexit have increased.

Headlines: LSE board poised to decide fate of Hong Kong exchange's $39 billion offer
Description: The London Stock Exchange's board will meet in coming days to decide on the Hong Kong bourse's surprise $39 billion takeover proposal, a source close to the British company said on Thursday, as the market poured cold water on the deal.

Headlines: Milan bourse strategic for Italy due to MTS bond trading platform: minister
Description: Italy's new economy minister said on Friday that the Milan bourse, which is part of the London Stock Exchange Group , is a strategic asset because it controls domestic government bond trading platform MTS.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court says Trump cannot dodge foreign corruption lawsuit
Description: A U.S. federal appeals court on Friday revived a lawsuit alleging President Donald Trump violated the U.S. Constitution by profiting from foreign and domestic officials who patronized his hotels and restaurants, moving a watchdog group closer to obtaining financial records from his real estate company.

Headlines: Tech companies won't wait for U.S. to act on social media laws, Microsoft's president says
Description: Microsoft Corp President and Chief Legal Officer Brad Smith said on Friday that technology companies are likely to change how they moderate online platforms in response to new laws from foreign governments, regardless of whether U.S. lawmakers act to change a U.S. law that has allowed social media platforms to flourish.

Headlines: Timeline: LSE - A story of failed mega-mergers
Description: The London Stock Exchange emphatically rejected a $39 billion takeover offer from the Hong Kong bourse on Friday, opting to stick with its planned purchase of data and analytics group Refinitiv.

Headlines: Solid U.S. retail sales calm some worries about economy
Description: U.S. retail sales increased more than expected in August, pointing to solid consumer spending that should continue to support a moderate pace of economic growth.

Headlines: Kone open to co-shareholding with Thyssenkrupp in elevator deal: Bloomberg
Description: Finland's Kone is open to a co-shareholding structure in a potential deal to merge with Thyssenkrupp's elevator division, its chief executive told Bloomberg News.

Headlines: White House moving forward to strip California of vehicle authority: sources
Description: The Trump administration is moving forward with a plan to revoke California's authority to set its own vehicle greenhouse gas standards and declare that states are pre-empted from setting their own vehicle rules, three people briefed on the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: IMF has a decision to make in Argentina: rock or hard place?
Description: The International Monetary Fund has a tough choice to make in Argentina: Unlock over $5 billion in funds under the country's loan deal as the government strains to stave off default, or hold the money back and risk sparking more market panic.

Headlines: India police probing AB InBev in New Delhi tax evasion case
Description: Police in India's capital New Delhi are probing a case of alleged tax evasion involving Anheuser-Busch InBev , according to a police officer and a document seen by Reuters, a setback for the brewer already battling a three-year city ban.

Headlines: Global stocks, bond yields lifted by U.S.-China trade hopes
Description: A gauge of global stocks rose for an eighth straight day and benchmark government bond yields climbed on Friday after signs of progress in U.S.-China trade talks, as well as a solid U.S. retail sales report, allayed recession worries.

Headlines: Citigroup stands by card strategy despite economic clouds
Description: Some Wall Street analysts have begun to question whether Citigroup Inc's big bet on credit cards will backfire if the U.S. economy enters a recession, despite the bank saying it is underwriting responsibly.

Headlines: Philippine fast food specialist Jollibee hungry to expand in U.S., China
Description: Jollibee Foods Corp , the Philippine fast food specialist known for fried 'Chickenjoy' and chopped hotdogs in sweet spaghetti sauce, is doubling down on expansion plans in the United States and China that are likely to include more M&A.

Headlines: Record low rates deliver competitive advantages to Australia's biggest banks: regulator
Description: Australia's banking watchdog on Friday said record-low interest rates are likely to benefit the country's "Big Four" lenders over their smaller counterparts due to their better capital position and access to cheaper funds.

Headlines: Trump trade-war aid sows frustration in farm country
Description: The U.S. government is paying Texas cotton farmer J. Walt Hagood $145 an acre for losses related to U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies. But Minnesota soybean farmer Betsy Jensen will get just $35 an acre.

Headlines: Attacks on Saudi facilities threaten spare oil capacity, price hikes
Description: Saturday's attacks on key Saudi Arabia processing plants will test the world's ability to handle a supply crisis as it faces the temporary loss of more than 5% of global supply from the world's biggest crude exporter.

Headlines: U.S. stock futures fall after Saudi oil attacks
Description: U.S. stock futures fell 0.3% percent when trading resumed on Sunday, a day after attacks on Saudi oil facilities that risk disrupting global energy supplies.

Headlines: U.S. shale seen unlikely to quickly replace barrels lost in attack on Saudi facilities
Description: U.S. shale producers have added millions of barrels to global crude supply in recent years, but that does not mean they can quickly replace barrels lost from weekend attacks on Saudi Aramco facilities, energy experts said on Sunday.

Headlines: Analyst View: Saudi attacks raise specter of oil at $100/barrel
Description: The oil market will rally by $5-10 per barrel when it opens on Monday and may spike to as high as $100 per barrel if Saudi Arabia fails to quickly resume oil supply lost after attacks over the weekend, traders and analysts said.

Headlines: Germany's car watchdog sets Audi ultimatum to remove illegal diesel software: report
Description: Germany's motor vehicle authority (KBA) has told Volkswagen's premium brand Audi that it faces penalties for its failure to remove illegal software from diesel cars that can manipulate emissions levels, the Bild am Sonntag (BamS) newspaper reported.

Headlines: Israel 'well-prepared' for any spill-over from attack on Saudi oil plant
Description: Israel is prepared for the possibility it might be drawn into any U.S.-Iranian confrontation over a strike on a Saudi oil plant, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Monday.

Headlines: Saudi officials considering delaying IPO after drone attack: WSJ
Description: Saudi Arabia officials are discussing delaying Aramco's initial public offering as attacks on the company's oil facilities have drastically reduced their output, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: EU seeks plane subsidy deal, but U.S. not talking: bloc's trade chief
Description: The European Union is urging the United States to hold off trade sanctions and seek an agreement on aircraft industry subsidies, but Washington has shown no sign it wants to talk, EU trade chief Cecilia Malmstrom said on Monday.

Headlines: Japan foreign minister expresses concern over global economy from attacks on Saudi
Description: Japanese Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said on Monday that he agreed with U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo that the global economy would be affected if the attacks on Saudi oil facilities destabilize the situation in the Middle East.

Headlines: Saudi attacks threaten U.S. gasoline price hikes, particularly in California
Description: U.S. motorists most likely to feel the hit from rising gas prices following the attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities are on the West Coast, which accounts for nearly half of all of U.S. crude imports from the kingdom.

Headlines: UK PM Johnson stands in support of Saudi allies after oil attack
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson stands in support of his Saudi Arabian allies following an attack on its oil facilities which marked a "wanton violation of international law", his spokesman said.

Headlines: U.S. energy secretary says oil market robust after attack on Saudi plants
Description: The oil market is resilient and will react positively to the attack on Saudi Arabia's oil industry, U.S. Energy Secretary Rick Perry said on Monday, blaming the attack firmly on Iran.

Headlines: Airbus sees no major 2019 impact from possible U.S. tariffs
Description: Possible U.S. tariffs against Airbus aircraft and European parts are unlikely to have a major impact on the European planemaker's 2019 results, but disruption cannot be ruled out, its chief executive said.

Headlines: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma files for bankruptcy protection
Description: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP filed for bankruptcy protection Sunday night, succumbing to pressure from more than 2,600 lawsuits alleging the company helped fuel the deadly U.S. opioid epidemic.

Headlines: What's next for OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma
Description: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP filed for bankruptcy protection after reaching a partial deal to resolve more than 2,600 lawsuits alleging it helped fuel the U.S. opioid crisis.

Headlines: Trump urges GM, UAW to resolve contract dispute
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said Sunday that General Motors Co and the United Auto Workers union should "get together and make a deal." Trump tweeted about five hours before the union is set launch its first nationwide strike at GM in 12 years.

Headlines: Chevron CEO: Saudi oil strikes won't have much short-term impact on U.S. oil production
Description: Attacks on Saudi oil plants will not have much impact on U.S. oil production in the short term, Chevron Chief Executive Michael Wirth told CNBC in an interview on Monday.

Headlines: FedEx to increase shipping rates across units in 2020
Description: U.S. package delivery company FedEx Corp said on Monday shipping rates at its express unit, which delivers packages using planes, will increase by an average of 4.9% for domestic, export and import services starting Jan. 6 next year.

Headlines: U.S. crude export demand surges after attack on Saudi facilities
Description: U.S. crude export demand at the Gulf Coast surged on Monday, traders said, as the window to export crude profitably to Asia and Europe was thrown open after attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities took out 5% of global oil supplies.

Headlines: Beleaguered U.S. energy shares soar after attacks on Saudi facilities
Description: Shares of U.S. energy companies surged on Monday as a jump in oil prices in the wake of attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities gave new juice to a sector that has been a chronic underperformer.

Headlines: Oil soars after attack on Saudi facilities, stocks dip
Description: Oil prices soared on Monday after attacks on crude facilities in Saudi Arabia cut the kingdom's production in half and sparked worries over the impact of an oil shock on economic growth, halting a positive run in world stock markets as investors reached for less-risky assets.

Headlines: Don't expect oil shocks to move the Fed
Description: The weekend bombings of Saudi Arabia's main oil refinery have already sparked U.S. President Donald Trump to pressure the Federal Reserve anew to lower rates.

Headlines: Trump says oil price rise after attack on Saudi plants 'not a problem'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday downplayed the impact of a spike in oil prices in the wake of the attacks on Saudi oil plants, saying prices had not risen much and that the United States and other countries could offset the increase by releasing more supply.

Headlines: UK will work with international partners on response to Saudia Arabia attack
Description: Britain will work with its international partners on the "widest and most effective" response to an attack on Saudi Arabia at the weekend, Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab said on Monday.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. prepared to tap emergency oil reserves, Perry says no decision yet
Description: U.S. Energy Secretary Rick Perry said on Monday it was too soon to say whether the United States would tap emergency oil reserves after attacks in Saudi Arabia halved the crude output in the world's largest oil exporter.

Headlines: Bahrain's Bapco refinery says operations continue after Saudi pipeline cutoff
Description: Bahrain's national oil and gas authority said on Monday that facilities at Bapco refinery were continuing without impact on the provision of oil derivatives in the local market, state news agency BNA reported.

Headlines: Airbus, French exporters reel as U.S. tariffs loom in subsidy row
Description: Shares in Airbus and French luxury goods exporters fell on Monday as the European Union acknowledged it may face U.S. tariffs in a long-running dispute over aircraft subsidies, part of an escalating tit-for-tat trade row.

Headlines: Japan's Abe says he will meet Iran's Rouhani this month in New York: NHK
Description: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said on Tuesday he would meet with Iranian President Hassan Rouhani at the end of the month, as regional tensions rise in the Middle East after the weekend attacks on Saudi oil facilities, public broadcaster NHK said.

Headlines: UAE official: Saudi Aramco attacks are a dangerous escalation
Description: Attacks on oil plants in Saudi Arabia are a dangerous escalation and the international community should stand by Riyadh and ensure regional stability, a senior United Arab Emirates official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China condemns attacks on Saudi oil facilities
Description: China on Tuesday condemned an attack on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities, in a toughening of its language from the previous day, but again without saying who it believed was behind it.

Headlines: Trump's Fed pick, Shelton, calls for Fed coordination with White House
Description: Judy Shelton, U.S. President Donald Trump's pick to fill a vacant seat at the Federal Reserve, downplayed the independence of the central bank on Tuesday and called on the Fed to work more closely with the White House, an approach that would upend how it currently conducts monetary policy.

Headlines: International panel to criticize U.S. FAA's Boeing 737 MAX approval process: WSJ
Description: A panel of international air-safety regulators is finishing a report, which is expected to criticize the initial U.S. approval process for Boeing Co's 737 MAX jets, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people briefed on the conclusions.

Headlines: Trump does not see oil reserve release after Saudi attacks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he did not think it would be necessary to release oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve after attacks on Saudi oil facilities, saying oil prices have not spiked very much.

Headlines: Apple says $14 billion EU tax order 'defies reality and common sense'
Description: The European Union's order to Apple to pay 13 billion euros ($14 billion) in back taxes "defies reality and common sense", the U.S. firm said as the two sides sparred in a case key to the EU's crackdown on sweetheart deals to multinationals.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia to restore oil output fully by end of September: energy minister
Description: Saudi Arabia will restore its lost oil production by the end of September and has managed to recover supplies to customers to the levels they were at prior to weekend attacks on its facilities by drawing from its huge oil inventories.

Headlines: Toyota invests $391 million in its Texas truck assembly plant
Description: Toyota Motor Corp said on Tuesday it was investing $391 million in its pickup truck assembly plant in San Antonio, Texas, as part of the Japanese automaker's plan to invest $13 billion in its U.S. operations over five years through 2021.

Headlines: U.S. effective fed funds rate jumps on Monday: New York Fed data
Description: What U.S. banks charge each other to borrow reserves overnight jumped on Monday, prompted by a jump in money market rates amid scarcity in cash available for lending, according to data from the New York Federal Reserve released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia to invite U.N. experts to investigate oil attack: statement
Description: Saudi Arabia will invite international experts including from the United Nations to participate in investigating an attack on its oil facilities and called on the world to condemn those behind it, its foreign ministry said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. does not need Middle East oil, but cargoes keep coming
Description: Amid a flurry of Twitter posts on Monday morning, U.S. President Donald Trump turned to the weekend attack on Saudi Arabia’s oil facilities and assured his audience the United States had become such a big producer it no longer needed oil from the Middle East. (See tweet https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1173560246863876096)

Headlines: Saudi-style drone attacks not seen as major U.S. risk, experts say
Description: The style of attack used against oil plants in Saudi Arabia that knocked out half of the country's production on Saturday is unlikely to be a risk in the United States, energy and security experts say.

Headlines: U.S., Chinese trade deputy talks to start on Thursday
Description: Deputy-level U.S.-China trade talks are scheduled to start in Washington on Thursday, the U.S. Trade Representative's office said, paving the way for high-level talks in October aimed at resolving a bitter, 14-month trade war.

Headlines: Workers picket GM plants as UAW contract talks resume
Description: Negotiators for General Motors Co and the United Auto Workers were continuing talks Monday afternoon to resolve a strike that shut down the automaker's highly profitable U.S. operations.

Headlines: UK urges collective response to attacks on Saudi oil facilities
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson told Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman on Tuesday that there should be a collective response to attacks on the country's oil facilities.

Headlines: Head of Russian shipping giant Sovcomflot to step down -deputy PM's office
Description: The chief executive of Russian state-controlled shipping giant Sovcomflot, Sergei Frank, will step down after 15 years in office, the office of Deputy Prime Minister Maxim Akimov said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Yemen Houthi drones, missiles defy years of Saudi air strikes
Description: At a weapons exhibition in July in Yemen's Houthi-controlled capital Sanaa, military officials whipped silken sheets off what they said were newly-developed drones and missiles.

Headlines: Oxycontin maker Purdue begins bankruptcy in push to settle opioid lawsuits
Description: Oxycontin maker Purdue Pharma LP on Tuesday told a bankruptcy judge it hopes to broaden support for a proposed settlement of 2,600 lawsuits alleging it fueled the U.S. opioid crisis, but opponents of the deal highlighted looming legal battles.

Headlines: Big banks score win as U.S. regulator proposes easing post-crisis derivatives rules
Description: A U.S. banking regulator on Tuesday proposed easing a rule requiring banks to set aside cash to safeguard derivatives trades between affiliates, marking one of the biggest wins for Wall Street lenders under the business-friendly Trump administration.

Headlines: AB InBev braves Hong Kong turmoil with second Asia IPO attempt
Description: Anheuser-Busch InBev NV will brave jittery Hong Kong markets in a second attempt to spin off its Asian business on Wednesday, aiming to raise up to $6.6 billion in what could be the world's second largest IPO this year.

Headlines: Kuwait foreign minister calls on armed forces to be on high alert: KUNA
Description: Kuwait's foreign minister called on the country's armed forces to be on high alert and prepared to confront any incident that may destabilize the country's security, state news agency KUNA reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. House Speaker Pelosi requests intelligence briefings on Saudi attacks
Description: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi has requested a briefing for all House members on the Saudi Aramco attacks and Iran, a spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: With a backup to the backup, insulin makers say they're primed for Brexit
Description: For two men trained as scientists, the bosses of Britain's major insulin providers have had to become experts in ferry schedules, trucking laws and warehouse capacity as they seek to guarantee the supply of life-saving drugs through a chaotic Brexit.

Headlines: Divided Fed set to cut interest rates this week, but then what?
Description: Deep disagreements within the Federal Reserve over the economic outlook and how the U.S. central bank should respond will not stop policymakers from cutting interest rates at a two-day meeting that began on Tuesday.

Headlines: Saudis yet to brief OPEC colleagues, IEA on oil outage: sources
Description: Saudi Arabia has yet to brief fellow OPEC members and other energy sector players about how long it will take to restore the country's oil output, OPEC and industry sources said as Riyadh tries to assess damage from the weekend's crippling attacks.

Headlines: U.S. Senators urge FTC to scrutinize multi-billion dollar pharma mergers
Description: U.S. presidential hopeful Amy Klobuchar on Tuesday led a letter by U.S. senators that urged the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to closely scrutinize pharma mergers, raising concerns about the potential harm to customers.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing production rebounds, outlook remains weak
Description: U.S. manufacturing output increased solidly in August, boosted by a surge in the production of machinery and other goods, but the outlook for factories remains weak amid rising headwinds from trade tensions and slowing global economies.

Headlines: Exclusive: Buyout firm CD&R pursues bid with PPG for Buffett-backed Axalta - sources
Description: Buyout firm Clayton, Dubilier & Rice LLC is in talks to partner with U.S. paint maker PPG Industries Inc to make an acquisition offer for Axalta Coating Systems Inc, the U.S. coatings company whose largest shareholder is Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Amazon starts hiring own drivers in German last-mile delivery push
Description: Amazon has begun hiring its own drivers in Germany and plans to open 11 more distribution centers to expand its delivery business in its second biggest market, the firm's German logistics chief said in an interview.

Headlines: Costly Saudi defenses prove no match for drones, cruise missiles
Description: Billions of dollars spent by Saudi Arabia on cutting edge Western military hardware mainly designed to deter high altitude attacks has proved no match for low-cost drones and cruise missiles used in a strike that crippled its giant oil industry.

Headlines: French President Macron calls Saudi crown prince on Aramco attacks: press
Description: The Saudi Arabian Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman received a phone call from the French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday to discuss the attack on oil facilities owned by Saudi Aramco, according to the state news agency SPA.

Headlines: U.S. housing starts, building permits scale 12-year high
Description: U.S. homebuilding surged to more than a 12-year high in August as both single- and multi-family housing construction accelerated, suggesting that lower mortgage rates were finally providing a boost to the struggling housing market.

Headlines: Analyst view: Fed's day two of cash injection into U.S. banking system
Description: As if the U.S. Federal Reserve didn't already have enough on its plate heading into its meeting on interest rates this week, chaos deep inside the plumbing of the U.S. financial system has thrown policymakers an unexpected curve ball.

Headlines: German carbon pricing plan may cost DAX companies billions: report
Description: Germany's blue-chip companies could face billions of euros in costs to cut carbon emissions under a climate protection plan due to be unveiled by the government on Friday, according to a study by asset manager Union Investment.

Headlines: Exclusive: Italy cuts 2019, 2020 GDP growth forecasts - sources
Description: Italy's new government expects the economy to expand by only about 0.4% next year after eking out 0.1% growth this year, three sources close to the matter told Reuters, underscoring the need for an expansionary 2020 budget.

Headlines: Novartis halts distribution of its Zantac versions amid probe into impurities
Description: Novartis AG's Sandoz unit said on Wednesday it was halting distribution of its versions of the drug commonly known as Zantac in all its markets, including the United States and Canada, after contaminants were found in the heartburn drug.

Headlines: Atlanta Fed model estimate for U.S. third-quarter GDP edges up to 1.9%
Description: The U.S. economy is likely growing at a 1.9% annualized rate in the third quarter, based on the latest data on industrial output and housing starts, the Atlanta Federal Reserve's GDPNow forecast model showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Britain to investigate $5 billion U.S. takeover of defense firm Cobham
Description: Britain will investigate the national security impact of the purchase of defense company Cobham by U.S. private equity firm Advent International, potentially delaying or even blocking the $5 billion deal.

Headlines: Fed's job gets more complex as fed funds rate moves out of bounds
Description: Stress in U.S. money markets loomed over a Federal Reserve policy meeting on Wednesday with new data showing that the central bank's target interest rate had drifted outside the level set by the central bank for the first time since the 2007-2009 financial crisis.

Headlines: Purdue Pharma seeks to halt opioid suits against company, Sacklers
Description: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP on Wednesday asked a U.S. bankruptcy judge to halt for roughly nine months more than 2,600 lawsuits alleging the company and its controlling Sackler family helped fuel the U.S. opioid crisis, according to court documents.

Headlines: U.S. bankers seize on repo-market stress to push for softer liquidity rules
Description: Big U.S. banks are using the recent chaos in short-term funding markets as an opportunity to pressure the Federal Reserve to ease liquidity requirements they have long despised.

Headlines: U.S. trade groups urge Congress to rein in 'Tariff Man' Trump
Description: Nearly two dozen U.S. lobbying groups have joined forces to try to rein in U.S. President Donald Trump's power to unilaterally impose tariffs amid growing concern about the negative economic impact of his trade policies.

Headlines: Fed cuts interest rates, signals holding pattern for now
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve cut interest rates again on Wednesday to help sustain a record-long economic expansion but signaled a higher bar to further reductions in borrowing costs, eliciting a fast and sharp rebuke from President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Fed makes small changes to control policy rate, hints at more to come
Description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday made only minor changes to help it better manage its benchmark interest rate after the U.S. central bank briefly lost control of it earlier in the week.

Headlines: Trump says the Fed should have acted faster but today’s action is fine
Description: President Donald Trump said the Federal Reserve's decision on Wednesday to lower interest rates was "fine" but the central bank should have acted sooner.

Headlines: Fed pumps more cash as key rate breaks above target
Description: The Federal Reserve injected another $75 billion into the U.S. banking system on Wednesday, restoring a measure of order after a bout of extreme volatility inside the bank funding market drove the central bank's benchmark interest rate above its targeted range for the first time since the financial crisis.

Headlines: Powell to Trump: Now it's your turn
Description: Tucked into Fed Chair Jerome Powell's news conference on Wednesday was a not-so-subtle message for President Donald Trump: the economy is holding up because the U.S. central bank has acted to support it through a volatile patch, and whether that continues is now in the president's lap.

Headlines: Trump on Fed: 'No "guts," no sense, no vision!'
Description: President Donald Trump blasted the Federal Reserve for delivering only a quarter-percentage point interest rate cut on Wednesday, saying the U.S. central bank and its chair, Jerome Powell, had "No 'guts,' no sense, no vision!"

Headlines: Explainer: The Fed has a repo problem. What's that?
Description: As if the U.S. Federal Reserve did not already have enough on its plate heading into its meeting on interest rates this week, chaos deep inside the plumbing of the U.S. financial system has thrown policymakers an unexpected curveball.

Headlines: Tesla takes on Porsche with battle on Germany's toughest circuit
Description: Tesla wants to steal Porsche's bragging rights by testing its Model S on the northern loop of Germany's Nuerburgring circuit, using a marketing tool that German carmakers have long used to tout the superiority of their products.

Headlines: Stocks reverse losses, Treasury yields dip following remarks by Fed's Powell
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow reversed losses to close higher on Wednesday and U.S. Treasury yields slipped after remarks by Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell tempered the market's initial reaction to the U.S. central bank's policy statement.

Headlines: 'Alexa, send $20 to my favorite presidential candidate'
Description: Amazon said on Wednesday it will make donating to a U.S. presidential candidate as easy as turning on the lights or replenishing a household's toilet-paper stocks, via its Alexa digital assistant.

Headlines: House Democrats ask if Trump interfered in DOJ automaker antitrust probe
Description: Two U.S. Democratic lawmakers on Thursday asked the White House to turn over documents that would show if President Donald Trump interfered or directed a Justice Department antitrust probe of four automakers that struck voluntary agreements with California to reduce tailpipe emissions, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg meets Trump, seeks to mend fences in Washington
Description: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg met with President Donald Trump on Thursday during a fence-mending visit to Washington where the chief executive faced aggressive questioning from lawmakers about the social network's failures to protect consumer privacy.

Headlines: Tech investors: No broad lessons seen in WeWork valuation drama
Description: Two top technology investors cautioned against drawing broadconclusions about the valuation of private companies from questions swirling around U.S. office-sharing startup WeWork.

Headlines: Saudi attacks rattle shippers' plan to switch fuels
Description: Refinery outages in Saudi Arabia following weekend attacks on its oil facilities could deal a blow to the shipping industry's preparations for the biggest switch in fuel standards in decades.

Headlines: Trump says he had a 'nice' meeting with Facebook CEO Zuckerberg
Description: President Donald Trump said in a tweet that he had a "nice meeting" with Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday and he included a picture of him shaking hands with Zuckerberg in the Oval Office.

Headlines: Trump, Facebook CEO Zuckerberg had 'good, constructive' meeting: Facebook
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg had a "good, constructive" meeting at the White House on Thursday, the social media company said in a statement.

Headlines: Explainer: U.S.-China trade talks - where they are and what's at stake
Description: Senior U.S. and Chinese officials are meeting in Washington on Thursday and Friday in an attempt to settle their ongoing trade war, but a lasting peace seems elusive.

Headlines: Factbox: Tariffs in place or planned for nearly all goods traded by U.S. and China
Description: U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators are meeting in Washington this week to find ways to defuse a trade war that has roiled markets and triggered tit-for-tat tariffs on hundreds of billions of goods traded between the world's largest economies.

Headlines: France's CNP and Brazil's Caixa seal $1.7 billion insurance deal
Description: France's CNP Assurances SA has reached a deal worth 7 billion reais ($1.7 billion) with Caixa Economica Federal [CEF.UL] to sell insurance in the bank's more than 3,000 branches, the Brazilian state-owned lender said on Thursday.

Headlines: Banker tells German fraud trial he made millions from 'astronomical' trades
Description: A British investment banker at the center of Germany's biggest fraud trial told judges on Thursday he earned millions of euros from deals involving "astronomical" trades that prosecutors say were a means to make bogus tax reclaims.

Headlines: U.S. travel industry urges Washington to reauthorize tourism body Brand USA
Description: Some 15 executives from companies associated with the tourism industry, such as American Express and Marriott , have urged the U.S. government to renew federal funding of Brand USA, which promotes the United States as a travel destination.

Headlines: Trump and California go to war over clean cars
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and the state of California went to war on Wednesday over who should set the standards in the United States for vehicle emissions and electric cars, foreshadowing a legal battle over environmental policy issues that will affect the auto industry and consumers.

Headlines: China's growth could slip below 6%, analysts warn, as trade war takes toll
Description: China's economic growth risks slipping below the lower-end of Beijing 2019 target of 6% in the third quarter or over the next year, analysts warn, but government economists are slightly more optimistic as they expect stimulus to help stave off a sharper slowdown.

Headlines: VW, Porsche to recall around 227,000 cars over airbag, seatbelt issues: report
Description: Volkswagen and Porsche have to recall around 227,000 cars due to problems with airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners, Germany's Stuttgarter Zeitung said on Thursday.

Headlines: Ryanair warns UK pilots of losing benefits if strikes continue: union
Description: The British Airline Pilots Association (BALPA) said https://www.balpa.org/Media-Centre/Press-Releases/Ryanair-reverts-to-type-and-starts-threatening-pil on Thursday that Ryanair pilots in the UK have been told by the airline that their benefits will be removed should they take part in strike action started on Wednesday.

Headlines: India's Modi to meet BP, Exxon executives to discuss investment opportunities
Description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will meet executives from energy majors BP PLC and Exxon Mobil Corp in the United States next week to discuss investment opportunities, the foreign ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: 'Show me the money'; dollar-hungry businesses squeezed in Lebanon
Description: Cars line up to fill their tanks but the worker at the gas station in Lebanon's capital city waves them off, standing by the 'Strike!' signs. "No fuel today," he shouts.

Headlines: India meets criteria to reclaim U.S. trade concessions
Description: India meets the criteria for trade concessions that the United States eliminated in June, India's Foreign Secretary Vijay Gokhale said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump 'not thrilled' with Fed but says chairman's job safe: Fox News
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell's job is safe, even though he was "not thrilled" with the central bank after it moved to lower interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point on Wednesday.

Headlines: Commerzbank considers sale of Polish unit mBank: Handelsblatt
Description: Germany's Commerzbank is considering selling its Polish subsidiary mBank as part of a new strategy, daily Handelsblatt reported on Friday.

Headlines: Singapore luxury apartment sales hit 11-year high, driven by Chinese demand
Description: Sales of Singapore apartments worth at least S$10 million ($7.3 million) have hit an 11-year high, fueled by increased demand from Chinese millionaires seeking safe-haven assets, say property consultants OrangeTee & Tie.

Headlines: EU court ruling on Starbucks, Fiat million euro tax orders on September 24
Description: Europe's second-highest court will rule on Sept. 24 whether Starbucks Corp has to pay up to 30 million euros ($33 million) in Dutch back taxes and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV a similar amount to Luxembourg.

Headlines: U.S. shale producers boost oil hedging after Saudi attack: sources
Description: U.S. shale producers pounced on the chance to lock in future revenue for this year and next after oil prices surged by the most in 30 years early this week following attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities, sources familiar with the money flows said.

Headlines: Fed's Rosengren says interest rate cuts are 'not costless'
Description: Boston Federal Reserve Bank President Eric Rosengren, who dissented from the central bank's decision to cut interest rates earlier this week, repeated on Friday that monetary stimulus was not needed for the U.S. economy and posed its own problems.

Headlines: Fed's Clarida hails strong U.S. consumer but says risks remain
Description: The U.S. consumer sector is in excellent shape but risks to the economic outlook mean that the Federal Reserve will decide the course of interest rates from one meeting to the next, Fed Vice Chair Richard Clarida said on Friday.

Headlines: No crowds as Apple's iPhone 11 hits stores in China
Description: Apple's latest iPhone 11 range hit stores in China on Friday, with short queues of die-hard fans contrasting with the hundreds who camped out ahead of some previous launches.

Headlines: Factbox: Traders in trouble - how does Mitsubishi's loss stack up?
Description: Mitsubishi Corp said on Friday a trader at its Singapore-based unit had lost $320 million through unauthorized transactions in crude oil derivatives, and the matter had been reported to the police.

Headlines: Trump tweetstorm hasn't slanted view of Fed : Reuters poll
Description: President Donald Trump's barrage of tweets blasting the U.S. Federal Reserve appears to have been ignored by both Republicans and Democrats who largely see the central bank as neutral in its decision making, according to results of a new Reuters Ipsos poll.

Headlines: U.S., Chinese trade deputies face off in Washington amid deep differences
Description: U.S. and Chinese deputy trade negotiators resumed face-to-face talks for the first time in nearly two months on Thursday, as the world's two largest economies try to bridge deep policy differences and find a way out of their protracted trade war.

Headlines: Belgian police search property of KPN's new CEO over Proximus share sale
Description: Belgian police searched the home and office of Dominique Leroy, the incoming chief executive of Dutch telecom firm KPN , to investigate her sale of shares in Proximus , the company she is leaving.

Headlines: Google to invest 3 billion euros in European data centers
Description: Google will make an additional investment of 3 billion euros ($3.3 billion) over the next two years to expand its European data centers, Chief Executive Sundar Pichai said in Finland.

Headlines: Fed's Rosengren flags risks to economy in WeWork-style model
Description: The rise in co-working spaces, like those offered by WeWork, may be a source of financial instability that could make the next U.S. recession worse by sparking a run on commercial real estate, Boston Federal Reserve Bank President Eric Rosengren said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. trade regulators approve some Apple tariff exemptions amid broader reprieve
Description: U.S. trade regulators on Friday approved 10 out of 15 requests for tariff exemptions filed by Apple Inc amid a broader reprieve on levies on computer parts, according to a public docket published by the U.S. Trade Representative and a Federal Register notice.

Headlines: Fund managers gird for long trade war after FedEx slide
Description: A profit warning and muted outlook from package delivery company FedEx Corp is prompting some high-profile fund managers to prepare for the trade war between the United States and China to last longer than many had originally anticipated.

Headlines: U.S. repo rate falls after Fed repo operation
Description: The interest rate on U.S. overnight repurchase agreements slipped on Friday after an operation conducted by the New York Federal Reserve that parked $75 billion in temporary cash in the U.S. banking system.

Headlines: Stocks fall as China cancels U.S. farm visits, yields dip
Description: An index of global stock markets surrendered early gains on Friday after Chinese agriculture officials who were to visit U.S. farm states next week canceled their trip, dampening optimism on U.S.-China trade talks.

Headlines: Few U.S. lawmakers hit 'like' button after Facebook CEO visits Capitol Hill
Description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg wrapped up three days of discussions with Washington movers and shakers on Friday, with few if any indications he had won new "friends" to help the top social media company deal with multiple probes by Congress, state attorneys general and federal regulators.

Headlines: Walmart to stop sales of e-cigarettes in U.S. stores: company memo
Description: Walmart Inc told staff on Friday it will stop selling e-cigarettes and electronic nicotine delivery products at its U.S. stores, amid a growing crackdown on surging teenage use of such products, reports of vaping-related lung disease and some deaths.

Headlines: U.S., China held 'productive' talks, still plan October meeting: USTR
Description: U.S. and Chinese deputy negotiators held "productive" talks in Washington this week aimed at improving their trade relationship, the U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Friday without offering further details.

Headlines: Hopes for trade breakthrough fade as China cancels U.S. farm visits
Description: A U.S.-China trade deal appeared elusive on Friday after Chinese officials unexpectedly canceled a visit to farms in Montana and Nebraska as deputy trade negotiators wrapped up two days of negotiations in Washington.

Headlines: China needs to change way it finances economy, think tank says
Description: China needs to develop a better system for financing small businesses that drive innovation in the economy but currently struggle to access the funds they need for growth, a leading Chinese think-tank said in a report published Sunday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bahn sees big windfall from climate change package
Description: Germany's Deutsche Bahn [DBN.UL] expects the government's 50 billion euro climate change package to generate the railway company's biggest growth spurt in its 180-year history, the state-owned firm's boss said on Sunday.

Headlines: Thomas Cook customers say hotel in Tunisia stopped them leaving
Description: British tourists in Tunisia said their hotel stopped them leaving for several hours on Saturday night over concerns about payment by their holiday operator Thomas Cook, though the Tunisian government said the incident was a misunderstanding.

Headlines: Key dates in the history of tour company Thomas Cook
Description: The bosses of Thomas Cook , the world's oldest travel company, were meeting lenders and creditors in London on Sunday to seek a last-ditch deal to save the company.

Headlines: Thomas Cook owes Tunisian hotels 60 million euros: minister
Description: Thomas Cook owes Tunisian hotels 60 million euros ($66 million)for stays in July and August, Tourism Minister Rene Trabelsi told Reuters on Monday, adding that 4,500 British Thomas Cook customers are still in the country.

Headlines: U.S.-Japan trade deal hits snag as Tokyo seeks assurances on car tariffs
Description: A U.S.-Japan trade deal hit a last-minute snag as Japanese officials sought assurances that the Trump administration will not impose national security tariffs on Japanese-built cars and auto parts, people familiar with the talks said on Monday.

Headlines: K+S cuts output, sees lower earnings on weak potash demand
Description: German mineral miner K+S will cut production of potash fertilisers, dragging core earnings lower, as a halt imposed by China on potash imports dampens global markets.

Headlines: Carlos Ghosn reached civil settlement with U.S.'s SEC: lawyers
Description: Former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn has reached a civil settlement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to resolve its investigation of alleged violations of U.S. securities laws, Ghosn's lawyers said in a statement on Monday.

Headlines: Ford recalls 322,000 cars over battery fire risk: kfz-Betrieb
