Description: Ford is recalling about 322,000 cars whose batteries could catch fire due to acid leakage, trade publication kfz-betrieb reported on Monday, citing Germany's KBA federal motor authority.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard: U.S.-China trade relations probably had to come to a head
Description: St. Louis Federal Reserve President James Bullard said on Monday it was probably inevitable that the United States and China would clash on trade, given that China has not lived up to commitments made when it was allowed into the World Trade Organization.

Headlines: Exclusive: We Company CEO Neumann starts talks on his role at WeWork parent - sources
Description: WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann has started talks with board directors and investors to discuss his future role at the U.S. office-sharing start-up, including the possibility of giving up his title as chief executive, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Wall Street ends flat as mixed economic data signals caution
Description: U.S. stocks barely budged on Monday, with slight gains in shares of Apple offset by mixed economic data that added to caution over the prolonged U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Trump's tweets threaten Fed's independence, push rate expectations lower: study
Description: Interest rate futures traders believe the U.S. Federal Reserve will bow to President Donald Trump's persistent tweets pressuring the central bank to lower interest rates, and this poses a "significant" risk to Fed independence, according to research released on Monday.

Headlines: Apple to make new Mac Pro PCs in U.S. after some tariff exemptions
Description: Apple Inc said on Monday it will make new Mac Pro desktop computers at its Austin, Texas facility, following some relief on tariffs by the U.S. government.

Headlines: Oil rises about 1% on concerns about return of Saudi output
Description: Oil ended about 1% higher on Monday after a volatile trading session as traders focused on when Saudi Arabia would be able to restore full output following the Sept. 14 attack on its facilities.

Headlines: Online banks to take bigger share of U.S. deposit market: Evercore
Description: Online banks, such as Ally Financial Inc and Capital One Financial Corp , are expected to take a bigger chunk of the overall U.S. deposit market, after racking up $95 billion in customer deposits this year with enticing yields on most savings accounts.

Headlines: Google launches subscription service for select apps and games
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Monday it is rolling out Google Play Pass, a subscription service that gives Android users access to more than 350 apps and games without ads and in-app purchases.

Headlines: China buys about 10 cargoes of U.S. soybeans after trade talks
Description: Chinese importers bought about 10 boatloads of U.S. soybeans on Monday following deputy-level trade talks in Washington last week that were overshadowed by the abrupt cancellation of a U.S. farm state visit by Chinese agriculture officials.

Headlines: Eyes on U.S. prize, Primark considers Central American suppliers
Description: Confident it can crack the $300 billion U.S. clothing and shoes market where many other foreign retailers have failed, Britain's Primark is ready to raise its bet on the country by securing new sources of fast fashion in central America.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia to restore full oil output by next week: source
Description: Saudi Arabia has restored more than 75% of crude output lost after attacks on its facilities and will return to full volumes by early next week, a source briefed on the latest developments told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Thomas Cook operator in Egypt says 25,000 bookings canceled: statement
Description: Thomas Cook operator Blue Sky Group said on Monday that 25,000 reservations in Egypt booked up to April 2020 had been canceled.

Headlines: UK PM Johnson questions whether Thomas Cook bosses 'properly incentivized'
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Monday questioned whether the directors of companies such as collapsed travel company Thomas Cook were properly incentivized to avoid bankruptcy.

Headlines: Airlines ask Hong Kong to waive airport fees as demand drops: letter
Description: Scores of airlines wrote jointly to the Hong Kong government earlier this month to seek airport fee waivers as they struggle to deal with the financial fallout from anti-government protests that have led to a sharp drop in traveler demand.

Headlines: 46 flights operated by Thomas Cook in Spain canceled: Airport operator AENA
Description: Spain's airport operator Aena said on Monday 46 flights operated by collapsed British travel group Thomas Cook have been canceled.

Headlines: German state of Hesse says it will support Condor's quest for bridging loan
Description: Germany's state of Hesse, where collapsed travel group Thomas Cook's German airline Condor is located, said it is ready to help the airline's application for a federal government bridging loan.

Headlines: UBS, Banco do Brasil to create investment banking venture in South America
Description: Switzerland's UBS Group AG and state-controlled Banco do Brasil SA signed a preliminary agreement on Monday to create a joint venture in investment banking in South America, the Brazilian bank said in a securities filing.

Headlines: Exclusive: Ceconomy eyes deal with heirs of Media Markt founder - sources
Description: Germany's Ceconomy , Europe’s biggest consumer electronics group, is in talks to resolve a long-running dispute with a major shareholder of subsidiary Media Saturn, people close to the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Thomas Cook's collapse strands about 50,000 in Greece, hotels fret
Description: About 50,000 tourists are stranded in Greece and mainly on island resorts after British travel firm Thomas Cook collapsed, the tourism minister said on Monday as extra flights were booked to ease their return home.

Headlines: Malindo Air says data leak caused by ex-staffers at contractor firm
Description: Malindo Air, the Malaysian subsidiary of Indonesia's Lion Group, said on Monday that two former employees of its e-commerce contractor were responsible for its passenger data breach.

Headlines: Cyprus says 15,000 Thomas Cook customers stranded on island
Description: Up to 15,000 holidaymakers are stranded on the island of Cyprus after the collapse of British travel firm Thomas Cook, saddling hotels with millions in potential losses, the deputy minister of tourism said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade talks will resume in two weeks: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Monday that he and U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer would meet with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He for trade talks in two weeks.

Headlines: U.S. court deals setback to FCC push to revamp media ownership rules
Description: The Federal Communications Commission suffered a setback on Monday in a long-running legal battle when a federal appeals court struck down its latest effort to loosen U.S. media ownership rules.

Headlines: Exclusive: Boeing bid for Embraer unit faces EU antitrust probe - sources
Description: Boeing is set to face an EU antitrust investigation of up to five months into its bid for a controlling stake in the commercial aircraft arm of Brazil's Embraer, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco IPO unlikely to happen this year after oil attacks: sources
Description: Saudi Arabia is unlikely to list its state-owned oil giant Aramco this year after attacks this month on its facilities, two sources with direct knowledge of the company's thinking said.

Headlines: Timeline: Key events in Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou's extradition case
Description: Meng Wanzhou, chief financial officer of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], will appear in a Vancouver, Canada, courtroom on the first of three days of trial starting on Monday. Here is a timeline of the case and its geopolitical implications.

Headlines: Timeline: Key events in Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou's extradition case
Description: Meng Wanzhou, chief financial officer of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd , will appear in a Vancouver, Canada, courtroom on Tuesday, for the second of three days of disclosure hearing that started Monday.

Headlines: Canada says officials did not act improperly when Huawei CFO was arrested
Description: There is no evidence Canadian border officials or police acted improperly when Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou was detained and arrested at Vancouver's airport nearly 10 months ago, the attorney general of Canada said in a filing released on Monday.

Headlines: Thomas Cook's Nordic business to carry on, looking for buyer
Description: Thomas Cook's Nordic business said on Tuesday it would continue to operate as it is a separate legal entity from its London-listed parent, which collapsed on Monday, and it was looking for new owners.

Headlines: Thomas Cook collapse affects 53,000 British nationals in Spain: tourism minister
Description: The collapse of British travel firm Thomas Cook has affected 53,000 Britons in Spain, Spanish Acting Tourism Minister Reyes Maroto told reporters on Tuesday.

Headlines: AB InBev Asia unit raises $5 billion in revived Hong Kong IPO under shadow of protests
Description: Brewer AB InBev priced the Hong Kong IPO of its Asia-Pacific unit at the bottom of a marketed range to raise about $5 billion, indicating deals in the pipeline may need subdued valuations to succeed as protests in the city unnerve investors.

Headlines: Starbucks wins, Fiat loses in EU tax fights
Description: Starbucks won its fight on Tuesday against an EU demand to pay up to 30 million euros ($33 million) in Dutch back taxes, while Fiat Chrysler Automobiles lost its challenge against an order to stump up a similar amount to Luxembourg.

Headlines: Poland's mBank rises on speculation about Commerzbank sale plans
Description: Shares in mBank hit their highest level since early August on Tuesday, partly in response to speculation that Poland's fourth largest lender by assets is up for sale.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence plunges in September
Description: U.S. consumer confidence fell by the most in nine months in September, far more than expected, as Americans' economic outlooks darkened in the face of the U.S.-China trade war, according to a private sector report released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Oil drops to lowest since Aramco attacks after Trump scolds China
Description: Oil prices plunged more than 2% on Tuesday to their lowest since the Sept. 14 attacks on Saudi Arabia's key oil facilities, after U.S. President Donald Trump rekindled fears the U.S.-China trade conflict that has crimped energy demand is far from over.

Headlines: Wall Street drops; Pelosi says to start formal impeachment inquiry
Description: U.S. stocks fell in volatile trade on Tuesday, giving the S&P 500 its biggest daily drop in a month as a push for the impeachment of U.S. President Donald Trump gained momentum among Democrats in the U.S. Congress.

Headlines: Chipotle faces more labor complaints at New York City stores
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc is facing fresh claims that it violated New York City's labor laws after the city sued the fast casual restaurant chain two weeks ago.

Headlines: Germany offers Thomas Cook's Condor 380 million euro bridging loan
Description: Germany will guarantee a 380 million euro ($418.6 million)bridging loan for Condor, the German airline owned by insolvent British travel operator Thomas Cook, to enable it to continue flying and save jobs, the economy minister said on Tuesday.

Headlines: About 45 Tunisian hotels affected by the collapse of Thomas Cook
Description: About 45 hotels have been affected in Tunisia after the collapse of Thomas Cook, and the government will help the hotels with soft loans, Tunisia's tourism minister said on Tuesday.

Headlines: As Thomas Cook customers return home, blame game begins
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson and unions questioned the part played by Thomas Cook's richly rewarded bosses in the company's demise on Tuesday, and asked why the state had to foot the bill for bringing tens of thousands of tourists home.

Headlines: Hydrogen hurdles: a deadly blast hampers South Korea's big fuel cell car bet
Description: Aiming to cash in on a major push by South Korea to promote fuel cell vehicles, Sung Won-young opened a hydrogen refueling station in the city of Ulsan last September. Just one year on, he's thinking about closing it down.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence falls in September, trade fears dominate
Description: U.S. consumer confidence ebbed in September as an escalation in trade tensions fanned concerns about business and labor market conditions, a potentially worrying signal for consumer spending, which has been driving the economy.

Headlines: U.S. quarter-end funding costs stay elevated
Description: A key borrowing cost for Wall Street remained elevated on Tuesday near the end of the quarter even after the Federal Reserve injected $30 billion in longer-term cash into the U.S. banking system a week after turmoil in money markets.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia considers doubling stake offered in Aramco IPO: WSJ
Description: Saudi Arabia is considering doubling the stake to be offered in oil giant Saudi Aramco's much awaited initial public offering, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: WeWork bond price bounces in choppy trading after CEO to step down
Description: The price of WeWork's 7.875% junk bond <96208LAA9=> bounced in choppy trading after co-founder Adam Neumann agreed to resign as chief executive of the U.S. office-sharing company, people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nio raising more cash amid cost-cutting campaign
Description: Nio Inc, one of China’s high-profile electric car startups, disclosed a fresh money-raising push this week, saying it had issued $200 million worth of bonds and was accelerating cost-cutting programs to slow cash burn as the company seeks to attract more investors in a slumping market.

Headlines: U.S., Japan seek conclusion of trade talks within four months: statement
Description: Japan and the United States on Wednesday said they intend to conclude their trade consultations within about four months and to refrain from actions "against the spirit" of an initial agreement, a joint statement released by Japan said.

Headlines: Best Buy targets $50 billion in revenue by 2025, eyes health tech boost
Description: Best Buy Co Inc aims to rake in revenue of $50 billion and cut about $1 billion in costs by 2025, while ramping up its healthcare technology business, the biggest U.S. consumer electronics retailer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. oil activity slumps amid rising price uncertainty: Fed survey
Description: U.S. oil and gas activity in some of the largest producing regions is declining, led by a weakening oilfield services sector as producers cut spending, according to an energy survey released on Wednesday by the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas.

Headlines: Credit Suisse defeats lawsuits over huge U.S. 'volatility' crash
Description: A U.S. judge on Wednesday dismissed three lawsuits accusing Credit Suisse Group AG of misleading investors about a complex product for betting on stock market swings, and causing huge losses when it lost 96% of its value in one harrowing day.

Headlines: GM calls on Alexa to give vehicles more skills
Description: General Motors Co will enable U.S. owners of 2018 and newer model vehicles to download Amazon.com's Alexa digital assistant software to control navigation, streaming media and phones starting next year, the companies said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tinder owner sued for using fake profiles in ads on Match.com
Description: The owner of Tinder and OkCupid is being sued by U.S. regulator for seeking to draw in potential subscribers with emails from fake users expressing interest in pairing up.

Headlines: Thomas Cook collapse to cost Morocco hotels $20 million: tourism body
Description: The collapse of British travel operator Thomas Cook has left Moroccan hotels facing unpaid bills of about 200 million dirhams ($20 million), the head of Morocco's tourism federation said on Wednesday.

Headlines: German fraud trial hears trader's journey from floor to jet-set
Description: A British banker told Germany's biggest fraud trial this week how he worked his way from office clerk to jet-setting trader before his dream career came to an early end.

Headlines: Lower mortgage rates stimulate lethargic U.S. housing market
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes rebounded more than expected in August, the latest sign that the sluggish housing market was starting to get a lift from lower mortgage rates.

Headlines: Global stocks rise, investors cool to impeachment talk
Description: The dollar rose and stocks on Wall Street lifted a gauge of global equities on Wednesday on robust U.S. housing data and the notion a strong economy would overcome any investor skittishness over a possible impeachment of President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. lawsuits take aim at vaping
Description: Several deaths and potentially hundreds of illnesses tied to e-cigarettes, which allow users to inhale nicotine vapor, often flavored, without smoking, have been reported by U.S. health agency. Lawsuits on behalf of young consumers have been filed against e-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc and others are expected amid increasing scrutiny.

Headlines: Exclusive: Oracle says investigators have asked it for information about Google
Description: Oracle Corp , which has clashed with Alphabet's Google in business disputes, has received requests for information from congressional and state investigators looking into allegations that Google violated antitrust law.

Headlines: U.S. transport chief warns against mixed messages on Boeing's 737 MAX
Description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao warned regulators on Wednesday against sending conflicting messages as they work to ensure Boeing Co's 737 MAX is safe to resume operations.

Headlines: Microsoft challenges federal judge's order on 'sneak and peek' searches
Description: Microsoft said on Wednesday it was challenging a federal judge's order that prevents the software maker from informing one of its large corporate customers that the U.S. government has issued a warrant for the customer's data.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia consults allies on oil attack, awaits result of investigation: official
Description: Saudi Arabia is in consultation "with friends and allies about the next steps to take" after a Sept. 14 attack on its oil facilities, but is waiting for the findings of an investigation, Saudi Arabia's Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Adel al-Jubeir told reporters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wall Street bounces back as investors shrug off impeachment risk
Description: The S&P 500 notched its biggest daily gain in two weeks on Wednesday as investors shrugged off the news of an impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump, while Nike shares jumped on upbeat quarterly results.

Headlines: Japan auto group says U.S. trade discussions going in direction of avoiding auto tariffs
Description: The chairman of the Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association said on Thursday that trade discussions between the United States and Japan were going in the direction of avoiding auto tariffs and that it was good for both countries.

Headlines: Prudential, M&G to split in October into two FTSE 100 firms
Description: Prudential will spin off its UK and European insurance and asset management business M&G in October, Britain's largest insurer said in a prospectus published on Wednesday, dividing the insurance giant into two large-cap stocks.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco restores oil output earlier than expected: sources
Description: Saudi Arabia has restored its oil production capacity to 11.3 million barrels per day, three sources briefed on Saudi Aramco's operations told Reuters, maintaining a faster than expected recovery after the Sept. 14 attacks on its oil facilities.

Headlines: Around 3,600 clients of Thomas Cook's Polish unit remain abroad
Description: Around 3,600 clients of Thomas Cook's Polish unit Neckermann Polska remain outside Poland, regional authorities said on Wednesday after the local travel agency announced insolvency.

Headlines: Nestle's premium baby formula saw strong demand in China despite falling birth rates: CFO
Description: Nestle's infant nutrition business in China grew at a healthy pace, despite a steep fall in birth rates and an overall slowdown in consumption, the company's chief financial officer said at a conference on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump impeachment? History suggests Wall Street ought not worry
Description: The move by Democrats in the U.S. Congress on Tuesday to launch a formal impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump has caused nervousness on Wall Street - but history suggests investors need not worry.

Headlines: WeWork's Neumann surrenders control, CEO role following investor revolt
Description: WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann agreed on Tuesday to resign as CEO and give up majority voting control, after SoftBank Group Corp and other shareholders turned on him over a plunge in the U.S. office-sharing start-up's estimated valuation.

Headlines: WeWork chief Neumann's top lieutenants step up as successors
Description: As WeWork parent We Company's CEO Adam Neumann asked Artie Minson and Sebastian Gunningham to separately take care of the U.S. office-sharing space start-up's finances and business, they developed turfs that became their mutual ticket to the top job.

Headlines: Israel Aerospace eyes U.S. government contracts, acquisitions
Description: Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI) [ISRAI.UL] said on Wednesday its U.S. unit opened a new government relations office in Washington DC as part of its strategy to secure more U.S. contracts.

Headlines: Explainer: Battle over Osram takes further twist
Description: An unprecedented bidding war has erupted over German lighting group Osram , with private equity group Bain swapping partners to team up with Advent to prepare to outbid Austria's AMS .

Headlines: Google to stop showing news snippets for French users
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google will stop showing news snippets from European publishers on search results for its French users, complying with a new European copyright law, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: VW in final talks about new plant in Turkey: board member
Description: German carmaker Volkswagen is nearing a decision on building a new plant in Turkey, a board member told reporters in Berlin on Thursday.

Headlines: How a sanctions-busting smartphone business thrives in North Korea
Description: North Korea is evading U.N. sanctions to cash in on soaring domestic demand for smartphones, using low-cost hardware imports to generate significant income for the regime, according to defectors, experts and an analysis of North Korean-made phones.

Headlines: Commodities trader Cargill's quarterly profit rises 3% on beef, eggs demand
Description: Global commodities trader Cargill Inc [CARG.UL] reported a 3% increase in adjusted quarterly profit on Thursday, citing strong consumer demand for meat and eggs in North America and growth in its animal nutrition businesses.

Headlines: Governments must ensure ECB is not overburdened, Merkel says
Description: Euro zone governments must reform their economies and use appropriate fiscal policies to ensure that the European Central Bank is not overburdened, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Thursday.

Headlines: Dallas Fed's Kaplan: U.S. needs more, not less, immigration for economic growth
Description: Proposals to curb immigration will weigh on economic growth in the United States where the existing workforce is growing more slowly as the population ages, Dallas Federal Reserve president Robert Kaplan said on Thursday.

Headlines: German court begins protection proceedings for Thomas Cook's Condor
Description: Germany's Condor, which is owned by British travel operator Thomas Cook, said on Thursday that a Frankfurt court had begun investor protection proceedings that should allow the airline to be restructured.

Headlines: British Airways owner says pilot strikes to hit profit
Description: British Airways parent IAG warned on Thursday that full-year profit will be hit by a pilots' strike at the UK carrier and weaker sales by budget stablemates Vueling and Level.

Headlines: In Michigan steel towns, tariffs meant to revive industry cost jobs
Description: Some steelworkers who cheered U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs on foreign steel last year are now being laid off, an unintended consequence of his America First policy as United States Steel Corp reacts to sagging demand from automakers reeling from higher steel prices.

Headlines: Exclusive: Saudi Aramco lures sovereign funds to hit $2 trillion IPO valuation - sources
Description: State-owned Saudi Aramco has approached Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA), Singapore's GIC and other sovereign wealth funds to invest in the domestic leg of the oil giant's listing at it seeks to achieve a $2 trillion valuation, sources said.

Headlines: Local officials in 31 U.S. states write to McDonald's on sexual harassment
Description: Scores of local government officials from 31 U.S. states pressured McDonald's Corp's on Thursday to do a better job of protecting workers from groping, obscene comments and other forms of sexual harassment, adding their voices to an employee-led campaign that has seen walkouts at several stores.

Headlines: Gambia fears tourism crisis after Thomas Cook collapse
Description: Fatou Jallow borrowed money this year to spruce up her beachside restaurant in Gambia, expecting the usual winter droves of European tourists keen to sample her hearty stews and spicy West African rice dishes.

Headlines: Fed's Clarida says inflation expectations in line with mandate
Description: U.S. inflation expectations are currently in line with the central bank's 2% goal, Federal Reserve Vice Chair Richard Clarida said on Thursday, an indication he does not see a pressing need for new rate cuts to push inflation back up.

Headlines: WeWork halts all new lease agreements with property owners: FT
Description: WeWork is halting all new lease agreements with property owners as the U.S. office-sharing startup looks to curtail costs, the Financial Times reported on Thursday citing people briefed on the matter.

Headlines: Internet sector contributes $2.1 trillion to U.S. economy: industry group
Description: The rapidly growing internet sector accounted for $2.1 trillion of the U.S. economy in 2018, or about 10% of the nation's gross domestic product (GDP), an industry group said on Thursday.

Headlines: Eni CEO searched, under investigation over dealings in Congo
Description: Italian oil and gas group Eni said on Thursday its chief executive, Claudio Descalzi, was under investigation for a conflict of interest issue over dealings in the Congo.

Headlines: Peloton raises $1.2 billion after IPO prices at top of range
Description: Peloton Interactive Inc , the U.S. fitness startup known for on-demand workout programs on its exercise bikes, on Wednesday raised $1.16 billion in its initial public offering after pricing shares at the top end of its target range.

Headlines: China criticizes new U.S. sanctions over Iranian oil deals
Description: China on Thursday criticized the United States for imposing new

Headlines: Former Nissan boss Ghosn's wife says he may not get fair trial in Japan: CNBC
Description: Carole Ghosn, the wife of former Nissan Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Carlos Ghosn, on Thursday raised doubts about her husband getting a fair trial in Japan in an interview to CNBC.

Headlines: Hackers tried to steal Airbus secrets via contractors: AFP
Description: A series of cyber attacks on Airbus in the past few months was conducted via the computer systems of its suppliers and security sources suspect a link to China, AFP news agency reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to stop output at UK factories for a week due to Brexit
Description: Britain’s biggest carmaker, Jaguar Land Rover, will halt production at its British factories for a week in November, its boss said on Thursday, joining BMW and Toyota in plans to help mitigate any immediate disruption from a no-deal Brexit.

Headlines: Exclusive: Texas signs ex-Microsoft lawyer, others to aid in Google antitrust probe
Description: The Texas attorney general's office has hired three consultants for a multi-state probe it is leading into Alphabet Inc's Google, including an economist who worked with some of the firm's major rivals and a lawyer who is a Microsoft veteran.

Headlines: Lockheed to begin supplying F-16 wings from Indian plant in 2020
Description: Lockheed Martin will begin supplying wings for its F-16 combat jets from a facility in southern India from next year, a senior executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Boeing CEO to testify before Congress about grounded 737 MAX
Description: Boeing Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg has agreed to testify before Congress next month on the grounded 737 MAX that was involved in two fatal crashes that killed 346 people, a U.S. House of Representatives committee and the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Data will show damage of tariffs, strong dollar on U.S. goods exporters
Description: It's no longer a probability, it's a reality: the escalating U.S.-China trade war and the strengthening dollar appear to be inflicting measurable damage on U.S. goods makers that rely on global markets.

Headlines: Barclays pays $6.3 million to settle U.S. SEC's Asia-Pacific hiring probe
Description: Barclays has agreed to pay about $6.3 million to settle U.S. charges it violated a federal anti-bribery law by hiring family and friends of foreign officials in the Asia-Pacific region to help win or retain investment banking business.

Headlines: Cooling U.S. consumer spending underscores risks to economy
Description: U.S. consumer spending barely rose in August and business investment remained subdued amid lingering trade tensions, prompting economists to slash their economic growth estimates for the third quarter.

Headlines: Marathon's board backs CEO amid calls for his ouster
Description: Marathon Petroleum Corp said on Friday the top U.S. refiner's board supported Gary Heminger staying on as chief executive officer amid calls for his ouster from two top 10 shareholders.

Headlines: Cyclical shares key to determining endurance of U.S. stock rally
Description: Improved economic sentiment in recent weeks has lifted shares of U.S. financial, energy, industrial and materials companies, but analysts are sharply divided on whether that optimism is warranted.

Headlines: Italy's Tod's appoints former Google executive to ramp up digital effort
Description: Italy's Tod's appointed a former Google executive as chief digital and innovation officer to ramp up its ongoing digital transformation, the shoes and leather goods company said on Friday.

Headlines: Huawei says it has begun producing 5G base stations without U.S. parts
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] said it has started making 5G base stations without U.S. components and that total production of 5G base stations should more than double next year as more countries introduce the technology.

Headlines: BMW not interested in settling EU cartel investigations: WirtschaftsWoche
Description: Germany's BMW has no interest in settling an investigations by the European Union antitrust authorities against the company and other German carmakers, German magazine WirtschaftsWoche reported on Friday, citing company sources.

Headlines: With bigger stake in Subaru, Toyota expands reach over Japan automakers
Description: Toyota Motor Corp on Friday announced plans to raise its stake in Subaru Corp to more than 20% as Japan's biggest automaker cements ties with its smaller rival to better compete with overseas automakers to develop new technologies.

Headlines: UK to repatriate 16,000 people on fifth day after Thomas Cook collapse
Description: UK's Civil Aviation Authority said on Friday 72 flights are scheduled to operate to bring back a further 16,000 people to the country following the collapse of Thomas Cook.

Headlines: Germany to name Lautenschlaeger successor soon: ministry
Description: Germany intends to remain represented on the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and will shortly name a candidate to succeed Sabine Lautenschlaeger, who announced she would resign earlier this week, a Finance Ministry spokesman said.

Headlines: Pfizer veteran Ian Read to retire as executive chairman
Description: Pfizer Inc said on Friday Ian Read will retire as executive chairman at the end of this year, after a four-decade association with the largest U.S. drugmaker that included eight years as chief executive officer.

Headlines: SoftBank likely to funnel $1 billion more into WeWork after delayed IPO: FT
Description: SoftBank Group Corp is planning to pump an extra $1 billion or more into WeWork by renegotiating a warrant agreement struck before falling valuations delayed the U.S. office-sharing startup's IPO, the Financial Times reported.

Headlines: Exclusive: Hedge fund D.E. Shaw to push for break-up of Emerson - sources
Description: Hedge fund D.E. Shaw & Co is building a stake in Emerson Electric Co and is planning to push for changes, including a potential split-up of the U.S. industrial conglomerate, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: In swipe at Trump, China tells U.N. tariffs could plunge world into recession
Description: The Chinese government's top diplomat said on Friday that tariffs and trade disputes could plunge the world into recession and Beijing was committed to resolving them in a "calm, rational and cooperative manner."

Headlines: Wall Street drops; White House considers delisting Chinese companies
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Friday after reports that the Trump administration was considering delisting Chinese companies from U.S. stock exchanges, raising worries about a further escalation in the U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: U.S. labor judge rules that Tesla broke labor law
Description: Electric carmaker Tesla Inc interfered with legitimate union organizing and must read a notice to workers explaining their rights in a meeting requiring attendance from Chief Executive Elon Musk, a U.S. labor judge ruled on Friday.

Headlines: SoftBank seeks help from its COO to turn WeWork around: Bloomberg
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp is seeking the help of its chief operating officer, Marcelo Claure, to turn around WeWork, Bloomberg reported on Friday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to pay $40 million over inflated sales figures
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV and its U.S. unit will pay $40 million for misleading investors about its monthly sales figures and will resolve a lengthy probe by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

Headlines: Trump considers delisting Chinese firms from U.S. markets: sources
Description: President Donald Trump's administration is considering delisting Chinese companies from U.S. stock exchanges, three sources briefed on the matter said on Friday, in what would be a radical escalation of U.S.-China trade tensions.

Headlines: After WeWork debacle, IPO market slams brakes on unprofitable companies
Description: Companies making their debut on the U.S. stock market are getting a rough welcome, especially if they are losing money, casting a shadow over the calendar for initial public offerings for the rest of the year.

Headlines: Spillover: world economies' next big headache
Description: Factories have been the first victims of the Trump-era global trade rows. Now the question is how much their troubles will spread to other parts of the world's biggest economies: the so-called spillover effect.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury says no plans to block Chinese listings 'at this time': Bloomberg
Description: The United States does not currently plan to stop Chinese companies from listing on U.S. exchanges, Bloomberg reported on Saturday, citing a U.S. Treasury official.

Headlines: China says will open more sectors of economy to foreign investors
Description: China will open up more sectors of the economy to foreign investors, and its policy of protecting foreign companies' rights in the country will not change, Vice Commerce Minister Wang Shouwen said on Sunday.

Headlines: U.S. judge rules for Bombardier, dismisses Comerica aircraft payments lawsuit
Description: A U.S. judge on Monday dismissed a lawsuit in which Comerica Inc sought millions of dollars from Bombardier Inc after the Canadian aircraft maker could not find buyers for four planes whose leases had expired.

Headlines: Oil falls, Brent posts biggest quarterly drop this year on demand fears
Description: Oil prices fell on Monday on fading concerns of supply shortfalls and conflicts in the Middle East after the Sept. 14 attack on Saudi Arabia, but global benchmark Brent posted its biggest quarterly loss this year on demand fears due to the escalating U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Factbox: Major U.S. retail bankruptcies since 2017
Description: Forever 21 Inc on Sunday became the latest U.S. retailer to file for bankruptcy, succumbing to the twin challenges of changing consumer tastes and a relentless shift to online shopping.

Headlines: Sprint, MetTel win $994 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Sprint Corp and MetTel have been awarded a $994 million U.S. defense contract for wireless services and devices, the Pentagon said on Monday.

Headlines: Apple and Microsoft push Wall Street higher as trade worries abate
Description: U.S. stocks climbed on Monday, helped by gains in Apple, Microsoft and Merck & Co, as investors set aside worries about the U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Lockheed martin wins $495 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp has been awarded a $495 million modification to a contract for Trident II (D5) missile production and deployed systems support, the Pentagon said on Monday.

Headlines: White House trade adviser Navarro calls China delisting report 'fake news': CNBC
Description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro on Monday dismissed reports that the Trump administration was considering delisting Chinese companies from U.S. stock exchanges as "fake news."

Headlines: Global stocks stalled in third-quarter as bonds boom and dollar zooms
Description: It has been a pivotal few months for financial markets. China and Europe have halted the global stocks rally, oil has cooled dramatically and rising recession worries have sent gold and government bonds charging again.

Headlines: Hong Kong's sky-high property prices prove resilient in face of protests
Description: While months of Hong Kong protests have scared away tourists, sent jitters across the financial centre and cast a dark cloud over the local economy, there's one thing residents of the city are confident they can bank on - sky-high property prices.

Headlines: Hong Kong Aug home prices drop for third month, steeper declines forecast
Description: Hong Kong private home prices fell for the third straight month in August, according to government data released on Monday, as increasingly violent street protests take a toll on the economy.

Headlines: United Technologies wins $2.2 billion U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Pratt & Whitney, a unit of United Technologies Corp , has been awarded a $2.2 billion U.S. defense contract for production of F135 propulsion systems, the Pentagon said on Monday.

Headlines: AB InBev Asia unit's strong Hong Kong debut to boost IPO outlook amid political unrest
Description: AB InBev's Asia-Pacific unit , which raised about $5 billion after relaunching its IPO this month, rose more than 6% on its market debut in Hong Kong, easing concerns of the impact of ongoing anti-government protests on new share offerings.

Headlines: Chinese companies rethink U.S. IPOs after Trump's delisting threat
Description: Bestbond, a Chinese apartment rental company, had been planning on a Nasdaq flotation in one to two years but as U.S.-China trade tensions racheted higher, the Hong Kong stock exchange emerged as a possible candidate. Now, it's firmly on the table.

Headlines: Blackstone to buy U.S. warehouses from Colony Capital in $5.9 billion deal
Description: Blackstone Group Inc said on Monday it would buy U.S. industrial warehouses from real estate and investment management firm Colony Capital Inc in a $5.9 billion deal, to capitalize on the e-commerce boom.

Headlines: Third quarter could mark turning point in U.S. profit cycle
Description: As investors prepare for U.S. corporations to report financial results next month, they could look past recent sluggish growth and find comfort as earnings look set to rebound after the third quarter.

Headlines: Oil prices slip as U.S. economic data weakens demand outlook
Description: Oil futures sank on Tuesday as weak U.S. economic data dimmed crude's demand outlook and pressured prices, while reports of a third-quarter decline in output from the world's largest oil producers kept oil from falling further.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including manufacturing data, Chinese IPOs, restaurants
Description: Jim Cramer advises that investors shake off September's poor manufacturing read, worry less about a potential Elizabeth Warren presidency, examines the stocks of Chipotle, McDonald's and Jack in the Box and interviews the CEO of ConEd.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs reshuffles Asia M&A leadership as John Kim joins Carlyle - memo
Description: Tech specialists Raghav Maliah and Jung Min have been appointed co-heads of Goldman Sachs' mergers and acquisitions in Asia Pacific excluding Japan as former head John Kim moves to global private equity giant Carlyle Group.

Headlines: WeWork weighs pullback in China as part of cost cuts: WSJ
Description: WeWork's parent The We Company's new management team is considering curbing its expansion plans in China as part of the company's new emphasis on controlling costs, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing dives to 10-year low as trade tensions weigh
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity tumbled to a more than 10-year low in September as lingering trade tensions weighed on exports, further heightening financial market fears of a sharp slowdown in economic growth in the third quarter.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles as factory activity hits 10-year low
Description: The S&P 500 and Dow suffered their worst tumbles in over a month on Tuesday after data showed U.S. factory activity shrank in September to its weakest in over a decade, ratcheting up fears that the U.S.-China trade war is hobbling the world's largest economy.

Headlines: Deere to lay off 163 U.S. workers as trade war dents equipment demand
Description: Deere & Co on Tuesday announced indefinite layoffs for 163 U.S. manufacturing workers at plants in Illinois and Iowa that make agricultural, forestry and construction equipment, citing decreased customer demand.

Headlines: U.S. September auto sales fall as shift in Labor Day holiday hurts
Description: Automakers, including Toyota Motor Corp and Hyundai Motor , on Tuesday reported a sharp drop in September U.S. sales, hurt by the early timing of Labor Day as sales from the holiday weekend were booked in August.

Headlines: Italy's Illycaffe sets five year target for U.S. expansion
Description: Italy's Illycaffe could reach its goal of opening 200 cafes in the United States within five years as part of a broader drive to expand its business outside its home market, Andrea Illy, the chairman of the premium coffee maker said.

Headlines: Major U.S. investors have billions at risk in Chinese stocks
Description: Major U.S. fund managers have tens of billion of dollars at stake in some of the most popular Chinese stocks on Wall Street, exposing them to potential losses should the White House move to delist Chinese firms from U.S. exchanges.

Headlines: Too big to lend? JPMorgan cash hit Fed limits, roiling U.S. repos
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co has become so big that some rival banks and analysts say changes to its $2.7 trillion balance sheet were a factor in a spike last month in the U.S. "repo" market, which is crucial to many borrowers.

Headlines: Facebook, Google, Amazon face another House inquiry: Bloomberg
Description: Facebook Inc, Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google will face a congressional inquiry on how the big technology companies may be damaging the competitive landscape for small businesses, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Despite third quarter decline, Tesla's Model 3 stays on top in Norway
Description: Tesla Inc's electric Model 3 remained Norway's top-selling car in the third quarter, although its sales declined from earlier in the year, registration data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Strike hits Fiat Chrysler plant in Italy after death of worker
Description: A Fiat Chrysler worker died overnight in an accident at the group's factory in Cassino, central Italy, prompting unions to launch a strike at the plant to demand tighter safety measures, officials said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hyundai, Kia sue four big U.S. railroads over fuel surcharges
Description: Hyundai Motor Co and its Kia affiliate have sued the four largest U.S. railroads, accusing them of violating U.S. antitrust law by conspiring to drive up shipping costs though coordinated fuel surcharges.

Headlines: Charles Schwab to end commissions for stock trading, shares fall
Description: Discount brokerage Charles Schwab Corp said on Tuesday it is eliminating commissions for online trading of stocks, ETFs and options listed on U.S. or Canadian exchanges.

Headlines: Amazon.com brings Alexa to Brazil, kicks off pre-orders for devices
Description: Amazon.com Inc will launch its virtual assistant Alexa in Brazil starting this month, with plans for three different devices with the software installed, as it rapidly expands operations in Latin America's largest economy.

Headlines: WTO decision will weigh on Airbus, Germany's Merkel says
Description: A decision by the World Trade Organisation (WTO) allowing the United States to target goods imported from the European Union over illegal subsidies to Airbus will weigh on the planemaker, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Timeline: Highlights of the 15-year Airbus, Boeing trade war
Description: The World Trade Organization is poised on Wednesday to open the door to hefty U.S. tariffs on European goods over illegal subsidies for Airbus, pushing a 15-year-old row over support for plane giants to the center of fraught global trade relations.

Headlines: EU says U.S. tariffs linked to Airbus would be counterproductive
Description: The European Commission said on Wednesday that a U.S. move to impose trade sanctions on EU imports would be short-sighted and counterproductive and risked causing damage on both sides of the Atlantic.

Headlines: Britain says tariffs are no answer to Airbus dispute after WTO ruling
Description: Britain said tariffs were in no-one's interest and should not be applied to the UK after a ruling by the World Trade Organization on Wednesday that the United States could target $7.5 billion of imports from the European Union over illegal subsidies for planemaker Airbus.

Headlines: U.S. SEC proposes exchanges seek public consultation on data fee changes
Description: The U.S. securities regulator on Tuesday proposed a change to the way exchange operators alter their fees, in a move aimed at improving transparency but which could make it harder for operators to compete on price to propel revenue growth.

Headlines: CIS-based firm Freedom Holding plans NASDAQ listing
Description: Freedom Holding Corp, a U.S. holding companies with subsidiaries that provide services to financial markets in Eastern Europe and Central Asia, has gained approval to list on New York's NASDAQ Capital Markets exchange, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Samsung ends mobile phone production in China
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd has ended mobile telephone production in China, it said on Wednesday, hurt by intensifying competition from domestic rivals in the world's biggest smartphone market.

Headlines: WeWork Japan gets new CEO, days after We Company founder quits
Description: WeWork Japan on Wednesday named a new head of local operations, just days after the co-founder of the We Company stepped down following a botched attempt to gain a stock market listing.

Headlines: Paddy Power and Poker Stars owners to create online gambling leader
Description: The owner of Paddy Power Betfair has agreed to buy the company behind Poker Stars in a $6 billion share deal to create the world's largest online betting and gambling company by revenue, seeking to take advantage of the opening up of U.S. markets.

Headlines: Tesla's China production to start, eyes on mass production timing: sources
Description: Tesla Inc's China factory aims to start production this month but it is unclear when it will meet year-end production targets due to uncertainties around orders, labor and suppliers, sources with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Softbank names Ralf Wenzel to oversee joint ventures in Latin America
Description: Japan's Softbank Group Corp named entrepreneur Ralf Wenzel as chief executive at its Latin American Tech Hub, with the goal of creating joint ventures among Softbank-backed companies in an effort to expand in the region.

Headlines: Veteran investor Gilbert to leave Standard Life Aberdeen
Description: Veteran investor Martin Gilbert will leave Standard Life Aberdeen next year, ending a career spanning more than three decades at the helm of one of Britain's most successful asset managers.

Headlines: UK to fly back another 7,100 people on Wed after Thomas Cook collapse
Description: UK's Civil Aviation Authority said 44 flights are scheduled to fly on Wednesday to bring back 7,100 people back to the country, following the collapse of travel firm Thomas Cook.

Headlines: London court allows mass claim against Google over iPhone data
Description: London's Court of Appeal gave the go-ahead for action against Google over claims it collected data from more than 4 million iPhone users, overturning a ruling in 2018 that in effect blocked any route to legal redress.

Headlines: German businesses urge EU to protect them after latest WTO decision
Description: Germany's DIHK chambers of commerce on Wednesday urged the European Union to act strongly in order to protect their interests in a tariff row between the EU and the United States, reacting to the World Trade Organization's (WTO) latest decision.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson settles Ohio lawsuits to avoid federal trial
Description: Johnson & Johnson said on Tuesday it will pay $20.4 million to settle claims by two Ohio counties, allowing the U.S. healthcare giant to avoid an upcoming federal trial seeking to hold the industry responsible for the nation's opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Any errors in arrest of Huawei CFO were technical, Canadian government tells court
Description: Any errors in the arrest of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou in Canada last December were technical in nature and do not meet the requirements to suspend her extradition proceedings to the United States, government lawyers said in court on Wednesday.

Headlines: Troubles with Tesla's automated parking feature summon safety regulators
Description: U.S. regulators are looking into parking lot crashes involving Tesla Inc cars driving themselves to their owners using the company's Smart Summon feature, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Investors keep their faith in Hong Kong markets despite protests
Description: As anti-government protesters fought pitched battles with police in Hong Kong streets last week, a group of bankers in another part of the city were busy taking in billions for the public float of the Asia unit of the world's largest brewer.

Headlines: Global stocks fall to lowest in month on U.S. growth worries
Description: World equity benchmarks hit their lowest levels in a month on Wednesday as signs of a slowdown in U.S. economic growth and weak earnings in Europe fanned fears that the U.S.-China trade war could push the global economy into a recession.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles as trade war threatens U.S. economy
Description: Wall Street's main indexes suffered their sharpest one-day declines in nearly six weeks on Wednesday after employment and manufacturing data suggested that the U.S.-China trade war is taking an increasing toll on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Delta says new U.S. tariffs on Airbus will hurt profits, inflict 'serious harm'
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc warned on Wednesday that new U.S. tariffs on Airbus planes "will inflict serious harm on U.S. airlines" and shrink the company's profits.

Headlines: Airbus hits four-month low after WTO ruling; Pernod falls
Description: Airbus shares fell to four-month lows and Pernod Ricard SA extended losses on Wednesday after Washington won approval to impose tariffs on $7.5 billion worth of European goods, opening a new front in the global trade war.

Headlines: Slowing U.S. private hiring adds to gloom over economy
Description: Hiring by U.S. private employers slowed further in September, suggesting that trade tensions, which have pressured manufacturing, could be spilling over to the labor market.

Headlines: Pick-up trucks remain mainstay for Detroit Three in third quarter
Description: The Big Three U.S. automakers on Wednesday reported a rise in sales of pick-up trucks for the third quarter as lower interest rates boosted demand in an otherwise sluggish auto market.

Headlines: Pompeo says U.S. tariffs after WTO ruling could include cheese, wine
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday that retaliatory U.S. tariffs following the World Trade Organization ruling over European illegal subsidies for planemaker Airbus could include cheese and wine.

Headlines: Oil slides 2% as U.S. inventories build, weak economic data weighs
Description: Oil prices fell more than 2% on Wednesday after official data showed a rise in U.S. crude inventories, adding to worries about an oversupplied market as weak economic readings in the United States depressed global financial markets.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including earnings season, EU tariffs, Constellation CEO
Description: Jim Cramer breaks down how to judge the coming earnings season, interviews Constellation Brands CEO after shares sink, calls Ulta Beauty a buy and bemoans Trump's tariffs on the European Union.

Headlines: France and EU ready to respond with sanctions in U.S. trade dispute: French minister
Description: France and the European Union (EU) are ready to respond "with sanctions" if the United States were to reject the hand extended by Europe in the Airbus trade dispute, said French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Thursday.

Headlines: H&M shares surge after first quarterly profit rise in two years
Description: Sweden's H&M posted its first rise in quarterly pretax profit in more than two years on Thursday as the world's second-biggest fashion retailer said its drive to meet rapid changes in the market were on track.

Headlines: China is dumping wooden cabinet imports in U.S.: Commerce Department
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said in preliminary determination on Thursday that China was dumping wooden cabinets in the United States at margins ranging from 4.5% to 262.2%.

Headlines: U.S. recession risks up as services growth hits three-year low
Description: U.S. services sector activity slowed to a three-year low in September amid rising concerns about tariffs, suggesting that trade tensions were spilling over to the broader economy.

Headlines: Oil ends little changed after touching near two-month lows
Description: U.S. crude futures were slightly lower on Thursday, drawing some support from the stock market after earlier touching nearly two-month lows on weak economic data.

Headlines: Brexit raises stakes for Britain in aircraft trade war
Description: U.S. tariffs on European goods have plunged Britain into a trade war between the European Union and United States just as it plans to leave the 28-nation bloc, infuriating Scotch whisky makers and handing it a dilemma over thousands of Airbus jobs.

Headlines: Global stocks crawl up slightly as weak U.S. data spurs hopes of Fed rate cut
Description: The latest weaker-than-expected U.S. economic data on Thursday fed hopes that the Federal Reserve would cut U.S. interest rates this month, which helped lift global equities slightly after two days of declines, but investors also parked some funds in U.S. Treasuries and other safe-haven assets.

Headlines: U.S. duties on French wine are bad news for all, exporters say
Description: The U.S. decision to impose tariffs on French wines will penalize American consumers who will see a sharp rise in prices while severely hurting French producers on their largest export market, exporters said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. tariffs grate on Italy's Parmesan cheesemakers
Description: U.S. consumers will pay around $5 a kilogram more for Italian Parmesan cheese because of duties announced by Washington on a range of European goods, a cheesemaking consortium said on Thursday, complaining it was set to take an unfair hit in the trade spat.

Headlines: Chasing Chinese consumers, Tiffany CEO sends top bling abroad
Description: Tiffany & Co is sending more of its priciest jewelry to mainland China to reach consumers kept at home by a weak currency, Chief Executive Alessandro Bogliolo said on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street gains as weak services data raises rate-cut expectations
Description: Wall Street stocks climbed on Thursday after data showing U.S. services-sector activity at a three-year low fueled expectations that the Federal Reserve would cut interest rates to stem a wider economic downturn.

Headlines: Costco quarterly sales miss estimates amid fierce competition
Description: Costco Wholesale Corp reported quarterly revenue below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, as the U.S. hypermarket chain struggled to attract shoppers in the competitive grocery space.

Headlines: PC maker HP to cut up to 9,000 jobs in restructuring push
Description: U.S. personal computer maker HP Inc said on Thursday it will cut up to 16% of its workforce as part of a restructuring plan aimed at cutting costs.

Headlines: U.S. hits Scotch whisky, Italian cheese, French wine with 25% tariffs
Description: The Trump administration slapped 25% tariffs on French wine, Italian cheese and single-malt Scotch whisky -- but spared Italian wine, pasta and olive oil -- in retaliation for European Union subsidies on large aircraft.

Headlines: Walmart to test programs for U.S. workers to cut its healthcare costs
Description: Walmart Inc said on Thursday it will begin several healthcare pilot programs for its U.S. employees starting Jan. 1 as it looks for ways to cut healthcare costs - one of the largest expenses for the retailer after wages.

Headlines: Chevron's shale allies are its secret weapon in Exxon race
Description: U.S. oil company Chevron Corp is turning to joint ventures and drilling alliances in its bid to dominate the Permian Basin after abandoning a takeover that would have made it the leading producer in the world's biggest shale field.

Headlines: Stocks on tenterhooks as U.S. recession signs build
Description: A wake-up call from the U.S. heartland has spooked Wall Street by raising fears of a recession that will push equities into a correction.

Headlines: Italy prosecutors open Netflix tax evasion investigation: source
Description: Italian prosecutors have opened an investigation into alleged tax evasion targeting U.S. streaming service Netflix, a source with direct knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: European luxury, drink stocks lifted by U.S. tariffs relief
Description: European luxury goods and drinks company shares rose on Thursday after new U.S. tariffs in retaliation over EU aircraft subsidies excluded cognac, champagne and leather goods.

Headlines: U.S. committee seeks to interview Boeing engineer on safety of 737 MAX
Description: A U.S. panel has asked Boeing Co to make an engineer available for an interview after reports that the worker filed an internal ethics complaint on 737 MAX's safety and that the planemaker convinced the regulator to relax safety standards.

Headlines: Axon boosts encryption, weighs blockchain to tackle body-cam 'deepfakes'
Description: Axon Enterprise Inc, the leading maker of U.S. police body cameras, began shipping new devices last week with security upgrades it says could aid in thwarting and discrediting "deepfake" videos.

Headlines: U.S. tariffs on EU products to affect $1 billion euros of Spanish exports: farmers' association
Description: U.S. tariffs on European Union products would affect around 1 billion euros ($1.10 billion) of Spanish agricultural products per year, Spanish agricultural association COAG said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. tariffs to hit 500 million euros of Italian food exports: farmers group
Description: U.S. tariffs on European Union products will hit around 500 million euros ($547.40 million) of Italian agricultural products per year, farmers' association Coldiretti said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump on WTO case: 'This case going on for years, a nice victory!'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday hailed a "nice victory" after the World Trade Organization gave Washington a green light to impose tariffs on $7.5 billion worth of EU goods annually as punishment for illegal aircraft subsidies.

Headlines: WTO win won't sway United States from its combative trade stance
Description: President Donald Trump has hailed a ruling by the World Trade Organization (WTO) that gives the United States the right to hit Europe with tariffs, but his new-found satisfaction with the WTO's rules-based approach is expected to prove short-lived.

Headlines: Broadcom faces EU order to suspend some business practices: source
Description: U.S. chipmaker Broadcom will be told by EU antitrust regulators this month to suspend certain business practices including exclusivity clauses with TV and modem makers, a person familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Fed should keep cutting rates despite jobs number: U.S. trade adviser Navarro
Description: White House Trade Adviser Peter Navarro said in a television interview on Friday the low U.S. unemployment rate and steady job growth should not deter the Federal Reserve from lowering interest rates.

Headlines: EU likely to respond to U.S. tariffs with own measures: Germany's Maas
Description: The European Union is likely to take retaliatory measures in response to new U.S. tariffs on European goods, German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas told newspapers in remarks published on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. Pompeo says will talk to EU over tariffs - La Stampa
Description: The United States will talk to the European Union before adopting its trade tariffs on European goods, the U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said in a video interview posted on daily La Stampa website on Friday.

Headlines: September's unemployment rate hit a 50-year-low —Five economists on what this means for markets
Description: The September jobs reports was slightly better than expectations. The U.S. added 136,00 nonfarm payrolls and the unemployment rate fell to 3.5 percent, the lowest level in 50 years.

Headlines: Behind the GM strike: Declining productivity at U.S. operations
Description: General Motors Co's U.S. workforce productivity has declined since the automaker recovered from a 2009 bankruptcy, even as its profit per employee has risen, a Reuters analysis shows.

Headlines: U.S. unemployment rate hits 3.5%; job growth moderate
Description: The U.S. unemployment rate dropped to near a 50-year low of 3.5% in September, with job growth increasing moderately, suggesting the slowing economy could avoid a recession for now despite trade tensions that are hammering manufacturing.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. September payrolls lower than expected, jobless rate drops
Description: U.S. job growth increased moderately in September, with the unemployment rate dropping to near a 50-year low of 3.5%, which could assuage financial market concerns that the slowing economy was on the brink of a recession amid lingering trade tensions.

Headlines: U.S. agency reviews whether 2,000 Teslas should have been recalled
Description: U.S. regulators said on Friday they were reviewing whether Tesla Inc should have recalled 2,000 of its electric cars in May instead of issuing a software upgrade to fix a potential defect that could have resulted in battery fires.

Headlines: Capital spending outlook another worry ahead of earnings
Description: Investors are preparing for more cautious capital investment outlooks from U.S. companies as worries mount heading into earnings season about the possibility of an economic recession.

Headlines: Sacklers reaped up to $13 billion from OxyContin maker, U.S. states say
Description: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP steered up to $13 billion in profits to the company's controlling Sackler family, according to U.S. states opposing efforts to halt lawsuits alleging the company and its owners helped fuel the U.S. opioid epidemic.

Headlines: New tariffs on EU food will boost prices, cost U.S. jobs: industry
Description: New 25% U.S. tariffs on Italian cheese, French wine, Scotch whisky, British biscuits, Spanish olives and thousands of other European food products will lead to higher prices ahead of the holiday season and cost American jobs, trade groups said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Antitrust probers in Congress ask Spotify to detail alleged Apple abuses - sources
Description: U.S. lawmakers have requested information from Apple critic Spotify as part of an antitrust probe, according to two sources briefed on the investigation into allegations the iPhone maker engages in anti-competitive behavior to support its own apps.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court takes up fight over $7.5 billion natural gas pipeline
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear an appeal by Dominion Energy Inc and President Donald Trump's administration of a lower court ruling that halted construction on a $7.5 billion natural gas pipeline due to run underneath a section of the popular Appalachian Trail in rural Virginia.

Headlines: Easing concerns about U.S. economy lift equity markets
Description: A report showing a modest increase in U.S. jobs lifted world equity benchmarks broadly on Friday, restoring calm after one of the worst weeks for stocks in months.

Headlines: Fighting GM puts a financial squeeze on striking union workers
Description: While striking workers at General Motors Co's U.S. auto plants continue walking picket lines for a third week to demand better pay and benefits, the financial pressure has mounted for union members like Frank Lee.

Headlines: Trump hails 'nice victory' on trade as EU whisky, wine makers left reeling
Description: President Donald Trump hailed a "nice victory" on Thursday after the United States got the green light to place tariffs on European Union goods in a dispute over EU aircraft subsidies.

Headlines: Oil settles up as U.S. unemployment rate drops, but crude ends week down 5%
Description: Oil prices rose about 1% on Friday as an increase in U.S. jobs eased some financial market concerns that a slowing global economy could dent oil demand, but crude fell more than 5% on the week, its second consecutive weekly decline.

Headlines: As Fed policymakers comb data, few decisive signals on outlook
Description: Federal Reserve policymakers on Friday signaled they are on high alert for signs that uncertainty over trade policy and slowing global growth are beginning to hold back the broader U.S. economy, but so far they have flagged little in the data that is pointing one way or the other.

Headlines: Main issues in UAW-GM labor talks narrow to wages, pensions: source
Description: As the U.S. strike by the United Auto Workers union against General Motors Co nears three weeks, the main remaining issues in the negotiations have narrowed to wages and pensions, a person familiar with the talks said on Saturday.

Headlines: Talks between UAW and GM take 'turn for the worse': union official
Description: Talks for a new four-year labor contract between General Motors Co and its striking workers took a "turn for the worse" on Sunday after the United Auto Workers rejected the largest U.S. automaker's latest offer but the two sides were still talking.

Headlines: Low inflation? Nothing to worry about, Fed's George says
Description: Kansas City Federal Reserve Bank President Esther George on Sunday rejected the notion that the U.S. central bank should cut interest rates to try to boost low inflation, which she said is largely a result of global forces that U.S. monetary policy can do little to counter.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz offers subsidies to retrofit older diesel cars in Germany
Description: Daimler said on Tuesday Mercedes-Benz customers in Germany could apply for a 3,000 euro ($3,350) subsidy to upgrade the exhaust filters of older, polluting diesel vehicles, the latest effort among German carmakers to avoid inner-city bans.

Headlines: Delta swings from market weakness to strength in Latin America
Description: A surprise $1.9 billion investment by Delta Air Lines in LATAM Airlines Group is likely to fire up competition in South America as the weakest U.S. carrier in the region joins up with the strongest homegrown player.

Headlines: Harley struggles to fire up new generation of riders with electric bike debut
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc is betting on electric motorcycles to attract the next generation of younger and more environmentally conscious riders to reverse declining U.S. sales.

Headlines: What next after AMS' failed $4.9 billion bid for Osram?
Description: Austrian sensor specialist AMS has pledged to find another way to take over Germany's Osram to form a global leader in sensors and lighting, after its $4.9 billion bid for the larger firm fell through on Friday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank in strategy shift to address tech woes
Description: Deutsche Bank is creating a new technology division in a strategy shift designed to reduce complexity and lower costs while transforming systems that have held back the bank for years.

Headlines: Oil prices drop as hopes fade for comprehensive U.S.-China trade deal
Description: Oil prices settled lower on Monday, paring earlier gains as hopes of a comprehensive U.S.-China trade deal faded and a new poll showed analysts expected U.S. oil crude inventories to have risen last week.

Headlines: Amazon launches bigger local online store in Singapore
Description: Amazon.com Inc has launched a bigger local store and marketplace in Singapore, expanding its product selection and intensifying competition with rivals such as Alibaba Group Holding Ltd's Lazada and Sea Ltd's Shopee.

Headlines: U.S.-Japan trade deal aims to put U.S. farmers on par with Trans-Pacific trade pact competitors
Description: The new U.S.-Japan trade deal will provide staged reduction of Japanese tariffs for more than $2 billion worth of U.S. beef and pork, matching access now granted to the 11 Trans-Pacific Partnership trade pact countries, a text of the agreement shows.

Headlines: Oracle to hire 2,000 workers to expand cloud business to more countries
Description: Oracle Corp plans to hire nearly 2,000 additional workers as part of an aggressive plan to roll out its cloud computing services to more locations around the world, its cloud chief told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: GE to freeze, pre-pay pensions to save up to $8 billion, cut debt
Description: General Electric Co said on Monday it would freeze pensions for about 20,000 salaried U.S. employees and take other related moves to help the ailing conglomerate cut debt and reduce its retirement fund deficit by up to $8 billion.

Headlines: Wall Street falls amid caution on U.S.-China trade dispute
Description: U.S. stocks eased on Monday as reports on the U.S.-China trade front kept investors cautious ahead of scheduled talks later in the week.

Headlines: Indexes tumble as visa restrictions fuel U.S.-China worries
Description: U.S. stocks ended down sharply and near the day's lows on Tuesday as news that the United States has imposed visa restrictions on Chinese officials overshadowed comments by Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell suggesting openness to further interest rate cuts.

Headlines: Stocks fall as trade tensions rise further; Brexit battle hurts pound
Description: Stocks fell on Tuesday as U.S.-China tensions rose further ahead of high-level trade talks, while the British pound sank on reports that Brexit negotiations were close to breaking down.

Headlines: Weak U.S. producer inflation bolsters case for Fed rate cut
Description: U.S. producer prices unexpectedly fell in September, leading to the smallest annual increase in nearly three years, likely giving the Federal Reserve further room to cut interest rates for the third time this year in October.

Headlines: Cracks in Purdue's proposed opioid settlement as Arizona backs out
Description: The U.S. state of Arizona withdrew its support for a proposed nationwide opioid settlement with Purdue Pharma LP, saying the maker of OxyContin sought to "undermine material terms of the deal," according to a court filing on Monday.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX timetable uncertain as regulators continue safety review
Description: U.S. and European Union regulators said on Tuesday they were still reviewing changes Boeing Co made to 737 MAX software after two fatal crashes, a development that raised questions about how quickly the grounded aircraft can return to service.

Headlines: Nissan to appoint Uchida as next CEO, Gupta as COO: Nikkei
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor Co will appoint Senior Vice President Makoto Uchida as chief executive officer, the Nikkei newspaper said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Biggest U.S. index funds oppose most climate proposals in shareholder votes
Description: The far-reaching impacts of climate change on companies have investors pressing corporate leaders for action to minimize environmental damage and to maximize disclosure of risks to their businesses. The threats range from more frequent floods or wildfires that imperil major assets to regulations that could undermine profits.

Headlines: Target to power new Toys 'R' Us online business
Description: Target Corp on Tuesday announced a partnership with Tru Kids, the parent company of Toys 'R' Us brand, to power the toy retailer's online business in the United States ahead of the holiday season.

Headlines: Trump's Scottish Golf courses post further losses
Description: Scottish Golf courses owned by President Donald Trump's family business posted further losses last year, according to accounts filed in Britain in recent days.

Headlines: Rent the Runway back up after operational glitch
Description: U.S. clothing rental service Rent the Runway said on Tuesday its business was back online after an operational snag caused the company to cancel several customer orders and hold off on new sign-ups.

Headlines: IKEA to open first store in Slovenia in 2020
Description: IKEA will start building its first store in Slovenia in October with construction expected to be completed in about 12 months, the Swedish furniture retailer said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Index funds invest trillions but rarely challenge management
Description: Index funds now control half https://tmsnrt.rs/2Mhmc6L the U.S. stock mutual fund market, giving the biggest funds enormous power to influence decisions and demand better returns at the companies in which they invest trillions of dollars.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil considers sale of Malaysian offshore assets for up to $3 billion: Bloomberg
Description: U.S. energy giant Exxon Mobil Corp is considering a sale of its Malaysian upstream offshore assets for up to $3 billion, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: After spurned play for LSE, Hong Kong bourse to seek deeper China embrace
Description: Hong Kong stock exchange boss Charles Li ignited his unrequited overture to the London Stock Exchange with a riff on Romeo and Juliet as a corporate romance, and doused it in a wistful blog reference to the author of 'Alice in Wonderland'.

Headlines: French finance minister says up to Renault's board to decide on management changes
Description: It was not up to the French state to interfere in management decisions at Renault , France's Finance minister said on Wednesday, following a report in business daily Le Figaro that the carmaker's CEO Thierry Bollore may be replaced soon.

Headlines: Wall Street gains on trade optimism, but Beijing tempers hopes
Description: Wall Street rose on Wednesday on hopes of progress in U.S.-China trade talks, though stocks pared gains late after Chinese officials said Beijing had lowered expectations for negotiations this week.

Headlines: Mississippi will back Sprint, T-Mobile merger and drop court challenge
Description: One of 17 U.S. states that sued to block a proposed $26.5 billion tie-up of Sprint Corp and T-Mobile US Inc agreed to drop the challenge after reaching a deal with the companies.

Headlines: Venezuela designers turn to piracy after Adobe announces it will cut service
Description: Venezuelans desperately explored piracy workarounds on Tuesday to continue using Adobe programs after the software developer said it will cut access to its products for the country's users, citing U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: White House denies report China's Liu He plans to leave Washington on Thursday: CNBC
Description: The White House has denied a report from the South China Morning Post that said that Chinese Vice Premier Liu He is planning to leave Washington on Thursday after just one day of minister-level meetings, a CNBC reporter said on Twitter.

Headlines: Trump's fast-tracking of oil pipelines hits legal roadblocks
Description: The Trump administration's effort to cut red tape and speed up major energy projects has backfired in the case of the three biggest U.S. pipelines now planned or under construction.

Headlines: American Airlines cancels 737 MAX flights until Jan. 16
Description: American Airlines Group Inc on Wednesday extended cancellations of Boeing 737 MAX flights through Jan. 15, running contrary to the U.S. planemaker's promises that the grounded jets would be flying again before the year-end.

Headlines: Shares in China's Hikvision and Dahua dive after U.S. blacklisting
Description: Shares of Hangzhou Hikvision Digital Technology and Zhejiang Dahua Technology Co Ltd, which were among companies blacklisted by Washington, fell sharply in early trading on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. weighing China currency pact as part of partial trade deal: Bloomberg
