Description: The United States is weighing a currency pact with China as part of a partial deal that could see a planned tariff hike next week being suspended, Bloomberg reported https://bloom.bg/35vnu7g on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the talks.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including China blacklist, Domino's earnings, S&P 500 run
Description: In Tuesday's "Mad Money" episode, Jim Cramer derides the Trump administration's ban on Chinese companies, interviews Domino's CEO Ritch Allison after earnings and sees what's in store for the S&P 500.

Headlines: Stocks rise on trade truce bets; lira shaken by Turkey move on Syria
Description: Stocks gained on Wednesday on a report that China could yet agree to a partial trade deal with the United States despite recent tensions, while the prospect of a last-minute Brexit agreement between the European Union and Britain seemed as remote as ever.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade war may cut global growth by half a point next year: Le Maire
Description: The trade war between the United States and China could cut global growth by 0.5 points next year, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Goldman evaluating role in China's Megvii IPO after U.S. blacklist
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc said on Tuesday it was reviewing its involvement in Megvii Technology Ltd's planned initial public offering after the U.S. government placed the Chinese artificial intelligence firm on a human rights blacklist.

Headlines: Hungary's MOL in talks for Chevron's $2 billion stake in giant Azeri oilfield: sources
Description: Hungarian energy firm MOL is in talks to acquire Chevron's stake in a giant oilfield in Azerbaijan for more than $2 billion, according to three banking and industry sources involved in the process.

Headlines: China's Hikvision sees only limited impact from U.S. blacklisting
Description: Chinese video surveillance company Hikvision will only suffer a limited, short-term hit after being blacklisted by the U.S. government and will strive to get the ban lifted, its general manager said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Halliburton cutting 650 jobs as U.S. oilfield slowdown accelerates
Description: Halliburton said on Wednesday it is cutting another 650 U.S. oilfield services jobs as U.S. and gas producers have slashed spending amid weak prices and investor demands for higher returns.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg to testify before U.S. House panel on Oct. 23
Description: Facebook chief executive Mark Zuckerberg will testify before the U.S. House Financial Services Committee on Oct. 23 as the social media company faces growing scrutiny from U.S. lawmakers over a planned cryptocurrency and other issues including advertising policies.

Headlines: Exxon names BAML to run Malaysia asset sales: sources
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp has appointed Bank of America Merrill Lynch to run the sale of its Malaysian oil and gas assets as the U.S. firm accelerates a vast disposal program, banking and industry sources said.

Headlines: Decreasing U.S. job openings point to cooling labor market
Description: U.S. job openings fell to a 1-1/2-year low in August and hiring declined, suggesting employment growth was slowing largely because of ebbing demand for labor as the economy loses momentum.

Headlines: Consumer Reports calls Tesla automated parking 'glitchy'
Description: Tesla Inc's Smart Summon automated parking system is "glitchy" and only works intermittently, influential U.S. magazine Consumer Reports has said, adding to recent questions about the app-based feature.

Headlines: Factbox: International tax faces biggest shake-up in decades under OECD plan
Description: The Organisation for Economic Cooperation (OECD) has proposed overhauling rules for taxing cross-border corporate income to bring them into line with the digital age.

Headlines: Nissan says no-deal Brexit tariffs would be unsustainable for it in Europe
Description: No-deal Brexit tariffs of 10% on vehicles would be unsustainable for Nissan in Europe, where it runs Britain's biggest car factory, the Japanese company warned on Thursday.

Headlines: JPMorgan targets Asia's growing wealth with Singapore trust company
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has set up a trust company in Singapore, its first in Asia, to cater for a growing cadre of ultra-wealthy individuals in the region.

Headlines: China willing to reach agreement with U.S.: Vice Premier Liu He
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He said on Thursday that China is willing to reach agreement with the United States on matters that both sides care about so as to prevent friction from leading to any further escalation, the state news agency Xinhua reported.

Headlines: Altcoins: Ahead of Libra, XRP cryptocurrency gains toehold in commerce
Description: Facebook's Libra may be grabbing all the headlines at the moment, yet a major cryptocurrency already exists that's gained a toehold in mainstream commerce.

Headlines: Exclusive: China Everbright Group to restructure, pursue billion-dollar HK IPO - sources
Description: State-owned financial conglomerate China Everbright Group aims to restructure its sprawling business and pursue a billion dollar IPO next year in Hong Kong, three people with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: Snakes and ladders - SoftBank Vision Fund's climbing, sliding valuations
Description: The $100 billion Vision Fund of Japan's SoftBank Group Corp has in just over two years burnt through much of its capital investing in money-losing, late-stage tech startups in areas as varied as autonomous driving, healthcare and finance.

Headlines: China urges U.S. to halt pressure on Chinese companies, including Huawei
Description: China has urged the United States to stop unreasonable pressure on Chinese companies, including Huawei Technologies, foreign ministry spokesman Geng Shuang said at a daily press briefing on Thursday.

Headlines: Chinese vice premier arrives at USTR offices for high-level trade talks
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer greeted Chinese Vice Premier Liu He on the steps of the USTR office on Thursday for the highest-level trade talks between the two countries since late July.

Headlines: Nissan to start building new Juke car at UK plant as Brexit looms
Description: Nissan said it will begin making the next-generation Juke vehicle at Britain’s biggest car plant on Monday, just over two weeks before a possible no-deal Brexit which the industry has warned could bring production to a halt.

Headlines: Trump says U.S.-China trade talks went very well on Thursday
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said trade talks between U.S. and Chinese officials on Thursday went very well and the two sides had a very, very good negotiation.

Headlines: Indexes climb on fresh hopes for U.S.-China trade deal
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Thursday on hopes that top-level U.S.-China trade talks would yield at least a partial deal, while a jump in Apple's shares also boosted the market.

Headlines: Port of Los Angeles September imports fall as trade war roils shipping
Description: The Port of Los Angeles, the busiest for ocean trade with China, processed fewer containers of imported goods in September as the prolonged U.S.-China trade war whipsaws global supply chains.

Headlines: Google begins responding to Texas antitrust investigators' data demands
Description: Texas officials managing a sprawling investigation of the advertising practices at Alphabet Inc's Google have begun receiving data from the search and advertising giant after two previous probes bogged down in extended document fights.

Headlines: GM urges UAW to agree to 'around-the-clock' bargaining
Description: General Motors Co late on Thursday urged the United Auto Workers union to agree to around-the-clock bargaining to try to resolve a 25-day U.S. strike that has cost the company more than $1 billion in profits, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Japan's Seven & I shares surge on plan to cut 3,000 jobs, shut stores
Description: Shares of Japan's Seven & I Holdings Co rose nearly 6% on Friday after the retail group said it will shut or relocate nearly 1,000 7-Eleven convenience stores and cut about 3,000 jobs as part of a group-wide restructuring.

Headlines: Air New Zealand entices Walmart U.S. boss Foran home to lead airline
Description: Air New Zealand Ltd named Walmart U.S. boss Greg Foran as its new chief executive on Friday, bringing him back home at a time the airline is trying to control costs in a lower-growth environment.

Headlines: Google secures two Android phone makers' backing in fight against EU antitrust order
Description: Alphabet unit Google's fight against a record EU antitrust fine related to its Android mobile software received a boost after Europe's second-highest court allowed Android phone maker Gigaset and HMD Global Oy to intervene in the lawsuit.

Headlines: U.S. judge urges parties to wisely use Purdue opioid settlement funds
Description: A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Thursday urged parties that will benefit from a proposed settlement with OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP to focus on addressing the opioid addiction crisis and avoid battling over the deal's billions of dollars.

Headlines: Renault board to meet, as CEO denounces potential exit as 'coup'
Description: Renault SA's CEO, Thierry Bollore, denounced as a "coup" his potential exit from the French carmaker, which has called a board meeting on Friday to discuss governance matters.

Headlines: Walmart U.S. CEO Foran to exit and be replaced by Sam's Club boss Furner
Description: Walmart Inc said on Thursday its chief executive for U.S. operations, Greg Foran, will leave the company early next year and be replaced by the head of its Sam's Club warehouse chain unit, John Furner.

Headlines: Fed eases post-crisis rules for domestic, foreign banks
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Thursday unveiled a final package of rules easing capital and liquidity requirements for domestic U.S. and foreign banks that were originally introduced following the 2007-2009 global financial crisis.

Headlines: Apple CEO Cook defends removal of police-tracking app used in Hong Kong
Description: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook on Thursday defended the iPhone maker's decision to remove from its app store a police-tracking app used by protesters in Hong Kong, according to a copy of a letter to employees seen by Reuters and confirmed by Apple.

Headlines: U.S. Chamber sees possible U.S.-China currency agreement, tariff hike delay
Description: Top U.S. and Chinese negotiators are working towards an "early harvest" of confidence-building agreements that could forestall further U.S. tariffs, including an agreement to avoid currency manipulation, a senior U.S. Chamber of Commerce official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Roche billionaire board member says short-term profit hunger 'destroyed the planet'
Description: A member of Swiss drugmaker Roche's controlling family said on Wednesday that short-term profit maximization has "destroyed the planet" and the world needs a new breed of capitalism putting long-term interests first.

Headlines: LVMH eases luxury sector fears of major Hong Kong hit
Description: A strong sales update from LVMH boosted stocks across the luxury goods sector on Thursday, as months of unrest in Hong Kong proved less of a drag on the Louis Vuitton owner in the third quarter than expected.

Headlines: American Airlines restructures operations and commercial teams
Description: American Airlines Group Inc said on Thursday it would restructure its operations and commercial teams and announced a host of new appointments as the No. 1 U.S. airline increases focus on revenue growth and network expansion.

Headlines: U.S. consumer inflation tame, labor market still tightening
Description: U.S. consumer prices were unchanged in September and underlying inflation retreated, supporting expectations the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates in October for the third time this year amid risks to the economy from trade tensions.

Headlines: Hugo Boss cuts outlook again, citing weak U.S., Hong Kong business
Description: German fashion house Hugo Boss cut its 2019 earnings forecast again, citing weak demand in the United States and Hong Kong, and reported third quarter results that were below its expectations.

Headlines: Fidelity follows rivals in cutting online trading commissions to zero
Description: Fidelity Investments on Thursday eliminated commissions on online trades of U.S. stocks, exchange traded funds (ETFs) and options, becoming the latest brokerage to cut trading fees to compete with new entrants in the market.

Headlines: Renault CEO denounces 'coup' at Renault: Les Echos
Description: Renault's CEO Thierry Bollore denounced on Thursday as a "coup" his potential exit from the French carmaker, which has called a board meeting on Friday.

Headlines: LSE told Italy it won't shift location of MTS operations: BOI source
Description: London Stock Exchange has given assurances to Italy that it plans to continue investing in its Italian trading platforms and does not intend to move them out of the country, a Bank of Italy source told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: LSE told Italy it won't move bond trading platforms: central bank source
Description: London Stock Exchange has given assurances to Italy that it plans to continue investing in its Italian trading platforms and does not intend to move them out of the country, a Bank of Italy source said on Thursday.

Headlines: Uber faces UK tax challenge
Description: Uber Technologies Inc says the UK is seeking to classify the company as a transportation provider, potentially opening it up to new tax charges that could weigh heavily on its business, according to UK accounts filings in recent days.

Headlines: Lengthy UAW strike at GM to cost $1.5 billion: Credit Suisse
Description: An ongoing workers' strike at General Motors Co could cost the automaker about $1.5 billion, brokerage Credit Suisse said on Friday, throwing the U.S. automaker's cost reduction plans off the track and forcing key suppliers to cut their 2019 outlook.

Headlines: Houston Rockets Nike merchandise disappears from China stores
Description: Houston Rockets sneakers and other merchandise were pulled from several Nike stores in major Chinese cities amid the furor surrounding a tweet from the team's general manager in support of anti-government protests in Hong Kong.

Headlines: Trump says U.S.-China trade talks are going well
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that U.S.-China trade talks were going well as the second day of top-level negotiations aimed at rolling back tensions between the world's two largest economies begins.

Headlines: Timeline: Key dates in the U.S.-China trade war
Description: Top U.S. and Chinese trade officials met on Thursday for the first time since late July to try to find their way out of a bitter, 15-month trade war as new irritants between the world's two largest economies threatened to dash hopes for progress.

Headlines: Day 1 of U.S.-China trade talks ends with hopes for limited deal
Description: Top U.S. and Chinese negotiators wrapped up a first day of trade talks in more than two months on Thursday as business groups expressed optimism the two sides might be able to ease a 15-month trade war and delay a U.S. tariff hike scheduled for next week.

Headlines: Chinese foreign ministry hopes China can work with U.S. for progress on trade talks
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday it hoped China can work with the United States for progress on trade consultations, when asked about trade talks between the two countries.

Headlines: SAP reverts to co-CEOs after showman McDermott's decade of growth
Description: Bill McDermott stood down on Friday after a decade building up SAP as the world's leading enterprise software company, handing the task of completing its transition to cloud computing to new co-CEOs Jennifer Morgan and Christian Klein.

Headlines: Factbox: Nearly all goods traded by U.S. and China will have tariffs by December 15
Description: U.S. and Chinese negotiators meet in Washington on Thursday and Friday to try, once again, to defuse a trade war that has roiled markets and triggered tit-for-tat tariffs on hundreds of billions of goods traded between the world's largest economies.

Headlines: Trump to meet with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He at 2:45 p.m. EDT/1845 GMT Friday
Description: President Donald Trump will meet with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He at 2:45 p.m. EDT/1845 GMT on Friday as the world's two biggest economies try to reach a trade agreement, the White House said.

Headlines: Boeing partners with Porsche on electric flying car
Description: U.S. planemaker Boeing Co said on Thursday it was working with Volkswagen's sports car brand, Porsche, to develop a concept electric flying vehicle capable of transporting people in urban settings.

Headlines: British regulator reviews JPMorgan metals trading amid U.S. probe: sources
Description: Britain's financial services regulator is examining allegations of precious metals market manipulation by JPMorgan Chase & Co traders following criminal charges by U.S. authorities, according to two people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Boeing board strips CEO of chairman title amid 737 MAX crisis
Description: Boeing Co's board has stripped chief executive Dennis Muilenburg of his chairmanship title, in an unexpected strategy shift announced by the U.S. planemaker on Friday only hours after a global aviation panel criticized development of the troubled 737 MAX.

Headlines: U.S. SEC halts Telegram's $1.7 billion digital token offering
Description: U.S. authorities said on Friday they have halted a $1.7 billion unregistered digital token offering by the messaging service Telegram Group Inc and its TON Issuer subsidiary.

Headlines: Digital assets subject to money-laundering, disclosure laws: U.S. regulators
Description: Three U.S. financial regulators on Friday issued a warning to firms with registered digital assets that they have an obligation to follow securities laws prohibiting money laundering and requiring disclosure of suspicious activity.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sempra nears $3 billion Chile sale to China's State Grid - sources
Description: U.S. power company Sempra Energy is near an agreement to sell its Chilean business to State Grid Corporation of China for close to $3 billion, the latest deal in its bid to shed non-core assets, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: American Airlines says it is negotiating partnership with Brazil's Gol
Description: American Airlines Group Inc said on Friday it is negotiating a possible partnership with Brazil's Gol Linhas Aereas Inteligentes SA .

Headlines: Oil rises 2% after reports of Iranian tanker attack
Description: Oil prices rose more than 2% on Friday after Iranian media said a state-owned oil tanker was attacked in the Red Sea near Saudi Arabia, while optimism surrounding the U.S.-China trade war lifted sentiment.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including China trade deal, Wendy's breakfast, earnings
Description: Jim Cramer says Trump's trade strategy is working, but he's not yet sold on trade talks. The "Mad Money" host previews the week ahead on Wall Street, chats with Wendy's CEO and offers tips in golf stocks.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Bruised U.S. banks expected to report third quarter earnings decline
Description: The biggest U.S. banks are expected to kick off the earnings season on a sour note next week due to falling interest rates, which may have pressured net interest margins enough to cause the sector's first year-over-year earnings per share decline in three years.

Headlines: Global risk 'confluence,' as tariffs, Brexit, weaker forecasts collide
Description: Higher tariffs. Slower growth. The countdown to Brexit.

Headlines: China September soybean imports ease on falling animal feed demand
Description: China's soybean imports in September fell 13.5% from the previous month, customs data showed on Monday, as an epidemic of African swine fever that has slashed China's pig herd reduced demand for soymeal.

Headlines: China September rare earth exports fall nearly 18% from last month
Description: China's rare earth exports in September fell 17.9% from August, customs data showed on Monday, amid lingering fears that the world's top producer of the minerals will restrict supply because of its trade row with the United States.

Headlines: China September iron ore imports surge to 20-month high on firm demand
Description: China's iron ore imports rose for a third straight month in September to a 20-month high, according to customs data released on Monday, fueled by firm demand at steel mills and stable shipments from big miners.

Headlines: China will use counter-cyclical adjustments to manage economy: Premier Li
Description: Downward pressure on China's economy is increasing and the government will make good use of counter-cyclical adjustments to keep economic operations within reasonable range, state television quoted premier Li Keqiang as saying.

Headlines: Brazil airline Azul eyes partnership with United, Avianca, Copa
Description: Brazil airline Azul SA said on Monday that it is in discussions to join a planned partnership with United Airlines , Avianca Holdings and Copa Holdings for flights between the United States and Latin America.

Headlines: China September crude oil imports rise on strong seasonal demand
Description: China's crude oil imports in September rose 10.8% from a year earlier as refiners ramped up output amid stable profit margins and solid fuel demand.

Headlines: Trump's hailing of $50 billion in Chinese farm purchases seen as 'meaningless'
Description: China is still a long way from forking out $50 billion for farm goods from the United States, agriculture industry analysts said on Monday, cautioning that getting there is contingent on removing substantial technical and political hurdles.

Headlines: Emirates president says he does not expect to take any Boeing 777x in 2020
Description: Emirates doubts it will receive any of the 115 Boeing 777-9s it has ordered next year, its president said on Monday, as the U.S. planemaker grapples with challenges in building the jet.

Headlines: China September copper imports rise to eight-month high, aluminum exports fall
Description: China's copper imports rose 10.15% in September from a month earlier, to their highest in eight months, data from the customs showed on Monday, as higher prices in Shanghai drew shipments to the world's top consumer of the metal.

Headlines: Buyout firm Thoma Bravo adds Sophos to its cybersecurity chest with $3.8 billion deal
Description: U.S. private equity firm Thoma Bravo is adding Sophos Group to its cybersecurity stable, announcing on Monday a buyout deal that values the British maker of antivirus and encryption products at about $3.8 billion.

Headlines: What to watch in third quarter earnings from U.S. companies
Description: U.S. companies are preparing to report third-quarter results following a rocky few months in which they grappled with a U.S.-China trade conflict undermining the business environment and an overall economy that has been showing signs of struggling.

Headlines: Uber launches boat service in Nigeria's megacity Lagos
Description: Global ride-hailing firm Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] on Friday launched a pilot test of a boat service in Nigeria's commercial capital Lagos to attract commuters seeking to avoid the megacity's notoriously congested roads.

Headlines: Google's fight against EU antitrust fine to be heard February 12-14 at EU court
Description: Alphabet unit Google's fight against a 2.4-billion-euro ($2.64 billion) EU antitrust fine will be played out over three days in February 2020 at Europe's second-highest court, according to parties involved in the case.

Headlines: Oilfield services firm ProPetro cuts almost 150 workers: sources
Description: ProPetro Holding Corp this month cut about 150 workers, people familiar with the matter said on Monday, the latest sign of growing trouble in the oilfield services sector as U.S. shale producers reduce drilling.

Headlines: In new headache, WeWork says it found cancer-causing chemical in its phone booths
Description: Cash-strapped WeWork, the office-sharing company that is trying to negotiate a financial lifeline, has a new problem that may prove costly. It has closed about 2,300 phone booths at some of its 223 sites in the United States and Canada after it says it discovered elevated levels of formaldehyde.

Headlines: Stocks meander on caution over trade talks, dollar gains
Description: The U.S. dollar gained on Monday as optimism ebbed over a potential U.S.-China trade deal that President Donald Trump outlined last week, while a gauge of global equity markets was little changed as investors sought details about an agreement.

Headlines: New Pratt engine checks after Swiss A220 diverts to Paris
Description: Pratt & Whitney recommended checks on engines on Airbus A220 aircraft and some Embraer jets after a Geneva-bound Swiss jet diverted to Paris with an engine problem, prompting the grounding of the rest of the airline's A220 fleet.

Headlines: WeWork bond prices at record low on possible debt-heavy financing deal
Description: The price of WeWork's U.S. junk bond fell to an all-time low on Tuesday, last trading at 78 cents on the dollar, as the company weighed financing options including a package that may include at least $2 billion of unsecured notes with a 15% coupon.

Headlines: Hedge fund D.E. Shaw raises pressure on Emerson, calls for breakup
Description: Hedge fund D.E. Shaw on Tuesday increased the pressure on Emerson Electric Co by publicly urging a breakup of the U.S. industrial conglomerate, a move it says could unlock more than $20 billion worth of shareholder value.

Headlines: Oil falls on weaker economic growth forecasts and swelling U.S. crude stocks
Description: Oil prices fell on Tuesday, as investors worried that the unrelenting U.S.-China trade war would keep squeezing the global economy, and that swelling U.S. crude inventories would further pressure prices.

Headlines: Big banks say U.S. consumers sturdy as businesses quiver with growth fears
Description: Quarterly results from four of the largest U.S. banks on Tuesday showed that American consumers are helping to prop up the economy, even as recession fears have led businesses to pull back on spending and borrowing.

Headlines: Google unveils Pixel 4 phones with radar, more affordable laptop
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google unveiled new Pixel smartphones with higher quality cameras, a radar sensor to track hand gestures and faster virtual assistant on Tuesday, but the devices had no surprise features to set them apart from rivals and nix concerns about price.

Headlines: Barneys nears bankruptcy deal with Authentic Brands, Saks owner: sources
Description: U.S. luxury department-store chain Barneys New York Inc is nearing a roughly $270 million deal with brand developer Authentic Brands Group that could lead to Barneys shops opening in Saks Fifth Avenue stores, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: London retains global finance throne amid Brexit chaos
Description: From the pinnacle of the City of London's largest skyscraper, Stuart Lipton is wagering a $1.2 billion bet that the British capital remains a master of the international financial universe no matter what happens with Brexit.

Headlines: Electric bike-sharing startup Wheels raises $50 million in latest funding round
Description: Electric bike-sharing startup Wheels said it has raised more than $50 million in its latest funding round led by venture capital firm DBL partners, as the company looks to expand into the U.S. and international markets.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil, India's ONGC sign expertise-sharing deal
Description: Global energy giant Exxon Mobil Corp will offer its expertise and technology to India's biggest state-owned explorer Oil and Natural Gas Corp Ltd to help develop its resources in offshore blocks, according to two sources directly privy to the development.

Headlines: China September exports, imports in deeper contraction as tariffs take toll
Description: A slide in China's exports picked up pace in September while imports contracted for a fifth straight month, pointing to further weakness in the economy and underlining the need for more stimulus as the Sino-U.S. trade war drags on.

Headlines: WeWork prefers JPMorgan's financing package over SoftBank's control: Bloomberg
Description: Shared office space company WeWork Companies Inc is leaning toward a near $5 billion financing package led by JPMorgan Chase & Co , instead of selling a controlling stake to Japan's SoftBank Group Corp , Bloomberg reported https://bloom.bg/2pl8JmL late on Monday.

Headlines: Citigroup plans to set up wholly-owned securities business in China: sources
Description: Citigroup Inc plans to set up a wholly-owned securities business in China, people with knowledge of the matter said on Tuesday, taking advantage of Beijing's move to fully open up some of its financial sectors to foreigners next year.

Headlines: Volkswagen postpones final decision on Turkey plant
Description: Volkswagen has postponed the final decision whether to build a car plant in Turkey, the company said, amid international criticism of the country's military operation in Syria and concerns about potential reputational fallout.

Headlines: Banks reap $1 billion from U.S. mortgage bond trading boom
Description: Global banks earned $1 billion from trading government-backed U.S. mortgage securities in the first half of 2019, data shows, a fivefold increase on last year for what industry sources say is the fastest growing revenue source in investment banking.

Headlines: HSBC taps Lazard to sell French retail business: source
Description: HSBC Holdings has hired U.S. investment bank Lazard Ltd to sell its French retail business, a source close to the matter told Reuters, as part of a plan by new interim chief executive Noel Quinn to reduce costs across the banking group.

Headlines: Intel buys software business from Canada's Pivot Technology in 5G push
Description: Intel Corp has agreed to purchase a software business from Toronto-based Pivot Technology Solutions Inc for $27 million, the U.S. chipmaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Unizo shares jump after Blackstone launches tender offer
Description: Shares of Unizo Holdings Co Ltd jumped on Wednesday after U.S. private equity firm Blackstone Group Inc ratcheted up its pursuit of the Japanese hotel operator by launching a 5,000 yen-per-share tender offer.

Headlines: JPMorgan beats profit estimates, says consumer remains strong
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co kicked off bank earnings on Tuesday by beating Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit by a wide margin, a signal that the U.S. consumer remains strong, executives at the largest U.S. bank said.

Headlines: Experience, not nationality, key for new CEO at France's Renault: minister
Description: Experience in overhauling a company and a track record in industry will be more important than nationality when carmaker Renault chooses a new chief executive, France's junior economy minister said on Tuesday.

Headlines: MGM to sell Bellagio, Circus Circus resorts for about $5 billion
Description: MGM Resorts International said on Tuesday it would sell its Bellagio and Circus Circus resorts in Las Vegas in separate deals valued at about $5 billion, as the U.S. casino operator seeks to monetize its real estate assets and bolster its balance sheet.

Headlines: Chilean bank ordered to open Uber's accounts to taxman
Description: Chile's Supreme Court has ordered the Bank of Chile to allow tax authorities to examine the local accounts of Uber , rejecting an appeal by the ride-sharing company, according to a judgment seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: House investigators say they have begun receiving data from big tech firms
Description: The leaders of the House of Representatives Judiciary Committee said late on Tuesday that they had begun receiving data from Facebook, Alphabet's Google, Amazon and Apple as part of their probe into the companies' potential breaches of antitrust law.

Headlines: Google, Reddit defend tech legal protections ahead of Congress hearing
Description: A 23-year-old law giving technology companies legal protection from lawsuits over user-generated content remains critical to the internet's future, Alphabet Inc's Google unit and social media site Reddit Inc said in testimony released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Weak U.S. retail sales cast shadow over slowing economy
Description: U.S. retail sales fell for the first time in seven months in September, suggesting that manufacturing-led weakness could be spreading to the broader economy, keeping the door open for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates again later this month.

Headlines: Oil rises on hopes OPEC will extend supply cuts, weaker U.S. dollar
Description: Oil rose on Wednesday, gaining support due to signs that OPEC and allied producers will continue to curb supplies in December, a weaker U.S. dollar and as traders covered short positions ahead of an industry report on U.S. crude inventories.

Headlines: Wall Street slips as weak economic data offsets earnings strength
Description: Wall Street lost ground on Wednesday as weak U.S. economic data and simmering geopolitical tensions spooked buyers away from the equities market, despite a string of generally positive third-quarter earnings reports.

Headlines: Mexican billionaire Slim vows to invest in Mexico, touting economic prospects
Description: Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim said on Wednesday that he expects to invest up to $5 billion in Mexican infrastructure during the current administration as he delivered a full-throated endorsement of the economy despite investor jitters.

Headlines: Southeast Asia's mobile payments face shakeout as market booms
Description: Just next to Ho Chi Minh City's financial district, two dozen street vendors' stalls display colorful adverts for e-wallets backed by private equity firm Warburg Pincus, ride-hailing firm Grab and Singapore sovereign wealth fund GIC, among others.

Headlines: U.S. chipmaker Broadcom told to stop exclusivity deals till EU probe ends
Description: U.S. chipmaker Broadcom has been ordered to halt exclusivity deals with six TV and modem makers for up to three years while EU antitrust enforcers investigate whether these agreements are aimed at thwarting rivals.

Headlines: Ride-hailing companies Uber, Lyft won't testify before Congress
Description: Uber Technologies Inc and Lyft Inc declined to appear on Wednesday at a U.S. House of Representatives hearing on issues relating to the ride-hailing industry, a congressional committee said.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler faces $79 million U.S. penalty for fuel economy shortfall
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV on Wednesday said it faces a $79 million U.S. civil penalty for failing to meet 2017 fuel economy requirements, as regulators reported more automakers were falling short of U.S. greenhouse gas emissions standards.

Headlines: Drug firms offer to settle U.S. opioid suits with $50 billion package: sources
Description: Five drugmakers and distributors are offering $22 billion in cash as well as drugs and services they value at $28 billion to resolve lawsuits alleging the industry fueled the U.S. opioid crisis, two sources familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Latitude CEO disappointed KKR pulled IPO due to low price
Description: Private equity giant KKR & Co and its partners canceled what was to be Australia's biggest listing of the year, lender Latitude Financial, because investors would not pay a price that reflected its value, the Latitude CEO said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. 'deeply concerned' about untrackable China ships carrying Iran oil: officials
Description: The White House is warning Chinese shipping companies against turning off their ships' transponders to hide Iranian oil shipments in violation of U.S. sanctions, two senior administration officials said.

Headlines: Skoda Auto reports 2.7% drop in deliveries in first nine months
Description: Skoda Auto's global deliveries dropped 2.7% to 913,700 cars in the first nine months compared with the same period last year, the subsidiary of Germany's Volkswagen said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Technical foul: Chinese traders in online sneaker market punish NBA after HK controversy
Description: On Oct. 4, a Chinese trader noticed a sharp drop in the price of crypto tokens backed by Nike's Air Jordan sneakers on a U.S.-based exchange after the general manager of the NBA's Houston Rockets tweeted support for the protests in Hong Kong.

Headlines: Broadcom says EU antitrust order will not impact business, will challenge it
Description: U.S. chipmaker Broadcom said on Wednesday that an EU antitrust order to halt certain business deals with six TV and modem makers will not have a material impact on its business and it will challenge the EU move in court.

Headlines: Volvo Cars aims to be climate neutral by 2040
Description: Volvo Cars, owned by China's Geely Holding, is targeting a 40% reduction in the carbon footprint of each car it manufactures by 2025 as it bids to become fully climate neutral by 2040, it said in a statement on Wednesday.

Headlines: Abbott revenue misses as heart devices eclipse diabetes gains
Description: Abbott Laboratories fell just short of Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue on Wednesday, as weakness in the medical device maker's cardiovascular business overshadowed strong performance in its fast-growing diabetes care unit.

Headlines: Bank of America puts investments over cost cuts as 'operating leverage' fades
Description: For the first time in nearly five years, Bank of America Corp did not rely on cost cuts to amplify profits – the latest sign of big U.S. banks prioritizing investments in their businesses over short-term gains.

Headlines: Signify to buy U.S. firm Cooper Lighting for $1.4 billion
Description: Signify , the Dutch-based lighting company, has agreed to buy U.S. firm Cooper Lighting Solutions from Eaton Corp. [EATO.UL] for $1.4 billion in cash to boost its presence in North America.

Headlines: Bank of America beats profit estimates on surge in advisory, lending
Description: Bank of America Corp beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Wednesday as it earned more in advisory fees and its loan book expanded, easing concerns that lower interest rates would crimp growth at the second-largest U.S. bank.

Headlines: WH Smith to buy Marshall Retail for $400 million in U.S. airports push
Description: British retailer WH Smith Plc made its second major foray into U.S. airports on Thursday with a $400 million purchase of Marshall Retail Group, expanding in a fast-growing segment and sending its shares up 5%.

Headlines: Barneys enters deal to sell assets to Authentic Brands, B. Riley for $271 million cash
Description: U.S. luxury department-store chain Barneys New York Inc has reached an agreement to sell its assets to brand developer Authentic Brands Group and investment bank B. Riley Financial Inc , a court document showed.

Headlines: UAW, GM leaders have a deal to end strike, now workers will decide
Description: General Motors Co and the United Auto Workers union reached a tentative agreement on Wednesday for a new four-year labor deal, moving closer to ending a costly month-long strike that shut down GM's most profitable factories in a test of wills over the future of U.S. auto industry jobs.

Headlines: Netflix and Amazon face censorship threat in India: source
Description: India is deliberating potential censorship on streaming platforms such as Netflix and Amazon Prime Video, a senior government source told Reuters.

Headlines: What makes Japanese hotelier Unizo attractive for Blackstone and Elliott?
Description: Little-known hotelier Unizo Holdings Co Ltd has found itself the center of private equity attention, with global names vying for the opportunity to buy into Japan's property market on the cheap.

Headlines: Elliott pushes Japan's Unizo to accept $1.6 billion Blackstone bid
Description: Unizo Holdings' top shareholder Elliott Management pushed the Japan hotel operator to accept a $1.6 billion tender offer from Blackstone Group, warning it would take "all available measures" if it fails to do its "fiduciary duty".

Headlines: Oil rises, supported by U.S. fuel stock draws but weighed by crude build
Description: Oil prices rose about 1% on Thursday after draws in U.S. fuel inventories, but gains were capped by a larger-than-expected rise in crude stockpiles and a series of weak economic figures.

Headlines: Ex-U.S. biotech executive fined for lying to auditors, charges dropped against CFO: SEC
Description: The former chief business officer of U.S. biotechnology company Osiris Therapeutics Inc has agreed to pay a $40,000 civil penalty for lying to auditors, the Securities and Exchange Commission said on Thursday.

Headlines: Stocks, sterling rise on long-awaited Brexit deal
Description: A deal on Britain's departure agreed with the European Union sent sterling to a five-month high on Thursday and hoisted European stocks to a 1-1/2-year peak before doubts about UK parliamentary support brought them back to earth.

Headlines: Timeline: UAW wrings higher pay from GM in deal to end strike, agrees to plant closings
Description: The United Auto Workers union wrung higher pay and other benefits from General Motors Co as part of a tentative deal to end a month-long U.S. strike by about 48,000 workers, the union disclosed on Thursday.

Headlines: UAW will keep GM strike going while members vote on new contract
Description: The United Auto Workers union said on Thursday workers at General Motors Co will stay off the job while they vote on a proposed contract that delivers higher pay for full-time workers and better terms for temporary workers, but allows the automaker to close three U.S. plants.

Headlines: Judge summons drug company CEOs to discuss opioid settlement: source
Description: The chief executives of the three largest U.S. drug distributors and a drugmaker have been summoned to appear before a federal judge to discuss a proposal to resolve thousands of lawsuits alleging they fueled the U.S. opioid crisis, a person familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Big U.S. liquefied natgas players move fast; smaller ones try to keep up
Description: A gap is emerging in the U.S. liquefied natural gas (LNG) industry as big players such as Exxon Mobil Corp and Cheniere Energy Inc race ahead to build export terminals with fewer long-term contracts, while smaller developers struggle to find financing for their first plants.

Headlines: Six warning lights flashing for China’s slowing economy
Description: China’s $13 trillion economy is slowing and indicators showing that range from freight shipments to factory power generation and from employment to expenditures on entertainment.

Headlines: EDF CEO says France prepares to build new nuclear plants: Le Monde
Description: It is clear that France is preparing to build new nuclear power plants, Jean-Bernard Levy, Chief Executive of state-controlled utility EDF , said in an interview with Le Monde newspaper on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. homebuilding retreats, manufacturing still struggling
Description: U.S. homebuilding tumbled from more than a 12-year high in September, but single-family home construction rose for a fourth straight month, suggesting the housing market remains supported by lower mortgage rates even as the economy is slowing.

Headlines: Ethiopia crash victims' families to subpoena U.S. operators of Boeing 737 MAX
Description: Lawyers representing families of passengers killed in a Boeing 737 MAX crash in Ethiopia in March are set to issue subpoenas to Southwest Airlines and American Airlines , according to documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Tesla gets approval to start manufacturing in China
Description: Tesla Inc was added to a government list of approved automotive manufacturers, China's industry ministry said on Thursday, as it granted the electric-vehicle maker a certificate it needs to start production in the country.

Headlines: Volkswagen gets more time from U.S., auditor to comply with diesel settlement terms
Description: Volkswagen said on Thursday it has been granted an additional 90 days to test its compliance programs required under a criminal plea agreement with the U.S. government following its emissions cheating scandal.

Headlines: Czech firm PPF close to deal with AT&T on buying CME: reports
Description: Investment group PPF, owned by the Czech Republic's richest man Petr Kellner, is close to concluding talks on buying a majority stake in Central European Media Enterprises (CME) from U.S. firm AT&T , Czech and Bulgarian media reported on Thursday.

Headlines: China says it hopes to reach phased trade pact with U.S. as soon as possible
Description: China hopes to reach a phased agreement in a protracted trade dispute with the United States and cancel tariffs as soon as possible, the Commerce Ministry said on Thursday, adding that trade wars had no winners.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson agrees to pay about $117 million to settle U.S. states' mesh probe
Description: Johnson & Johnson has agreed to pay nearly $117 million to resolve allegations that it deceptively marketed transvaginal surgical mesh devices, U.S. state attorneys general said on Thursday.

Headlines: Union Pacific misses profit expectations amid trade war, to cut spending, jobs
Description: Railroad operator Union Pacific Corp on Thursday reported quarterly profit that missed analysts' estimates and said it would cut capital spending and jobs as the multi-front U.S. trade war worsens an industry-wide freight volume slump.

Headlines: As 'Cannabis 2.0' kicks off in Canada, industry strangled by limited retail outlets
Description: A year after Canada legalized use of recreational marijuana cannabis stocks have lost half their market value, and investors betting that the launch of higher-margin pot-infused drinks and other products will quickly lift shares may be in for a bumpy ride.

Headlines: Tesla's Nuerburgring run revs up debate over speed records
Description: Tesla Inc's attempts to humble Porsche with a new lap record on Germany's legendary Nordschleife racetrack have reignited a controversy about the value of lap times, as the circuit steps in to quash claims of cheating.

Headlines: American Express profit beats estimates as consumers shrug off slowdown fears
Description: Credit card issuer American Express Co reported a higher-than-expected quarterly profit that highlighted the health of the U.S. consumer even as fears mount that a manufacturing-led weakness could spread to the broader economy.

Headlines: How a small aluminum maker won U.S. trade protection
Description: When Donald Trump won the White House, the sprawling aluminum smelter that hugs the Ohio River here was operating at less than half its capacity, and most of its skeleton crew of 270 remaining workers were fearful about their future.

Headlines: Instant View: China third-quarter GDP grows 6.0% year-on-year, misses expectations
Description: China's economic growth slowed more than expected to 6.0% year-on-year in the third quarter, the weakest pace in at least 27-1/2 years, as demand at home and abroad faltered amid a bruising Sino-U.S. trade war.

Headlines: General Motors strike to slash U.S. October payrolls: JPMorgan
Description: A month-long strike at General Motors could cut U.S. job growth by as much as 75,000 in October, JPMorgan economist Daniel Silver said on Friday, an unwelcome development amid financial market fears of a recession.

Headlines: Boeing, J&J, dismal China data drag Wall Street lower
Description: Wall Street fell on Friday as negative headlines about Johnson & Johnson and Boeing, along with bleak economic data from China, soured investor risk appetite and offset generally positive corporate earnings.

Headlines: Opioid settlement talks fail, landmark trial expected Monday
Description: A landmark trial over the U.S. opioid epidemic is on track to begin on Monday after drug companies and local governments failed to agree on a settlement on Friday that had been expected to be valued at around $50 billion.

Headlines: Oracle co-CEO Mark Hurd dies at 62
Description: Oracle Corp's 62-year-old co-chief Mark Hurd died on Friday morning, the company said, an unexpected development that raises pressure on co-CEO Safra Catz to lead the business software maker's ongoing transition to cloud computing.

Headlines: J&J recalls 33,000 bottles of baby powder as FDA finds asbestos in sample
Description: Johnson & Johnson said on Friday it is recalling around 33,000 bottles of baby powder in the United States after U.S. health regulators found trace amounts of asbestos in samples taken from a bottle purchased online.

Headlines: Oil falls as China economic concerns outweigh rising refinery runs
Description: Oil prices edged lower on Friday, as concerns about China's economy outweighed bullish signals from its refining sector, but losses were limited on hopes for progress toward a U.S.-China trade agreement.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lampert helps bankroll Sears as woes persist after bankruptcy - sources
Description: U.S. retailer Sears has borrowed about $150 million from lenders, including its billionaire owner Eddie Lampert, as it racks up losses less than a year after it emerged from bankruptcy protection, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Judge's unorthodox approach has huge opioid settlement within reach
Description: From the start of the sprawling U.S. litigation seeking to hold drugmakers and distributors liable for the country's opioid epidemic, Judge Dan Polster has made one thing clear: he never wanted a trial.

Headlines: Dollar weakens on Brexit, shares sapped by weaker China growth
Description: The dollar posted its worst week in almost four months on Friday, pummeled by sterling and euro rallies driven by a deal on Britain's departure from the European Union, while China's weakest growth in nearly three decades weighed on equities.

Headlines: SoftBank seeks to avoid WeWork's liabilities with new investment: sources
Description: SoftBank Group Corp is attempting to become the majority owner of WeWork without assuming the onerous lease obligations of the U.S. office-space sharing firm, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: China's indebted HNA group names chairman's son as president: Caixin
Description: China's indebted HNA Group has appointed its chairman's son as president as part of business restructuring at the finance-to-aviation conglomerate, Chinese financial magazine Caixin reported on its website on Saturday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Huawei in early talks with U.S. firms to license 5G platform - Huawei executive
Description: Blacklisted Chinese telecoms equipment giant Huawei is in early-stage talks with some U.S. telecoms companies about licensing its 5G network technology to them, a Huawei executive told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: China says will work with the U.S. to address each other's core concerns
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He said on Saturday that China will work with the United States to address each other's core concerns on the basis of equality and mutual respect, and that stopping the trade war would be good for both sides and the world.

Headlines: Boeing board to meet in Texas as scrutiny intensifies: sources
Description: Boeing Co's board of directors and top executives from its airplanes division and supply chain were due to meet on Sunday in San Antonio, Texas, two days after the U.S. planemaker was plunged into a fresh crisis over its banned 737 MAX jet.

Headlines: Qantas tests world's longest commercial flight from New York to Sydney
Description: Australia's flag carrier Qantas completed on Sunday a nonstop test flight from New York to Sydney, researching how the world's longest potential commercial airplane journey of nearly 20 hours would impact pilots, crew and passengers.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Tech haves and have-nots face third-quarter tests
Description: Technology companies, which make up the largest swath of the U.S. stock market, are expected to post a nearly 8% drop in third-quarter profits as reports roll in from many of the sector's biggest corporations.

Headlines: China's central banker says yuan level 'appropriate', trade tensions risk to global economy
Description: China's top central banker said on Saturday that potential escalation of trade tensions and policy uncertainty were the major risk factors facing the world economy, and market forces were keeping China's yuan at an appropriate level.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi says plans to launch more than 10 5G phones next year
Description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp plans to launch more than 10 5G phones in 2020, CEO Lei Jun said on Sunday, speaking at the World Internet conference in the eastern Chinese town of Wuzhen.

Headlines: Japan's extended exports slump could push BOJ to ease next week
Description: Japan's exports contracted for a 10th straight month in September, adding to speculation the central bank could ease monetary policy as soon as next week to support an economy hit by a slowdown in global demand.

Headlines: Gojek CEO quits to join Indonesian cabinet, replacements named
Description: Gojek CEO and co-founder Nadiem Makarim said on Monday he had resigned to join Indonesia's new cabinet, and the ride-hailing and payments company said two senior executives would jointly take over running operations of the $10 billion firm.

Headlines: Facebook suspends Russian Instagram accounts targeting U.S. voters
Description: Facebook Inc said on Monday it has suspended a network of Instagram accounts operated from Russia that targeted Americans with divisive political messages ahead of next year's U.S. presidential election, with operators posing as people within the United States.

Headlines: San Jose to propose turning PG&E into giant customer-owned utility - WSJ
Description: San Jose, California's third-biggest city, is proposing to convert PG&E Corp into the country's largest customer-owned utility, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing the city's mayor.

Headlines: China asks WTO for $2.4 billion sanctions against U.S. in latest clash
Description: China is seeking $2.4 billion in retaliatory sanctions against the United States for failing to comply with a World Trade Organization ruling in a case that highlights White House complaints about the global trade body.

Headlines: Santander to sell Puerto Rico unit to FirstBank in $1.1 billion deal
Description: Banco Santander said on Monday it had agreed to sell Santander Bancorp, the Spanish lender's retail and commercial banking franchise in Puerto Rico, to FirstBank Puerto Rico in a deal valued at $1.1 billion.

Headlines: UBS, Simmons Energy pare bankers as shale M&A slows: sources
Description: UBS Group AG and the energy arm of Piper Jaffray Companies have cut staff in their oil and gas investment banking teams, three people familiar with the matter said on Monday, as U.S. dealmaking continues to dry up.

Headlines: Teva, three U.S. drug distributors reach opioid settlement - source
Description: Drug maker Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Inc and the three biggest U.S. drug distributors reached a settlement on Monday to avoid a trial over their role in the opioid addiction crisis, a source said on Monday.

Headlines: Drug firms avert landmark opioid trial as talks on $48-billion settlement set to resume
Description: Four large drug companies could resume talks on Tuesday to try to reach a $48 billion settlement of all opioid litigation against them, after agreeing with two Ohio counties to a $260 million deal to avert the first federal trial over their role in the U.S. opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Apple starts selling locally assembled iPhone XR in India
Description: Apple Inc has started selling its popular iPhone XR phones assembled in India, as it looks to expand its share in the world's second-largest smartphone market where it has struggled against cheaper products from rivals.

Headlines: Fidelity drops Fisher's money management firm as withdrawals accelerate
Description: Fidelity Investments has dropped Fisher Investments as a money manager, a Fidelity spokesman said on Monday, the latest in an accelerating series of withdrawals from the firm over allegedly sexist comments by its leader, Kenneth Fisher.

Headlines: Opioid talks with Teva, distributors could resume Tuesday: attorney
Description: Talks to reach a settlement of thousands of lawsuits stemming from the U.S. opioid addiction crisis could resume as soon as Tuesday, an attorney for local governments said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump's Vuitton visit stirs discord at the brand as designer hits out
Description: Louis Vuitton designer Nicolas Ghesquiere has hit out at Donald Trump after the U.S. president inaugurated one of the brand's factories last week, distancing himself from a visit that was attended by top executives from parent group LVMH.

Headlines: Companies slow to disclose financial costs of climate change: report
Description: U.S. and European companies in polluting industries rarely disclose the financial risks they face related to climate change even though a global task force called on them to do so two years ago, Moody's Investors Service said in a report on Monday.

Headlines: Oil prices fall 1% as global demand concerns grow
Description: Oil prices fell nearly 1% on Monday after comments from a U.S. official fed concerns surrounding the U.S.-China trade war, adding to worries that a slowing global economy would reduce demand for oil.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson beats forecasts as international sales rebound
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc beat expectations for profit on Tuesday and stuck to its full-year shipment forecast, allaying fears of another major hit from European import tariffs and a further slump in sales in its main U.S. market.

Headlines: U.S. existing home sales drop more than expected in September
Description: U.S. home sales fell more than expected in September as the market continues to struggle with a dearth of properties for sale, especially for cheaper homes.

Headlines: Hasbro shares plunge as toymaker battles tariff costs
Description: Hasbro Inc fell well below Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Tuesday, as the toy maker wrestled with higher shipping and warehousing costs due to U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports, sending its shares down about 18%.

Headlines: Infosys loses $6.6 billion in market cap after whistleblower complaints
Description: India's No.2 software services exporter, Infosys Ltd , is probing whistleblower complaints that its top two executives engaged in "unethical practices" to boost short-term revenue and profit, sending its shares down 16% on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. crude stocks expected to rise for sixth consecutive week: Reuters poll
Description: U.S. crude stockpiles likely rose for the sixth straight week, while refined products stockpiles likely fell last week, an extended Reuters poll showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. companies facing worker shortage race to automate
Description: U.S. companies are responding to the lowest unemployment rate in almost 50 years by increasing their focus on automation in order to maintain healthy margins as labor costs tick higher, a Reuters analysis of corporate earnings transcripts shows.

Headlines: McDonald's misses profit target as competition delivers breakfast, plant burgers
Description: McDonald's Corp missed Wall Street estimates for profit for the first time in two years on Tuesday as more investment to spruce up U.S. restaurants and speed up service weighed on the world's biggest fast food chain, sending its shares down 4%.

Headlines: Spanish court to probe Russian tycoon's bid for DIA supermarket chain: document
Description: Spain's High Court will investigate allegations that Russian tycoon Mikhail Fridman acted to depress the share price of DIA when trying to take control of the supermarket chain, a court document seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump's G7 and trade adviser Kelly Ann Shaw to leave White House - officials
Description: President Donald Trump's G7 and trade adviser, Kelly Ann Shaw, is leaving his administration for a position in the private sector, White House officials said on Tuesday, marking the departure of one of the most senior women on the president's economic team.

Headlines: Gulfstream unveils new flagship G700 business jet in challenge to rival Bombardier
Description: U.S. planemaker Gulfstream on Monday unveiled its widely-expected G700 long-range jet, in a challenge to Bombardier Inc's flagship Global 7500 aircraft.

Headlines: U.S. business borrowing for equipment rises 18% in September: ELFA
Description: U.S. companies' borrowing to spend on capital investments rose 18% in September from a year earlier, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association (ELFA) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Pound, stocks slip as lawmakers reject Brexit law timetable
Description: The pound weakened and stocks on world markets declined on Tuesday after British lawmakers rejected the government's proposed timetable for passing legislation to ratify its deal to exit the European Union.

Headlines: U.S. charges six investment bankers over insider trading scheme
Description: U.S. prosecutors said on Tuesday they had charged six members of an insider trading ring who worked for firms including Goldman Sachs Group , Moelis and Centerview Partners and allegedly booked tens of millions of dollars in illicit profits.

Headlines: UBS tightens investment banking belt as earnings slide continues
Description: Swiss bank UBS is axing high-paying investment banking staff after a disappointing performance at the division prompted a 16% slide in third-quarter net profit and put the group's 2019 profit goals further out of reach.

Headlines: Walmart chief seeks stable business environment from India's Modi: ET
Description: Walmart Inc's chief executive has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking certainty and predictability in India's business environment, the Economic Times newspaper reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Chinese vice foreign minister says progress made in trade talks with U.S.
Description: China and the United States have achieved some progress in their trade talks, Vice Foreign Minister Le Yucheng said on Tuesday, and any problem could be resolved as long as both sides respected each other.

Headlines: Senior Chinese diplomat reiterates that U.S. forced trade war on China
Description: The United States has forced an unwanted trade war on China and Beijing must take the necessary countermeasures to protect its interests, senior Chinese diplomat Wang Yi said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Renault chairman vows to get Nissan alliance back on track next year
Description: Renault Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard is determined to get the carmaker's alliance with Japan's Nissan back on track next year, he said on Tuesday, adding other matters such as a potential tie-up with Fiat Chrysler were less of a priority.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs lowers forecast 2020 U.S. shale oil output growth
Description: Goldman Sachs wound back its forecast for growth in U.S. shale output in 2020, and slightly reduced its outlook for 2020 global oil demand growth.

Headlines: China will keep door open to foreign investment, global industry despite trade tensions
Description: China will take steps to safeguard its interests, but won't close its door to foreign investment and the global industry despite trade frictions with the United States, a Chinese official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: How will Amazon deliver in its second biggest market?
Description: Every half an hour, 50 vans sweep into Amazon's distribution center in Mannheim, Germany and sweep out again with up to 200 parcels and a precise delivery plan in each.

Headlines: Sales of Eli Lilly diabetes drug Trulicity fall short, shares drop
Description: Eli Lilly and Co third-quarter sales missed Wall Street estimates on Wednesday as rebates limited revenue from its top-selling diabetes drug Trulicity, and its shares fell about 4%.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz sees potential in baby food, will keep Plasmon
Description: Global packaged food group Kraft Heinz Co will keep baby food line Plasmon and plans to leverage its 'Made in Italy' credentials to expand the brand abroad, Kraft Heinz Co's general manager for Italy said.

Headlines: Some U.S. electronics factories start layoffs as trade tariffs hit
Description: U.S. electronics factories are investing less and slowing hiring or laying off workers in some cases due to the rising costs of trade tariffs, according to an industry survey set for release on Wednesday.

Headlines: China's premier says cooperation with the U.S. can create mutual benefit
Description: China's premier Li Keqiang says cooperation between China and the United States can create mutual benefit, as negotiations between the world's two largest economies over a trade war continue to drag on.

Headlines: Biogen, Eisai revive plans for Alzheimer's drug, surprising market
Description: Biogen Inc revived plans on Tuesday to seek U.S. approval for Alzheimer's treatment aducanumab, surprising investors and saying data from more patients in two discontinued studies showed the drug reduced the decline of patients.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg grilled in U.S. Congress on digital currency, privacy, elections
Description: Facebook Inc CEO Mark Zuckerberg conceded on Wednesday that the company's planned digital currency Libra was a "risky project," but sought to reassure skeptical U.S. lawmakers that it could lower the cost of electronic payments and open up the global financial system to more people.

Headlines: Teva’s proposed opioid settlement could cost drugmaker pennies on the dollar
Description: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd's proposed $23 billion drug giveaway to settle thousands of U.S. opioid lawsuits will likely cost the company a fraction of that figure due to how it has valued those medicines, according to a Reuters review of pricing data and industry analysts.

Headlines: Ford cuts full-year profit outlook as third-quarter profit dips
Description: Ford Motor Co on Wednesday cut its forecast for operating profit for the year after a disappointing third quarter that Chief Executive Jim Hackett blamed on higher warranty costs, bigger discounts and weaker than expected performance in China.

Headlines: Boeing sees 737 MAX U.S. approval before year-end, shares rise
Description: Boeing Co said on Wednesday it still expects U.S. regulatory approval for its grounded 737 MAX in the fourth quarter, sending its shares higher despite a slump in quarterly profit.

Headlines: Brazil court approves contract draft for transfer of rights oil deal
Description: Brazil's federal audits court on Wednesday approved a draft contract for a massive transfer of rights oil deal between state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA , better known as Petrobras, and the government.

Headlines: Global stocks rise despite lackluster results; sterling creeps up as EU delays Brexit decision
Description: World stock indexes climbed on Wednesday as investors brushed aside some earnings disappointments, while the British pound inched up as European Union leaders delayed a decision on whether to grant Britain a three-month Brexit extension.

Headlines: Huawei exposure roils Xilinx's revenue forecast
Description: Xilinx Inc on Wednesday forecast current-quarter and full-year revenue below Wall Street estimates, the second major chipmaker this week to flag the impact of a prolonged U.S.-China trade dispute on its business.

Headlines: China factory production key as Tesla reports third-quarter results
Description: Tesla Inc is conducting trial production runs at its new $2 billion China factory for the past several weeks and will sell some of the first cars from the plant to its employees, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: WeWork plans to lay off 4,000 staff - FT
Description: Office-sharing startup WeWork is planning to cut as many as 4,000 jobs as a part of a turnaround plan put in place by top shareholder Japan's SoftBank Group after it took control of the company this week, Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: WeWork's Claure warns layoffs are coming
Description: WeWork's new executive chairman Marcelo Claure wrote in a memo to employees on Wednesday that layoffs were in the works at the U.S. office-space sharing start-up following a $9.5 billion rescue financing deal with SoftBank Group Corp.

Headlines: Spirit Airlines commits to 100 Airbus jets amid tariff dispute
Description: U.S. budget carrier Spirit Airlines on Wednesday unveiled a provisional deal to order 100 Airbus A320neo-family jets to be delivered through 2027, becoming the first U.S. airline to pick European planes since Washington imposed tariffs on them.

Headlines: Wall Street ticks higher, but chip stocks tumble
Description: U.S. stocks edged higher on Wednesday as investors shrugged off lackluster quarterly reports from industrial bellwethers Boeing Co and Caterpillar Inc , though a lower-than-expected revenue outlook from Texas Instruments Inc sent chipmakers' shares lower.

Headlines: Microsoft forecasts cloud sales above expectations
Description: Microsoft Corp on Wednesday forecast sales for its cloud computing services that topped analysts' estimates, even as quarterly growth slows for its Azure business.

Headlines: Caterpillar cuts profit outlook as China construction sales slump
Description: Industrial bellwether Caterpillar Inc reported a drop in sales in the United States and China in the third quarter, leading it to cut its outlook for the year and adding to evidence that the global economy is firmly on the decline.

Headlines: Ex-Deutsche Bank traders avoid prison time for Libor scheme
Description: Two former Deutsche Bank AG traders will serve no prison time for conspiring to manipulate the Libor benchmark interest rate between 2005 and 2011, a federal judge ruled on Thursday, sharply criticizing U.S. prosecutors for treating the two men as "proxy wrongdoers" for a much larger scheme.

Headlines: American, Spirit eye more Mobile deliveries to avoid Airbus tariffs
Description: American Airlines Group and Spirit Airlines executives said on Thursday they were working with Airbus SE to mitigate the impact of U.S. tariffs on European-made aircraft, including having more planes delivered from Mobile, Alabama.

Headlines: Pound down vs dollar after PM calls for election; S&P 500 gains
Description: The British pound fell against the dollar on Thursday after British Prime Minister Boris Johnson's call for a national election, while global stock markets edged higher.

Headlines: Citi names Fraser as president, putting her in line to be first female CEO
Description: Citigroup Inc has promoted Jane Fraser to head of its global consumer bank and president, putting her in a position eventually to become the first female chief executive of the U.S. bank.

Headlines: American, Southwest overcome 737 MAX travails with quarterly profit growth
Description: American Airlines Group Inc and Southwest Airlines Co posted quarterly profit increases on Thursday thanks to strong U.S. travel demand even as the two carriers pointed to a rising cost impact from the continued grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX.

Headlines: Watch Fox News? You likely think the U.S. economy is great. MSNBC viewers not so much
Description: The performance of the U.S. economy has been a solid clue to the outcome of past presidential elections.

Headlines: HSBC, StanChart results to show Hong Kong protests are starting to gnaw
Description: HSBC Holdings Plc and Standard Chartered Plc are set to show early signs of strain from anti-government protests in Hong Kong, the single-biggest profit center for the two banks, when they report quarterly earnings next week.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia faces reality check as Wall Street heads to Riyadh
Description: Wall Street's heavy hitters are back in Saudi Arabia but the terms of engagement have changed.

Headlines: Oil extends gains despite weak demand outlook
Description: Oil prices extended their gains on Thursday, with Brent rising above $61 a barrel as a surprise drop in U.S. crude inventories and the prospect of further market-supporting action by OPEC and its allies offset some concern over the outlook for demand.

Headlines: Rosneft switches contracts to euros from dollars due to U.S. sanctions
Description: Russia's largest oil company Rosneft has fully switched the currency of its contracts to euros from U.S. dollars in a move to shield its transactions from U.S. sanctions, its Chief Executive Igor Sechin said on Thursday.

Headlines: SoftBank clinches WeWork takeover deal, bailing out co-founder
Description: SoftBank Group agreed to spend more than $10 billion to take over WeWork on Tuesday, doubling down on an ill-fated investment and giving a near $1.7 billion payoff to the U.S. office-space sharing startup's co-founder Adam Neumann to relinquish control.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales dip in September; prices fall
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes fell in September as low inventories continue to weigh on sales even as prices saw the biggest monthly fall in five years.

Headlines: U.S. senators ask FTC to probe Amazon over Capital One hack
Description: Two U.S. senators on Thursday asked the U.S. Federal Trade Commission to probe Amazon.com Inc to determine if the company failed to secure its servers prior to the Capital One hack.

Headlines: FCA pays up to keep its Jeep brand on CR7 Juve jersey
Description: Italian-American carmaker Fiat Chrysler more than doubled the value of a jersey sponsorship deal with Juventus in a sign of increasing support from the Agnelli family for Italy's football champions.

Headlines: Raytheon profit beats estimates, raises 2019 forecast on higher weapons demand
Description: U.S. weapons maker Raytheon Company reported better-than-expected third-quarter profit on Thursday and raised its full-year earnings and sales outlook, helped by higher demand for space programs, weapons and missile warning systems.

Headlines: Russia affirms close oil cooperation with Saudi Arabia, OPEC+
Description: Russia's energy ministry said on Friday it continues close cooperation with Saudi Arabia and OPEC and non-OPEC oil producers to enhance market stability and predictability.

Headlines: Fisher loses another $584 million from high-profile clients
Description: A Texas retirement system and Goldman Sachs Group Inc pulled a combined $584 million from Fisher Investments on Friday, after allegations that firm founder Ken Fisher made sexist comments at a conference.

Headlines: United Airlines says in talks with Apple on San Francisco airport upgrade
Description: United Airlines is in early discussions with Apple Inc about upgrading the U.S. carrier's terminal at San Francisco International airport, United's Chief Digital Officer Linda Jojo told journalists on Friday without providing more details.

Headlines: Oil prices clock strong weekly gains on trade hopes, crude supply
Description: Oil prices rose on Friday, registering the strongest weekly gains in more than a month as support from optimism over a U.S.-China trade deal, falling U.S. crude stocks and possible action from OPEC to extend output cuts outweighed broader economic concerns.

Headlines: U.S. government's annual budget deficit largest since 2012
Description: The U.S. government ended fiscal year 2019 with the largest budget deficit in seven years as gains in tax receipts were offset by higher spending and growing debt service payments, the Treasury department said on Friday.

Headlines: General Motors strike to dent U.S. October job growth
Description: A strike by General Motors workers should weigh on U.S. job growth in October, government data showed on Friday.

Headlines: What slowdown? China's riding to the rescue of luxury brands
Description: When Tiffany & Co said this month it was sending its priciest jewelry to mainland China to reach wealthy shoppers no longer jet-setting abroad, it reflected a trend helping global luxury brands weather a Chinese economic slowdown.

Headlines: UAW to bargain next with Ford on new contract deal: sources
Description: The United Auto Workers union is set to announce later on Friday it has chosen Ford Motor Co as the next U.S. automaker the union will negotiate with, sources briefed on the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Global stocks, dollar, yields climb on trade progress news
Description: Global stock indexes, the dollar and bond yields rose on Friday, with the S&P 500 nearing a record high as the United States said it was close to finalizing parts of a trade deal with China.

Headlines: Indonesia report on 737 MAX crash faults Boeing design, says Lion Air made mistakes
Description: Boeing, acting without adequate oversight from U.S. regulators, failed to grasp risks in the design of cockpit software on its 737 MAX airliner, sowing the seeds for a Lion Air crash that also involved errors by airline workers and crew, Indonesian investigators found.

Headlines: Timeline: UAW members ratify new labor deal with GM to end strike
Description: The United Auto Workers union said on Friday its members ratified a new four-year labor contract with General Motors Co , ending the strike with the No. 1 U.S. automaker after 40 days.

Headlines: UAW turns to Ford after GM workers approve new contract
Description: The United Auto Workers union said on Friday it has chosen Ford Motor Co as the next U.S. automaker the union will negotiate with after workers at General Motors Co approved a new contract deal.

Headlines: Big U.S. retailers pull 22-ounce J&J baby powder off shelves after recall
Description: Four major U.S. retailers, including Walmart and Target Corp, are removing all 22-ounce bottles of Johnson & Johnson's baby powder from their stores, following the healthcare conglomerate's recall last week of some bottles due to possible asbestos contamination.

Headlines: USTR says close to finalizing parts of trade deal with China
Description: The United States and China are close to finalizing some sections of a trade agreement after a phone call between top negotiators, the U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Friday.

Headlines: Verizon earnings beat estimates as cheaper plans attract customers
Description: Verizon Communications Inc beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit and revenue on Friday, as the largest U.S. wireless carrier cut prices of its unlimited plans to pull in more subscribers who pay monthly bills.

Headlines: EasyJet adds Orly baggage connections with long-haul partners
Description: Low-cost airline easyJet has added baggage services to its flight-connections partnership with two budget long-haul carriers flying from Paris, in a move that challenges Air France on transatlantic and Caribbean leisure routes.

Headlines: BMW CEO says trade war could cost U.S. jobs
