Description: BMW has told United States trade representatives, including Robert Lighthizer, that intensifying a global trade war could threaten jobs in South Carolina, Chief Executive Oliver Zipse said on Friday.

Headlines: SoftBank to write down minimum $5 billion for WeWork, other losses: Bloomberg
Description: SoftBank has ample funds to endure the pain from its massive bailout of WeWork, analysts said, even as it is reportedly set to write down at least $5 billion due to a slump in the value of the U.S. office sharing startup and some other top holdings.

Headlines: H&M opens new-look small boutique in Berlin, plans more
Description: H&M opened a boutique-like store in a trendy neighbourhood in Berlin on Friday that offers yoga classes, a cafe with a garden and space for other brands as the Swedish budget chain seeks a new look to revive flagging sales.

Headlines: Future delivery: Japanese trucks designed with no cabin and interchangeable cargo holds
Description: In Japan, trucks are being designed for a driverless future with no cabin and interchangeable container areas that would allow vehicles to be highly customized for parcel delivery or even serve as mini-hotels or beauty salons.

Headlines: Airless tire makers hope for breakout moment with autonomous driving
Description: Makers of airless tires such as Japan's Bridgestone Corp. hope driverless cars will herald a breakthrough for their niche technology, which is more than a decade old but underperforms standard tires in every way except resistance to puncture.

Headlines: Heineken to invest $244 million in Brazil by 2020 to double capacity: paper
Description: Heineken , the world's second-largest brewer, will invest 985 million reais ($244 million) in Brazil to double its production capacity, CEO Mauricio Giamellaro told the Valor Econômico newspaper in an interview published on Friday.

Headlines: Boeing considered system redesign before accidents: NTSB report
Description: Boeing engineers and test pilots considered before two fatal 737 MAX crashes whether an anti-stall system should be redesigned after discussing how flawed data from a single sensor could trigger it repeatedly, U.S. investigators have found.

Headlines: Estonian minister blamed for slow reform after Danske scandal
Description: Estonia's far-right finance minister has been criticized by lawmakers for holding up financial reforms promised after the Baltic state became the focus of Europe's biggest money laundering scandal.

Headlines: Exclusive: India probe finds AB InBev, Carlsberg, United Breweries colluded on prices - sources
Description: The investigations unit of India's Competition Commission has concluded that Anheuser-Busch InBev , Carlsberg and United Breweries colluded to fix beer prices, two people with direct knowledge told Reuters.

Headlines: Amazon's AWS unit gets OK to build $800 million data facility in Argentina
Description: Argentina has given the go-ahead to Amazon.com Inc's Web Services division AWS to build an $800-million data facility in Buenos Aires, which would mark a massive investment for the company in South America, according to a provincial bulletin dated Oct. 24.

Headlines: JS Global pulls Hong Kong listing amid trade gloom: sources
Description: Household appliances maker JS Global Lifestyle Company Ltd pulled its initial public offering of up to HK$3.62 billion ($464 million) on Saturday, the third float delayed in Hong Kong so far this year, two sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Leading union demands concessions in Thyssenkrupp elevator sale
Description: Top representatives at IG Metall, Germany's biggest union, will not approve a sale of Thyssenkrupp's prized elevator division unless potential buyers give far-reaching concessions to employees, they said.

Headlines: China studying blockchain application for forex - regulator
Description: China is studying the application of blockchain and artificial intelligence in cross-border financing with a focus on risk management, and will further liberalize its capital markets, a senior foreign exchange regulator said on Sunday.

Headlines: China should ease regulations for foreign financial institutions: HSBC executive
Description: China should ease regulations so that foreign financial institutions can obtain licenses and raise deposits more easily in the country, a senior executive from HSBC said on Sunday.

Headlines: Brazil working to bring Boeing 737 MAX plane back into service this year
Description: Brazil is working to bring the Boeing 737 MAX airplane back to service "by the end of the year," Civil Aviation Secretary Ronei Glanzmann said on Sunday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Brazil to lure airlines to fly domestic, taking meetings with three carriers
Description: Brazil is determined to lure airlines to operate domestic flights in Latin America's largest aviation market, and is taking meetings with at least three carriers, a senior government official told Reuters.

Headlines: Prologis to buy warehouse rival Liberty in $12.6 billion deal
Description: Warehouse giant Prologis Inc said on Sunday it had agreed to acquire rival industrial real-estate business Liberty Property Trust in a $12.6 billion deal to improve its U.S. presence amid the ecommerce boom.

Headlines: Small U.S. oil and gas companies get cold shoulder from large banks
Description: The largest banking lenders to the U.S. oil and gas sector are becoming more cautious, marking down their expectations for oil and gas prices that underpin loans in a move expected to put further financial stress on struggling producers, industry and banking sources said.

Headlines: Factbox: LVMH's jewelry and watches business
Description: LVMH has offered to buy Tiffany & Co, the U.S. jewelry retailer known for its engagement rings and ties to Hollywood glamor.

Headlines: Exclusive: Wells Fargo lays off more than 200 business bankers in U.S. - sources
Description: Wells Fargo & Co has laid off more than 200 bankers in its U.S. lending divisions in recent months, as the bank reacted to business trends and restructured some units, sources familiar with the matter said this week.

Headlines: Ebbing flows curb U.S. goods trade deficit; inventories mixed
Description: The U.S. goods trade deficit fell in September as trade tensions restricted the flow of goods, but that did not change views that economic growth decelerated further in the third quarter amid slowing consumer spending and declining business investment.

Headlines: Lebanon's eurobonds drop after cenbank chief says solution needed to avert collapse
Description: Lebanon's eurobonds sharpened their sell-off on Monday after Central Bank Governor Riad Salameh said a political solution was needed to the country's crisis in days to regain confidence and avoid a future economic collapse.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. will cooperate with 'like-minded' nations on 5G networks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a letter Monday the United States plans to cooperate with "like-minded nations" to promote security in next-generation 5G networks.

Headlines: UniCredit unveils 2015 data breach involving 3 million Italian clients
Description: UniCredit has uncovered a data breach involving the personal records of 3 million domestic clients, it said on Monday, the third security incident at Italy's top bank in recent years.

Headlines: Bitcoin holds ground after China voices support for blockchain
Description: Bitcoin held ground on Monday near a one-month high scaled over the weekend after China's president Xi Jinping said the world's second biggest economy should accelerate the development of blockchain technology.

Headlines: Microsoft beats Amazon for Pentagon's $10 billion cloud computing contract
Description: Microsoft Corp. has won the Pentagon's $10 billion cloud computing contract, the Defense Department said on Friday, beating out favorite Amazon.com Inc .

Headlines: The Force is with Microsoft: Shares up on winning JEDI contract
Description: Microsoft shares rise 3.4% to $145.50 premarket, after company wins the Pentagon's $10 billion cloud computing contract.

Headlines: Brazil rates to hit record low 5.00%, seen falling further: Reuters poll
Description: Brazil's benchmark interest rate will be cut to a record low of 5.00% on Wednesday, according to the unanimous view in a Reuters poll of economists, as the central bank battles to spur economic growth and prevent inflation from falling further below target.

Headlines: In a Nike factory in Argentina's hinterland, the ghost of Macri's fall
Description: Rumors of layoffs started spreading among workers at a factory here in northeastern Argentina making Nike Inc shoes the night before Cristian Fredy Aquino's scheduled shift.

Headlines: Investors brace for poor U.S. shale earnings amid weak oil and gas prices
Description: Investors are bracing for weaker results from U.S. shale players in coming days as lower oil and natural gas prices and cost-cutting measures have weighed on third-quarter operations.

Headlines: Exclusive: Thai Siam Cement's packaging unit set for $1 billion IPO - sources
Description: Thailand's Siam Cement Pcl's (SCG) packaging subsidiary is planning a local listing, in a float that is set to raise about $1 billion, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Lazard appoints Girodolle CEO of Lazard France
Description: Lazard said on Sunday it had appointed Jean-Louis Girodolle as CEO of Lazard Investment Banking in France, just a week after its chairman and CEO Matthieu Pigasse resigned.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lebanon needs solution to crisis in days - Central bank governor
Description: Lebanon needs a political solution to the country's crisis in days to regain confidence and avert a future economic collapse, Central Bank Governor Riad Salameh told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Pentagon deal to boost Microsoft's position in cloud computing: analysts
Description: Amazon.com Inc's firm grip on the cloud computing market could be threatened by Microsoft Corp's multi-billion dollar contract with the Pentagon, Wall Street analysts said on Monday.

Headlines: Japan tax agency finds Ghosn used Nissan money for private use: report
Description: Japan's tax authorities have determined former Nissan Motor Co Ltd boss Carlos Ghosn used company money for private use, bolstering the automaker's case that he diverted corporate funds for personal gain, the Yomiuri reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Justice Department issues grand jury subpoenas in J&J opioid probe: filing
Description: Johnson & Johnson received grand jury subpoenas in August from the U.S. attorney's office for the Eastern District of New York related to its opioid medication policies, the company said in a regulatory filing on Monday.

Headlines: Trump administration eases risks for banks on false lending claims
Description: The Trump administration said on Monday it would try to entice banks to offer more mortgages to low-income borrowers by reducing reliance on a Civil War-era law the Obama administration used in the wake of the subprime mortgage crisis to build bad-lending cases against big banks.

Headlines: Google's search for sales in cloud, hardware clip Alphabet profit
Description: Google parent Alphabet Inc reported quarterly results on Monday that show costs continue to rise faster than revenue as the web search leader seeks to broaden its business, dampening Wall Street's enthusiasm despite Google's continued dominance in advertising sales.

Headlines: Oil falls on weak Chinese data, forecasts for U.S. crude stocks build
Description: Oil prices fell on Monday after four days of gains as expectations U.S. crude stockpiles will rise and worries about weak Chinese industrial data offset hopes oil demand will increase if talks progress on a Sino-American trade deal.

Headlines: Lebanon's central bank urges quick solution to avoid future collapse
Description: Lebanon's central bank governor said on Monday a solution must be found in days to a crisis unleashed by huge protests against the ruling elite, saying this would restore confidence and avoid any future economic collapse.

Headlines: Trade optimism, Fed rate-cut expectation sends S&P 500 to record
Description: The S&P 500 hit a record high on Monday, while the Nasdaq fell just short of its lifetime high touched in late July as a more civil tone between the United States and China lifted hopes for a possible trade deal and investors looked toward a Federal Reserve rate cut later this week.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers will press Boeing CEO for answers on 737 MAX crashes
Description: The head of a U.S. Senate panel reviewing two catastrophic Boeing 737 MAX crashes told Reuters ahead of hearings this week that the plane would not return to U.S. skies until "99.9% of the American public" and policymakers are convinced it is safe.

Headlines: Global stocks falter, dollar slips on potential U.S.-China trade delay
Description: Global stocks faltered on Tuesday as strong earnings from U.S. drugmakers Merck and Pfizer and expectations the Federal Reserve will cut rates was offset by a potential delay in a U.S.-China trade deal, which clouded sentiment and weakened the dollar.

Headlines: Oil mixed on forecast of falling U.S. fuel stockpiles
Description: Oil prices were mixed on Tuesday, paring earlier steep losses as investors focused on signs that U.S.-China trade tensions could ease next month and expectations that U.S. refined product stockpiles declined last week.

Headlines: Zebra Technologies CEO: We're moving more supply chains out of China as new tariffs loom
Description: "They're going into existing facilities, so we think the start-up issue should be minimal," CEO Anders Gustafsson says.

Headlines: SEC probes AIG unit that sells retirement plans to teachers: WSJ
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is probing sales and disclosure practices at Valic, a unit of U.S. insurer American International Group Inc , the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: China to ease foreign investments curbs, won't force tech transfers -vice minister
Description: China will eliminate all restrictions on foreign investments not included in its self-styled "negative lists," a vice commerce minister said on Tuesday, and also will "neither explicitly nor implicitly" force foreign investors and companies to transfer technologies.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. coal-fired power plants scheduled to shut
Description: U.S. power companies expect to retire or convert from coal to gas over 13,800 megawatts (MW) of coal-fired plants in 2019 after shutting over 13,300 MW in 2018, according to U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) and Thomson Reuters data.

Headlines: Murray Energy files for bankruptcy as U.S. coal decline continues
Description: Murray Energy Corp, one of the largest privately-held U.S. coal miners, whose founder is an outspoken supporter of President Donald Trump, became the latest in a string of coal companies to file for bankruptcy on Tuesday as generators shift to cleaner-burning natural gas and renewable energy.

Headlines: NCAA board votes to let student athletes endorse brands, accept sponsors
Description: U.S. college athletes can profit from brand sponsorships and endorsement deals under a new rule approved on Tuesday by the governing board of the NCAA, the organization that regulates U.S. collegiate sports.

Headlines: U.S. shipping sanctions to dent demand for dirty shipping fuel: Refinitiv
Description: U.S. sanctions on a top Chinese shipping fleet is set to produce a totally unintended result -- less burning of the dirtiest marine fuels at sea at the start of next year, Refinitiv data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Aramco signs slew of deals at Future Investment Initiative conference
Description: Saudi Aramco has signed several deals at the Future Investment Initiative conference in Riyadh, Saudi Arabian General Investment Authority (SAGIA) said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Blackrock CEO says the world will see higher equity markets in 2020
Description: U.S. fund manager BlackRock Inc chief executive said on Tuesday the world will see higher equity markets in 2020.

Headlines: Factbox: Downstream Iranian energy projects disrupted by water crisis
Description: Below is a list of Iranian downstream energy projects where construction has been delayed and existing facilities where operations have been disrupted due to water scarcity. [L5N26W2I0]

Headlines: Three-peat? Fed copies 1990s playbook in bid to avert a downturn
Description: In the midst of what became a golden decade for the U.S. Federal Reserve, central bankers twice in the 1990s cut interest rates in short bursts that managed to help the U.S. economy continue growing despite slowing investment and weak growth overseas.

Headlines: Australian regulator files privacy suit against Google alleging location data misuse
Description: An Australian regulator has filed a lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's Google, accusing it of misleading smartphone users about how it collected and used personal location data, advancing a global crackdown on the world's biggest tech firms.

Headlines: VW ramps up China electric car factories, taking aim at Tesla
Description: Volkswagen AG is ramping up production of electric cars to around 1 million vehicles by end of 2022, according to manufacturing plans seen by Reuters, enabling the German carmaker to leapfrog Tesla Inc and making China the key battleground.

Headlines: Amazon could challenge loss of $10 billion Pentagon cloud deal as early as next week
Description: If Amazon.com decides to fight the Pentagon's decision to award a highly contested $10 billion cloud computing contract to Microsoft, it could act as early as next week.

Headlines: Airbus-owned Stelia Aerospace to build Portugal assembly plant
Description: Stelia Aerospace, owned by European planemaker Airbus , will open a 40 million euro ($44 million) assembly plant near Porto in Portugal, creating 240 jobs, company and government officials said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tesla filing shows U.S. sales tumbled 39% in third quarter
Description: Tesla Inc's third-quarter revenue tumbled 39% in the United States, its first drop in more than two years, but sales in China and other regions surged, the electric car maker's break down of sales by geography showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence slips, housing stabilizing
Description: U.S. consumer confidence fell for a third straight month in October amid concerns about the short-term outlook for business conditions and job prospects, but remained at levels consistent with continued growth in consumer spending.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips profit beats estimates on higher production
Description: U.S. oil and gas company ConocoPhillips' quarterly profit exceeded analysts' estimates on Tuesday, as higher shale production and a gain from asset sales offset the impact from lower crude prices and higher exploration costs.

Headlines: Pfizer raises 2019 forecast as sales of cancer drug, heart medicine surge
Description: Pfizer Inc reported a higher-than-expected third-quarter profit on Tuesday on increased sales of cancer drug Ibrance and a strong launch of new heart medicine Vyndaqel, prompting the largest U.S. drugmaker to lift its earnings forecast for the year.

Headlines: China woes persist as pressure point for U.S. corporate profits
Description: The U.S.-China trade war persists as an impediment to the growth of U.S. companies, even as the two countries appear close to clinching a limited agreement.

Headlines: Factbox: When will the Boeing 737 MAX fly again?
Description: Boeing Co's best-selling jet, the 737 MAX, was grounded globally in March, days after the crash of an Ethiopian Airlines flight that followed a similar Lion Air disaster in Indonesia in on Oct. 29, 2018. A total of 346 people died in the two crashes.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence slips in October
Description: U.S. consumer confidence unexpectedly fell in October amid household concerns about the short-term outlook for business conditions and job prospects.

Headlines: Wingstop CEO bets on advertising, digital and delivery in the wing chain's 'bright future'
Description: Wingstop has a "lot of runway for growth not only here in the U.S., but across the world," CEO Charlie Morrison tells "Mad Money's" Jim Cramer.

Headlines: Ford shutters oldest Brazil plant as revival bid faces doubts
Description: Ford Motor Co on Wednesday said it was shutting down its oldest plant in Brazil later in the day as planned, with prospects for saving any of the jobs in doubt as talks with a potential buyer have fallen behind schedule.

Headlines: Oil falls on hike in U.S. crude stockpiles, trade deal concerns
Description: Oil prices fell on Wednesday after a steep U.S. crude inventory build added to worries about a possible delay in resolving the U.S.-China trade war, which has hurt global oil demand.

Headlines: Boeing CEO Muilenburg resists multiple calls for resignation
Description: Boeing Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg on Wednesday spurned repeated calls to step down by U.S. lawmakers and from the mother of a young woman who was a victim of one of two 737 MAX crashes that killed 346 people.

Headlines: Bayer says U.S. farmers unfazed by glyphosate litigation
Description: Bayer, the world's largest maker of seeds and pesticides, said U.S. farmers were unperturbed by lawsuits seeking damages from Bayer for an alleged cancer-causing effect of glyphosate-based herbicides.

Headlines: S&P closes at record on Fed bump
Description: U.S. stocks advanced on Wednesday, with the S&P 500 closing at a record for the second time in three sessions, after a policy statement by the U.S. Federal Reserve that cut interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point.

Headlines: Instant View: Markets take Fed cut, pause signal in stride
Description: U.S. stocks firmed slightly and yields on Treasuries gyrated in narrow ranges on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve lowered interest rates for the third time this year, while signaling it might pause its easing cycle.

Headlines: Kuwait, Gulf central banks cut key rates following Fed
Description: Kuwait’s central bank cut its benchmark interest rate on Wednesday, joining the Federal Reserve-led monetary easing cycle with its Gulf peers for the first time since July.

Headlines: Factbox: What happens at the Fed's rate-setting meetings?
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve concluded its latest two-day policy meeting on Wednesday to set a key U.S. interest rate that impacts investors, consumers, and companies around the world.

Headlines: GM, Toyota, Fiat Chrysler back Trump on California emissions challenge
Description: Major automakers are siding with the Trump administration in its bid to bar California from setting its own fuel efficiency rules or zero-emission requirements for vehicles, the companies said in a filing with a U.S. appeals court late on Monday.

Headlines: PSA CEO Tavares gets board's green light to pursue FCA merger: source
Description: The supervisory board of Peugeot maker PSA agreed on Wednesday to give Chief Executive Carlos Tavares the go-ahead to pursue a merger with Italy's Fiat Chrysler , a source familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Italy respects market nature of FCA-PSA deal but must be vigilant: minister
Description: Italy respects the market nature of a possible merger between Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot-owner PSA but is also aware that such a crucial sector warrants high vigilance on the government's part, the country's economy minister said.

Headlines: Boeing CEO accused of telling 'half-truths' in 737 MAX hearing
Description: Boeing Co Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg faced intense grilling by U.S. lawmakers at a hearing on Tuesday over what the company knew about its MCAS stall-prevention system linked to two deadly crashes, and about delays in turning over internal 2016 messages that described erratic behavior of the software in a simulator.

Headlines: Traders keep bets on Fed pause after third rate cut
Description: U.S. short-term interest rate futures on Wednesday pared earlier gains after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates for a third time this year and signaled it would pause to assess any further need to ease policy.

Headlines: Malaysian financier Jho Low ready to address other issues after U.S. settlement
Description: Fugitive financier Jho Low is ready to address issues related to the 1MDB scandal in Malaysia or elsewhere, a spokesman from the Wells Haslem Mayhew Strategic Public Affairs agency who handles press matters on behalf of Low said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.N. seeks new host for climate talks after Chile withdraws
Description: The United Nations is seeking a new host for this year's round of climate talks in December after Chile withdrew as raging street protests grip the South American country.

Headlines: Costa Rica defers to Chile, U.N. on rescheduling climate change summit
Description: Costa Rica's government said on Wednesday it defers to Chile, the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and member states on how to proceed with the United Nations global climate change summit, COP25.

Headlines: Exclusive: Alibaba to resume Hong Kong listing plans as soon as November - sources
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd is eyeing a listing in Hong Kong as early as November to raise up to $15 billion, after political unrest put the move on ice earlier this year, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Toshiba sues former employee of U.S. unit, citing fraud
Description: Toshiba Corp said on Thursday it filed a lawsuit against a former employee of a U.S. unit for conspiring with a contractor and defrauding the Japanese industrial conglomerate.

Headlines: Ford reaches tentative labor deal with United Auto Workers union
Description: Ford Motor and the United Auto Workers union on Wednesday announced a tentative agreement for a new labor deal, allowing the No. 2 U.S. automaker to avoid a strike like the one that cost its larger rival General Motors about $3 billion.

Headlines: U.S. SEC considers relaxing post-crisis structured mortgage product rules
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on Wednesday said it was seeking feedback on whether disclosure rules were discouraging firms from issuing SEC-registered residential mortgage-backed securities (RMBS) as the Trump administration seeks to overhaul the U.S. housing finance market.

Headlines: Starbucks earnings heat up on China expansion, digital and cold brews
Description: Starbucks Corp beat Wall Street sales and revenue estimates on Wednesday, driven by new stores, digital ordering and delivery in China, and cold drinks in the United States.

Headlines: Consumers support U.S. economy as business spending slumps
Description: U.S. economic growth slowed less than expected in the third quarter as a further contraction in business investment was offset by resilient consumer spending, further allaying financial market fears of a recession.

Headlines: MetLife profit falls short on U.S., Latam weakness
Description: U.S. insurer MetLife Inc fell short of Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Wednesday, hit by a fall in adjusted earnings in its U.S. and Latin American businesses.

Headlines: Boeing CEO pummeled on compensation, 737 MAX flaws at U.S. hearing
Description: Boeing Co Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg was repeatedly hammered by U.S. lawmakers at a hearing on Wednesday over his compensation and key mistakes in development of the 737 MAX that he newly acknowledged.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers question Boeing's $1 mln rebate clause for Southwest 737 MAX orders
Description: To convince Southwest Airlines Co to buy the Boeing 737 MAX, the plane maker reassured the airline that pilots would not need expensive simulator training and backed up the promise with a $1 million per plane rebate if training was needed, U.S. lawmakers said on Wednesday.

Headlines: The Federal Reserve is waiting for a U.S.-China 'Phase One' trade deal too
Description: U.S. trade policy and its impact on business investment, manufacturing and exports were a key factor in the Federal Reserve's decision to cut rates, chair Jerome Powell said Wednesday.

Headlines: Nintendo moves closer to China Switch launch after nod for first game sale
Description: China granted approval for Nintendo Co to sell its first Switch console game in the country, a regulator announced, drawing closer the official launch of the hybrid home-portable device in the world's biggest game market.

Headlines: U.S. agricultural sales to China will 'take some time to scale up': Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Wednesday that it will take time for Chinese purchases of U.S. agricultural goods to "scale up" to the $40 billion to $50 billion annual level touted by President Donald Trump if the two sides can seal a "Phase 1" trade deal.

Headlines: Timeline: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot merger talks mark next round of consolidation
Description: FiatChrysler and France's Peugeot said they are in talks about a potential tie-up, the latest bout of auto industry consolidation as the costs of developing zero-emissions vehicles rises amid slowing global demand.

Headlines: FCA-PSA tie-up must be 'merger of equals' with no job cuts: UILM trade union
Description: A possible tie-up between Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot owner PSA must be a "merger of equals" that leads to no job losses in Italy, Italian trade union UILM leader Rocco Palombella said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. private sector job growth picks up in October: ADP
Description: U.S. private employers added 125,000 jobs in October, slightly above economists' expectations, a report by a payrolls processor showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: GM President Mark Reuss takes on additional leadership role
Description: General Motors Co said on Wednesday President Mark Reuss would now oversee North America, South America, China and international regions.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler calls board meeting on Peugeot tie-up: sources
Description: Italy's Fiat Chrysler has called a board meeting for late Wednesday to discuss a possible tie-up with French rival Peugeot , two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Pizza Hut, GrubHub troubles dent Yum profits; shares fall
Description: Yum Brands Inc missed earnings expectations, largely hit by a write down in the value of its investment in delivery company GrubHub and warned of sagging sales at its Pizza Hut U.S. chain next year, sending shares down 10% on Wednesday.

Headlines: UK union seeks meeting with Peugeot over potential Fiat tie-up fears
Description: Britain's biggest trade union Unite wants a meeting with management at French carmaker Peugeot over its possible tie-up with Fiat Chrysler, saying merger talks and uncertainty over Brexit are "deeply unsettling" for workers at British plants.

Headlines: In record deal, U.S. to recover $1 billion from Malaysian fugitive Jho Low
Description: The U.S. Justice Department has struck a deal to recoup $1 billion in funds allegedly looted from a Malaysian state investment fund by fugitive financier Jho Low, in a record capture for a U.S. anti-corruption probe.

Headlines: FTC probes Altria for role in Juul executive changes
Description: U.S. antitrust enforcers are probing Altria Group Inc for potentially exerting influence over electronic-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc before winning approval for a big share buy, Altria said in a government filing on Thursday.

Headlines: Twitter says tech tools remove one in two abusive tweets in first-half
Description: Twitter's technology tools removed one in two tweets containing abusive content posted in the first half of this year, it said on Thursday, amid calls to the U.S. social media company and its peers to do more to tackle the issue.

Headlines: OPEC October oil output jumps on swift Saudi recovery: Reuters survey
Description: OPEC oil output has bounced in October from an eight-year low as a rapid recovery in Saudi Arabian production from attacks on oil plants more than offset losses in Ecuador and voluntary curbs under a supply pact, a Reuters survey found.

Headlines: Scrapped Chile APEC summit throws up new hurdle for U.S.-China trade deal
Description: Leaders from the United States and China encountered a new obstacle in their struggle to end a damaging trade war on Wednesday, when the summit where they were supposed to meet was canceled because of violent protests.

Headlines: Hong Kong unrest, stronger dollar weigh on Estee Lauder's FY forecast
Description: Estee Lauder Cos Inc cut its full-year profit forecast on Thursday as it expects to take a hit from the ongoing unrest in Hong Kong and a stronger dollar, taking the sheen off its better-than-expected results and sending its shares down 5%.

Headlines: Encana to move to U.S., change name amid pipeline crunch in Canada
Description: Encana Corp will shift base from Calgary to the United States and become Ovintiv Inc next year, the oil and gas producer said on Thursday, the latest company to move away from Canada as the nation battles with pipeline capacity shortages.

Headlines: Uber pulls $40 million Colombia investment, citing regulatory uncertainty
Description: Ride-hailing mobile application Uber said on Thursday it will not be basing a $40 million support and safety center in Colombia after all, because of a lack of regulatory stability in the Andean country.

Headlines: Trump bets on Fed cuts to help the dollar. Don't count on it
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump says further Federal Reserve rate cuts would lower the value of the dollar and help the country's trade position.

Headlines: Several automakers back Trump in two other California vehicle emissions suits
Description: General Motors Co , Toyota Motor Corp , Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV and other major automakers late Thursday sought to intervene on the side of the Trump administration in two additional legal challenges to its efforts to bar California from setting tailpipe emissions standards.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending slowing; inflation benign
Description: U.S. consumer spending increased marginally in September while wages were unchanged, which could cast doubts on consumers' ability to continue driving the economy amid a deepening slump in business investment.

Headlines: Mexico says timetable slipped slightly for U.S. to ratify trade deal
Description: The timetable towards ratification of a new North American trade deal has slipped slightly but the pact could still pass the U.S. Congress by year end, a senior Mexican trade official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Massive mining waste dams could pose deadly risks, say investors
Description: A global inquiry into how mining companies store billions of tonnes of waste in huge dams, launched after a collapse in Brazil killed hundreds, shows about a tenth of the structures have had stability issues, investors said on Thursday.

Headlines: China's factory activity shrinks at sharper pace, services weaken as risks grow
Description: Factory activity in China shrank for the sixth straight month in October and by more than expected, while service sector growth eased as firms grapple with the weakest economic growth in nearly 30 years.

Headlines: Chinese officials say they have doubts if trade deal possible with Trump: Bloomberg
Description: Chinese officials have doubts about whether it is possible to reach a comprehensive long-term trade deal with Washington and U.S. President Donald Trump, Bloomberg reported on Thursday, citing unnamed sources.

Headlines: China's auto market could shrink about 8% this year: industry official
Description: Auto sales in China may skid to 26 million this year, a drop of around 8%, a senior industry executive warned, as the world's largest auto market braces for a second year of contraction amid slowing economic growth and tighter vehicle emissions standards.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot deal good news but must not affect jobs in Italy: Italian minister
Description: A planned merger between Italy's Fiat Chrysler (FCA) and French Peugeot owner PSA is good news provided it does not affect jobs in Italy, the country's industry minister said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. Fed cuts interest rates, signals it is on hold
Description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday cut interest rates for the third time this year to help sustain U.S. growth despite a slowdown in other parts of the world, but signaled there would be no further reductions unless the economy takes a turn for the worse.

Headlines: Bombardier to sell aerostructures business to Spirit AeroSystems
Description: Canada's Bombardier said on Thursday it had agreed to sell its aerostructures business to Spirit AeroSystems for more than $1 billion in cash and debt.

Headlines: German union seeks to preserve Opel independence as Peugeot pursues FCA
Description: IG Metall, Germany's largest union by members, said on Thursday it would seek to preserve the autonomy of PSA's German unit Opel after PSA and Fiat Chrysler announced plans to create the world's fourth-largest automaker.

Headlines: Columbia Sportswear CEO: There are better 'sourcing countries' than China
Description: Columbia Sportswear CEO Tim Doyle talks shifting apparel factories away from China, telling CNBC "there's been better opportunities in other sourcing countries."

Headlines: GM recalls 638,000 U.S. SUVs, trucks for unintended braking
Description: General Motors Co is recalling 638,000 U.S. sport utility vehicles and pickup trucks because a wheel-speed sensor could fail and cause unintended braking, it said Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. labor costs rise in third quarter
Description: U.S. labor costs increased in the third quarter as a tightening labor market lifted wages across the board.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending rises moderately, wages flat
Description: U.S. consumer spending rose marginally in September while wages were unchanged, which could cast doubts on consumers' ability to continue driving the economy amid a deepening slump in business investment.

Headlines: Conte says crucial to keep jobs, plants in Italy in FCA-PSA deal
Description: Italy's Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said that merger plan between Peugeot owner PSA and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles must keep jobs and factories in Italy, Italian media reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Price cuts, iPhone 11 timing drive Apple's uncertain China rebound: analysts
Description: Apple Inc managed to largely stem a fall in China revenue in the September quarter thanks to the release-timing of the iPhone 11, a cheaper variant, and a bit of good luck, but analysts said the company's good fortunes might be shortlived.

Headlines: Volkswagen brings electric cars to Rwanda for ride-hailing service
Description: Volkswagen is importing a batch of electric powered Golf models into Rwanda for a local ride-hailing service, establishing a bridgehead in the country that it hopes to expand to other nations as it seeks to increase market share globally.

Headlines: Bristol-Myers posts better-than-expected results, Opdivo growth slows
Description: U.S. drugmaker Bristol-Myers Squibb Co reported higher-than-expected third-quarter profit on Thursday, helped by strong sales of blood thinner Eliquis, even as growth of its blockbuster cancer treatment Opdivo slowed.

Headlines: French finance minister says Peugeot-Fiat deal 'good news' for France
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire gave his blessing to the merger between national champion PSA and Italo-American carmaker Fiat-Chrysler, saying the deal would be good news for France and Europe but that he would keep an eye on possible job cuts.

Headlines: Investors fear looming safety risks of mining waste dams
Description: A global inquiry into how mining companies store billions of tonnes of waste in huge dams, launched after a collapse in Brazil killed hundreds, shows about a tenth of the structures have had stability issues, investors said on Thursday.

Headlines: Greek airline Sky Express partners with Qatar Airways
Description: Greek airline Sky Express said on Thursday it had signed an agreement with Qatar Airways to cooperate on flights connecting Doha with the Greek islands, in a boost to the country's key tourism industry.

Headlines: Carlyle's third-quarter earnings drop by a quarter as asset sales slow
Description: U.S. buyout firm Carlyle Group LP reported a 25% year-on-year drop in its third-quarter earnings on Thursday, driven by lower proceeds from asset sales in its private equity portfolio.

Headlines: U.S., China trade working hard to conclude trade deal: Mnuchin
Description: The United States and China are working hard to conclude a trade deal following directions from their leaders, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. October payrolls growth slows less than expected
Description: U.S. job growth slowed less than expected in October as the drag from a strike at General Motors was offset by gains elsewhere, while hiring in the prior two months was stronger than previously estimated, offering assurance that consumers would continue to prop up the slowing economy for a while.

Headlines: Treasury yields jump after better-than-expected jobs report
Description: Yields on U.S. government bonds jumped on Friday morning after domestic job growth slowed less than expected in October, suggesting the Federal Reserve was justified in signaling on Wednesday that it would pause interest rate cuts going forward.

Headlines: India orders IndiGo to replace all Pratt engines on Airbus A320neo planes
Description: IndiGo must replace all Pratt & Whitney (P&W) engines on its fleet of almost 100 twin-engined Airbus A320neo family aircraft with new P&W power units, India's air safety watchdog said on Friday following recent inflight engine shutdowns.

Headlines: Amazon's bid to acquire stake in Indian retailer faces antitrust hurdle: sources
Description: India's antitrust body has sought more information from Amazon.com Inc about its planned acquisition of a stake in India's Future Retail , sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters, which could potentially delay the deal.

Headlines: Electric Audi SUV tops Norway's October car sales
Description: German auto maker Audi's fully-electric e-tron sports utility vehicle was the top-selling car in Norway last month with an 8.3% market share, registration data showed on Friday.

Headlines: South Africa's Taste Holdings to exit food business, sells Starbucks stores
Description: Taste Holdings , owner of Starbucks and Domino's Pizza franchises in South Africa, said on Friday it was abandoning the food business, and had already sold its 13 stores of the coffee chain to a consortium for 7 million rand ($464,000).

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including stock picks, Fed and China chatter, Smarties
Description: CNBC's Jim Cramer reveals stocks worth buying after Thursday's market decline, breaks down emerging Fed and China trade worries, and sits down with top brass of Columbia Sportswear, Smarties and Eurazeo.

Headlines: Australia's Genex pumped hydro project funding falls through, shares tank
Description: Australia's Genex Power Ltd on Friday said it won't be able to line up funding for its pumped hydro project until next year, after failing to sign a power sale agreement from the project.

Headlines: China wind power firm plans $1 billion LNG terminal by end-2022
Description: China's Suntien Green Energy Co. Ltd , a wind power producer and piped gas distributor, plans to build a $1 billion liquefied natural gas (LNG) receiving terminal in north China by end-2022, after its investment plans won state approval, a company official said.

Headlines: China, U.S. maintain close contact on trade issues: foreign ministry
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Friday China and the United States have maintained close contact on bilateral trade issues.

Headlines: India asks WhatsApp to explain privacy breach
Description: India, WhatsApp's biggest market with 400 million users, has asked the Facebook-owned company to explain the nature of a privacy breach on its messaging platform that has affected some users, Technology Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said.

Headlines: Singapore's Ascendas REIT to buy business parks from CapitaLand for $1.2 billion
Description: Ascendas Real Estate Investment Trust said on Friday it is buying 30 business parks in the United States and Singapore for about S$1.66 billion ($1.22 billion) from its controlling unit holder CapitaLand Ltd .

Headlines: U.S. construction spending beats expectations on homebuilding
Description: U.S. construction spending increased more than expected in September as investment in homebuilding rose its highest level in nine months.

Headlines: U.S., China reach consensus on principles after trade talks: Xinhua
Description: The United States and China have reached consensus after talks between their main trade negotiators on Friday, Beijing's state-media Xinhua News Agency reported.

Headlines: Factbox: GM strike sends ripples across auto parts suppliers
Description: Several auto parts makers and suppliers have lowered their full-year forecasts and disclosed hits to quarterly earnings from the 40-day strike at No.1 U.S. carmaker General Motors .

Headlines: U.S. October job growth beats expectations despite GM strike
Description: U.S. job growth slowed less than expected in October as the drag from a strike at General Motors was offset by gains elsewhere and hiring in the prior two months was stronger than previously estimated, offering some assurance that consumers would continue to support the slowing economy.

Headlines: After year-long bumpy ride, Fed appears to make soft landing
Description: After a year-long struggle with bond markets, the Trump administration, and each other, Federal Reserve policymakers found their way to a compromise this week with a rate cut that even the White House said had put monetary policy in a much better place.

Headlines: AT&T adds Seagate chairman Stephen Luczo to board
Description: AT&T Inc said on Friday it named Seagate Technology Plc chairman Stephen Luczo to its board, days after the second-largest U.S. wireless phone carrier by subscribers announced it would add two new board members.

Headlines: Deutsche Bahn in exclusive talks with Carlyle for Arriva sale
Description: Deutsche Bahn is in exclusive talks with U.S. buyout group Carlyle over the sale of the German rail operator's Arriva international passenger transport unit, a person familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Factbox: Fight for fitness - With Fitbit, Google takes on Xiaomi, Apple, Samsung
Description: Competition in the wearable market is taking a turn as Alphabet Inc-owned Google buys Fitbit Inc in a bid to take on Apple and Samsung.

Headlines: Google taps fitness tracker market with $2.1 billion bid for Fitbit
Description: Alphabet Inc-owned Google will buy Fitbit Inc for $2.1 billion, as the biggest Web search company looks to take on Apple and Samsung in the crowded market for fitness trackers and smart watches.

Headlines: Apple asks U.S. to waive tariffs on Chinese-made watches, iPhone parts, AirPods
Description: Apple Inc asked the Trump administration to waive tariffs on Chinese-made Apple Watches, iPhone components and other consumer products, according to company filings with the U.S. Trade Representative's Office.

Headlines: Oil rises nearly 4% on U.S.-China trade hopes, but sets weekly decline
Description: Oil prices rose nearly 4% on Friday on signs of progress in U.S.-China trade talks and stronger-than-expected economic data in both countries, including U.S. employment and Chinese manufacturing activity numbers.

Headlines: Global shares, crude prices rise on U.S., China data
Description: World equity markets surged and crude oil prices jumped on Friday after a stronger-than-expected U.S. employment report, a surprise bounce in Chinese manufacturing and optimism over U.S.-China trade talks tamped down fears of slowing global growth.

Headlines: White House will look 'very carefully' at Peugeot, Fiat Chrysler deal: Kudlow
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration will look very closely at the planned merger between Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot owner PSA , White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq set records on jobs data, trade headway
Description: U.S. stocks rallied to close out the trading week on Friday as the S&P 500 set a closing record for the third time in five days after an upbeat U.S. jobs report and data on Chinese manufacturing eased concerns about slowing global growth.

Headlines: US-China trade accord will require three phases: White House adviser
Description: The United States and China are on a good path to complete the first part of a trade agreement, but two additional phases will be needed to address all of China's "structural deadly sins," White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. extends divestiture deadline for sanctioned Russian firm GAZ
Description: The U.S. Treasury said on Friday it was giving investors several more months to divest from Russian automaker GAZ , a company linked to Russian tycoon Oleg Deripaska that Washington sanctioned over Russia's "malign activity."

Headlines: UAW union leaders recommend approval of Ford labor deal
Description: United Auto Workers leaders from Ford Motor Co's U.S. plants on Friday recommended approval of a tentative labor agreement that would allow the No. 2 U.S. automaker to avoid a strike like the one that cost its larger rival General Motors Co about $3 billion.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says policy is appropriate, should now be patient
Description: Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said on Friday the U.S. central bank now has monetary policy at a "roughly" appropriate setting and should leave interest rates where they are for the time being.

Headlines: No talks have taken place on ousting Fed's Powell: White House adviser
Description: A White House official said on Friday no discussions have taken place about ousting U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell after President Donald Trump expressed disappointment in him and criticized the central bank's latest interest rate cut.

Headlines: Three flight attendant unions voice alarm after 737 MAX hearings
Description: Unions representing flight attendants at the three U.S. airlines that operate Boeing Co's 737 MAX said they are more reluctant to support the grounded jet's return after congressional hearings this week on its development.

Headlines: Fosun Tourism to buy Thomas Cook, related hotel brands for $14.3 million
Description: China's Fosun Tourism Group said on Friday it would acquire the Thomas Cook and related hotel brands for 11 million pounds ($14.25 million), in a bid to expand its presence in the tourism business.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says he supported rate cut only if Fed signaled nothing further
Description: Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said on Friday he went along with the U.S. central bank's rate cut this week contingent on the Fed signaling that no further decreases to borrowing costs were likely, barring a material change in the economic outlook.

Headlines: Clarida says U.S. economy, Fed policy 'in a good place'
Description: The Federal Reserve's three interest rate cuts this year have provided "significant support" for the U.S. economy whose full effects are yet to be felt, Fed Vice Chair Richard Clarida said on Friday, elaborating on the case for why the central bank is likely to remain on hold for now.

Headlines: On eve of China import fair, EU warns of 'promise fatigue'
Description: The European Union said that China should make rapid and substantial improvements to the business environment or risk "promise fatigue."

Headlines: Iraqi protesters and security forces clash, keep Umm Qasr port closed
Description: Thousands of protesters were blocking all roads leading to Iraq's main Gulf port Umm Qasr on Saturday, after security forces used live rounds and tear gas on them overnight, security sources said.

Headlines: UAW union president takes leave of absence under cloud of U.S. federal probe
Description: The president of the United Auto Workers union, who has been linked https://www.reuters.com/article/us-autos-corruption-labor/federal-corruption-probe-hits-home-for-uaw-boss-contract-talks-under-storm-cloud-idUSKCN1VI229 to an ongoing corruption probe by U.S. federal officials, has taken a leave of absence, the union said on Saturday in a statement.

Headlines: Talks on Asian trade deal 'conclusive', Thai minister says
Description: Talks to agree what could be the world's biggest trade bloc were conclusive and an announcement on their success will be made later on Monday, Thailand's commerce minister said on Monday.

Headlines: Under Armour faces U.S. federal probe over accounting practices: WSJ
Description: Under Armour Inc is under investigation by U.S. federal law enforcement officials over whether the sportswear maker shifted sales from quarter to quarter to appear financially healthier, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Highlights of Saudi Aramco's intention to float
Description: Saudi Arabia's state oil company kicked off its initial public offering (IPO) on Sunday by announcing its intention to float on the Riyadh bourse.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco chairman says firm will continue to meet global oil supply demand post listing
Description: Saudi Aramco's chairman Yasser al-Rumayyan said on Sunday the state oil giant would continue to meet its global oil supply demand after it lists on the Riyadh bourse.

Headlines: China securities regulator says IPO reform to be expanded to Shenzhen's start-up board - Xinhua
Description: The registration-based mechanism for initial public offerings (IPOs) that underpins the successful launch of Shanghai's Nasdaq-style STAR Market will be rolled out on Shenzhen's start-up board ChiNext, China's top securities regulator said on Sunday.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Travel, leisure company reports set to give view of economy, consumer
Description: A wide swath of the U.S. travel and leisure industry is set to provide insight next week on the state of the economy, including trends in consumer spending, fallout from U.S.-China trade tensions and any damaging impact from the stronger U.S. dollar.

Headlines: ECB governor accused of bribery in Latvia corruption trial
Description: Latvia's central bank chief, who led the former Soviet republic into the euro, appeared in court on Monday accused of bribery in the first corruption trial of a European Central Bank governor.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra could come under some existing rules: watchdog
Description: Existing securities rules could apply to "stablecoin" digital currency initiatives such as Facebook's Libra project to help realize its benefits, global securities watchdog IOSCO said on Monday as policymakers examine whether new regulation is needed.

Headlines: Huawei will maintain robust growth in absence of U.S. supply: board director
Description: Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei will maintain robust business growth in the absence of U.S. supply and does not rely on any U.S. technology and components for 5G, board director William Xu said on Monday.

Headlines: EU argues case against Trump's metal tariffs at WTO
Description: The European Union argued on Monday for the withdrawal of tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump on metal imports in one of the most high-profile and potentially explosive cases to come to the World Trade Organization (WTO).

Headlines: Factbox: How TikTok, caught in U.S. regulatory crossfire, rose to global video stardom
Description: Short video-sharing app TikTok has become the latest Chinese firm caught in U.S. regulatory crossfire, with Washington launching a national security review of its $1 billion acquisition of U.S. social media app Musical.ly.

Headlines: Germany to hike electric car subsidies as VW launches car
Description: Germany plans to increase by half the grants available to buyers of electric cars over the five years from 2020, according to a government document seen by Reuters, the latest in a series of measures to speed the adoption of low-emissions vehicles.

Headlines: McDonald's CEO surprise exit throws long-term vision into doubt: analysts
Description: The surprise exit of McDonald's Corp chief executive officer, Steve Easterbrook, over the weekend has Wall Street wondering whether the burger chain's multi-billion dollar strategy to boost sales could change under the new head.

Headlines: ArcelorMittal's withdrawal from Ilva deal over legal shield is an alibi: minister
Description: Italy's industry minister called the decision by AcelorMittal to withdraw from a deal to buy Italian steelmaker Ilva on the grounds Rome had lifted immunity from prosecution over pollution issues "an alibi".

Headlines: ArcelorMittal to hand Ilva plant back to Italian state over legal row
Description: ArcelorMittal said on Monday it was withdrawing from a deal to buy struggling Italian steelmaker Ilva after Rome reneged on a promise to give it immunity from prosecution over its heavily polluting plant.

Headlines: Comcast launches tools to improve ad targeting on TV
Description: Comcast Corp on Monday launched new advertising capabilities to help advertisers find and target certain television viewers, as the largest U.S. cable TV provider tries to lure ad dollars away from digital rivals.

Headlines: Stocks gain on trade hopes, risk appetite lifts dollar
Description: The dollar strengthened and global stock markets rallied on Monday on signs the United States and China are nearing the end of a damaging trade war as well as indications the world economy may dodge a recession.

Headlines: Indexes hit closing records amid further trade deal optimism
Description: All three major U.S. stock indexes posted record closing highs on Monday, extending a recent run of gains on further hopes of a U.S.-China trade deal.

Headlines: Factbox: Meet McDonald's new CEO: Chris Kempczinski
Description: McDonald's Corp head of U.S. operations, Chris Kempczinski, replaced Steve Easterbrook as chief executive officer of the world's largest fast-food chain on Sunday.

Headlines: China says no 'promise fatigue' on opening its economy
Description: There is no "promise fatigue" about China's efforts to open its economy to foreign businesses, the government said on Monday on the eve of week-long import fair, after the European Union said China needed to make rapid and substantial improvements.

Headlines: Santander in 350 million pound deal for stake in UK's Ebury
Description: Santander has taken a 350 million pound ($453 million) majority stake in UK-based Ebury as part of a digital strategy to boost growth through new ventures, the Spanish bank announced on Monday.

Headlines: Factbox: Saudi Aramco - the oil colossus
Description: The world's largest oil producer, Saudi Aramco, has announced its intention to float in Riyadh in what could be the biggest stock market listing in history.

Headlines: Fifteen Asia-Pacific countries agree on trade pact, India holds back
Description: Fifteen Asia-Pacific countries have concluded negotiations for a trade pact that would be among the world's largest, but India still has "significant outstanding issues" before it is ready to sign on, the countries' leaders said on Monday.

Headlines: German cabin crew union UFO calls for two days of strike at Lufthansa
Description: Flights attendants' union UFO on Monday called for a two-day strike at Lufthansa's German operations later this week, citing an ongoing labor dispute with Germany's largest airline.

Headlines: BA parent IAG ups bet on Latin America with Air Europa takeover
Description: IAG , the parent of British Airways and Spain's Iberia, announced a 1 billion euro ($1.12 billion) takeover of Spain's Air Europa to boost its presence on routes to Latin America and the Caribbean.

Headlines: U.S. banks keep business loan standards steady in third-quarter
Description: Loan officers at U.S. banks reported keeping lending standards for business loans mostly unchanged in the third quarter but they tightened the terms for commercial real estate loans, a Federal Reserve survey showed on Monday.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including record highs, trade talks, Wayfair's bad stock
Description: CNBC's Jim Cramer breaks down how Wall Street rallied to new highs, says he's skeptical about China trade talks, steers investors clear of Wayfair's stock price and sits down with the CEO of OjO Electric.

Headlines: Factbox: Snakes and ladders- SoftBank Vision Fund's climbing, sliding valuations
Description: The $100 billion Vision Fund of Japan's SoftBank Group Corp has in just over two years burnt through much of its capital investing in money-losing, late-stage tech startups in areas as varied as autonomous driving, healthcare and finance.

Headlines: Boeing CEO Muilenburg 'has done everything right,' says chairman
Description: Boeing Co Chairman Dave Calhoun said on Tuesday the company's board believed Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg "has done everything right," just days after he came under attack from U.S. lawmakers and repeatedly refused to step down at a hearing on two fatal crashes involving Boeing 737 MAX airliners.

Headlines: Oil gains 1% as China pushes Trump for more tariff rollbacks
Description: Oil prices rose more than 1% on Tuesday on hopes for a U.S.-China trade agreement and optimism that Washington could roll back some tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: U.S. urged to invest more in AI; ex-Google CEO warns of China's progress
Description: U.S. government funding in artificial intelligence has fallen short and the country needs to invest in research, train an AI-ready workforce and apply the technology to national security missions, a government-commissioned panel led by Google's former CEO said in an interim report on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Walgreens has explored taking drug store chain private - sources
Description: Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc has been exploring whether to go private following private equity interest in the U.S drug store chain, which has a market value of more than $55 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. boards end era of impunity for 'skirt-chasers,' McDonald's firing shows
Description: Directors of U.S. companies are increasingly showing zero tolerance for executives' sexual relationships with employees, even consensual ones, an attitude shift evident in McDonald's Corp's dismissal of CEO Steve Easterbrook this week.

Headlines: AT&T to pay $60 million in settlement for slowing cellphone data on unlimited plans
Description: AT&T will pay $60 million to resolve U.S. allegations it misled millions of smartphone customers by charging them for "unlimited" data plans that reduced data speeds if they used too much, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Dept sets up anti-price collusion 'strike force'
Description: The Justice Department said on Tuesday it had created a strike force that will identify and prosecute companies that fix prices or collude to push up the cost of billions of dollars' worth of U.S. government purchases.

Headlines: Pioneer Natural CEO calls out shale industry for Permian Basin gas flaring
Description: The chief executive of Pioneer Natural Resources , Scott Sheffield, on Tuesday called on producers in the top U.S. shale field to limit natural gas flaring and monitor for methane leaks.

Headlines: U.S. CEOs who win trade barriers for their firms see big compensation boost: study
Description: The compensation of U.S. CEOs rises sharply when their companies gain import restrictions against foreign competitors, according to a new research paper.

Headlines: Lufthansa files motion to prevent cabin crew strike: spokeswoman
Description: Lufthansa , Germany's biggest airline, has filed a motion with a Frankfurt court to prevent a flight attendants' strike scheduled for this week, a company spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Scramble for propane marks Mother Nature's latest challenge for U.S. farmers
Description: Months after historic floods ravaged the U.S. Midwest, farmers scrambling to harvest their crops face a new headache: finding fuel to dry their soaked grains.

Headlines: Do more with less: New Zealand firm's four-day week
Description: A New Zealand estate planning company, which made headlines when it trailed a four-day week last year, has seen a big productivity increase since it made the change permanent, with staff spending less time surfing the Internet.

Headlines: Samsung says to shut down U.S. CPU research division
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Tuesday it will shut down a CPU research division at one of its U.S. facilities, a move that analysts said dimmed prospects for the tech giant's Exynos-branded mobile chips.

Headlines: Operating an airline in France is not easy, costs high: Air France KLM CEO
Description: Air France KLM is lobbying authorities in France as it pushes to try and make the market more competitive, the group's top boss said on Tuesday, adding that tax bills and the cost of operating out of airports there was higher than elsewhere.

Headlines: At Smithfield Foods' slaughterhouse, China brings home U.S. bacon
Description: Smithfield Foods' slaughterhouse in Virginia used to carve up pork for American sandwiches and holiday dinners. But workers now box up pig carcasses to ship to China, according to employees, local officials and industry sources.

Headlines: After U.S. blacklisting, iFlytek chief says firm will stick to law
Description: Chinese artificial intelligence firm iFlytek will strictly adhere to international laws, including a recent decision by the U.S. government to put the firm on a trade blacklist, its chairman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Beyond windmills, Epoch's Van Valen looks for grid improvements
Description: At a time when U.S. utilities face pressure to rely more on renewable energy, a well-known investor in the space said it is equally important to judge companies by their spending on less glamorous areas like power lines and grid reliability.

Headlines: Trump tariffs cost China $35 billion, hurt both economies: U.N.
Description: A trade war between the world's top two economies cut U.S. imports of Chinese goods by more than a quarter, or $35 billion, in the first half of this year and drove up prices for American consumers, a U.N. study showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tapestry sees current-quarter profit below estimates on Kate Spade, tariff woes
Description: Tapestry Inc on Tuesday forecast lower-than-expected profit for the current quarter, citing weak demand at its millennial-focused Kate Spade brand and the impact of U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: Coach powers Tapestry profit beat, tariffs to weigh on Kate Spade brand
Description: Tapestry Inc reported quarterly profit above market expectations on Tuesday, but warned of weakness at its Kate Spade business due to tariffs on apparel and jewelry imported from China.

Headlines: Fed's Barkin: Conflicting signals make U.S. economy hard to read
Description: Conflicting signals make it difficult to get a handle on the true health of the U.S. economy and reducing uncertainty for businesses would provide a shot in the arm to growth, Richmond Fed Reserve Bank President Thomas Barkin said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Mediaset ready to change pan-Europe TV governance to appease Vivendi: source
Description: Italian broadcaster Mediaset is ready to modify the governance of its pan-Europe TV reorganisation in order to reach a compromise with hostile shareholder Vivendi VIV.PA>, a source said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Huawei founder says not yet talking directly with U.S. firms to license 5G
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd is not yet directly engaged with any U.S. company over the firm's proposal to ease concerns about the security of its platform by licensing its 5G network technology, its founder and CEO Ren Zhengfei said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Cause of Philadelphia fire sounds alarm over aging U.S. refineries
Description: How did a piece of piping installed when Richard Nixon was U.S. president go without once being checked before leading to a fire that devastated the East Coast's largest and oldest oil refinery?

Headlines: China regulator warns e-commerce platforms to stop monopolistic practices
Description: China has warned top e-commerce platforms including Alibaba and JD.com to stop practices that could be deemed as monopolistic, as industry frictions grow ahead of the country's banner Singles Day shopping event on Nov. 11.

Headlines: Fed's Evans: U.S. economy in 'good place,' but watching inflation
Description: The U.S. economy is in a good place but the path of inflation will be important in deciding the future path of interest rates, Chicago Federal Reserve President Charles Evans said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Bank of America, Raymond James to pay $12 million for college fund overcharges
Description: Bank of America Corp and Raymond James Financial Inc will pay roughly $12 million in restitution to customers who incurred excessive fees on investments meant to help their children afford college, a U.S. regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Europe's banks must brace for coming digital storm: ECB's Schnabel
Description: Low profitability at European banks just when they need to invest to stay competitive in the digital era risks triggering a vicious circle of underinvestment and further poor performance, said Germany's nominee to the board of the European Central Bank.

Headlines: China considers up to $10 billion investment in Aramco IPO: Bloomberg
Description: China's state-owned entities are in talks about investing $5 billion to $10 billion in Saudi oil giant Aramco's planned initial public offering, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. sets sights on shipping companies for sanctions evasions
Description: The United States will target shipping companies that are in breach of sanctions and aggressively enforce measures across the globe to clamp down on such practices, a top U.S. official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Phillips 66 completely transparent in project financing: CEO
Description: Phillips 66 Chief Executive Greg Garland said on Thursday the company is completely transparent in the financing of pipelines and other projects the independent U.S. refiner and petrochemical producer has undertaken in the past few years.

Headlines: Explainer: ArcelorMittal's Italian venture runs into legal and financial woes
Description: ArcelorMittal said this week it was withdrawing from a deal to buy Italy's struggling steel firm Ilva after the government scrapped previous guarantees of legal immunity during an environmental clean-up at its plant.

Headlines: Ride-hailing market revs up in Egypt
Description: Competition in Egypt's ride-hailing and tech-enabled transport market is heating up as rivals from global giant Uber to smaller local firms vie for a slice of the Middle East's largest market.

Headlines: Tesla plans after-sales network expansion in China as Shanghai factory spins up
Description: Tesla Inc plans to double the number of repair and maintenance shops, add about 100 charging stations and revamp showrooms in China as the electric vehicle maker gears up to open its Shanghai plant.

Headlines: Regulators want revised Boeing 737 MAX software documentation: company
Description: U.S. and European regulators have asked Boeing Co to revise documentation on its proposed 737 MAX software fix, the planemaker confirmed Wednesday, further complicating its efforts to return the jet to service by year-end.

Headlines: Xerox in $33 billion bid for HP: sources
Description: U.S. printer maker Xerox Holdings Corp has made a roughly $33 billion cash-and-stock offer for personal computer maker HP Inc, a company more than three times its size, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: How the SEC is making life easier for corporate America
Description: Under the Trump administration, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has taken more than two dozen measures - including trimming rules - that make life easier for corporate America, according to a Reuters analysis of SEC announcements and interviews with more than a dozen lawyers, academics and advocacy groups.

Headlines: Alphabet expects to complete probe of sexual misconduct claims by next month
Description: The board of Google parent Alphabet Inc expects to complete by next month an investigation into the company's handling of sexual harassment and other misconduct complaints against current and former executives, according to a filing in state court last month.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers seek to ban federal pension fund from investing in China
Description: A group of U.S. lawmakers introduced legislation on Wednesday that would block a federal retirement fund from investing in Chinese stocks.

Headlines: Blackstone CEO is optimistic U.S., China will agree trade deal
Description: Private equity firm Blackstone Group Inc Chief Executive Stephen Schwarzman said on Wednesday he was optimistic that the United States and China would resolve their 16-month-long trade war, helping to ease tensions between two of the world's biggest economies.

Headlines: Fitbit reports a 12% fall in revenue
Description: Wearable device maker Fitbit Inc reported its first drop in revenue in five quarters on Wednesday as it faced intense competition from deeper-pocket companies such as Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd , underscoring challenges for buyer Alphabet Inc's Google.

Headlines: Risk rally pauses on U.S. data, trade talk caution
Description: The dollar slid and the three-day global stock market rally paused on Wednesday as U.S. productivity data disappointed and investors turned a bit cautious about U.S.-China trade talks.

Headlines: Wall St. ends near flat; healthcare shares gain but trade deal delay weighs
Description: U.S. stocks ended little changed on Wednesday as a report the U.S.-China trade deal could be delayed until December was offset by gains in healthcare shares.

Headlines: Italian PM says ArcelorMittal wants mass layoffs, govt rejects demand
Description: Steel giant ArcelorMittal wants to cut 5,000 jobs in Italy because of low production levels at its Taranto plant, Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said on Wednesday, denouncing the plan as "unacceptable".

Headlines: Roku quarterly net loss widens, shares plunge
Description: U.S. video streaming service Roku Inc reported a wider net loss in the third quarter on Wednesday, as it spent more to attract subscribers to its video streaming platform.

Headlines: Lufthansa ready for arbitration as cabin crew strike begins
Description: Lufthansa is ready to go into arbitration to resolve a long-running staff dispute, the CEO of Germany's largest airline said on Thursday, as a walkout by flight attendants disrupted travel plans of tens of thousands of passengers.

Headlines: Gap CEO exiting as forecast cut casts doubt on turnaround
Description: Gap Inc said on Thursday Chief Executive Officer Art Peck will leave the company, a surprise exit in the middle of a restructuring that comes as the apparel retailer slashed its full-year earnings forecast, sending its shares down 7%.

Headlines: U.S. may soon issue guidance to enforce foreign investment oversight
Description: The U.S. government is likely soon to spell out how it will enforce oversight of foreign investment in the United States, a U.S. official said on Thursday, after a law last year expanded the agency's authority to crack down on harmful Chinese investment.

Headlines: Rollback of China tariffs faces fierce opposition in White House
Description: An agreement between the United States and China to roll back existing tariffs as part of a "phase one" trade deal faces fierce internal opposition in the White House and from outside advisers, multiple sources familiar with the talks said.

Headlines: How the SEC is making life easier for corporate America
Description: Under the Trump administration, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has taken more than two dozen measures - including trimming rules - that make life easier for corporate America, according to a Reuters analysis of SEC announcements and interviews with more than a dozen lawyers, academics and advocacy groups.

Headlines: Stocks, dollar rally on U.S.-China trade deal hopes
Description: Oil prices rose and stocks rallied worldwide on Thursday after China said it had agreed with the United States to cancel tariffs in phases, a key consideration in reaching a deal to end a trade war that has crimped economic growth and roiled markets.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump administration moves closer to easing gun exports
Description: The Trump administration has passed a key milestone in a long-delayed rule change that would make it easier to sell U.S. firearms outside the United States, including assault rifles and ammunition, people briefed on the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Oil rises above $62/bbl on hopes for U.S.-China trade deal
Description: Oil rose above $62 a barrel on Thursday after China hinted at progress towards a trade deal with the United States, raising hopes for an end to a long dispute that has weighed on economic growth and demand for fuel.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sears says it has secured a $250 million lifeline, will close 96 stores
Description: Sears told Reuters on Thursday it had won a $250 million lifeline from lenders that include billionaire owner Eddie Lampert, and will close additional stores, as mounting losses strain the beleaguered U.S. department store chain's finances.

Headlines: Teva Pharm says opioid settlement will not derail ability to cut debt
Description: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd on Thursday expressed confidence in its ability to continue paying down its huge debt burden even if it is forced to pay billions of dollars to settle thousands of U.S. opioid lawsuits.

Headlines: Port of Los Angeles import and export volumes drop in October
Description: The Port of Los Angeles, the nation's busiest for ocean trade with China, processed fewer containers of imported and exported goods in October as the U.S.-China trade war roils the domestic economy and global supply chains.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce Dept finds Chinese exporters dumped ceramic tile
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Thursday it made a preliminary determination that Chinese exporters had dumped ceramic tile in the U.S. market at less than fair value.

Headlines: Volkswagen's Shanghai EV plant with SAIC has started trial production: VW CEO
Description: Trial production has started at Volkswagen AG's (VW) and SAIC Motor Corp Ltd's $2.5 billion electric vehicle (EV) factory in Shanghai, VW's chief executive said on Friday, the latest development in the race to sell EVs in China.

Headlines: Indonesia's Lion Air finds cracks in two 737 NGs with fewer flights than FAA safety directive
Description: Lion Air has found structural cracks in two Boeing Co 737 NG planes with fewer flights than a U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) threshold for checks, Indonesia's aviation safety regulator said on Friday.
