Headlines: Democratic lawmakers question FAA decisions on Boeing safety issues
Description: Two Democratic U.S. lawmakers said on Thursday the Federal Aviation Administration overruled agency technical specialists on two Boeing Co safety issues involving the 737 MAX and the 787 Dreamliner jets that they said could be "potentially catastrophic."

Headlines: Uber faces costly choices after expert finds it uses Waymo self-driving tech
Description: Uber said it "will likely" have to strike a licensing deal with Waymo or opt for costly changes to its autonomous driving software, after an expert found the ride-hailing giant still used technology from the Alphabet Inc unit.

Headlines: T-Mobile in talks with Sprint on merger, does not rule out lower price
Description: T-Mobile US Chief Executive John Legere on Thursday acknowledged talks are ongoing with Sprint Corp to extend their merger agreement, but he declined to rule out requesting the $26 billion price be reduced.

Headlines: Trump nominates former Ford executive to be new U.S. energy secretary
Description: The U.S. Department of Energy said on Thursday that President Donald Trump had formally nominated Deputy Energy Secretary Dan Brouillette, a former vice president of Ford Motor Co and Louisiana state energy regulator, to head the department.

Headlines: U.S. 'very, very optimistic' about reaching a trade deal with China: White House
Description: The United States is "very, very optimistic" about reaching a trade deal with China soon, White House spokeswoman Stephanie Grisham told Fox News Channel in an interview on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street investors slam Warren's policies
Description: Some Wall Street investors and Democratic donors sharply criticized progressive firebrand Elizabeth Warren's policies on issues from taxation to affordable healthcare because they are impractical.

Headlines: Exclusive: Beyond Meat eyes production in Asia before the end of 2020
Description: Beyond Meat Inc aims to start production in Asia before the end of next year, as it gets closer to selling its popular plant-based meat products in China, Executive Chairman Seth Goldman told Reuters.

Headlines: EU's Vestager says Google's antitrust proposal not helping shopping rivals
Description: Alphabet unit Google's proposal to create a level playing field for price comparison shopping rivals to stave off fresh fines has not led to more traffic for its competitors, Europe's antitrust chief said on Thursday.

Headlines: Tiffany asks LVMH to raise its $14.5 billion offer: sources
Description: Tiffany & Co has asked Bulgari owner LVMH to raise its $14.5 billion acquisition offer, arguing that it significantly undervalues the U.S. jewelry chain, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facing shorter holiday season, U.S. retailers rev up faster delivery, early deals
Description: U.S. retailers are rushing in with faster-than-ever delivery deals and earlier Christmas promotions in hopes of easing the impact of this year's shorter holiday selling season, a period that can be make-or-break for retailers.

Headlines: JD.com's Liu resigns from China parliament advisory body: state tv
Description: Richard Liu, the founder and chief executive of Chinese e-commerce company JD.com , has resigned from the advisory body to China's parliament for "personal reasons", state broadcaster CCTV reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Ford may consider making branded pickups in China if cities open more
Description: Ford Motor Co will consider building Ford-branded pickup trucks in China if restrictions on driving pickups in cities are relaxed and it could also roll out customized models at that time, a senior company official said.

Headlines: Dish beats profit estimates on higher pay-TV subscriber addition
Description: Dish Network Corp posted a better-than-expected quarterly profit on Thursday, as the U.S. satellite TV service provider surprised Wall Street by adding more payTV subscribers.

Headlines: China considers removal of U.S. poultry import restrictions: Xinhua
Description: China is considering the removal of restrictions on poultry imports from the United States, state-owned Xinhua News Agency reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Toyota announces $1.8 billion share buyback after strong second-quarter
Description: Toyota Motor Corp plans a $1.8 billion share buyback, Japan's biggest automaker said on Thursday, after beating quarterly forecasts on higher global vehicle sales and an improved performance in North America.

Headlines: LafargeHolcim says takes note of French court decision on Syria
Description: LafargeHolcim has taken note of a French appeal court decision to drop the charge of complicity in crimes against humanity brought against Lafarge SA over its operations in Syria, the Swiss cement maker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Power struggle escalates at German railways: sources
Description: A power struggle has escalated at Germany's Deutsche Bahn [DBN.UL], with the position of finance chief Alexander Doll at risk, company sources said ahead of a special meeting of the supervisory board of the railway company on Thursday.

Headlines: Remain more likely than no-deal Brexit - Aviva's Fitzgerald
Description: There is more than a one-in-five chance that Britain remains in the European Union and there's a greater likelihood of that outcome than a no-deal Brexit, said Peter Fitzgerald, head of multi-asset management at Aviva Investors.

Headlines: Drake signs up for Toronto marijuana venture
Description: The biggest of Canada's new brand of marijuana producers will join forces with Toronto-born rap star Drake to launch a fully-licenced joint venture in the city to produce and distribute cannabis, the two sides said on Thursday.

Headlines: Alibaba, Russian Post launch China-Russia flights to cut delivery times
Description: Alibaba Group's logistics operator and Russia's Pochta postal service have launched their first direct China-Russia cargo flights to deliver AliExpress goods purchased online by Russians, AliExpress Russia said on Thursday.

Headlines: Delayed U.S. soybean cargo booked under waiver offloads, worries linger
Description: A cargo of American soybeans booked in the hope it would be exempt from tariffs has been offloaded in China after about a one-week delay due to a dispute between the buyer and customs officials over duty payments, said two sources briefed on the matter.

Headlines: EU's Vestager says Apple Pay has prompted many concerns
Description: Apple Pay has attracted regulatory scrutiny as a result of several expressions of concern about the U.S. tech giant's mobile payment service, Europe's antitrust chief said on Thursday.

Headlines: Brazil will reevaluate signing bonuses, other parameters of offshore auctions
Description: The Brazilian government will reevaluate the terms of pre-salt auctions, including the signing bonuses and profit oil required from bidders, Brazil's mines and energy minister said on Thursday, after a round that was widely seen as disappointing.

Headlines: Ralph Lauren profit gets boost from Chinese demand; shares rise 14%
Description: Strong demand for Ralph Lauren Corp's Polo shirts and tweed jackets in China helped the high-end apparel retailer beat quarterly profit estimates on Thursday, sending its shares up nearly 14%.

Headlines: General Dynamics wins $732 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: General Dynamics Corp has been awarded a $732 million U.S. defense contract for sustainment of the Mobile User Objective System ground system, a narrowband military satellite communications system, the Pentagon said on Friday.

Headlines: Gap commits to Old Navy split; CEO exit won't impact holiday shopping season
Description: Gap Inc said on Friday it was sticking with plans to spin off its Old Navy brand into a separate company, as Wall Street analysts questioned its commitment to the project following the surprise exit of Chief Executive Officer Art Peck.

Headlines: White House optimistic on prospects for China trade deal, official tells CNBC
Description: The White House is "very optimistic" it will reach a so-called phase one trade pact with China before the end of the year, a senior administration official said on Friday, adding that a deal would likely be struck before more tariffs take effect in mid-December.

Headlines: S&P 500 posts fifth week of gains as Wall St. hits records
Description: The three major U.S. stock indexes posted record closing highs and the S&P 500 registered a fifth straight week of gains on Friday as investors brushed aside worries over the progress of U.S.-China trade talks and as Walt Disney shares rose.

Headlines: U.S. CFTC orders Wells Fargo to pay $14 million over unfair foreign exchange trade
Description: The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission ordered Wells Fargo & Co to pay more than $14 million to settle charges it provided "misinformation" when conducting a large foreign exchange trade with a counterparty, the agency said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Japanese companies likely to spurn Saudi Aramco IPO: JXTG president
Description: Japanese companies are unlikely to invest in Saudi Aramco's blockbuster initial public offering (IPO) because it is difficult to evaluate the value of the world's biggest oil company, the head of Japan's largest refiner said on Friday.

Headlines: Arkansas joins states backing T-Mobile's deal to buy Sprint
Description: Arkansas has decided to back the U.S> Justice Department's decision to approve a merger of T-Mobile US and Sprint, the third and fourth largest U.S. wireless carriers.

Headlines: Gap CEO exiting as forecast cut casts doubt on turnaround
Description: Gap Inc said on Thursday Chief Executive Officer Art Peck will leave the company, a surprise exit in the middle of a restructuring that comes as the apparel retailer slashed its full-year earnings forecast, sending its shares down 7%.

Headlines: Exclusive: Boon for Hong Kong as Alibaba plans $15 billion listing in late November - sources
Description: Chinese retail titan Alibaba plans to list in Hong Kong in the final week of November, two people with direct knowledge said, aiming to raise up to $15 billion in a deal that signals a vote of confidence in the Asian financial hub.

Headlines: Wall Street Weekahead: Small-cap shares poised to benefit from shift to value
Description: Beleaguered shares of small U.S. companies are set for a bump in performance as value stocks have risen, market analysts say, but small caps could quickly fade again with an economic setback.

Headlines: China's auto industry discusses ways to boost rural car sales: sources
Description: China's auto industry executives met with government officials over the weekend to discuss ways to promote higher car sales in rural areas, sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq slip on trade uncertainty; Boeing buoys Dow
Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq stock indexes fell from record highs on Monday as uncertainty about progress in U.S.-China trade talks again rose to the fore following comments by President Donald Trump, while a jump in Boeing shares helped the Dow Jones Industrial Average eke out a slim gain.

Headlines: Helping veterans develop business skills as entrepreneurs
Description: NEW YORK - Every year, about 250,000 U.S. military members leave the service and enter the workforce, and one in five tries to start their own business.

Headlines: Brazil's Petrobras delists shares on Argentina stock market
Description: Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA has completed the process of delisting its shares on the Argentine stock market, it said in a securities filing on Monday.

Headlines: Airbnb, Chobani among companies to oppose U.S. asylum work permit slowdown
Description: Airbnb, Chobani, Western Union and a dozen other companies are urging the withdrawal of a Trump administration proposal to slow down the work permit approval process for asylum seekers.

Headlines: WeWork begins search for a new CEO: sources
Description: WeWork has started a search for a new chief executive following the departure of co-founder Adam Neumann, people familiar with the matter said on Monday, as the U.S. office-sharing start-up seeks to reverse its widening losses.

Headlines: Trump expected to delay European auto tariff decision: EU officials
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to announce this week he is delaying a decision on whether to slap tariffs on cars and auto parts imported from the European Union, likely for another six months, EU officials said.

Headlines: China's NEV market may contract this year due to subsidy cut: industry association
Description: Fewer new energy vehicles (NEV) could be sold in China this year than in 2018, an official at the country's biggest auto industry association said on Monday, as customers hold back on purchases following a government decision to cut subsidies.

Headlines: China October new bank loans dip to 22-month low, more easing expected
Description: New bank loans in China fell more than expected to the lowest in 22 months in October, but the drop was likely due to seasonal factors and policymakers are still expected to ramp up support for the cooling economy in coming months.

Headlines: On Singles' Day, green groups warn of China's surge in packaging waste
Description: Accumulated waste from China's e-commerce and express delivery sectors stands to more than quadruple by 2025 unless action is taken to rein it in, green groups said on Monday, as an online shopping spree known as Singles' Day broke new sales records.

Headlines: Southwest will speed up inspections of 38 used 737 airplanes after FAA concerns
Description: Southwest Airlines Co said Monday it will complete inspections on 38 737 airplanes it acquired from foreign air carriers by Jan. 31 that may not meet all U.S. aviation safety requirements.

Headlines: UK building sector hit by surge in insurance costs after Grenfell fire
Description: Two years after a fire killed 71 people at London's Grenfell Tower, insurance premiums for building contractors, architects and surveyors have surged by as much as several hundred percent, risking future projects, industry sources say. Combustible materials used to refurbish Grenfell were central to the chain of events in June 2017 that turned an ordinary kitchen fire into an inferno, an official inquiry said last month.

Headlines: China's Jingye enters sale contract with British Steel
Description: China's Jingye Steel has entered into a "sales contract" to buy the assets of British Steel but the deal has not been finalised, British officials said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump to meet with vaping industry as he mulls tighter regulation
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he will be meeting with vaping industry representatives as his administration considers tightening e-cigarette regulations amid a nationwide outbreak of vaping-related injuries and deaths.

Headlines: SunPower to spin off solar panel manufacturing, shares rise
Description: U.S. solar company SunPower said on Monday it will split into two publicly traded companies, separating most of its solar panel manufacturing operations from storage and energy services, sending its shares up as much as 15%.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sudan needs up to $5 billion in budget support to prevent collapse
Description: Sudan needs up to $5 billion in budget support to avert economic collapse and launch reforms after the ouster of veteran ruler Omar al-Bashir, its finance minister told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: China's love of e-commerce powers Alibaba's Singles' Day
Description: China's dominant e-commerce firm Alibaba Group Holding raked in $23 billion worth of sales in the first nine hours of its annual Singles' Day shopping extravaganza on Monday, setting records as the event celebrates its 11th year.

Headlines: China's Jingye Group agrees outline deal to rescue British Steel
Description: China's Jingye Group said on Monday it has reached a provisional deal to buy British Steel and promised to invest 1.2 billion pounds ($1.5 billion) over the next decade and save thousands of jobs.

Headlines: Maersk's head of operations Soren Toft steps down
Description: Denmark's Maersk said on Monday its Chief Operating Officer Soren Toft has decided to leave the company after two years at management level at the shipping group.

Headlines: Boeing says 737 MAX should resume commercial flights in January; shares jump
Description: Boeing Co on Monday said it expected U.S. regulators to approve the return to commercial service of its grounded 737 MAX jet in the coming weeks, and its shares jumped as investors grew more hopeful the planemaker had addressed software problems at the heart of two fatal crashes.

Headlines: Chinese national pleads guilty in U.S. court to stealing Phillips 66 trade secrets
Description: A Chinese national pleaded guilty on Tuesday to stealing trade secrets from U.S. petroleum company Phillips 66 , where he worked on the research and development of next generation battery technologies, the U.S. Justice Department said.

Headlines: Boeing pilot who exchanged leaked 737 MAX simulator messages changes jobs-sources
Description: One of two Boeing Co technical pilots who described flaws in a crucial flight control system in leaked 2016 instant messages has been transferred to a new job at the U.S. planemaker, two people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Some U.S. airlines willing to take 737 MAX jets before pilot training approval: sources
Description: Some U.S. airlines are willing to pick up their 737 MAX jets from Boeing Co as soon as December if the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) approves delivery of the grounded planes before new pilot training is agreed, three people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Trump bashes Europe for 'terrible' trade barriers
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday renewed his criticism of European Union's trade policies, saying it has "terrible" barriers that are unfair to U.S. producers.

Headlines: D.R. Horton sees 2020 home sales above estimates, shares rise
Description: D.R. Horton Inc topped expectations for quarterly profit and forecast 2020 home sales above analysts' estimates, as cheaper mortgage rates buoyed demand from buyers, sending shares in the biggest U.S. homebuilder up as much as 6%.

Headlines: Trump, Apple CEO Tim Cook to tour Apple operations in Texas: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Apple CEO Tim Cook are expected to tour facilities in Texas where Apple products are made as soon as next week to showcase companies that keep jobs in America, according to two people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Explainer: What a roll-back of Trump tariffs on Chinese goods may look like
Description: The latest bargaining chip in U.S.-China negotiations to cool a 16-month-old trade war is whether President Donald Trump would roll back tariffs on hundreds of billions of dollars' worth of Chinese imports, and how soon.

Headlines: Huawei to give staff $286 million bonus for helping it ride out U.S. curbs
Description: Chinese telecoms giant Huawei Technologies said on Tuesday it will hand out 2 billion yuan ($286 million) in cash rewards to staff working to help it weather a U.S. trade blacklisting.

Headlines: Factbox: Sensor specialist AMS closes in on lighting group Osram
Description: German lighting group Osram has urged its shareholders to back a $5 billion takeover bid from Austria's AMS after a previous offer at the same price failed last month to win enough backing to proceed.

Headlines: Osram backs AMS takeover as auto downturn triggers 2019 loss
Description: Osram urged shareholders to back a $5 billion takeover bid from Austria's AMS and said it would cut costs and not pay a dividend as it posted a loss for the fiscal year ending in September, hit by a downturn in the auto industry.

Headlines: Facebook unites payment service across apps with Facebook Pay
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it was launching Facebook Pay, a unified payment service through which users across its platforms including WhatsApp and Instagram can make payments without exiting the app.

Headlines: No tariff adjustments until deal made, Kudlow says: CNBC
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Tuesday there will be no tariff adjustments until trade deal with China is made.

Headlines: Fed's election year challenge: Is slowing U.S. job growth a 'material' change?
Description: Having guided interest rates lower this year and declared a stopping point, Federal Reserve officials face a potentially volatile election year problem if U.S. job growth slows in coming months as many expect it will.

Headlines: Give me some of that: Trump renews call for negative U.S. interest rates
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday renewed his criticism of the Federal Reserve's raising and then cutting of interest rates, saying the central bank had put the United States at a competitive disadvantage with other countries and calling for negative interest rates.

Headlines: Boeing orders sink as customers opt to swap MAX
Description: Boeing Co took 10 new plane orders last month, but saw some customers swapping the U.S. planemaker's grounded 737 MAX planes in favor of more expensive wide-body planes as doubts lingered about the MAX's return to service.

Headlines: U.S. auto showrooms need more electric cars, environmental group says
Description: Environmental group the Sierra Club on Tuesday urged automakers and dealerships to help cut U.S. carbon emissions and fight the climate crisis by making more electric vehicle available in U.S. showrooms.

Headlines: Alibaba opens bookbuild for Hong Kong listing: sources
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group has opened the trading books for its $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing, two sources with direct knowledge of the process told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Russia to cut share of U.S. dollar in National Wealth Fund, mulls other currencies
Description: Russia will reduce the share of the U.S. dollar in its National Wealth Fund and is considering investing in other foreign currencies including the Chinese yuan, Deputy Finance Minister Vladimir Kolychev said on Wednesday.

Headlines: German auto lobby to pick utility manager Hildegard Mueller as president: report
Description: The German carmakers lobby VDA is set to appoint conservative politician and former Innogy board member Hildegard Mueller as president, Berlin daily newspaper Der Tagesspiegel reported on Wednesday, citing sources.

Headlines: Fed's Powell takes old-school view on U.S. borrowing capacity
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell likes to avoid any hint of politics in his public statements, but in a seemingly non-controversial response to a question about U.S. government borrowing on Wednesday, he weighed in on one of the core issues in the political debate over how to manage the economy.

Headlines: Trade talks between U.S. and China 'hit a snag' over farm purchases: WSJ
Description: U.S.-China trade negotiations have 'hit a snag' over farm purchases, with China not wanting a deal that looks one-sided in the favor of the United States, the Wall Street Journal reported https://on.wsj.com/2CEYDR7 on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: One day ahead of deadline, Trump says he'll decide on auto tariffs 'soon'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he would make a decision soon on whether to impose tariffs on cars and auto parts imported into the United States but gave no other details.

Headlines: Google Pay to offer checking accounts through Citi, Stanford Federal
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it will offer personal checking accounts next year through its Google Pay app, initially in partnership with Citigroup Inc and a small credit union at Stanford University.

Headlines: Germany welcomes Tesla's Berlin move as boost to e-car shift
Description: The German government on Wednesday welcomed Tesla's decision to set up shop in Berlin, a move it believes will turbo-charge the country's shift into the electric car era even as costs of running a business in Europe's largest economy remain high.

Headlines: German military refuses to take delivery of two Airbus A400M planes
Description: Germany's air force said on Wednesday it had decided not to accept delivery of two Airbus A400M planes, citing recurring technical problems with the military transporters.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices increase more than expected in October
Description: U.S. consumer prices rebounded more than expected in October and underlying inflation picked up, which together with abating trade tensions and fears of a recession, support the Federal Reserve's signal for no further interest rate cuts in the near term.

Headlines: Alibaba launches $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing to fund expansion
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group launched the share sale for its Hong Kong listing on Wednesday, braving unrest in the global financial hub to try to raise up to $13.4 billion to fund its expansion plans.

Headlines: London forex trader accuses Citigroup of unfair dismissal
Description: A former top Citigroup trader, who was fired in 2014 but acquitted of foreign exchange-rigging charges after a trial in New York, told a London employment tribunal he was unfairly dismissed despite being in the "eye of the storm" at the time.

Headlines: Airbus says A400M technical issues not safety critical
Description: Airbus said on Wednesday that technical issues in its A400M planes that had prompted Germany to refuse delivery of two of the aircraft were not safety critical.

Headlines: U.S. inflation firms on rising healthcare, energy costs
Description: U.S. consumer prices jumped by the most in seven months in October, which together with abating fears of a recession, support the Federal Reserve's signal for no further interest rate cuts in the near term.

Headlines: United Auto Workers union unveils ethics reforms after U.S. corruption probe
Description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) on Wednesday announced a series of ethics reforms in answer to a spreading U.S. federal corruption probe that has resulted in charges or convictions for a number of former leaders of the union.

Headlines: Trump threat of more China tariffs could hit consumer goods before Christmas
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to jack up U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods if the world's two largest economies fail to reach a trade deal could raise the price of cellphones, laptops, and toys less than two weeks before Christmas.

Headlines: Biotech-for-hire PeptiDream charts new path and becomes short target
Description: The promise of PeptiDream Inc's drug-discovery technology and its lucrative research-for-hire contracts have made it a darling of the Tokyo stock market. Now, those gains have made it a target for short-seller Muddy Waters.

Headlines: Hyundai to make Santa Cruz pickups at Alabama plant in $410 million expansion
Description: South Korean automaker Hyundai Motor will start making its Santa Cruz pickup trucks at its U.S. factory in 2021, with an investment of $410 million, as it seeks a foothold in the popular, but highly competitive, segment led by U.S. rivals.

Headlines: Uber launches new safety features in UK as it fights for new license
Description: Uber launched a set of new safety features in Britain on Thursday as it battles to retain its taxi operating license in the face of concerns about passenger safety.

Headlines: Shares, bond yields slip on sour trade deal sentiment
Description: Global equity markets and government bond yields fell on Wednesday on growing doubts that a U.S.-China trade deal can be reached soon and fears that unrest in Hong Kong may lead to a Chinese crackdown.

Headlines: U.S. charges two former Herbalife executives in China over bribery scheme: source
Description: U.S. prosecutors criminally charged two former executives of Herbalife Nutrition Ltd's Chinese unit with running a decade-long scheme to bribe Chinese government officials to win business and evade regulatory scrutiny, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: ProSieben says merger with Mediaset wouldn't work
Description: German broadcaster ProSiebenSat.1 is more interested in collaborating in digital growth areas than in a full-blown merger, Chief Executive Max Conze said on Thursday after Italy's Mediaset raised its shareholding.

Headlines: Walmart posts strong results ahead of holidays, earns praise from Trump
Description: Walmart Inc raised its annual outlook on Thursday as a robust economy boosted purchases at its stores and website and the retailer picked up market share in food and other groceries, earning praise from U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard: 'More normal' yield curve bullish sign for 2020
Description: The way U.S. bond markets responded to recent Federal Reserve interest rate cuts could be "bullish" for the economy, St. Louis Federal Reserve President James Bullard said on Thursday, adding he was ready to keep rates on hold and see how it plays out.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says strong consumer will help the U.S. economy avoid recession in 2020
Description: Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said he does not expect the U.S. economy to enter a recession next year, and he was optimistic that the strong consumer can help the U.S. economy overcome potential headwinds.

Headlines: City and union officials to consult on Philadelphia refinery sale process: U.S. court
Description: A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Thursday approved a process for the sale of the Philadelphia Energy Solutions oil refinery, the largest and oldest on East Coast, under which city officials and a trade union will consult on the matter.

Headlines: Stocks, yields slip as investor sentiment wavers
Description: World stocks edged lower and debt yields fell on Thursday as Chinese economic data slowed in October and Germany narrowly avoided a recession in the third quarter, adding to concerns about the U.S.-China trade war's impact on global growth.

Headlines: Strong healthcare costs help to lift U.S. producer inflation
Description: U.S. producer prices increased by the most in six months in October, lifted by gains in the costs of goods and services, further bolstering the Federal Reserve's stance that it will probably not cut interest rates again in the near term.

Headlines: Google antitrust probe to expand into Android: CNBC
Description: The several dozen attorneys general investigating advertising practices at Alphabet Inc's Google are planning to expand their antitrust probe into the unit's flagship Android business, CNBC reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: WeWork bond drops, spread hits a record on report of delayed share tender
Description: WeWork's junk bond price dropped and its risk premium shot to a record high on Thursday following a report that its main backer still hasn't delivered on a plan to buy $3 billion of stock from existing shareholders.

Headlines: Oil edges lower on U.S. crude stockpiles, record production
Description: Oil prices eased on Thursday as U.S. crude futures were pressured by a build in domestic inventories and record production, but losses were limited by forecasts from the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries for a lower-than-expected oil surplus.

Headlines: Boeing received 'unnecessary' contract boost for astronaut capsule, watchdog says
Description: Boeing's multibillion dollar contract to build U.S. astronaut capsules received an "unnecessary" extension from NASA, a watchdog report said on Thursday, the latest management blunders in the agency's program to restart domestic human spaceflight.

Headlines: Spain's former BBVA chairman 'FG' placed under investigation: source
Description: Spain's High Court on Thursday placed the former chairman of BBVA , Francisco Gonzalez, under investigation as part of a probe into an alleged spying case, a source with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: One of China's richest men named in Hikvision securities probe
Description: China's securities regulator is investigating one of the country's richest men for alleged violation of disclosure rules as a director of U.S.-blacklisted surveillance camera giant Hikvision , the company said.

Headlines: Cramer: Ideological divides could make the US-China trade war 'go on for years'
Description: "If I were the Chinese, I would rather deal with Trump now, than Trump or Warren later," the "Mad Money" host says.

Headlines: Wells Fargo former interim CEO Parker steps down as general counsel
Description: Wells Fargo & Co said on Thursday general counsel Allen Parker, who briefly served as interim chief executive of the scandal-hit U.S bank, will step down next year.

Headlines: German automation talent powers Musk's battery move to Europe
Description: To unclog bottlenecks last year at his Tesla Inc plant in California, Elon Musk flew in six planeloads of new robots and equipment from Germany to speed up battery production for its Model 3.

Headlines: Reuters poll: Trade truce unlikely in 2020 but U.S. recession fears recede - economists
Description: The U.S.-China trade war is unlikely to see a permanent truce over the coming year, and while concerns have eased over a U.S. recession, an economic rebound is also not expected any time soon, according to a Reuters poll of economists.

Headlines: Factbox: Dollar domination - why global markets depend on the U.S. currency
Description: From the dominant reserve currency for central banks to the main conduit for global trade and borrowing, U.S. dollars are the lifeblood for banks and markets around the world.

Headlines: China says holding 'in-depth' talks with U.S. on interim trade deal
Description: China and the United States are holding "in-depth" discussions on a first phase trade agreement, and cancelling tariffs is an important condition to reaching a deal, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Singapore fines UBS $8 million over deceptive bond trades
Description: Singapore said on Thursday it had fined UBS S$11.2 million ($8 million) after investigations showed the Swiss bank deceived wealthy clients over prices for bonds and structured products.

Headlines: Burberry aims to woo more customers in China with Tencent tie-up
Description: British luxury brand Burberry on Thursday said it has joined forces with China's Tencent for a new digital marketing and sales push to tap the nation's increasingly social media savvy shoppers in a critical luxury market.

Headlines: Britain's Asda blames Brexit uncertainty for sales dip
Description: Asda, the British supermarket arm of the world's biggest retailer Walmart , blamed lower sales in its latest quarter on Brexit uncertainty, saying it had negatively affected consumers' spending patterns.

Headlines: Timeline: Amazon challenges Pentagon awarding $10 billion cloud deal to Microsoft
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it is contesting the Pentagon's award of an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal to Microsoft Corp , expressing concern that politics got in the way of a fair contracting process.

Headlines: Alibaba gets strong demand for $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing: sources
Description: Alibaba's order books for its $13.4 billion Hong Kong share sale have already been covered "multiple times," sources with direct knowledge of the matter said on Friday, as the ecommerce group kicked off its campaign for the secondary listing in the city gripped by protests.

Headlines: U.S. companies say consumer still strong even as broader outlook dims
Description: Walmart became the latest company to point to a strong U.S. consumer, adding to a raft of firms in recent weeks citing healthy demand at a time when spending is seen as an increasingly key support for the economy.

Headlines: Citi names Manuel Romo CEO of Mexican unit
Description: Manuel Romo has been appointed chief executive officer of Citigroup's Mexican operations Citibanamex with immediate effect, the Mexican unit said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: United joins U.S. peers in pulling 737 MAX until early March
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc said on Friday it is extending cancellations of Boeing 737 MAX flights until March 4, joining U.S. peers who are also scheduling without the aircraft until early March as the jet awaits approval to fly again.

Headlines: China's JD.com beats quarterly revenue estimates, shares rise
Description: China's JD.com Inc beat analysts' estimates for quarterly revenue on Friday, boosted by stronger sales in its core e-commerce business, sending its shares up nearly 7% before the bell.

Headlines: Qantas completes 'double sunrise' test flight from London to Sydney, aircraft order could follow
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd could place an order for planes capable of ultra long-haul flights early next year, the airline's chief executive said after he completed a 19 hour, 19 minute non-stop test flight from London to Sydney on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. and China 'getting close' to trade deal: White House economic adviser
Description: The United States and China are getting close to a trade agreement, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Thursday, citing what he called very constructive talks with Beijing about ending a 16-month trade war.

Headlines: Siberian taxi firm bringing fare-haggling to Moscow plans expansion
Description: A Siberian ride-hailing firm that allows customers to haggle over their fares is investing to beef up its presence in Moscow, a market dominated by New York-listed internet giant Yandex and Uber , its founder said.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales rise modestly; factory output tumbles
Description: U.S. retail sales rebounded moderately in October although consumers did cut back on purchases of big-ticket household items like furniture and discretionary spending, which could temper expectations for a strong holiday shopping season.

Headlines: Hong Kong's cash pool tightens as Alibaba primes for $13 billion listing
Description: Alibaba Group's $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing is shrinking cash levels in the protest-wracked financial hub, with short-term borrowing costs shooting back towards a decade-high marked in July.

Headlines: Explainer: Why is Alibaba listing in Hong Kong?
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is set to price its first share sale in Hong Kong next week, raising up to $13.4 billion in what will be the largest deal in the city since 2010 and the world's biggest ever cross-border secondary listing.

Headlines: Automakers around world await Trump tariff decision
Description: Automakers around the world are awaiting a decision from U.S. President Donald Trump on whether he will impose up to 25% tariffs on U.S. car and auto part imports after a 180-day review period elapsed this week.

Headlines: Highlights: Hong Kong paralyzed for fifth day, students guard campuses
Description: Anti-government protesters paralyzed parts of Hong Kong for a fifth day on Friday, forcing schools to close and blocking some main roads, as university students barricaded campuses and authorities struggled to calm the violence.

Headlines: Hong Kong confirms economy fell into recession amid protests, trade war
Description: Hong Kong sank into recession for the first time in a decade in the third quarter, government data confirmed on Friday, weighed down by increasingly violent anti-government protests and the escalating U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Alibaba's $13.4 billion bookbuild covered multiple times: sources
Description: Alibaba's $13.4 billion institutional bookbuild for its Hong Kong listing is already covered "multiple times," according to a message sent to investors and verified by sources with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Oil prices gain 2% despite concerns about rising supplies
Description: Oil futures gained nearly 2% on Friday as comments from a top U.S. official raised optimism for a U.S.-China trade deal, but worries about increasing crude supplies capped prices.

Headlines: Ford's UAW members vote to ratify new four-year contract
Description: The United Auto Workers union said on Friday that rank-and-file members at Ford Motor Co have voted in favor of a new four-year labor contract with the No. 2 U.S. automaker.

Headlines: Microsoft to probe work of Israeli facial recognition startup it funded
Description: Microsoft Corp has hired former U.S. Attorney General Eric Holder to investigate whether the use of facial recognition technology developed by an Israeli startup it funded complies with its ethics principles, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Bristol-Myers Squibb wins antitrust approval to buy Celgene, but must divest psoriasis drug
Description: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co and Celgene Corp have won U.S. antitrust approval for their merger on condition that they sell Celgene's psoriasis drug Otezla, the Federal Trade Commission said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. regulator rethinking changes to whistleblower program after backlash - sources
Description: The U.S. securities regulator is rethinking a proposal that could weaken a landmark whistleblower program after a pushback from whistleblower lawyers and advocates, people with knowledge of the deliberations told Reuters.

Headlines: Amazon challenges Pentagon's $10-billion cloud award to Microsoft
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Thursday said it is contesting the Pentagon's award of an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal to Microsoft Corp , expressing concern that politics got in the way of a fair contracting process.

Headlines: Trump, Apple CEO Tim Cook set to tour computer plant in Texas Wednesday: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Apple CEO Tim Cook are set to visit facilities in Texas on Wednesday where Apple's high-end computers are assembled, sources briefed on the matter confirmed Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street Weekahead: Sagging consumer discretionary shares look for a spark
Description: The strength of the U.S. consumer has been often cited as a pillar of the economy and one of the reasons the S&P 500 has recently scaled new heights, but consumer discretionary stocks have skipped the party for several months.

Headlines: U.S. and China have significant differences ahead of trade talks Friday night
Description: Top U.S. and Chinese negotiators are seeking to narrow differences on an initial trade agreement during a Friday evening phone call, but remain split on key issues.

Headlines: UK's Corbyn: Labour to exclude NHS, medicines from trade deals with U.S.
Description: UK opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said the Labour Party will exclude Britain's National Health Service and medicines from trade deals with the United States, as he accused Prime Minister Boris Johnson of covering up "secret talks" on the NHS.

Headlines: 'Crown jewel' Aramco stirs loyal Saudi demand for giant IPO
Description: From taxi drivers to clerics, Saudis clamoring to own part of state oil giant Aramco went online and to local banks on Sunday at the start of a long-delayed share sale for what could be the world's biggest initial public offering.

Headlines: Made in China: Samsung farms out more phones to fend off rivals
Description: Samsung's plan to outsource a fifth of its smartphone production to China next year may help it compete with low-cost rivals such as Huawei and Xiaomi but it's a strategy fraught with risks, people with familiar with the move said.

Headlines: California to stop buying GM, Toyota and Fiat Chrysler vehicles over emissions fight
Description: California said on Monday it will halt all purchases of new vehicles for state government fleets from GM, Toyota, Fiat Chrysler and other automakers backing U.S. President Donald Trump in a battle to strip the state of authority to regulate tailpipe emissions.

Headlines: With stores burned and looted, Walmart seeks police protection in riot-hit Chile
Description: Walmart has sought court orders for police protection in protest-wracked Chile after more than 120 of its supermarkets were looted or burned.

Headlines: U.S. car safety agency head: NAFTA successor 'big win' for industry
Description: The acting top U.S. auto safety official said on Monday he was confident the U.S. Congress will ratify the trade treaty intended to replace NAFTA, boosting the auto industry and enabling automakers to build safer cars at lower prices.

Headlines: U.S. watchdog backs Bezos' protest over key Pentagon launch program
Description: A U.S. watchdog on Monday backed a protest from Jeff Bezos' space company that challenged the Pentagon's military space launch procurement strategy, showing support for one of the Amazon billionaire's disputes with major agency procurement programs.

Headlines: U.S. Congress seeks answers on patient privacy in Google, Ascension cloud deal
Description: Four Democratic leaders on the U.S. House of Representatives Energy and Commerce committee on Monday wrote Alphabet Inc's Google and Ascension Health demanding briefings by Dec. 6 on how patient data the hospital chain is storing on the cloud is used.

Headlines: Trump says he told Fed's Powell U.S. interest rates are too high
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he complained to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell about high U.S. interest rates in a meeting they held at the White House on Monday morning.

Headlines: Trump, Powell met Monday at White House to discuss economy
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell met at the White House on Monday in their second meeting since Powell started the job in February 2017, and soon became the target of criticism from the president who appointed him.

Headlines: Replacing Pratt engines in IndiGo fleet by end of January a challenge: CEO
Description: Replacing all Pratt & Whitney engines on IndiGo's fleet of almost 100 Airbus planes by Jan. 31, as ordered by India's aviation watchdog, will be challenging but the airline aims to complete the work, its chief executive officer said on Monday.

Headlines: Etihad Airways still has long way to go to become profitable: Group CEO
Description: Abu Dhabi-based Etihad Airways still has a long way to go to become profitable, Group CEO Tony Douglas said on Monday.

Headlines: Fed's Mester: U.S. monetary policy 'in a good spot'
Description: The current level of interest rates is appropriate for the U.S. economy and the Federal Reserve should now pause as it monitors how the economy evolves, Cleveland Fed President Loretta Mester said on Monday.

Headlines: UBS Chief Ermotti wants to stay until 2021: report
Description: UBS's Sergio Ermotti wants to remain as chief executive of Switzerland's biggest bank until 2021, Swiss website Finews reported on Monday, citing unnamed sources.

Headlines: ArcelorMittal willing to re-commit to Ilva steel plant on three conditions: paper
Description: ArcelorMittal is drafting a plan to re-commit to the 2018 deal, under which it bought the troubled Ilva steel plant in southern Italy, on three conditions, Il Messaggero daily reported on Monday.

Headlines: SoftBank to create $30 billion tech giant via Yahoo Japan, Line Corp deal
Description: SoftBank Corp plans to merge internet subsidiary Yahoo Japan with messaging app operator Line Corp to create a $30 billion tech group, as it strives to compete more effectively with local rival Rakuten and U.S. tech powerhouses.

Headlines: Parts with passports: how free trade drives GM's engines
Description: Long before the pistons for General Motors Co V-6 engines reach the U.S. No. 1 automaker's Romulus, Michigan plant, they are seasoned international travelers.

Headlines: HP says open to exploring bid for Xerox
Description: HP Inc said on Sunday it was open to exploring a bid for U.S. printer maker Xerox Corp after rebuffing a $33.5 billion cash-and-stock acquisition offer from the latter as "significantly" undervaluing the personal computer maker.

Headlines: HP down 5% after Xerox bid rejection, counter offer hints
Description: Shares of HP Inc fell as much as 5% on Monday after the personal computer maker rejected a buyout offer from Xerox Holdings Corp , and indicated it might instead make its own offer to take over the U.S. printer maker.

Headlines: Major FirstGroup shareholders call for U.S. asset sale
Description: Two major FirstGroup shareholders on Monday called for the British bus and train operator to sell its U.S. assets as part of a portfolio overhaul which already includes the planned sale of North American intercity bus service Greyhound.

Headlines: Alibaba to close books early in $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing after strong demand: sources
Description: Alibaba will stop taking orders from prospective institutional investors for its $13.4 billion secondary listing in Hong Kong earlier than expected after attracting strong demand, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Global trade umpire: the next casualty of Trump's tariff war?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has upended the global trade order with a slew of tariffs on economic rivals: now, Washington has redoubled its efforts to paralyze the very body designed to settle such disputes.

Headlines: Hong Kong's Best Mart 360 to keep stores open despite attacks
Description: Best Mart 360's chairman said on Monday he would keep every one of the popular Hong Kong snack food chain's stores open, despite them being repeatedly damaged during anti-government protests.

Headlines: Kuwait's Jazeera unhappy with Airbus delays, no plans for aircraft order this week
Description: Kuwait's Jazeera Airways is unhappy with delivery delays of Airbus aircraft and has no plans to place an order at this week's Dubai Airshow, its chief executive said.

Headlines: Air Astana says signs letter of intent for 30 Boeing 737 MAX
Description: Kazakhstan flag carrier Air Astana said on Tuesday it had signed a letter of intent to order 30 Boeing 737 MAX for its recently launched low-cost carrier subsidiary Fly Arystana.

Headlines: Airbnb lobbies local Japan governments to ease curbs for Olympics
Description: Airbnb Inc said on Tuesday it is lobbying local governments in Japan to ease curbs on short-term home rentals during next year's Tokyo Olympics, seeking to counter a thicket of rules imposed last year.

Headlines: Salesforce's Marc Benioff introduces Customer 360 Truth: The 'computer science holy grail'
Description: "Now we're entering the fourth stage of computing. It's the pursuit of [the stage known as] single source of truth, and we've built that into our platform," Marc Benioff tells CNBC's Jim Cramer.

Headlines: Huawei plays down impact of new U.S. license extension
Description: Huawei Technologies has dismissed a new 90-day extension by the Trump administration allowing U.S. firms to continue doing business with the Chinese company as making little difference, repeating that it was being unfairly treated.

Headlines: A year after arrest, Ghosn seeks trial date, access to evidence
Description: A year after his arrest, Nissan ex-Chairman Carlos Ghosn remains stuck in Tokyo under stringent bail conditions and without a trial date as he seeks access to a trove of Nissan emails and other evidence to fight charges of financial misconduct.

Headlines: Fed's Williams: Risks to U.S. economy still to the downside
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve has interest rates at the appropriate level for the U.S. economy but risks to the economic outlook are still tilted downwards, New York Federal Reserve President John Williams said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Lower mortgage rates boost U.S. housing starts, building permits
Description: U.S. homebuilding rebounded in October and permits for future home construction jumped to a more than 12-year high, pointing to strength in the housing market amid lower mortgage rates.

Headlines: Google enters gaming with cloud-based streaming service Stadia
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Tuesday launched Stadia, a cloud-based service that allows users to stream games including "Assassin's Creed Odyssey" and "NBA 2K20" on Chrome web browser.

Headlines: U.S. safety board wants Boeing to redesign part after fatal 737 NG accident
Description: The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board on Tuesday called on Boeing Co to redesign the fan cowl structure on all 737 NG planes and retrofit existing planes after an April 2018 incident in which a woman was killed on Southwest Airlines plane after an engine failure caused by a fan blade.

Headlines: Factbox: The Australian financial crime regulator's accusations against Westpac
Description: Australia's Westpac Banking Corp has been accused of 23 million breaches of anti-money laundering law, with regulators saying the company enabled payments from convicted child sex offenders and "high risk" countries over half a decade.

Headlines: Beijing tariff demands may expand U.S.-China 'phase one' trade deal significantly
Description: A "phase one" trade deal between the United States and China was supposed to be a limited agreement that would allow leaders from both countries to claim an easy victory while soothing financial markets.

Headlines: Uber, distracted backup driver cited by NTSB in fatal self-driving crash
Description: A U.S. safety agency on Tuesday faulted Uber for inadequate attention to safety and decisions in the company's autonomous vehicle development in an investigation into the first-ever death involving a self-driving vehicle, which also cited the vehicle's distracted back-up driver.

Headlines: NZ cenbank 'looks closely' at Australian regulator allegations against Westpac
Description: New Zealand's central bank said on Wednesday that it would look closely at findings by Australia's financial crime watchdog calling Westpac Banking Corp's anti-money laundering oversight "deficient".

Headlines: U.S. housing outlook improves but not breaking new ground: Reuters poll
Description: The rise in U.S. home prices will continue to outpace consumer inflation until at least 2022, albeit at a slower pace than forecast three months ago, despite a majority of analysts polled by Reuters predicting an improvement in activity in the coming year.

Headlines: Kohl's, Home Depot forecasts quell pre-holiday cheer
Description: Retail heavyweights Kohl's Corp and Home Depot Inc sent a shiver through Wall Street on Tuesday, lodging weak results and annual forecasts that cast more doubt on the health of the U.S. consumer ahead of the crucial holiday shopping season.

Headlines: Former Goldman Sachs CEO pushes back on Warren's criticism, wealth tax
Description: Former Goldman Sachs Group Inc Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein pushed back on Tuesday against Elizabeth Warren's criticism of him and other prominent billionaires, saying the singling out of individuals makes him fear for the "political process in the United States."

Headlines: Trade commission finds Chinese mattress imports hurt U.S. industry
Description: The U.S. International Trade Commission on Tuesday concluded that U.S. industry is materially injured by Chinese-made mattresses that are sold at less than fair value, paving the way for the U.S. Commerce Department to impose anti-dumping duties.

Headlines: Trump can no longer impose 'Section 232' auto tariffs after missing deadline: experts
Description: The clock has run out on President Donald Trump's "Section 232" tariffs on imports of foreign-made cars and auto parts, after he failed to announce a decision by a self-imposed deadline, trade law experts say.

Headlines: Ghana joins airline competition fray with Dubai jet order
Description: Ghana became the latest African nation to support the development of an international airline to boost its economy and develop tourism as its government signed a provisional order for three Boeing long-haul 787 Dreamliner jets on Tuesday.

Headlines: United Auto Workers president resigns amid corruption probe: source
Description: United Auto Workers (UAW) President Gary Jones resigned ON Wednesday after being linked to an ongoing corruption probe by U.S. federal officials, a union source confirmed to Reuters.

Headlines: Fed shows little appetite for bold policy change sought by Trump
Description: As U.S. Federal Reserve officials hone their monetary policy playbook in preparation for the next economic downturn, it appears they will eschew more controversial approaches tried by other global central banks, including one that President Donald Trump has called on the Fed to try.

Headlines: Ukraine widens probe against Burisma founder to embezzlement of state funds
Description: Ukraine has widened its investigation into the founder of energy company Burisma to include suspicion of embezzling state funds, Prosecutor General Ruslan Ryaboshapka said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Chinese airlines turn to Asia as long-haul losses pile up
Description: BENGALURU/BEIJING - Chinese airlines are adding seats on short- and mid-range Asian flights in a strategic shift away from prestigious but loss-making North American routes to a market that promises better returns and growth.

Headlines: UAW president resigns after union accuses him of false accounting
Description: United Auto Workers President Gary Jones resigned on Wednesday shortly after the union moved to remove him office amid a widening corruption probe from U.S. prosecutors, a union source told Reuters.

Headlines: Oil jumps over 2% after U.S. inventory data, Russia OPEC comments
Description: Oil prices surged more than 2% on Wednesday after a better-than-expected U.S. crude inventories report and as Russia said it would continue its cooperation with OPEC to keep the global oil market balanced.

Headlines: Google bars elections ads from using political leanings, voter data
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google will stop giving advertisers the ability to target election ads using data such as public voter records and general political affiliations, the company said in a blog post on Wednesday.

Headlines: Some Huawei suppliers get U.S. approval to restart sales to blacklisted firm
Description: The Trump administration on Wednesday gave Huawei its second reprieve this week, allowing some suppliers to restart sales to the Chinese telecoms giant after it was placed on a trade black list over national security concerns six months ago.

Headlines: Union threatens strikes unless Lufthansa makes concessions in wage dispute
Description: A trade union representing Lufthansa's cabin-crew on Wednesday threatened strikes that could fall during the busy Christmas period if Germany's biggest airline does not make concessions in a wage dispute.

Headlines: Exclusive: LVMH gets access to Tiffany's books after it raises offer - sources
Description: French luxury group LVMH has persuaded U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co to provide it with confidential due diligence after it raised its bid to close to $16 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Google to let sites block personalized ads under California privacy law
Description: Websites and apps using Google's advertising tools will be able to block personalized ads to internet users in California and elsewhere as part of the Alphabet Inc unit's effort to help them comply with the state's new privacy law, it told clients this week.

Headlines: White House Deputy Press Secretary: progress being made on China phase-one deal text - Fox
Description: White House Deputy Press Secretary Judd Deere has said that talks with China are continuing and that there is progress on the text of a phase-one trade deal, Fox News reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. healthcare shares pick up steam as some political worries abate
Description: U.S. healthcare stocks, led by health insurers, have gained strength in recent weeks, buoyed by solid third-quarter earnings and investor comfort that political risks to the sector have eased. Wednesday's Democratic presidential debate could test their momentum.

Headlines: U.S. regulator proposes splitting auto safety spectrum to boost Wi-Fi
Description: A little-used block of spectrum set aside for auto safety should be split to accommodate the rapidly growing number of wireless devices, the chairman of the U.S. telecoms regulator said on Wednesday, a plan that sets up a clash between two major industries.

Headlines: China's Great Wall aims to sell 300,000 WEY vehicles a year by 2025: chairman
Description: China's top sport-utility vehicle maker Great Wall Motor aims to sell 300,000 of its premium brand WEY vehicles a year by 2025, its chairman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Alibaba raises up to $12.9 billion in landmark Hong Kong listing
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group raised up to $12.9 billion in a landmark listing in Hong Kong, the largest share sale in the city in nine years and a world record for a cross-border secondary share sale.

Headlines: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries rethinking Spacejet delivery schedule: CEO
Description: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd is rethinking the timetable for Japan's first new commercial aircraft in 50 years and cannot commit to its target of making initial deliveries by mid-2020, the company's chief executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Junk loan market tensions signal end of buyout-led binge
Description: Many investors are shunning the riskiest corners of the junk-rated U.S. corporate loan market because of concerns about possible credit rating downgrades, putting the brakes on a run of leveraged buyouts and debt-funded dividends.

Headlines: Factbox: 'To Tim': Trump's tweets to Apple CEO Cook on factories, iPhones
Description: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook will give U.S. President Donald Trump a personal tour of its Texas computer factory on Wednesday, the latest sign of a close relationship between two of America's most powerful men.

Headlines: Swedbank to investigate report of possible U.S. sanctions breach
Description: Swedbank's chief executive Jens Henriksson vowed on Wednesday to "get to the bottom" of an alleged funds transfer from a Russian arms company, which Swedish public service broadcaster SVT said may have violated U.S sanctions.

Headlines: Australia's Westpac slapped with 23 million money laundering breaches
Description: Regulators accused Australia's Westpac Banking Corp of 23 million breaches of anti-money laundering laws, saying the banking giant ignored red flags and for years enabled payments from convicted child sex offenders and "high risk" countries.

Headlines: U.S. aviation regulator pledges rigorous certification for Boeing 777X
Description: The U.S. aviation regulator will ensure certification of Boeing's 777X wide-body jet is conducted rigorously, the agency's head said on Wednesday while reaffirming that its review of the grounded 737 MAX will not be rushed.

Headlines: #MeToo drove rise in CEO firings in 2018: report
Description: The number of corporate leaders fired for #MeToo-related misconduct rose in 2018 while the number of S&P 500 companies led by females fell 20%, according to a report from U.S. think-tank the Conference Board.

Headlines: Tesla needs safeguards to prevent drivers from sleeping on 'Autopilot': U.S. senator
Description: Democratic U.S. Senator Ed Markey asked Tesla Inc on Wednesday to disable its "Autopilot" driver-assistance system until it installs new safeguards to prevent drivers from evading system limits that could let them fall asleep.

Headlines: Apple starts construction of new $1 billion campus in Texas
Description: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it had started construction of a new campus in Austin, Texas, beside its existing facility where it makes the new MacBook Pro laptops.

Headlines: Big banks would get climate stress tests under proposed U.S. law
Description: U.S. Democratic Senator Brian Schatz of Hawaii on Wednesday introduced a bill that would direct the Federal Reserve to subject large banks to so-called "stress tests" measuring their resilience to climate-related financial risks.

Headlines: Exclusive: ECB flags failings in dirty-money screening at Malta's top bank
Description: Malta's biggest bank failed for years to detect or address risks involving thousands of payments, the European Central Bank (ECB) said, detailing "severe shortcomings" that could have allowed money laundering or other criminal activities.

Headlines: Lowe's calms nerves with profit forecast raise after Home Depot sales warning
Description: Lowe's Cos Inc raised its annual profit forecast on Wednesday, helping ease concerns over the health of the U.S. consumer after larger rival Home Depot Inc cut its full-year sales estimates ahead of the all-important holiday season.

Headlines: Emirates jet swap opens door to Boeing 787 deal in Dubai
Description: Emirates agreed to buy its first Boeing 787 Dreamliners in a last-minute, $9 billion deal at the Dubai Airshow on Wednesday while reducing its order for the U.S. planemaker's delayed 777X model.

Headlines: Peugeot's small car platforms should be favored in Fiat merger: executive
Description: Small car platforms developed by France's Peugeot should be favored if plans to merge PSA and Fiat Chrysler go ahead, PSA executive Gaetano Thorel told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump administration to miss 2019 target for Alaska refuge oil lease sale - official
Description: The Trump administration will miss its target of holding the first-ever oil drilling lease sale in Alaska’s Arctic National Wildlife Refuge this year due to delays in the environmental review process, Interior Secretary David Bernhardt told Reuters.

Headlines: Daimler brings SUV to luxury Maybach brand's portfolio
Description: Daimler plans to sell luxury Maybach brand's first sport-utility vehicle, its China chief executive, Hubertus Troska, said on Thursday, joining other luxury brands that offer SUV models to attract customers from China and the United States.

Headlines: VW sees mild growth for China auto market over next three to four years
Description: Volkswagen AG , the top foreign automaker in China, said on Thursday it expects the world's biggest passenger car market to stabilize next year with low growth levels likely for three to four years.

Headlines: Alibaba, Aramco share sale bonanza fails to produce fee windfall for banks
Description: A late-year rush of giant global share sales led by Alibaba's $13 billion Hong Kong listing and Aramco's $26 billion initial public offering is failing to deliver an equivalent payday for equities bankers.

Headlines: Pressure grows on Westpac CEO after massive Australian money laundering scandal
Description: Pressure mounted on the chief executive of Westpac Banking Corp on Thursday over the handling of Australia's biggest money laundering scandal, with the prime minister saying the bank's board should reflect deeply on Brian Hartzer's position.

Headlines: Germany fines BMW, Daimler, Volkswagen for forming steel cartel
Description: Germany's cartel authority said on Thursday it was fining the country's three major carmakers - BMW , Volkswagen and Daimler - a total of 100 million euros for forming a cartel to buy steel.

Headlines: OPEC+ likely to extend oil supply cuts until June: sources
Description: OPEC and its allies are likely to extend existing oil output cuts when they meet next month until mid-2020, with non-OPEC oil producer Russia supporting Saudi Arabia's push for stable oil prices amid the listing of state oil giant Saudi Aramco.

Headlines: Trump wants Apple to be involved in 5G infrastructure building in U.S.
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had asked Apple Inc Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook to look into helping develop telecommunications infrastructure for 5G wireless networks in the United States.

Headlines: Wall Street dips as investors await U.S.-China trade progress
Description: U.S. stock indexes moved slightly lower on Thursday as investors moved to the sidelines with mixed messages and no concrete signs of progress on U.S.-China relations.

Headlines: Judge rejects U.S. move to disqualify states' lawyer in T-Mobile/Sprint lawsuit
Description: A federal judge on Thursday rejected a U.S. government effort to disqualify a lawyer arguing for 15 states and the District of Columbia in their effort to block T-Mobile US Inc's planned $26.5 billion takeover of Sprint Corp .

Headlines: Gap's Old Navy brand to exit China in early 2020
Description: Gap Inc said on Thursday it would not sell its Old Navy apparels in China from early 2020 and instead would focus on its North America market to boost sales.

Headlines: Panasonic has no plans for new Tesla battery plant in China: CEO
Description: Panasonic Corp has no plans to build a new battery plant for Tesla Inc in China, the Japanese company's chief executive said, as it struggles to make profits from its existing battery business with the electric vehicle maker.

Headlines: Microsoft granted license to export 'mass-market' software to Huawei
Description: Microsoft Corp said on Thursday it had been granted a license from the U.S. government to export software to Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headlines: Charles Schwab in advanced talks to buy TD Ameritrade: source
Description: Charles Schwab Corp is in advanced talks to acquire TD Ameritrade Holding Corp , a person familiar with the matter said on Thursday, in a deal that could exceed $26 billion and combine the two largest U.S. discount brokerages.

Headlines: Schwab-TD Ameritrade deal shows Trump rule-easing boon for financial M&A
Description: A possible purchase by brokerage giant Charles Schwab Corp. of rival TD Ameritrade reflects a more relaxed mood under Trump administration regulators, which has helped unleash other big-ticket takeovers in the financial sector, analysts said.

Headlines: Stocks slip, dollar rebounds on trade hopes stir sentiment
Description: The dollar rebounded and global equity markets edged lower on Thursday as efforts by China to smooth the path forward in U.S.-Sino trade talks helped sooth investor sentiment, though fears remained that a phase one deal might not occur until next year.

Headlines: China says it will strive to reach 'phase one' trade deal with U.S.
Description: China will strive to reach an initial trade agreement with the United States as both sides keep communication channels open, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Thursday, in an attempt to allay fears talks might be unraveling.

Headlines: Europe voices guarded optimism it has dodged U.S. car tariffs
Description: EU trade chief Cecilia Malmstrom and ministers expressed cautious optimism on Thursday that the threat of U.S. tariffs on imported European cars had passed.

Headlines: Pot stocks soar as U.S. House committee clears bill on federal weed legalization
Description: Shares of marijuana companies rose on Thursday after a U.S. congressional committee passed a legislation to decriminalize cannabis, taking it a step closer to being approved by the Democratic-controlled House of Representatives.

Headlines: Explainer: How would a Schwab-TD Ameritrade deal affect retail investors?
Description: U.S. discount broker Charles Schwab Corp. is in talks to buy rival TD Ameritrade in a $26 billion deal that would create an online brokerage behemoth, according to media reports.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco order book reaches 73 billion riyals so far: Samba
Description: Saudi Aramco's initial public offering (IPO) has attracted approximately 73 billion riyals ($19.47 billion) in institutional and retail orders so far, Saudi Arabia's Samba Financial Group said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. grants final approval for expanded Delta, Air France, Virgin, KLM JV
Description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao on Thursday granted final approval for an expanded trans-Atlantic joint venture for Delta Air Lines Inc , Air France KLM SA and Virgin Atlantic.

Headlines: More foreign firms halted U.S. deals amid Trump administration scrutiny: report
Description: More overseas companies investigated by U.S. authorities for national security concerns have abandoned investments in the United States since President Donald Trump took office, a report showed on Friday, signaling headwinds for key sources of funding for U.S. companies.

Headlines: U.S. banks cram for Fed risk test, with ripple effects in repo
Description: New quarterly data from the biggest U.S. banks suggest that some will need to back away from short-term lending markets by year-end to avoid triggering requirements that they hold more capital.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chevron CEO plans major cost-cutting overhaul of production teams - sources
Description: Chevron Corp Chief Executive Michael Wirth is preparing sweeping changes at the No. 2 U.S. oil and gas company that would cut costs and streamline operations in a drive to boost profitability, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Aramco IPO: It's a thanks, but no thanks from Malaysia's Petronas
Description: With Saudi Aramco yet to name any major foreign investors in its upcoming share sale, Malaysia's state energy company Petronas [PETR.UL] decided to take a pass on Friday.

Headlines: WeWork names new executives, path to profitability by 2023: report
Description: WeWork named four men to executive roles on Friday and outlined a six-point path to profitability, though the money-losing flexible office space operator said it will not be cash flow positive until 2023, according to a media report.

Headlines: Bayer's Monsanto pleads guilty to illegal Hawaii pesticide spraying
Description: Monsanto pleaded guilty to spraying a banned pesticide on the Hawaiian island of Maui, and agreed to pay $10.2 million in criminal fines and other payments for the spraying and for illegally storing hazardous waste, U.S. prosecutors said.

Headlines: Board of Australia's Westpac 'unreservedly apologizes' over money-laundering
Description: The board of Australia's second largest bank on Friday apologized unreservedly for 23 million breaches of money laundering laws, but stood by management despite pressure from politicians to review its leadership.

Headlines: Ford's China JV with Changan to return to sales growth in 2020-president
Description: Auto sales at Ford Motor Co's China venture with Chongqing-based carmaker Changan are likely to turn positive next year, Changan’s president said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. factory and services activity quicken in November: Markit
Description: U.S. manufacturing output accelerated in November to its fastest pace in seven months and services activity also picked up more than expected, a survey of purchasing managers showed on Friday in a sign of the continued resilience of the U.S. economy in the face of the U.S.-China trade war and other headwinds.

Headlines: AstraZeneca shares rise on early U.S. approval for leukemia drug
Description: AstraZeneca shares rose 2.7% on Friday after the British drugmaker won earlier-than-expected U.S. regulatory approval for a leukemia drug, in a challenge to rival AbbVie .

Headlines: Ban on flavored vapes could lead to loss of 150,000 jobs, $8.4 billion sales hit: report
Description: A potential U.S. ban on e-cigarette flavors could result in a loss of more than 150,000 jobs and a direct sales hit of $8.4 billion, according to a report released on Friday by a vaping industry trade group.

Headlines: Trump, Xi send positive signals on initial deal to defuse U.S.-China trade war
Description: The leaders of the United States and China on Friday both underscored their desire to sign an initial trade deal and defuse a 16-month tariff war that has lowered global growth, providing a welcome boost to financial markets.

Headlines: Trump says yet to decide whether to close trade deal with China
Description: President Donald Trump said on Friday a potential U.S.-China trade deal was coming along well, but he had yet to decide whether he wanted to finalize it.

Headlines: Bitcoin plummets to a six-month low on China crackdown
Description: Bitcoin slumped to a six-month low on Friday after China's central bank launched a fresh crackdown on cryptocurrencies, warning of the risks entailed in issuing or trading them.

Headlines: Italy could use ESM talks to push Italian candidate to head fund: Panetta
Description: Italy should use ongoing talks over the reform of the euro zone bailout fund, the ESM, to secure something for itself such as the appointment of an Italian to head the fund, Bank of Italy Deputy governor Fabio Panetta said on Saturday.

Headlines: Exclusive: UniCredit clinches deal to cut exposure to Turkish lender Yapi Kredi - sources
Description: UniCredit has struck a deal to reduce its exposure to Turkey's Yapi Kredi , three sources told Reuters, a move seen as a first step toward the Italian bank's full exit from the recession-hit country.

Headlines: Novartis nears deal to buy U.S. biotech firm Medicines Co for about $7 billion: WSJ
Description: Swiss drugmaker Novartis AG is nearing an agreement to acquire U.S. biotechnology firm The Medicines Co for about $7 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Finnair cancels 276 flights as unions join solidarity strike
Description: Finland's national airline Finnair said on Sunday it was forced to cancel 276 flights scheduled for Sunday and Monday after attempts to settle a labor dispute at the Finnish postal service failed, leading several Finnish labor unions to join a solidarity strike on Monday.

Headlines: France's LVMH close to buying Tiffany after sweetening offer: sources
Description: LVMH is close to buying U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co for about $16.3 billion after sweetening its offer, sources said on Sunday, as the owner of Louis Vuitton and Bulgari aims to tap the fast-growing luxury jewelry market.

Headlines: Japanese hotel group Unizo gets six new buyout offers
Description: Japanese hotel operator Unizo Holdings said on Sunday it had received six more buyout offers at a price competitive with an existing $1.6 billion bid proposed by Blackstone Group .

Headlines: Saudi Aramco markets IPO in Dubai after approaching Kuwait fund
Description: Saudi Aramco met investors in Dubai on Sunday to market its initial public offering (IPO), after trying to secure demand from Kuwait's sovereign wealth fund for the deal, worth up to $25.6 billion, which relies heavily on local and regional buyers.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco won't breach maximum weight for firms in Saudi index: Argaam
Description: Saudi Aramco's weighting in Saudi Arabia's main stock index once the oil giant has listed shares is not expected to breach the maximum limit set by the Gulf kingdom's Tadawul exchange, a senior executive said on Sunday.

Headlines: Brazil minister says it's 'impossible' to put value on Eletrobras privatization
Description: Brazil's mines and energy minister said on Monday it is "impossible" to say how much the privatization of state-run power company Eletrobras SA will raise, despite an earlier government estimate of 16.2 billion reais ($3.84 billion).

Headlines: LVMH aims to restore Tiffany's sparkle with $16.2 billion takeover
Description: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH has agreed to buy Tiffany for $16.2 billion in its biggest acquisition yet, as the French luxury goods maker bets it can restore the U.S. jeweller's lustre by investing in stores and new collections.

Headlines: EU on course to allow in more U.S. beef from 2020
