Description: European Union plans to allow more U.S. beef imports cleared a key hurdle on Monday when EU lawmakers specializing in trade backed the move, which is likely to ease transatlantic tensions.

Headlines: Oil climbs on U.S.-China trade talks optimism
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Monday as positive comments from the United States and China rekindled hopes in global markets that the world's two largest economies could soon sign an interim deal to end their trade war.

Headlines: U.S. charges former Outcome Health executives in $1 billion fraud
Description: U.S. prosecutors announced criminal charges accusing the founders of Outcome Health of overseeing a scheme to overbill clients and fraudulently obtain nearly $1 billion of funds, including from major investors.

Headlines: DHL to debut zero-emission electric delivery vans in U.S. cities
Description: Deutsche Post DHL Group's StreetScooter electric vehicle unit will enter the U.S. market next year as delivery firms and municipalities work to cut greenhouse gas emissions.

Headlines: World share markets rally on revived trade hopes; dollar gains
Description: The dollar rose and global equity markets rallied on Monday, with the Nasdaq and S&P 500 hitting new highs as investors grew more hopeful the United States and China could soon sign an interim deal to end their trade war.

Headlines: Wall Street sets records on trade progress optimism
Description: Each of Wall Street's three major averages kicked off the trading week with record closes on Monday as signs pointed to progress between the United States and China on a trade truce, while a round of merger deals also helped buoy sentiment.

Headlines: AIG to sell 76.6% stake in Fortitude Re for $1.8 billion
Description: U.S. insurer American International Group Inc said on Monday it would sell a major portion of its stake in reinsurer Fortitude Re to buyout fund Carlyle Group and Japanese insurer T&D Holdings for about $1.8 billion.

Headlines: 'Unfit' Uber loses London license over safety failures
Description: Uber was stripped of its license to carry paying passengers in London on Monday for the second time in just over two years, pending an appeal, over a "pattern of failures" on safety and security.

Headlines: Going whole hog: U.S. tells exporters to report pig carcass sales as China buying soars
Description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture said on Monday that commodity exporters must disclose sales of hog carcasses, giving officials and traders more insight into a surge of Chinese pork buying that has roiled global meat markets.

Headlines: U.S. securities regulator proposes new rules on use of derivatives in exchange traded funds
Description: The U.S. securities regulator on Monday proposed new regulations for the use of derivatives by investment funds to introduce some safeguards for more risky products and increase competition.

Headlines: Pelosi says U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade deal is 'within range'
Description: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Monday that a version of the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement that House Democrats could back was "within range" but that they needed to conduct a final review.

Headlines: China and U.S. moving closer to trade deal, but no agreement on tariff rollbacks: report
Description: China and the United States are "moving closer to agreeing" on a "phase one" trade deal, the Global Times, a tabloid run by the ruling Communist Party's official People's Daily, reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Eight electric pickup truck manufacturers to load up U.S. market by 2021
Description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk and his spacy Cybertruck have ignited a frenzy over electric pickups, and at least seven other U.S. automakers expect to build new battery-powered trucks by 2021.

Headlines: McDonald's to pay $26 million to settle California wage lawsuit
Description: McDonald's Corp agreed to pay $26 million to settle a nearly seven-year-old lawsuit accusing the fast food chain of underpaying U.S. staff at its corporate-owned restaurants in California.

Headlines: China says it hopes U.S. will work on basis of equality in trade talks
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Monday it hopes the United States will work with Beijing on a basis of equality and mutual respect on the ongoing bilateral trade negotiations.

Headlines: SoftBank-backed Paytm raises $1 billion in fresh funding
Description: Indian digital payments company Paytm said on Monday it has raised fresh funds from a group of investors including existing backers SoftBank's Vision Fund and China's Ant Financial Services in a deal valuing the firm at $16 billion.

Headlines: China's electric vehicle market to see sales rebound next year, executives say
Description: China's new energy vehicle (NEV) market is likely to see a sales rebound next year as automakers roll out more new products to lure buyers, but more supportive government policies are needed, auto executives said.

Headlines: Uber to appeal London license loss decision
Description: Uber will appeal Monday's decision by London's transport regulator to strip the firm of its license in the city, saying it has taken steps to change its business model and sets the standard on safety.

Headlines: Just Eat urges shareholders to shun Prosus and stick with Takeaway deal
Description: Britain's Just Eat urged shareholders on Monday to shun a $6.3 billion cash offer from Prosus , saying a currently lower valued deal with Takeaway.com was a better bet as it would create the largest food delivery firm outside China.

Headlines: GE brings in shipper Maersk's CFO as finance chief
Description: General Electric Co on Monday named finance head at shipper AP Moller-Maersk as its new chief financial officer in the latest top-level change aimed at turning around the U.S. industrial conglomerate.

Headlines: Factbox: M&As in vogue for luxury retailers seeking growth
Description: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH snapped up U.S. jeweler Tiffany & Co on Monday for $16.2 billion in its largest buyout ever, adding America's biggest luxury name to its stable of brands.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler has started 90% of planned investments in Italy: executive
Description: Fiat Chrysler has already started 90% of the investments earmarked for Italy, the auto maker's Chief Operating Officer for the EMEA region Pietro Gorlier said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence ebbing; housing market firming
Description: U.S. consumer confidence fell for a fourth straight month in November amid worries about current business conditions and employment prospects, but remained at levels sufficient to support a steady pace of consumer spending.

Headlines: Black Friday darker for some retail stocks than others
Description: The U.S. holiday shopping period kicking off on Friday may heighten Wall Street's perception of a growing divide between retailers adapting to online sales and those unable to shake their reliance on dwindling shopping mall traffic.

Headlines: Musk to testify in own defense in defamation trial, his lawyer says
Description: Tesla Inc's chief executive, Elon Musk, will testify in his own defense against a defamation lawsuit brought by a British cave explorer, Musk's lawyer said on Monday in U.S. District Court in Los Angeles.

Headlines: Activist investor seeks to oust Trump friend Barrack from CEO job at Colony Capital
Description: Activist investor Blackwells is pushing to remove Tom Barrack, a billionaire friend of President Donald Trump, as CEO of Colony Capital, saying his mismanagement of the real estate and investment firm has cost shareholders billions of dollars in lost gains.

Headlines: Factbox: The world's biggest electric vehicle battery makers
Description: Asian companies dominate the market for electric vehicle (EV) batteries and they are expanding their production capacity in Europe, China and the United States in a fight to win lucrative contracts from global automakers.

Headlines: Wall Street crawls to record levels on trade hopes
Description: U.S. stocks crawled higher on Tuesday, and all three major Wall Street indexes notched record levels, as upbeat comments by President Donald Trump on trade talks eclipsed some softer-than-anticipated economic data.

Headlines: Exclusive: Hedge fund Citadel's commodities business up about $1 billion for the year - sources
Description: Citadel's commodities investments are up at least $1 billion for the year, according to three sources familiar with the matter, helping to drive strong overall performance at one of the world's largest hedge funds.

Headlines: Factbox: Five years of Australian finance scandals
Description: The CEO and chairman of Australia's Westpac Banking Corp are out after financial crime watchdog AUSTRAC accused the bank of 23 million breaches of anti-money laundering laws, including payments related to child exploitation.

Headlines: Oil gains, bolstered again by U.S.-China trade talks
Description: Oil prices rose on Tuesday after news that U.S. and Chinese officials discussed trade, while predictions for a weekly draw on U.S. crude stockpiles lent some support as well.

Headlines: China raises $6 billion in its biggest ever international bond sale
Description: China raised $6 billion in its biggest ever international sovereign bond sale on Tuesday, as it pounced on the year's sharp dive in borrowing costs.

Headlines: It's not just trade hopes fueling the U.S. stocks rally
Description: Wall Street stocks have leap-frogged over a host of concerns, including a stall in corporate earnings and political controversy in Washington, on their way to record highs this month.

Headlines: China sells $6 billion worth of dollar bonds, double official target
Description: China sold $6 billion worth of dollar-denominated bonds on Tuesday, double its initial target.

Headlines: Factbox: Westpac's money-laundering scandal in quotes
Description: The chief executive of Australia's Westpac Banking Corp stepped down on Tuesday over a money laundering scandal involving child exploitation, just a day after he told staff it was "not a major issue" and that he intended to stay on.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor to invest $1.55 billion in first Indonesia car plant
Description: South Korea's Hyundai Motor said on Tuesday it has signed a preliminary deal to build a new factory in Indonesia, which would be its first car plant in Southeast Asia and a crack at Japanese rivals that dominate the market.

Headlines: Alibaba's Hong Kong shares rise 6.6% on debut in heavy volume
Description: Alibaba Group's Hong Kong shares closed their first trading session up 6.6% from the issue price after this year's largest stock sale.

Headlines: CEO of Australia's Westpac exits over money laundering scandal
Description: The chief executive of Australia's Westpac Banking Corp stepped down on Tuesday over a money laundering scandal involving child exploitation, just a day after he told staff it was "not a major issue" and that he intended to stay on.

Headlines: Audi gives job guarantees in Germany until 2029: sources
Description: Volkswagen's luxury car unit Audi has agreed to give employment guarantees until 2029 in its home-market Germany, two people close to the matter said.

Headlines: Dollar Tree forecast misses as tariffs bite; shares slump 17%
Description: Dollar Tree Inc forecast holiday-quarter profit below Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, as the discount retailer fell short in its efforts to counter the impact of the latest U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports, sending its shares down about 17%.

Headlines: Best Buy signals robust holiday shopping demand with upbeat forecast
Description: Best Buy Co Inc signaled it expected a strong holiday shopping season by forecasting fourth-quarter profit above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, sending shares of the biggest U.S. consumer electronics retailer up over 8%.

Headlines: How LVMH's whirlwind courtship sealed $16 billion Tiffany deal
Description: Tiffany was codenamed "Tea" and LVMH was "Latte" in the whirlwind talks that led to the U.S. jeweler being taken over by the French luxury group for more than $16 billion, in a homage to famed film "Breakfast at Tiffany's".

Headlines: U.S. goods trade deficit narrows sharply in October
Description: The U.S. goods trade deficit fell sharply in October as both exports and imports declined, pointing to a continued reduction in trade flows that has been blamed on the Trump administration' "America First" policy.

Headlines: Deere warns of lower profits in 2020 on lingering trade tensions
Description: Deere & Co. on Wednesday warned of lower earnings next year after reporting a fall in quarterly profits, hurt by trade tensions as well as poor weather in the U.S. farm belt that has slowed equipment purchases by farmers.

Headlines: U.S. pending home sales slip in October: NAR
Description: Contracts to buy previously owned U.S. homes fell unexpectedly in October, with new contract signings down in three of the four U.S. regions.

Headlines: U.S. economy picks up in third-quarter; data surprise on the upside
Description: U.S. economic growth picked up slightly in the third quarter, rather than slowing as initially reported, and there are signs the downturn in business investment may be drawing to a close.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's ByteDance moves to ringfence its TikTok app amid U.S. probe - sources
Description: ByteDance has stepped up efforts to separate its social media app TikTok from much of its Chinese operations, amid a U.S. national security panel's inquiry into the safety of the personal data it handles, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. economy growing modestly, labor market still tight: Fed report
Description: The U.S. economy expanded modestly from October to mid-November and the outlook for growth was generally positive while labor markets remained tight across the country, the Federal Reserve said in a report on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending increases steadily; inflation muted
Description: U.S. consumer spending rose steadily in October, suggesting the economy will probably maintain its moderate pace of growth in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: Oil slips after U.S. crude build and record production
Description: Oil eased on Wednesday after a report showing U.S. crude inventories grew unexpectedly last week, while gasoline stocks surged and production hit another record.

Headlines: Stocks near record highs on trade hopes, dollar gains
Description: The U.S. dollar rose and a gauge of global equities pushed closer to an all-time high on Wednesday after a batch of U.S. economic data brightened the economic outlook and investors remained bullish on prospects for a U.S.-China trade accord.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon's cloud unit readies more powerful data center chip - sources
Description: Amazon.com Inc's cloud computing unit has designed a second, more powerful generation of data center processor chip, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters, the latest sign that the company is pouring money into custom silicon for its fastest-growing business.

Headlines: Westpac shareholders call for more heads to roll over money-laundering scandal
Description: Two of Australia's top shareholder proxy advisers on Wednesday urged investors to vote out more directors of Westpac Banking Corp after a money-laundering scandal claimed the CEO and chairman of the country's No.2 retail bank.

Headlines: Further to run for global stocks, but trade salve needed: Reuters poll
Description: The global stock market rally has further to run in 2020, according to analysts, brokers and strategists polled by Reuters, but much depends on U.S. and Chinese officials making real progress in stopping a disruptive trade war.

Headlines: BAT says U.S vaping slowdown will curb growth of e-cig business
Description: World No.2 tobacco maker British American Tobacco said on Wednesday a slowdown in the U.S. vaping market would lead to lower revenue growth in its vaping arm even as it gained market share in its traditional cigarettes business.

Headlines: Gulf state investors step in to help Aramco hit IPO target: sources
Description: Saudi Arabia's wealthy Gulf neighbors plan to invest in the initial public offering (IPO) of Saudi Aramco, sources familiar with the matter said, helping out Riyadh as it strives to raise $25.6 billion from a domestic listing of the state oil giant.

Headlines: U.S. stocks to keep climbing in 2020 but growth well below this year's: Reuters poll
Description: U.S. stocks will keep rising in 2020 but at a much more modest pace than this year, with plenty to potentially slow the ascent, according to a Reuters poll of strategists.

Headlines: U.S. third-quarter GDP growth revised up to 2.1%
Description: U.S. economic growth picked up slightly in the third quarter, rather than slowing as initially reported, amid a stronger pace of inventory accumulation and a less steep decline in business investment.

Headlines: Top Mexican official floats prospect of labor tweak for continental trade deal
Description: Adjustments could be made to how labor disputes are handled in the new United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) trade deal to help push through its ratification in the United States, Mexican deputy foreign minister Jesus Seade said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Scandal-hit Westpac to refund some buyers of new shares
Description: Australia's Westpac Banking Corp offered to refund people who bought new shares weeks before a lawsuit accusing it of millions of breaches of money laundering laws, a move some investors said was to fend off criticism about its transparency.

Headlines: China limits number of rides drivers can offer through car-pooling services
Description: China's Ministry of Transport said car-pooling services have to limit the daily number of rides drivers can offer through apps such as Didi Chuxing's Hitch, which began trial operations this month a year after passenger deaths left the service suspended.

Headlines: Novartis's $90 million Swiss factory to help solve cell therapy bottleneck
Description: Swiss drugmaker Novartis's new $90 million cell and gene therapy factory in northern Switzerland is on track to begin commercial production of its cell therapy Kymriah for cancer in 2020.

Headlines: Green's in fashion as Lithuanian used clothes site joins $1 billion club
Description: Vinted, an online marketplace for second-hand clothes, has surfed a sustainable fashion wave to become Lithuania's first technology startup to reach "unicorn" status with a valuation of over $1 billion.

Headlines: Grain trader Louis Dreyfus to cut costs in ongoing overhaul
Description: Louis Dreyfus Company is making sweeping cost cuts, starting with travel, entertainment, hiring and salaries, as the 168-year-old agricultural commodities firm tries to revive dwindling profits.

Headlines: Timeline: A turbulent decade for grain trader Louis Dreyfus and its owner
Description: Louis Dreyfus Co (LDC) has launched a sweeping cost-cutting plan in the latest attempt to revive profits at the 168-year-old family-owned firm, one of the world's largest agricultural commodity merchants.

Headlines: Permira, North Face owner among bidders for sneaker brand Golden Goose: sources
Description: U.S. apparel and footwear conglomerate VF Corporation and buyout funds Permira and Advent are lining up indicative offers for Italian shoe brand Golden Goose ahead of a mid December deadline, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Amazon must check for trade mark violations: EU court adviser
Description: U.S. online retail giant Amazon is not liable for unwittingly stocking trade mark infringing goods for third-party sellers, but should be diligent in checking whether products are legal, an adviser to Europe's top court said on Thursday.

Headlines: Hong Kong loses luster for luxury brands as mainland China shines: Bain
Description: Luxury brands are likely to retreat from Hong Kong as the city is wracked by protests at a time when wealthy Chinese shoppers are staying on the mainland, consultancy Bain said on Thursday, highlighting a shift that is reshaping the global industry.

Headlines: China's factory activity seen contracting for seventh month on trade pressure: Reuters poll
Description: China's factory activity is expected to have contracted for the seventh straight month in November amid sluggish domestic demand a Reuters poll showed, despite some optimism over chances for an interim deal to de-escalate a trade war with the United States.

Headlines: Factbox: India's telecom sector on the ropes after $13 billion levy ruling
Description: India's telecoms sector has been rocked by a Supreme Court ruling last month that sided with the government in a dispute over how levies are calculated, saddling the industry with a combined $13 billion in fresh debt.

Headlines: Panasonic to sell its chip unit to Taiwan's Nuvoton for $250 million
Description: Panasonic Corp said it would sell its loss-making semiconductor unit to Taiwan's Nuvoton Technology Corp for $250 million as the Japanese electronics giant struggles to lift its profit amid a lack of growth drivers.

Headlines: Drugmakers slash prices in China to get on reimbursement list
Description: Drugmakers including Roche and Novartis' have agreed to cut the prices of some of their newest drugs by an average of 61% in China in order to get on a national reimbursement scheme list, regulators said.

Headlines: Denmark's Maersk to lay off staff as part of cost cuts
Description: Danish shipping group Maersk said on Thursday it would lay off staff at its main offices in Denmark and in other countries.

Headlines: China reiterates its pledge to lower trade barriers, widen market access: Xinhua
Description: China on Thursday reiterated its pledge to further widen market access for foreign capital and lower non-tariff trade barriers, as it aims to boost flagging trade amid a slowing economy and a trade war with the United States.

Headlines: EU lawmakers clear U.S. beef imports but fault U.S. tariffs
Description: European Union lawmakers approved an increase in U.S. beef imports to the EU on Thursday, a move likely to ease transatlantic tensions.

Headlines: Axel Springer unit, others say Google still playing unfairly, want EU to act
Description: Axel Springer's price-comparison shopping service Idealo and 40 other European peers have accused Alphabet Inc's Google of tilting the playing field in its favor and urged EU antitrust regulators to enforce a ruling against the company.

Headlines: Oil slumps but sets monthly gain ahead of OPEC meeting
Description: Oil prices fell on Friday, with U.S. crude dropping more than 4%, on fresh trade tensions and record high U.S. crude production, but they still ended the month higher as OPEC watchers expect an extension next week to a pact to throttle oil output beyond March.

Headlines: Nokia says working to end patent licensing row with Daimler, others
Description: Nokia said on Friday it was working to end a row with Germany's Daimler and other firms which have complained to the EU antitrust regulators about the level of fees charged for technology patents from the Finnish company.

Headlines: OPEC November oil output slips before Aramco IPO, policy meeting
Description: OPEC oil output has fallen in November as Angolan production has slipped due to maintenance and Saudi Arabia has kept a lid on supply to support the market before the initial public offering (IPO) of state-owned Saudi Aramco, a Reuters survey found.

Headlines: China's factory activity unexpectedly returns to growth in November
Description: Factory activity in China unexpectedly returned to growth in November for the first time in seven months, as domestic demand picked up on Beijing's accelerated stimulus measures to steady growth.

Headlines: Singapore tells Facebook to correct user's post in test of 'fake news' laws
Description: Singapore instructed Facebook on Friday to publish a correction on a user's social media post under a new "fake news" law, raising fresh questions about how the company will adhere to government requests to regulate content.

Headlines: As Juncker bids farewell, new EU executive begins with scrutiny over Luxembourg tax
Description: Officials from the new European Commission will discuss an International Monetary Fund study that lists Luxembourg as a world-leading tax haven just days after the former leader of the Grand Duchy departs the EU executive's helm.

Headlines: That frenzied Black Friday crush? Not this year
Description: The frenzy associated with Black Friday shopping was missing this year as U.S. retailers offered earlier discounts and more consumers shopped online, though spot checks around the country showed traffic picked up after a sluggish morning.

Headlines: BMW, Great Wall to build new China plant for electric cars
Description: BMW and its partner Great Wall Motor said they plan to build a plant in China with a capacity of 160,000 cars per year, and which will produce BMW's electric MINI brand and Great Wall Motor models.

Headlines: Britain's Ocado signs technology partnership with Japan's Aeon
Description: British online grocer Ocado has signed a technology partnership with Japan's Aeon to help the retailer establish an online business, its first deal in Asia.

Headlines: Indian retailer Future's shares surge as regulator approves Amazon investment
Description: Shares in Future Retail Ltd surged 13% on Friday, after India's antitrust body approved a deal that would give Amazon.com Inc a minority stake in one of the country's top retail groups.

Headlines: Take Five: NATO -- dead or alive?
Description: Beneath the birthday bonhomie, tensions will be simmering as the transatlantic military alliance turns 70 and leaders of the 29 member states celebrate near London on Dec. 3-4.

Headlines: Block Friday: French activists try to disrupt discount shopping day
Description: Activists staged protests against online retailer Amazon around France on Friday and tried to blockade a shopping mall in Paris, denouncing as rampant consumerism the U.S. Black Friday shopping frenzy that has spread to European shores.

Headlines: Top U.S. retailers absorb tariff pressure ahead of holiday shopping season
Description: Prices for electronics sold online at top U.S. retailers were up slightly heading into the critical U.S. shopping season, but sites including Walmart Inc and Amazon.com Inc have held prices steady for many other popular holiday products despite the pressure from tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: Facebook issues corrective label on user's post under new Singapore fake news law
Description: Facebook said on Saturday it had issued a correction notice on a user's post at the request of the Singapore government, but called for a measured approach to the implementation of a new "fake news" law in the city-state.

Headlines: International stocks to outperform U.S. in 2020: investors
Description: Even though the U.S. stock market continues a record-breaking rally that has sent the benchmark S&P 500 index up nearly 25% for the year, investors appear to be looking elsewhere for better values in the year ahead.

Headlines: Black Friday shoppers stay away from stores, make $7 billion-plus splurge online
Description: U.S. shoppers made more purchases online on Black Friday than in the mall - hurting traffic and sales at brick-and-mortar stores, according to data that offered a glimpse into what is still one of the busiest shopping days of the year.

Headlines: Tesla move will draw further companies into Germany: state premier
Description: Tesla's announcement earlier this month that it will build its first European factory near Berlin will draw further companies from the electric mobility and energy storage sectors into Germany, a state premier told newspaper Die Welt.

Headlines: China's Nov factory activity unexpectedly expands at quickest pace in almost three years - Caixin PMI
Description: China's factory activity unexpectedly expanded at the quickest pace in almost three years in November, with solid increases in output and new orders, a private business survey showed on Monday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler reaches tentative labor deal with United Auto Workers
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV and the United Auto Workers (UAW) union on Saturday announced a tentative agreement for a four-year labor contract, a boost for the automaker as it works to merge with France's Groupe PSA.

Headlines: China wants U.S. tariffs rolled back in phase one trade deal: Global Times
Description: Beijing's top priority in any phase one trade deal with the United States is the removal of existing tariffs on Chinese goods, China's Global Times newspaper reported on Sunday, amid uncertainty on whether the two sides can end a 17-month trade war that has depressed global growth.

Headlines: Exclusive: Former Honeywell CEO in bid talks for Vertiv - sources
Description: A company led by former Honeywell International Inc chief executive David Cote and backed by Goldman Sachs Group Inc is in talks to acquire U.S. backup power equipment firm Vertiv for more than $5 billion, including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Oil futures edge up on talk of further OPEC+ supply curbs
Description: Oil futures gained about 1% on Monday on hints the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and its allies may agree to deepen output cuts at a meeting this week and as rising manufacturing activity in China suggested stronger demand.

Headlines: Large investor lays out $31 million options hedge against U.S. stock market drop
Description: Monday's slide in U.S. stocks prompted at least one large investors to load up big on stock options that would guard against a sharper hit to stocks into the start of next year.

Headlines: Zuckerberg denies that Trump tried to lobby against ban on political ads: CBS
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said in an interview to CBS on Monday that U.S. President Donald Trump did not discourage him from banning political ads on the social media platform during a secret meeting in October.

Headlines: U.S. stocks retreat on economy and trade jitters
Description: Wall Street stepped back from last week's record highs on Monday, with weak U.S. manufacturing data and fresh trade worries keeping buyers on the sidelines.

Headlines: Exclusive: Brazil's Odebrecht in talks to stave off Braskem sale, keep payout - sources
Description: Creditors of Brazil's Odebrecht SA are in advanced talks to let the corruption-ensnared conglomerate keep its crown jewel asset, listed petrochemical company Braskem SA , for another two years, retreating from their prior demand for a quick sale, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Huawei plans to shift research center to Canada from U.S.: Globe and Mail
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd plans to shift its research center to Canada from the United States, Ren Zhengfei, the founder of the Chinese telecoms equipment maker, said in an interview with Canada's Globe and Mail.

Headlines: U.S. says sees no reason to reduce tariffs in EU aircraft subsidy case
Description: The U.S. Trade Representative's office on Monday said it saw no basis in Monday's World Trade Organization report that would justify reducing U.S. retaliatory tariffs by $2 billion as Europe's Airbus has suggested.

Headlines: U.S. Cyber Monday sales to hit record $9.2 billion
Description: Cyber Monday sales were on course to bring in a record $9.2 billion, according to evening estimates, building on a bumper Black Friday weekend for U.S. retailers driven by earlier-than-usual promotions and free shipping.

Headlines: FCC chair, Democrats call on Congress to reverse planned spectrum sale
Description: The chair of the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) on Monday joined several Democratic senators in urging the cancellation of an auction of wireless spectrum used by U.S. law enforcement agencies because of the costs and difficulty of moving them to alternatives.

Headlines: Cramer: Warren's backtrack on 'Medicare for All' is a boon for this managed-care stock
Description: UnitedHealth's stock has "caught fire" due in part to Sen. Elizabeth Warren appearing to "back away" from her "Medicare for All" proposal, according to Jim Cramer.

Headlines: Italy set to grant funds to keep Alitalia afloat: source
Description: Italy is set to free up funds for loss-making airline Alitalia on Monday as Rome struggles to find investors to keep it afloat, a political source told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. Attorney says government can still seek to take auto workers union control: Detroit News
Description: The U.S. government may still seek to take control of the United Auto Workers Union (UAW) once its investigators determine the depths of corruption in the union, U.S. Attorney Matthew Schneider said in an interview with Detroit News on Sunday.

Headlines: China's factory activity surprises with fastest expansion in three years: Caixin PMI
Description: China's factory activity showed surprising signs of improvement in November, with growth picking up to a near three-year high, a private sector survey showed on Monday, reinforcing upbeat government data released over the weekend.

Headlines: China picks new leaders for Macau, replaces economy chief
Description: China has appointed a slate of new officials to head the world's top gambling hub of Macau, changing key roles including the city's economy and justice secretaries.

Headlines: China's facial recognition rollout reaches into mobile phones, shops and homes
Description: China on Sunday put into effect new regulations that require Chinese telecom carriers to scan the faces of users registering new mobile phone services, a move the government says is aimed at cracking down on fraud.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing contracts further, tempers economic growth hopes
Description: U.S. factory activity contracted for a fourth straight month in November as new orders slumped back to around their lowest level since 2012, while construction spending fell in October, tempering optimism over the economy that had been fanned by a recent run of upbeat reports.

Headlines: Hong Kong Airlines told to improve finances or risk losing license
Description: Hong Kong Airlines, controlled by cash-strapped Chinese conglomerate HNA Group, must shore up its financial position by Dec. 7 or risk the suspension or loss of its license, a Hong Kong air transport regulator said on Monday.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia wants OPEC+ to deepen oil cuts due to Aramco IPO
Description: OPEC and its allies plan to deepen oil cuts and have the deal in place so it runs at least until June 2020 as Saudi Arabia wants to deliver a positive surprise to the market before the listing of Saudi Aramco, two sources familiar with the talks said.

Headlines: WTO rules that EU continues to provide unfair Airbus subsidies
Description: The World Trade Organization (WTO) ruled on Monday that the European Union continues to provide unfair subsidies to European planemaker Airbus , supporting the U.S. case for retaliatory tariffs.

Headlines: U.S. factory sector contracts again in November: ISM
Description: The U.S. economy's manufacturing sector contracted for a fourth straight month in November as new order volumes slid back to around their lowest level since 2012, according to an industry report released on Monday.

Headlines: UAW announces financial reforms as U.S. corruption probe widens
Description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) union said on Monday it would implement stringent changes to its financial procedures and processes in response to a widening corruption probe from U.S. prosecutors.

Headlines: Off the radar: U.S. CEOs' jet perks add millions to corporate tax bills
Description: As U.S. corporate jet use approaches pre-financial crisis levels and chief executives take an increasing number of personal trips on the company tab, many investors are being kept in the dark about the true cost of the perk.

Headlines: U.S. oil output growth slows: just how much is anyone's guess
Description: U.S. oil producers could expand daily output by 1 million barrels next year, or by as little as 100,000 barrels, with the wide gap creating huge uncertainty as OPEC officials gather this week to weigh production curbs.

Headlines: French Champagne makers fear impact of potential new U.S. duties
Description: French champagne producers and exporters decried a U.S. government threat to slap tariffs of up to 100% on a range of French products including sparkling wines, saying they have nothing to do with the dispute and calling for government help.

Headlines: U.S. shoppers, mostly online, spend 16% more over holiday weekend
Description: A record number of U.S. consumers spent more online and in stores over the holiday weekend for everything from clothing to toys, the National Retail Federation said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Glencore's Glasenberg says successor could be in place next year
Description: Glencore could announce a new chief executive next year once a new management team is in place, its current boss told an investor meeting on Tuesday as the commodities giant laid out its priorities for 2020.

Headlines: Stocks fall, bonds climb amid concern over longer trade war
Description: A comment by President Donald Trump that a deal to end the U.S.-China trade war might not come until after the November 2020 election weighed on global stock markets on Tuesday, sending investors to the safety of bonds.

Headlines: Elon Musk's tweets bring controversy, nearly 30 million followers
Description: Trial began in U.S. District Court in Los Angeles on Tuesday in a defamation lawsuit brought against Elon Musk by British cave diver Vernon Unsworth over three July 15, 2018 tweets by the Tesla chief executive, one calling him "pedo guy."

Headlines: U.S. solar group says Trump tariffs killing jobs; White House says 'fake news'
Description: The U.S. solar industry warned on Tuesday that the Trump administration's tariffs on imported panels will cost the United States 62,000 jobs and $19 billion (£14.81 billion) in investment, an estimate the White House dismissed as "fake news".

Headlines: Factbox: Trump has upended relationships with nine of 10 top U.S. trading partners
Description: During his election campaign in 2016, U.S. President Donald Trump promised to shake up global trade and bring down America's growing trade deficits.

Headlines: Wall Street falls as trade hopes wane
Description: U.S. stocks sold off for a third consecutive session on Tuesday after comments from President Donald Trump and Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross threw cold water on hopes of a possible near-term respite from the market-bruising U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: U.S. has not ruled out imposing tariffs on imported autos: Commerce chief
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Tuesday the Trump administration has not ruled out imposing tariffs on imported autos, after letting a review period end in November with no action.

Headlines: Former Bumble Bee tuna CEO found guilty of price fixing
Description: The former chief executive of Bumble Bee Foods LLC, Chris Lischewski, was found guilty of price-fixing on Tuesday, a court filing showed.

Headlines: United orders 50 new Airbus long-range jets to replace Boeing 757s
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc announced on Tuesday an order for 50 Airbus SE A321XLR jets to fly between the U.S East Coast and Europe, becoming the latest U.S. airline to ink a deal for the European planemaker's new passenger jet.

Headlines: Elon Musk's jury to be queried on opinions of billionaires, visitors to Thailand
Description: Potential jurors in the defamation trial of high-tech entrepreneur Elon Musk may be excused from the case if they voice strong feelings about billionaires or people who visit Thailand.

Headlines: Brazilian investor group Abradin files complaint against Embraer-Boeing deal
Description: A Brazilian group representing minority investors filed a complaint on Tuesday with Brazil's antitrust watchdog CADE against the Embraer-Boeing deal.

Headlines: France's Macron hopeful of settling digital tax dispute with U.S.
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Tuesday he was hopeful that trade and economic disagreements with the United States, including a dispute over France's new digital services tax, could be settled.

Headlines: Cineworld sees lower full-year revenue on weaker box office demand
Description: UK-based international cinema chain Cineworld Group plc on Tuesday warned that revenue for the full year is expected to be slightly below the company's expectations due to weaker box office demand.

Headlines: Battle of the biscuits as Ferrero aims to take a bite out of Barilla
Description: In the red corner is Italy's reigning cookie champion, Barilla's Gocciola. Across the ring in the blue corner is the challenger, Ferrero's Nutella Biscuit. Fight!

Headlines: Daimler cost cuts to hit Germany hardest - Stuttgarter Zeitung
Description: Daimler's workforce in Germany will bear the brunt of 1.4 billion euros ($1.5 billion) in cost cuts planned by the end of 2022, the head of the carmaker's works council told a newspaper.

Headlines: India weighs tougher rules for Boeing 737 MAX on return to flying: source
Description: India is considering setting an experience threshold for pilots who fly Boeing's 737 MAX planes, as it moves to ensure safety once the aircraft returns to service, a senior official of the air safety regulator told Reuters.

Headlines: New U.S. threat of sanctions are bad for global economy - Le Maire
Description: New tariff threats by the United States on certain French products are bad for the global economy, and France is counting upon the solidarity of its European partners as it looks to challenge the move, the French finance minister said.

Headlines: EU ready to respond to U.S. tariff threat on France: Le Maire
Description: The latest U.S. tariff threats on French products are "unacceptable" and the European Union is ready to issue a riposte, French finance minister Bruno Le Maire said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Alibaba raises further $1.7 billion in over-allotted shares in HK listing
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba said on Tuesday it has raised an additional HK$13.17 billion ($1.68 billion) by exercising the over-allotment option in its Hong Kong secondary listing.

Headlines: World's largest pension fund halts stock lending to short sellers
Description: Japan's Government Pension Investment Fund (GPIF), the world's largest pension fund, has suspended stock lending for short selling, calling the practice inconsistent with its responsibilities as a long-term investor.

Headlines: EU says will seek immediate talks with U.S. over French digital tax
Description: The European Union will seek immediate talks with the United States on how to solve a dispute over France's new digital service tax, the EU delegation to the United States said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Huawei faces online storm in China over employee treatment
Description: Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] is facing a public backlash in China after details of the dismissal and wrongful detention of a former employee went viral.

Headlines: EU will act as one over U.S tariffs on France - Commission
Description: The European Union will act as one over planned U.S. tariffs on French goods and believes the World Trade Organization is the best way to settle such disputes, the European Commision said on Tuesday.

Headlines: CNH Industrial's Iveco unveils first electric truck in partnership with Nikola
Description: CNH Industrial's truck unit Iveco on Tuesday unveiled its first electric vehicle, the Nikola Tre, built in partnership with U.S. startup Nikola Motor Co..

Headlines: U.S. services sector, private payrolls growth slow
Description: U.S. services sector activity slowed in November as lingering concerns about trade tensions and worker shortages pushed production to its lowest level in a decade, which could heighten fears about the economy's health.

Headlines: Exclusive: Alibaba-backed startup AutoX applies for driver-less test permit in California
Description: Chinese startup AutoX, backed by e-commerce giant Alibaba, has applied to test self-driving vehicles without an in-car backup driver in California, the first challenger to Alphabet Inc's autonomous driving venture Waymo to say it has done so.

Headlines: Exclusive: WeWork China sets out bold 2020 sales targets at meeting - sources
Description: WeWork China has set out ambitious revenue goals for 2020 even though it faces staff cutbacks and weak occupancy numbers at its properties across China, sources familiar with the matter said, citing targets announced by the division's general manager at an internal meeting in Shanghai on Wednesday.

Headlines: Airbnb to process EU payments via Luxembourg as Brexit looms
Description: Airbnb will process payments between hosts and guests for the European Union through Luxembourg as of 2020, as the home rental giant prepares for Britain's departure from the bloc, Luxembourg for Finance said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Bombardier on track to meet 2019 Global 7500 business jet delivery targets: executive
Description: Canada's Bombardier will hit its 2019 delivery targets for its Global 7500 business jet, as the company redirects manpower from other planes to its flagship corporate aircraft program, an executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil jumps 3% on U.S. stockpiles drop; further OPEC output cuts seen
Description: Oil prices surged more than 3% on Wednesday on expectations that OPEC and allied producers would extend production curbs, and as U.S. government data showed a large drop in domestic crude stockpiles.

Headlines: Amazon faces U.S. antitrust scrutiny on cloud business: Bloomberg
Description: U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has broadened scrutiny of Amazon.com Inc beyond its retail operations to include cloud-computing business, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Peloton's Christmas ad mocked as sexist
Description: Exercise bike maker Peloton Interactive Inc said on Wednesday it was encouraged by support from some customers and social media users, despite its Christmas ad coming under criticism for being "sexist" and "dystopian".

Headlines: BMW sues air conditioning suppliers over price fixing
Description: BMW is suing two of its suppliers over price fixing on air conditioning components, the German carmaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: As Citgo profit rises, pressure to restore dividend grows - sources
Description: Citgo Petroleum Corp's directors are unlikely to bow to pressure this week to resume dividend payments, two sources close to the discussions said, as the refiner cannot yet help Venezuela's interim government ease creditors' claims against its parent PDVSA that also are threatening its assets.

Headlines: Under Pichai, Alphabet's moonshot projects may face more scrutiny
Description: Alphabet's leadership change has some investors hoping that the owner of Google will take a hard look at the cash-burning ventures championed by its founders.

Headlines: U.S. service sector slows more than expected in November
Description: U.S. services sector activity slowed more than expected in November amid lingering concerns about trade tensions and worker shortages, which could revive fears about the economy's health.

Headlines: Factbox: New Alphabet chief started at Google, made name with Android
Description: Google Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai will replace company co-founder Larry Page as CEO of parent Alphabet Inc, the company said in a blog post on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump says Huawei is a security risk as NATO seeks secure 5G
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Chinese telecommunication firm Huawei was a security risk after NATO said it needed secure next-generation 5G technology.

Headlines: Robinhood democratizes stocks for younger generations, co-founder says
Description: "People are paying lower prices and that's something that's gone beyond Robinhood and is now available to tens of millions of consumers across the U.S.," co-CEO Vladimir Tenev says.

Headlines: Qualcomm to appeal record South Korean anti-trust fine
Description: Qualcomm said it would appeal a South Korean court decision on Wednesday to uphold a record $873 million fine against the U.S. chip giant for unfair business practices related to patent licensing and modem chip sales.

Headlines: OPEC, Russia debate deeper oil cuts as new glut looms
Description: OPEC and its allies led by Russia are gearing up to approve deeper oil production cuts this week to prevent a new glut and a collapse on oil prices with OPEC member Iraq saying the move was supported by key members.

Headlines: China's Postal Savings Bank says some retail investors opt out of Shanghai listing
Description: Postal Savings Bank of China said investors had opted out of paying for 3% of shares on offer in its Shanghai listing - a rare development that underscores growing concerns over problems in China's banking system.

Headlines: China capex growth hits three-year low as weak economy, trade war drag
Description: Capital investment by Chinese firms has ground to its slowest pace in three years, as a weakening economy, tight credit and prolonged trade war with the United States dent sales growth and cash reserves, a Reuters analysis showed.

Headlines: South Africa's Grand Parade loses appetite for Burger King
Description: Grand Parade Investments (GPI) Ltd , which holds the Burger King franchise in South Africa, said on Wednesday it was in talks to sell a stake in the business, without giving a reason.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade talks are 'on track': Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday that trade talks with China are on track, with deputy negotiators from both countries holding a call Thursday as they actively worked toward a deal, but he said the United States is not bound to a deadline.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit shrinks sharply; labor market tight
Description: The U.S. trade deficit dropped to its lowest level in nearly 1-1/2 years in October, suggesting trade could contribute to economic growth in the fourth quarter, though a broad decline in imports hinted at a slowdown in domestic demand.

Headlines: Factbox: Alphabet's 'Other bets' in focus as Google's Pichai takes helm
Description: Google Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai will replace Larry Page as CEO of parent Alphabet Inc, heralding a new chapter for the company that helped reshape the global tech industry under its co-founders Page and Sergey Brin.

Headlines: Huawei mounts legal challenge against FCC over rural carrier customers
Description: China's Huawei mounted a legal challenge against the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) on Thursday after the body designated the technology giant as a security threat and moved to bar it from a government subsidy program.

Headlines: Global stocks falter on trade uncertainty; sterling gains
Description: The dollar slid and global equity markets traded little changed on Thursday as enthusiasm over Apple shares was offset by doubts about the likelihood of a "phase one" trade deal before a new round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports begins in 10 days.

Headlines: Tiffany profit falls short on weak demand in Americas, Hong Kong
Description: Luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co , which is being bought by Louis Vuitton owner LVMH , missed market expectations for quarterly profit and sales on Thursday, hit by lower spending by foreign tourists in the United States and Hong Kong.

Headlines: CBS, Viacom complete merger in a win for Shari Redstone
Description: CBS Corp and Viacom Inc completed their merger on Wednesday, reuniting media mogul Sumner Redstone's U.S. entertainment empire.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including China trade fears, Salesforce co-CEO
Description: CNBC's Jim Cramer says China is a "much smaller issue than most people seem to realize," chats with Salesforce co-CEO Keith Block after the cloud company's earnings and offers stock buying advice to callers.

Headlines: Japan launches $122 billion stimulus to fight trade risks, post-Olympic slump
Description: Japan's cabinet approved a $122 billion fiscal package on Thursday to support stalling growth in the world's third-largest economy amid offshore risks and as policymakers look to sustain activity beyond the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.

Headlines: Gazing into the recession crystal ball
Description: The protracted trade war between China and the United States and a deteriorating global growth outlook have left investors nervous that the longest expansion in American history is at risk of ending.

Headlines: Western, Chinese consumers divided on electric, self-driving cars -survey
Description: Automakers, ride-hailing and technology companies plowing money into the development of electric, self-driving and shared car services will find more enthusiastic consumers in China than in Europe and the United States, a survey on Thursday showed.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco prices shares at top of range in world's biggest IPO
Description: RIYADH/DUBAI Reuters - State-owned oil giant Saudi Aramco's initial public offering (IPO) will be the biggest in history, but will fall short of the towering $2 trillion valuation long sought by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

Headlines: Chinese defy Hong Kong's protest gloom in hunt for bargain stocks
Description: Chinese investors more than doubled their Hong Kong stocks purchases this year, braving market headwinds from violent street protests and the protracted Sino-U.S. trade war, which have battered the Asian financial hub's economy.

Headlines: Labor group accuses Google of illegally firing workers to stifle unionism
Description: The Communications Workers of America union filed a federal labor charge against Alphabet Inc's Google on Thursday, accusing the company of unlawfully firing four employees to deter workers from engaging in union activities.

Headlines: Strong U.S. job growth showcases economy's resilience
Description: U.S. job growth increased by the most in 10 months in November as the healthcare industry boosted hiring and production workers at General Motors returned to work after a strike, the strongest sign yet the economy is in no danger of stalling.

Headlines: Strong U.S. job growth showcases economy's resilience
Description: U.S. job growth increased by the most in 10 months in November as the healthcare industry boosted hiring and production workers at General Motors returned to work after a strike, the strongest sign yet the economy is in no danger of stalling.

Headlines: Amazon websites could be added to USTR's 'Notorious Markets' list: WSJ
Description: The Trump administration is considering putting some of Amazon.com Inc's overseas websites on a list of global marketplaces known for counterfeit goods, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: What deeper OPEC+ oil output cuts mean for the market
Description: Saudi Arabia and Russia led a deal on Friday in which OPEC and its allies committed to deeper oil output cuts in the first quarter of 2020 aiming to avert oversupply and support prices.

Headlines: Returning General Motors workers seen boosting U.S. November payrolls
Description: U.S. job growth likely accelerated in November as former striking workers returned to General Motors' payrolls, which would confirm that the economy remained on a moderate expansion path despite a prolonged manufacturing slump.

Headlines: Global stocks rally, dollar gains on robust U.S. jobs data
Description: The dollar rose and global equity markets jumped on Friday after data showed U.S. job growth increased by the most in 10 months in November, putting to rest recession fears and briefly taking the spotlight off contentious U.S.-China trade talks.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Tariff deadline keeps focus on trade as 2019 draws to close
Description: The stock market looks set to end 2019 the way it began the year -- highly sensitive to headlines from President Donald Trump's global trade war.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including looming earnings, Dec. 15 tariffs, Boot Barn
Description: CNBC's Jim Cramer looks at the week ahead in company earnings and stock market news, sits down with Boot Barn CEO Jim Conroy to get insight into its brick-and-mortar plans and says President Trump should authorize the Dec. 15 tariff hike.

Headlines: Tesla Inc boss Elon Musk wins defamation trial over 'pedo guy' tweet
Description: A U.S. District Court jury in Los Angeles on Friday found in favor of Tesla Inc boss Elon Musk in the defamation lawsuit brought against him by a British cave explorer who Musk had branded a "pedo guy" on Twitter.

Headlines: Italy's Atlantia interested in relaunch not rescue of Alitalia: paper
Description: Italy's Atlantia is still interested in supporting the relaunch, and not the rescue, of ailing carrier Alitalia [CAITLA.UL], the chairman of the infrastructure group said in an interview on Friday.

Headlines: Indonesia fines Garuda after CEO fired over smuggled Harley Davidson
Description: Indonesia will fine flag carrier PT Garuda Indonesia for violating aviation rules after its chief executive was accused of smuggling a Harley Davidson motorcycle onboard a new plane, state news agency Antara cited the transport minister as saying.

Headlines: China-built Tesla cars secure new energy vehicle subsidies
Description: Tesla Inc said on Friday its Chinese-built Model 3 cars would receive state subsidies, a move that will help the U.S. electric vehicle maker's push into the world's biggest auto market.

Headlines: Cramer's week ahead: 'Amazing' jobs report gives us a break from China trade news
Description: "When we get an amazing employment report, we can take a break from the on-again, off-again China news and just focus on earnings," "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's Dongfeng plans partial sale of PSA stake - sources
Description: China's Dongfeng Motor will likely trim its stake in Peugeot owner PSA after hiring banks to study options, people close to the matter said, in a move that could ease the French carmaker's planned merger with Fiat Chrysler (FCA) .

Headlines: Fed voters a less-hawkish bunch in 2020, lowering bar for U.S. rate cut
Description: The bar for cutting U.S. interest rates may get a little lower next year when a new crop of central bankers rotate into voting spots on the Federal Reserve's policy-setting panel as part of its annual membership reshuffle.

Headlines: Britain's Phoenix to buy Swiss Re's ReAssure business for $4.1 billion
Description: Phoenix Group Holdings has agreed to buy the British ReAssure business of Swiss Re for 3.2 billion pounds ($4.1 billion) in cash and shares, the UK insurer's biggest deal to date as it bulks up on policies closed to new customers.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's SenseTime expects $750 mln 2019 revenue despite U.S. ban - sources
Description: Chinese artificial intelligence (AI) start-up SenseTime, which Washington put on a trade blacklist in October, expects its 2019 revenue to increase by more than 200% year-on-year to around $750 million, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. Nov payrolls up by most in 10 months
Description: U.S. job growth increased by the most in 10 months in November as former striking workers returned to General Motors' payrolls and the healthcare industry stepped up hiring, confirming that the economy remained on a moderate expansion path despite a prolonged manufacturing slump.

Headlines: China's November trade surplus with U.S. at $24.60 billion vs $26.45 billion in October
Description: China's trade surplus with the United States for November stood at $24.60 billion, Reuters calculation based on Chinese customs data showed on Sunday, easing from the previous month's surplus of $26.45 billion.

Headlines: Fiat appeals to Europe's top court against $33 million EU tax order
Description: Carmaker Fiat Chrysler has lodged an appeal with Europe's top court against an EU order to pay 30 million euros ($33 million) in Luxembourg back-taxes, seeking to overturn a lower tribunal ruling backing EU antitrust regulators.

Headlines: China copper imports hit 13-month high in November on improved factory activity
Description: China's copper imports rose 12.1% in November from the previous month to their highest in more than a year, as an unexpected improvement in the manufacturing sector drove up demand.

Headlines: China's November coal imports slump 19% month-on-month on port curbs
Description: China's coal imports plunged 19% in November from the previous month as tighter import rules at ports curbed shipments towards the year's end.

Headlines: U.S. banks' reluctance to lend cash may have caused repo shock: BIS
Description: The unwillingness of the top four U.S. banks to lend cash combined with a burst of demand from hedge funds for secured funding could explain a recent spike in U.S. money market rates, the Bank for International Settlements said.

Headlines: Japan's markets watchdog likely to recommend $22 million fine against Nissan: NHK
Description: Japan's markets watchdog will likely recommend soon that the financial regulator fine Nissan Motor Co Ltd about 2.4 billion yen ($22 million) over false reporting on its financial statement, public broadcaster NHK reported on Sunday.

Headlines: China November exports fall, but import growth hints of recovering demand
Description: China's exports in November shrank for the fourth consecutive month, underscoring persistent pressures on manufacturers from the Sino-U.S. war but growth in imports may be a sign that Beijing's stimulus steps are helping to stoke demand.

Headlines: As Fed reiterates rate pause, forecasts likely to be blown off course
Description: Friday's booming U.S. jobs report should give the Federal Reserve all it needs to stick to its plan not to cut interest rates further in the near future, so when U.S. central bankers meet this week, most of the focus will be on their outlook for next year and beyond.

Headlines: China November crude oil imports hit record high as refiners race to use up quotas
Description: China's crude oil imports hit a record high on a daily basis in November, as refiners operated at high run rates to use up annual import quotas.

Headlines: J&J CEO spurns U.S. congressional hearing on carcinogens in talc products
Description: Johnson & Johnson Chief Executive Officer Alex Gorsky has declined to appear at a U.S. congressional hearing set for Tuesday on the safety of the company's Baby Powder and other talc-based cosmetics.

Headlines: Wall St. falls as Apple, health shares drag, tariff deadline looms
Description: U.S. stocks pulled back on Monday from near-record levels, as Apple and healthcare shares fell and investors braced for a busy week of political and economic news, including a potential turning point in the U.S.-China trade dispute.

Headlines: Sprint tells of business struggles in first day of T-Mobile merger trial
Description: Executives from Sprint Corp testified on Monday that the U.S. wireless carrier has struggled to improve its network, hindering its growth and underscoring the need to merge with larger rival T-Mobile US Inc.

Headlines: Mexico asks Pelosi to act on trade deal, business groups wary
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Monday urged U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to decide on ratification of a North American trade pact, even as Mexican business groups fretted that proposed changes were weakening the deal.

Headlines: Jim Cramer: Be ready to buy stocks if this Fed, tariff scenario happens
Description: If the Fed teases potential interest rate hikes and Trump follows through on higher tariffs, "you have to be ready to buy [stocks]," Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: Former Boeing employee who warned about 737 problems will testify at hearing
Description: A former Boeing Co employee who warned of problems with 737 production will testify on Wednesday at a U.S. House hearing on the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) review of the grounded 737 MAX.

Headlines: Global stocks, gold little changed as trade war spurs concerns
Description: Global equity markets traded flat on Monday on hopes officials would delay more U.S. tariffs set to take effect on Chinese goods this coming Sunday, while gold held firm as investors hedged against a possible escalation in the trade war.

Headlines: Australia's Westpac faces investor rage after exploitation payment scandal
Description: Australia's Westpac Banking Corp faces a showdown with investors at its annual meeting this week, seeking to hold back an avalanche of outrage over a money laundering scandal that includes accusations of enabling child exploitation payments.

Headlines: Volkswagen charged with violating vehicle emission standards in Canada
Description: German automaker Volkswagen AG on Monday was charged with importing nearly 128,000 vehicles into Canada contravening the country's environmental legislation, a Canadian government agency said.

Headlines: Amazon lawsuit blames Trump for loss of Pentagon cloud contract
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Monday accused U.S. President Donald Trump of exerting "improper pressure" and bias that led the Department of Defense to award a lucrative $10 billion cloud contract to rival Microsoft Corp.

Headlines: Flying cars could lure investors away from ground-based services: survey
Description: Electric air taxis — known colloquially, if somewhat misleadingly, as "flying cars" — could draw millions of investor dollars away from ground-based transportation start-up firms in 2020, according to a study released on Monday.

Headlines: Swelling U.S. IPO backlog points to crowded 2020 field
Description: More and more companies are putting plans for U.S. initial public offerings (IPO) on ice this year because of investor pushback against their valuations, creating a backlog that could make stock market debuts more challenging in 2020.

Headlines: U.S. consumer inflation expectations rebound from five-year low: NY Fed
Description: U.S. consumers' inflation expectations rose slightly in November, bringing the outlook for near and medium-term inflation up from a five-year low in a New York Federal Reserve survey, potentially offering relief to policymakers worried about sagging inflation.

Headlines: France's Sanofi to buy biotech firm Synthorx for $2.5 billion
Description: France's Sanofi on Monday agreed to buy California-headquartered biotechnology firm Synthorx in a cash deal worth about $2.5 billion as it steps up a push in the lucrative field of cancer drugs under its new chief executive.

Headlines: Brazil's weak currency, cheaper credit add to Amazon threats
Description: Brazil's record-low interest rates and exchange rate threaten to accelerate Amazon deforestation, which has already risen sharply under Brazil's farm-friendly President Jair Bolsonaro, economists tell Reuters.

Headlines: Canada to present fiscal update before Christmas: finance minister
Description: Canada's new minority Liberal government will present a fiscal update before the Christmas break, although no date has been set, Finance Minister Bill Morneau said on Monday.

Headlines: Walmart Chile pulls court requests for police protection, but warns looting continues
Description: Walmart in Chile on Monday pulled requests it filed earlier with Chilean courts demanding police protection for its supermarkets, but said looting of its stores continued and that the situation following weeks of unrest remained "complex."

Headlines: Global stocks, dollar slip as U.S.-China trade deadline looms
Description: The dollar eased and global stock markets slipped on Tuesday as uncertainty kept risk appetite in check days ahead of the Dec. 15 deadline for a new round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department to review Google's deal for Fitbit: source
Description: The U.S. Justice Department will review plans by Alphabet Inc-owned Google to buy fitness tracker maker Fitbit Inc for possible antitrust issues, a source told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street slips as tariff deadline closes in
Description: Wall Street's main stock indexes ended slightly lower on Tuesday, though not far from record highs, as investors awaited concrete news on whether a new round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods would take effect on Dec. 15, a potential turning point in a trade dispute between the world's two largest economies that has convulsed markets.

Headlines: U.S. senators threaten Facebook, Apple with encryption regulation
Description: U.S. senators grilled Apple Inc and Facebook Inc executives over their encryption practices on Tuesday and threatened to regulate the technology unless the companies make encrypted user data accessible to law enforcement.

Headlines: Powell's 'half-full' U.S. glass sturdy but still at risk for spills as Fed meets
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has taken a glass-half-full view of the U.S. economy but the trouble may be that the glass has gotten smaller and has a few cracks.

Headlines: Trump will have final say on U.S.-China trade deal: White House trade adviser
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will be the one to make the final decision on tariffs and the U.S.-China trade deal, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Deutsche Telekom CEO denies T-Mobile/Sprint deal will reduce competition
Description: T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp did not pursue a merger in order to reduce price competition in the U.S. wireless market, the chief executive of Deutsche Telekom, T-Mobile's majority shareholder, testified on Tuesday in federal court in Manhattan.

Headlines: Cramer: Trade uncertainty gives investors chance to buy stocks at discount
Description: Predicting President Trump's next move in the U.S.-China trade war is a difficult task, CNBC's Jim Cramer said. But investors can use that uncertainty to their advantage, he says.

Headlines: Chevron expects $10 billion-$11 billion charge in fourth quarter; plans asset sales
Description: U.S. oil major Chevron Corp on Tuesday said it expects to write down the value of its assets $10 billion to $11 billion this quarter and is considering selling some natural gas projects to prepare for long term low prices.

Headlines: Netflix could lose four million U.S. subscribers in 2020: brokerage
Description: Needham and Co was the fourth Wall Street brokerage in two months to cut its rating for Netflix Inc on Tuesday, arguing competition from new streaming services could lead to the loss of 4 million premium U.S. subscribers next year.

Headlines: Japan's markets watchdog recommends $22 million fine for Nissan over Ghosn pay
Description: Japan's markets watchdog said on Tuesday it has recommended that Nissan Motor Co Ltd be fined about 2.4 billion yen ($22 million) over the underreporting of former chairman Carlos Ghosn's compensation.

Headlines: U.S. trade offensive takes out WTO as global arbiter
Description: U.S. disruption of the global economic order reaches a major milestone on Tuesday as the World Trade Organization (WTO) loses its ability to intervene in trade wars, threatening the future of the Geneva-based body.

Headlines: U.S. third-quarter labor cost growth cut; productivity soft
Description: Growth of U.S. labor costs was not as robust as initially thought in the third quarter, suggesting inflation could remain tame in the near term.

Headlines: Deutsche paints gloomy picture at investor gathering
Description: Deutsche Bank pared back its revenue growth target on Tuesday, highlighting the tough task facing Germany's biggest lender to revive its fortunes against a gloomy economic backdrop.

Headlines: Choppy markets leave U.S. bank bonus decisions in limbo
Description: December is always a month of suspense on Wall Street, as dealmakers, traders and money managers at big U.S. banks wait to find out how much they will receive in bonuses.

Headlines: U.S. productivity weak in third quarter; labor costs revised lower
Description: U.S. worker productivity fell by the most in nearly four years in the third quarter, the government confirmed, while growth in unit labor costs was not as robust as initially thought.

Headlines: Huawei's CFO wins Canada court fight to see more documents on her arrest
Description: Lawyers for Huawei’s chief financial officer have won a court battle after a judge asked Canada’s attorney general to hand over more evidence and documents relating to the arrest of Meng Wanzhou, according to a court ruling released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Global stocks rise after Fed keeps rates on hold; oil falls
Description: Global equity markets rose on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve indicated interest rates would remain on hold for some time - a positive for risk assets - while oil prices fell after data showed an unexpected increase in U.S. crude inventories.

Headlines: Porsche's electric Taycan draws interest from 30,000 buyers: Handelsblatt
Description: Porsche has taken down payments from 30,000 customers in Europe for its Taycan, the luxury car maker's first fully electric model, CEO Oliver Blume told Germany's Handelsblatt newspaper.

Headlines: Home Depot says peak investments to pressure 2020 margins
Description: Home Depot Inc , the No. 1 U.S. home improvement chain, on Wednesday forecast 2020 sales below Wall Street expectations and said major investments in its online overhaul program would pressure margins next year.

Headlines: Factbox: How the North American trade deal will affect labor, environment, drugs
Description: New amendments to the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement (USMCA) focus heavily on stronger labor enforcement, outlining a detailed process to address any allegations that Mexican factories are violating workers' rights.

Headlines: Continental Resources founder Hamm to step down as CEO
Description: Legendary U.S. oilman Harold Hamm, who once called the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries a "toothless tiger," will step down as chief executive of Continental Resources and become its executive chairman, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler's UAW members ratify new four-year contract
Description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) union said on Wednesday that rank-and-file members at Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV have voted in favor of a new four-year labor contract with the automaker, helping the Italian-American firm avoid a strike as it works to merge with France's Groupe PSA.

Headlines: High-stakes White House meeting expected Thursday to debate U.S.-China tariffs: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to meet with top trade advisers on Thursday to discuss planned Dec. 15 tariffs on some $160 billion in Chinese goods, three sources familiar with the plans said, as markets braced for potential negative impacts.

Headlines: Australia tells Facebook and Google to commit to competition rules, or else
Description: Australia said on Thursday technology giants such as Facebook Inc and Google will have to agree to new rules to ensure they do not abuse their market power and damage competition, or the government will impose new controls on them.

Headlines: Nestle sells U.S. ice cream brands to joint venture Froneri in $4 billion deal
Description: Nestle SA has agreed to sell its U.S. ice cream business to Froneri in a deal valued at $4 billion, moving control of brands including Häagen-Dazs to a joint venture the Swiss group set up in 2016.

Headlines: Oil drops on surprise U.S. crude build but tariff deadline eyed
Description: Oil prices dropped almost 1% on Wednesday following a surprise build in U.S. crude inventories, and as investors waited to see if a fresh round of tariffs by Washington on Chinese goods would come into force on Sunday.

Headlines: Gasoline, rents lift U.S. consumer inflation in November
Description: U.S. consumer prices increased solidly in November, which together with labor market strength could support the Federal Reserve's intention to keep interest rates steady indefinitely after reducing borrowing costs three times this year.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs names new head of Johannesburg office
Description: U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs has appointed Jonathan Penkin as head of its Johannesburg office, the bank's base for sub-Saharan Africa where the current chief executive is retiring at the end of the year.

Headlines: U.S. government posts $209 billion deficit in November
Description: The U.S. federal government recorded a $209 billion budget deficit in November as an increase in spending on programs like public health insurance outpaced gains in revenues, the Treasury Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: NYSE files amended direct listings proposal
Description: The New York Stock Exchange on Wednesday filed an amended proposal for a rule change that would allow U.S direct listings to raise new capital like in an initial public offering (IPO).

Headlines: Germany's Warburg offers to repay money in sham trading trial
Description: MM Warburg, part-owned by one of Germany's oldest banking dynasties, offered on Wednesday to repay some gains from a share trading scheme at the center of the country's biggest post-war fraud case, a letter seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices increase more than expected in November
Description: U.S. consumer prices rose more than expected in November, which could further support the Federal Reserve's intention not to cut interest rates again in the near term after reducing borrowing costs three times this year.

Headlines: Germany to repay customers of insolvent Thomas Cook
Description: Germany will give financial assistance to customers hit by the insolvency of Thomas Cook because the tour operator's insurance cover has proved insufficient, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: JPMorgan to revamp wealth management business: WSJ
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co is combining its U.S. wealth-management operations for affluent clients and the Chase branch network's financial-advisory business into a new unit, The Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing a memo.

Headlines: U.S. reaches deal in principle on trade with China: source
Description: The United States has reached a "phase-one" trade deal in principle with China, a source briefed on talks between the two nations said on Thursday, saying a statement from the White House was expected soon.

Headlines: Subaru CEO expects record U.S. sales in 2020 despite market slowdown
Description: Subaru Corp expects its U.S. vehicle sales to rise to a record high in 2020, as demand for its SUV crossover models helps it buck the trend of slowing car sales in the Japanese automaker's biggest market.

Headlines: Repo is Wall Street's big year-end worry. Why?
Description: The $2.2 trillion repurchase agreement market - part of the inner workings of the U.S. financial system - is facing what could be another strain as the year comes to a close. That could have wider implications than just Wall Street.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices tepid; jobless claims at more than two-year high
