Description: After years of reconnaissance, China's retail king Alibaba is finally making its move on Europe. It is undercutting Amazon sellers' fees to attract vendors but has had mixed results, six sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Lebanon says it will take the necessary steps over Interpol red notice for ex-Nissan boss Ghosn
Description: Lebanon's public prosecutor has received an Interpol red notice over fugitive ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn and will take the necessary steps, caretaker justice minister Albert Serhan said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Toyota to build prototype city of the future in Japan
Description: Toyota Motor Corp said on Monday it planned to build a prototype "city of the future" at the base of Japan's Mt. Fuji, powered by hydrogen fuel cells and functioning as a laboratory for autonomous cars, "smart homes," artificial intelligence and other technologies.

Headlines: Explainer: Ghosn to 'speak freely' after his escape; what's in store?
Description: Ousted Nissan Motor Co Ltd boss Carlos Ghosn is set to hold on Wednesday his first live news conference since his arrest in November 2018 on financial misconduct charges, saying his escape from Japan has meant he can communicate "freely".

Headlines: Japan to do utmost to have Ghosn return for trial: ministry official
Description: Japanese legal officials are poring over Lebanese laws in a bid to find a way to return ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn to Japan, a Ministry of Justice senior official said on Tuesday, adding that Tokyo will do its utmost to have him face trial on financial misconduct charges.

Headlines: Nissan bolsters taskforce to prepare for Ghosn broadsides: sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co has strengthened a taskforce of senior officials ahead of an expected onslaught of criticism from former chairman Carlos Ghosn following his dramatic escape from house arrest in Japan, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Takata recalls 10 million U.S. replacement air bag inflators
Description: Takata is recalling 10 million replacement air bag inflators in the United States, the largest ever auto safety recall in history, as U.S. regulators consider whether to make it even wider.

Headlines: McDonald's expands Beyond Meat plant-based burger trials in Canada
Description: McDonald's Corp said on Wednesday it will expand its trial in Canada of vegan burgers made by Beyond Meat as the world's biggest fast food chain tests the viability of a broader rollout.

Headlines: Would consider traveling to France with guarantees: Ghosn
Description: Former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn, asked in a French television interview if he would be willing to face trial in France, says he would maybe travel if he knew he would not face problems at the border.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker seeks ban on intelligence sharing with countries that use Huawei
Description: U.S. Senator Tom Cotton on Wednesday introduced a bill that would prevent the United States from sharing intelligence with countries that allow Chinese telecoms giant Huawei Technologies to operate 5G network technology within their borders, according to a copy of the bill seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Ghosn: Seeds of Renault-Nissan crisis were sown by Macron's move
Description: Ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn said on Wednesday that a surprise corporate move, orchestrated five years ago by French President Emmanuel Macron who was then economy minister, soured relations between Renault and Nissan and contributed to his ouster.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz names Campbell executive to head U.S. business
Description: Kraft Heinz Co on Wednesday named Campbell Soup Co executive Carlos Abrams-Rivera president of its U.S. business, the Heinz ketchup maker's latest executive hire as it aims to revitalize its business after a troubling year.

Headlines: Ghosn says can help Lebanon as gets prosecutor summons
Description: Ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn has been summoned for questioning by a Lebanese public prosecutor over an Interpol notice issued by Japan calling for his arrest on financial misconduct charges after he fled last month ahead of his trial.

Headlines: Walgreens misses profit estimates on pharmacy weakness, shares fall 7%
Description: Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc's quarterly profit missed Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, hit by lower payments from insurers on drugs sold at its U.S. pharmacies, knocking back its shares and those of rival CVS Health Corp .

Headlines: Seeking justice: the legal risks facing fugitive Carlos Ghosn
Description: Carlos Ghosn said on Wednesday he was the victim of a conspiracy to oust him from the helm of automaker Nissan and escaped from Japan because he could not defend himself against baseless charges of financial misconduct.

Headlines: Fugitive ex-Nissan boss Ghosn hits out at carmaker and Japan
Description: Carlos Ghosn, speaking publicly for the first time since his dramatic escape from Japanese justice, said on Wednesday he had been treated "brutally" by Tokyo prosecutors and was the victim of an inside job to oust him from the helm of automaker Nissan.

Headlines: Former Nissan boss Ghosn points the finger at news conference
Description: Fugitive former Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn said that he was brought down by a plot cooked up at the company, some of whose executives he named at a news conference in Beirut on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: Financial wrongdoing allegations against Carlos Ghosn
Description: Carlos Ghosn, the ousted boss of the Renault-Nissan carmaking alliance who fled house arrest in Japan last week, denies the allegations of financial misconduct made against him.

Headlines: U.S. outlines strong support for self-driving cars at CES
Description: The Trump administration on Wednesday signaled strong support for self-driving vehicles as it released new guidance from federal agencies at the annual CES tech conference.

Headlines: Timeline: From arrest to flight - key dates in the Ghosn affair
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn decided to flee Japan after learning his trial had been delayed until April 2021 and also because he had not been allowed to speak to his wife, sources close to Ghosn told Reuters.

Headlines: Malaysia anti-graft body says audio clips show Najib tried to cover-up 1MDB scandal
Description: Malaysia’s former prime minister, Najib Razak, allegedly sought help from the United Arab Emirates' crown prince to fake evidence to cover up for the 1MDB scandal, according to audio clips revealed by Malaysian anti-graft officials on Wednesday.

Headlines: Geely, Mercedes-Benz launch $780 million JV to make electric smart-branded cars
Description: Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co Ltd and Mercedes-Benz on Wednesday said they would each invest 2.7 billion yuan ($388.77 million) in a China-based venture to build "premium and intelligent electrified" vehicles under the smart brand.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee seeks more of China market, launches equity deals worth $821 million
Description: Luckin Coffee Inc said it is expanding into vending machines that sell freshly brewed hot beverages and snacks, seeking even more of the China market after overtaking Starbucks Corp as the country's biggest coffee chain by number of stores.

Headlines: 'Shot across the bow': U.S. steps up pressure on UK ahead of Huawei decision
Description: The United States is making a final pitch to Britain ahead of a UK decision on whether to upgrade its telecoms network with Huawei equipment, amid threats to cut intelligence-sharing ties, people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. private payrolls post largest gain in eight months
Description: U.S. private payrolls increased by the most in eight months in December, pointing to sustained labor market strength though job gains last month were likely flattered by a seasonal quirk.

Headlines: Tokyo prosecutors say no conspiracy with Nissan, Ghosn failed to justify his acts
Description: Tokyo prosecutors struck back at ousted Nissan Motor boss Carlos Ghosn on Thursday, saying his allegations of a conspiracy between prosecutors and the automaker were false and that he had failed to justify his acts.

Headlines: Ghosn ready to help Lebanon if asked
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn said on Wednesday he was ready to use his expertise if asked to help Lebanon, which is reeling from a deep economic and financial crisis.

Headlines: Turkish jet firm met Japan ambassador to offer help with Ghosn
Description: The Turkish operator of private jets that ex-Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn used to escape Japan said on Wednesday it met with the Japanese ambassador to Turkey and offered to collaborate with the authorities in that country over the incident.

Headlines: Two U.S. auto trade groups merge as regulatory issues loom
Description: Two major U.S. automotive trade groups said Wednesday they will merge as the industry faces dramatic challenges, including regulatory, trade and emissions issues.

Headlines: Trump's tariffs cost U.S. companies $46 billion to date, data shows
Description: Tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump to restructure the United States's top trade relationships have cost American companies $46 billion since February 2018, and U.S. exports of goods hit by retaliatory tariffs have fallen sharply, according to an analysis of Commerce Department data.

Headlines: IKEA enters UK shopping centers market with London mall deal
Description: IKEA's shopping center business is spending 170 million pounds ($222 million) to buy and upgrade a London mall in its first foray into Britain, betting it can win over a nation increasingly doing its shopping online.

Headlines: Trump says he may wait to finish Phase 2 China trade deal until after November
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said his administration will start negotiating the Phase 2 U.S.-China trade agreement soon but that he might wait to complete any agreement until after November's U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: Kinder Morgan sells Pembina shares for $764 million
Description: Pipeline operator Kinder Morgan Inc said on Thursday it sold the 25 million shares in Canada's Pembina Pipeline Corp that it received when Pembina bought Kinder Morgan Canada for $764 million.

Headlines: NY Fed's Williams says central bank can avert 'downward trend' in inflation expectations
Description: U.S. central bank officials need to hold themselves accountable and boost communication of their strategy as they grapple with the challenge of preventing inflation - and inflation expectations - from falling too low, a senior Fed official said Thursday.

Headlines: Global stocks scale records, oil dips as investors hail easing of Mideast tensions
Description: Crude oil prices slid and equity markets around the world set new highs on Thursday as investors took on greater risk in a relief rally after the United States and Iran moved to defuse escalating tensions in the Middle East.

Headlines: Blackstone raises three-quarters of targeted $4.6 billion life sciences fund
Description: U.S. private equity firm Blackstone Group Inc has secured $3.4 billion from investors for its first fund dedicated to investments in the life sciences sector, targeting $4.6 billion in total, a regulatory filing showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street notches records on trade optimism, Apple gains
Description: Major U.S. stock indexes registered record closing highs on Thursday as optimism about a U.S.-China trade deal firmed and as Apple and other market heavyweights posted strong gains.

Headlines: Waymo secures bigger award against workers who went to rival Uber
Description: Alphabet Inc's Waymo said on Thursday that arbitrators had finalized a judgment of $128 million, plus undisclosed legal costs and interest, against two former employees who went to rival Uber Technologies Inc.

Headlines: Concerns over U.S. Latecoere purchase overblown: Dassault CEO
Description: Concerns among French lawmakers about aerospace firm Latecoere's sale to a U.S. fund are "overblown", the head of its major client Dassault Aviation said on Thursday.

Headlines: Jim Cramer: Tyson Foods could become the biggest winner from the US-China trade deal
Description: China's pork shortage is a boon for Tyson Foods and the meat producer's earnings projections may need to be increased, the "Mad Money" host said.

Headlines: Chairman Mao's favored Red Flag carmaker eyes 1 million customers by 2030
Description: China's FAW Group [SASACJ.UL] aims to double its annual sales of Chairman Mao Zedong's carmaker of choice, Hongqi, or Red Flag, to 200,000 units this year and grow them further to 1 million cars in the next decade, its chairman Xu Liuping said.

Headlines: ABN Amro names PwC's former Dutch chairman as new CEO
Description: ABN Amro said on Thursday that Robert Swaak, a former chairman of accounting firm PwC in the Netherlands, is to succeed Kees van Dijkhuizen as the Dutch bank's chief executive.

Headlines: Exclusive: India reviewing anti-trust complaint against Maruti Suzuki over car insurance - sources
Description: India's antitrust regulator is looking into allegations that Maruti Suzuki , the country's biggest car maker, pushes buyers to purchase insurance policies offered by the company, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Divergent paths: Oil, natural gas going different directions
Description: The diverging fundamentals of U.S. oil and natural gas can be seen dramatically in the markets, where the oil-to-gas price ratio has surged to its highest in six years.

Headlines: Lebanon imposes travel ban on Ghosn after questioning over warrant: judicial source
Description: A Lebanese prosecutor imposed a travel ban on former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn on Thursday, a judicial source said, after he was questioned over an Interpol warrant issued by Japan seeking his arrest on financial misconduct charges.

Headlines: EU resumes probe into Boeing-Embraer deal, sets new April 30 deadline
Description: The European Union's antitrust regulators have resumed their investigation into Boeing's deal to buy the commercial arm of Brazil's Embraer , according to a filing posted on the EU's website on Thursday.

Headlines: Grocers roll out plant-based burgers - at prices below Beyond Meat
Description: (This Jan. 8 story corrects para 11 to say private-label companies, and not retailers, will need to sell plant-based products at a net wholesale cost of $1.25 below Beyond Meat and rivals)

Headlines: Lebanon seeks Ghosn file from Japan-Lebanese judicial source
Description: Lebanese judicial authorities have asked Japan for its file on Carlos Ghosn, including the charges against him, and will not question him again until the information is received, a Lebanese judicial source told Reuters on Thursday after Ghosn was questioned.

Headlines: First Abu Dhabi Bank to auction Al Jaber's Dubai Shangri-La hotel: sources
Description: First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB) has started an auction process for a Dubai hotel operated by Shangri-La and owned by indebted construction group Al Jaber with a starting price of 700 million dirhams ($190.59 million), two sources said.

Headlines: Apple's iPhone sales in China up 18% in December: government data
Description: Sales of Apple Inc's iPhone in China in December jumped more than 18% year on year, government data showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Lebanese investigators finish questioning Ghosn, file referred to prosecutor: judicial source
Description: Lebanese investigators finished questioning former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn on Thursday, a judicial source said, after he was summoned over an Interpol warrant issued by Japan seeking his arrest on financial misconduct charges.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims fall, but labor market cooling
Description: New applications for U.S. jobless benefits fell more than expected last week, but the labor market appears to be cooling, with the number of Americans on unemployment rolls surging to more than a 1-1/2-year high at the end of 2019.

Headlines: U.S. dollar to dominate in directionless forex market: Reuters poll
Description: The U.S. dollar, which has dominated currency market trading for the last two years, looks set to do so again in 2020, according to the latest Reuters poll of foreign exchange strategists.

Headlines: SoftBank's Son eyes further Indonesia investment
Description: SoftBank Group Corp founder and chief executive, Masayoshi Son, said on Friday he wants to expand his tech conglomerate's investments in Indonesia, in remarks following a meeting with President Joko Widodo.

Headlines: U.S. December payrolls up less than expected
Description: U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in December, but the pace of hiring remains more than enough to keep the longest economic expansion in history on track despite a deepening downturn in a manufacturing sector stung by trade disputes.

Headlines: Timeline - Mediaset vs Vivendi: a TV courtroom drama unfolds
Description: Italy's biggest commercial broadcaster Mediaset holds a shareholder meeting on Friday over governance changes needed to enable a pan-European expansion plan, which its second-largest investor Vivendi is fighting in court.

Headlines: Factbox: Takeaway and Just Eat to form world leading food deliverer
Description: The takeover by Dutch food delivery company Takeaway.com of its British peer Just Eat is set to create the world's biggest online food delivery company outside China.

Headlines: Dollar, stocks slide on renewed Middle East tensions
Description: The dollar fell and global equity markets retreated from fresh highs on Friday, as signs of renewed U.S.-Iranian tensions scuttled a rally triggered by a U.S. labor report showing a strong economy despite slowing job growth in December.

Headlines: Uber to take exit ramp in Colombia after 'arbitrary' court ruling
Description: Uber Technologies Inc will stop operating in Colombia at the end of this month, following a court order late last year which the ride-hailing company on Friday called "arbitrary" and a violation of its right to due process.

Headlines: Airbus net orders rise but lag behind deliveries in 2019
Description: Airbus posted higher airplane orders for 2019 but failed to keep pace with deliveries for the second year in a row after axing its A380 superjumbo program and clearing its books of some defunct deals left over from a faltering industry order boom.

Headlines: Robotaxis will be available as soon as 2022, self-driving tech supplier Mobileye CEO says
Description: Mobileye CEO Amnon Shashua broke down why "robotaxi is not that far away" in an interview with "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer.

Headlines: Wall Street slips from records after jobs data, but posts weekly gains
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Friday from record-high levels as investors took profit and data showed slower-than-expected December U.S. jobs growth, but the major indexes posted gains for the week.

Headlines: U.S. employment in the 2010s in five charts
Description: The last U.S. employment report of the 2010s out Friday had few surprises, but it wrapped up a decade that featured some notable milestones in a job market that has changed dramatically in the space of 10 years.

Headlines: Canadian prosecutors say case against Huawei CFO is about fraud, not sanctions
Description: Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou's conduct amounts to fraud under Canadian law and the court need not consider U.S. sanctions law, Canadian federal prosecutors argued in a court filing released on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. refinery sales hit the brakes, with 5% of capacity on block
Description: From coast to coast, U.S. refineries are available for the taking, but nobody is buying.

Headlines: As U.S. election heats up, investors brace for volatility
Description: A U.S. stock market that has weathered trade wars, weak corporate earnings, and now a U.S.-Iran conflict to continually hit record highs faces a new obstacle: the 2020 U.S. election season.

Headlines: Japan failed to arrange fair trial for Ghosn: French lawyer
Description: Former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn's lawyer on Friday told Japan's government that the authorities had failed to arrange for a fair trial that respected universal rights.

Headlines: Mediaset approves changes to keep pan-European TV plan afloat
Description: Italy's Mediaset on Friday won shareholder approval for governance tweaks needed to smooth a pan-European expansion plan despite opposition from its second-biggest investor Vivendi, which is fighting the project in court.

Headlines: China's Geely in talks to take stake in Aston Martin
Description: China’s Geely Automobile Holding is in talks with Aston Martin management and investors about taking a stake in the luxury carmaker, according to a source close to the discussions and a report by the Financial Times, sparking a sharp jump in the British company's share price.

Headlines: U.S. to probe Fitbit, Garmin, other wearable devices after Philips complains
Description: U.S. trade regulators said on Friday they will investigate wearable monitoring devices, including those made by Fitbit Inc and Garmin Ltd , following allegations of patent violations by rival Koninklijke Philips and its North America unit.

Headlines: Oil falls below $65/bbl in first weekly drop since November
Description: Oil fell below $65 a barrel on Friday in its first weekly loss since late November, erasing the week's risk premium added since a U.S. drone strike killed a top Iranian general as investors focused on rising U.S. inventories and other signs of ample supply.

Headlines: U.S. employment growth slows; labor market tightening
Description: U.S. job growth slowed in December after surging in the prior month, but the pace of hiring is enough to keep the longest economic expansion in history on track despite a deepening downturn in a manufacturing sector stung by trade disputes.

Headlines: Amazon boss Bezos to face protests from traders during India trip
Description: Thousands of small-scale traders in India are planning to organize protests against Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos, who will visit the country next week for a company event and potential meetings with government officials.

Headlines: Striking Cambodian casino workers return to work in NagaWorld deal
Description: Thousands of striking Cambodian workers of a Hong Kong-listed casino company returned to their jobs on Saturday after winning wage increases and the reinstatement of a suspended union leader in a rare labor victory.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz to build smart brand cars with Geely in China's Xi'an: senior exec
Description: Mercedes-Benz will build smart-branded electric cars with Zhejiang Geely Holding Group [GEELY.UL] in the Chinese city of Xian from a base with annual capacity of around 150,000 vehicles, a senior official from its German parent Daimler AG said on Saturday.

Headlines: Pressure for 2020 as U.S. companies report end of weak profit year
Description: As major U.S. corporations prepare to close the books on a lackluster year of profit growth, they may need to shore up confidence that 2020 will show significant improvement to keep the stock market's rally going.

Headlines: U.S. officials to visit Britain, pushing for Huawei 5G ban
Description: A delegation of U.S. officials will arrive in Britain on Monday to try to persuade Britain not to use Huawei equipment in the upgrade of its telecoms network, two people with knowledge of the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Walmart India says eight senior staff among 56 executives fired
Description: Walmart Inc , the world's largest retailer, has fired 56 of its India executives including eight from senior management, Krish Iyer, President and CEO of its India unit, said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. gave Britain new evidence of 'madness' of using Huawei in 5G network: report
Description: U.S. government officials presented the British government with new evidence on Monday about the risks of including Huawei [HWT.UL] equipment in future 5G mobile networks, branding it "madness", the Guardian newspaper reported.

Headlines: Stocks hit record ahead of U.S.-China trade deal, dollar gains
Description: Bond yields edged higher while a gauge of global equity markets hit a record high on Monday, lifted by optimism over the planned signing this week of a U.S.-China trade deal and hopes the start of the U.S. corporate earnings season will not disappoint.

Headlines: U.S. coal-fired power plants closing fast despite Trump's pledge of support for industry
Description: U.S. coal-fired power plants shut down at the second-fastest pace on record in 2019, despite President Donald Trump’s efforts to prop up the industry, according to data from the federal government and Thomson Reuters.

Headlines: Wall Street hits record, boosted by trade and earnings optimism
Description: Apple, Alphabet and other tech favorites propelled Wall Street to record highs on Monday, fueled by optimism about the signing of a preliminary U.S.-China trade deal, as well upcoming fourth-quarter earnings reports.

Headlines: New Boeing chief executive: planemaker can be 'much better'
Description: Boeing Co's new chief executive, David Calhoun, assumed the job on Monday as the U.S. planemaker battles to recover from two fatal crashes of 737 MAX planes that killed 346 people in five months and led to the model's worldwide grounding in March.

Headlines: U.S. rejects Avenatti claim that 'document dump' justifies Nike trial delay
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Monday rejected Michael Avenatti's claim that they overwhelmed him with large amounts of material for the Jan. 21 trial accusing the celebrity lawyer of trying to extort Nike Inc, and that the material should be excluded or the trial delayed by 30 days.

Headlines: China's BYD names former GM president Kevin Wale as senior adviser
Description: China's BYD Co Ltd said on Monday it has appointed Kevin Wale, former General Motors (GM) China President, as a senior adviser to the electric car maker's chairman.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including Alphabet valuation, market gains, CVS CEO
Description: CNBC's Jim Cramer warned that Alphabet's march toward the $1 trillion valuation mark could be ephemeral. The "Mad Money" host sat down for interviews with health care executives.

Headlines: Alphabet is marching toward the $1 trillion club, but Jim Cramer is skeptical of the move
Description: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer said he worries that Alphabet, alongside Microsoft, Apple and Facebook, may not hold its recent gains when the company reports earnings.

Headlines: U.S. government posts $13.3 billion deficit in December
Description: The U.S. government recorded a $13.3 billion budget deficit in December, the Treasury Department said on Monday.

Headlines: Oil falls 1% as focus shifts to high U.S. fuel stocks
Description: Oil prices fell about 1% on Monday as Middle East tensions eased and investors turned their focus to lackluster seasonal demand following last week's bearish U.S. report showing a large fuel stockbuilds.

Headlines: Volkswagen's Skoda Auto 2019 deliveries dip to 1.24 million cars due to weaker sales in China
Description: Deliveries of Volkswagen's Skoda Auto dropped slightly in 2019 to 1.24 million vehicles, from 1.25 million in 2018, mainly due to weaker sales in China, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: As businesses hold back, U.S. consumers seen boosting big banks' profits
Description: Consumer lending is expected to propel profits for big U.S. banks when they unveil fourth-quarter results this week, though stress in corporate lending and uneven capital markets may cast a shadow over results.

Headlines: Walmart sacks 56 executives in India as part of restructuring
Description: Walmart Inc, the world's largest retailer, has fired 56 of its executives in India as it restructures in the country.

Headlines: The real price of Occidental's 'costless' oil hedge
Description: In just 12 days, Occidental Petroleum Corp pulled off one of the biggest hedges against falling oil prices ever placed by a U.S. energy company. It characterized the transaction as "costless" but a Reuters review of regulatory filings, market data and interviews shows that's not the whole story.

Headlines: Stretched tech stocks leave some investors seeking off-ramp
Description: As the bull market in U.S. stocks hits new highs, some investors are searching for ways to pare their exposure to the small group of technology and communications stocks that has fueled market gains for years.

Headlines: Ford's China vehicle sales drop 26% in third straight year of decline
Description: Ford Motor Co's China vehicle sales fell for a third consecutive year, by 26.1%, as it battles a prolonged overall sales decline in its second-biggest market that has hit demand for its mass-market Ford brand and sports utility vehicles.

Headlines: U.S. makes it harder to sue corporations over franchise wage law violations
Description: The Trump administration has made it harder for employees of fast-food restaurants or other big franchises to sue corporations when individual franchise owners violate wage laws, a step that was a top priority for business groups.

Headlines: India's Supreme Court asks crime fighting agency to seize local assets of JPMorgan: report
Description: India's Supreme Court on Monday directed the government's crime fighting agency to seize local assets of JPMorgan in relation to some transactions the bank engaged in with a local real estate company in 2010, according to a Press Trust of India report in Business Standard.

Headlines: Drag from Trump's trade wars continues to ripple through U.S. economy
Description: As U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese Vice Premier Liu He prepare to sign a "Phase 1" trade deal, new data show that the costs of Trump's trade wars are proving more widespread, deeper and longer-lasting than previously believed.

Headlines: Oil edges up after five days of losses ahead of U.S.-China trade pact
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Tuesday after five days of declines as the United States and China prepared to sign a preliminary trade deal and as Middle East tensions eased.

Headlines: Wall Street dips from record in 'Jason Bourne market'
Description: U.S. stocks dipped on Tuesday, reversing earlier intraday record highs, following a report that the United States would likely maintain tariffs on Chinese goods until after November's presidential election.

Headlines: Documents to show U.S.-China trade deal fully enforceable: Mnuchin
Description: Documents to be released Wednesday will show skeptics that a Phase 1 U.S.-China trade agreement will be fully enforceable, including a pledge by China to refrain from manipulating its currency, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said Tuesday.

Headlines: Why the Ukrainian plane tragedy is unlikely to lead to global airspace rules
Description: Why was the Ukrainian airliner mistakenly shot down near Tehran by Iranian forces last week for the loss of 176 lives even allowed to take off from a country that had just fired missiles towards its neighbour? And why didn't the airline just delay or cancel the flight?

Headlines: U.S. bank executives offer cautious optimism heading into 2020
Description: Despite trade wars, low interest rates and new geopolitical tensions, big U.S. banks have not experienced major disruption to their core businesses and top executives are hopeful they can generate growth this year.

Headlines: Ford invests $82 million to expand Vietnamese plant
Description: Ford Motor Co said on Tuesday it is investing $82 million to expand its plant in northern Vietnam to boost production capacity.

Headlines: China December copper imports hit highest since March 2016; annual shipments fall
Description: China's unwrought copper imports rose 9.1% in December from the previous month to their highest since March 2016, customs data showed on Tuesday, as improving industrial activity and dwindling scrap metal supply lifted demand.

Headlines: Ahead of Bezos visit, India antitrust chief says e-commerce firms shouldn't offer heavy discounts
Description: Big e-commerce firms should not offer steep discounts, must disclose discounting policies and ensure they do not drive brick-and-mortar rivals out of business, India's antitrust chief said as his commission launched a probe into Amazon.com and Walmart's Flipkart.

Headlines: China's 2019 iron ore imports rise to second-highest ever
Description: China's iron ore imports rose 0.47% in 2019 to hover just below their all-time annual peak, fueled by strong demand at steel mills and a second-half recovery in shipments from big miners after disruptions earlier in the year.

Headlines: China's 2019 trade surplus with U.S. narrows to $295.8 billion vs $323.3 billion in 2018
Description: China's trade surplus with the United States for December stood at $23.18 billion, Reuters calculation based on Chinese customs data showed on Tuesday, narrowing slightly from the $24.6 billion surplus posted for November.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury drops China currency manipulator label ahead of trade deal signing
Description: The U.S. Treasury Department on Monday dropped its designation of China as a currency manipulator days before top officials of the world's two largest economies were due to sign a preliminary trade agreement to ease an 18-month-old tariff war.

Headlines: China rare earth exports rebound in December, but annual shipments lowest since 2015
Description: China's rare earth exports bounced back in December from a four-and-a-half-year low the previous month as buyers ramped up purchases ahead of the Lunar New Year holiday, though annual shipments still sank to their lowest in four years, hit by weaker global manufacturing demand.

Headlines: Nissan says not considering dissolving alliance with Renault
Description: Nissan Motor said on Tuesday it was "in no way" considering dissolving its alliance with France's Renault SA and Mitsubishi Motors Corp and that the alliance was the source of Nissan's competitiveness.

Headlines: China's 2019 annual crude imports set record for 17th year
Description: China's crude oil imports in 2019 surged 9.5% from a year earlier, setting a record for a 17th straight year, as demand growth from new refineries built last year propelled purchases by the world's biggest importer, data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices gain slightly; underlying inflation tame
Description: U.S. consumer prices rose slightly in December even as households paid more for healthcare, and monthly underlying inflation slowed, supporting the Federal Reserve's desire to keep interest rates unchanged at least through this year.

Headlines: Chile's Codelco says uncovered $22 million insurance fraud involving unions
Description: Chile's state-owned Codelco, the world's largest copper producer, said on Tuesday it had filed a lawsuit over an alleged scam in insurance contracts drawn up by unions for workers at its Chuquicamata and Radomiro Tomic mines.

Headlines: JPMorgan posts record annual profit as bond trading rebounds
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co posted its biggest-ever annual profit on Tuesday as its bond trading business bounced back in the last three months of the year, setting an upbeat tone for the big U.S. banks reporting this week.

Headlines: Amazon boss Jeff Bezos arrives in India as local traders plan protests
Description: Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos arrived in India on Tuesday, according to a post on his Twitter account, as thousands of small traders across 300 cities planned protests, claiming the firm is distorting local retail market.

Headlines: American Airlines extends Boeing 737 MAX flight cancellations into June
Description: American Airlines Group Inc will extend cancellations of Boeing Co 737 MAX flights through June 3 as the grounding threatens to impact a second busy U.S. summer travel season.

Headlines: Jim Cramer on stocks to buy on trade deal: 'FedEx can make a comeback'
Description: "If the stocks of any of these companies with new access to China get hit, I think you need to be a buyer into weakness," the "Mad Money" host said.

Headlines: Polish watchdog fines Volkswagen over 'dieselgate' scandal
Description: Poland's consumer watchdog UOKiK said on Wednesday it was fining Volkswagen more than 120 million zlotys ($31.6 million) for misleading customers about the emissions of its vehicles.

Headlines: Honda, Isuzu power up fuel cell partnership for heavy-duty trucks
Description: Japan's Honda Motor Co and Isuzu Motors Ltd on Wednesday said they would jointly research the use of hydrogen fuel cells to power heavy-duty trucks, looking to expand fuel cell use by applying the zero-emission technology to larger vehicles.

Headlines: Maersk chief warns EU antitrust policy benefits China, U.S.
Description: Strict EU enforcement of competition rules prevents the development of the global champions necessary to compete with Chinese and U.S. companies, the head of shipping company Maersk warned in an interview.

Headlines: Exclusive: 'I'm happy he did it' - in Beirut, wife of fugitive Ghosn slams Japanese justice
Description: Carlos and Carole Ghosn, the former first couple of carmaker Nissan, are united again in Beirut. They hold hands in the street and whisper together in a mix of Arabic and French. They kiss.

Headlines: Ghosn says French envoy told him Nissan was turning against him
Description: Former Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn, speaking in Beirut after his dramatic escape from Japanese justice, said on Tuesday that the French ambassador had warned him shortly after his arrest that his own company was plotting against him.

Headlines: Spain's Banco Sabadell hires IBM for 1 billion euro IT upgrade
Description: Spain's Banco Sabadell has hired IBM for a 1 billion euro ($1.11 billion) overhaul of its IT systems over the next ten years, Miguel Montes, the bank's director of operations and people, said on Wednesday.

Headlines: ValueAct's Ubben cheers BlackRock's new stance on climate change
Description: Investor Jeffrey Ubben, already betting there is money to be made from coaxing corporations into being better citizens, gained an ally on Tuesday when BlackRock Inc chief Laurence Fink told companies to tackle climate change or face his wrath.

Headlines: Dow closes above 29,000 after China and U.S. sign trade truce
Description: The Dow ended above 29,000 for the first time on Wednesday and the S&P 500 also closed at a record high after the United States and China signed a Phase 1 trade agreement and pledged to resolve a tariff dispute that has roiled Wall Street for over a year.

Headlines: Trump urges Boeing to move fast on resolving 737 MAX issues
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday urged Boeing Co to move quickly to resolve issues with the grounded 737 MAX, noting the planemaker's significant impact on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: China's Liu: China to use trade deal to prove talks working to improve economy - CGTN
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He said China will use the results of the Phase 1 trade deal with the United States to prove that the negotiations are working to improve the economy, Chinese state television reported on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade deal, USMCA to boost economy: Mnuchin on Fox News
Description: Completion of the Phase 1 U.S.-China trade deal and a new North American trade agreement will boost the U.S. gross domestic product (GDP) by a combined 50 to 75 basis points, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told Fox News on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump: U.S. will lift tariffs on China after Phase 2 deal finished
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he would remove all U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports as soon as the two countries completed the Phase 2 part of their trade agreement, adding that he does not expect there to be a Phase 3 pact.

Headlines: U.S. economy expands modestly but trade tensions weigh, Fed survey shows
Description: The U.S. economy expanded at a modest pace through the final six weeks of 2019 but uncertainty over U.S. trade policy continued to hurt firms, a survey conducted by the Federal Reserve said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Under fire in India, Amazon offers small business owners $1 billion olive branch
Description: Amazon.com Inc CEO Jeff Bezos said his company will invest $1 billion to bring small businesses online in India, reaching out to some of his fiercest critics in a goodwill visit that saw him donning traditional Indian attire and fly a kite with children.

Headlines: Holiday shock for Target as toys, electronics disappoint
Description: Target Corp fell short of its own expectations for holiday season sales on Wednesday, reporting a drop off in online growth and demand for toys and electronics that sent a shiver through the wider U.S. retail sector.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices nudge up as inflation remains benign
Description: U.S. producer prices edged up in December as a rise in the cost of goods was offset by weakness in services, the latest indication of tame inflation pressures that could allow the Federal Reserve to keep interest rates unchanged this year.

Headlines: UnitedHealth bets on government health plan growth in 2020
Description: UnitedHealth Group Inc, the largest U.S. health insurer, reported a better-than-expected fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, and said it expects strong sales of its government health plans this year.

Headlines: T-Mobile/Sprint urge court for deal approval, states warn of price hikes
Description: A group of U.S. states suing to block T-Mobile US Inc from merging with Sprint Corp on Wednesday told a federal judge that the deal would raise prices for consumers, while the phone companies pushed back and emphasized they would compete aggressively to push prices down.

Headlines: What's in the U.S.-China Phase 1 trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese Vice Premier Liu He signed a deal on Wednesday in the White House that cut some U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods in exchange for Chinese pledges to purchase more of American farm, energy and manufactured goods and address some U.S. complaints about intellectual property practices.

Headlines: Trump takes time in China deal signing to lament his Fed chair pick, again
Description: A funny thing happened on the way to the U.S.-China trade deal signing: President Donald Trump may have tipped his next pick for head of the Federal Reserve -- if he gets the chance.

Headlines: Factbox: Foreign investment banks with majority stakes in China units
Description: The world's biggest investment banks will be able to wholly own their China securities businesses from April 1 as the U.S.- China Phase 1 trade deal accelerates a previous deadline for removing foreign ownership caps by nine months.

Headlines: Hyundai, Kia invest $110 million in UK electric van startup Arrival Ltd
Description: Korea's Hyundai Group is backing a UK electric vehicle startup that plans to begin selling battery-powered delivery vans in 2021, the companies said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. Senate approves U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade deal
Description: The U.S. Senate on Thursday approved a revamp of the 26-year-old North American Free Trade Agreement that includes tougher labor and automotive content rules but leaves $1.2 trillion in annual U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade flows largely unchanged.

Headlines: U.S. data point to moderate economic growth, tightening jobs market
Description: U.S. retail sales increased for a third straight month in December, with households buying a range of goods even as they cut back on purchases of motor vehicles, suggesting the economy maintained a moderate growth pace at the end of 2019.

Headlines: JPMorgan says no notice from Supreme Court on Amrapali real estate case
Description: The local arm of JPMorgan said on Thursday that the bank has not received any communication from India's Supreme Court in a case relating to past transactions between the bank and a New Delhi-based real estate firm.

Headlines: Alphabet public market capitalization tops $1 trillion
Description: The public market capitalization of Google parent Alphabet topped the $1 trillion mark shortly before the close of trading on Thursday, making it the fourth S&P 500 component to top the lofty level.

Headlines: Eli Lilly targets quarterly deals of $1 billion-$5 billion in 2020: CFO
Description: Eli Lilly and Co aims to announce roughly one $1 billion to $5 billion deal every quarter in 2020, its chief financial officer told Reuters, as the U.S. drugmaker looks to build up its pipeline of future products.

Headlines: Instant View: China's economic growth slows to 6.1% in 2019, near 30-year low
Description: China's economy grew 6.0% in the fourth quarter of 2019 from a year earlier, official data showed on Friday, in line with expectations and steadying from the previous quarter's pace.

Headlines: Timeline: Key dates in the U.S.-China trade war
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese Vice Premier Liu He

Headlines: China's 2019 birth rate slowest in 70 years: stats bureau
Description: China's birth rate fell to its lowest last year since the founding of the People's Republic of China 70 years ago, posing a long-term challenge for its government.

Headlines: S&P 500 blasts through 3,300 as tech stocks surge
Description: The S&P 500 rallied through the 3,300 mark for the first time on Thursday and the other main U.S. indexes also surged to record highs, fueled by tech stocks, solid retail sales data and upbeat quarterly earnings from Morgan Stanley.

Headlines: China's 2019 property investment solid, but first sales drop in 5 years dents outlook
Description: China's property investment hit a two-year low in December even as it grew at a solid pace in 2019, adding to recent signs of a slackening in the sector and suggested Beijing might need to offer more stimulus to stabilize a cooling economy.

Headlines: China to roll out more support measures as economy faces pressure: statistics head
Description: China will maintain a proactive fiscal policy and a prudent monetary policy in 2020 and roll out more support measures this year as the economy faces downward pressure, the chief of the country's statistics bureau said on Friday.

Headlines: China's 2019 pork output plunges to 16-year low as disease culls herd
Description: China's 2019 pork output plunged to a 16-year low, official data showed on Friday, as the fatal hog disease African swine fever killed millions of pigs in the world's top producer.

Headlines: China's annual aluminum output slips for first time in decade
Description: China's annual aluminum production fell for the first time in 10 years in 2019, official data showed on Friday, hit by softer demand amid the Sino-U.S. trade row and large-scale smelter outages.

Headlines: Dollar gains, stocks scale fresh highs on data, trade deal
Description: The dollar rose while key world and stock indexes on Wall Street scaled new records on Thursday as the U.S.-China trade deal, strong corporate earnings and encouraging U.S. economic data lifted equity markets.

Headlines: China's 2019 and December crude oil runs hit record highs
Description: China's crude oil throughput rose to a record high in 2019 following the start-up of two mega-refineries, official data showed on Friday, with December posting the highest daily run-rate on record.

Headlines: European firms call for tougher EU approach to China
Description: European companies called on European Union policy-makers on Thursday to toughen their approach to China to secure a level playing field for European businesses.

Headlines: China's Liu: China will push forward capital account opening, yuan internationalization - state media
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He said China will steadily push forward capital account opening and yuan internationalization, under the premise of focusing on preventing risks, state media People's Daily reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Chinese financial institutions can cope with foreign competition: central bank
Description: Chinese financial institutions are completely capable of coping with foreign competition as the $40 trillion financial sector is freed up, the central bank said on Thursday, after China and the United States signed a initial deal on trade.

Headlines: What to watch as fourth-quarter earnings kick into high gear
Description: U.S. corporate reporting season is expected to show lackluster profit growth, and it has already gotten off to a bumpy start, with big banks kicking off the fourth quarter to mixed investor reaction so far on the stock market.

Headlines: PSA Group 2019 sales slump 10% after record 2018
Description: French carmaker PSA Group said on Thursday global sales fell 10% last year to 3.49 million units, compared with a record 3.88 million in 2018, as it suffered from declining volumes in China, the Middle East and Africa.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines push Boeing 737 MAX flight cancellations into June
Description: Southwest Airlines Co said on Thursday it would extend cancellations of 737 MAX flights through June 6, as the grounding of the Boeing Co jet threatens to hurt a second straight U.S. summer travel season.

Headlines: New Tesla registrations in California nearly halve in fourth quarter: data
Description: Tesla Inc's overall vehicle registrations nearly halved in the U.S. state of California during the fourth quarter, according to a Dominion Cross-Sell report, which collates data from state motor vehicle records.

Headlines: The yield curve's still weird. Fed's Bullard is okay with that
Description: It was more than a year ago when St. Louis Federal Reserve bank President James Bullard started raising the alarm about a U.S. bond market where interest rates seemed to show investors losing faith in the economy, a risky environment for the Fed to carry out planned rate increases.

Headlines: Wall Street's trillion-dollar club dwarfs Europe Inc
Description: With Google parent Alphabet becoming the latest entrant to Wall Street's trillion-dollar club, Europe's blue-chip companies are dwarfed by comparison -- the most valuable firm from the "old continent", Nestle, is worth just a third of that.

Headlines: Walmart U.S. Chief Merchandising Officer Bratspies departs
Description: Chief merchandising officer of Walmart Inc's U.S. operations, Steve Bratspies, is set to leave the big-box retailer, according to an internal memo sent on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. job openings post biggest drop in more than four years
Description: U.S. job openings recorded their biggest drop in more than four years in November, while hiring increased moderately, suggesting a loss of momentum in the labor market at the tail end of 2019.

Headlines: U.S. housing starts at 13-year high, factory output gains
Description: U.S. homebuilding surged to a 13-year high in December as activity increased across the board, suggesting the housing market recovery was back on track amid low mortgage rates, and could help support the longest economic expansion on record.

Headlines: After India's Amazon snub, Modi's party slams Bezos-owned Washington Post
Description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's ruling party on Friday slammed editorial policies of billionaire Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post, even as his e-commerce firm Amazon announced plans to create a million jobs in the country by 2025.

Headlines: Best Buy starts investigation into CEO's personal conduct
Description: U.S. consumer electronics retailer Best Buy Co said on Friday that its board was conducting an independent review on allegations of misconduct against Chief Executive Officer Corie Barry after receiving an anonymous letter.

Headlines: Wall Street hits new highs in strongest week since August
Description: Wall Street climbed to record highs on Friday, with major indexes turning in their strongest weekly gains since August, after strong U.S. housing data and signs of resilience in the Chinese economy raised hopes of a rebound in global growth.

Headlines: Shares set fresh records, lifted by U.S. housing data
Description: Key world equity indexes scaled new highs on Friday, boosted by a surge in U.S. housing starts to levels last seen in 2006, while the greenback rose to a one-week high against the euro on expectations of solid economic growth.

Headlines: Facebook sued in U.S. federal court for alleged anticompetitive conduct
Description: Four companies sued Facebook Inc in U.S. federal court on Thursday for alleged anticompetitive conduct, saying the social network inappropriately revoked developer access to its platform in order to harm prospective competitors.

Headlines: Senate passes North America trade deal, Canada still to approve
Description: The U.S. Senate on Thursday approved a revamp of the 26-year-old North American Free Trade Agreement that includes tougher rules on labor and automotive content but leaves $1.2 trillion in annual U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade flows largely unchanged.

Headlines: China 2019 crude steel output jumps 8.3%, sets second straight annual record
Description: Crude steel production in China climbed to a record just shy of 1 billion tonnes in 2019, boosted by a resilient property market and robust demand as Beijing beefed up infrastructure spending in a bid to weather a slowdown in economic growth.

Headlines: China fourth-quarter GDP grows 6%, in line with expectations and hovering near 30-year low
Description: China's economy grew 6.0% in the fourth quarter of 2019 from a year earlier, official data showed on Friday, in line with expectations and unchanged from the previous quarter's pace.

Headlines: China markets split on outcome of LPR lending benchmark in January
Description: China's financial markets are nearly evenly divided over whether the benchmark lending rate will be lowered or kept steady next Monday, a survey of participants showed, after the central bank kept rates on medium-term loans unchanged this week.

Headlines: H&M to enter Panama in late 2020
Description: The world's second-biggest fashion retailer H&M said on Friday it would open a first store in Panama at the end of 2020, making the country its first Central American market.

Headlines: Exclusive: Temasek, Trustbridge target majority stake in WeWork China at $1 billion valuation – sources
Description: Temasek Holdings and Trustbridge Partners have held talks with WeWork China over increasing their stake in the China branch of the troubled co-working startup to take majority ownership, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Indonesian minister says SoftBank offering to invest up to $40 billion in new capital
Description: SoftBank has offered to invest up to $40 billion in the new capital city Indonesia plans to build on Borneo island, a minister said on Friday, though the Japanese tech conglomerate said no figure had been suggested yet.

Headlines: Mexico hails USMCA trade deal approval, expects more investment
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Thursday hailed the U.S. Senate's approval of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) trade deal, forecasting it would deliver a boost to the Mexican economy.

Headlines: China posts weakest growth in 29 years as trade war bites, but ends 2019 on better note
Description: China's economic growth cooled to its weakest in nearly 30 years in 2019 amid a bruising trade war with the United States, and more stimulus is expected this year as Beijing tries to boost sluggish investment and demand.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler and Foxconn plan push into Chinese electric car market
Description: Automaker Fiat Chrysler plans to set up a joint venture with the parent of iPhone assembler Foxconn to build electric cars and develop internet-connected vehicles in China, as it looks to make up ground in electric mobility.

Headlines: "You're stealing our water": Germans protest against Tesla gigafactory
Description: Around 250 Germans on Saturday protested in the outskirts of Berlin where electric car startup Tesla is planning to build a gigafactory, saying its construction will endanger water supply and wildlife in the area.

Headlines: German cabin crew union plans further strikes at Lufthansa
Description: German cabin crew union UFO said on Saturday it was planning further strikes at Lufthansa to increase pressure on management after talks with Germany's largest airline and two potential mediators did not yield any results.

Headlines: Nokia October warning investigated by local FSA: newspaper report
Description: Finland's Financial Supervisory Authority (FSA) has started an investigation into Nokia's sharp profit warning in October which sent its shares more than 20% lower, Finnish daily Helsingin Sanomat reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Founder of South Korean retail giant Lotte dies
Description: Lotte Group founder Shin Kyuk-ho, who started manufacturing chewing gum in 1948 in Japan and built the business into South Korea's No.5 conglomerate with interests ranging from retail to chemicals, died on Sunday, the company said. He was 98.

Headlines: Boeing customer Air Lease says 'damaged' MAX brand should be dropped
Description: The chairman of major aircraft leasing firm Air Lease , which has 150 of Boeing's grounded 737 MAX jet on order, on Monday called on the U.S. manufacturer to drop the "damaged" MAX brand to avoid it undermining the plane's value.

Headlines: Tesla rebuffs U.S. safety recall petition, says no unintended acceleration in vehicles
Description: Tesla Inc said on Monday there was no unintended acceleration in its vehicles, as it responded to a petition to a U.S. safety regulator to investigate and recall around 500,000 of the company's electric cars over the alleged defect.

Headlines: Oil rises as Libya declares force majeure in oilfields
Description: Oil prices rose to their highest in more than a week on Monday after two large crude production bases in Libya began shutting down amid a military blockade, risking reducing crude flows from the OPEC member to a trickle.

Headlines: BBC's Hall to step down ahead of crunch funding talks with British government
Description: The BBC's most powerful man will step down in six months to allow a new person to lead negotiations with Prime Minister Boris Johnson's government over a financing model for the publicly funded broadcaster.

Headlines: Air Niugini delays delivery of four 737 MAX jets until at least 2024
Description: Papua New Guinea carrier Air Niugini has updated its contract with Boeing Co to delay the delivery of its four 737 MAX jets on order until at least 2024, the airline's chief executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Brazil's Ambev sets ambitious target to end plastic pollution in packaging
Description: Brazilian beverages company Ambev SA has set an ambitious target of eliminating plastic pollution in its packaging by 2025, in a push that an executive said on Monday has the potential to generate approximately 1 billion reais ($239.09 million) in business.

Headlines: Belgian labor authority launches court case against Deliveroo
Description: Belgium's labor authority launched the first stage of a court case against British food delivery group Deliveroo on Monday, challenging working conditions for the firm's 3,500 riders in Brussels.

Headlines: Subaru sets mid-2030s target to sell only electric vehicles
Description: Japan's Subaru Corp set a target on Monday to sell only electric vehicles worldwide by the first half of the 2030s, in a move toward its long-term goal of a carbon-free society.

Headlines: Markets regulators struggling to keep up with technology: SEC's Jackson
Description: The rapid growth of digital assets and computer-driven investment advice has become a key challenge for regulators in trying to keep up with technological advances while seeking to protect investors, a U.S. markets regulator said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook targets UK growth with 1,000 hires this year
Description: Facebook will hire 1,000 people in London this year in roles such as product development and safety as it continues to grow its biggest engineering center outside the United States after Britain leaves the European Union.

Headlines: Risk assets fall as Chinese virus triggers anxiety
Description: Risk assets took a hit across the globe on Tuesday, while the Japanese yen and U.S. Treasury prices gained, as financial markets reacted to mounting concern about a new strain of flu-like virus out of China.

Headlines: IBM forecasts full-year profit above estimates on cloud growth
Description: International Business Machines Corp forecast full-year profit above market expectations on Tuesday after reporting surprise growth in quarterly revenue, boosted by its high-margin cloud computing business, sending its shares up more than 4%.

Headlines: Factbox: How a virus impacts the economy and markets
Description: The outbreak of a new virus in China has sent shivers through world financial markets, with investors drawing comparisons to the 2003 SARS (Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome) outbreak in order to assess its potential economic impact.

Headlines: Honda recalling 2.7 million North American vehicles for new air bag inflator defect
Description: Honda Motor Co said on Tuesday it will recall 2.7 million older U.S. vehicles in North America for potentially defective air bag inflators.

Headlines: Boeing seeks to borrow $10 billion or more amid 737 MAX crisis: source
Description: Boeing Co is in talks with banks about borrowing $10 billion or more amid rising costs for the U.S. planemaker after two crashes involving its 737 MAX jetliner, a source told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Key events in Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou's extradition case
Description: Meng Wanzhou, chief financial officer of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, will appear in a Vancouver, Canada, courtroom on Monday for the first day of her extradition trial, a process expected to take months - possibly years - to decide whether she can be extradited from Canada to the United States.

Headlines: Halliburton takes $2.2 billion charge on shale slump
Description: U.S. oilfield services firm Halliburton Co. on Tuesday disclosed a $2.2 billion charge to earnings as weakening North American shale activity continued to hit the industry.

Headlines: Citibank to pay $18 million penalty for failing to insure flood-prone properties
Description: A U.S. banking regulator fined Citibank N.A. $18 million for delays in purchasing mandatory flood insurance for properties where borrowers were located in flood-prone areas.

Headlines: Honda to join White House initiative to boost U.S. job training
Description: Honda Motor Co will join on Tuesday a growing number of companies signing a White House pledge to boost U.S. job training opportunities.

Headlines: Insurers look to curb ransomware exposure as U.S. cyber rates rise
Description: U.S. insurers are ramping up cyber-insurance rates by as much as 25% and trying to curb exposure to vulnerable customers after a surge of costly claims, industry sources said.

Headlines: Trump says middle class tax cut to be announced over next 90 days: Fox Business
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday a tax cut for the middle class would be announced over the next 90 days.

Headlines: Activist investor calls on Toshiba Machine to put defense plans before shareholders
Description: Japan's most prominent activist investor on Wednesday demanded Toshiba Machine Co hold an extraordinary shareholders meeting to discuss its plans to introduce defense measures against a hostile takeover.

Headlines: Trump says Fed raising rates was a mistake: CNBC
Description: The United States' economy would be growing at a pace near 4% if wasn't for the lingering effect of Federal Reserve rate hikes, President Donald Trump told CNBC in an interview on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tesla crosses $100 billion stock market valuation in extended trading
Description: Tesla Inc became the first $100 billion publicly listed U.S. carmaker in extended trading on Tuesday, in a sign of Wall Street's confidence in an all-electric future.

Headlines: Ghosn's right-hand man stands high chance of acquittal in Japan: ex-prosecutor
Description: A lieutenant to Carlos Ghosn who is facing charges in Japan for underreporting his salary at Nissan Motor Co stands a very high chance of being acquitted, as would Ghosn had he remained in Japan to face trial, a former prosecutor said.

Headlines: Boeing eyes developing Israeli technology for light aircraft
Description: Boeing Co said on Wednesday it has agreed with Israel-based Tactical Robotics to explore development of a ducted fan propulsion technology with potential uses for piloted and autonomous light aircraft.

Headlines: 'Death Cross,' growth abroad threaten U.S. dollar
Description: Storm clouds are gathering over the U.S. dollar, threatening a two-year rally in the currency that has squeezed corporate profits and angered President Donald Trump.

Headlines: U.S., Canadian oil company bankruptcies surge 50% in 2019: report
Description: The number of oil and gas company bankruptcies in the United States and Canada rose 50% in 2019 over the previous year, and is likely to increase as a slide in energy prices continues to shake producers Dallas law firm Haynes and Boone said in a report released on Wednesday.

Headlines: Stocks edge up, oil drops as China virus worries abate
Description: World stock markets gained back some ground on Wednesday as investors took heart from measures to curb the spread of a flu-like virus from China, while oil prices tumbled on a forecast for a market surplus.

Headlines: Cathay to let crew wear masks on all flights due to new coronavirus
Description: Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd will allow all crew members and frontline employees to wear surgical masks due to concerns over a new coronavirus, and said passengers to and from Wuhan, China, could change or cancel flights for free through March 31.

Headlines: Kinder Morgan profit, cash flow rise on Gulf Coast Express pipeline strength
Description: U.S. pipeline operator Kinder Morgan Inc reported a 26% rise in quarterly profit on Wednesday, benefiting from higher gas takeaway from the Permian Basin through its Gulf Coast Express pipeline.

Headlines: Canadian judge approves C$196.5 mln Volkswagen fine for diesel emissions
Description: A judge in Canada approved a C$196.5 million ($149.7 million) fine against Volkswagen AG on Wednesday after the company pleaded guilty to dozens of counts of diesel emissions violations.

Headlines: Finance wants competitiveness role for UK watchdogs after Brexit
Description: Britain's regulators should have a formal role after Brexit to keep the financial sector globally competitive and less prone to "gold-plating" international norms, an industry think tank said on Thursday.

Headlines: Boeing CEO expects to resume 737 MAX production before mid-year
Description: Boeing Chief Executive Dave Calhoun told reporters on Wednesday the U.S. planemaker expects to resume 737 MAX production months before its forecasted mid-year return to service and said it did not plan to suspend or cut its dividend.

Headlines: After China trade deal, Europe and UK next on Trump's to-do list
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump vowed to rip up international trade deals and rebalance America's global trade relationships.

Headlines: Airbus hits record highs, 737 MAX buyers fall on latest Boeing news
Description: Airbus' shares hit record highs on Wednesday, after U.S. arch rival Boeing warned of further delay in returning its grounded 737 MAX airliner to service, while Boeing customers and suppliers fell on the news.

Headlines: Dollar steady as coronavirus contagion fears abate
Description: The U.S. dollar was unchanged against a basket of currencies on Wednesday as safe-haven demand ebbed along with worries about whether the spread of a flu-like coronavirus would hurt the global economy.

Headlines: Google CEO eyes major opportunity in healthcare, says will protect privacy
Description: Sundar Pichai, the CEO of Alphabet Inc and its Google subsidiary, said on Wednesday that healthcare offers the biggest potential over the next five to 10 years for using artificial intelligence to improve outcomes, and vowed that the technology giant will heed privacy concerns.

Headlines: Air Canada to not fly the MAX until June 30
Description: Air Canada said on Wednesday it has removed Boeing's 737 MAX from its flight schedule until June 30, 2020, a day after the U.S. planemaker warned the grounded jet would not win regulatory approval until mid-year.

Headlines: PSA not sure if engines it delivered to Mitsubishi are part of German probe
Description: French carmaker PSA said on Wednesday it did not know if 1.6 liter diesel engines it supplied to Japanese carmaker Mitsubishi between 2015 and 2018 are part of a probe in Germany.

Headlines: Wall Street pegs Boeing's 737 MAX bill at more than $25 billion
Description: Boeing Co's bill for the 737 MAX grounding could balloon to more than $25 billion, analysts estimated on Wednesday, a day after the U.S. planemaker warned of further delay in returning its once best-selling jet to service.

Headlines: U.S. home sales surge to near two-year high; supply at record low
Description: U.S. home sales jumped to their highest level in nearly two years in December, the latest indication that lower mortgage rates are helping the housing market to regain its footing after hitting a soft patch in 2018, though record low inventory could be an obstacle to continued strong gains.

Headlines: U.S. stocks correction overdue, Bloomberg best placed to beat Trump: Scaramucci
Description: U.S. stocks are headed higher, although a 10% correction is "long overdue", Anthony Scaramucci, founder and co-managing partner of Skybridge Capital, said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump threatens big tariffs on car imports from EU
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday threatened to impose high tariffs on imports of cars from the European Union if the bloc doesn't agree to a trade deal.

Headlines: Tesla's furious rally pushes market value past $100 billion
Description: Tesla Inc shares surged on Wednesday, and the company became the first publicly listed U.S. automaker to cross $100 billion in market valuation, more than Ford Motor Co and General Motors Co combined.

Headlines: UniCredit shuffles top managers in Italy, names new Americas CIB head
Description: Italy's biggest bank UniCredit said on Wednesday it had appointed a number of senior managers to new roles, shuffling people across jobs as it works to implement its 'Team 23' four-year plan unveiled in December.

Headlines: Coronavirus set to impact Chinese airlines' first quarter profit: Aercap CEO
Description: The chief executive of one of the world's largest aircraft lessors, Aercap , expects the new coronavirus that has emerged from Wuhan, China to impact Chinese airlines' profitability in the first quarter.

Headlines: French anti-corruption agency runs checks on Renault
Description: Renault on Wednesday said France's anti-corruption agency was carrying out checks at the company, though a source at the carmaker, which was rocked by the arrest of former boss Carlos Ghosn, said the inspection was a routine matter.

Headlines: Coronavirus fears weigh on global equity markets
Description: The biggest tumble in Chinese stocks in more than eight months led global equity markets lower on Thursday as concern mounted about the coronavirus outbreak in China.

Headlines: Ex-Wells Fargo executives face civil charges, multimillion-dollar fines from U.S. bank regulator
Description: A U.S. bank regulator announced Thursday that several senior former Wells Fargo executives face potential lifetime industry bans and millions of dollars in civil penalties for their roles in the bank's long-running sales practices scandal.

Headlines: Exclusive: Guyana opening search for oil firm to trade its crude - official
Description: Guyana's government next month plans to begin a search for an oil company or trading firm to market its share of the South American country's crude, the director of the Department of Energy, Mark Bynoe, said in an interview.

Headlines: Amazon asks court to pause Microsoft's work on Pentagon's JEDI contract
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday it filed a motion in court to pause the U.S. Department of Defense and Microsoft Corp from carrying out an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal until a court rules on its protest of the contract award.

Headlines: Insys founder Kapoor sentenced to 66 months in prison: judge
Description: Insys Therapeutics founder John Kapoor was sentenced to 66 months in prison for his role in an opioid fraud scheme by a U.S. district judge in Boston on Thursday.

Headlines: S&P 500 gains, Nasdaq hits new high as investors eye earnings, coronavirus
Description: The S&P 500 ended slightly higher and the Nasdaq eked out a record closing high on Thursday, helped by a jump in Netflix, while news about the coronavirus outbreak spreading from China and mixed earnings results kept a lid on the market.

Headlines: U.S. bank regulator charges ex-Wells Fargo executives for role in sales scandal
Description: Wells Fargo & Co's U.S. regulator on Thursday announced it had banned former Chief Executive John Stumpf from the banking industry and charged him and seven other former executives combined more than $58 million in civil penalties for their roles in the bank's multi-year sales practices scandal.

Headlines: Trump announces adjustments to tariff quotas for washing machines
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump announced on Thursday that tariff quotas on washing machines would be allocated on a quarterly rather than an annual basis, saying that domestic producers had begun to do better in the face of foreign competitors but more was left to be done.

Headlines: Intel signals 2020 will be a turnaround year for chip industry leader
Description: Intel Corp on Thursday cemented the market view that the chip industry is turning around after a prolonged slowdown, forecasting better 2020 revenue and profit than Wall Street anticipated, driven by cloud computing demand.

Headlines: Insys founder Kapoor sentenced to 66 months in prison for opioid scheme
Description: John Kapoor, the founder of Insys Therapeutics Inc, on Thursday was sentenced to 66 months in prison for his role in a bribery and fraud scheme that contributed to the U.S. opioid crisis.

Headlines: U.S. extradition battle over Huawei's Meng ends first phase but Canada court fight continues
Description: The first phase of battle over whether Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou should be extradited to the United States wrapped up on Thursday after four days, with lawyers for Meng challenging prosecution claims that her alleged actions are a crime in Canada.

Headlines: U.S. to unveil crackdown on counterfeit, pirated e-commerce goods
Description: The Trump administration plans to unveil efforts on Friday to crack down on counterfeit and pirated goods sold on major e-commerce sites and urge companies to do more to vet third-party sellers and increase self-policing efforts.

Headlines: American Airlines beats quarterly profit estimates on strong travel demand
Description: American Airlines Group Inc edged past Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Thursday, as strong travel demand and lower fuel costs cushioned the U.S. carrier from flight cancellations due to the 737 MAX grounding.

Headlines: Lebanon's new government may have little reserves left to stabilize economy
Description: Lebanon's new government faces huge upcoming debt repayments and a currency peg at breaking point, but it may already have run out of the hard cash firepower it needs to tackle these problems.

Headlines: Explainer: Global airlines on high alert as virus outbreak spreads
Description: Airlines and passengers are on guard against a new flu-like virus that originated in Wuhan, China.

Headlines: Australia's Westpac hires 'Mack the knife' McFarlane to chair crisis-hit bank
Description: Australia's Westpac Banking Corp named a former Barclays boss as chairman on Thursday, entrusting veteran banker John McFarlane with the task of steering it through the country's biggest money-laundering scandal.

Headlines: From Communist-era roots to cash cows: Poland's gaming industry takes on the world
Description: The drab exteriors of a pair of 1970s buildings in an industrial Warsaw neighborhood belie the hive of high-tech activity inside where developers, screenplay writers and others at leading video game maker CD Projekt hustle to create the next global hit.

Headlines: Factbox: Polish video game productions that have hit the jackpot
Description: Poland's booming video game and esports market was worth $664 million in 2019, according to PwC, and is projected to climb to nearly $850 million over the next four years.

Headlines: S&P Global places Boeing's rating on credit watch negative
Description: S&P Global Ratings on Thursday placed Boeing Co's 'A-' credit rating on 'credit watch' with negative implications, citing a rise in costs and cash outflows at the U.S. planemaker due to a further delay in the grounded 737 MAX's recertification.

Headlines: Former top U.S. general Dunford joining Lockheed Martin's board
Description: The former top U.S. military official, General Joseph Dunford, has been elected to the board of Lockheed Martin Corp , the Pentagon's largest weapons supplier, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. bank regulator sharpens teeth on Wells Fargo, surprising critics
Description: Long accused of being too soft, a U.S. bank regulator has surprised its critics with tough treatment of scandal-ridden lender Wells Fargo, culminating on Thursday in more than$58 million in fines against eight former executives at the bank.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Hopes are high for tech stock 'Cadillacs'; so are their prices
Description: Wall Street is betting that the most popular U.S. technology and internet stocks can keep outshining the broader equities market but their latest rally leaves little room for error this earnings season.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including big earnings week, L Brands' predicament
Description: CNBC's Jim Cramer previews the week ahead of earnings as coronavirus concerns rise. He explains why he's not so bullish about Victoria's Secret-parent L Brands' turnaround story.

Headlines: Cramer's week ahead earnings: 'We've got a huge number of companies reporting next week'
Description: High-quality stocks — unrelated to China or travel — that get hurt on coronavirus fears are worth pouncing on, CNBC's Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: Bayer faces fourth U.S. Roundup cancer trial in Monsanto's hometown
Description: Bayer AG is set to face a fourth U.S. jury trial over allegations that its Roundup weed killer causes cancer, with four cancer patients in the hometown of its agricultural subsidiary Monsanto scheduled to begin making their case on Friday.

Headlines: Impossible or Beyond: U.S. restaurants find partners to go vegan
Description: The world's largest burger chain McDonald's Corp said this month that it would expand its test of a plant-based meat product with Beyond Meat patties in Canada, and other chains also are looking to serve vegan customers.

Headlines: Italy watchdog threatens Facebook with another fine over improper use of data
