Description: In a first-of-its-kind approval by U.S. regulators, a federal agency on Thursday gave permission for autonomous vehicle startup Nuro Inc over the next two years to deploy up to 5,000 low-speed electric delivery vehicles without human controls like mirrors and steering wheels.

Headlines: U.S. trade panel opens patent probe into Google speakers after Sonos complaint
Description: The U.S. International Trade Commission said on Thursday it was launching a patent investigation into certain audio players and controllers sold by Alphabet Inc's Google based on a complaint by rival smart speaker maker Sonos Inc.

Headlines: South Korea asks China for help in resuming production at auto parts plants
Description: The South Korean government said on Friday it has asked Chinese regional governments for help in resuming production at South Korean auto parts suppliers' factories in China.

Headlines: Honda to keep vehicle plants in Wuhan suspended through Feb. 13
Description: Honda Motor Co said Friday it will keep operations at its vehicle plants in Wuhan, China, suspended through Feb. 13, as previously planned.

Headlines: Tightrope Thiam: comeback CEO stung by a spying scandal
Description: Tidjane Thiam is unlikely to quietly retire after his abrupt exit as chief executive of Credit Suisse, some of those who have worked with him predict.

Headlines: Fed says risks to economy easing, but calls out coronavirus in report to Congress
Description: A "moderately" expanding U.S. economy was slowed last year by a manufacturing slump and weak global growth, but key risks have receded and the likelihood of recession has declined, the U.S. Federal Reserve said in its latest monetary policy report to the U.S. Congress.

Headlines: EU goes into meeting frenzy ahead of February 20 summit on next seven-year budget
Description: European Union leaders and institutions went into a frenzy of meetings this week to start the toughest job the bloc faces this year: agreeing on a seven-year budget that for many is the most tangible sign of what a united Europe will look like after Brexit.

Headlines: U.S. 'Section 232' auto decision on hold for possible U.S.-EU trade deal: Kudlow
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday a U.S. decision to impose "Section 232" national security tariffs on cars and auto parts imported from the European Union is on pause amid attempts to reach a U.S.-EU trade deal.

Headlines: From black swan to bubble: investors weigh coronavirus risks
Description: When worries over the coronavirus shook U.S. stocks out of a period of quiet trading last week, investors wondered if the outbreak was the “Black Swan” event that would trigger a sharp decline. Less than a week later, talk has turned instead to a market melt-up.

Headlines: Mediaset set to win more time to complete merger of Italy, Spain units: sources
Description: Mediaset will submit revised plans to merge its Italian and Spanish broadcasting units under a Dutch entity to authorities in the Netherlands, securing a six-month extension to complete the project, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: New drugs contribute to AbbVie's upbeat 2020 view; shares hit year-high
Description: AbbVie Inc on Friday forecast full-year earnings well above Wall Street estimates, as the U.S. drugmaker looks to new treatments and its pending acquisition of Allergan Plc to drive growth beyond 2023, when its cash cow Humira loses patent protection.

Headlines: Swedish central bank set to keep rates steady on Feb. 12, and through 2021: Reuters Poll
Description: Sweden's central bank is expected to keep its benchmark interest rate at zero at a policy meeting next week and is not expected to alter its stance for the foreseeable future, a Reuters poll showed on Friday.

Headlines: 'We'll see; - U.S. Vice President on whether U.K.'s 5G decision could hurt possible trade deal
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence said on Friday that Britain's decision to let Huawei Technologies have a limited role in its 5G network remains a point of issue between the two traditional allies.

Headlines: Ford shakes up top management, promises faster turnaround
Description: Ford Motor Co on Friday shook up its top management, naming strategy chief Jim Farley as chief operating officer of the No. 2 U.S. automaker and promising skeptical investors the company will kick a slow-moving turnaround into a higher gear.

Headlines: Apple to delay reopening of retail stores in China
Description: Apple Inc is extending its retail store closures in China due to the coronavirus outbreak, even as it worked toward opening its corporate offices and contact centers, the iPhone maker said on Friday.

Headlines: Treasury's Mnuchin sees U.S. GDP growth less than 3% in 2020
Description: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday he expects 2020 U.S. GDP growth to be less than 3%, partly due to problems at Boeing Co , which halted production of its 737 MAX planes over safety issues.

Headlines: Stocks fall on fears China virus to slow growth, gold gains
Description: Global equity markets and government debt yields slumped on Friday as nagging concerns about the impact of the coronavirus on global growth overshadowed a strong U.S. jobs report that indicated an economy on pace to grow moderately.

Headlines: Indexes drop from record highs, but tally strong weekly gains
Description: Wall Street fell from record levels on Friday after a four-day rally as investors digested the monthly U.S. jobs report and braced for the next coronavirus developments, but stocks still posted solid gains for the week.

Headlines: Mild weather boosts U.S. job growth; jobless rate ticks up
Description: U.S. job growth accelerated in January, with unseasonably mild temperatures boosting hiring in weather-sensitive sectors, indicating the economy will probably continue to grow moderately despite a deepening slump in business investment.

Headlines: Consumer discretionary names could see bumpy ride
Description: A raft of earnings reports from consumer discretionary companies and U.S. retail sales data set for the coming week could help investors determine to what extent the coronavirus is hitting consumer demand.

Headlines: U.S. jobs growth beats expectations for January
Description: U.S. non-farm payrolls data for January came in above analysts expectations, bolstering the view that the economy continues to grow at a healthy pace.

Headlines: Sparkle fades as coronavirus risks wiping out luxury goods growth
Description: The luxury goods industry normally relishes the spotlight, but in the case of China's coronavirus it is ruing being one of the most globally exposed sectors to an epidemic that risks all-but wiping out its sales growth this year.

Headlines: Nissan's China sales fell 12% in January as coronavirus epidemic weighs
Description: Japanese carmaker Nissan said on Friday its sales in China, the world's biggest auto market, fell by 11.8% in January year-on-year, as the Lunar New Year holiday began earlier than usual and the outbreak of coronavirus stymied economic activity.

Headlines: L'Oreal CEO says coronavirus will hamper sales in coming weeks
Description: L'Oreal CEO Jean-Paul Agon said on Friday that the French cosmetics company had a good January in China but that the spread of the coronavirus would have an impact on demand in the coming weeks.

Headlines: U.S. December wholesale inventories revised lower
Description: U.S. wholesale inventories were a bit weaker than initially estimated in December amid a broad decline in stocks, including motor vehicles.

Headlines: Malaysia's Mahathir clarifies comments on AirAsia
Description: Malaysia's Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad on Friday sought to clarify comments he made on bribery allegations linked to AirAsia Group .

Headlines: Fiat reaches settlement with Italy tax agency over Chrysler value claim
Description: Fiat Chrysler has reached a settlement with Italian tax authorities over the valuing of its U.S. Chrysler business involving no cash payment or penalty, the group's chief financial officer said.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's mobile giants to take on Google's Play store - sources
Description: China's Xiaomi , Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL], Oppo and Vivo are joining forces to create a platform for developers outside China to upload apps onto all of their app stores simultaneously, in a move analysts say is meant to challenge the dominance of Google's Play store.

Headlines: Foxconn, Chinese firms refit production lines to make masks amid virus outbreak
Description: A number of Chinese manufacturers including a subsidiary of Apple Inc partner Foxconn have refitted production lines to make masks and medical clothing, as a deadly coronavirus spreads across China.

Headlines: Credit Suisse CDS jump after CEO Thiam quits
Description: The cost of insuring exposure to debt issued by Credit Suisse jumped by 3 basis points (bps) on Friday after Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam quit amid a power struggle at Switzerland's second-biggest bank.

Headlines: L'Oreal rallies as sales increase offsets China concerns
Description: L'Oreal's shares rose on Friday after fourth-quarter earnings from the French cosmetics company helped to offset concerns over the impact of China's coronavirus health crisis on its business.

Headlines: Carmakers close Chinese factories because of coronavirus
Description: Automakers and parts suppliers have shut factories in China, in line with government guidelines, or have flagged a hit to profits following the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: ArcelorMittal, commissioners extend talks on Italy's Ilva plant: lawyer
Description: ArcelorMittal and commissioners of the Ilva steelworks in southern Italy have agreed to extend talks to the end of the month after making progress towards a possible deal to buy the plant, a lawyer for the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Toyota keeps China plant output stopped through February 16 as virus hits supply, logistics
Description: Toyota Motor Corp on Friday said production at all of its China plants would remain suspended through Feb. 16, joining a growing number of automakers facing stoppages due to supply chain issues as the coronavirus spreads.

Headlines: Blue collar boom? College grads, baby boomers big winners in Trump's economy
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump rolled out an eye-catching statistic in his State of the Union address Tuesday: the wealth held by the poorest half of American households increased three times as fast as the wealth held by the "1%" since he became president.

Headlines: Volkswagen says restart of some China plants postponed until February 17
Description: Volkswagen has postponed restarting production at most China plants in its joint venture with SAIC Motor and the Tianjin plant in its JV with FAW Group until Feb. 17 amid the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Uber and Lyft take different roads in search of profit
Description: Uber Technologies Inc and Lyft Inc , the two leading U.S. ride-hailing companies, are on divergent paths as Uber pours money into money-losing side businesses while smaller rival Lyft focuses on moving people around.

Headlines: Tesla can get support for German factory: Economy Minister
Description: Tesla could get state subsidies in its plan to set up a gigafactory in Germany, the country's economy minister told a weekly newspaper.

Headlines: SoftBank set for sharp quarterly profit drop amid pressure from Elliott
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group is expected to post a slide in profits for the past quarter, deepening concern about its ability to secure funding for a second Vision Fund and giving activist fund Elliott Management more fodder for a shake-up.

Headlines: China to France: Don't discriminate against Huawei on 5G networks
Description: The Chinese embassy in Paris on Sunday urged the French government not to discriminate against Huawei as it selects suppliers for its 5G mobile network, saying it feared the company would face more constraints than rivals.

Headlines: Mattel will close Canada factory after shuttering two manufacturing sites in Asia: WSJ
Description: Mattel Inc will close a factory in Canada after shutting down two plants in Asia, as the toymaker reduces its manufacturing footprint to cut costs, the Wall Street Journal said on Sunday.

Headlines: Boral shares plunge after bushfire profit hit, accounts probe
Description: Australia's Boral Ltd said on Monday delays to building projects due to bushfires will likely cause a plunge in its second-half results, while revealing an investigation had found inflated earnings at its North American window-making business.

Headlines: U.S. Transportation Dept. IG to audit FAA pilot training requirements after Boeing 737 MAX crashes
Description: The U.S. Transportation Department's Office of Inspector General said on Monday it will audit Federal Aviation Administration pilot training requirements for U.S. and foreign air carriers after two deadly crashes of Boeing's 737 MAX.

Headlines: Trump's budget proposes sale from emergency oil reserve
Description: President Donald Trump's 2021 budget released on Monday proposed a sale of 15 million barrels of oil from the emergency petroleum reserve to help pay for projects overseen by the Department of Energy.

Headlines: How Brazil's JBS became collateral damage in war between billionaires
Description: A business dispute between the disgraced billionaire Batista brothers in Brazil and the heir to an Indonesian pulp and paper fortune is throwing a wrench in meatpacker JBS SA’s plans to list its international operations in the United States.

Headlines: Amazon challenges India antitrust probe in court: filing
Description: Amazon.com Inc has begun legal action in India to quash an antitrust investigation against the company, saying it could cause "irreparable" loss and damage to its reputation, according to its court filing seen by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court denies Apple bid for rehearing in VirnetX patent case
Description: A U.S. appeals court on Monday denied a request by Apple Inc that it reconsider a decision upholding a finding Apple iPhones infringed VirnetX Holding Corp patents relating to secure communications technology.

Headlines: Judge denies Uber's, Postmates' request to halt California gig worker law
Description: A U.S. judge on Monday rejected a request by Uber Technologies Inc and courier services provider Postmates Inc to block a California labor law from taking effect, saying the bill's public benefits outweighed the companies' concerns.

Headlines: Trump budget proposes $150 million for creation of uranium reserve
Description: President Donald Trump's 2021 budget proposed $150 million for the creation of a U.S. uranium reserve as the administration seeks to help struggling producers of the fuel for nuclear power reactors.

Headlines: Trump's $4.8 trillion budget gets chilly reception from Congress
Description: President Donald Trump's $4.8 trillion budget plan for the coming fiscal year drew a prompt rejection on Monday from congressional Democrats, who said it betrayed his promise to protect popular health and safety-net programs.

Headlines: Caterpillar says most of its Chinese facilities reopened on February 10
Description: Caterpillar reopened most of its facilities in China on Monday after getting the go-ahead from the local government following the coronavirus outbreak, the company said.

Headlines: White House calls for biggest NASA budget in decades to reach the moon, Mars
Description: The White House on Monday asked Congress for $25.2 billion for NASA in 2021, the agency's biggest budget in decades, calling for steady increases over five years to meet President Donald Trump's goal of landing astronauts on the moon and Mars.

Headlines: WeWork temporarily closes 100 buildings in China over coronavirus: CNBC
Description: Office sharing startup WeWork has temporarily closed 100 buildings in China due to the coronavirus outbreak, Chairman Marcelo Claure said in a CNBC interview on Monday.

Headlines: Nissan to halt production at Japan factory due to coronavirus
Description: Nissan Motor Co will temporarily halt production at its plant in Kyushu, southwestern Japan, due to the coronavirus, the Japanese automaker said on Monday, as the outbreak starts to strain the global supply chain.

Headlines: China rejects Foxconn's request to resume production in key Shenzhen plant: source
Description: Taiwan's Foxconn was not allowed to resume production in its plant in the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen that had been shut due to the coronavirus outbreak, a person with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: GM to restart production in China from Feb. 15
Description: General Motors said on Monday it would restart production in from Feb. 15 in China, where the country is dealing with a coronavirus epidemic which has killed more than 900 people.

Headlines: Britain 'reasonably confident' of U.S. trade deal despite Huawei concerns
Description: Britain takes U.S. concerns about its use of Huawei equipment seriously but is confident a trade deal with the United States will be among its first after leaving the European Union, its foreign secretary said on Monday.

Headlines: Investor backing proved poison chalice for Credit Suisse CEO
Description: As the chairman of Credit Suisse prepared for a crunch meeting of directors over the future of its chief executive, the vocal backing of a U.S. investor for Tidjane Thiam had unintended consequences, helping seal the ousted CEO's fate.

Headlines: Credit Suisse CEO Thiam toppled by espionage scandal
Description: Tidjane Thiam has quit as Credit Suisse chief executive after a spying scandal that has hit the reputation of one of Europe's largest banks and shocked Switzerland's financial community.

Headlines: Credit Suisse's new CEO Gottstein seeks growth offensive
Description: Credit Suisse's incoming chief executive, Thomas Gottstein, plans to put Switzerland's second-biggest bank on a growth offensive following predecessor Tidjane Thiam's cost-cutting exercise, he told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Apple's main iPhone maker Foxconn to resume some Chinese production: source
Description: Apple's main iPhone maker Foxconn got the green light on Monday to reopen two major plants in China closed because of the coronavirus and aims to resume production even though only 10% of the workforce has returned so far, a source told Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: Top lithium miner seeks to monitor water scarcity in parched Chile salt flat
Description: With residents and courts ringing the alarm about depleted water supplies in Chile's Atacama salt flat, the world's top lithium miner Albemarle quietly filed a proposal in December for a network to monitor flows beneath the parched desert floor.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including coiled spring stocks, crude consolidation
Description: CNBC's Jim Cramer reveals what health official he is taking his cue from before he turns bullish on travel and other stocks with China exposure.

Headlines: Boeing scores no January orders for first time since 1962
Description: Boeing Co booked no new orders for airplanes last month, the first time it has come up empty-handed in January since 1962, as the U.S. planemaker's once best-selling jet, the 737 MAX, remained grounded following two fatal crashes.

Headlines: Exclusive: Argentina's Aerolineas to add new flights to New York and Madrid - chairman
Description: Aerolineas Argentinas will add new flights to New York and Madrid as the government-controlled carrier seeks to ramp up sales outside its home country and boost income in an effort to beat back persistent operating losses.

Headlines: Trump lashes out at Fed while Powell testifies before U.S. House committee
Description: President Donald Trump reiterated his criticism that the Federal Reserve has kept interest rates too high and seemed to say the U.S. central bank's chair, Jerome Powell, had hurt stock prices during his testimony to Congress on Tuesday.

Headlines: Finland's Supercell reports sales up 2% while core earnings slip
Description: Finland's biggest game maker Supercell reported on Tuesday its full-year 2019 sales rose 2% to 1.39 billion euros ($1.52 billion) although core earnings slipped 4%.

Headlines: Under Armour shares drop after surprise profit decline warning for 2020
Description: Under Armour Inc on Tuesday forecast a surprise drop in 2020 profit, blaming ongoing weakness in its North American business and the coronavirus outbreak in China, sending its shares tumbling as much as 16%.

Headlines: China c.bank gives green light to Mastercard's China JV for clearing business
Description: China's central bank said on Tuesday it has approved an application by Mastercard's China joint venture to conduct bank card clearing operations in the country.

Headlines: China's first-quarter smartphone sales may halve due to coronavirus: analysts
Description: China's smartphone sales may plunge by as much as 50% in the first quarter, as many retail shops have closed for an extended period and production has yet to fully resume due to the fast spread of a new coronavirus, according to research reports.

Headlines: Michelin shares fall after tire maker sees lower 2020 operating income
Description: Shares in French tire maker Michelin fell on Tuesday after the company forecast a slightly lower operating income for 2020 and flagged uncertainty to its business from the coronavirus crisis in China.

Headlines: JD Sports may have to sell Footasylum if it doesn't address competition concerns: watchdog
Description: UK sportswear retailer JD Sports may have to sell Footasylum if it does not address competition concerns about last year's acquisition of its smaller rival, Britain's competition watchdog said on Tuesday after an in-depth review of the takeover.

Headlines: Small Hong Kong businesses count the cost of coronavirus
Description: As the spread of coronavirus sends jitters across Hong Kong, usually bustling shopping malls, restaurants and retailers are deserted, leaving some small business owners contemplating their future in the global financial hub.

Headlines: FTC demands data on small buys by Google, Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Microsoft
Description: Concerned that big tech companies are unfairly engaging in potential anti-competitive behavior, the Federal Trade Commission said on Tuesday it ordered Alphabet Inc's Google unit, Amazon.com Inc , Apple Inc , Facebook Inc and Microsoft Corp to provide information on mergers that were too small to report to antitrust regulators.

Headlines: Barren streets but bustling stock markets in virus-stricken China
Description: Shops, restaurants and cinemas may be deserted in many parts of virus-plagued China, but online trading forums, internet roadshows and analyst calls are teeming with investors who have driven up stock trading volumes to nine-month highs.

Headlines: Oil prices rise about 1%, up from 13-month low as virus cases slow
Description: Oil prices rose about 1% on Tuesday, up from 13-month lows as the number of new coronavirus cases slowed in China, easing some concern over the potential for lengthy oil demand destruction.

Headlines: Exclusive: Germany's Volkswagen and Daimler push for more 'sustainable' Chile lithium
Description: German automakers Volkswagen and Daimler have launched a study to push for more "sustainable" lithium mining in Chile, according to lobbyist filings reviewed by Reuters, a sign of growing supply chain concerns ahead of an expected electric vehicle boom.

Headlines: U.S. companies cut back on installing robots in 2019
Description: U.S. companies installed fewer robots in 2019 than they did the year before, the first cut back since 2015, as a downturn in manufacturing fueled by trade wars and weaker demand dampened appetite for the machines.

Headlines: U.S. downgrade could stoke bias against Malaysian airlines: regulator
Description: Malaysia's aviation regulator said on Tuesday its airlines could be discriminated against by foreign authorities after the country's air safety rating was downgraded by the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) late last year.

Headlines: Mercedes has re-started China production, still assessing virus impact
Description: Mercedes-Benz has re-started production of luxury passenger cars in Beijing this week, Ola Kaellenius, Chief Executive of parent company Daimler , said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Sleeping giant awakens? Downside risks for euro grow
Description: A drop in the euro/dollar exchange rate to a four-month low raises the prospect of a repricing of one of the world’s most important macro-economic metrics and a potential re-rating of the U.S. currency across the globe.

Headlines: Despite $1 trillion deficits, Trump tax cuts will still 'pay for themselves': Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin insisted on Wednesday that President Donald Trump's tax cuts will still pay for themselves over 10 years, even as the administration forecasts near-term deficits close to $1 trillion.

Headlines: Pentagon expected to back additional Huawei restrictions: source
Description: The Pentagon is likely to back new U.S. restrictions on Huawei Technologies, reversing earlier opposition to a proposal meant to further crack down on exports to the blacklisted Chinese company, a person briefed on the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Raytheon discloses SEC subpoena related to payments by Thales JV in Middle East
Description: Raytheon has received a subpoena from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission related to an investigation into the possibility of improper payments made for contracts in certain Middle East countries since 2014, the U.S. weapons maker disclosed in a filing https://www.sec.gov/ix?doc=/Archives/edgar/data/1047122/000104712220000009/rtn-12312019x10k.htm on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tesla seeks approval to build longer range Model 3s in China
Description: Tesla Inc is seeking approval from Chinese regulators to offer a new China-made Model 3 variant, a government document shows.

Headlines: Carnival stock's rally is a sign 'this market is driven by hope,' Jim Cramer says
Description: Wall Street is "blessing any company that spells out its China losses," CNBC's Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: MGM Resorts CEO Jim Murren to step down before contract ends
Description: MGM Resorts International's Chief Executive Officer Jim Murren will step down before completing his contract, the U.S. casino operator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: PVH closes most Calvin Klein, Tommy Hilfiger China stores on virus outbreak
Description: PVH Corp said on Wednesday it had temporarily closed majority of its Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger stores in China due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Gucci owner Kering halts spending in China on virus fears
Description: Gucci-owner Kering has temporarily shut half of its stores in China, and shelved new openings and advertising campaigns there, as the coronavirus outbreak throws luxury brands into turmoil.

Headlines: New coronavirus: what markets should watch now
Description: World markets started shrugging off the worst of the coronavirus impact last week and stock markets have since reached record highs. China's announcement that new cases of the so-called COVID-19 detected on Tuesday were at their lowest since Jan 30 has only consolidated those gains.

Headlines: Souring energy loans wipe out ABN Amro's profit growth
Description: Souring energy loans eroded ABN Amro's fourth quarter profit growth, it said on Wednesday, prompting the Dutch bank to launch another review of its trade and commodity finance operations.

Headlines: Coronavirus brings jet refinancing boost: Avolon CEO
Description: Major aircraft lessor Avolon and its peers stand to benefit from the coronavirus outbreak as airlines shore up cash by refinancing their planes, the Dublin-based firm said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Clariant's leadership reshuffle continues as CFO jumps ship to Maersk
Description: Clariant Chief Financial Officer Patrick Jany is exiting for a post at Maersk , the world's biggest shipping company, marking the latest management change at the Swiss speciality chemicals maker after its CEO jumped ship last year.

Headlines: China's GDP goal on track despite virus impact: government economist
Description: China will be able to achieve its long-term goal of doubling gross domestic product and incomes this year despite the impact from a conoravirus outbreak, an influential economist at a top government think tank said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fed's Powell reinforces regulation and defends repo support in letter to Congress
Description: U.S. central bank officials are considering options that would make it easier for banks to treat Treasury holdings similar to reserves when meeting liquidity requirements, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said this week in a letter to a top Senate Democrat.

Headlines: U.S. judge drops some charges against Theranos's Holmes, leaves wire fraud
Description: A federal judge late on Tuesday dismissed some charges against Theranos Inc founder Elizabeth Holmes, but let stand wire fraud charges accusing her and an associate of misleading patients about the abilities of her company's blood tests.

Headlines: Oil rises over 3% as demand worries ease amid fewer new coronavirus cases
Description: Oil prices rose over 3% on Wednesday as China reported its lowest daily number of new coronavirus cases since late January, stoking investor hopes that fuel demand in the world's second-largest oil consumer may begin to recover.

Headlines: 'Everyone is guessing' about coronavirus economic impacts, say experts
Description: The coronavirus that spread from a seafood market in Wuhan, China to infect tens of thousands has shuttered businesses, grounded flights and killed over 1,000 people so far, mostly in China.

Headlines: FTC antitrust victory on Qualcomm questioned by appeals court
Description: The U.S. government's antitrust victory over chip supplier Qualcomm Inc drew tough questions for the Federal Trade Commision from a panel of three appellate judges in San Francisco on Thursday.

Headlines: Nvidia forecast tops expectations on cloud sales despite coronavirus hit
Description: Nvidia Corp on Thursday forecast first-quarter revenue that topped Wall Street expectations, powered by sales of its chips to cloud computing vendors, even as it projected a $100 million hit from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Woodside holds on to stake in Senegal oil field as FAR challenge fails
Description: ConocoPhillips' sale of a stake in a $4.2 billion Senegal oil and gas project to Woodside Petroleum has been cleared by an international tribunal, resolving a long-running challenge by Australian partner FAR Ltd .

Headlines: Tesla to recall 3,183 Model X vehicles in China: market regulator
Description: Tesla Inc will recall 3,183 Model X vehicles in China, because of a potential issue that could make steering harder and increase the risk of a crash, according to the country's market regulator.

Headlines: Alibaba warns of drop in e-commerce revenues due to coronavirus
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd warned of a drop in revenues at its key e-commerce businesses this quarter as the coronavirus sweeping China hits supply chains and deliveries.

Headlines: Rents lift U.S. core inflation; weekly jobless claims rise slightly
Description: U.S. underlying consumer prices picked up in January, while the number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits rose slightly last week, suggesting the economy was stable enough for the Federal Reserve to keep interest rates on hold this year.

Headlines: Trump Fed nominee Shelton apologises for likening currency forger to Rosa Parks
Description: Federal Reserve board nominee Judy Shelton on Thursday apologised for having likened a convicted currency counterfeiter to U.S. civil rights icon Rosa Parks in an unusual exchange with a lawmaker weighing her appointment to the central bank.

Headlines: Southwest extends 737 MAX flight cancellations through early August
Description: Southwest Airlines on Thursday extended its cancellation of 737 MAX flights through early August as the grounding of the Boeing Co jet continued and threatened to impact nearly all of the busy U.S. summer travel season.

Headlines: Oil prices climb on prospects for deeper OPEC+ output cuts
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Thursday as investors hoped the world's biggest producers would cut output more while they largely shrugged off forecasts of slumping demand due to the coronavirus outbreak in top oil importer China.

Headlines: Barclays chief Staley probed over Epstein ties
Description: Britain's financial regulators are probing links between Barclays Chief Executive Jes Staley and the U.S. financier Jeffrey Epstein, who killed himself while awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges, after the Financial Times reported on a trove of emails between the two on Thursday.

Headlines: Fire damage at Exxon's second largest U.S. refinery leaves restart uncertain: sources
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp does not have a timeline for restarting fuel-producing units at its second-largest U.S. refinery following a fire Wednesday that cut production, sources said, as the shutdown boosted gasoline prices on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump Fed nominee Shelton apologizes for likening currency forger to Rosa Parks
Description: Federal Reserve board nominee Judy Shelton on Thursday apologized for having likened a convicted currency counterfeiter to U.S. civil rights icon Rosa Parks in an unusual exchange with a lawmaker weighing her appointment to the central bank.

Headlines: Google seals takeover of Looker after UK green light
Description: Alphabet Inc-owned Google said on Thursday it has completed its $2.6 billion buyout of privately held big-data analytics firm Looker Data Sciences after winning clearance from Britain's competition watchdog.

Headlines: Apple to reopen some stores in Beijing on February 14: website
Description: Apple will reopen some stores in Beijing from Feb. 14 with reduced opening hours, it said on its website, while many of its other stores in mainland China will remain shut as the country continues to battle a coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Hong Kong banks compare pandemic stress test with epidemic reality
Description: Last October, nearly four dozen banks in Hong Kong confronted a nightmare "stress test" scenario: a pandemic that swept through the city, followed by a major cyberattack and a telecoms breakdown.

Headlines: Mad cow fright keeps EU cautious on food rules
Description: The specter of the 1990s BSE crisis means the European Union is likely to reject U.S. demands it ease strict food safety rules, even with President Donald Trump threatening car tariffs if EU countries do not start importing more U.S. farm products.

Headlines: Turkey's Atlasglobal suspends flight operations: news websites
Description: Turkish airline Atlasglobal has decided to suspend all its operations and told its personnel not to come to work on Thursday, the aviation sector news website AirportHaber and other media reported.

Headlines: Qantas raises the stakes in pilot pay dispute
Description: Australia's Qantas Airways has urged its pilots to reach agreement on a pay deal for the world's longest commercial flights or face being replaced for those routes.

Headlines: Hyundai bet big on China. Now coronavirus is twisting its supply chain
Description: South Korean car giant Hyundai Motor has increasingly relied on China to supply auto parts to its manufacturing hub at home in recent years. As the coronavirus spreads, its strategy could be backfiring.

Headlines: Airbus, Quebec to buy out Bombardier's A220 stake
Description: Airbus has teamed up with the Quebec government to buy Bombardier's 33.5% stake in the A220 passenger jet program, completing the Canadian firm's exit from civil aviation and boosting Airbus's position in a new battleground with Boeing.

Headlines: Gazprom to resume China gas route talks once virus quarantine lifted
Description: Russia's Gazprom said on Thursday it will continue talks on new China natural gas routes once the coronavirus quarantine is lifted.

Headlines: UK's Domino's finds buyers for Norway business
Description: Britain's biggest pizza delivery company Domino's Pizza Group said on Thursday it would sell its Norwegian business to existing minority shareholders of the business, kicking off the sale of its loss-making overseas operations.

Headlines: Trump Fed nominee Shelton hits bipartisan skepticism in Senate hearing
Description: Federal Reserve board nominee Judy Shelton faced deep skepticism from Republicans and Democrats on the Senate Banking Committee on Thursday, as lawmakers challenged her independence from President Donald Trump and characterized her thinking as too far outside the mainstream to trust with the nation's economy.

Headlines: Zuckerberg ready for Facebook to pay more tax as welcomes rules review
Description: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg accepts that global tax reforms mean it may have to pay more taxes in different countries, excerpts of a speech he is due to deliver in Germany on Saturday show.

Headlines: U.S. firm wins reprieve from expanded duties on steel products
Description: The U.S. Court of International Trade has issued a temporary order under which U.S. customs agents cannot collect duties from a U.S. company under President Donald Trump's recently-announced expansion of steel and aluminum tariffs.

Headlines: Timeline: Highlights of the 16-year Airbus, Boeing trade war
Description: The U.S. government on Friday raised tariffs on aircraft imported from the European Union, ratcheting up pressure on the EU to resolve an epic 16-year-old dispute over support for airplane makers, and raising the stakes in broader talks to reach a U.S.-EU trade deal.

Headlines: Airbus says higher U.S. tariffs on EU planes will harm U.S. airlines, consumers
Description: The U.S. government's decision to raise tariffs on European-built aircraft will hit U.S. airlines already facing a shortage of aircraft and complicate efforts to reach a negotiated settlement with the European Union, Airbus said.

Headlines: Boeing to extend labor contract with engineer's union by four years
Description: U.S. planemaker Boeing Co said it has agreed to a tentative deal with its engineers' union to extend its labor contract by another four years.

Headlines: Dolce & Gabbana founders have received offers but have no plans to sell: paper
Description: Italy's Dolce & Gabbana founder Stefano Gabbana said on Friday he had received proposals to buy the group but had no intention to sell.

Headlines: Buffett's Berkshire buys Kroger and Biogen, reduces Wells Fargo and Goldman stakes
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc on Friday said it has taken a $549.1 million stake in Kroger Co, investing in the largest U.S. supermarket chain as smaller rivals struggle.

Headlines: Saks Fifth Avenue plans expansion into bankrupt Barneys shop in Los Angeles
Description: Luxury department store operator Saks Fifth Avenue, owned by Canada's Hudson's Bay Co , is expanding into bankrupt fashion chain Barneys' Beverly Hills shop, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Canadian pot producer Canopy may face challenges offloading assets, CEO says
Description: Canada's biggest cannabis producer, Canopy Growth Corp , could face challenges offloading assets as it seeks to winnow its facilities down to focus on its most lucrative markets and products, its chief executive told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. looking for industry partnership to counter Huawei: White House official
Description: The United States is looking to develop a partnership with the telecoms industry to provide alternatives to China's Huawei Technologies, a senior White House official said on Friday.

Headlines: Total considers stopping fuel oil sales for power: CEO
Description: France's Total is considering stopping sales of fuel oil to power markets as the energy giant seeks to reduce its carbon footprint and grow its renewable power business, its chief executive told Reuters.

Headlines: MGM Resorts-led consortium named as lead bidder for Osaka casino project
Description: A consortium led by U.S. entertainment giant MGM Resorts International has been named as the lead bidder for an integrated casino complex in Osaka, the local government said on Friday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler halts production in Serbia over China disruption
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) said on Friday it had temporarily halted production at its Serbian plant, the first such suspension by an automaker in Europe in response to the coronavirus outbreak in China.

Headlines: Europe wants G20 to make taxing digital giants top priority this year
Description: Europe wants the world's financial leaders to make it their top priority this year to reach a deal on global rules for taxing digital giants like Google , Amazon and Facebook , a document showed.

Headlines: U.S. January industrial output falls on weather, Boeing drop
Description: U.S. industrial production fell 0.3% in January as unseasonably warm weather held down the output of utilities and Boeing Co cut production of civilian aircraft, the Federal Reserve said on Friday.

Headlines: Apple to reopen a store in Shanghai on February 15
Description: Apple Inc said on Friday it would reopen one of the seven retail stores it has in Shanghai from Feb. 15 with reduced working hours, a day after the iPhone maker said a few retail stores in Beijing would start functioning from Feb. 14.

Headlines: Volkswagen offers 830 million euros to compensate German buyers
Description: Volkswagen said it will compensate owners of its heavily polluting diesel vehicles in Germany in a settlement that will cost the German carmaker 830 million euros.

Headlines: Google in talks with publishers to pay for premium news content: WSJ
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google is in talks with publishers on paying a licensing fee for content that would be packaged in a premium news product, the Wall Street Journal reported https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-in-talks-to-pay-publishers-for-content-in-premium-news-product-11581689169, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Toyota to resume China output at three plants next week
Description: Toyota Motor Corp said on Saturday it plans to resume output at three of its four main auto plants in China next week.

Headlines: Factbox: Carmakers look to resume China output after virus forced closures
Description: Automakers including Daimler, Ford and Tesla are looking to resume production in China after being forced to shut factories following the outbreak of a new coronavirus.

Headlines: Airbus regrets U.S. tariffs, hopes for change when WTO authorizes EU retaliation
Description: European aerospace group Airbus said on Saturday it deeply regretted the U.S. decision to increase tariffs on aircraft imported from the European Union and said it would hurt U.S. airlines and their customers.

Headlines: Rebuffed by UK, U.S. pitches 'big tent' for Huawei rivals in Europe
Description: The United States is seeking to rally European support for competitors to Huawei Technologies following disappointment in Washington over Britain's decision to use 5G equipment made by the Chinese company.

Headlines: These five S&P 500 stocks have the highest number of buy ratings on the Street
Description: Amazon, Alphabet, Facebook, Salesforce and PayPal are Wall Street's most loved stocks, but only one looks especially attractive at its elevated levels, traders say.

Headlines: Japan ready to take steps vs virus impact on tourism: Economy Minister
Description: Japanese Economy Minister Yasutoshi Nishimura said on Monday the government was ready to take all necessary steps flexibly with an eye on the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on the economy and tourism.

Headlines: Alstom nears deal to buy Bombardier's train unit: source
Description: France's Alstom SA is close to clinching a deal to buy Bombardier Inc's train business which will give the unit an enterprise value of $7 billion, according to a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Tesla ordered by German court to stop cutting down trees for Gigafactory
Description: A German court on Sunday ordered Tesla Inc to stop clearing forest land near the capital Berlin to build its first European car and battery factory, a victory for local environmental activists.

Headlines: Amazon, Flipkart seek rollback of new Indian tax on online sellers
Description: Amazon and Walmart's Flipkart are among online retailers demanding that India scale back a proposed tax on third-party sellers on their platforms, saying the burden of compliance will hurt the fledgling industry, according to documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Carrefour to buy 30 stores in Brazil from rival Makro
Description: The Brazilian unit of France's Carrefour SA has agreed to buy 30 stores from rival retailer Makro's Brazilian subsidiary for 1.95 billion reais ($453.69 million), the French retailer said in a securities filing on Sunday.

Headlines: Regulators should allow RTL and ProSieben to merge: Rabe
Description: The head of publisher Bertelsmann said its TV arm RTL should be allowed to merge with German rival ProSiebenSat.1 , to give them a fighting chance against U.S. streaming giants.

Headlines: Treat us like something between a telco and a newspaper, says Facebook's Zuckerberg
Description: Online content should be regulated with a system somewhere between the existing rules used for the telecoms and media industries, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg told global leaders and security chiefs on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. peach grower awarded $265 million from Bayer, BASF in weedkiller lawsuit
Description: A Missouri jury's $265 million award to peach grower Bill Bader in his lawsuit against herbicide providers Bayer and BASF has raised the stakes for the two companies as at least 140 similar cases head to U.S. courts later this year.

Headlines: New York drops fight against T-Mobile-Sprint merger
Description: New York on Sunday dropped its fight against the $40 billion merger of U.S. wireless carriers T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp , saying the state would not appeal a judge's approval of the deal.

Headlines: EU industry chief warns of more onerous tech rules by year end
Description: The European Union will decide by the end of the year whether to impose rules reining in the market power of U.S. tech giants, the bloc's industry chief said on Monday as he criticised Facebook's proposals as insufficient to address EU concerns.

Headlines: Chinese support measures buoy world stocks
Description: Global shares were buoyant on Monday as the promise of further policy stimulus from China to counteract the economic hit from a coronavirus outbreak calmed nervous investors.

Headlines: Oil edges up as output cut hopes offset coronavirus concern
Description: Oil prices inched up on Monday as concerns over the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak in China were offset by expectations that potential production cuts from major producers could tighten global crude supply.

Headlines: EU industry chief tells Facebook to adapt to EU, not other way round
Description: EU industry commissioner Thierry Breton said on Monday it was for Facebook to adapt to Europe's standards, not the other way round, as he criticized the U.S. social media giant's proposed internet rules as insufficient.

Headlines: Xerox courts HP shareholders as takeover battle heats up
Description: U.S. printer maker Xerox Holdings Corp is hosting a dinner for HP Inc shareholders this week as it seeks investor support to overcome the personal computer maker's resistance to its $35 billion takeover bid, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Alibaba offers $2.86 billion in loans to firms hit by coronavirus outbreak
Description: Alibaba Group Holdings said on Monday its affiliate Ant Financial's MYBank unit would offer 20 billion yuan ($2.86 billion) in loans to companies in China in light of the coronavirus outbreak, with preferential terms for Hubei firms.

Headlines: BOJ's Kuroda flags more easing if virus impact worsens: Sankei
Description: Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said the central bank would consider additional rapid easing if the coronavirus outbreak significantly threatened Japan's economy and price trends, the Sankei newspaper reported on Monday.

Headlines: Climate change could make premiums unaffordable: QBE Insurance
Description: Australia's QBE Insurance Group said on Monday climate change could make some premiums unaffordable, especially for customers exposed to extreme weather events, and was a "material risk" for its operations across the globe.

Headlines: NMC Health founder Shetty resigns as turmoil deepens
Description: NMC Health said on Monday its founder BR Shetty had resigned as the Emirati healthcare group's joint non-executive chairman, leaving UK businessman H.J. Mark Tompkins as sole chairman.

Headlines: Dow, S&P 500 decline after Apple's sales warning
Description: The Dow and S&P 500 fell on Tuesday after a sales warning from Apple left investors assessing the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on U.S. companies.

Headlines: Hedge funds use DIY strategies to gauge coronavirus impact
Description: As investors crunch numbers to determine how the coronavirus will hit China’s economy, hedge fund manager Nathaniel Polachek has tied much of his outlook to the fate of a ship anchored near Weihai, China.

Headlines: Coronavirus dents bookings for Holiday Inn owner IHG
Description: InterContinental Hotels (IHG) warned on Tuesday that fewer travellers are booking its rooms in China because of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Consumer groups, unions oppose fix for planned merger of AbbVie and Allergan
Description: A group of unions and consumer groups wrote to U.S. antitrust enforcers on Tuesday to oppose a proposed remedy that could lead to U.S. approval for AbbVie Inc's planned purchase of Allergan Plc .

Headlines: HSBC to slash investment bank, 35,000 jobs in strategy overhaul
Description: HSBC Holdings PLC said on Tuesday it would shed $100 billion in assets, shrink its investment bank and revamp its U.S. and European businesses in a drastic overhaul that will mean 35,000 jobs cut over three years.

Headlines: Stocks slide on Apple's virus warning, euro near three-year low
Description: Gold rose and global equity markets slid on Tuesday after Apple Inc said it was unlikely to meet its sales guidance because of the coronavirus outbreak in China, a warning highlighting the epidemic's threat to global growth and corporate profits.

Headlines: China races to contain job losses as coronavirus batters economy
Description: When cameraman Mark Xia returned to his job this month after holidays, the Shanghai video production house where he worked told him to take three months of leave with no pay, as a coronavirus epidemic takes a toll of China's businesses.

Headlines: U.S. judge rejects Huawei challenge to federal law restricting its business
Description: A federal judge in Texas on Tuesday rejected Chinese telecommunications equipment maker Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's constitutional challenge to a U.S. law that restricted its ability to do business with federal agencies and their contractors.

Headlines: Hormel joins Tyson Foods, JBS in removing drug banned by China from hog supply
Description: Spam-maker Hormel Foods Corp is eliminating a growth drug banned by China from its hog supply, the company said on Tuesday, joining rivals that are seeking to increase meat sales to Chinese buyers grappling with a pork shortage.

Headlines: French finance minister warns Renault against job cuts, factory closures
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire warned Renault on Tuesday against shutting factories in France and cutting jobs there after the carmaker announced "no taboos" cost cuts last week.

Headlines: If Apple is hurting due to the coronavirus, its suppliers and rivals likely are too
Description: Apple Inc's surprise warning that it will likely fall short of this quarter's sales target due to the coronavirus epidemic points to much pain for its chip and other suppliers as well as for rivals who also rely on China to build their products.

Headlines: Nissan CEO tells angry shareholders he is ready to be sacked if no turnaround
Description: Nissan's new chief executive said on Tuesday he would accept being fired if he fails to turn around Japan's second biggest automaker which is grappling with plunging sales in the aftermath of the scandal surrounding ex-chairman Carlos Ghosn.

Headlines: Exclusive: Tesla in talks to use CATL's cobalt-free batteries in China-made cars - sources
Description: Tesla is in advanced stages of talks to use batteries from CATL that contain no cobalt - one of the most expensive metals in electric vehicle (EV) batteries - in cars made at its China plant, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Apple warns sales to fall short of target due to coronavirus impact
Description: Apple Inc warned on Monday it was unlikely to meet its March quarter sales guidance set just three weeks ago as the world's most valuable technology firm became one of the biggest corporate casualties of China's coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Should Facebook, Google be liable for user posts? asks U.S. Attorney General Barr
Description: U.S. Attorney General William Barr on Wednesday questioned whether Facebook, Google and other major online platforms still need the immunity from legal liability that has prevented them from being sued over material their users post.

Headlines: Oil up more than 2% on slowing coronavirus cases, U.S. move on Venezuela
Description: Oil prices gained more than 2% on Wednesday as worries eased about demand declining due to the spread of coronavirus cases in China, while supplies tightened as the United States moved to cut off more Venezuelan crude from the market.

Headlines: Exclusive: Google users in UK to lose EU data protection - sources
Description: Google is planning to move its British users' accounts out of the control of European Union privacy regulators, placing them under U.S. jurisdiction instead, sources said.

Headlines: U.S. housing starts fall, building permits near 13-year high
Description: U.S. homebuilding fell less than expected in January while permits surged to a near 13-year high, pointing to sustained housing market strength that could help keep the longest economic expansion in history on track.

Headlines: Boeing, crash victims' lawyers negotiate over access to 737 MAX documents
Description: Boeing Co and lawyers representing families of victims of a 737 MAX crash agreed in court on Wednesday to hold a conference call with U.S. government crash probe authorities over access to documents related to the now-grounded aircraft's design, development and two fatal disasters involving it.

Headlines: Fresenius Medical says fourth-quarter operating profit up 3%
Description: Germany's Fresenius Medical Care on Wednesday said quarterly adjusted operating income edged 3% higher as growth in dialysis services and products was partly offset by a negative adjustment for accounts receivable in a legal dispute in North America.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq hit record closing highs, lifted by China stimulus hopes
Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq rose to record closing highs on Wednesday as optimism that China would take more measures to prop up its economy eased concerns about the economic impact of the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Lofty stocks, hefty debt sow seeds of worry for some at Fed
Description: Rock-bottom corporate bond yields, high levels of business debt and one of the fastest expansions of stock market valuations on record are worrying some Federal Reserve officials who fret such financial imbalances could aggravate any negative shocks to the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Google plans to move UK users' accounts outside EU jurisdiction
Description: Google is planning to move its British users' accounts out of the control of European Union privacy regulators, placing them under U.S. jurisdiction instead, the company confirmed late on Wednesday.

Headlines: UniCredit CEO says no M&A deal after Intesa's surprise UBI bid
Description: The head of UniCredit repeated in a letter to staff on Wednesday that Italy's biggest bank had no intention of engaging in merger and acquisition deals following Intesa's blitz move to buy rival UBI Banca .

Headlines: Exclusive: India antitrust investigators see no evidence of collusion by IndiGo, SpiceJet and others - sources
Description: Investigators with India's antitrust watchdog have found no evidence that the country's biggest airline, IndiGo , and four rival carriers colluded to fix ticket prices, three sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Puma warns of hit to sales and profits from coronavirus
Description: German sportswear group Puma on Wednesday said it expected China's coronavirus outbreak to hit its sales and profits in the first quarter but it still hopes to reach its targets for 2020.

Headlines: General Motors to lay off all 1,500 plant workers in Thailand following sale
Description: General Motors will begin laying off around 1,500 employees in Thailand in June, after announcing the sale of its production plants in the country, a government official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Adidas, Puma warn of coronavirus hit to China business
Description: German sportswear makers Adidas and Puma have both warned that the coronavirus outbreak was hurting their business in China due to store closures and fewer Chinese tourists travelling and shopping in other markets.

Headlines: Their market shut, traders in China's Silicon Valley do business from bags
Description: While coronavirus fears curtail much of China's bustle, traders are getting back to business at the world's largest electronics market, buying and selling from bags and suitcases on the streets outside their shut premises.

Headlines: Exclusive: Vodafone, Telecom Italia offer rivals access to some sites to ease EU concerns - EU paper
Description: Vodafone and Telekom Italia have offered to allow rivals access to sites in some cities for up to nine years, a proposal aimed at allaying EU antitrust concerns over the creation of Italy’s largest mobile tower company, according to an EU document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: UBS's tech-savvy new boss Hamers not always loved by the Dutch
Description: Ralph Hamers made his mark as a tech-savvy chief executive who led Dutch bank ING back to profitability after cementing its position as a no-frills lender in Germany and simplifying its product portfolio.

Headlines: Lebanon's Aoun vows accountability over financial crisis-Twitter
Description: Lebanese President Michel Aoun said on Thursday measures would be taken to hold to account all those who contributed to Lebanon's financial crisis through illegal actions be they transfers abroad, manipulation of Eurobonds or other acts.

Headlines: Watchdog faults Swiss bank Julius Baer for money laundering lapses
Description: Swiss bank Julius Baer has been reprimanded by the country's financial watchdog for ignoring money laundering risks in handling millions of francs of payments linked to corruption in Venezuela and world soccer body FIFA.

Headlines: EU privacy body warns of privacy risks in Google, Fitbit deal
Description: Alphabet Inc-owned Google's $2.1 billion bid for fitness trackers company Fitbit could pose privacy risks, the European Data Protection Board (EDPB) warned on Thursday, adding its voice to other critics of the deal.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley's E*Trade deal to test Washington's regulatory mood in election year
Description: Morgan Stanley's takeover of brokerage E*Trade Financial Corp reflects a more relaxed regulatory mood in Washington, but it is still a gamble in an election year that will see Democrats continue to shine a spotlight on Wall Street excesses, said analysts.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sears snags new financial lifeline as losses continue - sources
Description: U.S. department store operator Sears has reached a deal for a fresh financial lifeline totaling roughly $100 million from hedge fund Brigade Capital Management LP, as it tries to stabilize after bankruptcy, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Dollar slams yen and safe-haven status, gold gains
Description: The rally in U.S. equities took a pause and the strong dollar got stronger on Thursday, rising to a three-year high against a basket of trading partner currencies, after a steep slide in the Japanese yen called into question its safe-haven status.

Headlines: Airbus investing up to 1 billion euros in A220 passenger jet program this year
Description: Airbus SE plans to invest between 500 million euros and 1 billion euros ($539 million-$1.08 billion) this year on its A220 passenger jet program, Chief Executive Guillaume Faury said on Thursday at the company's A220 factory in Mirabel, just outside Montreal.

Headlines: P&G expects coronavirus outbreak to hit current-quarter revenue, profit
Description: Procter & Gamble Co said on Thursday its current-quarter revenue and profit would take a hit from supply chain disruptions and weak demand due to the coronavirus outbreak in China, the consumer goods company's second-biggest market.

Headlines: L Brands sells majority stake in Victoria's Secret, CEO Wexner to step down
Description: L Brands Inc said on Thursday it will sell a controlling stake in its Victoria's Secret unit to investment firm Sycamore Partners, valuing the lingerie brand at $1.1 billion, as it focuses on its core Bath & Body Works brand.

Headlines: Shares of HNA affiliates rally after report of China bailout plan
Description: Shares in affiliates of HNA Group surged on Thursday following a news report that China plans to take over the debt-laden conglomerate as the coronavirus outbreak has further hit its ability to meet financial obligations.

Headlines: What secrets? Apple embroiled in row over book by German former executive
Description: Apple has become embroiled in a publishing row in Germany after it tried to halt sales of a book written by a former executive, saying it disclosed secrets about the App Store.

Headlines: Domino's shares hit new high on first U.S. same-store sales beat in a year
Description: Domino's Pizza Inc's shares soared 25% to a record high after the pizza chain comfortably beat quarterly U.S. same-store sales and profit estimates on Thursday, benefiting from its focus on faster delivery and new promotions.

Headlines: Exclusive: France's Engie eyes U.S. energy services firm Ameresco - sources
Description: French power utility Engie SA has approached Ameresco Inc, a U.S. provider of energy efficiency solutions and developer of renewable energy plants, to express interest in acquiring it, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: BAE Systems predicts 2020 growth despite Saudi ban
Description: Britain's BAE Systems forecast another year of growth in 2020, saying the company was well-placed to take advantage of increased defence spending that could help to offset any future impact from a German ban on arms exports to Saudi Arabia.

Headlines: Exclusive: Westinghouse set to sign pact with Indian firm for nuclear reactors during Trump visit
Description: U.S. energy firm Westinghouse is expected to sign a new agreement with state-run Nuclear Power Corporation of India for the supply of six nuclear reactors during U.S. President Donald Trump's visit next week, officials said, aiming to kickstart a long-running project.

Headlines: Trump economist says 'uncertainty' from trade disputes hit business investment
Description: A slowdown in U.S. growth last year was at least partly the fault of President Donald Trump's global trade battles and the resulting hit to business investment, the administration's top economist said on Thursday in an outlook for the coming years.

Headlines: Walmart's struggling Japan unit finally delivers with online grocery growth
Description: Walmart Inc might finally have found the sweet spot in Japan's food market with a fast-growing venture ranked third in a nascent online grocery sector, as the brick-and-mortar stores it bought into two decades ago continue their search for profit.

Headlines: Foxconn says cautiously resuming China output, warns coronavirus will hit revenue
Description: Apple iPhone maker Foxconn said on Thursday it is cautiously restarting production at its main plants in China and warned revenue will be hurt this year by the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Canadian regulator considers changes to new drug pricing plan
Description: Canada's drug pricing agency is contemplating significant changes to how it will apply new regulations aimed at lowering costs, Reuters has learned, as drugmakers unhappy with the policy delay introducing new medicines in the country and blame it for job cuts.

Headlines: U.S. watchdog proposes national standard for disclosing expired debt
Description: The U.S. consumer watchdog on Friday proposed establishing a national standard for how debt collectors must inform borrowers when they cannot be sued for expired debt.

Headlines: UniCredit may make announcement soon on CEO Mustier's future: sources
Description: Italy's biggest bank UniCredit may make an announcement as early as Friday night on the future of boss Jean Pierre Mustier, two sources familiar with the matter said, after reports he is vying for the top job at rival HSBC .

Headlines: Coronavirus fears, U.S. business data drag down Wall Street
Description: U.S. stocks sold off and the Nasdaq had its worst daily percentage decline in about three weeks on Friday as a spike in new coronavirus cases and data showing a stall in U.S. business activity in February fueled investors' fears about economic growth.

Headlines: U.S. SEC probes Altria's investment in Juul: source
Description: U.S. regulators have opened a probe regarding Marlboro maker Altria Group Inc's investment in e-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley to get $375 million termination fee if E*Trade walks away from deal
Description: Morgan Stanley will receive a $375 million breakup fee if E*Trade Financial Corp walks away from its $13 billion deal for the discount brokerage, the U.S. bank said on Friday.

Headlines: Inside the Philip Morris campaign to 'normalize' a tobacco device
Description: At Germany's Bambi Awards for the media industry in November, celebrities posed for red-carpet photos against a backdrop of established luxury brands. Alongside the likes of Mercedes-Benz and Swiss watchmaker Chopard was a newer name: IQOS, a "reduced risk" heated-tobacco device sold by cigarette maker Philip Morris International Inc.

Headlines: Coronavirus fears weigh on U.S. manufacturing, services sectors
Description: U.S. manufacturing and services sectors activity stalled in February amid growing concerns about the deadly coronavirus' impact on the economy, boosting investor demand for safe-haven assets like government bonds.

Headlines: UniCredit shares fall at open after report Mustier vying for HSBC top job
Description: Shares in Italy's biggest bank UniCredit fell more than 1% at open on Friday following reports Chief Executive Jean Pierre Mustier is being considered for the top job at rival HSBC .

Headlines: Global central bankers scour shopping malls, manufacturers for coronavirus playbook
Description: In the days after a new virus was identified in China on Dec. 31, global central bankers fell back on past experience for a comforting early analysis.

Headlines: Daimler warns of "significant adverse effects" of virus outbreak
Description: German luxury carmaker Daimler on Friday warned of risks for the economy and its own business from the outbreak of coronavirus that is spreading in China and around the world.

Headlines: Global telcos join Alphabet, SoftBank's flying cellphone antenna lobbying effort
Description: Alphabet and SoftBank's attempts to launch flying cellphone antennas high into the atmosphere have received backing from global telcos, energizing lobbying efforts aimed at driving regulatory approval for the emerging technology.

Headlines: Tesla gets court approval to clear forest for German Gigafactory
Description: Tesla Inc got approval from a German court on Thursday to continue to cut down forest near the capital Berlin to build its first European car and battery factory, in a defeat for local environmental activists.

Headlines: L'Oreal's online sales of make-up rose in China in February: CEO
Description: Online sales of L'Oreal make-up and skincare products had picked up in China in February and were even stronger than a year earlier, Chief Executive Jean-Paul Agon said on Friday.

Headlines: Xerox to press ahead despite HP's poison pill plan against takeover offer
Description: Xerox Holdings Corp said on Friday it would continue to pursue HP Inc, even after the PC maker said it would implement a poison pill plan to shield itself against a takeover offer from the U.S. printer maker.

Headlines: Japan urges G20 members with fiscal scope to boost spending
Description: Japan called on G20 countries with fiscal space to ramp up spending to help the global economy weather risks, including the fallout from the coronavirus outbreak, Finance Minister Taro Aso said on Saturday.

Headlines: Encryption on Facebook, Google, others threatened by planned new bill
Description: U.S. legislation will be introduced in the coming weeks that could hurt technology companies' ability to offer end-to-end encryption, two sources with knowledge of the matter said, and it aims to curb the distribution of child sexual abuse material on such platforms.

Headlines: Tesla resumes tree cutting in Germany to build Gigafactory
Description: Tesla Inc said it had resumed tree cutting in Gruenheide, Germany so it can construct its first European car and battery factory following moves by environmentalists to stop local deforestation.

Headlines: Wells Fargo to pay $3 billion to U.S., admits pressuring workers in fake-accounts scandal
Description: Wells Fargo & Co has agreed to pay $3 billion to resolve criminal and civil probes into fraudulent sales practices and has admitted to pressuring employees in a fake-accounts scandal, U.S. officials said on Friday, wrapping up one of the last major investigations looming over the bank.

Headlines: Federal prosecutors probing if Boeing pilot knowingly lied to FAA: NYT
Description: Federal prosecutors investigating Boeing Co are examining whether the U.S. planemaker knowingly misled the Federal Aviation Administration while it was seeking approval for its 737 MAX jet, the New York Times reported, citing two people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: G20 sees need to coordinate coronavirus response as IMF trims growth forecasts
Description: The world's top economies called on Saturday for a coordinated response to the coronavirus outbreak, which the IMF predicted would lower China's growth this year to 5.6% and shave 0.1 percentage points from global growth.

Headlines: Hughes fears Indian closure, bank disruptions over unpaid fees
Description: U.S. satellite broadband provider Hughes Network Systems may have to shut its Indian operations due to unpaid levies owed to the government, which could put thousands of banking services at risk, a company letter seen by Reuters showed.

Headlines: No global digital tax by end-2020 would mean chaos: France
Description: Failure to reach a global deal on where and how much to tax digital giants such as Google , Amazon or Facebook would result in many digital tax regimes emerging all over the world, France's Finance Minister said on Sunday.

Headlines: Banned Thai opposition party says junta helped 1MDB cover-up
Description: A banned Thai opposition party on Sunday accused the former military junta of helping cover up Malaysia's multi-billion-dollar 1MDB scandal, urging Thais to demand the truth ahead of a censure debate against Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha.

Headlines: As Teck oil sands mine hopes for okay from Canada's Trudeau, 20 other projects on hold
Description: As Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau considers whether to approve Teck Resources' Frontier oil sands project, roughly 20 others sit on the shelf as companies delay investment decisions hoping for new pipelines and higher prices.

Headlines: Stocks tumble, oil falls, gold spikes as virus fears grip markets
Description: Stocks across the globe fell by the most since mid-2016 on Monday and oil prices tumbled as a jump in coronavirus cases outside of China drove investors to the perceived safety of gold and government bonds on fears of the impact on the global economy.

Headlines: Cancelled Teck oil sands project underscores global climate-energy policy tension
Description: Teck Resources Ltd's surprise decision to cancel a planned C$20.6 billion ($15.6 billion) oil sands mine in northern Alberta, citing uncertainty about Canada's climate policy, underscores a global struggle to balance energy growth with environmental concerns.

Headlines: Coronavirus sparks deepest S&P 500 drop since early 2018
Description: The S&P 500 suffered its worst day in two years on Monday as a surge in coronavirus cases outside China rattled investors already worried about valuations following recent record highs.

Headlines: Mallinckrodt proposes $1.6 billion opioid deal, Chapter 11 for generics unit: WSJ
Description: Mallinckrodt Plc is finalizing a settlement proposal of at least $1.6 billion that would place its U.S. generic drug business into bankruptcy to address the debt maturities and liabilities arising out of the opioid crisis, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.

Headlines: K-pop sensation BTS' label picks JPMorgan, others for IPO: media
Description: Big Hit Entertainment, the music label of South Korean boy band BTS, has chosen JPMorgan , NH Investment and Securities and others to handle its initial public offering (IPO), according to media reports.

Headlines: Defending against Xerox, HP doubles down on share buybacks, cost cuts
Description: HP Inc said on Monday it would step up efforts to slash costs and buy back stock, as it seeks investor support to defend against a $35 billion takeover offer from U.S. printer maker Xerox Holdings Corp .

Headlines: PepsiCo buys Chinese snack brand Be & Cheery for $705 million
Description: PepsiCo Inc has agreed to buy Chinese snack brand Be & Cheery from local jujube maker Haoxiangni Health Food Co Ltd for $705 million, the companies said.

Headlines: Large parts of China ease coronavirus curbs, many report no new cases
Description: Urged to restore economic activity by President Xi Jinping, large parts of China relaxed curbs on transport and travel on Monday as reported new cases of coronavirus outside the worst-hit province fell to the lowest in a month.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs pleads not guilty in Malaysia over 1MDB bond sales: state media
Description: Three units of Goldman Sachs pleaded not guilty to charges of misleading investors regarding $6.5 billion in bond sales that the U.S. investment bank helped raise for state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB), Bernama state news agency reported on Monday.

Headlines: Italy's UniCredit says Mustier to stay on as CEO
Description: Italy's biggest bank UniCredit said on Monday boss Jean Pierre Mustier had confirmed he would remain in his role, after a source told Reuters the French banker had ruled himself out for the top job at rival HSBC .

Headlines: 'Our currency, your problem': all over again
Description: The dollar juggernaut rolls on. The U.S. currency <=USD> has rocketed to a near three-year high versus the euro, a 10-month high against the yen and an 11-year peak versus the Aussie. This month alone it's added 2.5% against six currency peers. Economic indicators are reinforcing the U.S growth engine's outperformance. The United States has the highest bond yields among developed nations and its companies keep beating earnings forecasts. It's relative resilience to coronavirus damage m

Headlines: Take Five: 'Our currency, your problem' - all over again
Description: The dollar juggernaut rolls on. The U.S. currency <=USD> has rocketed to a near three-year high versus the euro, a 10-month high against the yen and an 11-year peak versus the Aussie. This month alone it's added 2.5% against six currency peers. Economic indicators are reinforcing the U.S growth engine's outperformance. The United States has the highest bond yields among developed nations and its companies keep beating earnings forecasts. It's relative resilience to coronavirus damage m

Headlines: Mastercard to add 1,500 technology jobs in Ireland
Description: Mastercard Inc plans to hire 1,500 more staff in Dublin over the next three to five years, more than trebling its workforce in one of Ireland's largest single multinational jobs announcements.

Headlines: Blackstone raises offer for Japan's Unizo, tops Lone Star's bid
Description: Blackstone Group has raised its proposed offer to buy Japanese hotel chain Unizo Holdings to 6,000 yen ($53.78) from 5,600 yen per share, the U.S. private equity firm said on Monday, topping a bid by U.S. investment fund Lone Star.

Headlines: United Technologies, Raytheon offer EU concessions over $120 billion merger deal
Description: United Technologies Corp and Raytheon Co have offered concessions to address EU antitrust concerns about their plan to create a $120 billion U.S. aerospace and defense giant, a filing on the European Commission website showed on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Juul halts Indonesia e-cigarette sales, throwing Asia expansion in doubt
Description: Juul Labs Inc is halting sales in Indonesia, citing concerns that it can't stop retailers from selling its high-nicotine e-cigarettes to young people in a largely unregulated tobacco market.

Headlines: Factbox: Charting the impact of the new coronavirus
Description: The following charts aim to capture the scale and trajectory of stock market moves in response to the new coronavirus outbreak, the growing number of cases beyond China, the reaction of China's central bank and the impact on safe haven investments.

Headlines: Virus fears rise: Investors worry about supply chain and pandemic-type spread
Description: As fears about the coronavirus catch up to U.S. markets, investors are watching closely to see if the outbreak freezes global supply chains and spreads far enough to be called a pandemic.

Headlines: Bank of America names new French investment banking boss: memo
Description: Bank of America has appointed Jérôme Morisseau as its head of investment banking for France as it seeks to bolster its Paris franchise and win more business from large French clients, a memo seen by Reuters said.

Headlines: Oil sinks 4% on demand concerns as coronavirus spreads
Description: Oil prices slumped by nearly 4% on Monday as the rapid spread of the coronavirus in countries outside China added to investor concerns over the effect on demand for crude.

Headlines: Primark owner warns coronavirus threatens clothing supplies
