Description: Primark owner Associated British Foods warned on Monday there was a risk of shortages of some clothing lines later this year if delays in factory production in China are prolonged because of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Oil falls for 3rd day as virus fears accelerate on U.S. warning
Description: Crude prices fell about 3% on Tuesday, dropping for a third day, as concerns about the spread of the coronavirus grew after the U.S. government warned Americans to prepare for the disease.

Headlines: Coronavirus clouds Apple's timeline for new iPhones
Description: Travel restrictions to China because of the coronavirus have come just as Apple Inc's engineers usually jet off to Asia to perfect the production of this fall's new iPhones, former employees and supply chain experts told Reuters.

Headlines: Tesco completes China exit with $357 million stake sale
Description: Britain's biggest retailer Tesco has completed its exit from China with the 275 million pound ($357 million) sale of its joint venture stake to state-run partner China Resources Holdings (CRH).

Headlines: U.S. labor board limits companies' liability for franchisee labor-law violations
Description: A U.S. labor board on Tuesday finalized a rule that will make it more difficult to hold companies liable for unlawful labor practices by franchisees and contractors, reversing a more worker-friendly Obama-era standard criticized by business groups.

Headlines: Facebook would have to pay $3.50 per month to U.S. users for sharing contact info: study
Description: German Facebook users would want the social media platform to pay them about $8 per month for sharing their contact information, while U.S. users would only seek $3.50, according to a study of how people in various countries value their private information.

Headlines: Fed's Clarida says too soon to tell coronavirus impact on U.S. economy
Description: The impact of the coronavirus on the U.S. economy would likely need to be "material and persistent" for the central bank to change its outlook, U.S. Federal Reserve Vice Chair Richard Clarida indicated on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's Clarida: We are 'closely monitoring' impact of coronavirus
Description: The Federal Reserve is "closely monitoring" the escalating coronavirus outbreak but it is still too soon to gauge if it would require a change in monetary policy, Fed Vice Chair Richard Clarida said on Tuesday as the central bank continues to patiently monitor the impact of the epidemic on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Stocks, oil fall further on accelerating coronavirus concerns
Description: Stocks and oil prices tumbled again on Tuesday and the benchmark U.S. debt yield hit a record low on growing concern about the effects of the spread of coronavirus on the global economy.

Headlines: AI computing startup SambaNova raises $250 million in BlackRock-led funding
Description: Artificial intelligence computing firm SambaNova Systems said on Tuesday it has raised $250 million in a funding round led by BlackRock Inc to expand its customer base, reflecting investors' appetite for the market.

Headlines: Mattel receives SEC subpoena on whistleblower letter
Description: Mattel Inc had received a subpoena in December from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission seeking documents related to a whistleblower letter and subsequent investigation, the U.S. toymaker said in a filing on Tuesday.

Headlines: Economic contagion spreads beyond China to other Asian economies: Reuters poll
Description: The effects of the coronavirus outbreak are likely to reverberate beyond China as most major economies in the region are expected to either slow down significantly, halt or shrink outright in the current quarter, Reuters polls found.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says unclear right now if coronavirus calls for U.S. rate change: WSJ
Description: Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Robert Kaplan said on Tuesday events are still too fluid around the coronavirus outbreak to say the U.S. central bank needs to lower short-term rates, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tesla and U.S. regulators strongly criticized over role of Autopilot in crash
Description: The National Transportation Safety Board on Tuesday sharply criticized Tesla Inc.'s lack of system safeguards in a fatal 2018 Autopilot crash in California and called U.S. regulators' approach in overseeing the driver assistance systems "misguided."

Headlines: Mallinckrodt agrees to $1.6 billion opioid settlement, unit to seek bankruptcy
Description: Mallinckrodt Plc on Tuesday said it had agreed to a $1.6 billion settlement proposal in which its generic drug business would file for bankruptcy in order to resolve thousands of lawsuits alleging it helped fuel the U.S. opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Three U.S. Senate Democrats propose sweeping reforms after Boeing 737 MAX crashes
Description: Three Democratic U.S. senators on Tuesday introduced sweeping legislation to reform how new airplanes are certified and overseen by U.S. regulators after two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes killed 346 people.

Headlines: Stocks, oil fall further on accelerating coronavirus concerns
Description: Stocks across the globe fell on Tuesday to their lowest since early December and the benchmark U.S. debt yield hit a record low on concerns about the economic hit of the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: Japan to further ease rules on foreign ownership of stocks: sources
Description: Japan will add exemptions to new foreign investment restrictions for companies exposed to sensitive national security issues, government sources said, in a move aimed at keeping overseas capital in the country.

Headlines: SoftBank-backed Grab raises $856 million from Japanese investors in financial services push
Description: Southeast Asia's Grab said Japan's Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc (MUFG) and IT services firm TIS Inc have agreed to invest a combined $856 million in the ride-hailing firm, as it seeks to expand aggressively into financial services.

Headlines: UBS, Credit Suisse's emergency plans are effective: financial watchdog
Description: The emergency plans of UBS and Credit Suisse to deal with a financial crisis are effective, Switzerland's regulator FINMA said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's main manufacturing hubs reboot after virus shutdown
Description: As many parts of China ease coronavirus travel curbs, main manufacturing hubs in the east and south are seeing hundreds of thousands of migrant workers returning to work and more traffic on the roads during rush hours.

Headlines: Health insurer shares pummeled by Sanders surge, virus worries
Description: As concerns over the spreading coronavirus outbreak hammered U.S. stocks, one corner of the market was confronted with another potentially game-changing prospect: a Bernie Sanders nomination.

Headlines: Fed banks unanimously voted to keep discount rate unchanged - minutes
Description: All of the Federal Reserve's 12 regional banks wanted to keep unchanged the rate commercial banks are charged for emergency loans ahead of the U.S. central bank's last policy meeting, minutes from the discussion of the discount rate showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Housing market strength underpins Home Depot's holiday-quarter results
Description: Home Depot Inc benefited from a solid U.S. housing market and higher job growth that led consumers to spend more at its stores in the holiday shopping quarter, helping the home improvement chain beat sales and profit estimates.

Headlines: Goldman, Citi among banks curbing Italy trips over coronavirus fears - sources
Description: Goldman Sachs, Citigroup Inc, Credit Suisse and other investment banks have curbed trips to Italy amid fears that the coronavirus outbreak across the north of the country could quickly spread across Europe, sources said.

Headlines: Goldman, Citi among banks curbing Italy trips over coronavirus fears
Description: Goldman Sachs , Citigroup Inc , Credit Suisse and other investment banks have curbed trips to Italy amid fears that the coronavirus outbreak across the north of the country could quickly spread across Europe, sources said.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence holds at higher levels despite coronavirus
Description: U.S. consumer confidence edged up in February, suggesting a steady pace of consumer spending that could support the economy despite growing fears over the fast-spreading coronavirus, which have roiled financial markets.

Headlines: Eight men in frame to run Norway wealth fund, including deputy CEO
Description: Eight candidates have applied to head Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the country's central bank said on Tuesday, as its board prepares to decide who should steer the global portfolio of assets worth $1.1 trillion through a time of transition.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending could see one-two punch from stocks drop, coronavirus
Description: The coronavirus outbreak has yet to spread meaningfully to U.S. shores, but fears of it alone have already eviscerated some $2 trillion of American stock market value, setting off a market rout that could stymie consumer spending - even before other economic effects of the disease are felt.

Headlines: Fund investors retreat from U.S. stocks as coronavirus fears weigh
Description: Investors pulled nearly $3.3 billion out of mutual funds and exchange-traded funds that hold U.S. stocks last week, snapping the longest streak of asset gains since July, according to data released Wednesday by the Investment Company Institute.

Headlines: Toyota says Japan plants may be affected by virus-related supply issues
Description: Toyota Motor Corp on Wednesday said that operations at its plants in Japan may be affected by supply chain issues linked to the new coronavirus outbreak in the coming weeks, as the global outbreak gathers pace.

Headlines: Profit rise lifts Peugeot shares ahead of Fiat merger
Description: Peugeot maker PSA Group said on Wednesday profitability reached a record high in 2019, results that contrasted with those of many rivals and boosted the group's shares as it beds down a merger with Italy's Fiat Chrysler.

Headlines: Google to invest over $10 billion in 2020 on U.S. data centers, offices
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it would invest more than $10 billion in offices and data centers across the United States this year.

Headlines: Electrolux says implementing Italy travel ban until March 9 due to Coronavirus
Description: Swedish home appliance maker Electrolux said on Wednesday it had decided on ban travel by its employees to and from Italy, where it has manufacturing facilities in some regions affected by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: BP to quit main U.S. refining lobby over carbon policy
Description: BP will leave the main U.S. refining lobby and two other trade groups as new Chief Executive Bernard Looney spurs some of the oil sector's most ambitious targets for curbing carbon emissions.

Headlines: EU open to more spending in countries hit by coronavirus outbreak
Description: Italy and other euro zone countries hit by the coronavirus outbreak are expected to benefit from waivers under EU fiscal rules that will allow them to spend more to tackle the emergency, the bloc's economics commissioner said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. stock exchanges say prepared for coronavirus
Description: U.S. stock exchanges said on Wednesday they were watching coronavirus-related developments closely and had contingency plans in place to continue running if any of their operations were affected.

Headlines: Waymo joins backlash against California self-driving data requirement
Description: Alphabet Inc's Waymo and General Motors Co's Cruise are leading a backlash against a California reporting requirement on self-driving vehicle test data that the companies claim is not relevant or accurate in measuring performance or progress.

Headlines: China's CATL aims to raise $2.85 billion for EV battery projects
Description: CATL , China's top electric vehicle battery maker, said it aims to raise up to 20 billion yuan ($2.85 billion) in a private placement of shares to fund its battery projects and boost working capital.

Headlines: Coronavirus clouds Apple's timeline for new iPhones
Description: Travel restrictions to China because of the coronavirus have come just as Apple Inc's engineers usually jet off to Asia to perfect the production of this fall's new iPhones, former employees and supply chain experts told Reuters.

Headlines: US stocks still the best of a bad bunch as sell-off stretches on, says trader. Here's why
Description: As coronavirus worries grow worldwide, traders are seeking safe havens in the U.S. market — for now.

Headlines: Senator Rubio seeks U.S. review of sale of AT&T unit to Czech-owned conglomerate
Description: U.S. Senator Marco Rubio on Wednesday asked the Trump administration to review the national security implications of AT&T's Inc's planned sale of its majority stake in Central European Media Group Enterprises (CME) to the Czech-owned conglomerate PPF Group.

Headlines: Apple investor vote sounds 'warning' over China app takedowns
Description: An Apple Inc shareholder proposal critical of the company's app removals in China received a relatively high level of support at the iPhone maker's annual meeting on Wednesday, enough to push the company to respond, experts said.

Headlines: Toll Brothers says 11 home sales in California impacted by coronavirus
Description: Home builder Toll Brothers Inc said on Wednesday that the coronavirus outbreak in China had led to shortages of lighting fixtures and small appliances, forcing it to delay the sales of 11 homes in California, one of its biggest markets.

Headlines: Microsoft expects Windows unit to miss revenue outlook on coronavirus impact
Description: Microsoft Inc said on Wednesday it does not expect to meet its quarterly revenue forecast for its Windows and personal computing business as a result of the coronavirus outbreak, sending its shares down more than 1% in after-market trading.

Headlines: Hyundai to decide hydrogen fuel-cell factory location this year - exec
Description: Hyundai Motor Co and its affiliates are ready to decide the location of a new hydrogen fuel-cell system factory this year, which could be in South Korea or overseas, an executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook to publicly track political sponsored content after Bloomberg's paid memes
Description: Facebook Inc will provide a way for people to track political sponsored content on Facebook and Instagram ahead of the U.S. presidential election, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil prices dive to lowest in over a year on coronavirus fears
Description: Oil prices tumbled for a fifth day on Thursday to their lowest level in more than a year, as new reports of novel coronavirus cases outside China spurred investor fears that the rapidly spreading outbreak could slow the global economy.

Headlines: FCC to propose $200 million fines for U.S. cellphone carriers over consumer data disclosures
Description: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission is set to propose fining four major U.S. mobile phone companies at least $200 million in total for improperly disclosing some consumer real-time location data, two people briefed on the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Telecom Italia picks KKR as partner for Italian broadband
Description: Telecom Italia (TIM) on Thursday picked KKR as an exclusive partner to develop its ultra-broadband business, saying its board had taken positive note of a non-binding proposal by the U.S. investment firm.

Headlines: Tellurian stock falls after company extends U.S. LNG sale negotiations with Petronet
Description: Tellurian Inc stock dropped on Thursday after the company said it extended the amount of time India's Petronet LNG Ltd had to finalize an agreement to buy liquefied natural gas (LNG) from Tellurian's Driftwood plant in Louisiana.

Headlines: Mexico's state-run Pemex posts steep 2019 loss in blow to president's revival plan
Description: Petroleos Mexicanos posted a $18.3 billion net loss for 2019 on Thursday, nearly doubling the previous year's loss and dealing a major blow to the Mexican president's quest to revive the heavily-indebted state oil company.

Headlines: Public Storage only bidder left for National Storage with $1.25 billion bid
Description: U.S.-based Public Storage emerged on Friday as the likely buyer of Australia's largest self-storage operator National Storage REIT with its current A$1.89 billion ($1.25 billion) offer, after two rivals dropped out of the race.

Headlines: Highlights: Fed policymakers on why diversity matters and how to get there
Description: Several U.S. Federal Reserve policymakers told Reuters why increasing diversity within the U.S. central bank system matters. Here are some highlights:

Headlines: Wall Street set for steep fall on alarm over fast-spreading virus
Description: Futures indicated that the Dow Jones Industrials index would shed more than 300 points at the open on Thursday after the rapid spread of the coronavirus outside China deepened worries about growth and corporate earnings.

Headlines: Taxi group wins right to join Uber's London license appeal case
Description: A taxi association will be able to participate in Uber's appeal against the loss of its operating license in the British capital city set to be heard in full from July 6, a British judge decided on Thursday.

Headlines: Microsoft wants to invest in Indonesia data centers, says Indonesian president
Description: Microsoft Corp is keen to invest in data centers in Indonesia which will soon make regulatory changes to facilitate the move, the country's president said after meeting with the software giant's CEO on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. economy grows steadily in fourth-quarter, but coronavirus looms large
Description: The U.S. economy grew moderately in the fourth quarter, the government confirmed, and is facing a bumpy road in early 2020 amid the fast-spreading coronavirus that has left financial markets fearing a recession.

Headlines: U.S. pending home sales jump 5.2% in January
Description: Contracts to buy previously owned U.S. homes rebounded in January to their second-highest monthly figure in about two years as low mortgage rates boosted sales.

Headlines: Fed's Evans: too early to cut growth outlook or rates on coronavirus
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans said on Thursday it was too soon to say if the U.S. growth forecast would be lowered due to the coronavirus epidemic, let alone if the U.S. central bank would need to cut rates. .

Headlines: Fed's Evans says above-target inflation 'essential' in future
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans on Thursday suggested that "extraordinary accommodation" and a period of elevated inflation will be integral to the U.S. central bank's approach to fighting the next severe economic downturn.

Headlines: Alphabet still facing questions over data use in its Toronto smart city project proposal
Description: Alphabet's proposed "smart" city development in Toronto is facing fresh questions over the project's data-gathering technology from a panel advising the Canadian government-mandated body in charge of getting it built.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp sells elevator unit for $18.7 billion to Advent-led consortium
Description: Thyssenkrupp on Thursday said it agreed to sell its prized elevator division to a private equity consortium including Advent, Cinven and Germany's RAG foundation for 17.2 billion euros ($18.7 billion).

Headlines: TIM board views positively KKR's non-binding bid for fiber-optic network
Description: Telecom Italia (TIM) said on Thursday its board viewed positively a non-binding offer by U.S. investment firm KKR to become the Italian telecoms group's exclusive partner in developing a fiber-optic network.

Headlines: China's top container ports unclog backlog as virus curbs ease
Description: China's top container ports are loosening the backlog of cargoes on their docks as workers return to their jobs after coronavirus travel curbs that kept them away and jammed up global supply chains have been eased.

Headlines: Tesla shares slump as coronavirus hits China car registrations
Description: Shares of Tesla Inc fell as much as 14% on Thursday on concerns about the impact of the coronavirus on the electric-car maker's vehicle registrations in China.

Headlines: DoorDash files to go public in latest IPO test for unprofitable startups
Description: DoorDash Inc, the loss-making U.S. food delivery startup backed by SoftBank Group Corp , said on Thursday it has filed for an initial public offering (IPO), setting it up to be one of the most high-profile listings of 2020.

Headlines: Starbucks' CEO says 85% of stores in China are open
Description: Starbucks Corp said on Thursday 85% of its stores in China were open, weeks after the coffee chain shut nearly half of its over 4,000 stores in the world's second-largest economy due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: SoftBank communications chief Gary Ginsberg takes leave to aid Bloomberg campaign: sources
Description: Gary Ginsberg, the global head of communications for SoftBank Group Corp , has taken an indefinite leave of absence to advise Michael Bloomberg's U.S. presidential campaign, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines suspend flights due to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Airlines have been suspending flights or modifying service in response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Kuwait to check visiting ships for coronavirus, evacuate citizens from Thailand
Description: Kuwait will check visiting ships for the new coronavirus before allowing them to dock and require crew members to stay on board as part of measures to prevent the spread of the disease, state news agency KUNA said.

Headlines: Airlines at center of storm as coronavirus spreads
Description: European airlines stepped up their warnings over the coronavirus outbreak on Friday, with British Airways-owner IAG and Finnair flagging a hit to profits and easyJet reporting a big drop in demand into and out of a virus-affected region in Italy.

Headlines: Ex-Barclays bankers cleared over 2008 Qatar fees in blow to UK fraud office
Description: Three former Barclays executives were unanimously acquitted on Friday of charges they helped funnel 322 million pounds ($418 million) in secret fees to Qatar in return for rescue financing during the credit crisis.

Headlines: Madoff customer payout nears $14 billion, as dying swindler seeks freedom
Description: Bernard Madoff's former customers will soon see their total recovery approach $14 billion, a court-appointed trustee said on Friday, as the dying swindler awaits a decision on whether the U.S. government will support his request to leave prison early.

Headlines: Cooling consumer spending, inflation put spotlight on Fed amid coronavirus
Description: U.S. consumer spending slowed in January and could lose further momentum as the fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak, which has sparked a stock market sell-off and revived fears of a recession, causes households to tighten their purse strings.

Headlines: Pandemic fears send investors running as Wall Street confirms correction
Description: (This Feb. 27 version of the U.S. stocks copy has been republished)

Headlines: Factbox: Global central bankers on coronavirus, possibility of rate cuts
Description: With the rapid global spread of the new coronavirus and the U.S. stock market suffering its worst week since the Great Recession, central bankers around the world are under rising pressure to reduce borrowing costs to create a cushion against economic harm. So far they have largely resisted. Following are some of their recent remarks:

Headlines: Sanofi to pay $11.9 million to resolve U.S. drug charity kickback probe
Description: Sanofi SA has agreed to pay $11.85 million to resolve U.S. allegations that it used a charity that helps cover Medicare patients' out-of-pocket drug costs as a means to pay them kickbacks to use a high-priced multiple sclerosis drug.

Headlines: GM to add 1,200 jobs at Michigan plants to meet SUV demand
Description: No. 1 U.S. automaker General Motors Co said on Friday it plans to add more than 1,200 jobs at its Lansing plants in Michigan to meet growing demand for its SUVs.

Headlines: Wall Street in coronavirus contingency mode with staff, visitors, regulators
Description: Big U.S. banks have been rolling out contingency plans to respond to the global coronavirus outbreak - requiring some staff to work from home, implementing travel restrictions, and talking to regulators about potential stresses.

Headlines: Intesa, UBI line up advisers to face off in takeover battle
Description: Intesa Sanpaolo said on Friday it had hired JP Morgan, Morgan Stanley, UBS and local broker Equita SIM to complete a team of advisers led by Mediobanca supporting Italy's biggest retail bank in its takeover offer of rival UBI Banca.

Headlines: Goldman expects 75 bps of Fed rate cuts by June
Description: Goldman Sachs expects the coronavirus to drive the Federal Reserve to cut U.S. interest rates by 75 basis points by June it said on Friday, implying as many as three cuts starting at its next meeting in March.

Headlines: Exclusive: Aluminum smelter resurrected on Trump tariffs may close as losses mount
Description: A bankrupt aluminum smelter that re-opened in 2018, after U.S. President Donald Trump imposed tariffs on imported metals, is losing money at such a rapid clip that it could close within 60 days, the top executive at the Missouri plant said on Thursday.

Headlines: Investment advisers worry U.S. response to coronavirus is too little too late
Description: Investment-advisers are increasingly worried that U.S. authorities are not be doing enough to prevent a widespread outbreak of coronavirus in the country, potentially adding further downside to already-battered markets.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor halts work at factory after worker tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Hyundai Motor shut down a factory in South Korea on Friday after a worker tested positive for the new coronavirus, disrupting production of popular models such as Palisade sport utility vehicle.

Headlines: China's big airlines resume some global flights halted by coronavirus
Description: China's three biggest airlines have restored a fraction of the international flights they halted in the wake of a coronavirus outbreak, heeding a call from the aviation regulator as business activity recovers slowly.

Headlines: Chinese maker of 'Amazon coat' weathers coronavirus impact with tax breaks, rent waivers
Description: Orolay, the maker of the 'Amazon coat' that became a darling of U.S. fashion and social media a year ago, knows it is luckier than most Chinese small businesses trying to get back on their feet amid huge disruptions caused by the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: EasyJet to cancel flights as coronavirus hits demand
Description: British budget airline easyJet said on Friday it would cancel flights and cut costs across its business after the coronavirus outbreak hit demand for travel to Italy and other European markets.

Headlines: Tokyo Disneyland to close through mid-March on coronavirus concerns
Description: Tokyo Disneyland will be closed from Saturday to March 15 due to concerns about coronavirus infections spreading in Japan, its operator said on Friday, leaving all of Walt Disney Co's theme parks in Asia temporarily shut.

Headlines: Italy's Alitalia reduces flights on 38 routes as coronavirus deters passengers
Description: Italy's flagship carrier Alitalia said on Friday it was reducing flights on 38 national and international routes because coronavirus was leading to fewer passengers.

Headlines: Uniqlo reopens more China stores, most partner factories restart
Description: Fast Retailing , which operates casual clothing chain Uniqlo, said on Friday it had reopened more than 100 stores in China in the past week, while 125 remained closed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Powered by hydrogen, Hyundai's trucks aim to conquer the Swiss Alps
Description: Hyundai's hydrogen-powered 18-tonne trucks are set to hit the roads in Switzerland next month as the South Korean automaker looks to establish a case for its zero-emissions technology in a low carbon world.

Headlines: Swiss anti-viral ban on large events hits Geneva car show head-on
Description: Switzerland on Friday banned large events expected to draw more than 1,000 people in a drive to curb the new coronavirus epidemic, prompting cancellation of the Geneva car show and grumbling from businesses watching demand vanish.

Headlines: Bullard: Market pricing will not dictate rate cut, Fed policymakers will monitor events up to March FOMC
Description: The Federal Reserve does not need to cut U.S. interest rates just because markets have priced in aggressive central bank action, but policymakers will be monitoring events closely up to the upcoming March 17-18 meeting, St. Louis Federal Reserve bank president James Bullard said on Friday.

Headlines: Lion Air puts $500 million IPO on hold as global equity markets tumble: sources
Description: Indonesia's Lion Air has deferred plans for an initial public offering (IPO) due to a sharp fall in global stock markets, people close to the matter said on Friday, as the spreading coronavirus sparks worries of a global pandemic.

Headlines: Prudential investors back Loeb but in no rush to execute break-up plan
Description: Shareholders in Prudential Plc have given their blessing to a bid by activist investor Third Point to carve up Britain’s largest insurer but advise against a hasty sale of its U.S business.

Headlines: Wall Street Weekahead: Main Street leans toward Sanders, but Wall Street says Trump
Description: Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders may be surging in the polls ahead of Super Tuesday, but some on Wall Street have made their own conclusions on what November will bring: four more years of President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Venezuela revamps PDVSA leadership after Maduro launches restructuring
Description: Venezuela has named new vice presidents for four units of state oil company PDVSA, as well as a new president for the unit that handles joint ventures with private oil companies, PDVSA said on Saturday.

Headlines: Implied yield on U.S. 10-Year treasury futures trading below 1% for first time
Description: The implied yield on U.S. 10-Year Treasury futures traded below 1% for the first time, as investors grew increasingly unnerved by the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. officials talk down coronavirus market panic, tout economic strength
Description: Senior officials in President Donald Trump's administration on Sunday tried to calm market panic that the coronavirus could cause a global recession, saying the U.S. public had over-reacted and that stocks would rebound due to the American economy's underlying strength.

Headlines: U.S. stock futures resume coronavirus rout
Description: U.S. stock index futures tumbled as trading reopened on Sunday night with investors still unnerved by the coronavirus and taking little solace from weekend comments by U.S. officials that aimed to soothe panic about a pandemic.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs sees Fed cutting soon, perhaps before March 17-18 meeting
Description: Goldman Sachs economists on Sunday predicted the U.S. Federal Reserve will cut interest rates aggressively perhaps before its next scheduled meeting in two weeks time, saying the head of the U.S. central bank sent a clear signal with his unscheduled statement on Friday.

Headlines: Canada and indigenous group reach tentative deal in dispute that led to road, rail blockades
Description: Canadian authorities on Sunday reached a tentative deal with an indigenous group in the Pacific province of British Columbia that could end solidarity protests across Canada that have been blocking rail lines and roads for weeks.

Headlines: Exclusive: Norway wealth fund could blacklist four major climate culprits
Description: Norway's $1 trillion wealth fund will exclude four companies for their vast emissions of greenhouse gases, or at least put them on probation to force them to change, the chairman of its ethics watchdog told Reuters.

Headlines: Stocks rally after last week's rout on central bank policy hopes
Description: Equity markets around the world rose on Monday as speculation that central banks will cut interest rates to soften the economic blow of the coronavirus heartened investors and drove U.S. government debt yields to record lows.

Headlines: Amtrak names new CEO to head money-losing passenger railroad
Description: Amtrak said Monday it had tapped Atlas Air's chief executive to run the money-losing U.S. passenger railroad that has seen record traffic.

Headlines: Amazon's fight against $277 million EU tax order kicks off in court on Thursday
Description: Amazon will on Thursday seek to overturn an EU order to repay about 250 million euros ($277 million) in back taxes to Luxembourg at Europe's second-highest court, one of a series of high-profile cases marking the bloc's crackdown on unfair tax deals.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing sector stalls as coronavirus hits supply chains
Description: U.S. factory manufacturing activity slowed in February as new orders contracted, reflecting worries about supply chain disruptions related to the fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak, which has revived financial market fears of a recession.

Headlines: Exclusive: UBS CEO Ermotti poised to get Swiss Re chairman role - sources
Description: UBS Group Chief Executive Sergio Ermotti is poised to become chairman of Swiss Re next year after leaving the helm of Switzerland's biggest bank, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: UK wants retaliatory tariffs removed early on in U.S. trade talks: Truss
Description: British trade minister Liz Truss said she wanted with the United States to agree to the removal of retaliatory tariffs on some British and U.S. products over EU subsidies on large aircraft early in trade negotiations to show goodwill.

Headlines: Trump presses U.S. Federal Reserve to cut rates
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday reiterated his call for the U.S. central bank to lower interest rates, tweeting that the Federal Reserve has been "slow to act" and should be more aggressive.

Headlines: Britain vows 'hard bargain' in list of demands for U.S. trade deal
Description: Britain on Monday unveiled its mandate for trade talks with the United States, with Prime Minister Boris Johnson vowing to drive a hard bargain in negotiations that are set to test the two allies' "special relationship".

Headlines: Ryanair to cut Italy flights by 25% due to coronavirus
Description: Ryanair will cut capacity in and out of Italy, its largest market, by 25% for three weeks due to a significant drop off in bookings since a coronavirus outbreak, Europe's biggest low-cost airline said on Monday.

Headlines: Tencent extends warranty for Nintendo Switches in China as virus hits sales
Description: Chinese tech giant Tencent said on Tuesday it would extend warranty for Nintendo Switches purchased in China via official channels before March 31 by six months as sales have been hit by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Honda to cut production at Japanese plants on sourcing concerns
Description: Japan's Honda Motor Co Ltd said on Tuesday it will temporarily cut back local production due to difficulty in sourcing parts amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Chevron offering U.S. workers buyouts to trim staffing: sources
Description: Chevron Corp is offering buyouts to reduce its U.S. oil exploration and production workforce, three sources told Reuters, as the oil major moves to cut costs in the face of sharply lower oil and gas prices.

Headlines: 'Neutron Jack' Welch, who led GE's rapid expansion, dies at 84
Description: Jack Welch, who upended the business world in the 1980s and 1990s by transforming General Electric Co from a stolid maker of light bulbs and washing machines into the most valuable U.S. public company, has died at 84, GE said on Monday.

Headlines: White House set to meet with airline, cruise industry CEOs
Description: The White House will hold meetings this week with top executives from U.S. airlines and the cruise industry amid the growing coronavirus outbreak, a spokeswoman for Vice President Mike Pence confirmed on Monday.

Headlines: Google's self-driving sister, Waymo, gets first outside investors
Description: Waymo, the self-driving unit of Alphabet Inc , said on Monday it had raised $2.25 billion in its first external investment round and expects to add more outside investors.

Headlines: More traffic, night lights show China's factories restart as new virus cases drop
Description: Nearly 300 million people have gone back to work in China since the Lunar New Year break as more companies restart business and coronavirus travel restrictions ease, although many small firms are still struggling to find enough workers to run plants.

Headlines: Take Five: The virus data fog
Description: The first data releases coming out for February make for grim reading: China's factories were dealt a devastating blow last month as the coronavirus epidemic triggered the sharpest contraction in activity on record, with the health crisis paralysing large parts of the economy.

Headlines: Swiss National Bank to double payout after posting $50 billion profit
Description: The Swiss National Bank posted an annual profit of 48.9 billion Swiss francs ($50.71 billion), the central bank said on Monday, and said it would double its payout to Switzerland's regional and central governments.

Headlines: Samsung starts building $220 million R&D center in Vietnam
Description: Samsung Electronics has started building a $220 million research and development center in Vietnam, the South Korean tech giant's local unit said on Monday.

Headlines: Amazon confirms two employees in Italy have contracted coronavirus
Description: Amazon.com Inc said late on Sunday that two employees in Milan, Italy, have contracted the coronavirus and are under quarantine.

Headlines: Coronavirus expected to hurt U.S. earnings harder and longer
Description: The hit to U.S. corporate earnings from the coronavirus epidemic is getting harder and messier to predict.

Headlines: UK trade minister says hopes to start U.S. trade deal talks as quickly as possible
Description: Britain is aiming to begin negotiations on a post-Brexit trade deal with the United States as quickly as possible, trade minister Liz Truss said on Monday.

Headlines: Coronavirus hits global factories; chances of monetary policy easing rise
Description: Global factories took a beating in February from the coronavirus outbreak, with activity in China shrinking at a record pace, surveys showed on Monday, raising the prospect of a coordinated policy response by central banks to prevent a global recession.

Headlines: British Airways cancels some flights to United States as coronavirus hits demand
Description: British Airways on Monday said it was cancelling some flights from London to the United States to match reduced demand for flying due to the impact of a new coronavirus on consumer sentiment.

Headlines: Blackstone reshuffles London energy team amid Siccar Point sale attempt
Description: Blackstone Group Inc has reshuffled its London-based private equity team in charge of energy while trying to sell all or part of its flagship investment, North Sea oil and gas producer Siccar Point.

Headlines: Barclays investor Sherborne renews attacks on CEO over Epstein link
Description: Barclays' chairman and board should rescind their support for Chief Executive Jes Staley following the disclosure of regulatory probes into his links with U.S. financier Jeffrey Epstein, the bank's third biggest investor said on Monday.

Headlines: UK says any system for resolving U.S. investor disputes will be fair
Description: The British government said any system to protect U.S. companies' interests in the country after a free trade agreement - typically a sensitive issue for civil society groups worried about the power of multinationals - would have to be fair and transparent.

Headlines: Stocks slide, 10-year Treasury at record low after Fed's rate cut
Description: Global equity markets slid on Tuesday and the yield on 10-year U.S. Treasuries fell below 1% for the first time after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates to shield the U.S. economy from the impact of the fast-spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: OPEC, Russia moving closer to big oil cut as coronavirus hits demand
Description: A panel of OPEC and its allies recommended cutting oil output by an extra 1 million barrels per day (bpd) on Tuesday signaling that Russia and Saudi Arabia were moving closer to a deal to prop up prices which have been hit by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: UPS and FedEx warn coronavirus outbreak could hurt operations
Description: U.S. package delivery companies United Parcel Service Inc and FedEx Corp warned on Tuesday that the coronavirus outbreak could disrupt shipment of goods in affected countries and possibly weigh on their first-quarter results.

Headlines: Nokia says will cut up to 148 jobs in Finland this year
Description: Finnish network equipment maker Nokia will cut up to 148 jobs in Finland in 2020 excluding its 5G development operations, it said on Tuesday evening.

Headlines: Lufthansa CEO supports Boeing-Embraer tie-up
Description: Germany's Lufthansa threw its weight behind a proposed $4.2 billion takeover of Embraer's commercial aircraft activities by Boeing , saying it would preserve a level playing field.

Headlines: Oil lower on coronavirus fears despite Fed rate cut and hopes for OPEC+ output cut
Description: The global oil benchmark ended Tuesday slightly lower under pressure from falling equities, but the losses were contained slightly as top producers considered more output cuts to support prices and the Federal Reserve cut U.S. interest rates to support the economy.

Headlines: Resiliency test: How well can Chinese firms cope financially from a virus hit?
Description: As companies in China gradually restart business following the extended Lunar New Year break, investors are fretting over the financial impact of the coronavirus outbreak that has squeezed cash flow and hammered revenues in many sectors.

Headlines: HK's Bank of East Asia to review assets with Elliott Management
Description: Hong Kong-based Bank of East Asia said on Wednesday it would carry out a comprehensive review of its portfolio of businesses and assets with the support of activist investor Elliott Management.

Headlines: Fed cuts rates to blunt coronavirus impact, markets drop
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve cut interest rates on Tuesday in a bid to shield the world's largest economy from the impact of the coronavirus, but the emergency move failed to comfort U.S. financial markets roiled by worries about a deeper, lasting slowdown.

Headlines: Fed's Evans expects virus impacts on economy to be short-lived
Description: The coronavirus outbreak will likely have only a "short-lived imprint" on the U.S. economy, Chicago Federal Reserve bank President Charles Evans said on Tuesday night.

Headlines: Impossible Foods cuts prices of plant-based meat sold to distributors
Description: Impossible Foods on Tuesday announced an average 15% cut in prices of its vegan products sold to U.S. distributors as the plant-based meat maker tries to make its patties more affordable to compete better with beef.

Headlines: JPMorgan to test emergency coronavirus plans with some employees working from home: sources
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co is asking thousands of U.S. employees to spend a day working from home in the coming weeks to test its contingency plans should the coronavirus spread, sources familiar with the plan told Reuters.

Headlines: Daimler says production in China stable but too early to forecast coronavirus impact
Description: Daimler's car production in China is stable and the supply chains are secure but it is too early to forecast the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on the German carmaker's sales, Mercedes-Benz's sales chief said on Monday.

Headlines: Kuwait oil minister says optimistic on outcome of OPEC meetings
Description: Kuwait's oil minister said on Tuesday he is optimistic about the outcome of OPEC meetings this week and continued cooperation among OPEC+ countries, Kuwait state news agency KUNA reported.

Headlines: Kremlin stays silent on Russia oil cut plans ahead of OPEC+ meeting
Description: The Kremlin told reporters on Tuesday it would not say whether Moscow was ready to make additional oil output cuts as part of the cooperation between OPEC and non-OPEC countries and said it was necessary to wait for their meeting later this week.

Headlines: Olympics: Tokyo 2020 wheelchair rugby test event canceled over coronavirus
Description: This month's wheelchair rugby test event has been canceled due to the coronavirus outbreak, Tokyo 2020 organizers said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Amazon adds warehouse network closer to cities to speed up same-day delivery
Description: Amazon.com Inc has quietly opened a series of small warehouses closer to big U.S. cities in a move to shave hours off delivery times, the company told Reuters.

Headlines: Xerox, HP blame each other as takeover battle heats up
Description: U.S. printer maker Xerox Holdings Corp took its $35 billion bid for HP Inc to the U.S. personal computer maker's shareholders on Monday, with a formal tender offer and a rebuttal to HP's account of why they could not negotiate a deal.

Headlines: Think-tank report on Uighur labor in China lists global brands
Description: Tens of thousands of ethnic Uighurs were moved to work in conditions suggestive of "forced labor" in factories across China supplying 83 global brands, an Australian think tank said in a report released on Sunday.

Headlines: Peugeot maker says UK factory plans dependent on Brexit talks
Description: Peugeot maker PSA does not expect to make a call before the end of 2020 on whether to keep its British factory at Ellesmere Port running, depending on how Brexit talks evolve, Chief Executive Carlos Tavares said on Tuesday.

Headlines: BMW says coronavirus hit China sales but sticks to 2020 global target
Description: BMW on Tuesday said its China sales have taken a hit this year because of the new coronavirus, but stuck to its target for growing passenger car sales for the year, and said its global supply chain has not been disrupted.

Headlines: Powell says coronavirus outbreak poses material risk to outlook
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Tuesday said the coronavirus poses a material risk to the economic outlook, and that change to the balance of risks drove the U.S. central bank to deliver its first emergency interest rate cut since the financial crisis.

Headlines: Trump calls on Fed to cut rates further after emergency move
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump called for further cut rates after the Federal Reserve earlier on Tuesday slashed rates by half percentage point in an emergency move designed to insulate the nation's economy from the impact of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Virus to dent Foxconn's consumer electronics revenue in first-quarter
Description: Apple supplier Foxconn warned revenue would drop 15% in businesses including consumer electronics and enterprise products in the first quarter, but that it would recover thereafter as production returns to normal in virus-hit China.

Headlines: Too early for U.S. dollar sell-off despite Fed rate cuts: Reuters poll
Description: The U.S. dollar's strength will remain in place and for longer than expected just a month ago, despite Federal Reserve interest rate cuts intended to limit the economic damage from the spreading coronavirus, a Reuters poll showed.

Headlines: U.S. not considering suspending tariffs on China in response to coronavirus: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Tuesday said the United States was not considering lowering tariffs on goods from China in response to the fast-spreading coronavirus, but would look at all options as the situation evolved.

Headlines: Futures traders greet Fed rate cut with bets on more to come
Description: Traders of futures contracts tied to the Federal Reserve's policy rate reacted to a sooner-than-expected reduction in borrowing costs Tuesday with bets on more to come as the central bank moves to try to shield the U.S. economy from the effects of the new coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. businesses show growing concern over impact of coronavirus, Fed survey shows
Description: There are signs the escalating coronavirus outbreak has begun to weigh on business sentiment in the United States, a report by the Federal Reserve released on Wednesday showed, even as the U.S. economy expanded at a modest to moderate pace over the past several weeks.

Headlines: Data show U.S. economy on solid footing as coronavirus fears mount
Description: U.S. services sector activity jumped to a one-year high in February, suggesting strength in the economy before a recent escalation of recession fears ignited by the coronavirus epidemic that prompted an emergency interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Huawei pleads not guilty to new U.S. criminal charges in 2018 case
Description: China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, the world's largest telecommunications equipment maker, on Wednesday pleaded not guilty in a New York federal court to new charges in a 2018 case against the company.

Headlines: Oil gives up gains even as OPEC works on big output cut
Description: Crude oil prices ended lower, giving up early gains as major oil producers, including Saudi Arabia, struggled to bring Russia on board for deeper supply cuts to try to offset a slump in demand caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: United Airlines, JetBlue cut flights, spending as coronavirus hits demand
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc and JetBlue Airways Corp are cutting flights and implementing cost controls in the most drastic actions by U.S. airlines to get ahead of depressed travel demand due to the spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. senator's trade advice to EU: Keep calm and put agriculture on the table
Description: The Trump administration would face resistance from the U.S. Congress if it tried to push through a mini trade deal with the European Union that did not include agriculture, U.S. Senate Finance Committee Chairman Chuck Grassley said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wells Fargo to raise minimum pay in most of its U.S. markets
Description: Wells Fargo & Co said on Wednesday it plans to increase minimum wage to between $15 and $20 per hour for most of its U.S. markets, joining other Wall Street banks that have raised hourly pay in recent years.

Headlines: Factbox: From shadow banking to coronavirus, U.S. regulators eye lurking risks
Description: U.S. regulators will gather Wednesday at a scheduled meeting of the Financial Stability Oversight Council (FSOC) to discuss risks to the United States and beyond. With fears around coronavirus driving market turmoil not seen since the 2007-2009 financial crisis, here are some of the top risks in their sights.

Headlines: Stocks rally as Biden surge offsets coronavirus fears
Description: The dollar and global equities rose on Wednesday as a strong showing by Joe Biden in the U.S. Democratic presidential primaries cheered the markets, though the economy-slowing coronavirus outbreak kept investors on tenterhooks.

Headlines: Bayer's top seed faces U.S. soybean challenge from Corteva
Description: Bayer AG's takeover of Monsanto has been beset by problems, and now a decades-long dominance of the $4 billion U.S. soybean seed market is under threat from rival Corteva Inc.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler's U.S. sales chief Reid Bigland who sued company steps down
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles said on Wednesday its U.S. sales chief, Reid Bigland, is leaving the company to pursue other interests.

Headlines: GM launches advanced electric batteries to power its EVs
Description: U.S. automaker General Motors Co on Wednesday launched Ultium, a battery with higher capacity and fast charging capabilities, to power its upcoming line of electric vehicles.

Headlines: As Americans hoard food, Campbell Soup speeds up ingredients orders
Description: Campbell Soup said it is ordering more ingredients to ensure it can keep enough soups, sauces and snacks on hand to meet growing demand from retailers as U.S. consumers hoard food in preparation for potential coronavirus quarantines.

Headlines: U.S. service sector races to one-year high in February
Description: U.S. services sector activity accelerated to a one-year high in February, suggesting underlying strength in the economy despite the coronavirus outbreak, which has triggered financial market fears of a recession and led to an emergency interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Kazakhstan says OPEC+ countries yet to reach consensus on extension: TASS
Description: Kazakhstan's Energy Minister Nurlan Nogayev said on Thursday that OPEC and non-OPEC oil exporters have not yet reached consensus on the parameters of an extension on their oil output deal, the TASS news agency reported.

Headlines: Russia's Aeroflot to suspend Hong Kong flights amid coronavirus fears: Interfax
Description: Russia's state carrier Aeroflot said on Thursday it would suspend its flights to and from Hong Kong amid fears over coronavirus.

Headlines: Walmart's Flipkart faces further anti-trust probe in India
Description: Walmart Inc's Flipkart faces a further anti-trust probe in India after an appellate tribunal asked the competition watchdog to investigate whether the company had abused its dominant position in e-commerce.

Headlines: Exxon to push ahead with spending plans despite investor concerns
Description: Two years into an ambitious growth plan to revive earnings at the largest U.S. oil company, Exxon Mobil Corp said on Thursday it would stick to its plans to "lean in" to spending even as its shares have lagged those of competitors, which are cutting costs.

Headlines: Big tech firms ask Seattle employees to work from home over coronavirus fears
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Thursday joined Amazon.com Inc, Facebook Inc and Microsoft Corp in recommending employees in the Seattle area to work from home, after many were infected with the coronavirus in the region.

Headlines: Russia can cope with oil price drop if no OPEC cut agreed -Finance Minister
Description: Russia is fiscally prepared to cope with a drop in oil prices, Finance Minister Anton Siluanov said on Thursday, as OPEC tries to convince Moscow to support the market with a deeper output cut in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. fourth-quarter unit labor costs, productivity revised down
Description: U.S. unit labor costs grew much slower than initially thought in the fourth quarter and were soft in 2019, suggesting inflation could remain tame despite tightening labor market conditions.

Headlines: UBS hardens energy lending as 'sustainable' investments rise
Description: Switzerland's UBS said the value of its 'sustainable' investments rose by more than 50% to nearly $500 billion in 2019, while lending to the energy and utilities sectors fell by 40% as it tightened its rules.

Headlines: Finland's Nokia announces 5G partnership with Intel
Description: Finland's Nokia Oyj has entered into partnership with Intel to accelerate its so-far sluggish shift to 5G, the company said on Thursday, a day after announcing a similar deal with Marvell Technology .

Headlines: Iranian oil minister confirms OPEC agreed a 1.5 million bpd cut
Description: The Iranian oil minister confirmed on Thursday that OPEC ministers had agreed an extra 1.5 million barrel per day (bpd) cut in oil production and that Iran was still exempt from the reduction.

Headlines: ProSieben's $500 million dating bet a turn-off for investors
Description: ProSiebenSat.1 Media has staked a $500 million bet on romance by buying U.S. dating app developer Meet Group Inc , but the deal was a turn-off for investors who sent the German broadcaster's shares down as much as 10% to a decade low.

Headlines: HSBC sends home 100 London staff, confirms China coronavirus case
Description: HSBC Holdings PLC has sent home more than 100 staff in London after a worker tested positive for the coronavirus, the first known case at a major company in Europe's main financial hub.

Headlines: Airlines suspend flights due to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Airlines have been suspending flights or modifying services in response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. economy could take hit from coronavirus
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday the U.S. economy might take a hit from the coronavirus outbreak but predicted the challenge would eventually pass and defended his handling of the crisis.

Headlines: Wall Street drops over 3% on virus fears, travel shares slammed
Description: U.S. stocks tumbled on Thursday, with shares of banks and travel companies taking a beating, as a new wave of fear about the spread of the coronavirus and its economic impact gripped investors just one day after election results powered a rally.

Headlines: Former UAW President Gary Jones charged in U.S. corruption probe
Description: Former United Auto Workers (UAW) President Gary Jones was charged on Thursday with embezzling more than $1 million of union funds amid a U.S. corruption probe that has raised the specter of a federal government takeover of the union.

Headlines: U.S. financial companies prep for new normal amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: U.S. financial companies are doubling down on travel restrictions to include domestic trips, replacing meetings with video calls, and webcasting events as the coronavirus outbreak starts to alter business-as-usual across the sector.

Headlines: Probe panel on Kansai Elec's graft scandal to report findings on March 14
Description: An independent committee investigating a graft scandal at Kansai Electric Power Co , Japan's second-largest utility, will release its findings on March 14, a representative of the committee said on Friday.

Headlines: Portugal's TAP cancels 1,000 flights in March-April as coronavirus hits demand
Description: Portugal's flag carrier TAP canceled around 1,000 flights scheduled in March and April on Thursday after concerns about the coronavirus epidemic led to a fall in demand and said it envisaged an unspecified impact on revenues.

Headlines: Old Navy boss to take the helm at Gap
Description: Apparel retailer Gap Inc on Thursday named long-time executive Sonia Syngal as its new chief executive officer, nearly four months after the surprise exit of its then chief Art Peck.

Headlines: Iraq death toll by coronavirus rises to three: state news agency
Description: Iraq reported a death by coronavirus in the city of Karbala, bringing total death count by coronavirus to three in the country, state news agency reported on Friday.

Headlines: France to close schools in areas worst hit by coronavirus for 15 days
Description: France will close nurseries and schools for 15 days from Monday in the two areas most hit by coronavirus infections, one north of Paris and the other in the northeastern part of the country, its prime minister said on Friday.

Headlines: Iraq reports eight new coronavirus cases: state news agency
Description: Iraq reported eight new coronavirus cases on Friday, 5 in Baghdad, 2 in Sulaimaniya and one case in Karbala, state news agency reported quoting health ministry.

Headlines: Across Asia, countries race to boost face mask supplies
Description: At a face mask factory just outside the South Korean capital of Seoul, workers are churning out 300,000 masks a day - and it's still not enough.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley shifts London traders to Heathrow site to counter virus: sources
Description: Morgan Stanley is shifting part of its London-based sales and trading staff to a secondary site near Heathrow airport to ensure its trading desks can operate smoothly through the coronavirus outbreak, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. telehealth companies brace for demand spike as coronavirus spread accelerates
Description: The U.S. telehealth industry, including market leader Teladoc Health Inc, is preparing for a surge in demand as public health officials aiming to contain the fast-spreading new coronavirus encourage use of alternatives to clinic visits and patients seek to avoid public spaces.

Headlines: OPEC's pact with Russia falls apart, sending oil into tailspin
Description: A three-year pact between OPEC and Russia ended in acrimony on Friday after Moscow refused to support deeper oil cuts to cope with the outbreak of coronavirus and OPEC responded by removing all limits on its own production.

Headlines: Telecom Italia fined 116 million euros for broadband market abuse
Description: Italy's competition watchdog said on Friday it had fined former phone monopoly Telecom Italia (TIM) 116 million euros ($131 million) for abusing its dominant position in the broadband market in an attempt to obstruct the entrance of rivals.

Headlines: Coronavirus concerns drag down Wall Street, but indexes eke out weekly gains
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Friday as fears of economic damage from the spread of the coronavirus intensified, though Wall Street's major indexes ended well above their session lows.

Headlines: White House considers tax relief for airlines, travel firms amid coronavirus
Description: The Trump administration is weighing tax relief for airline, cruise and travel industries to help such companies cope with a growing coronavirus outbreak that has dried up bookings, a source familiar with the plan said on Friday.

Headlines: U.N. cancels some meetings ahead of climate summit due to coronavirus
Description: The United Nations has canceled some meetings in Bonn, Germany, and elsewhere planned in the run-up to a crucial U.N. climate summit to be held in Glasgow, Scotland, in November due to the coronavirus outbreak, an official said on Friday.

Headlines: Bond yields slide to record lows, stocks succumb to virus fears
Description: Yields on U.S. Treasuries plunged to historic lows on Friday as fear the coronavirus outbreak will slam the global economy drove investors to snap up risk-adverse assets and dump equities, overshadowing data highlighting a strong U.S. labor market.

Headlines: Colombia confirms its first case of coronavirus
Description: Colombia confirmed its first case of coronavirus on Friday, joining other South American countries that have reported cases of the fast-spreading disease.

Headlines: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon recovering after emergency heart surgery
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co CEO and Chairman Jamie Dimon is recovering from emergency heart surgery done on Thursday morning, with two deputies taking over as he recuperates, the largest U.S. bank said.

Headlines: Standard U.S. economic weapons may be inadequate for coronavirus crisis
Description: As the risks of the coronavirus outbreak continue to rise, U.S. officials are wrestling with what to do in the worst-case economic scenarios, if large numbers of people can't go to work, are told to stay home, or stop going out in public entirely.

Headlines: U.S. job growth robust before coronavirus outbreak hit shores
Description: U.S. employers maintained a robust pace of hiring in February, giving the economy a strong boost heading into the coronavirus outbreak, which has stoked fears of a recession and prompted an emergency interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Nissan pushes on with new vehicle plan at UK factory despite Brexit warning
Description: Nissan is pushing on with plans to build its new Qashqai sports utility vehicle at its British factory despite warnings over Brexit, announcing on Friday a 52-million pound investment in a new press line at the site.

Headlines: Tesla wins approval to sell longer-range China-made Model 3 vehicles
Description: Tesla Inc has secured Chinese government approval to sell longer-range China-made model 3 vehicles in China, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology said on Friday.

Headlines: Peugeot CEO Tavares says China strategy needs rethink
Description: Peugeot boss Carlos Tavares said on Friday PSA and Fiat Chrysler (FCA) will need to review their strategy in China in order to boost sales after the closing of the merger between the two groups.

Headlines: India's Tata Motors warns of JLR profit hit due to coronavirus
Description: Indian automaker Tata Motors warned on Friday of lower profit at its British luxury car brand Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) for the fiscal year as the coronavirus outbreak has hit sales in China.

Headlines: Rolling in toilet paper - Australian family over-orders coveted commodity
Description: An Australian family is rolling in a much-coveted commodity after mistakenly ordering 48 boxes instead of 48 rolls of toilet paper online.

Headlines: China's first-quarter economic hit from coronavirus looking more severe: Reuters poll
Description: The coronavirus likely halved China's economic growth in the current quarter compared with the previous three months, more severe than thought just three weeks ago and triggering expectations for earlier interest rate cuts, a Reuters poll found.

Headlines: EssilorLuxottica forecasts profit growth despite coronavirus impact
Description: EssilorLuxottica expects continued profit growth this year after stronger 2019 results, saying on Friday the outbreak of coronavirus had not hit output at its Italian factories and its production in China was getting back to normal.

Headlines: Timeline: India central bank takes control of bad loan-burdened Yes Bank
Description: India's central bank took control of the country's fifth-largest private sector lender Yes Bank on Thursday and imposed limits on withdrawals, spreading confusion and fear among account holders.

Headlines: On the brink: China's bakers, bars and beauty spas struggle to survive coronavirus
Description: The coronavirus outbreak in China is pushing many small businesses to the brink, as efforts to stem its spread left usually bustling streets deserted and malls shut or empty.

Headlines: Facebook, Google ask San Francisco staff to work from home as coronavirus spreads
Description: Social media giant Facebook Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google on Thursday recommended their San Francisco Bay area employees work from home to minimize the risk of spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: 'Unsustainable': Mexico's Pemex buckling under crushing pension debt
Description: Straining under a massive debt load and at risk of a ratings downgrade, Mexican state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) was hit with a record jump in its pension liabilities last year as more workers retired on generous benefits.

Headlines: U.S. employment report expected to show strength before coronavirus spread
Description: U.S. job growth likely slowed in February, but the pace probably remained consistent with a healthy labor market despite the coronavirus outbreak, which stoked financial market fears of a recession and prompted an emergency interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Exclusive: Tencent-backed WeDoctor invites banks to lead $1 billion Hong Kong IPO, sources say
Description: WeDoctor will push ahead with a Hong Kong listing and invite pitches from investments banks next week to lead an IPO valuing the Chinese healthcare platform at up to $10 billion, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Coronavirus cases rise to 45 in Greece after group trip to Israel, Egypt
Description: Greece has confirmed 14 new cases of coronavirus infection, health authorities said on Friday, bringing the total in the country to 45.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit narrows in January; exports, imports fall
Description: The U.S. trade deficit narrowed more than expected in January as imports declined, and further decreases are likely as the coronavirus outbreak disrupts the flow of goods and services.

Headlines: Italian coronavirus deaths jump to 197, cases climb to 4,636
Description: The death toll from an outbreak of coronavirus in Italy has risen by 49 to 197, the Civil Protection Agency said on Friday, the largest daily increase in fatalities since the contagion was uncovered two weeks ago.

Headlines: Instant view: U.S. payrolls better than expected, as markets look to coronavirus impact
Description: U.S. employers maintained a robust pace of hiring in February, giving the economy a strong boost as it confronts the coronavirus outbreak that has stoked financial market fears of a recession and prompted an emergency interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Traders bet U.S. Fed will slash interest rates in coming months
Description: Futures traders are betting the Federal Reserve will slash U.S. interest rates in coming months to blunt damage to the world's largest economy, as governments and companies move to control the spread of the new coronavirus by limiting travel and public gatherings.

Headlines: Fed to cut rates again in March, but effectiveness challenged: Reuters poll
Description: The Federal Reserve will cut U.S. interest rates by 25 basis points later this month but it is a close call, according to a Reuters poll of economists who have substantially raised their forecasts for the chances of a recession following the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. Fed should cut rates, stimulate economy
Description: President Donald Trump said on Friday the Federal Reserve should cut U.S. interest rates and stimulate the economy, three days after the central bank slashed interest rates by half a percentage point in an emergency bid to blunt the economic effects of the coronavirus.

Headlines: India's Yes Bank debacle jolts investors, customers and partners
Description: Shares in India's Yes Bank plunged on Friday as panicky depositors rushed to withdraw funds and payment partners faced outages after the banking regulator took control of the lender in a late-night move and limited withdrawals.

Headlines: India sets out Yes Bank rescue, State Bank of India to take 49% stake
Description: India laid out a rescue plan for Yes Bank on Friday under which State Bank of India will take a 49% stake in the troubled lender, which is struggling with bad loans.

Headlines: OPEC, non-OPEC fail to agree existing cuts roll-over: sources
Description: OPEC and non-OPEC oil producers have failed to agree a roll over of existing output cuts, two OPEC sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Chipotle founder Steve Ells leaves board, CEO Niccol to add chairman role
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill said on Friday founder Steve Ells has stepped down from the board, handing over the role of executive chairman to Chief Executive Officer Brian Niccol.

Headlines: Coronavirus spreads in French parliament
Description: A second member of France's National Assembly has been taken to hospital after contracting coronavirus and five other lawmakers are being tested for the illness, the lower house's presidency said in a statement on Saturday.

Headlines: Italy poised to lock down Lombardy after coronavirus jump
Description: Italy is set to impose a virtual lockdown on its wealthiest and most populous region, which includes the financial capital Milan, as part of tough new measures to try to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Coronavirus infects 100,000-plus worldwide, 21 cases found on ship off San Francisco
Description: Twenty-one people aboard a cruise ship that was barred from docking in San Francisco have tested positive for coronavirus, U.S. officials said on Friday, adding to the more than 100,000 cases of the fast-spreading illness across the world.

Headlines: German coronavirus cases jump, economic anxiety rises
Description: The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Germany jumped by more than 100 on Saturday, reaching 795 by mid-afternoon amid growing concern at the economic impact of the spreading epidemic on one of the world's most trade-dependent economies.

Headlines: Coronavirus deaths rise to 145 in Iran, infections near 6,000: ministry
Description: Iran's death toll from coronavirus reached 145 on Saturday after another 21 people were confirmed to have died during the last day, among them a conservative lawmaker from Tehran, officials and local news agencies said.

Headlines: Italy coronavirus deaths near 200 after biggest daily jump
Description: The death toll from an outbreak of coronavirus in Italy has risen by 49 to 197, the Civil Protection Agency said on Friday, the largest daily increase in fatalities since the contagion was uncovered two weeks ago.

Headlines: France says 11 people have now died from coronavirus: Health Ministry
Description: France's Health Ministry said on Saturday that two more people had died from the coronavirus, bringing the total death toll to 11 people.

Headlines: Ethiopian draft report blames Boeing for 737 MAX plane crash: sources
Description: A draft interim report from Ethiopian crash investigators circulated to U.S. government agencies concludes the March 2019 crash of a Boeing Co 737 MAX was caused by the plane's design, two people briefed on the matter said Friday.

Headlines: Czech coronavirus quarantine measures extended to foreign residents
Description: Foreign nationals living in the Czech Republic will have to enter a two-week coronavirus quarantine if they return to the country from Italy, the European nation hit hardest by the epidemic, Prime Minister Andrej Babis said on Saturday.

Headlines: CME Group says U.S. stock futures hit down limit, continue to trade
Description: Futures contracts on the U.S. stock market had hit their 5% overnight down limit but trading in the instruments continued, the CME Group said on Monday.

Headlines: Boeing proposal to avoid MAX wiring shift does not win U.S. support
Description: Boeing Co's proposal to leave wiring bundles in place on the grounded 737 MAX has not won the backing of U.S. aviation regulators, a person briefed on the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. stock futures sink by 5% down limit after crude rout
Description: U.S. stock futures plunged 5% to hit their daily down limit and halt trading after the biggest single-day loss in oil futures in almost 30 years on Sunday exacerbated fears of a credit crunch across financial markets.

Headlines: Brazil, U.S. sign agreement to develop defense technology
Description: Brazilian and U.S. governments signed on Sunday an agreement for development of defense projects that may give the South American country access to financing.

Headlines: IKEA reopens nine more stores in China
Description: IKEA, the world's biggest furniture brand, is reopening nine of its stores in China this weekend, a company spokeswoman said.

Headlines: Maldives confirms first two coronavirus cases; two resort islands locked down
Description: The Maldives has curbed movement on several resort islands, authorities said on Sunday, after the country reported its first two cases of coronavirus.

Headlines: Coronavirus fears, oil price plunge pummel world markets
Description: Global stock markets plunged on Monday and oil prices tumbled by as much as a third after Saudi Arabia launched a price war with Russia, sending investors already spooked by the coronavirus outbreak fleeing for the safety of bonds and the Japanese yen.

Headlines: JPMorgan to cut up to 140 jobs in Switzerland: source
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co could eliminate up to 140 jobs in Switzerland in an effort to cut costs, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday, confirming a report by the Swiss financial news website Finews.

Headlines: Business picks up pace in China, but global virus spread may slow recovery
Description: China's business and travel activities are steadily recovering after being disrupted by the coronavirus outbreak, but rapidly rising infections globally will pose a challenge to the country's broader economic resumption.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines suspend flights due to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Airlines across the globe have suspended flights or modified services in response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Hawaiian Airlines CEO says hard to predict short-term industry outlook
Description: While no U.S. airlines have requested a bailout to date, the head of Hawaiian Airline said on Monday that it was difficult to predict what would happen in the weeks and months ahead for the industry as travelers cancel flights amid coronavirus uncertainty.

Headlines: Oil plunges 25%, hit by erupting Saudi-Russia oil price war
Description: Crude prices suffered their biggest daily rout since the 1991 Gulf War on Monday as top producers Saudi Arabia and Russia began a price war that threatens to overwhelm global oil markets with supply.

Headlines: Ethiopia Airlines crash report focuses on Boeing's faulty systems
Description: Ethiopian investigators singled out faulty systems on a Boeing 737 MAX plane in an interim report on last year's Ethiopian Airlines crash that killed 157 people, piling pressure on the U.S. jetmaker on the eve of the disaster's anniversary.

Headlines: Wall Street clobbered as crude plummets, virus crisis deepens
Description: Wall Street suffered its biggest one-day loss since the 2008 financial crisis on Monday and recession worries loomed large as tumbling oil prices and ongoing coronavirus fears prompted investor panic on the anniversary of the U.S. stock market's longest-ever bull run.

Headlines: Heineken to pour $183 million into expansion in Brazil
Description: Heineken NV will invest 865 million reais ($183.14 million) to expand its Ponta Grossa brewing plant in Brazil, the company said on Monday, as competition between the world's two largest beer makers bubbles up.

Headlines: Qantas asks Airbus for extension to A350-1000 order deadline due to virus
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd has asked Airbus SE for an extension to a March-end deadline to order up to 12 A350-1000 planes capable of the world's longest commercial flights from Sydney to London, the airline's CEO said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Boeing shares plunge on coronavirus, 737 MAX wiring bundle setback
Description: Shares of Boeing Co dropped more than 12% on Monday amid a broader market plunge as pressure mounted on global aviation from the spread of the coronavirus and U.S. regulators said they disagreed with Boeing's argument about the safety of wiring bundles on the grounded 737 MAX jet.

Headlines: Barclays cuts 2020 oil price outlook on price war, virus impact
Description: Barclays on Tuesday slashed its oil price forecasts for 2020, citing OPEC's failure to convince its allies including Russia to cut production further, which led to Saudi Arabia saying it would raise its output in April despite sluggish global demand.

Headlines: Indonesia readying measures to stabilize financial markets - finance minister
Description: Indonesia Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati said on Tuesday that authorities are prepared to use all measures they implemented during the 2008 global financial crisis to stabilize financial markets.

Headlines: U.S. bank shares slammed as virus, plunging oil amp up economic fears
