Description: U.S. regulators are considering giving banks additional regulatory points for lending to mid- to low-income Americans hurt by the coronavirus, as they seek to mitigate the economic impact of the pandemic, an official within a banking agency told Reuters.

Headlines: Brazil's big privatizations, the latest coronavirus victim
Description: As Brazil's stock market hit record highs in January, Economy Minister Paulo Guedes said the country could raise up to 150 billion reais ($30 billion) with sales of state-owned companies through share offerings, mergers and acquisitions.

Headlines: U.S. grocery meat supply to improve soon, after virus-fueled demand surge: Tyson Foods
Description: Demand for U.S. meat at grocery stores will likely exceed supplies for at least another week, the chief executive of Tyson Foods Inc told Reuters on Thursday, as the coronavirus pandemic fuels panic buying among shoppers.

Headlines: U.S. oil reverses losses, posts largest one-day gain on record
Description: U.S. crude oil prices spiked by 25% on Thursday, the largest single-day gain on record, recouping some losses from three days of selling that drove the benchmark to near 20-year lows.

Headlines: U.S. jobless claims could top record 1.5 million next week: economists
Description: A wave of layoffs at restaurants, bars and hotels, as efforts to contain the coronavirus pandemic bring much of everyday American life to a halt, could drive new applications for U.S. unemployment benefits to a record 1.5 million or more next week, economists warned on Thursday.

Headlines: Prince Albert of Monaco tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Prince Albert of Monaco has tested positive for coronavirus but his health is not a cause for concern, his office said on Thursday.

Headlines: Coronavirus patients flood hospitals in Swiss canton next to Italy
Description: The southern Swiss canton of Ticino on the border with Italy is being swamped with coronavirus patients and authorities are battling to find enough intensive care beds, a top public health official said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. to buy initial 30 million bbls of oil for emergency stockpile
Description: The U.S. Department of Energy said on Thursday it will buy up to 30 million barrels of crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve by the end of June as a first step in fulfilling President Donald Trump's directive to fill the emergency stockpile to help domestic crude producers.

Headlines: H&M issues notice of temporary lay-offs to 2,000 staff in Norway: DN
Description: Swedish retailer H&M has sent notice of temporary lay-offs to 2,000 employees in Norway due to the coronavirus outbreak, Norwegian business daily Dagens Naeringsliv reported on Thursday, citing the head of the Norwegian business.

Headlines: Coronavirus turmoil poses test as Canada's Bombardier sheds assets
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc could face its first test as a standalone business jet maker as economic uncertainty linked to the rapid spread of coronavirus crimps demand for new corporate aircraft and has sparked fears of a recession, industry executives and analysts said.

Headlines: U.S. recession chances now at 80% despite Fed emergency moves: Reuters poll
Description: The coronavirus crisis has almost certainly ended the longest U.S. expansion on record and pushed the economy into the start of a short slump, according to analysts polled by Reuters who gave a median 80% chance of recession this year.

Headlines: Coronavirus to have short-lived drastic impact on Armenian economy: minister
Description: The spread of the coronavirus will have a short-lived, drastic impact on Armenia's economy, Economy Minister Tigran Khachatryan said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.N. chief says global recession due to coronavirus 'a near certainty'
Description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned on Thursday that a global recession "is a near certainty" and current national responses to the coronavirus pandemic "will not address the global scale and complexity of the crisis."

Headlines: Factbox: Europeans ask what has EU done for us? Answer: 2.5 trillion euro stimulus
Description: The European Union has responded to the coronavirus, seen by German Chancellor Angela Merkel as the biggest challenge since World War Two, with a wide range of measures to limit the spread of the disease and the resulting economic damage.

Headlines: U.S. auto suppliers seek government aid to cope with coronavirus hit
Description: The trade group for U.S. auto parts makers on Thursday asked the government for emergency grants "to keep the doors open," tariff relief and other assistance to cope with mounting pressures from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Factbox: From Boeing to Tennessee whiskey, coronavirus U.S. bailout requests top $2 trillion
Description: As the coronavirus pandemic threatens to bring U.S. economic activity to a halt, American businesses are jockeying for a financial lifeline from President Donald Trump's administration and Congress.

Headlines: Catholics worldwide pray with pope for end to coronavirus pandemic
Description: Catholics around the world joined Pope Francis in praying the rosary on Thursday night to ask God to end the coronavirus pandemic, which has killed more people in Italy than anywhere else.

Headlines: Trump says he would support government taking stake in certain companies
Description: President Donald Trump on Thursday opened the door to a radical shift in the U.S. government's relationship to private industry as the coronavirus outbreak upends the nation's economy, saying he would back the government taking stakes in certain companies.

Headlines: China asks airlines to cut international flights, redirects some due to virus
Description: China's aviation regulator has asked airlines to cut international flights and ordered some Beijing ones to be rerouted, as the country grapples with a rising number of imported coronavirus cases, especially in the capital.

Headlines: U.S. conglomerates see borrowing costs spike
Description: Walt Disney Co , JPMorgan Chase & Co and United Parcel Service Inc were among seven major U.S. companies that accepted a big rise in their borrowing costs to issue bonds on Thursday, as the coronavirus outbreak roiled credit markets.

Headlines: JLR to suspend production at UK manufacturing facilities from next week
Description: Luxury automaker Jaguar Land Rover said late on Thursday it would temporarily suspend production at its UK manufacturing facilities from next week to curb the coronavirus' spread.

Headlines: Colombia to suspend entry for all travelers from abroad
Description: Colombia will block entry to everyone traveling from abroad from midnight on Monday in an effort to control the spread of coronavirus, President Ivan Duque said on Thursday.

Headlines: Brazil coronavirus cases top 600, diplomatic spat with China bubbles
Description: Confirmed coronavirus cases in Brazil surged past 600 on Thursday, more than doubling in two days, as a diplomatic spat over the disease's origins between President Jair Bolsonaro's son and the Chinese ambassador threatened relations with Brazil's top trading partner.

Headlines: 'Quadruple witching' may spell some relief to stressed stocks
Description: In calm markets "quadruple witching" usually passes unnoticed, but some market players are hoping this Friday's concurrent quarterly expiration of U.S. options and futures contracts could shake some sense back into stocks.

Headlines: Fast food chains easing rent, fees for franchisees amid coronavirus
Description: Dunkin' Brands Group Inc on Thursday said it will ease royalty and advertising fee payments for franchisees in the United States and Canada, while McDonald's Corp is in talks to reduce some payments for franchisees.

Headlines: JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon recovering well, mid-April return possible: source
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon's recovery from recent heart surgery is going well and the face of the U.S. banking industry could be back to work as soon as mid-April, a source said on Thursday.

Headlines: LVMH considering buying Tiffany's shares on open market: Bloomberg News
Description: French luxury goods maker LVMH , which last year agreed to buy Tiffany & Co for $16.2 billion, is considering buying shares of the U.S. jeweler for less on the open market, Bloomberg News reported https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-19/lvmh-is-said-to-consider-buying-tiffany-shares-on-open-market on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Wall Street ends higher to stem coronavirus sell-off
Description: U.S. stocks managed to post gains on Thursday after recent steep losses as policymakers around the world took further emergency actions to try to help financial markets cope with deep coronavirus-driven economic damage.

Headlines: Airbnb fields interest from investors seeking a stake: sources
Description: Airbnb Inc has received inquiries from potential investors who want to acquire a stake in the U.S. home rental company in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. aviation industry calls for immediate grants, loans to ensure survival
Description: The leading U.S. airline trade group and dozens of other U.S. aviation industry trade groups on Thursday called for immediate grants, unsecured loans and limited tax measures to ensure the industry's ability to survive the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: UK's Queen Elizabeth addresses message to nation over virus crisis
Description: Queen Elizabeth said on Thursday that the royal family would play its part as Britain rises to the challenge of overcoming the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Government bans Norwegians from traveling to cabins amid coronavirus
Description: Norway on Thursday banned people from going to their country cabins to prevent the spread of coronavirus and lessen the burden on local public services.

Headlines: Three people have coronavirus at U.S. mission in Geneva: official
Description: Three people employed by the U.S. diplomatic mission in Geneva have contracted coronavirus, but are in "good condition", a spokesperson told Reuters on Thursday, declining to give specifics.

Headlines: UK says has no plans for travel restrictions or to use military to keep order
Description: The British government has no plans to bring in blanket travel restrictions for London or to close down the capital's transport system, Prime Minister Boris Johnson's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headlines: Banks aim to keep trading floors open in event of any London lockdown
Description: London-based banks plan to keep trading floors open even in the event of a formal lockdown of the British capital, betting that their frontline staff will be treated by authorities as "key workers".

Headlines: Exclusive: China to ramp up spending to revive economy, could cut growth target - sources
Description: China is set to unleash trillions of yuan of fiscal stimulus to revive an economy expected to shrink for the first time in four decades amid the coronavirus pandemic, while a planned growth target is likely to be cut, according to four policy sources.

Headlines: Google critics see its Firebase tools as another squeeze play
Description: Some app developers say Alphabet Inc's Google is increasingly pressing them to embed code in their own products that will deepen Google's access to data on consumers, giving the company a leg up on rivals.

Headlines: Dutch test blood donations for unseen coronavirus spread
Description: Dutch health authorities have begun a major project testing blood donation samples to see how many people in the Netherlands may have already had the new coronavirus, often with symptoms so mild they hardly noticed.

Headlines: Xiaomi says 80% of supply chain operational ahead of 5G phone launch
Description: China's Xiaomi had resumed operations for over 80% of its supply chain as of Thursday in the wake of the country's coronavirus outbreak, the company's president said.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank expects German economy to contract 4%-5% in 2020
Description: Deutsche Bank slashed its forecast for Germany's economy on the coronavirus fallout, saying it now expected the euro zone's largest economy to contract between 4-5% in 2020 while industrial production could shrink by 10%.

Headlines: Factbox: Global oil, gas producers cut spending after crude price crash
Description: Oil and gas companies aim to cut spending as the impact of the new coronavirus on demand and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output have hammered oil markets.

Headlines: Qantas to cease international flying, tells majority of workforce to take leave
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd said on Thursday it will halt all international flights from late March until at least the end of May and is putting two-thirds of its workforce on leave after Australia told citizens not to travel overseas due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: Emirates asks pilots and cabin crew to take unpaid leave
Description: Emirates is asking pilots and cabin crew to take unpaid leave and rival Qatar Airways laid off about 200 staff in Doha this week as the coronavirus outbreak hammers demand for travel.

Headlines: Coronavirus sees India's biggest airline cut employee pay: internal memo
Description: India's biggest airline IndiGo has cut the salaries of most employees by between 5% and 20% in response to the coronavirus outbreak, which has paralyzed air travel and dented its revenues, an internal memo seen by Reuters said.

Headlines: GM, Mercedes to furlough all workers in Brazil, suggesting production stop
Description: General Motors Co and Mercedes Benz will furlough all employees in Brazil later this month, the companies said on Wednesday, suggesting that production in South America's main auto center will be heavily impacted by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Croatia reports first death of person infected with coronavirus
Description: Croatia registered its first death of a person infected with the coronavirus, the state public health institute said on the official government web page for the crisis.

Headlines: Greece has registered 464 coronavirus cases, six deaths: health min official
Description: Greece has so far confirmed 464 coronavirus cases and registered six deaths, a health ministry official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Cambodia reports 10 new cases of coronavirus, bringing total to 47
Description: Cambodia reported 10 new cases of coronavirus on Thursday, raising its tally to 47.

Headlines: Germany expects more than 2 million people to use short-time scheme in 2020
Description: Germany expects a record 2.15 million people to this year make use of a scheme that allows employees to work shorter hours but keep their jobs, as the impact of the coronavirus causes havoc in the labor market, a ministry document seen by Reuters showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Iran's death toll from coronavirus rises to 1,284: official
Description: The new coronavirus is killing one person every 10 minutes in Iran, the health ministry spokesman tweeted on Thursday, as the death toll in the Middle East's worst-affected country climbed to 1,284.

Headlines: France says pressure on Amazon workers 'unacceptable' amid lockdown
Description: Amazon workers in France are coming under unacceptable pressure, Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Thursday, after staff complained they faced not getting paid if they stopped showing up due to fears of coronavirus contamination.

Headlines: Investor Ackman tweets to Trump: Close down the country
Description: Billionaire investor William Ackman, who has long worried about risks posed by the coronavirus, called on the Trump administration on Wednesday to seal off the country for 30 days and said stocks would "soar" if such restrictions were imposed.

Headlines: Dutch PM tells citizens to relax, saying there's enough toilet paper for 10 years
Description: The prime minister in the Netherlands has offered reassurances amid the global coronavirus outbreak: telling citizens on Thursday there is no shortage of toilet paper.

Headlines: Boutique shops in central London on the brink as coronavirus kills trade
Description: Horlis Ramirez packed shoes with silk bags into boxes in his empty store in London's West End shopping district, voicing fears that coronavirus could deal a fatal blow to his business.

Headlines: U.S. life insurers impose waiting periods to skirt coronavirus risk
Description: U.S. life insurers are trying to curb their own risks to coronavirus by imposing waiting periods for applicants who have traveled to regions with widespread outbreaks, industry experts said.

Headlines: ASEAN summit in Vietnam postponed until end-June over coronavirus
Description: A summit of Southeast Asian and other international leaders scheduled in Vietnam early next month has been postponed until end-June due to worries about coronavirus, Vietnam's Ministry of Foreign Affairs said on Thursday.

Headlines: Dutch confirmed coronavirus cases at 2,460: health authorities
Description: The number of confirmed cases of coronavirus in the Netherlands has risen by 409 to a total of 2,460, Dutch health authorities said in their daily update on Thursday, with 18 new deaths.

Headlines: Fiat, Toyota, Renault latest to announce auto production halt in Brazil over coronavirus
Description: Fiat Chrysler , Toyota Motor Corp and Renault announced on Friday they will stop auto production in Brazil temporarily due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: This is no 2008: Mnuchin borrows from Paulson's economic crisis playbook
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin has stepped into the breach as the Trump administration's point man to rescue the economy from coronavirus devastation, taking on the role his former Goldman Sachs boss, Hank Paulson, played over a decade ago.

Headlines: Spain to treat thousands of coronavirus patients in conference hall as toll tops 1,000
Description: Spanish authorities said on Friday they would turn a Madrid conference centre into a giant military hospital for coronavirus patients, as Europe's second-worst outbreak claimed another 235 lives and the government warned the worst days lay ahead.

Headlines: Fed announces more emergency moves to stem dollar, liquidity strains
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve continued to roll out emergency support on Friday as it enhanced efforts with other major central banks to ease a global dollar-funding crunch, backstopped a market essential for U.S. state and local government finances and ramped up its purchases of mortgage-backed securities.

Headlines: Airlines face reckoning as government help comes with strings attached
Description: Shattered airlines were left counting the cost of government support as countries from the United States to New Zealand set out conditions for bailouts needed to absorb the shock of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Orange CEO asks for delay of Disney+ streaming launch in France
Description: The chief executive of telecoms operator Orange called on Friday for a delay to the launch of Walt Disney's streaming services in France to avoid overloading networks amid the country's lockdown following the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: 3M doubles production of respirator masks amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: U.S. industrial giant 3M Co said on Friday it has doubled the production of N95 respirator masks over the last two months as a result of a surge in demand due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Madagascar confirms first cases of coronavirus: president
Description: The island nation of Madagascar confirmed its first cases of coronavirus on Friday, the president said in a televised statement.

Headlines: Panama's Copa Airlines cancels all flights as coronavirus crisis spreads
Description: Panama's Copa Airlines on Friday said it will suspend all operations from March 22 until April 21, making it the first Latin American carrier to take such a drastic measure in order to weather the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. airlines call for payroll protections as aid talks continue
Description: U.S. airlines called on Friday for a government stimulus package to help them weather the coronavirus crisis by providing payroll protections, warning that around 750,000 jobs depend on the airline industry.

Headlines: U.S. senators question Amazon on coronavirus safety at warehouses
Description: Four Democratic U.S. senators on Friday expressed concern in a letter to Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Jeff Bezos that the world's largest online retailer has not given enough support to warehouse staff during the coronavirus outbreak, according to a copy of the message seen by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. auto industry backs tax relief, delaying USMCA start after coronavirus
Description: Groups representing major automakers and suppliers asked U.S. lawmakers on Friday to consider new tax relief and delay the start of a new trade deal as auto sales decline as a result of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. extends tax filing deadline to July 15: Mnuchin
Description: The U.S. government will give individuals and companies an extra three months to file their 2019 tax returns, extending the deadline to July 15 amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: States rush to prepare for wave of U.S. unemployed
Description: The U.S. unemployment benefits program, a key part of the safety net for the labor market, is facing its biggest test in more than a decade.

Headlines: Wall Street weekahead: Coronavirus uncertainty muddies views on buying opportunities for plunging stocks
Description: U.S. stock valuations are tumbling in the wake of the coronavirus-fueled market rout, but determining when equities are cheap enough to buy is a tricky proposition.

Headlines: Boeing suspends dividend, CEO foregoes pay after coronavirus-related aid request
Description: Boeing Co will cancel CEO pay, suspend its dividend and extend a pause on share buybacks, the U.S. planemaker said on Friday, as companies eager for government aid to curb fallout from the coronavirus face pressure to cut payouts to investors.

Headlines: Wall Street dives, ends worst week since 2008, as New York, California impose restrictions
Description: Wall Street wrapped up its worst week since October 2008, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 sliding more than 4% on Friday as tough restrictions imposed by New York and California to try to limit the spread of the coronavirus fueled worries about damage to the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit pulls elderly workers from checkouts on coronavirus concerns
Description: Grocers including Walmart de Mexico have begun bowing to pressure to pull from stores tens of thousands of elderly workers who pack bags at checkouts as concerns grow about their vulnerability to coronavirus amid panic buying nationwide.

Headlines: Google cancels annual developer conference on coronavirus fears
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Friday canceled its annual developer conference, two weeks after calling off the in-person portion of the event due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Trump slams companies for using U.S. tax credit to buy back stocks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday took Boeing Co and some airlines to task for buying back shares with the cash boost from a 2018 tax break, vowing to ensure that companies benefiting from coronavirus stimulus won't follow suit.

Headlines: Anglo American says to reschedule work at mines to contain virus
Description: Anglo American said on Friday it would reschedule work at mines in countries such as Chile to contain the spread of coronavirus but added there had been no material disruption on production.

Headlines: U.S. home sales race to 13-year high; coronavirus disruption looms
Description: U.S. home sales surged to a 13-year high in February, but the housing market recovery is likely to be derailed by the coronavirus pandemic, which has unleashed a wave of layoffs and left the economy teetering on the brink of a recession.

Headlines: Germany will block foreign takeovers to avoid economy sell-out
Description: Germany will protect domestic firms from foreign takeovers, two leading politicians said on Friday, after company valuations in Europe's largest economy have been hammered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Truckmaker Volvo to put all 20,000 Swedish staff on temporary lay off-scheme
Description: Truckmaker AB Volvo said on Friday it would put all its 20,000 staff in Sweden on a short-term, temporary lay off-scheme starting next week as it plans to close all production in the country due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Global oil, gas producers cut spending after crude price crash
Description: Oil and gas companies are cutting spending plans in response to the new coronavirus and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output.

Headlines: Muslims in Indonesia divided over Friday prayers amid coronavirus fears
Description: While many Muslims in Indonesia's capital accepted advice to avoid religious gatherings and prayed at home on Friday elsewhere in the world's most populous Muslim country, people ignored the risk of coronavirus and crowded into their mosques.

Headlines: A poorer student falls behind in Hong Kong as coronavirus forces online learning
Description: When Hong Kong student Wendy received a question from her geography teacher during an online class, she scrambled to unmute her mother's cellphone, but the screen kept freezing. She had already used up her monthly five gigabytes data allowance.

Headlines: France says 130,000 of its nationals trying to return home
Description: France is trying to facilitate the repatriation of 130,000 of its nationals stuck overseas due to the coronavirus outbreak, Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said on Friday.

Headlines: Taiwan's new 'electronic fence' for quarantines leads wave of virus monitoring
Description: Taiwan, which has won global praise for its effective action against the coronavirus, is rolling out a mobile phone-based "electronic fence" that uses location-tracking to ensure people who are quarantined stay in their homes.

Headlines: Apple limits online iPhone purchases to two per person amid coronavirus
Description: Apple Inc is limiting customer purchases of iPhones over its online stores in many countries including the United States and China to a maximum of two handsets per person, checks on its website on Friday revealed.

Headlines: OPEC supply curbs, U.S. measures could support oil prices near term: Goldman
Description: Supply restraint by core-OPEC producers could push second-quarter Brent oil prices up to $30 a barrel, while U.S. measures to support the market could underpin prices in the near term, Goldman Sachs said in a research note.

Headlines: Thailand reports 50 new coronavirus infections for total of 322
Description: Thailand reported 50 new coronavirus infections, taking its tally to 322, a health official said on Friday, with the majority located in Bangkok, the capital.

Headlines: Finnish health boss questions WHO coronavirus testing advice
Description: Finland's national health authority questioned on Friday the World Health Organization's call on countries to test as many patients as possible for coronavirus, after the country ran out of testing capacity this week.

Headlines: Inditex considers 25,000 temporary layoffs in Spain
Description: Inditex, the owner of fashion chain Zara, may temporarily lay off all 25,000 of its store staff in Spain if the country's state of emergency extends beyond April 15, in what would be one of the largest such moves in Europe due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Poland donates 430 thousand litres of confiscated spirits for disinfectant
Description: Nearly half a million litres of confiscated vodka and rectified spirit will be sent to Polish public institutions in need of disinfectant amid the coronavirus outbreak, Poland's prosecutor's office said on Friday.

Headlines: Crowds form at Olympic torch event in Japan despite coronavirus caution
Description: An Olympic torch event in Japan drew hundreds of spectators on the day of the flame's arrival on Friday, creating the type of packed gathering the government and Tokyo 2020 organisers have warned against to prevent coronavirus from spreading further.

Headlines: Sri Lanka imposes curfew as South Asia steps up coronavirus battle
Description: Sri Lanka imposed a nationwide weekend curfew on Friday as South Asian countries escalated efforts to check the spread of coronavirus across the densely populated region of 1.9 billion people.

Headlines: Fed increases frequency of swap line operations with other major central banks
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Friday that it would enhance the U.S. dollar liquidity swap line arrangements it has with several major central banks.

Headlines: Brazil Senate approves state of emergency to fight coronavirus
Description: Brazil's Senate on Friday approved a presidential decree declaring a national emergency over the coronavirus epidemic, allowing the government to waive fiscal targets and free up budget resources to fight the virus that has killed seven and infected 621 in the country.

Headlines: U.S. power industry may ask key employees to live at work if coronavirus worsens
Description: The U.S. electric industry may ask essential staff to live on site at power plants and control centers to keep operations running if the coronavirus outbreak worsens, and has been stockpiling beds, blankets, and food for them, according to industry trade groups and electric cooperatives.

Headlines: Malaysia to deploy army amid movement curbs to contain coronavirus
Description: Malaysia will deploy the army from Sunday to assist police in enforcing a restricted movement order aimed at reining in the spread of a coronavirus, the government said.

Headlines: U.S. existing home sales surge to 13-year high in February
Description: U.S. home sales surged to a 13-year high in February, but the housing market recovery is likely to be derailed by the coronavirus pandemic, which has unleashed a wave of layoffs and left the economy teetering on the brink of a recession.

Headlines: U.S. finance industry says markets must stay open during epidemic
Description: Keeping U.S. markets open during the coronavirus epidemic is critical for maintaining investor confidence, exchanges and market industry bodies said in a joint statement on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Goldman injects $1 billion into own money-market funds after heavy withdrawals
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc poured more than $1 billion into two of its prime money-market portfolios this week due to heavy investor withdrawals, according to a filing with the U.S. securities regulator.

Headlines: LVMH orders 40 million masks from China for France
Description: LVMH , the world's biggest luxury goods group, is ordering 40 million health masks from a Chinese supplier to help France cope with the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: Agitating bondholders press Argentina to step up efforts
Description: Agitating bondholders have written to Argentina's government, accusing it of not doing enough to allow the country's crucial debt restructuring negotiations to make progress, according to bondholder sources involved in the process.

Headlines: Amazon raises overtime pay for warehouse workers
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Saturday it is raising overtime pay for associates working in its U.S. warehouses as the world's largest online retailer tries to meet the rapidly growing demand for online shopping from consumers stuck at home during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Airlines appear to come up short in bid to win cash grants in rescue package
Description: A last-ditch effort by the chief executives of major U.S. airlines to try to win cash grants to weather the coronavirus crisis looked to be unsuccessful, four congressional aides and airline officials said late Saturday.

Headlines: Occidental nears deal with activist Icahn on proxy battle: source
Description: U.S. oil and gas producer Occidental Petroleum Corp is nearing an agreement with activist investor Carl Icahn to halt a proxy battle in return for board seats, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: WeWork board's special committee prepares for fight against SoftBank
Description: The special committee of WeWork's board is preparing for a fight against Japan's SoftBank Group Corp saying that SoftBank should complete its tender offer promised to the office sharing company's employees and shareholders.

Headlines: Embraer puts Brazil-based workers on furlough to protect them from coronavirus
Description: Brazilian planemaker Embraer is putting all its Brazil-based employees who cannot work remotely on paid leave until March 31, the company said on Sunday, adding that only "a few essential operations" will be maintained.

Headlines: Coronavirus supplies donated by Alibaba's Ma arrive in Africa
Description: A first planeload of protective and medical equipment donated to Africa by Chinese billionaire and Alibaba co-founder Jack Ma to help it fight the coronavirus arrived in the Ethiopian capital Addis Ababa on Sunday.

Headlines: Wall Street stares down another bleak week, with coronavirus risks amplified
Description: Wall Street analysts and investment managers expect another rough week for U.S. markets due to coronavirus fears, with a wild open for futures on Sunday evening as lawmakers battled over an economic aid package in Washington.

Headlines: Facebook to cut video streaming quality in virus-hit Europe
Description: Facebook will downgrade video streaming quality on its platform and on Instagram in Europe, the latest U.S. tech giant to respond to an EU call to stave off internet gridlock as thousands work from home due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Ford, GM, Tesla getting 'go ahead' to make ventilators: Trump
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday that U.S. automakers Ford Motor Co, General Motors Co and Tesla Inc had been given the green light to produce ventilators and other items needed during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Explainer: Hobbled IRS tax agency may need months to put cash into Americans' hands
Description: In order to put recession-fighting checks into the hands of millions of Americans, President Donald Trump will rely on a tax agency that has fewer workers, a smaller budget, and the same 1960s-era computer systems it had the last time it was asked to do so.

Headlines: Fed's big move could help U.S. Treasury liquidity, but effects may not last long
Description: The Federal Reserve's unparalleled steps to directly backstop the U.S. economy and its willingness to purchase vast sums of U.S. government debt, mortgage-backed securities and even corporate bonds could help boost depleted liquidity in the $17-trillion Treasury market.

Headlines: Some U.S. wealth advisers tell clients to stay put as markets fall
Description: The deepest U.S. stock market sell-off since the 2008 financial crisis is prompting some financial advisers to tell wealthy clients to hold steady or even increase their equity exposure if they have at least 10 years until retirement.

Headlines: U.S. junk bonds fall despite unprecedented Fed stimulus
Description: Prices of the riskiest U.S. corporate bonds fell on Monday as investors bet that the Federal Reserve's pledge to backstop an unprecedented range of debt would not materially change the outlook for less financially stable companies, particularly those at risk of default.

Headlines: U.S. prosecutors charge PDVSA contractor with money laundering
Description: U.S. prosecutors have charged a Venezuelan oilfield contractor with money laundering for bribing officials at state oil company Petroleos de Venezuela to win overpriced contracts, and then seeking to hide the proceeds in the United States.

Headlines: Wells Fargo to pay special compensation to front-line workers amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Wells Fargo & Co will join other large U.S. banks in paying out special compensation to front-line employees, according to a memo seen on Monday by Reuters.

Headlines: Fed's money market move lifts Northern Trust fund above key threshold
Description: Liquidity at a $2.2 billion prime money-market fund run by Northern Trust Corp fell below the key 30% U.S. regulatory threshold twice last week, but rebounded above that level after the U.S. Federal Reserve shored up the industry.

Headlines: Trump says won't allow long-lasting damage to economy from virus
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he will not allow the coronavirus to do long-lasting damage to the U.S. economy and that he would consider how to move forward after a 15-day shutdown ends next week.

Headlines: Mnuchin: Negotiators 'very close' to deal on coronavirus stimulus
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Monday that Republican and Democratic senators and Trump administration negotiators were nearing a deal on a coronavirus stimulus bill.

Headlines: U.S. SEC warns against illegal trading during coronavirus disruption
Description: The U.S. securities regulator on Monday warned corporate executives against insider trading during disruption caused by the coronavirus, in an unusual statement that underscores the chaos coursing through financial markets.

Headlines: At Alibaba's Lazada, coronavirus measures become the latest culture conflict
Description: At Lazada, the Southeast Asian arm of Alibaba Group Holding , staff are furious over demands they submit health reports daily and other coronavirus-prevention steps seen as too invasive, highlighting a long-running culture clash with management from China.

Headlines: Boeing suspending Washington state production due to coronavirus risks
Description: Boeing Co said on Monday it would halt production at its Washington state twin-aisle jetliner factory as a temporary measure to help fight the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fast food closures sweep U.K., as even drive-thrus deemed unsafe
Description: McDonald's Corp, Yum! Brands Inc's KFC fried chicken chain, Coca-Cola Co unit Costa Coffee and Subway sandwich shops were among restaurants that shuttered all locations in the United Kingdom and Ireland by the end of Monday to help slow the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Netflix to reduce traffic in Israel by 25% to help ISPs
Description: Netflix said on Monday it would reduce network traffic in Israel over the next month following a government request to ease data congestion from people staying home due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: Factbox: Global oil, gas producers cut spending after crude price crash
Description: Oil and gas companies are cutting spending plans in response to the new coronavirus and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output. [O/R]

Headlines: Senate GOP virus bill aids U.S. transport sector; offers airlines loans, not cash
Description: A Senate Republican coronavirus stimulus package would provide financial aid to U.S. airports, transit systems and passenger railroad Amtrak, but $50 billion for struggling U.S. airlines would be a loan, not a cash payout, the proposal showed.

Headlines: H&M scraps dividend due to coronavirus as all costs under review
Description: Sweden's H&M , the world's second largest clothing retailer, said on Monday it had decided to scrap its proposed dividend due to the coronavirus outbreak, and that it was reviewing all parts of its operations, including all costs.

Headlines: Central banks deploy record sums to break financial logjam, but may need more
Description: Central banks have offered trillions of dollars of support to markets in recent days to keep them from freezing up, as investors worried about the economic damage from the coronavirus and made a chaotic dash for the exits.

Headlines: Fed: New Main Street program meant to ensure all firms have access to credit
Description: A Federal Reserve "Main Street" lending program still under development is meant to dovetail with proposals under consideration by Congress to make sure the full range of U.S. companies, from the smallest to the largest, have access to credit during the coronavirus health scare, the Fed said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. businesses see big hit from coronavirus, Fed survey shows
Description: U.S. businesses expect a "very large and very negative impact" from the coronavirus pandemic and efforts to slow its spread, according to a survey published on Monday by the Atlanta Federal Reserve Bank.

Headlines: GE's aviation unit to cut 10% of U.S. workforce: CEO
Description: General Electric Co's aviation unit will cut its U.S. workforce by about 10%, Chief Executive Officer Larry Culp said in a letter to staff on Monday, as a shattered airline industry sought state support to survive the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. banks hand out bonuses to staff as coronavirus crisis intensifies
Description: Some U.S. banks on Monday offered employees one-time bonuses to help ease the financial burden of the coronavirus pandemic and as a reward for working through the crisis.

Headlines: Western supply chains buckle as coronavirus lockdowns spread
Description: Freight carriers are struggling to deliver goods by land, sea or air as the coronavirus pandemic forces Western governments to impose lockdowns, threatening supplies of vital products including medicines into the most affected areas, such as Italy.

Headlines: Instant View: Fed launches unprecedented range of credit support
Description: The S&P 500 opened lower, reversing a brief bounce in U.S. stock futures after the U.S. Federal Reserve on Monday said it would backstop an unprecedented range of credit for households, small businesses and major employers to offset the "tremendous hardship," caused by coronavirus.

Headlines: Ford joins GE, 3M in speeding up ventilator, respirator production
Description: Carmaker Ford Motor Co on Tuesday jumped into the emergency push by major U.S. manufacturers to produce thousands of ventilators and respirators needed to help combat the spread of the coronavirus under a partnership code-named "Project Apollo."

Headlines: As customers hoard pot brownies, North American weed firms see lockdown boost
Description: Cannabis sales are touching new highs as customers across the United States and Canada stockpile weed to prepare for long spells of isolation because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Coronavirus to bring deep U.S. capital return letdowns
Description: U.S. investors will likely see sharp declines in capital returns this year as companies look to conserve cash during the coronavirus crisis, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices which is predicting a significant first-quarter decline in buybacks and a dismal second quarter.

Headlines: Renault workers use 3D printers to make medical visors
Description: Renault workers in Spain have begun using 3D printers to manufacture visors for health workers from home, the French carmaker said on Tuesday, in a scheme that could be expanded to make other medical equipment elsewhere.

Headlines: Britain to stricken airlines: try raising your own money first
Description: Britain has told airlines it will only consider stepping in to help them survive the coronavirus crisis once they have explored the possibility of raising capital from other sources including existing investors.

Headlines: Oil little changed as falling demand offsets hopes of U.S. aid package
Description: Oil prices rose modestly on Tuesday, but settled off the day's highs as the coronavirus pandemic's heavy toll on demand offset hopes for a forthcoming $2 trillion U.S. economic relief package.

Headlines: Shutdowns stoke debate over what's an 'essential industry'
Description: Shortly after British Prime Minister Boris Johnson ordered the closure of non-essential retailers on Monday to curb the spread of coronavirus, the parent company of Sports Direct wrote to its staff to let them know: the next day would be business as usual.

Headlines: Netflix, Facebook to cut data traffic in India to ease network congestion
Description: Streaming service Netflix Inc and social media giant Facebook Inc said on Tuesday they would reduce the amount of data their services use to ease congested telecoms networks in India, where millions are using home internet amid a lockdown to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Banks, regulators move to protect customers from wave of coronavirus scams in UK, U.S.
Description: UK banks are stepping up fraud prevention measures to protect customers from scammers eager to exploit the coronavirus pandemic with a whole range of new tricks, including fake sales of medical supplies and bogus government relief schemes.

Headlines: Boeing CFO says aerospace industry needs credit urgently, markets closed to new debt
Description: Boeing Co's chief financial officer said on Tuesday the U.S. aerospace industry urgently needs credit to cope with the coronavirus pandemic but "markets essentially are closed" to new debt.

Headlines: USDA, USTR cite progress on farm provisions of U.S.-China trade deal
Description: The United States and China have made progress in implementing the agriculture-related provisions of a Phase 1 trade deal that took effect on Feb. 14, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) and U.S. Trade Representative said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Explainer: Trump has little power to restart U.S. economy
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday said he wants the U.S. economy to reopen by Easter Sunday, April 12, despite the rapid spread of the novel coronavirus in some U.S. states and a rising death toll from the disease.

Headlines: Nike revenue beats as digital growth offsets rare China sales fall on virus hit
Description: Nike Inc beat estimates for quarterly revenue on Tuesday as strong digital demand offset the first China sales drop in nearly six years from the coronavirus-fueled shutdowns, but the company held back from providing a forecast due to the outbreak.

Headlines: Dow soars over 11% in strongest one-day performance since 1933
Description: The Dow soared on Tuesday to its biggest one-day percentage gain since 1933, after U.S. lawmakers said they were close to a deal for an economic rescue package in response to the coronavirus outbreak, injecting optimism following the biggest selloff since the financial crisis.

Headlines: Stocks, gold surge as Congress nears $2 trillion aid package
Description: Stock markets soared on Tuesday, with a gauge of global equities posting its biggest gain since the coronavirus roiled financial markets a month ago, as the U.S. Congress zoned in on a $2 trillion stimulus package to curb the pandemic's economic toll.

Headlines: Dollar pares losses as investors wait on stimulus bill
Description: The dollar gave up most of its early losses on Tuesday as investors waited on a Senate stimulus bill meant to blunt the economic impact of the spreading coronavirus, and after U.S. President Donald Trump pressed his case for a re-opening of the U.S. economy by mid-April.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers nearing deal for massive aviation sector bailout: sources
Description: U.S. lawmakers are nearing agreement on a $61 billion rescue package for the aviation sector that would include $25 billion in payroll grants for passenger airlines weathering a sharp falloff in travel demand amid rising coronavirus outbreaks, three people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Trump says he will not let Boeing go out of business: Fox News interview
Description: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he would not let airplane maker Boeing Co go out of business as a result of the economic disruption caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. drilling lease sales draw few bids during oil market meltdown
Description: Oil and gas lease sales offered by the Trump administration in three Western states on Tuesday drew few bids as a crash in energy prices tamped down interest among drillers.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit says CFO to step down
Description: Walmart de Mexico said on Tuesday that its chief financial officer Olga Gonzalez has resigned for personal reasons and will leave her post by April 30.

Headlines: Philips warns protectionism could derail critical medical supplies
Description: Broad powers over U.S. factories brought in by President Donald Trump could fuel protectionism and jeopardize the supply of critical medical equipment to fight the coronavirus pandemic, Dutch health technology company Philips warned on Tuesday.

Headlines: Auto industry urges U.S. lawmakers to ensure 'sufficient liquidity'
Description: Major automakers, parts suppliers and auto dealers urged U.S. lawmakers on Monday to provide "robust credit facilities" to ensure "sufficient liquidity" in the auto industry despite the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: How the U.S. could intervene to weaken its surging dollar
Description: A blistering dollar rally has revived speculation that the U.S. may rein in its currency if the buck goes much higher.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to make face masks for North America
Description: Italian-U.S. car giant Fiat Chrysler has confirmed plans to produce a million face masks a month and said it will distribute them to emergency services in North America to help the fight against coronavirus.

Headlines: Refiner Phillips 66 cuts spending forecast by 18%, commits to dividend
Description: Refiner Phillips 66 on Tuesday cut its 2020 spending forecast by about 18% and assured investors their dividend was secure even as the coronavirus outbreak and a price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia threaten the oil market with massive oversupply.

Headlines: U.S. industries scramble for exemptions as state shutdown orders grow
Description: As several more U.S. states moved to impose stay-at-home orders to limit the spread of the coronavirus, industries from steelmakers to auto dealerships were scrambling for exemptions that would allow them to remain open.

Headlines: House Democrats would give airlines, contractors $40 billion bailout
Description: Democratic U.S. lawmakers on Monday proposed giving struggling U.S. airlines and contractors $40 billion in cash grants that would not have to be paid back but require significant new environmental, labor and other conditions.

Headlines: Tesla CEO says bought ventilators in China for U.S
Description: Tesla bought hospital ventilators in China and shipped them to the United States, CEO Elon Musk said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Reopening economy too early could backfire for humans and markets, investors say
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's desire to rapidly reopen the economy despite signs the coronavirus is still spreading may backfire, with higher deaths and citizens remaining fearful of going out, some investors said.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales fall in February, January revised up sharply
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes fell in February after surging in the prior month, and could decline further because of the coronavirus pandemic which is boosting unemployment and severely disrupting economic activity.

Headlines: Investors eye cracks in $4.4 trillion U.S. ETF market as sell-off rages
Description: Wild swings in asset prices have thrown a spotlight on liquidity in corners of the $4.4 trillion market for U.S. exchange-traded funds, which have played a key role for investors in Wall Street's coronavirus-fueled sell-off.

Headlines: Coca-Cola to suspend production in India amid coronavirus lockdowns
Description: Coca-Cola's India unit said on Tuesday it has temporarily suspended production at its manufacturing facilities across the country following widespread lockdowns to halt the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Aston Martin to temporarily shut UK manufacturing facilities
Description: British luxury carmaker Aston Martin said on Tuesday it would suspend production at its UK manufacturing facilities starting Wednesday until April 20 to cope with the coronavirus pandemic, which has hurt demand for its cars.

Headlines: Amazon to stop non-essential sales in India
Description: Amazon.com Inc's India unit on Tuesday said it will halt orders for non-essential products in India to prioritize customers' critical needs at a time when much of the country is under lockdown to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: France's Accor, Airbnb help provide rooms for medics during crisis
Description: French hotel group Accor and home rental company Airbnb are launching online services to help medical staff fighting the coronavirus epidemic in France find emergency housing.

Headlines: Citigroup will temporarily close up to 15% of U.S. branches
Description: Citigroup Inc said on Tuesday it will temporarily shutter up to 15% of its U.S. branches amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: India likely to unveil $20 billion-plus stimulus package to tackle coronavirus downturn - sources
Description: India is likely to agree an economic stimulus package of more than 1.5 trillion rupees ($19.6 billion) to fight a downturn in the country that is currently locked down to stem the spread of coronavirus, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: Global oil, gas producers cut spending after crude price crash
Description: Oil and gas companies are cutting spending plans in response to the new coronavirus and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output.

Headlines: Oil prices settle higher on stimulus package, fuel demand sinks
Description: U.S. crude prices settled higher on Wednesday, bolstered by progress on a massive pending U.S. economic stimulus package, even as government data showed the coronavirus pandemic started undercutting U.S. fuel demand last week.

Headlines: Stocks rebound further as markets await $2 trillion U.S. stimulus boost
Description: The dollar slid and global equity markets marched higher on Wednesday for a second day of gains, on optimism $2 trillion in U.S. fiscal stimulus will dampen the economic shock the coronavirus pandemic has started to inflict.U.S. senators will vote Wednesday. Top aides to Republican President Donald Trump and senior Republican and Democrat senators agreed on the unprecedented bill after five days of marathon talks.

Headlines: Do more to stop coronavirus price gouging, U.S. states tell Amazon, Walmart, Facebook
Description: A group of 32 U.S. states have a message for the nation's leading online platforms: You are not doing enough to stop price gouging amid the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Computer chip makers seek U.S. permission to work during pandemic
Description: A group representing major U.S. semiconductor companies on Wednesday said it was working with federal officials to make clear to state and local officials overseeing lockdowns that chip companies are essential businesses that should continue operations.

Headlines: Canadian oil companies ask government for cash, credit to survive
Description: Canadian oil and gas companies are urging Ottawa to free up credit and cash to help them survive the twin shocks of COVID-19 spread and a crude price war, pitching ideas ranging from tax deferrals to backstopping bank loans.

Headlines: India's huge outsourcing industry struggles with work-from-home scenario
Description: As the coronavirus pandemic pushes India into a lockdown, the call centres and IT services firms that function as the world's back office are struggling to piece together work-from-home solutions and other business-continuity plans.

Headlines: U.S. auto sales in states with coronavirus lockdown orders to drop 80%: analysts
Description: Vehicle sales in U.S. states that implemented lockdown orders to curb the spread of the coronavirus will drop 80% or more, analysts said on Wednesday.

Headlines: McDonald's to trim U.S. menu during coronavirus pandemic
Description: McDonald's Corp said on Wednesday it would temporarily remove some items from its U.S. menu as it focuses on simplifying operations in the face of the fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Airbnb holds meeting with bankers to extend $1 billion debt facility: source
Description: Airbnb Inc on Wednesday held a phone meeting with bankers to discuss extending an existing $1 billion debt facility as the home rental start-up grapples with a slowdown due to the coronavirus, a source who participated in the meeting said.

Headlines: Oil majors slash 2020 spending 18% after prices slump
Description: The world's biggest oil and gas companies are slashing spending this year following a collapse in oil prices driven by a slump in demand because of coronavirus and a price war between the top exporters Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Coronavirus-stricken U.S. companies pop poison pills
Description: More U.S. companies are rushing to adopt so-called poison pills, dusting off a nearly 40-year-old takeover defense tool to ward off hostile bidders and activist shareholders eager to exploit the coronavirus-induced market sell-off.

Headlines: Eni cuts 2020, 2021 capex to mitigate Coronavirus hit
Description: Italian oil and gas group Eni said on Wednesday it would reduce its capital expenditure this year by around 2 billion euros ($2.17 billion) to mitigate the impact from falling commodity prices following the coronavirus emergency.

Headlines: UK PM Johnson says talks continue over support for airlines
Description: Britain is continuing talks with the aviation industry about how best to support the sector, Prime Minister Boris Johnson and a pilots' union said on Wednesday, reviving the prospect of a sector-specific support package that had seemed to be on hold.

Headlines: Peugeot restarts car production in virus-hit Wuhan with Dongfeng
Description: French automaker Peugeot SA's joint venture in China with Dongfeng Motor Group said on Wednesday it had restarted car production at its plant in Wuhan city, the epicenter of China's coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: China suspends Bristol-Myers' cancer drug sales over findings at U.S. plant
Description: Sales of Bristol-Myers Squibb Co's cancer drug Abraxane have been suspended in China based on findings at a third-party manufacturing plant in the United States.

Headlines: Global oil demand forecast to fall by 4.9 mln bpd in 2020: Rystad
Description: Global oil demand could fall by as much as 4.9 million barrels per day (bpd), or by about 4.9%, in 2020 due to the coronavirus outbreak, Norway's biggest independent energy consultancy Rystad Energy said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Occidental slashes budget, salaries in bid to cope with falling oil prices
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp on Wednesday unveiled a new round of deep spending cuts, slashing budget for a second time this month and sharply reducing salaries, as the debt-laden U.S. oil producer tries to save cash amid tumbling energy prices.

Headlines: Bullard: 46 million workers could be jobless in short-term
Description: As many as 46 million people in the U.S. may be left jobless in the short term as companies shut down services that have "high contact" with the public during the battle against the coronavirus epidemic, St. Louis Federal Reserve president James Bullard said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Nike shares rise as Wall Street lauds recovery in China sales
Description: Nike Inc shares rose 8% on Wednesday after the sportswear maker's impressive recovery in China sales offered hope that it was prepared to cope with the financial fallout of the coronavirus pandemic in other markets.

Headlines: Johnson says UK doing everything it can to help aviation industry
Description: The British government has not washed its hands of any sector and is doing everything it can to help the aviation industry through the coronavirus crisis, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. stocks seesaw as vote awaited on stimulus deal
Description: U.S stocks seesawed on Wednesday, digesting the previous session's huge rebound, with investors torn as optimism about an imminent $2 trillion coronavirus package was offset by concerned about the lasting economic impact from the pandemic. [.N]

Headlines: Explainer: Hobbled IRS tax agency may need months to get cash to Americans
Description: In order to put recession-fighting checks into the hands of millions of Americans, the U.S. government will rely on a tax agency that has fewer workers, a smaller budget and the same 1960s-era computer systems it had the last time it was asked to do so.

Headlines: Oil majors slash 2020 spending 20% after prices slump
Description: The world's biggest oil and gas companies are slashing spending this year following a collapse in oil prices driven by a slump in demand because of coronavirus and a price war between the top exporters Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Federal Reserve gives small banks more time to file March financial statements
Description: The Federal Reserve announced Thursday it was giving small U.S. banks another month to file financial statements due at the end of March.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims soar to record 3.28 million
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits surged to a record of more than 3 million last week as strict measures to contain the coronavirus pandemic brought the country to a sudden halt, unleashing a wave of layoffs that likely ended the longest employment boom in U.S. history.

Headlines: Oil sheds more than $1 as weakening demand outweighs stimulus hopes
Description: Oil prices dropped more than $1 a barrel on Thursday as a growing number of virus-related restrictions on travel slashed global fuel demand, overshadowing expectations that a $2 trillion U.S. stimulus package will bolster economic activity.

Headlines: U.S. Senate approves big rescue for struggling aviation sector
Description: The U.S. Senate voted late Wednesday 96-0 to give the U.S. aviation industry $58 billion in a coronavirus-rescue package, half in the form of grants to cover some 750,000 employees' paychecks, in a badly needed lifeline for an industry facing the worst travel downturn in history.

Headlines: China, U.S. to set aside differences in G20 coronavirus summit: SCMP
Description: China and the United States are expected to call a timeout on their coronavirus blame game and focus on the challenges of the pandemic when leaders of the G20 nations hold talks via video conference on Thursday, the South China Morning Post said.

Headlines: Norway's wealth fund lost $124 billion this year as stocks crash
Description: Norway's $930 billion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, has lost 1.33 trillion Norwegian crowns ($124 billion) so far this year as stock markets plunged amid the coronavirus outbreak, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Norway wealth fund will bump stock portfolio back up to 70%, outgoing CEO says
Description: Norway's sovereign wealth fund will raise its stock market investments back to 70% of its portfolio from the current 65.3%, outgoing Chief Executive Yngve Slyngstad told a news conference on Thursday.

Headlines: Credit Suisse turns slightly bullish on stocks, wants to be early mover
Description: Credit Suisse on Thursday moved to a "small overweight" on global equities, especially developed markets, saying the risk of a "very bad" economic outcome had come down significantly after the massive $2 trillion U.S. stimulus package.

Headlines: Norway names Nicolai Tangen as new head of sovereign wealth fund
Description: The new chief executive for Norway's $930 billion sovereign wealth fund is Nicolai Tangen, until now chief executive of investment firm AKO Capital, which he established in 2005.

Headlines: Factbox: Ford and General Motors' electric vehicle plans
Description: Ford Motor Co and General Motors Co , the top two U.S. automakers, have more than two dozen new battery electric vehicles (EVs) in the pipeline, according to their executives and suppliers familiar with the companies' plans.

Headlines: Explainer: How U.S. emissions rules encourage larger SUVs and trucks
Description: Drivers around the world want more roomy and powerful cars. Rules made under the administration of President Barack Obama make it easier for U.S. automakers to give customers what they want and to keep expanding the size of their vehicles.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. jobless claims balloon to record on coronavirus impact
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits shot to record of more than 3 million last week as strict measures to contain the coronavirus pandemic ground the country to a sudden halt, unleashing a wave of layoffs that likely brought an end to the longest employment boom in U.S. history.[]

Headlines: CVS says membership, payment collection hit by coronavirus
Description: U.S. drugstore operator CVS Health Corp said on Thursday its medical membership and payment collection have been hit due to the coronavirus pandemic, although it cannot reasonably estimate the impact on its businesses, cash flows or operating results.

Headlines: Mitsubishi Corp could take Renault stake in alliance rejig: sources
Description: Japan's Mitsubishi Corp could potentially invest in Renault as part of scenarios being discussed to reinforce an alliance between the French carmaker, Nissan and Mitsubishi Motors, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Ten signs the oil industry is bent out of shape
Description: The oil industry has been hit by a simultaneous demand and supply shock in March as the coronavirus pandemic cuts fuel consumption and top producer Saudi Arabia raises output to full capacity to fight a price war with rivals.

Headlines: Petrobras' divestment push in Brazil challenged by oil price war
Description: A move by Brazil's Petrobras on Thursday to slash output, capital spending and dividends brings the state-run oil firm into alignment with global rivals confronted with a global pandemic and a plunge in crude prices.

Headlines: U.S. banks borrow at discount window after Fed offers stigma relief
Description: With encouragement from the Federal Reserve, U.S. banks have turned to a long-shunned lending facility known as the discount window to borrow $50.8 billion, according to data the central bank released on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. carmakers move to shore up cash, Ford to restart some plants
Description: The two largest U.S. automakers on Thursday announced measures to shore up their finances as the coronavirus pandemic takes a deep economic bite, with Ford Motor Co aiming to resume production next month of its most profitable vehicles while cutting costs further.

Headlines: Dow wraps up strongest three days since 1931
Description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average wrapped up its strongest three days in nine decades on Thursday as record weekly U.S. jobless claims came in below investors' worst fears and the focus stayed on an unprecedented $2 trillion stimulus awaiting approval by the U.S. House of Representatives.

Headlines: Africa's web of creditors complicates coronavirus debt relief
Description: Africa is crying out for debt relief to weather a perfect storm of coronavirus, plummeting oil and commodity prices, mounting budget deficits and weaker currencies.

Headlines: Forex volatility to make providers hike prices: Walmart de Mexico
Description: Walmart de Mexico said on Friday that foreign exchange fluctuations will make its providers increase some of their prices, pointing to the depreciation of the peso and other currencies during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Apple works with White House to release 'COVID-19' app, website
Description: Apple Inc and the White House said on Friday that the iPhone maker worked with the Trump administration and federal agencies to release an app and website that will direct users to guidance from the Centers for Disease Control on the disease caused by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Virgin Atlantic set to ask for state aid: FT
Description: UK-based airline Virgin Atlantic will ask the British government for a package of commercial loans and guarantees worth hundreds of millions of pounds, the Financial Times reported https://www.ft.com/content/c2d817d9-8a73-4bb8-89e7-e5ca67ed41d7 on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Fed working to bolster credit during 'self-mandated' recession: Kaplan
Description: A raft of programs from the U.S. central bank and a $2 trillion rescue bill nearing approval in Congress are aimed at providing relief during a "self-mandated" recession "so that when the virus is defeated we can walk, we can run, and then we can sprint out of this," Dallas Federal Reserve bank President Robert Kaplan said on Friday.

Headlines: Newly jobless Americans worry about making ends meet
Description: Optician Ali Nelson sent the final few orders of eyeglasses to clients last week before her Washington D.C.-based store closed to help prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Google-parent Alphabet to donate $800 million in response to coronavirus crisis
Description: Alphabet Inc will donate more than $800 million in funds towards producing medical supplies used to fight COVID-19, and in ad credits to government and health organizations and businesses, Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. airlines expect clarity on terms of payroll grants in 5-10 days: UAL senior executives
Description: U.S. airlines expect to learn the terms of federal aid meant to protect workers' payrolls in the midst of a sharp downturn from the coronavirus in the next five to 10 days, senior executives at United Airlines Holdings Inc said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer sentiment near three-and-a-half year low, spending sluggish
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment dropped to near a 3-1/2-year low in March as the coronavirus epidemic upended life for Americans, and consumer spending was sluggish in February, strengthening economists' expectations of a deep recession.

Headlines: Lufthansa applies for short-time work for 31,000 employees
Description: Lufthansa has applied for short-time work for around 31,000 crew and ground staff at its core brand until the end of August, a spokesman said on Friday, as Germany's flagship carrier has slashed flights due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles as U.S. virus cases pass 100,000
Description: Wall Street stocks tumbled on Friday, ending a massive three-day surge after doubts about the fate of the U.S. economy resurfaced and the number of coronavirus cases in the country climbed.

Headlines: More than 100 British companies halt dividend payments due to coronavirus pandemic
Description: More than 100 British companies have postponed or ditched dividend payments in a bid to preserve cash for what could be a lengthy enforced shutdown of large parts of the UK and global economy due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Delta CEO says gov't aid ensures no industry lay-offs through September 30
Description: Delta Air Lines Chief Executive Ed Bastian said payroll assistance funds from the government under a massive stimulus package approved on Friday ensure there will not be any involuntary furloughs or pay cuts in the U.S. airline industry through Sept. 30.

Headlines: A U.S. recession? Probably. Depression? Only if the virus is untamed
Description: WASHINGTON - A U.S. recession may already be underway. Could it be worse?

Headlines: Global oil refiners shut down as coronavirus destroys demand
Description: The first oil refinery shutdowns in India and Europe were announced on Friday while global refinery runs drop like a stone in response to plunging demand as countries worldwide implement lockdowns.

Headlines: Indian lockdown disrupts Amazon, Flipkart deliveries: sources
Description: India's coronavirus lockdown is disrupting e-commerce companies including Amazon and Flipkart, despite government assurances it would not, four sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Tesla to slash on-site staff at Nevada factory by 75% due to virus: county manager
Description: U.S. electric carmaker Tesla Inc plans to slash on-site staff at its Nevada battery plant by around 75% due to the coronavirus pandemic, the local county manager said on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: Global oil, gas producers cut spending after crude price crash
Description: Oil and gas companies are cutting spending plans in response to the coronavirus pandemic and a push by Saudi Arabia and Russia to ramp up output.

Headlines: Olympics delay deals setback to Samsung's plans to win over Japan market
Description: For Samsung Electronics Co Ltd , the 2020 Tokyo Olympics were going to be its springboard to attain a long-held goal - making significant inroads into Japan's lucrative smartphone market where Apple Inc dominates.

Headlines: China's auto industry wastes no time coaxing drivers back to showrooms after lockdown
Description: China's auto industry has gone from zero to sixty in its post-pandemic campaign drive, with manufacturers and dealers quick to woo back lockdown-weary consumers through campaigns as unusual as a makeup-promoting personality touting car leasing.

Headlines: Brazil headed for 'whatever it takes' QE as coronavirus crash looms
Description: Brazil's central bank could soon be forced to fire up the money printing presses if the coronavirus-fueled recession facing Latin America's largest economy is as devastating as some economists fear.

Headlines: Goldman, Morgan Stanley receive approvals for majority stakes in China ventures
Description: Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley said on Friday they had received the final regulatory approvals to take majority stakes in their China securities joint ventures, as Beijing continues to open its financial sector to foreigners.

Headlines: Exclusive: India's Reliance seeks to sell Mideast crude cargoes in rare move
Description: India's Reliance Industries Ltd is seeking to sell some April-loading crude cargoes in a rare move as it plans to cut crude processing after the coronavirus pandemic hit global fuel demand, four sources said on Friday.

Headlines: 'Maximum bearish': funds in record rush to cash in past week
Description: Investors rushed into cash and out of bonds at a record pace over the past week as the coronavirus pandemic caused mayhem in markets, BofA said on Friday, though it noted a key positioning signal at "maximum bearish" could signal a big rally ahead.

Headlines: Alitalia seeks to place 2,900 more staff in layoff scheme: document
Description: Alitalia's administrator has asked Italy's government to raise to nearly 7,000 the number of its employees under a temporary lay-off scheme, with most of its aircraft standing idle during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: 'This is a war and we want to survive,' says Polish retailer
Description: Polish fashion retailers may not survive the coronavirus crisis if the government, banks and shopping mall owners do not help them bear the costs, a lobby group said on Friday, as Poland closed non-essential shops to stop the spread of the virus.

Headlines: U.S. airlines to dash for cash grants, not loans, even with potential government stake
Description: U.S. airlines are preparing to tap the government for up to $25 billion in grants to cover payroll in a sharp travel downturn triggered by the coronavirus, even after the government warned it may take stakes in exchange for bailout funds, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Travelex shuts UK forex bureaus on virus fears, starts funding talks
Description: Foreign exchange company Travelex said on Friday it was shutting its UK bureaus for about eight weeks or more due to the coronavirus pandemic and that it was in talks with its stakeholders for continued access to funds.

Headlines: Treasury: U.S. will be 'compensated' for assistance to airlines
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said on Friday that taxpayers will "compensated" for providing up to $25 billion in direct grants to the airline industry.

Headlines: Trump tells GM: Stop 'wasting time', build ventilators to address coronavirus
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday invoked emergency powers to require General Motors Co to build much-needed ventilators for coronavirus patients after he accused the largest U.S. automaker of "wasting time" during negotiations.

Headlines: Bipartisan majority of Americans reject Trump idea to reopen by Easter: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Description: A bipartisan majority of Americans appear to reject an idea floated by President Donald Trump to reopen businesses by Easter, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll, which also showed that nearly one in four have been laid off or furloughed during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. regulators give banks relief on accounting standard, derivatives rule
Description: U.S. banking regulators told banks Friday they could ignore the capital implications of a new accounting standard for two years and adopt early a new, more sensitive way to measure risk in a bid to ensure banks continue lending through the pandemic.

Headlines: Apple's factories are running, but suppliers wary about iPhone demand
Description: As China reopens its economy after months of lockdown, Apple Inc's iPhone factories are largely up and running. But with the coronavirus pandemic spreading across the world, the urgent question for the company is how many buyers there will be both for current models and the new slate of phones expected in the fall.

Headlines: Pence says virus taskforce soon to deliver recommendation on whether to re-open economy
Description: Vice President Mike Pence, heading the Trump administration's response to the coronavirus outbreak, said on Saturday that he would deliver a recommendation to the president on whether to re-open the U.S. economy in the coming week.

Headlines: Clothing rental service Rent the Runway lays off workers amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: U.S. clothing rental firm Rent the Runway said on Saturday it had laid off retail employees following temporary store closures amid the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Major airlines urge U.S. Treasury to disburse assistance quickly
Description: Major U.S. airlines asked the U.S. Treasury to move quickly to release up to $58 billion in government grants and loans and recommended a formula to divide up the money.

Headlines: Coronavirus worries and strife: Investors fear markets not out of woods despite big rally
Description: After a brutal meltdown, some investors have been wading back into U.S. stocks. But others are wary of another leg down as the coronavirus spreads and its economic impact is difficult to predict.

Headlines: From quills to qwerty: Lloyd's underwriters adapt to home working
Description: Thousands of London's underwriters took their stamps and fountain pens home last week, which they use to sign insurance contracts, but they won't need them.

Headlines: U.S. senators scrutinize meat packers' big profits during pandemic
Description: U.S. senators are calling for investigations of record profit margins for beef processors like Tyson Foods and Cargill, after ranchers complained surging meat prices due to coronavirus hoarding did not translate into higher cattle prices.

Headlines: Workers go on strike at Amazon delivery site in Italy amid coronavirus
