Description: Around one-third of those working at an Amazon delivery station in central Italy went on strike on Monday, a union representative said, citing a request for enhanced safety measures for workers amid the coronavirus health emergency.

Headlines: Credit Suisse weighs curbing bonuses at time of coronavirus: CEO
Description: Credit Suisse bank could restrain 2020 bonuses in a show of unity with victims of the coronavirus epidemic in Switzerland, Chief Executive Thomas Gottstein said on Monday.

Headlines: Macy's, Kohl's, Gap turn to mass furloughs as virus crisis deepens
Description: Major U.S. retailers Macy's Inc , Kohl's Corp and Gap Inc said on Monday they would furlough tens of thousands of employees, as they prepare to keep stores shut for longer to curb the spread of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: J&J, Moderna sign deals with U.S. to produce huge quantity of possible coronavirus vaccines
Description: The U.S. government has cut deals with Johnson & Johnson and Moderna Inc and said it is in talks with at least two other companies to prepare them to produce massive quantities of coronavirus vaccines even before safe and effective ones become available.

Headlines: U.S. grocers add plexiglass sneeze guards to protect cashiers from coronavirus
Description: Kroger Co, Walmart Inc, Albertsons and other grocery sellers are installing plexiglass partitions at checkout counters to protect cashiers from the highly contagious coronavirus.

Headlines: Activist investor Starboard says it has 9.3% stake in software firm Commvault
Description: Activist investor Starboard Value LP has built a stake in U.S. data protection and data management software company Commvault, saying in a regulatory filing that it felt the shares were undervalued when it purchased them.

Headlines: KFC owner Yum Brands breaks junk debt market's four-week fast
Description: Yum Brands Inc , owner of Pizza Hut, KFC and Taco Bell restaurant chains, sold $600 million in bonds on Monday, reopening the U.S. market for junk-rated debt issues after its longest lull since the 2008 financial crisis.

Headlines: Samsung says chip factory worker tests positive for virus, output not affected
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Tuesday that one of its chip factory workers in South Korea had tested positive for coronavirus, but its output has not been affected.

Headlines: Airbnb to pay out $250 million to hosts to help ease coronavirus cancellation pain
Description: U.S. home rental firm Airbnb said on Monday it was allocating $250 million to help offset losses by hosts around the world whose guests have canceled bookings in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Spirit cancels New York, Connecticut, New Jersey flights after CDC warning
Description: Low-cost U.S. carrier Spirit Airlines Inc said on Monday it will cancel all flights to and from New York, Connecticut and New Jersey after U.S. officials warned against travel to the area because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies, led by healthcare jump
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Monday, led in part by healthcare stocks as investors looked for shares that have become cheap and can withstand the impact to the economy from efforts to stem the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: China unexpectedly cuts reverse repo rate by most in five years to support virus-hit economy
Description: China's central bank unexpectedly cut the rate on reverse repurchase agreements by 20 basis points on Monday, the largest in nearly five years, as authorities ramped up steps to relieve pressure on an economy ravaged by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump's attack on GM over ventilators quickly turns to praise
Description: President Donald Trump, who excoriated General Motors Co on Friday and invoked emergency powers to compel the production of badly needed ventilators to tackle the coronavirus pandemic, has abruptly shifted gears to praise the automaker.

Headlines: U.S. stimulus package is biggest ever, but may not be big enough
Description: The Federal Reserve has offered more than $3 trillion in loans and asset purchases in recent weeks to stop the U.S. financial system from seizing up, but it has not yet directly helped large swaths of the real economy: companies, municipalities and other borrowers with less than perfect credit.

Headlines: China's big banks flag asset pressure due to virus, boding ill for smaller kin
Description: China's largest state banks said the impact of restrictions on movement imposed to slow the spread of the coronavirus could pull down asset quality as borrowers struggle to repay loans, though they are likely big enough to weather any fallout.

Headlines: France's Renault puts Paris white collar staff on partial unemployment
Description: French carmaker Renault put most of its white collar staff in the Ile-de-France region around Paris on partial unemployment on Monday as the lockdown imposed due to the coronavirus outbreak lowered activity.

Headlines: Finnish government pushes Fortum to strive for carbon neutrality
Description: Finland's center-left government on Monday gave its blessing to majority state-owned Fortum's strategy to cut emissions, but promised to push the company further towards carbon neutrality, the minister in charge wrote.

Headlines: flydubai to reduce staff pay for three months due to coronavirus
Description: United Arab Emirates carrier flydubai will reduce pay for its employees for three months from April due to the impact of the global coronavirus crisis on its business, a spokeswoman said on Monday.

Headlines: Bostic: Fed programs could be broadened if they have missed important parts of economy
Description: As U.S. officials role out trillions of dollars in new economic support, a Federal Reserve policymaker on Monday said focus will now shift to whether those programs prove adequate or need to be expanded even further.

Headlines: Lockdown set to stymie Fiat attempt to restart some Italian production
Description: A probable extension of Italy's lockdown could frustrate an attempt by Fiat Chrysler to resume some vehicle production at three Italian plants next week, a union representative said on Monday.

Headlines: Adidas stops 1 billion euros share buyback
Description: Germany's Adidas on Tuesday said it will suspend a 1 billion euros share buyback it had planned for this year as a way to conserve cash after closing its retail outlets in Europe and North America.

Headlines: What the Federal Reserve has done in the coronavirus crisis
Description: The Federal Reserve has moved into overdrive to try to keep the U.S. economy from suffering lasting damage from the coronavirus pandemic, announcing an emergency interest rate cut on March 3 and rolling out new efforts almost weekly since, including slashing rates to zero and relaunching large-scale asset purchases.

Headlines: Walt Disney to launch streaming service in India on Friday
Description: Walt Disney Co will launch its Disney+ service in India on April 3, the company said on Tuesday, intensifying rivalry with Netflix Inc and Amazon.com Inc's Prime Video in a country where demand for online streaming is surging.

Headlines: Coronavirus drives U.S. March auto sales off a cliff
Description: U.S. new vehicle sales likely drove off a cliff in March as the coronavirus pandemic pounded consumer confidence and shuttered dealerships across much of the country, and sales are likely to take a further beating in April as social distancing guidelines remain in place.

Headlines: U.S. unemployment offices sitting on mountain of pending claims
Description: Last week's record-setting U.S. jobless claims number will be quickly surpassed, economists and state officials predict, as local labor offices digest a pile of pending applications, and the new stimulus bill extends benefits to the self-employed.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs slashes U.S. GDP estimate further
Description: Goldman Sachs said on Tuesday the second-quarter U.S. economic decline would be much greater than it had previously forecast and unemployment would be higher, citing anecdotal evidence and "sky-high jobless claims numbers" resulting from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: INEOS to build third European hand sanitiser plant in ten days
Description: Chemicals manufacturer INEOS [INEOSG.UL] said on Tuesday it will build a hand sanitiser plant in France in 10 days to help meet a European shortage and has begun production at its new British and German plants ahead of schedule.

Headlines: Microsoft clarifies Teams usage surged 775% in Italy
Description: Microsoft Corp said it has seen a 775% jump in a month for Teams calling and meeting in Italy, withdrawing an earlier statement that the surge was for its cloud services in regions around the world that enforced social distancing to curb transmission of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Russia's Sistema-backed online retailer Ozon raises $50 million from U.S. fund
Description: Russian online retailer Ozon, part-owned by the Sistema conglomerate, said on Tuesday it had raised $50 million from U.S. investment fund Princeville Capital through a convertible loan that can be turned into equity.

Headlines: China sales seen picking up after coronavirus blow: Volkswagen
Description: Volkswagen expects vehicle sales in China, the world's largest car market, to quadruple in March, it said, pointing to a recovery following the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: China factory activity unexpectedly expands, but economy cannot shake off virus shock
Description: Factory activity in China unexpectedly expanded in March from a collapse the month before, but analysts caution that a durable near-term recovery is far from assured as the global coronavirus crisis knocks foreign demand and threatens a steep economic slump.

Headlines: Google Japan defends impartiality of search results amid lockdown rumors
Description: Google on Tuesday defended the impartiality of its search results after users in Japan seeking to corroborate rumors of an imminent state of emergency declaration by the government were met with no results on its website.

Headlines: Xerox abandons $35 billion hostile bid for HP
Description: U.S. printer maker Xerox Holdings Corp walked away from its $35 billion hostile cash-and-stock bid for HP Inc on Tuesday, after the coronavirus outbreak weighed on its campaign to take over the PC and printing equipment manufacturer.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler does not see delay in PSA merger, FIOM union says
Description: Fiat Chrysler did not mention any possible delay in the merger process with France's PSA during a call with unions on Tuesday, metal workers' union FIOM said.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. aims to lease space in emergency oil stockpile, after buying plan canceled - sources
Description: The Trump administration plans to lease out space for energy companies to store oil in the nation's Strategic Petroleum Reserve, after a previous effort to buy millions of barrels for the emergency stockpile was canceled over a lack of funding, according to two people briefed on the matter.

Headlines: J.C. Penney furloughs staff, extends store closures amid pandemic
Description: J. C. Penney Co Inc said on Tuesday it would furlough a majority of its hourly staff and salaried associates next month, the latest U.S. retailer looking to weather the financial strain from store closures due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump signs off on deferring tariffs for most-favored nations for three months
Description: President Donald Trump has signed off on a plan to defer U.S. tariffs for most-favored nations for three months, according to a source familiar with the decision.

Headlines: UniCredit says top managers to forego entire 2020 bonus pay
Description: Italy's biggest bank by assets, UniCredit SpA , said on Tuesday its top managers had decided to waive their entire 2020 bonus pay and that the bank would donate an equivalent amount to the UniCredit Foundation to support social initiatives.

Headlines: Architect of Trump tax cut may run $500 billion coronavirus loan program
Description: U.S. Deputy Treasury Secretary Justin Muzinich, an architect of the sweeping 2017 Republican tax cut, is under consideration to oversee a newly created $500 billion coronavirus rescue loan program for large companies, cities and states, two sources familiar with the agency's plans said.

Headlines: Special Report: The Mask Middlemen - How pop-up brokers seek big paydays in a frenzied market
Description: Brian Kolfage, a Florida military veteran, recently convinced Americans to donate millions of dollars for a privately built wall on the U.S. southern border. Now he has jumped into a new venture: hawking millions of protective face masks that are in critically short supply during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump holds call with U.S. internet, mobile phone providers
Description: President Donald Trump spoke with the biggest U.S. internet and mobile phone providers on Tuesday to talk about how the networks are holding up as tens of millions of Americans work from home.

Headlines: SocGen, Natixis skip 2019 dividends, may consider payments in second half
Description: French banks, Societe Generale and Natixis joined a cohort of European peers that announced plans to skip 2019 dividends following the European Central Bank's guidance to direct profits toward supporting the economy during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Chanel turns its workshops to making face masks against coronavirus
Description: (This Mar 29 story corrects number of staff, clarifies they are in France.)

Headlines: U.S. court rules for Teva in migraine patent dispute with Eli Lilly
Description: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd on Tuesday won a ruling from a U.S. administrative court that could help it fend off competition from Eli Lilly and Co in the market for migraine drugs.

Headlines: Fed will do 'whatever it takes' to help U.S. economy likely in recession, Daly says
Description: The Federal Reserve is ready to do more to help a U.S. economy ground to a sudden halt as businesses shutter and people stay home to slow the coronavirus pandemic, San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Senators urge U.S. airlines to issue ticket refunds after bailout
Description: Nine Democratic U.S. senators on Tuesday urged the chief executives of 11 major airlines to issue full cash refunds to customers canceling flights during the coronavirus pandemic after Congress approved a massive rescue package for the hard-hit industry.

Headlines: Nissan says U.S. auto plants will remain closed through late April
Description: Nissan Motor Co said on Wednesday its U.S. auto plants will remain closed through late April to help reduce the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Pelosi urges U.S. Treasury not to delay $25 billion in grants to airlines
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi urged the U.S. Treasury on Wednesday not to hold up $25 billion in cash grants approved by Congress last week to airlines for payroll costs.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing contracts; private payrolls post first drop since 2017
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity contracted less than expected in March, but disruptions caused by the coronavirus pandemic pushed new orders received by factories to an 11-year low, reinforcing economists' views that the economy was in recession.

Headlines: U.S. construction spending unexpectedly falls in February
Description: U.S. construction spending unexpectedly fell in February and could decline further as the coronavirus pandemic wreaks havoc on the economy.

Headlines: U.S. factory activity in March was weakest since 2009: IHS Markit
Description: The U.S. manufacturing sector contracted in March, with activity hitting its lowest level since 2009, as the coronavirus pandemic caused widespread shortages, a survey confirmed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Argentina to continue talks with creditors after missing deadline: economy minister
Description: Argentina will continue talks this week and next with creditors over restructuring its $83 billion in foreign debt, Economy Minister Martin Guzman said on Tuesday, after the South American country missed the March 31 deadline it had set previously.

Headlines: Glencore's chrome joint venture in South Africa with Merafe declares force majeure
Description: Glencore's chrome joint venture in South Africa with Merafe Resources has declared force majeure on qualifying contracts after a nationwide lockdown forced operations to shut, a Merafe executive said.

Headlines: Mother of invention: the new gadgets dreamt up to fight coronavirus
Description: Driving to work at his factory to the west of London last week, designer Steve Brooks had coronavirus on his mind. What could he make that would let him open a door without touching the handle?

Headlines: Exclusive: KKR shelves $2 billion sale of Singapore-based Goodpack due to market slump: sources
Description: KKR & Co has shelved a plan to sell Singapore-based Goodpack, which provides shipping containers and logistics services, after the coronavirus outbreak hit valuations, sources with knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple doubles China donations for COVID-19 recovery efforts
Description: Apple more than doubled its donation to China's efforts to fight COVID-19 to over 50 million yuan ($7 million), CEO Tim Cook posted on Weibo on Wednesday, weeks after the iPhone maker said it had opened all its 42 stores in one of its largest markets.

Headlines: U.S. pension funds may pour $400 billion into stocks, lifting virus-hit markets: JP Morgan
Description: U.S. pension funds that delayed rebalancing their portfolios are likely to pump about $400 billion into stocks over the next two quarters, analysts at JP Morgan said, providing a potential boost to equity markets battered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Starbucks extends coronavirus provisions for two weeks, explores more changes
Description: Starbucks Corp on Wednesday said it will extend special coronavirus provisions, including pay increases for U.S. workers and closed dining areas, for two weeks to May 3.

Headlines: U.S. factory activity contracts in March; orders tumble to 11-year low: ISM
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity contracted less than expected in March, but disruptions caused by the coronavirus pandemic pushed new orders received by factories to an 11-year low, reinforcing economists' views that the economy was in recession.

Headlines: Challengers rev their engines to fight Trump's auto emissions weakening
Description: Just two months after taking office, President Donald Trump in March 2017 traveled to Michigan to announce that he would undo ambitious vehicle emissions standards mandated under his predecessor Barack Obama, portraying the reversal as a boost to the U.S. auto industry centered in the Midwestern state.

Headlines: Democrats urge U.S. Treasury not to delay $25 billion in grants to airlines
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi urged the U.S. Treasury on Wednesday not to hold up $25 billion in cash grants approved by Congress last week to airlines for payroll costs.

Headlines: China's ports brace for second hit as virus spread wipes out exports
Description: China's ports and shipping firms are bracing for a second wave of supply chain disruptions that may be deeper and more prolonged than during the country's coronavirus lockdown as the global spread of the virus chokes off international demand.

Headlines: Amazon warehouse workers protest near Detroit, days after NYC walkout
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday a handful of workers staged a demonstration at one of its warehouses near Detroit, another U.S. protest this week over staff concerns about contracting the novel coronavirus on the job.

Headlines: U.S. shale company Whiting becomes first major bankruptcy of oil-price crash
Description: Whiting Petroleum Corp filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, the U.S. shale producer said on Wednesday, the first publicly traded casualty of crashing crude oil prices that are expected to bite into record U.S. output.

Headlines: Wall Street dives 4% as virus pandemic fears intensify
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes fell more than 4% on Wednesday, after President Donald Trump's dire warning on the U.S. death toll from the coronavirus sent investors running from even the most defensive equities.

Headlines: Oil ends lower after U.S. crude stockpiles jump, gasoline demand sinks
Description: Oil prices fell on Wednesday after U.S. crude inventories rose last week by the most since 2016, while gasoline demand suffered its biggest weekly drop ever due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: As millions lose jobs, Fed policymakers say recession is here
Description: The U.S. recession is here. How long it will last will depend on the course of a viral pandemic that could still kill hundreds of thousands of Americans, and has most of the country under lockdowns aimed at slowing the infection's spread.

Headlines: Retail sector companies turn to masks, gloves in coronavirus fight
Description: Major U.S. retail sector companies on Thursday moved to allay health and safety concerns of staff working at warehouses and stores through the coronavirus pandemic by promising face masks, gloves and sanitizers.

Headlines: Disney to furlough some U.S. employees in wake of coronavirus
Description: Walt Disney Co said on Thursday it will start furloughs of non-essential U.S. employees across the company on April 19, a response to the global coronavirus outbreak that has shut down or disrupted its media and theme park businesses.

Headlines: Elon Musk's SpaceX bans Zoom over privacy concerns -memo
Description: Elon Musk's rocket company SpaceX has banned its employees from using video conferencing app Zoom, citing "significant privacy and security concerns," according to a memo seen by Reuters, days after U.S. law enforcement warned users about the security of the popular app.

Headlines: 'Dear Elon': Ukraine takes up Tesla's ventilator offer via Twitter
Description: Ukraine has taken to Twitter to ask Elon Musk to send it ventilators after the billionaire chief executive of Tesla Inc offered to ship them across the world during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Ford says post-crisis support for U.S. customers 'would be appropriate'
Description: Ford Motor Co's U.S. sales chief said on Thursday the automaker believes some level of government stimulus will be needed for consumers once the coronavirus pandemic recedes and that the crisis will spur a permanent shift toward more online vehicle sales in America.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines to apply for U.S. government aid as demand craters
Description: Southwest Airlines Co said on Thursday it intends to apply for U.S. government aid to help it ride out the sharp drop in travel demand caused by the massive lockdowns because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon back at work after heart surgery
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon has returned to lead the largest U.S bank, after recovering from recent heart surgery, according to an internal memo to employees seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Fund managers freeze UK institutional property funds
Description: Investment managers BlackRock and Schroders have suspended trading in UK real estate funds aimed at institutional investors, citing difficulty in getting an accurate price for their assets.

Headlines: H&M in talks with tens of thousands of staff to cut working hours due to pandemic
Description: Sweden's H&M said on Thursday it was in talks with tens of thousands of its staff about shortening working hours with the firm among many retailers hit by the coronavirus pandemic and fewer customers in many markets.

Headlines: Pigs fly in as China replenishes world's biggest hog herd
Description: Six planes carrying more than 4,000 high-quality French breeding pigs have arrived in China so far this year, the first of an expected dozens of plane-loads as the world's top pork producer rebuilds its decimated hog herd.

Headlines: U.S. Energy Department urges Saudi, Russia to calm oil markets
Description: The U.S. Energy Department on Wednesday urged Saudi Arabia and Russia to calm oil markets after the kingdom's crude supply rose to a record of more than 12 million barrels per day even as oil demand falters on the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: German carmakers had crisis call with Merkel: Handelsblatt
Description: The bosses of Volkswagen , BMW and Daimler held a crisis call with German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Wednesday to discuss how to get production restarted, Germany's Handelsblatt newspaper reported on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. unemployment to shoot up while GDP declines in second quarter: congressional estimators
Description: The U.S. unemployment rate will shoot past 10% in the second quarter and the growth rate of gross domestic product will decline by more than 7% as the coronavirus crisis grips the U.S. economy, according to projections released by the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) on Thursday.

Headlines: GE to furlough 50% of U.S. engine assembly, component manufacturing ops staff
Description: General Electric Co said on Thursday it would furlough about half its workers in the U.S. engine assembly and component manufacturing operations, a move that would affect thousands of employees, as the coronavirus pandemic hurts travel demand.

Headlines: Walgreens shares fall as coronavirus pandemic hits store sales
Description: Shares of Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc fell 6% on Thursday after the drugstore retailer reported a steep decline in U.S. same-store sales in the last week of March as customers stayed indoors due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon to deploy masks and temperature checks for workers by next week
Description: Amazon.com Inc plans to roll out temperature checks and face masks for staff at all its U.S. and European warehouses plus Whole Foods stores by early next week, a huge deployment for workers on the front lines of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. borrowers struggle to get coronavirus relief from big banks
Description: U.S. borrowers seeking a reprieve from mortgage, auto or credit card payments because of coronavirus hardships are not getting the help they expected from big banks that promised assistance in recent weeks.

Headlines: Bank of America cuts Brazil 2020 GDP forecast to -3.5% from -0.5%: report
Description: Bank of America on Thursday cut its 2020 forecast for Brazil's gross domestic product (GDP) to a 3.5% contraction from a 0.5% fall, it said in a report, citing the strong impact on consumption and investment stemming amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Thousands of U.S. banks may sit out small-business rescue plan on liability worries: sources
Description: Thousands of U.S. banks, including some of the country's largest lenders, have said they may not participate in the federal government's small-business rescue program due to concerns about taking on too much legal and financial risk, five people with direct knowledge of industry discussions told Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: Germany in talks to inject billions into Lufthansa - sources
Description: Germany is in talks to provide Lufthansa with billions of euros in state aid and could take a stake in the airline, which has grounded 95% of its fleet due to the coronavirus pandemic, people close to the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. gig workers seeking coronavirus jobless benefits hit bureaucratic wall
Description: Uber and Lyft drivers are hitting a wall in their efforts to apply for the coronavirus jobless benefits promised by Congress as state agencies say they are not ready to handle a class of workers who are totally new to the U.S. unemployment system.

Headlines: Airbnb lowers internal valuation to $26 billion as coronavirus hits bookings: source
Description: Airbnb lowered its internal valuation by 16% to $26 billion, as the U.S. home rental firm grapples with a slowdown in bookings due to the global spread of the coronavirus pandemic, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump invokes Defense Production Act for ventilator manufacturing
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday invoked the Defense Production Act to aid companies building ventilators for coronavirus patients to receive the supply of materials they need.

Headlines: Healthcare stocks show their defensive allure in ailing market
Description: The coronavirus pandemic is throwing a spotlight on stocks in the U.S. healthcare sector, home to the companies that could develop treatments, vaccines and improved diagnostics needed to tackle the greatest public health crisis in a century.

Headlines: GM rolls out safety protocols for ventilator-making workers
Description: General Motors Co on Thursday rolled out a series of safety measures for workers in Indiana who will make ventilators, outlining what could be a blueprint for opening U.S. auto plants in the coming weeks.

Headlines: Chipotle under pressure in New York over coronavirus sick leave
Description: Less than two months after settling with New York City regulators over paid sick leave, Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc is under pressure for its policies amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: 'Mom & Pop' shops worry they will be squeezed out of small business coronavirus aid
Description: Family-owned restaurants fear they could be pitted against larger competitors, hotel chains and potentially investment funds in a race starting on Friday for a $349 billion pot of money the U.S. government will offer businesses hard-hit by coronavirus.

Headlines: Instant View: Coronavirus slams U.S. jobs growth in March
Description: The U.S. economy abruptly ended a historic 113 straight months of employment growth in March, as stringent measures to control the novel coronavirus pandemic shuttered businesses and factories, all but confirming a recession is underway.

Headlines: U.S. services sector growth slows; employment drops: ISM
Description: U.S. services sector activity slowed to a more than 3-1/2-year low in March, with industries reporting a moderation in new orders and decline in employment amid the coronavirus pandemic, which has brought the country to sudden stop.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee's journey from hot startup to $5billion share wipeout
Description: Here is a timeline of the Nasdaq-listed Luckin Coffee Inc's journey from a hot Chinese start-up to U.S. IPO and now an investigation for alleged fraud.

Headlines: Petrobras says talks among Russia, Saudi Arabia, U.S. 'irrelevant' for oil prices
Description: Recent negotiations involving leaders from major oil-producing nations and the United States will prove irrelevant for oil prices, which are low because of depressed demand, the chief executive of Brazil's Petrobras said on Thursday evening.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler starts ventilator component output in Italy
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) has begun producing ventilator parts to help Italy's Siare Engineering boost its output of the medical equipment needed to treat patients during the coronavirus crisis, the carmaker said on Friday.

Headlines: Beijing autoshow postponed to September due to virus
Description: Organisers of the Beijing autoshow, which was scheduled to be held in late-April, said on Friday the event would be held between Sept. 26 and Oct. 5 due to the coronavirus pandamic.

Headlines: H&M sees second-quarter loss, plans cost cuts as pandemic slams sales in March
Description: Sweden's H&M , the world's second-biggest clothing retailer, said on Friday it expected a loss in the second quarter after reporting a 46% plunge in March sales as the coronavirus pandemic took a toll on the retail sector.

Headlines: Southwest expects talks on U.S. payroll grant terms over next several days
Description: Southwest Airlines Co said on Friday it has applied for U.S. payroll grants but cannot disclose details as the next several days could involve conversations on the terms of any agreement.

Headlines: Russia says U.S. has legal curbs on oil output cuts, but should be flexible
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said on Friday that the United States has legal restrictions on oil output cuts, but the country should be flexible with them, RIA news agency reported.

Headlines: Oil surges more than 13% on hopes of output deal
Description: Crude futures surged for a second day on Friday, with both U.S. and Brent contracts posting their largest weekly percentage gains on record due to hopes that a global deal to cut crude supply worldwide will emerge early next week.

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell spoke with Trump as virus took aim at U.S.
Description: As the coronavirus bore down on the United States in February and President Donald Trump renewed his public call for interest rate cuts, he and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell conducted two previously undisclosed phone calls, calendars released by the U.S. central bank on Friday show.

Headlines: Dollar climbs on safe-haven bids; shrugs off horrible U.S. jobs number
Description: The dollar firmed against major currencies for a third straight day on Friday, as investors took shelter in the U.S. currency amid worsening economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Canada signs agreement with Amazon Canada to manage distribution of medical equipment
Description: Canada has signed an agreement with Amazon Canada to manage the distribution of medical equipment like masks, gloves and ventilators purchased by the Canadian government to help in its fight against the cornonavirus outbreak, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Friday.

Headlines: Richmond Fed's Barkin: Employment numbers to get worse before getting better
Description: U.S. employment numbers will get worse amid the ongoing coronavirus outbreak before getting better, Richmond Federal Reserve President Thomas Barkin said in an interview with Bloomberg News.

Headlines: Large U.S. banks to take small business loan applications next week: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday he expects all large U.S. banks to be participating in a newly launched, $350 billion small business coronavirus rescue loan program by next week, with community banks issuing most of the loans so far.

Headlines: Soaring unemployment increases odds U.S. banks will cut dividends
Description: Questions are building about whether big U.S. banks will have to cut dividends later this year as the coronavirus crisis puts a record portion of Americans out of work, making it difficult for borrowers to pay back loans.

Headlines: Wall Street falls as coronavirus shreds U.S. payrolls
Description: Wall Street's main indexes fell more than 1.5% on Friday as the coronavirus abruptly ended a record U.S. job growth streak of 113 months, intensifying fears of a deep economic slowdown.

Headlines: Big U.S. banks start accepting small business aid requests
Description: Bank of America Corp and JPMorgan Chase & Co are now accepting applications for federally backed small-business loans, a sign that big U.S. banks have warmed up to the relief program after initially resisting participation.

Headlines: American Airlines applies for U.S. payroll assistance grants
Description: American Airlines, the largest U.S. airline, confirmed Friday it has applied to the U.S. Treasury for a chunk of the $25 billion payroll assistance grants approved by Congress last week.

Headlines: JPMorgan says now accepting applications for federal loan program
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co , the largest U.S. lender by assets, started accepting at Friday midday applications for loans from the federal government's paycheck protection program, according to a post on the bank's website.

Headlines: Exclusive: Spain's coronavirus crisis stalls global fashion giant Inditex
Description: Inditex has switched its clothes factories in Spain over to making medical supplies and its logistics hub has almost ground to a halt, effectively freezing the nerve centre of its business from which it supplies stores worldwide.

Headlines: Coronavirus depresses U.S. payrolls, more job losses coming
Description: The U.S. economy shed 701,000 jobs in March, abruptly ending a historic 113 straight months of employment growth as stringent measures to control the novel coronavirus outbreak shuttered businesses and factories, confirming a recession is underway.

Headlines: 3M warns against Trump's order to limit face mask exports
Description: 3M Co said on Friday it would make more face masks for the United States to fight the coronavirus pandemic, but warned of the "humanitarian implications" of limiting supply to other countries as President Donald Trump directed.

Headlines: Trump says 3M 'will have a big price to pay' over face masks
Description: President Donald Trump slammed 3M Co in a tweet late on Thursday after earlier announcing he was invoking the Defense Production Act to get the company to produce face masks.

Headlines: Exclusive: Neiman Marcus advances bankruptcy preparations - sources
Description: Neiman Marcus Group is stepping up preparations to seek bankruptcy protection, after the coronavirus pandemic forced the debt-laden U.S. luxury department store chain to close its stores, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump says Bank of America, others doing 'great job' on small-business loans
Description: President Donald Trump hailed one of the country's largest banks, as well as many small lenders, for making small business emergency loans on the first day of a new U.S. coronavirus economic relief program.

Headlines: Italy looks to safeguard biomedical valley leading fight against COVID-19
Description: Italy plans to tighten health checks to ensure that work is not disrupted in a small northern town specialising in the production of medical supplies to tackle its coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: When will U.S. economy bottom? Economists hunt for the right view
Description: The economic crisis spawned by the coronavirus pandemic has produced a wave of grim U.S. data, with likely more to come as millions lose jobs, businesses shutter and spending stops.

Headlines: GM reduces loan refinancing target, may pay up for new debt
Description: NEW YORK (LPC) - General Motors Co (GM) will seek to extend maturities on US$6bn in revolving loans rather than refinance a US$16.5bn credit facility following discussions with its bank group during an unprecedented health crisis in the US.

Headlines: Trump invokes Defense Production Act to stop export of masks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday signed an order directing his administration to stop N-95 face masks and other personal protective equipment needed in the fight against the coronavirus pandemic from being exported to other countries.

Headlines: Explainer: Antitrust law won't get in the way of U.S. acting to raise oil prices
Description: It is illegal for oil producers to meet to discuss pushing up oil prices under U.S. antitrust law, but perfectly legal if state regulators or the federal government set lower production levels for them, U.S. antitrust experts said on Friday.

Headlines: Why sweetened layoff benefits may be at odds with U.S. loan program
Description: The generous U.S. unemployment benefits rolled out to blunt the economic harm caused by the coronavirus could have an unintended effect: it may actually be an incentive for companies to choose layoffs rather than keep staff on their books.

Headlines: U.S. airlines apply for U.S. payroll help but terms still unclear
Description: Major U.S. airlines applied on Friday for payroll grants from the U.S. Treasury meant to keep workers employed during a sharp downturn resulting from the coronavirus outbreak, but while talks over the terms were expected to continue in coming days some warned the funds would not be enough to help them through their toughest crisis ever.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia denies withdrawing from OPEC+ deal, says Russia was the one that withdrew
Description: The Saudi foreign minister said early on Saturday that a statement attributed to Russia's President Vladimir Putin about the kingdom's withdrawal from the OPEC+ deal is not correct, and that Russia is the one that withdrew, state agency (SPA) reported.

Headlines: Tesla cuts contractors from California, Nevada factories: CNBC
Description: Tesla Inc is cutting contractors from its U.S. car and battery plants, CNBC reported on Friday, citing workers and a contract staffing agency.

Headlines: Trump aims to ease U.S. oil industry's cash crunch, no plan to trim output: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has directed his cabinet to find ways to ease a cash crunch in the drilling industry after oil company executives told him in a Friday meeting it was among their top concerns, according to three sources briefed on the matter.

Headlines: U.S. businesses swarm coronavirus bailout fund after days of confusion
Description: Like many small business owners, New York City restaurateur Dan Kluger spent his Friday scrambling to apply for a loan under the U.S. government's $349 billion small business bailout fund, which officially launched in the morning.

Headlines: The watchdogs overseeing the $2.3 trillion U.S. bailout
Description: Who's watching over the U.S. government's largest bailout in history - the $2.3 trillion in fiscal stimulus to fight the economic impact of the coronavirus?

Headlines: Trump says will ask Congress for more small business funds if money runs out
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he would ask Congress for more money to make loans to small businesses struggling with the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak if the original $349 billion allocated in a fiscal stimulus bill runs out.

Headlines: How the coronavirus job cuts played out by sector and demographics
Description: The job losses suffered in March as the U.S. economy shut down in the face of the novel coronavirus pandemic were widespread but still were disproportionately felt in a handful of employment sectors and by women, the young and the less educated.

Headlines: U.S. banks to defend dividend payments in stress tests: FT
Description: U.S. banks are expected to defend their dividend payments when they submit their annual capital plans to the Federal Reserve on Monday for the upcoming stress tests, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Boeing extends Washington state production shutdown indefinitely
Description: Boeing Co said on Sunday it would extend the suspension of production operations at its Washington state facilities until further notice amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Oil prices decline $3 a barrel as market remains uncertain on supply outlook
Description: Global benchmark oil prices traded as much as $3 a barrel lower as the market opened for Monday's trading session, reflecting fears of oversupply after Saudi Arabia and Russia postponed to Thursday a meeting about a potential pact to cut production.

Headlines: Coronavirus muddies U.S. economic data as business closures push down response rates
Description: A near total closure of U.S. businesses as authorities try to control the spread of the novel coronavirus could make U.S. economic data unreliable in the coming months and harder to get a clearer picture of the severity of the recession caused by the virus.

Headlines: World stocks jump on less dire virus data, oil falls after OPEC+ delay
Description: World stock markets jumped on Monday, encouraged by slowdowns in coronavirus-related deaths and new cases in some global hot spots, while oil prices tumbled again due to a delay in talks between Saudi Arabia and Russia to cut supply.

Headlines: OPEC+ likely to agree to cut production if U.S. joins effort: sources
Description: Major oil producers including Saudi Arabia and Russia are likely to agree to cut production at a Thursday meeting but only if the United States joins the effort, aimed at coping with the disastrous effect of the coronavirus on fuel demand, three OPEC+ sources told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: White House considering U.S. Treasury coronavirus bond: Kudlow
Description: White House advisers have been discussing the possibility of a coronavirus-related U.S. Treasury bond, President Donald Trump's economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Monday.

Headlines: Allstate to return $600 million in auto premiums as coronavirus cuts driving
Description: Allstate Corp , one of the largest U.S. auto insurers, said on Monday it would return more than $600 million in premiums to customers as many Americans drive less due to stay-at-home orders aimed at curbing the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Airbnb secures $1 billion investment from Silver Lake, Sixth Street
Description: Airbnb said on Monday private equity firms Silver Lake and Sixth Street Partners will invest $1 billion in the U.S. home rental company, bolstering its finances at a time when the coronavirus outbreak has roiled the travel and leisure industry.

Headlines: Trump says OPEC has not asked him for a U.S. oil production cut
Description: President Donald Trump said on Monday that OPEC had not pressed him to ask U.S. oil producers to reduce their output to support global prices, which have been hard-hit by the economic fallout of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street soars on hopes of slowing coronavirus deaths
Description: U.S. stocks rocketed higher on Monday, with each of the major indexes rallying at least 7%, after a fall in the daily death toll in New York, the country's biggest coronavirus hot spot, fueled optimism a leveling off of the pandemic was on the horizon.

Headlines: Fed says it will provide financing against new U.S. 'payroll protection' loans
Description: The Federal Reserve on Monday moved to bolster a new small-business lending program by allowing banks to turn those loans over to the U.S. central bank for cash, easing concerns among banks about getting stuck holding the low interest loans.

Headlines: As Germany reels from coronavirus, some officials debate impact on banks
Description: As Germany rolls out a 750 billion-euro economic stimulus package, officials and experts are discussing whether German lenders, including Deutsche Bank AG and Commerzbank AG, will be able to weather the economic fallout of coronavirus without state help.

Headlines: JPMorgan CEO Dimon calls 'bad recession', mulls suspending 2020 dividend
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co's top boss, Jamie Dimon , on Monday said he sees a "bad recession" in 2020, and that the largest U.S. bank could suspend its dividend if the coronavirus crisis deepens.

Headlines: Exclusive: Qatar Petroleum - coronavirus turmoil will not stop LNG expansion abroad
Description: Qatar Petroleum (QP) is pressing ahead with foreign as well as domestic expansion despite the global market turmoil caused by the coronavirus pandemic, its chief executive told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Airbus announces additional production pauses
Description: Airbus said on Monday it had decided additional production pauses, in Germany and in the United States, in response to an industry-wide slowdown triggered by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: CVS ramps up drive-through coronavirus testing sites with faster kits
Description: CVS Health Corp , called on by the Trump administration last month to help test Americans for infections from the new coronavirus, said it was launching two offsite testing locations with Abbott Laboratories' faster diagnostic kit and would be able to handle 1,000 tests per day.

Headlines: Oil falls after Saudi Arabia, Russia delay meeting, Cushing stockpiles soar
Description: Oil prices slumped on Monday, pulling back from last week's gains after Saudi Arabia and Russia delayed a meeting of oil producers aimed at resolving growing worldwide oversupply as the coronavirus pandemic pummels demand.

Headlines: Alaska Air expects to lower April and May capacity by 80%
Description: The U.S. carrier had earlier planned to reduce its April capacity by at least 10% and May capacity by at least 15%.

Headlines: Total among companies seeking force majeure on EDF contracts: sources
Description: Energy major Total is among several power suppliers that tried to declare force majeure on buying nuclear power from EDF, sources said, as the coronavirus outbreak has pushed prices in the French electricity market far below existing contracts.

Headlines: Lufthansa's Belgian carrier suspends flights until mid-May
Description: Belgium's Brussels Airlines, a Lufthansa subsidiary, has extended its suspension of flights until at least May 15, it said on Monday.

Headlines: Honda, Fiat Chrysler aim to restart U.S., Canada auto production in May
Description: Honda Motor Co and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV said on Monday they hope to restart U.S. and Canadian auto production in May amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: HSBC Hong Kong shareholders mull legal action over dividend suspension
Description: HSBC shareholders in Hong Kong are calling for an extraordinary meeting with the bank's management and considering legal action against its decision to scrap dividend payments.

Headlines: Uber connects out-of-work U.S. ride-hail drivers to delivery, production jobs
Description: Uber Technologies Inc said on Monday its app will list job openings in the delivery, food production and grocery industry that its U.S. drivers can access during a slump in ride-hailing demand due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: Safaricom, Vodacom finalise M-Pesa acquisition from Britain's Vodafone
Description: Kenya's leading telecom firm Safaricom and South Africa's Vodacom said on Monday that they had completed the acquisition of popular mobile money platform M-Pesa from Britain's Vodafone .

Headlines: Oil drop saps gains as Wall Street fades late
Description: Wall Street fell on Tuesday, as a drop in oil prices steepened in the latter stages of the session and erased early gains built on tentative signs that coronavirus outbreaks in some of the biggest U.S. hot spots may be leveling.

Headlines: U.S. banking regulators encourage 'prudent efforts' by banks to help borrowers
Description: U.S. banks should feel welcome to pursue "prudent efforts" to help borrowers impacted by the coronavirus pandemic, according to a new joint statement issued by banking regulators Tuesday.

Headlines: Exxon could delay third Guyana project as government review drags on
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp said on Tuesday that production at the Payara project, its third development in Guyana, could be postponed due to delays in government approvals as the company scales back spending elsewhere due to the crude price crash.

Headlines: Wall Street volatility raises fears of another selloff
Description: The evaporation of a rally on Wall Street in the closing minutes of Tuesday's session shows that many investors fear the U.S. stock market is in danger of a renewed tumble due to uncertainty surrounding the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Former Fed chief Bernanke sees bad year, no quick recovery
Description: The U.S. economy could shrink 30% or more this quarter as stay-at-home orders aimed at slowing the coronavirus outbreak choke off business, and it could be a couple of years before the economy regains its footing, former Federal Reserve Chair Ben Bernanke said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. economy will eventually reopen but with big changes: Kudlow
Description: The Trump administration is aiming to reopen the U.S. economy when the nation's top health experts give the go-ahead, but Americans' lives will be drastically different, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nissan's China sales drop 44.9% in March due to virus
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan said on Wednesday its sales in China fell 44.9% from a year earlier to 73,297 units in March, as the coronavirus epidemic continues to hit the world's biggest car market.

Headlines: U.S. pushes back on call by OPEC+ to join big oil output cuts
Description: Saudi Arabia, Russia and allied oil producers will agree to deep cuts to their crude output at talks this week only if the United States and several others join in with curbs to help prop up prices that have been hammered by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Volkswagen Mexico says employee died in potential case of COVID-19
Description: Volkswagen Mexico issued a statement saying one of its employees in the country had died in a potential case of coronavirus.

Headlines: Wynn, NCR deals a sign of yet more risk returning to bond market
Description: U.S. casino operator Wynn Resorts Ltd and automated teller machines maker NCR Corp jointly raised $1 billion on Tuesday, in the first unsecured junk-rated bond offerings since the market was roiled by the coronavirus outbreak at the start of March.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury talks continue on $25 billion in aviation grants
Description: Talks between U.S. airlines and the Treasury Department over how to award $25 billion in cash grants earmarked for payroll assistance due to the coronavirus outbreak were set to continue into the evening Tuesday, people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: KKR sets up $50 million international coronavirus relief fund
Description: KKR & Co Inc has established a $50 million global relief fund to help people affected by the new coronavirus, according to a letter the U.S. private equity firm sent to its investors on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump says $70 billion in coronavirus rescue loans authorized. But where's the cash?
Description: Roughly $70 billion of a $350 billion pot of loans to cover the payrolls of ailing small businesses have been originated by U.S. lenders in recent days, President Donald Trump said on Tuesday, adding that that money was "essentially loaned."

Headlines: Levi's coming back to life in China as stores reopen, online sales rise
Description: Levi Strauss & Co said on Tuesday a majority of its stores in China, where the coronavirus outbreak first emerged in December, were open with sales recovering on a weekly basis and digital sales rising last month.

Headlines: VW plans to partially reopen plant in Spain's Navarra on April 20
Description: German carmaker Volkswagen hopes to partially reopen its plant in Spain's Navarra region on April 20 after its closure in mid-March due to the coronavirus outbreak, a spokesman for the plant said on Tuesday.

Headlines: France's Thales withdraws final dividend, suspends outlook
Description: France's Thales on Tuesday became the latest major company to slash its dividend, suspend profit guidance and top up liquidity in response to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: China's Ucar, in which Luckin chairman is top shareholder, halts shares
Description: China's Ucar Inc, in which Luckin Coffee Chairman Charles Zhengyao Lu is the biggest shareholder, suspended trading of its shares on Tuesday after regulators questioned the car service provider about how the alleged fraud at Luckin would impact it.

Headlines: Cemex resumes Mexico operations after brief pause due to coronavirus
Description: Mexican cement company Cemex said on Monday it would resume operations in the country, hours after announcing a pause, as fresh guidelines from the government permitted such a move.

Headlines: Graphic: Oil majors cut 2020 spending by 22% after prices slump
Description: The world's biggest oil and gas companies are cutting spending this year following a collapse in oil prices driven by a slump in demand because of the coronavirus crisis and a price war between top exporters Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: In a first, China knocks U.S. from top spot in global patent race
Description: China was the biggest source of applications for international patents in the world last year, pushing the United States out of the top spot it has held since the global system was set up more than 40 years ago, the U.N. patent agency said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Demand for Luckin app surges as Chinese rush to drink up after admission of fraud
Description: Luckin Coffee's app has rocketed to become the second most popular in China as consumers rushed to claim a free drink that it has long offered for downloading, worried the chain might collapse after it said much of its sales last year were fabricated.

Headlines: Japan's SoftBank to invest $48 million in Brazil pet products site Petlove
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp reached an agreement to invest 250 million reais ($48 million) in pet products online retailer Petlove, the companies said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: OPEC+ needs to agree output numbers before meeting: Iran oil minister
Description: There needs to be an agreement on oil production numbers before any future meeting between OPEC and non-OPEC members, Iran's Oil Minister Bijan Zanganeh tweeted on Tuesday.

Headlines: AT&T takes on $5.5 billion loan to boost 'financial flexibility'
Description: AT&T Inc. on Tuesday announced a $5.5 billion term-loan agreement, which it said would give the company "financial flexibility" during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Huawei laments U.S. plans to crimp its global chip supply
Description: A Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] executive on Tuesday described as "unfortunate" plans by the U.S. government to curb the Chinese telecom equipment maker's access to global chip supplies.

Headlines: Honda, Nissan furlough U.S. workers as auto demand plummets
Description: Honda Motor Co and Nissan Motor Co on Tuesday said they had furloughed thousands of workers at their U.S. operations as the coronavirus pandemic slashes demand for cars in the country.

Headlines: JPMorgan takes action against traders for using WhatsApp at work: Bloomberg News
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co, the largest U.S. bank, has taken action against more than a dozen traders for using WhatsApp at work, firing one and cutting bonuses for the rest, Bloomberg news reported on Wednesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: JetBlue seeks U.S. approval to temporarily halt flights to 11 airports
Description: JetBlue Airways Corp on Wednesday asked the U.S. Transportation Department for emergency approval to temporarily suspend service to 11 U.S. airports, including Dallas, Houston, Minneapolis, Portland, Sacramento and Albuquerque.

Headlines: Pelosi: more small business spending alone would not pass U.S. House
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Wednesday that $250 billion in coronavirus relief for small businesses desired by Republicans could not pass the House of Representatives on its own under current procedures, which require a unanimous vote of those present while most of Congress is out of town.

Headlines: U.S. dollar drifts higher as optimism ebbs on coronavirus crisis
Description: The U.S. dollar gained on Wednesday in choppy trading as some optimism faded that the coronavirus crisis may be nearing a peak faded and as investor concerns remained over the economic fallout of the pandemic.

Headlines: Google bans Zoom software from employee laptops
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Wednesday banned Zoom video conferencing application from its employees' laptops, citing security concerns.

Headlines: Trump administration seeks $250 billion more in aid for small U.S. businesses: Mnuchin
Description: The Trump administration on Tuesday asked Congress for an additional $250 billion in emergency economic aid for small U.S. businesses reeling from the coronavirus pandemic, as Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell pushed for passage as soon as Thursday.

Headlines: Ferrari to pilot 'Back on Track' employee screening for coronavirus
Description: Ferrari said on Wednesday it was piloting a project to conduct voluntary screening of employees and their families for coronavirus once the supercarmaker's factories in Italy reopen.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan sees U.S. growth returning in second half, but consumers staying cautious
Description: The U.S. economy is headed for a return to growth in the second half of the year after a steep decline this quarter, Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. senator to liquidate individual stock shares after coronavirus flap
Description: U.S. Senator Kelly Loeffler said on Wednesday she would liquidate her individual stock share positions after the wealthy Republican and her husband were criticized over sales of millions of dollars in stock during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Hundreds of U.S. lenders get access to small-business rescue program with new system launch
Description: The U.S. government's $350 billion program to help ailing businesses took an important step forward on Wednesday, with the launch of a system that will allow hundreds of new lenders to participate in the unprecedented scheme.

Headlines: Virus lockdown threatens $60 billion in UK dividends: report
Description: UK-listed companies could cancel about $60 billion in dividend payments this year following Britain's lockdown and calls from regulators to preserve cash during the coronavirus crisis, according to a report by analytics company Link Group.

Headlines: Factbox: Insurers return part of auto premiums as coronavirus cuts driving
Description: Major U.S. insurers are offering credit to auto and motorcycle policyholders following a decline in driving, as most Americans stay at home to help contain the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. approves Google request to use segment of U.S.-Asia undersea cable
Description: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) on Wednesday approved Alphabet Inc unit Google's request to use part of an U.S.-Asia undersea telecommunications cable after the company warned it would face significantly higher prices to carry traffic by other means.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies on hopeful coronavirus signs, healthcare lift
Description: U.S. stock markets jumped on Wednesday on hopeful signs about the coronavirus outbreak in the United States was close to a peak, with health insurers getting an additional lift from Bernie Sanders' decision to suspend his presidential campaign.

Headlines: Wobbly U.S. fiscal response could deepen coronavirus recession
Description: The U.S. government's massive effort to nurse the economy through the coronavirus crisis was billed as a send-money-and-don't-sweat-the-details flood of cash to people and businesses in a $22 trillion system that has ground to a halt.

Headlines: Tiffany says Australian regulators seek more time to review LVMH deal
Description: Tiffany & Co said on Wednesday Australian regulators have sought more time to review LVMH's multi-billion dollar purchase of the U.S. jeweler due to the coronavirus outbreak, potentially delaying closure of the deal.

Headlines: Tesla to furlough workers, cut employee salaries due to coronavirus
Description: Tesla Inc told employees on Tuesday it would furlough all non-essential workers and implement salary cuts during a shut down of its U.S. production facilities because of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Coronavirus rout spurs China investors to dividend plays
Description: Wild swings in global equities markets are prompting brokers and fund managers to urge patience with a strategy still alien to many of China's momentum-driven stock investors: switch into companies offering high and stable dividends.

Headlines: HSBC reports potential money laundering breaches in Australia
Description: HSBC has reported itself to Australia's financial regulator for possible breaches of anti-money laundering rules, the bank disclosed in a regulatory filing by its Australian subsidiary.

Headlines: Fed modifying asset cap so Wells Fargo can make more small business loans
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Wednesday it would "temporarily and narrowly" modify the growth restriction on Wells Fargo & Co's balance sheet, allowing the bank to make more loans under government assistance programs for small businesses hurt by the coronavirus disruption.

Headlines: Lufthansa's Austrian unit negotiates state aid, job cuts
Description: Austrian Airlines is in negotiations with the government regarding state aid to save jobs and keep Vienna as a transfer hub for long-haul flights, the carrier said on Wednesday, adding the talks were at an early stage and will probably take weeks.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit hires over 7,700 employees to manage higher demand
Description: Walmart de Mexico, known locally as Walmex , has hired 7,741 employees to manage higher volume and demand at its stores, the retailer said in a statement on Wednesday

Headlines: Dollar drops after Fed launches new loan program, curbing safety bids
Description: The dollar dropped broadly on Thursday after the Federal Reserve rolled out a $2.3 trillion effort to bolster local governments and small and mid-sized businesses in its latest move to keep the U.S. economy intact as the country battles the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Facebook sues Bangkok resident for selling fraudulent ad tools
Description: Facebook Inc sued a Bangkok-based Indian man on Thursday for developing and marketing a software to bypass the social network's advertising review process and deliver prohibited ads to users.

Headlines: BAT files patent suits against Philip Morris' IQOS products
Description: British American Tobacco said on Thursday that it sued Philip Morris International Inc in the United States and Germany, alleging that the tobacco heating technology used in its bigger rival's IQOS devices infringed its patents.

Headlines: Fed rolls out $2.3 trillion to backstop 'Main Street,' local governments
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Thursday announced a broad, $2.3 trillion effort to bolster local governments and small and mid-sized businesses, the latest in an expanding suite of programs meant to keep the U.S. economy intact as the country battles the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Russia, Saudi Arabia overcome differences holding up big oil cut deal: Dmitriev
Description: Russia and Saudi Arabia have overcome differences that had presented potential hurdles to a plan for major oil output cuts aimed at shoring up crude prices hammered by the coranavirus crisis, the head of Russia's wealth fund said on Thursday.

Headlines: As delivery workers emerge as frontline soldiers, India's government warms to e-commerce
Description: Three days after India imposed a nationwide lockdown, Devender Singh revved up his motorcycle to deliver meat and eggs to customers - but his heart was in his mouth as he closed in on a police barricade on a deserted New Delhi road.

Headlines: Trump says airlines could receive grant details this weekend; sources say around 275 applied
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that airlines could receive details this weekend about the terms of a $32 billion payroll grant to offset the impact of the coronavirus outbreak, which sources told Reuters has received around 275 applicants.

Headlines: Pelosi pushes need for money for smallest U.S. businesses
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Thursday the country's smallest businesses need to be protected against the ravages of the coronavirus outbreak and pushed for $60 billion to be allocated to those enterprises in the next funding allocation.

Headlines: Volkswagen furloughs 1,500 workers at Tennessee auto plant starting April 11
Description: Volkswagen AG said Thursday it will furlough 1,500 workers at its U.S. assembly plant in Tennessee starting April 11 as the industry grapples with the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump says administration likely to release details on airline aid this weekend
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday his administration would be releasing details over the weekend about its program to help U.S. airlines hit hard by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Mnuchin, Kudlow say U.S. economy could open in May, defying experts
Description: The Trump administration's top economic officials said on Thursday they believe the U.S. economy could start to reopen for normal business in May, despite health experts' emphasis on prolonged social distancing measures to defeat the coronavirus.

Headlines: Trump administration official says U.S. welcomes reports of OPEC+ oil cut deal
Description: The United States welcomed on Thursday reports that OPEC and its allies agreed in principal to reduce oil production by 10 million barrels per day (bpd), a senior Trump administration official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Explainer: What the Federal Reserve has done in the coronavirus crisis
Description: The Federal Reserve has moved into overdrive to try to keep the U.S. economy from suffering lasting damage from the coronavirus pandemic, announcing an emergency interest rate cut on March 3 and rolling out new efforts almost weekly since, including slashing rates to zero and relaunching large-scale asset purchases.

Headlines: S&P cuts Renault bonds to 'junk' and downgrades outlook on PSA
Description: Credit rating agency Standard & Poor's (S&P) delivered downgrades on Thursday to France's top car companies Renault and PSA , cutting Renault's bonds to 'junk' status due to the impact of the new coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. bank results to focus on looming loan losses during coronavirus
Description: How much money will U.S. banks lose on loans because of the coronavirus recession?

Headlines: Prague aims to get a grip on Airbnb with coronavirus crisis laws
Description: Officials in Prague are using the coronavirus crisis to get a firmer grip on short-term rentals like Airbnb, which they say have squeezed locals out of the Czech capital's centre.

Headlines: Exclusive: Wall Street firm dangled up to 175% returns to investors using U.S. aid programs
Description: A New York investment firm pitched wealthy investors in recent days on a way to make returns of 22% to 175% using U.S. government programs designed to help Americans keep their jobs and boost the coronavirus-stricken economy, according to a marketing document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: UniCredit renews commitment to boosting shareholder returns: chairman
Description: UniCredit remains strongly committed to increasing returns for investors in Italy's biggest bank, its chairman said, following a decision to suspend dividend payments and a share buyback to comply with supervisory guidance.

Headlines: Tesla's China sales hit record high in March: industry association
Description: Tesla Inc sold 10,160 vehicles in China in March, its highest ever monthly sales in the world's largest auto market, the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) said on Thursday.

Headlines: Advertisers shun coronavirus coverage, hastening news media battle for survival
Description: From Rupert Murdoch's News UK to McClatchy's chain of local newspapers across the United States, news publishers are attracting record numbers of readers as people in lockdown seek information about the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: JPMorgan looking to offload Saudi and UAE sovereign fund loans - sources
Description: JPMorgan is seeking to sell at a discount loans raised by the sovereign wealth funds of Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, according to two sources and a document, as banks brace for a borrowing spree in the Gulf due to low oil prices.

Headlines: Streaming service Disney+ crosses 50 million paid subscribers globally
Description: Walt Disney Co said on Wednesday that Disney+ has attracted more than 50 million paid users, with 8 million of them coming from India where the video streaming service was rolled out last week.

Headlines: Fed will continue to act 'forcefully, proactively and aggressively,' Powell says
Description: The Federal Reserve will continue to use all the tools at its disposal until the U.S. economy begins to fully rebound from the harm caused by the novel coronavirus outbreak, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said on Thursday, even as he acknowledged the limits of the central bank's powers.

Headlines: Fed chief Powell sees road to recovery, warns on 'false start'
Description: The U.S. economy could be headed "fairly quickly" toward recovery if people stay home, government gets aid to businesses and households, and public health officials create a national plan to restart the economy, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Thursday.

Headlines: White House to announce economic coronavirus task force soon: senior administration official
Description: The White House is expected to announce soon formation of a second coronavirus task force, this one devoted to getting the U.S. economy going again when the time is right, a senior administration official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Smithfield Foods closes U.S. pork plant due to new coronavirus
Description: Smithfield Foods Inc, the world's biggest pork processor, said on Thursday it is temporarily closing a plant in Sioux Falls, South Dakota, because of the new coronavirus, the latest disruption to the U.S. food supply chain from the outbreak.

Headlines: Millions filed for U.S. unemployment - many are still waiting for the cash
Description: A shocking 16.8 million people filed for U.S. unemployment benefits in the last three weeks as the country shut down to stop the spread of the novel coronavirus, overwhelming state labor departments and creating a large backlog of pending applications.

Headlines: U.S. consumer prices post largest drop in five years amid coronavirus disruptions
Description: U.S. consumer prices fell by the most in more than five years in March and further decreases are likely as the novel coronavirus outbreak suppresses demand for some goods and services, offsetting price increases related to shortages resulting from disruptions to the supply chain.

Headlines: Economists see uneven jobs recovery, high U.S. unemployment through 2021
Description: The trillions of dollars in cash and loans unleashed by the Federal Reserve and U.S. political leaders in recent weeks is meant to build a financial bridge for the country to get beyond the coronavirus pandemic and restart the economy with little or no long-term damage.

Headlines: Apple, Google to create contact tracing technology to fight coronavirus spread
Description: Apple Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google said on Friday that they will work together to create contact tracing technology that aims to slow the spread of the coronavirus by allowing users to opt into a system that catalogs other phones they have been near.

Headlines: Russia's Putin, Saudi crown prince discuss OPEC+: Kremlin
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman discussed a planned OPEC+ reduction of oil output, the Kremlin said.

Headlines: Boeing hires Lazard, Evercore to assess government aid or private loans: source
Description: Boeing Co has hired investment banks Lazard and Evercore Inc to assess potential U.S. government assistance or private sector loans, a person briefed on the matter confirmed on Friday.

Headlines: Fed policymakers working to limit damage as pandemic puts U.S. economy on pause
Description: The U.S. economy was on a strong footing before the coronavirus pandemic and Federal Reserve officials are working to help the economy rebound quickly once businesses that were shuttered because of the virus begin to reopen, two policymakers said Friday.

Headlines: Saudi crown prince, Russia's Putin discuss efforts to stabilize oil markets: SPA
Description: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince and Russian President Vladimir Putin reviewed in a telephone conversation on Friday the efforts to achieve stability of energy markets to support the growth of the global economy, Saudi state news agency (SPA) reported.

Headlines: How COVID-19 affected U.S. consumer prices in March
Description: Coast-to-coast shutdowns of businesses and stay-at-home orders from the effort to contain the new coronavirus pandemic took their toll on U.S. consumer prices in March, sending them down by the most in five years.

Headlines: G20 ministers to propose task force on next steps to help oil market: India
Description: G20 energy ministers in their joint statement will propose setting up a task force to advise ministers on the steps needed to stabilise the oil markets amid the coronavirus pandemic, India's oil ministry said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Japan's battle with pandemic may mark end of Abe's fiscal experiment
Description: The huge cost of the coronavirus pandemic is upending Japan's seven-year experiment to rescue the economy from its debt timebomb, as recession fears prompt calls for "helicopter money" - unlimited spending bankrolled by the central bank.

Headlines: Trump says he is speeding help to farmers hurt by coronavirus dislocation
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he has directed his agriculture secretary to expedite help to farmers, especially small farmers, hurt by the economic disruption caused by the new coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Trump: 'Have to save the airlines!'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that American airlines must be saved, as his administration prepares to give them details this weekend about the terms of a $32 billion payroll grant to offset the impact of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: Italy's government set to reappoint Eni and Enel CEOs - source
Description: The chief executives of Italy's top two energy groups Eni and Enel are on course to secure third terms next week when Rome decides on roles at key state-controlled companies, a senior government official said.

Headlines: Warehouse workers risk COVID-19 to ship Gucci shades, face cream, sofas
Description: As U.S. authorities ordered shutdowns of non-essential businesses to fight coronavirus, retailer Nordstrom Inc closed hundreds of stores and gave in-store workers three weeks’ pay, calling their safety its top priority.

Headlines: Airlines want U.S. Treasury to scrap proposal to make some grant money repayable
Description: Major U.S. airlines were urging Treasury officials and the federal government's outside advisers on Saturday to scrap or revise a proposal that would make part of the $25 billion earmarked by Congress to help keep workers on the payroll repayable in the form of low-cost loans.

Headlines: Siemens CEO rules out job cuts from coronavirus impact
Description: Siemens will not cut its workforce because of the economic downturn triggered by the new coronavirus, Chief Executive Joe Kaeser said, although short-time working measures could be extended in Germany.

Headlines: Apple, Google plan software to slow virus, joining global debate on tracking
Description: Apple Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google said on Friday that they will work together to create contact tracing technology that aims to slow the spread of the coronavirus by allowing users to opt into logging other phones they have been near.

Headlines: Boeing supplier furloughs 2,300 employees on closure of Boeing facilities amid COVID-19
Description: U.S. aero parts maker Triumph Group Inc said it was furloughing about 2,300 employees across its U.S. and European plants for two to four weeks to cut capacity linked to Boeing commercial aircraft programs amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Kia Motors considers halting three South Korean plants as virus hits exports
