Description: As the U.S. quarterly earnings season picks up steam this week, investors are getting a glimpse of how companies are weathering the coronavirus outbreak, including the strength of their balance sheets.

Headlines: Next round of coronavirus business aid to be as fair as possible: Kudlow
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Wednesday said the Trump administration would try to fairly distribute the next round of aid for small businesses hurt by the coronavirus outbreak, saying demand for the first round of funding was "overwhelming."

Headlines: U.S. Treasury market faces structural issues even as liquidity improves
Description: The recent liquidity crisis in the $17 trillion U.S. Treasury market has exposed structural problems that are unlikely to be fixed any time soon, which could lead to new bouts of volatility and make it more costly for the U.S. government to sell bonds.

Headlines: Brent crude rebounds from more-than 20-year low; U.S. oil up 20% in wild trade
Description: Brent crude oil rebounded from two days of losses and U.S. futures surged on Wednesday, bolstered by tentative talk of additional supply cuts from OPEC producers and U.S. inventory builds that were less dire than some expected.

Headlines: Securities group asks SEC to intervene for brokers in audit-trail database fight
Description: U.S. brokers should not be forced to sign an agreement that could make them liable for breaches of a massive new industry trading database that they have no control over, a leading financial industry trade group told regulators on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. securities regulator warns investors over Chinese company disclosures
Description: The head of the U.S. securities regulator on Wednesday warned investors against putting money into Chinese companies as they rebalance their portfolios following market turmoil due to ongoing problems with those companies' disclosures.

Headlines: Facebook bets on India with $5.7 billion Reliance deal
Description: Facebook is set to spend $5.7 billion to buy a 9.99% stake in Reliance Industries' digital arm, as it looks to roll out services for India's grocers and small businesses by capitalizing on WhatsApp's extensive reach in the country.

Headlines: EU says air travel will need social distancing, U.S. airlines taking their own steps
Description: The European Commission will next month present a set of rules for the safe reopening of air travel when coronavirus lockdowns end, including social distancing in airports and planes, while some U.S. airlines are taking their own protective measures.

Headlines: Air France-KLM nears bailout with improved guarantees: sources
Description: Air France-KLM is moving towards a 10 billion euro ($10.9 billion) government-backed rescue deal, sources said, after France agreed to higher guarantees on loans designed to tide the airline group through the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Google says state-backed hackers increasing coronavirus phishing attacks
Description: Security experts at Alphabet Inc's Google have identified more than a dozen government-backed hacking groups using the COVID-19 pandemic as cover for phishing and malware attempts.

Headlines: Georgia tests boundaries of life post-pandemic with 'risky' reopening
Description: A handful of mostly southern U.S. states will begin loosening economic restrictions this week in the midst of a still virulent pandemic, providing a live-fire test of whether America's communities can start to reopen without triggering a surge that may force them to close again.

Headlines: IKEA opens half of stores in Israel after lockdown eased
Description: IKEA, the world’s biggest furniture brand, opened three of its six stores in Israel on Wednesday after the government started to gradually ease its coronavirus lockdown.

Headlines: Daimler resumes engine production at Mercedes in Germany
Description: Mercedes-Benz is ramping up engine production at its plant in Bad Cannstatt, Stuttgart, this week after Germany eased lockdown measures in a sign Europe's largest economy is getting back to work after the coronavirus brought the country to a standstill.

Headlines: Housing regulator offers further support for mortgage-finance companies
Description: The U.S. housing regulator on Wednesday announced its second step in as many days to help ease the liquidity strain in the mortgage market.

Headlines: Bankruptcy looms over U.S. energy industry, from oil fields to pipelines
Description: U.S. shale producers, refiners and pipeline companies are scrambling for cash and face likely restructuring as they struggle under heavy debt loads while engulfed in the worst crisis the oil industry has faced.

Headlines: GM ignition switch settlement with vehicle owners wins U.S. court approval
Description: General Motors Co on Thursday won preliminary U.S. court approval of a $120 million settlement with owners who said defective ignition switches caused their vehicles to lose value.

Headlines: Millions of Americans join unemployment line as coronavirus savages economy
Description: A stunning 26.5 million Americans have sought unemployment benefits since mid-March, confirming that all the jobs gained during the longest employment boom in U.S. history have been wiped out as the novel coronavirus savages the economy.

Headlines: Drowning in crude, U.S. drillers say Trump strategic reserve plan is no lifeline
Description: President Donald Trump's plan to fill the U.S. emergency crude oil stockpile has become the centerpiece of his administration's strategy to shield drillers from a meltdown in energy demand - but company officials and industry groups say the program has been too slow and won't be enough to save them.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales tumble in March
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes dropped by the most in more than 6-1/2 years in March and further declines are likely as the novel coronavirus outbreak batters the economy and throws millions of Americans out of work.

Headlines: Empty kitchens, closed stores: Small China firms struggle to cope with epidemic fallout
Description: Ma Xinli has shut four of his clothing stores and expects to close another three by mid-June. Unsold winter stock is now hard to sell, there's no money to buy summer clothing, and rent and staff salaries still need paying.

Headlines: Tyson to shutter beef facility as workers undergo coronavirus testing
Description: A Tyson Foods Inc unit said on Thursday it will temporarily halt production at a beef facility in Pasco, Washington, adding to the meat processing plant the company has had to shutter as it tests workers for COVID-19.

Headlines: U.S.'s Mnuchin considers lending program for struggling oil companies: Bloomberg News
Description: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said he is considering a government lending program for U.S. oil companies looking for federal aid as they cope with a devastating plunge in prices, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Eli Lilly lifts 2020 profit forecast; coronavirus fuels stockpiling of its medicines
Description: Eli Lilly and Co raised the top-end of its 2020 profit forecast on Thursday and reported better-than-expected quarterly results, as customers stocking up medicines such as diabetes drug Trulicity during the coronavirus pandemic boosted sales.

Headlines: L Brands files complaint against Sycamore for backing out of Victoria's Secret deal
Description: L Brands Inc filed a legal complaint against Sycamore Partners on Thursday, after the buyout firm walked away from a $525 million deal to acquire a majority stake in the company's Victoria's Secret lingerie brand.

Headlines: More U.S. companies return payroll loans after new Treasury guidance
Description: U.S. companies on Thursday began refusing government loans they were just awarded, after the Treasury Department said that publicly traded firms would have a hard time proving they really needed the coronavirus relief funds.

Headlines: Exclusive: Argentina plans higher local oil price to protect sector amid rout - sources
Description: Argentina plans to issue a decree setting a higher local oil barrel price to protect the domestic industry from being further decimated by a collapse in global prices and slumping fuel demand due to the coronavirus pandemic, two industry sources told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. coronavirus deaths top 49,000, averaging 2,000 lives lost a day: Reuters tally
Description: U.S. coronavirus deaths topped 49,000 on Thursday as the number of lives lost in April rises by an average of 2,000 a day, according to a Reuters tally.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to restart van production at Atessa plant at 70% normal rate: union
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) aims to restart van production at its Atessa joint venture plant in central Italy at 70% of the normal rate, a union representative told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Sweden's Volvo hit by cancelled orders as pandemic creates 'new normal'
Description: Sweden's AB Volvo on Thursday warned of stalling truck orders and a challenging adjustment to a "new normal" of feebler demand after reporting a smaller-than-expected fall in quarterly operating earnings helped by service sales.

Headlines: Volkswagen making masks in China for its staff at European plants
Description: Volkswagen AG is making masks in China for distribution to Volkswagen plant employees in Europe, the German automaker said on Thursday as it prepares to restart European production.

Headlines: China's BYD, Toyota's Hino partner in electric commercial vehicles
Description: Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD said on Thursday it has partnered with Toyota-owned truck maker Hino Motors to develop electric commercial vehicles, as BYD deepens electric collaboration with Japan's top automaker.

Headlines: U.S. bank investors put on mute as shareholder meetings go virtual
Description: Often rowdy and confrontational, this year's bank shareholder meetings have so far been brief and uneventful as the annual gatherings move online amid U.S. coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: UniCredit appoints Hecker as global head of equity capital markets
Description: UniCredit has appointed Jana Hecker, formerly at Deutsche Bank, as its global head of equity capital markets (ECM), Italy's biggest bank said on Thursday.

Headlines: 'Plain robbery': Lebanese fume as dollar savings hit by financial crisis
Description: Ziad Abdallah has watched with growing alarm as Lebanon's financial meltdown has threatened the savings he spent 25 years building up in his dollar account.

Headlines: Reeling Oklahoma oil producers win right to keep leases while wells shut
Description: Oklahoma's energy regulator said on Wednesday that oil producers could close wells without losing their leases, the first victory for struggling U.S. companies seeking relief from states after the market crash.

Headlines: U.S. business activity hits fresh record lows amid coronavirus lockdowns
Description: U.S. business activity plumbed new record lows in April as the novel coronavirus severely disrupted manufacturing and services industry production, pushing the economy into uncharted waters.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to restart some European output from mid-May
Description: Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) will restart some production in Europe from May 18, including at one of its three British car plants and its factory in Slovakia, where the new Defender vehicle is being made.

Headlines: U.S. air fares extend decline as Europe and Asia bottom out: Skytra
Description: U.S. air fares are approaching a 40% decline and still falling while ticket pricing in Europe and Asia is bottoming out, according to data (https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fskytra.airbus.com%2Fpresses%2Fcovid-19-impact-on-global-air-travel-23-april&data=02%7C01%7Claurence.frost%40thomsonreuters.com%7C055642bce03940d42daa08d7e7506926%7C62ccb8646a1a4b5d8e1c397dec1a8258%7C0%7C0%7C637232205851692896&sdata=4pmLAkgTrbI3eIrGBJs3MLzdd02jRr%2B1OGrap3AfKM

Headlines: U.S. House to pass nearly $500 billion more in coronavirus relief
Description: Hundreds of members of the U.S. House of Representatives will gather in Washington on Thursday to pass a $484 billion coronavirus relief bill, bringing the unprecedented total of funds approved for the crisis to nearly $3 trillion.

Headlines: Cash is king as U.S. quarterly reporting season gains steam
Description: With the U.S. quarterly earnings season picking up steam this week, investors have caught a glimpse of how companies are weathering the coronavirus outbreak, including the strength of their balance sheets.

Headlines: Democrats urge U.S. to provide at least $5 billion in loans to bus industry
Description: Two senior U.S. House Democrats on Friday asked the U.S. Treasury and Federal Reserve to direct at least $5 billion in loans to struggling intercity bus companies because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street curtails corporate lending in Europe to put America first: sources
Description: U.S. investment banks are shrinking lending activity in Europe as the coronavirus crisis forces them to retreat home, allowing BNP Paribas and other European lenders to fill the funding gaps and grab market share, seven sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Doubts gather over Boeing-Embraer deal as deadline nears: sources
Description: A $4.2 billion deal for Boeing to buy the civil jetmaking arm of Brazil's Embraer has hit a roadblock over implementation, threatening its collapse barring a last-minute breakthrough on Friday, people familiar with the talks said.

Headlines: Polish airline PLL LOT cancels flights until May 15
Description: Poland's state-owned airline PLL LOT has cancelled all passenger flights until May 15 citing the government's and European Union's air traffic and border restrictions, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump signs fourth coronavirus relief bill into law, pushes back against USPS aid
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday signed a nearly $500 billon coronavirus relief bill into law to expand loans for small businesses reeling from the outbreak, as his Treasury secretary promised surveillance to stop bigger companies from accessing the funds.

Headlines: AT&T names new CEO as Trump gloats over changes at CNN owner
Description: Veteran John Stankey will take over as AT&T chief executive officer, the company said on Friday, as the U.S. telecommunications and media giant grapples with the impact of the coronavirus outbreak and its late entrance into the global streaming wars.

Headlines: Explainer: How the U.S. could use taxpayer dollars to save oil and energy companies
Description: The U.S. federal government is looking at "a whole bunch of alternatives" to support oil and other energy companies, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday as the industry struggles with plummeting prices and demand as the coronavirus crushes economic activity.

Headlines: French court backs workers in Amazon row over virus measures
Description: A French court on Friday rejected Amazon's appeal against a ruling that restricts what it can deliver during the coronavirus crisis, handing a victory to unions that had criticised the U.S. e-commerce giant's safety measures.

Headlines: U.S. weighs taking equity stakes in U.S. energy companies, Mnuchin says
Description: The U.S. government is considering taking equity stakes in U.S. energy companies as it seeks to help the nation's oil and gas sector amid the coronavirus outbreak, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday.

Headlines: GM's mask operation: a glimpse into the factory of the coronavirus era
Description: Before the coronavirus outbreak shut them down, U.S. auto factories were hectic workplaces where men and women worked side by side along fast-moving assembly lines, ate in crowded break areas, and jostled in and out of gates as they changed shifts.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trial of Gilead's potential coronavirus treatment running ahead of schedule, researcher says
Description: A key U.S. government trial of Gilead Sciences Inc's experimental coronavirus treatment may yield results as early as mid-May, according to the study's lead investigator, after doctors clamored to enroll their patients in the study.

Headlines: Airbnb booking data from China offers glimpse of a rebound
Description: While the coronavirus pandemic has frozen global travel and hit the travel industry hard, data from home-sharing startup Airbnb Inc shows the number of domestic bookings in China for the first half of April were up more than 200% compared with the same period in March.

Headlines: Brazil JBS workers catch COVID-19 in latest meat plant outbreak
Description: A JBS SA poultry plant in southern Brazil was hit by an outbreak of COVID-19, according to labor prosecutors, marking the first large-scale infection at a Brazilian meat plant.

Headlines: Stocks struggle with muddled government pandemic responses
Description: Global equity benchmarks struggled on Friday as some U.S. states began reopening businesses despite the disapproval of health experts, and as the European Union put off addressing details of its new economic rescue plan.

Headlines: U.S. deficit could quadruple to $3.7 trillion in coronavirus crisis: CBO
Description: A nationwide business shutdown and surge in U.S. government spending will nearly quadruple the federal deficit to a record $3.7 trillion this fiscal year as the country combats the coronavirus pandemic, congressional forecasters said on Friday.

Headlines: Oil rises, but ends wild week lower as coronavirus slashes fuel demand
Description: Oil prices rose on Friday, bringing an end to another week of losses that featured the U.S. contract plunging to minus $40 a barrel, as global production cuts could not keep pace with the collapse in demand caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: United mandates masks for flight attendants, unions want passengers included
Description: All United Airlines flight attendants must wear a face covering or mask while on duty starting April 24, the airline said on Thursday, one of the first major U.S. carriers to make such a requirement.

Headlines: Spanish court orders Ryanair to reinstate 224 dismissed workers
Description: Spain's High Court ordered Ryanair on Friday to reinstate 224 workers collectively dismissed from four bases in the country, saying the reasons given by the airline for seeking to close the bases did not justify such a move.

Headlines: Eight Thai airlines seek $770 million government assistance
Description: Thailand’s budget and full-service carriers are seeking soft-loans worth 25 billion baht ($770.65 million) from the government to support their businesses amid the coronavirus outbreak, an airline executive said on Friday.

Headlines: French court to rule on Amazon union spat as vendors struggle
Description: A French court will on Friday decide whether to back Amazon's appeal against an order to restrict the goods it can deliver, which led it to close its warehouses in France and left many small firms struggling to ship products.

Headlines: Main Street's mainstays: How some U.S. states tapped crisis loans
Description: As the coronavirus crisis gripped the U.S. economy and Congress approved hundreds of billions of dollars in emergency small business loans, Utah builder Clark Ivory knew what to tell his local colleagues.

Headlines: U.S. oil firm Continental Resources halts shale output, seeks to cancel sales
Description: The largest oil producer in North Dakota has halted most of its production in the U.S. state and notified some customers it would not supply crude after prices dived into negative territory this week, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Swatch CEO says China sales rise but global situation still grim
Description: Swatch Group's sales at its own stores in China are up by almost a quarter during April, the watchmaker's Chief Executive Nick Hayek told Blick newspaper, but the global situation following the coronavirus outbreak remains tough.

Headlines: Korean Air to get up to $971 million support from state-owned banks
Description: Two state-owned banks in South Korea said on Friday they would provide up to 1.2 trillion won ($971 million) in liquidity to support Korean Air Lines Co Ltd as the aviation industry reels from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Facebook's big India deal portends a bruising time for SoftBank-backed Paytm
Description: Facebook's $5.7 billion investment in Reliance promises to be the biggest headache yet for Paytm, a SoftBank-backed pioneer in India's digital payments market but which has been losing ground to rivals with deeper pockets.

Headlines: Halliburton follows Chevron in halting Venezuelan operations
Description: Oilfield services provider Halliburton Co said on Friday it would cease most of its operations in Venezuela after the U.S. Treasury Department imposed tight new regulations on oil and gas companies doing business in the South American nation.

Headlines: FCA to resume preparatory operations at Melfi plant in Italy from Monday
Description: An average of 750 workers of Fiat Chrysler Melfi assembly plant in southern Italy will be back to work next week to prepare the facility for the final development of the group's new hybrid cars, a union representative said on Friday.

Headlines: Apple, Google update coronavirus contact tracing tech ahead of launch
Description: Apple Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google on Friday updated technical details of the coronavirus contact tracing system they plan to release next month, saying new features would strengthen privacy protections and give health authorities more detailed data.

Headlines: Greene King furloughs over 36,000 employees as pandemic shuts pubs
Description: British pub operator Greene King has furloughed more than 36,000 employees, owner CK Asset Holdings said on Friday, as government measures to halt the spread of the coronavirus has led to the closure of all its pubs in the UK.

Headlines: Norway approves new law that could help rescue Norwegian Air
Description: Norway's parliament voted through a new company restructuring law on Friday that could help save Norwegian Air and many other companies from potential bankruptcy as a result of the restrictions to stem the spread of COVID-19.

Headlines: U.S. airlines receive extra $9.5 billion in payroll support: U.S. Treasury
Description: The U.S. Treasury Department said on Saturday it has released $9.5 billion in additional funds from the Payroll Support Program to U.S. air carriers, bringing to $12.4 billion the total provided to the airline sector hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump threatens to block aid for U.S. Postal Service if it does not raise prices for Amazon
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday threatened to block federal aid for the U.S. Postal Service unless it raises shipping rates for online companies like Amazon.com, prompting criticism that the move would hurt consumers relying more than usual on packages during the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. will cap how much each bank can lend under emergency coronavirus program: memo
Description: The U.S. government notified lenders on Sunday that it will cap how much each bank can lend under the emergency loan program designed to keep workers on payrolls amid the coronavirus pandemic, hours ahead of the reopening of the lending program.

Headlines: Starbucks says in partnership with Sequoia Capital China for investments
Description: Starbucks on Monday said it has entered a strategic partnership with investment firm Sequoia Capital China that will see the two companies make strategic co-investments in China's technology sector.

Headlines: U.S. economy faces historic shock, with 16% joblessness possible, Trump adviser says
Description: The shuttering of the U.S. economy due to the coronavirus pandemic is a shock of historic proportions that will likely push the national unemployment rate to 16% or higher this month and require more stimulus to ensure a strong rebound, a White House economic adviser said on Sunday.

Headlines: German government divided over form of Lufthansa rescue deal
Description: Germany's ruling coalition is divided over whether the state should have a role in running airline Lufthansa in return for a rescue package the company aims to finalise next week, politicians said on Sunday.

Headlines: When oil became waste: a week of turmoil for crude, and more pain to come
Description: The magnitude of how damaged the energy industry is came into full view on April 20 when the benchmark price of U.S. oil futures, which had never dropped below $10 a barrel in its nearly 40-year history, plunged to a previously unthinkable minus $38 a barrel.

Headlines: European carmakers restart production as coronavirus lockdowns ease
Description: Volkswagen will restart production at its Wolfsburg factory in Germany on Monday, the latest of a fleet of European carmakers to take advantage of eased coronavirus lockdown rules to resume manufacturing.

Headlines: Daimler says China business picks up again: report
Description: Mercedes-Benz maker Daimler has seen business stabilise in China after the country ended coronavirus lockdowns, a senior manager at the German carmaker told a newspaper on Sunday.

Headlines: Poland's LOT in talks to convert Boeing Dreamliners for freight
Description: Polish airline LOT is in talks with Boeing to modify its 787 Dreamliner jets into temporary cargo carriers, a LOT spokesman told Reuters, in a move that could help to narrow losses from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler resumes van production in Atessa, some other Italian operations
Description: Fiat Chrysler resumed van production on Monday at its Atessa plant in central Italy, a week before the country plans to start lifting a national lockdown put in place to limit the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: Investors to challenge Neiman Marcus bankruptcy loan, push for sale - sources
Description: An investor group that comprises investment firm Mudrick Capital Management LP and Daniel Loeb's hedge fund Third Point LLC plans to challenge a $600 million financing package that Neiman Marcus Group has lined up for its looming bankruptcy, and will push the U.S. department store operator to sell itself, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: U.S. oil plunges 25%, Brent falls below $20 a barrel
Description: Brent crude fell below $20 a barrel and U.S. crude plunged 25% on Monday, driven lower by skittish investors fleeing the U.S. benchmark due to lack of available storage to deal with a coronavirus-induced collapse in demand.

Headlines: Adidas says worse to come as profits and sales plunge
Description: Adidas warned of an even bigger hit to second-quarter sales and profits from coronavirus lockdowns, after the German sportswear firm reported first-quarter earnings were almost wiped out and said it had not yet seen a full rebound in China.

Headlines: Shares jump on lockdown easing hopes; oil drops further
Description: Stocks rose across the globe on Monday as investors cheered news that more countries and U.S. states were looking to ease lockdowns and the Bank of Japan expanded its stimulus program, while the price of oil continued to crumble as storage runs out.

Headlines: Boeing says it will need to borrow more money on coronavirus fallout
Description: Boeing Co will need to borrow more money over the next six months and does not expect to pay dividends again for years, as the U.S. planemaker wrestles with industry fallout from the coronavirus and the grounding of its 737 MAX jet, chief executive Dave Calhoun told shareholders on Monday.

Headlines: Scrutiny mounts on China's Luckin Coffee as market regulator inspects
Description: China's top market regulator has launched an inspection into Luckin Coffee , joining the country's securities watchdog in doing so as the coffee chain comes under scrutiny for fabricating millions of dollars worth of sales deals.

Headlines: GM, Ford and Fiat Chrysler target May 18 U.S. restart date: WSJ
Description: General Motors Co , Ford Motor Co and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV are targeting May 18 to resume some production at their U.S. factories after shutting down plants in March due to the coronavirus outbreak, the Wall Street Journal reported.

Headlines: U.S. wireless firms extend concessions for coronavirus-hit till June 30
Description: Major U.S. wireless firms said on Monday they will extend a commitment through June 30 not to cancel service or charge late fees to customers who have been impacted by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Tech issues hobble U.S. banks' mad grab for $310 billion in new small-business aid
Description: U.S. banks beginning another chaotic dash to grab $310 billion in fresh small-business aid released by the government on Monday were hamstrung after 11th-hour changes to the first-come-first-served program caused technology issues for many lenders.

Headlines: U.S. health insurers benefit as elective care cuts offset coronavirus costs
Description: As Americans delay elective surgeries and avoid doctors and hospitals during the coronavirus pandemic, healthcare spending declines have more than offset the added costs of COVID-19 care, insurance executives and experts say, boosting U.S. health insurer profits.

Headlines: Many U.S. businesses unlikely to seek government aid: NABE survey
Description: A majority of U.S. companies expect to stay afloat for more than six months without government assistance, according to a survey on Monday, even though the novel coronavirus outbreak has severely disrupted economic activity and hit cash flow.

Headlines: U.S. firm, FAW to build sports cars under Chairman Mao's favoured brand Hongqi
Description: A little-known U.S.-based engineering and design firm said it plans to invest 10 billion yuan ($1.41 billion) to make sports cars with China's FAW Group under the brand of choice of late revolutionary leader Chairman Mao Zedong, Hongqi.

Headlines: No decision yet on state aid for Germany's Lufthansa: minister
Description: Berlin will decide on state support for Lufthansa once the country's largest airline applies for aid and all facts are on the table, the German Economy Minister said on Monday.

Headlines: German airline Condor to receive loans worth 550 million euros: government
Description: The German government and the federal state of Hesse have agreed to provide Condor with loans worth 550 million euros ($596.31 million), the economy minister said on Monday, after the owner of Poland's LOT pulled out of a deal to buy the airline.

Headlines: GE's coronavirus troubles likely to hit power business, not just aviation
Description: Quarantines and lockdowns at large U.S. power plants are threatening to squeeze a multibillion-dollar slice of revenue that General Electric Co is counting on to help lift profits.

Headlines: Investors bet on testing, treatments for restart of U.S. economy
Description: Investors are pinning their hopes for the reopening of the U.S. economy on the potential for wider availability of testing for COVID-19 cases and on drug trials for treatments of the deadly disease but said, until there is concrete progress in these areas, further stock market gains may be limited.

Headlines: Norway now in formal talks with Thyssenkrupp over new submarines
Description: Norway has started formal talks with the shipbuilding division of Thyssenkrupp for the construction of new submarines and expects to conclude the negotiations this year, the Norwegian defence ministry said on Monday.

Headlines: Thai Airways to press ahead with maintenance facility after Airbus withdraws
Description: State-owned Thai Airways International Pcl will press on with a project to build a $339 million maintenance facility east of Bangkok after partner Airbus dropped out due to the coronavirus outbreak, a senior official said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump to meet with textile makers as companies shift to masks, gowns: Navarro
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will meet with American textile industry representatives on Monday as clothiers seek to shift their production lines to face masks and other critical items amid the coronavirus outbreak, the White House said.

Headlines: Nissan plans to slash Japan May car output by 78% vs last year, June: documents
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor Co Ltd plans to slash the number of cars it produces at home in May by 78% from last year, as the impact of the coronavirus shakes the troubled automaker which has already been struggling with falling sales.

Headlines: Any aid for Germany's Lufthansa must have strings attached: senior SPD lawmaker
Description: Any state support for Germany's largest airline, Lufthansa , must come with strings attached, a senior legislator for the Social Democrats said, suggesting that management should be banned from receiving dividends or bonuses.

Headlines: Broadcom offers to scrap exclusivity deals to end EU antitrust probe
Description: U.S. chipmaker Broadcom has offered to scrap its exclusivity deals with TV and modem makers to end an EU antitrust investigation and stave off a possible hefty fine.

Headlines: H&M set to permanently close eight shops in Italy
Description: Sweden's H&M is set to permanently close eight of its Italian stores, including two in the country's fashion capital Milan, as it pushes ahead with plans that pre-date the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence, exports sink amid coronavirus disruptions
Description: U.S. consumer confidence tumbled to near a six-year low in April as tough measures to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus sharply disrupted economic activity and threw millions of Americans out of work.

Headlines: Russia's Yandex.Taxi targets continued profitability even as rides plummet
Description: Yandex.Taxi, the ride-hailing arm of Russian internet giant Yandex , is hoping to remain profitable in the second half of this year despite a sharp drop in sales as coronavirus restrictions keep people across the country at home.

Headlines: U.S. banks battle technology issues in race for $310 billion in new small-business aid
Description: U.S. bankers racing to grab $310 billion in fresh small-business aid worked through the night on Tuesday, with many battling ongoing technology problems created by 11th hour changes to the first-come-first-served program, multiple bankers said.

Headlines: Millions of Americans locked out of unemployment system, survey finds
Description: Millions of Americans who have been thrown out of work during the coronavirus pandemic have been unable to register for unemployment benefits since the U.S. economy entered a free fall, according to a poll released on Tuesday.

Headlines: Lufthansa may seek creditor protection alongside Berlin rescue talks
Description: Lufthansa might seek some form of protection from creditors while talking to the Berlin government about a 9 billion euro ($9.76 billion) rescue package, a company source said on Tuesday after government and airline sources said talks on a deal were continuing.

Headlines: Coming U.S. shale results will test extent of oil hedges, output cuts
Description: As low crude oil prices leave U.S. producers struggling to eke out profits, investors will focus on production hedges and cost-cuts to determine winners from losers as first quarter earnings roll out in coming days.

Headlines: Brent settles higher on hopes of easing lockdowns, U.S. crude falls amid storage shortage
Description: U.S. crude prices settled about 3% lower on Tuesday after data showing domestic stockpiles didn't rise as high as had been expected given tightening storage, despite pledges to cut production from May 1.

Headlines: Alphabet warns of difficult quarter as consumers Google pandemic, not shopping
Description: Alphabet Inc on Tuesday beat analysts' estimate for quarterly revenue as its Google unit posted double-digit advertising growth despite the economic slowdown from the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Starbucks expects China recovery by September as coronavirus seen easing
Description: Starbucks Corp said on Tuesday it sees sales in China, the company's biggest growth market, recovering by the end of September, following a massive drop in same-store sales in the current quarter on fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, which forced Starbucks to close stores around the globe.

Headlines: Health advisers to U.S. auto union say masks not enough to shield workers from coronavirus
Description: As Detroit's automakers seek to restart their U.S. plants during the coronavirus pandemic, two health experts advising Michigan's governor and the United Auto Workers union warned against an over-reliance on masks and face shields to keep workers safe.

Headlines: Merck sees $2.1 billion coronavirus hit to 2020 sales
Description: Merck & Co Inc said on Tuesday it expects the coronavirus pandemic to reduce 2020 sales by more than $2 billion, and the U.S. drugmaker lowered its profit forecast as a big drop in doctors' office visits during the outbreak will take a hefty toll, sending its shares down more than 3%.

Headlines: With virus war still raging, Fed peers out of the foxhole
Description: The Federal Reserve has two core jobs assigned by Congress: Foster maximum employment and stable prices.

Headlines: Bayer faces second investor reckoning over glyphosate litigation
Description: Bayer on Tuesday faces its second annual investor reckoning over its handling of a wave of U.S. lawsuits claiming its glyphosate-based weedkillers cause cancer.

Headlines: UK corporate profitability hit 10-year low in late 2019
Description: British companies' profitability dropped to its lowest in more than a decade in the final three months of 2019, when concerns about Brexit and political uncertainty - rather than the coronavirus - were to the fore, official data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Spanish government considering loans for Iberia: El Pais
Description: The Spanish government is considering granting soft loans to flagship airline Iberia, a unit of London-listed International Consolidated Airlines Group , newspaper El Pais reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. goods trade deficit rises as auto exports tumble
Description: The U.S. goods trade deficit widened in March amid a collapse in exports of motor vehicles and parts, but overall imports continued to decline likely as the novel coronavirus outbreak disrupted the flow of goods.

Headlines: China discounts, cheaper iPhone to cushion Apple from virus blow to demand
Description: Apple Inc's discounts on the iPhone 11 in China and the release of a new low-price SE model have put the company in a better position than rivals to weather a coronavirus-related plunge in global smartphone demand.

Headlines: U.S. insurers want taxpayers to back pandemic coverage for businesses
Description: The U.S. insurance industry is promoting the idea of an insurance plan backed by the federal government that would help businesses that in the future suffer losses from a pandemic, people familiar with the effort told Reuters.

Headlines: Amazon's foreign websites named in U.S. piracy and counterfeiting report
Description: Several of Amazon.com Inc's foreign websites have been added to the U.S. trade regulator's "Notorious Markets" report on marketplaces known for counterfeiting and piracy concerns.

Headlines: JetBlue, Delta seek U.S. OK to suspend flights to 25 U.S. airports
Description: Delta Air Lines , JetBlue Airways Corp and Spirit Airlines on Tuesday asked the U.S. Transportation Department for approval to suspend flights to more than two dozen U.S. airports.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chesapeake Energy preparing bankruptcy filing
Description: Chesapeake Energy Corp, the oil and gas exploration and production company that was at the forefront of the past decade's U.S. shale boom, is preparing a potential bankruptcy filing as it grapples with an unprecedented rout in energy prices, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Canopy Growth Corp to lay off 200 employees
Description: Canadian pot producer Canopy Growth Corp said on Wednesday it would lay off 200 employees in North America and the UK, according to an internal announcement seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Tyson Foods temporarily pauses operations at beef facility in Dakota City
Description: Tyson Foods Inc is halting operations at a beef facility in Dakota City, Nebraska until May 4 to complete a deep cleaning of the plant amid the coronavirus outbreak, a unit of the largest U.S. meat supplier said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon turns to Chinese firm on U.S. blacklist to meet thermal camera needs
Description: Amazon.com Inc has bought cameras to take temperatures of workers during the coronavirus pandemic from a firm the United States blacklisted over allegations it helped China detain and monitor Uighurs and other Muslim minorities, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Coronavirus savages U.S. economy in first quarter; bigger hit still to come
Description: The U.S. economy contracted in the first quarter at its sharpest pace since the Great Recession as stringent measures to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus almost shut down the country, ending the longest expansion in the nation's history.

Headlines: U.S. economy faces hard slog back from pandemic, Fed chief says
Description: The head of the Federal Reserve on Wednesday dashed lingering hopes for a fast rebound from the coronavirus pandemic, saying the U.S. economy could feel the weight of consumer fear and social distancing for a year or more in a prolonged climb from a deepening hole.

Headlines: VW, Toyota delay U.S. production restart, citing supplier concerns
Description: Volkswagen AG and Toyota Motor Corp said on Wednesday they will delay restarting U.S. production amid the coronavirus pandemic and concerns about the automotive supply network.

Headlines: Austria says it might demand Lufthansa stake for Austrian Airlines aid
Description: Austria might demand a stake in Lufthansa in exchange for granting emergency aid to the German flag carrier's unit Austrian Airlines, the country's conservative chancellor, Sebastian Kurz, said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies on promising coronavirus drug
Description: U.S. stocks surged on Wednesday as hopes for an effective COVID-19 treatment prompted a broad rally and helped investors shrug off bleak GDP data and words of warning from U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell.

Headlines: Toilet paper trophy hunters on a roll as U.S. shortages start easing
Description: U.S. consumers have begun spotting rare Quilted Northern and Charmin toilet paper rolls on store shelves across the United States, as stocks start building after weeks of severe shortages.

Headlines: Lufthansa's Belgian carrier suspends flights until June 1
Description: Belgium’s Brussels Airlines, a Lufthansa (LHAG.DE) subsidiary, has extended its suspension of flights until June 1, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: White House official warns of negative shocks before rebound later in 2020
Description: Top Trump adminstration officials on Tuesday predicted a strong economic rebound in the fourth quarter as the coronavirus fades, but a senior White House adviser warned that near-term unemployment and GDP data will be a "very grave" negative shock.

Headlines: White House adviser sees 'cash' phase of economic rescue winding down
Description: With the U.S. economy poised for a sharp rebound, it is time for policy to move from a "cash" rescue phase to focus on more long-term measures that can underpin growth, a top White House adviser said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Minority businesses worry they are locked out of payroll lending program
Description: As the government issues a second round of aid for small business owners, some U.S. senators, community banking groups and minority-owned banks said they are worried businesses owned by people of color may miss out on receiving much-needed loans.

Headlines: McConnell says business protection a condition for next COVID bill
Description: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Wednesday doubled down on his demand that Congress protect businesses from coronavirus-related liabilities in its next legislative package for combating the pandemic.

Headlines: Samsung's phone fortunes wane as COVID-19 hits 5G phones in Europe and U.S.
Description: When the coronavirus outbreak in China disrupted global smartphone production in February, Samsung looked set to weather the crisis better than most thanks to its limited exposure there and launches of pricey 5G phones. Its fortunes are reversing.

Headlines: Boeing to cut staff by 10% amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: Boeing Co CEO Dave Calhoun told employees on Wednesday that the largest U.S. planemaker is reducing the size of its workforce by about 10% amid a steep fall in travel demand due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Embraer and Boeing's $4.2 billion deal ruled out pandemic as pretext to cancel
Description: Boeing Co's recently aborted $4.2 billion agreement to buy the commercial jet-making operations of Brazil's Embraer specifically forbade either party from calling it off because of a pandemic or a global economic recession, Reuters has found.

Headlines: Italy's airport lobby says social distancing on planes not sustainable
Description: The Italian airport operators association, Assaeroporti, said on Thursday proposals to keep some seats empty on planes for social distancing would not be workable if only imposed by Italy and would make the domestic sector vulnerable to foreign rivals.

Headlines: Fourth stimulus bill may not be needed if states bounce back: White House
Description: A fourth bill to provide stimulus to the U.S. economy may not be needed if states are able to successfully reopen their economies "relatively quickly," as some forecasters and equity markets expect, a White House economic adviser said on Thursday.

Headlines: AT&T brings ad unit Xandr under WarnerMedia ahead of HBO Max launch
Description: AT&T Inc said on Thursday it will bring its advertising unit Xandr under its WarnerMedia label, which is set to launch its streaming channel HBO Max in May.

Headlines: Equality key to rescuing U.S.-China business ties: U.S. business lobby
Description: Recent strains in the relationship between the United States and China make it especially important to establish a policy of 'competitive neutrality' the American Chamber of Commerce in China said on Thursday.

Headlines: Macy's reopening 68 stores, targets all within six weeks as U.S. curbs loosen
Description: Macy's Inc plans to reopen 68 U.S. stores on Monday in states that have loosened coronavirus lockdowns, the department store operator said on Thursday, as more retailers sought to get business going after a crushing month of closures.

Headlines: Ford wants to restart U.S. car plants shut by coronavirus, if it can convince union
Description: Ford Motor Co on Thursday outlined the safety measures it will institute to restart its most profitable U.S. plants amid the coronavirus pandemic, expanding on similar efforts by General Motors Co and Fiat Chrysler to convince leaders of the United Auto Workers union to send members back to work.

Headlines: Biggest U.S. banks says they submitted $45.8 billion in loans for emergency aid program
Description: The two largest U.S. banks, JPMorgan Chase & Co and Bank of America, said on Thursday that they submitted almost half a million applications worth nearly $46 billion to the Small Business Administration's Paycheck Protection Program for small businesses hurt by the coronavirus shutdown.

Headlines: Boeing says will not seek further funds from U.S. govt
Description: Boeing Co has no plans to seek additional funding through the capital markets or from the U.S. government at this time, the planemaker said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: American Airlines, Delta, United to require facial coverings on U.S. flights
Description: Three of the largest four U.S. airlines said Thursday they will require passengers to wear facial coverings on U.S. flights, joining JetBlue Airways Corp in taking the step to address the spread of the coronavirus and convince reluctant passengers to resume flying.

Headlines: Apple sales inch higher despite coronavirus but CEO Tim Cook sees uncertain future
Description: Apple Inc reported sales and profits that beat Wall Street expectations Thursday, with Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook saying China sales were "headed in the right direction" as that country reopens from the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Wall St. caps best month in decades with broad sell-off
Description: U.S. stocks lost ground on Thursday as grim economic data and mixed earnings prompted investors to take profits at the close of the S&P 500's best month in 33 years, a remarkable run driven by expectations the economy will soon start recovering from crushing restrictions enacted to curb the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: BlackRock names London-based executive as new stewardship chief
Description: BlackRock Inc on Thursday said it named London-based financial executive Sandy Boss as its new head of investment stewardship, bringing a more international structure to the top asset manager's voting on topics like climate change and social issues.

Headlines: Oil prices surge on last day of roller-coaster month
Description: Oil prices jumped on Thursday, after several producers said they would cut output and as signs the U.S. crude glut was not growing as quickly as many had feared brought an upbeat close to one of the most volatile months for oil trading in history.

Headlines: Facebook could address some U.S. antitrust concerns with new photo transfer tool
Description: Facebook Inc will allow users in the United States and Canada to transfer photos and videos to a rival tech platform for the first time - a step that could assuage antitrust concerns by giving users an option to easily leave the company's services, the social media network said on Thursday.

Headlines: Ferrari to gradually restart operations from Monday
Description: Luxury carmaker Ferrari said on Thursday it would restart operations at its Maranello and Modena plants on May 4, when Italy is set to start lifting lockdown measures.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nissan shakes off virus woes in China sales with rebound in April - sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co's vehicle sales in China this month almost recovered to the prior year's level after a coronavirus-related 45% plunge in March, two sources with knowledge of the Japanese automaker's preliminary data said.

Headlines: Tesla's Elon Musk calling coronavirus lockdowns 'fascist' overshadows profitable quarter
Description: Tesla Inc's outspoken CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday called sweeping U.S. stay-at-home restrictions to curtail the coronavirus outbreak "fascist" as the electric carmaker posted its third quarterly profit in a row.

Headlines: Fed officials worry about lasting economic scars from crisis
Description: After rolling out trillions of dollars in support for the U.S. economy during the coronavirus pandemic, Federal Reserve officials have begun warning of potentially lasting scars to the workforce and productivity if the recovery is not handled well.

Headlines: Will U.S. exchange trading floors still be relevant post-coronavirus?
Description: The coronavirus pandemic has upended U.S. equities trading with unprecedented market volatility and forced bourses like the New York Stock Exchange to close their trading floors, raising questions about the need for such spaces.

Headlines: Telefonica seeks to merge Britain's O2 and Virgin Media: sources
Description: Spain's Telefonica SA is in talks with billionaire John Malone's Liberty Global Plc to explore a merger of its British mobile operator O2 with Liberty's Virgin Media cable network company, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exxon, Chevron slam brakes on shale as oil demand tumbles
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp and Chevron Corp are slamming the brakes on oil output, as the top two U.S. producers plan for combined global shut-ins of 800,000 barrels per day in response to plunging crude prices and fuel demand.

Headlines: U.S. Republicans push for coronavirus lawsuit immunity for business
Description: The top Republicans in the U.S. Congress displayed a united front on Friday in their drive for coronavirus-related liability protections for businesses, saying such measures will be crucial to talks about future relief legislation.

Headlines: Uber must face lawsuit claiming it stifled competition, drove out rival Sidecar
Description: Uber Technologies Inc was ordered by a U.S. judge on Friday to face a lawsuit claiming its illegal predatory pricing and other anticompetitive practices stifled competition, and drove rival Sidecar Technologies Inc out of business.

Headlines: 3M sues five vendors for attempting to sell nonexistent N95 respirators
Description: Industrial conglomerate 3M Co said on Friday it sued five vendors for allegedly attempting to target government officials with fraudulent offers to sell billions of nonexistent N95 respirators.

Headlines: 'W-shaped' recovery may be too optimistic, Fed's Powell suggests
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has sketched out an altogether bumpier ride for the U.S. economy than many are predicting - one that sees business activity stop and start for months to come, until an effective treatment or vaccine for the novel coronavirus can be found.

Headlines: Dreams grounded: Cadet pilots face uncertain future as coronavirus turns shortage to surplus
Description: Mark, 34, quit his job as a town planner in London last year to start flight-training school, buoyed by a conditional offer of employment with budget carrier easyJet at a time when the airline industry was desperately short of pilots.

Headlines: Norway wealth fund backs Barclays climate goals amid investor pressure
Description: Norway's sovereign wealth fund will vote in favour of a resolution committing Barclays to tackling climate change at the bank's annual general meeting on May 7, instead of a separate shareholder one, the fund said on Friday.

Headlines: For cloud giants, usage soars but tech investment delays hobble revenue growth
Description: As lockdown orders force billions of people to work, learn and play from home during the novel coronavirus outbreak, usage has surged for the cloud computing services that power video conferencing, streaming television and online games.

Headlines: For small business loan program, forgiveness may be the hardest part
Description: The U.S. government's $660 billion small business rescue program has stumbled on missing paperwork, technology failure, and the misdirection of funds to big corporations. Now, it is lurching toward another hurdle: forgiving those hastily arranged loans.

Headlines: Think Wall Street's back to normal? Not so fast, options markets say
Description: Options investors are preparing for more volatility ahead despite last month's sharp rebound in U.S. stocks, reflecting doubts that markets will be quick to return to their former highs in the middle of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing activity plunges to 11-year low as orders sink
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity plunged to an 11-year low in April as the novel coronavirus wreaked havoc on supply chains, suggesting the economy was sinking deeper into recession.

Headlines: Ryanair sets mid-May deadline for talks on new Boeing MAX order
Description: Ryanair aims to conclude talks with Boeing on a new plane order in the next two weeks, but possible price cuts or cancellations related to an existing 737 MAX order are also part of the discussions, its chief executive said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Stocks face test as reopenings could fuel demand - or more coronavirus
Description: A bounce in stocks is likely to face a test in the coming weeks as investors try to gauge whether countries and U.S. states emerging from lockdowns can arrest a sharp fall in economic growth without provoking a resurgence of coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. coronavirus stimulus went to some healthcare providers facing criminal inquiries
Description: Eager to bolster the healthcare system during the coronavirus pandemic, the U.S. government last month sped $30 billion in stimulus payments to most healthcare providers that billed Medicare last year.

Headlines: Berkshire sells entire stakes in U.S. airlines: Buffett
Description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc sold its entire stakes in the four largest U.S. airlines in April, Chairman Warren Buffett said Saturday at the company's annual meeting, saying "the world has changed" for the aviation industry.

Headlines: Iceland could mull taking stake in Icelandair if state injects funds: PM
Description: Iceland may consider taking a stake in Icelandair Group if the government injects funds into the airline, Bloomberg reported, citing comments by Prime Minister Katrin Jakobsdottir to a local radio station.

Headlines: GM and SAIC's China sales rebound in April as market recovers
Description: General Motors' sales in China saw double-digit year-on-year growth in April, its two local ventures said on Sunday, as the world's biggest auto market recovers from the coronavirus.

Headlines: Pipe-laying vessel reaches Baltic as Russia's Nord Stream 2 target looms
Description: A special pipe-laying vessel that could be used by Russia to complete construction of the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline to Germany has arrived in the Baltic Sea, a Reuters witness said on Sunday.

Headlines: Dutch McDonald's trials social-distancing restaurant
Description: Big Macs delivered on meal trolleys, hand sanitizers at the entrance and designated waiting spots to separate customers could become a feature of McDonald's restaurants in the Netherlands when they are allowed to reopen.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp sees coronavirus cash squeeze despite elevator sale: letter
Description: Germany's Thyssenkrupp expects the coronavirus crisis to cause a new financial squeeze, scuppering hopes that selling its elevator business would deliver a swift cash respite for the embattled firm, its management board told staff in a letter.

Headlines: U.S. aviation sector cuts more jobs amid travel meltdown
Description: The ongoing U.S. travel crisis is causing thousands of job cuts as the aviation sector waits for passengers to return to the skies but braces for years of lower demand because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. airlines now requiring masks, promise more safety measures
Description: With the largest U.S. airlines now set to mandate - and provide - facial coverings for all passengers over the next two weeks, many are turning their focus to other measures to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus during air travel.

Headlines: U.S. airlines now requiring masks, promise more safety measures
Description: With the largest U.S. airlines now set to mandate - and provide - facial coverings for all passengers over the next two weeks, many are turning their focus to other measures to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus during air travel.

Headlines: GM Korea to cut output of key SUV as virus hits U.S. exports: document
Description: General Motors Co's South Korean unit plans to sharply cut output this month at a factory producing its new Trailblazer sport-utility vehicle (SUV), as the coronavirus outbreak weighs on its U.S. exports and also disrupts parts supplies.

Headlines: 'Like watching a train wreck': The coronavirus effect on North Dakota shale oilfields
Description: Oil executive Bill Kent was with fellow managers in the Colorado board room of Resource Energy headquarters on April 20 when benchmark U.S. crude prices collapsed to minus $37 a barrel. Sitting six feet apart because of the coronavirus, they knew the pandemic was not only a personal matter.

Headlines: U.S. airline shares tumble as Buffett sell-off adds to worries
Description: Shares of the top four U.S. airlines dropped on Monday after billionaire investor Warren Buffett said Berkshire Hathaway offloaded its entire stake in the carriers last month, adding to the sense of crisis around the industry.

Headlines: Massive U.S. stock bounce stokes doubts, provokes bears
Description: Investors are treating the U.S. equity market’s blistering rally with a dose of caution, socking away cash, staying on the sidelines or buying insurance against a reversal even as markets scream higher in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: France deals blow to Amazon as warehouses remain shut
Description: France has rejected a request from e-commerce giant Amazon to tap a state-funded scheme to subsidise furloughed employees at its six closed warehouses in the country.

Headlines: Coronavirus will constrain U.S. meat supply despite Trump order: Tyson Foods
Description: The coronavirus crisis will continue to idle U.S. meat plants and slow production, Tyson Foods Inc said on Monday, signaling more disruptions to the U.S. food supply after U.S. President Donald Trump ordered facilities to stay open.

Headlines: Wall Street snaps two-day slump on lift from tech titans
Description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Monday as increases in large tech and internet companies and oil price gains outweighed concerns about the latest U.S.-China tensions and downbeat sentiment from the annual meeting of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway.

Headlines: Global shares fall on U.S.-Sino spat but Wall Street rebounds
Description: The dollar rose on risk aversion and global stock markets fell on Monday as U.S.-Chinese bickering over the origin of the coronavirus outbreak sparked fear of a new trade war, but Wall Street rebounded as the lifting of lockdowns in some U.S. states boosted optimism.

Headlines: Intel buys Moovit transit app for $900 million to help develop robotaxis
Description: Chipmaker Intel Corp has bought Israeli public transit app maker Moovit for about $900 million to help it develop self-driving "robotaxis" that could take to the streets in early 2022, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: Here's how dividend-based ETFs are managing shareholder payout cuts: Issuer
Description: Simeon Hyman of ProShares, Dave Nadig of ETF Trends and Chris Hempstead of IndexIQ talk what could lie ahead for dividend-based ETFs as corporations cut their shareholder payouts. With CNBC's Bob Pisani.

Headlines: U.S. coronavirus tariff exemptions sought for robots, drones, elevators
Description: Major U.S. firms and trade groups want the U.S. Trade Representative's Office to waive tariffs on a wide range of Chinese-made products as a result of the coronavirus pandemic, including drones, robots, personal computers and 3D printers.

Headlines: Wells Fargo receives 'outstanding' rating for community lending
Description: Wells Fargo & Co said on Monday it has received an "outstanding" rating on a U.S. regulatory test for community lending between 2012 and 2018.

Headlines: India's Reliance to sell $750 million stake in unit to Silver Lake, on track to cut debt
Description: India's Reliance Industries Ltd said on Monday private equity firm Silver Lake will invest nearly $750 million in its digital arm, days after securing a $5.7 billion investment from Facebook Inc , boosting its efforts to cut debt.

Headlines: HSBC to buy out life insurance joint venture partner in China
Description: HSBC Holdings PLC said on Monday its insurance unit had agreed to acquire its China life insurance venture partner's 50% stake to own fully the company under the new rules on foreign ownership that came into effect in January.

Headlines: Carmakers Dacia and Ford resume production in Romania
Description: Romanian carmaker Dacia, owned by France's Renault and Ford Motor Co's Craiova plant resumed operations on Monday after output was halted due to the coronavirus pandemic in March, they said.

Headlines: Telefonica shares rise on O2-Virgin Media merger talks
Description: Shares in Spain's Telefonica SA rose on Monday to post the only strong gains on an otherwise almost entirely red Madrid index, after the company confirmed it was in talks with billionaire John Malone's Liberty Global Plc over a possible merger of their respective businesses in Britain.

Headlines: Book a table for fast food? Burger King trials post-lockdown app in Italy
Description: Burger King is trialling an app for ordering food and booking a table at its outlets in Italy, as it seeks to persuade locals it is safe to eat out again after more than two months of coronavirus lockdown.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. airlines burn through $10 billion a month as traffic plummets
Description: U.S. airlines are collectively burning more than $10 billion in cash a month and averaging fewer than two dozen passengers per domestic flight because of the coronavirus pandemic, industry trade group Airlines for America said in prepared testimony seen by Reuters ahead of a U.S. Senate hearing on Wednesday.

Headlines: Delta caps aircraft seating capacity to ensure safety amid COVID-19
Description: Delta Air Lines said on Tuesday it was putting a limit to seating capacity in its airplanes, as the U.S. carrier looks to provide a safe flying experience to customers amid the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lord & Taylor to liquidate its stores as soon as they reopen - sources
Description: Venerable U.S. retailer Lord & Taylor plans to liquidate inventory in its 38 department stores once restrictions to curb the spread of coronavirus are lifted as it braces for a bankruptcy process from which it does not expect to emerge, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed policymakers see slow, uneven U.S. recovery after coronavirus downturn
Description: The U.S. economy could start to recover in the second half of the year after what is shaping up to be the worst recession in decades, but growth is likely to be slow and uneven, several top Federal Reserve policymakers indicated on Tuesday.

Headlines: Occidental posts $2.2 billion loss on charges, deepens spending cuts
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp on Tuesday swung to a first quarter loss on writedowns and charges, and the troubled U.S. oil producer cut its budget for the third time since March in response to a historic oil-price crash.

Headlines: Beyond Meat plans U.S. discounts, hopes to replace beef on summer grills
Description: Plant-based burger maker Beyond Meat plans to offer large value packs and discounts to some U.S. retailers this summer, hoping to grab a greater share of the market as prices for beef rise amid production disruptions caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street rises as lockdowns ease, healthcare shares jump
Description: Wall Street's main indexes gained on Tuesday as healthcare stocks rallied, oil prices surged and a number of countries and U.S. states eased coronavirus-induced restrictions in an attempt to revive their economies.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit widens, services sector contracts amid coronavirus
Description: The U.S. trade deficit increased by the most in more than a year in March as a record drop in exports offset a shrinking import bill, suggesting the novel coronavirus outbreak was upending the global flow of goods and services.

Headlines: WeWork co-founder Neumann sues SoftBank over failed tender offer
Description: WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann filed a lawsuit against Japan's SoftBank Group Corp and its Vision Fund on Monday for terminating a $3 billion tender offer to the office-sharing startup's shareholders.

Headlines: Liechtenstein's LGT Group to be split up in 2021
Description: Liechtenstein-based financial group LGT will be split into three separate firms in 2021, all directly held by the Prince of Liechtenstein Foundation, LGT said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hugo Boss expects 50% sales drop next quarter as crisis impact worsens
Description: Hugo Boss is seeing signs of a sales rebound in China and online, but expects the impact of the coronavirus crisis to worsen before any recovery kicks in after first quarter sales fell by 17%, which knocked its shares.

Headlines: Microsoft to invest $1 billion in Polish cloud project
Description: Microsoft will invest $1 billion in Poland as part of a plan that will involve opening a data centre in the country to provide cloud services to businesses and government institutions, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Uber, Lyft investors want to hear plans to get riders back in cars
Description: As U.S. lockdowns and fears of the coronavirus pandemic stretch into a third month, who wants to take an Uber ride?

Headlines: Fed's Evans says 'reasonable' to expect U.S. growth in second half of 2020
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve President Charles Evans said on Tuesday it's "reasonable" to expect the U.S. economy to return to growth in the second half of the year, but that such an outcome is only slightly more likely than other, more pessimistic views.

Headlines: White House adviser expects U.S. unemployment rate for April to be 'north of 16%'
Description: White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett on Tuesday said he expects the U.S. unemployment rate was above 16% in April, as the coronavirus pandemic began to devastate the country's economy.

Headlines: Fed lending program not for insolvent oil drillers, Kaplan says
Description: Insolvent or overly leveraged firms, including oil drillers and oil services firms, won't be able to tap the U.S. central bank's "Main Street" emergency lending program, Dallas Federal Reserve President Robert Kaplan said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fed lending program not for insolvent oil drillers, Kaplan says
Description: Insolvent or overly leveraged firms, including oil drillers and oil services firms, won't be able to tap the U.S. central bank's "Main Street" emergency lending program, Dallas Federal Reserve President Robert Kaplan said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Breakout time behind plexiglass: Renault factory restarts in France
Description: With temperature scanners on the door and tables partitioned by plexiglass shields in the breakout area, workers at one of Renault's French plants are adjusting to new routines as carmakers try to cope with the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Abercrombie, Gap prepare to reopen stores as lockdowns ease
Description: Abercrombie & Fitch Co and cash-strapped Gap Inc on Wednesday laid out plans to reopen stores in areas where lockdown curbs have eased, while also introducing social-distancing measures.

Headlines: Breakout time behind plexiglass: Renault factory restarts in France
Description: With temperature scanners on the door and tables partitioned by plexiglass shields in the breakout area, workers at one of Renault's French plants are adjusting to new routines as carmakers try to cope with the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Frontier Airlines rescinds empty middle seat charge after lawmaker pressure
Description: U.S. budget carrier Frontier Airlines withdrew on Wednesday a "More Room" policy that would have given passengers the option of paying extra to keep the middle seat empty on flights after a backlash from politicians, according to a letter to lawmakers seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Surging small cap stocks offer hope of U.S. growth rebound
Description: Big gains in small caps stocks are fueling hopes that a bounce in broader equity markets may stick, as investors ponder how quickly the U.S. economy can emerge from its coronavirus-fueled slowdown.

Headlines: World shares mixed amid hopes for business pickup; oil slips
Description: Oil prices slid and world equity markets seesawed on Wednesday as investor hopes for a pickup in business activity were dashed by downbeat economic data and a rise in U.S. crude stockpiles to three-year highs that highlighted low fuel demand.

Headlines: VW sees multi-speed coronavirus rebound led by China
Description: Volkswagen sees demand rebounding in China, helped by new buyers switching from public transport and sales of premium vehicles, but warned business would not recover from the coronavirus crisis as quickly in other parts of the world.

Headlines: The magic word for Detroit automakers is trucks
Description: The coronavirus pandemic brought the U.S. auto industry to its knees, but Americans' love affair with beefy pickup trucks is helping the Detroit automakers get on the road to recovery.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow drop as financial sector declines counter tech gains
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow fell on Wednesday as declines in financials and defensive groups countered gains in tech shares and as data showed U.S. private employers laid off 20 million workers in April, underscoring the economic fallout of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Amber Capital: no plans to sell Lagardere stake and it may even raise it
Description: The founder of activist investment company Amber Capital, which lost out this week in a bid to shake up the governance at French group Lagardere , said on Wednesday he had no plans to exit his stake in Lagardere and added that he could even raise it.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard: Drop in U.S. payrolls 'not a surprise' given shutdowns - CNBC
Description: The massive drop in U.S. private payrolls for April, reported on Wednesday, is "not a surprise" but employment could recover dramatically in the second half of the year if the coronavirus pandemic is controlled, St. Louis Federal Reserve president James Bullard said.

Headlines: Yum China keeps bets on dine-in, sticks to expansion plans after virus
Description: Yum China is betting that Chinese consumers will still choose to dine-in in the aftermath of the coronavirus crisis and plans to open more Pizza Hut and KFC outlets in China's smaller cities in the coming months, its chief executive said.

Headlines: Tyson Foods to resume limited production at largest U.S. pork plant
Description: Tyson Foods Inc will resume limited production at its largest U.S. pork plant this week, the company said late on Tuesday, a week after President Donald Trump ordered companies to keep meat-processing plants open to protect the supply chain.

Headlines: GSK sells $3.4 billion Hindustan Unilever stake in largest India block trade
Description: GlaxoSmithKline has sold its stake in Unilever's Indian business for $3.4 billion, marking India's largest block trade, which will help the British company in its goal of reinvigorating its drug development pipeline.

Headlines: U.S. and Europe spar over next stage of aircraft subsidy dispute
Description: The United States said there was "no valid basis" for the European Union to retaliate against U.S. goods in a long-running subsidy row after Boeing lost state tax breaks, but the EU said it was pressing ahead with its demand for tariffs.

Headlines: U.S. demand for cars expected to rebound while travel, dining lag: ad agency
Description: Consumer demand for cars could begin to recover this month in the United States after steep declines due to the coronavirus pandemic, but the hard-hit travel and dining industries will likely continue to face difficult times, according to a major U.S. advertising agency.

Headlines: Liberty Global expects no major regulatory challenge to O2-Virgin deal: CEO
Description: Liberty Global expects no major regulatory challenge to a deal to merge its Virgin Media unit with British mobile operator O2, owned by Spain's Telefonica , its chief executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Italy to inject 3 billion euros in new Alitalia: industry minister
Description: Italy's government will inject fresh capital worth at least 3 billion euros ($3.24 billion) in the ailing carrier Alitalia, which is being nationalised following financial problems, Industry Minister Stefano Patuanelli said on Thursday.

Headlines: Climate activists spray 'fake oil' onto Barclays HQ in London's Canary Wharf
Description: Climate activists from the Extinction Rebellion group sprayed "fake oil" onto the Barclays headquarters in London's Canary Wharf on Thursday, calling on the bank to divest from fossil fuels.

Headlines: IAG CEO says would like group to continue to have presence at Gatwick
Description: The chief executive of British Airways-owner IAG Willie Walsh said on Thursday that his personal was that the airline group should continue to have a presence at London's Gatwick Airport.

Headlines: U.S. employers must try to accommodate workers vulnerable to coronavirus: agency
Description: The U.S. agency that enforces laws prohibiting disability discrimination said on Thursday that employers must try to accommodate workers with medical conditions that make them vulnerable to the novel coronavirus before sending them home.

Headlines: The great potato giveaway: U.S. farmers hand out spuds to avoid food waste
Description: When Tina Yates pulled her truck up to a mall in western Washington state on Thursday, workers waved her past hundreds of cars waiting to pick up free russet potatoes.

Headlines: Japan's ANA suspends recruitment citing coronavirus fallout
Description: ANA Holdings Inc , the operator of Japan's top airline, said on Friday it would suspend its recruitment process at its 37 group companies due to an uncertain business climate caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Ford plans to restart North America production from May 18
Description: U.S. automaker Ford Motor Co said on Thursday it is planning to restart production and operations in North America in a phased manner, starting May 18.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. companies got emergency government loans despite having months of cash
Description: When American companies recently applied for U.S. government loans meant to help small businesses survive the coronavirus crisis, they had to certify they needed the cash to cover basic needs like salaries and rent. The money, up to $10 million, was meant to tide them over for eight weeks.

Headlines: AB InBev sees worse ahead, but some light in China
Description: Anheuser-Busch InBev , the world's largest beer maker, forecast a "materially worse" second quarter as coronavirus restrictions curb drinking across the globe, although China was showing early signs of recovery.

Headlines: Lufthansa seeks 9 billion euro bailout amid political discussions
Description: Lufthansa is negotiating a 9 billion euro ($9.71 billion) bailout with Germany's economic stabilisation fund to ensure its future, the airline said on Thursday, confirming an earlier Reuters report.

Headlines: Coronavirus deals U.S. economy Great Depression-like job losses, high unemployment
Description: The U.S. economy lost a staggering 20.5 million jobs in April, the steepest plunge in payrolls since the Great Depression, laying bare both the economic and human tragedy wrought by the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. private payrolls dive by a record 20.2 million
Description: U.S. private employers laid off a record 20.236 million workers in April as mandatory business closures in response to the novel coronavirus outbreak savaged the economy, setting up the overall labor market for historic job losses last month.

Headlines: Great Depression-like U.S. job losses, unemployment rate expected in April
Description: The U.S. economy likely lost a staggering 22 million jobs in April, in what would be the steepest plunge in payrolls since the Great Depression and the starkest sign yet of how the novel coronavirus pandemic is battering the world's biggest economy.
