Headlines: Chipotle secures $600 million credit line amid coronavirus crisis
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc has secured a new year-long $600 million revolving credit line, a regulatory filing showed https://bit.ly/2SOtm6L on Friday, as the restaurant chain looks to deal with the fallout from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Trump 'torn' over U.S.-China trade deal as officials push to fulfill its terms
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he was "very torn" about whether to end the so-called Phase 1 U.S.-China trade deal, just hours after top trade officials from both countries pledged to press ahead with implementing it despite coronavirus economic wreckage.

Headlines: Wall Street jumps as historic job losses fewer than feared
Description: Major U.S. stock indexes jumped on Friday and logged solid gains for the week after data on historic job losses due to the coronavirus crisis showed they were slightly fewer than feared.

Headlines: U.S. small business rescue program ignored Congress: watchdog
Description: The U.S. government's $660 billion program to rescue small businesses hit by the coronavirus pandemic thwarts the intention of Congress by making it hard for some borrowers to convert loans to grants and failing to prioritize the right businesses, a government watchdog said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: U.S. data deluge to underscore divide between roaring market, plunging economy
Description: A week packed with U.S. economic data is likely to provide investors with more evidence of the extent to which the coronavirus pandemic has hit growth, sharpening the debate on whether a rebound in stocks has been justified amid an unprecedented slowdown.

Headlines: Explainer: Fed funds futures market sees negative rates by next April
Description: The fed funds futures market is pricing in negative U.S. interest rates next year, a scenario the Federal Reserve has said it wants to avoid as many doubt that it would be an effective tool to stimulate growth.

Headlines: Exclusive: J.C. Penney to file for bankruptcy as soon as next week, sources say
Description: J.C. Penney Co Inc is preparing to file for bankruptcy protection as soon as next week with plans to permanently close about a quarter of its roughly 850 stores, becoming the latest major U.S. retailer to succumb to fallout from the coronavirus outbreak, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Germany's BaFin investigating Wirecard communication ahead of audit publication
Description: Germany's financial market watchdog BaFin is investigating Wirecard's communication with investors directly ahead of the publication of a critical audit by KPMG, a spokeswoman for the regulator said on Friday.

Headlines: Explainer: Why 14.7% unemployment rate doesn't capture the true state of the coronavirus economy
Description: The U.S. economy shed 20.5 million jobs in April, and the unemployment rate rose to 14.7%, a government report Friday showed.

Headlines: China, U.S. hold trade talks on implementation of signed phase one deal
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and United States Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer held a phone call late on Thursday in which they spoke about U.S.-China trade, the U.S. government said in a statement.

Headlines: Still hiring! Walmart, other superstores buck U.S. employment trend
Description: Amid the carnage of the U.S. employment report for April was one bright spot: superstores led by Walmart Inc , the world's largest retailer, added more than 90,000 jobs.

Headlines: Sony to make, donate face shields to Japan hospitals
Description: Sony Corp said on Friday it will manufacture and donate medical face shields to hospitals in Japan, amid worries about the availability of protective equipment for healthcare workers dealing with the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Indonesia's Garuda to seek restructuring of $500-mln Islamic bonds
Description: National flag carrier Garuda Indonesia will seek to restructure $500 million of Islamic bonds due to mature next month, the deputy of the state-owned enterprises ministry said on Friday.

Headlines: Take Five: Trade War II
Description: China's exports rebound has been quickly overshadowed by dire predictions of Trade War II between the world's two biggest economies.

Headlines: Instant view: Coronavirus ravaged U.S. payrolls in April, 20.5 mln jobs lost
Description: The U.S. economy lost a staggering 20.5 million jobs in April, the steepest plunge in payrolls since the Great Depression and the starkest sign yet of how the novel coronavirus pandemic is battering the world's biggest economy.

Headlines: U.S. joblessness slams Latinos, less educated with brutal force
Description: The U.S. economy's record run of job growth and historically low unemployment has been stopped in its tracks by the fight against the coronavirus pandemic: joblessness hit 14.7% in April, and even if it starts to fall in coming weeks there will be scars.

Headlines: U.S. wholesale inventories revised up in March
Description: U.S. wholesale inventories fell in March, albeit less than initially estimated, and further decreases are likely as the novel coronavirus outbreak continues to weigh on imports of goods.

Headlines: Bankruptcy court approves Neiman Marcus' plea to access financing
Description: U.S. luxury department store chain Neiman Marcus Group said on Friday it received court approval to access $675 million of its debtor-in-possession financing, which will allow continuity of the company's business during Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings and enable it to pay employees and vendors.

Headlines: Mazda Motor seeks $2.8 billion in loans to ride out pandemic: source
Description: Mazda Motor Corp has sought loans totalling about 300 billion yen ($2.8 billion) from Japan's three megabanks and other lenders to ride out the coronavirus epidemic, a source with direct knowledge of the matter said on Saturday.

Headlines: China central bank signals more policy measures to support virus-ravaged economy
Description: China's central bank said on Sunday it will step up counter-cyclical adjustments to support the economy and make monetary policy more flexible to fend off financial risks.

Headlines: White House considers more coronavirus aid as jobs picture worsens
Description: The White House has begun informal talks with Republicans and Democrats in Congress about what to include in another round of coronavirus relief legislation, officials said on Sunday, while predicting further U.S. jobs losses in the coming months.

Headlines: Nintendo smashes Switch sales view; says Animal Crossing is device's fastest-selling game
Description: Japan's Nintendo Co Ltd said on Thursday its fourth-quarter profit soared 200% due to surging demand for its Switch games console, and that title Animal Crossing: New Horizons shifted a record 13.4 million units in its first six weeks.

Headlines: U.S. unemployment rate will get worse, Treasury's Mnuchin says
Description: The staggering U.S. unemployment rate reported by the government on Friday amid coronavirus lockdowns may get even worse, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Sunday.

Headlines: Major U.S. airlines endorse temperature checks for passengers
Description: A major U.S. airline trade group on Saturday said it backed the U.S. Transportation Security Administration (TSA) checking the temperatures of passengers and customer-facing employees during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: EU could open legal case against Germany over ECB bond-purchases ruling: Commission
Description: The European Commission could open a legal case against Germany over a ruling by the country's constitutional court that the European Central Bank had overstepped its mandate with bond purchases, the EU executive arm said on Sunday.

Headlines: Germany's Altmaier opposes active state role at Lufthansa
Description: Germany is working on a "concrete model" to aid Lufthansa, Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Sunday, amid a political row over whether the state should take a strategic shareholding and play an active role in the stricken airline.

Headlines: Chinese advisers call for talks on new trade deal with U.S.: Global Times
Description: Hawkish voices have emerged in China seeking a reevaluation of its Phase 1 trade deal with the United States, with some advisers urging fresh talks, a state-controlled tabloid said, citing sources close to the Chinese government.

Headlines: Oil falls on fears of second coronavirus wave
Description: Oil prices fell on Monday as investors worried about a second wave of coronavirus infections, but new output cuts from Saudi Arabia tempered worries about oversupply and limited price losses.

Headlines: Over 80% of U.S. small businesses expect longer impact of pandemic: survey
Description: Eighty-one percent of small U.S. companies surveyed by Veem, a global payments network, expect the new coronavirus pandemic to affect their business over the next 12-16 months, and nearly 90% are bracing for an economic slowdown, the company said Monday.

Headlines: Marriott profit misses as bookings, revenue per room plunge
Description: U.S. hotel operator Marriott missed already lowered estimates for first-quarter profit by a huge margin on Monday, as bookings plunged due to the coronavirus-led lockdowns that kept a quarter of its hotels closed.

Headlines: Washington in talks with chipmakers about building U.S. factories
Description: The Trump administration is in talks with semiconductor companies about building chip factories in the United States, representatives from two chipmakers said on Sunday.

Headlines: Roche's U.S. gRED research head to retire, be replaced by MIT's Regev
Description: Roche said Monday it has hired a Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) professor as the new head of the Swiss drugmaker's U.S. research arm that was responsible for some of the company's best-selling medicines of the last few decades.

Headlines: Nissan's China sales grew 1.1% in April as market recovered
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan Motor said on Monday its April sales in China grew 1.1% from a year earlier to 122,846 vehicles, as the world's biggest auto market recovered from the coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: Wuhan, recovering from virus, weighs policies to help hometown automaker Dongfeng
Description: China's Wuhan city is considering steps to support its biggest local automaker Dongfeng Motor Corp, according to a draft policy document reviewed by Reuters, as the epicentre of China's novel coronavirus outbreak tries to revive its economy.

Headlines: KKR builds 5.2% stake in ProSieben, says company undervalued
Description: U.S. private equity house KKR said on Monday it had acquired a stake of 5.2% in ProSiebenSat.1 Media , becoming the third investor to amass a sizable shareholding in the struggling German broadcaster.

Headlines: LafargeHolcim to keep Philippines business after San Miguel deal collapses
Description: LafargeHolcim has decided to keep its $2.15 billion Philippines business after a deal to sell the operation collapsed, the world's biggest cement maker said on Monday.

Headlines: Tim Hortons China says Tencent has invested, did not disclose amount
Description: Tim Hortons China said Tuesday it received an investment from Chinese tech giant Tencent, as the Canadian coffee brewer seeks to expand in the Chinese market.

Headlines: German watchdog investigates payments company Wirecard
Description: Germany's financial watchdog BaFin said on Tuesday it was conducting multiple investigations into Wirecard , sending its shares lower and adding to pressure over allegations it has denied.

Headlines: Trump again urges Fed to adopt negative U.S. interest rates
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday again pushed the Federal Reserve to adopt negative interest rates, even as several members of the U.S. central bank have said they do not see a need for rates - now near zero - to move into negative territory.

Headlines: Tesla's Musk says ready for arrest as he reopens California plant against local order
Description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk on Monday said production was resuming at the automaker's sole U.S. vehicle factory, in California, defying an order to stay closed and saying if anyone had to be arrested it should be him.

Headlines: Brussels Airlines slashes jobs, fleet as COVID-19 bites
Description: Brussels Airlines, part of Germany's Lufthansa , said on Tuesday it would reduce its fleet by 30% and its workforce by a quarter to guarantee its survival during and after the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Tencent Music misses quarterly revenue estimates, signals better second quarter
Description: China's Tencent Music Entertainment narrowly missed market estimates for quarterly revenue on Monday as the COVID-19 crisis hurt the company's social entertainment services business, sending its shares down 4.5% in extended trade overnight.

Headlines: Popeyes sticks to China expansion plan in spite of virus
Description: Fried chicken chain Popeyes is forging ahead with the opening of its first outlet in China despite the coronavirus outbreak and plans to set up "a few more" by the end of the year in several Chinese cities, its executives said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Toyota sees 80% profit drop as virus wipes $14 billion off car sales
Description: Toyota Motor Corp said on Tuesday it expects profit to drop by 80% to its lowest in nine years, as Japan's biggest automaker grapples with the impact of the novel coronavirus which has sapped global demand for vehicles.

Headlines: China's Tesla wannabes risk running out of road in virus-stricken times
Description: Challenged by the arrival of Tesla in China last year, domestic electric vehicle (EV) start-ups were struggling even before the economic shock wrought by the coronavirus, but now for some it has become a battle for survival.

Headlines: The U.S. needs more fiscal help to fight coronavirus, Fed officials say
Description: U.S. businesses and households are going to need more fiscal support to get through what will likely be a longer period of recovery from the coronavirus shutdown than initially expected, Federal Reserve policymakers said on Tuesday.

Headlines: S&P 500 tumbles on fears of virus resurgence in economic reopening
Description: The S&P 500 dropped 2% on Tuesday as investors took profits following a warning from the top U.S. infectious disease expert that premature moves to reopen the nation's economy could lead to novel coronavirus outbreaks and set back economic recovery.

Headlines: U.S. federal court tells SEC, Justice Dept to review RBS whistleblower case
Description: The U.S. Justice Department and Securities and Exchange Commission must review whether an ex-Royal Bank of Scotland employee is owed a whistleblower payout and provide documents relating to his case, a federal U.S. court said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. attorneys seek Amazon data on coronavirus-linked worker deaths, infections
Description: A group of 13 U.S. attorneys general on Tuesday asked Amazon.com Inc to provide data on coronavirus-related deaths and infections among its workforce, along with evidence of the company's compliance with paid sick leave laws.

Headlines: Stock market rally pauses, bonds edge higher on fears of second virus wave
Description: World equity markets slid and safe-haven bonds climbed on Tuesday as rising concerns about a second wave of coronavirus infections outweighed stronger economic data from China and upbeat corporate earnings in Europe.

Headlines: KKR leads $43 million investment round in Slice pizza platform
Description: U.S. private equity firm KKR & Co Inc said on Tuesday it led an investor group making a $43 million investment in Slice, an online delivery platform for local pizza shops across the country.

Headlines: Coronavirus crisis leads to largest U.S. consumer price decline since 2008
Description: U.S. consumer prices dropped by the most since the Great Recession in April, weighed down by a plunge in demand for gasoline and services including airline travel as Americans stayed home during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. airlines tell crews not to force passengers to wear masks
Description: The top three U.S. airlines have told their flight attendants not to force passengers to comply with their new policy requiring face coverings, just encourage them to do so, according to employee policies reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Japan´s Softbank sees consolidation in Latam food delivery
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp , a shareholder in some of Latin America's largest food delivery companies, expects consolidation in most markets, a senior executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Powell: Fed not looking at negative rates
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, in a sober review of where the U.S. economy stands on the cusp of its reopening, said on Wednesday the country could face an "extended period" of weak growth and stagnant incomes, pledged to use more Fed power as needed, and issued a call for more fiscal spending.

Headlines: All eyes on Detroit as automakers ready slow, careful reopening of plants
Description: The U.S. factories that make Fords, Chevys and Jeeps are coming back to life this week as workers install new safety equipment and wake up machines ahead of the high-stakes restart the Detroit automakers plan to launch on Monday.

Headlines: Trump extends U.S. telecom supply chain order aimed at Huawei, ZTE
Description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday extended for another year an executive order signed in May 2019 declaring a national emergency and barring U.S. companies from using telecommunications equipment made by firms posing a national security risk.

Headlines: Less than zero? Fed's Powell shows no love for negative rates
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell had a clear message to interest rate futures traders on Wednesday: Bets that the U.S. central bank will pursue a negative interest-rate policy are off-base.

Headlines: U.S. March, April job losses revised higher
Description: The U.S. economy lost a record 20.537 million jobs in April and not 20.5 million as reported last Friday, according to revised data published by the Labor Department this week.

Headlines: Brazil's Gol values Boeing's 737 MAX compensation at up to $412 million
Description: Brazil airline Gol Linhas Aereas Inteligentes said on Wednesday it will receive up to 2.4 billion reais ($412 million) from Boeing Co as compensation for the grounding of the 737 MAX plane, in a mix of cash and credits.

Headlines: Tesla, California county reach deal to reopen U.S. plant next week
Description: Tesla Inc and officials in California have resolved their acrimonious clash over safety procedures at the automaker’s sole U.S. assembly plant with a deal that allows production to resume as early as Monday, county officials said.

Headlines: Equities slide, bonds rise on Fed warning of prolonged recession
Description: Stock markets tumbled on Wednesday on fears about a second wave of coronavirus infections and warnings from Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell that the U.S. faces a "significantly worse" recession than any downturn since World War Two, while bonds rose on a safety bid.

Headlines: In nod to grim U.S. outlook, Fed's Powell calls for more fiscal support
Description: The head of the Federal Reserve warned on Wednesday of an "extended period" of weak economic growth, vowed to use the U.S. central bank's power as needed, and called for additional fiscal spending to stem the fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell warns of prolonged U.S. recession after coronavirus
Description: Jerome Powell, chairman of the Federal Reserve board of governors, warned Wednesday that the long-term health of the U.S. economy may depend on more fiscal stimulus to fight the economic impacts of the coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices record largest drop since 2009 as coronavirus suppresses demand
Description: U.S. producer prices fell by the most since 2009 in April, leading to the largest annual decline in nearly 4-1/2 years, bolstering some economists' predictions for a brief period of deflation as the novel coronavirus depresses demand.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices post biggest drop since 2009
Description: U.S. producer prices fell by the most since 2009 in April, leading to the largest annual decline in nearly 4-1/2 years, which could bolster some economists' predictions for a brief period of deflation as the novel coronavirus depresses demand.

Headlines: Mitsubishi slashes SpaceJet budget, drops variant
Description: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI) said it was more than halving the annual development budget for its SpaceJet regional jet as the coronavirus pandemic squeezes profit, and will suspend plans for a possible variant seen as key to winning future orders, particularly from U.S. airlines.

Headlines: EasyJet, Germanwings lose legal fight against EU's Italian airport ruling
Description: Easyjet and Lufthansa's Germanwings on Wednesday lost their challenge against an EU ruling ordering Italy to recover illegal state aid granted to airlines serving Sardinia.

Headlines: Resurgent Wall Street disconnected from reality on the ground
Description: With the U.S. economy facing its potentially deepest economic decline in nearly a century, Wall Street is pulling further and further ahead from Main Street.

Headlines: Amazon expects to extend France warehouse closures to May 18
Description: Amazon plans to extend until May 18 the closure of its six French warehouses, which have been closed since April 16 after court rulings ordering the U.S. e-commerce giant to restrict deliveries during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Japan stands by its integrated resort policy despite Sands' move
Description: Japan has no plan to change its schedule regarding the launch of integrated resorts (IR) - Las Vegas-style complexes that include casinos and shopping arcades - despite Las Vegas Sands' decision to end its plan to open an IR casino in Japan, a top government spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Las Vegas Sands scraps plans for Japan integrated resort casino project
Description: Las Vegas Sands said it has ended plans to open an integrated resort (IR) casino in Japan, dealing another blow to Japan's attempts to energise its economy through tourism.

Headlines: Trump wants California to let automaker Tesla reopen assembly plant
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday urged that Tesla Inc be allowed to reopen its electric vehicle assembly plant in California, joining CEO Elon Musk's bid to defy county officials who have ordered it to remain closed.

Headlines: S.Korean shoppers go the distance to beat Chanel price hike
Description: More than a hundred shoppers waited in line outside a Chanel store in Seoul on Wednesday, shrugging off concerns about a second wave of coronavirus infections to beat imminent price hikes by the French luxury brand.

Headlines: Equities edge higher, bonds rise on hopes of stimulus
Description: Global equity benchmarks gained late on Thursday, with safe-haven bonds also rising as investors shrugged off disappointing U.S. jobs data and took comfort in the possibility of states re-opening after lockdowns and fueling an economic recovery.

Headlines: Exclusive: Tesla's secret batteries aim to rework the math for electric cars and the grid
Description: Electric car maker Tesla Inc plans to introduce a new low-cost, long-life battery in its Model 3 sedan in China later this year or early next that it expects will bring the cost of electric vehicles in line with gasoline models, and allow EV batteries to have second and third lives in the electric power grid.

Headlines: Second layoffs, backlogs wave keeps U.S. jobless claims elevated
Description: The novel coronavirus crisis continues to pummel the U.S. labor market, with the number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits falling less than expected last week, suggesting a second wave of layoffs in industries and jobs not initially impacted by business closures caused by the pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street closes with strong gains as recovery hopes offset pandemic fears
Description: Wall Street surged on Thursday as investors weighed the prospect of economic recovery against bellicose remarks from President Donald Trump regarding U.S.-China trade and a whistleblower's dire warnings about the U.S. response to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Taiwan's TSMC announces plan to build $12 billion U.S. factory
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd, the world's biggest contract manufacturer of computer chips, on Friday announced plans to build an approximately $12 billion advanced chip factory in Arizona.

Headlines: We favor US stocks over non-US stocks: Wells Fargo
Description: Brian Jacobsen of Wells Fargo Asset Management discusses the concerns among investors about possible rebound in cases as the U.S. begins reopening. He also highlights the risks stemming from escalating U.S.-China tensions, one of the key reasons behind his preference over U.S. stocks.

Headlines: Most Ford U.S. dealers got federal payroll protection loans: COO
Description: Most of Ford Motor Co's U.S. dealers received payroll protection loans from the U.S. government amid the coronavirus pandemic, the automaker's chief operating officer said on Thursday.

Headlines: McDonald's issues new guidelines to U.S. franchisees on restaurant reopenings: WSJ
Description: McDonald's Corp has asked its U.S. franchisees to make a series of changes in restaurants before reopening to diners in an effort avoid the spread of the new coronavirus, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Storm clouds gather over U.S. stocks as hopes of quick recovery fade
Description: A lightning-quick rally in U.S. equities is showing cracks, as investors face mounting evidence that the economy's coronavirus-fueled woes may be far longer-lasting than many had anticipated.

Headlines: BMW CEO sees 'very slow' U.S. recovery after corona rebound in China
Description: BMW on Thursday said China sales of luxury passenger cars rebounded in April but the German premium car and motorbike manufacturer cautioned that other markets including the United States will be "very slow" to recover from the corona pandemic.

Headlines: Tesla starts building Long Range Model 3 cars at China plant
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc said on Thursday it had started producing Long Range Model 3 vehicles in its Shanghai factory and aimed to deliver them to customers soon.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp, union call for further consolidation in warship sector
Description: Thyssenkrupp and Germany's largest union IG Metall on Thursday called for further consolidation of the country's warship sector, saying a tie-up of rivals Luerssen and German Naval Yards (GNYK) did not go far enough.

Headlines: JPMorgan's U.S. credit card holders spent 40% less due to coronavirus
Description: Credit card spending among some of JP Morgan Chase & Co's U.S. customers fell 40% during March and early April compared to last year, as Americans stayed home to protect against the novel coronavirus, according to a new report on Thursday.

Headlines: Delta to retire Boeing 777 aircraft fleet to rein in costs
Description: Delta Air Lines said on Thursday it would no longer fly Boeing Co's wide-body 777 aircraft and some of the other older high-maintenance jets, as the U.S. carrier looks to cut costs amid a steep fall in bookings due to travel restrictions around the world.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade deal not falling apart: White House adviser
Description: The U.S.-China "Phase 1" trade deal reached in January is not falling apart and the two countries are still working to implement it, the White House's top economic adviser said on Friday, but President Donald Trump added that he was not "thrilled" with the agreement.

Headlines: Companies fear coronavirus liability lawsuits. So far, few exist
Description: Businesses are urging U.S. lawmakers to shield companies from what they fear could be a flood of lawsuits by workers and consumers blaming employers for exposing them to the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Wall Street ends up after swings on reopening hopes, weak data, trade woes
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes closed higher after swinging between gains and losses on Friday as investors weighed worries about Sino-U.S. trade relations and weaker-than-expected U.S. economic data against growing optimism that easing coronavirus restrictions would boost activity this month.

Headlines: Wall Street ends up after swings on reopening hopes, weak data, trade woes
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes closed higher after swinging between gains and losses on Friday as investors weighed worries about Sino-U.S. trade relations and weaker-than-expected U.S. economic data against growing optimism that easing coronavirus restrictions would boost activity this month.

Headlines: U.S. employers wary of coronavirus 'immunity' tests as they move to reopen
Description: U.S. employers have cooled to the idea of testing workers for possible immunity to the coronavirus as they prepare to reopen factories and other workplaces.

Headlines: U.S. moves to cut Huawei off from global chip suppliers as China eyes retaliation
Description: The Trump administration on Friday moved to block global chip supplies to blacklisted telecoms equipment giant Huawei Technologies, spurring fears of Chinese retaliation and hammering shares of U.S. producers of chipmaking equipment.

Headlines: U.S. state attorneys general likely to bring antitrust lawsuits against Google -source
Description: A group of state attorneys general led by Texas are likely to file an antitrust lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's Google and are working on potential litigation for later this year, a person familiar with the situation said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade deal not falling apart: White House adviser
Description: The U.S.-China "Phase 1" trade deal reached in January is not falling apart and the two countries are still working to implement it, the White House's top economic adviser said on Friday, but President Donald Trump added that he was not "thrilled" with the agreement.

Headlines: U.S. consumer sentiment edges up in May but worries about social isolation grow
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment rose unexpectedly in early May after a record plunge a month earlier as emergency assistance payments improved household finances hurt by mass layoffs from the coronavirus crisis, a survey released on Friday showed.

Headlines: White House's Kudlow floats cutting U.S. corporate tax rate in half
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Friday floated the idea of cutting the corporate tax rate in half for U.S. companies who bring their operations back from other countries.

Headlines: Australia's Westpac admits to breaches of money-laundering laws
Description: Westpac Banking Corp admitted to millions of breaches of anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism laws in a filing in Australia's Federal Court on Friday, but denied accusations it enabled illegal payments between known child sex offenders.

Headlines: Swedish central bank to use Blackrock for corporate bond market analysis
Description: Sweden's central bank will engage BlackRock’s Financial Markets Advisory for analysis work on the Swedish corporate bonds market, it said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Check-up after check-in: Accor bets on online medicine for hotel rebound
Description: France's Accor , which runs hotels such as Ibis and Movenpick, said on Friday it would offer its clients free access to online medical consultations run by insurer AXA as it prepares for a recovery from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. food aid program launches with companies scrambling to deliver
Description: Texas-based CRE8AD8 LLC bid for a federal government contract to quickly rescue food from struggling farmers and deliver it to U.S. food banks as fallout from the coronavirus pandemic has put millions of Americans out of work and driven many to seek help putting food on the table.

Headlines: India's farmers gather record wheat crop, but cannot move it
Description: Late last month, Sukrampal had to beg and borrow farmhands from nearby villages to gather his part of the country's largest-ever wheat harvest in Haryana state near New Delhi.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nissan sees bigger role for U.S., China markets in global car sales - sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co expects equal contributions to global car sales from China, the United States and elsewhere in coming years as the struggling Japanese carmaker strategises to recover profitability, two people with knowledge of the issue said.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin to pay $300 million more to suppliers hit by coronavirus
Description: U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin Corp said on Friday it would pay an additional $300 million to its suppliers hurt by a sharp economic slowdown caused by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Coronavirus pummels U.S. retail sales, industrial production
Description: U.S. retail sales endured a second straight month of record declines in April as the novel coronavirus pandemic kept Americans at home, putting the economy on track for its biggest contraction in the second quarter since the Great Depression.

Headlines: Italian PM Conte says Fiat Chrysler entitled to seek state-backed loan
Description: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said on Saturday that Fiat Chrysler was entitled to apply for Italy's state-backed loans because the automaker employs thousands of people in the country, even though its legal base is located abroad.

Headlines: Fed says around 600 smaller banks tapped PPP facility in its first days
Description: Around 600 banks, most of them small community institutions, tapped the Federal Reserve's Paycheck Protection Program facility for about $30 billion of loans as of May 6, the U.S. central bank reported on Saturday in its first detailed disclosure under the new program.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Investors prepare for more U.S. stock swings as states reopen
Description: Investors are bracing for more turbulence in U.S. stocks, as some states prepare to reopen their economies and global trade tensions rise.

Headlines: Canada's Trudeau to look at possible further aid for airlines, after Air Canada layoffs
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Saturday he would look at possible ways to help airlines further, but laid out no new measures after the country's biggest airline announced mass layoffs due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Japan's economy to slump significantly due to pandemic: economy minister
Description: Japan's economy is expected to slump significantly due to sluggish overseas demand blamed on the coronavirus pandemic, Economy Minister Yasutoshi Nishimura said on Monday.

Headlines: GM tells Mexico workers it plans May 20 restart at Silao plant
Description: General Motors Co is tentatively planning to restart operations at its auto assembly plant in the Mexican city of Silao on May 20, according to a message to workers seen by Reuters on Sunday, as the car industry prepares to exit the coronavirus lockdown.

Headlines: SK Hynix shares fall on demand worries after U.S. curbs on Huawei chip supply
Description: Shares of South Korea's SK Hynix , the world's No.2 memory chip maker and supplier to Huawei [HWT.UL], fell as much as 3.3% early on Monday after a U.S. move to curb semiconductor supplies to the Chinese company stoked fears about a demand hit.

Headlines: UK's Gove says EU trade deal can be done despite talks stalemate
Description: Senior British government minister Michael Gove said on Sunday there was a post-Brexit trade deal to be done with the European Union providing the bloc agreed to compromise, days after both sides said talks were making little progress.

Headlines: Senator Rubio calls for fast action to extend U.S. payroll protection program
Description: The United States needs to quickly revise its coronavirus aid program for small businesses to extend the eight-week period in which the law currently requires companies to spend the money, a key U.S. senator said on Sunday.

Headlines: Pelosi sees negotiations on new $3 trillion coronavirus legislation: CBS
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Sunday there will be negotiations on the new $3 trillion coronavirus relief legislation passed by the Democratic-controlled House of Representatives and that Democrats have "no red lines."

Headlines: GM instructs Mexican suppliers to prepare to resume operations
Description: The president of General Motors Co's Mexican unit advised suppliers to prepare to resume operations after the Mexican government said the automotive industry could exit the coronavirus lockdown before June 1 with adequate safety measures.

Headlines: China says opposed to latest U.S. rules against Huawei
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Sunday it is firmly opposed to the latest rules by the United States against Huawei and will take all necessary measures to safeguard Chinese firms' rights and interests.

Headlines: China urges food companies to boost supplies on fears of further COVID-19 disruption
Description: China has asked trading firms and food processors to boost inventories of grains and oilseeds as a possible second wave of coronavirus cases and worsening infection rates elsewhere raise concerns about global supply lines.

Headlines: A month after negative oil prices, U.S. crude contract expiry looms
Description: A month after sellers had to pay nearly $40 a barrel to get rid of U.S. oil futures, the next watershed moment looms with the expiry of the June contract on Tuesday - and so far there is little sign of a repeat of the historic plunge.

Headlines: U.S. Senator Klobuchar blasts Uber, Grubhub deal talks
Description: U.S. Senator Amy Klobuchar on Sunday blasted merger talks between ride-hailing firm Uber Technologies Inc and online food delivery company Grubhub Inc, calling any deal bad for competition and consumers.

Headlines: J.C. Penney to permanently shut about 242 stores as part of bankruptcy plan
Description: J.C. Penney Co Inc plans to trim its store count by 29% to about 604, as the U.S. department store chain looks to focus on those more profitable, a regulatory filing showed on Monday, two days after it filed for bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: More than 8% of U.S. mortgages now in forbearance: MBA weekly survey
Description: Roughly 4.1 million U.S. mortgage borrowers have had their payments paused or reduced as the novel coronavirus outbreak hits household finances, but the increase in the number of people needing such help is slowing, the latest weekly survey from the Mortgage Bankers Association showed on Monday.

Headlines: FCA has to strengthen investments in Italy to seek state-backed loan: Economy Minister
Description: Italy's Economy Minister Roberto Gualtieri on Monday said Fiat Chrysler [FCHA.MI] has to strengthen investments in Italy and avoid delocalizing its factories outside the national borders to apply for a state backed loan.

Headlines: Trump says should be possible to allow PPP borrowers more time to use loans
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday extending the amount of time borrowers in the Paycheck Protection Program have to spend their funds to 24 weeks from the current eight weeks "should be easy."

Headlines: NIBC says it will pay 2019 dividend to Blackstone to ensure acquisition
Description: Dutch bank NIBC Holding NV said late on Monday it has agreed to pay its 2019 dividend to its proposed buyer, U.S. equity firm Blackstone Group Inc , before the deal settles, in order to remove one hurdle to the proposed 1.36 billion-euro ($1.47 billion) takeover.

Headlines: S&P 500 closes at 10-week high on vaccine hopes, stimulus pledge
Description: U.S. stocks jumped on Monday, and the S&P 500 closed at a 10-week high, on encouraging early-stage data for a potential coronavirus vaccine and on the promise of more stimulus to lift an economy beaten down by the pandemic.

Headlines: Starbucks says reopening many stores in Japan
Description: Starbucks Coffee Japan said it was reopening many of its stores in Japan, including Tokyo, starting on Tuesday, although many of them will be limited to take-out and drive-through services.

Headlines: Australia's Qantas set to ramp up domestic flights without social distancing
Description: Qantas Airways Ltd could restart 40-50% of its domestic capacity in July if states relax border controls, and expects to offer low and flexible fares without social distancing measures to stimulate travel demand, its chief executive said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Japan braces for worst postwar slump as pandemic tips economy into recession
Description: Japan's economy slipped into recession for the first time in 4-1/2 years in the last quarter, putting the nation on course for its deepest postwar slump as the coronavirus crisis ravages businesses and consumers.

Headlines: Fed's Powell: 'Medical metrics' most important data for U.S. economy now: CBS
Description: The most important data for the U.S. economy right now are the "medical metrics" around the coronavirus pandemic, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said Sunday night in broadcast remarks where he outlined the likely need for three to six more months of government financial help for firms and families.

Headlines: Panasonic sees strong demand from Tesla, in talks to expand Nevada battery plant
Description: Panasonic Corp's finance chief said the company is seeing strong demand for battery cells from U.S. partner Tesla and they are in talks to expand their joint plant in Nevada, which is now profitable.

Headlines: Tech firms sweeten deals for U.S. banks cutting costs in crisis
Description: Top technology services firms are offering payment deferrals, discounts of up to 20% and other sweeteners to some U.S. banks to keep their business as the pandemic forces Wall Street to cut tech budgets, according to executives involved in the talks.

Headlines: SoftBank's Vision Fund tumbles to $18 billion loss in 'valley of coronavirus'
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp reported a stunning $18 billion loss at its giant Vision Fund, pushing Masayoshi Son's conglomerate to a record loss and highlighting the deepening crisis at its portfolio companies from the global downturn.

Headlines: Trump admin slaps solar, wind operators with retroactive rent bills
Description: The Trump administration has ended a two-year rent holiday for solar and wind projects operating on federal lands, handing them whopping retroactive bills at a time the industry is struggling with the fallout of the coronavirus outbreak, according to company officials.

Headlines: TSMC stops new Huawei orders after U.S. restrictions: Nikkei
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd has stopped new orders from Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] in response to Washington's move aimed at further limiting chip supplies to the Chinese company, the Nikkei reported on Monday, citing multiple sources.

Headlines: U.S. car rental firm Hertz names new CEO
Description: Hertz Global Holdings Inc on Monday appointed Paul Stone as its chief executive officer days after the U.S. car rental company raised going-concern doubts following a bigger quarterly loss.

Headlines: Huawei calls U.S. move to curb chips supply 'arbitrary', expects business impact
Description: Huawei Technologies in its first official response to the Trump administration's move to curb its access to global chip supplies called it "arbitrary" and said its business would be impacted.

Headlines: U.S. homebuilder confidence rises in May
Description: Confidence among U.S. single-family homebuilders rose in May, potentially signaling that the worst of the economic downturn was probably over as the country gradually reopens after lockdowns to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Microsoft to adapt its cloud software for healthcare industry
Description: Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday it plans to roll out a version of its cloud-based software that will be modified to suit the needs of healthcare organizations.

Headlines: Few U.S. oil and gas firms return small-business COVID-19 loans
Description: U.S. securities filings show that only four of 12 listed oil and gas companies that received emergency government aid made available for small businesses said they would return it ahead of a deadline for firms that do not need the funds to do so.

Headlines: S&P recovery will be far faster than 2008: Citigroup
Description: U.S. stock markets will deliver among the steepest recoveries in their history over the next year, returning to levels from before March's coronavirus lockdowns more than twice as fast as after the 2008 financial crisis, according to analysts from U.S. bank Citigroup.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler's loan request raises doubts about 5.5 euro billion dividend
Description: Italy could look into Fiat Chrysler's planned 5.5 billion euro ($6 billion) payout as part of its merger with Peugeot after the Italian-American carmaker asked for a 6.3 billion euro state-backed loan, a senior government source said.

Headlines: Nasdaq informs China's Luckin Coffee it plans to delist it
Description: Luckin Coffee Inc said on Tuesday that Nasdaq Inc has given it notice that it plans to delist it from the U.S. stock exchange a month after the Chinese coffee chain disclosed that some of its employees fabricated sales accounts.

Headlines: As coronavirus crushes small restaurants, big chains see room to move in
Description: Prime storefronts left empty by failed businesses. Cheaper or even flexible rents. Landlords willing to add drive-thru lanes.

Headlines: Mnuchin says seeing large second quarter unemployment, negative economic data
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Tuesday that he is continuing to see large unemployment numbers and other negative economic indicators during the second quarter, but the situation is expected to improve as the U.S. economy starts to reopen.

Headlines: Airlines say ticket cancellations slowing; business models may change
Description: Top U.S. airlines and Air Canada on Tuesday reported slower ticket cancellations and an improvement in bookings on some routes, though executives said overall demand remained weak and changes to travel rules may force new business models.

Headlines: Coronavirus hammers U.S. homebuilding; permits tumble
Description: U.S. homebuilding dropped by the most on record in April and permits for future construction tumbled, underlining fears that the coronavirus crisis would lead to the deepest economic contraction in the second quarter since the Great Depression.

Headlines: U.S. economy won't reclaim all of its lost ground until after 2021: CBO
Description: The U.S. economy should bounce back sharply in the third quarter after its deep coronavirus-related collapse, but it will not fully retake recover lost ground until sometime after next year, the non-partisan Congressional Budget Office said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump administration signs up new company to make COVID-19 drugs in U.S.
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration awarded a contract worth up to $812 million for a new U.S. company to manufacture drugs and drug ingredients to fight COVID-19 on American soil, aiming to end dependence on other countries.

Headlines: American Airlines may use loyalty program as collateral for U.S. debt: President
Description: American Airlines Group Inc may use its Advantage loyalty program as collateral for a secured U.S. government loan, President Robert Isom said at a conference on Tuesday, noting that government talks are ongoing.

Headlines: 'All my dreams are shattered': coronavirus crushes Asia’s garment industry
Description: Zarchi Lwin pawned her only two gold bangles for $140 when the owner of the Myanmar factory where she sewed winter coats for British retailer Next Plc shut it down after orders dried up due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: Financial gain trumps espionage as top motivator in cyber attacks: report
Description: Money trumped spying as the top motivator for data breaches last year, according to Verizon's annual report on cyber crimes published on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. overtakes China as most attractive country for renewables investment: research
Description: The United States has overtaken China as the most attractive country in the world for renewables investment and the global clean energy sector is expected to bounce back quickly despite the coronavirus pandemic, research showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Disney's streaming chief Mayer to become TikTok CEO
Description: Walt Disney Co's top streaming executive, Kevin Mayer, will leave the entertainment and theme parks giant to become the chief executive officer of TikTok, the popular video app owned by China's ByteDance Technology Co, the companies said on Monday.

Headlines: Phlow gets $354 million U.S. funding to ensure drug supply amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: U.S. drug manufacturer Phlow said on Tuesday it had received $354 million from the government to speed up the manufacturing of drugs being tested and used to fight the new coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. housing starts fall sharply in April
Description: U.S. homebuilding dropped to a five-year low in April, underlining fears that the novel coronavirus crisis would lead to the deepest economic contraction in the second quarter since the Great Depression.

Headlines: Trump floats halt to U.S. cattle imports as pandemic hurts ranchers
Description: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday the United States should consider terminating trade deals under which it imports cattle as he looks to help U.S. ranchers hit hard by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Ford requires visitors to wear masks but unclear if Trump will comply
Description: Ford Motor Co on Tuesday reiterated its policy that all visitors to its manufacturing plants must wear a mask but said the White House will ultimately decide if U.S. President Donald Trump will comply during a planned visit.

Headlines: Senate Democrats call for Trump administration to unveil details of TSMC plant deal
Description: Democratic lawmakers on Tuesday urged the Trump administration to answer "serious questions" about Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd's plans to build a U.S.-based $12 billion plant, flagging national security concerns and potentially undisclosed subsidies.

Headlines: Trump wants payroll tax holiday to mitigate coronavirus economic pain: Kudlow
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Tuesday that President Donald Trump wants a payroll tax holiday for U.S. workers in the hopes of staunching economic pain caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Exxon revives sale of stake in giant Azeri oilfield
Description: Exxon Mobil has relaunched the sale of its stake in Azerbaijan's largest oilfield, the company said on Tuesday, as banking and industry sources said the move was drawing interest from large Asian oil and gas companies seeking to capitalize on the recent collapse in oil prices.

Headlines: U.S. crude strengthens as certain stimulus measures to continue
Description: U.S. crude ended slightly higher on Tuesday, as U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said he supported extending certain measures intended to bolster the economy, while Brent ended lower on concerns that output cuts might not be sufficient.

Headlines: GM delays tentative restart for plant in Silao, Mexico to May 21
Description: General Motors Co signaled it has pushed back the tentative date for restarting operations at its auto assembly plant in the central Mexican city of Silao to May 21 from May 20, according to a message to workers seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fiserv's First Data pays $40 million to settle FTC charges it aided merchants' fraud
Description: First Data Merchant Services LLC and a former executive will pay nearly $40.3 million to settle U.S. civil charges they knowingly processed payments and helped launder credit card transactions in four scams that harmed hundreds of thousands of consumers.

Headlines: U.S. travelers pick car rentals over flights for holidays: travel website Kayak
Description: Travel website Kayak is seeing more demand for car rentals than air travel from customers looking to avoid crowds and stay closer to home as U.S. states reopen, Chief Executive Officer Steve Hafner told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Senate passes bill that could block Chinese firms from U.S. securities exchanges
Description: The U.S. Senate passed legislation on Wednesday that could prevent some Chinese companies from listing their shares on U.S. exchanges unless they follow standards for U.S. audits and regulations.

Headlines: Apollo Global invests $1.75 billion in U.S. supermarket operator Albertsons
Description: Buyout firm Apollo Global Management said on Wednesday it has invested $1.75 billion in Albertsons Companies Inc, a sign of confidence in the debt-laden U.S. supermarket operator whose fortunes have picked up in the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Oil rises on lower U.S. stocks, firmer demand
Description: Oil prices rallied on Wednesday after U.S. crude inventories fell in the most recent week, but gains were capped by worries over the economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic and weak refining margins.

Headlines: Ford shuts two U.S. assembly plants due to COVID-19 infections
Description: Ford Motor Co on Wednesday closed two U.S. assembly plants as the coronavirus pandemic wreaked early havoc with the No. 2 U.S. automaker's plan to restart North American production and begin making its most profitable vehicles again.

Headlines: U.S. airlines step up safety measures in preparation for recovery
Description: U.S. carriers JetBlue Airways Corp and United Airlines Holdings Inc announced fresh safety measures on Wednesday aimed at restoring confidence in air travel as several executives pointed to signs domestic demand is improving.

Headlines: Small and mid-cap equities are more reflective of the real U.S. economy: Wells Fargo
Description: Kirk Hartman of Wells Fargo Asset Management says the gap between U.S. small caps and large caps is closing. He sees some value in the small-cap space, but the key is to have the economy recover first.

Headlines: Zalando proposes Rent The Runway CEO to join board
Description: German online fashion retailer Zalando proposed on Wednesday that Jennifer Hyman, the chief executive of U.S. clothing rental firm Rent the Runway, joins its supervisory board, replacing Alexander Samwer.

Headlines: U.S. regulators open door to possible tightening of Huawei chip curb
Description: U.S. regulators are open to making changes to close what some see as a loophole in a new rule aimed at curbing global chip sales to blacklisted Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei Technologies Ltd, two U.S. officials said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Nissan says it has noted U.S. arrests in Ghosn case, reserves right for legal measures
Description: Nissan Motor Co said on Thursday it still reserves the right to take further legal measures in the case of its ousted former Chairman Carlos Ghosn, after the United States arrested two men on charges they enabled his escape from Japan.

Headlines: Canada recommends masks, says emergency loans have no cap but many limits
Description: There will be no cap on the size of Canada's emergency loans to large companies harmed by the coronavirus pandemic but there will be multiple restrictions, the government said on Wednesday, as it recommended wearing masks in public for the first time.

Headlines: Norwegian Air's lessors take majority ownership
Description: Lessors including AerCap and BOC Aviation are now the biggest shareholders in Norwegian Air after the budget carrier completed a debt restructuring and secured a long-sought credit guarantee from Norway's government.

Headlines: Coronavirus crushes Australia's dividends with banks leading the decline
Description: Australia has made the deepest dividend cuts globally this year, with more than $6 billion deferred or cancelled as companies conserve cash to ride out the coronavirus, turning foreign investors wary of the country's normally high-yielding firms.

Headlines: Germany approves new powers to block foreign takeovers in healthcare
Description: Germany gave itself new powers to veto hostile foreign takeover bids for healthcare companies on Wednesday, a measure designed to ensure a continuous supply of essential products during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Luckin scandal ripple effect prompts chairman-backed firm to seek cash: sources
Description: A company linked to China's scandal-hit Luckin Coffee Inc is seeking fresh capital, sources said, highlighting the ripple effect of Luckin's fabricated transactions as the chairman of both firms scrambles to avoid a cash crunch.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank chairman to stand down in 2022
Description: Deutsche Bank's chairman Paul Achleitner said he intends to step down when his term ends in 2022, heralding a new era at Germany's largest lender as it struggles to become profitable.

Headlines: Delta CEO: More summer flights seen as U.S. travel slowly rises
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc is likely to increase capacity this summer by adding flights in June and July as U.S. domestic travel slowly picks up amid the novel coronavirus pandemic, its chief executive officer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson to stop selling talc baby powder in U.S. and Canada
Description: Johnson & Johnson will stop selling its talc Baby Powder in the United States and Canada, it announced on Tuesday, saying demand had fallen in the wake of what it called "misinformation" about the product's safety amid a barrage of legal challenges.

Headlines: Britain's Rolls-Royce to axe 9,000 jobs in air travel slump
Description: Rolls-Royce plans to cut at least 9,000 jobs, or more than a sixth of its workforce, in the latest blows to the UK economy and aviation industry dealt by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Britain ready to support Rolls-Royce employees over job cuts
Description: Britain's government stands ready to help those affected by a plan at engine maker Rolls-Royce to cut at least 9,000 jobs, a spokesman for Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Nestle to build new plant-based food facility in China under $100 million investment plan
Description: Food giant Nestle said on Wednesday it would spend 100 million swiss francs ($103.58 million) on expanding its manufacturing footprint in China to include a new plant-based food facility and widen its production lines.

Headlines: Renault to re-open its Sandouville plant on Friday: union source
Description: French carmaker Renault will re-open its Normandy-based Sandouville plant in northwestern France on Friday, a trade union source told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: France wants Renault to maintain its French plants
Description: The French government will insist on preserving Renault production plants in France and wants it to remain the carmaker's global centre for engineering, research, innovation and development, Prime Minister Edouard Philippe said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Brent at highest since March on U.S. stock draw, recovering demand
Description: Global benchmark Brent rose more than 1% on Thursday to its highest since March, supported by lower U.S. crude inventories, OPEC-led supply cuts and recovering demand as governments ease coronavirus restrictions on people's movements.

Headlines: Americans splurge at Walmart, Target as stimulus checks kick in
Description: The Trump Administration's coronavirus relief payment provided a fillip to sales of major retailers in April as millions of Americans used the money to buy everything from video games to sewing machines even as the country struggles with record job losses.

Headlines: Exclusive: Baidu considers leaving the Nasdaq to boost its valuation - sources
Description: Chinese search engine giant Baidu Inc is considering delisting from the U.S. Nasdaq and moving to an exchange closer to home to boost its valuation amid rising tension between the United States and China over investments, three sources said.

Headlines: Mnuchin sees U.S. economic bottom in second quarter, 'gigantic increase' fourth quarter
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday he believes the U.S. economy will "bottom out" in the second quarter and start to improve with the third quarter, with a "gigantic increase" in fourth quarter activity.

Headlines: Top safety official at Waymo self-driving unit stepping down
Description: Alphabet Inc’s Waymo self-driving unit said on Thursday that its chief safety officer, Debbie Hersman, was stepping down but would remain as a consultant to the company.

Headlines: U.S. meat inventories tightened as virus shut slaughterhouses: USDA
Description: U.S. frozen pork inventories fell in April, when they typically rise, and beef inventories dropped more than normal as the coronavirus pandemic shut slaughterhouses and prompted grocers to limit customers' buying, government data showed on Thursday.

Headlines: GM starts to reopen plants in Mexico
Description: General Motors Co said that it was on Thursday gradually restarting the transmissions and motors lines at its Mexican plants in Ramos Arizpe in the northern state of Coahuila and in the central city of Silao.

Headlines: Judgment on key aspect of Huawei CFO's extradition trial in Canada due next Wednesday
Description: A decision on a key legal aspect of the trial over whether Huawei Technologies Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou can be extradited to the United States from Canada will be announced next Wednesday, the British Columbia Supreme Court said on Thursday.

Headlines: Proxy adviser ISS recommends vote 'against' executive pay at Alphabet
Description: Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) has recommended shareholders of Google-parent Alphabet Inc to vote "against" the company's proposed executive pay at its annual meet in June, according to a report seen by Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: 'I've not yet signed Renault loan', says French finance minister
Description: France's Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said he has not signed off on a 5 billion euro ($5.47 billion) state-guaranteed loan to help Renault cope with the fallout from the coronavirus, and that discussions continued.

Headlines: U.S. existing home sales post largest decline in nearly 10 years
Description: U.S. home sales logged their biggest drop in nearly 10 years in April as the novel coronavirus pandemic upended the labor market and broader economy, undercutting demand for housing.

Headlines: The slow reopen: Retail visits edge up, broader economic measures still unmoved
Description: The U.S. continued its cautious reemergence from a coronavirus-linked shutdown over the past week, with measures of retail foot traffic slowly increasing but broader indexes of economic activity still stalled.

Headlines: JPMorgan plans to hire a dozen research analysts for China brokerage: sources
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co plans to hire at least 12 equity research analysts in China this year, two people with knowledge of the matter said, in its first major mainland hiring push as it takes advantage of eased ownership rules for financial firms.

Headlines: Israeli anti-viral mask maker Sonovia eyes Nasdaq listing this year
Description: Israel's Sonovia Ltd, which makes washable and reusable anti-viral masks, is considering going public on Nasdaq by the end of this year, its chief technology officer said.

Headlines: Gap rushes in more robots to warehouses to solve virus disruption
Description: U.S. apparel chain Gap Inc is speeding up its rollout of warehouse robots for assembling online orders so it can limit human contact during the coronavirus pandemic, the company told Reuters.

Headlines: Lufthansa closes in on $10 billion state rescue deal
Description: Lufthansa is in advanced talks over a 9 billion euros ($9.9 billion) state bailout that would see Germany take a 20% stake in its flagship airline, as countries battle to save an aviation industry hammered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Traders Beware: U.S. taps new tools to find fraud in volatile commodities market
Description: When the U.S. Department of Justice charged a handful of JP Morgan Chase & Co traders in 2018 and 2019 with alleged commodities futures manipulation, it wasn't the first time the government had probed the bank's metals trading activities.

Headlines: Japan to seek extradition of men arrested in U.S. over Ghosn escape
Description: Japan said on Thursday it was working to secure the rapid extradition of two men arrested in the United States on charges of enabling the dramatic escape of former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn from the country.

Headlines: U.S. leveraged loan defaults at six-year high as coronavirus hits businesses
Description: The monthly tally of defaults in the U.S. leveraged loan market has hit a six-year high, data from Fitch Ratings showed, as companies are either missing payments or filing for bankruptcy because of the fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Italy Economy Minister confident government, Fiat can complete state-backed loan
Description: Italy's Economy Minister Roberto Gualtieri said on Friday he was confident the government and Fiat Chrysler would be able to complete a deal over a state-backed loan for the carmaker.

Headlines: U.S. senators urge Delta, JetBlue to restore employee hours
Description: A group of U.S. senators is urging Delta Air Lines Inc and JetBlue Airways Corp to immediately reverse their decisions to reduce employees' hours, calling them contrary to the requirements of taxpayer-funded payroll assistance.

Headlines: Hedge funds increased exposure to growth favorites in first quarter: Goldman
Description: Hedge funds concentrated their portfolios even further into growth stocks including Amazon.com Inc and Microsoft Corp in the first quarter of 2020 as the COVID-19 pandemic pummeled U.S. markets, Goldman Sachs analysts said in a report.

Headlines: U.S. grants tentative OK for 15 air carriers to suspend service to 75 airports
Description: The U.S. Transportation Department said late on Friday it had granted tentative approval to 15 airlines to temporarily halt service to 75 U.S. airports because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Automaker trade backs U.S. on effort to weaken fuel efficiency rules
Description: A group representing many major automakers on Friday backed the Trump administration's decision to weaken Obama administration fuel efficiency standards but said it opposed further reductions in requirements.

Headlines: U.S. charges ousted Hollywood executive with defrauding pandemic loan program, BlackRock fund
Description: U.S. prosecutors have charged the recently ousted owner of a Hollywood movie distributor with defrauding a federal coronavirus emergency relief program and a BlackRock Inc investment fund, including to pay for a Beverly Hills mansion and other luxuries.

Headlines: All 50 U.S. states shed jobs in April: Labor Department
Description: Unemployment rates rose and total employment fell in all 50 U.S. states and the District of Columbia in April as efforts to contain the coronavirus pandemic forced businesses to close across the country, the Labor Department said on Friday.

Headlines: Dozens of Chinese companies added to U.S. blacklist in latest Beijing rebuke
Description: The United States said on Friday it would add 33 Chinese firms and institutions to an economic blacklist for helping Beijing spy on its minority Uighur population or because of ties to weapons of mass destruction and China's military.

Headlines: Business groups push Trump to keep skilled-worker visas amid pandemic
Description: A range of business groups have made an 11th-hour appeal to U.S. President Donald Trump as he weighs whether to restrict temporary work visas, warning of negative economic consequences if he blocks the flow of skilled foreign workers into the United States.

Headlines: U.S. agencies ask FCC to rescind Ligado spectrum decision
Description: A group of U.S. agencies on Friday asked the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to reconsider its unanimous April 22 decision to allow Ligado Networks [MOSAV.UL] to deploy a low-power nationwide mobile broadband network, saying it could pose a threat to global positioning systems (GPS).

Headlines: Uber customer claims company won price-fixing suit because arbitrator was scared
Description: An Uber customer on Friday asked a Manhattan federal judge to overturn an arbitration win for the company in a price-fixing case, arguing that the arbitrator only ruled in Uber's favor because he was scared.

Headlines: Rudderless after a rally, stock markets look for next catalyst
Description: Global equity markets have shuffled up about 1% this month despite the world starting to re-open after the coronavirus-driven lockdowns and U.S. and European economic data showing glimmers of a recovery.

Headlines: Trump visits Ford plant in politically crucial Michigan, leaves mask off for cameras
Description: President Donald Trump traveled on Thursday to the crucial U.S. election battleground state of Michigan to visit a Ford Motor Co plant amid tensions with its Democratic governor during the coronavirus pandemic, opting not to wear a protective face mask for the cameras.

Headlines: China's biggest automaker expects domestic car sales to pick up in second quarter
Description: China's biggest automaker SAIC Motor expects the nation's auto sales to post year-on-year growth in the second quarter due to recovering demand and supportive policies, its chairman said on Friday.

Headlines: Ryanair's Lauda airline to close Vienna base, 300 jobs to go
Description: Ryanair's Austrian airline Lauda on Friday said it would shut down its main Vienna base on May 29 with the loss of more than 300 jobs in Austria after it did not manage to agree new labour contracts with the union.

Headlines: China's Geely to explore deeper cooperation with Daimler: chairman
Description: China's Geely will explore the possibility of deeper cooperation with German luxury automaker Daimler AG , its Chairman Li Shufu said on Friday.

Headlines: Angola's oil exploration evaporates as COVID-19 overshadows historic reforms
Description: The coronavirus pandemic has done in a handful of months what even a 27-year civil war did not: it has brought oil drilling to a halt in Angola, Africa's second-largest oil producer.

Headlines: Amazon to hire 50,000 temp workers in India as lockdown boosts demand
Description: Amazon.com Inc's India unit said it would hire 50,000 temporary workers to meet a surge in online shopping in the country, where customers have been stuck indoors for two months in a lockdown to fight the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Large employers push back on U.S. healthcare mergers during coronavirus crisis
Description: A group representing some of the largest U.S. employers has asked Congress for a year-long ban on mergers and acquisitions among hospitals and doctors groups that received government money to cope with the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Most publicly listed companies keep U.S. small-business aid loans
Description: More than four-fifths of publicly listed companies that received emergency small-business loans from the U.S. government have held onto them, sticking with a certification that they need the money, according to data from market research firm FactSquared.

Headlines: Air France must slash domestic traffic in exchange for state guarantees -minister
Description: Air France will have to "drastically" reduce its domestic air traffic in exchange for state loan guarantees, French Environment Minister Elisabeth Borne said on Sunday.

Headlines: China's Great Wall expects mild domestic auto sales growth in second half
Description: Great Wall Motor expects China's overall auto sales in the second half this year to return to the same level as last year, its president said, as the world's biggest auto market recovers from a coronavirus-driven low.

Headlines: Nissan says preparing to gradually restart Mexico operations
Description: The Mexican unit of Nissan Motor Co Ltd unit said on Monday that it is preparing to gradually reopen under strict safety measures, beginning with activities that are directly related to vehicle and autoparts manufacturing.

Headlines: Germany's Scholz: Lufthansa rescue package should yield 'small profit' for state
Description: Germany's rescue package for flagship carrier Lufthansa is a "very, very good solution" that is taking into account the needs of both the company and taxpayers, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Monday.

Headlines: Air Canada, Transat deal faces intense EU antitrust scrutiny
Description: Air Canada's bid for Canadian tour operator Transat AT Inc may result in higher prices and less choice for flights between Europe and Canada, EU antitrust regulators said on Monday as they opened a full-scale investigation into the deal.

Headlines: Lufthansa says Germany approves stabilization package
Description: Germany's new Economic Stabilization Fund (WSF) has approved a 9 billion euro ($9.80 billion) stabilization package for Lufthansa , Germany's flagship carrier said on Monday.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit pays scaled-down tax of $358 million after government talks
Description: Walmart de Mexico paid $358 million in taxes after talks with the Mexican government over an even larger sum authorities had aimed to charge the retailer for the sale of a restaurant chain, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: New emissions blow for VW as German court backs damages claims
Description: Volkswagen must pay compensation to owners of vehicles with rigged diesel engines in Germany, a court ruled on Monday, dealing a fresh blow to the automaker almost five years after its emissions scandal erupted.

Headlines: Merkel won't allow EU to deprive Lufthansa of key slots: Handelsblatt
Description: Chancellor Angela Merkel told senior members of her party that the German government would not allow the European Commission to deprive Lufthansa of valuable take-off and landing slots at Frankfurt and Munich airports, Handelsblatt reported.

Headlines: Japan lifts Tokyo's state of emergency, eyes fresh stimulus
Description: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe lifted a state of emergency for Tokyo and four remaining areas on Monday after the number of infections fell across the country, but warned that it could be reimposed if the virus started spreading again.

Headlines: BMW to begin gradual restart in San Luis Potosi, Mexico on May 27
Description: German carmaker BMW said on Tuesday it would begin a gradual restart of operations at its plant in the central Mexican state of San Luis Potosi on Wednesday, May 27.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker wants insurers, govt. to share future pandemic business losses
Description: U.S. legislation introduced on Tuesday would create a taxpayer-backed insurance program to protect businesses from revenue losses during future pandemics and require insurers to pay a slice of the claims.

Headlines: S&P 500 rises on economic recovery and vaccine hopes, pulls back from highs
Description: U.S. stocks closed higher on Tuesday on optimism about the development of coronavirus vaccines and a revival of business activity, but the S&P 500 failed to hold above the key psychological level of 3,000 points.

Headlines: Amtrak needs $1.5 billion bailout, prepares to cut up to 20% of workforce
Description: U.S. passenger railroad service Amtrak said on Tuesday it needs a further $1.475 billion bailout and disclosed plans to cut its workforce by up to 20% in the coming budget year.

Headlines: COVID-19 lawsuit takes on McDonald's like it was a rowdy bar
Description: As U.S. businesses reopen, worried workers and their advocates are borrowing a legal strategy commonly used to shut down rowdy topless bars to try and force employers to strengthen protection against further spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: LATAM airline shares plunge 51% following bankruptcy announcement
Description: Shares in LATAM Airlines Group SA plunged 51% on Santiago´s stock exchange after the region´s top carrier filed for U.S. bankruptcy protection on Tuesday.

Headlines: Google to start reopening offices, targets 30% capacity in September
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Tuesday it would reopen buildings in more cities at roughly 10% of their capacity beginning July 6 and scale it up to 30% in September, if conditions permit.

Headlines: Ryanair challenges Lufthansa's bailout package
Description: Low-cost carrier Ryanair challenged Germany's 9 billion euro rescue package for Lufthansa on Tuesday, saying it distorted competition, while the German carrier moves towards finalising the deal next month.

Headlines: French restaurant ruling puts coronavirus claims on global menu
Description: AXA will meet the bulk of business interruption claims from some restaurant owners in France, it said on Tuesday, after losing a court case seen as a potential precedent for coronavirus-related disputes across the world.

Headlines: Austrian Airlines, government agree financing package: Kurier
Description: Austria's government and Lufthansa-owned carrier Austrian Airlines on Tuesday reached agreement on loans for the airline and to keep Vienna airport as a long-haul hub, a major step forward in the rescue negotiations, daily Kurier said.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence stabilizes; new home sales surprise
Description: U.S. consumer confidence nudged up in May, suggesting the worst of the novel coronavirus-driven economic slump was likely in the past as the country starts to reopen, but it could take a while for the economy to dig out of its hole amid record unemployment.

Headlines: Apple to reopen about 100 U.S. stores, most with curbside pickup
Description: Apple Inc plans to reopen about 100 U.S. stores, mostly with curbside pickup but some with walk-in service, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Warner Music kicks off $1.8 billion Nasdaq IPO
Description: Warner Music Group said on Tuesday it is aiming to sell up to $1.82 billion in stock in its U.S. initial public offering, potentially the largest New York IPO so far in 2020 as the market for new stocks rebounds after the COVID-19 pandemic put many debuts on hold.

Headlines: Armed with whistleblower tips, U.S. SEC cracks down on coronavirus misconduct
Description: The novel coronavirus outbreak and economic fallout is proving to be a bonanza for whistleblower lawyers as the U.S. securities regulator cracks down on a range of related misconduct from companies touting sham cures to misuse of federal aid.

Headlines: U.S. business borrowing for equipment falls about 7% in April: ELFA
Description: U.S. companies' borrowings for capital investments fell about 7% in April from a year earlier, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association (ELFA) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Instant View: S&P rises above 3,000 level for first time since March
