Description: U.S. stocks rose above the 3,000 level for the first time since March 5 on Tuesday, continuing a rally that has pushed the benchmark index up nearly 35% from its March 23 closing low on hopes for a potential coronavirus vaccine and the reopening of businesses across the country.

Headlines: 'Rally of hope': Why the S&P soared back past 3,000
Description: Unthinkable just two months ago as the world economy shut down in response to the coronavirus pandemic, the U.S. stock benchmark S&P 500 index broke through the psychologically-important 3,000 level on Tuesday, capping a 37% stock rally since its March low.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales unexpectedly rise in April
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes unexpectedly rose in April, but the gains are likely temporary as the coronavirus crisis ravages the economy, unleashing record unemployment.

Headlines: Israel taps local desalination firm IDE over Hong Kong rival
Description: Israel on Tuesday chose local company IDE Technologies over a Chinese-linked rival to build the country's largest desalination plant to tackle water shortages in one of the driest parts of the world.

Headlines: Take Five: Coronavirus vaccine race is on
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has put his faith in anti-malarial drug hydroxychloroquine to ward off COVID-19, but governments and investors are focusing on a vaccine. Without one, it's unlikely economic activity can resume fully.

Headlines: Tencent to invest $70 billion in 'new infrastructure'
Description: Chinese tech giant Tencent Holdings will invest 500 billion yuan ($70 billion) over the next five years in technology infrastructure including cloud computing, artificial intelligence and cybersecurity, the company said Tuesday.

Headlines: Uber-rival Bolt raises 100 million euros
Description: Ride-hailing service Bolt said on Tuesday it has raised 100 million euros ($109 million) from London-based investment firm Naya Capital Management in a deal valuing the European rival of Uber at 1.7 billion euros.

Headlines: Exclusive: Cathay Pacific's brand merger hits roadblock from China's aviation regulator
Description: China's aviation regulator may make it difficult for Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd to merge regional arm Cathay Dragon into its main brand because of infractions during last year's pro-democracy protests, two sources said.

Headlines: U.S. small firms leave $150 billion in coronavirus stimulus untapped
Description: When the U.S. government first rolled out forgivable loans to small businesses in early April under the Paycheck Protection Program, loan officers at Bank of the West in Grapevine, Texas worked nights and weekends to process a tsunami of applications.

Headlines: KFC to test revamped sandwich after last year's fried chicken frenzy
Description: Kentucky Fried Chicken on Tuesday will begin testing an overhauled sandwich featuring a bigger chicken filet and other modifications that could reignite last year's Great Chicken Sandwich Wars with rivals Popeyes and Chick-fil-A.

Headlines: Exclusive: ECB prepares for the worst: life without the Bundesbank - sources
Description: The European Central Bank (ECB) is drafting contingency plans to carry out its multi-trillion bond-buying programme without the Bundesbank in case Germany's top court forces the main participant in the scheme to quit, four sources told Reuters.

Headlines: S&P 500 futures surge on recovery, vaccine hopes
Description: U.S. stock futures surged on Tuesday as business restarts and optimism about a potential coronavirus vaccine helped investors returning from a long weekend to overlook Sino-U.S. tensions.

Headlines: Swiss trial begins of banker alleged to have ignored 1MDB warnings
Description: A banker went on trial in Switzerland on Tuesday charged with failing to sound the alarm over millions of dollars linked to scandal-tainted Malaysian sovereign wealth fund 1MDB.

Headlines: Sanofi shares down despite $13 billion Regeneron payday
Description: Shares in Sanofi fell on Tuesday despite the French drugmaker's impending $13 billion payday from selling most of its 20.6% stake in U.S. partner Regeneron .

Headlines: Hertz awards over $16 million in retention bonus to key executives
Description: U.S. car rental company Hertz Global Holdings said on Tuesday it has paid about $16.2 million in retention bonuses to a range of key executives at the director level and above, days after the company filed for bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: Germany stamps authority on Lufthansa with $9.8 billion lifeline
Description: Germany threw Lufthansa a 9 billion euro ($9.8 billion) lifeline on Monday, agreeing a bailout which gives Berlin a veto in the event of a hostile bid for the airline.

Headlines: A Florida toy importer braces for retail upheaval
Description: Most U.S. states have begun to reopen their economies, but Jay Foreman, chief executive of Basic Fun, said he's more worried than ever.

Headlines: Uber cuts 600 jobs in India as lockdown hits business
Description: Uber Technologies Inc has cut about 600 jobs in India as part of plans to reduce its global workforce by 23%, the company said on Tuesday, joining local rival Ola as the COVID-19 pandemic crushes demand for app-based cab services.

Headlines: Nissan to begin restart of U.S. auto plants on June 1
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan Motor Co said Wednesday it plans to begin restarting its shuttered U.S. manufacturing operations beginning June 1.

Headlines: Online sales surge helps Ralph Lauren recover in China
Description: Ralph Lauren Corp said on Wednesday a surge in online shopping was helping it get back on track in China and putting it on course for a recovery from the financial damage wrought by the COVID-19 lockdowns in other markets as well.

Headlines: LATAM becomes largest airline driven to bankruptcy by coronavirus
Description: LATAM Airlines Group , the continent's largest carrier, filed for U.S. bankruptcy protection on Tuesday, becoming the world's largest carrier so far to seek an emergency reorganization due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: H&M sees furloughed HQ staff returning to work in July
Description: Sweden's H&M expects the 2,500 furloughed staff at its headquarters in Stockholm to return to work in July, the world's second-largest fashion retailer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. businesses hammered by pandemic but see some green shoots, Fed says
Description: U.S. businesses continued to be slammed by the effects of the novel coronavirus epidemic into the middle of May, a Federal Reserve report showed on Wednesday, and few expected a swift recovery despite some signs of hope.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chevron to cut up to 15% of staff amid restructuring
Description: Chevron Corp will cut 10% to 15% of its worldwide workforce as part of an ongoing restructuring at the second-largest U.S. oil producer.

Headlines: Wall Street frets as 'unloved' stock rally powers on
Description: The love-hate relationship many investors had with U.S. stocks during the more-than-decade-long bull market is reemerging, as equities steadily climb in the face of economic devastation and uncertainty over the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Lufthansa board rejects EU conditions on $10 billion bailout
Description: Lufthansa's $10 billion government bailout was thrown into doubt on Wednesday after the German airline's supervisory board refused to accept the conditions attached by Brussels.

Headlines: Ford to gradually resume operations, production at Mexican plants
Description: Ford Motor Co will gradually resume operations and production at several of its Mexican plants, the automaker said on Wednesday, as the sector begins to come back online as coronavirus contingencies are relaxed.

Headlines: All three Detroit automakers had workers test positive for COVID-19 since plants reopened
Description: In the week since U.S. auto factories reopened after coronavirus lockdowns, workers at all three Detroit automakers have tested positive for COVID-19 but only Ford Motor Co has temporarily closed plants.

Headlines: U.S. mortgage applications rise for sixth straight week
Description: U.S. applications for home mortgages jumped last week, in a sixth straight weekly increase, suggesting the housing market could lead the economy's recovery from the novel coronavirus crisis even as high unemployment is expected to linger.

Headlines: Boeing set to announce significant U.S. job cuts this week: union
Description: Boeing Co is expected to announce U.S. job cuts this week after disclosing last month it planned to shed 10% of its worldwide workforce of 160,000 employees, people briefed on the plans and a union said.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg says government censoring social media not the 'right reflex'
Description: Facebook Inc's Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg, commenting on U.S. President Donald Trump's threats against social media companies, said on Wednesday censoring a platform would not be the "right reflex" for a government worried about censorship.

Headlines: Nissan Motor to close Barcelona plant: El Pais
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor Co will close its factory in Barcelona, resulting in the loss of about 2,800 jobs, Spanish newspaper El Pais reported, citing government and union sources.

Headlines: Wall Street rises with economic hopes; bank stocks jump
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Wednesday, with the S&P 500 closing above 3,000 for the first time since March 5, as the further easing of lockdowns lifted optimism for an economic recovery.

Headlines: U.S. states sue Trump administration over fuel efficiency rollback
Description: A group of 23 U.S. states and the District of Columbia filed a lawsuit on Wednesday challenging a Trump administration decision to weaken Obama-era fuel efficiency standards.

Headlines: Trump will sign an executive order on social media companies: White House spokeswoman
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will sign an executive order shortly regarding social media companies, a White House spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Luxury homebuilder Toll Brothers scraps 2020 forecast on COVID-19 woes
Description: U.S. luxury homebuilder Toll Brothers Inc on Wednesday withdrew its full-year forecast and warned it would not provide such guidance for the foreseeable future due to uncertainty caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: American Airlines CEO quells U.S. bankruptcy talk, says demand improving
Description: American Airlines Group Inc is not considering a Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing, Chief Executive Doug Parker said on Wednesday and dismissed speculation that a major U.S. carrier could disappear due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: FedEx set to take stake in German deliver firm Hermes: report
Description: U.S. logistics company FedEx Corp is close to taking a stake in German parcel delivery firm Hermes, the Handelsblatt newspaper reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Boeing resumes 737 MAX production at low rate
Description: Boeing Co on Wednesday said it has resumed production of its 737 MAX passenger jet at the company’s Renton, Washington, plant at a "low rate" after halting production in January following two crashes that killed 346 people.

Headlines: Fears of coronavirus second wave prompt flu push at U.S. pharmacies, drugmakers
Description: U.S. pharmacy chains are preparing a big push for flu vaccinations when the season kicks off in October, hoping to curb tens of thousands of serious cases that could coincide with a second wave of coronavirus infections.

Headlines: Drugmaker Sanofi to raise over $11 billion via sale of Regeneron shares
Description: Sanofi will raise over $11 billion from the sale of 21.6 million shares in its U.S. partner Regeneron , the French drugmaker said on Wednesday, adding it would use the proceeds for innovation and general growth.

Headlines: Exclusive: TikTok owner ByteDance moves to shift power out of China - sources
Description: TikTok's poaching of Disney's Kevin Mayer to be its CEO was just the most visible part of a broader strategy by its Chinese owner to shift its centre of power away from China at a time of rising global tensions, several people familiar with the plans said.

Headlines: Trump directs AG to boost enforcement of state laws on social media companies
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that he is directing Attorney General William Barr to work with states to enforce their own laws against what he described as deceptive business practices by social media companies.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says U.S. economy has bottomed, ties rebound to testing
Description: The U.S. economy has likely bottomed, Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said on Thursday, but a healthy rebound depends on a massive increase in testing so that people feel comfortable resuming traveling, dining out and other pre-crisis activities.

Headlines: Trump could sign order on social media companies later on Thursday: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump could sign an executive order on social media companies later on Thursday, but the timing could change, White House Press Secretary Kayleigh MacEnany said, after Twitter urged readers to check facts in tweets sent by Trump earlier this week for the first time.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. taxpayers' virus relief went to firms that avoided U.S. taxes
Description: Last month Zagg Inc, a Utah-based company that makes mobile device accessories, received more than $9.4 million in cash from a U.S. government program that has provided emergency loans to millions of businesses hit by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Italy's credit agency SACE approves state guarantees for FCA $7 billion bank loan: source
Description: The board of Italy's export credit agency SACE has approved state guarantees covering 80% of a 6.3 billion euro ($7 billion) bank loan for Fiat Chrysler , a source close to the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump move could scrap or weaken law that protects social media companies
Description: President Donald Trump said he will introduce legislation that may scrap or weaken a law that has protected internet companies, including Twitter and Facebook, in an extraordinary attempt to regulate social media platforms where he has been criticized.

Headlines: Exclusive: Argentina says new debt revamp proposal in right direction, still falls short
Description: Argentina's economy minister said on Friday that a newly received debt restructuring proposal from two creditor groups was a step in the right direction, but still fell short of what the country needed to strike a deal.

Headlines: Tyson Foods will shut U.S. pork plant as more workers catch COVID-19
Description: Tyson Foods Inc said on Thursday it will temporarily close an Iowa pork plant due to the coronavirus pandemic, a month after U.S. President Donald Trump ordered slaughterhouses to stay open to protect the country's food supply.

Headlines: U.S. judge orders 15 banks to face big investors' currency rigging lawsuit
Description: A U.S. judge on Thursday said institutional investors, including BlackRock Inc and Allianz SE's Pacific Investment Management Co, can pursue much of their lawsuit accusing 15 major banks of rigging prices in the $6.6 trillion-a-day foreign exchange market.

Headlines: UPS adds 'peak' surcharge amid coronavirus fueled delivery spike
Description: United Parcel Service Inc on May 31 will slap surcharges on U.S. e-commerce companies that have flooded its delivery network with shipments of everything from packaged food to patio furniture since the coronavirus took hold in March.

Headlines: U.S. major airlines roll out more options to avoid staff layoffs
Description: The top three U.S. airlines, hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic, are rolling out fresh programs to induce tens of thousands of employees to accept voluntary leave or early retirement in the hope of avoiding widespread furloughs in the fall, company memos show.

Headlines: German union accuses Volkswagen of 'management errors' that put jobs at risks
Description: Germany's biggest labor union criticized Volkswagen on Thursday for a recent advert deemed racist and other "errors", saying management had damaged the carmaker's reputation and put jobs at risk.

Headlines: French carmaker PSA to make surgical masks at Mulhouse site
Description: French carmaker PSA said on Thursday that it would start manufacturing surgical masks at its site in Mulhouse in eastern France from August.

Headlines: Alibaba extends its reach in China as coronavirus outbreak opens doors
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd is emerging as one of China's biggest corporate winners of the coronavirus crisis, gaining the opportunity to expand its businesses and solidify its status as a critical part of the country's socio-economic engine.

Headlines: Trump to sign executive order on social media on Thursday: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will sign an executive order on social media companies on Thursday, White House officials said after Trump threatened to shut down websites he accused of stifling conservative voices.

Headlines: Timeline: Key events in Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou's extradition case
Description: A Canadian judge will rule Wednesday on a key aspect of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou's extradition to the United States. The judge will rule on double criminality, meaning whether the charges against Meng were illegal in both Canada and the United States at the time of her December 2018 arrest.

Headlines: EasyJet will not fly to Italy with distancing on planes: report
Description: EasyJet will not fly to Italy if Rome prolongs social distancing rules on planes beyond June 15, the budget airline's chief executive said in a newspaper interview.

Headlines: Tencent raises $6 billion in largest Asian corporate debt deal this year
Description: Chinese social media and gaming giant Tencent Holdings Ltd said on Thursday it raised $6 billion in a U.S. dollar bond sale - the largest debt deal by an Asian corporate in 2020.

Headlines: Boeing cutting more than 12,000 U.S. jobs, thousands more planned
Description: Boeing Co said on Wednesday it was eliminating more than 12,000 U.S. jobs, including 6,770 involuntary layoffs, as the largest American planemaker restructures in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. stocks to end year around current levels as virus takes toll: Reuters poll
Description: U.S. stocks will end this year around current levels as the coronavirus pandemic cripples the economy and eats into earnings, according to strategists polled by Reuters.

Headlines: New wave of U.S. layoffs feared as coronavirus pain deepens
Description: Job cuts by U.S. state and local governments whose budgets have been crushed fighting the COVID-19 pandemic and more second-wave layoffs in the private sector likely contributed last week to a 10th straight week of more than 2 million Americans seeking unemployment benefits.

Headlines: Explainer: What happens next in Huawei CFO's U.S. extradition case
Description: A Canadian judge will rule Wednesday on a key aspect of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou's extradition to the United States. The judge will rule on double criminality, meaning whether the charges against Meng were illegal in both Canada and the United States at the time of her December 2018 arrest.

Headlines: Trump leapfrogs back ahead of Obama in stock market gains
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is once again beating predecessor Barack Obama in stock market performance following a stunning recovery on Wall Street.

Headlines: Amazon to offer permanent roles to 70% of 175,000 new U.S. hires
Description: Amazon.com Inc plans to offer permanent jobs to about 70% of the U.S. workforce it has hired temporarily to meet consumer demand during the coronavirus pandemic, the company told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Spain says it will do all it can to reverse Nissan closure, workers protest
Description: Spain said on Thursday it would do everything possible to stop Nissan from closing its main car factory in the country as angry workers burned tyres and shouted "War" outside the Barcelona plant.

Headlines: Citigroup looks to return some staff to NY headquarters over the summer: Bloomberg News
Description: Citigroup Inc looks to return a small number of staff to its New York headquarters in July or possibly August, with workers reentering its London offices possibly even earlier, Chief Executive Officer Michael Corbat told Bloomberg News in an interview.

Headlines: KKR to inject money into vending machine group Selecta: sources
Description: U.S. buyout group KKR is preparing to inject funds into Swiss vending machine company Selecta, which is saddled with debts and faces a loss of business due to the coronavirus crisis, four sources close to the matter said.

Headlines: Spain aims to convince Nissan to change mind on Barcelona plant, hopes Renault stays
Description: Spain will do everything it can to get Nissan to reverse its decision to close its Barcelona plant, Foreign Minister Arancha Gonzalez Laya said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. firms shield CEO pay as pandemic hits workers, investors
Description: Sonic Automotive Inc , which operates 95 U.S. car dealerships, started laying off and furloughing about a third of its workforce as the coronavirus pandemic crushed its sales. Then it changed its executives' pay packages - handing them a multimillion-dollar windfall.

Headlines: Nissan says to close Barcelona plant from December
Description: Nissan Motor Co intends to close its Barcelona main plant and two nearby facilities starting from December 2020, but it will keep open two facilities in northern Spain, the chairman of Nissan in Europe, Gianluca De Ficchy, said on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil surges 5% on U.S.-China trade optimism, falling crude output
Description: Oil prices soared on Friday, with U.S. futures closing out May with record monthly gains, on hopes that the U.S.-China trade deal would remain intact and on falling crude production.

Headlines: Trump administration to study ways to protect for U.S. investors from Chinese firms
Description: The Trump administration will study ways to safeguard Americans from the risks of investing in Chinese companies, U.S. president Donald Trump said on Friday, ratcheting up pressure on the firms to comply with U.S. accounting and disclosure rules.

Headlines: U.S. pipeline operator Energy Transfer warns of coming job cuts
Description: U.S. pipeline operator Energy Transfer LP will begin cutting about 6% of its workforce next week, underscoring the spreading impact of weak oil and gas prices on the energy business.

Headlines: Cramer's week ahead: This is a bad time for a trade war
Description: "Right now, our economy's struggling and any kind of retaliation from China will make it even more difficult for us to recover."

Headlines: Lyft violates Washington DC sick day law during pandemic, lawsuit claims
Description: Lyft Inc was sued on Friday by a former driver who accused the ride-sharing company of failing to provide required paid sick leave to drivers in Washington, D.C., a policy she said could fuel the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: SoftBank leads $500 million fundraising for Didi's self-driving unit
Description: China's Didi Chuxing said on Friday it had completed a fundraising round of over $500 million for its autonomous driving subsidiary that was led by SoftBank Group's Vision Fund 2.

Headlines: China's Kunlun says U.S approves sale of Grindr to investor group
Description: Chinese gaming company Beijing Kunlun Tech Co Ltd said on Friday that a U.S. national security panel approved the $620 million sale of popular gay dating app Grindr to an investor group called San Vicente Acquisition LLC.

Headlines: Coronavirus sinks U.S. consumer spending; savings hit record high
Description: U.S. consumers cut spending by the most on record for the second straight month in April while boosting savings to an all-time high, and the growing frugality reinforced expectations the economy could take years to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Ukraine expects $5 billion IMF loan approval on June 5 - PM
Description: Ukraine expects the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to approve a $5 billion (4.05 billion pounds) loan package at a board meeting on June 5 and the first tranche of $1.9 billion to be disbursed the following day, Prime Minister Denys Shmygal told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Travel disruptions, cost cutting key issues for U.S. business in China: report
Description: Global travel disruptions are the top concern for American businesses in China, of which many are cutting compensation and bonuses amid the fallout of the COVID-19 epidemic, according to a report from a business group.

Headlines: 'Intensive' talks on Lufthansa with EU Commission ongoing: Germany
Description: Berlin is in intensive talks with the European Commission over a planned bailout for flagship German carrier Lufthansa , a government spokesman said on Friday.

Headlines: Volkswagen says it will have full control of JAC-VW Chinese venture
Description: German automaker Volkswagen will have full management control of its JAC-VW joint venture, the company's China CEO said on Friday.

Headlines: Ryanair's Lauda airline shuts down Vienna base
Description: Ryanair's Austrian carrier Lauda said on Friday it was closing down its Vienna base after failing to reach an agreement with unions on pay, and had already relocated many of its 15 planes to other bases.

Headlines: Exclusive: Brazil's Embraer draws foreign interest after Boeing rift - sources
Description: Aircraft makers are circling Brazil's Embraer weeks after Boeing ditched plans for a historic commercial aviation tie-up, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Take Five: Hong Kong takes center stage
Description: China just concluded its closed-door annual meeting of parliament, the National People's Congress (NPC), with top officials making clear that employment is the top priority.

Headlines: Uber launches hourly ride booking option in some U.S. cities
Description: Uber Technologies Inc on Friday said it would offer rides by the hour in some U.S. cities, a feature aimed at helping Americans with essential trips during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Renault factory worker spared layoffs - for now
Description: Giovanni Pili, a worker at a Renault factory in France, was on Friday savoring the fact that he was not laid off in a global shakeup at the carmaker, and trying not to think too much about the uncertain future facing his plant, and his industry.

Headlines: Volkswagen pumps 2 billion euros into China electric vehicle bet
Description: Volkswagen AG plans to boost its electric push in China, the world's biggest auto market, by pumping 2.1 billion euros in two Chinese electric vehicle players.

Headlines: Danish state prosecutor drops investigation of Danske Bank auditor EY
Description: Denmark's state prosecutor has dropped its investigation into whether accounting firm EY breached anti-money laundering laws in connection with its audit of Danske Bank , the Danish Business Authority said on Friday.

Headlines: Google postpones Android 11 unveiling amid U.S. protests
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Saturday said it has postponed next week's planned unveiling of the beta version of its latest Android 11 mobile operating system in light of protests and unrest in the United States.

Headlines: Retailers already hit by coronavirus board up as U.S. protests rage
Description: Target Corp and Walmart said on Sunday they shuttered stores across the United States as retailers already reeling from closures because of the coronavirus pandemic shut outlets amid protests that included looting in many U.S. cities.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Investors eye consumer discretionary stocks as U.S. reopens
Description: Investors are taking a closer look at the market's consumer discretionary companies as a reopening U.S. economy fuels hopes of a turnaround for some of the sector's hardest-hit names.

Headlines: Renault chairman dismisses fears over potential Maubeuge closure
Description: Renault has no plans to close its Maubeuge plant in northern France, Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Sunday, two days after the carmaker announced 15,000 job cuts globally as part of a major restructuring.

Headlines: Amazon removes racist messages after they appear on some product listings
Description: Amazon.com Inc said it was removing certain images after messages using extremely strong racist abuse appeared on some listings on its UK website when users searched for Apple's AirPods and other similar products.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mexican broadcaster Televisa to launch mobile phone service, challenging Slim
Description: Mexican broadcaster Televisa said on Sunday it will start offering mobile phone service, a bid to challenge billionaire Carlos Slim's America Movil, which has long dominated the country's telecommunications market.

Headlines: Embraer negotiating $600 million bank financing for exports
Description: Brazilian planemaker Embraer SA , the world's third largest commercial jet builder, should obtain $600 million in credit lines from Brazil's state development bank BNDES and private banks in June, government sources said on Sunday.

Headlines: Sign here first: U.S. salons, gyms, offices require coronavirus waivers
Description: As U.S. businesses reopen after weeks of pandemic lockdowns, many have been posting coronavirus disclaimers or requiring employees and patrons to sign waivers before entering.

Headlines: Marriott opens all hotels in China, sees steady U.S. recovery: CEO
Description: Marriott International has reopened all its hotels in China and is seeing a steady recovery in the United States, its biggest market, Chief Executive Officer Arne Sorenson said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. companies issue shares at fastest rate ever, selling the rally
Description: U.S. public companies sold more than $60 billion in shares in May, the biggest monthly haul ever, as they capitalized on a stock market rally fueled by hopes that the COVID-19 pandemic is subsiding.

Headlines: Wall Street closes higher as recovery signs soothe protest, pandemic worries
Description: U.S. stocks posted gains on Monday as signs of U.S. economic recovery helped offset jitters over increasingly violent social unrest amid an ongoing pandemic and rising U.S.-China tensions.

Headlines: Facebook, Snapchat join chorus of companies condemning George Floyd death, racism
Description: Facebook Inc and Snapchat developer Snap Inc became the latest U.S. companies condemning racial inequality in the United States as violent protests flared up across major cities over the death of George Floyd, an unarmed black man who died while in police custody in Minneapolis last week.

Headlines: U.S. court refuses to shield Volkswagen in diesel scandal lawsuits
Description: A U.S. appeals court ruled on Monday that Volkswagen AG cannot escape potential financial penalties from two counties in Florida and Utah that may amount to a "staggering" additional liability arising from the German automaker's diesel emissions scandal.

Headlines: Facebook staffers walk out saying Trump's posts should be reined in
Description: Facebook employees walked away from their work-from-home desks on Monday and took to Twitter to accuse Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg of inadequately policing U.S. President Donald Trump's posts as strictly as the rival platform has done.

Headlines: Ryanair must face U.S. shareholder lawsuit over unionization comments
Description: Ryanair Holdings Plc and Chief Executive Michael O'Leary failed to persuade a U.S. judge to dismiss a securities fraud lawsuit accusing Europe's largest budget airline of defrauding them by downplaying its willingness to recognize labor unions.

Headlines: Visa sees recovery in U.S. payments volume in May
Description: Visa Inc's total U.S. payments volume fell at a much slower pace in May from the previous month, indicating that consumer spending was picking up as the government starts to ease coronavirus-induced lockdowns.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing activity crawls off 11-year low
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity eased off an 11-year low in May, the strongest sign yet that the worst of the economic downturn was behind as businesses reopen, though the recovery from the COVID-19 crisis could take years because of high unemployment.

Headlines: Analysts' View: Impact of the U.S. protests on financial markets
Description: National Guard troops have been deployed in 15 U.S. states and the U.S. capital after five nights of violence and destruction that began with peaceful protests over the death of a black man, George Floyd, in police custody.

Headlines: Yum China to bring Beyond Meat's plant-based burgers to China
Description: Yum China Holdings Inc said on Monday it will introduce Beyond Meat Inc's plant-based burgers at its fast-food restaurants in mainland China starting June 3.

Headlines: Buffett-backed BYD to supply EV batteries to Ford
Description: Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker BYD Co Ltd , will supply EV batteries to U.S. automaker Ford Motor Co , a document on the website of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology showed on Monday.

Headlines: Wall Street and Fed fly blind as coronavirus upends annual stress tests
Description: U.S. financial regulators, banks and their investors will get their first glimpse into the health of the nation's banking system as it confronts soaring corporate and consumer defaults in the economic crisis sparked by the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Walmart's Flipkart to re-apply for food retail license in India
Description: Walmart Inc's Indian e-commerce unit Flipkart said on Monday it would re-apply for a food retail license in India after reports said its earlier proposal was rejected by the government last week.

Headlines: U.S. utilities look newly cheap, but face COVID-19 headwinds this summer
Description: U.S. utility stocks have started to look like bargains after being considered expensive relative to the broader market for well over a year. Still, the outlook is far from certain as demand this summer is set to be hard hit by the contraction in commercial and industrial usage.

Headlines: Construction spending falls less than expected
Description: U.S. construction spending fell less than expected in April even as other sectors of the economy buckle under the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: U.S. opens national security probe into vanadium imports
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Tuesday it was opening an investigation into whether imports of vanadium, a metal used in aerospace, defense and energy applications, impair U.S. national security.

Headlines: China is using Huawei to drive a wedge in the UK-U.S. special relationship: senator
Description: China is using telecoms giant Huawei to try to drive a wedge between Britain and the United States, Republican senator Tom Cotton told British lawmakers on Tuesday.

Headlines: Britain, EU clash over financial market access: diplomats
Description: Britain wants binding commitments from the European Union on financial market access to avoid the country's finance industry suddenly being cut off from the bloc, a request Brussels has rejected, EU officials and diplomats said.

Headlines: Financing hunt during pandemic lifts May U.S. convertible debt issuance to record
Description: U.S. issuance of convertible bonds in May hit a record high of $20.7 billion, according to Bank of America data, as companies struggling with the impact of the coronavirus pandemic ventured into the one-time niche market seeking cheaper and easier ways to borrow cash.

Headlines: No major conditions on Renault's state-backed loan, chairman says
Description: France has not attached any major conditions to a 5 billion euro ($5.6 billion) state-backed loan for Renault, the carmaker's chairman said on Tuesday, although the finance minister called on the company to hold "exemplary" talks with unions.

Headlines: Geely's Polestar plans China showroom expansion to compete with Tesla: sources
Description: Polestar, the premium electric vehicle maker owned by China's Geely, plans a big expansion of its showroom network in the mainland, sources said, as it prepares for delivery of cars to compete with Tesla Inc's locally made Model 3.

Headlines: JPMorgan, Barclays settle Mexican bond rigging litigation
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co and Barclays Plc will pay $20.7 million to resolve investors' claims they conspired to rig the Mexican government bond market, the first of nine banks in the proposed class-action litigation to settle.

Headlines: U.S. sanctions four shipping firms for transporting Venezuelan oil
Description: The U.S. Treasury Department on Tuesday said it had sanctioned four shipping firms for transporting Venezuelan oil, the latest escalation in Washington's effort to oust socialist President Nicolas Maduro by cutting off the OPEC nation's crude exports.

Headlines: Advocacy group sues to block Trump social media executive order
Description: A Washington-based advocacy group on Tuesday asked a U.S. judge to invalidate an executive order on social media companies President Donald Trump signed last week claiming it violates the First Amendment.

Headlines: Qatar Petroleum's $19 billion LNG vessel order boon for South Korean shipbuilders
Description: South Korea's ailing shipbuilders have been thrown a lifeline in an increasingly tough market with a $19 billion order from Qatar Petroleum (QP) for liquefied natural gas (LNG) ships, analysts said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Pfizer to invest up to $500 million in public drug developers
Description: Pfizer Inc said on Tuesday it will invest up to $500 million into publicly traded drug developers to fund their treatment candidates and provide access to the U.S. drugmaker's scientific expertise.

Headlines: Natgas flows to U.S. LNG export plants sink to 9-month low due to coronavirus
Description: The amount of natural gas flowing on pipelines to U.S. liquefied natural gas export plants is at its lowest levels since August, a signal of weak worldwide demand due to government lockdowns to repress the coronavirus.

Headlines: Plunging cost of wind and solar marks turning point in energy transition: IRENA
Description: Plunging costs of renewables mark a turning point in a global transition to low-carbon energy, with new solar or wind farms increasingly cheaper to build than running existing coal plants, according to a report published on Tuesday.

Headlines: Australia's Woolworths to reward over 100,000 staff with shares for virus efforts
Description: Australia's biggest supermarket chain Woolworths Group said on Tuesday it will reward more than 100,000 of its staff with free company shares for their efforts during a period of upheaval amid bushfires and the coronavirus buying frenzy.

Headlines: China auto sales growth seen for second straight month, boosting recovery hopes
Description: China's vehicle sales are estimated to rise 11.7% on year in May, its top auto industry body said on Tuesday, cementing hopes of a recovery in the world's biggest auto market with the first back to back monthly sales increase in about two years.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. small business program handed out virus aid to many borrowers twice
Description: A technical snafu in a U.S. government system caused many small businesses to receive loans twice or more under a federal aid program to help businesses hurt by the COVID-19 pandemic, nearly a dozen people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Relief rally or bear market bubble? For investors, it's hard to tell
Description: What started as a bear market bounce in U.S. equities has transformed into one of the most dramatic rallies in memory, leaving investors looking to past rebounds, options markets and technical analysis for clues on how far it could run.

Headlines: Oil up more than 3% ahead of OPEC+ meeting and on easing lockdowns
Description: Oil prices climbed by more than $1 a barrel on Tuesday on hopes that major crude producers will agree to extend output cuts during a video conference expected to be held this week and as countries and U.S. states begin to reopen after coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Rental fleet collapse drags down U.S. vehicle sales
Description: The collapse in demand for new vehicles from U.S. rental car fleets hit automakers hard in May, even as consumer sales were stronger than expected as coronavirus stay-at-home orders began to ease.

Headlines: After Facebook staff walkout, Zuckerberg defends no action on Trump posts
Description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg told employees on Tuesday that he stood by his decision not to challenge inflammatory posts by U.S. President Donald Trump, refusing to give ground a day after staff members staged a rare public protest.

Headlines: Bacardi family member fights for reshuffle at spirits group
Description: Monika Bacardi, a member of the family owning the maker of the eponymous rum, said her Liechtenstein-based trust was blocking her attempt to reshuffle the management team at the spirits group, uncovering a fight inside the family.

Headlines: U.S. labor market stabilizing as layoffs abate
Description: U.S. private payrolls fell less than expected in May, suggesting layoffs were abating as businesses reopen, though the overall economy's recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic will be slow.

Headlines: Virus-hit U.S. state revenue could start slow recovery in third quarter: analysts
Description: U.S. state tax revenue, which plunged due to the economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, could start to slowly recover this summer as long as the outbreak does not undergo a resurgence, analysts said.

Headlines: Apple must face U.S. shareholder lawsuit over CEO's iPhone, China comments
Description: A federal judge said Apple Inc must face part of a lawsuit claiming it fraudulently concealed falling demand for iPhones, especially in China, leading to tens of billions of dollars in shareholder losses.

Headlines: On Raul Castro's birthday, U.S. threatens Cuba remittances
Description: The Trump administration expanded on Wednesday its list of Cuban entities that Americans are banned from doing business with to include the financial corporation that handles U.S. remittances to the Communist-run country.

Headlines: Wall Street closes sharply higher on signs of economic rebound
Description: Wall Street rallied broadly on Wednesday with the Nasdaq approaching record highs as signs of an economic recovery from mandated shutdowns helped investors look beyond U.S. social unrest and pandemic worries.

Headlines: U.S. dollar's shine fading, but risk high of rush to safe havens: Reuters poll
Description: A fading of the U.S. dollar's allure will continue as global funding strains ease, but a majority of analysts polled by Reuters said there was a high risk that the U.S.-China trade standoff will renew safe-haven bets in the next six months.

Headlines: Early Facebook staffers denounce Zuckerberg stance on Trump posts
Description: Nearly three dozen former employees from Facebook's early days on Wednesday blasted Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's decision not to act against incendiary posts by U.S. President Donald Trump as "cowardly" and a "betrayal" of company ideals.

Headlines: U.S. prosecutor says UAW takeover remains option after ex-president pleads guilty
Description: The United Auto Workers still needs to reform and a federal takeover remains an option, the U.S. prosecutor leading the investigation of corruption within the union told Reuters on Wednesday after the UAW's former president pleaded guilty to embezzlement.

Headlines: U.S. HR executives see working from home as part of new normal: survey
Description: More than three out of four U.S. human resource executives think more employees will continue to work from home even after the threat of the novel coronavirus subsides, according to a survey by a large business association released on Wednesday.

Headlines: Pilgrim's Pride CEO indicted over alleged U.S. chicken price-fixing
Description: The chief executive of Pilgrim's Pride Corp, a major U.S. poultry company, was indicted along with three other current and former industry executives on charges of seeking to fix the price of chickens, the Justice Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Snapchat removes Trump account from curated promotional section
Description: Snap Inc said it would no longer promote U.S. President Donald Trump's account in Snapchat's Discover section, saying his incendiary comments last week made the account ineligible for the curated section where users explore new content.

Headlines: From wagyu beef to melons, Japan's $2.2 trillion virus rescue piques struggling firms
Description: As the coronavirus jolts Japan, the government's huge stimulus package has come under fire from hard-hit restaurant owners for channelling funds for items like wagyu beef, melons and tourism rather than accelerating help for firms with burning cash needs.

Headlines: Warner Music strikes a chord as shares pop on Nasdaq debut
Description: Warner Music Group Corp's stock popped 8% on its Nasdaq debut on Wednesday, after the world's third-largest recording label sold shares in its $1.9-billion initial public offering towards the higher end of its target.

Headlines: Walmart removes firearms, ammunition from floor display as protests rage in U.S.
Description: Walmart Inc said on Wednesday it shifted firearms and ammunition out of sales floors of some U.S. stores amid nationwide protests over the death of an unarmed black man at the hands of police last week.

Headlines: Geely's Polestar to open 20 showrooms in China to compete with Tesla
Description: Polestar, the premium electric vehicle maker owned by China's Geely, plans to open 20 showrooms in the mainland, as it prepares for delivery of its Polestar 2 electric sedans to compete with Tesla Inc's locally made Model 3.

Headlines: Nomura considers having fewer staff at headquarters permanently
Description: Nomura Holdings Inc is considering having fewer staff work at its Tokyo headquarters permanently now that the coronavirus pandemic has spurred a huge shift to remote working, its chief executive said.

Headlines: Geely's Volvo Cars sales soar 40% in May vs month-ago as virus curbs ease
Description: Volvo Cars, owned by China's Geely Holding, said on Wednesday it sold 40% more cars in May than in April, as restrictions to contain the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic started to ease in several markets.

Headlines: Iberdrola to invest up to 4 billion euros in French renewable energy
Description: Spanish utility Iberdrola said on Wednesday it will invest up to 4 billion euros ($4.5 billion) over the next four years in France to develop renewable energy.

Headlines: China drives global oil demand recovery out of coronavirus collapse
Description: China's oil demand has recovered to more than 90% of the levels seen before the coronavirus pandemic struck early this year, a surprisingly robust rebound that could be mirrored elsewhere in the third quarter as more countries emerge from lockdowns.

Headlines: 3M names General Electric exec Monish Patolawala as CFO
Description: U.S. industrial conglomerate 3M Co on Wednesday appointed General Electric Co executive Monish Patolawala as the company's chief financial officer, effective July 1.

Headlines: Shell weighs sale of $2 billion-plus stake in Queensland LNG facilities
Description: Royal Dutch Shell is considering raising more than $2 billion from the sale of a stake in the common facilities at its Queensland Curtis LNG plant in Australia, according to a sale flyer reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. services sector off 11-year trough; still contracting
Description: U.S. services industry activity pushed off an 11-year low in May, but businesses appeared in no rush to rehire workers as they reopen, supporting views the economy could take years to recover from the devastation caused by the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: LVMH's takeover of Tiffany seen as uncertain: WWD
Description: French luxury goods group LVMH's $16.2 billion takeover of Tiffany & Co is looking less certain as the jeweler grapples with a deteriorating situation in the U.S. market brought on by a global pandemic and severe social unrest, fashion trade publication WWD reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank faces action from NY regulators over Epstein ties: sources
Description: Deutsche Bank could face enforcement action by New York regulators investigating its ties to the late U.S. financier and accused sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, two sources familiar with the investigation told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Shell plastics plant Trump touted faces oversupply risks: energy institute report
Description: A massive Pennsylvania plastics project that President Donald Trump touted during a visit last year faces risks of oversupply and a low price outlook for the materials, a report by an institute that examines energy issues said on Thursday.

Headlines: Volkswagen resumes deliveries of Golf 8 after software fix
Description: Volkswagen is resuming deliveries of its Golf 8 model after fixing a software glitch, a spokesman said on Thursday.

Headlines: Germany rebuffs gasoline auto lobby with radical electric plan
Description: Germany has become the second major European economy to use a multi-billion-euro recovery plan to spur clean driving, with incentives for electric cars that should boost Volkswagen and Tesla , while polluting SUVs face higher taxes.

Headlines: Fiat-Chrysler's state-backed loan crucial for Italy's economy-Intesa CEO says
Description: A 6.3 billion euro ($7 billion) state-backed loan for Fiat Chrysler (FCA) , financed by Intesa Sanpaolo , is crucial in terms of safeguarding Italy's economy, the head of the country's biggest retail bank said.

Headlines: FCA to face checks, sanctions on state-backed loan
Description: Fiat Chrysler will file regular reports on its use of a multi-billion euro state-backed loan which Italy is set to approve soon and will face sanctions if it does not respect commitments attached to the package, the economy minister said.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Bond investors look for Fed to justify steepening yield curve
Description: Expectations that the global economy has dodged the worst-case scenarios for the coronavirus pandemic have led to a dramatic selloff in U.S. government bonds from their record highs, pushing the yield curve to its steepest level since March.

Headlines: American Airlines soars 41% as plan to add July flights sparks relief rally
Description: American Airlines Group Inc shares jumped more than 40% on Thursday after announcing a big boost to U.S. flights next month following dramatic cuts caused by the coronavirus pandemic, as well as some leadership changes to cut costs.

Headlines: U.S. banks attract bargain hunters though hurdles to growth remain
Description: Investors eyeing a turnaround in the U.S. economy are piling into U.S. bank stocks even as some caution that positive stress test results and an abatement of loan losses will be needed to sustain a rally in the battered sector.

Headlines: U.S. court blocks sales of Bayer weed killer in United States
Description: A U.S. appeals court has blocked Bayer AG from selling an agricultural weed killer in the United States, the latest setback for a business already fighting an expensive legal battle over another product.

Headlines: Uber Eats features black-owned restaurants on U.S., Canadian delivery platform
Description: Uber Technologies Inc on Thursday launched a feature on its food delivery app Uber Eats that lets customers in the United States and Canada order from restaurants owned by black people and pay no delivery fees for those orders through 2020.

Headlines: Trump gives U.S. agencies power to fast-track big infrastructure projects
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday signed an executive order that gives federal agencies emergency powers to fast-track major energy and other infrastructure projects by overriding environmental permitting requirements.

Headlines: Germany finally splurges, but not without fresh criticism
Description: Under pressure from its European peers for years to spend more, Germany has finally served up a bumper stimulus package financed with new debt, but Berlin's rediscovered love to splurge is causing fresh unease among its neighbours.

Headlines: Oil refineries, offshore drillers face hurricane challenges amid pandemic
Description: As oil and gas companies began shutting offshore production before the first tropical storm of the season in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico, experts said restarting wells and refineries will take longer and prove more costly this year because of COVID-19.

Headlines: Adidas says China sales back to growth faster than expected
Description: German sportswear firm Adidas said on Thursday that sales had returned to growth in greater China faster than it had expected after the coronavirus lockdown, while the reopening of business in Europe and the Americas was going more gradually.

Headlines: LVMH's Arnault mulls ways to renegotiate deal with Tiffany: sources
Description: LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault is exploring ways to reopen negotiations on the French luxury goods giant's $16.2 billion acquisition of U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co , as U.S. social unrest and the coronavirus pandemic weigh on the retail sector, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ford's China ventures increase May sales as market rebounds
Description: Ford Motor's China ventures have reported year-on-year sales growth for May in a sign of how the world's biggest auto market is continuing its recovery from coronavirus-induced lows.

Headlines: LVMH has explored coronavirus impact on Tiffany deal terms
Description: LVMH 's board met this week to discuss the fallout from the coronavirus crisis on its $16.2 billion purchase of U.S. jeweller Tiffany , the luxury goods group said on Thursday, opening the door to a possible attempt to review the deal terms.

Headlines: U.S. airlines gain final approval to drop services to 75 domestic airports
Description: Fifteen U.S. airlines were granted final government approval on Wednesday to temporarily halt service to 75 domestic airports as travel demand has been crushed due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Rosneft replaces sanctioned trading arm with new one - sources
Description: Russia's Rosneft , which closed its oil trading arm after sanctions were imposed by U.S. authorities in February, has set up a new Geneva-based trading business, four trading sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Germany will require all petrol stations to provide electric car charging
Description: Germany said it will oblige all petrol stations to offer electric car charging to help remove refuelling concerns and boost consumer demand for the vehicles as part of its 130 billion euro ($146 billion) economic recovery plan.

Headlines: For U.S. economy, the bottom may be here, but the rebound is slow so far
Description: The U.S. economy may have hit its low point in the coronavirus crash but the rebound so far remains tepid, according to both broad indexes of activity and higher frequency counts of cellphone data and employee time information.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon in talks to buy $2 billion stake in Indian telco Bharti Airtel - sources
Description: Amazon.com is in early-stage talks to buy a stake worth at least $2 billion in Indian mobile operator Bharti Airtel , three people with knowledge of the discussions told Reuters, in a move that could turbocharge India's digital economy.

Headlines: Bank of America to pay $7.23 million for mutual fund overcharges: FINRA
Description: Bank of America Corp agreed to pay $7.23 million in restitution and interest to settle a U.S. regulator's accusations that it overcharged customers on mutual funds.

Headlines: Factbox: German stimulus to drive forward green vehicles
Description: Germany's coronavirus recovery stimulus package contains measures to boost low emission cars and electric vehicle charging infrastructure.

Headlines: U.S. Labor secretary: Jobless rate can dip below 10% by year's end
Description: The U.S. unemployment rate, which economists expect hit 19.8% in May, should be able to drop below 10% by the end of 2020 now that workers side-lined by coronavirus-related shutdowns are returning to work, U.S. Labor Secretary Eugene Scalia said on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil climbs 5% on U.S. jobless drop, OPEC+ meeting hopes
Description: Oil prices rose on Friday after an unexpected fall in the May U.S. jobless rate and OPEC's decision to bring forward to Saturday discussions on whether to extend record production cuts.

Headlines: LVMH refrains from renegotiating Tiffany deal, sources say
Description: French luxury goods giant is not asking to renegotiate its $16.2-billion acquisition of U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co after deliberating whether to do so, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: German prosecutors probe Wirecard management board
Description: Munich prosecutors on Friday said they had searched Wirecard's headquarters and opened proceedings against the payment company's entire management board as part of a market manipulation probe initiated by Germany's financial regulator BaFin.

Headlines: Nasdaq hits record high as U.S. economy shows signs of rebound
Description: The Nasdaq Composite on Friday became the first of the three major U.S. stock indexes to bounce back to a record high, recovering from a stunning coronavirus-led slump on growing hopes of a swift economic rebound.

Headlines: Canada posts surprise jobs gain in May and June could be even better
Description: Canada unexpectedly added almost 290,000 jobs in May as some provinces loosened COVID-19 restrictions on businesses, data showed on Friday, and there could be an even bigger improvement in June.

Headlines: PG&E Corp preparing $11 billion debt financing: investor
Description: California utility PG&E Corp is preparing an $11 billion debt-financing package as it prepares to exit from its bankruptcy, an investor involved with the company's funding plan said on Friday, sending its shares up more than 12%.

Headlines: U.S. labor market unexpectedly improves; recovery years away
Description: The U.S. economy unexpectedly added jobs in May after suffering record losses in the prior month, offering the clearest signal yet that the downturn triggered by the COVID-19 pandemic was probably over, though the road to recovery could be long.

Headlines: Trump opens Atlantic sanctuary to commercial fishing
Description: President Donald Trump announced on Friday he will open up a 5,000 square mile conservation area in the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of New England to commercial fishing.

Headlines: Equities surge, bonds tumble on surprise U.S. jobs gains
Description: An unexpected jump in U.S. employment sent world equities and oil surging on hopes that the global economy has started to recover from the coronavirus pandemic, pulling investors out of perceived safe havens like government bonds and gold.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies to end higher on surprise U.S. jobs report
Description: Wall Street surged on Friday after a strikingly upbeat May jobs report unexpectedly provided the clearest evidence yet that the U.S. economy is headed for a quicker-than-anticipated recovery.

Headlines: Surprise U.S. unemployment rate drop leaves out blacks, Asians
Description: The U.S. unemployment rate dropped unexpectedly in May, but not all workers benefited equally as joblessness among African Americans and Asians rose, signaling some minorities face a longer recovery as the economy slowly rebounds from the coronavirus shutdowns.

Headlines: Trump touts job gains as 'greatest comeback in American history'
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday celebrated a stunning U.S. employment report that showed more than 2.5 million jobs were added last month during the thick of the coronavirus pandemic, and predicted the battered economy will recover all of its lost jobs by next year.

Headlines: Reddit co-founder Ohanian resigns from board, wants a black candidate to take over
Description: Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian on Friday resigned from the social network firm's board and sought to be replaced by a black candidate.

Headlines: Bonds falter as blazing stock rally lures investors
Description: Improving U.S. economic data is pushing investors out of U.S. government bonds at the fastest pace in months, the latest sign that risk appetite is returning to broader markets.

Headlines: U.S. will allow Chinese passenger carriers two flights per week
Description: The United States will permit Chinese passenger air carriers to operate two flights per week after Beijing said it would ease coronavirus-related restrictions to allow in more foreign carriers, the U.S. Transportation Department said on Friday.

Headlines: Explainer: May's jobs report stunner: real deal or head fake?
Description: The U.S. economy unexpectedly added jobs in May, surprising economists and analysts who had forecast millions more losing their livelihoods, and raising hopes of a faster economic recovery than expected.

Headlines: Trump threatens EU, China with tariffs; names Navarro 'lobster king'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday threatened to impose tariffs on European Union cars if the bloc does not drop its tariff on American lobsters, naming White House trade adviser Peter Navarro the "lobster king" in charge of talks.

Headlines: Japan's first-quarter GDP decline likely smaller than initial estimates on firmer capex: Reuters poll
Description: Japan's first quarter economic contraction was likely smaller than initially estimated, a Reuters poll showed, thanks to stronger business spending although the country is still expected to slide deeper into recession this year.

Headlines: Global airlines add flights; U.S. carriers target the great outdoors
Description: Airlines from America to Australia are ramping up flights in June and July, boosting hopes for a pickup in tourist traffic even as bigger-spending business and global travel remains sluggish during the ongoing pandemic.

Headlines: Surprise May U.S. payrolls rise fans hopes for economic recovery
Description: The U.S. unemployment rate unexpectedly fell in May and layoffs abated, the Labor Department said on Friday in a report that showed the latest signs the economic downturn caused by the COVID-19 pandemic was bottoming.

Headlines: Canada adds net 289,600 jobs in May
Description: Canada added a net 289,600 jobs in May, with most of the employment gains coming in full time, Statistics Canada said on Friday. The rebound in May hiring comes after Canada lost a record-breaking 2 million jobs in April.

Headlines: Pence says jobs report indicative of U.S. economy beginning to recover
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence said the jobs report released on Friday was a sign the U.S. economy was beginning to recover from the deep hit caused by the novel coronavirus outbreak, but said President Donald Trump is still in favor of a payroll tax cut.

Headlines: Brazil, Mexico currencies both rebound but real has more legs than peso
Description: The Brazilian real and Mexican peso have both rebounded strongly in recent weeks, but their rallies are starting to diverge with the peso running out of steam and the real gaining momentum.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg promises a review of content policies after backlash
Description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Friday said he would consider changes to the policy that led the company to leave up controversial posts by President Donald Trump during recent demonstrations protesting the death of an unarmed black man while in police custody, a partial concession to critics.

Headlines: Exclusive: Malaysia - Even $3 billion not enough to settle 1MDB case with Goldman
Description: Malaysia's new government would not be willing to accept even compensation of $3 billion from Goldman Sachs in a settlement over the 1MDB scandal, the finance minister told Reuters, ruling out a figure that is far higher than the bank offered last year.

Headlines: HSBC warns it could face reprisals in China if UK bans Huawei equipment: Telegraph
Description: HSBC Holdings Plc Chairman Mark Tucker has warned Britain against a ban on networking equipment made by Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, claiming the bank could face reprisals in China, the Telegraph reported on Saturday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Buyout firm Sycamore Partners in talks to buy J.C. Penney - sources
Description: Private equity firm Sycamore Partners is in preliminary talks to acquire J.C. Penney Co Inc out of bankruptcy should the U.S. department store chain's negotiations with its creditors fail, three people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Bond investors look for Fed to justify steepening yield curve
Description: Expectations that the global economy has dodged the worst-case coronavirus pandemic scenarios have led to a dramatic sell-off in U.S. government bonds from their record highs, pushing the yield curve to its steepest level since March.

Headlines: AstraZeneca contacted Gilead over potential megamerger: Bloomberg News
Description: Britain's AstraZeneca has approached U.S. rival Gilead Sciences about a possible merger to form one the world's largest drug companies, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Dunkin' franchisees to hire up to 25,000 workers as U.S. states reopen
Description: Dunkin', a unit of Dunkin' Brands Group Inc , said on Monday its franchisees are seeking to hire up to 25,000 workers as it prepares for higher demand, with U.S. states reopening after months-long lockdowns to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Factbox: Who's bidding to be next World Trade Organization chief?
Description: The World Trade Organization (WTO) began the process on Monday of selecting a new director-general to replace Brazil's Roberto Azevedo, who is stepping down a year early at the end of August.

Headlines: AstraZeneca, Gilead merger doubted by Wall Street analysts
Description: A merger between AstraZeneca and Gilead Sciences Inc is unlikely due to significant political hurdles, Wall Street analysts said on Monday after a Bloomberg report that the British drugmaker last month had contacted its U.S. rival about a deal.

Headlines: U.S. consumers grew slightly more optimistic about jobs and earnings in May
Description: U.S. consumers felt slightly more optimistic about their finances and job security in May as businesses began to reopen and rehire workers following the easing of coronavirus-related restrictions, according to a survey released on Monday by the New York Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Lufthansa's Austrian arm gets 450 million euro government bailout
Description: Austria is granting Lufthansa's Austrian Airlines unit a 450 million euro ($508 million) bailout that will protect Vienna as a transit hub and safeguard "the bulk" of the flag carrier's 7,000 jobs, the government said on Monday.

Headlines: Nasdaq hits record high as U.S. recession becomes official
Description: On the same day that the Nasdaq marked a new bull market, the U.S. economy was officially declared to be in a recession. The two milestones on Monday illustrate how an 11-week surge in stocks has occurred despite widespread economic devastation fueled by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Stocks rally on quick economic revival hopes, oil slides
Description: Global equity markets surged on Monday, with the Nasdaq hitting a record high on hopes of a quick recovery from the coronavirus slump, while oil slid after Saudi Arabia said new output cuts by producer nations would not include extra cuts by three Gulf countries.

Headlines: China's troubled Baoshang rescue exposes fault lines in bank reform drive
Description: In May 2019, China's central bank announced a shock takeover of a lender, its first such move in 20 years, citing "serious credit risks". Creditors in small Baoshang Bank were to take a hit, assets would be sold and an example set for governance.

Headlines: Australia shakes up foreign investment laws for national security
Description: Australia announced the biggest shakeup of its foreign investment laws in almost half a century on Friday, including giving the government the power to force the sale of a business if it creates a national security risk.

Headlines: Instant View: Japan's economy braced for worst postwar slump despite capex gains in first-quarter GDP
Description: Japan's economy shrank less than initially estimated in the first quarter, revised data showed on Monday, but the broad impact from the coronavirus crisis is still expected to send the country deeper into recession.

Headlines: Japan's economy minister warns against deepening negative rates
Description: Japan should focus on back-stopping struggling businesses rather than trying to spark overall demand in fighting the coronavirus pandemic, its economy minister said, suggesting the central bank should avoid pushing interest rates deeper into negative territory.

Headlines: Coronavirus widens the cracks in Egypt's cement industry
Description: The coronavirus is putting Egypt's private cement industry under even more pressure.

Headlines: Possibly millions of jobs could be lost if planes stay grounded, Heathrow boss says
Description: Hundreds of thousands of jobs, if not millions, could be lost in Britain if aviation is not able to resume quickly, the chief executive of London's Heathrow Airport said on Monday.

Headlines: Hong Kong activist investor David Webb to step back for health reasons
Description: Hong Kong activist investor David Webb has said he will step back from posting his widely read critiques of companies and the city's government after being diagnosed with prostate cancer.

Headlines: Japan's service sector sentiment rises 7.6 points in May
Description: Japan's service sector sentiment index rose in May, a Cabinet Office survey showed on Monday, although the coronavirus pandemic continues to weigh on firms' business confidence.

Headlines: EasyJet CEO says legal case against UK quarantine is strong
Description: Britain's quarantine plan was rushed into existence, is out of proportion and should be challenged in the courts, according to the head of easyJet which has joined rivals in threatening legal proceedings.

Headlines: Japan braces for worst postwar economic slump, pandemic tests policy response
Description: Japan's economy braced for its worst postwar slump even as first-quarter GDP contracted less than initially thought, as the coronavirus crisis slams the brakes on global growth and raises pressure on Tokyo to cushion the blow to business and consumers.

Headlines: Scarred and scared: post-Covid consumers not their old selves
Description: Michael Clark of Amy's Housewares has one big fear as its London stores prepare to reopen on June 15 along with other retailers around Britain: "Customers not spending, having no trust in the economy."

Headlines: Galeries Lafayette's Champs Elysees store struggles as group faces $1 billion hit: CEO
Description: Galeries Lafayette's [GALP.UL] new outlet on the Champs Elysees is struggling because people are staying away from the famous Paris boulevard due to COVID-19, according to its CEO, who said the crisis would hit the group to the tune of 1 billion euros.

Headlines: Corning wins U.S. funding to boost vial output for COVID-19 vaccines
Description: Glass maker Corning Inc said on Tuesday it would receive $204 million from the U.S. government to boost the manufacturing capacity of its vials that will be used to store coronavirus vaccines and treatments.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chanel, Revlon, L'Oreal pivoting away from talc in some products
Description: Chanel, Revlon and L'Oreal, three of the biggest brands in cosmetics, are quietly moving away from using talc in some products as U.S. cancer lawsuits and consumer concerns mount.

Headlines: FCC proposes record $225 million fine for massive robocall campaign
Description: The Federal Communications Commission on Tuesday voted unanimously to propose a record-setting $225 million fine against Texas-based health insurance telemarketers for allegedly making approximately 1 billion illegal robocalls.

Headlines: Investors brace for market swings as Trump slips in election polls
Description: The U.S. presidential election is re-emerging as a potential risk to markets after a shift in polls that has seen President Donald Trump lose ground to Democrat Joe Biden.

Headlines: DoubleLine's Gundlach bearish on U.S. dollar, says stocks 'lofty'
Description: The U.S. dollar is unlikely to make significant moves higher in the near term because of the ballooning budget deficit, Jeffrey Gundlach, the billionaire chief executive of DoubleLine Capital, said on a webcast presentation on Tuesday.

Headlines: China factory gate deflation deepens on global demand slump
Description: China's producer prices fell by the sharpest rate in more than four years, underscoring pressure on the manufacturing sector as the COVID-19 pandemic reduces trade flows and global demand.

Headlines: Barclays labels Staveley lawsuit 'distorted and exaggerated'
Description: Barclays has dismissed as "distorted and exaggerated" legal arguments by financier Amanda Staveley, who is claiming up to 1.5 billion pounds in damages for alleged deceit over a financial crisis-era fundraising in a high-profile London trial.

Headlines: Japanese traders gird for Fed to anchor yields, clip dollar's wings
Description: Japanese investors have clipped the wings of a resurgent U.S. dollar as they position for the likelihood that the U.S. Federal Reserve will take steps to flatten the Treasury yield curve.

Headlines: TSMC says still in talks about subsidies for new U.S. plant
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSMC) is still in talks with the U.S. government about subsidies for its new plant in Arizona, chairman Mark Liu said on Tuesday.

Headlines: TSMC says could fill order gap if unable to sell chips to Huawei
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSMC) could quickly fill any order gap should U.S. restrictions against Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] prevent sales to the Chinese firm, the company's chairman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: No ware to sell: Beijing's street vendors back on the run
Description: Clad in black, Beijing's city inspectors descended on street vendors this week and ordered them to clear out, just days after the Chinese premier had sparked a rush to set up curbside stalls by praising them as a creator of jobs in the coronavirus-hit economy.

Headlines: Hong Kong government to lead $5 billion rescue package for Cathay Pacific
Description: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd announced on Tuesday a recapitalisation plan worth HK$39 billion ($5.03 billion) led by the Hong Kong government to help it weather the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Banks to Berlin - Loosen coronavirus cash rules for firms
Description: Germany's bank lobby is set to urge the government to drop some of the conditions attached to a trillion euro rescue scheme, arguing that companies are so reluctant to take the help that it threatens any recovery from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. failed to properly oversee Chinese telecom carriers: Senate panel
Description: A U.S. Senate report released Tuesday says the U.S. government failed to properly oversee Chinese-owned telecommunications companies for nearly two decades.

Headlines: Hong Kong spearheads $5 billion Cathay Pacific rescue package
Description: Hong Kong will lead a $5 billion rescue of Cathay Pacific Airways , which like other airlines has been hit by a global travel slump triggered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Volkswagen replaces Herbert Diess as CEO of the VW brand
Description: Volkswagen replaced Herbert Diess as chief executive of the VW brand on Monday and installed chief operating officer Ralf Brandstaetter to lead cost cutting efforts at the company's largest plants in Germany.

Headlines: S&P cuts Japan's debt outlook as spending surges during pandemic
Description: S&P Global Ratings on Tuesday lowered its outlook on Japan's sovereign debt rating to stable from positive, citing increased uncertainty over the country's fiscal health as it boosts spending to overcome the effects of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Singapore's migrant workers fear financial ruin after virus ordeal
Description: As Sharif Uddin contemplates leaving the cramped Singapore dormitory where he has spent weeks under coronavirus quarantine, fears about his future creep in.

Headlines: Factbox: Why Tiffany's debt obligations matter for its sale to LVMH
Description: U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co said on Tuesday that it amended some of the terms of its debt to give it financial breathing space, as it seeks to ensure that its $16.2 billion sale to French luxury goods giant LVMH is completed.

Headlines: Chinese companies put U.S. listing plans on ice as tensions mount
Description: Chinese companies are putting off plans for U.S. listings as tensions between the world's top two economies rise, lawyers, bankers, accountants and regulators involved in what has been a major capital-raising route told Reuters.

Headlines: Dollar sinks to three-month lows as Fed keeps easing policy
Description: The dollar extended losses, dropping to a fresh three-month low against a basket of major currencies on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve made no policy changes, as expected, and pledged to continue its asset purchases aimed at stabilizing a U.S. economy that has been ravaged by the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Fed shifts tone from repeated lockdown fears to jobs focus
Description: At Fed Chair Jerome Powell's policy meeting press conference six weeks ago he talked repeatedly about the possibility of second and third waves of the novel coronavirus in the months ahead and the havoc that could wreak on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Congress seeks answers on Juniper Networks breach amid encryption fight
Description: A group of U.S. lawmakers preparing to fight a legislative attack on encrypted communications is trying to establish what happened when encryption was subverted at a Silicon Valley maker of networking gear.

Headlines: Mall operator Simon Property abandons $3.6 billion acquisition of Taubman
Description: Simon Property Group Inc , the biggest U.S. mall operator, said on Wednesday it was ending its $3.6-billion deal to buy Taubman Centers Inc , citing the beating the retail sector has taken during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. inflation subdued with economy in recession
Description: U.S. consumer prices fell for a third straight month in May and underlying inflation was weak as demand for goods and services remained subdued amid a recession caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Oil edges higher, even as U.S. inventory rise revives glut worries
Description: Oil rebounded from earlier losses on Wednesday, even as U.S. data showed crude inventories rose to a record high, reviving worries of a persistent glut due to weak demand.
