Headlines: American, Delta say demand uptick helping cash burn; United requiring health checklists
Description: American Airlines Group Inc and Delta Air Lines Inc said on Wednesday that a modest recovery in demand was helping to slow daily cash burn rates in June after the U.S. government reported record low passenger numbers in April amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips CEO says surprised by swift recovery in oil prices
Description: ConocoPhillips Chief Executive Officer Ryan Lance on Wednesday expressed surprise at the quick rebound in U.S. oil prices that slipped into the negative territory in April and said he expects prices to remain volatile in the near term.

Headlines: Possible Fed move to cap yield rise could further weaken U.S. dollar
Description: The U.S. dollar would probably come under further pressure if the Federal Reserve adopts targets for U.S. Treasury yields that would limit their rise and ensure that interest rates remain near zero for some time.

Headlines: Better three months late than never for Fed 'Main Street' loans, Powell says
Description: It is not too late for small and medium-sized U.S. businesses to benefit from the Federal Reserve's "Main Street" lending program, Chair Jerome Powell said on Wednesday, even though its launch in the coming days will be nearly three months after the central bank announced the nearly $600 billion program.

Headlines: U.S. May deficit nearly doubles to $399 billion
Description: The U.S. federal budget deficit in May nearly doubled to $399 billion from a year earlier amid continued strong spending on coronavirus relief programs and a 25% drop in receipts, the Treasury Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. companies vow to fight racism but face critics on diversity
Description: In the past, U.S. corporations have largely remained silent as protests erupted over killings of African-Americans by police officers. That changed with the May 25 death of George Floyd in Minneapolis, which has set off a flurry of corporate statements of solidarity with the black community – along with pledges of more than $1.7 billion to advance racial justice and equity.

Headlines: Ford recalls 2.15 million U.S. vehicles for potentially faulty door latches
Description: Ford Motor Co said on Wednesday it will recall 2.15 million U.S. vehicles with potentially faulty door latches.

Headlines: Tyson Foods says cooperating with DoJ in chicken price-fixing probe
Description: Tyson Foods Inc said on Wednesday it was cooperating with the U.S. Department of Justice on a price-fixing investigation in the poultry industry, under a program that could protect the meat processor from criminal prosecution.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific shares hit three-and-half-month high after rescue package, outlook uncertain
Description: Shares of Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd surged as much as 18.7% on Wednesday, reaching their highest level since Feb. 24, after the carrier announced a HK$39 billion ($5 billion) recapitalisation plan led by the Hong Kong government.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific plans to repay Hong Kong government over three to five years
Description: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd said it expects to repay the Hong Kong government for HK$19.5 billion ($2.52 billion) of preference shares over a three to five year period.

Headlines: Germany should make provisions to ensure banks have sufficient capital: OECD
Description: Germany should make provisions to ensure banks have sufficient capital in case of a wave of bankruptcies in Europe's largest economy caused by the coronavirus crisis, a senior OECD economist said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Explainer: How will Britain pay for coronavirus borrowing?
Description: British government borrowing is soaring to levels not seen since World War Two, something Prime Minister Boris Johnson and his finance minister Rishi Sunak will try to fix once the worst of the coronavirus crisis has passed.

Headlines: Finnair seeks 500 million euros from shareholders to cope with crisis
Description: Finnair launched a share sale on Wednesday to raise 500 million euros ($568 million) from its existing investors, almost as much as its current market value as it seeks to strengthen its finances to cope with the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: NATO chief says on Huawei: UK review of 5G security is important
Description: The head of the NATO military alliance said on Wednesday that the West could not ignore the rise of China and so it was important that Britain had a review of the role of Huawei in its 5G network to ensure its security.

Headlines: Adidas pledges to hire more black and Latino staff
Description: German sportswear brand Adidas has pledged to invest $20 million in the black community in the United States and make sure that at least 30% of all new U.S. jobs are filled with black and Latino people at its Adidas and Reebok brands.

Headlines: U.S. banks prepare branches for gradual post-coronavirus re-opening
Description: U.S. banks have been stocking up on masks and other supplies and setting up acrylic barriers to prevent spreading the novel coronavirus as they ready their branches for the country's gradual reopening, executives and suppliers told Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: RWE, Thyssenkrupp plan hydrogen production venture
Description: Germany's RWE plans to produce hydrogen from renewable energy to supply steelmaker Thyssenkrupp, the two companies told Reuters.

Headlines: Reddit names Michael Seibel to board after Ohanian's call for black candidate
Description: Social network company Reddit on Wednesday named venture capital investor Michael Seibel to its board, days after co-founder and former director Alexis Ohanian resigned and called for the company to replace him with a black candidate.

Headlines: Cerberus demands changes at 'disastrous' Commerzbank
Description: U.S. activist investor Cerberus is calling on Commerzbank to appoint two of its nominees to the supervisory board, cut costs and adopt a new strategy, as it battles to make a success of a big bet on German banks.

Headlines: Ford to return to pre-COVID production rates in U.S. plants by early July, COO says
Description: Ford Motor Co expects to have its U.S. vehicle assembly plants return by early July to building at the rates they did before the coronavirus pandemic shut down the U.S. auto industry for two months, a top executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Goldman traders gain $1 billion in commodities revenue after oil slump
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc commodities unit generated more than $1 billion in revenue this year through May as traders positioned their bets for the collapse in oil prices, a source familiar with the group's finances said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler plans to resume Panda production on June 16: union
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) plans to resume production of its Panda small car at its plant in Pomigliano, near Naples in southern Italy, on June 16, a union representative said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Delta expects second-quarter revenue to slump, looks to amend debt deals
Description: U.S. carrier Delta Air Lines on Wednesday forecast a 90% plunge in second-quarter revenue and warned it would need to renegotiate its debt agreements to avoid a default next year.

Headlines: Global risk rally has a powerful ally: the weaker dollar
Description: Investors are betting a weaker U.S. dollar will further boost a rally that has seen stocks, emerging market currencies and other risky assets soar in recent weeks.

Headlines: Unilever picks Britain as best option as it ends Anglo-Dutch era
Description: Unilever proposed on Thursday to ditch its dual Anglo-Dutch legal structure and create a single company in Britain to give it more flexibility for mergers and acquisitions as the coronavirus pandemic overwhelms businesses worldwide.

Headlines: U.S. states accuse 26 drugmakers of generic drug price fixing in sweeping lawsuit
Description: Twenty-six drug manufacturers were sued on Wednesday by the attorneys general of most U.S. states and several territories, which accused them of conspiring to reduce competition and drive up generic drug prices.

Headlines: Google's new rules clamp down on discriminatory housing, job ads
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Thursday it was tackling unlawful discrimination by barring housing, employment and credit ads from being targeted to its users based on their postal code, gender, age, parental status or marital status.

Headlines: Taco Bell parent Yum sues Grubhub for alleged violation of delivery deal
Description: Taco Bell parent Yum Brands Inc sued Grubhub Inc on Thursday for allegedly violating a delivery contract, a day after Europe's Just Eat Takeaway.com agreed to buy the U.S. food delivery company for $7.3 billion.

Headlines: Palantir close to registering for stock market debut: sources
Description: Data mining firm Palantir Technologies Inc is aiming to file confidentially with U.S. regulators to go public in the coming weeks, emboldened by the strong performance of other initial public offerings (IPOs), people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: A month into reopening, no clear turn for U.S. economy or pandemic
Description: A month into efforts to broadly reopen the U.S. economy there is little clarity either on the pace and durability of the recovery, or on the ability to convincingly suppress the virus that has killed more than 112,000 Americans.

Headlines: Wall Street's 'fear gauge' jumps on fears of coronavirus resurgence
Description: The Cboe Volatility Index, known as Wall Street's "fear gauge," jumped to its highest level in more than a month on Thursday as concerns over a resurgence of the novel coronavirus pandemic felled U.S. stocks.

Headlines: Dutch government regrets Unilever's British HQ decision
Description: The Dutch government on Thursday said it regretted Unilever's choice to base the company solely in Britain and not in the Netherlands.

Headlines: Despite pandemic, new U.S. solar capacity will grow 33% in 2020
Description: New U.S. solar installations will increase by a third this year, a report published on Thursday showed, as soaring demand by utilities for carbon-free power more than outweighs a dramatic decline in rooftop system orders for homes and businesses due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Tesla wins China approval to build Model 3 vehicles with LFP batteries: ministry
Description: Tesla Inc has received government approval to build Model 3 vehicles in China equipped with lithium iron phosphate (LFP) batteries, a document on Ministry of Industry and Information Technology website showed.

Headlines: China auto sales up for second straight month after almost two-year slump
Description: China's auto sales in May rose 14.5% from the same month a year earlier, industry data showed on Thursday, the second consecutive month of increase as the world's biggest vehicle market recovers from lows hit during coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Unilever's UK move is vote of confidence: British minister
Description: Unilever's decision to base the company solely in Britain and not in the Netherlands represented a vote of confidence in the country, said British business minister Alok Sharma.

Headlines: Renault's Senard says relations with Nissan much improved
Description: Renault 's partnership with Japan's Nissan has entered an "incredibly positive" phase after episodes of strained relations in recent years, the French carmaker's chairman Jean-Dominique Senard said on Thursday.

Headlines: China, U.S. should resume timely communication on trade: China adviser
Description: China and the United States should resume timely communication on trade and other issues, an adviser to the Chinese cabinet said on Thursday, stressing that the world's two biggest economies are too intertwined to be decoupled.

Headlines: Zoom suspends U.S.-based activists' account after Tiananmen event
Description: Zoom Video Communications temporarily shut the account belonging to a group of U.S.-based Chinese activists after they held an event to commemorate the 31st anniversary of China's Tiananmen Square crackdown, the activists said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Pershing Square's Ackman eyes $1 billion-plus 'blank-check' company - sources
Description: Billionaire investor William Ackman's hedge fund Pershing Square Capital Management has filed confidentially with U.S. regulators for an initial public offering (IPO) of a blank-check investment vehicle that could raise more than $1 billion and be the biggest of its kind, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Oil prices see weekly loss on virus resurgence fears
Description: Oil was little changed on Friday and logged a first weekly decline since April as new U.S. coronavirus cases spiked, stoking fears of a second wave of the virus hitting fuel demand.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. senators draft plan to reform new plane design approvals after 737 MAX crashes
Description: Two key U.S. senators are circulating a bipartisan draft bill that would reform how the Federal Aviation Administration certifies new aircraft in the wake of two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes that killed 346 people.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence rises; COVID-19, unemployment shadow lingers
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment perked up in early June as households cheered the reopening of businesses and a surprise rebound in hiring, though they did not expect a significant improvement in the economy amid fears of a resurgence in COVID-19 infections.

Headlines: Fed frets about small business failures amid 'alarming' data
Description: A large number of small U.S. businesses could fail during the coronavirus recession, the Federal Reserve said on Friday, slowing recovery and creating lasting damage to the world's largest economy.

Headlines: U.S. insurers use lofty estimates to beat back coronavirus claims
Description: U.S. property and casualty insurers have cast the coronavirus pandemic as an unprecedented event whose massive cost to small businesses they are neither able nor required to cover.

Headlines: After jolt, investors still see stocks as long-term bet
Description: An interruption to a searing rally gave a jolt to equity investors who had been getting used to weeks of steadily rising U.S. stocks.

Headlines: Wall Street ends higher but indexes mark worst week since March selloff
Description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Friday as bargain hunters stepped back into the market following sharp losses a day earlier, but all three major indexes suffered their biggest weekly percentage declines since March.

Headlines: Airbnb partners with Brazil virus hotspot Sao Paulo on post-pandemic tourism
Description: Home rental firm Airbnb struck a partnership with Brazil's Sao Paulo state to encourage tourism once the novel coronavirus crisis has passed, a company executive said on Friday.

Headlines: Lawmakers label British Airways 'national disgrace' over jobs
Description: British Airways was labelled a "national disgrace" by lawmakers for its treatment of employees on Saturday, adding to pressure on the airline as it juggles job cuts and new quarantine rules.

Headlines: U.S. eases criminal record provision in coronavirus business loan program
Description: Federal authorities administering business payroll loans as part of U.S. coronavirus relief efforts on Friday eased rules prohibiting lending to business owners with criminal records, allowing some with no convictions in the past year to access funds.

Headlines: World shares modestly higher as investors mull coronavirus, recovery outlook
Description: Global equity markets rose in choppy trading on Friday as concerns triggered by the U.S. Federal Reserve's less-than-optimistic outlook for an economic recovery and a jump in U.S. coronavirus cases gave investors pause.

Headlines: U.S. consumer sentiment rises in early June
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment perked up in early June as households responded to the reopening of businesses, which had been shuttered to slow the spread of COVID-19, and a rebound in hiring.

Headlines: Pandemic heightens chance Japan slides back into deflation: Reuters poll
Description: The coronavirus pandemic has raised the chance Japan's economy will slip back into deflation as social curbs to halt the spread of the disease hits businesses and consumers, a majority of analysts polled by Reuters said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Netflix in talks to source Indian content from Reliance affiliate Viacom18 - sources
Description: U.S. video streaming company Netflix is in talks with Viacom18, part of the Indian conglomerate Reliance Industries' media unit Network18, about a multi-year partnership to source content, three sources told Reuters, in a move that would expand a relationship between the two sides.

Headlines: Honda resumes production at plants hit by suspected cyber attack
Description: Japan's Honda Motor Co has resumed production at automobile and motorcycle plants in the United States and other countries after they were hit by a suspected cyber attack this week, a spokesman said on Friday.

Headlines: New U.S. stock exchange MEMX adds Citigroup as investor
Description: The Members Exchange (MEMX), a new U.S. stock exchange backed by some of Wall Street's biggest firms that is preparing for a Sept. 4 launch, said it received financial backing from Citigroup Inc .

Headlines: American Express JV gets final approval to launch operations in China
Description: China's central bank has given the final nod to a network clearing license for an American Express joint venture, allowing it to be the first foreign credit card company to launch onshore operations in China.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Investors bet bounce in value stocks will stick
Description: As the U.S. economy begins to emerge from the sharp slowdown during the coronavirus pandemic, some fund managers have been drawn to value stocks, a sector that underperformed during the recent rally.

Headlines: Systemic racism slows economic growth: Dallas Fed chief Kaplan
Description: Systemic racism and high unemployment levels among black and Hispanic Americans create a drag on the U.S. economy, Dallas Federal Reserve President Robert Kaplan said on Sunday.

Headlines: UAW president, U.S. prosecutor to meet for union reform talks on June 30
Description: United Auto Workers (UAW) President Rory Gamble will meet Matthew Schneider, the U.S. attorney for the Eastern District of Michigan, at the end of the month in Detroit to begin negotiations for reforming the union, UAW said on Monday.

Headlines: Amazon's business practices examined by two U.S. states
Description: State investigators in both California and Washington are examining Amazon's business practices, two newspapers reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. economy will start to rebound in second half of 2020, Fed's Kaplan says
Description: The U.S. economy will experience a "significant, historic" contraction in the second quarter before it starts to rebound, and unemployment will remain elevated at the end of 2020, Dallas Federal Reserve President Robert Kaplan said on Monday.

Headlines: Explainer: How Fed's Main Street program compares to other small business pandemic aid
Description: The Federal Reserve on Monday launched its latest life raft for U.S. businesses hurt by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S., China to each allow four weekly flights for airlines; Delta to fly next week
Description: The United States and China will each allow four weekly flights between the two countries, the U.S. Transportation Department said on Monday, easing a standoff on travel restrictions in the midst of the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Embraer to receive $600 million loan, partly backed by government, due to coronavirus
Description: Planemaker Embraer said on Monday it will receive a $600 million loan, financed partly by Brazil's government, to help the company weather the coronavirus crisis that has ravaged the air travel industry.

Headlines: Embraer secures $600 mln loan as commercial aviation chief departs
Description: Embraer SA said on Monday it had secured a $600 million loan, partly backed by Brazil's government, at the same time as a key executive departed the planemaker weeks after a potentially transformational deal with Boeing Co fell apart.

Headlines: Fed launches long-awaited Main Street lending program, seeks to reach nonprofits
Description: The Federal Reserve on Monday launched its Main Street Lending Program, the most complex program undertaken yet by the U.S. central bank to help keep the backbone of the economy from buckling under the strains of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Amazon says CEO Bezos willing to testify before U.S. Congress
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Monday its founder and Chief Executive Jeff Bezos was willing to testify to a congressional panel investigating potential violations of U.S. antitrust law by big technology companies.

Headlines: FCC chair calls T-Mobile U.S. network outage 'unacceptable', vows probe
Description: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) will probe an extensive T-Mobile network outage that impacted customers across the United States, the head of the U.S. telecommunications regulatory agency said on Monday.

Headlines: China's factory output perks up but consumers stay cautious
Description: China's factories stepped up production for a second straight month in May, as the country shook off the economic torpor of the coronavirus, although the weaker-than-expected gain suggested the recovery remained fragile.

Headlines: Analysts' view: Market jitters over second COVID-19 wave are an overdue pullback
Description: A second straight day of record new coronavirus cases in Beijing and a spike in infections across a swathe of the United States has dented investor sentiment and sent stocks sharply lower on Monday.

Headlines: BPER sees cash call of 600-700 million euro to fund new Intesa deal: sources
Description: Italy's BPER Banca estimates it will need to raise 600-700 million euros in a new share issue to fund a revised deal to buy branches and assets from Intesa Sanpaolo , two sources with knowledge of the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Volkswagen in Mexico will begin sending workers back to plant on Tuesday
Description: Volkswagen AG's Mexican unit will begin sending workers back to its plant in the central state of Puebla on Tuesday for "preparation and training eyeing a gradual start further ahead," the company said in a statement on Sunday.

Headlines: Intesa, BPER revise terms to try to clear antitrust hurdles to UBI deal
Description: Italy's Intesa Sanpaolo has agreed to sell more branches and assets to rival BPER to try to overcome antitrust objections to its proposed takeover of UBI Banca .

Headlines: Honeywell launches new business unit to capture drone market
Description: Honeywell International Inc, a major supplier of aerospace products, said Monday it launched an unmanned aerial systems business to bet on the autonomous aviation space – drones, air taxis, and unmanned cargo delivery vehicles.

Headlines: Delta has received approval from Shanghai government to resume flights
Description: Delta Air Lines has received approval from the Shanghai government to resume flights from June 18, a company spokeswoman said on Monday, paving the way for the carrier to resume services to China after months of suspension due to COVID-19.

Headlines: GE picks Embraer planemaking chief to run aviation unit
Description: General Electric Co on Monday tapped the planemaking head of Brazil's Embraer to run its key aircraft engines division on Monday, as the global aviation industry grapples with disruption caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Hungary ready to help Audi run local plant at full capacity: Orban
Description: Hungary is ready to give financial support to Audi to help its manufacturing plant in the country run at full operating capacity, Prime Minister Viktor Orban was reported as saying on Monday as he visited the site.

Headlines: U.S. mattress business springs back from pandemic shutdown
Description: The U.S. mattress business has bounced back after months of shutdowns from the coronavirus pandemic kept customers away.

Headlines: Carmaker PSA cuts back on transfer of Polish workers to French plant
Description: France's PSA , the maker of Peugeot cars, on Monday said it would only transfer a small group of Polish workers to help out in a French plant where production is being increased, following a backlash over the knock-on effect for local jobs.

Headlines: Tesla signs three-year pricing deal with battery cell maker Panasonic
Description: Tesla Inc has signed a three-year pricing deal with Japan's Panasonic Corp relating to the manufacture and supply of lithium-ion battery cells at the Gigafactory in Nevada, the electric carmaker disclosed in a filing on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street closes higher on signs of economic recovery
Description: Wall Street advanced on Tuesday as the prospect of additional stimulus and a record jump in retail sales suggested the U.S. economy could bounce back sooner than expected, five months into its pandemic-inflicted recession.

Headlines: Transparency needed to restore trust after 737 MAX crashes: FAA chief
Description: U.S. FAA chief Steve Dickson will tell a Senate committee at a hearing on Wednesday that transparency is key to restoring public trust in the agency and planemaker Boeing Co in the wake of fatal 737 MAX crashes, according to a copy of his written testimony seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Asian stocks set to rise as drug trials, data push Wall Street higher
Description: Asian stocks were set to climb on Wednesday after another late Wall Street surge in response to upbeat trial results for a COVID-19 treatment and data showing U.S. consumers spent big in May.

Headlines: U.S. bank profits plunge 70% on coronavirus loss provisioning
Description: U.S. bank profits fell by 69.6% to $18.5 billion in the first quarter of 2020 from the year prior as banks felt the economic impact of the novel coronavirus pandemic, according to data from a banking regulator.

Headlines: Dollar firm after retail sales jump fans recovery hopes
Description: The dollar held firm against many of its rivals on Wednesday after U.S. retail sales jumped far more than expected in May, while risk-sensitive currencies were hobbled by concerns about the coronavirus and diplomatic tensions in Asia.

Headlines: Trump team prepares $1 trillion infrastructure plan to spur economy
Description: The Trump administration is preparing an up to $1 trillion infrastructure package focused on transportation projects as part of its push to spur the world's largest economy back to life, a source familiar with the situation said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Green shoots welcome but recovery still a long road, Fed's Powell says
Description: A full U.S. economic recovery will not occur until the American people are sure that the novel coronavirus epidemic has been brought under control, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday, as he began the first of two days of hearings before U.S. lawmakers.

Headlines: Senate bill aims to improve aircraft certification after 737 MAX crashes
Description: U.S. senators introduced legislation on Tuesday that would strengthen FAA oversight of aircraft certification following fatal Boeing Co 737 MAX crashes, though a victim's father said the bill, while a positive step, "still lacks teeth."

Headlines: Stocks and dollar gain on U.S. retail sales, drug trial
Description: Risk appetite found new life on Tuesday on a record rebound in U.S. retail sales, fresh support from the Federal Reserve and Bank of Japan, and upbeat trial results for a COVID-19 treatment, driving global equity markets higher and boosting the dollar.

Headlines: U.S. says former eBay workers sent live roaches, bloody pig mask to intimidate critics
Description: Six former eBay Inc employees have been criminally charged with mounting a cyberstalking campaign against a Massachusetts couple whose online newsletter they viewed as critical of the e-commerce company, U.S. prosecutors announced on Monday.

Headlines: Did elite David Boies law firm get a pandemic bailout? It's a secret
Description: When the U.S. government announced a multibillion-dollar bailout of struggling small businesses amid the coronavirus pandemic, one of the top U.S. law firms sensed an opportunity.

Headlines: Appeals court sides with exchanges in U.S. SEC fee row
Description: A U.S. appeals court ruled on Tuesday that the Securities and Exchange Commission cannot force stock exchanges to conduct a costly experiment to see how the fees they charge and the incentives they offer affect brokers' trading habits.

Headlines: U.S. economy starts long recovery as retail sales post record jump
Description: U.S. retail sales increased by the most on record in May after two straight months of sharp declines as businesses reopened, offering more evidence that the recession triggered by the COVID-19 pandemic was over or drawing to an end.

Headlines: Instant View: Powell: No U.S. growth recovery until epidemic controlled
Description: A full U.S. economic recovery will not occur until the American people are sure that the novel coronavirus epidemic has been brought under control, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday as he began the first of two days of hearings before U.S. lawmakers.

Headlines: European airlines face longer haul to recovery
Description: A patchwork of national restrictions and a reluctance among travellers to cross borders mean European airlines face a bumpier return to the skies from coronavirus lockdowns than U.S. and Asian rivals.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories drop more than expected
Description: U.S. business inventories fell more than expected in April as the COVID-19 crisis depressed imports, suggesting inventory investment could again be a drag on economic output in the second quarter.

Headlines: Main IKEA retailer starts returning government aid received to cover wages
Description: Ingka Group, the owner of most IKEA stores, said on Tuesday it had repaid aid received from the Serbian government to cover wages for furloughed staff during lockdown, and was about to do the same in Romania.

Headlines: Renault to cut 1,500 engineering jobs in France: union source
Description: French carmaker Renault plans to cut 1,500 engineering jobs in France, a trade union source told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. health insurers may balk at paying for coronavirus antibody testing
Description: U.S. health insurers may balk at covering tests that look for coronavirus antibodies in some cases, arguing that employers or the government should foot a bill expected to run into billions of dollars.

Headlines: Volkswagen invests extra $200 million in U.S. battery company QuantumScape
Description: Volkswagen is increasing its stake in U.S. company QuantumScape by up to $200 million to boost the development of solid-state battery technology that aims to increase the ranges of electric cars and shorten charging times, the German carmaker said https://bit.ly/2BcvqPY on Tuesday.

Headlines: Cerberus vows no let up in push for change at Commerzbank
Description: Cerberus will use "alternative paths" to force leadership change at Commerzbank if it continues to resist calls to reform, the activist investor said in a letter to Germany's second-biggest bank seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell says strong job market can reduce U.S. racial inequality
Description: The best way the Federal Reserve can help reduce racial inequality is to return the U.S. labor market to its pre-coronavirus strength, U.S. Fed Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday, as he sidestepped questions over whether the Fed itself contributes to the problem.

Headlines: Google sets 2025 leadership diversity goal, ends 'tailgater' ID checks
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Wednesday announced a new hiring goal and security policy to address racial issues at its offices, as protests over police brutality against African Americans have carried into discussions about corporate culture.

Headlines: House panel debating $494 billion infrastructure measure
Description: A U.S. House of Representatives panel is debating on Wednesday a Democratic plan to boost infrastructure spending that aims to fix crumbling roads and highways and reduce carbon pollution.

Headlines: Amazon launches Saudi Arabia shopping site despite CEO's dispute with kingdom
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Wednesday launched a website for shoppers in Saudi Arabia, showing its continued business interests there despite a public dispute between Riyadh and the company's chief executive, Jeff Bezos.

Headlines: FAA chief acknowledges agency, Boeing made mistakes on 737 MAX
Description: The head of the Federal Aviation Administration, Steve Dickson, acknowledged on Wednesday that Boeing Co and the U.S. air safety agency both made mistakes on the 737 MAX jet, but rejected senators' accusations the FAA was "stonewalling" probes after two fatal crashes.

Headlines: U.S. trade chief vows to push for 'broad reset' at WTO
Description: The Trump administration will push for a broad reset of "outdated tariff determinations" at the World Trade Organization to fix what it sees as years of unfair treatment of the United States, a top trade official told U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fed's Powell beats drum for more government aid to bolster economy
Description: The U.S. economy is beginning to recover from the worst of the coronavirus crisis, but with some 25 million Americans displaced from work and the pandemic ongoing, it will need more help, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told lawmakers on Wednesday.

Headlines: Main Street's boldest take on Wall Street in bankruptcy stock frenzy
Description: When Bryan Quevedo received his U.S. government stimulus check last month, he invested $1,000 in the stock of bankrupt car rental company Hertz Global Holdings Inc.

Headlines: Several U.S. banks to close branches, offices early for Juneteenth
Description: Several U.S. banks are closing branches and offices early on Friday to observe the Juneteenth holiday, which commemorates the day in 1865 when the last group of enslaved African Americans learned slavery was abolished.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker says seeking bipartisan legislation on airline mask rules
Description: A U.S. senator said on Wednesday he was hoping for bipartisan support in Congress for mandatory rules on masks for air travel after the head of the Federal Aviation Administration again resisted calls for a mandate.

Headlines: U.S. homebuilding rises moderately; jump in permits hints at green shoots
Description: U.S. homebuilding increased less than expected in May, but a strong rebound in permits for future home construction suggested the housing market was starting to emerge from the COVID-19 crisis along with the broader economy.

Headlines: U.S. shale companies to boost oil output by 500,000 bpd by month-end
Description: U.S. shale producers are expected to restore roughly half a million barrels per day (bpd) of crude output by the end of June, according to crude buyers and analysts, amounting to a quarter of what they shut since the coronavirus pandemic cut fuel demand and hammered oil prices.

Headlines: United Airlines sweetens exit deal for flight attendants, others
Description: United Airlines sweetened on Tuesday a voluntary exit package for frontline employees like flight attendants and gate agents, saying it needed "a lot more people to sign up" to avoid involuntary layoffs in October, according to a staff email seen by Reuters.

Headlines: FCA moves closer to state guarantee for $7.1 billion loan: source
Description: Italy's Treasury has taken a further step towards approving a state guarantee for a 6.3 billion euro ($7.1 billion) loan for Fiat Chrysler's Italian unit, a government source told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Google releases new ad features to help small businesses
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Wednesday introduced new advertising features intended to help local businesses get more customers and recover from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Wall Street rally wins more fans as economy hints at recovery
Description: Record upside surprises in U.S. economic data are bolstering the case for a “V” shaped recovery from the COVID-19 recession and boosting investor confidence in a stock rally that has already delivered hefty gains in recent months.

Headlines: Special delivery: activists urge France to rein in Amazon
Description: Environmental campaigners delivered a 12-foot (3.6-metre) tall mock-up of an Amazon parcel to the French finance ministry on Wednesday to demand that the government rein in the e-commerce giant's expansion in France.

Headlines: May flowers: Where the U.S. retail blooms are and are not
Description: No denying May's $73 billion rebound in U.S. retail sales was an eye-popper and is the latest fodder to fuel the red-hot "V" vs "U" debate about what kind of recovery to expect from the COVID-19 recession.

Headlines: Prudential sells Jackson equity stake to Apollo-backed Athene for $500 million
Description: Prudential sold a minority stake in its U.S. business, Jackson, to Apollo Global-backed Athene Holding for $500 million, the insurer said on Thursday, in the first phase of its plan to create an independent U.S. business.

Headlines: Kroger says demand easing after coronavirus stockpiling
Description: U.S. supermarket chain Kroger Co stopped short of raising its annual forecasts on Thursday, saying a coronavirus-driven surge in demand for essential goods was fading as American households reconsider what they have on their shelves.

Headlines: Chanel warns virus impact will linger on luxury sector
Description: The luxury industry will feel the fallout from the coronavirus crisis for the next two years if not longer, Chanel's chief financial officer said on Thursday, warning the French fashion label's 2020 revenues and profit would be significantly hit.

Headlines: Lufthansa investor Thiele seeks talks with German government: Handelsblatt
Description: Lufthansa's biggest shareholder, German billionaire Heinz Hermann Thiele, has reached out to Berlin politicians for talks, Handelsblatt said, the latest step in a standoff over the airline's 9 billion euro ($10.1 billion) bailout.

Headlines: Oil edges up on OPEC output cut compliance; pandemic still weighs
Description: Oil prices rose slightly on Thursday as a panel of OPEC and its allies met to review record oil supply cuts, even as the market remained concerned about additional coronavirus cases reported in parts of the United States and China.

Headlines: Tesla wants to start building a new U.S. vehicle plant this summer
Description: Electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc wants to start building a large vehicle assembly plant in the southwestern United States as early as the third quarter of this year, the company told Texas officials in documents made public this week.

Headlines: Dollar up on fears of new pandemic wave, unemployment claims
Description: The U.S. dollar strengthened on Thursday as concerns about a rise in new coronavirus cases globally and higher-than-expected U.S. unemployment claims drove demand for the safe-haven currency.

Headlines: U.S. grocer Albertsons expects IPO to raise up to $1.3 billion
Description: U.S. grocery retailer Albertsons Cos Inc said on Thursday its initial public offering would target to raise up to $1.32 billion.

Headlines: SoftBank set to invest in more than a dozen U.S. minority-led startups
Description: SoftBank Group Corp will invest $2 million or more in 14 U.S. startups led by black founders and other underrepresented groups, the company said on Thursday, as part of its effort to fund more a more diverse array of entrepreneurs.

Headlines: Japanese insurer Sompo investing $500 million in data analytics firm Palantir
Description: Palantir Technologies Inc on Thursday said that Japanese insurance holding company Sompo Holdings Inc is investing $500 million in the Silicon Valley data analytics company, whose clients range from global banks to the U.S. government and the Central Intelligence Agency.

Headlines: S&P 500 closes nominally higher amid COVID-19 spikes, muted data
Description: The S&P 500 closed nominally higher on Thursday as investors weighed a resurgence in coronavirus infections and the possibility of a new round of shutdowns as well as data that suggested the U.S. economy might not bounce back with quick, V-shaped recovery.

Headlines: Trump to nominate lawyer Crenshaw to fill SEC Democratic commissioner slot
Description: The White House announced on Thursday that President Donald Trump intends to nominate Caroline Crenshaw to fill a Democratic vacancy at the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

Headlines: Australian regulator says Google's $2.1 billion Fitbit deal could harm competition
Description: Australia's antitrust regulator warned Google's planned $2.1 billion acquisition of fitness tracker maker Fitbit may give it too much of people's data, potentially hurting competition in health and online advertising markets.

Headlines: Automakers rev up U.S. assembly lines, wary of outside risks to workers
Description: Automakers are speeding up U.S. assembly lines to meet recovering demand, increasingly confident coronavirus safety protocols are working to prevent outbreaks in their plants but wary of the challenges workers face outside.

Headlines: Amazon to hire 3,000 people in South Africa for customer service roles
Description: Amazon.com Inc is hiring 3,000 people in South Africa this year to provide support to customers in North America and Europe, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: JPMorgan gets China's nod for first fully foreign-owned futures business
Description: China on Thursday approved JPMorgan's application to operate the first fully foreign-owned futures business, as the world's second-largest economy pushes ahead with opening its multi-trillion-dollar financial market.

Headlines: Cash flows into U.S. growth funds surge, value funds see outflows
Description: U.S. investors have ramped up investments in growth funds over the past few months on expectations of higher returns and safety, while they dumped value funds despite cheaper prices after this year's pandemic-linked selloff.

Headlines: Mother's Day sales uptick doesn't cover coronavirus downturn, Washington D.C. florist says
Description: Mother's Day during the coronavirus pandemic meant an uptick in sales for Lee's Flower and Card Shop in Washington, D.C.

Headlines: U.S. current account deficit edges down; COVID-19 curbs trade
Description: The U.S. current account deficit dipped to a near two-year low in the first quarter as the COVID-19 pandemic restricted the flow of goods and services, while companies continued to repatriate profits back home.

Headlines: Acknowledging derogatory term, Eskimo Pie owner says to change ice cream's name
Description: The U.S. owner of Eskimo Pie ice cream will change the product's brand name and marketing, it told Reuters on Friday, becoming the latest company to rethink racially charged brand imagery amid a broad debate on racial injustice.

Headlines: Take Five: Reshuffle the decks
Description: After one of the most severe equity market selloffs in decades comes the June 26 "Russell Recon", the once-a-year re-jig of FTSE Russells's U.S. index range, tracked by over $9 trillion in assets.

Headlines: Dollar records small weekly gain on safe-haven demand
Description: Fears of a second wave of coronavirus infections have increased demand for safe-haven assets, driving the U.S. dollar on Friday to its best weekly gain in a month.

Headlines: U.S. shares retreat on renewed pandemic fears, safe-havens rise
Description: Demand for safe havens rose and global equity markets turned south on Friday after Apple Inc said it would temporarily shut 11 U.S. stores as coronavirus cases continue to rise, rekindling fears of a deadly second wave of the pandemic.

Headlines: Airbus extends furloughs in UK, Spain in latest effort to tackle COVID-19 fallout
Description: European planemaker Airbus SE said on Friday it is extending furlough programs for 5,300 of its employees in Spain and the United Kingdom in its latest effort to cope with the impact of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: FedEx to record about $370 million in charges in fourth quarter
Description: U.S. package delivery company FedEx Corp said https://www.sec.gov/ix?doc=/Archives/edgar/data/1048911/000119312520174218/d949507d8k.htm on Friday it would record non-cash asset impairment charges of about $370 million in the fourth quarter, primarily related to its retail chain that provides printing, packing and shipping services.

Headlines: U.S. economy will likely need more support, Fed's Rosengren says
Description: The continued spread of the novel coronavirus could hamper the U.S. economic rebound from the pandemic, and more fiscal and monetary support will likely be needed, Boston Federal Reserve President Eric Rosengren said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Blackstone, Taisho Pharma among final bidders for Takeda's Japan OTC unit - sources
Description: Blackstone, Bain Capital and Taisho Pharmaceutical are among the final bidders for Takeda Pharmaceutical's consumer drug business in Japan, a deal that could be worth up to 400 billion yen ($3.7 billion), three people familiar with the deal said.

Headlines: Nissan cuts more shifts at Japan car plants due to low demand
Description: Nissan Motor Co on Friday said it will cut more shifts at its three assembly plants in Japan due to falling demand, as the automaker struggles to recover from a drop in sales triggered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Colgate reviewing Chinese toothpaste brand Darlie amid debate on racial inequality
Description: Colgate-Palmolive on Thursday said it was working to review and evolve its Chinese toothpaste brand, Darlie, the latest in a string of brand reassessments amid a U.S. debate on racial inequality.

Headlines: South Korea's wealthy, passed over by pandemic pain, splurge on Porsches and BMWs
Description: Hwang Min-yong, a 37-year-old South Korean businessman, recently received his black Porsche Cayenne coupe with red leather seats after a seven-month wait and took it out for a spin on a scenic road overlooking a river near Seoul.

Headlines: Unilever Brazil laundry franchise deal may presage new business push
Description: Unilever Plc said on Friday it is buying a chain of laundromats in Brazil to be renamed Omo, after the world's No. 2 laundry detergent, in what the consumer goods giant said could be a precursor to other similar deals elsewhere.

Headlines: Wirecard seeks new financing strategy after Moody's junk downgrade
Description: German payments firm Wirecard said it had hired U.S. investment bank Houlihan Lokey to devise a new financing strategy after Moody's slashed the company's rating to junk over the disappearance of 1.9 billion euros.

Headlines: China eases green rules for petrol-electric hybrids, giving makers space to manoeuvre
Description: China re-classified petrol-electric hybrid vehicles on Monday so they get more favourable treatment than all-petrol or diesel counterparts under new clean car rules, making it easier for automakers to meet environment quotas and offer more choice.

Headlines: Wirecard CEO exits as search for missing billions hits dead end in Asia
Description: Wirecard's chief executive quit on Friday as the German payments firm's search for $2.1 billion of missing cash hit a dead end in the Philippines and it scrambled to secure a financial lifeline from its banks.

Headlines: Dior revives fashion shows - but with no front row
Description: French luxury label Christian Dior said on Monday it would press ahead with a calendar of fashion shows for this year starting in July with an Italian catwalk display - but without the celebrated front-row audience of A-listers.

Headlines: Patagonia joins The North Face in Facebook ad boycott
Description: Outdoor apparel brand Patagonia Inc will pause its ads on Facebook Inc and Facebook's photo-sharing app, Instagram, making it the latest company to join a boycott campaign organized by U.S. civil rights groups.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court rejects challenge to Trump's steel tariffs
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday turned away a challenge to President Donald Trump's tariffs on imported steel brought by an industry group that had argued that a key part of the law under which he imposed the duties violates the U.S. Constitution.

Headlines: Dollar dips, Aussie gains as traders bet on pandemic recovery
Description: The U.S. dollar weakened and higher-risk currencies including the Australian dollar jumped on Monday as investors focused on the prospect for an eventual economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Factbox: Who is affected by Trump's new rules on work visas?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump suspended the entry of certain foreign workers on Monday until the end of the year, a move the White House said would help the coronavirus-battered economy, but which business groups strongly oppose.

Headlines: Google faces employee petition to end tech sales to police
Description: More than 1,600 workers at Alphabet Inc are petitioning its Google unit to stop selling email and other services to police departments, a source familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: South Africa to oppose Airlink's bid to halt SAA creditors meeting
Description: South Africa plans to oppose an application by regional airline Airlink to put South African Airways (SAA) into provisional liquidation and prevent a meeting of SAA's creditors to discuss a restructuring plan, the government said on Monday.

Headlines: Who's bidding to be next World Trade Organization chief?
Description: The World Trade Organization (WTO) began the process this month of selecting a new director-general to replace Brazil's Roberto Azevedo, who is stepping down a year early at the end of August.

Headlines: Nigeria's WTO candidate gets regional backing: document
Description: The West African regional bloc ECOWAS is backing Nigeria's candidate to head the World Trade Organization (WTO) and calls on other African countries to follow, a document showed on Monday, in a possible step towards uniting Africa behind her.

Headlines: Changing of guard at top German court signals de-escalation for ECB
Description: Changes to the composition of Germany's top court are likely to make it less confrontational towards the European Central Bank following a ruling about bond purchases that sent shockwaves around Europe, according to two sources close to the court.

Headlines: Global dollar crunch appears over as central banks rely less on Fed backstop
Description: A global crunch for U.S. dollars that was a hallmark of the early moments of the coronavirus crisis appears to have passed, the latest milestone in a remarkable turnaround in financial conditions engineered by the Federal Reserve and other top central banks.

Headlines: No clear path to salvation seen for stricken Wirecard
Description: Wirecard's confirmation that $2.1 billion it had booked in its accounts likely never existed raises questions over whether the company is able to survive as a going concern or can be broken up and sold.

Headlines: Credit Suisse says it will delist volatility ETN
Description: Credit Suisse Group AG said on Monday that it will delist several exchange-traded notes, including one linked to Wall Street's "fear gauge" that soared during the peak of the sell-off in U.S. stocks.

Headlines: Germany's Scholz says Lufthansa talks were good
Description: The German government on Monday held last-ditch talks about a 9 billion euros Lufthansa bailout on Monday, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said, as Berlin politicians seek to resolve a standoff with a key shareholder in the airline.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Index reshuffle to give healthcare stocks a bigger profile
Description: The U.S. healthcare sector looks set for a bulked up profile in growth indexes when FTSE Russell reconstitutes its stock indexes late next Friday, an annual event that historically creates one of the biggest trading volume days of the year.

Headlines: Nokia must 'really significantly' reduce job cuts in France, finance ministry official says
Description: Finnish telecoms equipment maker Nokia must "really significantly" reduce its announced job cuts in France, an official at the French finance ministry said on Monday.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz, Nvidia deepen autonomous driving alliance
Description: Semiconductor maker Nvidia Corp has struck a deal with Germany's Daimler to develop and equip Mercedes-Benz cars with a next generation chip and software platform that could eventually be used for autonomous driving functions.

Headlines: Sanofi clinches $2 billion vaccines deal with Translate Bio
Description: French drugmaker Sanofi has agreed a potential $2 billion vaccines deal with Translate Bio , expanding their collaboration in development of an inoculation against COVID-19 and sending the U.S. biotech company's shares soaring.

Headlines: U.S. economy improving; rising COVID-19 cases a threat
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes increased more than expected in May and business activity contracted moderately this month, suggesting the economy was on the cusp of recovering from the recession caused by the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: Euro rises on upbeat data, Trump says China trade deal still intact
Description: The euro jumped to one-week highs following positive economic data on Tuesday, while the Australian dollar and other higher-risk currencies strengthened after U.S. officials confirmed that the U.S.-China trade deal remained intact.

Headlines: Justice Dept, state AGs to meet Friday on Google antitrust probe: source
Description: U.S. Justice Department officials and some state attorneys general are set to meet on Friday to discuss ongoing antitrust probes into Alphabet Inc's Google unit, a person briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Dell considering spinning off VMware stake: WSJ
Description: Dell Technologies Inc is considering spinning off its roughly $50 billion stake in cloud computing software maker VMware Inc , the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Explainer: Who is affected by Trump’s suspension of foreign work visas?
Description: President Donald Trump temporarily suspended the entry into the United States of certain foreign workers on Monday despite strong opposition from business groups, including major tech companies.

Headlines: U.S. home sales hit nine-and-a-half-year low; price growth cools
Description: U.S. home sales dropped to their lowest level in more than 9-1/2 years in May, strengthening expectations for a sharp contraction in housing market activity in the second quarter following disruptions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Siemens, Salesforce aim to sell products for COVID-19 back-to-work plans
Description: Siemens and U.S. software developer Salesforce will work together on products to help companies' employees get back to work while following rules to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus, the firms said on Tuesday.

Headlines: EU countries, lawmakers agree deal on class action lawsuits
Description: European Union countries and lawmakers struck a deal late on Monday to pave the way for Europeans to team up and sue companies for defective products but with built-in safeguards to guard against the excesses of U.S. class action lawsuits.

Headlines: SoftBank kicks off $21 billion sale of T-Mobile shares
Description: SoftBank Group Corp unveiled a series of transactions on Monday to divest more than $21 billion worth of stock in U.S. wireless carrier T-Mobile US Inc , as it seeks funding for a $41 billion share buyback and debt reduction plan.

Headlines: Exclusive: German finance minister points to regulatory failures in Wirecard scandal
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said lawmakers need to quickly determine how to tighten regulation in the wake of an accounting scandal at payments company Wirecard that has tarnished the reputation of Germany's financial watchdog.

Headlines: Trump suspends entry of certain foreign workers despite business opposition
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump suspended the entry into the United States of certain foreign workers on Monday, a move the White House said would help the coronavirus-battered economy, but which business groups strongly oppose.

Headlines: Factbox: Apple, Google, Amazon take aim at Trump visa ban
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has suspended the entry of some foreign workers in a bid to boost domestic hiring, sparking opposition from corporate America and tech sector executives including Google's Sundar Pichai and Tesla's Elon Musk.

Headlines: United Airlines expects to raise $3 billion in debt offering
Description: United Airlines said on Tuesday it plans to raise $3 billion in debt by issuing senior notes, as U.S. airlines beef up liquidity in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Fed isn't fueling U.S. inequality, Daly says
Description: San Francisco Federal Reserve President Mary Daly on Tuesday defended the U.S. central bank from criticism that its easy monetary policy and emergency lending programs are doing more to help the rich than the poor.

Headlines: Wirecard 'disaster' piles on pressure for corporate reform in Germany
Description: Wirecard's fall from grace prompted calls for an overhaul of Germany's system of corporate oversight on Tuesday, as the fraud scandal threatened to further undermine the country's once-prized reputation for integrity.

Headlines: Explainer: Why COVID-19 can run rife in meatpacking plants
Description: Meat-processing plants around the world are proving coronavirus infection hotspots, with an outbreak at a factory in Germany leading to Guetersloh becoming on Tuesday the first area in the country to be ordered back into lockdown.

Headlines: Central banks hint at pandemic stimulus exit. Markets aren't buying it
Description: As strict coronavirus lockdowns end, some central bankers have started hinting at another kind of exit -- from emergency stimulus they launched just three months ago. Markets so far appear to be calling their bluff.

Headlines: U.S. business sector contraction eases in June
Description: U.S. business activity contracted for a fifth straight month in June, but the pace of decline eased, supporting views that the recession caused by the COVID-19 crisis was drawing to an end.

Headlines: New Google default wipes users' location, web history after 18 months
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it will automatically delete some location history after 18 months for new users and make it easier for everyone to access its search, Maps and YouTube apps without being tracked.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs CEO says economic recovery will be rapid at first then challenged
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc's Chief Executive David Solomon said on Wednesday that he expects the U.S. economic recovery to look V-shaped at first, but for that rapid growth to flatten out and become more challenged in the next 6 to 12 months.

Headlines: Daimler and Nvidia team up to close tech gap to Tesla
Description: Having pulled ahead in the race to develop a software-based vehicle operating system, U.S. electric car pioneer Tesla faces a new challenge from an alliance of German luxury carmaker Daimler and U.S. computer graphics specialist Nvidia.

Headlines: Dollar gains as coronavirus fears return to fore
Description: The dollar strengthened on Wednesday as a rise in coronavirus cases in the United States reduced confidence in a quick economic recovery, and as the U.S. weighed tariffs on European products.

Headlines: Italy approves guarantees for $7.1 billion loan to Fiat Chrysler
Description: Italy has approved a decree offering state guarantees for a 6.3-billion euro ($7.1 billion) loan to Fiat Chrysler's (FCA) Italian unit, the Treasury said on Wednesday, paving the way for the largest crisis loan to a European carmaker.

Headlines: Wall Street finishes lower on rising virus cases, weak economic view
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes on Wednesday suffered their biggest daily percentage drop in almost two weeks as a surge in U.S. coronavirus cases intensified fears of another round of government lockdowns and worsening economic damage.

Headlines: U.S. pilots union asks government to subsidize empty seats on planes
Description: A major U.S. pilots union said on Wednesday it has begun discussing with key lawmakers a plan for the government to purchase seats on each flight to prevent passengers from having to sit next to strangers.

Headlines: China taps World Bank official for U.S.-facing finance post: sources
Description: China is adding a new face to its trade negotiation team by appointing its chief representative at the World Bank to head the Finance Ministry's international cooperation department, three people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: T-Mobile shares priced at $103 each in SoftBank sale
Description: U.S. wireless carrier T-Mobile US Inc said it has priced a sale of its shares at $103 each in a deal that will see SoftBank Group divest a portion of its stake - a major step in the Japanese conglomerate's plan to sell assets.

Headlines: Philippines probing people linked to Wirecard saga, ex-board member 'may still be here'
Description: The Philippines is investigating individuals linked to an accounting saga at German payment firm Wirecard, its justice minister said on Wednesday, including a former board member who visited the country in March and "may still be here".

Headlines: New-look U.S. bank 'stress tests' may leave analysts guessing
Description: U.S. bank analysts have cleared their diaries on Thursday ahead of a long evening poring over results of the Federal Reserve's bank health checks, which have been upended this year by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: CVS to offer companies COVID-19 testing program as U.S. cases rise
Description: As U.S. employers grapple with trying to keep workers healthy and on the job amid fresh spikes in COVID-19 cases, CVS Health Corp has begun selling companies a diagnostic testing program.

Headlines: Factbox: Competing claims for oil cargoes linked to Hin Leong
Description: Over $200 million of oil stored mainly on ships in Singapore and Europe and a terminal in Singapore is caught up in lawsuits related to trade and financing deals by Singapore's Hin Leong Trading (Pte) Ltd, court documents show.

Headlines: Philippines to investigate Wirecard's phantom billions
Description: Wirecard's missing $2.1 billion is being investigated by the Philippines, which said that the German payments firm's former chief operating officer Jan Marsalek may be in the country.

Headlines: Council's £1 billion property bet shaken by WeWork rent waiver request
Description: LONDON (IFR) - WeWork has asked to skip millions of pounds of rent payments owed to Spelthorne Borough Council, creating a major headache for the tiny local authority that has borrowed more than £1bn to bet on commercial property.

Headlines: Factbox: More U.S. companies join Facebook ad boycott bandwagon
Description: A handful of U.S. companies have pulled advertising from Facebook Inc in support of a campaign that called out the social media giant for not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platforms.

Headlines: Lufthansa investors back $10 bln German government rescue
Description: Lufthansa shareholders on Thursday backed a 9 billion euro ($10 billion) government bailout, securing the future of Germany's flagship airline after it was brought to the brink of collapse by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela's PDVSA weighs plan to pay for refinery work with fuel, byproducts - sources
Description: Officials from Venezuelan state oil company Petroleos de Venezuela [PDVSA.UL] have spoken with private contractors about paying for work fixing the country's refineries with fuel and byproducts, a half dozen people familiar with the talks said.

Headlines: Weak demand prompts Macy's to cut 3,900 jobs in push to save cash
Description: Macy's Inc said on Thursday it would lay off about 3,900 employees in corporate and management positions as U.S. businesses try to save cash in the face of dwindling demand caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Germany welcomes EU green light for Lufthansa bailout
Description: Germany's economy and finance ministers on Thursday welcomed the approval by the European Union for a government bailout package for Lufthansa and urged shareholders to approve the deal at a meeting later in the day.

Headlines: Netherlands agrees to contribute 3.4 billion euros to Air France-KLM bailout
Description: The Dutch government has reached a deal with France to contribute 3.4 billion euros ($3.8 billion) to an Air France-KLM bailout that had strained relations between the airline group's state shareholders, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Albertsons pulls off downsized IPO after years of trying
Description: U.S. supermarket operator Albertsons Companies Inc decided to go ahead with a downsized $800 million initial public offering (IPO) on Thursday, the culmination of multiple attempts by its private equity owner Cerberus Capital Management LP to cash out.

Headlines: Equities gain, safe havens rise in choppy trading as virus cases surge
Description: Global equity benchmarks moved higher in choppy trading on Thursday as investors gauged the potential economic impact of a surge in U.S. coronavirus cases and loosening restrictions on the U.S. banking sector, while perceived safe-haven assets, including U.S. Treasuries and the dollar, edged higher.

Headlines: District of Columbia sues four oil majors for misleading consumers on climate change
Description: The attorney general for the District of Columbia on Thursday filed a lawsuit against Exxon Mobil Corp , BP Plc, Chevron Corp, and Royal Dutch Shell Plc for "systematically and intentionally misleading" consumers about the role their products play in causing climate change, the latest action by a U.S. attorney general against the oil and gas industry.

Headlines: Dollar strengthens as virus fears dent risk appetite
Description: The U.S. dollar gained on Thursday due to safety buying as fears grew over a rapid rise in coronavirus infections in some U.S. states, and as trade tensions worsened between the United States and the European Union.

Headlines: Oil prices climb as U.S. economic data lends support
Description: Oil prices rose about 2% in a volatile session on Thursday, buoyed by signs of a marginal improvement in the U.S. economy and a tepid rise in fuel demand, but price gains were limited by rising cases of COVID-19 in some U.S. states.

Headlines: L'Oreal's beauty-conscious customers return post-lockdown
Description: Purchases of cosmetics are picking up - especially in China - as countries exit coronavirus shutdowns that forced forced hair salons and retailers to close, L'Oreal Chief Executive Jean-Paul Agon said.

Headlines: Blackstone adds Alphabet CFO Ruth Porat to its board
Description: Blackstone Group Inc said on Thursday Alphabet Inc's finance chief, Ruth Porat, will join the private equity firm's board of directors.

Headlines: Americans split along party lines over green stimulus: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Description: Americans are split along party lines over whether federal stimulus programs to boost the U.S. economy during the COVID-19 pandemic should prioritize clean energy businesses, according to a survey published by Reuters/Ipsos on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Legal tussles snarl millions in oil from Hin Leong deals
Description: Millions of dollars of oil stored in tanks and ships in Asia and Europe has become caught in a web of lawsuits related to trade and financing deals by Singapore's Hin Leong Trading (Pte) Ltd, according to court documents and shipping data.

Headlines: Factbox: German payments firm Wirecard goes from boom to bust
Description: Wirecard said on Thursday it was filing for insolvency after disclosing a $2.1 billion hole in its accounts only a week ago, capping a swift demise for a company that expanded rapidly over two decades to become a member of Germany's blue-chip share index.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump administration says Huawei, Hikvision backed by Chinese military
Description: The Trump administration has determined that top Chinese firms, including telecoms equipment giant Huawei Technologies and video surveillance company Hikvision , are owned or controlled by the Chinese military, laying the groundwork for new U.S. financial sanctions.

Headlines: U.S. new-car sales in June seen down as much as 30%: research firms
Description: While U.S. new-vehicle sales in June are expected to decline as much as 30%, research firms on Thursday maintained that retail demand has held up relatively well during the coronavirus outbreak and the question now is whether the industry can rebuild inventories fast enough as demand rebounds.

Headlines: Coronavirus resurgence looms over Wall Street rally
Description: The resilience of a months-long rebound in U.S. stocks is being put to the test as a long-feared resurgence in coronavirus infections weighs on hopes of a sharp economic recovery in the United States.

Headlines: Bayer to pay up to $10.9 billion to settle bulk of Roundup weedkiller cancer lawsuits
Description: Bayer AG, after more than a year of talks, agreed to pay as much as $10.9 billion to settle close to 100,000 U.S. lawsuits claiming that its widely-used weedkiller Roundup caused cancer, resolving litigation that has pummeled the company's share price.

Headlines: Investors warm to Europe as Biden lead, virus fears rattle Wall Street
Description: European stocks look poised to make up ground on Wall Street in the second half of 2020 as Joe Biden consolidates his lead over Donald Trump ahead of the November U.S. presidential election and a surge of new COVID-19 cases threatens the U.S. economic recovery.

Headlines: Exclusive: PKN set to win EU antitrust approval for Lotos deal - sources
Description: Poland's biggest refiner PKN Orlen is set to gain EU antitrust approval for its takeover of smaller rival Lotos after sweetening concessions aimed at allaying competition concerns, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: United Airlines to resume China flights in July
Description: United Airlines said on Friday it would resume service to China, with two flights a week between San Francisco and Shanghai beginning July 8.

Headlines: Carmakers slip further from compliance with upcoming EU CO2 goals
Description: Carbon dioxide emissions from new cars in Europe rose for a third year running in 2019, provisional data from the European Union's environment agency (EEA) showed on Friday, with carmakers further lagging the bloc's upcoming climate goals.

Headlines: U.S. bank shares drop as Fed sets limits following stress tests
Description: Shares of U.S. banks dropped on Friday, with Wells Fargo's stock falling more than 6% and Goldman Sachs Group Inc down 7%, after the Federal Reserve capped dividend payments and barred share buybacks until at least the fourth quarter after its annual stress test.

Headlines: Novartis faces key meeting in U.S. bribery scandal after settling corruption case
Description: Swiss drugmaker Novartis, fresh from settling U.S. charges over alleged kickbacks to doctors, is preparing for a key meeting next week with U.S. prosecutors that could lead to the resolution of a decade-old bribery scandal.

Headlines: Canada's top court rules in favor of Uber driver in gig economy case
Description: Canada's Supreme Court on Friday ruled in favor of a driver in a gig economy case that paves the way for a class action suit calling for Uber Technologies Inc to recognize drivers in Canada as company employees.

Headlines: Exclusive: Italy's Generali in bid to acquire U.S. asset manager Brightsphere - sources
Description: Assicurazioni Generali SpA has approached Brightsphere Investment Group Inc about a possible acquisition of the U.S. asset management firm, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. on track for economic rebound despite virus 'interruptions', Commerce secretary says
Description: The U.S. economy is still on track for a strong rebound in the second half of the year, despite Texas' decision to scale back its reopening as cases of the novel coronavirus spike, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. and states' Google antitrust probe nears finish line
Description: The U.S. Justice Department is seeking the final documents to complete an antitrust investigation of Alphabet Inc's Google , said three sources familiar with the probe, which is expected to end with a lawsuit this summer.

Headlines: Consumer sentiment tepid in U.S. South as COVID-19 cases spike
Description: Consumers in southern U.S. states where COVID-19 infections spiked to record levels after authorities rushed to reopen businesses were less optimistic about economic conditions in June than residents in areas that proceeded more cautiously and followed the advice of health experts.

Headlines: Major U.S. airline CEOs to hold White House meeting Friday
Description: The CEOs of major U.S. airlines are set to hold a meeting Friday to discuss several coronavirus-related travel issues, including a push to convince the federal government to mandate temperature checks for passengers, three people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: PG&E raises $5.5 billion as it eyes exit from bankruptcy next week
Description: PG&E Corp has raised about $5.5 billion from a share offering and sale of equity units as the biggest U.S. power provider by customers looks to emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy next week.

Headlines: U.S. lenders, businesses brace for disclosure on small business pandemic aid
Description: Americans will soon get a first full look at which businesses received $515 billion of taxpayer funds when the government, after initial resistance by President Donald Trump's administration, releases borrower data for one of its highest- profile pandemic aid efforts.

Headlines: Hapag-Lloyd to halt waste shipments to China
Description: German container shipping line Hapag-Lloyd said it had notified customers it will stop accepting cargoes of solid waste, including scrap metal, bound for China that arrive from Sept. 1 onwards to comply with new legislation.

Headlines: Aston Martin turns to stock offering to bolster capital
Description: Aston Martin said on Friday it would issue new shares worth up to 20% of its existing equity capital for proceeds of 152 million pounds ($188.37 million) as the luxury carmaker seeks additional funds to ride out the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Navistar names Persio Lisboa as CEO
Description: Navistar International Corp named insider Persio Lisboa as its chief executive officer, effective July 1, the U.S. truck maker said on Friday.

Headlines: Samsung group heir should not be indicted, South Korea panel recommends
Description: An external review panel in South Korea recommended that prosecutors should not indict Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee over a 2015 merger and alleged accounting fraud, the Supreme Prosecutors' Office said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. auto sales expected to continue their recovery in June: J.D. Power, LMC Automotive
Description: U.S. auto sales are expected to continue their recovery in June following a collapse in April, as coronavirus-led lockdown restrictions ease and buyers slowly return to the market, industry consultants J.D. Power and LMC Automotive said.

Headlines: Take Five: World stocks' 2020 rollercoaster ride rumbles on
Description: World stocks have been on a rollercoaster ride in the first half of 2020. Having slumped 35% from Feb. 20 to March 23, they are now within 10% of February's record highs thanks to lashings of fiscal stimulus, interest rates slashed to 0% or below in most major economies, and massive amounts of QE. Borrowing costs for high-grade U.S. companies have in fact fallen below January levels.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending rebounds; falling income, surging COVID-19 cases loom
Description: U.S. consumer spending rebounded by the most on record in May, but the gains are not likely to be sustainable, with income dropping and expected to decline further as millions lose their unemployment checks starting next month.

Headlines: Factbox: More U.S. companies join Facebook ad boycott bandwagon
Description: A handful of U.S. companies have pulled advertising from Facebook Inc in support of a campaign that called out the social media giant for not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platforms.

Headlines: U.S. dollar inches up, with spotlight on surge in coronavirus cases
Description: The safe-haven dollar edged higher in choppy trading on Friday, moving within narrow ranges, as investors grew cautious about a resurgence in U.S. coronavirus cases that has fueled doubts on expectations of a V-shaped recovery for the world's largest economy.

Headlines: Facebook will label newsworthy posts that break rules as ad boycott widens
Description: Facebook Inc said on Friday it will start labeling newsworthy content that violates the social media company's policies, and label all posts and ads about voting with links to authoritative information, including those from politicians.

Headlines: GM seeks U.S. appeals court ruling to continue legal fight with Fiat Chrysler
Description: General Motors Co on Friday asked a U.S. appeals court to allow it to continue pursuing its civil racketeering suit against rival Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV, rejecting a lower court judge's belittling of the complaint.

Headlines: Investors eye economic data, stimulus measures as stocks rally stalls
Description: Upcoming U.S. economic data and deadlines for renewing some fiscal stimulus measures in July could prove key tests for an equities rebound that has wavered in recent weeks.

Headlines: Wall Street ends lower as coronavirus surge prompts renewed restrictions
Description: Wall Street's major indexes tumbled more than 2% on Friday as several U.S. states imposed business restrictions in response to a surge in coronavirus cases.

Headlines: EU investigating German watchdog over Wirecard collapse
Description: The European Union is investigating Germany's financial regulator over the collapse of payments company Wirecard in a rare move that heaps embarrassment on Berlin days before it is due to take over the EU's rotating presidency.

Headlines: Ford, VW will stay neutral on challenges to Trump vehicle emissions rule: document
Description: Four major automakers will not take a position on legal challenges to the Trump administration's decision to dramatically weaken Obama-era fuel economy standards but want to weigh in on any court fix, according to a document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Albertsons shares fall on NYSE debut after lackluster IPO
Description: Albertsons Cos Inc saw its shares fall in its New York Stock Exchange debut on Friday, a day after the U.S. supermarket operator downsized its initial public offering to $800 million.

Headlines: China's big three airlines take delivery of domestically made ARJ21 aircraft
