Description: China's three biggest state-owned airlines on Sunday took delivery of their first ARJ21 aircraft, a short haul 90-seater aircraft made by state-run Commercial Aircraft Corporation of China (COMAC).

Headlines: Grounded jets sit out coronavirus pandemic in Pyrenees
Description: At the airport of Tarbes in France, row upon row of empty jets in liveries from Asia to Africa sit nose to tail on the tarmac, waiting out the coronavirus crisis in the foothills of the Pyrenees.

Headlines: German development bank could lose 100 million euros from Wirecard insolvency
Description: Germany's state development bank KfW could lose 100 million euros ($112.17 million) after payments company Wirecard filed for insolvency, a spokesman said on Saturday.

Headlines: New York court subpoenas Etihad, Fitch in $1.2 billion debt battle
Description: A New York court has sent subpoenas to Etihad and ratings agency Fitch this week seeking a document at the centre of a battle over $1.2 billion in debt issued by the Abu Dhabi carrier and airlines it partly owned, according to legal documents reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Japanese bank predicts years of gloom for tourist hub Osaka
Description: Tetsuya Kan, head of a major regional bank in Osaka, said it will take two more years for the western Japan prefecture to recover from the damage caused by COVID-19, which has crushed the city's once thriving tourism and retail sectors.

Headlines: Shale pioneer Chesapeake Energy files for bankruptcy
Description: Chesapeake Energy Corp filed for Chapter 11 on Sunday, becoming the largest U.S. oil and gas producer to seek bankruptcy protection in recent years as it bowed to heavy debts and the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on energy markets.

Headlines: SoftBank to repurchase $1.9 billion of corporate bonds
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp said on Monday it will repurchase up to 200 billion yen ($1.9 billion) of its domestic unsecured corporate bonds from June 30 to July 17, part of its plan to pay down debt.

Headlines: Japan's Takeda expects $200 million operating loss related to Novartis' Xiidra withdrawal
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd said on Monday it anticipates an operating loss of about $200 million related to Novartis AG's decision to withdraw a marketing application for the dry-eye drug Xiidra.

Headlines: Amazon workers in Germany to go on strike over coronavirus infections
Description: Workers at six Amazon sites in Germany will go on strike on Monday in protest over safety after some staff at logistics centres tested positive for coronavirus, labour union Verdi said.

Headlines: Germany to sever ties with accounting watchdog after Wirecard scandal
Description: The German government plans to terminate its contract with the country's accounting watchdog after payments company Wirecard filed for insolvency last week in one of Germany's biggest fraud scandals, a government official said on Sunday.

Headlines: Chesapeake asks to cancel pipeline contracts, sets drilling cuts
Description: Chesapeake Energy Corp on Monday sought bankruptcy court approval to cancel $311 million in pipeline contracts, setting up a battle with U.S. regulators and operators including Energy Transfer LP, according to court filings.

Headlines: Dollar edges higher before quarter-end
Description: The greenback edged higher on Monday as investors positioned for quarter-end and weighed an increase in coronavirus cases in some U.S. states against improving economic data.

Headlines: Canada federal court dismisses drugmakers' plea challenging drug price rules
Description: The federal court of Canada on Monday dismissed a plea by drugmakers challenging the Canadian government's new regulations aimed at lowering prices of patented drugs that could potentially lead them to lose billions over a decade.

Headlines: Cirque du Soleil files for bankruptcy protection as COVID-19 cancels shows
Description: Canada's Cirque du Soleil Entertainment Group filed for bankruptcy protection on Monday as the COVID-19 pandemic forced the famed circus operator to cancel shows and lay off its artistes.

Headlines: Reddit bans 'The_Donald' forum amid broad social media crackdown
Description: Social media site Reddit on Monday shut down r/The_Donald, a forum which long served as a popular online home base for fans of President Donald Trump, saying it violated the site's hate speech rules.

Headlines: China service sector grows at fastest pace in seven months in June: official PMI
Description: Activity in China's services sector expanded at its fastest pace in 7 months in June, official data showed on Tuesday, suggesting consumer confidence is rapidly recovering even as Beijing ramps up coronavirus curbs after a resurgence in infections in the capital.

Headlines: U.S. still poised for 'V-shaped recovery' despite reopening setbacks: Trump adviser
Description: The U.S. economy still appears headed for a "V-shaped recovery" despite some setbacks in efforts to reopen state economies that had been shuttered for the coronavirus, a top White House adviser said on Monday.

Headlines: China's factory activity likely slowed in June on subdued global demand, Reuters poll shows
Description: China's factory activity likely grew for the fourth month June but the pace may be waning, as global demand stayed subdued while a fresh coronavirus outbreak in the Chinese capital and rising worldwide cases threaten to undermine a gradual domestic recovery.

Headlines: Credit Suisse appoints new CEO for business in Israel
Description: Credit Suisse on Monday appointed Hila Goldenberg as chief executive officer of its business in Israel.

Headlines: Germany agrees to terminate contract with accounting watchdog
Description: Germany will cancel its contract with the country's accounting watchdog FREP, a justice ministry spokesman said on Monday, after payments company Wirecard filed for insolvency last week in one of Germany's biggest fraud scandal.

Headlines: Exclusive: India plans incentives for auto companies to boost exports - sources
Description: India is drawing up an incentive scheme for the autos sector aimed at doubling exports of vehicles and components in the next five years, four sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Philippines promises 'thorough' probe of Wirecard, looking at three local payment firms
Description: The Philippines' anti-money laundering agency on Monday said it would conduct a "swift and thorough" investigation into scandal-hit German payments firm Wirecard AG and that it has drawn up an initial list of people and entities of interest.

Headlines: U.S. pending home sales jump a record 44.3% in May
Description: Contracts to buy U.S. previously owned homes rebounded by the most on record in May, suggesting the housing market was starting to turn around after being hammered by the COVID-19 pandemic along with the rest of the economy.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court stays order requiring GM, FCA meet to resolve GM lawsuit
Description: A U.S. appeals court on Monday stayed a lower court's order requiring officials from General Motors Co and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles to resolve GM's racketeering lawsuit.

Headlines: H&M's online second-hand shop Sellpy launches in Germany
Description: Swedish online second-hand shop Sellpy, which is majority-owned by fashion giant H&M, has launched in Germany in a first step outside its home market as it bets on shoppers trending towards more sustainable consumption.

Headlines: U.S. home contracts post record jump, factory activity improves in Texas
Description: Contracts to buy U.S. previously owned homes rebounded by the most on record in May, suggesting the housing market was starting to turn around after being hammered by the COVID-19 pandemic along with the rest of the economy.

Headlines: Wirecard collapse leads to call for German parliamentary inquiry
Description: Germany's opposition called on Monday for a parliamentary inquiry into the collapse of payments firm Wirecard after a global fraud that left a gaping hole in its books went undiscovered by auditors and regulators for years.

Headlines: European shares edge lower at the end of strong quarter
Description: European stocks slipped on Tuesday, with banks and energy firms leading the losses at the end of a strong quarter, while UK markets took a hit from a worse-than-expected GDP reading.

Headlines: U.S. top medical experts rebuke American Airlines for filling planes
Description: Top U.S. health experts on Tuesday criticized American Airlines and other carriers for filling planes to capacity, saying it sends the wrong message as the country grapples with a rise in coronavirus outbreaks.

Headlines: U.S. FCC issues final orders declaring Huawei, ZTE national security threats
Description: The Federal Communications Commission on Tuesday formally designated Chinese's Huawei Technologies Co and ZTE Corp as posing threats to U.S. national security, a declaration that bars U.S. firms from tapping an $8.3 billion government fund to purchase equipment from the companies.

Headlines: Google stymies media companies from chipping away at its data dominance
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google upended plans by European media companies to block it from harvesting data about their readers and slash some of its dominance in online advertising, seven people involved in the talks said this month.

Headlines: Mexico loses 12 million jobs, workers in informal sector grow
Description: Twelve million Mexicans have lost their jobs since March as part of the economic fallout from the coronavirus, and the number of people working in the informal sector shot up significantly, official data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Airbus plans to cut jobs right across its UK operation: union
Description: Plans by Airbus to cut 1,700 UK jobs will affect its operations across Britain including its two biggest factories, the Unite union said on Tuesday, as it re-iterated a call for government support for the sector.

Headlines: Italy bank showdown looms in test for European consolidation
Description: As many bankers fled Italy's financial capital for second homes in the mountains or lakes at the start of a coronavirus lockdown in March, Victor Massiah rushed instead to rent a house within walking distance of UBI Banca's Milan offices.

Headlines: Airbus says to shed 15,000 jobs
Description: Airbus on Tuesday unveiled plans to shed around 15,000 jobs including 900 already earmarked in Germany, saying its future was at stake after the coronavirus pandemic rocked the air travel industry.

Headlines: Dollar edges lower amid uncertain U.S. outlook
Description: The dollar slipped on Tuesday, alternating between gains and losses, as markets digested less bearish comments from U.S. monetary officials along with a more dire prognosis from the country's top medical expert on the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: China's factory activity expands, but job losses quicken amid weak exports: Caixin PMI
Description: China's factory activity grew at a faster clip in June after the government lifted coronavirus lockdown measures and ramped up support steps, but the health crisis continues to pressure exports and jobs, a private business survey showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Goldman's investment bank to increase Black staff hiring, recruitment
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc's investment bank formed a new group to increase its recruitment and hiring of Black employees and improve career development and retention among existing Black employees, according to a memo sent on Tuesday that was seen by Reuters.

Headlines: UAW leader, U.S. prosecutor discuss independent oversight for union
Description: The United Auto Workers' president met on Tuesday with the U.S. prosecutor heading a federal investigation into corruption at the union, and the two said they discussed reforms including possible independent oversight of future labor agreements.

Headlines: Beyond Meat to sell patties in mainland China through Freshippo stores
Description: Beyond Meat Inc said on Tuesday that it will launch retail sales of its plant-based burger patties in mainland China through Alibaba Group Holding Ltd's Freshippo markets.

Headlines: FedEx shares jump over 9% as quarterly results top expectations
Description: Shares of FedEx Corp jumped 9.4% in extended trading on Tuesday after a surge in pandemic-fueled home deliveries helped the U.S. package carrier post better-than-expected quarterly profit and revenue.

Headlines: Airbus to cut 15,000 jobs to survive coronavirus crisis
Description: Airbus is cutting 15,000 jobs within a year, including 900 already earmarked in Germany, saying its future is at stake after the coronavirus outbreak paralysed air travel.

Headlines: S&P 500 ends best quarter since 1998 on a high note
Description: The S&P 500 rallied on Tuesday to finish higher and secure its biggest quarterly percentage gain in more than two decades as improving economic data bolstered investor beliefs that a stimulus-backed rebound for the U.S. economy was on the horizon.

Headlines: NY Fed's Williams says full recovery will likely take years
Description: The U.S. economy is showing signs of a turnaround as businesses reopen, but the pace of the recovery is being slowed by large-scale virus outbreaks in some states and it could be years before the economy is back at full strength, New York Federal Reserve Bank President John Williams said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Aeromexico becomes latest LatAm airline to file for bankruptcy
Description: Mexican airline Aeromexico said on Tuesday it had begun restructuring under Chapter 11 proceedings, the latest Latin American airline to run into serious trouble as the coronavirus pandemic wreaks havoc on tourism and business travel.

Headlines: Cerberus wants well over 7,000 Commerzbank job cuts: source
Description: Cerberus wants Commerzbank to cut far more than a reported 7,000 jobs as part of plans by Germany's second biggest bank to reduce costs, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Standard Life Aberdeen picks ex-Citi executive as CEO
Description: Standard Life Aberdeen (SLA) Chief Executive Keith Skeoch will step down after five years at the helm and former Citi executive Stephen Bird will replace him, the British asset manager said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Slumping fleet sales weigh on U.S. auto market
Description: Collapsing demand from rental car companies, corporations and government agencies has sapped U.S. auto sales during the coronavirus pandemic and a recovery will likely be slow, threatening auto workers whose jobs depend on fleet sales.

Headlines: New rules may be needed for payments in wake of Wirecard, BIS boss says
Description: More joined up rules may be needed across the payments sector after the collapse of Germany's Wirecard AG, Bank for International Settlements president Augustin Carstens said.

Headlines: Fed's offered flood of credit so far just a trickle in practice
Description: The Federal Reserve's promise in the early days of the coronavirus pandemic to flood the U.S. economy with trillions of dollars seemed like the proverbial central bank bazooka.

Headlines: Wirecard's former boss faces criminal complaint in Austria
Description: An Austrian lawyer has filed a criminal complaint against Wirecard's former Chief Executive Markus Braun and Chief Operating Officer Jan Marsalek at a court in Vienna, accusing them of market manipulation and serious fraud.

Headlines: Temasek looks to inject up to $100 million in India's Zomato: Economic Times
Description: Singapore's state investor, Temasek, is looking to invest up to $100 million in Indian food delivery firm Zomato, Economic Times reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence perks up; rising COVID-19 cases cast shadow over recovery
Description: U.S. consumer confidence rebounded in June as businesses reopened, strengthening views that the economic downturn was likely over, though rising COVID-19 infections threaten to derail the budding recovery.

Headlines: Nasdaq's $1.2 trillion biotech index draws Europe's COVID drug hunters
Description: Spain's Pharma Mar is looking at listing on New York's Nasdaq market, joining a flurry of biotech companies aiming to tap investors' voracious appetite for the sector as it tests one of its therapies to treat COVID-19.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence rebounds in June, but rising COVID-19 infections a worry
Description: U.S. consumer confidence grew more than expected in June, strengthening views that the economic downturn was likely over, though rising COVID-19 infections threatened to derail the budding recovery.

Headlines: China's factory activity quickens, but pandemic drags on exporters and recovery
Description: China's factory activity expanded at a stronger pace in June after the government lifted lockdowns and stepped up investment, but persistent weakness in export orders suggests the coronavirus crisis will remain a drag on the economy for some time.

Headlines: Japan to delay 'womenomics' target for female leaders by up to a decade: media
Description: Japan will delay by up to a decade its target to raise the percentage of women in leadership posts to 30% - part of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's campaign to empower women - after failing to hit the deadline this year, domestic media have reported.

Headlines: EasyJet looking to cut over 700 pilot jobs: union
Description: British low cost airline easyJet has said that 727 of its UK-based pilots are at risk of redundancy, equivalent to about one-third of its pilots in the country, union BALPA said in a statement.

Headlines: Oil rises over 1% on U.S. crude stockpile draw, manufacturing activity
Description: Oil prices rose more than 1% on Wednesday following a drawdown in U.S. crude inventories from record highs and a string of positive manufacturing data, but a surge in coronavirus cases tempered gains.

Headlines: Dollar wobbles as decent U.S. data tempers safe-haven demand
Description: The dollar retreated on Wednesday in choppy trading, as generally solid U.S. economic data and improving European numbers diminished its appeal as a safe haven, though the currency's outlook remained upbeat given renewed risks posed by the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Trump: Getting 'more and more happy' with Fed Chair Powell during pandemic
Description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday indicated he was warming to Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell, whom he has harshly criticized for not cutting lending rates below zero, telling Fox Business Network he appreciated the central bank putting liquidity into the economy during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump says he will have a statement on the minimum wage in the next two weeks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he will have a statement on the minimum wage in the next two weeks, adding that his view on the issue is different than some fellow Republicans.

Headlines: Police raid Wirecard HQ as administrator kicks off asset sales
Description: Police and public prosecutors raided Wirecard's headquarters in Munich and four properties in German and Austria on Wednesday as they widened their investigation into the financial payments company that collapsed last week.

Headlines: Fed's Daly sees four to five year recovery in best-case scenario
Description: San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank President Mary Daly on Wednesday painted a grim picture of the U.S. economic outlook, saying that even under her best-case scenario unemployment will still top 10% at year's end and won't return to pre-crisis levels for four or five years.

Headlines: Alitalia resumes international flights from Milan, Linate to open on July 13
Description: Alitalia [CAITLA.UL] on Wednesday resumed international flights from Milan as Italy gradually reopens its airports to foreign travellers and scraps restrictions imposed to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Automakers laud U.S. consumer 'resilience' despite COVID-19 hit to sales
Description: Major automakers posted lower U.S. monthly or quarterly new vehicle sales on Wednesday due in large part to weak fleet orders, but said consumer demand remained robust despite the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: European stocks end choppy session higher on vaccine hopes
Description: Hopes of a COVID-19 vaccine pulled European stocks from losses earlier on Wednesday, after fears of a no-deal Brexit and anxieties relating to the European Union's recovery fund had weighed on sentiment.

Headlines: Manufacturing, vaccine data power stocks higher; U.S. dollar dips
Description: Stocks across the globe rose on Wednesday following data pointing to a recovery in manufacturing and on bets for a COVID-19 vaccine, while the risk-on mood pushed the U.S. dollar lower.

Headlines: U.S. companies not rushing to rehire workers; rising COVID-19 cases threaten recovery
Description: U.S. private payrolls increased less than expected in June as reopening businesses showed little urgency to rehire workers and employers announced more than 170,000 layoffs, bolstering views the recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic would be a long slog.

Headlines: Manufacturing slump eases as world emerges from pandemic
Description: A slump in global manufacturing showed signs of easing in June as a rebound in Chinese and U.S. activity offered some hope the world's two largest economies may have passed the worst of the devastation caused by the novel coronavirus pandemic, while the collapse in European factory activity abated.

Headlines: Trump backs work incentives as part of next stimulus bill
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he supports another coronavirus stimulus bill but wants it to include incentives for Americans to go back to work, setting up a clash with Democrats in Congress over jobless benefits.

Headlines: Mexico exporters urge government to respect foreign investors under new trade deal
Description: A top Mexican exporters' group on Wednesday urged the government not to spook foreign investors after a number of disputes erupted over major projects in the run-up to the start of a new North American trade deal.

Headlines: New North American trade deal launches under cloud of disputes, coronavirus
Description: A modernized U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade pact took effect on Wednesday, ensuring continuity for manufacturers and agriculture, but the threat of disputes is exposing cracks in what was meant to be a stronger North American fortress of competitiveness.

Headlines: U.S. employers announced more job cuts in June: report
Description: U.S. employers announced an additional 170,219 job cuts in June as the recession caused by the COVID-19 depresses demand and pushes companies into bankruptcy, a report showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Senior UK lawmaker says: West should not do business with Huawei
Description: The chairman of the British parliament's foreign affairs committee said on Wednesday that the West should not be doing business with China's Huawei.

Headlines: Renault sees June recovery in French car sales stretching into third quarter
Description: Renault expects a pick-up in the French car market in June, after the country's coronavirus lockdown was lifted, to carry on into the third quarter, the brand's sales chief for France Ivan Segal said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Citigroup pulls back on office return plans
Description: Citigroup Inc said on Wednesday it was delaying plans for U.S. employees returning to offices as COVID-19 cases rise in several states.

Headlines: Chinese police say Tencent likely swindled by chilli sauce impostors
Description: Chinese police on Wednesday said Tencent appears to have been duped by a group of people masquerading as representatives of China's best-known chilli oil maker, Lao Gan Ma, after the internet giant accused the latter of breaching a contract.

Headlines: The long bumpy road from NAFTA to USMCA
Description: After an long, arduous road the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement (USMCA) took effect on Wednesday, replacing its predecessor, the quarter-century-old North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).

Headlines: EasyJet to cut jobs in Berlin, scrap German domestic flights
Description: British low cost carrier easyJet plans to cut jobs and the number of aircraft it has in Berlin and is proposing scrapping domestic German flights as part of its retrenchment over COVID-19, a German union and source familiar with the plan said.

Headlines: German watchdog defends Wirecard oversight before lawmakers
Description: The head of Germany's financial market regulator BaFin, which is under intense scrutiny for its oversight of collapsed Wirecard , defended its record on Wednesday, saying it wasn't alone in deciding how to categorise the payments provider.

Headlines: Luxury British department store Harrods to cut nearly 700 jobs
Description: Luxury British department store Harrods said on Wednesday it plans to cut up to 672 jobs because of the coronavirus crisis, which kept its flagship branch in central London closed for nearly three months.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing activity hits 14-month high
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity rebounded in June, hitting its highest level in more than a year as the broader economy reopened, but rising COVID-19 infections threaten the recovery.

Headlines: IKEA agrees to buy Paris site as part of inner-city push
Description: IKEA store operator Ingka Group has agreed to buy a commercial property on Paris' Rue de Rivoli and is looking for more such acquisitions in other large European cities, the head of its investment arm said.

Headlines: Spain working with Airbus to keep jobs in wake of restructuring
Description: Spain is working with Airbus to find ways for the airplane maker to keep jobs in the country, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Wednesday, a day after it announced many layoffs as part of a global restructuring.

Headlines: India asks telcos, internet firms to block banned Chinese apps, ByteDance to hold talks
Description: India has ordered telecom companies and other internet providers to stop access to 59 banned Chinese-origin apps, according to notices seen by Reuters, intensifying efforts to crack down on such businesses following a border clash between the nations.

Headlines: Trump touts 'historic' jobs report as rival Biden accuses him of premature celebration
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday touted a government report showing the country gained a record 4.8 million jobs in June, drawing a blistering response from his Democratic rival, Joe Biden, that he was ignoring a much bleaker reality.

Headlines: Oil up more than 2% on U.S. jobs data but virus fears cap gains
Description: Oil futures gained more than 2% on Thursday, supported by a drop in U.S. unemployment and a drawdown in crude inventories, but a resurgence in U.S. coronavirus infections fanned concerns that economic activity will weaken in coming weeks.

Headlines: Fed's Powell continued to talk frequently with Mnuchin, lawmakers in May
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell continued to talk regularly with Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and key U.S. lawmakers in May as the United States began to turn the corner on the economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, Fed records released on Thursday showed.

Headlines: State Department warns top U.S. firms over supply chain risks linked to China's Xinjiang
Description: The U.S. State Department warned top American companies including Walmart Inc, Apple Inc and Amazon.com Inc over risks faced from maintaining supply chains associated with human rights abuses in China's western Xinjiang province, according to a letter seen by Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Germany can prevent job losses by supporting Airbus: CEO to Spiegel
Description: Airbus could save 2,000 of the 5,100 jobs it is due to cut in Germany if the government helps it by extending a short-time work programme and supporting its research into hydrogen-fueled propulsion, its boss told Spiegel magazine.

Headlines: Who's to blame for Wirecard? Germany passes the buck
Description: Germany's accountancy watchdog has denied blame for failing to spot problems at collapsed payments firm Wirecard, the latest in a string of agencies to shirk responsibility following the country's biggest accounting scandal.

Headlines: German watchdog chief calls Wirecard scandal a 'massive criminal act'
Description: The head of Germany's financial watchdog on Thursday called the accounting scandal at Wirecard "a massive criminal act", while Deutsche Bank said it was considering support for the collapsed payments company's banking unit.

Headlines: Amid strong June job growth, signs U.S. recovery may be stumbling
Description: The U.S. economic recovery, after two months of faster-than-expected job gains, may be stumbling as a surge of new coronavirus infections prompts states to delay and in some cases reverse plans to let stores reopen and activities resume.

Headlines: U.S dollar gains on worries about resurgent coronavirus pandemic
Description: The U.S. dollar rose on Thursday, regaining its safe-haven appeal, as investors worried that the resurgence of U.S. coronavirus cases could erase the summer's employment gains.

Headlines: Global stocks jump on strong U.S. jobs data; COVID-19 caution lingers
Description: A measure of stocks across the globe rose for a fourth straight day on Thursday after June U.S. payrolls grew by a record 4.8 million, but investors also flocked to the safe-haven dollar and U.S. Treasuries on concerns about surging COVID-19 cases in many U.S. states.

Headlines: Dominican Republic eyes opportunities as U.S. firms adjust supply chains
Description: U.S. companies are expanding and opening new plants in the Dominican Republic as they diversify their supply chains, moves that will help offset the economic impact of the new coronavirus pandemic, the Dominican economy minister said.

Headlines: Cyclical rally, U.S. jobs data drive European stocks to one-week high
Description: European shares closed at a one-week high on Thursday as hopes of a COVID-19 vaccine and a better-than-expected rebound in U.S. hiring overshadowed concerns about surging coronavirus infections.

Headlines: Citi targets more growth in Saudi Arabia after adding over 20 bankers in two years
Description: Citigroup is planning to hire more bankers in Saudi Arabia for its direct custody business after adding more than 20 for onshore capital markets in the last two years, its Europe, Middle East and Africa head said.

Headlines: Wirecard debt that facilitated SoftBank investment put up for auction
Description: Convertible bonds that were part of a complex transaction that allowed Japan's SoftBank Group to buy a stake in now-collapsed payments company Wirecard and then de-risk the transaction have been put up for sale in an auction.

Headlines: Japan asks U.S. to extradite men accused of helping ex-Nissan boss Ghosn flee
Description: Japan has formally asked the United States to extradite a former Green Beret and his son accused of helping former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn flee the country while he was awaiting trial on financial charges.

Headlines: Delta amends credit facility to include stricter covenants
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc said on Thursday it has amended its $2.65 billion credit facility agreement with covenants, which include restricting the U.S. airline's ability to pay dividends or repurchase stock before Sept. 30, 2021.

Headlines: Shares in Aeromexico bounce back after sharp losses
Description: Shares in Aeromexico climbed as much as 27% on Thursday after nosediving a day earlier on the Mexican airline's announcement it had started bankruptcy proceedings as the coronavirus pandemic battered business.

Headlines: Wall Street closes higher after biggest payrolls jump on record
Description: Wall Street closed higher and the Nasdaq reached an all-time closing high on Thursday as investors headed into their long holiday weekend buoyed by a record surge in payrolls, which provided assurance that the U.S. economic recovery was well under way.

Headlines: U.S. job growth roars back, but COVID-19 resurgence threatens recovery
Description: The U.S. economy created jobs at a record clip in June as more restaurants and bars reopened, but 31.5 million Americans were collecting unemployment checks in the middle of the month, and a resurgence in COVID-19 cases suggested the labor market could suffer a setback in July.

Headlines: Indian police allege fraud by GVK chairman, others at Mumbai airport
Description: India's federal police have filed a criminal complaint against the chairman of conglomerate GVK Group and others for alleged fraud in the development of Mumbai's international airport that resulted in the government losing more than $92 million.

Headlines: Investors are waking up to a possible Biden victory in U.S. presidential election
Description: Investors are increasingly preparing for market volatility ahead of the U.S. presidential election, with some shifting stock positions and selling the dollar, as Democratic contender Joe Biden maintains a lead against President Donald Trump in opinion polls.

Headlines: Tesla to make molecule printers for German COVID-19 vaccine developer CureVac
Description: Tesla Inc is building mobile molecule printers to help make the potential COVID-19 vaccine being developed by CureVac in Germany, the electric-car maker's Chief Executive Officer, Elon Musk, tweeted on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. regulator, Boeing complete 737 MAX certification test flights
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration and Boeing Co have completed certification test flights on the 737 MAX, a key milestone toward the plane's return to service, the U.S. regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Energy Transfer digs in on North Dakota pipeline expansion despite oil slump, sources say
Description: U.S. pipeline company Energy Transfer has taken the rare step of invoking force majeure - normally used in times of war or natural disaster - to prevent oil firms from walking away from a proposed expansion of the controversial Dakota Access pipeline, according to two sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Italy's Prada sales in Asia up double-digit, trend will continue: CEO
Description: Sales at Italy's Prada are growing at double-digit rates in Asia while any forecast for the American market is hard to make due to the health emergency, the Chief Executive of the luxury group Patrizio Bertelli said on Thursday.

Headlines: June U.S. payrolls rise sets record amid virus reopenings
Description: The U.S. economy created jobs at a record clip in June as more restaurants and bars resumed operations, further evidence that the COVID-19 recession was probably over, though a surge in cases of the coronavirus threatens the fledgling recovery.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit widens as exports fall to lowest level since 2009
Description: The U.S. trade deficit widened in May as the COVID-19 pandemic pushed exports to their lowest level since 2009, strengthening expectations the economy will contract in the second quarter at its steepest pace since the Great Depression.

Headlines: Explainer: How U.S. airlines are trying to stop COVID-19 on flights
Description: As some Americans prepare to travel for the July 4 holiday weekend, and airlines slowly ramp up service, the U.S. government has not changed rules for air travel during the pandemic, leaving airlines to implement their own measures.

Headlines: Top-performing U.S. equity funds this year are betting on a transformed world
Description: U.S. equity funds that were able to best weather the global economic upheaval from the coronavirus pandemic this year are turning to healthcare, e-commerce and electric vehicle stocks as they look ahead to 2021.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Clouds may be parting for dividend investors
Description: U.S. companies are cutting their dividends less than investors anticipated, providing a potential boost to a stock market rally that has clashed with concerns over a recent surge in coronavirus infections.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury agrees on loan terms with American, four other airlines
Description: The U.S. Treasury said on Thursday it has agreed on terms for government loans with five U.S. carriers, including American Airlines Group Inc .

Headlines: Deutsche Bank weighs support for Wirecard's bank
Description: Deutsche Bank said on Thursday that it was considering providing "financial support" to the banking unit of Germany's Wirecard.

Headlines: U.S. farmers scramble for help as COVID-19 scuttles immigrant workforce
Description: The novel coronavirus delayed the arrival of seasonal immigrants who normally help harvest U.S. wheat, leaving farmers to depend on high school students, school bus drivers, laid-off oilfield workers and others to run machines that bring in the crop.

Headlines: Ryanair resumes flights from Greece after four-month grounding
Description: Low cost carrier Ryanair resumed flights from Athens after a near four-month grounding due to COVID-19 travel restrictions, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Novartis pays $729 million to settle U.S. kickback charges
Description: Novartis AG agreed to pay more than $729 million to settle U.S. government charges it paid illegal kickbacks to doctors and patients to boost drug sales, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Aeromexico shares rise for second day despite missed debt payment
Description: Shares in airline Aeromexico closed up 4.48% on Friday, rising for a second straight day even as the company missed a debt payment after filing for bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: Daimler seeks to sell French factory in production overhaul
Description: Daimler will seek to sell its factory in Hambach, France, as part of an overhaul of its production system, the German carmaker said on Friday, prompting France's finance minister to urge the company to reconsider.

Headlines: French finance minister urges Daimler to reconsider plan to sell Hambach site
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire urged German carmaker Daimler on Friday to reconsider plans to sell its factory in Hambach, France.

Headlines: Australia's Westpac to pay $5.5 million for staff underpayment, cites calculation errors
Description: Australia's Westpac Banking Corp on Friday said it will have to pay A$8 million ($5.5 million) to around 8,000 employees who were found to have been underpaid their long-service leave entitlements due to calculation errors.

Headlines: Nissan's China sales grew 4.5% in June
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan Motor said on Friday its sales in China grew 4.5% in June from a year earlier to 136,929 vehicles, as the world's biggest auto market recovered from its coronavirus low.

Headlines: GM's China sales drop 5% in second quarter, underperforms industry recovery
Description: General Motors Co's vehicle sales in China dropped 5.3% between April and June from the corresponding period last year, underperforming the industry average amid a recovery from the coronavirus fallout on the world's biggest auto market.

Headlines: HSBC to invest further in China amid political strife over Hong Kong law
Description: HSBC Holdings Plc said on Friday it would make new investments in its wealth management and insurance operations in mainland China.

Headlines: After Wirecard review, Singapore launches probe into Citadelle, Senjo Group
Description: Singapore authorities said they launched an investigation into Citadelle Corporate Services, Senjo Group and its subsidiaries after scrutinising collapsed German payments firm Wirecard's local operations.

Headlines: Factbox: Growing list of Australian companies underpaying staff
Description: Some of Australia's biggest companies have been caught up in underpayment scandals, prompting the federal government to say it would introduce tougher laws that criminalise what it called "wage theft" and ban executives from being company directors if they were involved.

Headlines: Boeing communications chief resigns over decades-old article on women in combat
Description: Boeing Co's communications chief Niel Golightly abruptly resigned on Thursday, following an employee's complaint over an article the former U.S. military pilot wrote 33 years ago arguing women should not serve in combat.

Headlines: German economy minister sees economic recovery from October
Description: Germany's economy may recover from October onwards from the coronavirus pandemic, Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said in a newspaper interview on Sunday.

Headlines: Exclusive: CIMB alleges 'suspicious' Hontop Energy oil deals with BP - affidavit
Description: Singapore's High Court has appointed an independent supervisor to oversee the restructuring of trader Hontop Energy.

Headlines: Trump approves five-week extension for small business pandemic loan applications
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday signed into law a deadline extension to August 8 for small businesses to apply for relief loans under a federal aid program to help businesses hurt by the COVID-19 pandemic, the White House said.

Headlines: Fujitsu to halve office space in three years citing 'new normal'
Description: Japan's Fujitsu Ltd said on Monday it would halve its office space in three years as it rewrites the way employees work under a "new normal" amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Germany's Scholz wants more power for financial watchdog after Wirecard case: FAS
Description: German finance minister Olaf Scholz said on Sunday he planned to give the Germany's financial markets watchdog more power in response to a corporate fraud scandal at payments company Wirecard that had escaped the scrutiny of auditors.

Headlines: U.S. tech chiefs to testify before House antitrust panel on July 27: committee
Description: The chief executives of Amazon.com , Apple , Alphabet's Google and Facebook will appear before a U.S. House of Representatives panel on July 27, the committee said in a statement on Monday.

Headlines: In sign of the times, Ayn Rand Institute approved for PPP loan
Description: The institute promoting the “laissez-faire capitalism” of writer Ayn Rand, who in the novels “Atlas Shrugged” and “The Fountainhead” introduced her philosophy of “objectivism” to millions of readers, was approved for a Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loan of up to $1 million, according to data released Monday by the Trump administration.

Headlines: United Airlines adds more international routes for September
Description: United Airlines said on Monday it was further expanding its international schedule in September by bringing back service between Chicago and Hong Kong and Los Angeles and Sydney, and adding new nonstop flights between Chicago and Tel Aviv.

Headlines: U.S. Midwest products prices due to rise from Dakota Access pipeline shutdown
Description: Prices for gasoline and diesel in the U.S. Midwest could rise in the coming months, market participants said, because of a U.S. court ruling on Monday that ordered the largest pipeline from the North Dakota shale oil fields to be shut within a month.

Headlines: Global stocks rally, yuan surges as investors bet on China revival
Description: Global stock markets rallied and China's yuan posted its biggest gain since December on Monday as investors bet the Chinese economy would boost global growth even as surging coronavirus cases delayed business re-openings across the United States.

Headlines: Wall Street investors scored emergency government loans amid pandemic
Description: Some investment firms, including those that run hedge funds or manage money for wealthy investors, are among the businesses approved for emergency U.S. government loans to help small companies and non-profits pay employees during the coronavirus lockdown, according to data made public on Monday.

Headlines: Kanye West's clothing brand, Hollywood production companies on pandemic loan list
Description: Ventures backed by big-name entertainers Kanye West and Francis Ford Coppola were among those approved for loans under a U.S. government program to help businesses survive the coronavirus pandemic, according to a list released on Monday.

Headlines: Dakota pipeline investors could face major hit after adverse ruling
Description: Large investors in the Dakota Access Pipeline, including Phillips 66 , could be on the hook for hundreds of millions in payments, after a U.S. court on Monday ordered the shutdown of the major artery.

Headlines: Energy Transfer vows legal fight against order to shut oil pipeline
Description: Energy Transfer LP will immediately file a motion to stay a U.S. district court decision on Monday to shut and empty the Dakota Access crude oil pipeline within a month, the company said in a statement.

Headlines: Dakota Access files motion to stay court ruling to shut oil pipeline in 30 days
Description: Dakota Access LLC, controlled by Energy Transfer, filed a motion to stay a U.S. District Court ruling on Monday to shut down the 570,000-barrel-per-day (bpd) oil pipeline within 30 days.

Headlines: Court orders Dakota pipeline shut in latest blow to U.S. fossil fuel projects
Description: A U.S. court ordered the shutdown of the Dakota Access oil pipeline on Monday over concerns about its potential environmental impact, a big win for the Native American tribes and green groups who fought the major pipeline's route across a crucial water supply for years.

Headlines: Dozens of expensive private schools received millions in U.S. pandemic loans
Description: At least six dozen expensive private schools, including one where former President Barack Obama's children studied, got between $42 million and $104.25 million in loans under a U.S. program meant to help small businesses weather the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Investment banks got aid intended for U.S. small businesses
Description: Tens of millions of dollars earmarked by U.S. lawmakers to assist small businesses in the coronavirus-induced economic downturn went to investment banks advising on corporate dealmaking, according to official data released on Monday.

Headlines: Small-government advocates, lobbyists tap $660 billion U.S. pandemic-aid fund
Description: As Congress signed off on trillions of dollars in coronavirus aid, the small-government group Citizens Against Government Waste urged lawmakers to oppose bailouts for U.S. states, broadcasters, unemployed people and other recipients.

Headlines: Eyeing United States, EU lawmakers seek quicker trade retaliation
Description: EU lawmakers overwhelmingly backed a proposal on Monday to allow the European Union to retaliate more quickly in trade disputes, with a clear eye on the tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: One fifth of German firms fear for their survival amid pandemic: Ifo
Description: Around one fifth of German companies (21%) believe their survival is threatened by the coronavirus crisis, Germany's Ifo institute said on Monday, with travel agents, hotels and restaurants particularly concerned.

Headlines: Ford's China ventures extend auto sales recovery in June
Description: Ford Motor's China ventures reported year-on-year sales growth for June as the world's biggest auto market continues to recover from coronavirus-induced lows.

Headlines: UK will face consequences if it rules China is a hostile country: envoy
Description: Britain will have to bear the consequences if it treats China as a hostile country when deciding whether to allow Huawei to be involved in the country's telecommunications networks, the Chinese ambassador to Britain said on Monday.

Headlines: C$ steadies near a two-week high ahead of BoC business survey
Description: The Canadian dollar was little changed against its U.S. counterpart on Monday, holding near an earlier 13-day high as stocks rallied globally and ahead of the release of a Bank of Canada business survey.

Headlines: China recovery hopes, upbeat data lift European shares; HSBC leads
Description: European shares closed at their highest in nearly a month on Monday, as upbeat economic data tied in with a rally in China's markets on hopes of recovery from a coronavirus-induced slump.

Headlines: U.S. service sector rebounds strongly in June
Description: U.S. services industry activity rebounded sharply in June, almost returning to its pre-COVID-19 pandemic levels, but a resurgence in coronavirus cases that has forced some restaurants and bars to close again threatens the emerging recovery.

Headlines: U.S. government awards Novavax $1.6 billion for coronavirus vaccine
Description: The U.S. government has awarded Novavax Inc $1.6 billion to cover testing and manufacturing of a potential vaccine for the novel coronavirus in the United States, with the aim of delivering 100 million doses by January.

Headlines: European stocks slip as hopes of post-pandemic rebound fade
Description: European shares fell on Tuesday as surging U.S. coronavirus cases and forecasts for a deeper-than-feared recession in the euro zone dimmed optimism around a post-pandemic rebound.

Headlines: U.S. hiring vaults to record high in May; new COVID-19 cases set to limit gains
Description: U.S. hiring surged to a record high in May and layoffs fell as businesses reopened, but the improvement in the labor market is likely to be blunted by a resurgence in COVID-19 cases that has forced some enterprises to shut down again.

Headlines: Lufthansa to cut a fifth of leadership jobs in restructuring
Description: Germany's Lufthansa airlines will cut 20% of its leadership positions and 1,000 administrative jobs in a restructuring plan that it announced on Tuesday to cope with fallout from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Fed's Bostic: Business 'getting nervous again' as virus surges
Description: The surge in U.S. coronavirus cases has made business owners "nervous again," Atlanta Federal Reserve Bank President Raphael Bostic said on Tuesday, and prompted him to focus on company decisions over the next three to six weeks.

Headlines: U.S. hiring vaults to record high in May; new COVID-19 cases set to limit gains
Description: U.S. hiring surged to a record high in May and layoffs fell as businesses reopened, but the improvement in the labor market is likely to be blunted by a resurgence in COVID-19 cases that has forced some enterprises to shut down again.

Headlines: Pence says U.S. to maintain 'strong stand' on TikTok
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence said on Tuesday the United States would "continue to take a strong stand" regarding Chinese entities that threaten U.S. security, including potentially the social media app TikTok.

Headlines: Fed's Clarida says there is more the Fed can and will do
Description: With the surge in coronavirus cases threatening the U.S. recovery, Federal Reserve Vice Chairman Richard Clarida had a message on Tuesday: the U.S. central bank is not going to sit idly, even if a double dip recession is not the base case scenario.

Headlines: Boeing settles nearly all Lion Air 737 MAX crash claims: filing
Description: Boeing Co has reached settlement agreements in more than 90% of the wrongful death claims filed in federal court after the 2018 crash of a Lion Air 737 MAX in Indonesia that killed all 189 people on board, a court filing on Tuesday said.

Headlines: Dollar rises as virus worries hurt risk appetite
Description: The U.S. dollar rose against a basket of currencies on Tuesday, holding above the near two-week low hit in the previous session, as investors turned uneasy over new coronavirus flare-ups and local lockdowns in some countries.

Headlines: Wall Street drops after strong rally as COVID-19 cases mount
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Tuesday, adding to losses into the close, as investors took profits a day after the S&P 500 logged its longest streak of gains this year and as new U.S. coronavirus cases rose further.

Headlines: Oil steadies as economic data overshadows coronavirus worries
Description: Oil prices settled little changed on Tuesday as demand concerns due to a new surge in coronavirus cases overshadowed U.S. government forecasts for lower production.

Headlines: U.S. probes fuel leaks in GM's older Chevy Cobalt and HHR vehicles
Description: U.S. auto safety regulator on Tuesday disclosed it has opened an investigation into complaints of fuel leaks in older Chevrolet Cobalt compact cars and HHR wagons, manufactured by General Motors Co .

Headlines: U.S. pandemic aid program saved 51.1 million jobs, but wealthy and connected also benefited
Description: A high-profile pandemic aid program protected about 51.1 million American jobs, the Trump administration said on Monday, as it revealed how $521.4 billion in taxpayer cash was injected into small businesses but also into the pockets of the rich and famous.

Headlines: Factbox: Highlights from U.S. government data on pandemic aid
Description: The Trump administration on Monday released the names of hundreds of thousands of businesses which took money from a high-profile $660 billion pandemic aid program, letting the public see for the first time how the majority of the cash was spent and whether it helped save jobs.

Headlines: SoftBank-backed startups among those approved for U.S. paycheck loan program
Description: Four technology startups backed by SoftBank Group Corp's $100 billion Vision Fund were among the small companies approved for a U.S. pandemic aid program, according to data released by the Treasury Department on Monday.

Headlines: Grindr, dating app valued at $620 million, cleared for small-business loan
Description: Grindr, the gay dating app valued at $620 million when it was sold recently by its Chinese owner, was approved for a $1 million to $2 million loan for small businesses suffering from the coronavirus outbreak, according to official U.S. data released on Monday.

Headlines: UK says it can draw investment and defend values after Huawei row
Description: Britain can both remain a popular destination for foreign investment and stand up for its values, its business minister said on Tuesday after China warned that a dispute over tech firm Huawei could lead to many "consequences".

Headlines: Investors in Russian bonds relaxed about extended Putin rule
Description: The prospect of President Vladimir Putin staying in the Kremlin until 2036 does not seem to be deterring buyers of Russia's high-yielding sovereign bonds as investors focus on economic fundamentals and political stability rather the risk of policy stagnation.

Headlines: Fed's Bostic says U.S. recovery may be 'levelling off': FT interview
Description: Atlanta Federal Reserve Bank President Raphael Bostic said the U.S. economic recovery is in danger of stalling due to the recent spike in coronavirus cases across many American states.

Headlines: Nokia to add open interfaces to its telecom equipment
Description: Finland's Nokia on Tuesday became the first major telecom equipment maker to commit to adding open interfaces in its products that will allow mobile operators to build networks that are not tied to a vendor.

Headlines: Economists call for more direct cash payments tied to the health of the economy
Description: Direct cash payments can improve financial security, boost consumer spending and may speed up the recovery, according to a letter from a group of economists calling on U.S. policymakers to keep providing direct cash payments to Americans until the economy is stronger.

Headlines: U.S. home solar installer Sunrun to buy Vivint Solar for about $1.46 billion
Description: Sunrun Inc said on Monday it will buy Blackstone-backed peer Vivint Solar for about $1.46 billion in an all-stock deal, as the top U.S. residential solar installers look to solidify their market position.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler restarts production at Serbia's plant: report
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) restarted production at its Serbian plant, after halting it in mid-March in response to the coronavirus outbreak, Serbia's state-run Tanjug news agency reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Europe's recession may be milder than feared, ECB's Schnabel says
Description: Some economic indicators suggest that Europe's pandemic-induced recession may be milder than earlier feared, European Central Bank board member Isabel Schnabel told Dutch newspaper NRC Handelsblad.

Headlines: Bayer shares fall after judge questions part of proposed Roundup settlement
Description: Bayer shares fell more 6% on Tuesday after a U.S. judge questioned part of the German company's proposed settlement to deal with future claims relating to allegations that its widely used weedkiller Roundup caused cancer.

Headlines: U.S. signs $450 million contract with Regeneron for COVID-19 therapy
Description: The U.S. government signed a $450 million contract with Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc for its potential COVID-19 antibody cocktail, the drugmaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court rejects GM's call to remove judge from Fiat Chrysler lawsuit
Description: A U.S. appeals court on Monday denied General Motors Co's petition to remove a lower court judge from its racketeering lawsuit against Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA), but said the companies' heads need not meet to settle the issue.

Headlines: Deutsche Telekom denies report it is intensifying partnership with Huawei
Description: Deutsche Telekom on Tuesday denied a report that it had intensified its business relationship with China's Huawei despite security authorities' warnings.

Headlines: Currency crisis impoverishes Iranians, strains economic defenses
Description: Desperate to afford her daughter's overseas university fees, 58-year-old retired Iranian teacher Maryam Hosseini withdrew all her savings from the bank to buy U.S. dollars.

Headlines: Oil settles higher on improving U.S. gasoline demand
Description: Oil prices settled higher on Wednesday as U.S. gasoline consumption showed signs of a recovery, but price gains were limited by rising crude inventories and an increase in coronavirus infections.

Headlines: 'Weaponized' Facebook fails to protect civil rights, audit says
Description: Facebook Inc's decisions to allow controversial posts by President Donald Trump established a "terrible precedent" that could allow the platform to be "weaponized to suppress voting," an external civil rights audit found on Wednesday.

Headlines: Explainer: What 1.1 million foreign students contribute to the U.S. economy
Description: The Trump administration said on Monday that foreign university students will have to leave the country if their classes are all taught online - clouding the future of tens of thousands of enrollees and potentially straining budgets at schools struggling to reopen during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Commerzbank board meets amid leadership void after top resignations
Description: Commerzbank's supervisory board formally accepted the resignation of its chief executive at a meeting on Wednesday amid a continuing leadership vacuum at the top of Germany's No. 2 bank.

Headlines: Air Canada assesses Spartan Bioscience's COVID-19 testing technology
Description: Air Canada said on Wednesday it was working with Spartan Bioscience Inc to assess using the Ottawa-based biotechnology company's portable COVID-19 testing technology in the aviation sector.

Headlines: U.S. office, apartment vacancy rates rise marginally in second quarter: Reis
Description: U.S. office and apartment vacancy rates rose marginally in the second quarter from a year earlier, as property owners were yet to feel the full impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to real estate research firm Reis Inc.

Headlines: Global shares rise despite coronavirus fears; gold gains
Description: Global stocks rose on Wednesday as recovery hopes overcame fears that a surge in coronavirus cases would slow the U.S. economy, but many investors still sought safety on pandemic worries, driving gold prices above $1,800 an ounce for the first time since 2011.

Headlines: Nvidia eclipses Intel as most valuable U.S. chipmaker
Description: Nvidia has overtaken Intel for the first time as the most valuable U.S. chipmaker.

Headlines: Federal judge throws out GM's racketeering lawsuit against Fiat Chrysler
Description: A federal judge on Wednesday threw out a racketeering lawsuit General Motors Co had filed against smaller rival Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV, saying the No. 1 U.S. automaker's alleged injuries were not caused by FCA's alleged violations.

Headlines: Nasdaq ends at record high as Wall Street rises with tech shares
Description: U.S stocks rose on Wednesday and the Nasdaq hit a record closing high, supported by technology shares as early signs of an economic rebound offset concern about further lockdowns due to a jump in coronavirus cases across the country.

Headlines: Facebook takes down accounts and pages of Trump ally Roger Stone
Description: Facebook Inc on Wednesday removed 50 personal and professional pages connected to U.S. President Donald Trump's longtime adviser Roger Stone, who is due to report to prison next week.

Headlines: U.S. tech giants face hard choices under Hong Kong's new security law
Description: U.S. tech giants face a reckoning over how Hong Kong's security law will reshape their businesses, with their suspension of processing government requests for user data a stop-gap measure as they weigh options, people close to the industry say.

Headlines: Fed officials suggest U.S. recovery may be stalling
Description: Federal Reserve officials raised fresh doubts on Wednesday about the durability of the U.S. recovery, while new business surveys highlighted developing risks from the relentless coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. will act to deny China access to Americans' data, says Pompeo
Description: The Trump administration will take steps to ensure the Chinese government does not gain any access to the private information of American citizens through telecommunications and social media, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday, when asked if the U.S. was planning to ban Chinese-owned app Tiktok.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson's Cilag to sell up to 11.8 million Idorsia shares
Description: Johnson & Johnson's Cilag Holding will offer up to approximately 11.8 million existing ordinary shares in Idorsia Ltd in an accelerated bookbuilding to commence on Wednesday, the transaction's bookrunner said.

Headlines: Bayer puts Roundup future claims settlement on hold
Description: Bayer was forced on Wednesday to delay part of a proposed settlement of allegations that its widely used weedkiller Roundup caused cancer after a U.S. judge questioned its plan to deal with future claims.

Headlines: Chinese factories to face headwinds in next phase of post-lockdown recovery
Description: Orders for infrastructure materials and equipment have helped industrial output recover faster in China than most places emerging from COVID-19 lockdowns, but further expansion will be hard to attain without stronger broad-based demand and exports.

Headlines: Credit Suisse aims for 100% of securities venture in China growth plan
Description: Credit Suisse wants to raise its China securities joint venture stake to 100% and increase its market share after getting the regulatory green light to take a majority holding, the head of its Asia business said.

Headlines: U.S. airlines move toward federal loans as COVID-19 surge threatens demand, jobs
Description: The largest U.S. air carriers have all signed letters of intent on federal loans to help them weather the novel coronavirus, with United Airlines warning employees on Tuesday that a surge in outbreaks was hitting bookings, threatening a travel rebound and jobs.

Headlines: Cannabis firms see jump in insurance costs to protect leaders as investors sue
Description: Canadian and U.S. cannabis companies are facing a spike in already high costs of insurance to protect top executives from personal liability, following a slew of lawsuits by disgruntled investors alleging fraud and misinformation, with more such action expected.

Headlines: AirAsia shares in biggest daily fall as auditor flags 'going concern' doubts
Description: Shares in Malaysia's AirAsia Group Bhd tumbled more than 17% on Wednesday in their biggest daily fall after the auditor cast doubt on the budget carrier's ability to continue as a going concern due to the coronavirus travel slump.

Headlines: Germany insists self-regulation not enough for Facebook
Description: Germany is determined to expand its attempts to regulate online hate speech even as Facebook promises to do more to clean up its site after a global advertiser boycott, with politicians saying the issue is too important to leave to self-regulation.

Headlines: SEAT urges Spain to 'wake up' and promote electric cars
Description: Spain needs to "wake up" and follow other European countries in giving more incentives for electric cars, the head of Volkswagen's Spanish brand SEAT said on Wednesday.

Headlines: HSBC and Nokia drag European stocks lower amid virus worries
Description: HSBC and Nokia dragged European shares lower on Wednesday as a surge in coronavirus cases appeared to threaten a recovery in the global economy, while Britain's plan to head off an unemployment crisis cushioned a fall in London's domestically focused stocks.

Headlines: Apple expands independent repair shop program to Europe, Canada
Description: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it is expanding a program to supply repair parts, tools and manuals for iPhones to independent repair shops in 32 countries in Europe as well as Canada.

Headlines: Cars, a cocktail and a celebrity: South Koreans succumb to Tesla fever
Description: From an eponymous cocktail to eager buyers following the shipping routes of long-awaited cars, Tesla Inc is having a moment in South Korea, particularly among tech-savvy professionals.

Headlines: Trump administration says pandemic aid saved 51 million jobs. Did it?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration touted its $660 billion small business pandemic aid program this week as a "wild success," unveiling data that showed the initiative saved 51 million jobs.

Headlines: Exclusive: Alibaba's Ant plans Hong Kong IPO, targets valuation over $200 billion, sources say
Description: Ant Group, the fintech arm of Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba, plans a Hong Kong float as soon as this year and targets a valuation of more than $200 billion, said two sources with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: 'Disaster' U.S. earnings loom, but investors try and look beyond
Description: U.S. companies are preparing to open their books on a quarter that is set to show the biggest earnings fall since the financial crisis, leaving investors looking for light at the end of the tunnel.

Headlines: Starbucks makes face masks mandatory at all company-owned U.S. outlets
Description: Starbucks Corp said on Thursday customers would have to wear face coverings at all company-owned U.S. stores, starting July 15, to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: LATAM Airlines adds $1.3 billion to bankruptcy financing proposal, Brazil unit seeks protection
Description: LATAM Airlines, the largest airline group in Latin America, said Thursday it had secured an additional $1.3 billion for its financing proposal before a New York bankruptcy court, while adding its unit in Brazil to the debt restructuring process.

Headlines: European stocks slide as Wall Street hit by virus surge
Description: European stocks closed sharply lower on Thursday as Wall Street tumbled after another record surge in U.S. coronavirus cases that raised fears of fresh lockdowns.

Headlines: VW's labour chief sees no need for more cost cuts
Description: Volkswagen's labour chief Bernd Osterloh has been on a roadshow to tell analysts and investors the carmaker has no need for deeper cost cuts in Germany.

Headlines: U.S. recovery in limbo as retail traffic falls in virus hot spots
Description: U.S. states that have driven a record surge in coronavirus cases may now be slipping backward https://graphics.reuters.com/USA-ECONOMY/REOPEN/yxmpjlxewpr in their economic recovery, as cellphone data shows retail visits in a clutch of high case-growth locations falling below the rest of the country.

Headlines: Nokia launches data centre networking tools, developed with Apple
Description: Finland's Nokia launched a set of tools on Thursday for data centre networking, developed in cooperation with Apple Inc, to help companies to manage the growth in traffic as 5G and machine learning technologies roll out.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. finalizing federal contract ban for companies that use Huawei, others
Description: The Trump administration plans to finalize regulations this week that will bar the U.S. government from buying goods or services from any company that uses products from five Chinese companies including Huawei, Hikvision and Dahua, a U.S. official said.

Headlines: Dollar rises from four-week low as U.S. stocks end mixed
Description: The dollar climbed from a four-week low on Thursday, as a decline in U.S. stocks enhanced the currency's safe-haven appeal for investors following a surge in new coronavirus cases and a U.S. Supreme Court ruling on President Donald Trump's financial records.

Headlines: Global stocks succumb to shutdown fears but China charges on
Description: Equity markets slid on Thursday after U.S. data raised worries about the economy's recovery and doused enthusiasm that drove a Chinese stock rally for an eighth straight day, while the dollar rebounded as new coronavirus cases hit another record.

Headlines: A space odyssey: Britain rockets into unknown with OneWeb
Description: Britain is betting that satellite operator OneWeb will help it boldly go into a post-Brexit era. But it faces formidable challenges to complete a working constellation and rebuild a collapsed venture that has proved a money pit for investors.

Headlines: China's aviation industry suffers $4.9 billion loss in second quarter on coronavirus jolt
Description: China's aviation industry sank further into the red, losing 34.25 billion yuan ($4.89 billion) in the second quarter, only slightly narrower than in the first quarter, underlining the colossal financial impact from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Crypto exchange Coinbase readies landmark stock market listing, sources say
Description: Coinbase Inc has started plans for a stock market listing that could come as early as this year, making it the first major U.S. cryptocurrency exchange to go public, according to three people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Ford's quarterly China sales rise for the first time in 3 years
Description: Ford Motor Co said its China vehicle sales increased 3% in April-June from a year earlier, its first quarterly sales rise in the world's bigggest auto market in almost three years.

Headlines: Ant Group listing would be fillip for Hong Kong's flagging IPO market
Description: An initial public offering from Alibaba's Ant Group by year-end would give equity capital markets in Hong Kong a timely boost after a new security law cast in doubt the city's future as a global financial centre, analysts said on Thursday.

Headlines: Gilead to deliver more remdesivir to Europe from autumn: WiWo
Description: Gilead Sciences Inc plans to make more of its drug remdesivir available for Germany and Europe from autumn and will decide how much each country gets based on the rate of infection, the drugmaker's Germany boss told a German magazine.

Headlines: Tesla 'very close' to level 5 autonomous driving technology, Musk says
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc is "very close" to achieving level 5 autonomous driving technology, Chief Executive Elon Musk said on Thursday, referring to the capability to navigate roads without any driver input.

Headlines: Bain Capital extends deadline for Japan's Nichiigakkan bid for second time
Description: U.S. buyout fund Bain Capital said on Thursday it had extended its deadline for a $1 billion buyout offer for Japanese nursing home operator Nichiigakkan Co for a second time.

Headlines: Another 1,300 jobs at risk in UK retail sector as John Lewis shuts eight stores
Description: British department store chain John Lewis said on Thursday it would close eight stores, putting around 1,300 jobs at risk in another blow to the UK retail sector after the coronavirus pandemic accelerated a shift to online shopping.

Headlines: Speedy removal of Huawei would cost UK, operators: Vodafone and BT
Description: Britain's rebound from COVID-19 could be harmed if the government demands a speedy removal of telecoms equipment made by China's Huawei from mobile networks, Vodafone and BT warned on Thursday.

Headlines: Brazilian airline Gol says expects to lose 3.20 reais per share in the second quarter
Description: Brazil's Gol Linhas Aereas Inteligentes said on Thursday it expects to lose 3.20 reais per share in the second quarter, and that it could reduce its fleet by 30 more aircraft in 2021-2.

Headlines: American Airlines delays HK flights over new COVID-19 testing rules
Description: American Airlines Group Inc said on Thursday it delayed flights to Hong Kong, a day after the city introduced mandatory virus tests for all arriving crew members.

Headlines: Mexico's Aeromexico sees passenger traffic drop 86.1% in June
Description: Mexican carrier Aeromexico said on Thursday that passenger traffic dropped 86.1% in June when compared to the same month the previous year after the coronavirus pandemic eroded demand for air travel.

Headlines: Alstom offers French factory sale to clinch Bombardier deal
Description: France's TGV high-speed train maker Alstom on Thursday offered to sell a French rail factory and make other concessions to win European Commission approval for its planned purchase of Bombardier Inc's transportation business.

Headlines: Malaysia's AirAsia seeks nearly $500 million in funding: report
Description: Malaysia's AirAsia Group Bhd is looking to raise 2 billion ringgit ($469 million), its CEO was quoted as saying by the Nikkei Asian Review on Thursday, a day after its auditor cast doubt on the airline's ability to continue as a going concern.

Headlines: ‘The Ultimate Hold’: Why Disney has investors stuck in place
Description: Walt Disney Co is planning to reopen its Orlando-based Walt Disney World theme park on July 11, ending the longest shutdown of the company's highly profitable U.S. theme park division in its history.

Headlines: Exclusive: Apple supplier Foxconn to invest $1 billion in India, sources say
Description: Foxconn plans to invest up to $1 billion to expand a factory in southern India where the Taiwanese contract manufacturer assembles Apple iPhones, two sources said.

Headlines: U.S. companies seeking capital during pandemic test bank market's new normal
Description: NEW YORK (LPC) - Bank lenders for high-quality US companies are taking different refinancing avenues as they seek to extend maturities on billions of US dollars in loans at a time when the Covid-19 pandemic has made liquidity a top priority.

Headlines: Wall Street jumps with financials; Gilead data offsets virus fears
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Friday as a positive analysis on Gilead Sciences Inc's antiviral drug to treat COVID-19 helped to soothe investor worries over a record rise in coronavirus cases in the United States, and as financial shares surged.

Headlines: Amazon begins rolling out bigger UPS and FedEx-style delivery trucks
Description: Amazon.com is launching a new fleet of bigger, boxier trucks like those favored by rival package carriers United Parcel Service Inc and FedEx Corp , as it fights to fix widespread pandemic-fueled delivery delays that sent customers into the arms of competitors like Walmart Inc .

Headlines: UK expected to order removal of Huawei 5G equipment by 2025: Telegraph
Description: The British government is expected to set a deadline of 2025 for removing equipment made by China's Huawei from the country's 5G telecoms networks, the Telegraph newspaper said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lonza expects EPA approval 'very soon' to make COVID-killing claims for surface disinfectants
Description: Lonza Group AG is in the “last step” of discussions with U.S. regulators for approval to claim that its formulation is effective in killing the novel Coronavirus on surfaces, an executive at the pharmaceutical and chemical giant told Reuters.

Headlines: Blackouts darken misery of Lebanon's economic collapse
Description: Samira Hanna spends a lot of time in the dark. Her old Beirut apartment gets less than two hours of electricity a day, and with Lebanon's economy in ruins, the grandmother can barely afford candles, let alone a private generator.

Headlines: ING accelerates Dutch branch closures as customers go digital
Description: Dutch bank ING will close a quarter of its bank branches in the Netherlands as the COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated the switch to digital banking, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Honda invests in China's CATL to jointly develop EV batteries
Description: Japan's Honda Motor Co Ltd will buy a 1% stake in Chinese electric vehicle (EV) battery maker Contemporary Amperex Technology (CATL) and the two will jointly develop EV batteries, the companies said on Friday.

Headlines: Japan's economy to shrink at fastest pace in decades this fiscal year due to pandemic: Reuters poll
Description: Japan's economy will shrink at the fastest pace in decades in the year through March 2021, forcing the government to compile another stimulus package to cushion the blow from the coronavirus pandemic, a Reuters poll showed on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: India panel proposes new regulator for non-personal data: draft report
Description: India should set up a data regulator and require companies to disclose how they collect and store data devoid of personal details or which has been anonymised, a panel tasked to draw up such regulations has said in a draft report seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Standard Life Aberdeen sells Boohoo shares, citing 'inadequate' response to allegations
Description: Investor Standard Life Aberdeen said on Friday it had sold its shares in fashion retailer Boohoo , describing the company's response to allegations of worker abuse at supplier factories as "inadequate".

Headlines: Italy's Armani returned to sales growth in 2019
Description: Sales at Italian fashion group Giorgio Armani returned to growth in 2019, a year in advance of its target, after a three-year planned fall from streamlining its distribution and brand portfolio under just three labels.

Headlines: U.S. producer prices unexpectedly fall; underlying inflation stabilizing
Description: U.S. producer prices unexpectedly fell in June as rising costs for energy goods were offset by weakness in services, pointing to subdued inflation that should allow the Federal Reserve to keep pumping money into the economy to arrest a downward spiral.

Headlines: Muji's U.S. business seeks bankruptcy protection over coronavirus
Description: Minimalist lifestyle brand Muji's U.S. subsidiary has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, its Japanese owner Ryohin Keikaku Co said on Friday, joining the list of casualties from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: China floods blamed for fresh African swine fever outbreaks
