Description: Outbreaks of deadly African swine fever are surging in some parts of southern China following heavy rains, analysts and industry sources said, in what could be a big setback for Beijing's goal of replenishing pork supplies.

Headlines: UK cyber security centre continuing work on Huawei, says PM's spokesman
Description: Britain's National Cyber Security Centre is continuing its work looking into Huawei, a spokesman for Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Friday, responding to reports that culture minister Oliver Dowden would make a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: India asks court to stymie potential challenge to Chinese app ban
Description: India's government has petitioned a state court to stop any of the Chinese companies whose 59 apps it recently banned from obtaining an injunction to block the order, according to two sources and the legal filing.

Headlines: Chinese electric vehicle maker Li Auto files for U.S. listing
Description: Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker Li Auto Inc, backed by food delivery giant Meituan Dianping , has filed for a U.S. initial public offering.

Headlines: Goya chief executive sparks backlash over praise for Trump
Description: Goya Foods Inc, the largest Hispanic-owned U.S. food company and a popular brand among Latino Americans, became the target of a boycott campaign on social media on Friday sparked by its CEO effusively praising President Donald Trump at the White House.

Headlines: UK plans to create 'freeports,' cut taxes: Sunday Telegraph
Description: British finance minister Rishi Sunak is preparing to introduce sweeping tax cuts and an overhaul of planning laws in up to 10 new “freeports” within a year of the UK's becoming fully independent from the European Union in December, the Sunday Telegraph said.

Headlines: U.S. Congress needs compromise to extend COVID-19 unemployment payments, Pelosi says
Description: Democratic House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Sunday she believes U.S. lawmakers can find a compromise on extending jobless benefits and unemployment insurance for Americans struggling amid coronavirus pandemic shutdowns.

Headlines: Dollar stabilizes ahead of earnings, U.S. consumer data
Description: The dollar edged lower on Monday as investors looked to U.S. corporate earnings and upcoming retail data to gauge whether guarded optimism on the economic outlook was justified.

Headlines: Tesla slashes Model Y SUV price as pandemic weighs on auto sector
Description: Tesla Inc cut the price of its sport utility vehicle Model Y by $3,000, just four months after its launch, as the U.S. electric carmaker seeks to maintain sales momentum in the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Apple says full return to offices not until the end of the year: Bloomberg News
Description: Apple Inc has told its staff that a full return to U.S. offices will not occur before the end of the year, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing an internal video message.

Headlines: U.S. June deficit surges to $864 billion
Description: The U.S. federal budget deficit in June surged to $864 billion from single digits a year earlier amid continued strong spending on coronavirus relief programs and a drop in individual and corporate tax receipts, the Treasury Department said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. consumers more secure about jobs but earnings expectations drop: New York Fed survey
Description: U.S. consumers are more optimistic that the worst of the economic crisis sparked by the coronavirus pandemic is behind them, but are still concerned about their earnings and their ability to find new jobs if they become unemployed, according to a survey released on Monday by the New York Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Equities reverse after hitting five-month peak, bonds edge higher
Description: World equity benchmarks reversed course after hitting a five-month peak on Monday while safe-haven U.S. government bonds and gold gained, as optimism about a global economic recovery was overtaken by renewed fears amid record numbers of new coronavirus cases in the U.S.

Headlines: American Airlines emphasizes mask rules after photo of Texas senator emerges
Description: American Airlines said on Monday it had reached out to U.S. Senator Ted Cruz after a photo of the Texas Republican without a mask aboard an airplane was posted on a social media site.

Headlines: Delta may avoid furloughs thanks to demand for early exit deal
Description: Delta Air Lines may be able to avoid involuntary furloughs in the fall after receiving interest from more than 15,000 employees for early exit deals, one person with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: China June exports unexpectedly rise 0.5% year-on-year, imports up 2.7%
Description: China's exports in June unexpectedly rose 0.5% from a year earlier, and imports increased 2.7%, customs data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Disney to shut Hong Kong Disneyland again as coronavirus cases rise
Description: Walt Disney Co is temporarily closing its Hong Kong Disneyland theme park from July 15 amid rising coronavirus cases in the Chinese-ruled city, the company said Monday.

Headlines: NIBC agrees to Blackstone's reduced takeover offer
Description: NIBC has agreed to a proposed takeover by Blackstone , the Dutch bank said on Monday, despite the U.S. private equity firm lowering its bid in light of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: EU should draw up list of medicines to be produced in Europe, says German health minister
Description: The European Union should draw up a list of active substances used in medicines whose production should be brought back to Europe to reduce dependency on China, German Health Minister Jens Spahn said on Monday.

Headlines: Federal Reserve's $3 trillion virus rescue inflates market bubbles
Description: The Federal Reserve's $3 trillion bid to stave off an economic crisis in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak is fuelling excesses across U.S. capital markets.

Headlines: UK trade fair industry warns 30,000 jobs at risk as events yet to resume
Description: Around 30,000 jobs in Britain's events industry are at risk due to increased uncertainty about when trade fairs and exhibitions could resume in the UK, an industry body representing event organisers, venues and suppliers warned on Monday.

Headlines: Russia keeps U.S. fuel oil exports high as Washington seeks to replace Venezuelan barrels
Description: Russia kept fuel oil exports to the United States close to its record-highs in the first six months of this year, as Washington looks to replace the heavy Venezuelan barrels it stopped buying a year ago, traders said and data showed.

Headlines: C$ rallies along with stocks; BoC decision due Wednesday
Description: The Canadian dollar strengthened against its U.S. counterpart on Monday as stock markets globally climbed and ahead of an interest rate decision this week from the Bank of Canada, with the loonie recovering from a 10-day low on Friday.

Headlines: Brazil's offshore oil workers chilled by coronavirus outbreaks
Description: On Friday, May 1, two workers on the PXA-1 offshore platform owned by Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras checked into the facility's infirmary complaining of headaches and fever-like symptoms.

Headlines: "Thick fog" over U.S. economy and Fed will need to provide sustained accommodation: Brainard
Description: There is a great deal of uncertainty about the path ahead for the U.S. economy and the Federal Reserve should use forward guidance and large-scale asset purchases for a "sustained" period in order to help the recovery, Fed Governor Lael Brainard said on Tuesday, as she offered a downbeat assessment of the risks ahead.

Headlines: Google hit with 600,000 euro Belgian privacy fine
Description: Google has received a record fine from Belgium's data protection authority (APD) of 600,000 euros for not complying with European rules on a person's "right to be forgotten" online.

Headlines: Thailand's AIS says Huawei among bidders to build 5G core networks
Description: Thailand's largest mobile operator Advanced Info Service Pcl said on Tuesday Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] was among five companies bidding to build its 5G core networks as it ramped up investments this year.

Headlines: Gasoline boosts U.S. inflation; escalating COVID-19 cases seen suppressing demand
Description: U.S. consumer prices rebounded by the most in nearly eight years in June, but a resurgence in new COVID-19 cases after the reopening of businesses suggests a moderation in demand that could keep inflation muted and allow the Federal Reserve to keep injecting money into the ailing economy.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX cancellations top 350 planes in first half of 2020
Description: Boeing Co customers canceled orders for 355 of its 737 MAX jets in the first half of 2020, the U.S. planemaker said on Tuesday, as the damage done by the jet's grounding and the coronavirus crisis to the airline industry continued to mount.

Headlines: Spotify expands to Russia and 12 other countries
Description: Spotify Technology SA on Tuesday launched its music streaming service in Russia, the fastest growing international market for music, and 12 other regions as part of its expansion strategy after breaking into India last year.

Headlines: India quizzing owners of banned Chinese apps over content and practices
Description: Chinese companies such as TikTok-owner ByteDance have been asked by India to answer 77 questions about their apps that have been banned by New Delhi, including whether they censored content, worked on behalf of foreign governments or lobbied influencers.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump administration to soon end audit deal underpinning Chinese listings in U.S. - official
Description: The Trump administration plans to soon scrap a 2013 agreement between U.S. and Chinese auditing authorities, a senior State Department official said, a move that could foreshadow a broader crackdown on U.S.-listed Chinese firms under fire for sidestepping American disclosure rules.

Headlines: Oil rises slightly as OPEC+ complies with production cuts
Description: Oil prices rose slightly on Tuesday as OPEC and its allies cut production by more than agreed to in June, although demand concerns lingered due to increased cases of COVID-19 in the United States. Brent crude futures settled up 18 cents at $42.90 a barrel, after moving lower earlier in the session. U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures rose 19 cents to $40.29 a barrel.

Headlines: Fed officials warn on 'thick fog' ahead for U.S. economy as recovery concerns deepen
Description: The U.S. economy will recover more slowly than expected amid a surge in novel coronavirus cases across the country, and a broad second wave of the disease could cause economic pain to deepen again, Federal Reserve officials warned on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's Harker says increase in coronavirus cases has direct economic impact
Description: The increase in coronavirus cases across the U.S. can stall the economy and make consumers cautious, Philadelphia Federal Reserve Bank President Patrick Harker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's Brainard: Forward guidance and yield curve control 'very complementary' tools
Description: It may become relevant for the U.S. Federal Reserve to consider using yield curve control in the future alongside the use of forward guidance to help speed the U.S. economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic, Fed Governor Lael Brainard said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. air passengers fell 89% in May amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: U.S. airlines carried 89% fewer passengers in May compared with last year, a massive decline that is still better than a historic low in April amid the coronavirus pandemic, the U.S. Transportation Department said Tuesday.

Headlines: Virus worries and FOMO drive options bets on surging tech giants
Description: Options investors are ramping up bets on some of this year's biggest winners, including Amazon.com Inc , Netflix Inc and Tesla Inc , even as they turn cautious on the wider market amid a resurgent U.S. coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Elanco to divest brands, forgo Canadian rights for Bayer's unit deal
Description: Elanco Animal Health Inc has decided against acquiring Bayer AG's Canadian distribution rights to several poultry insecticides, Canada's Competition Bureau said on Tuesday, as it looks to complete a $7.6-billion deal.

Headlines: Google faces lawsuit over tracking in apps even when users opted out
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google records what people are doing on hundreds of thousands of mobile apps even when they follow the company's recommended settings for stopping such monitoring, a lawsuit seeking class action status alleged on Tuesday.

Headlines: German court bans Tesla ad statements related to autonomous driving
Description: Germany has banned Tesla from repeating what a court says are misleading advertising statements relating to the capabilities of the firm's driver assistance systems and to autonomous driving, a Munich judge ruled on Tuesday.

Headlines: John Browne steps down as Huawei UK chairman ahead of government ban
Description: Former BP chief John Browne is stepping down as chairman of Huawei's UK operation ahead of the British government banning the Chinese company from the country's 5G networks later on Tuesday.

Headlines: Google in talks to invest $4 billion in Reliance's digital arm, Bloomberg reports
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google is in advanced talks to invest $4 billion for a stake in the digital arm of Indian conglomerate Reliance Industries Ltd, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Thailand gears up for motor show as pandemic restrictions ease
Description: Thailand's capital on Tuesday prepared to host its twice-postponed annual auto show, with organizers saying it would showcase the country's success in containing the coronavirus.

Headlines: Niche U.S. finance firms grease global trade of masks, gloves
Description: From specialty finance firms to boutique investment banks, a disparate mix of small financiers is bankrolling a U.S. gold rush for masks, gloves and other supplies in the wake of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: China's economy seen growing 2.5% in second quarter as lockdowns end, stimulus kicks in: Reuters poll
Description: China's economy likely returned to modest growth in the second quarter after a record contraction, as lockdown measures ended and policymakers announced more stimulus to combat the shock from the coronavirus crisis, according to a Reuters poll.

Headlines: Hedge fund manager Singh calls Trump's handling of coronavirus 'an incredible gift'
Description: President Donald Trump's handling of the coronavirus outbreak early this year was "an incredible gift" for investors because it kept markets stable long enough for some to protect their portfolios, Axon Capital co-founder Dinakar Singh told investors this month.

Headlines: Delta may avoid furloughs after demand for buyouts, other U.S. airlines sound alarm
Description: Delta Air Lines may be able to avoid involuntary furloughs in the fall after receiving interest from more than 15,000 employees for early buyout packages, one person with knowledge of the matter said, even as other U.S. airlines are sounding the alarm on jobs.

Headlines: China eases Macau border restrictions, shares in casino operators jump
Description: China has loosened coronavirus-related border restrictions between Macau and the neighbouring coastal province of Guangdong, sending shares of Macau casino operators surging on hopes of a quick pickup in demand.

Headlines: Prominent Democrats press Fed, Treasury to aid states, citing racial inequality
Description: With the Republican-controlled U.S. Congress far from agreement on how or even whether to give more aid to states and cities reeling from revenue losses during the coronavirus crisis, three U.S. Senate Democrats are appealing to the U.S. Treasury and the Federal Reserve to do more to help.

Headlines: Garuda Indonesia talking to Airbus to delay 2020 deliveries
Description: Flag carrier Garuda Indonesia is in talks with Airbus to delay deliveries of four aircraft this year, its chief executive said on Tuesday, as the coronavirus outbreak restricts travel and dampens demand.

Headlines: Big U.S. banks predict more economic pain from coronavirus
Description: Three of the largest U.S. banks said on Tuesday they had set aside a whopping $28 billion for loan losses, in a stark reminder that much of the economic pain from the coronavirus pandemic is still to come.

Headlines: 15 U.S. states to jointly work to advance electric heavy-duty trucks
Description: A group of 15 U.S. states and the District of Columbia on Tuesday unveiled a joint memorandum of understanding aimed at boosting the market for electric medium- and heavy-duty vehicles and phasing out diesel-powered trucks by 2050.

Headlines: Huawei says 'disappointing' ban will put UK in the digital slow lane
Description: Huawei said Britain's "disappointing" decision to ban the use of its equipment in its 5G networks was "bad news for anyone in the UK with a mobile phone" and threatened to put the country into the digital slow lane.

Headlines: As Britain bans Huawei, U.S. pressure mounts on Europe to follow suit
Description: Britain's decision to ban China's Huawei from its 5G network increases further pressure on EU countries to impose stricter limits on the world's largest telecoms equipment maker just as the company expands its footprint across Europe.

Headlines: UK says Canada has a similar Huawei analysis to UK
Description: Britain's digital minister said that Canada had a similar type of analysis to that done by the United Kingdom which on Tuesday said it would ban Huawei equipment from the 5G network by 2027.

Headlines: UK to ban Huawei from 5G network
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson's government will ban Huawei from Britain's 5G network by ordering telecoms companies to remove its equipment by 2027, Media Secretary Oliver Dowden said on Tuesday.

Headlines: India's tech hub, other towns back in lockdown amid COVID-19 surge
Description: India's high-tech hub of Bengaluru will go back into a coronavirus lockdown for a week on Tuesday after a surge of infections, threatening to derail government efforts to revive a stuttering economy.

Headlines: Oil climbs 2% on U.S. stock draw but gains capped as OPEC+ set to ease cuts
Description: Oil prices rose 2% on Wednesday, supported by a sharp drop in U.S. crude inventories, but further gains were limited as OPEC and its allies are set to ease supply curbs from August as the global economy gradually recovers from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing snaps back; new COVID-19 cases threaten recovery
Description: U.S. factory output rose by the most in more than 74 years in June as motor vehicle production accelerated amid the reopening of businesses, but the nascent economic recovery was overshadowed by surging new COVID-19 infections.

Headlines: Beyond Meat to sell plant-based patties Brazil, world's No. 3 beef consumer
Description: Beyond Meat Inc said on Wednesday it will sell plant-based burgers and sausages at a Brazilian high-end supermarket chain, entering the country about two weeks after launching in mainland China's retail market through Alibaba Group's Freshippo markets.

Headlines: J.C. Penney to cut 1,000 jobs, close 152 stores
Description: J.C. Penney Co Inc said on Wednesday it would cut about 1,000 jobs and shutter 152 stores as the U.S. department store chain looks to emerge from Chapter 11 protection and the COVID-19 crisis.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing output surges in June, but production still below pre-pandemic level
Description: U.S. factory output increased for a second straight month in June as motor vehicle production accelerated amid the reopening of businesses, but the nascent improvement in manufacturing activity was overshadowed by surging new COVID-19 infections.

Headlines: UBS will no longer be able to contest client data sent to France tax authorities: Swiss court
Description: UBS will no longer be informed or be able to contest customer data the Swiss tax authorities hand over to counterparties in France investigating alleged tax avoidance, a Swiss court said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Google backs Reliance's Jio Platforms with $4.5 billion India investment
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google will invest $4.5 billion in Reliance Industries' digital unit, the Indian group said on Wednesday as it laid out an ambitious roadmap for its businesses ranging from entertainment to retail.

Headlines: Safe-haven dollar hits one-month low on vaccine hopes
Description: Risk sentiment revived in currency markets on Wednesday as progress toward a COVID-19 vaccine helped equities rebound and commodity currencies strengthen, pushing the dollar to a one-month low.

Headlines: China's economy will continue recovery in second half: stats bureau
Description: China's economy will continue its recovery in the second half of the year, although the impact from the coronavirus pandemic on the world economy would create some challenges for its growth, the statistics bureau said on Thursday.

Headlines: China's second-quarter GDP grows 3.2% year-on-year, beats expectations
Description: China's economy grew 3.2% in the second-quarter from a year earlier, data showed on Thursday, recovering from a record contraction as lockdown measures ended and policymakers stepped up stimulus to combat the shock from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: China industrial output rises 4.8% year-on-year in June; retail sales, investment fall
Description: China's industrial output rose 4.8% in June from a year earlier, data showed Thursday, expanding for the third straight month and offering some relief to an economy trying to regain its footing from the shock of the coronavirus outbreak earlier in the year.

Headlines: Google ties more work tools into Gmail, aiming to get ahead of Microsoft
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday its corporate Gmail customers would now be able to edit documents and other files without leaving the email service, as it aims to lure clients from rivals by making its tools more integrated.

Headlines: Dell considering spinning off VMware stake, shares surge
Description: Dell Technologies Inc is considering spinning off its 81% stake in cloud computing software maker VMware , the PC maker said on Wednesday, adding that such a move would not occur before September 2021.

Headlines: U.S. rare earths miner MP Materials to go public in $1.47 billion deal
Description: U.S. rare earths miner MP Materials will go public in a $1.47 billion deal by merging with a private-equity backed blank-check company, underscoring Wall Street's rising interest in efforts to boost production of the strategic minerals.

Headlines: U.S. judge confirms Berkshire Hathaway unit's 643 million euro award against German pipemaker
Description: A U.S. judge on Wednesday confirmed a 643 million euro ($734 million) arbitration award favoring a unit of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc that claimed it was fraudulently induced to buy an ailing German pipemaker that inflated sales to look profitable.

Headlines: Japan firms see no immediate fix for virus pain, some eye better productivity: Reuters poll
Description: Nearly half of Japan's companies have no immediate plans in place to help counter the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, although a third of those surveyed in a Reuters poll indicated they were looking to improve productivity to cushion the blow.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies on vaccine bets, Goldman results
Description: U.S. stocks ended sharply higher on Wednesday, with the S&P 500 at its highest since early June, following promising early data for a potential COVID-19 vaccine and a strong quarterly report from Goldman Sachs.

Headlines: German watchdog under EU scrutiny as it widens Wirecard investigation
Description: The European Union's markets watchdog said on Wednesday that it was reviewing Germany's financial reporting set-up in the wake of Wirecard's collapse as Germany widened its own investigation into the failed company.

Headlines: U.S. Paycheck Protection hit some of its mark, but missed the most vulnerable
Description: The Paycheck Protection Program appears to have thrown a critical safety net under U.S. middle and upper-middle-wage jobs, but it faltered when it comes to lower-paying positions and the industries hit hardest by the coronavirus pandemic, according to a Reuters analysis of loan details.

Headlines: UK minister on Trump's Huawei remark: 'We all know Trump don't we'
Description: A senior British minister on Wednesday denied that U.S. President Donald Trump was responsible for Britain's 5G ban on Huawei, saying the decision was a considered one despite attempts by some individuals to claim credit.

Headlines: Singapore's Resorts World, a major employer, axes jobs as virus batters tourism
Description: Resorts World Sentosa, one of Singapore's biggest private sector employers, said on Wednesday it was laying off staff to cut costs as the coronavirus pandemic batters the city-state's tourism industry.

Headlines: Tele2 says Huawei remains a 'viable vendor'
Description: Swedish telecom operator Tele2 sees China's Huawei as a "viable vendor", although that could change in the future, its top chief said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China says it will act to protect its interests after UK Huawei ban
Description: China said on Wednesday it will take all necessary measures to safeguard its interests following Britain's decision to purge all Huawei Technologies Co Ltd equipment from its 5G network by the end of 2027.

Headlines: Asian shares gain in cautious mood as U.S.-China tensions rise
Description: Asian shares rose on Wednesday led by coronavirus vaccine hopes though sentiment was cautious after Beijing vowed retaliatory sanctions against the United States, while the euro rose to a four-month high ahead of a crucial EU summit.

Headlines: Over 2,500 games removed from Apple's China App Store after loophole shuts: data firm
Description: More than 2,500 mobile games were removed from Apple's China app store in the first week of July, four times as many in the same period in June, after Apple closed a loophole to comply with Chinese licence requirements, data from SensorTower showed.

Headlines: UK's Huawei decision disappointing and wrong: China's ambassador
Description: China's ambassador to Britain said the decision to strip Huawei equipment out of the country's 5G network was disappointing and wrong and called into question Britain's openness to foreign investors.

Headlines: German's watchdog widens probe of possible Wirecard insider trading
Description: Germany's financial watchdog is widening its examination into possible insider trading of Wirecard shares to include any individuals who have sat on the company's management and supervisory boards in 2020, a BaFin spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Chinese mutual fund industry sees jump in new funds and inflows
Description: China's mutual fund industry saw another massive jump in new products and subscriptions in June, suggesting the swift rally in mainland stocks has room to run further.

Headlines: Policymakers will tread carefully on tax reform after Apple ruling, says Ireland's Donohoe
Description: Policymakers will pay greater care to the legal foundations of corporate tax reforms after an EU order for Apple to pay 13 billion euros ($14.9 billion) in Irish back taxes was rejected in court, Ireland's finance minister said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Navistar to develop self-driving trucks with TuSimple
Description: Truck maker Navistar International Corp has bought a minority stake in TuSimple and aims to co-develop self-driving trucks by 2024 with the technology company as it rolls out a national U.S. autonomous freight network, the two companies said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ireland welcomes annulling of EU Apple tax order
Description: Ireland welcomed the judgment by Europe's second-top court on Wednesday to reject a European Union order that iPhone maker Apple pay 13 billion euros ($14.78 billion) in Irish back taxes.

Headlines: Chipotle plans on hiring 10,000 workers to support drive-thru expansion
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc said on Wednesday it plans to hire as many as 10,000 employees over the next few months to help support the expansion of drive-thru lanes at its restaurants.

Headlines: Back-to-school sales to hit $102 billion as laptop buys surge: NRF
Description: U.S. households are likely to spend a record $102 billion in back-to-school shopping next month, with laptop sales set to boom as parents anticipate the COVID-19 pandemic will keep at least some classes online, a U.S. trade group said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Shares of Hyundai Motor jump nearly 8% on Seoul's 'green new deal'
Description: Shares of Hyundai Motor jumped nearly 8% on Wednesday, a day after South Korea announced a "green new deal" to spur use of environmentally friendly vehicles.

Headlines: TikTok expected to operate as a U.S. company, White House adviser says
Description: A top White House adviser said on Thursday that he expects TikTok to separate from its Chinese owner and operate as an American company amid growing U.S. concerns about the security of the data handled by the short video app.

Headlines: U.S. Senator Warner asks for probe of hacks, better monitoring of high-risk accounts
Description: U.S. Senator Mark Warner called on Thursday for Twitter Inc to investigate how hackers gained access to the social media company's internal systems to hijack accounts of several politicians, billionaires, celebrities and companies, and to put more resources into protecting high-profile feeds.

Headlines: Top EU court ditches transatlantic data transfer deal
Description: Europe's highest court ruled on Thursday that a transatlantic data transfer deal is invalid because of concerns about U.S. surveillance in a decision that could disrupt thousands of companies that rely on the agreement.

Headlines: Target, CVS, Walgreens to require customers wear masks at U.S. stores
Description: Target Corp, CVS Health Corp and Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc said on Thursday they would require customers wear face coverings while shopping at their U.S. stores, adopting a widely accepted way to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Privacy activist Schrems welcomes EU court decision on Facebook
Description: Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems on Thursday welcomed a decision by the European Union's top court in his case against Facebook, saying the legal basis for more then 5,000 U.S. companies that use an EU tool to transfer Europeans' personal data to the United States for commercial use has been annulled.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales snap back; high unemployment, rising COVID-19 loom over recovery
Description: U.S. retail sales rose more than expected in June as consumers bought big-ticket items like motor vehicles and dined out, but a resurgence in new COVID-19 cases is chipping at the budding recovery, keeping 32 million Americans on unemployment benefits.

Headlines: UK ban on Huawei opens door for competitors, although consumer may pick up tab
Description: Britain's decision to ban China's Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] from next-generation 5G telecom networks is the latest blow to the global leader in telecom equipment and could help lay the groundwork for broader changes in the industry.

Headlines: Oil giants including Exxon set first joint carbon target
Description: A group of the world's top oil companies, including Saudi Aramco, China's CNPC and Exxon Mobil, have for the first time set goals to cut their greenhouse gas emissions as a proportion of output, as pressure on the sector's climate stance grows.

Headlines: Exclusive: J&J in talks with Japan, Gates Foundation to lock in deals on COVID-19 vaccine
Description: Johnson & Johnson is in talks with the government of Japan and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation about locking up allocations of its potential COVID-19 vaccine as it prepares to kick off human trials, the company's Chief Financial Officer Joseph Wolk told Reuters in an interview.

Headlines: Twitter silences some top accounts after internal systems hacked
Description: Twitter said hackers accessed its internal systems to hijack some of the platform's top voices including U.S. presidential candidate Joe Biden, reality TV star Kim Kardashian, former U.S. President Barack Obama and billionaire Elon Musk and used them to solicit digital currency.

Headlines: Negative U.S. rate bets persist, but seen unlikely to happen
Description: Negative U.S. interest rates could be the norm next year and all through to 2023 if fed funds futures are any indication. Or it could just be traders hedging their bets.

Headlines: Virus surges. Work hours plateau. U.S. may be flattening the wrong curve
Description: The U.S. economic recovery showed signs of plateauing last week as the country battled rising coronavirus case counts and an increasingly fractured government response, according to data from a broad set of industry and government sources.

Headlines: Rise in COVID-19 cases spurs risk-off move, dollar lifted
Description: The safe-haven U.S. dollar rose modestly on Thursday afternoon as worries about rising numbers of coronavirus infections spurred a broader risk-off move, pushing U.S. equities lower.

Headlines: Trump will remain on Twitter, his account secure: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will not stop using Twitter and his account was secure during a hack of the social media platform, a White House spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headlines: FBI says it is investigating hack of high-profile Twitter accounts
Description: The FBI's San Francisco office said on Thursday it has launched an investigation after hackers accessed Twitter's internal systems to hijack accounts for high-profile people such as U.S. presidential candidate Joe Biden, reality TV star Kim Kardashian, former U.S. President Barack Obama and billionaire Elon Musk and used them to solicit digital currency.

Headlines: Rising U.S. coronavirus cases slam stocks, push debt yields lower
Description: Government debt yields and global equity markets fell on Thursday as a growing number of U.S. coronavirus cases weighed on risk sentiment, which was also hurt by deteriorating U.S.-China relations and discouraging Chinese data.

Headlines: Danone beefs up Specialized Nutrition business in China
Description: French food group Danone said on Thursday it would spend 100 million euros ($114.08 million) to strengthen its Specialized Nutrition business in China, as it bets on the Chinese market as a source of growth.

Headlines: Amid virus crisis, U.S. bars imports of Malaysia's Top Glove over labour issues
Description: U.S. Customs placed a detention order on imports of products made by subsidiaries of the world's largest medical glove maker, Malaysia's Top Glove Corp Bhd , an action taken against firms suspected of using forced labour.

Headlines: Factbox: Reaction after EU court strikes down transatlantic data transfer deal
Description: Europe's top court on Thursday quashed a transatlantic data transfer deal for the second time because of U.S. surveillance concerns in a ruling that could disrupt thousands of companies that rely on the pact.

Headlines: China's economy rebounds after steep slump, weak demand, U.S. tensions raise risks
Description: China's economy returned to growth in the second quarter after a deep slump at the start of the year, but unexpected weakness in domestic consumption underscored the need for more policy support to bolster the recovery after the shock of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: BOJ looks to big data for clues on pandemic-driven economic changes
Description: The coronavirus pandemic may have caused structural changes in Japan's economy and the way it affects inflation, requiring the Bank of Japan to tap more deeply into big data in making policy decisions, the central bank's top economist said on Thursday.

Headlines: Amid national debate on race, Fed's Bostic sees central bank role on inequality
Description: A rising stock market alongside 11% unemployment has put the U.S. Federal Reserve in a quandary amid the national debate over racial and economic fairness: Is it helping fix the problems its top officials agree need fixing, or deepening divides between Black and white, and rich and poor?

Headlines: Germany’s long, lonely campaign: Battling Wirecard’s short sellers
Description: German authorities pressed on for four years investigating investors who bet against Wirecard AG's shares, even after a UK regulator concluded that their evidence against the short sellers was "not sufficient," according to documents and people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Siemens to let staff spend less time in the office permanently
Description: Germany's Siemens has decided to let its employees work from wherever they want for two or three days a week, in the latest example of how the coronavirus is making major companies re-think how and where their staff work.

Headlines: EU justice chief says will boost data transfers tool after court setback
Description: The European Commission will closely study a top EU court ruling striking down an EU-U.S. data transfer pact and consider how to boost such transfers with its U.S. counterpart, EU Justice Chief Didier Reynders said on Thursday.

Headlines: China vows 'necessary' measures in response to UK's Huawei ban
Description: China will take necessary measures in response to Britain's "discriminatory" ban on Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], which has severely damaged China's investment confidence in the country, China's Commerce Ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: With inflation in India ticking higher it may be time for RBI to pause
Description: With India's economic growth sputtering, the Reserve Bank of India was expected to maintain a rate-cutting cycle, but an uptick in near-term inflation could give the central bank's Monetary Policy Committee reason to pause for now.

Headlines: Trumps tweet support for Goya Foods amid boycott campaign
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and his daughter and adviser Ivanka Trump are rallying support for Goya Foods on Twitter, as social media pressure continues for boycotting the largest Hispanic-owned U.S. food company over its CEO's effusive praise for Trump.

Headlines: Delayed tax day to bring revenue lift to cash-strapped U.S. states
Description: A downward spiral in revenue in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak will pause this month for most U.S. states as Wednesday's income tax filing deadline generates billions of dollars in payments that would have been due in April.

Headlines: Tesla registrations in California nearly halve in second quarter: data
Description: Tesla Inc's vehicle registrations nearly halved in the U.S. state of California during the second quarter, according to data from Cross-Sell, a marketing research firm that collates title and registration data.

Headlines: Amazon India demands product listings have country of origin by August 10
Description: Amazon.com Inc's India unit has told sellers they must provide country of origin information on product listings by August 10, according to an email sent by the e-commerce giant to sellers, against a backdrop of brewing anti-China sentiment.

Headlines: Irish regulator sees U.S. data transfers decided on 'case by case' basis
Description: Ireland's Data Protection Commissioner, the lead data regulator for Facebook in the European Union, on Thursday "strongly welcomed" a ruling by Europe's highest court that a transatlantic data transfer deal was invalid.

Headlines: Twitter hacking spree alarms experts concerned about the platform's security
Description: The extraordinary hacking spree that hit Twitter on Wednesday, leading it to briefly muzzle some of its most widely followed accounts, is drawing questions about the platform's security and resilience in the run-up to the U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories post record drop in May
Description: U.S. business inventories fell by the most on record in May amid the COVID-19 crisis, supporting expectations for the sharpest drop in gross domestic product in the second quarter since the Great Depression.

Headlines: U.S. passive stock funds back in demand as investors seek steadier returns
Description: U.S. passive equity funds have started to witness inflows after a two-month hiatus as investors flock to rising equity markets, but prefer shadowing indexes to picking stocks.

Headlines: Japanese robot to clock in at a convenience store in test of retail automation
Description: In August, a robot vaguely resembling a kangaroo will begin stacking sandwiches, drinks and ready meals on shelves at a Japanese convenience store in a test its maker, Telexistence, hopes will help trigger a wave of retail automation.

Headlines: Facebook studying EU court ruling on data transfer
Description: Facebook said on Thursday it was looking at the implications of a European court ruling that deemed a transatlantic data transfer deal invalid because of concerns about U.S. surveillance.

Headlines: U.S. economy faces significant risks, long road to recovery: IMF staff
Description: The U.S. economy is forecast to shrink by 6.6% in 2020 due to the shock of the coronavirus pandemic, but a resurgence in coronavirus infections and a systemic increase in poverty could worsen that outlook, the staff of the International Monetary Fund warned on Friday.

Headlines: Rival parties take aim at Germany's Scholz over Wirecard scandal
Description: Germany's Social Democrat Finance Minister Olaf Scholz is facing calls from rival parties to account for the regulatory failures that led to the collapse of Wirecard after it emerged he knew of concerns about the company 18 months ago.

Headlines: On eve of bankruptcy, U.S. firms shower execs with bonuses
Description: Nearly a third of more than 40 large companies seeking U.S. bankruptcy protection during the coronavirus pandemic awarded bonuses to executives within a month of filing their cases, according to a Reuters analysis of securities filings and court records.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Fund managers navigate 'Night of the Living Dead' in small caps
Description: Investors are searching for bargains in the world of U.S. small-caps, as the beaten-down asset class prepares for what may be the worst earnings season in its history amid a resurgent coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Flight to suburbs boosts U.S. homebuilding, but COVID-19 surge erodes consumer sentiment
Description: U.S. homebuilding increased in June by the most in nearly four years amid reports of rising demand for housing in suburbs and rural areas as companies allow employees to work from home during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Google bans ads on coronavirus conspiracy theory content
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Friday it would prohibit websites and apps that use its advertising technology from running ads on "dangerous content" that goes against scientific consensus during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. Republicans seek liability protections as coronavirus aid battle looms
Description: A battle in the U.S. Congress over a new coronavirus-aid bill began on Friday as Republicans were putting the finishing touches on provisions granting liability protections for a wide range of entities resuming operations amid the pandemic.

Headlines: Cohen's Point72 to open Warsaw office for some back office teams
Description: Billionaire investor Steven A. Cohen's Point72 Asset Management is opening the $16.2 billion firm's latest satellite location in Warsaw and moving some back office operations to lower-cost Poland.

Headlines: Volkswagen expects single-digit sales decline in China this year
Description: Volkswagen AG said on Friday it expects its China sales to fall a single-digit percent this year as new sport-utility vehicles and premium models help it recover from a sales slide in the world's biggest auto market.

Headlines: Stripe wins business following Wirecard's collapse
Description: The U.S. payments company Stripe is picking up some former Wirecard customers, an executive told Reuters.

Headlines: Bored bank customers flock to day-trading platforms during pandemic
Description: Retail investing is having a moment. Major U.S. brokerages that reported quarterly results this week cheered the self-directed day trading happening on their platforms as individuals with a bit of extra money and time on their hands during the coronavirus pandemic have been engaging more in markets.

Headlines: German abattoir scandal puts cooling systems under COVID spotlight
Description: A COVID-19 outbreak in Germany is forcing meatpacking plants to review infection risks posed by their cooling systems, placing the industry at the sharp end of growing global concerns over airborne transmission of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Economic recovery further away than markets think: BlackRock CEO Fink
Description: The U.S. economy is going to take longer to recover from the hit from the coronavirus pandemic than the market expects, and more stimulus is critical, BlackRock Inc Chief Executive Larry Fink said on Wednesday.

Headlines: As big U.S. banks let customers delay payments, loan losses remain unclear
Description: Major U.S. bank executives this week said they extended forbearance programs to millions of credit card, auto loan and mortgage customers who were financially hard hit by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Pact to aid poor cocoa farmers in peril as COVID-19 hits demand
Description: The steepest dive in cocoa demand in a decade has thrown into jeopardy a plan by top producers Ivory Coast and Ghana to guarantee some two million farmers a living wage, sources within the countries' regulators said.

Headlines: Trail of missing Wirecard executive leads to Belarus, Der Spiegel reports
Description: Former Wirecard chief operating officer Jan Marsalek travelled to Minsk soon after he was suspended and may still be in Belarus or Russia, a German magazine reported on Saturday.

Headlines: TikTok considers London and other locations for headquarters
Description: TikTok has been in discussions with the UK government over the past few months to locate its headquarters in London, a source familiar with the matter said, as part of a strategy to distance itself from its Chinese ownership.

Headlines: Salesforce's Marc Benioff: Face masks can end the U.S. coronavirus crisis within weeks
Description: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff told CNBC's Jim Cramer that face masks can stop the coronavirus crisis in the U.S. in "just three weeks." The two are sponsoring a mask design challenge.

Headlines: DBS sees signs of a 'healthy' US market rally
Description: Hou Wey Fook of DBS Bank says the U.S. equity rally has been broad, which is a positive indicator. He also explains why the entry of retail investors is a good thing for the markets.

Headlines: Aggressive policy bolstering markets: Hirtle Callaghan
Description: Hirtle Callaghan's Jonathan Hirtle thinks this recession is one of design, and gives his range predictions for the S&P 500 and the U.S. 10-year treasury.

Headlines: We expect a U-shaped economic recovery: Strategist
Description: Erik Knutzen of Neuberger Berman says he's cautious about the trajectory of the market and economic recoveries, and explains why his base case scenario is for U.S. GDP to contract 6% this year.

Headlines: Cramer reacts to Trump administration's potential $1 trillion infrastructure proposal
Description: CNBC's Jim Cramer weighs his favorite stock picks amid talks of the Trump administration considering a massive infrastructure spending package.

Headlines: Pullback on Nasdaq a good opportunity to join the uptrend: Daryl Guppy
Description: Daryl Guppy of Guppytraders.com gives technical analysis on key U.S. market indices and VIX.

Headlines: Expect the Fed to continue to provide support to propel economy: Strategist
Description: Sam Stovall of CFRA discusses the U.S. economy amid the current crisis and a looming recession. Sam foresees that Fed will not be too quick to remove the stimulus, ahead of the FOMC meeting this week.

Headlines: Most global indexes have surpassed our 12-month targets: CIO
Description: The magnitude of the rally in U.S. stocks since March has come as a surprise, says Tuan Huynh of Deutsche Bank Wealth Management. With the markets pricing in a "blue sky" scenario, he says now is the time to take some profits off the table.

Headlines: We stand behind our 3400 target for S&P 500 by Q1 2021: BMO Capital Markets
Description: Brian Belski of BMO Capital Markets says in addition to Fed support on liquidity, the fundamentals of economy and quality of U.S. stocks supported the 40% rally from the March lows. He sees further upside in market based on projected recovery in second half of the year.

Headlines: China is the 'first leading indicator' of a rebound in autos, Marvell Tech CEO says
Description: China is showing "very positive signs of production resuming," Marvell Technology CEO Matt Murphy said.

Headlines: Look to small-cap stocks for returns as markets recover: Citi
Description: Large-cap stocks on the U.S. are weighted towards resilient sectors like e-commerce and digital media, leaving them less affected by signs of a recession, says Steven Wieting of Citi Private Bank. He notes that small-cap shares are more likely to bounce back as the economy recovers.

Headlines: Impossible Foods CFO says its plant-based meat will soon be available in nearly 1,000 stores in US
Description: Impossible Foods CFO David Lee joined CNBC's Jim Cramer to discuss the company's expansion into more grocery stores across the U.S.

Headlines: Coronavirus harms the oil market more than OPEC friction, oil commodities expert says
Description: "I would say that ... 15% of this is Saudi Arabia and Russia and 85% of it is Covid," RBN Energy CEO Rusty Braziel said of the state of the oil market.

Headlines: Australia's parliament set to pass huge stimulus plan as S&P ratings agency lowers 'AAA' outlook
Description: Australia's coveted "AAA" rating came under a cloud on Wednesday as its parliament returned to pass an emergency A$130 billion ($80 billion) stimulus package to cushion the economic blow of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Microsoft 'might be the best tech stock in this market,' Jim Cramer says
Description: Demand for cloud computing services has spiked during the coronavirus outbreak and Microsoft has been a "huge beneficiary from the lockdowns," the "Mad Money" host said.

Headlines: More falls ahead, S&P 500 to test the bottom at around 2200: Strategist
Description: On Feb. 24, Jonathan Pain of The Pain Report predicted a 20% decline in the U.S. equity markets in a month. He now still sees more downside in the markets and expects the U.S. economy to contract in excess of 5% in the second quarter.

Headlines: Business bailouts are not enough to stop the economic fallout of coronavirus, Jim Cramer says
Description: The "Mad Money" host said the end to the economic damage from COVID-19 will arrive when the U.S. has adequate testing capacity and medical supplies. "Legislation isn't enough," he said.

Headlines: Stocks have 'at least 10% to 15%' further to fall: Scaramucci
Description: The U.S. is in a "protracted bear market" and stock prices could fall further, according to Anthony Scaramucci, an investor and former White House communications director.

Headlines: Hormel CEO says 'return to normalcy' in China shows businesses can rebound from coronavirus
Description: "There's actually a return to normalcy and so our plants are fully staffed," Hormel CEO Jim Snee said about business in China.

Headlines: US must 'think big' on coronavirus response or risk losing influence to China, Jim Cramer says
Description: "The rest of the world's looking to China for leadership, not us. That's going to be permanent if we don't get our act together," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

Headlines: Stocks may be due for a near-term bounce after worst day since 1987, trader says
Description: The U.S. stock market appears primed for upside that could last longer than recent bounces, says Miller Tabak chief market strategist Matt Maley.

Headlines: Elizabeth Warren calls for a 'grassroots' stimulus package to counter coronavirus economic impact
Description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren told CNBC's Jim Cramer she wants a targeted, "big stimulus package" that doesn't "disproportionately" advantage "rich folks."

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including recession potential, bank stock headwinds
Description: CNBC's Jim Cramer explained what he thinks it will take to quell the spread of the coronavirus in the U.S. The "Mad Money" host broke down how the banks will take a hit from the pandemic.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including investing next week, foreign drug stocks
Description: Jim Cramer breaks down the Trump administration considering curbs on U.S. investing in Chinese businesses, recommends foreign pharmaceutical companies, reviews Conagra's earnings report and interview GoodRx CEO Doug Hirsch.

Headlines: Jim Cramer: These foreign drug stocks are worth betting on over domestics
Description: "If you want big pharma exposure, with fewer headaches related to U.S. politics, you could always buy a well-run foreign drug company," CNBC's Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including presidential fears, Peloton IPO, housing market
Description: Jim Cramer explains why Elizabeth Warren's presidential prospects are dropping managed care stocks, and breaks down Peloton's IPO, sits down with the CEO of homebuilder Taylor Morrison and recommends stock picks.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer on 'Mad Money,' including Trump impeachment, Bob Iger chat, new GW Pharma drug
Description: Jim Cramer reacts to House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's move to open an impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump, talks with Disney CEO about his new memoir and interviews GW Pharma CEO.

Headlines: The days of sharp, sustained spikes in oil prices are likely gone for now, analyst tells Jim Cramer
Description: "When you look at how much resiliency that there is built into the marketplace, I think most of the market assumes that if prices go up, the U.S. and other countries will respond," oil analyst Rusty Braziel says.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including the week ahead, iPhone sales, Zscaler CEO
Description: Jim Cramer previews the week ahead of earnings and stock market news, projects iPhone sales in China, breaks down AbbVie and Bristol-Myers' latest deals and interviews Zscaler CEO Jay Chaudhry.

Headlines: Cramer flags stocks held 'hostage' by trade — and others worth looking at
Description: CNBC's Jim Cramer takes another look at stocks with high exposure to China before earnings season approaches.

Headlines: Cramer: Investors buying stocks on trade optimism are totally misreading the situation
Description: Investors are under a false impression that "we may be having a thaw in our trade war with China," Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: Everything Jim Cramer said on 'Mad Money,' including looming earnings and economic reports
Description: Cramer reveals what he expects to see next week in market news, chats with At Home CEO Lee Bird about dodging China tariffs and praises Lululemon's performance, among other things.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: If the Fed cuts rates, this is a must-own stock
Description: Jim Cramer tells investors to consider adding Nucor to their portfolios in the positive steel cycle boosted by the Fed and President Donald Trump.

Headlines: There has been a paradigm shift in the weed industry, Jim Cramer says
Description: "As the weak hands exit the cannabis space, investors are starting to care about the actual results," the "Mad Money" host says.

Headlines: S&P 500 crosses 3,000 for the first time after Powell signals rate cut
Description: The S&P 500 crosses 3,000 for the first time as Fed chair Jay Powell signals a rate cut for July. CNBC's Jim Cramer, David Faber and Carl Quintanilla discuss.

Headlines: Cramer: Dell's stock is 'ridiculously cheap' despite being 'shackled' by investors on China fears
Description: "Between Dell's China exposure, and a possible slowdown in their server business driven by a weaker economy, the stock can't seem to get much traction," the "Mad Money" host says.

Headlines: IFF CEO on the impacts of Brexit and China tariffs on business
Description: "So we have planned for Brexit. I think we have plan A, B and C, and you need all these plans — I can tell you," CEO Andreas Fibig says.

Headlines: The Shanghai index is making a 'major turnabout': Daryl Guppy
Description: Daryl Guppy of Guppytraders.com analyzes the charts for markets including the Hang Seng index, Nasdaq and S&P 500. He says the Hong Kong market is not concerned about the recent protests apart from the "inconvenience of disruption."

Headlines: Cramer on the week ahead: Watch for Fed signals and Trump's Twitter
Description: "The most important thing to watch next week is Twitter — we're watching for a president who slags China regularly," Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: Dexcom CEO teases a diabetes collaboration with Apple Watch
Description: Dexcom CEO Kevin Sayer also says its partnership with an Alphabet subsidiary will be produce a more advanced device "for the ages."

Headlines: It's not time for the Fed to cut yet, says Citi strategist
Description: Ken Peng of Citi Private Bank says, with the S&P 500 only around 6% below its all-time peak, it's not yet time for the Fed to cut rates or for U.S. President Donald Trump to turn more friendly on trade.

Headlines: 'Exploit the volatility' in the markets, says Wells Fargo
Description: Given the ongoing trade disputes, the U.S. market is likely to be range bound for a while, says Kirk Hartman of Wells Fargo Asset Management. He also discusses which stocks investors could consider buying.

Headlines: Cramer: Trump's going after business, and that's bad for stocks
Description: "The president's whims have trumped his pro-business attitude ... [and] investors are going to pay less" for stocks, Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: Cramer: Investors who bought Apple ahead the quarter got the call right
Description: "Not only did Apple deliver a nice top- and bottom-line beat, but China, the major source of weakness last quarter, is turning around," Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: 3M CEO on disappointing earnings: We're getting ahead of the curve in China and weak sectors
Description: Roman blamed challenges in China as well as in the automotive and electronics sectors for the manufacturing giant's weak first quarter earnings.

Headlines: Jim Cramer revisits his top stock picks for the 5G rollout
Description: In February, he declared that Skyworks Solutions, Intel, Qualcomm, Broadcom, and Xilinx were the top five semiconductor companies that stand to benefit from the building of 5G infrastructure.

Headlines: The US earnings season has been 'pretty good' so far: Charles Schwab
Description: Randy Frederick of Charles Schwab says he's surprised by how good corporate earnings in the U.S. have been. He also says the gain may have helped lift the S&P 500 to an all-time record.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: Memo to President Trump - the Fed's on your side
Description: Jim Cramer's sending a signal to Trump as his central bank criticism continues.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: You can't ignore the rebound in these two food companies
Description: Jim Cramer digs into the packaged food industry and reveals how General Mills and JM Smucker have rebounded after its toxic turn.

Headlines: Olive Garden-parent Darden isn't screaming a recession is coming, Jim Cramer says
Description: Jim Cramer explains why Chicken Alfredo sales at Olive Garden could help investors gauge the health of the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Global growth is 'unlikely' if China trade and Brexit are not resolved, FedEx CEO says
Description: Jim Cramer chats with FedEx CEO Fred Smith about the company's reduction in growth expectations as U.S.-China trade and Brexit linger.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: If the dollar peaks, it could be positive for your portfolio
Description: Jim Cramer takes a look at the charts to see if the U.S. dollar could weaken and why that could benefit the market.

Headlines: Salesforce co-CEO Benioff says $30 billion in revenue is 'right around the corner'
Description: Salesforce co-CEO Marc Benioff tells Jim Cramer how three computing trends are driving growth at the cloud software company.

Headlines: Most US cannabis stores are 'underperforming' their potential: Retail industry vet and cannabis CEO
Description: Jim Cramer hears from Peter Horvath, a former Victoria's Secret and American Eagle Outfitters executive, about his new gig as CEO of a cannabis products company.

Headlines: Cramer says it's 'highly unlikely' tariff costs will all trickle down to consumers
Description: Jim Cramer points to the action in retail stocks as a sign that the economic windfall from the U.S.-China trade spat won't affect U.S. consumers as much as people think.

Headlines: Cramer: China's stock market wouldn't be tumbling if the US was losing the trade war
Description: Jim Cramer points out the difference in market performance in China and the United States and ties it to the trade war fears that are rattling investors.

Headlines: Cramer: The surge in oil prices could reverse the oil-and-gas bear market
Description: Jim Cramer sees a "big problem" in the U.S. energy market. Wednesday's oil price boost could help curb it.

Headlines: Millennials are marrying later, but that's not exactly bad for homebuilders, Toll Brothers CEO says
Description: Jim Cramer sits down with Toll Brothers CEO Douglas C. Yearley, Jr. to hear his take on trends in the U.S. housing market.

Headlines: Cramer: Stocks heavily tied to China may be signaling an end to the trade war
Description: Jim Cramer argues that the action in stocks like Honeywell suggests that China could soon give in to the United States' trade demands.

Headlines: Cramer's game plan: Be ready for another Trump tariff-fueled sell-off
Description: Jim Cramer lays out his game plan for the week ahead and warns of potential market weakness after the president's latest warning to China.

Headlines: Cramer: If you're worried about the economy, just look at the retail stocks
Description: Jim Cramer makes the case for embracing the strength of the U.S. economy by tracking the gains in top retail stocks like Walmart.

Headlines: Cramer says FANG stocks could still have room to run after Alphabet's quarter
Description: Jim Cramer says Alphabet's latest quarter proved that shares of the Google parent and other tech titans could still have room to run.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: Alphabet has broken this troubling trend after reporting earnings
Description: Jim Cramer explains how Alphabet has debunked the stock’s trend in sliding post-earnings.

Headlines: Nucor CEO touts second-best quarter in steelmaker's history, nods to tariffs
Description: Jim Cramer hears from Nucor Chairman, President and CEO John Ferriola, who touts the effects of President Donald Trump's steel and aluminum tariffs.

Headlines: Cramer: If you own shares in companies with business in China, you should be worried
Description: Jim Cramer warns investors of Boeing, Caterpillar and other China-reliant stocks that the trade war could still get worse.

Headlines: GDP could rise to 4 percent in Q2 thanks to business-friendly policies, Bank of America CEO says
Description: Jim Cramer sits down with Bank of America Chairman and CEO Brian Moynihan, who outlines the U.S. economy's growth drivers.

Headlines: People are 'numb' to Trump's behavior, says Wall Street veteran
Description: President Trump continues his unorthodox approach to the presidency, upsetting some people, while others are left "numb" to his behavior, says Wall Street investor.

Headlines: Cramer argues that this rally is 'all about China blinking' in the trade war
Description: Jim Cramer says China seems to have blinked in its trade dispute with the United States.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: After Trump’s NATO comments, these sectors are worth owning
Description: Jim Cramer reveals why U.S. defense and natural gas stocks are strong picks after the NATO Summit.

Headlines: 'Tweed and tonic' marijuana drinks could be coming to Canada in 2019, says Canopy Growth CEO
Description: Jim Cramer sits down with Canopy Growth CEO Bruce Linton, who outlines his cannabis company's game plan for when recreational marijuana becomes fully legal in Canada.

Headlines: Cramer: The real cause of the bank stocks' weakness isn't the yield curve — it's trade
Description: Jim Cramer deciphers what Monday's stock market action means for the stocks of major U.S. banks.

Headlines: Cramer: I'm wary of even the hottest Chinese IPOs
Description: Jim Cramer warns investors about chasing fresh-faced Chinese companies that have recently begun trading on U.S. exchanges.

Headlines: Cramer translates what US bonds are saying, and it's not good for the economy
Description: Jim Cramer says that if the Fed keeps raising interest rates, the U.S. economy could be on a path to recession.

Headlines: Cramer flags the market's 3 'most worrisome components' ahead of July's earnings wave
Description: Jim Cramer says a slowing global economy, a strong U.S. dollar and rising raw costs are likely to weigh on next quarter's earnings reports.

Headlines: US banks are 'among the better values' in the S&P 500: Investor
Description: Nate Thooft of Manulife Asset Management says there is a "high likelihood" of smaller banks in the U.S. being acquired by some of the bigger players in the space.

Headlines: Cramer: It's hard to believe this is bottom for shares of General Electric
Description: Jim Cramer explains why even General Electric's exit from the Dow Jones industrial average isn't the end of the industrial's painful turnaround.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: Go ahead, China—sell your U.S. Treasurys!
Description: Jim Cramer says there are a lot of things that scare him about a U.S.-China trade war, but selling its position in U.S. Treasurys isn’t one of them.

Headlines: CEO of US oil and gas play Carrizo flags an unusual problem for drillers: Water
Description: Jim Cramer sits down with Carrizo Oil & Gas President and CEO Chip Johnson for an update on key U.S. oil markets.

Headlines: Cramer points to the trillion-dollar question about US-China trade: What about Apple?
Description: Jim Cramer flags the one wild card in the escalating trade dispute between China and the United States.

Headlines: Dow closes lower for fourth day in a row
Description: The "Closing Bell" team discusses the market's reaction to trade tensions with China. With Bertelsen, Aviance Capital Management; CNBC's Mike Santoli; and CNBC Contributor Evan Newmark.

Headlines: Cisco CEO says new Google Cloud partnership 'plays an enormous role' in security, policy
Description: Jim Cramer gets Cisco Systems Chairman and CEO Chuck Robbins' take on his computer hardware company's latest venture with Alphabet's Google.

Headlines: Cramer tries to decode Trump's trade strategies with 5 new theories
